abstract: Shoreham Harbour Lifeboat Station is an [[RNLI|RNLI]] station located in the town of [[Shoreham-by-Sea|Shoreham-by-Sea]] in the [[English|England]] [[county|county]] of [[West Sussex|West Sussex]] in the [[United Kingdom|United Kingdom]]. It underwent extensive re-development in 2010 with a new purpose built boathall to accommodate its new all-weather lifeboat. It operates two lifeboats. The AWB lifeboat is called and the Inshore lifeboat is a called .
title: Shoreham Harbour Lifeboat Station

abstract: Hayling Island Lifeboat Station is an [[RNLI|RNLI]] station located on Hayling Island close to the town of [[Mengham|Mengham]] in the [[English|England]] county of [[Hampshire|Hampshire]]. The station is located on the eastern side of Hayling island at the entrance to Chichester Harbour where it joins the major shipping route of the [[Solent|Solent]], and is opposite the village of [[West Wittering|West Wittering]]. This major shipping route is a busy at all times of the year and there are estimated to be 10,000 boats in the Chichester area alone. The Hayling Island station provides cover for the area 24 hours a day, all year, by means of two inshore rigid inflatable lifeboats placed on this station.
title: Hayling Island Lifeboat Station

abstract: Astara Television Tower (), is a [[steel|steel]] tall [[Azerbaijan|Azerbaijani]] [[lattice|lattice tower]] [[television tower|television tower]] located in the city of [[Astara|Astara, Azerbaijan]], on the southeastern part of the [[Republic of Azerbaijan|Azerbaijan]], thus the name. Possessing an antenna attached to the tower's [[pinnacle|pinnacle]], which in turn, is [[guyed|Guy-wire]] on a horizontal cross (4 cross-like steel arms) fixed on the main body of the tower, the Astara TV Tower is used for transmitting FM-/TV-broadcasting, at the same time, for mobile and/or other means of [[telecommunication|telecommunication]].
title: Astara TV Tower

abstract: New Quay Lifeboat Station is an [[RNLI|Royal National Lifeboat Institution]] [[lifeboat|Lifeboat (rescue)]] station in the coastal resort of [[New Quay|New Quay]], [[Ceredigion|Ceredigion]], West [[Wales|Wales]]. It was established in 1864 and in 2014 celebrated 150 years of service. In 2014 the station operated two lifeboats: a [[Mersey class|Mersey class lifeboat]] all-weather boat and a [[D class|D class lifeboat (IB1)]] inshore boat.
title: New Quay Lifeboat Station

abstract: Fishguard Lifeboat Station (based in [[Goodwick|Goodwick]], [[Pembrokeshire|Pembrokeshire]], [[Wales|Wales]]) is a [[Royal National Lifeboat Institution|Royal National Lifeboat Institution]] (RNLI) station.
title: Fishguard Lifeboat Station

abstract: Llandudno Lifeboat Station is located in the North [[Wales|Wales]] town of [[Llandudno|Llandudno]]. It was the only lifeboat station in the UK to have its boathouse located in the middle of town. Whereas most lifeboat stations are situated next to the sea for obvious reasons, Llandudno Lifeboat Station was situated in Lloyd Street, almost equidistant from both of Llandudno's shores. The reason for the unique situation of Llandudno Lifeboat goes back to 1861 when the boathouse was positioned so that it could be towed equally quickly to either of Llandudno's main shores. The boathouse was constructed in 1903.In order to accommodate the new [[Shannon-class lifeboat|Shannon-class lifeboat]], a new boathouse was built on the south end of the promenade at Craig-y-Don. The new lifeboat "William F. Yates" (ON1325) arrived at its new home on 24 September 2017.
title: Llandudno Lifeboat Station

abstract: Porthcawl Lifeboat Station (based in [[Porthcawl|Porthcawl]], [[Bridgend|Bridgend]], [[Wales|Wales]]) opened in 1860 and a boathouse was subsequently built on the promenade to house the lifeboat. This station was closed in 1902 when Porthcawl Dock was closed.
title: Porthcawl Lifeboat Station

abstract: Penarth Lifeboat Station is located in [[Penarth|Penarth]], [[Vale of Glamorgan|Vale of Glamorgan]], [[Wales|Wales]] and originally opened in 1861.
title: Penarth Lifeboat Station

abstract: Ramsgate Lifeboat Station is an RNLI station located in the [[Port of Ramsgate|Port of Ramsgate]] in the [[English|England]] county of [[Kent|Kent]]. The station is one of the oldest to operate in the British Isles and has launched to many notable services. Over the years its crews have won over 50 awards for gallantry the most recent being in 2000.
title: Ramsgate Lifeboat Station

abstract: Bronte House is an [[heritage-listed|heritage register]] historic house and visitor attraction located at 470 Bronte Road, [[Bronte|Bronte, New South Wales]], [[Waverley Municipality|Waverley Municipality]], [[New South Wales|New South Wales]], Australia. Built in the [[Australian Gothic Revival|Australian residential architectural styles#Victorian Period c. 1840 – c. 1890]] style, the house was designed by Georgiana & Robert Lowe and [[Mortimer Lewis|Mortimer Lewis]] and built from 1843 to 1845. It is also known as Bronte estate. The property is owned by [[Waverley Municipal Council|Waverley Municipal Council]] and was added to the [[New South Wales State Heritage Register|New South Wales State Heritage Register]] on 2 April 1999 and is listed on the (now defunct) [[Register of the National Estate|Register of the National Estate]].
title: Bronte House

abstract: The Saigon Trade Center is a high-rise building in [[Ho Chi Minh City|Ho Chi Minh City]], Vietnam. It was constructed from April 1994 and completed in July 1997 and with a height of 145 metres (476   ft), it was the tallest building in Vietnam from 1997 until 2010, when it was surpassed by the [[Bitexco Financial Tower|Bitexco Financial Tower]].
title: Saigon Trade Center

abstract: Horton and Port Eynon Lifeboat Station (based in [[Horton|Horton, Swansea]], [[Swansea|Swansea]], [[Wales|Wales]]) opened in 1884 and was originally based in [[Port Eynon|Port Eynon]].
title: Horton and Port Eynon Lifeboat Station

abstract: Cidade do Samba ([[Portuguese|Portuguese language]], Samba City), formally known as Cidade do Samba Joãozinho Trinta, is a complex of buildings in the neighborhood of [[Gamboa|Gamboa, Rio de Janeiro]], [[Rio de Janeiro|Rio de Janeiro]], [[Brazil|Brazil]]. It is used for [[Samba schools|Samba schools]] to prepare for carnival. About fourteen of the major samba schools have a warehouse in the complex.
title: Cidade do Samba

abstract: Torquay Lifeboat Station was the base for [[Royal National Lifeboat Institution|Royal National Lifeboat Institution]] (RNLI) search and rescue operations at [[Torquay|Torquay]], [[Devon|Devon]] in England from 1876 until 1923. A second lifeboat was kept at the harbour from 1917 until 1928.
title: Torquay Lifeboat Station

abstract: Vessels trying to reach [[Topsham|Topsham, Devon]] and [[Exeter|Exeter]] have to negotiate the sandbanks at the mouth of the [[River Exe|River Exe]]. Local people raised funds with the help of [[Lloyd's of London|Lloyd's of London]] to purchase a lifeboat in 1803. A [[boathouse|boathouse]] was built near Passage House but this was washed away in a storm in 1814. The RNLI revived Exmouth Lifeboat Station in 1858. A new boathouse was built near the beach, although the lifeboat had to be taken across the road before it could be launched. This boathouse was demolished and a new one built on the same site in 1903 to accommodate a larger lifeboat. The first motor lifeboat at Exmouth arrived in 1933 and a tractor was provided to speed up the movement across the road and beach for launches.Exmouth received brand new Maria Noble on 1 October 1953 but it was not named until 1 September 1954. Her first service call was on the evening 19 September 1954 to investigate flashing lights and shouts for help near the Maer Rocks. The lifeboat secretary and [[coxswain|coxswain]] lit up the scene with a car's headlights and they saw the cabin cruiser Nicky which was at anchor but appeared to be sinking. The tide was too low to reach it with the lifeboat, but as soon as the water had risen sufficiently it was launched. Even now the lifeboat touched the bottom in the troughs between waves. The lifeboat took on board all the people from the Nicky and returned to station just 26 minutes after being launched. Coxswain Harold 'Dido' Bradford was awarded the RNLI Bronze Medal for bravery during this rescue.
title: Exmouth Lifeboat Station

abstract: Nardaran Fortress () was built in 1301 by architect [[Mahmud ibn Sa'ad|Mahmud ibn Sa'ad]] in the northern part of [[Absheron Peninsula|Absheron Peninsula]].
title: Nardaran Fortress

abstract: Vilhelmsborg is the National Equestrian Centre of [[Denmark|Denmark]] and a [[listed building|Listed buildings in Aarhus Municipality]] in [[Aarhus Municipality|Aarhus Municipality]]. The main manor building was completed in 1842 and was listed by the [[Danish Heritage Agency|Danish Heritage Agency]] on 3 March 1945. The manor lies 10   km. south of [[Aarhus|Aarhus]], by [[Beder-Malling|Beder-Malling, Denmark]] in Mårslet Parish, and is today owned by Aarhus Municipality along with 288 hectares of adjoining land.
title: Vilhelmsborg

abstract: Abcon Complex & Towers is a planned building complex in [[Nairobi|Nairobi]], [[Kenya|Kenya]]'s capital and largest city.
title: Abcon Complex & Towers

abstract: South Quay Plaza is a residential-led scheme under construction in [[Millwall|Millwall]] on the [[Isle of Dogs|Isle of Dogs]], [[London|London]], within the borough of [[Tower Hamlets|Tower Hamlets]] developed by [[Berkeley|Berkeley Group Holdings]] and designed by architect firm [[Foster + Partners|Foster + Partners]]. The site of the development lies to the immediate north of Marsh Wall and to the immediate south of the financial district [[Canary Wharf|Canary Wharf]]. It is scheduled for completion in 2022.
title: South Quay Plaza

abstract: The Oregon Manufacturing Innovation Center, Research & Development, abbreviated as OMIC R&D, is a research facility located in [[Scappoose, Oregon|Scappoose, Oregon]]. OMIC R&D is a collaborative environment bringing together industry, higher education, and government in partnership to develop new tools, techniques, and technologies to address near-term manufacturing challenges through applied research and advanced technical training. OMIC R&D is modeled after the University of Sheffield Advanced Manufacturing Research Center (AMRC) with Boeing in Sheffield, England.
title: Oregon Manufacturing Innovation Center

abstract: Taipei Nan Shan Plaza () is a skyscraper in [[Xinyi Special District|Xinyi Special District]], [[Xinyi|Xinyi District, Taipei]], [[Taipei|Taipei]], [[Taiwan|Taiwan]]. It is the second tallest building in Taipei (after [[Taipei 101|Taipei 101]]) and the third tallest building in Taiwan (after [[Taipei 101|Taipei 101]] and [[85 Sky Tower|85 Sky Tower]]).
title: Taipei Nan Shan Plaza

abstract: Tigran Melikov's House() is a historic mansion located at crossing of Islam Safarli and Hazi Aslanov streets in [[Baku|Baku]], Azerbaijan. The mansion was built between 1895 and 1897 on the order of Tigran Melikov, who was a son of [[Armenian|Armenians]] industrialist, Ambarsum Melikov. It is the first building built in the Gothic style in Baku, as well as [[Józef Gosławski|Józef Gosławski (architect)]]'s first project on personal order.
title: Tigran Melikov's House

abstract: The National Liberal Club (NLC) is a London [[private members' club|gentlemen's club (traditional)]], open to both men and women. It was established by [[William Ewart Gladstone|William Ewart Gladstone]] in 1882 to provide club facilities for Liberal Party campaigners among the newly enlarged electorate following the [[Third Reform Act|Third Reform Act]] in 1884. The club's [[neo-Gothic|neo-Gothic]] building on the Embankment of the river [[Thames|Thames]] is the second-largest clubhouse ever built. Designed by [[Alfred Waterhouse|Alfred Waterhouse]], it was completed in 1887. Its current facilities include a dining room, a bar, function rooms, a billiards room, a [[smoking room|smoking room]], a library and an outdoor riverside terrace. It is located at [[Whitehall Place|Whitehall Court]], close to the [[Houses of Parliament|Houses of Parliament]], the [[Thames Embankment|Thames Embankment]] and [[Trafalgar Square|Trafalgar Square]].
title: National Liberal Club

abstract: The National Ski Association, today known as the [[U.S. Ski and Snowboard Association|U.S. Ski and Snowboard Association]], was formed in Ishpeming in 1905, . It was formed during a meeting of ski clubs from Ishpeming, [[Minneapolis|Minneapolis]], [[Red Wing, Minnesota|Red Wing, Minnesota]], and [[Eau Claire, Wisconsin|Eau Claire, Wisconsin]]. Ispheming Ski Club founder [[Carl Tellefsen|Carl Tellefsen]] (1854−1908) was its first president, and for his contribution, he was among the first four to be accorded honored membership in the hall of fame in early 1957.The Roland Palmedo Memorial Library, one of the largest research ski libraries in the United States is housed here. [[Roland Palmedo|Roland Palmedo]] (1895−1977) was a ski-sport builder and contributor for more than 50 years. He helped to organize the [[National Ski Patrol|National Ski Patrol]], the teacher certification program, and various early ski teams and clubs. Palmedo also founded [[Mad River Glen|Mad River Glen]] ski area, edited two skiing books, and developed one of the most extensive ski libraries in America. Following his death, his family donated his library to the National Ski Hall of Fame and Museum where it has become the nucleus for the Roland Palmedo Memorial Library.
title: National Ski Hall of Fame

abstract: The Befreiungshalle ("Hall of Liberation", ) is a [[Neoclassical|Neoclassical architecture]] monument on the Michelsberg hill above the town of [[Kelheim|Kelheim]] in [[Bavaria|Bavaria]], Germany. It stands upstream of [[Regensburg|Regensburg]] on the river [[Danube|Danube]] at the confluence of the Danube and the [[Altmühl|Altmühl]], i.e. the [[Rhine-Main-Danube Canal|Rhine-Main-Danube Canal]]. It is just downstream of the [[Danube Gorge|Danube Gorge (Weltenburg)]], towering above its lower end. It was commissioned by King [[Ludwig I of Bavaria|Ludwig I of Bavaria]] to commemorate the victory over [[Napoleon|Napoleon]] in the [[Befreiungskriege|German Campaign of 1813]] of 1813-15.
title: Befreiungshalle

abstract: The Detroit Masonic Temple is the world's largest [[Masonic Temple|Masonic Temple]]. Located in the [[Cass Corridor|Cass Corridor]] of [[Detroit|Detroit]], [[Michigan|Michigan]], at 500 Temple Street, the building serves as a home to various [[masonic|Freemasonry]] organizations including the [[York Rite|York Rite]] Sovereign College of [[North America|North America]]. The building contains a variety of public spaces including three theaters, three ballrooms and banquet halls, and a clear-span [[drill hall|drill hall]].
title: Detroit Masonic Temple

abstract: The Class of 1959 Chapel is a [[non-denominational|non-denominational]] chapel located on the campus of [[Harvard Business School|Harvard Business School]] in [[Boston, Massachusetts|Boston, Massachusetts]]. It was designed by [[Moshe Safdie|Moshe Safdie]] in 1992, as part of a master plan to complement the existing 1927 campus architecture by [[McKim, Mead and White|McKim, Mead and White]] that would allow for Business School to expand along the [[Charles River|Charles River]]. It was funded by a gift from alumni from the Class of 1959. It was engineered by Weidlinger Associates and built by Richard White Sons, Inc. for a cost of approximately $2.5 million.
title: The Class of 1959 Chapel

abstract: The Busan Lotte Town Tower, also known as Busan Lotte World Tower ([[Hangul|Hangul]]: 부산 롯데 타운 타워) is a 108-[[floor|floor]], [[supertall|supertall]] [[skyscraper|skyscraper]] on hold in [[Busan|Busan]], [[South Korea|South Korea]]. The tower is planned on a site next to Nampo-dong station on [[Busan Subway Line 1|Busan Subway Line 1]] .
title: Busan Lotte Town Tower

abstract: The towers are 28 stories high, and rise to . Sun Life Plaza - West was the first tower built, and was completed in 1981. Development continued with Sun Life Plaza - North, completed in 1982, and was concluded in 1984 with Sun Life Plaza - East. Current occupants include the North West Redwater Partnership and RBC.
title: Sun Life Plaza

abstract: The Leeds Studios (also known as the Yorkshire Television Studios or YTV Studios) is a [[television production complex|Television studio]] on [[Kirkstall Road|A65 road]] in [[Leeds|Leeds]], [[West Yorkshire|West Yorkshire]], [[England|England]]. [[ITV plc|ITV plc]] had proposed to close the studios in 2009, however later in the year had a change of mind and instead decided to refit them as [[high definition|high definition television]] studios.
title: The Leeds Studios

abstract: One Wilshire is an office building located at the junction of [[Wilshire Boulevard|Wilshire Boulevard]] and [[South Grand Avenue|Grand Avenue (Los Angeles)]] in downtown [[Los Angeles|Los Angeles]]. Notwithstanding the building's name, its actual address is 624 S. Grand Avenue. Built in 1966, the thirty story high-rise was designed by [[Skidmore, Owings and Merrill|Skidmore, Owings and Merrill]], and for its first decades in existence it was used almost exclusively by law firms. In the early 1990s it began housing largely telecommunications companies, and in 1992 One Wilshire underwent a major renovation, with the improvements largely related to telecommunication network upgrades. Around this time a large [[meet-me room|meet-me room]] was constructed on the fourth floor, and in 2008 [[Wired|Wired Magazine]] claimed that One Wilshire had "the world's most densely populated Meet-Me room," with around 260 [[ISP|ISPs]] with interconnected networks.
title: One Wilshire

abstract: One Great George Street (OGGS) is a four-domed [[grade II listed|grade II listed]] [[Edwardian|Edwardian]] building used as a [[conference|Conference venue]] and wedding venue just off [[Parliament Square|Parliament Square]] in [[Westminster|Westminster]], [[London|London]], [[England|England]]. The building is the global headquarters of the [[Institution of Civil Engineers|Institution of Civil Engineers]] (ICE); it was originally soley a venue for ICE members to relax, meet and have conferences but became available for public events in 1989. It is near the [[Houses of Parliament|Houses of Parliament]], [[Westminster Abbey|Westminster Abbey]], and [[St James's Park|St James's Park]].
title: One Great George Street

abstract: The clock on the building is unofficially known as the "Baby [[Big Ben|Clock Tower, Palace of Westminster#Great Bell]]" or the "Big Ben of Wales", and also serves as a Welsh history museum. The Pierhead Building is part of the estate of the [[National Assembly for Wales|National Assembly for Wales]], which also includes the [[Welsh Assembly|Welsh Assembly]] and [[Ty Hywel|Ty Hywel]].
title: Pierhead Building

abstract: The O2 is a large entertainment district on the [[Greenwich peninsula|Greenwich peninsula]] in South East London, England, including an [[indoor arena|indoor arena]], a music club, a [[Cineworld|Cineworld]] cinema, an exhibition space, piazzas, bars and restaurants. It was built largely within the former [[Millennium Dome|Millennium Dome]], a large dome-shaped canopy built to house an exhibition celebrating the turn of the third millennium; consequently The Dome remains a name in common usage for the venue. It is sometimes referred to as [[The O2 Arena|The O2 Arena]], but that name properly refers to a smaller indoor arena within The O2. Naming rights to the district were purchased by the mobile telephone provider [[O2|O2 (United Kingdom)]] from its developers, [[Anschutz Entertainment Group|Anschutz Entertainment Group]] (AEG), during the development of the district. AEG owns the long-term lease on the O2 Arena and surrounding leisure space.
title: The O2

abstract: Fortune Plaza is located in central business district of [[Chaoyang|Chaoyang District, Beijing]], Beijing, nearby Kerry center; [[China World Trade Center|China World Trade Center]] and the [[CCTV Headquarters|CCTV Headquarters]] building. It is a mixed use development with a total construction area of 720,000 square meters, covering 92,100 square meters of land.
title: Fortune Plaza

abstract: For eight years after the fire, One Meridian Plaza sat vacant and damaged—in the center of Philadelphia's business district. The building was caught in litigation between the owners and the insurance company over how much the insurers would pay the owners and how repairs or demolition would proceed. Businesses near the empty high-rise closed or moved and the city sued the owners to do something with the building. After lawsuits were settled, the building was declared a total loss and began to be dismantled in 1998.
title: One Meridian Plaza

abstract: Council House 2 (also known as CH2), is an office building located at 240 [[Little Collins Street|Little Collins Street, Melbourne]] in the [[CBD|Melbourne CBD]] of [[Melbourne|Melbourne]], Australia. It is used by the [[City of Melbourne|City of Melbourne]] council, and in April 2005, became the first purpose-built office building in Australia to achieve a maximum Six [[Green Star|Green Star (Australia)]] rating, certified by the [[Green Building Council of Australia|Green Building Council of Australia]]. CH2 officially opened in August 2006.
title: Council House 2

abstract: Rhyl Lifeboat Station is located in the North [[Wales|Wales]] town of [[Rhyl|Rhyl]]. For over 150 years, the Lifeboat Crew in Rhyl have been saving lives at sea. The first lifeboat was stationed in the town in 1853 and the present station was opened in December 2001. The station operates a Mersey-class all-weather boat (ALB) and an IB1 inshore lifeboat (ILB).
title: Rhyl Lifeboat Station

abstract: Southwold Lifeboat Station is an [[RNLI|RNLI]] operated lifeboat station located in the town of [[Southwold|Southwold]] in the English county of [[Suffolk|Suffolk]].
title: Southwold Lifeboat Station

abstract: Aldeburgh Lifeboat Station is an [[RNLI|RNLI]] station located in the town of [[Aldeburgh|Aldeburgh]] in the English county of [[Suffolk|Suffolk]]. the lifeboat station evolved from the Suffolk Shipwreck Association station in 1851 which was originally in [[Sizewell|Sizewell]] and there has been a lifeboat here since that date. The present station has two boats on station. These are the lifeboat and the Inshore lifeboat . The station covers the coast from [[Harwich|Harwich]] to the south, and [[Southwold|Southwold]] to the North.
title: Aldeburgh Lifeboat Station

abstract: St Ives Lifeboat Station is the base for [[Royal National Lifeboat Institution|Royal National Lifeboat Institution]] (RNLI) search and rescue operations at [[St Ives|St Ives, Cornwall]], [[Cornwall|Cornwall]] in the United Kingdom. The first [[lifeboat|Lifeboat (rescue)]] was built for the town in 1840 and the present boathouse was opened in 1994. It operates a all weather boat (AWB) and a inshore lifeboat (ILB).
title: St Ives Lifeboat Station

abstract: Lynmouth Lifeboat Station was the base for [[Royal National Lifeboat Institution|Royal National Lifeboat Institution]] (RNLI) search and rescue operations at [[Lynmouth|Lynmouth, Devon]], [[Devon|Devon]] in England from 1869 until 1944. Its best known action was in 1899 when the [[lifeboat|Lifeboat (rescue)]] was taken across [[Exmoor|Exmoor]] before being launched to assist a ship in trouble.
title: Lynmouth Lifeboat Station

abstract: From 1999 until the opening of the new building in 2004, committee rooms and the [[debating chamber|debating chamber]] of the Scottish Parliament were housed in the [[General Assembly Hall|General Assembly Hall of the Church of Scotland]] of the [[Church of Scotland|Church of Scotland]] located on [[The Mound|The Mound]] in Edinburgh. Office and administrative accommodation in support of the Parliament were provided in buildings leased from the [[City of Edinburgh Council|City of Edinburgh Council]]. The new Scottish Parliament Building brought together these different elements into one purpose-built parliamentary complex, housing 129 MSPs and more than 1,000 staff and [[civil servants|civil servants]].
title: Scottish Parliament Building

abstract: The Coconut Palace, also known as Tahanang Pilipino (), is a government building located in the [[Cultural Center of the Philippines Complex|Cultural Center of the Philippines Complex]], in [[Manila|Manila]], [[Philippines|Philippines]]. It was the official residence and the principal workplace of the [[Vice President of the Philippines|Vice President of the Philippines]] during the term of [[Jejomar Binay|Jejomar Binay]].
title: Coconut Palace

abstract: Soestdijk Palace ( ) is a former [[palace|palace]] of the [[Dutch Royal Family|House of Orange-Nassau]]. It consists of a central block and two wings.
title: Soestdijk Palace

abstract: [[Construction|Construction]] began in 1963 and was completed in 1967. Extensive use of [[prestressed concrete|prestressed concrete]] resulted in a simple and sturdy [[structure|structure]]. It surpassed the [[Empire State Building|Empire State Building]] to become the [[tallest free-standing structure in the world|List of tallest freestanding structures in the world]]. It held this [[record|world record]] for eight years until it was overtaken by the [[CN Tower|CN Tower]] in 1975, which surpassed its height by . The Ostankino Tower remained the second-tallest free-standing structure in the world for another 32 years until the [[Burj Khalifa|Burj Khalifa]] surpassed both it and the CN Tower in height in 2007. The Ostankino Tower has remained the tallest structure in Europe for over 50 years.
title: Ostankino Tower

abstract: Complexe Desjardins is a [[mixed-use|mixed-use]] office, hotel, and [[shopping mall|shopping mall]] complex located in [[Montreal|Montreal]], [[Quebec|Quebec]], Canada. The project was designed to develop the eastern end of [[downtown Montreal|downtown Montreal]], it is located in the quadrilateral formed by [[Saint Catherine|Saint Catherine Street]], [[Saint-Urbain|Saint Urbain Street]], [[Jeanne Mance|Jeanne Mance]] and [[René Lévesque Boulevard|René Lévesque Boulevard]].
title: Complexe Desjardins

abstract: Auckland Castle, also known as Auckland Palace and locally as the Bishop's Castle or Bishop's Palace, is located in [[Bishop Auckland|Bishop Auckland]], its neighbouring town in [[County Durham|County Durham]], [[England|England]].
title: Auckland Castle

abstract: Little and Broad Haven Lifeboat Station is a [[Royal National Lifeboat Institution|Royal National Lifeboat Institution]] (RNLI) [[lifeboat|Lifeboat (rescue)]] station in [[Pembrokeshire|Pembrokeshire]], West [[Wales|Wales]]. The station was opened in 1882 at [[Little Haven|Little Haven]] where it operated until 1921. It reopened in 1967 under its present name, and serves the area in [[St Bride's Bay|St Bride's Bay]] surrounding Little Haven and [[Broad Haven|Broad Haven]] resorts. When it was built it was the RNLI's smallest lifeboat station.
title: Little and Broad Haven Lifeboat Station

abstract: Amanora Park Town is a [[township|township]] project based near[[Hadapsar, Pune|Hadapsar, Pune]] opposite to the [[Magarpatta|Magarpatta]] township, in India. The project is developed by the City Corporation Limited, a real estate firm operating under the chairmanship of Aniruddha Deshpande. The township project comes under the [[Government of Maharashtra|Government of Maharashtra]]'s special township policy. Amanora Chambers, a juncture for a lot of start-ups and offices, is a part of this Amanora township.
title: Amanora Park Town

abstract: Gevora Hotel ([[Arabic|Arabic]]: فندق جيفورا) is a tall hotel along [[Sheikh Zayed Road|E 11 road (United Arab Emirates)]] in the city [[Dubai|Dubai]]. That height has given the skyscraper the title of tallest hotel building according to [[Guinness World Records|Guinness World Records]]. The four-star Gevora Hotel opened its doors in February 2018 after a construction period of twelve years. It offers a total of 528 rooms spread over its 75 floors and a number of facilities including restaurants and a pool on top of its parking garage building.
title: Gevora Hotel

abstract: Skegness Lifeboat Station is an RNLI operated lifeboat station located in the town of [[Skegness|Skegness]] in the [[English|England]] county of [[Lincolnshire|Lincolnshire]]. The station is located on the south-east coast north of the Wash and south of the [[Humber Estuary|Humber Estuary]]. This area of the British coastline is characterised by many shoals and constantly changing sandbanks, many of which lie between the town and the East Dudgeon Lightship. The current station was built in 1990 and was the first in the British Isles built especially to house a [[Mersey-class|Mersey-class lifeboat]] lifeboat. The boathouse also accommodates an Inshore Lifeboat and a souvenir shop. There are currently two lifeboats stationed at Skegness (2013). They are the Inshore D-class Lifeboat [[RNLB Marie Theresa Bertha Barras (D-792)|RNLB Marie Theresa Bertha Barras (D-792)]] and the Shannon-class AWB [[RNL Joel and April Grunnill (ON 1324)|RNLB Joel and April Grunnill (ON 1324)]]
title: Skegness Lifeboat Station

abstract: Aberdovey Lifeboat Station (Welsh: Aberdyfi) is an [[RNLI|Royal National Lifeboat Institution]] [[lifeboat|Lifeboat (rescue)]] station in the coastal village of [[Aberdovey|Aberdovey]], [[Gwynedd|Gwynedd]], West [[Wales|Wales]], on the [[River Dovey|River Dovey]] (Dyfi) estuary in [[Cardigan Bay|Cardigan Bay]]. It was established in 1853, but there has been a lifeboat serving the village since 1837.
title: Aberdovey Lifeboat Station

abstract: Cuartel de Santa Lucia is a ruined building in [[Intramuros|Intramuros]], [[Manila|Manila]], the Philippines.
title: Cuartel de Santa Lucia

abstract: Centre Georges Pompidou (), commonly shortened to Centre Pompidou and also known as the Pompidou Centre in English, is a complex building in the [[Beaubourg|Beaubourg]] area of the [[4th arrondissement of Paris|4th arrondissement of Paris]], near [[Les Halles|Les Halles]], [[rue Montorgueil|rue Montorgueil]], and the [[Marais|Le Marais]]. It was designed in the style of [[high-tech architecture|high-tech architecture]] by the architectural team of [[Richard Rogers|Richard Rogers]] and [[Renzo Piano|Renzo Piano]], along with [[Gianfranco Franchini|Gianfranco Franchini]].
title: Centre Georges Pompidou

abstract: Les Invalides (), formally the Hôtel national des Invalides (The National Residence of the Invalids), or also as Hôtel des Invalides, is a complex of buildings in the [[7th arrondissement|7th arrondissement of Paris]] of [[Paris|Paris]], France, containing [[museum|museums]] and monuments, all relating to the [[military history of France|military history of France]], as well as a hospital and a retirement home for [[war veteran|war veterans]], the building's original purpose. The buildings house the [[Musée de l'Armée|Musée de l'Armée]], the military museum of the Army of France, the [[Musée des Plans-Reliefs|Musée des Plans-Reliefs]], and the [[Musée d'Histoire Contemporaine|Musée d'Histoire Contemporaine]], as well as the Dôme des Invalides, a large church, the tallest in Paris at a height of 107 meters, with the tombs of some of France's war heroes, most notably [[Napoleon|Napoleon]].
title: Les Invalides

abstract: The Dartford-Thurrock River Crossing, commonly known as the Dartford Crossing and until 1991 the Dartford Tunnel, is a major road crossing of the [[River Thames|River Thames]] in England, carrying the A282 road between [[Dartford|Dartford]] in [[Kent|Kent]] to the south with [[Thurrock|Thurrock]] in [[Essex|Essex]] to the north. It consists of two bored tunnels and the [[cable-stayed|cable stayed bridge]] Queen Elizabeth II Bridge. The only fixed road crossing of the Thames east of [[Greater London|Greater London]], it is the busiest estuarial crossing in the United Kingdom, with an average daily use of over 130,000 vehicles. It opened in stages: the west tunnel in 1963, the east tunnel in 1980 and the bridge in 1991. The crossing, although not officially designated a motorway, is considered part of the [[M25 motorway|M25 motorway]]'s route, using the tunnels northbound and bridge southbound. Described as one of the most important road crossings in Britain, it suffers from heavy traffic and congestion.
title: Dartford Crossing

abstract: Sennen Cove Lifeboat Station is the base for [[Royal National Lifeboat Institution|Royal National Lifeboat Institution]] (RNLI) search and rescue operations for the sea around [[Land's End|Land's End]], [[Cornwall|Cornwall]] in the United Kingdom. The first [[lifeboat|Lifeboat (rescue)]] was stationed at [[Sennen Cove|Sennen Cove]] in 1853. Since 2009 it has operated a all weather boat (ALB) and a (IB1) inshore lifeboat (ILB).
title: Sennen Cove Lifeboat Station

abstract: Atlantic College Lifeboat Station (based in [[Atlantic College|Atlantic College]], [[South Wales|South Wales]], a [[United World College|United World College]]) opened in 1963 as one of the first experimental inshore lifeboat stations established by the [[RNLI|RNLI]].
title: Atlantic College Lifeboat Station

abstract: Penlee Lifeboat Station is the base for [[Royal National Lifeboat Institution|Royal National Lifeboat Institution]] (RNLI) search and rescue operations for [[Mount's Bay|Mount's Bay]] in [[Cornwall|Cornwall]], United Kingdom. The [[lifeboat|Lifeboat (rescue)]] station operated at various locations in [[Penzance|Penzance]] from the early 19th century. It moved to [[Penlee Point|Penlee Point, Mousehole]] near [[Mousehole|Mousehole]] in 1913, thus gaining its current name, but was moved to [[Newlyn|Newlyn]] in 1983 without any change of name. The station is remembered for the [[loss of the entire lifeboat crew on 19 December 1981|Penlee lifeboat disaster]].
title: Penlee Lifeboat Station

abstract: Cardigan Lifeboat Station, at [[Poppit Sands|Poppit Sands]], North [[Pembrokeshire|Pembrokeshire]], near [[Cardigan, Ceredigion|Cardigan, Ceredigion]], [[Wales|Wales]], is a [[Royal National Lifeboat Institution|Royal National Lifeboat Institution]] (RNLI) lifeboat station opened in 1849. The station closed in 1932 but reopened in 1971 as an inshore lifeboat station.
title: Cardigan Lifeboat Station

abstract: 171 La Trobe Street is a building in Melbourne, Victoria, Australia, by architect [[Nonda Katsalidis|Nonda Katsalidis]]. 171 La Trobe Street is a 13-storey structure glazed with a green glass exterior and designs overhanging the building on each side.
title: 171 La Trobe Street

abstract: Portishead Lifeboat Station (based in [[Portishead, Somerset|Portishead, Somerset]]) opened in 1995 as Portishead Lifeboat Trust, an independent [[lifeboat|Lifeboat (rescue)]] operating from Sugar Loaf Bay. It was adopted by the [[Royal National Lifeboat Institution|Royal National Lifeboat Institution]] (RNLI) in 2015 when a new lifeboat station was opened adjacent to Portishead Pier.
title: Portishead Lifeboat Station

abstract: Holyhead Lifeboat Station was first mentioned in 1825 when it was decided a lifeboat would be built for the coastal town of Holyhead. A local committee was formed three years later and the first lifeboat arrived at the station shortly afterwards. The [[Royal National Lifeboat Institution|Royal National Lifeboat Institution]] (RNLI) took over control of the station in 1855 and an lifeboat house was built three years later. The station covered the shipping lane in and out of Liverpool. In 1890 Holyhead Lifeboat Station received its first steam lifeboat, which was one of six to serve in the RNLI. The lifeboat was involved in an operation to rescue crewmembers of the SS Harold in 1908 which anchored near rocks between [[North Stack|North Stack]] and [[South Stack|South Stack]]. It was retired in 1928 when it was replaced by a motor-powered lifeboat and twenty-one years later a new boathouse and slipway were constructed on [[Salt Island|Salt Island, Anglesey]]. The boathouse and slipway were used until 1980 when a new Arun class boat was allocated to the station and kept afloat in the harbour. Unfortunately, wash from the ferry traffic lead to the boat's GRP hull being damaged and as a temporary measure a steel hulled Waveney class boat was placed on station while the boathouse and slipway were reconditioned and a new Tyne class boat was constructed for the station. The new boat entered service in 1985 and slipway launching continued until 1997 when a new, more protected, berth was found for an Arun class boat to take over, to be replaced in 2003 by the present Severn class.An inshore lifeboat station was established on the site in 1967. The boathouse was expanded in 1987 to fit a [[D-class lifeboat (EA16)|D-class lifeboat (EA16)]] and its launching trolley. Its current inshore boat, the D-791 Mary & Archie Hooper, entered service in 2016; the current all-weather boat that serves the station, the ON 1272 Christopher Pearce, was first used in 2003. Lead was stolen from the station's roof in the morning of 16 June 2011. In February 2015 the station appointed its first female helm.
title: Holyhead Lifeboat Station

abstract: The Theater Erfurt is a German municipal theatre located in [[Erfurt|Erfurt]], the capital of [[Thuringia|Thuringia]]. The main stage is in a new building in the , completed in 2003. The theatre offers musical theatre and concerts, played by the . Ballet and plays are offered by guest performances. The company organizes the annual open air festival [[DomStufen|DomStufen-Festspiele]]. The theatre's current Generalintendant, , has held the post since 2002.
title: Theater Erfurt

abstract: Stupa No. 2 is located in the Buddhist complex of [[Sanchi|Sanchi]]. It was probably founded later than the Great Stupa (Stupa number 1) at Sanchi, but it contained reliquaries dated to the [[Mauryan Empire|Mauryan Empire]] period (323-185 BCE), and it was the earliest to receive decorative reliefs, about a century earlier than Stupa Nb 1. One of the key indicators to date Sanchi Stupa No.2 has been the similarity of its architectural motifs with those of [[Heliodorus pillar|Heliodorus pillar]], which is datable to circa 113 BCE due to its establishment during the rule of [[Indo-Greek|Indo-Greek]] [[Antialcidas|Antialcidas]], as well as similarities of the [[paleography|paleography]] of the inscriptions.
title: Sanchi Stupa No.2

abstract: The Atlanta Financial Center is a 914,747-square-foot office building complex located in [[Buckhead|Buckhead]], [[Atlanta|Atlanta]], [[Georgia|Georgia (U.S. state)]]. The office complex is situated directly over [[Georgia 400|Georgia 400]] and features a black aluminum/glass-frame design, composed of three interconnected towers: an 11 story South Tower, a 12 story North Tower and a 19-story East Tower. The Atlanta Financial Center is situated next to the [[MARTA|Metropolitan Atlanta Rapid Transit Authority]] [[Red Line|Red Line (MARTA)]] [[Buckhead station|Buckhead station]]; the Red Line runs directly underneath the complex.
title: Atlanta Financial Center

abstract: The Austin Centre is a 16-story mixed-use hi-rise in Downtown [[Austin, Texas|Austin, Texas]]. The building, notable for its large enclosed glass atrium, contains office space, retail space, an [[Omni Hotel|Omni Hotel]], and condominiums; the hotel component of the complex contains a rooftop pool and bar. The building is headquarters to companies like [[LIN Digital|LIN Digital]] and the Capital Factory, a [[startup incubator|startup incubator]]. The building's lobby is home to many large events, including the [[South by Southwest|South by Southwest]] Startup Crawl.
title: Austin Centre

abstract: One Canada Square is a skyscraper in [[Canary Wharf|Canary Wharf]], London. It is the second tallest building in the United Kingdom at [[above ground level|above ground level]] containing 50 stories.
title: One Canada Square

abstract: The Barbican Estate is a residential estate that was built during the 1960s and the 1980s within the [[City of London|City of London]] in [[Central London|Central London]], in an area once devastated by [[World War II|World War II]] bombings and today densely populated by financial institutions. It contains, or is adjacent to, the [[Barbican Arts Centre|Barbican Arts Centre]], the [[Museum of London|Museum of London]], the [[Guildhall School of Music and Drama|Guildhall School of Music and Drama]], the Barbican public library, the [[City of London School for Girls|City of London School for Girls]] and a [[YMCA|YMCA]] (now closed), forming the Barbican Complex.
title: Barbican Estate

abstract: Stockholm Palace or the Royal Palace ( or ) is the [[official residence|official residence]] and major [[royal palace|Crown palaces in Sweden]] of the [[Swedish monarch|Monarchy of Sweden]] (the actual residence of King [[Carl XVI Gustaf|Carl XVI Gustaf of Sweden]] and [[Queen Silvia|Queen Silvia of Sweden]] is at [[Drottningholm Palace|Drottningholm Palace]]). Stockholm Palace is located on [[Stadsholmen|Stadsholmen]], in [[Gamla stan|Gamla stan]] in the [[capital|capital city]], [[Stockholm|Stockholm]]. It neighbours the [[Riksdag building|Parliament House, Stockholm]]. The offices of the King, the other members of the [[Swedish Royal Family|Swedish Royal Family]], and the offices of the [[Royal Court of Sweden|Royal Court of Sweden]] are located here. The palace is used for representative purposes by the King whilst performing his duties as the [[head of state|head of state]].
title: Stockholm Palace

abstract: Näsinneula is an [[observation tower|observation tower]] in [[Tampere|Tampere]], [[Finland|Finland]], overseeing Lake [[Näsijärvi|Näsijärvi]]. It was built in 1970–1971 and was designed by [[Pekka Ilveskoski|Pekka Ilveskoski]]. It is the tallest free-standing structure in Finland and the second tallest observation tower in the [[Nordic countries|Nordic countries]] at a height of . The tower opened in 1971 and is located in the [[Särkänniemi|Särkänniemi]] [[amusement park|amusement park]]. There is a [[revolving restaurant|revolving restaurant]] in the tower above the ground; one revolution takes 45 minutes. The design of Näsinneula was inspired by the [[Space Needle|Space Needle]] in [[Seattle|Seattle]]. The idea of a revolving restaurant was taken from the [[Puijo tower|Puijo tower]] in [[Kuopio|Kuopio]].
title: Näsinneula

abstract: The Toronto–Dominion Centre, or TD Centre, is a cluster of buildings in [[downtown Toronto|downtown Toronto]], [[Ontario|Ontario]] owned by [[Cadillac Fairview|Cadillac Fairview]]. It has six towers and a pavilion covered in bronze-tinted glass and black painted steel. It serves as the global headquarters of the [[Toronto-Dominion Bank|Toronto-Dominion Bank]], and provides office and retail space for many other businesses. About 21,000 people work in the complex, making it the largest in Canada.
title: Toronto–Dominion Centre

abstract: The Dominion Astrophysical Observatory, located on Observatory Hill, in [[Saanich, British Columbia|Saanich, British Columbia]], was completed in 1918 by the [[Canadian government|Canadian Government]]. The Dominion Architect responsible for the building was [[Edgar Lewis Horwood|Edgar Lewis Horwood]]. The main instrument is the 72 inch (1.83 meter) [[aperture|aperture]] Plaskett [[telescope|telescope]], proposed and designed by [[John S. Plaskett|John S. Plaskett]] in 1910 with the support of the [[International Union for Cooperation in Solar Research|International Union for Cooperation in Solar Research]]. It was planned to be the largest telescope in the world but delays meant it was completed and saw "first light" on May 6, 1918, 6 months after the [[100-inch Hooker telescope|100-inch Hooker telescope]] (2.5 m) at [[Mount Wilson Observatory|Mount Wilson Observatory]].
title: Dominion Astrophysical Observatory

abstract: Gyeongbokgung (), also known as Gyeongbokgung Palace or Gyeongbok Palace, was the main royal [[palace|palace]] of the [[Joseon dynasty|Joseon]]. Built in 1395, it is located in northern [[Seoul|Seoul]], [[South Korea|South Korea]]. The largest of the [[Five Grand Palaces|Five Grand Palaces]] built by the Joseon dynasty, Gyeongbokgung served as the home of Kings of the Joseon dynasty, the Kings' households, as well as the government of Joseon.
title: Gyeongbokgung

abstract: The Shard, also infrequently referred to as the Shard of Glass, Shard London Bridge and formerly London Bridge Tower, is a 95-story [[supertall skyscraper|supertall skyscraper]], designed by the Italian architect [[Renzo Piano|Renzo Piano]], in [[Southwark|Southwark]], [[London|London]], that forms part of the Shard Quarter development. Standing high, the Shard is the [[tallest building in the United Kingdom|List of tallest buildings in the United Kingdom]], the [[tallest building in the European Union|List of tallest buildings in the European Union]], the [[fifth-tallest building in Europe|List of tallest buildings in Europe]] and the [[96th-tallest building in the world|List of tallest buildings]]. It is also the [[second-tallest free-standing structure in the United Kingdom|List of tallest structures in the United Kingdom]], after the concrete tower of the [[Emley Moor transmitting station|Emley Moor transmitting station]]. It replaced [[Southwark Towers|Southwark Towers]], a 24-story office block built on the site in 1975.
title: The Shard

abstract: The Torre Colpatria () is a 50-story skyscraper in the downtown area of [[Bogotá|Bogotá]], [[Colombia|Colombia]]. It's the third tallest building in the country and the fifth-tallest in South America. Constructed from 1973 to 1978 and opened in 1979, it has a total height of , becoming the tallest skyscraper of Colombia and holding that title until 2016, when the south tower of the [[BD Bacatá|BD Bacatá]] was topped off. The main headquarters of the Colpatria Bank are located in the building, and also a great number of other banks and financial corporations have offices in it. The building lies at the intersection of 26th street and 7th avenue, in the heart of the city's downtown.
title: Torre Colpatria

abstract: The Biodesign Institute is a major research center known for [[nature-inspired|Biotechnology]] solutions to global health, sustainability, and security challenges located on the [[Tempe campus|Arizona State University Tempe campus]] of [[Arizona State University|Arizona State University]]. The Institute is organized into a growing number of collaborative research centers and laboratories staffed by scientists in diverse disciplines. It is currently led by Executive Director Dr. Joshua LaBaer, a personalized diagnostics researcher.
title: The Biodesign Institute

abstract: The Southern Integrated Gateway () refers to a complex in [[Johor Bahru|Johor Bahru]], [[Johor|Johor]], [[Malaysia|Malaysia]] incorporating the city's main railway station, [[JB Sentral|Johor Bahru Sentral railway station]], and a [[:customs|:customs]], [[:immigration|:immigration]], and [[quarantine|quarantine]] complex (CIQ), the [[Sultan Iskandar Building|Sultan Iskandar Building]] ([[Malay|Malay language]]: Bangunan Sultan Iskandar), named after [[Almarhum Sultan Iskandar ibni Almarhum Sultan Ismail|Sultan Iskandar of Johor#Legacy]] of Johor.
title: Southern Integrated Gateway

abstract: Dunans Castle is a historic structure located in [[Glendaruel|Glendaruel]], on the [[Cowal|Cowal]] [[peninsula|peninsula]], [[Argyll and Bute|Argyll and Bute]], [[Scotland|Scotland]]. The property is owned by Charles and Sadie Dixon-Spain. A property at Dounens was shown on maps in 1590; Dunans House was elaborated into its present mock [[castle|castle]] form in 1864. Once part of a much larger estate the property presently includes of ground and in 2001 was ruined by fire.
title: Dunans Castle

abstract: The Palace of Nations (, ) is the home of the [[United Nations Office at Geneva|United Nations Office at Geneva]], located in [[Geneva|Geneva]], [[Switzerland|Switzerland]]. It was built between 1929 and 1938 to serve as the headquarters of the [[League of Nations|League of Nations]]. It has served as the home of the United Nations Office at Geneva since 1946 when the [[Secretary-General of the United Nations|Secretary-General of the United Nations]] signed a Headquarters Agreement with the Swiss authorities, although Switzerland did not become a member of the [[United Nations|United Nations]] until 2002.
title: Palace of Nations

abstract: The building, a silver glass [[curtain wall|Curtain wall (architecture)]] skyscraper with of floor space, includes retail and restaurant space, a conference room, a nine-story parking garage and a [[pedestrian bridge|Pedestrian separation structure]] that links the Cira Centre's lobby with 30th Street Station. The building's lighting, designed by Cline Bettridge Bernstein Lighting Design, includes a wall of [[LEDs|Light-emitting diode]] on most of its [[facade|facade]] that can change color to create various patterns and effects.
title: Cira Centre

abstract: King's Meadow Campus is a university campus, that is part of the [[University of Nottingham|University of Nottingham]], and is located in [[Nottingham|Nottingham]]. From 1983 until 2005, the complex was an ITV studio complex called East Midlands Television Centre and later Carlton Studios.
title: King's Meadow Campus

abstract: The Russell Senate Office Building is the oldest of the [[United States Senate|United States Senate]] office buildings. Designed in the [[Beaux-Arts|Beaux-Arts architecture]] [[architectural style|architectural style]], it was built from 1903 to 1908 and opened in 1909. It was named for former Senator [[Richard Russell Jr.|Richard Russell Jr.]] from [[Georgia|Georgia (U.S. state)]] in 1972. It occupies a site north of the Capitol bounded by [[Constitution Avenue|Constitution Avenue (DC)]], First Street, Delaware Avenue, and C Street N.E..
title: Russell Senate Office Building

abstract: 'La Fábrica' ([[English|English language]]: "The Factory") is the name given to the [[Real Madrid Youth Academy|Real Madrid C.F. (youth)]] and [[player farm system|Farm team]], or "[[cantera|cantera]]." It is a world class youth academy that has contributed to [[Real Madrid|Real Madrid C.F.]]'s sporting success throughout its history. For instance, in the 1980s, Real Madrid won five consecutive [[La Liga|La Liga]] titles, two consecutive [[UEFA Europa League|UEFA Europa Leagues]] and reached three consecutive [[UEFA Champions League|UEFA Champions League]] semi-finals with a squad composed mostly of players formed at La Fábrica.
title: La Fábrica

abstract: Whampoa Garden () is the largest [[private housing estate|private housing estate]] located in [[Hung Hom|Hung Hom]], [[Kowloon|Kowloon]], Hong Kong. It was built on the site of the former [[Whampoa Dockyards|Whampoa Dockyards]] by [[Hutchison Whampoa Property|Hutchison Whampoa Property]]. The urban design of the estate incorporates concepts inspired by the [[Garden city movement|Garden city movement]] and was completed in 1991.
title: Whampoa Garden

abstract: The First National Bank Tower also plays host to Trek up the Tower, a vertical stair climb race up to the top of the tower. This race is presented by The Wellness Council of the Midlands.
title: First National Bank Tower

abstract: SLR Siemiatycze (Makarki) is a tall [[partially guyed tower|partially guyed tower]], consisting of a free-standing lattice tower with a [[guyed mast|guyed mast]] on top, for FM and TV situated at [[Makarki|Makarki]] near [[Siemiatycze|Siemiatycze]] in [[Podlaskie Voivodeship|Podlaskie Voivodeship]], [[Poland|Poland]]. It is also referred to as Makarki Directional Radio Tower.
title: SLR Siemiatycze (Makarki)

abstract: Fountain Studios (formerly Wembley Studios) was an independently owned [[television studio|television studio]] located in [[Wembley Park|Wembley Park]], [[Wembley|Wembley]], north-west [[London|London]], close to [[Wembley Park|Wembley Park tube station]] [[underground station|underground station]]. The company was part of the Avesco Group plc.
title: Fountain Studios

abstract: The Columbia Centre is a landmark office building situated in the heart of [[Bracknell|Bracknell]] town centre adjacent to the rail station, bus station and [[taxi rank|taxi rank]] and situated prominently on Market Street / Station Road. The building is currently undergoing a comprehensive refurbishment, an enhanced entrance and reception area will offer a new contemporary style to the building.
title: Columbia Centre

abstract: 5 World Trade Center (also referred to as 130 Liberty Street) is a planned skyscraper at the [[World Trade Center|World Trade Center site]] in [[Lower Manhattan|Lower Manhattan]], [[New York City|New York City]]. The site is across [[Liberty Street|Liberty Street (Manhattan)]], to the south of the main World Trade Center site. , the project is on standby while the [[Port Authority|Port Authority of New York and New Jersey]] explores a potential sale of the lot to a developer and looks for tenants to occupy the skyscraper. The proposed building shares its name with the original [[5 World Trade Center|List of tenants in Five World Trade Center]], which was heavily damaged as a result of the [[collapse of the North Tower|Collapse of the World Trade Center]] during the [[September 11 attacks|September 11 attacks]] and was later demolished. The Port Authority has no plans to construct a building at 130 Liberty Street, although it is open to future development of the site as office, retail, hotel, residential or some mix of those uses.
title: 5 World Trade Center

abstract: 84 Plymouth Grove, now known as Elizabeth Gaskell's House, is a [[writer's house museum|writer's house museum]] in [[Manchester|Manchester]]. The [[Grade II* listed|Listed building]] [[neoclassical|Neoclassical architecture]] villa was the residence of [[William|William Gaskell]] and [[Elizabeth Gaskell|Elizabeth Gaskell]] from 1850 till their deaths in 1884 and 1865 respectively. The Gaskell household continued to occupy the villa after the deaths of Elizabeth and William. The death of Elizabeth Gaskell's daughter, Margaret Emily "Meta" Gaskell, in 1913, brought to an end the Gaskells' residence there.
title: 84 Plymouth Grove

abstract: The Burbank Studios (formerly known as NBC Studios) is a television production facility located in [[Burbank, California|Burbank, California]]. The studio is home to [[Days of Our Lives|Days of Our Lives]], the [[IHeartRadio|IHeartRadio]] Theater, and the [[Blizzard|Activision Blizzard]] [[eSports|eSports]] Arena (home of the [[Overwatch League|Overwatch League]]).
title: The Burbank Studios

abstract: Wuhan Greenland Center is an unfinished skyscraper in [[Wuhan|Wuhan]], China. Construction has stalled since August 2017 at the 96th floor. Due to [[airspace|airspace]] regulations, it will be redesigned so its height does not exceed 500 metres above sea level. Another Chinese building, [[Ping An Finance Center|Ping An Finance Centre]], was also scaled down for similar reasons.
title: Wuhan Greenland Center

abstract: Elite Towers is a cluster of 34 towers located in the [[City of Arabia|City of Arabia]] in [[Dubai|Dubai]], [[United Arab Emirates|United Arab Emirates]]. Currently, there are a few towers that are under construction; all others are approved. The tallest tower in the complex has a height of 290   m (951   ft). The number of floors for the towers range from 30 to 60. The towers in the complex consist of residential, office and hotel towers. The whole complex is a development by Ilyas and Mustafa Galadari Group.
title: Elite Towers

abstract: Marina 1 is a cluster of six residential buildings in [[Dubai Marina|Dubai Marina]] in [[Dubai|Dubai]], [[United Arab Emirates|United Arab Emirates]]. Marina 1 was the first phase, and first completed buildings, in Dubai Marina. Because of that, these buildings have become a symbol for Dubai Marina. The complex contains 1100 units, which were all sold out shortly after going on sale in 2002.
title: Marina 1

abstract: The Executive Towers is a complex of 12 towers in [[Business Bay|Business Bay]] development in [[Dubai|Dubai]], [[United Arab Emirates|United Arab Emirates]]. They comprise 10 residential towers, one commercial tower known as Aspect Tower, and one hotel tower 'The Taj Hotel'. They are the first buildings to be completed in [[Business Bay|Business Bay]], and are located near its entrance.
title: Executive Towers

abstract: Originally Calpine intended to lease of space. By February 2003 Calpine announced that it would sublease some of the space to other firms. The Calpine Center was scheduled for completion at the end of 2003. In July 2003 the space was 82% booked for occupation. Calpine and Burlington Resources, another energy company, leased space in the building; each company agreed to lease of space. In addition Jones Day agreed to lease over . The building opened on Monday November 10, 2003. Other tenants that had occupied the building by its opening included Cheniere Energy Inc. and Hines's southwest region development office. In 2004 Avalon Advisors LP agreed to lease of space in the building, bringing its occupancy level to 86%.
title: Calpine Center

abstract: La Masia de Can Planes, usually shortened to La Masia (; ), is often used to generically describe the Barcelona [[youth academy|youth academy]]. This academy holds more than 300 young players, and has been praised since 2002 as the best in the world, being a significant factor in FC Barcelona's European success.
title: La Masia

abstract: The Art Institute of Chicago Building (1893 structure built as the World's Congress Auxiliary Building) houses the [[Art Institute of Chicago|Art Institute of Chicago]], and is part of the [[Chicago Landmark|Chicago Landmark]] [[Historic Michigan Boulevard District|Historic Michigan Boulevard District]] in the [[Loop|Chicago Loop]] [[community area|Community areas of Chicago]] of [[Chicago|Chicago]], [[Illinois|Illinois]]. The building is located in [[Grant Park|Grant Park (Chicago)]] on the east side of [[Michigan Avenue|Michigan Avenue (Chicago)]], and marks the third address for the Art Institute. The building was built for the joint purpose of accommodating the 1893 [[World's Columbian Exposition|World's Columbian Exposition]] and subsequently the Art Institute. The core of the current complex, located opposite Adams Street, officially opened to the public on December 8, 1893, and was renamed the Allerton Building in 1968.
title: Art Institute of Chicago Building

abstract: Manhattan Hill () is a [[high-rise|high-rise]] development located in the [[Lai Chi Kok|Lai Chi Kok]] district of [[Kowloon|Kowloon]] in [[Hong Kong|Hong Kong]], formerly [[Kowloon Motor Bus|Kowloon Motor Bus]] Lai Chi Kok Depot. The complex consists of five towers. Towers 1 and 2, which are interconnected, rise 51 floors, while towers 3, 5 and 6 rise 49 floors; each of the five towers is high. The entire complex was developed by [[Sun Hung Kai Properties|Sun Hung Kai Properties]] and was completed in January 2007.
title: Manhattan Hill

abstract: Dunbar Lifeboat Station is a [[lifeboat|lifeboat (rescue)]] station located in [[Dunbar|Dunbar]] on the South East coast of [[Scotland|Scotland]], operated by the [[Royal National Lifeboat Institution|Royal National Lifeboat Institution]]. Dunbar Lifeboat Station currently operates a 'Trent' Class All Weather Lifeboat and a 'D' Class Inshore Lifeboat. The current coxswain is Gary Fairbairn.
title: Dunbar Lifeboat Station

abstract: The Citadel of Besançon () is a 17th-century fortress in [[Franche-Comté|Franche-Comté]], [[France|France]]. It is one of the finest masterpieces of military architecture designed by [[Sébastien Le Prestre de Vauban|Sébastien Le Prestre de Vauban]]. The Citadel occupies on Mount Saint-Etienne, one of the seven hills that protect [[Besançon|Besançon]], the capital of Franche-Comté. Mount Saint-Etienne occupies the neck of an oxbow formed by the river [[Doubs|Doubs]], giving the site a strategic importance that [[Julius Caesar|Julius Caesar]] recognised as early as 58 BC. The Citadel overlooks the old quarter of the city, which is located within the oxbow, and has views of the city and its surroundings.
title: Citadel of Besançon

abstract: The Sultan Iskandar Building or Bangunan Sultan Iskandar (BSI) (Jawi: باڠونن سلطان إسکندر) is a [[customs, immigration and quarantine (CIQ) complex|border checkpoint]] in [[Johor Bahru|Johor Bahru]], [[Johor|Johor]], [[Malaysia|Malaysia]]. Located at the [[Johor–Singapore Causeway|Johor–Singapore Causeway]], it is one of the two land [[ports of entry|ports of entry]] to Malaysia on the [[Malaysia–Singapore border|Malaysia–Singapore border]].
title: Sultan Iskandar Building

abstract: The Fort of Saint Vincent Ferrer (Fuerte de San Vicente Ferrer) or commonly known as Punta Cruz Watchtower (Bantayan ng Punta Cruz) is a [[Spanish colonial era|History of the Philippines (1521–1898)]] [[watchtower|watchtower]] located at the western tip of the municipality of [[Maribojoc|Maribojoc]], [[Bohol|Bohol]], Philippines. Also known as Maribojoc Watchtower because of its geographical location, it is located three kilometers () away from [[Maribojoc Church|Maribojoc Church]]. It is known for being the "only perfect [[isosceles triangle|isosceles triangle]]" tower-fort structure in the Philippines.
title: Punta Cruz Watchtower

abstract: St Agnes Lifeboat Station (based in [[St Agnes|St Agnes, Cornwall]], [[Cornwall|Cornwall]], [[UK|UK]]) opened in 1968. The station's lifeboats have been sponsored by BBC's [[Blue Peter|Blue Peter]] programme, mostly being named Blue Peter IV.
title: St Agnes Lifeboat Station

abstract: Aberystwyth Lifeboat Station is an [[RNLI|Royal National Lifeboat Institution]] [[lifeboat|Lifeboat (rescue)]] station in the coastal resort of [[Aberystwyth|Aberystwyth]], [[Ceredigion|Ceredigion]], West [[Wales|Wales]]. It was established in 1861, but there has been a lifeboat serving the town since 1843.
title: Aberystwyth Lifeboat Station

abstract: The Calvo Building is a historic building along [[Escolta|Escolta]] corner Soda Streets, [[Binondo|Binondo]], [[Manila|Manila]], Philippines. Built in 1938, it is an outstanding example of [[beaux-arts|Beaux-Arts architecture]] architecture. It served as the home of the radio station [[DZBB-AM|DZBB-AM]] before moving to its present location in Diliman, [[Quezon City|Quezon City]]. It now houses the Escolta Museum which contains memorabilia from the past. The building is designed by [[Fernando H. Ocampo|Fernando H. Ocampo]].
title: Calvo Building

abstract: RTCN Suwałki (Krzemianucha) is a tall guyed mast for FM and TV situated at [[Jeleniewo|Jeleniewo]] near [[Suwałki|Suwałki]] in [[Podlaskie Voivodeship|Podlaskie Voivodeship]], [[Poland|Poland]].
title: RTCN Suwałki (Krzemianucha)

abstract: Nailcote Hall is a four-star 17th century country house hotel located in [[Berkswell|Berkswell]], [[Warwickshire|Warwickshire]], United Kingdom. The hotel features 49 rooms alongside a Par 3 Champion golf course, restaurant, and leisure and conference facilities. The venue also hosts weddings and entertainment events.
title: Nailcote Hall

abstract: The Southern Cross Hotel was a hotel in Melbourne, Australia. It opened in 1962 as Australia's first modern 'International' hotel, heralding the arrival of American-style glamour, the jet-set and international tourism. It occupied a large site on [[Bourke Street|Bourke Street]] in central [[Melbourne|Melbourne]], formerly occupied by the grand Eastern Market, and was the premier hotel in the city into the early 1980s. The Southern Cross was the preferred hotel for celebrities in this period, most famously the Beatles in 1964, and the ballroom was the preferred location for locally and nationally important events.
title: Southern Cross Hotel

abstract: The Baldomero Aguinaldo Shrine is a single-detached house built by [[Gen. Baldomero Aguinaldo|Baldomero Aguinaldo]], cousin of [[Gen. Emilio Aguinaldo|Emilio Aguinaldo]] during the American Colonial Period in 1906 at Binakayan, [[Kawit, Cavite|Kawit, Cavite]]. Baldomero held several positions at the revolutionary government during the early 1900s. He became the head of the Kawit Chapter of the [[Katipunan|Katipunan]], President of the KKK Magdalo Council, and Secretary of the Treasury in the 1897 [[Biak-na-Bato Republic|Republic of Biak-na-Bato]]. Also, he became the Secretary of War and Public Works after the establishment of the [[First Philippine Republic|First Philippine Republic]] by Emilio Aguinaldo.
title: Baldomero Aguinaldo Shrine

abstract: The Casa de Segunda, also known as Luz–Katigbak House, is a heritage house museum located along Rizal Street, [[Lipa City, Batangas|Lipa, Batangas]]. It was built during the 1860s and owned by Don Manuel Mitra de San Miguel-Luz and Doña Segunda Solis Katigbak, [[Dr. José Rizal's|José Rizal]] first love. The house was repaired in 1956 by Paz Luz-Dimayuga and was eventually declared a national heritage house by the [[National Historic Institute|National Historical Commission of the Philippines]]. At present, the house was converted into a [[museum|museum]].
title: Casa de Segunda

abstract: The Ted Weiss Federal Building, also known as the Foley Square Federal Building, is a 34-story [[United States|United States]] [[Federal Building|Federal government of the United States]] located at 290 [[Broadway|Broadway (Manhattan)]] in [[Foley Square|Foley Square]] in the [[Civic Center|Civic Center, Manhattan]] district of [[Lower Manhattan|Lower Manhattan]], [[New York City|New York City]]. The building, which is adjacent to the [[African Burial Ground National Monument|African Burial Ground National Monument]], was opened in 1995. The building is named for [[Ted Weiss|Ted Weiss]], deceased [[Democratic|Democratic Party (United States)]] member of the [[United States House of Representatives|United States House of Representatives]] from [[New York|New York (state)]].
title: Ted Weiss Federal Building

abstract: The Building of Baku City Executive Power is an administrative building at [[ Istiglaliyyat Street, 4|Istiglaliyyat Street]]. The building was built in Baroque style in 1900–1904 on the basis of architect Józef Gosławski's project. The building is the last work of architect Gosławski. After the death of Gosławski in 1904, the project was initially led by Kazimierz Skórewicz, later by [[Józef Płoszko|Józef Płoszko]].
title: Building of Baku City Executive Power

abstract: Hospice Sainte-Cunégonde (or Hospice de Sainte-Cunégonde, or Asile de Sainte-Cunégonde) was an [[orphanage|orphanage]], [[child care|child care]] centre and [[nursing home|nursing home]] for the destitute in [[Montreal|Montreal]]'s Sainte-Cunégonde neighbourhood, today known as [[Little Burgundy|Little Burgundy]]. It was operated by the [[Grey Nuns|Grey Nuns]], a Roman Catholic religious order based in Montreal. The hospice was established in 1889 in the former Brewster mansion, and moved in 1896 to its own building at 2625 Albert Street at the corner of [[Atwater Avenue|Atwater Avenue]]. Albert Street is today named Lionel-Groulx Avenue. The building had a stone facade but its interior structure was built of timber.
title: Hospice Sainte-Cunégonde

abstract: It was officially opened on the 15th of March 2012 as Niyama Maldives by PER AQUUM Hotels & Resorts. Minor International (MINT) acquired a 50% stake in NIYAMA Maldives as a part of the Per AQUUM brand, which MINT acquired 50% of in August 2013. It was named Niyama Private Islands Maldives following its full acquisition by Minor in 2017.
title: Niyama Private Islands Maldives

abstract: San Jacinto Center is a three-building [[real estate development|real estate development]] in Downtown [[Austin, Texas|Austin, Texas]]. The complex, which overlooks [[Lady Bird Lake|Lady Bird Lake]], contains a 21-story office tower, a 10-story [[Four Seasons Hotel|Four Seasons Hotel]], and the 32-story Four Seasons Residences, a condo [[skyscraper|skyscraper]]. The [[postmodern|postmodern architecture]] office tower and hotel are clad in Texas creme [[limestone|limestone]] and [[Llano|Llano, Texas]] rose granite.
title: San Jacinto Center

abstract: Looe Lifeboat Station is the base for [[Royal National Lifeboat Institution|Royal National Lifeboat Institution]] (RNLI) search and rescue operations at [[Looe|Looe]], [[Cornwall|Cornwall]] in the United Kingdom.
title: Looe Lifeboat Station

abstract: The Halifax Central Library is a [[public library|public library]] in [[Halifax|Halifax, Nova Scotia]], [[Nova Scotia|Nova Scotia]], [[Canada|Canada]] on the corner of [[Spring Garden Road|Spring Garden, Halifax]] and Queen Street. It serves as the flagship library of the [[Halifax Public Libraries|Halifax Public Libraries]], replacing the Spring Garden Road Memorial Library.
title: Halifax Central Library

abstract: Newhaven Lifeboat Station is an [[RNLI|RNLI]] station located in the town of [[Newhaven|Newhaven, East Sussex]] in the [[English|England]] [[county|county]] of [[East Sussex|East Sussex]] in the [[United Kingdom|United Kingdom]]. The station currently operates as all-weather lifeboat station. The original station was established in 1803 and taken over by the RNLI in 1854. The current lifeboat (2014) is the [[Severn class|Severn-class lifeboat]] [[David and Elizabeth Acland (ON 1243)|RNLB David and Elizabeth Acland (ON 1243)]].
title: Newhaven Lifeboat Station

abstract: Whitstable Lifeboat Station is an RNLI station located in the [[Whitstable|Whitstable]] in the [[English|England]] county of [[Kent|Kent]]. The station was established in 1963. The current lifeboat on the station is a which is named Lewisco (B-877) which has been on the station since 2014.
title: Whitstable Lifeboat Station

abstract: Dover Lifeboat Station is a [[Royal National Lifeboat Institution|Royal National Lifeboat Institution]] (RNLI) lifeboat station located in the town of [[Dover|Dover]] in the [[English|England]] county of [[Kent|Kent]]. The station first opened in 1837, becoming under the RNLI’s control in 1855.
title: Dover Lifeboat Station

abstract: Cuéllar Castle or The Castle of the Dukes of Alburquerque is the most emblematic monument in the town of [[Cuéllar|Cuéllar]], located in the [[province of Segovia|province of Segovia]], autonomous community of [[Castile and León|Castile and León]], in [[Spain|Spain]]. It was declared [[Bien de Interés Cultural|Bien de Interés Cultural]] (Property of Cultural Interest) on 3 June 1931.
title: Cuéllar Castle

abstract: The Bacton Gas Terminal is a complex of six [[gas terminals|Natural gas processing]] within four sites located on the [[North Sea|North Sea]] coast in [[North Norfolk|North Norfolk]] near [[Paston|Paston, Norfolk]] and between [[Bacton|Bacton, Norfolk]] and [[Mundesley|Mundesley]]. The nearest main town is [[North Walsham|North Walsham]]. The other main UK gas terminals which receive gas from the UK continental shelf are at [[St Fergus, Aberdeenshire|St Fergus Gas Terminal]]; [[Easington, East Riding of Yorkshire|Easington Gas Terminal]]; [[Theddlethorpe|Theddlethorpe Gas Terminal]], Lincolnshire; [[CATS Terminal|Central Area Transmission System]], Teesside; and [[Rampside gas terminal|Rampside Gas Terminal]], Barrow, Cumbria.
title: Bacton Gas Terminal

abstract: Port Talbot Lifeboat Station (based in, [[Aberavon|Aberavon]], [[Port Talbot|Port Talbot]], [[Neath Port Talbot|Neath Port Talbot]], [[Wales|Wales]]) was opened in 1966 as an Inshore Lifeboat Station with a lifeboat. The station is currently housed in a purpose built building close to the coastguard and lifeguard station that was finished in 1998.
title: Port Talbot Lifeboat Station

abstract: The Mumbles Lifeboat Station (based in [[Mumbles|Mumbles]], [[Swansea|Swansea]], [[Wales|Wales]]) opened in 1835 with a lifeboat that was funded and managed by Swansea Harbour Trustees and was known as Swansea Lifeboat Station. The station was taken over by the [[RNLI|RNLI]] in 1863 and moved to Mumbles in 1866. The station only officially became The Mumbles Lifeboat Station in 1904.
title: The Mumbles Lifeboat Station

abstract: Tun Mustapha Tower is a 122 metre, 30-story glass tower in [[Kota Kinabalu|Kota Kinabalu]], [[Sabah|Sabah]], [[Malaysia|Malaysia]]. It was built in 1977 by [[Mori Building Company|Mori Building Company]], a Japanese builder. The building was formerly named Yayasan Sabah Tower as it housed [[Yayasan Sabah|Yayasan Sabah]], a state-sponsored foundation to promote education and economic development in the state. In 2001, the tower was renamed to honour [[Tun Datu Mustapha|Tun Datu Mustapha]], a former Sabah chief minister.
title: Tun Mustapha Tower

abstract: The Shanghai Tower () is a , 128-story [[megatall skyscraper|megatall skyscraper]] in [[Lujiazui|Lujiazui]], [[Pudong|Pudong]], [[Shanghai|Shanghai]]. It shares the record (along with the [[Ping An Finance Center|Ping An Finance Center]]) of having the world's highest [[observation deck|observation deck]] within a building or structure at 562   m, and the 2nd world's fastest [[elevator|elevators]] at a top speed of . It is the world's [[second-tallest building by height to architectural top|list of tallest buildings]]. However, the title of the world's fastest elevator now belongs to the [[Guangzhou CTF Finance Centre|Guangzhou_CTF_Finance_Centre]], with a top speed of achieved in 2017. Designed by international design firm [[Gensler|Gensler]] and owned by the Shanghai city government, it is the tallest of the world's first triple-adjacent super-tall buildings in [[Pudong|Pudong]], the other two being the [[Jin Mao Tower|Jin Mao Tower]] and the [[Shanghai World Financial Centre|Shanghai World Financial Centre]]. Its tiered construction, designed for high energy efficiency, provides nine separate zones divided between office, retail and leisure use.
title: Shanghai Tower

abstract: Babbacombe Model Village is a [[miniature village|miniature village]] and railway located in [[Babbacombe|Babbacombe]] in [[Torquay|Torquay]], [[Devon|Devon]].
title: Babbacombe Model Village

abstract: <COORD SDEC:22.27872,114.16818> The Hong Kong Police Headquarters () or HKPHQ are located at 1 Arsenal Street, [[Wan Chai|Wan Chai]], on [[Hong Kong Island|Hong Kong Island]]. It is the headquarters of the [[Hong Kong Police Force|Hong Kong Police Force]].
title: Hong Kong Police Headquarters

abstract: The Grand Promenade () is a high-rise development located in the [[Sai Wan Ho|Sai Wan Ho]] area of Hong Kong. The complex consists of five towers. Towers 2, 3, and 5, which are all interconnected and listed as one skyscraper by real estate data company [[Emporis|Emporis]], were built in 2005 and contain 66 floors each; each tower rises . Towers 1 and 6 were also built in 2005 and contain 63 floors each, rising . The entire complex, also known as the Sai Wan Ho Harbour Plaza, was developed by [[Henderson Land Development|Henderson Land Development]] and its subsidiary, [[The Hongkong and Yaumati Ferry Co Ltd.|Hongkong and Yaumati Ferry]] The building is composed entirely of residential units, and contains 2,020 apartments.
title: Grand Promenade

abstract: The Victoria Towers () are a [[high-rise|high-rise]] residential development located in the [[Tsim Sha Tsui|Tsim Sha Tsui]] area of [[Hong Kong|Hong Kong]]. The complex consists of three towers, each rising 62 [[floors|Storey]] and in height.
title: Victoria Towers

abstract: Jeddah Tower (), previously known as Kingdom Tower () and Mile-High Tower (), is a skyscraper under construction on the north side of [[Jeddah|Jeddah]], [[Saudi Arabia|Saudi Arabia]]. It is planned to be the world's first high building, and the centrepiece and first phase of a development and tourist attraction known as [[Jeddah Economic City|Jeddah Economic City]].
title: Jeddah Tower

abstract: Somerhill House is a [[Grade I listed|listed building]] [[Jacobean|Jacobean architecture]] [[mansion|mansion]] situated near [[Tonbridge|Tonbridge]], [[Kent|Kent]], [[United Kingdom|United Kingdom]]. It was built for [[The 4th Earl of Clanricarde|Richard Burke, 4th Earl of Clanricarde]] in 1611–13. The estate was sequestrated by Parliament in 1645, and restored to its rightful owner in 1660. The building had become derelict by the mid-eighteenth century but was later restored. Somerhill was painted by [[Turner|J. M. W. Turner]] in 1811. It was bought by a member of the Goldsmid family in 1849 and greatly extended between 1879 and 1897, making it the second largest house in Kent, after [[Knole House|Knole House]], [[Sevenoaks|Sevenoaks]].
title: Somerhill House

abstract: Borth Lifeboat Station (based in [[Borth|Borth]], [[Ceredigion|Ceredigion]], Wales) was first established by the [[Royal National Lifeboat Institution|Royal National Lifeboat Institution]] (RNLI) in June 1966. The station currently operates a lifeboat.
title: Borth Lifeboat Station

abstract: Chennai Trade Centre is a permanent exhibition complex in [[Nandambakkam|Nandambakkam]], [[Chennai|Chennai]], hosting several [[trade fair|trade fairs]] and conventions round the year. It is the first fair infrastructure that has been developed by India Trade Promotion Organisation (ITPO)—the premier trade promotion agency of the [[Government of India|Government of India]], Ministry of Commerce and Industry—outside [[Delhi|Delhi]]. A joint initiative of the ITPO and the Tamil Nadu Trade Promotion Organisation, which hold 51 and 49 percent stakes, respectively, the Trade Centre was designed by C R Narayan Rao, and was commissioned in January 2001, while the convention centre was commissioned on 1 November 2004. The exhibition hall was constructed at an estimated cost of 23 crore and the convention centre at a cost of 22 crore. Together, these centres cover 10,560 sq m and are fully booked for 75 days in a year. Built over an area of 25.48 acres, the centre comprises four modules of 4,400   m2 each of exhibition halls and support services to be built in a phased manner. In the first phase, two [[air-conditioned|Air conditioning]] halls without pillars or columns encompassing areas of 5,000   m2 and 1,850   m2 were constructed. There are three halls, viz, Hall No. 1 (4,400   m2), Hall No. 2 (1,760   m2) and Hall No. 3 (4,400   m2). The halls feature a height of 6   m to display all merchandise including machinery. These have been supplemented recently with a modern, fully air-conditioned [[convention centre|convention centre]]. All the halls are inter-linked, and Hall No. 3 is connected with the convention centre. The convention centre can accommodate 1,500 participants with a provision for dividing the hall into two equal parts and has an [[audiovisual|audiovisual]] facility suitable for multi-purpose use such as conferences, conventions, cultural shows, and so forth. The Chennai Trade Centre is managed by Tamil Nadu Trade Promotion Organisation (TNTPO), a joint venture of ITPO and [[Tamil Nadu Industrial Development Corporation|Tamil Nadu Industrial Development Corporation]] (TIDCO).
title: Chennai Trade Centre

abstract: Porthdinllaen Lifeboat Station ([[Welsh|Welsh (language)]] Gorsaf Bad Achub Porthdinllaen) is an [[RNLI|RNLI]]-operated [[lifeboat station|lifeboat station]] in the coastal village of [[Porthdinllaen|Porthdinllaen]], within the community of [[Dwyfor|Dwyfor]] on the [[Llŷn Peninsula|Llŷn Peninsula]], [[Gwynedd|Gwynedd]], [[North Wales|North Wales]]
title: Porthdinllaen Lifeboat Station
