abstract: Tighnabruaich Lifeboat Station is located in the [[Kyles of Bute|Kyles of Bute]]. It has been in use for nearly 40 years. The inshore lifeboat carries out rescues mainly to leisure craft. The station is the base for [[Royal National Lifeboat Institution|Royal National Lifeboat Institution]] (RNLI) search and rescue operations at [[Tighnabruaich|Tighnabruaich]], Argyll, United Kingdom. It operates an [[Atlantic 85|Atlantic 85-class lifeboat]] inshore Lifeboat (ILB).
title: Tighnabruaich Lifeboat Station

abstract: 200 Clarendon Street, previously John Hancock Tower and colloquially known as The Hancock, is a 60-story, [[skyscraper|skyscraper]] in [[Boston|Boston]]. The tower was designed by [[Henry N. Cobb|Henry N. Cobb]] of the firm [[I. M. Pei & Partners|I. M. Pei & Partners]] and was completed in 1976. In 1977, the [[American Institute of Architects|American Institute of Architects]] presented the firm with a National Honor Award for the building, and in 2011 conferred on it the [[Twenty-five Year Award|Twenty-five Year Award]]. It has been the [[tallest building in Boston|List of tallest buildings in Boston]] and [[New England|New England]] for over 40 years.
title: John Hancock Tower

abstract: 555 California Street, formerly Bank of America Center, is a 52-[[story|Storey]] [[skyscraper|skyscraper]] in [[San Francisco|San Francisco]], [[California|California]]. It is the fourth tallest building in the city, the largest by floor area, and a focal point of the [[Financial District|Financial District (San Francisco)]]. It is the [[75th tallest building in the United States|Tallest buildings in the United States]] (upon completion), one foot taller than [[One Worldwide Plaza|One Worldwide Plaza]] in [[New York City|New York City]] and just 1 foot shorter than the 68th tallest building in the USA, which is also owned by [[Bank of America|Bank of America]], the [[Bank of America Center|Bank of America Center (Houston)]] in [[Houston|Houston]], [[Texas|Texas]] at 780   ft (238 m), and just 2 feet shorter than the 67th tallest building in the USA, [[30 Hudson Street|30 Hudson Street]] in [[Jersey City, New Jersey|Jersey City, New Jersey]] at 781   ft (238 m). Some sites round the heights of all four buildings to 780   ft (238 m) making those four buildings tied as the 67th tallest buildings in the country.
title: 555 California Street

abstract: The Donauturm () is a tower in [[Vienna|Vienna]], the [[tallest structure in Austria|List of tallest buildings and structures in Austria]] at , and among the 75 [[tallest towers in the world|List of towers]]. Opening in April 1964, the tower is located near the north bank of the [[Danube River|Danube River]] in the district of [[Donaustadt|Donaustadt, Vienna]]. The hills [[Leopoldsberg|Leopoldsberg]] and [[Kahlenberg|Kahlenberg]] are visible in the background.
title: Donauturm

abstract: The Semi-Automatic Ground Environment (SAGE) was a system of [[large computers|mainframe computer]] and associated [[networking|computer network]] equipment that coordinated data from many [[radar|radar]] sites and processed it to produce a single unified image of the airspace over a wide area. SAGE directed and controlled the [[NORAD|NORAD]] response to a Soviet air attack, operating in this role from the late 1950s into the 1980s. Its enormous computers and huge displays remain a part of [[cold war|cold war]] lore, and a common prop in movies such as [[Dr. Strangelove|Dr. Strangelove]] and [[Colossus|Colossus: The Forbin Project]].
title: Semi-Automatic Ground Environment

abstract: The United States Capitol, often called the Capitol Building, is the home of the [[United States Congress|United States Congress]] and the seat of the [[legislative branch|Legislative branch of the United States federal government]] of the [[U.S. federal government|U.S. federal government]]. It is located on [[Capitol Hill|Capitol Hill]] at the eastern end of the [[National Mall|National Mall]] in [[Washington, D.C.|Washington, D.C.]] Though no longer at the geographic center of the [[Federal District|Geography of Washington, D.C.]], the Capitol forms the origin point for the District's street-numbering system and [[the District's four quadrants|Quadrants of Washington, D.C.]].
title: United States Capitol

abstract: 4 World Trade Center (also known by its street address, 150 Greenwich Street) is a [[skyscraper|skyscraper]] that is part of the [[World Trade Center|World Trade Center (2001–present)]] complex in [[New York City|New York City]]. It is located on the southeast corner of the [[World Trade Center site|World Trade Center site]], where the original nine-story 4 World Trade Center stood. [[Pritzker Prize|Pritzker Prize]]-winning architect [[Fumihiko Maki|Fumihiko Maki]] was awarded the contract to design the building. It houses the headquarters of the [[Port Authority of New York and New Jersey|Port Authority of New York and New Jersey]] (PANYNJ).
title: 4 World Trade Center

abstract: Flaxley Abbey is a former [[Cistercian|Cistercian]] [[monastery|monastery]] in England, now a [[Grade I listed|Grade I listed]] [[manor|English country house]] and private residence, near the village of [[Flaxley|Flaxley]] in the [[Forest of Dean|Forest of Dean]], [[Gloucestershire|Gloucestershire]]. It is the former seat of the [[Crawley-Boevey Baronets|Crawley-Boevey Baronets]].
title: Flaxley Abbey

abstract: The Campbell Mithun Tower is a 41-floor tower located on 9th   Street and 3rd   Avenue in [[Minneapolis|Minneapolis]], [[Minnesota|Minnesota]]. It is the fifth tallest building in Minneapolis.
title: Campbell Mithun Tower

abstract: Kai Tak Cruise Terminal is a luxury [[cruise ship|Cruising (maritime)]] [[terminal|ferry terminal]] that opened at the former [[Kai Tak Airport|Kai Tak Airport]] runway at [[Hong Kong|Hong Kong]]. Its completion date was delayed into 2013 due to re-tendering. Following an international competition, [[Foster + Partners|Foster + Partners]] was chosen to design the cruise terminal. The first ship berthed on 12 June 2013. The terminal has the capacity to berth two large long vessels, which carry a total of 5,400 passengers and 1,200 crew, as well as anticipating the demands of cruise liners currently on the drawing board.
title: Kai Tak Cruise Terminal

abstract: The Baluarte de San Diego is a [[bastion|bastion]] in [[Intramuros|Intramuros]], part of the Spanish colonial fortification in the walled city of [[Manila|Manila]] in the [[Philippines|Philippines]].
title: Baluarte de San Diego

abstract: House with Chimaeras or Horodecki House (, ) is an [[Art Nouveau|Art Nouveau]] building located in the [[historic|Subdivisions of Kyiv#Historical neighborhoods]] [[Lypky|Lypky]] neighborhood of [[Kiev|Kiev]], the capital of Ukraine. Situated across the street from the [[President of Ukraine|President of Ukraine]]'s office at No. 10, [[Bankova Street|Bankova Street]], the building has been used as a presidential residence for official and diplomatic ceremonies since 2005. The street in front of the building is closed off to all automobile traffic, and is now a patrolled [[pedestrian zone|pedestrian zone]] due to its near proximity to the [[Presidential Administration building|Presidential Administration of Ukraine]].
title: House with Chimaeras

abstract: The history of Tung Wah Coffin Home began in 1875 when it was built by the [[Man Mo Temple|Man Mo Temple]]. The Coffin Home was originally located in [[Kennedy Town|Kennedy Town]] near a slaughterhouse. The [[Tung Wah Group of Hospitals|Tung Wah Group of Hospitals]] then took over the responsibility of managing the coffin home, and it was rebuilt in 1899 near Sandy Bay on Hong Kong Island. It was then renamed as the Tung Wah Coffin Home.
title: Tung Wah Coffin Home

abstract: The Greater Penobscot Building, commonly known as the Penobscot Building, is a [[class-A|Class A office space]] office tower in [[Downtown|Downtown Detroit]] [[Detroit|Detroit]], [[Michigan|Michigan]]. The 1928 [[Art Deco|Art Deco]] building is located in the heart of the [[Detroit Financial District|Detroit Financial District]]. The Penobscot is a hub for the city's [[wireless|Wireless LAN]] [[Internet|Internet]] zone and [[fiber-optic|fiber-optic communication]] network.
title: Penobscot Building

abstract: The Brewster-Douglass Housing Projects (officially named the Frederick Douglass Homes, and alternately named Frederick Douglass Projects, Frederick Douglass Apartments, Brewster-Douglass Homes, and Brewster-Douglass Projects) were the largest residential [[housing project|Public housing in the United States]] owned by the city of [[Detroit|Detroit]], located in the [[Brush Park|Neighborhoods in Detroit#Midtown]] section on the east side of [[Detroit|Detroit]], [[Michigan|Michigan]], near the [[Chrysler Freeway|Chrysler Freeway]], Mack Avenue and St. Antoine Street. The housing project is named after [[Frederick Douglass|Frederick Douglass]], [[African American|African American]] [[abolitionist|Abolitionism in the United States]], author, and reformer.
title: Brewster-Douglass Housing Projects

abstract: The Matrimandir (Sanskrit for Temple of The Mother) is an edifice of spiritual significance for practitioners of [[Integral yoga|Integral yoga]], situated at the centre of [[Auroville|Auroville]] initiated by [[The Mother|Mirra Alfassa]] of the [[Sri Aurobindo Ashram|Sri Aurobindo Ashram]]. It is called soul of the city and is situated in a large open space called Peace. Matrimandir does not belong to any particular religion or section
title: Matrimandir

abstract: The tower is the primary television and radio broadcast site for the [[Kantō region|Kantō region]]; the older [[Tokyo Tower|Tokyo Tower]] no longer gives complete [[digital terrestrial television|digital terrestrial television]] broadcasting coverage because it is surrounded by high-rise buildings. Skytree was completed on Leap Day, 29 February 2012, with the tower opening to the public on 22 May 2012. The tower is the centrepiece of a large commercial development funded by [[Tobu Railway|Tobu Railway]] and a group of six terrestrial broadcasters headed by [[NHK|NHK]]. Trains stop at the adjacent [[Tokyo Skytree Station|Tokyo Skytree Station]] and nearby [[Oshiage Station|Oshiage Station]]. The complex is north-east of [[Tokyo Station|Tokyo Station]].
title: Tokyo Skytree

abstract: Padrão dos Descobrimentos (; lit. Monument of the Discoveries) is a monument on the northern bank of the [[Tagus River|Tagus River]] estuary, in the civil parish of [[Santa Maria de Belém|Santa Maria de Belém]], [[Lisbon|Lisbon]]. Located along the river where ships departed to explore and trade with [[India|India]] and [[the Orient|the Orient]], the monument celebrates the Portuguese [[Age of Discovery|Age of Discovery]] (or Age of Exploration) during the 15th and 16th centuries.
title: Padrão dos Descobrimentos

abstract: One Liberty Plaza, formerly the U.S. Steel Building, is a skyscraper in [[Lower Manhattan|Lower Manhattan]], in [[New York City|New York City]], at the location of the former [[Singer Building|Singer Building]] (tallest structure ever dismantled) and the former [[City Investing Building|City Investing Building]]. One Liberty Plaza is currently owned and operated by [[Brookfield Office Properties|Brookfield Office Properties]]. The building is tall and has 54 floors. It was completed in 1973. At , each floor offers almost of office space, making it one of the largest office buildings in New York.
title: One Liberty Plaza

abstract: Kuala Lumpur City Centre (KLCC) is a multipurpose development area in [[Kuala Lumpur|Kuala Lumpur]], [[Malaysia|Malaysia]]. The area is located around [[Jalan Ampang|Jalan Ampang]], [[Jalan P. Ramlee|Jalan P. Ramlee]], [[Jalan Binjai|Jalan Binjai]], [[Jalan Kia Peng|Jalan Kia Peng]] and [[Jalan Pinang|Jalan Pinang]]. There are a number of shopping complexes such as Suria KLCC and Avenue K. There are also hotels within walking distance such as [[G Tower|G-Tower]], [[Mandarin Oriental|Mandarin Oriental Hotel Group]], [[Grand Hyatt Kuala Lumpur|Grand Hyatt Kuala Lumpur]] and InterContinental Kuala Lumpur hotel.
title: Kuala Lumpur City Centre

abstract: Pathé Tuschinski, originally Theater Tuschinski, is a [[movie theater in the Netherlands|Movie theaters in the Netherlands]] in [[Amsterdam|Amsterdam]] commissioned by [[Abraham Icek Tuschinski|Abraham Icek Tuschinski]] in 1921 at a cost of 4 million [[guilders|guilders]]. The interior and exterior are a spectacular mix of styles, as designed by Hijman Louis de Jong; [[Amsterdam School|Amsterdam School]], [[Art Nouveau|Art Nouveau]] and [[Art Deco|Art Deco]]. The main auditorium hosts many premieres of Dutch films. It is considered to be one of the most beautiful cinemas in the world.
title: Tuschinski

abstract: The Saint Peter Port Lifeboat Station was established in Guernsey in 1803. Originally based at Saint Sampson, it relocated to Saint Peter Port in 1881.
title: Saint Peter Port Lifeboat Station

abstract: The Pakubuwono is a residential complex of 11 skyscrapers at [[Kebayoran Baru|Kebayoran Baru]] in [[South Jakarta|South Jakarta]], [[Indonesia|Indonesia]]. The Pakubuwono Signature is the tallest among the skyscrapers of the complex, which is also currently the tallest residential building in Indonesia.The tower is 252 meters tall with 52 floors above the ground.
title: The Pakubuwono

abstract: Olga TV is a [[British|United Kingdom]] independent television production company set up by the entertainer and talk show host, [[Paul O'Grady|Paul O'Grady]] in 2005.
title: Olga TV

abstract: The G. Heileman Brewing Company of [[La Crosse, Wisconsin|La Crosse, Wisconsin]], United States, was a [[brewery|brewery]] firm that operated from 1858 to 1996. It was ultimately acquired by [[Stroh's|Stroh's]], and its independent existence ceased. From 1872 until its acquisition, the brewery bore the family name of its co-founder, brewer [[Gottlieb Heileman|Gottlieb Heileman]].
title: G. Heileman Brewing Company

abstract: In 1987 Mahesh Bhatt turned producer when he set up his own banner, "Vishesh Films", with his brother [[Mukesh Bhatt|Mukesh Bhatt]]. He went on to become one of the most recognised directors of the Indian film industry in the coming decade, giving both serious productions – like [[Daddy|Daddy (1989 film)]] (1989), launching his daughter [[Pooja Bhatt|Pooja Bhatt]] as a movie actress, and Swayam (1991) — as well as commercial romantic hits like [[Awaargi|Awaargi]] (1990), [[Aashiqui|Aashiqui]] (1990) and [[Dil Hai Ki Manta Nahin|Dil Hai Ki Manta Nahin]] (1991), in which he cast Pooja with actor [[Aamir Khan|Aamir Khan]]. He next directed [[Sadak|Sadak]] (1991) which remains his highest grossing work to date either directed or produced under his Vishesh Films. He won critical acclaim for [[Sir|Sir (film)]] (1993), which saw Pooja Bhatt acting with Naseeruddin Shah along with the hit [[Gumraah|Gumrah (1993 film)]] and [[Criminal|Criminal (1995 film)]] (1995) it. In 1994 he won the [[National Film Award - Special Jury Award|National Film Award – Special Jury Award (Feature Film)]] for [[Hum Hain Rahi Pyar Ke|Hum Hain Rahi Pyar Ke]] (1993).
title: Vishesh Films

abstract: Shakuntalam Telefilms is a [[production company|production company]] for [[Indian television|Television in India]]. It has produced many drama serials for [[Zee TV|Zee TV]], [[Star Plus|STAR Plus]], [[Colors TV|Colors TV]] and [[Star Bharat|STAR Bharat]].
title: Shakuntalam Telefilms

abstract: CIM Bank offers a variety of financial services.
title: CIM Bank

abstract: CleanEquity® Monaco is an annual conference hosting the world’s next generation sustainable and resource efficiency technologies. The invitation only event was founded by [[H.S.H. Prince Albert II of Monaco|Albert II, Prince of Monaco]] and Mungo Park, Chairman of Innovator Capital in 2008.
title: CleanEquity

abstract: Schöma is a company based in [[Diepholz|Diepholz]], [[Germany|Germany]], specialising in the construction of small [[diesel locomotive|diesel locomotives]].After Christoph Schöttler left his father's business, the [[Diepholzer Maschinenfabrik Fritz Schöttler|:de:Diepholzer Maschinenfabrik Fritz Schöttler]] (DIEMA), because of disagreements about the product range, in 1930 he founded his own machine factory, the Christoph Schöttler Maschinenfabrik GmbH, on a former premises of DIEMA. As a shortcut he first led SCHÖMAG, which was changed a few years later in Schöma . In the early years, he continued the production of mill machines and tractors, but soon started the construction of rail vehicles.
title: Schöma

abstract: Following on from a successful prototype one number travel service developed by Lancashire County Council in 1999, the national Traveline organisation was established in 2000.
title: Traveline

abstract: Sudocrem is an [[over-the-counter|over-the-counter]] medicated cream aimed primarily at the treatment of [[nappy rash|nappy rash]]. It contains a water-repellent base (consisting of [[oils|oils]]/[[waxes|waxes]]); protective and [[emollient|emollient]] agents; [[antibacterial|antibacterial]] and [[antifungal|Antifungal medication]] agents; and a weak [[anesthetic|anesthetic]]. As well as nappy rash, it can also be used to treat [[eczema|eczema]], [[bedsores|bedsores]], [[acne|acne]], minor burns, surface wounds, [[sunburn|sunburn]] and [[chilblains|chilblains]].
title: Sudocrem

abstract: Wilhelm Hunkemöller and his wife Josephina Lexis founded the company in 1886 as a special shop for corsets and [[bustle|bustles]] in Amsterdam. In the beginning they used to produce in their own factory. In the following years the family owned business expanded and they could open stores in [[Amsterdam|Amsterdam]], [[Rotterdam|Rotterdam]] and [[Utrecht|Utrecht]]. In 1974 the company was acquired by Vendex subsidiary Confendex B.V., a subsidiary company of Vroom & Dreesman B.V. Thereby the company name was changed from “Hunkemöller Lexis” just to “Hunkemöller”. In 1977 the company expanded to Belgium and ten years later to Germany. Nowadays Hunkemöller has many stores in Europe and in the Middle East. Flagship stores are located in [[Amsterdam|Amsterdam]], [[Vienna|Vienna]], [[Stuttgart|Stuttgart]], [[Oberhausen|Oberhausen]], [[Düsseldorf|Düsseldorf]], [[Rotterdam|Rotterdam]] and [[Antwerp|Antwerp]]. Since August the 31, the Dutch model [[Doutzen Kroes|Doutzen Kroes]] represents Hunkemöller as the new face of the brand. Previously, the model and moderator [[Sylvie Meis|Sylvie Meis]] was the face of the company.
title: Hunkemöller

abstract: Asia Racing Team (ART Motorsports) is a [[Chinese|People's Republic of China]] / [[Macanese|Macau]] motor racing team that was formed in 2003. Its main operational headquarters is located within the [[Zhuhai International Circuit|Zhuhai International Circuit]] complex, in Southern China, with a second workshop in Chaoqing's [[Guangdong International Circuit|Guangdong International Circuit]].
title: Asia Racing Team

abstract: Heidolph Instruments is a manufacturer of [[laboratory equipment|laboratory equipment]] with a presence in more than 100 countries. It sells equipment to [[laboratories|laboratories]] in pharmaceutical research, cosmetics, biology, bio-fuel, chemical industries and universities worldwide.
title: Heidolph

abstract: Flickerpix is an animation company based in [[Holywood|Holywood]], [[Northern Ireland|Northern Ireland]]. Flickerpix have produced a wide range of projects including On The Air; a mix of stop motion and 2D animation based on the [[Gerry Anderson (broadcaster)|Gerry Anderson (broadcaster)]] BBC Radio Ulster show. They have also produced the [[BBC Northern Ireland|BBC Northern Ireland]] series Five Fables; an adaptation of [[Seamus Heaney's|Seamus Heaney]] translation of five medieval Scots fables. This was narrated by acclaimed comedian/ actor [[Billy Connolly|Billy Connolly]] and scored by Belfast-born pianist [[Barry Douglas|Barry Douglas (musician)]]. Their collaboration with [[CBBC|CBBC (TV channel)]] [[Newsround|Newsround]] for the special Living with Alcohol went on to be awarded a [[BAFTA|British Academy of Film and Television Arts]].
title: Flickerpix

abstract: Director's Kut Productions is a television [[production company|production company]] based in [[Mumbai|Mumbai]]. Established in 2007, it produces television shows for various channels like [[Star Plus|Star Plus]], [[Colors TV|Colors TV]], [[Sony TV|Sony TV]], and [[Life OK|Life OK]]. They have produced popular Indian serials including [[Sapna Babul Ka...Bidaai|Sapna Babul Ka...Bidaai]], [[Amrit Manthan|Amrit Manthan]] ,"[[Kuch Toh Log Kahenge|Kuch Toh Log Kahenge]]" and [[Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai|Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai]].
title: Director's Kut Productions

abstract: Manitoba Pool Elevators was a [[grain trade|grain trade]] company founded in 1924. It became a subsidiary of the [[Saskatchewan Wheat Pool|Saskatchewan Wheat Pool]] until November 1932, when the Pool declared bankruptcy. In 1998 [[Alberta Wheat Pool|Alberta Wheat Pool]] and Manitoba Pool Elevators merged to form Agricore Cooperative Limited. In 2001, [[United Grain Growers|United Grain Growers]] combined its business operations with Agricore Cooperative Ltd. and carried on business as [[Agricore United|Agricore United]], a publicly traded company, no longer a farmer-owned cooperative. In 2007, Agricore United was taken over by the Saskatchewan Wheat Pool, another publicly traded company. The merged corporation was renamed [[Viterra|Viterra]].
title: Manitoba Pool Elevators

abstract: Kairosoft was founded as a [[dōjin games|Dōjin soft]] developer in 1996, and is currently located in the [[Nishi-Shinjuku|Nishi-Shinjuku]] district of [[Tokyo|Tokyo]] with only nine employees. They started out developing [[simulation games|Simulation video game]] for the [[Windows|Microsoft Windows]] platform, the first of which was released in 1996 and simulated a [[used bookstore|used bookstore]], and another example was the original [[Game Dev Story|Game Dev Story]] released in 1997, with a sequel released in 2001. In 2001, Kairosoft switched to developing mobile simulation games for the Japanese cell phone market, which was much more developed than America's. The company was incorporated in September 2007, and launched a new website on November 4, 2008.
title: Kairosoft

abstract: State Records is a British [[independent record label|independent record label]], established by [[Wayne Bickerton|Wayne Bickerton]], [[Tony Waddington|Tony Waddington (songwriter)]] and John Fruin in 1975. The label released hits by many successful artists including [[The Rubettes|The Rubettes]], [[Mac & Katie Kissoon|Mac & Katie Kissoon]] and [[Delegation|Delegation (band)]].
title: State Records

abstract: Sakevisual (stylized as sakevisual) is a developer and publisher of interactive story games such as [[visual novel|visual novels]] and [[otome game|otome games]], well known for their otome game RE: Alistair++. Their games are for [[Windows|Windows]], [[macOS|macOS]] and [[Linux|Linux]]. Sakevisual is a partner of [[Hanako Games|Hanako Games]], [[Winter Wolves|Riva Celso]] and [[Tycoon Games|Riva Celso]].
title: Sakevisual

abstract: The following is the complete list of films distributed by Geo Films in Pakistan:
title: Geo Films

abstract: Coes Wrench Company was a tool manufacturing company based in [[Worcester, Massachusetts|Worcester, Massachusetts]]. The company was originally part of the L. and A. G. Coes & Co.
title: Coes Wrench Company

abstract: King of the Dot Entertainment, also known as KOTD, is a [[rap battle|Battle rap]] league founded in [[Toronto, Ontario|Toronto]], Canada in 2008. The company's HQ is based in Toronto, from which it gets its name. Successful music artists such as [[Shotty Horroh|Shotty Horroh]], [[360|360 (rapper)]], and [[Madchild|Madchild]] have battled in King of the Dot.
title: King of the Dot

abstract: Shark Island Productions is an award-winning [[documentary film|documentary film]] [[production company|production company]] based in [[Sydney|Sydney]], [[Australia|Australia]].
title: Shark Island Productions

abstract: Fennada-Filmi was a Finnish film production company which was in operation from 1950 to 1982. It was one of the largest companies in its field in Finland from 1950s to 1970s. [[Mauno Mäkelä|Mauno Mäkelä]] was the head of the company during its entire run.
title: Fennada-Filmi

abstract: 888poker, formerly Pacific Poker, is an international [[online poker|online poker]] [[cardroom|cardroom]] and network owned by [[888 Holdings|888 Holdings]]. 888poker was established in 2002, and is based in [[Gibraltar|Gibraltar]].
title: 888poker

abstract: The Republican National Committee (RNC) is a U.S. [[political committee|Political action committee]] that provides national leadership for the [[Republican Party of the United States|Republican Party (United States)]]. It is responsible for developing and promoting the Republican [[political platform|political platform]], as well as coordinating [[fundraising|fundraising]] and election strategy. It is also responsible for organizing and running the [[Republican National Convention|Republican National Convention]]. Similar committees exist in every [[U.S. state|U.S. state]] and most [[U.S. counties|County (United States)]], although in some states party organization is structured by [[congressional district|List of United States congressional districts]], allied campaign organizations being governed by a national committee. [[Ronna Romney McDaniel|Ronna Romney McDaniel]] is the current committee chairwoman.
title: Republican National Committee

abstract: The South Manchuria Railway (: [[Japanese|Japanese language]] ; [[Chinese|Chinese language]] ), officially , or () for short ( in Chinese), was a large of [[Japan|Japan]] whose primary function was the operation of railways on the [[Dalian|Dalian]]–[[Fengtian (Mukden)|Shenyang]]–[[Changchun|Changchun]] (called [[Xinjing|Xinjing]] from 1931 to 1945) corridor in northeastern [[China|China]], as well as on several branch lines. However, it was also involved in nearly every aspect of the economic, cultural and political life of [[Manchuria|Manchuria]], from power generation to agricultural research, for which reason it was often referred to as "Japan's [[East India Company|East India Company]] in China".
title: South Manchuria Railway

abstract: Warp Films was established by [[Warp Records|Warp Records]] founding partners Rob Mitchell and Steve Beckett. It was initially created with financial support from [[NESTA|NESTA]] and had a remit to produce a number of short films.
title: Warp Films

abstract: Telekom Romania (formerly known as [[Romtelecom|Romtelecom]] and Cosmote România) is a [[Romania|Romanian]] [[telecommunications|telecommunications]] company headquartered in [[Bucharest|Bucharest]]. It is the result of the brand merger between [[Romtelecom|Romtelecom]] and [[Cosmote Romania|Cosmote]]. Although it shares the branding of [[Deutsche Telekom|Deutsche Telekom]], the company is a subsidiary of [[OTE|OTE]], a Greek telecommunications company (which is in turn minority-controlled by Deutsche Telekom).
title: Telekom Romania

abstract: Arcana Studio is a Canadian [[animation studio|animation studio]] in [[Burnaby|Burnaby]], [[British Columbia|British Columbia]], Canada. Founded as a [[comic book|comic book]] [[publisher|publisher]] by former [[Coquitlam|Coquitlam]], [[British Columbia|British Columbia]] school teacher [[Sean O'Reilly|Sean O'Reilly]] in 2004, in 2012 Arcana opened up its animation division.
title: Arcana Studio

abstract: British Energy was the UK's largest [[electricity generation|electricity generation]] company by volume, before being taken over by [[Électricité de France|Électricité de France]] (EDF) in 2009. British Energy operated eight former UK state-owned [[nuclear power stations|nuclear power stations]] and one coal-fired power station.
title: British Energy

abstract: Long-Term Capital Management L.P. (LTCM) was a [[hedge fund|hedge fund]] management firm based in [[Greenwich|Greenwich, Connecticut]], [[Connecticut|Connecticut]] that used [[absolute-return|absolute return]] trading strategies combined with high financial [[leverage|leverage (finance)]]. The firm's [[master|master-feeder]] hedge fund, Long-Term Capital Portfolio L.P., collapsed in the late 1990s, leading to an agreement on September 23, 1998, among 16 financial institutions—which included [[Bankers Trust|Bankers Trust]], [[Barclays|Barclays]], [[Bear Stearns|Bear Stearns]], [[Chase Manhattan Bank|Chase Manhattan Bank]], [[Crédit Agricole|Crédit Agricole]], [[Credit Suisse First Boston|Credit Suisse First Boston]], [[Deutsche Bank|Deutsche Bank]], [[Goldman Sachs|Goldman Sachs]], [[JP Morgan|JP Morgan]], [[Lehman Brothers|Lehman Brothers]], [[Merrill Lynch|Merrill Lynch]], [[Morgan Stanley|Morgan Stanley]], [[Paribas|Paribas]], [[Salomon Smith Barney|Salomon Smith Barney]], [[Société Générale|Société Générale]], and [[UBS|UBS]]—for a $3.6 billion [[recapitalization|recapitalization]] ([[bailout|bailout]]) under the supervision of the [[Federal Reserve|Federal Reserve System]].
title: Long-Term Capital Management

abstract: The Walt Disney World Resort, also called Walt Disney World and Disney World, is an entertainment complex in [[Bay Lake|Bay Lake, Florida]] and [[Lake Buena Vista|Lake Buena Vista, Florida]], [[Florida|Florida]], in the United States, near the cities [[Orlando|Orlando, Florida]] and [[Kissimmee|Kissimmee, Florida]]. Opened on October 1, 1971, the resort is owned and operated by [[Walt Disney Parks, Experiences and Consumer Products|Walt Disney Parks, Experiences and Consumer Products]], a division of [[The Walt Disney Company|The Walt Disney Company]]. It was first operated by [[Walt Disney World Company|Walt Disney World Company]]. The property covers nearly and only half of it has been used, comprises four [[theme parks|Amusement park]], two [[water park|water parks]], twenty-seven themed [[resort hotels|resort]], nine non-Disney hotels, several golf courses, a camping resort, and other entertainment venues, including the outdoor shopping center [[Disney Springs|Disney Springs]].
title: Walt Disney World

abstract: In 1898 Spyker built the Golden Coach for state ceremonial use by the Dutch house of royals.
title: Spyker

abstract: American International Pictures (AIP) was an independent [[film production|film production]] and [[distribution|Film distributor]] company formed on April 2, 1954 as American Releasing Corporation (ARC) by [[James H. Nicholson|James H. Nicholson]], former Sales Manager of [[Realart Pictures|Realart Pictures]], and [[Samuel Z. Arkoff|Samuel Z. Arkoff]], an entertainment lawyer. It was dedicated to releasing low-budget films packaged as [[double feature|double features]], primarily of interest to the [[teenagers|Teen film]] of the 1950s, 1960s, and 1970s. Nicholson and Arkoff formed ARC in 1954; their first release was [[The Fast and the Furious|The Fast and the Furious (1955 film)]] in 1955.
title: American International Pictures

abstract: 3dfx Interactive was a company headquartered in [[San Jose, California|San Jose, California]], founded in 1994, that specialized in the manufacturing of [[3D|3D graphics]] [[graphics processing unit|graphics processing units]], and later, [[graphics card|graphics cards]]. It was a pioneer in the field from the late 1990s until 2000.
title: 3dfx Interactive

abstract: Titmouse, Inc. is an American [[animation studio|animation studio]] that develops and produces animated television programming, feature films, music videos, title sequences, commercials and short films. The studio opened in 2000, and has offices in [[Los Angeles|Los Angeles]], [[New York City|New York City]] and [[Vancouver|Vancouver, British Columbia]]. Some of their productions include [[Motorcity|Motorcity]] for [[Disney XD|Disney XD]], [[Metalocalypse|Metalocalypse]], [[The Venture Bros.|The Venture Bros.]], [[Superjail!|Superjail!]], [[Ballmastrz: 9009|Ballmastrz: 9009]] and [[Black Dynamite|Black Dynamite (TV series)]] for [[Adult Swim|Adult Swim]].
title: Titmouse, Inc.

abstract: Room 8 Studio is a Game Development and Art Production studio having its office in Limassol and representation in Los Angeles.
title: Room 8 Studio

abstract: The Brisbane Racing Club was founded on 1 July 2009 by a merger of the [[Queensland Turf Club|Queensland Turf Club]] and the Brisbane Turf Club (BTC). The club conducted 98 race meetings in 2012. The consolidation of the race clubs was the first of its kind in Australia as later other metropolitan race clubs would follow their initiative.
title: Brisbane Racing Club

abstract: Road transport corporation in Telangana State was first established as NSRRTD ([[Nizam State Rail & Road Transport Department|Nizam State Railways - Road Transport Division]]), a wing of Nizam State Railway in the erstwhile [[Hyderabad State|Hyderabad State]], in 1932, with 27 buses and 166 employees. Andhra Pradesh State Road Transport Corporation (APSRTC) was established on 11 January 1958 in pursuance of the Road Transport Corporations Act 1950. Consequent upon [[bifurcation of Andhra Pradesh state|Telangana movement]] into Telangana and residual Andhra Pradesh, TSRTC operated as a separate entity from 03.06.2015. The [[Government of Telangana|Government of Telangana]] has subsequently established Telangana State Road Transport Corporation (TSRTC), on 27.04.2016, under the Road Transport Corporation Act, 1950.
title: Telangana State Road Transport Corporation

abstract: Curzon Cinemas were established in 1934 when Harold Wingate, who imported unknown films during the post World War I period, opened the first cinema in Mayfair. The second location, Curzon Bloomsbury, opened in 1972. In 1976 Curzon Artificial Eye, the film distribution company was launched.
title: Curzon Cinemas

abstract: King Art Games is a German [[video game developer|video game developer]]. The company created the [[point-and-click adventure|point-and-click adventure]] [[The Book of Unwritten Tales|The Book of Unwritten Tales]], including its prequel called [[The Critter Chronicles|The Book of Unwritten Tales: The Critter Chronicles]] and the sequel [[The Book of Unwritten Tales 2|The Book of Unwritten Tales 2]]. Their other project that uses similar [[gameplay|gameplay]] mechanics, is the point-and-click adventure [[The Raven: Legacy of a Master Thief|The Raven: Legacy of a Master Thief]].
title: King Art Games

abstract: StartupBus is an annual technological [[startup|Startup Company]] competition and entrepreneurship boot camp, described as a [[Hackathon|Hackathon]], created by Elias Bizannes in February 2010. The competition is held across a 3-day bus ride where contestants or "buspreneurs" compete to conceive the best technology [[startup|Startup Company]]. The competition seeks to attract young top talents to compete, to search for the most innovative [[startup|Startup Company]] conceived by the groups, where the winners are determined by a panel of judges. Starting from February 2011, it has gone through many iterations in various continents from 2011 to the present day, with the first in [[Austin|Austin]], [[Texas|Texas]] and subsequently in [[North America|North America]], [[Europe|Europe]] and [[Africa|Africa]].
title: StartupBus

abstract: Regional Payments Associations (familiarly RPAs) are independently-run, American not-for-profit trade associations that provide electronic payments-related education and operational support to payments professionals. Each association is a direct member of [[NACHA - The Electronic Payments Association|NACHA]] and is certified to provide continuing education in payments, particularly in [[Automated Clearing House (ACH)|ACH Network]] transactions. RPA membership allows payments professionals to earn the Accredited ACH Professional (AAP) designation.
title: Regional Payments Associations

abstract: TransRomantic Films is a [[pornographic film|pornographic film]] [[studio|film studio]] that specializes in [[transsexual-themed films|Transsexual pornography]]. The company was founded by [[pornographic actress|pornographic film actor]] and [[film director|film director]] [[Nica Noelle|Nica Noelle]].
title: TransRomantic Films

abstract: Cárnicas Joselito S.A. is the company name of this family business from [[Guijuelo|Guijuelo]] (Salamanca, Spain) that manufactures Iberian, acorn-fed pork products. The company is better known on the market by its commercial names "Joselito" y "Jamón Joselito". In fact, in this article it is mostly these interchangeable names that are used to refer to the company. The article itself sets out to describe the company, which was founded in 1868, from every possible angle.
title: Cárnicas Joselito

abstract: The Cool Beer Brewing Company is a [[microbrewery|microbrewery]] in the southern end of [[Etobicoke|Etobicoke]], Ontario, in an area known as [[Mimico|Mimico]] just off of the Gardiner Express Way, one of the major highways that cuts through the city of [[Toronto|Toronto]].
title: Cool Beer Brewing Company

abstract: Revelo Electric (REvolutionary VELO; "vélo" is French for "bike") is a Canadian [[clean mobility|Sustainable transport]] company that designs, develops, sells and services Revelo's front pedaling chainless [[electric bicycles|electric bicycles]]. The company was founded in Toronto in 2012 by CEO Henry Chong, as Revelo Bikes Inc., and the name was changed to Revelo Electric Corp. in 2014. Revelo's core design principles are ease of use and ease of maintenance, and have created their products to fit these principles.
title: Revelo Electric

abstract: Nufront Co., Ltd. is a Chinese [[fabless|Fabless manufacturing]] [[semiconductor|Semiconductor industry]] company founded in 2004 that provides [[system-on-chip|System on a chip]] solutions for [[tablets|Tablet computer]] and [[smartphones|smartphones]].
title: Nufront

abstract: Hum Films is a film production and distribution company based in [[Karachi|Karachi]], Pakistan, working under the [[Hum Network Group|Hum Network Limited]]. It was launched in September 2014, with setting a film [[Na Maloom Afraad|Na Maloom Afraad]] to release domestically on October 5, 2014. The second film, banner released was a romance [[Bin Roye|Bin Roye]] on July 18, 2015.
title: Hum Films

abstract: Smilegate is a South Korean [[video game developer|video game developer]] and [[publisher|Video game developer]], which develops, publishes and services mobile and PC online games. It has five core business sectors - game development, publishing, platform, investment and social contribution. Established in Korea in 2002, the company is the creator of [[CrossFire|CrossFire (video game)]], the world’s top online FPS game with over six million concurrent players across the globe, and many more distinguished titles.
title: Smilegate

abstract: Global United Media Company Private Limited is a corporate entity in the Indian film markets formed in March 2014. The company's core engagement is film production, acquisition and distribution across languages, genres and territories. Global United Media has distributed films such as [[Baahubali: The Beginning|Baahubali: The Beginning]] (2015), [[I|I (film)]] (2015) and [[KGF|KGF (film)]] (2018) across [[Kerala|Kerala]].
title: Global United Media

abstract: Studio 11 is a recording studio in [[Chicago|Chicago]], [[Illinois|Illinois]], founded in 1996. Best known for [[hip hop music|hip hop music]], [[duranguense|duranguense]], [[gangsta rap|gangsta rap]], and [[house music|house music]] styles, Studio 11 has recorded, mixed, and mastered over 35,000 musical songs.
title: Studio 11

abstract: Perfect World Pictures ("PWPIC") is a China-based diversified entertainment company, engaging in the production, distribution and marketing of film and television content, content related advertising and merchandising business, as well as talent management business. The company produces between 600–800 hours of scripted and unscripted TV programs every year and produced numerous local language movies, in addition to being one of the most active marketers of foreign films in China.
title: Perfect World Pictures

abstract: Fun Bits Interactive is an [[American|United States]] [[video game developer|video game developer]] founded in 2010 by the core team previously working as [[Titan Studios|Titan Studios]].
title: Fun Bits Interactive

abstract: Roamler is a Dutch [[information technology|information technology]] company which specializes in [[crowd-sourced|Crowdsourcing]] [[solution|solutions]] for business.
title: Roamler

abstract: JSK Film Corporation is an Indian film production and distribution company based in Chennai. JSK film corporation along with film productions acquires negative rights of film's too. JSK Audio label was launched in 2014 which are into the production of music for the subsequent films which are being produced by JSK Film Corporation.
title: JSK Film Corporation

abstract: Veterans United Home Loans is a full service mortgage lender headquartered in [[Columbia, Missouri|Columbia, Missouri]]. The company has 28 offices nationwide and is licensed in all 50 states. The company primarily originates [[VA loans|VA loan]], a mortgage product guaranteed by the [[U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs|United States Department of Veterans Affairs]]. In 2017, Veterans United financed $10.2 billion in VA volume nationwide, making it the second largest vendor in the nation.
title: Veterans United Home Loans

abstract: Two Brothers Pictures is a London-based British television production company founded in 2014 by brothers, Harry Williams and Jack Williams. Harry and Jack launched the company with the [[BBC One|BBC One]] series[[The Missing|The Missing (TV series)]]. The show was nominated for 2 [[Golden Globe Award|Golden Globe Awards]], 4 [[BAFTAs|British Academy of Film and Television Arts]] and 2 [[Emmys|Emmy Award]] as well as winning two Nymph d'Ors, Bulldog and BPG awards. The Missing returned in 2016 for a second series airing on BBC One and [[Starz|Starz]].
title: Two Brothers Pictures

abstract: IGG Inc. (799.HK) was founded on June 6, 2006. With its headquarters located in Singapore, IGG branches are also located in other various countries and areas which include the United States, China, Canada, Japan, South Korea, Belarus, Thailand, Philippines and Hong Kong.
title: IGG Inc.

abstract: GolemLabs Studios Inc is a French-Canadian computer games developer based in the town of [[Sherbrooke|Sherbrooke]], [[Québec|Québec]], [[Canada|Canada]] and was founded in 2000.
title: GolemLabs

abstract: BAA Training (the former Baltic Aviation Academy and a subsidiary of [[Avia Solutions Group|Avia Solutions Group]]) is one of the largest European standard aviation training centres, headquartered in Vilnius, [[Lithuania|Lithuania]]. It is one of the leading aviation training centres and Approved Training Organizations (ATO) in the European Union. The company provides training for more than 19 types of aircraft at over 30 locations all over the world. Its ground training facilities have spacious and modern classrooms, air speak classroom and a FNPT II trainer. At the moment BAA Training Ab Initio school has over 200 students from more 50 different countries. Their training is being conducted in 3 different Lithuanian aerodromes with the school fleet consisting of 18 [[Tecnam|Tecnam]] and [[Cessna|Cessna]] aircraft.
title: BAA Training

abstract: Zero Tolerance Knives (ZT Knives) is a [[knife|knife]] brand of Kai USA, headquartered in [[Tualatin, Oregon|Tualatin, Oregon]], [[United States|United States]]. Both Zero Tolerance and Kai USA are members of the Kai Group, a global cutlery company.
title: Zero Tolerance Knives

abstract: Development Bank of Ethiopia (DBE) is a specialized state owned [[development financial institution|National development bank]], which is supervised by the Public Financial Enterprises Agency in [[Ethiopia|Ethiopia]].
title: Development Bank of Ethiopia

abstract: Schell Games is a [[game design|game design]] and [[development|Video game development]] company based in [[Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania|Pittsburgh]]. It was founded in 2002 by game developer [[Jesse Schell|Jesse Schell]]. Schell Games creates video games and interactive experiences for education and entertainment.
title: Schell Games

abstract: Mathspace is an online mathematics program designed for students in primary/elementary, secondary, and higher education. It is designed for students aged between 7 and 18, and is used by schools in [[Australia|Australia]], [[New Zealand|New Zealand]], the [[United States|United States]], [[Canada|Canada]], the [[United Kingdom|United Kingdom]] and [[Hong Kong|Hong Kong]].
title: Mathspace

abstract: Coconut Motion Pictures is an Indian film production, distribution and marketing company established by Rashmin Majithia.
title: Coconut Motion Pictures

abstract: Giovine Orchestra Genovese (also known as GOG) is an Italian [[music organization|music organization]], concert society and cultural association, founded in 1912 in [[Genoa|Genoa]] by Giovanni Semeria. A [[nonprofit organization|nonprofit organization]], it organizes and produces classical and chamber music concerts and promotes musical education for students.
title: Giovine Orchestra Genovese

abstract: Magic Moments Motion Pictures is an Indian Bengali-language television serial and film [[production company|production company]] based in [[Kolkata|Kolkata]], incorporated on 29 June 2010. Magic Moments Motion Pictures Private Limited has 3 creative directors/key management personnel- Kunal Banerjee, Saibal Banerjee and Leena Ganguli. They started off with shows like "Binni Dhaner Khoi" and "[[Keya Patar Nouko|Keya Patar Nouko]]", and went on to produce many more popular shows on Bengali Television, the most notable ones being- [[Ishti Kutum|Ishti Kutum]], [[Ichche Nodee|Ichche Nodee]] and [[Kusum Dola|Kusum Dola]] .
title: Magic Moments Motion Pictures

abstract: Terrytoons was a studio in [[New Rochelle|New Rochelle, New York]], [[New York|New York (state)]], that produced animated [[cartoons|cartoons]] for theatrical release from 1929–1971. Terrytoons was founded by [[Paul Terry|Paul Terry (cartoonist)]] and operated out of the [["K" Building|271 North Avenue]] in downtown New Rochelle. The studio created many cartoon characters including [[Heckle and Jeckle|Heckle and Jeckle]], [[Mighty Mouse|Mighty Mouse]], [[Gandy Goose|Gandy Goose]], Sourpuss, [[Dinky Duck|Dinky Duck]] and [[Luno|Luno The White Stallion]]. The "New Terrytoons" period of the late 1950s through early 1970s produced such characters as [[Deputy Dawg|Deputy Dawg]], [[Hector Heathcote|Hector Heathcote]], [[Hashimoto|Hashimoto-san]], [[Sidney the Elephant|Sidney the Elephant]], [[Possible Possum|Possible Possum]], [[James Hound|James Hound]], [[Astronut|Astronut]], [[Sad Cat|Sad Cat]] and [[The Mighty Heroes|The Mighty Heroes]]. [[Adult animation|Adult animation]] pioneer [[Ralph Bakshi|Ralph Bakshi]] got his start as an animator, and eventually as a director, at Terrytoons. Terrytoons were originally released to theaters by [[20th Century Fox|20th Century Fox]]. The Terrytoons library was later purchased by the [[CBS Corporation|CBS Corporation]].
title: Terrytoons

abstract: Packard was an American [[luxury automobile|luxury vehicle]] marque built by the Packard Motor Car Company of [[Detroit|Detroit]], [[Michigan|Michigan]], United States. The first Packard automobiles were produced in 1899, and the last Detroit-built Packard in 1956, when they built the Packard Predictor, their last concept car.
title: Packard

abstract: The Pierce-Arrow Motor Car Company was an American [[motor vehicle manufacturer|Automotive industry]] based in [[Buffalo, New York|Buffalo, New York]], which was active from 1901 to 1938. Although best known for its expensive [[luxury cars|Luxury vehicle]], Pierce-Arrow also manufactured commercial [[trucks|motor truck]], [[fire trucks|Fire apparatus]], camp trailers, [[motorcycle|motorcycles]], and [[bicycle|bicycles]].
title: Pierce-Arrow Motor Car Company

abstract: Independent Television News (ITN) is a UK-based television production company. It is made up of two divisions: Broadcast News and ITN Productions. ITN is based in [[London|London]], with bureaux and offices in Beijing, Brussels, Jerusalem, Johannesburg, New York, Paris, Sydney and Washington DC.
title: ITN

abstract: The Philippine National Railways (PNR) () is a [[state-owned|government-owned and controlled corporation]] [[railway company|railway company]] in the [[Philippines|Philippines]], operating a single line of track on [[Luzon|Luzon]]. As of 2016, it operates one [[commuter rail|commuter rail]] service in [[Metro Manila|Metro Manila]] and local services between [[Sipocot|Sipocot,_Camarines_Sur]], [[Naga City|Naga,_Camarines_Sur]] and [[Legazpi City|Legazpi,_Albay]] in [[Bicol Region|Bicol Region]].
title: Philippine National Railways

abstract: Sydney Theatre Company was formed in December 1978, following the closure of The [[Old Tote Theatre Company|Old Tote Theatre Company]] the month before. The then Premier, [[Neville Wran|Neville Wran]], approached Elizabeth Butcher, who had been seconded from the [[National Institute of Dramatic Art|National Institute of Dramatic Art]] to administer the Old Tote, and asked her to set up a new state theatre company, to perform in the Drama Theatre of the [[Sydney Opera House|Sydney Opera House]]. Butcher established its legal identity and managerial structure, and proposed the name, Sydney Theatre Company. With John Clark (Director of NIDA) as the Artistic Adviser of the first season, five theatre companies were invited to produce six plays to be presented by STC as the 1979 Interim Season in the Drama Theatre. The first production, by The Paris Company, was [[A Cheery Soul|A Cheery Soul]], by [[Patrick White|Patrick White]], Australia's Nobel Laureate for Literature, directed by [[Jim Sharman|Jim Sharman]], featuring [[Robyn Nevin|Robyn Nevin]] as Miss Docker.
title: Sydney Theatre Company

abstract: The Australian Radio Network is a group of commercial radio stations around Australia. It includes the [[Pure Gold|Pure Gold Network]], [[KIIS Network|KIIS Network]], [[The Edge|The Edge 96.ONE]] and [[iHeartRadio|iHeartRadio]] brands.
title: Australian Radio Network

abstract: October Films was a major U.S. [[independent film|independent film]] production company and [[distributor|film distributor]] founded in 1991 by [[Bingham Ray|Bingham Ray]] and [[Jeff Lipsky|Jeff Lipsky]] as a means of distributing the 1990 film [[Life Is Sweet|Life Is Sweet (film)]].
title: October Films

abstract: CrossGen Comics, Inc., was founded in 1998, in [[Tampa, Florida|Tampa, Florida]] by [[entrepreneur|entrepreneur]] [[Mark Alessi|Mark Alessi]].
title: CrossGen

abstract: Knight Ridder (from , knight) was an American media company, specializing in [[newspaper|newspaper]] and [[Internet|Internet]] [[publishing|publishing]]. Until it was bought by [[The McClatchy Company|The McClatchy Company]] on June 27, 2006, it was the second-largest newspaper publisher in the United States, with 32 daily newspapers sold. Its headquarters were located in [[San Jose|San Jose, California]], [[California|California]].
title: Knight Ridder

abstract: Elkjøp (translates as [[El|Consumer electronics]] buy) better known as [[Elgiganten|Elgiganten]] outside [[Norway|Norway]], is the largest [[consumer electronics|consumer electronics]] retailer in the [[Nordic countries|Nordic countries]], with 400 stores in six countries and 10,000 employees. It is owned by [[Dixons Carphone|Dixons Carphone]], who bought it in 1999, then removing the company from [[Oslo Stock Exchange|Oslo Stock Exchange]].It was founded by [[Trygve Fjetland|Trygve Fjetland]] on 16 March 1962. Elkjøp also had sister stores outside the Nordic countries, namely in [[Czech Republic|Czech Republic]] and in [[Slovakia|Slovakia]]. These were sold in 2014. The company as a whole sold for £2.3 billion in 2013 to 2014. Means of maintaining the low prices include huge bulk purchases and accompanying stockpiles, efficient use of big department stores instead of costly downtown shops, and an extensive array of no name or lesser known brands.
title: Elkjøp

abstract: Bombay Talkies was a movie studio founded in 1934. During its period of operation, Bombay Talkies produced 40 movies in [[Malad|Malad]], a suburb of the Indian city of [[Bombay|Mumbai]].
title: Bombay Talkies

abstract: Swedish American Line (, abbreviated SAL) is a Swedish passenger shipping line. It was founded in December 1914 under the name Rederiaktiebolaget Sverige-Nordamerika, beginning [[ocean liner|ocean liner]] service from [[Gothenburg|Gothenburg]] to [[New York|New York City]] in 1915. In 1925 the company changed its name to Svenska Amerika Linien / Swedish American Line.The Swedish American Line was amongst the first companies to build liners with provisions for off-season cruising, as well as the first company to build a [[diesel-engined|diesel engine]] transatlantic liner. Increased operational costs and stronger competition from [[aeroplane|aeroplanes]] forced the company to abandon passenger traffic in 1975, but cargo operations continued until the 1980s.
title: Swedish American Line

abstract: Established in 1817 in Macquarie Place, [[Sydney|Sydney]] premises leased from [[Mary Reibey|Mary Reibey]], the Bank of New South Wales (BNSW) was the first bank in Australia. It was established under the economic regime of [[Governor|Governor of New South Wales]] [[Lachlan Macquarie|Lachlan Macquarie]] (responsible for transitioning the penal settlement of Sydney into a capitalist economy). At the time, the colony of Sydney had not been supplied with currency, instead barter and promissory notes was the payment method of choice. Governor Macquarie himself used cattle and rum as payment for the construction of [[Sydney Hospital|Sydney Hospital]] and the road from Sydney to Liverpool. The suggestion of establishing a bank was raised in March 1810; but it wasn't until November 1816 that a meeting was held to discuss the real possibility of such a proposal. In February 1817 seven directors of the bank were elected: [[D'Arcy Wentworth|D'Arcy Wentworth]], [[John Harris|John Harris (Australian settler)]], [[Robert Jenkins|Robert Jenkins (merchant)]], [[Thomas Wylde|John Wylde#Deputy Judge Advocate of New South Wales]], [[Alexander Riley|Alexander Riley]], [[William Redfern|William Redfern]] and [[John Thomas Campbell|John Thomas Campbell]]. Campbell was elected the bank's first president and [[Edward Smith Hall|Edward Smith Hall]] as its first cashier and secretary. During the 19th and early 20th century, the Bank opened branches throughout Australia and Oceania. This included at [[Moreton Bay|Moreton Bay]] ([[Brisbane|Brisbane]]) in 1850, then in [[Victoria|Victoria (Australia)]] (1851), New Zealand (1861), [[South Australia|South Australia]] (1877), [[Western Australia|Western Australia]] (1883), [[Fiji|Fiji]] (1901), Papua (now part of [[Papua New Guinea|Papua New Guinea]]) (1910) and [[Tasmania|Tasmania]] (1910).Besides expanding its branch network, the bank also expanded by acquiring other banks:
title: Bank of New South Wales

abstract: Armstrong Siddeley was a British engineering group that operated during the first half of the 20th century. It was formed in 1919 and is best known for the production of [[luxury vehicle|luxury vehicles]] and [[aircraft engine|aircraft engines]].
title: Armstrong Siddeley

abstract: Living Books was a series of [[interactive storybook|interactive storybooks]] for children, first produced by [[Brøderbund|Brøderbund]] and then spun off into a jointly owned (with [[Random House|Random House]]) subsidiary, which were distributed on [[CD-ROM|CD-ROM]] for [[Mac OS|Mac OS]] and [[Microsoft Windows|Microsoft Windows]]. The series began in January 1992 with the release of [[Just Grandma and Me|Just Grandma and Me]] (an adaptation of the book by [[Mercer Mayer|Mercer Mayer]]) in 1992 till it ended in 1998; other titles in the series included [[The Tortoise and the Hare|The Tortoise and the Hare]], [[Arthur's Teacher Trouble|Arthur's Teacher Trouble]] (and other adaptations of books by [[Marc Brown|Marc Brown (author)]]), [[Dr. Seuss|Dr. Seuss]], [[P. D. Eastman|P. D. Eastman]], and [[Berenstain Bears|Berenstain Bears]] titles.
title: Living Books

abstract: The Alberta Wheat Pool was the first of [[Canada|Canada]]'s [[wheat|wheat]] [[farmer co-operatives|agricultural cooperative]] in 1923.
title: Alberta Wheat Pool

abstract: ANEK Lines (Ανώνυμη Ναυτιλιακή Εταιρεία Κρήτης, Anonymi Naftiliaki Eteria Kritis, Anonymous Shipping Company of Crete) is the largest passenger shipping company in Greece. It was founded in 1967 by numerous shareholders who were inhabitants of [[Crete|Crete]]. It operates passenger ferries, mainly on Piraeus-Crete and Adriatic Sea lines.
title: ANEK Lines

abstract: Red Funnel, formally the Southampton Isle of Wight and South of England Royal Mail Steam Packet Company Limited, is a ferry company that carries [[passengers|passengers]], [[vehicles|vehicles]] and [[freight|freight]] on routes between the English mainland and the [[Isle of Wight|Isle of Wight]]. High-speed foot passenger [[catamarans|catamarans]], known as Red Jets, run between [[Southampton|Southampton]] and [[Cowes|Cowes]], while [[vehicle ferries|Roll-on/roll-off]] run between Southampton and [[East Cowes|East Cowes]].
title: Red Funnel

abstract: Checker Motors Corporation was a [[Kalamazoo, Michigan|Kalamazoo, Michigan]]-based vehicle manufacturer and tier-one subcontractor that manufactured [[taxicab|taxicabs]] used by [[Checker Taxi|Checker Taxi]]. Checker Motors Corporation was established by [[Morris Markin|Morris Markin]] in 1922 through a merger of [[Commonwealth Motors|Commonwealth (automobile company)]] and Markin Automobile Body.
title: Checker Motors Corporation

abstract: In 2007, Coastal Extreme Brewing Company expanded to create Newport Distilling Company, producer of Thomas Tew Rum; the only current rum producing operation in Rhode Island.
title: Coastal Extreme Brewing Company

abstract: United Bulgarian Bank is the first large-scale project for banking consolidation in Bulgaria. It was founded on 30 September 1992 through the merger of 22 regional state-owned banks – Botevgradska Commercial Bank AD, Vrachanska Commercial Bank AD, Gabrovska Commercial Bank AD, Commercial Bank Doverie AD, Commercial Bank Elhovo AD, Commercial Bank Iskar AD, Kardzhaliyska Commercial Bank AD, Loveshka Commercial Bank AD, Mihaylovgradska Commercial Bank AD, Novozagorska Commercial Bank AD, Pazardzhishka Commercial Bank AD, Pernishka Commercial Bank AD, Peshterska Commercial Bank AD, Plevenska Commercial Bank AD, Popovska Commercial Bank AD, Rusenska Commercial Bank AD, Samokovska Commercial Bank AD, Slivenska Commercial Bank AD, Commercial Bank Stroybank AD, Targovishtka Commercial Bank AD, Haskovska Commercial Bank AD and Shumenska Commercial Bank.
title: United Bulgarian Bank

abstract: Dacom, Inc. was founded in 1966 by two ex-[[Lockheed|Lockheed Corporation]] engineers, Daniel Hochman, President, and Don Weber, Vice President, building on their pioneering work on digital image compression invented for satellite communications. Their work resulted in the first commercial [[digital|Digital data]] [[fax|fax]] machine and later the first sub-minute facsimile transmission over a single standard phone line. In 1973 Dacom was recipient of the IR-100 Award (the name was later changed to the R&D 100 Awards) for the most significant new product in Information Technology. The patents and technology developed by Dacom have become the foundation of the modern desktop fax machine.
title: Dacom

abstract: Watchmen Recording Studios is a [[music|music]] recording facility owned and operated by Doug White, located in [[Lockport, New York|Lockport (city), New York]], USA. The studio opened to the public in 1995, and as of 2013 over 4000 bands and artists have recorded at the location. These include regional and national acts such as [[Gym Class Heroes|Gym Class Heroes]], [[Psyopus|Psyopus]], [[The Bunny The Bear|The Bunny The Bear]], and [[Brutal Truth|Brutal Truth]], as well as labels such as [[Relapse Records|Relapse Records]], [[Victory Records|Victory Records]], [[Metal Blade Records|Metal Blade Records]], [[Willowtip Records|Willowtip Records]] and [[Century Media Records|Century Media Records]].
title: Watchmen Recording Studios

abstract: Ingenic Semiconductor is a Chinese [[fabless|Fabless manufacturing]] [[semiconductor|semiconductor industry]] company based in [[Beijing|Beijing]], [[China|China]] founded in 2005. They purchased licenses for the [[MIPS architecture|MIPS architecture]] [[instruction set|instruction sets]] in 2009 and design [[CPU|Central processing unit]]-[[microarchitecture|microarchitectures]] based on them. They also design [[system on a chip|system on a chip]] products including their CPUs and licensed [[semiconductor intellectual property|semiconductor intellectual property]] blocks from third parties, such as [[Vivante Corporation|Vivante Corporation]], commission the fabrication of [[integrated circuit|integrated circuits]] at [[semiconductor fabrication plant|semiconductor fabrication plants]] and sell them.
title: Ingenic Semiconductor

abstract: Montgomery Motorcycles was a pioneering British [[motorcycle|motorcycle]] manufacturer. Originally based in [[Bury St Edmunds|Bury St Edmunds]], Suffolk, following the First World War manufacturing was moved to [[Coventry|Coventry]]. Its founder William Montgomery was an innovator and is credited with the invention of the [[sidecar|sidecar]]. Like [[Brough|Brough Motorcycles]], Montgomery made use of the best [[proprietary|Property]] components from other specialist companies and concentrated on the production of frames and forks in-house - and Montgomery supplied a number of frames and its own sprung fork to George Brough. In an advert from the time, Montgomery claimed "These Montgomery machines are for the men who prefer a distinctive mount in appearance and performance. That extra degree of soundness – those little touches which distinguish the 'super' machine from the mere motorcycle, come naturally to the Montgomery and at a price that is amazingly low."
title: Montgomery Motorcycles

abstract: Dunelt Motorcycles was a British [[motorcycle|motorcycle]] and [[bicycle|bicycle]] manufacturer. Based in [[Sheffield|Sheffield]], the business was founded by two steel makers and engineers, Dunford and Elliott (Dunelt is a combination of their names) of Sheffield in 1919. Their first motorcycle was an innovative [[supercharged|supercharged]] 499   cc two-stroke single. The company specialised in good quality sidecars from 1926 and a Dunelt motorcycle was first to cross the desert from Cairo to Siwa and back in 1924. Dunelt also enjoyed racing success and won the Double Twelve Hour World Record at [[Brooklands|Brooklands]] with a Model K in 1928. Dunelt moved into commercial three-wheeled cars but these were not a success. A Dunelt moped was exhibited at the [[Earls Court|Earls Court]] show in 1956 but the company diversified into other areas of engineering in 1957.
title: Dunelt Motorcycles

abstract: DMW Motorcycles was a British [[motorcycle|motorcycle]] manufacturer. Based in [[Wolverhampton|Wolverhampton]], DMW was founded in 1940. The company took over [[Ambassador Motorcycles|Ambassador Motorcycles]] in 1963 and continued production until they closed the company in 1965. Although DMW ceased motorcycle production in 1971, it was noted for trials and racing machines and many DMWs can still be seen at UK sporting events. DMW produced about 15,000   motorcycles and several other manufacturers used DMW forks and engines.
title: DMW Motorcycles

abstract: Jennings & Company was a leading manufacturer of [[slot machine|slot machines]] in the [[United States|United States]] and also manufactured other coin-operated machines, including [[pinball|pinball]] machines, from 1906 to the 1980s. It was founded by Ode D. Jennings as Industry Novelty Company, Incorporated of [[Chicago|Chicago]]. On the death of its founder in 1953, the company was succeeded by Jennings & Company.
title: Jennings & Company

abstract: The Detroit Automobile Company (DAC) was an early [[American|United States]] [[automobile manufacturer|Automotive industry]] founded on August 5, 1899, in [[Detroit|Detroit]], [[Michigan|Michigan]]. It was the first venture of its kind in Detroit. Automotive mechanic [[Henry Ford|Henry Ford]] attracted the financial backing of twelve investors; Detroit Mayor [[William Maybury|William Maybury]], William H. Murphy and others. As with many early car ventures, the company floundered and was dissolved in January 1901. Twenty vehicles were built and $86,000 ($2.61 million in 2019) of investment was lost.
title: Detroit Automobile Company

abstract: Oddworld Inhabitants Inc. is an American [[video game developer|video game developer]] founded in [[1994|1994 in video gaming]] by special-effects and computer-animation veterans Sherry McKenna and [[Lorne Lanning|Lorne Lanning]]. The company is primarily known for the incomplete [[Oddworld Quintology|Oddworld]], a series of award-winning video games about the fictional planet of [[Oddworld|Oddworld]] and its native creatures. The series debuted with [[Oddworld: Abe's Oddysee|Oddworld: Abe's Oddysee]] in [[1997|1997 in video gaming]] and continued with [[Oddworld: Munch's Oddysee|Oddworld: Munch's Oddysee]] in [[2001|2001 in video gaming]] but the studio has also developed standalone titles [[Oddworld: Abe's Exoddus|Oddworld: Abe's Exoddus]] in [[1998|1998 in video gaming]] and [[Oddworld: Stranger's Wrath|Oddworld: Stranger's Wrath]] in [[2005|2005 in video gaming]].
title: Oddworld Inhabitants

abstract: Mauritius Telecom (MT) is a telecommunications company in [[Mauritius|Mauritius]], a small republic in the [[Indian Ocean|Indian Ocean]]. The company had about 357,000 Telephone customers, 804,000 Mobile customers and 162,000 Broadband Internet customers (My.T ADSL) as at June 2014.
title: Mauritius Telecom

abstract: Diatto was an Italian manufacturing company founded in 1835 in [[Turin|Turin]] by Guglielmo Diatto to make 'carriages for wealthy customers'. In 1874 Guglielmo’s sons, Giovanni and Battista Diatto, began building [[railway carriage|railway carriages]] for [[Compagnie Internationale des Wagons-Lits|Compagnie Internationale des Wagons-Lits]] and the [[Orient Express|Orient Express]]. In 1905 Guglielmo's grandsons, Vittorio and Pietro Diatto, began Diatto-Clément, a cooperative venture making motor-vehicles under license from French manufacturer [[Clément-Bayard|Clément-Bayard]] owned by industrialist [[Adolphe Clément-Bayard|Adolphe Clément-Bayard]]. By 1909 they had full ownership of 'Autocostruzioni Diatto' and began developing their own motor-vehicles and exporting them worldwide.
title: Diatto

abstract: The North Coast Brewing Company is a [[brewery|brewery]] and [[pub|pub]] in [[Fort Bragg, California|Fort Bragg, California]], USA.
title: North Coast Brewing Company

abstract: Pea Soup Andersen's is a restaurant chain in [[California|California]] that primarily serves travelers. The chain consists of two locations along the state's two major highways: [[U.S. Route 101|U.S. Route 101 in California]] in [[Buellton|Buellton, California]] and [[Interstate 5|Interstate 5 in California]] in [[Santa Nella|Santa Nella, California]]. While the restaurants are best known for their pea soup, they serve complete home-style meals. Both locations include a bakery and gift shop and have an associated hotel on the property. The company also markets a line of canned soups.
title: Pea Soup Andersen's

abstract: Mindcraft Software (or simply Mindcraft) is an American video game developer, founded in 1989 by Ali Atabek. It is best recognized for the award-winning [[The Magic Candle|The Magic Candle]] series. .
title: Mindcraft

abstract: The ATI 425 Titanium Alloy is a titanium alloy developed and produced by [[Allegheny Technologies|Allegheny Technologies]] Incorporated (ATI).
title: ATI 425 Titanium Alloy

abstract: TinyGrab is a simple [[screenshot|screenshot]] sharing tool for [[Windows|Microsoft Windows]], [[Mac|Macintosh]] and [[iOS|iOS]]. The tool allows the user to take a screenshot and automatically [[upload|upload]] it to their servers. The URL is passed directly to the user's clipboard allowing them to paste the link in an email, [[blog|blog]] post, on [[Twitter|Twitter]], or any [[instant messaging|instant messaging]] application. The service is tiered with the free accounts limited to ten "grabs" a day and paid accounts giving unlimited grabs and the ability to use [[File Transfer Protocol|File Transfer Protocol]] to upload to custom servers.
title: TinyGrab

abstract: The Farm 51 is a [[Polish|Poland]] [[video game developer|video game developer]] founded in 2005 by Wojciech Pazdur and Kamil Bilczyński, which previously worked on the [[Painkiller|Painkiller (game)]] series at [[People Can Fly|People Can Fly]], and Robert Siejka, former president of 3D Magazine. Originally, the company did some [[outsourcing|outsourcing]] contracts work for other studios, but then gathered enough [[IP|Intellectual property]] to get funding from [[1C Company|1C Company]] for their 2009 debut project, [[NecroVisioN|NecroVisioN]], and then its [[prequel|prequel]], [[NecroVisioN: Lost Company|NecroVisioN#Prequel]]. They were initially working on [[City Interactive|City Interactive]]'s Alien Fear, but are no longer involved with the project. They have also released [[Deadfall Adventures|Deadfall Adventures]], on November 15, 2013.[[ Get Even|Get Even (video game) ]] was published by [[Bandai Namco Entertainment|Bandai Namco Entertainment]] and released on June 23rd 2017 on PC, [[PlayStation 4|PlayStation 4]] and [[Xbox One|Xbox One]]. Their most recent game, World War 3, is in development and released as an early access title on [[Steam|Steam (software)]] on October 19th 2018.
title: The Farm 51

abstract: Platige Image S.A. is a [[Polish|Poland]] company founded in 1997. It specializes in [[computer graphics|computer graphics]], [[3D animation|3D animation]], and digital [[special effects|special effects]]. Its core business includes advertising as well as film, art, and educational projects. The studio employs a staff of over 150 artists, including directors, art directors, graphic designers, and producers. Platige has received over 200 awards and honors, including four Best of Show awards at the [[SIGGRAPH|SIGGRAPH]] festival and a [[British Academy of Film and Television Arts (BAFTA)|BAFTA]] award. The studio was nominated for an [[Academy Award|Academy Award]], the Golden Palm at the [[Cannes Film Festival|Cannes Film Festival]], and the Golden Lion at the [[Venice International Film Festival|Venice International Film Festival]].
title: Platige Image

abstract: Founded in 1994, Dragon Capital Group is a [[Vietnam|Vietnam]]-focused financial institution with long-standing investment experience in [[Vietnam|Vietnam]] and its surrounding [[Southeast Asia|Southeast Asian]] region. Established from an initial base of US$16m and eight staff, Dragon Capital Group currently manages around US$1.3 billion with a headcount of 100. Dragon Capital has offices in [[Ho Chi Minh City|Ho Chi Minh City]] and [[Hanoi|Hanoi]] (SSC registered) in Vietnam as well as [[Bangkok|Bangkok]], [[Hong Kong|Hong Kong]] (SFC registered) and the UK (FCA registered).
title: Dragon Capital

abstract: Launch Services Program (LSP) is responsible for [[NASA|NASA]] oversight of launch operations and countdown management, providing added quality and mission assurance in lieu of the requirement for the launch service provider to obtain a commercial [[launch license|launch license]]. It operates under the Human Exploration and Operations (HEO) Mission Directorate of NASA.
title: Launch Services Program

abstract: Through the 1980s, many artists recorded at Odyssey Studios, including [[Cliff Richard|Cliff Richard]], [[Paul McCartney|Paul McCartney]], [[Kate Bush|Kate Bush]], [[George Michael|George Michael]], [[Spandau Ballet|Spandau Ballet]] and [[Roger Daltrey|Roger Daltrey]]. Below is a list of some albums recorded either in part or entirely at Odyssey Studios.
title: Odyssey Studios

abstract: DPV Deutscher Pressevertrieb is a full-service distributor for the worldwide distribution of media products with its head office in [[Hamburg|Hamburg]] and further branches in [[Stuttgart|Stuttgart]],[[Mörfelden-Walldorf|Mörfelden-Walldorf]], [[Hürth|Hürth]] and [[Munich|Munich]].
title: Deutscher Pressevertrieb

abstract: [[Allison Argo|Allison Argo]], who serves as producer, director, writer, editor, and narrator for ArgoFilms, began the company with the goal of "lending a voice to those who cannot speak for themselves." The company focusing especially on [[endangered species|endangered species]] and [[captive animal|captivity (animal)]] issues.
title: ArgoFilms

abstract: Topcraft (トップクラフト, also written "Top Craft") was a Japanese anime studio established in 1971 by former [[Toei Animation|Toei Animation]] producer Toru Hara. It was famous for doing animation for [[hand-drawn animation|hand-drawn animation]] titles by [[Rankin/Bass|Rankin/Bass]] and for the production of [[Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind|Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind (film)]] and [[Macross: Do You Remember Love?|Macross: Do You Remember Love?]]. The studio went bankrupt and dissolved in June 15, 1985 essentially splitting the studio in half. [[Hayao Miyazaki|Hayao Miyazaki]], [[Toshio Suzuki|Toshio Suzuki (producer)]] and [[Isao Takahata|Isao Takahata]] bought the studio while laying off most of its animation staff, changing its name to [[Studio Ghibli|Studio Ghibli]].. Topcraft's animators later formed another studio called Pacific Animation Corporation to continue to work with Rankin/Bass on shows like [[ThunderCats|ThunderCats (1985 TV series)]] and [[Silverhawks|Silverhawks]] but eventually joined Ghibli once the studio was bought out by Disney and became [[Walt Disney Animation Japan|Walt Disney Animation Japan]]. Some animators like Tsuguyuki Kubo went to work for other anime studios such as [[Studio Pierrot|Studio Pierrot]] working on [[Naruto|Naruto]] and [[Bleach|Bleach (anime)]] for them. In the end the buy out of Topcraft made the studio into the birth of Studio Ghibli. Topcraft's founder Toru Hara became Studio Ghibli's first manager.
title: Topcraft

abstract: Due to the popularity of its signed acts across the French-speaking world, Wati B established its own "Wati B" line of fashion apparel with the first "Wati Boutique" opened on 1 February 2011 in Paris.
title: Wati B

abstract: Runningland cooperates with the Shanghai Lubricant Association by providing training facilities and consultants. Annual training sessions and examination were held in 2010 and 2009 respectively in the area of Oil Analysis and Lubrication Analysis. Runningland's facilities have hosted training sessions for trainees, introducing them to newly improved testing methods revised annually by GB (Domestic), ASTM, ISO, and IP. The Shanghai Lubricant Association works closely with industry-related institutions and enterprises, making contributions to the development and progress of the Lubricant Industry in China.
title: Runningland

abstract: Revolution Brewing was started as a [[brewpub|brewpub]] in 2010 by owner Josh Deth. Deth attended the [[University of Michigan|University of Michigan]] and became interested in brewing from his frequent visits to [[Bell's Brewery|Bell's Brewery]]. Deth worked at [[Goose Island Brewery|Goose Island Brewery]] and connected with head brewmaster Jim Cibak during his time there. Cibak has worked at a number of breweries including [[Three Floyds Brewing|Three Floyds Brewing]].
title: Revolution Brewing

abstract: Ché Trading was an independent UK record label co-founded by Vinita Joshi and Nick Allport, and was responsible for releasing the music of Essex etherealists [[Disco Inferno|Disco Inferno (band)]]. Other artists on their roster included the [[Tindersticks|Tindersticks]], [[Füxa|Füxa]], and [[Slipstream|Slipstream]]. Ché was also responsible for two Top 40 hit singles by [[Lilys|Lilys]], "A Nanny In Manhattan" and [[Urusei Yatsura|Urusei Yatsura]]'s 1997 track "Hello Tiger". The I label is an offshoot of Ché Trading, which specialises in alternative and left field releases.
title: Ché Trading

abstract: Cumming Corporation is a privately held international project management and cost consulting firm with more than 620 employees, 37 offices and a focus on serving the [[Education|Education]], [[Healthcare|Healthcare]], Themed Entertainment, and [[Hospitality|Hospitality]] sectors. In 2017, the firm generated an estimated $117 million in professional fees on more than $4 billion in [[construction|construction]].
title: Cumming Corporation

abstract: Diantong Film Company () was a short-lived but important [[film studio|film studio]] and [[production company|production company]] during the 1930s in [[Shanghai|Shanghai]], China. Though it produced only four films during its existence between 1934-1935, all four films became important examples of the [[left-leaning|Left-wing politics]] Chinese cinema of the 1930s. Of all the film studios of the period, Diantong had the closest connection to the [[Communist Party of China|Communist Party of China]].
title: Diantong

abstract: DOK-ING d.o.o is a [[Croatia|Croatian]] company which manufactures [[electric vehicle|electric vehicles]], [[unmanned|Unmanned ground vehicle]] multi-purpose vehicles and [[robotic|Robotics]] systems. established in 1992.
title: DOK-ING

abstract: The Commission de la construction du Québec (CCQ) is responsible for the application of the laws and regulations that govern the [[construction|construction]] industry in the province of [[Québec|Québec]]. Funded by the industry's employers and employees, the CCQ offers numerous services in the areas of social services, vocational training, workforce management, and application of the construction industry's [[collective agreements|collective agreements]].
title: Commission de la construction du Québec

abstract: Verizon Fios, also marketed as Fios by Verizon, is a [[bundled|Triple play (telecommunications)]] [[Internet access|Internet access]], telephone, and television service that operates over a [[fiber-optic|Optical fiber]] communications network with over 5 million customers in nine U.S. states. The name, Fios, is an [[acronym|acronym]] for Fiber Optic Service. Service is offered in some areas of the United States by [[Verizon Communications|Verizon Communications]], while [[Frontier Communications|Frontier Communications]] operates licensed [[FiOS|FiOS from Frontier]] services in former Verizon territories across six states, using a nearly identical network infrastructure. Fios service began in 2005, and networked areas expanded through 2010, although some areas do not have service or cannot receive TV and phone service because of [[franchise|franchising]] agreements.
title: Verizon Fios

abstract: Gravity Studios is a [[recording studio|recording studio]] in [[Chicago|Chicago]], [[Illinois|Illinois]] founded in 1993 by Doug McBride.
