Starting with the single "[[Seether|Seether (song)]]" by local band [[Veruca Salt|Veruca Salt]], Gravity has hosted bands such as the [[Plain White T’s|Plain White T’s]], [[Silversun Pickups|Silversun Pickups]], and [[Fall Out Boy|Fall Out Boy]]. An adjacent mastering studio, Gravity Mastering, has been used by bands and producers throughout the country.
title: Gravity Studios

abstract: Before launching Rocket Girl in 1997, Vinita Joshi had been actively involved in running both [[Cheree Records|Cheree Records]] and [[Ché Trading|Ché Trading]], releasing tracks by artists such as [[The Telescopes|The Telescopes]], [[The Tindersticks|The Tindersticks]], [[Bark Psychosis|Bark Psychosis]] and [[Disco Inferno|Disco Inferno (band)]]. Ché Trading, an offshoot label co-founded by Joshi and Nick Allport, was responsible for releasing the music of Essex Etherealists, Disco Inferno, and had a roster that also included the [[Tindersticks|Tindersticks]], [[Backwater|Backwater (band)]], [[Füxa|Füxa]], and [[Slipstream|Slipstream]]. Ché Trading had two Top 40 hit singles by [[Lilys|Lilys]] (A Nanny In Manhattan) and [[Urusei Yatsura|Urusei Yatsura]] (Hello Tiger). Vinita has also been involved with a number of other record labels throughout the years, namely [[Bella Union|Bella Union]] and [[One Little Indian|One Little Indian]].
title: Rocket Girl

abstract: Entebbe Handling Services (ENHAS), is an airport ground handling service company based in [[Uganda|Uganda]]. It is the largest ground handling company at [[Entebbe International Airport|Entebbe International Airport]] , Uganda's largest civilian and military airport, where it services at least 19 airlines, as of November 2017.
title: Entebbe Handling Services

abstract: Amoeba Culture () is a South Korean independent [[record label|record label]] established in 2006 by [[Dynamic Duo|Dynamic Duo (South Korean duo)]] ([[Gaeko|Gaeko]] and [[Choiza|Choiza]]) and Go Kyung-min. The label is home to prominent artists such as [[Dynamic Duo|Dynamic Duo (South Korean duo)]], [[Primary|Primary (musician)]], [[Rhythm Power|Rhythm Power]], [[Crush|Crush (singer)]], and [[Ha:tfelt|Park Ye-eun]]. The label had the third largest sales among Korean record labels in 2015.
title: Amoeba Culture

abstract: The Propeller Group was founded in late 2006 by visual artists Phunam Thuc Ha (born 1974, [[Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam|Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam]]) and Tuan Andrew Nguyen (born 1976, [[Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam|Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam]]), who were joined by Matt Lucero (born 1976, [[Upland, California|Upland, California]]) in 2008. Phunam studied sculpture and conservation in [[Bangkok|Bangkok]] and [[Chiang Mai, Thailand|Chiang Mai, Thailand]] and at the [[Hanoi College of Fine Arts|Hanoi College of Fine Arts]]. Nguyen earned a [[BFA|Bachelor of Fine Arts]] from the [[University of California, Irvine|University of California, Irvine]]. He met Lucero while they were completing their [[MFA|Master of Fine Arts]] from the [[California Institute of the Arts|California Institute of the Arts]]. Lucero earned a BFA from the [[University of California, Riverside|University of California, Riverside]]. As of late 2017, Phunam Thuc Ha and Matt Lucero are no longer active members of The Propeller Group having withdrawn to pursue more personal interests.
title: The Propeller Group

abstract: Doosan Škoda Power, a part of global company [[Doosan|Doosan]], is a manufacturer and supplier of equipment for [[power stations|power stations]], [[machine rooms|machine rooms]] especially equipped for [[steam turbines|steam turbines]].
title: Doosan Škoda Power

abstract: Ernst Kaps Piano Fabrik was a German piano manufacturer founded in 1858 with the original factory at 20 to 22 Seminarstrasse in [[Dresden|Dresden]], Germany. Kaps acquired the title of purveyor of the [[Kingdom of Saxony|Kingdom of Saxony]].
title: Ernst Kaps

abstract: Jacso Entertainment was formed in 2010 as joint venture of eSun Holdings (). Celia Sie was the founder of Jacso Entertainment. The core businesses of Jacso are media, entertainment, artist management, production and distribution, and online marketing.
title: Jacso Entertainment

abstract: KB INDELA, Ltd. is a private Belarusian innovative company, specializing in development and production of [[unmanned aerial vehicles|unmanned aerial vehicles]] (UAVs) and multifunctional unmanned aircraft systems (UASs) of various designation.
title: KB INDELA

abstract: 888casino, formerly Casino-on-Net, is an [[online casino|online casino]] founded in 1997 and based in [[Gibraltar|Gibraltar]]. It is one of the Internet's oldest casinos, and in 2013 it became the first exclusively online casino to be licensed in the [[United States|United States]].
title: 888casino

abstract: FlipTop Battle League is the first and largest professional [[rap battle|Battle rap]] conference in the Philippines founded by Alaric Riam Yuson (known as Anygma) in 2010. The league promotes [[Pinoy hip hop|Pinoy hip hop]]. FlipTop is heavily influenced by the original rap battle leagues in the West founded in 2008 – Grind Time Now (U.S.), [[King of the Dot|King of the Dot]] (Canada) and [[Don't Flop|Don't Flop]] (UK), which inspired the creation of FlipTop and other battle leagues around the world. The league also branched out into several divisions after its success.
title: FlipTop Battle League

abstract: is a Japanese [[video game developer|video game developer]] based in [[Gifu|Gifu]]. It was founded in July 2010 by former [[Flight-Plan|Flight-Plan]] employees. In April 2015 Felistella and [[Idea Factory|Idea Factory]] have entered a capital tie-up agreement, in which Idea Factory acquired a portion of Felistella's stock.
title: Felistella

abstract: Lokesh Productions, based in [[Bengaluru|Bengaluru]], [[Karnataka|Karnataka]] is an [[India|Indian]] [[production company|film making]] best known for making Non Fiction Shows in [[Kannada|Kannada]] language. It was founded in 2013 by [[Girija Lokesh|Girija Lokesh]] and [[Srujan Lokesh|Srujan Lokesh]], wife and son of veteran Kannada actor [[Lokesh|Lokesh]], son of [[Subbaiah Naidu|Subbaiah Naidu]], credited as first hero of Kannada silent movies. The production house has produced several successful shows on television including Challenge, Chota Champion, Kaasige Toss, all being reality shows. Currently, the house produces [[Majaa Talkies|Majaa Talkies]], a sketch comedy show which has been a huge hit among Kannada audience.
title: Lokesh Productions

abstract: Stone & Wood Brewing Co. is an Australian craft brewery which is based in [[Byron Bay|Byron Bay]], New South Wales. In 2016, it was awarded 'Champion Large Australian Brewery' at the 2016 [[Australian International Beer Awards|Australian International Beer Awards]] and its Pacific Ale won a Silver medal at the [[World Beer Cup|World Beer Cup]] in the English-Style Summer Ale category.
title: Stone & Wood Brewing Co.

abstract: Toonbox is an animation studio founded in [[Russia|Russia]] and based in [[Cyprus|Cyprus]].
title: Toonbox

abstract: Digital Cybercherries Ltd. is a British video game developer based in the [[United Kingdom|United Kingdom]]. It was founded in 2015. They developed [[New Retro Arcade: Neon|New Retro Arcade: Neon]] and [[Hypercharge: Unboxed|Hypercharge: Unboxed]].
title: Digital Cybercherries

abstract: Lezhin Comics is a [[webtoon|webtoon]] portal that was founded by [[South Korea|South Korean]] [[blog|blogger]] Han Hee-sung in 2013. It is based in South Korea and its services are offered in Korean, Japanese and English.
title: Lezhin Comics

abstract: Acropolis Entertainment Pvt. Ltd. is an Indian Bengali-language television serial and film [[production company|production company]] based in [[Kolkata|Kolkata]], incorporated on 6 October 2006 . Acropolis Entertainment Private Limited has 4 creative directors/key management personnel- Snigdha Sumit Basu, Sumit Tinkari Basu, Rajnish Jaichandra Hedao and Sani Ghose Ray. They started off with shows like "[[Agnipariksha|Agnipariksha (TV series)]]" and "Rashi", and went on to produce many more popular shows on Bengali Television, the most notable ones being- [[Bodhuboron|Bodhuboron]], [[Aamar Durga|Aamar Durga]] and [[Bokul Kotha|Bokul Kotha]].
title: Acropolis Entertainment

abstract: Acura holds the distinction of being the first Japanese automotive luxury brand. The creation of Acura coincided with the introduction of a JDM Honda dealership sales channel, called [[Honda Clio|Honda#Japan]], which sold luxury vehicles, joining previously established Honda Verno, followed by Honda Primo the following year. In its first few years of existence, Acura was among the best-selling luxury marques in the US. Though sales were down in the mid-to-late 1990s, the brand experienced a revival in the early 2000s, due to drastic redesigns and the introductions of new models.
title: Acura

abstract: The Triumph Motor Company was a British car and motor manufacturing company in the 19th and 20th centuries. The marque had its origins in 1885 when [[Siegfried Bettmann|Siegfried Bettmann]] of [[Nuremberg|Nuremberg]] formed S. Bettmann & Co. and started importing [[bicycle|bicycles]] from Europe and selling them under his own trade name in London. The trade name became "Triumph" the following year, and in 1887 Bettmann was joined by a partner, Moritz Schulte, also from Germany. In 1889, the businessmen started producing their own bicycles in [[Coventry|Coventry]], England.
title: Triumph Motor Company

abstract: MicroProse Software Inc. was an American [[video game publisher|video game publisher]] and [[developer|video game developer]] founded by [[Bill Stealey|Bill Stealey]] and [[Sid Meier|Sid Meier]] in 1982. It developed and published numerous games, many of which are regarded as groundbreaking, classics and cult titles, including starting the [[Civilization|Civilization (series)]] and [[X-COM|X-COM]] series. Most of their internally developed titles were [[vehicle simulation|vehicle simulation game]] and [[strategy|strategy video game]] games.
title: MicroProse

abstract: DKW (Dampf-Kraft-Wagen, , also Deutsche Kinder-Wagen . Das-Kleine-Wunder, or Des-Knaben-Wunsch, ) is a German [[car|automobile]] and [[motorcycle|motorcycle]] [[marque|marque]]. The company and brand is one of the ancestor companies of the modern day [[Audi|Audi]] company as one of the four companies that formed [[Auto-Union|Auto-Union]].
title: DKW

abstract: The Bristol Aeroplane Company, originally the British and Colonial Aeroplane Company, was both one of the first and one of the most important British [[aviation|aviation]] companies, designing and manufacturing both [[airframe|airframes]] and [[aircraft engine|aircraft engines]]. Notable aircraft produced by the company include the [['Boxkite'|Bristol Boxkite]], the [[Bristol Fighter|Bristol F.2 Fighter]], the [[Bulldog|Bristol Bulldog]], the [[Blenheim|Bristol Blenheim]], the [[Beaufighter|Bristol Beaufighter]], and the [[Britannia|Bristol Britannia]], and much of the preliminary work which led to the [[Concorde|Concorde]] was carried out by the company. In 1956 its major operations were split into Bristol Aircraft and Bristol Aero Engines. In 1959, Bristol Aircraft merged with several major British aircraft companies to form the [[British Aircraft Corporation|British Aircraft Corporation]] (BAC) and Bristol Aero Engines merged with [[Armstrong Siddeley|Armstrong Siddeley]] to form [[Bristol Siddeley|Bristol Siddeley]].
title: Bristol Aeroplane Company

abstract: The Republican Liberty Caucus (RLC) is a political action organization dedicated to promoting the ideals of [[individual liberty|Individual freedom]], [[limited government|limited government]] and [[free market|free market]] economics within the [[Republican Party|Republican Party (United States)]] in the [[United States|United States]]. It is part of the [[libertarian|Libertarianism in the United States]] wing of the Republican Party. It also operates a [[political action committee|political action committee]], the RLC-USA PAC.
title: Republican Liberty Caucus

abstract: Viasat is a [[Nordic|Nordic countries]] [[direct broadcast satellite|direct broadcast satellite]] [[television|television]] [[broadcaster|Broadcasting]] and [[pay TV|pay TV]] operator, owned by the Swedish media group [[Nordic Entertainment Group|Nordic Entertainment Group]] in Nordics, [[All Media Baltics|All Media Baltics]] in Baltics and some channels owned by [[Viasat World|Viasat World]]. Broadcasting from [[London|London]], the target markets are in the [[Nordic|Nordic countries]] and the [[Baltic Countries|Baltic state]].
title: Viasat

abstract: Janssen Pharmaceutica is a [[pharmaceutical company|pharmaceutical company]] headquartered in [[Beerse|Beerse]], [[Belgium|Belgium]]. It was founded in 1953 by [[Paul Janssen|Paul Janssen]].
title: Janssen Pharmaceutica

abstract: Pixomondo is an international visual effects company with a global network of studios in Los Angeles, Frankfurt, Stuttgart, Vancouver, Beijing, Toronto, and Shanghai. The company produces visual effects for feature films, television and commercials. As of 2016, Pixomondo employs over 400 people worldwide.
title: Pixomondo

abstract: Mugen Motorsports (M-TEC Co., Ltd) (無限) is a [[Japan|Japanese]] company formed in 1973 by [[Hirotoshi Honda|Hirotoshi Honda]], the son of [[Honda Motor Company|Honda]] founder [[Soichiro Honda|Soichiro Honda]], and Masao Kimura. Mugen, meaning "Without Limit", "Unlimited" or "Vast", (hence the commonly placed word "Power" after, denoting "Unlimited Power") is an engine tuner and parts manufacturer that manufactures OEM parts such as body kits and sports exhausts for [[Honda Motor Company|Honda Motor Company]]. Despite the family connections, however, Mugen is not, and has never been, owned by Honda Motor Company; Mugen owner Hirotoshi Honda has been the major shareholder in Honda since his father's death in 1991.
title: Mugen Motorsports

abstract: Intelligent Creatures (IC) is a motion picture visual effects company located in [[Toronto|Toronto]], [[Ontario|Ontario]], Canada.
title: Intelligent Creatures

abstract: Wella [[AG|Aktiengesellschaft]] is a major [[German|Germany]] [[hair care|hair care]] company headquartered in [[Darmstadt, Germany|Darmstadt, Germany]]. Founded in 1880 by [[Franz Ströher|Franz Ströher]], it specializes in [[hair care|hair care]], [[styling|Hair styling]] and [[colorants|colorants]] sold to individuals as well as [[hairdresser|hairdressers]] and was controlled by [[Procter & Gamble|Procter & Gamble]] from 2003 until it was sold to [[Coty, Inc.|Coty, Inc.]] in 2015 along with some 40 other P&G brands.
title: Wella

abstract: Bucks Music Group, founded in 1967, is an independent, international music publisher. The company has worked with many music artists, including [[Black Sabbath|Black Sabbath]], [[David Bowie|David Bowie]], [[The Move|The Move]], [[Procol Harum|Procol Harum]], [[The Rolling Stones|The Rolling Stones]], and [[|T. Rex (band)]].
title: Bucks Music Group

abstract: Rohloff AG was founded in 1986 and began by producing a high-tech and very expensive [[bicycle chain|bicycle chain]], the SLT 99. Sales of this chain generated revenues of €1m in 1991, and approximately €0,5m annually from 1992-1998.
title: Rohloff

abstract: Ontario Hydro, established in 1906 as the Hydro-Electric Power Commission of Ontario, was a publicly owned electricity utility in the Province of [[Ontario|Ontario]]. It was formed to build transmission lines to supply municipal utilities with electricity generated by private companies already operating at [[Niagara Falls|Niagara Falls, Ontario]], and soon developed its own generation resources by buying private generation stations and becoming a major designer and builder of new stations. As most of the readily developed [[hydroelectric|hydroelectricity]] sites became exploited, the corporation expanded into building [[coal|coal]]-fired generation and then [[nuclear-powered|nuclear power]] facilities. Renamed as "Ontario Hydro" in 1974, by the 1990s it had become one of the largest, fully integrated [[electricity|electricity]] corporations in North America.
title: Ontario Hydro

abstract: Cobalt Networks was a maker of low-cost [[Linux|Linux]]-based [[server|server (computing)s]] and [[server appliance|server appliances]]. The company had 1,900 end user customers in more than 70 countries.During the [[dot-com bubble|dot-com bubble]], the company had a [[market capitalization|market capitalization]] of $6 billion despite only $22 million in annual revenue.
title: Cobalt Networks

abstract: Horch was a car brand manufactured in [[Germany|Germany]] by [[August Horch|August Horch]] & Cie, at the beginning of the 20th century.
title: Horch

abstract: Millennium Transit Services, LLC is a bus manufacturer formed in 2003 to take over the former [[NovaBus|NovaBus]] manufacturing plant in [[Roswell, New Mexico|Roswell, New Mexico]] and continue construction of the [[Rapid Transit Series|Rapid Transit Series]] (RTS) buses that were built there. The company was composed mostly of former NovaBus employees and financed by the city of Roswell, the [[State of New Mexico|State of New Mexico]], and [[Pioneer Bank|Pioneer Bank]].
title: Millennium Transit Services

abstract: The FitzJohn company was formed in 1919 to build truck and bus bodies. The former were mostly for [[Ford|Ford Motor Company]] chassis, while the latter were for [[REO|REO Motor Car Companys]]. Originally sold under the Fitz-Er marque, the buses were soon badged as FitzJohn. FitzJohn's best selling point was the low price relative to its quality, which led to enough success that a new plant was purchased in 1924, five times larger than the original. Sales continued to increase, doubling from 1924 to 1925, and in the late 1920s FitzJohn was delivering almost 300 bodies a year. At that time FitzJohn models had a simple letter designation, although some had rather basic names, too. However, since so many options (such as rooftop luggage racks or polished aluminum bright-work) were offered, many of the variations were also given Indian names by the company's sales & marketing department.From 1 January 1929, FitzJohn began selling directly to consumers, rather than exclusively through chassis manufacturers and dealers. This change, however, did not prevent a 40% decline in sales due to the [[Depression|Great Depression]], and on 8 June 1931, the company went into receivership. Its founder (H.A. FitzJohn) was forced out, and went into partnership with Paul O. Dittmar to produce the 12- to 15-passenger Dittmar-FitzJohn Autocoach (similar to the model D, but with a lowered aisle along the right side). H.A. FitzJohn later became the first manager of the [[General American Aerocoach Company|Aerocoach]].
title: FitzJohn

abstract: Mobilink started operations in 1990 as the first [[GSM|GSM]] [[cellular|Cellular network]] [[mobile|Mobile phone]] service in [[Pakistan|Pakistan]] with a joint venture by [[Saif Group|Saif Group]] and [[Motorola|Motorola]] Inc., who later sold it to [[Orascom Telecom|Orascom Telecom]], an [[Egypt|Egypt]]-based multinational company and then they also further sold it to [[Vimpelcom|Vimpelcom]] Group, a Russian Company.
title: Mobilink

abstract: Ambassador Motorcycles is a British [[motorcycle|motorcycle]] manufacturer. Founded by racer [[Kaye Don|Kaye Don]] after the [[World War II|World War II]], the company produced lightweight motorcycles with [[Villiers|Villiers Ltd]] and JAP engines and imported [[Zundapps|Zündapp]] from Germany. Production started in 1947 with a 197   cc Villiers-engined bikes. In 1953 a model was produced with electric starters and the first Ambassador twin appeared in 1957. The company was taken over by [[DMW|DMW (motorcycle)]] in 1963 who continued production until they closed the company in 1965. Ambassador Motorcycles was reformed in late 2016.
title: Ambassador Motorcycles

abstract: Nordic Capital [[private equity|private equity]] funds focus on investments primarily in the [[Nordic|Nordic countries]] region. Nordic Capital invests across a broad array of industries but has a particular focus on health care. Other key sectors are tech & payment, financial services, industrial goods & services and consumer & retail.
title: Nordic Capital

abstract: FilmFair was a [[production company|production company]] and [[animation studio|animation studio]] that produced [[children's television series|children's television series]], [[animated cartoon|animated cartoons]], [[educational film|educational films]], and [[television advertisement|television advertisements]]. The company is perhaps best remembered for its [[stop-motion|Stop motion]] films using [[puppet|puppets]], [[clay animation|clay animation]], and [[cutout animation|cutout animation]].
title: FilmFair

abstract: Duzmo Motorcycles was a British [[motorcycle|motorcycle]] manufacturer. Founded in [[Enfield Highway|Enfield Highway]], London in 1919 by John Wallace, engines for the early Duzmo machines were manufactured by the [[Advance Motor Manufacturing Company|Advance Motor Manufacturing Company]] in [[Northampton|Northampton]]. Wallace had no training as an engineer but while he was still at school he set up a workshop in his garden and built a motorcycle from parts. This experience helped him secure an apprenticeship with Collier & Sons. His father bought him a [[Rudge|Rudge-Whitworth]] racing motorcycle and he began competing at [[Brooklands|Brooklands]]. Originally riding for [[JAP|JA Prestwich Industries]] until they found he was under age, Wallace met [[Bert le Vack|Bert le Vack]] and both found work at Scottish car makers Arrol-Johnston designing aircraft engines for the duration of the First World War.
title: Duzmo Motorcycles

abstract: Mohawk Productions is a [[television production company|television production company]] affiliated with television producer [[Bruce Helford|Bruce Helford]].
title: Mohawk Productions

abstract: Plastic Wax is an animation and visual effects studio specializing in pre-rendered CG for video games, film and television.
title: Plastic Wax

abstract: Red Rockets Glare is a [[Los Angeles|Los Angeles]] recording studio, founded by musician, producer, and engineer Raymond Richards in 2003. The associated record label, Red Rockets Glare Records, has signed bands such as Frankel and the [[Leviathan Brothers|Leviathan Brothers]], while artists that have recorded at the studio include [[The Broken West|The Broken West]],[[Chapin Sisters|Chapin Sisters]], [[The Fling|The Fling (band)]], [[The Monolators|The Monolators]] and [[My Own Holiday|My Own Holiday]]. Richards frequently produces albums at the studio, including [[Catch the Brass Ring|Catch the Brass Ring]] (2007) by[[Ferraby Lionheart|Ferraby Lionheart]] and [[Gorilla Manor|Gorilla Manor]] (2009) by [[Local Natives|Local Natives]].
title: Red Rockets Glare

abstract: Rainstorm Entertainment is an [[independent film|independent film]] development, production and sales company headquartered in [[Hollywood, California|Hollywood, California]].
title: Rainstorm Entertainment

abstract: Rappler is an [[online news|online news]] website based in the [[Philippines|Philippines]] with a bureau in [[Jakarta, Indonesia|Jakarta, Indonesia]]. It started as a Facebook page named MovePH in August 2011 and later evolved into a complete website on January 1, 2012. Along with web based text news content, it was also among the first news websites in the Philippines to extensively use online multimedia including video, pictures, text and audio. It also uses social media sites for news distribution.
title: Rappler

abstract: Swastik Productions Pvt. Ltd. is an Indian [[production company|production company]] which produces [[Television series|Television series]] and Entertainment content. It was founded by [[Siddharth Kumar Tewary|Siddharth Kumar Tewary]] who serves as the company's creative director.
title: Swastik Productions

abstract: The Mircom Group of Companies is a manufacturer and distributor of life safety and communications systems including fire detection & alarm, voice evacuation, controlled access and security solutions. The company is headquartered in [[Vaughan|Vaughan, Ontario]], [[Ontario|Ontario]], [[Canada|Canada]].
title: Mircom

abstract: Pipeworks Brewing Company is a [[brewery|brewery]] in [[Chicago|Chicago]], [[Illinois|Illinois]]. The brewery opened in January 2012 by founders Beejay Oslon and Gerrit Lewis. Pipeworks began their brewing different from other microbreweries in that they initially brewed their beers entirely as a series of 'one off' beers that were aimed specifically to the [[niche market|niche market]] of beer connoisseurs. The brewery's stated goal is to release a new beer every week. This approach gave the brewery and its beers somewhat of a cult status among beer enthusiasts, with its offerings selling out relatively quickly. After seeing significant growth, both in output brand and identity, Pipeworks has since augmented their one-off beers with several of its 'core' beers in 16 ounce can 4-Packs now regularly available widely throughout the Chicago area.
title: Pipeworks Brewing

abstract: Blue Hills Brewery is a [[brewery|brewery]] in [[Canton, Massachusetts|Canton, Massachusetts]], [[New England|New England]], USA. They are close to [[Great Blue Hill|Great Blue Hill]], which is where the name came from. Google list currently lists them as closed.
title: Blue Hills Brewery

abstract: List of films distributed/produced under the banner ARY Films
title: ARY Films

abstract: With [[fraternity|Alpha Phi Alpha]] brothers [[William Packer|William Packer (producer)]] and [[Gregory Anderson|Gregory Anderson (screenwriter)]] producing, [[Rob Hardy|Rob Hardy]] wrote and directed Chocolate City, a $20,000 film that [[Blockbuster|Blockbuster LLC]] distributed through its video stores. The film about a young man’s profound experience on a black college campus, was shot using [[16mm color film|16mm film]] on the campus of [[Florida A&M University|Florida A&M University]] in [[Tallahassee, Florida|Tallahassee, Florida]]. In 1994, on the eve of the success of Chocolate City, Hardy and Packer created Rainforest Films. One of the most important goals of Rainforest Films is to create work that will uplift, instead of degrade, the African-American spirit.
title: Rainforest Films

abstract: Reolian Public Transport Co. (Reolian), () was one of the three Bus Public Transport Operators of [[Macau|Macau]] along with [[Transmac|Transmac]] (Transportes Urbanos de Macau) and TCM ([[Transportas Companhia de Macau|Transportas Companhia de Macau]]).
title: Reolian

abstract: Tushek&Spigel Supercars GmbH is an Austrian/Slovenian manufacturer of [[supercar|supercars]], founded in [[Slovenia|Slovenia]] under the name 'Tushek' and based in [[Graz|Graz]], in the former military airport, which consist of a private race track for testing. The company was founded by Aljoša Tushek and Jacob Carl Spigel.
title: Tushek&Spigel Supercars

abstract: Founders Jay Goodwin and Alex Wallash met while attending [[UCSB|UCSB]]. They started home-brewing in their apartment and decided that they would one day start a brewery together. Goodwin started working at [[The Bruery|The Bruery]], where he worked his way from a production assistant to brewer, eventually becoming the head of their barrel aging program. The Rare Barrel brewed its first batch of beer in February 2013, and opened its tasting room on December 27, 2013.
title: The Rare Barrel

abstract: Leadcore Technology is a Chinese [[fabless|Fabless manufacturing]] [[semiconductor|semiconductor industry]] company that provides [[system-on-chip|system on a chip]] solutions for [[smartphone|smartphones]] and [[tablets|Tablet Computer]], specializing in the [[TD-SCDMA|TD-SCDMA]] and [[TD-LTE|TD-LTE]] network standards used in China and in other countries.
title: Leadcore Technology

abstract: In September 1989, Leader Price was created after the opening of the first store in Paris by [[Jean Baud|Jean Baud (businessman)]] and [[Albert Baussan|Albert Baussan]]. From 1989, the chain primarily extended in Paris, with the American group [[TLC Beatrice|TLC Beatrice]] becoming the main shareholder.
title: Leader Price

abstract: Being once considered as the largest film studio in [[Asia|Asia]], Vijaya Vauhini Studios resulted from the merger between [[Vauhini Studios|Vauhini Studios]] and [[Vijaya Productions|Vijaya Productions]], in 1948 when Telugu & Tamil movie producer [[Moola Narayana Swamy|Moola Narayana Swamy]] leased the studios which was under heavy liabilities to the Vijaya Productions run by [[Bommireddy Nagi Reddy|Bommireddy Nagi Reddy]], [[Aluri Chakrapani|Aluri Chakrapani]] who were one time partners of [[Moola Narayana Swamy|Moola Narayana Swamy]] in 1930s.
title: Vijaya Vauhini Studios

abstract: Z/Yen conducts market research and intelligence. It publishes most of its research freely on its own website.
title: Z/Yen

abstract: Headquartered in [[Toronto|Toronto]], [[Ontario|Ontario]], Discovery Air's subsidiary companies have bases across Canada.
title: Discovery Air

abstract: D4 Enterprise (D4エンタープライズ) is a Japanese video game publisher currently specializing in content delivery services like Project EGG over the Internet. Some of the titles that have been re-released include many of [[Compile|Compile (company)]]'s titles, like the [[Madō Monogatari|Madō Monogatari]] games. The company has also provided [[Neo Geo|Neo Geo (console)]] and [[MSX|MSX]] titles to the [[Virtual Console|Virtual Console]] for the [[Wii|Wii]].
title: D4 Enterprise

abstract: Commit Media is a socially entrepreneurial company that utilizes entertainment to advance the missions of non-profits and philanthropic organizations. The company also works with celebrities and public figures who have an authentic connection with a cause and want to achieve lasting impact. The CEO of Commit Media is [1], a long-time entertainment industry executive and two-time Grammy nominee.
title: Commit Media

abstract: YRF Television is a production company, based in [[Mumbai|Mumbai]], [[India|India]], and promoted by [[Aditya Chopra|Aditya Chopra]]. YRF Television has produced a small number of programmes. It is owned by [[Yash Raj Films|Yash Raj Films]] (YRF) It entered into an exclusive agreement with [[Sony Entertainment Television|Sony Entertainment Television (India)]] (now Multi Screen Media Private Limited), one of [[India|India]]’s leading television broadcaster, on October 6, 2009 to produce exclusive fiction and non-fiction content for the channel.
title: YRF Television

abstract: Nexus Audio Recording Studio is a [[recording studio|recording studio]] located in [[East Oakland, California|East Oakland, California]]. It was established in October 2004 by [[Chris Paxton|Chris Paxton]], who presently owns, manages, and is the head engineer. The seven-room facility offers tracking, mixing and mastering for all audio projects, including musical genres as diverse as [[reggae|reggae]] and [[rock|rock music]]. Nexus is frequently used by artists in the [[San Francisco Bay Area urban music scene|hyphy]], and recording acts have included [[Kreayshawn|Kreayshawn]], [[Mistah F.A.B|Mistah F.A.B]], [[Spice 1|Spice 1]], [[Turf Talk|Turf Talk]], [[Clyde Carson|Clyde Carson]] and [[Shock G|Shock G]].
title: Nexus Audio Recording Studio

abstract: Blokker Holding is a [[Dutch|Netherlands]] company that owns several chains of stores.Blokker Holding is active in twelve countries and in 2010 all the chains combined had 2825 stores. In 2015 the company had a [[revenue|revenue]] of 2.1 billion euro, of which 98 million euros from online retail. Most store chains have both stores they own and stores that are franchised to other investors.
title: Blokker Holding

abstract: After receiving his bachelor's degree from the [[University of Missouri|University of Missouri]] in 1954, Al McQuinn, the founder of Ag-Chem Equipment Co., served in the Army until 1957. Upon his departure from the armed forces, he went to work for Federal Chemical Company which sold row crop sprayers. These sprayers and others like it didn't do a very good job of applying product. The solubles in the product would often settle in the solution which led to inconsistent, watered-down applications and unhappy customers.
title: Ag-Chem Equipment

abstract: Film Farm India is a production house based in [[Mumbai|Mumbai]], [[India|India]]. It produces [[Indian soap opera|Indian soap operas]] for various channels like [[Colors|Colors TV]], [[Zee TV|Zee TV]].It is promoted and established by Pintoo Guha & Rupali Guha
title: Film Farm India

abstract: The Gage Roads Brewing Company (Gage Roads Brewing Co. Ltd) is an Australian craft brewery located just outside the city of [[Fremantle|Fremantle, Western Australia]] in [[Palmyra, Western Australia|Palmyra, Western Australia]]. It is one of Australia's largest independent [[breweries|breweries]]. In 2016, it's New World Pale Ale - Little Dove - was awarded the Trophy for Champion Australian Beer at the 2016 [[Australian International Beer Awards|Australian International Beer Awards]]. In 2015, it was runner-up Champion Large Brewery at the [[Australian International Beer Awards|Australian International Beer Awards]].
title: Gage Roads Brewing Company

abstract: Cipher Prime is a video game development studio based in [[Philadelphia|Philadelphia]]. The company was founded in 2008. Cipher Prime is best known for its titles [[Auditorium|Auditorium (video game)]] (2008), [[Fractal|Fractal (video game)]] (2010), and [[Splice|Splice (video game)]] (2012). They are currently working on a [[Kickstarter|Kickstarter]]-backed sequel to Auditorium titled Auditorium 2: Duet. Since 2012, Cipher Prime has been hosting their own monthly [[Game Jams|Game jam]] on Thursday nights in their Philadelphia offices. In 2013 they enlarged their office to create the [[Philly Game Forge|Philly Game Forge]], a coworking space for independent game developers. Several of their games have been featured in [[Humble Bundles|Humble bundle]], including [[Humble Bundles With Android 4 and 6|Humble bundle#Android-based bundles]].
title: Cipher Prime

abstract: Fidelio Telemetry is a [[computer software|computer software]] company, located in Italy, to develop [[telemetry|telemetry]] software for [[R/C Racing Car|radio-controlled car]]. Its products include "Fidelio Orchestra" and "Testbed". Fidelio Telemetry develops telemetry software for processing and plotting telemetry data for R/C Car vehicles and [[RC racing setup|Racing setup]].
title: Fidelio Telemetry

abstract: Gimlet Media is a digital media company and podcast network, focused on producing narrative [[podcast|podcasts]], headquartered in [[Brooklyn|Brooklyn]], [[New York|New York (state)]]. The company was founded by [[Alex Blumberg|Alex Blumberg]] and Matthew Lieber, who serve as the company's [[CEO|Chief executive officer]] and president respectively.
title: Gimlet Media

abstract: SummitMedia, LLC is an American radio broadcasting company based in Birmingham, Alabama. The company formed to purchase mid-market radio stations being divested by [[Cox Radio|Cox Radio]] in 2013.
title: SummitMedia

abstract: Rashmi Sharma Telefilms Limited is an Indian [[production company|production company]] based in [[Mumbai|Mumbai]]. They started to produce their first show, [[Raja Ki Aayegi Baraat|Raja Ki Aayegi Baraat]], in 2008.
title: Rashmi Sharma Telefilms Limited

abstract: Anarchy Championship Wrestling (ACW) is a [[professional wrestling|professional wrestling]] [[promotion|Professional wrestling promotion]] based out of [[Austin, Texas|Austin, Texas]], owned and operated by Darin Childs. They held their first official event on January 14, 2007 in [[San Antonio, Texas|San Antonio, Texas]]. The promotion has developed a reputation over the years for featuring [[hardcore wrestling|hardcore wrestling]] in [[music venue|music venues]] and festivals, as well as the pioneering women's division, the "[[Joshi|Joshi (wrestling)]] Division"
title: Anarchy Championship Wrestling

abstract: South Punjab Forest Company (SPFC) is a subsidiary of the [[Forestry, Wildlife & Fisheries Department|Forestry, Wildlife and Fisheries department, Punjab]], Government of the Punjab and operates on [[Public Private Partnership|Public–private partnership]] (PPP) mode. The company is created under the visionary leadership of [[Mian Muhammad Shahbaz Sharif|Mian Muhammad Shahbaz Sharif]], Chief Minister Punjab and spearheaded by Awais Ahmed Khan Leghari, Chairman, South Punjab Forest Company (SPFC). One of the main objectives of the organization is to streamline public and private sector investments in the forestry sector, so that [[deforestation|deforestation]] can be reduced in Punjab, and forest conservation and sustainable economic development go hand in hand. SPFC aims to encourage investments in the forestry sector which offers low risk with high return. The land will be awarded to successful bidders for 15 years and further extendable to another 15 years subjected to satisfactory performance of investors. The project will be floated in the market for solicitation of expression of interest from the potential investors in June 2017. The land slots will be awarded to the successful bidders based on evaluation by the end of August, 2017. The [[Monitoring and Evaluation|Monitoring and evaluation]] (M&E) of forest sites, awarded to successful bidders, will be done in collaboration with the Forestry, Wildlife & Fisheries Department, Government of the Punjab, as per the provisions of PPP Act, 2014, and The Punjab Forest (Amendment) Act, 2016. Revenue sharing will be done in this initiative. The Company in order to effectively reach out to the business community is organizing seminars in collaboration with various Chambers of Commerce & Industry to sensitize business groups to invest in the opportunity.
title: South Punjab Forest Company

abstract: Espresso House is the largest [[coffeehouse chain|List of coffeehouse chains]] in the [[Nordics|Nordic countries]]. Founded in [[Lund|Lund, Sweden]], [[Sweden|Sweden]] in 1996 by Elisabet and Charles Asker, it now has over 220 locations throughout Sweden, Norway, Finland and Denmark.
title: Espresso House

abstract: Birch Communications is an US provider of [[IP-based|Internet Protocol]] communications, network [[broadband|broadband]], [[cloud computing|Cloud (computing)]], and [[information technology|information technology]] services to small, mid-sized, enterprise and wholesale business customers in the United States, [[Canada|Canada]] and [[Puerto Rico|Puerto Rico]]. Founded in 1996 in the wake of the [[1996 Telecommunications Act|1996 Telecommunications Act]], several years later the company began acquiring other telecom companies in an effort to increase its network size and service offerings. Birch Communications raised $77.5 million in funding in 2011, and $110 million in funding in 2012 after it financed a new $90 million facility.
title: Birch Communications

abstract: Cinema Shares International Distribution was an American company that released localized English versions of films produced outside of the United States, often sanitizing their content to receive a [[G rating|Motion Picture Association of America film rating system]].
title: Cinema Shares

abstract: More Than Just Parks is an organization and film project with the goal of encouraging the exploration and conservation of [[national parks|national parks]] through short films. The project was founded by filmmakers and brothers [[Jim Pattiz|Jim Pattiz]] and Will Pattiz from [[Georgia|Georgia (U.S. state)]]. The brothers use a combination of [[time lapse photography|time lapse photography]] and video to create their films, which have received critical acclaim. The project has thus far resulted in short films on 10 national parks, with an aim of filming all 59 US national parks. The Pattiz brothers frequently appear on [[The Weather Channel|The Weather Channel]]'s morning programs [[Weekend Recharge|Weekend Recharge]] and [[AMHQ|AMHQ]] to share insight from different national parks.
title: More Than Just Parks

abstract: Team6 Game Studios B.V. is a [[Dutch|Netherlands]] privately owned [[video game developer|video game developer]] based in Assen. It was founded in 2001, but it initially developed several games under a different company name. In 2003 the founders decided to change it to the current title. The company currently employs approximately 40 individuals and is headed by director Ronnie Nelis.
title: Team6 Game Studios

abstract: Inspire Films Private Limited is a television content company under Beyond Dreams Entertainment Private Limited. The Television Company of Beyond Dreams Entertainment Private Limited, Inspire Films Private Limited has conceptualized and produced over many popular and critically acclaimed shows like [[Ek Veer Ki Ardaas...Veera|Ek Veer Ki Ardaas...Veera]] for [[Star Plus|Star Plus]], [[Sadda Haq|Sadda Haq (TV series)]] and Million Dollar Girl for [[Channel V India|Channel V India]], [[Rang Badalti Odhni|Rang Badalti Odhni]] for [[Star One|STAR One]], [[Main Naa Bhoolungi|Main Naa Bhoolungi]] for [[Sony TV|Sony Entertainment Television (India)]], [[Cambala Investigation Agency|Cambala Investigation Agency]] for [[Pogo TV|Pogo TV]], Jamunia for [[NDTV Imagine|NDTV Imagine]] and many more. Also, earlier, it had operated two television shows which are [[Kuch Rang Pyar Ke Aise Bhi|Kuch Rang Pyar Ke Aise Bhi]] for Sony TV and [[Jaana Na Dil Se Door|Jaana Na Dil Se Door]] for Star Plus and currently, it is operating thriller show "[[Ishq Mein Marjawan|Ishq Mein Marjawan]]" for Colors.
title: Inspire Films

abstract: The Seguso family has been dedicated to the art of [[Murano glass|Murano glass]] in Venice since May 3, 1397. Seguso is one of the most esteemed, historical and respected glass manufacturers on the island, and among the largest glass furnaces in [[Murano|Murano]], which has a few, homonymous furnaces. Glass made by the Seguso furnace can be found in over 75 museums worldwide, such as [[MOMA|MOMA]] in New York and the [[Victoria and Albert Museum|Victoria and Albert Museum]] in London. Today, Seguso is known for its high end [[Venetian glass|Venetian glass]] objects, lighting, accessories and custom installations. Seguso glass has been made for the Pope, Royalty and numerous luxury interiors throughout the world.
title: Seguso

abstract: BetBright is a digital entertainment and online sports betting company based in Dublin and operating in the [[UK|United Kingdom]] and [[Republic of Ireland|Republic of Ireland]].
title: BetBright

abstract: The Florida incorporated company began in 2016 Closshey and Culver co-produced the 2018 film No Postage Necessary. For the blockchain debut, the company partnered with [[decentralized application|decentralized application]] Vevue, a peer-to-peer incentivized video network built on the QTUM platform and utilizing [[smart contracts|smart contracts]]. The company also distributed the film in the United States, screening in select U.S. theaters July 6, 2018 and available digitally online July 10, 2018. In 2018, Two Roads Picture Co. launched a blockchain distribution division of the company headed by [[Jeremy Culver|Jeremy Culver]].
title: Two Roads Picture Co.

abstract: Marmon Motor Car Company was an American [[automobile|automobile]] manufacturer founded by [[Howard Carpenter Marmon|Howard Carpenter Marmon]] and owned by [[Nordyke Marmon & Company|Nordyke Marmon & Company]] of [[Indianapolis, Indiana|Indianapolis, Indiana]], US. It was established in 1851 and was merged and renamed in 1933. They produced cars under the Marmon brand. It was succeeded by [[Marmon-Herrington|Marmon-Herrington]] and later the [[Marmon Motor Company|Marmon Motor Company]] of [[Denton, Texas|Denton, Texas]]. The name currently survives through the [[Marmon Group|Marmon Group]] of [[Chicago, Illinois|Chicago, Illinois]].
title: Marmon Motor Car Company

abstract: Walter Lantz Productions was an American [[animation|animation]] studio. It was in operation from 1929 to 1983, and was the principal supplier of animation for [[Universal Studios|Universal Pictures]], now part of the media conglomerate [[NBCUniversal|NBCUniversal]], owned by [[Comcast|Comcast]]. Nowadays the company exists in name only as a subsidiary of [[Universal Animation Studios|Universal Animation Studios]], handling the rights to the studio's characters and films.
title: Walter Lantz Productions

abstract: Studebaker ( ) was an American [[automobile|automobile]] manufacturer based in [[South Bend, Indiana|South Bend, Indiana]]. Founded in 1852 and incorporated in 1868 as the Studebaker Brothers Manufacturing Company, the firm was originally a producer of wagons for farmers, miners, and the military.Studebaker entered the automotive business in 1902 with [[electric vehicle|electric vehicles]] and in 1904 with gasoline vehicles, all sold under the name "Studebaker Automobile Company". Until 1911, its automotive division operated in partnership with the [[Garford Company|Arthur Garford]] of [[Elyria, Ohio|Elyria, Ohio]], and after 1909 with the [[E-M-F Company|E-M-F Company]]. The first gasoline automobiles to be fully manufactured by Studebaker were marketed in August 1912. Over the next 50 years, the company established a reputation for good quality and reliability.
title: Studebaker

abstract: T-Mobile (stylised as ·T···Mobile·) is the brand name used by the mobile communications subsidiaries of the German telecommunications company [[Deutsche Telekom AG|Deutsche Telekom]]. The brand is active in [[Austria|Austria]] (under the subsidiary [[T-Mobile Austria|T-Mobile Austria]]), the [[Czech Republic|Czech Republic]] ([[T-Mobile Czech Republic|T-Mobile Czech Republic]]), the [[Netherlands|Netherlands]] ([[T-Mobile Netherlands|T-Mobile Netherlands]]), [[Poland|Poland]] ([[T-Mobile Polska|T-Mobile Polska]]), and the [[United States|United States]] ([[T-Mobile US|T-Mobile US]]). The name was previously used by subsidiaries in other countries, including [[Albania|Albania]] (now [[Telekom Albania|Telekom Albania]]), [[Croatia|Croatia]] (now [[Hrvatski Telekom|Hrvatski Telekom]]), [[Germany|Germany]] (now [[Deutsche Telekom|Deutsche Telekom]]), [[Hungary|Hungary]] (now [[Magyar Telekom|Magyar Telekom]]), [[Macedonia|Former Yugoslavian Republic of Macedonia]] (now [[Makedonski Telekom|Makedonski Telekom]]), [[Montenegro|Montenegro]] (now [[Crnogorski Telekom|Crnogorski Telekom]]), the [[United Kingdom|United Kingdom]] (now [[EE Limited|EE Limited]]), Romania (now [[Telekom Romania|Telekom Romania]]), and [[Slovakia|Slovakia]] (now [[Slovak Telekom|Slovak Telekom]]).
title: T-Mobile

abstract: Hispano-Suiza (English: Hispanic-Swiss) was a [[Spanish|Spain]] automotive/engineering company and, after World War II, a [[French|France]] aviation engine and components manufacturer. It is best known for its pre-World War II luxury cars and aviation engines. In 1923, its French subsidiary became a semi-autonomous partnership with the Spanish parent company. In 1946, the Spanish parent company sold all its Spanish automotive assets to [[Enasa|Enasa]]. In 1968, the French arm was taken over by the aerospace company [[Snecma|Snecma]], now a part of the French [[Safran Group|Safran]].
title: Hispano-Suiza

abstract: The National Association for the Education of Young Children (NAEYC) is a large [[nonprofit|nonprofit]] association in the [[United States|United States]] representing [[early childhood education|early childhood education]] teachers, para-educators, center directors, trainers, college educators, families of young children, policy makers, and advocates. NAEYC is focused on improving the well-being of young children, with particular emphasis on the quality of educational and developmental services for children from birth through age 8.
title: National Association for the Education of Young Children

abstract: The Ryan Aeronautical Company was founded by [[T. Claude Ryan|Tubal Claude Ryan]] in [[San Diego, California|San Diego, California]] in 1934. It became part of [[Teledyne|Teledyne]] in 1969, and of [[Northrop Grumman|Northrop Grumman]] when the latter company purchased Teledyne in 1999. Ryan built several historically and technically significant aircraft, including four innovative [[V/STOL|V/STOL]] designs, but its most successful production aircraft was the [[Ryan Firebee|Ryan Firebee]] line of unmanned drones used as [[target drone|target drones]] and [[unmanned air vehicle|unmanned air vehicles]].
title: Ryan Aeronautical

abstract: Schunck () is the name of former [[fashion house|fashion house]] and [[department store|department store]] Firma Schunck in [[Heerlen|Heerlen]], the [[Netherlands|Netherlands]]. It is also the name for the collection of buildings the firm has been housed in, one of which is known as the [[Glaspaleis|Glaspaleis]] (Glass Palace), which is now a cultural centre and declared one of the 1000 most important buildings of the 20th century by the Union of International Architects.
title: Schunck

abstract: Millstream Brewing Company was established in the fall of 1985 in The Amana Colonies by locals Carrol Zuber and brothers James and Dennis Roemig. Joseph Pickett designed the brewery and created the original recipes. Originally Millstream's only products consisted of the Millstream Lager and the Schild Brau Amber. In 2001 three employees formed a partnership and purchased the brewery. Since that time Millstream has continued to grow and expand their product line, now offering almost 15 different beers throughout the year and two types of [[Soda|Soft drink]].
title: Millstream Brewing

abstract: Penguin Software was a computer software and [[video game publisher|video game publisher]] from [[Geneva|Geneva, Illinois]], [[Illinois|Illinois]] that produced graphics and application software and games for the [[Apple II|Apple II]], [[Macintosh|Macintosh]], [[IBM|IBM]], [[Commodore 64|Commodore 64]], [[Amiga|Amiga]], [[Atari 8-bit|Atari 8-bit]], and [[Atari ST|Atari ST]] computers. They produced the graphics programs [[Graphics Magician|Graphics Magician]] and [[Complete Graphics System|Complete Graphics System]], graphic adventure games such as the [[Transylvania|Transylvania (computer game)]] series, arcade-style games like [[Spy's Demise|Spy's Demise]], and [[role-playing video game|role-playing video games]] such as [[Xyphus|Xyphus]].
title: Penguin Software

abstract: Also, cranes are developed and built in Lauf and then mounted on commercial truck frames. Tadano Faun GmbH organises the sales and services of the Tadano Group for Europe and other selected markets for the all-terrain cranes, exclusively produced by the holding company in Japan.
title: Tadano Faun GmbH

abstract: Canadian Vickers Limited was an aircraft and shipbuilding company that operated in [[Canada|Canada]] during the early part of the 20th century until 1944. A subsidiary of [[the UK parent|Vickers Limited]], it built its own aircraft designs as well as others under licence. [[Canadair|Canadair]] absorbed the Canadian Vickers Ltd. aircraft operations in November 1944.
title: Canadian Vickers

abstract: SD Entertainment is an American [[animation studio|animation studio]] specialising in direct-to-DVD and theatrical movies for children. The "SD" in the initials of the company name stand for Sabella Dern, the respective last names of its founders: former [[MGM Animation|Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer Animation]] employees [[Paul Sabella|Paul Sabella]] and [[Jonathan Dern|Jonathan Dern]].
title: SD Entertainment

abstract: The OCP Group (formerly the Office chérifien des phosphates), founded on August 7, 1920 in Morocco and transformed into a limited company (OCP SA) in 2008, is one of the leading exporters of phosphate rock, phosphoric acid and phosphate fertilizers in the world.
title: OCP Group

abstract: Russian River Brewing Company is a [[brewery|brewery]] and [[brewpub|brewpub]] in downtown [[Santa Rosa, California|Santa Rosa, California]]. The company makes strong [[India pale ale|India pale ales]] and [[sour beer|sour beers]].
title: Russian River Brewing Company

abstract: Korea Development Bank (kdb, [[Korean|Korean language]]: 한국산업은행, [[Hanja|Hanja]]: 韓國産業銀行) is a wholly state-owned policy [[bank|bank]] in South Korea. It was founded in 1954 in accordance with The Korea Development Bank Act to finance and manage major industrial projects to expedite industrial development and enhance the national economy. As Korea’s representative development financing bank, No. 1 arranger in Asia-Pacific project finance market and leader of domestic capital market, KDB has fostered the growth and heightened the competitiveness of strategic industries by meeting their changing financial needs. Following public policy, KDB facilitates the management normalization of troubled companies through corporate restructuring and consulting services, and provides capital for strategic regional development projects.
title: Korea Development Bank

abstract: Many of the world's top [[professional golfer|professional golfers]] have used Wilson equipment, including [[Gene Sarazen|Gene Sarazen]] (who had a 75-year relationship with the company, the longest-running contract in sports history). Other golfers who have used Wilson Staff equipment include [[Sam Snead|Sam Snead]], [[Walter Hagen|Walter Hagen]], [[Arnold Palmer|Arnold Palmer]], [[Patty Berg|Patty Berg]], [[Nick Faldo|Nick Faldo]], [[Payne Stewart|Payne Stewart]], [[John Daly|John Daly (golfer)]], [[Ben Crenshaw|Ben Crenshaw]], and [[Vijay Singh|Vijay Singh]]. Palmer and Crenshaw both used Wilson 8802 putters, with Crenshaw's receiving the moniker Little Ben due to his proficiency with it. Current Wilson Staff players include [[Open|The Open Championship]] and [[USPGA|PGA Championship]] champion [[Pádraig Harrington|Pádraig Harrington]] as well as [[Kevin Streelman|Kevin Streelman]].
title: Wilson Staff

abstract: The Mills Novelty Company, Incorporated of [[Chicago|Chicago]], [[Illinois|Illinois]] was once a leading manufacturer of coin-operated machines, including [[slot machine|slot machines]], [[vending machine|vending machines]], and [[jukebox|jukeboxes]], in the United States. Between about 1905 and 1930, the company's products included the Mills Violano-Virtuoso and its predecessors, celebrated machines that automatically played a [[violin|violin]] and, after about 1909, a [[piano|piano]]. By 1944 the name of the company had changed to Mills Industries, Incorporated. The slot machine division was then owned by Bell-O-Matic Corporation. By the late 1930s, vending machines were being installed by Mills Automatic Merchandising Corporation of [[New York|New York (state)]].
title: Mills Novelty Company

abstract: Salmson is a French engineering company. Initially a [[pump|pump]] manufacturer, it turned to automobile and aeroplane manufacturing in the 20th century, returning to pump manufacturing in the 1960s, and re-expanded to a number of products and services in the late 20th and into the 21st century. It is headquartered in [[Chatou|Chatou]] and has production facilities in [[Laval|Arrondissement of Laval]]. It has subsidiaries in Argentina, Italy, Lebanon, Portugal, South Africa and Vietnam.
title: Salmson

abstract: Coventry-Eagle was a British [[bicycle|bicycle]] and [[motorcycle|motorcycle]] manufacturer. Established as a [[Victorian|Victorian era]] bicycle maker, the company began under the name of Hotchkiss, Mayo & Meek. The company name was changed to Coventry Eagle in 1897 when John Meek left the company . By 1898 they had begun to experiment with motorised vehicles and by 1899, had produced their first motorcycle. The motorcycles were hand built from components and finished carefully, Coventry-Eagle motorcycles proved reliable and by the First World War the range included [[Villiers Engineering|Villiers Engineering]] and [[JAP|JA Prestwich Industries Ltd]] engines.During the early 1920s, the models changed depending on what engines were available and the company swapped between five engine manufacturers - [[Villiers|Villiers Engineering]], [[JAP|JA Prestwich Industries]], [[Sturmey-Archer|Sturmey-Archer]], [[Blackburne|Blackburne (motorcycles)]] and [[Matchless|Matchless]]. The model Flying 8 was probably the most iconic bike of its time and bore a resemblance to the contemporary Brough Superior. During the depression of the 1930s, the company concentrated on producing two-strokes. Production continued until the start of the Second World War in 1939.
title: Coventry-Eagle

abstract: West Berkshire Brewery is a [[microbrewery|microbrewery]] in [[Yattendon|Yattendon]], [[Berkshire|Berkshire]], England, founded in 1995 by husband and wife Dave and Helen Maggs in a [[brickworks|brickworks]] shed in [[Frilsham|Frilsham]].
title: West Berkshire Brewery

abstract: Nova Scotia Light and Power Company, Limited (NSLP) was an electric and gas utility company with its head office in [[Halifax|Halifax, Nova Scotia]], [[Canada|Canada]]. The company still exists as a [[shell|Shell corporation]] but is no longer active; however, for more than a century, it was the major producer of energy in the province of [[Nova Scotia|Nova Scotia]], and its largest public transit operator.
title: Nova Scotia Light and Power

abstract: Capco, first known as The Capital Markets Company N.V., is a global business and technology [[consultancy|consultancy]] with 28 offices across four continents: Europe, North America, South America and Asia. Founded in 1998, Capco focuses on financial services, including banking and payments, capital markets, and wealth and asset management. It also has a dedicated energy division in the US.
title: Capco

abstract: CSL Behring operates the plasma collection network, CSL Plasma.
title: CSL Behring

abstract: EnerNOC, an Enel Group Company, is the largest provider of [[demand response|demand response]] worldwide, serving a capacity of 6GW across 8,000 customers worldwide, and a leading provider of energy management advisory and technology services and solutions for commercial, institutional, and industrial customers, as well as electric power grid operators and utilities. In addition to demand response, EnerNOC's solutions offerings include energy procurement advisory services, [[utility bill management|Utility bill management software]] solutions, [[demand-side management|Demand side management]] solutions, [[energy management software|energy management software]] and services, and intelligent [[energy storage|energy storage]] and [[microgrid|microgrid]] solutions. In August 2017, EnerNOC was acquired by the [[Enel Group|Enel]].
title: EnerNOC

abstract: Marshall Brewing Company is a [[brewery|brewery]] in [[Tulsa, Oklahoma|Tulsa, Oklahoma]], USA. It opened in 2008 in a facility outside downtown Tulsa, Oklahoma. It is the first commercial brewing facility in Tulsa since [[World War II|World War II]]. The brewery produced about in 2009 and in 2010. Currently, Marshall Brewing offers several year-round core beers, including Atlas IPA, Sundown Wheat, This Land Lager, Dunkel, Volks Pilsner, and This Machine Belgian-Style IPA. Outside of their core brands, Marshall Brewing offers over 30+ Seasonal beers throughout the year, including some only available at their Tulsa Tap Room, located at 1742 E 6th Street.
title: Marshall Brewing Company

abstract: Actions Semiconductor Co. Ltd. () is a Chinese [[fabless|Fabless manufacturing]] [[semiconductor|semiconductor industry]] company founded in 2000 and headquartered in [[Zhuhai|Zhuhai]], [[Guangdong|Guangdong]] province. The company has an about 600 employees and designs [[SoCs|System on a chip]] for [[tablets|Tablet Computer]], [[digital audio players|digital audio players]], photo viewers and related products.
title: Actions Semiconductor

abstract: Red Granite Pictures is an American film production and distribution company, co-founded by [[Riza Aziz|Riza Aziz]] and [[Joey McFarland|Joey McFarland]] in 2010.
title: Red Granite Pictures

abstract: Don't Flop Entertainment is the largest [[rap battle|Battle rap]] league based in the [[United Kingdom|United Kingdom]]. It was founded by longtime friends Eurgh (Rowan Faife) and Cruger (Freddie Scott-Miller) in 2008. Since then, notable performers include Oshea, Sensa, [[Lunar C|Lunar C]], Rizzle (of [[Rizzle Kicks|Rizzle Kicks]]), Tony D (of Poisonous Poets), Blizzard, doferefnetion, Mercury Music Prize nominee [[Soweto Kinch|Soweto Kinch]], [[Mark Grist|Mark Grist]] and Afghan Dan. Several rappers from Don't Flop have also made appearances in the Canadian rap battle league [[King of the Dot|King of the Dot]], as well as youth and music broadcaster [[SB.TV|SB.TV]]. American rappers [[Illmaculate|Illmaculate]] and [[Soul Khan|Soul Khan]] have also made appearances on Don't Flop, both as rappers and judges. Don't Flop events feature all elements of hip hop culture, including cappella emcee battles, freestyle battles (sometimes over beats), grime clashes, DJ sets, live performances by hip-hop/rap artists and more recently at the 'BLAM' events there has been live art and breakdancing.
title: Don't Flop

abstract: CS Communication & Systèmes is a French information-technology service company listed on the [[Paris Bourse|Paris Bourse]] as a member of the [[CAC Small|CAC Small]] index. The company designs information systems, develops and integrates software; manages projects and deploys industrial applications and provides science, technology and consulting services. CS is the French leader in [[air traffic control|air traffic control]], the third biggest supplier of traffic-management systems in the world and provides [[information technology consulting|information technology consulting]] services.
title: CS Communication & Systèmes

abstract: GoldFire Studios is a video game development company based out of [[Oklahoma City|Oklahoma City]], [[Oklahoma|Oklahoma]]. The company was established in June, 2008 by James Simpson. GoldFire Studios specializes in the development of multiplayer, browser-based games using [[HTML5|HTML5]] technologies.
title: GoldFire Studios

abstract: Wasabi Anime was started by Tom Croom with a group of motivated anime fans shortly after the completion of [[Anime Festival Orlando II|Anime Festival Orlando]] in Kissimmee, Florida. The group felt that dedicating help to one single convention and club didn't serve the purpose of helping all of fandom, so Wasabi Anime (then called "Wasabi Anime of Florida") began networking pre-existing anime clubs and helping support new anime clubs. Wasabi Anime club members had access to photo I.D. cards that granted discounts a local anime and comic stores in Florida. Clubs in the Wasabi Anime network included:
title: Wasabi Anime

abstract: NeocoreGames is a [[Hungarian|Hungary]] [[video game developer|video game developer]] that focuses on creating and publishing [[role-playing video game|role-playing video games]]. The company has their own development studio that is headquartered in [[Budapest|Budapest]], and the video games developed at NeocoreGames are created using their custom-built [[game engine|game engine]] named Coretech. The company is best known for their [[King Arthur: The Role-playing Wargame|King Arthur: The Role-playing Wargame]] series.
title: NeocoreGames

abstract: The Harrington Project was launched as an effort to bridge varying aspects of the drug development sphere. In response to recent decline in the number of traditional, early-stage [[biotechnology|biotechnology]] [[venture capital|venture capital]] firms, BioMotiv utilizes an asset-centric model to in-license, fund, and manage technologies in-house. Its goal is to address the "valley of death" between research, discovery, and early clinical-stage [[drug development|drug development]]. Projects are advanced by the management team through clinical [[proof-of-concept|Proof of concept]] and then out-licensed via strategic alliances with [[pharmaceutical companies|pharmaceutical companies]].
title: BioMotiv

abstract: Mukta A2 Cinemas is one of the Cinema chains in [[India|India]]; started by [[Mukta Arts Ltd|Mukta Arts Ltd]]. The company began its commercial operations in July 2011 with the launch in [[Vadodara|Vadodara]] city, [[Gujarat|Gujarat]], India. [[Subhash Ghai|Subhash Ghai]] (Founder, Mukta Arts Ltd.) started this cinema chain to connect better with the audience.
title: Mukta A2 Cinemas

abstract: Neela Tele Films Private Limited is a production house based in Mumbai, India. It produces fiction and non-fiction shows for various television channels.
title: Neela Tele Films

abstract: Embassy TechVillage is located in Bellandur on [[Outer Ring Road|Outer Ring Road, Bangalore]] and close to the residential suburbs in Bangalore like Whitefield and Sarjapur. It was developed by Assetz Property Group in 2010. In 2013, Blackstone have taken possession of the 104-acre Vrindavan Tech Village after signing a Rs 1,951 crore deal earlier this year.
title: Embassy TechVillage

abstract: Liberty General Insurance started its operations in the year 2013, offering a range of insurance solutions for retail, commercial and industrial insurance needs.
title: Liberty General Insurance

abstract: Youda Games is a [[Dutch|Netherlands]] development studio and publisher focused on creating [[strategy games|Strategy video game]] that was founded in 2006. The company's first releases were the computer games "Final Fortress” and "Rail of War". Eventually the studio found major success with their first award winning hits, "Governor of Poker" and “Governor of Poker 2”, available on PC, Mac, iOS, Android and Facebook. Youda Games Studio develops casual experience games for a broad, international audience and publishes game titles on its portal www.youdagames.com as well as leading 3rd party games. Today it continues to grow and offer games available on a wide variety of platforms.
title: Youda Games

abstract: Bridge County is called "Mini-America" by locals, a name that caught on after an effective advertising by Bridge County's marketing team.
title: Bridge County

abstract: Jamii Bora Bank (JBB), is a [[commercial bank|commercial bank]] in Kenya. It is one of the commercial banks licensed by the [[Central Bank of Kenya|Central Bank of Kenya]], the national banking regulator.
title: Jamii Bora Bank

abstract: Scott Free Productions has offices in London and Los Angeles. It works with Ridley Scott's larger company RSA Films by assisting directors in film and television.
title: Scott Free Productions

abstract: The statutory and fiduciary mandate of the State Board of Administration of Florida (SBA) is to invest, manage and safeguard assets of the Florida Retirement System (FRS) Trust Fund as well as the assets of a variety of other funds. The SBA managed 25 different investment funds and trust clients.
title: State Board of Administration of Florida

abstract: The Shelikhov-Golikov Company (SGC) was a Russian [[fur trading|fur trade]] venture, founded by [[Irkutsk|Irkutsk]] entrepreneurs [[Grigory Shelikhov|Grigory Shelikhov]] and [[Ivan Larionovich Golikov|Ivan Larionovich Golikov]] in 1783. Formed in [[Eastern Siberia|Eastern Siberia]] during the 1780s along with several competing companies, the SGC had operations in [[Kurile Islands|Kurile Islands]] and areas that later became [[Russian America|Russian America]]. Russian ventures had been focused on maritime operations under [[promyshlenniki|promyshlenniki]], though costs had continued to rise as more distant [[sea otter|sea otter]] populations had to be exploited. Centered on the [[Kodiak|Kodiak Island]] and several [[Aleutian|Aleutian Islands]] Islands, the majority of the company's indentured laborer was recruited among the [[Aleut|Aleut people]] and [[Alutiiq|Alutiiq people]] nations. A common practice amongst Russian companies was to take hostages from various villages, to force maritime hunters to gather otter furs. Shelikhov led aggressions on Kodiak Island against the indigenous Alutiiqs in 1784, known as the [[Awa'uq Massacre|Awa'uq Massacre]], where Russian employees killed over 2,000 people according to some estimates. In consequence of the massacre, the Island became fully controlled by the company.
title: Shelikhov-Golikov Company

abstract: Prophete GmbH u. Co. KG is a German manufacturer for bicycles, e-bikes, scooters, and supply parts that traditionally trade under the Prophete brand name.
title: Prophete

abstract: Active Gaming Media Inc. (AGM) is a localization company based in Osaka, Japan. Founded in 2008 by CEO Ibai Ameztoy, the company's main focus lies in providing [[localization|Game localization]] services for video games. AGM has since branched out to provide services such as game [[debugging|debugging]], marketing, promotion, voice acting, and publishing for games and [[anime|anime]].
title: Active Gaming Media

abstract: Ybrant Digital is a digital marketing company founded in 2000 and headquartered in India with offices in US, Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Uruguay, Mexico, UK, France, Germany, Sweden, Ukraine, Serbia, Israel, China, India, and Australia, and with representatives or partners in Poland, and Italy.
title: Ybrant Digital

abstract: Base FX specializes in high-end creature and character animation, fluid and dynamic effects, and photo-real 3D matte painting and set extensions, providing services to Hollywood film companies, producers and top directors in China.
title: Base FX

abstract: 4 Lions Films is a production house based in [[Mumbai|Mumbai]], [[India|India]]. Founded in 2008, its primary focus is youth-oriented and general entertainment shows.
title: 4 Lions Films

abstract: Soundrya Production is Production Company in India which is founded by [[Vinod Bachchan|Vinod Bachchan]] and the company has debut in 2011, movie [[Tanu Weds Manu|Tanu Weds Manu]].

abstract: DJ's Creative Unit is an Indian TV shows production company founded by Deeya Singh and Tony Singh. Its productions [[Left Right Left|Left Right Left (TV series)]],[[Choti Bahu|Choti Bahu]], [[Banegi Apni Baat|Banegi Apni Baat]], [[Just Mohabbat|Just Mohabbat]], [[Kaala Teeka|Kaala Teeka]] and [[Jassi Jaissi Koi Nahin|Jassi Jaissi Koi Nahin]] have been popular.
title: DJ's Creative Unit

abstract: Hats Off Productions is an Indian television production house based in [[Mumbai|Mumbai]]. It started to develop and grow from its theatre projects. It is promoted by [[Jamnadas Majethia|Jamnadas Majethia]] and [[Aatish Kapadia|Aatish Kapadia]]. In 2013, the company ventured into training and development business by launching their acting academy, HatsOff Actors Studio.

abstract: Academy Films is a British film production company, creating commercials, music videos, short films, digital content, art installations and feature films. The company's head office is in London, UK.
title: Academy Films

abstract: Doosan Lentjes' main headquarters are in [[Ratingen|Ratingen]], [[Germany|Germany]].
title: Doosan Lentjes

abstract: Bank First, formerly known as Victoria Teachers Mutual Bank, is one of Australia’s financial institutions, with more than 100,000 customers, over $2 billion in assets and the only financial institution in Victoria focusing on the Education Community.
title: Bank First

abstract: Motto Pictures was founded in 2009 by [[Julie Goldman (producer)|Julie Goldman (producer)]], an Emmy Award-winning producer of documentary feature films.
title: Motto Pictures

abstract: Foxit Software, Inc. develops [[Portable Document Format|Portable Document Format]] (PDF) software and tools used to create, edit, sign, and secure files and digital documents. It is a multinational software technology corporation headquartered in Fremont, California, with offices in Berlin, Beijing, Fuzhou, South Yarra, Australia and other locations. There are about 425 million Foxit users, with sales to more than 100,000 customers in 200 countries around the world.
title: Foxit Software

abstract: Umidigi (formerly known as UMI) is a Chinese Mobile Phone firm based in [[Shenzhen City|Shenzhen]][[.|Shenzhen]] Umidigi mainly designs [[smartphone|smartphones]]. It was registered in Feb 2012 and their first phone was launched in July of that year, which was known as the Umi X1.
title: Umidigi

abstract: Luvanis S.A. is a [[private investment company|Investment company]] headquartered in [[Luxembourg|Luxembourg]] and specialized in the incubation and revival of long dormant luxury brands, also coined as “sleeping beauties”.
title: Luvanis

abstract: Champs Boxing was a series of boxing matches that took place in [[Fort Worth, Texas|Fort Worth, Texas]] during 2002 and 2003. The boxing events were created to supplement [[Telefutua|UniMás]]’s programming when the network moved to a 24-hour schedule. The boxing matches took place on Saturday night, and aired later in the week to round out [[TeleFutura|UniMás]]’s growing need for programming content. TeleFutura had large Friday Night boxing programming, but the demand was to add several smaller events throughout the week.
title: Champs Boxing

abstract: Riverbank Studios is an independent [[film production|film production]] company based in India and founded by the filmmaker and conservationist, [[Mike Pandey|Mike Pandey]].
title: Riverbank Studios

abstract: Cyclops Gear was founded by Mark Krause and Allan Lord Mounir both action sport enthusiasts who sought a better way to capture life's adventures. The result was a wearable camera as well as camera-embedded sunglasses and goggles which allow for hand free recording without the bulky equipment. With the success of the wearable technology market Cyclops Gear was able to form partnerships with industry leaders including [[Bombardier Recreational Products|Bombardier Recreational Products]] allowing them to sponsor athletes and major racing events.
title: Cyclops Gear

abstract: Founded in 1935 by August Hormann, the Hormann Group has produced and delivered 15 million doors worldwide. The original name of the company was Bielefelder Stahltore.
title: Hormann Group

abstract: Scripbox.com India Private Limited is an Indian financial company that provides mutual funds investments via its online platform scripbox.com. Scripbox was founded in Bengaluru in 2012 and is considered to be one of India’s fastest growing asset management groups with 850 crores in assets under management (AUM).
title: Scripbox

abstract: Faceit is a production company and an independent platform for [[professional competitions|eSports]] within online [[multiplayer video game|multiplayer video games]], which was founded in [[London|London]] in 2012. They have been administrating e-sports leagues on games such as [[Counter-Strike: Global Offensive|Counter-Strike: Global Offensive]], [[League of Legends|League of Legends]], [[Rocket League|Rocket League]], and [[Dota 2|Dota 2]].
title: Faceit

abstract: As of 2009, the Franchise Pictures library, along with that of [[ThinkFilm|ThinkFilm]], is now owned by Orange Holdings LLC. The Franchise Library is currently distributed worldwide by [[Revolution Studios|Revolution Studios]] through Park Circus.
title: Franchise Pictures

abstract: Fábrica Nacional de Motores (FNM) was a Brazilian manufacturer of engines and motor vehicles based in the Xerém district of [[Duque de Caxias|Duque de Caxias, Rio de Janeiro]] near [[Rio de Janeiro|Rio de Janeiro]] that operated between 1942 and 1988.
title: Fábrica Nacional de Motores

abstract: RadioShack, formerly RadioShack Corporation, is the [[trade name|trade name]] of an American [[retailer|retailer]] founded in 1921. Since 2017, [[General Wireless Operations, Inc.|Standard General]] has leased the name from Kensington Capital Holdings and operates primarily as an [[e-commerce|e-commerce]] website, a network of approximately 425 independently owned authorized dealer stores, and as a supplier of parts for [[HobbyTown|HobbyTown]]. All stores are located in the United States.
title: RadioShack

abstract: Nexus Studios is an animation, film and interactive studio based in London and LA. It was founded in 2000 by [[Charlotte Bavasso|imdbname:1773698]] and [[Christopher O'Reilly.|imdbname:1929039]]
title: Nexus Studios

abstract: Founded in 1961 by three friends (painter Desmond Knox-Leet, set designer Yves Coueslant, and Christiane Gautrot, who was working in an architecture firm), Diptyque originally produced printed [[fabric|fabrics]], but in 1963 they introduced a line of scented [[candle|candles]] which eventually became the focus of their business. There are now over fifty scented candles in the product line.
title: Diptyque

abstract: Cymer is currently developing next-generation laser-produced plasma [[extreme ultraviolet|extreme ultraviolet]] (EUV) light sources.
title: Cymer

abstract: The company was founded by [[James Addison Jones|James Addison Jones]] in the 1890s. One of Jones' early landmark projects was the twelve story [[Independence Building|Independence Building (Charlotte)]], Charlotte's first "skyscraper" and the soon to be first office of J.A. Jones Construction.
title: J.A. Jones Construction

abstract: Cirkle is a [[public relations|public relations]] agency that specialises in Food & Drink PR, Lifestyle PR and Beauty PR. It was founded in 1998 and is a member of the [[PRCA|Public Relations Consultants Association]]. Staff are also members of the [[CIPR|CIPR]].
title: Cirkle

abstract: Atomics International was a division of the [[North American Aviation|North American Aviation]] [[company|company]] (later acquired by the [[Rockwell International|Rockwell International]] company) which engaged principally in the early development of [[nuclear technology|nuclear technology]] and [[nuclear reactors|Nuclear reactor technology]] for both commercial and government applications. Atomics International was responsible for a number of accomplishments relating to [[nuclear energy|Nuclear power]]: design, construction and operation of the first nuclear reactor in California (1952), the first nuclear reactor to produce power for a commercial power grid in the United States (1957) and the first nuclear reactor launched into outer space by the United States (1965).Atomics International undertook the development of nuclear reactors soon after being established: a series of commercial nuclear power reactors beginning with the [[Sodium Reactor Experiment|Sodium Reactor Experiment]] (SRE) and a range of compact nuclear reactors culminating with the Systems for Auxiliary Nuclear Power [[SNAP-10A|SNAP-10A]] system. Both efforts were successful, despite [[nuclear accident|nuclear accidents]] at the [[Santa Susana Field Laboratory|Santa Susana Field Laboratory]], but overall interest in nuclear power steadily declined. The division transitioned to non-nuclear energy-related projects such as coal gasification and gradually ceased designing and testing nuclear reactors. Atomics International was eventually merged with another division of the same parent company. As of 2010, All of the Atomics International facilities, except for the few remaining facilities located in the Area IV test area at the Santa Susana Field Laboratory (SSFL), have been demolished, cleaned and reused, or awaiting final cleanup.
title: Atomics International

abstract: Lycamobile is a [[mobile virtual network operator|mobile virtual network operator]] (MVNO) operating in 22 countries.
