The brand is active in [[Austria|Austria]], [[Australia|Australia]], [[Belgium|Belgium]], [[Denmark|Denmark]], [[France|France]], [[Germany|Germany]], [[Ireland|Republic of Ireland]], [[Italy|Italy]], [[Republic of Macedonia|Republic of Macedonia]], [[Netherlands|Netherlands]], [[Norway|Norway]], [[Poland|Poland]], [[Portugal|Portugal]], [[Romania|Romania]], [[South Africa|South Africa]], [[Spain|Spain]], [[Sweden|Sweden]], [[Switzerland|Switzerland]], [[Tunisia|Tunisia]], [[Ukraine|Ukraine]], [[United Kingdom|United Kingdom]] and the [[USA|United States]]. The bulk of Lycamobile revenue is claimed to be generated from its SIM products. Lycatel, also a part of Lyca Group, targets customers within expatriate and ethnic markets that want to make international calls.
title: Lycamobile

abstract: Rankin/Bass Productions, Inc. (founded as Videocraft International, Ltd. and later known as Rankin/Bass Animated Entertainment) was an American [[production company|production company]], known for its [[seasonal|seasonal]] [[television special|television specials]], particularly its work in [[stop motion|stop motion]] animation. Rankin/Bass stop-motion features are recognizable by their visual style of doll-like characters with spheroid body parts, and ubiquitous powdery snow using an animation technique called "Animagic". Often, traditional [[cel animation|cel animation]] scenes of falling snow would be projected over the action to create the effect of a snowfall.
title: Rankin/Bass Productions

abstract: Aer Arann (styled as Aer Arann Regional) was a [[regional airline|regional airline]] based in [[Dublin|Dublin]], Ireland. The airline operated scheduled services on behalf of [[Aer Lingus Regional|Aer Lingus Regional]]. The airline had three bases in [[Cork|Cork Airport]], [[Dublin|Dublin Airport]] and [[Shannon|Shannon Airport]] which operated under the Aer Lingus Regional brand.On 19 March 2014, Aer Arann announced that it would be changing its corporate name to [[Stobart Air|Stobart Air]] by the end of 2014.
title: Aer Arann

abstract: The Aquila Italiana founded as the "Società Anonima Aquila" and quickly renamed as "Società Anonima Italiana Aquila" was an [[Italian|Italy]] [[automobile|automobile]] manufacturer from 1906 to 1917. The company was named again in 1909 after it was bought by bank as "Aquila Anonima Italiana di L. Marsaglia", the Marsaglia part came from the name of bank owner's son Vincenzo Marsaglia, talented automobile driver.Designed by [[Giulio Cesare Cappa|Giulio Cesare Cappa]], the cars were big [[four-|four-cylinder]] and [[six-cylinder|straight-6]] models with [[ioe|ioe]] engines of an advanced type. There was an interruption in construction after 1908, but the company introduced new models in 1911; these featured 4192 cc six-cylinder engines and proved to be successful in many races. Among Aquila Italiana drivers were [[Meo Constantini|Meo Constantini]] (later to join [[Bugatti|Bugatti]] at [[Molsheim|Molsheim]], where he became first a racing driver and later the [[Chef d'Equipe|Chef d'Equipe]]) and [[Carlo Masetti|Carlo Masetti]] (count [[Giulio Masetti|Giulio Masetti]]'s elder brother).
title: Aquila Italiana

abstract: The Poker Hall of Fame is the [[hall of fame|hall of fame]] of professional [[poker|poker]] in the [[United States|United States]]. Founded in [[Las Vegas|Las Vegas Valley]], it was created in 1979 by [[Benny Binion|Benny Binion]], the owner of the [[Horseshoe Casino|Horseshoe Casino]], to preserve the names and legacies of the world's greatest poker players and to serve as a tourist attraction to his casino. Binion was known for the creative ways in which he marketed his casino. In 1949, he convinced [[Johnny Moss|Johnny Moss]] and [[Nick "The Greek" Dandolos|Nick Dandolos]] to play high-stakes poker [[heads up|heads-up]] where the public could watch them. In 1970, he invited a group of poker players to compete in what would be the first [[World Series of Poker|World Series of Poker]] (WSOP). When Harrah's Entertainment, now known as [[Caesars Entertainment|Caesars Entertainment Corporation]], acquired the rights to the WSOP in 2004, it also assumed ownership of the Poker Hall of Fame. Currently, membership in the Poker Hall of Fame is handled directly by the WSOP.
title: Poker Hall of Fame

abstract: Preceding the Asüna marque, Passport sold a Korean ([[Daewoo|GM Daewoo]]) made [[badge engineered|badge engineered]] [[Opel Kadett|Opel Kadett]] E known as the [[Passport Optima|Passport Optima]] (which hit Canadian shores in 1991) as well as a selection of [[Isuzu|Isuzu]] cars and [[SUVs|SUVs]]. [[General Motors Canada|General Motors Canada]] changed its branding strategy in 1988, disbanding Passport (the Optima was rebadged for 1992 as [[Pontiac LeMans|Pontiac LeMans]]). Isuzu was grouped together with [[Saab|Saab Automobile]] and GM's new, import-fighting [[Saturn|Saturn Corporation]] division to form Saturn-Saab-Isuzu dealerships. The Geo marque was introduced in Canada in (model year) 1992, offered at [[Chevrolet|Chevrolet]]-[[Oldsmobile|Oldsmobile]]-[[Cadillac|Cadillac]] dealers (who had been selling the Geo (rebadged Suzuki) marque's products as Chevrolets from 1987 until the marque's introduction). Sales of Geo vehicles were relatively successful, prompting [[Pontiac|Pontiac]]-[[Buick|Buick]]-[[GMC|GMC (General Motors division)]] dealers to request GM Canada to provide a lineup of similar "import" vehicles. Asüna was created to fulfill this demand. Geo has been terminated for 1998 so the Chevrolet Tracker name was back (as in 89-91) until 2004. Small Metro and Firefly until year 2000.
title: Asüna

abstract: Sodexo Justice Services (formerly United Kingdom Detention Services and Kalyx), a subsidiary of [[Sodexo|Sodexo]], is a company that provides custodial and post-release facilities for the [[United Kingdom|United Kingdom]] [[Home Office|Home Office]]. The company changed its name to Sodexo Justice Services in 2011.
title: Sodexo Justice Services

abstract: Digital Pictures was an [[American|United States]] [[video game|video game]] developer founded in 1991 by Lode Coen, Mark Klein, Ken Melville, Anne Flaut-Reed, Kevin Welsh and [[Tom Zito|Tom Zito]].
title: Digital Pictures

abstract: The ONA Group (Omnium Nord-Africain, Arabic: مجموعة أونا) was established in 1934 and dissolved in 2010 and succeeded by [[Societe Nationale d'Investissement|Societe Nationale d'Investissement]]. ONA was an industrial, financial and services conglomerate, focused on positions of leadership and value creation in business activities contributing to the growth and sustainable development of Morocco, the Maghreb Region and the African Continent. ONA Group was structured around several activities: Mining, [[Agribusiness|Agribusiness]], Distribution, Financial Services, Telecommunication, Renewable Energies, and Growth Drivers, etc.
title: ONA Group

abstract: ZCCM Investments Holdings is a successor company to Zambia Consolidated Copper Mines Limited (ZCCM Ltd), of [[Zambia|Zambia]].
title: ZCCM Investments Holdings

abstract: New Hudson Motorcycles was a British [[motorcycle|motorcycle]] manufacturer. Founded in 1903 by George Patterson in [[Birmingham|Birmingham]], their first motorcycle was produced in 1902 but was unsuccessful. The New Hudson range expanded between 1910 and 1915 using [[JAP|JA Prestwich Industries]] engines, then the factory joined the war effort until 1919. As well as side-valve and OHV single-cylinder engines of 350 to 600   cc, they also built a 211   cc two-stroke and a number of three-wheelers with MAG engines. In 1927 [[Bert le Vack|Bert le Vack]] broke the record at Brooklands on a 500   cc New Hudson.
title: New Hudson Motorcycles

abstract: Top Aces, is a [[Montreal|Montreal]], [[Quebec|Quebec]]-based defence contractor that offers contracted airborne training services to the [[Canadian Armed Forces|Canadian Armed Forces]] through the Contracted Airborne Training Services (CATS) program. Top Aces operates a fleet of modernized fighter aircraft to provide Red Air threat replication, [[Joint Terminal Attack Controller|Joint Terminal Attack Controller]] (JTAC) training, practice munitions drop, air-to-air gunnery training and naval target tow profiles for the Canadian and German militaries. It also provides [[electronic warfare|electronic warfare]] training and tactics development, and supports advanced radar trials in nationally controlled environments. All Electronic Warfare Officers and EW role equipment are provided by the 414 Electronic Warfare Squadron, Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF) as part of the CATS contract.
title: Top Aces

abstract: NUT Motorcycles was a British [[motorcycle|motorcycle]] manufacturer founded in [[Newcastle Upon Tyne|Newcastle Upon Tyne]] in 1912 by Hugh Mason and Jock Hall, who had previously been making motorcycles since 1906 under a badge based on Mason's initials, HM, and later under the name of Jesmond and Bercley. By 1913 their racing motorcycles were competing successfully in the [[Isle of Man TT|Isle of Man TT]] races and Hugh Mason's JAP engined NUT motorcycle won the 1913 Junior TT by just 46 seconds. Originally based on [[JAP|JA Prestwich Industries]] and [[Villiers|Villiers Engineering]] engines, NUT began to build their own [[V-twin|V-twin]] sports machines. Following further racing success Mason and Hall moved to larger premises but the company could not survive the First World War and was declared bankrupt. The business was bought by Robert Ellis who restarted in 1921 as Hugh Mason and Company, but it foundered in 1922. Between 1923 and 1933 they continued to make motorcycles under the NUT name but in 1933 the company closed for good.
title: NUT Motorcycles

abstract: Beardmore Precision Motorcycles was a [[British|United Kingdom]] [[motorcycle|motorcycle]] manufacturer. The original Precision company was set up by Frank E.Baker in [[Birmingham|Birmingham]], and quickly established a reputation for performance motorcycle engines, supplying [[Haden|Haden (motorcycle)]], and [[Sun Motorcycles|Sun (motorcycle)]].
title: Beardmore Precision Motorcycles

abstract: Zenith Motorcycles was a British [[motorcycle|motorcycle]] and automobile manufacturer established in [[Finsbury Park|Finsbury Park (area)]], London in 1903, by W.G. Bowers. Automobile manufacture only lasted from 1905–1906. The first Zenith motorcycle was the 'BiCar' of 1903, based on Tooley's Bi-Car design, which was purchased by Zenith for its own production. The BiCar was a unique design with [[hub-center steering|hub-center steering]] and a low-slung chassis with the engine (from [[Fafnir|Fafnir_(automobile)]] in [[Germany|Germany]]) centrally fixed.
title: Zenith Motorcycles

abstract: XPEC Entertainment is a Taiwanese [[video game developer|video game developer]] and [[publisher|video game publisher]] based in [[Taipei|Taipei]]. It was founded in 2000.
title: XPEC Entertainment

abstract: Toy Gun Films is a production company that is in the process of developing a diverse slate of art house films. The company believes that just like a [[toy gun|toy gun]] is a weapon of imagination, film is a weapon of imagination that has the power to transform hearts and minds. The company was founded by [[Brent Ryan Green|Brent Ryan Green]] and Jeff Goldberg in 2009.
title: Toy Gun Films

abstract: Rovio Animation's first film, The Angry Birds Movie, was an international co-production between the United States and Finland. to make this film, over 350 people were involved with the film, and grossed $352.3 million worldwide with its budget of $73 million.
title: Rovio Animation

abstract: Sensor Coating Systems (SCS) is an instrumentation company pioneering high definition thermal mapping. SCS' Thermal History Technology provides a unique luminescence based sensing technology which enables engineers to record past temperatures on a previously inaccessible components. The temperature measurement capability reaches from around 150°C to 1,400°C which makes the technology very useful for the evaluation and design of mission-critical components in harsh environments such as gas turbine blades or vanes . The company’s unique thermal history technology has received numerous awards since its development with application possibilities in the power generation, aerospace, automotive, oil & gas sectors, as well as opportunities for other relevant high temperature industrial applications.
title: Sensor Coating Systems

abstract: The locations operated by Beaches Resorts are:
title: Beaches Resorts

abstract: 606 Films is a motion picture production company founded by Oscar-winning actress [[Halle Berry|Halle Berry]], and inspired by the California Senate Bill that put limits on paparazzi and their photography of children of celebrities. The bill was signed into law by Gov. [[Jerry Brown|Jerry Brown]]. The production company was co-founded by Elaine Goldsmith Thomas who repped for [[Julia Roberts|Julia Roberts]] at [[ICM Partners|ICM Partners]] and later she went on to run [[Revolution Studios|Revolution Studios]] founded by [[Joe Roth|Joe Roth]]. The foundation of the company stems from Halle Berry's role in the [[CBS|CBS]] science-fiction drama [[Extant (TV series)|Extant (TV series)]] and the company will be housed on the production lot at CBS.
title: 606 Films

abstract: Sudha Productions (Marathi:सुधा प्रॉडक्शन) is a film production company started by [[Anuya Mhaiskar|Anuya Mhaiskar]] in 2008.
title: Sudha Productions

abstract: Iris AO, Inc. manufactures small-scale, microelectromechanical systems ([[MEMS|MEMS]])-based [[deformable mirror|deformable mirrors]] (DM) and adaptive optics systems that offer radical advantages in cost, size, durability, flexibility, and power consumption. Iris AO systems make [[adaptive optics|adaptive optics]] (AO) practical for a host of new applications, including [[astronomy|astronomy]], retinal and [[biomedical imaging|biomedical imaging]], beam shaping, portable laser communications, and horizontal-path imaging.
title: Iris AO, Inc.

abstract: By 1907 Bolckow, Vaughan was possibly the largest producer of [[pig iron|pig iron]] in the world. The firm failed to modernise at the start of the 20th century, and was closed in 1929.
title: Bolckow, Vaughan

abstract: The Archipel Brouweriji Compagnie (Archipelago Brewery Co.) was formed in [[Batavia|Batavia, Dutch East Indies]] (now known as Jakarta), by German brewer, [[Beck's|Beck's Brewery]]. It opened its brewery in Singapore in November 1933, produced Anchor Beer.
title: Archipelago Brewery

abstract: Starwood Capital Group is an [[investment firm|investment firm]] headquartered in [[Greenwich, Connecticut|Greenwich, Connecticut]] managed by [[Barry Sternlicht|Barry Sternlicht]]. It was co-founded by Barry Sternlicht and [[Robert Faith|Robert Faith]] in 1991. In 1993, Faith left Starwood to found [[Greystar Real Estate Partners.|Greystar Real Estate Partners]]
title: Starwood Capital Group

abstract: Freebird Games is a [[video game developer|video game developer]] from [[Canada|Canada]]. They have developed six games. [[To the Moon|To the Moon]] was nominated for Best Writing and Innovation Award for the Canadian Videogame Awards.
title: Freebird Games

abstract: Amkette is a computer hardware and electronics manufacturer headquartered in [[New Delhi|New Delhi]], [[India|India]]. In November 2014, the company launched a headphone with a sharing jack, Trubeats Tango, that allows listeners to connect additional listening devices to the headphone. The company's current flagship product is [[EvoTV|EvoTV]] (a smart device that integrates the Internet and web features into the TV). Other products include wireless products, personal technology and audio, peripherals and multimedia devices. The company has a pan-India distribution network and heavily invests in hardware and software R&D. Its manufacturing facility is in [[Udaipur|Udaipur]], [[Rajasthan|Rajasthan]] while the software team is based in [[Bangalore|Bangalore]], India.
title: Amkette

abstract: 21st Amendment Brewery is a [[brewery|brewery]] located in [[San Leandro|San Leandro]], [[California|California]]. Their original location is a brewpub and restaurant in the [[South Park|South Park, San Francisco]] neighborhood of [[San Francisco|San Francisco]], [[California|California]], two blocks from [[AT&T Park|AT&T Park]]. The brewery's name refers to the [[21st Amendment to the U.S. Constitution|Twenty-first Amendment to the United States Constitution]], which repealed [[Prohibition|Prohibition in the United States]].
title: 21st Amendment Brewery

abstract: Simian Squared Ltd, or Simian Squared (sometimes referred to as Simian 2) is a [[British video game developer|Video game developer]] based in [[London, England|London, England]]. The company was founded by brothers Robert Cummings and Giuseppe Landolina in 2011.
title: Simian Squared

abstract: The Experimental Cinema of the Philippines (ECP) was a [[government-owned corporation|government-owned corporation]] of the [[Republic of the Philippines|Republic of the Philippines]] created to promote the growth and development of the [[local film industry|Cinema of the Philippines]]. Created in 1982 after the first Manila International Film Festival through Executive Order 770, the ECP was primarily known as a production company. However, it was created among other things; to hold the Manila International Film Festival, to manage the [[Manila Film Center|Manila Film Center]], administer a film rating and classification system and to establish and operate the National Film Archive. It was also mandated to provide financial assistance to select motion pictures through a film fund.
title: Experimental Cinema of the Philippines

abstract: Life Length was founded on September 28, 2010 as a spin-off of the CNIO with the aim of commercializing Telomere Analysis Technology (TAT). The co-founders are Stephen J. Matlin, current CEO of Life Length, and Dr. Maria Blasco, Director of the CNIO.
title: Life Length

abstract: Oats Studios is an independent film studio started in 2017 by [[Oscar|Academy Awards]]-nominated South African filmmaker [[Neill Blomkamp|Neill Blomkamp]]. The studio was created with the goal of distributing experimental short films via [[YouTube|YouTube]] and [[Steam|Steam (software)]] in order to gauge the community for interest and feedback as to which of them are viable for expansion into feature films.
title: Oats Studios

abstract: Coffee Fellows is a German coffeeshop chain founded in 1999 in [[Munich|Munich]], Bavaria, Germany by Kathrin Tewes and co-managed by her and her husband, Olympic Gold medalist [[Stefan Tewes|Stefan Tewes]] who joined her in management in 2000. As of 2018, they have about 209 stores in Germany, most of them franchised. This makes it the one which has the most, before Starbucks who have 160 stores.
title: Coffee Fellows

abstract: Number 9 Films is a British [[independent film|independent film]] production company co-founded in 2002 by producers [[Elizabeth Karlsen|Elizabeth Karlsen]] and [[Stephen Woolley|Stephen Woolley]], after a long collaboration at both Palace Pictures and Scala Productions.
title: Number 9 Films

abstract: Team GrisGris (Japanese: チームグリグリ [[Hepburn|Hepburn romanization]]: Kōshiki Saito) is a Japanese video game developer and publisher company. The company is most famous for the [[Corpse Party|Corpse Party]] series.
title: Team GrisGris

abstract: Art of War Undisputed Arena Fighting Championship (Art of War) is a defunct U.S.-based Mixed martial arts (MMA) organization. The Art of War was headquartered in Dallas, Texas and was owned and operated by SUN Sports & Entertainment, Inc. It is not related to Chinese MMA promotion [[Art of War Fighting Championship|Art of War Fighting Championship]].
title: Art of War Undisputed Arena Fighting Championship

abstract: Moving Picture Company (MPC) is a global leader in [[visual effects|visual effects]] and production, headquartered in [[Soho|Soho]], London with global facilities located in [[Vancouver|Vancouver]], [[Los Angeles|Los Angeles]], [[New York City|New York City]], [[Montreal|Montreal]], [[Amsterdam|Amsterdam]], [[Bengaluru|Bengaluru]], [[Paris|Paris]], and [[Shanghai|Shanghai]].
title: Moving Picture Company

abstract: Blueprint Pictures is an independent production company founded in 2005 by producers [[Graham Broadbent|Graham Broadbent]] and [[Peter Czernin|Peter Czernin]].
title: Blueprint Pictures

abstract: Super Rare Games Limited is a [[video game|video game]] [[publisher|publisher]] and [[distributor|Distributor (business)]] based in [[London, England|London]]. The company releases limited print games for the [[Nintendo Switch|Nintendo Switch]] which are purchasable from their website. Super Rare Games was founded by, and is currently led by, George Perkins, Stuart Townsend, Verity Murphy and Lindsey Reed.
title: Super Rare Games

abstract: Chile (; ), officially the Republic of Chile (), is a [[South America|South American]] country occupying a long, narrow strip of land between the [[Andes|Andes]] to the east and the Pacific Ocean to the west. It borders [[Peru|Peru]] to the north, [[Bolivia|Bolivia]] to the northeast, [[Argentina|Argentina]] to the east, and the [[Drake Passage|Drake Passage]] in the far south. Chilean territory includes the Pacific islands of [[Juan Fernández|Juan Fernández Islands]], [[Salas y Gómez|Salas y Gómez]], [[Desventuradas|Desventuradas Islands]], and [[Easter Island|Easter Island]] in [[Oceania|Oceania]]. Chile also claims about of [[Antarctica|Antarctica]], although all claims are suspended under the [[Antarctic Treaty|Antarctic Treaty]].
title: Chile

abstract: Croatia (, ; , ), officially the Republic of Croatia (, ) is a country at the crossroads of [[Central|Central Europe]] and [[Southeast Europe|Southeast Europe]], on the [[Adriatic Sea|Adriatic Sea]]. It borders [[Slovenia|Slovenia]] to the northwest, [[Hungary|Hungary]] to the northeast, [[Serbia|Serbia]] to the east, [[Bosnia and Herzegovina|Bosnia and Herzegovina]] and [[Montenegro|Montenegro]] to the southeast, sharing a [[maritime border|maritime border]] with [[Italy|Italy]]. Its capital, [[Zagreb|Zagreb]], forms one of the country's [[primary subdivisions|administrative divisions of Croatia]], along with [[twenty counties|twenty counties]]. Croatia has an area of and a population of 4.28   million, most of whom are [[Roman Catholics|Roman Catholics]].
title: Croatia

abstract: Cyprus (; ; ), officially the Republic of Cyprus (; ), is an island country in the [[Eastern Mediterranean|Eastern Mediterranean]] and the third largest and third most populous island in the [[Mediterranean|Mediterranean Sea]], located south of [[Turkey|Turkey]], west of [[Syria|Syria]] and [[Lebanon|Lebanon]], northwest of [[Israel|Israel]], north of [[Egypt|Egypt]], and southeast of [[Greece|Greece]].
title: Cyprus

abstract: Finland ( ; ), officially the Republic of Finland (, ()) is a [[country|sovereign state]] in [[Northern Europe|Northern Europe]] bordering the [[Baltic Sea|Baltic Sea]], [[Gulf of Bothnia|Gulf of Bothnia]], and [[Gulf of Finland|Gulf of Finland]], between [[Norway|Norway]] to the north, [[Sweden|Sweden]] to the northwest, and [[Russia|Russian Federation]] to the east. Finland is a [[Nordic country|Nordic countries]] and is situated in the geographical region of [[Fennoscandia|Fennoscandia]]. The capital and largest city is [[Helsinki|Helsinki]]. Other major cities are [[Espoo|Espoo]], [[Vantaa|Vantaa]], [[Tampere|Tampere]], [[Oulu|Oulu]] and [[Turku|Turku]].
title: Finland

abstract: Fiji ( ; ; [[Fiji Hindi|Fiji Hindi]]: फ़िजी), officially the Republic of Fiji (; [[Fiji Hindi|Fiji Hindi]]: फ़िजी गणराज्य), is an [[island country|island country]] in [[Melanesia|Melanesia]], part of [[Oceania|Oceania]] in the [[South Pacific Ocean|Pacific Ocean]] about northeast of [[New Zealand|New Zealand]]'s [[North Island|North Island]]. Its closest neighbours are [[Vanuatu|Vanuatu]] to the west, [[New Caledonia|New Caledonia]] to the southwest, [[New Zealand|New Zealand]]'s [[Kermadec Islands|Kermadec Islands]] to the southeast, [[Tonga|Tonga]] to the east, the [[Samoas|Samoan Islands ]] and [[France|France]]'s [[Wallis and Futuna|Wallis and Futuna]] to the northeast, and [[Tuvalu|Tuvalu]] to the north. Fiji consists of an [[archipelago|archipelago]] of more than 330 islands—of which 110 are permanently inhabited—and more than 500 [[islet|islets]], amounting to a total land area of about . The most outlying island is [[Ono-i-Lau|Ono-i-Lau]]. The two major islands, [[Viti Levu|Viti Levu]] and [[Vanua Levu|Vanua Levu]], account for 87% of the total population of . The capital, [[Suva|Suva]] on Viti Levu, serves as Fiji's principal cruise -port. About three-quarters of Fijians live on Viti Levu's [[coast|coasts]], either in Suva or in smaller urban centres like [[Nadi|Nadi]] (with tourism as the major local industry) or [[Lautoka|Lautoka]] ([[sugar-cane industry|Sugar cultivation]]). Viti Levu's interior is sparsely inhabited due to its terrain.
title: Fiji

abstract: The French Southern and Antarctic Lands (, TAAF) is an [[overseas territory|Overseas territory (France)]] ( or ) of [[France|France]]. It consists of:
title: French Southern and Antarctic Lands

abstract: Barbados ( or ) is an [[island country|island country]] in the [[Lesser Antilles|Lesser Antilles]] of the West Indies, in the [[Caribbean|Caribbean]] region of [[North America|North America]]. It is in length and up to in width, covering an area of . It is situated in the western area of the North Atlantic and east of the [[Windward Islands|Windward Islands]] and the [[Caribbean Sea|Caribbean Sea]]; therein, Barbados is east of the Windwards, part of the Lesser Antilles, roughly at [[13°N|13th parallel north]] of the [[equator|equator]]. It is about east of both the countries of [[Saint Lucia|Saint Lucia]] and [[Saint Vincent and the Grenadines|Saint Vincent and the Grenadines]] and north-east of [[Trinidad and Tobago|Trinidad and Tobago]]. Barbados is outside the principal Atlantic [[hurricane belt|hurricane belt]]. Its capital and largest city is [[Bridgetown|Bridgetown, Barbados]].
title: Barbados

abstract: Belarus (; , ), officially the Republic of Belarus (, ), formerly known by its [[Russian|Russian language]] name Byelorussia or Belorussia (), is a [[landlocked country|landlocked country]] in [[Eastern Europe|Eastern Europe]] bordered by [[Russia|Russia]] to the northeast, [[Ukraine|Ukraine]] to the south, [[Poland|Poland]] to the west, and [[Lithuania|Lithuania]] and [[Latvia|Latvia]] to the northwest. Its capital and most populous city is [[Minsk|Minsk]]. Over 40% of its is forested. Its major economic sectors are service industries and manufacturing. Until the 20th century, different states at various times controlled the lands of modern-day Belarus, including the [[Principality of Polotsk|Principality of Polotsk]] (11th to 14th centuries), the [[Grand Duchy of Lithuania|Grand Duchy of Lithuania]], the [[Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth|Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth]], and the [[Russian Empire|Russian Empire]].
title: Belarus

abstract: Bolivia (, ; ; ; ), officially the Plurinational State of Bolivia ( ) is a landlocked country located in western-central [[South America|South America]]. The capital is [[Sucre|Sucre]] while the [[seat of government|seat of government]] and financial center is located in [[La Paz|La Paz]]. The largest city and principal industrial center is [[Santa Cruz de la Sierra|Santa Cruz de la Sierra]], located on the [[Llanos Orientales|Geography of Bolivia]] (tropical lowlands) a mostly flat region in the east of Bolivia.
title: Bolivia

abstract: Gabon (; ), officially the Gabonese Republic (), is a country on the west coast of [[Central Africa|Central Africa]]. Located on the [[equator|equator]], Gabon is bordered by [[Equatorial Guinea|Equatorial Guinea]] to the northwest, [[Cameroon|Cameroon]] to the north, the [[Republic of the Congo|Republic of the Congo]] on the east and south, and the [[Gulf of Guinea|Gulf of Guinea]] to the west. It has an area of nearly and its population is estimated at million people. Its capital and largest city is [[Libreville|Libreville]].
title: Gabon

abstract: Andorra (; ), officially the Principality of Andorra (), also called the Principality of the Valleys of Andorra (), is a [[sovereign|Sovereignty]] landlocked [[microstate|microstate]] on the [[Iberian Peninsula|Iberian Peninsula]], in the eastern [[Pyrenees|Pyrenees]], bordered by [[France|France]] to the north and [[Spain|Spain]] to the south. Believed to have been created by [[Charlemagne|Charlemagne]], Andorra was ruled by the [[Count of Urgell|Count of Urgell]] until 988, when it was transferred to the [[Roman Catholic Diocese of Urgell|Roman Catholic Diocese of Urgell]], and the present principality was formed by [[a charter in 1278|Paréage of Andorra 1278]]. It is known as a [[principality|principality]] as it is a [[diarchy|diarchy]] headed by two [[Co-Princes|Co-Princes of Andorra]]: the Catholic [[Bishop of Urgell|Bishop of Urgell]] in Catalonia, Spain and the [[President of France|President of France]].
title: Andorra

abstract: Although inhabited since the [[Paleolithic Era|Paleolithic Era]], what is now Angola was molded by [[Portuguese colonisation|Portuguese colonization of Africa]]. It began with, and was for centuries limited to, coastal settlements and [[trading post|trading posts]] established starting in the 16th century. In the 19th century, European settlers slowly and hesitantly began to establish themselves in the interior. The [[Portuguese colony|Portuguese West Africa]] that became Angola did not have its present borders until the early 20th century because of resistance by groups such as the Cuamato, the [[Kwanyama|Oukwanyama]] and the [[Mbunda|Mbunda people]].
title: Angola

abstract: Human habitation in Afghanistan dates back to the [[Middle Paleolithic|Middle Paleolithic]] Era, and the country's [[strategic|Geostrategy]] location along the [[Silk Road|Silk Road]] connected it to the cultures of the Middle East and other parts of Asia. The land has historically been home to various peoples and has witnessed [[numerous military campaigns|Invasions of Afghanistan]], including those by [[Alexander the Great|Alexander the Great]], [[Mauryas|Maurya Empire]], [[Muslim Arabs|Islamic conquest of Afghanistan]], [[Mongols|Mongol invasion of Khwarezmia and Eastern Iran]], [[British|First Anglo-Afghan War]], [[Soviets|Soviet–Afghan War]], and [[since 2001|War in Afghanistan (2001–present)]] by the [[United States|United States]] with [[NATO|NATO]]-allied countries. It has been called "unconquerable" and nicknamed the "graveyard of empires". The land also served as the source from which the [[Kushans|Kushan Empire]], [[Hephthalites|Hephthalite Empire]], [[Samanids|Samanid Empire]], [[Saffarids|Saffarid Empire]], [[Ghaznavids|Ghaznavids]], [[Ghorids|Ghorids]], [[Khaljis|Khalji dynasty]], [[Mughals|Mughal Empire]], [[Hotaks|Hotak Empire]], [[Durranis|Durrani dynasty]], and others have risen to form major empires.
title: Afghanistan

abstract: Anguilla ( ) is a [[British overseas territory|British Overseas Territories]] in the [[Caribbean|Caribbean]]. It is one of the most northerly of the [[Leeward Islands|Leeward Islands]] in the [[Lesser Antilles|Lesser Antilles]], lying east of [[Puerto Rico|Puerto Rico]] and the [[Virgin Islands|Virgin Islands]] and directly north of [[Saint Martin|Saint Martin]]. The territory consists of the main island of Anguilla, approximately long by wide at its widest point, together with a number of much smaller islands and [[cay|cays]] with no permanent population. The island's capital is [[The Valley|The Valley, Anguilla]]. The total land area of the territory is , with a population of approximately ( estimate).
title: Anguilla

abstract: Ecuador ( , ) (), officially the Republic of Ecuador (, which literally translates as "Republic of the [[Equator|Equator]]"; ), is a country in northwestern [[South America|South America]], bordered by [[Colombia|Colombia]] on the north, [[Peru|Peru]] on the east and south, and the Pacific Ocean to the west. Ecuador also includes the [[Galápagos Islands|Galápagos Islands]] in the Pacific, about west of the mainland. The capital city is [[Quito|Quito]] and the largest city as well.
title: Ecuador

abstract: The German Democratic Republic was established in the Soviet zone, while the [[Federal Republic|West Germany]] was established in the three western zones. East Germany was a [[satellite state|satellite state]] of the [[Soviet Union|Soviet Union]]. Soviet occupation authorities began transferring administrative responsibility to German communist leaders in 1948, and the GDR began to function as a state on 7 October 1949. However, [[Soviet forces|Group of Soviet Forces in Germany]] remained in the country throughout the Cold War. Until 1989, the GDR was governed by the [[Socialist Unity Party|Socialist Unity Party of Germany]] (SED), though other parties nominally participated in its alliance organisation, the [[National Front of Democratic Germany|National Front of Democratic Germany]]. The SED made the teaching of [[Marxism–Leninism|Marxism–Leninism]] and the [[Russian language|Russian language]] compulsory in schools.
title: East Germany

abstract: The territory of modern Hungary was for centuries inhabited by a succession of peoples, including [[Celts|Celts]], [[Romans|Ancient Rome]], [[Germanic tribes|Germanic people]], [[Huns|Huns]], [[West Slavs|West Slavs]] and the [[Avars|Avars (Carpathians)]]. The foundations of the Hungarian state was established in the late ninth century AD by the [[Hungarian|Hungarians]] grand prince [[Árpád|Árpád]] following the [[conquest of the Carpathian Basin|Hungarian conquest of the Carpathian Basin]]. His great-grandson [[Stephen I|Stephen I of Hungary]] ascended the throne in 1000, converting his realm to a [[Christian kingdom|Kingdom of Hungary]]. By the 12th century, Hungary became a regional power, reaching its [[cultural and political height in the 15th century|History of Hungary#Age of early absolutism]]. Following the [[Battle of Mohács|Battle of Mohács]] in 1526, Hungary was partially [[occupied by the Ottoman Empire|Ottoman Hungary]] (1541–1699). It came under [[Habsburg rule|Habsburg Empire]] at the turn of the 18th century, and later joined [[Austria|Austrian Empire]] to form the [[Austro–Hungarian Empire|Austro–Hungarian Empire]], a major European power.
title: Hungary

abstract: Portugal (), officially the Portuguese Republic ( ), is a country located mostly on the [[Iberian Peninsula|Iberian Peninsula]] in [[southwestern Europe|Southern Europe]]. It is the westernmost [[sovereign state|sovereign state]] of [[mainland Europe|mainland Europe]]. It is bordered to the west and south by the [[Atlantic Ocean|Atlantic Ocean]] and to the north and east by [[Spain|Spain]]. Its territory also includes the Atlantic [[archipelago|archipelagos]] of the [[Azores|Azores]] and [[Madeira|Madeira]], both [[autonomous regions|Autonomous regions of Portugal]] with their own [[regional government|regional governments]].
title: Portugal

abstract: The territory that now constitutes Pakistan was the site of several [[ancient cultures|Prehistory of Pakistan]] and intertwined with the history of the broader [[Indian subcontinent|Indian subcontinent]]. The ancient history involves the [[Neolithic|Neolithic]] site of [[Mehrgarh|Mehrgarh]] and the [[Bronze Age|Bronze Age]] [[Indus Valley Civilisation|Indus Valley Civilisation]], and was later home to kingdoms ruled by people of different faiths and cultures, including [[Hindu|Hindus]], [[Indo-Greeks|Indo-Greek Kingdom]], [[Muslims|Muslim conquest in the Indian subcontinent]], [[Turco-Mongols|Timurid dynasty]], [[Afghans|Afghan (ethnonym)]] and [[Sikh|Sikhs]]. The area has been ruled by numerous empires and dynasties, including the Persian [[Achaemenid Empire|Achaemenid Empire]], [[Alexander III of Macedon|Alexander the Great]], the [[Seleucid Empire|Seleucid Empire]], the Indian [[Maurya Empire|Maurya Empire]], the [[Gupta Empire|Gupta Empire]], the Arab [[Umayyad Caliphate|Umayyad Caliphate]], the [[Delhi Sultanate|Delhi Sultanate]], the [[Mongol Empire|Mongol Empire]], the [[Mughal Empire|Mughal Empire]], the Afghan [[Durrani Empire|Durrani Empire]], the [[Sikh Empire|Sikh Empire]] (partially) and, most recently, the [[British Empire|British Empire]]. Pakistan is the only country to have been created in the name of Islam. It is an [[ethnically|Ethnic groups in Pakistan]] and [[linguistically|Languages of Pakistan]] diverse country, with a similarly diverse [[geography|Geography of Pakistan]] and [[wildlife|Fauna of Pakistan]]. Initially a [[dominion|Dominion of Pakistan]], Pakistan adopted a [[constitution|Constitution of Pakistan]] in 1956, becoming an Islamic republic. An ethnic [[civil war|Bangladesh Liberation War]] and [[Indian military intervention|Indo-Pakistani War of 1971]] in 1971 resulted in the secession of [[East Pakistan|East Pakistan]] as the new country of [[Bangladesh|Bangladesh]]. In 1973, Pakistan adopted a new constitution which stipulated that all laws are to conform to the injunctions of [[Islam|Islam]] as laid down in the [[Quran|Quran]] and [[Sunnah|Sunnah]].
title: Pakistan

abstract: The Pitcairn Islands (; [[Pitkern|Pitkern]]: ), officially Pitcairn, Henderson, Ducie and Oeno Islands, are a group of four [[volcanic|Volcano]] islands in the southern [[Pacific Ocean|Pacific Ocean]] that form the sole [[British Overseas Territory|British Overseas Territories]] in the [[South Pacific|South Pacific Ocean]]. The four islandsPitcairn proper, [[Henderson|Henderson Island (Pitcairn Islands)]], [[Ducie|Ducie Island]], and [[Oeno|Oeno Island]]are scattered across several hundred miles of ocean and have a combined land area of about . Henderson Island accounts for 86% of the land area, but only Pitcairn Island is inhabited. The nearest places are [[Mangareva|Mangareva]] (of [[French Polynesia|French Polynesia]]) to the west and [[Easter Island|Easter Island]] to the east.
title: Pitcairn Islands

abstract: Rwanda (; ), officially the Republic of Rwanda (; [[Swahili|Kiswahili]]: Jamhuri ya Rwanda; ), is a country in [[Central|Central Africa]] and [[East Africa|East Africa]] and one of the smallest countries on the African mainland. Located a few degrees south of the [[Equator|Equator]], Rwanda is bordered by [[Uganda|Uganda]], [[Tanzania|Tanzania]], [[Burundi|Burundi]] and the [[Democratic Republic of the Congo|Democratic Republic of the Congo]]. Rwanda is in the [[African Great Lakes|African Great Lakes]] region and is highly elevated; its geography is dominated by mountains in the west and [[savanna|savanna]] to the east, with numerous lakes throughout the country. The climate is temperate to subtropical, with two rainy seasons and two dry seasons each year.
title: Rwanda

abstract: Jersey (, ; [[Jèrriais|Jèrriais]]: Jèrri ), officially the Bailiwick of Jersey (; [[Jèrriais|Jèrriais]]: Bailliage dé Jèrri), is a [[Crown dependency|Crown dependencies]] located near the coast of [[Normandy|Normandy]], [[France|France]]. Jersey was part of the [[Duchy of Normandy|Duchy of Normandy]], whose dukes went on to become kings of England from 1066. After Normandy was lost by the kings of England in the 13th century, and the ducal title surrendered to France, Jersey and the other [[Channel Islands|Channel Islands]] remained attached to the English crown.
title: Jersey

abstract: Due to its central geographic location in Europe and the Mediterranean, Italy has historically been home to a myriad of peoples and cultures. In addition to the various [[ancient Italian tribes|List of ancient peoples of Italy]] and [[Italic peoples|Italic peoples]] dispersed throughout the [[Italian Peninsula|Italian Peninsula]] and [[insular Italy|insular Italy]], beginning from the [[classical|Classical antiquity]] era, [[Phoenicians|Phoenicians]], [[Carthaginians|Ancient Carthage]] and [[Greeks|Magna Graecia]] established settlements in the [[south of Italy|Southern Italy]], with [[Etruscans|Etruscans]] and [[Celts|Celts]] inhabiting the [[centre|Central Italy]] and the [[north|Northern Italy]] of Italy respectively. The Italic tribe known as the [[Latins|Latins (Italic tribe)]] formed the [[Roman Kingdom|Roman Kingdom]] in the 8th century BC, which eventually became a [[republic|Roman Republic]] that [[conquered|Roman conquest of Italy]] and [[assimilated|Romanization (cultural)]] its neighbours. In the first century BC, the [[Roman Empire|Roman Empire]] emerged as the dominant power in the [[Mediterranean Basin|Mediterranean Basin]] and became the leading cultural, political and religious [[centre|Caput Mundi]] of [[Western civilisation|Western world]]. The [[legacy of the Roman Empire|legacy of the Roman Empire]] is widespread and can be observed in the global distribution of [[civilian law|civilian law]], [[republican government|republican governments]], [[Christianity|History of Christianity]] and the [[Latin script|Latin script]].
title: Italy

abstract: Ireland ( ), also known as the Republic of Ireland (), is a country in north-western [[Europe|Europe]] occupying 26 of 32 counties of the [[island of Ireland|island of Ireland]]. The capital and largest city is [[Dublin|Dublin]], which is located on the eastern part of the island, and whose metropolitan area is home to around a third of the country's over 4.8 million inhabitants. The [[sovereign state|sovereign state]] shares its only land border with [[Northern Ireland|Northern Ireland]], a [[part|Countries of the United Kingdom]] of the [[United Kingdom|United Kingdom]]. It is otherwise surrounded by the [[Atlantic Ocean|Atlantic Ocean]], with the [[Celtic Sea|Celtic Sea]] to the south, [[Saint George's Channel|Saint George's Channel]] to the south-east, and the [[Irish Sea|Irish Sea]] to the east. It is a [[unitary|unitary state]], [[parliamentary republic|parliamentary republic]]. The legislature, the , consists of a [[lower house|lower house]], , an [[upper house|upper house]], , and an elected [[President|President of Ireland]] () who serves as the largely ceremonial [[head of state|head of state]], but with some important powers and duties. The [[head of government|head of government]] is the (Prime Minister, literally 'Chief', a title not used in English), who is elected by the Dáil and appointed by the President; the Taoiseach in turn appoints other government ministers.
title: Republic of Ireland

abstract: Monaco (; ), officially the Principality of Monaco (), is a sovereign [[city-state|city-state]], [[country|country]], and [[microstate|microstate]] on the [[French Riviera|French Riviera]] in [[Western Europe|Western Europe]]. [[France|France]] borders the country on three sides while the other side borders the [[Mediterranean Sea|Mediterranean Sea]].
title: Monaco

abstract: Mozambique (), officially the Republic of Mozambique ( or , ), is a country located in [[Southeast Africa|Southeast Africa]] bordered by the [[Indian Ocean|Indian Ocean]] to the east, [[Tanzania|Tanzania]] to the north, [[Malawi|Malawi]] and [[Zambia|Zambia]] to the northwest, [[Zimbabwe|Zimbabwe]] to the west, and [[Eswatini (Swaziland)|Eswatini]] and [[South Africa|South Africa]] to the southwest. The [[sovereign state|sovereign state]] is separated from the [[Comoros|Comoros]], [[Mayotte|Mayotte]] and [[Madagascar|Madagascar]] by the [[Mozambique Channel|Mozambique Channel]] to the east. The capital of Mozambique is [[Maputo|Maputo]] (formerly known as "Lourenço Marques" from 1876 to 1976) while [[Matola|Matola]] is the largest city, being a suburb of Maputo.
title: Mozambique

abstract: Montenegro (; / Crna Gora ) is a country in [[Southeastern Europe|Southeastern Europe]] on the [[Adriatic Sea|Adriatic Sea]]. It borders [[Bosnia and Herzegovina|Bosnia and Herzegovina]] to the north; [[Serbia|Serbia]] and the disputed country of [[Kosovo|Kosovo]] to the east, [[Albania|Albania]] to the south and [[Croatia|Croatia]] to the west. Montenegro has an area of 13,812 square kilometres and a population of 678,901, most of whom are [[Orthodox Christians|Eastern Orthodox Church]]. Its capital [[Podgorica|Podgorica]] is one of the twenty-three municipalities in the country. [[Cetinje|Cetinje]] is designated as the Old Royal Capital.
title: Montenegro

abstract: Kazakhstan (, ; ), officially the Republic of Kazakhstan (; ), is the world's largest [[landlocked country|landlocked country]], and the [[ninth largest|List of countries and outlying territories by land area]] in the world, with an area of . It is a transcontinental country largely located in [[Asia|Asia]]; the most western parts are located in [[Europe|Europe]]. Kazakhstan is the dominant nation of [[Central Asia|Central Asia]] economically, generating 60% of the region's GDP, primarily through its oil/gas industry. It also has vast mineral resources.
title: Kazakhstan

abstract: Kosovo (; or ; ), officially the Republic of Kosovo (; ), is a [[partially recognised|International recognition of Kosovo]] [[state|state (polity)]] and [[disputed territory|List of territorial disputes]] in [[Southeastern Europe|Southeastern Europe]].
title: Kosovo

abstract: Latvia ( or ; ), officially the Republic of Latvia (), is a country in the [[Baltic region|Baltic region]] of [[Northern Europe|Northern Europe]]. Since its independence, Latvia has been referred to as one of the [[Baltic states|Baltic states]]. It is bordered by [[Estonia|Estonia]] to the north, [[Lithuania|Lithuania]] to the south, [[Russia|Russia]] to the east, and [[Belarus|Belarus]] to the southeast, and shares a [[maritime border|Maritime boundary]] with [[Sweden|Sweden]] to the west. Latvia has 1,957,200 inhabitants and a territory of . The country has a [[temperate seasonal climate|Temperate climate]].
title: Latvia

abstract: Lesotho (, ) officially the Kingdom of Lesotho () is an [[enclaved country|Enclave and exclave]] within the border of [[South Africa|South Africa]]. It is just over in size and has a population of around million. Its capital and largest city is [[Maseru|Maseru]].
title: Lesotho

abstract: New Caledonia (; ) is a [[special collectivity of France|Sui generis collectivity]] in the southwest [[Pacific Ocean|Pacific Ocean]], located to the south of [[Vanuatu|Vanuatu]], about east of [[Australia|Australia]] and from [[Metropolitan France|Metropolitan France]]. The archipelago, part of the [[Melanesia|Melanesia]] subregion, includes the main island of [[Grande Terre|Grande Terre (New Caledonia)]], the [[Loyalty Islands|Loyalty Islands]], the [[Chesterfield Islands|Chesterfield Islands]], the [[Belep|Belep]] archipelago, the [[Isle of Pines|Isle of Pines (New Caledonia)]], and a few remote islets. The Chesterfield Islands are in the [[Coral Sea|Coral Sea]]. Locals refer to Grande Terre as ("the pebble").
title: New Caledonia

abstract: The Federal Republic of Nigeria, commonly referred to as Nigeria (), is a [[federal|Federation]] [[republic|republic]] in [[West Africa|West Africa]], bordering [[Niger|Niger]] in the north, [[Chad|Chad]] in the northeast, [[Cameroon|Cameroon]] in the southeast, and [[Benin|Benin]] in the west. Its coast in the south is located on the [[Gulf of Guinea|Gulf of Guinea]] in the [[Atlantic Ocean|Atlantic Ocean]]. The [[federation|federation]] comprises [[36 states|States of Nigeria]] and 1 [[Federal Capital Territory|Federal Capital Territory, Nigeria]], where the [[capital|Capital city]], [[Abuja|Abuja]] is located. Nigeria is [[officially|Constitution of Nigeria]] a [[democratic|Democracy]] [[secular country|Secular state]].
title: Nigeria

abstract: Zimbabwe (), officially the Republic of Zimbabwe, is a [[landlocked country|landlocked country]] located in [[southern Africa|southern Africa]], between the [[Zambezi|Zambezi]] and [[Limpopo River|Limpopo Rivers]], bordered by [[South Africa|South Africa]], [[Botswana|Botswana]], [[Zambia|Zambia]] and [[Mozambique|Mozambique]]. The capital and largest city is [[Harare|Harare]]. A country of roughly million people, Zimbabwe has 16 [[official languages|official languages]], with [[English|English language]], [[Shona|Shona language]], and [[Ndebele|Northern Ndebele language]] the most commonly used.
title: Zimbabwe

abstract: Serbia ( / Srbija ), officially the Republic of Serbia ( / Republika Srbija ), is a country situated at the crossroads of [[Central|Central Europe]] and [[Southeast Europe|Southeast Europe]] in the southern [[Pannonian Plain|Pannonian Plain]] and the central [[Balkans|Balkans]]. The [[sovereign state|sovereign state]] borders [[Hungary|Hungary]] to the north, [[Romania|Romania]] to the northeast, [[Bulgaria|Bulgaria]] to the southeast, [[Macedonia|Republic of Macedonia]] to the south, [[Croatia|Croatia]], [[Bosnia and Herzegovina|Bosnia and Herzegovina]], and [[Montenegro|Montenegro]] to the southwest. The country claims a border with [[Albania|Albania]] through the [[disputed|political status of Kosovo]] territory of [[Kosovo|Kosovo]]. Serbia numbers around 7 million residents. Its capital, [[Belgrade|Belgrade]], ranks among the oldest and largest cities in [[southeastern Europe|southeastern Europe]].
title: Serbia

abstract: Sardinia ( ; ; or ; ; ; ; ) is the [[second-largest|Mediterranean islands#By area]] island in the [[Mediterranean Sea|Mediterranean Sea]] (after [[Sicily|Sicily]] and before [[Cyprus|Cyprus]]). It is located west of the [[Italian Peninsula|Italian Peninsula]] and to the immediate south of the French island of [[Corsica|Corsica]].
title: Sardinia

abstract: Tanzania (), officially the United Republic of Tanzania (), is a country in eastern Africa within the [[African Great Lakes|African Great Lakes]] region. It borders [[Uganda|Uganda]] to the north; [[Kenya|Kenya]] to the northeast; Comoro Islands at the [[Indian Ocean|Indian Ocean]] to the east; [[Mozambique|Mozambique]] and [[Malawi|Malawi]] to the south; [[Zambia|Zambia]] to the southwest; and [[Rwanda|Rwanda]], [[Burundi|Burundi]], and the [[Democratic Republic of the Congo|Democratic Republic of the Congo]] to the west. [[Mount Kilimanjaro|Mount Kilimanjaro]], Africa's highest mountain, is in north-eastern Tanzania.
title: Tanzania

abstract: Tokelau (; previously known as the Union Islands, and officially as Tokelau Islands until 1976; lit. "[[north-northeast|north-northeast]]") is a [[dependent territory|dependent territory]] of [[New Zealand|New Zealand]] in the southern Pacific Ocean. It consists of three tropical coral [[atoll|atolls]] ([[Atafu|Atafu]], [[Nukunonu|Nukunonu]] and [[Fakaofo|Fakaofo]]), with a combined land area of . The capital rotates yearly between the three atolls. Tokelau lies north of the [[Samoan Islands|Samoan Islands]], east of [[Tuvalu|Tuvalu]], south of the [[Phoenix Islands|Phoenix Islands]], southwest of the more distant [[Line Islands|Line Islands]], and northwest of the [[Cook Islands|Cook Islands]]. [[Swains Island|Swains Island]] is geographically part of Tokelau, but is subject to an ongoing territorial dispute and is currently administered by the United States as part of [[American Samoa|American Samoa]].
title: Tokelau

abstract: Rhodesia (, ) was a country in [[southern Africa|southern Africa]] from 1965 to 1979, equivalent in territory to modern [[Zimbabwe|Zimbabwe]]. Rhodesia was the de facto [[successor state|successor state]] to the [[British colony|British colony]] of [[Southern Rhodesia|Southern Rhodesia]], which had been [[self-governing|Self-governing colony]] since achieving [[responsible government|responsible government]] in 1923. A [[landlocked|landlocked]] nation, Rhodesia was bordered by [[South Africa|South Africa]] to the south, [[Bechuanaland|Bechuanaland Protectorate]] (later [[Botswana|Botswana]]) to the southwest, [[Zambia|Zambia]] to the northwest, and [[Mozambique|Mozambique]] ([[a Portuguese province|Portuguese Mozambique]] until 1975) to the east.
title: Rhodesia

abstract: Sierra Leone was a [[British Crown Colony|Sierra Leone Colony and Protectorate]] from 1808 to 1961. Sierra Leone became independent from the [[United Kingdom|United Kingdom]] on 27 April 1961, led by Sir [[Milton Margai|Milton Margai]]. In May 1962, Sierra Leone held its first general elections as an independent nation. On 19 April 1971, [[Siaka Stevens|Siaka Stevens]]' government abolished Sierra Leone's [[parliamentary government|parliamentary government]] system and declared Sierra Leone a [[presidential republic|presidential republic]] with Stevens as the country's first president. From 1978 to 1985, Sierra Leone was a one-party state in which Stevens' APC was the only legal political party in the country. The current [[constitution of Sierra Leone|constitution of Sierra Leone]], which includes multiparty democracy, was adopted in 1991 by the government of President [[Joseph Saidu Momoh|Joseph Saidu Momoh]], Stevens' hand-picked successor. On 23 March 1991, a rebel group known as the [[Revolutionary United Front|Revolutionary United Front]] led by a former Sierra Leone army officer [[Foday Sankoh|Foday Sankoh]] launched an eleven-year brutal civil war in the country, in an unsuccessful goal to overthrow the Sierra Leone government.
title: Sierra Leone

abstract: Slovenia ( ; ), officially the Republic of Slovenia (Slovene: , [[abbr.|Abbreviation]]: RS), is a [[sovereign state|sovereign state]] located in southern [[Central Europe|Central Europe]] at a crossroads of important European cultural and trade routes. It is bordered by [[Italy|Italy]] to the west, [[Austria|Austria]] to the north, [[Hungary|Hungary]] to the northeast, [[Croatia|Croatia]] to the southeast, and the [[Adriatic Sea|Adriatic Sea]] to the southwest. It covers and has a population of 2.07 million. One of the successor states of the former [[Yugoslavia|Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia]], Slovenia is a [[parliamentary republic|parliamentary republic]] and a member of the [[United Nations|United Nations]], of the [[European Union|European Union]], and of [[NATO|NATO]]. The capital and largest city is [[Ljubljana|Ljubljana]].
title: Slovenia

abstract: Somaliland (; , ), officially the Republic of Somaliland (, Jumhūrīyat Ṣūmālīlānd), is a [[self-declared state|Self-declared states]], internationally considered to be an [[autonomous region|autonomous region]] of [[Somalia|Somalia]].
title: Somaliland

abstract: The British Overseas Territories (BOTs) or United Kingdom Overseas Territories (UKOTs) are 14 [[territories|Dependent territory]] under the jurisdiction and sovereignty of the [[United Kingdom|United Kingdom]]. They are remnants of the [[British Empire|British Empire]] that have not been granted independence or have voted to remain British territories. These territories do not form part of the United Kingdom and, with the exception of [[Gibraltar|Gibraltar]], are not part of the [[European Union|European Union]]. Most of the permanently inhabited territories are internally self-governing, with the UK retaining responsibility for defence and [[foreign relations|foreign relations]]. Three are inhabited only by a transitory population of military or scientific personnel. They all share the [[British monarch|Monarchy of the United Kingdom]] ([[Elizabeth II|Elizabeth II]]) as [[head of state|head of state]].
title: British Overseas Territories

abstract: Vietnam (, ; ), officially the Socialist Republic of Vietnam (), is the easternmost country on the [[Indochina Peninsula|Indochina]]. With an estimated million inhabitants , it is the [[15th most populous country in the world|List of countries and dependencies by population]]. Vietnam is bordered by [[China|China]] to the north, [[Laos|Laos]] and [[Cambodia|Cambodia]] to the west, part of [[Thailand|Thailand]] to the southwest, and the [[Philippines|Philippines]], [[Malaysia|Malaysia]], and [[Indonesia|Indonesia]] across the [[South China Sea|South China Sea]] to the east and southeast. Its [[capital city|capital city]] has been [[Hanoi|Hanoi]] since the [[reunification|Reunification Day]] of [[North|North Vietnam]] and [[South Vietnam|South Vietnam]] in 1976, while its most populous city is [[Ho Chi Minh City|Ho Chi Minh City]].
title: Vietnam

abstract: Puntland (, ), officially the Puntland State of Somalia (, ), is a region in northeastern [[Somalia|Somalia]]. Centered on the town of [[Garoowe|Garoowe]] in the [[Nugal|Nugal, Somalia]] province, its leaders declared the territory an [[autonomous state|States and regions of Somalia]] in 1998 but is internationally recognized as an [[autonomous region|autonomous region]] of [[Somalia|Somalia]].
title: Puntland

abstract: North Yemen is the geographic area named the [[Yemen Arab Republic|Yemen Arab Republic]] (1962–1990), its predecessor, the [[Mutawakkilite Kingdom of Yemen|Mutawakkilite Kingdom of Yemen]] (1918–1962), and their predecessors that exercised [[sovereignty|sovereignty]] over the territory that is now the north-western part of the state of [[Yemen|Yemen]] in southern [[Arabia|Arabia]].
title: North Yemen

abstract: It is considered the third period of [[republican rule in Greece|History of the Hellenic Republic]], following the [[First Republic|First Hellenic Republic]] during the [[Greek War of Independence|Greek War of Independence]] (1821–32) and the [[Second Republic|Second Hellenic Republic]] during the temporary abolition of the monarchy in 1924–35. The term "[[Metapolitefsi|Metapolitefsi]]" (Μεταπολίτευση) is commonly used for this period, but this term concerns more often with the first years immediately after the fall of the military junta. While the First and Second Hellenic Republics aren't in common use except in a historiographic context, the term Third Hellenic Republic is used frequently.
title: Third Hellenic Republic

abstract: Turkey ( ), officially the Republic of Turkey ( ), is a [[transcontinental|List of transcontinental countries]] country located mainly in [[Western Asia|Western Asia]], with a smaller portion on the [[Balkan Peninsula|Balkan Peninsula]] in [[Southeast Europe|Southeast Europe]]. [[East Thrace|East Thrace]], located in Europe, is separated from [[Anatolia|Anatolia]] by the [[Sea of Marmara|Sea of Marmara]], the [[Bosphorous strait|Bosphorous strait]] and the [[Dardanelles|Dardanelles]] (collectively called the [[Turkish Straits|Turkish Straits]]). Turkey is bordered by [[Greece|Greece]] and [[Bulgaria|Bulgaria]] to its northwest; [[Georgia|Georgia (country)]] to its northeast; [[Armenia|Armenia]], the [[Azerbaijan|Azerbaijani]] [[exclave|exclave]] of [[Nakhchivan|Nakhchivan Autonomous Republic]] and [[Iran|Iran]] to the east; and [[Iraq|Iraq]] and [[Syria|Syria]] to the south. [[Ankara|Ankara]] is its capital but [[Istanbul|Istanbul]] is the country's largest city. Approximately 70 to 80 per cent of the country's citizens identify as [[Turkish|Turkish people]]. [[Kurds|Kurds in Turkey]] are the largest minority; the size of the Kurdish population is a subject of dispute with estimates placing the figure at anywhere from 12 to 25 per cent of the population.
title: Turkey

abstract: Jordan ( ), officially the Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan ( ), is an [[Arab country|Arab country]] in [[Western Asia|Western Asia]], on the [[East Bank|Transjordan (region)]] of the [[Jordan River|Jordan River]]. Jordan is bordered by [[Saudi Arabia|Saudi Arabia]] to the south, [[Iraq|Iraq]] to the north-east, [[Syria|Syria]] to the north and [[Israel|Israel]] and [[Palestine|State of Palestine]] ([[West Bank|West Bank]]) to the west. The [[Dead Sea|Dead Sea]] is located along its western borders and the country has a small coastline to the [[Red Sea|Red Sea]] in its extreme south-west, but is otherwise landlocked. Jordan is strategically located at the crossroads of Asia, Africa and Europe. The capital, [[Amman|Amman]], is Jordan's most populous city as well as the country's economic, political and cultural centre.
title: Jordan

abstract: Hirshabelle consists of the [[Hiran|Hiran, Somalia]] and [[Middle Shabelle|Middle Shabelle]] regions of Somalia, and its name is derived from a conflation of their names. Hirshabelle considers itself an autonomous state within the larger [[Federal Republic of Somalia|Federal Republic of Somalia]], as defined by the [[Provisional Constitution of the Federal Republic of Somalia|Provisional Constitution of the Federal Republic of Somalia]].
title: Hirshabelle

abstract: The United States of America (USA), commonly known as the United States (U.S. or US) or America, is a country composed of 50 [[states|U.S. state]], a [[federal district|Washington, D.C.]], five major [[self-governing territories|Territories of the United States]], and [[various possessions|United States Minor Outlying Islands]]. At 3.8   million square miles (9.8   million km2), the United States is the world's [[third or fourth largest country by total area|List of countries and dependencies by area]] and slightly smaller than the entire continent of [[Europe|Europe]]'s 3.9   million square miles (10.1   million km2). With a population of over 327 million people, the U.S. is the [[third most populous country|List of countries and dependencies by population]]. The capital is [[Washington, D.C.|Washington, D.C.]], and the [[largest city by population|List of United States cities by population]] is [[New York|New York City]]. Forty-eight states and the capital's federal district are [[contiguous|Contiguous United States]] in [[North America|North America]] between [[Canada|Canada]] and [[Mexico|Mexico]]. The [[State of Alaska|Alaska]] is in the northwest corner of North America, bordered by Canada to the east and across the [[Bering Strait|Bering Strait]] from [[Russia|Russia]] to the west. The [[State of Hawaii|Hawaii]] is an [[archipelago|archipelago]] in the mid-[[Pacific Ocean|Pacific Ocean]]. The U.S. [[territories|Territories of the United States]] are scattered about the Pacific Ocean and the [[Caribbean Sea|Caribbean Sea]], stretching across nine official [[time zones|Time in the United States]]. The extremely diverse [[geography|geography of the United States]], [[climate|climate of the United States]], and [[wildlife|Fauna of the United States]] of the United States make it one of the world's 17 [[megadiverse countries|megadiverse countries]].
title: United States

abstract: Busoga is a traditional Bantu kingdom and one of five constitutional monarchies in present-day [[Uganda|Uganda]]. The kingdom is a [[cultural institution|cultural institution]] which promotes popular participation and unity among the people of the region through development programs to improve their standard of living. Busoga strives for a united people who have economic, social and cultural prosperity and assists the [[Kyabazinga|Kyabazinga of Busoga]].
title: Busoga

abstract: Sweden ( ), officially the Kingdom of Sweden (Swedish: ), is a [[Scandinavia|Scandinavian]] [[Nordic country|Nordic country]] in [[Northern Europe|Northern Europe]]. It borders [[Norway|Norway]] to the west and north and [[Finland|Finland]] to the east, and is connected to [[Denmark|Denmark]] in the southwest by [[a bridge-tunnel|Øresund Bridge]] across the [[Öresund|Øresund]], a strait at the Swedish-Danish border. At , Sweden is the largest country in [[Northern Europe|Northern Europe]], the third-largest country in the [[European Union|European Union]] and the [[fifth largest|List of European countries by area]] country in [[Europe|Europe]] by area. Sweden has a total population of 10.2   million of which 2.4 million has a foreign background. It has a low population density of . The highest concentration is in the southern half of the country.
title: Sweden

abstract: The Australian Antarctic Territory (AAT) is a part of [[Antarctica|Antarctica]] administered by the [[Australian Antarctic Division|Australian Antarctic Division]], an agency of the federal [[Department of the Environment and Energy|Department of the Environment and Energy]]. The territory's history dates to a claim on [[Enderby Land|Enderby Land]] made by the United Kingdom in 1841, which was subsequently expanded and eventually transferred to Australia in 1933. It is the largest territory of Antarctica claimed by any nation by area. In 1961, the [[Antarctic Treaty|Antarctic Treaty System]] came into force. Article 4 deals with territorial claims, and although it does not renounce or diminish any preexisting claims to sovereignty, it also does not prejudice the position of Contracting Parties in their recognition or non-recognition of territorial sovereignty. As a result, only four other countries; New Zealand, the United Kingdom, France and Norway recognise Australia's claim to sovereignty in Antarctica.
title: Australian Antarctic Territory

abstract: The Fifth Republic, [[France|France]]'s current [[republic|republican]] system of government, was established by [[Charles de Gaulle|Charles de Gaulle]] under the [[Constitution of the Fifth Republic|Constitution of the Fifth Republic]] on 4 October 1958. The Fifth Republic emerged from the collapse of the [[Fourth Republic|French Fourth Republic]], replacing the former [[parliamentary republic|parliamentary republic]] with a [[semi-presidential|Semi-presidential system]], or dual-executive, system that split powers between a [[Prime Minister|Prime Minister of France]] as [[head of government|head of government]] and a [[President|President of France]] as [[head of state|head of state]]. De Gaulle, who was the [[first French President elected under the Fifth Republic|List of Presidents of France#French Fifth Republic (1958–present)]] in December 1958, believed in a strong head of state, which he described as embodying ("the spirit of the nation").
title: French Fifth Republic

abstract: Nyasaland () was a [[British Protectorate|British Protectorate]] located in Africa that was established in 1907 when the former [[British Central Africa Protectorate|British Central Africa Protectorate]] changed its name. Between 1953 and 1963, Nyasaland was part of the [[Federation of Rhodesia and Nyasaland|Federation of Rhodesia and Nyasaland]]. After the Federation was dissolved, Nyasaland became independent from Britain on 6 July 1964 and was renamed [[Malawi|Malawi]].
title: Nyasaland

abstract: Turkmenistan ( or ; , ), formerly known as Turkmenia, officially the Republic of Turkmenistan, is a country in [[Central Asia|Central Asia]], bordered by [[Kazakhstan|Kazakhstan]] to the northwest, [[Uzbekistan|Uzbekistan]] to the north and east, [[Afghanistan|Afghanistan]] to the southeast, [[Iran|Iran]] to the south and southwest, and the [[Caspian Sea|Caspian Sea]] to the west. [[Ashgabat|Ashgabat]] is the capital and largest city. The population of the country is 5.6 million, the lowest of the Central Asian republics and one of the most sparsely populated in Asia.
title: Turkmenistan

abstract: Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) is an inter-governmental forum for 21 [[Pacific Rim|Pacific Rim]] member economies that promotes [[free trade|free trade]] throughout the Asia-Pacific region. Inspired from the success of [[Association of Southeast Asian Nations|Association of Southeast Asian Nations]] (ASEAN)’s series of post-ministerial conferences launched in the mid-1980s, the APEC was established in 1989 in response to the growing interdependence of Asia-Pacific economies and the advent of regional [[trade bloc|trade blocs]] in other parts of the world; and to establish new markets for agricultural products and raw materials beyond Europe. Headquartered in Singapore, the APEC is recognised as one of the oldest forums and highest-level multilateral blocs in the Asia-Pacific region, and exerts a significant global influence.
title: Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation

abstract: Basutoland was a [[British Crown colony|British Crown colony]] established in 1884 due to the [[Cape Colony|Cape Colony]]'s inability to control the territory. It was divided into seven administrative districts: [[Berea|Berea District]], [[Leribe|Leribe District]], [[Maseru|Maseru]], [[Mohale's Hoek|Mohale's Hoek District]], [[Mafeteng|Mafeteng]], [[Qacha's Nek|Qacha's Nek]] and [[Quthing|Quthing]].
title: Basutoland

abstract: Denmark (, ), officially the Kingdom of Denmark, is a [[Nordic country|Nordic countries]] and the southernmost of the [[Scandinavia|Scandinavian]] nations. Denmark lies southwest of [[Sweden|Sweden]] and south of [[Norway|Norway]], and is bordered to the south by [[Germany|Germany]]. The Kingdom of Denmark also comprises [[two autonomous constituent countries|#Greenland and the Faroe Islands]] in the [[North Atlantic Ocean|Atlantic Ocean]]: the [[Faroe Islands|Faroe Islands]] and [[Greenland|Greenland]]. Denmark proper consists of a peninsula, [[Jutland|Jutland]], and an [[archipelago|archipelago]] of [[443 named islands|List of islands of Denmark]], with the largest being [[Zealand|Zealand]], [[Funen|Funen]] and the [[North Jutlandic Island|North Jutlandic Island]]. The islands are characterised by flat, [[arable land|arable land]] and sandy coasts, low elevation and a [[temperate|temperate]] climate. Denmark has a total area of , land area of , and the total area including Greenland and the Faroe Islands is , and a population of 5.8 million ().
title: Denmark

abstract: The Territory of Christmas Island is an [[Australian external territory|States and territories of Australia]] comprising the island of the same name. Christmas Island is located in the [[Indian Ocean|Indian Ocean]], around south of [[Java|Java]] and [[Sumatra|Sumatra]] and around north-west of the closest point on the Australian mainland. It has an area of .
title: Christmas Island

abstract: El Salvador was for centuries inhabited by several [[Mesoamerican|Mesoamerican]] nations, especially the [[Cuzcatlecs|Pipil people]], as well as the [[Lenca|Lenca]] and [[Maya|Maya people]]. In the early 16th century, the [[Spanish Empire|Spanish Empire]] conquered the territory, incorporating it into the [[Viceroyalty of New Spain|Viceroyalty of New Spain]] ruled from [[Mexico City|Mexico City]]. However the Viceroyalty of Mexico had little or no influence in the daily affairs of the Central American isthmus, which would be colonized in 1524. In 1609 the area became the [[Captaincy General of Guatemala|Captaincy General of Guatemala]], from which El Salvador was part of until its independence from Spain, which took place in 1821, as part of the [[First Mexican Empire|First Mexican Empire]], then further seceded, as part of the [[Federal Republic of Central America|Federal Republic of Central America]], in 1823. When the Republic dissolved in 1841, El Salvador became a sovereign nation, then formed a short-lived union with [[Honduras|Honduras]] and [[Nicaragua|Nicaragua]] called the [[Greater Republic of Central America|Greater Republic of Central America]], which lasted from 1895 to 1898.
title: El Salvador

abstract: French Polynesia (; ; ) is an [[overseas collectivity|overseas collectivity]] of the [[French Republic|French Republic]] and the only [[overseas country of France|overseas country of France]]. It is composed of 118 geographically dispersed islands and [[atoll|atolls]] stretching over an expanse of more than in the [[South Pacific Ocean|Pacific Ocean]]. Its total land area is .
title: French Polynesia

abstract: Bangladesh (; , lit.   "The country of Bengal"), officially the People's Republic of Bangladesh ( ), is a country in [[South Asia|South Asia]]. It shares land borders with [[India|India]] and [[Myanmar|Myanmar]] (Burma).The country's maritime territory in the [[Bay of Bengal|Bay of Bengal]] is roughly equal to the size of its land area. Bangladesh is the world's [[eighth most populous country|List of countries and dependencies by population]]. [[Dhaka|Dhaka]] is its capital and largest city, followed by [[Chittagong|Chittagong]], which has the country's largest port. Bangladesh forms the largest and easternmost part of the [[Bengal|Bengal]] region. [[Bangladeshis|Bangladeshis]] include people from a range of ethnic groups and religions. [[Bengalis|Bengalis]], who speak the official [[Bengali language|Bengali language]], make up 98% of the population. The politically dominant [[Bengali Muslims|Bengali Muslims]] make the nation the world's third largest [[Muslim-majority country|Islam by country]]. [[Islam|Islam]] is the [[official religion|official religion]] of Bangladesh.
title: Bangladesh

abstract: Brunei ( ), officially the Nation of Brunei, the Abode of Peace (, [[Jawi|Jawi alphabet]]: ), is a country located on the north coast of the island of [[Borneo|Borneo]] in [[Southeast Asia|Southeast Asia]]. Apart from its coastline with the [[South China Sea|South China Sea]], the [[sovereign state|sovereign state]] is completely surrounded by the [[Malaysia|Malaysian]] [[state|federated state]] of [[Sarawak|Sarawak]]. It is separated into two parts by the Sarawak district of [[Limbang|Limbang District]]. Brunei is the only sovereign state completely on the island of Borneo; the remainder of the island's territory is divided between the nations of Malaysia and [[Indonesia|Indonesia]]. [[Brunei's population|Demographics of Brunei]] was in .
title: Brunei

abstract: The Cook Islands ([[Cook Islands Māori|Cook Islands Māori]]: Kūki 'Āirani) is a self-governing [[island country|island country]] in the [[South Pacific Ocean|Pacific Ocean]] in [[free association|Associated state]] with [[New Zealand|New Zealand]]. It comprises 15 islands whose total land area is . The Cook Islands' [[Exclusive Economic Zone|Exclusive Economic Zone]] (EEZ) covers of ocean.
title: Cook Islands

abstract: Germany ( ), officially the Federal Republic of Germany (, ), is a country in [[Central|Central Europe]] and [[Western Europe|Western Europe]], lying between the [[Baltic|Baltic Sea]] and [[North|North Sea]] Seas to the north, and the [[Alps|Alps]] to the south. It borders [[Denmark|Denmark]] to the north, [[Poland|Poland]] and the [[Czech Republic|Czech Republic]] to the east, [[Austria|Austria]] and [[Switzerland|Switzerland]] to the south, [[France|France]] to the southwest, and [[Luxembourg|Luxembourg]], [[Belgium|Belgium]] and the [[Netherlands|Netherlands]] to the west. Germany includes 16 [[constituent states|States of Germany]], covers an area of , and has a largely temperate seasonal climate. With nearly 83 million inhabitants, it is the second most populous state of [[Europe|Europe]] after [[Russia|Russia]], the most populous state lying entirely in Europe, as well as the most populous [[member state|member state of the European Union]] of the [[European Union|European Union]]. Germany is a very [[decentralized|decentralized]] country. Its [[capital|capital city]] and [[largest|List of cities in Germany by population]] metropolis is [[Berlin|Berlin]], while [[Frankfurt|Frankfurt]] serves as its financial capital and has the country's busiest [[airport|Frankfurt Airport]]. Germany's largest urban area is the [[Ruhr|Ruhr]], with its main centres of [[Dortmund|Dortmund]] and [[Essen|Essen]]. The country's other major cities are [[Hamburg|Hamburg]], [[Munich|Munich]], [[Cologne|Cologne]], [[Stuttgart|Stuttgart]], [[Düsseldorf|Düsseldorf]], [[Leipzig|Leipzig]], [[Dresden|Dresden]], [[Bremen|Bremen]], [[Hannover|Hannover]], and [[Nuremberg|Nuremberg]].
title: Germany

abstract: Guinea-Bissau was once part of the kingdom of [[Gabu|Kaabu]], as well as part of the [[Mali Empire|Mali Empire]]. Parts of this kingdom persisted until the 18th century, while a few others were under some rule by the [[Portuguese Empire|Portuguese Empire]] since the 16th century. In the 19th century, it was colonized as [[Portuguese Guinea|Portuguese Guinea]]. Upon independence, declared in 1973 and recognised in 1974, the name of its capital, [[Bissau|Bissau]], was added to the country's name to prevent confusion with [[Guinea|Guinea]] (formerly [[French Guinea|French Guinea]]). Guinea-Bissau has a history of political instability since independence, and no elected president has successfully served a full five-year term.
title: Guinea-Bissau

abstract: The Netherlands (, ) is a country located mainly in [[Northwestern Europe|Northwestern Europe]]. Together with three island territories in the [[Caribbean|Caribbean Netherlands]] ([[Bonaire|Bonaire]], [[Sint Eustatius|Sint Eustatius]] and [[Saba|Saba]]), it forms a [[constituent country|Constituent state]] of the [[Kingdom of the Netherlands|Kingdom of the Netherlands]]. The European portion of the Netherlands consists of [[twelve provinces|Provinces of the Netherlands]] and borders [[Germany|Germany]] to the east, [[Belgium|Belgium]] to the south and the [[North Sea|North Sea]] to the northwest, with [[maritime borders|Maritime boundary]] in the North Sea with Belgium, Germany and the [[United Kingdom|United Kingdom]]. The five largest cities in the Netherlands are [[Amsterdam|Amsterdam]], [[Rotterdam|Rotterdam]], [[The Hague|The Hague]], [[Utrecht|Utrecht]] and [[Eindhoven|Eindhoven]]. Amsterdam is the [[country's capital|Capital of the Netherlands]], while The Hague holds the seat of the [[States General|States General of the Netherlands]], [[Cabinet|Cabinet of the Netherlands]] and [[Supreme Court|Supreme Court of the Netherlands]]. The [[Port of Rotterdam|Port of Rotterdam]] is the largest port in [[Europe|Europe]] and the largest outside Asia.
title: Netherlands

abstract: Nicaragua (; ), officially the Republic of Nicaragua (), is the largest country in the [[Central America|Central American]] [[isthmus|isthmus]], bordered by [[Honduras|Honduras]] to the northwest, the [[Caribbean|Caribbean Sea]] to the east, [[Costa Rica|Costa Rica]] to the south, and the [[Pacific Ocean|Pacific Ocean]] to the southwest. [[Managua|Managua]] is the country's capital and largest city and is also the third-largest city in [[Central America|Central America]], behind [[Tegucigalpa|Tegucigalpa]] and [[Guatemala City|Guatemala City]]. The multi-ethnic population of six million includes people of indigenous, European, African, and Asian heritage. The main language is Spanish. Indigenous tribes on the [[Mosquito Coast|Mosquito Coast]] speak their own languages and English.
title: Nicaragua

abstract: Malawi (, or ; or [[[maláwi|International Phonetic Alphabet]]]), officially the Republic of Malawi, is a [[landlocked country|landlocked country]] in southeast [[Africa|Africa]] that was formerly known as [[Nyasaland|Nyasaland]]. It is bordered by [[Zambia|Zambia]] to the northwest, [[Tanzania|Tanzania]] to the northeast, and [[Mozambique|Mozambique]] on the east, south and west. Malawi is over with an estimated population of (as at July ). [[Lake Malawi|Lake Malawi]] takes up about a third of Malawi's area. Its capital is [[Lilongwe|Lilongwe]], which is also Malawi's largest city; the second largest is [[Blantyre|Blantyre]], the third is [[Mzuzu|Mzuzu]] and the fourth largest is its old capital [[Zomba|Zomba, Malawi]]. The name Malawi comes from the [[Maravi|Maravi]], an old name of the [[Nyanja people|Nyanja people]] that inhabit the area. The country is also nicknamed "The Warm Heart of Africa".
title: Malawi

abstract: Present-day Mali was once part of three West [[African empires|African empires]] that controlled [[trans-Saharan trade|trans-Saharan trade]]: the [[Ghana Empire|Ghana Empire]], the [[Mali Empire|Mali Empire]] (for which Mali is named), and the [[Songhai Empire|Songhai Empire]]. During its golden age, there was a flourishing of mathematics, [[astronomy|astronomy]], literature, and art.
