At its peak in 1300, the Mali Empire covered an area about twice the size of modern-day [[France|France]] and stretched to the west coast of Africa. In the late 19th century, during the [[Scramble for Africa|Scramble for Africa]], France seized control of Mali, making it a part of [[French Sudan|French Sudan]]. French Sudan (then known as the Sudanese Republic) joined with [[Senegal|Senegal]] in 1959, achieving independence in 1960 as the [[Mali Federation|Mali Federation]]. Shortly thereafter, following Senegal's withdrawal from the federation, the Sudanese Republic declared itself the independent Republic of Mali. After a long period of one-party rule, a coup in 1991 led to the writing of a new constitution and the establishment of Mali as a democratic, multi-party state.
title: Mali

abstract: Malta (, ; ), officially known as the Republic of Malta (), is a Southern European [[island country|island country]] consisting of an [[archipelago|archipelago]] in the [[Mediterranean Sea|Mediterranean Sea]]. It lies south of [[Italy|Italy]], east of [[Tunisia|Tunisia]], and north of [[Libya|Libya]]. With a population of about 475,000 over an area of , Malta is the [[world's tenth smallest|List of countries and dependencies by area]] and [[fifth most densely-populated|List of countries and dependencies by population density]] country. Its capital is [[Valletta|Valletta]], which is the smallest national capital in the [[European Union|European Union]] by area at 0.8   km.2 The official languages are [[Maltese|Maltese language]] and English, with Maltese officially recognised as the national language and the only [[Semitic language|Semitic language]] in the European Union.
title: Malta

abstract: Mauritius (; ), officially the Republic of Mauritius (), is an [[island nation|island nation]] in the [[Indian Ocean|Indian Ocean]]. The main Island of Mauritius is located about 2,000 kilometres (1,200   mi) off the southeast coast of the [[Africa|African]] continent. The Republic of Mauritius includes the islands of [[Rodrigues|Rodrigues]], [[Agalega|Agalega]] and [[St. Brandon|St. Brandon]]. The capital and largest city [[Port Louis|Port Louis]] is located on the main island of Mauritius.
title: Mauritius

abstract: Moldova (, sometimes ), officially the Republic of Moldova (), is a [[landlocked|landlocked]] country in [[Eastern Europe|Eastern Europe]], bordered by [[Romania|Romania]] to the west and [[Ukraine|Ukraine]] to the north, east, and south. The capital city is [[Chișinău|Chișinău]].
title: Moldova

abstract: Jamaica () is an [[island country|island country]] situated in the [[Caribbean Sea|Caribbean Sea]]. Spanning in area, it is the third-largest island of the [[Greater Antilles|Greater Antilles]] and the fourth-largest island country in the [[Caribbean|Caribbean]]. Jamaica lies about south of [[Cuba|Cuba]], and west of [[Hispaniola|Hispaniola]] (the island containing the countries of [[Haiti|Haiti]] and the [[Dominican Republic|Dominican Republic]]).
title: Jamaica

abstract: Luxembourg (; ; ; ), officially the Grand Duchy of Luxembourg, is a small [[landlocked country|landlocked country]] in western Europe. It is bordered by [[Belgium|Belgium]] to the west and north, [[Germany|Germany]] to the east, and [[France|France]] to the south. Its capital, [[Luxembourg City|Luxembourg City]], together with [[Brussels|Brussels]] and [[Strasbourg|Strasbourg]], is one of the three official capitals of the [[European Union|European Union]] and the seat of the [[European Court of Justice|European Court of Justice]], the highest judicial authority in the EU. Its culture, people, and languages are highly intertwined with its neighbours, making it essentially a mixture of [[French|French culture]] and [[German|German culture]] cultures, as evident by the nation's three [[official language|official languages]]: [[French|French language]], [[German|German language]], and the [[national language|national language]], [[Luxembourgish|Luxembourgish]] (sometimes considered a dialect of German). The repeated invasions by Germany, especially in [[World War II|Luxembourg in World War II]], resulted in the country's strong will for mediation between France and Germany and, among other things, led to the foundation of the European Union.
title: Luxembourg

abstract: Madagascar (; ), officially the Republic of Madagascar ( ; ), and previously known as the [[Malagasy Republic|Malagasy Republic]], is an [[island country|island country]] in the [[Indian Ocean|Indian Ocean]], approximately 250 miles off the coast of [[East Africa|East Africa]]. The nation comprises the island of [[Madagascar|Geography of Madagascar]] (the fourth-[[largest island|List of islands by area]] in the world) and numerous smaller peripheral islands. Following the prehistoric breakup of the [[supercontinent|supercontinent]] [[Gondwana|Gondwana]], Madagascar split from the [[Indian subcontinent|Indian peninsula]] around 88   million years ago, allowing native plants and animals to evolve in relative isolation. Consequently, Madagascar is a [[biodiversity hotspot|biodiversity hotspot]]; over 90% of [[its wildlife|wildlife of Madagascar]] is found nowhere else on Earth. The island's diverse ecosystems and unique wildlife are threatened by the encroachment of the rapidly growing human population and other environmental threats.
title: Madagascar

abstract: Romania ( ; ) is a country located at the crossroads of [[Central|Central Europe]], [[Eastern|Eastern Europe]], and [[Southeastern Europe|Southeast Europe]]. It borders the [[Black Sea|Black Sea]] to the southeast, [[Bulgaria|Bulgaria]] to the south, [[Ukraine|Ukraine]] to the north, [[Hungary|Hungary]] to the west, [[Serbia|Serbia]] to the southwest, and [[Moldova|Moldova]] to the east. It has a predominantly [[temperate|temperate climate]]-[[continental climate|continental climate]]. With a total area of 238,397 square kilometres (92,046   sq   mi), Romania is the [[12th largest country|List of European countries by area]] and also the [[7th most populous|List of European Union member states by population]] member state of the [[European Union|European Union]], having almost 20 million inhabitants. Its capital and largest city is [[Bucharest|Bucharest]] and other major [[urban areas|Metropolitan areas in Romania]] include [[Cluj-Napoca|Cluj-Napoca]], [[Timișoara|Timișoara]], [[Iași|Iași]], [[Constanța|Constanța]], [[Craiova|Craiova]], or [[Brașov|Brașov]].
title: Romania

abstract: The United States Minor Outlying Islands are a statistical designation defined by the [[International Organization for Standardization|International Organization for Standardization]]'s [[ISO 3166-1|ISO 3166-1]] code. The entry code is [[ISO 3166-2:UM|ISO 3166-2:UM]]. The minor outlying islands and groups of islands consist of eight [[United States|United States]] [[insular areas|insular area]] in the [[Pacific Ocean|Pacific Ocean]] ([[Baker Island|Baker Island]], [[Howland Island|Howland Island]], [[Jarvis Island|Jarvis Island]], [[Johnston Atoll|Johnston Atoll]], [[Kingman Reef|Kingman Reef]], [[Midway Atoll|Midway Atoll]], [[Palmyra Atoll|Palmyra Atoll]], and [[Wake Island|Wake Island]]) and one in the [[Caribbean Sea|Caribbean Sea]] ([[Navassa Island|Navassa Island]]).
title: United States Minor Outlying Islands

abstract: The [[establishment|Growth of the Old Swiss Confederacy]] of the [[Old Swiss Confederacy|Old Swiss Confederacy]] dates to the late medieval period, resulting from a series of military successes against [[Austria|Duchy of Austria]] and [[Burgundy|Duchy of Burgundy]]. Swiss independence from the [[Holy Roman Empire|Holy Roman Empire]] was formally recognized in the [[Peace of Westphalia|Peace of Westphalia]] in 1648. The country has a history of [[armed neutrality|armed neutrality]] going back to the [[Reformation|Swiss Reformation]]; it has not been in a state of war internationally since 1815 and did not join the [[United Nations|United Nations]] until 2002. Nevertheless, it pursues an active foreign policy and is frequently involved in peace-building processes around the world. In addition to being the birthplace of the [[Red Cross|International Committee of the Red Cross]], Switzerland is home to numerous international organisations, including the [[second largest UN office|United Nations Office at Geneva]]. On the European level, it is a founding member of the [[European Free Trade Association|European Free Trade Association]], but notably not part of the [[European Union|European Union]], the [[European Economic Area|European Economic Area]] or the [[Eurozone|Eurozone]]. However, it participates in the [[Schengen Area|Schengen Area]] and the [[European Single Market|European Single Market]] through bilateral treaties.
title: Switzerland

abstract: Sri Lanka (, ; ; Ilaṅkai), officially the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka, is an [[island country|island country]] in [[South Asia|South Asia]], located in the [[Indian Ocean|Indian Ocean]] to the southwest of the [[Bay of Bengal|Bay of Bengal]] and to the southeast of the [[Arabian Sea|Arabian Sea]]. The island is historically and culturally intertwined with the [[Indian subcontinent|Indian subcontinent]], but is geographically separated from the Indian subcontinent by the [[Gulf of Mannar|Gulf of Mannar]] and the [[Palk Strait|Palk Strait]]. The [[legislative capital|Capital city]], [[Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte|Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte]], is a suburb of the commercial capital and largest city, [[Colombo|Colombo]].
title: Sri Lanka

abstract: Suriname (, US also , also sometimes spelled Surinam), officially known as the Republic of Suriname ( ), is a country on the northeastern [[Atlantic|Atlantic]] coast of South America. [[It is bordered|Borders of Suriname]] by the Atlantic Ocean to the north, [[French Guiana|French Guiana]] to the east, [[Guyana|Guyana]] to the west and [[Brazil|Brazil]] to the south. At just under , it is the smallest [[sovereign state|sovereign state]] in South America. Suriname has a population of approximately , most of whom live on the country's north coast, in and around the capital and largest city, [[Paramaribo|Paramaribo]].
title: Suriname

abstract: Slovakia (; ), officially the Slovak Republic (, ), is a [[landlocked country|landlocked country]] in [[Central Europe|Central Europe]]. It is bordered by [[Poland|Poland]] to the north, [[Ukraine|Ukraine]] to the east, [[Hungary|Hungary]] to the south, [[Austria|Austria]] to the west, and the [[Czech Republic|Czech Republic]] to the northwest. Slovakia's territory spans about and is mostly mountainous. The population is over 5.4 million and consists mostly of [[Slovaks|Slovaks]]. The capital and largest city is [[Bratislava|Bratislava]], and the second largest city is [[Košice|Košice]]. The [[official language|official language]] is [[Slovak|Slovak language]].
title: Slovakia

abstract: Its land area is with a population of about . [[Mata-Utu|Mata-Utu]] is the capital and biggest city. The territory is made up of three main [[volcanic|volcano]] [[tropical island|tropical islands]] along with a number of tiny [[islets|islets]], and is split into two island groups that lie about apart, namely the [[Wallis Island|Wallis Islands]] (Uvea) in the northeast, and the [[Hoorn Islands|Hoorn Islands]] (also known as the Futuna Islands) in the southwest, including [[Futuna Island|Futuna Island, Wallis and Futuna]] proper and the mostly uninhabited [[Alofi Island|Alofi Island]].
title: Wallis and Futuna

abstract: The country derives its name literally from [[Saint Marinus|Saint Marinus]], a [[stonemason|Stonemasonry]] originating from the [[Roman|Roman Empire]] colony on the island of [[Rab|Rab]], in modern-day [[Croatia|Croatia]]. In AD 257, Marinus, according to legend, participated in the reconstruction of [[Rimini|Rimini]]'s city walls after their destruction by [[Liburnian|Liburnians]] [[pirates|pirates]]. Marinus then went on to found an independent monastic community on [[Monte Titano|Monte Titano]] in AD 301; thus, San Marino lays claim to be the oldest extant sovereign state as well as the oldest constitutional [[republic|republic]].
title: San Marino

abstract: Tajikistan (, ; ), officially the Republic of Tajikistan (, Jumhuriyi Tojikiston), is a mountainous, [[landlocked|landlocked]] country in [[Central Asia|Central Asia]] with an area of and an estimated population of million people as of . It is bordered by [[Afghanistan|Afghanistan]] to the south, [[Uzbekistan|Uzbekistan]] to the west, [[Kyrgyzstan|Kyrgyzstan]] to the north, and [[China|China]] to the east. The traditional homelands of the [[Tajik people|Tajiks]] include present-day Tajikistan as well as parts of Afghanistan and Uzbekistan.
title: Tajikistan

abstract: The Turks and Caicos Islands ( and ), or TCI for short, are a [[British Overseas Territory|British Overseas Territory]] consisting of the larger Caicos Islands and smaller Turks Islands, two groups of [[tropical island|tropical islands]] in the [[Lucayan Archipelago|Lucayan Archipelago]] of the [[Atlantic Ocean|Atlantic Ocean]] and northern [[West Indies|West Indies]]. They are known primarily for tourism and as an [[offshore financial centre|offshore financial centre]]. The resident population is 31,458 of whom 23,769 live on [[Providenciales|Providenciales]] in the Caicos Islands. It is the third largest of the British overseas territories by population.
title: Turks and Caicos Islands

abstract: Georgia (, ) is a [[country|sovereign state]] in the [[Caucasus|Caucasus]] region of [[Eurasia|Eurasia]]. Located at [[the crossroads|Europe–Asia border]] of [[Western Asia|Western Asia]] and [[Eastern Europe|Eastern Europe]], it is bounded to the west by the [[Black Sea|Black Sea]], to the north by [[Russia|Russia]], to the south by Turkey and [[Armenia|Armenia]], and to the southeast by [[Azerbaijan|Azerbaijan]]. The [[capital|capital city]] and [[largest city|List of cities and towns in Georgia (country)]] is [[Tbilisi|Tbilisi]]. Georgia covers a territory of , and its 2017 population is about 3.718   million. Georgia is a [[unitary|unitary state]] [[semi-presidential|Semi-presidential system]] [[republic|republic]], with the government elected through a [[representative democracy|representative democracy]].
title: Georgia (country)

abstract: South Ossetia (, less commonly ), officially the Republic of South Ossetia – the State of Alania, or The Tskhinvali Region, is a [[disputed territory|International recognition of Abkhazia and South Ossetia]] in the [[South Caucasus|South Caucasus]], in the northern part of the internationally recognised [[Georgian|Georgia (country)]] territory. It has a population of 53,000 people who live in an area of 3,900   km2, south of the [[Russian Caucasus|North Caucasian Federal District]], with 30,000 living in [[Tskhinvali|Tskhinvali]]. The separatist polity, [[Republic of South Ossetia|Government of South Ossetia]] (or the State of Alania), is [[recognised as a state|International recognition of Abkhazia and South Ossetia]] by [[Russia|Russia]], [[Venezuela|Venezuela]], [[Nicaragua|Nicaragua]], [[Nauru|Nauru]], and [[Syria|Syria]]. While Georgia lacks control over South Ossetia, the [[Georgian government|Government of Georgia (country)]] and most members of the [[United Nations|United Nations]] consider the territory part of [[Georgia|Georgia (country)]], whose constitution designates the area as "the former autonomous district of South Ossetia", in reference to the [[former Soviet autonomous oblast|South Ossetian Autonomous Oblast]] disbanded in 1990.
title: South Ossetia

abstract: The Principality of Seborga () is an [[unrecognized state|List of states with limited recognition]] that claims a area located in the northwestern [[Italian|Italy]] [[Province of Imperia|Province of Imperia]] in [[Liguria|Liguria]], near the [[French|France]] border, and about from [[Monaco|Monaco]]. The principality is in coexistence with, and claims the territory of, the town of [[Seborga|Seborga]].
title: Principality of Seborga

abstract: Transnistria, officially the Pridnestrovian Moldavian Republic, is an [[unrecognised state|List of states with limited recognition]] which split off from [[Moldova|Moldova]] after the dissolution of the [[USSR|USSR]] and mostly consists of a narrow strip of land between the river [[Dniester|Dniester]] and the territory of [[Ukraine|Ukraine]]. Transnistria [[has been recognised|Foreign relations of Transnistria]] only by three other mostly non-recognised states: [[Abkhazia|Abkhazia]], [[Artsakh|Republic of Artsakh]], and [[South Ossetia|South Ossetia]]. The region is considered by the [[UN|UN]] to be part of [[Moldova|Moldova]].
title: Transnistria

abstract: Iraqi Kurdistan, officially called the Kurdistan Region of Iraq () by the Iraqi constitution, is an [[autonomous region|autonomous region]] located in northern [[Iraq|Iraq]]. It is also referred to as Southern Kurdistan (), as [[Kurds|Kurds]] generally consider it to be one of the four parts of [[Greater Kurdistan|Greater Kurdistan]], which also includes parts of southeastern [[Turkey|Turkey]] ([[Northern Kurdistan|Northern Kurdistan]]), northern [[Syria|Syria]] ([[Rojava|Rojava]] or Western Kurdistan), and northwestern [[Iran|Iran]] ([[Eastern Kurdistan|Eastern Kurdistan]]).
title: Iraqi Kurdistan

abstract: France (), officially the French Republic (, ), is a country whose territory consists of [[metropolitan France|metropolitan France]] in [[Western Europe|Western Europe]] and [[several overseas regions and territories|Overseas France]]. The metropolitan area of France extends from the [[Mediterranean Sea|Mediterranean Sea]] to the [[English Channel|English Channel]] and the [[North Sea|North Sea]], and from the [[Rhine|Rhine]] to the [[Atlantic Ocean|Atlantic Ocean]]. It is bordered by [[Belgium|Belgium]], [[Luxembourg|Luxembourg]] and [[Germany|Germany]] to the northeast, [[Switzerland|Switzerland]] and [[Italy|Italy]] to the east, and [[Andorra|Andorra]] and [[Spain|Spain]] to the south. The overseas territories include [[French Guiana|French Guiana]] in [[South America|South America]] and several islands in the Atlantic, [[Pacific|Pacific Ocean]] and [[Indian|Indian Ocean]] oceans. The country's [[18 integral regions|regions of France]] (five of which are situated overseas) span a combined area of and a total population of 67.3 million (). France, a [[sovereign state|sovereign state]], is a [[unitary|unitary state]] [[semi-presidential|Semi-presidential system]] [[republic|republic]] with its [[capital|Capital city]] in [[Paris|Paris]], the country's largest city and main cultural and commercial centre. Other major [[urban areas|Urban area (France)]] include [[Lyon|Lyon]], [[Marseille|Marseille]], [[Toulouse|Toulouse]], [[Bordeaux|Bordeaux]], [[Lille|Lille]] and [[Nice|Nice]].
title: France

abstract: In 1704, Anglo-Dutch forces [[captured Gibraltar|Capture of Gibraltar]] from [[Spain|Spain]] during the [[War of the Spanish Succession|War of the Spanish Succession]] on behalf of the [[Habsburg|Habsburg]] claim to the Spanish throne. The territory was ceded to [[Great Britain|Kingdom of Great Britain]] in perpetuity under the [[Treaty of Utrecht|Treaty of Utrecht]] in 1713. During World War II it was an important base for the [[Royal Navy|Royal Navy]] as it controlled the entrance and exit to the [[Mediterranean Sea|Mediterranean Sea]], which is only wide at this naval [[choke point|choke point]]. It remains strategically important, with half the world's seaborne trade passing through the strait. Today Gibraltar's economy is based largely on tourism, online gambling, financial services and cargo ship refuelling.
title: Gibraltar

abstract: Syria is a [[unitary|unitary state]] [[republic|republic]] consisting of [[14 governorates|Governorates of Syria]] and is the only country that politically espouses [[Ba'athism|Ba'athism]]. It is a member of one international organization other than the United Nations, the [[Non-Aligned Movement|Non-Aligned Movement]]; it has become suspended from the [[Arab League|Arab League]] on November 2011 and the [[Organisation of Islamic Cooperation|Organisation of Islamic Cooperation]], and self-suspended from the [[Union for the Mediterranean|Union for the Mediterranean]].
title: Syria

abstract: The Republic of Artsakh (; , ), or simply Artsakh, also known by its official name between 1991 and 2017, the Nagorno-Karabakh Republic (), is a [[de facto|de facto]] independent country in the [[South Caucasus|South Caucasus]] that is internationally recognized as part of [[Azerbaijan|Azerbaijan]]. The region is populated mostly by Armenians and the primary spoken language is Armenian. Artsakh controls most of the territory of the former [[Nagorno-Karabakh Autonomous Oblast|Nagorno-Karabakh Autonomous Oblast]] and [[some of the surrounding area|Armenian-controlled territories surrounding Nagorno Karabakh]], giving it a border with [[Armenia|Armenia]] to the west and [[Iran|Iran]] to the south. Its capital is [[Stepanakert|Stepanakert]].
title: Republic of Artsakh

abstract: Bahrain (; ), officially the Kingdom of Bahrain ( ), is an [[island country|island country]] in the [[Persian Gulf|Persian Gulf]]. The [[sovereign state|sovereign state]] comprises a small [[archipelago|archipelago]] centered around [[Bahrain Island|Bahrain Island]], situated between the [[Qatar|Qatar]] peninsula and the north eastern coast of [[Saudi Arabia|Saudi Arabia]], to which it is connected by the [[King Fahd Causeway|King Fahd Causeway]]. Bahrain's population is 1,234,571 (c. 2010), including 666,172 non-nationals. It is in size, making it the [[third-smallest nation|List of countries and dependencies by area]] in Asia after the [[Maldives|Maldives]] and [[Singapore|Singapore]].
title: Bahrain

abstract: Cuba (; ), officially the Republic of Cuba (), is a country comprising the island of Cuba as well as [[Isla de la Juventud|Isla de la Juventud]] and several minor [[archipelagos|archipelagos]]. Cuba is located in the northern [[Caribbean|Caribbean]] where the [[Caribbean Sea|Caribbean Sea]], [[Gulf of Mexico|Gulf of Mexico]] and [[Atlantic Ocean|Atlantic Ocean]] meet. It is east of the [[Yucatán Peninsula|Yucatán Peninsula]] ([[Mexico|Mexico]]), south of both the [[U.S.|United States]] state of [[Florida|Florida]] and [[the Bahamas|the Bahamas]], west of [[Haiti|Haiti]] and north of both [[Jamaica|Jamaica]] and the [[Cayman Islands|Cayman Islands]]. [[Havana|Havana]] is the largest city and capital; other major cities include [[Santiago de Cuba|Santiago de Cuba]] and [[Camagüey|Camagüey]]. The area of the Republic of Cuba is ( without the territorial waters). The island of Cuba is the largest island in Cuba and in the Caribbean, with an area of , and the second-most populous after [[Hispaniola|Hispaniola]], with over 11 million inhabitants.
title: Cuba

abstract: [[Pre-Columbian Mexico|Pre-Columbian Mexico]] dates to about 8000 BC and is identified as one of five [[cradles of civilization|Cradle of civilization]] and was home to many advanced [[Mesoamerica|Mesoamerican]] civilizations such as the [[Olmec|Olmec]], [[Toltec|Toltec]], [[Teotihuacan|Teotihuacan]], [[Zapotec|Zapotec civilization]], [[Maya|Maya civilization]], and [[Aztec|Aztec]] before [[first contact|First contact (anthropology)]] with [[Europe|Europeans]]. In 1521, the [[Spanish Empire|Spanish Empire]] [[conquered and colonized|Spanish conquest of the Aztec Empire]] the territory from its politically powerful base in [[Mexico-Tenochtitlan|Mexico-Tenochtitlan]] (part of Mexico City), which was administered as the [[viceroyalty of New Spain|New Spain]]. Three centuries later, the territory became a [[nation state|nation state]] following its recognition in 1821 after the [[Mexican War of Independence|Mexican War of Independence]]. The post-independence period was tumultuous, characterized by [[economic inequality|Economic history of Mexico#Independence]] and many contrasting political changes. The [[Mexican–American War|Mexican–American War]] (1846–1848) led to a [[territorial cession|Territorial evolution of Mexico]] of the extant northern territories to the United States. The [[Pastry War|Pastry War]], the [[Franco-Mexican War|Franco-Mexican War]], a [[civil war|Reform War]], [[two empires|Emperor of Mexico]], and the [[Porfiriato|Porfirio Díaz#The Porfiriato]] occurred in the 19th century. The Porfiriato was ended by the start of the [[Mexican Revolution|Mexican Revolution]] in 1910, which culminated with the promulgation of the [[1917 Constitution|Constitution of Mexico]] and the emergence of the country's current [[political system|Politics of Mexico]] as a [[federal|federal republic]], [[democratic republic|democratic republic]].
title: Mexico

abstract: Guatemala ( ; ), officially the Republic of Guatemala (), is a country in [[Central America|Central America]] bordered by [[Mexico|Mexico]] to the north and west, [[Belize|Belize]] and the [[Caribbean|Caribbean Sea]] to the northeast, [[Honduras|Honduras]] to the east, [[El Salvador|El Salvador]] to the southeast and the [[Pacific Ocean|Pacific Ocean]] to the south. With an estimated population of around million, it is the most populated country in Central America. Guatemala is a [[representative democracy|representative democracy]]; its capital and largest city is Nueva Guatemala de la Asunción, also known as [[Guatemala City|Guatemala City]].
title: Guatemala

abstract: Estonia ( ), officially the Republic of Estonia (), is a country in [[Northern Europe|Northern Europe]]. It is bordered to the north by the [[Gulf of Finland|Gulf of Finland]] with [[Finland|Finland]] on the other side, to the west by the [[Baltic Sea|Baltic Sea]] with [[Sweden|Sweden]] on the other side, to the south by [[Latvia|Latvia]] (343   km), and to the east by [[Lake Peipus|Lake Peipus]] and [[Russia|Russia]] (338.6   km). The territory of Estonia consists of a mainland and 2,222 islands in the Baltic Sea, covering a total area of , water , land area , and is influenced by a [[humid continental climate|humid continental climate]]. The official language of the country, [[Estonian|Estonian language]], is the second most spoken [[Finnic language|Finnic languages]].
title: Estonia

abstract: Almost all inhabited French administrative divisions outside Europe are classified as either [[overseas region|overseas regions]] or [[overseas collectivities|overseas collectivity]]; these statuses are very different from one another from a legal and administrative standpoint. Overseas regions have exactly the same status as mainland France's regions. The French constitution provides that, in general, French laws and regulations (France's civil code, penal code, administrative law, social laws, tax laws, etc.) apply to French overseas regions the same as in mainland France, but can be adapted as needed to suit the region's particular needs. Hence, the local administrations of French overseas regions cannot themselves pass new laws, whereas the overseas collectivities are empowered to make their own laws, except in certain areas reserved to the French national government (such as defense, international relations, trade and currency, and judicial and administrative law). The overseas collectivities are governed by local elected assemblies and by the French Parliament and [[French government|Political system of France#Executive branch]], with a [[cabinet member|French government ministers]], the [[Minister of Overseas France|Ministry of Overseas France]], in charge of issues related to the overseas territories. ([[New Caledonia|New Caledonia]] is neither an overseas region nor an overseas collectivity; it has a sui generis status, in keeping with the [[Nouméa Accord|Nouméa Accord]].)
title: Overseas France

abstract: The Sahrawi Republic (), officially the Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic (SADR; also [[romanized|Romanization of Arabic]] with Saharawi; ; ), is a [[partially recognized state|List of states with limited recognition]] that claims the [[non-self-governing territory|non-self-governing territory]] of [[Western Sahara|Western Sahara]], but controls only [[the easternmost one-fifth of that territory|Free Zone (region)]]. Until 1976, Western Sahara was known as [[Spanish Sahara|Spanish Sahara]], a [[Spanish colony|Spanish colony]] (later an [[overseas province|overseas province]]).
title: Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic

abstract: Carriacou and Petite Martinique is a dependency of [[Grenada|Grenada]], lying north of [[Grenada|Grenada]] island and south of [[Saint Vincent and the Grenadines|Saint Vincent and the Grenadines]] in the [[Lesser Antilles|Lesser Antilles]]. The [[Grenadine Islands|Grenadines]] to the north of Carriacou and Petite Martinique belong to the nation of [[St. Vincent and the Grenadines|St. Vincent and the Grenadines]].
title: Carriacou and Petite Martinique

abstract: Ethiopia (; , , ), [[Somali|Somali language]]: Itoobiya, [[Oromo|Oromo language]]: Itiyoophiyaa, [[Hebrew|Hebrew language]]: אתיופיה -officially the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia (, ), is a country in the northeastern part of Africa, popularly known as the [[Horn of Africa|Horn of Africa]]. It shares borders with [[Eritrea|Eritrea]] to the north, [[Djibouti|Djibouti]] to the northwest, to the northeast [[Somaliland|Somaliland]], and [[Somalia|Somalia]] to the east, [[Sudan|Sudan]] and [[South Sudan|South Sudan]] to the west, and [[Kenya|Kenya]] to the south. With over million inhabitants, Ethiopia is the most populous [[landlocked country|landlocked country]] in the world and the second-most populous nation on the [[African continent|African continent]]. It occupies a total area of , and its capital and largest city is [[Addis Ababa|Addis Ababa]].
title: Ethiopia

abstract: Kenya (; ), officially the Republic of Kenya (), is a country in [[Africa|Africa]] with its capital and largest city in [[Nairobi|Nairobi]]. Kenya's territory lies on the [[equator|equator]] and overlies the [[East African Rift|East African Rift]], covering a diverse and expansive terrain that extends roughly from [[Lake Victoria|Lake Victoria]] to [[Lake Turkana|Lake Turkana]] (formerly called [[Lake Rudolf|Lake Rudolf]]) and further south-east to the [[Indian Ocean|Indian Ocean]]. It is bordered by [[Tanzania|Tanzania]] to the south and south-west, [[Uganda|Uganda]] to the west, [[South Sudan|South Sudan]] to the north-west, [[Ethiopia|Ethiopia]] to the north and [[Somalia|Somalia]] to the north-east. Kenya covers has a population of approximately 48 million. Kenya's capital and largest city is [[Nairobi|Nairobi]], while its oldest city and first capital is the coastal city of [[Mombasa|Mombasa]]. [[Kisumu City|Kisumu]] is the third largest city and a critical inland port at Lake Victoria. Other important urban centres include [[Nakuru|Nakuru]] and [[Eldoret|Eldoret]].
title: Kenya

abstract: Vojvodina ([[Serbian|Serbian language]] and [[Croatian|Croatian language]]: ; ; [[Pannonian Rusyn|Pannonian Rusyn language]]: ; ; [[Slovak|Slovak language]] and [[Czech|Czech language]]: ; ), officially the Autonomous Province of Vojvodina ( / Autonomna Pokrajina Vojvodina; see [[Names in other languages|#Name]]), is an [[autonomous province|Autonomous administrative division]] of [[Serbia|Serbia]], located in the northern part of the country, in the [[Pannonian Plain|Pannonian Plain]].
title: Vojvodina

abstract: Saudi Arabia (, ; ), officially the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia (KSA; , ), is a country in [[Western Asia|Western Asia]] constituting the bulk of the [[Arabian Peninsula|Arabian Peninsula]]. With a land area of approximately , Saudi Arabia is the largest [[sovereign|sovereign state]] state in the [[Middle East|Middle East]], geographically the fifth-largest in [[Asia|Asia]], second-largest in the [[Arab world|Arab world]] after [[Algeria|Algeria]] and [[12th-largest in the world|List of countries and dependencies by area]]. Saudi Arabia is bordered by [[Jordan|Jordan]] and [[Iraq|Iraq]] to the north, [[Kuwait|Kuwait]] to the northeast, [[Qatar|Qatar]], [[Bahrain|Bahrain]], and the [[United Arab Emirates|United Arab Emirates]] to the east, [[Oman|Oman]] to the southeast and [[Yemen|Yemen]] to the south. It is separated from [[Israel|Israel]] and [[Egypt|Egypt]] by the [[Gulf of Aqaba|Gulf of Aqaba]]. It is the only nation with both a [[Red Sea|Red Sea]] coast and a [[Persian Gulf|Persian Gulf]] coast, and most of its terrain consists of arid desert, lowland and mountains. Saudi Arabia is the largest by size, population and [[economy|List of countries by GDP (nominal)]] in the Middle East as of October 2018 and the 18th largest in the world.
title: Saudi Arabia

abstract: The Herzegovina-Neretva Canton (; ) is one of 10 [[cantons|Cantons of the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina]] of the [[Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina|Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina]] in [[Bosnia and Herzegovina|Bosnia and Herzegovina]].
title: Herzegovina-Neretva Canton

abstract: Brazil ( ), officially the Federative Republic of Brazil (, ), is the largest country in both [[South America|South America]] and [[Latin America|Latin America]]. At 8.5   million square kilometers (3.2   million square miles) and with over 208 million people, Brazil is the world's [[fifth-largest country by area|list of countries and outlying territories by total area]] and the [[fifth most populous|list of countries by population]]. The capital is [[Brasília|Brasília]], and [[the most populated city|List of largest cities in Brazil]] is [[São Paulo|São Paulo]]. The federation is composed of the union of the 26 [[states|States of Brazil]], the [[Federal District|Federal District (Brazil)]], and the 5,570 [[municipalities|Municipalities of Brazil]]. It is the largest country to have [[Portuguese|Portuguese language]] as an [[official language|List of territorial entities where Portuguese is an official language]] and the only one in the [[Americas|Americas]]; it is also one of the most [[multicultural|Multiculturalism]] and ethnically diverse nations, due to over a century of mass [[immigration from around the world|Immigration to Brazil]].
title: Brazil

abstract: The Bahamas (), known officially as the Commonwealth of The Bahamas, is a country within the [[Lucayan Archipelago|Lucayan Archipelago]]. The [[archipelagic state|archipelagic state]] consists of more than 700 [[island|islands]], [[cay|cays]], and [[islet|islets]] in the [[Atlantic Ocean|Atlantic Ocean]], and is located north of [[Cuba|Cuba]] and [[Hispaniola|Hispaniola]] ([[Haiti|Haiti]] and the [[Dominican Republic|Dominican Republic]]), northwest of the [[Turks and Caicos Islands|Turks and Caicos Islands]], southeast of the [[United States|United States]] state of [[Florida|Florida]], and east of the [[Florida Keys|Florida Keys]]. The capital is [[Nassau|Nassau, Bahamas]] on the island of [[New Providence|New Providence]]. The designation of "the Bahamas" can refer either to the country or to the larger island chain that it shares with the [[Turks and Caicos Islands|Turks and Caicos Islands]]. The [[Royal Bahamas Defence Force|Royal Bahamas Defence Force]] describes the Bahamas territory as encompassing of ocean space.
title: The Bahamas

abstract: Burkina Faso (, ; ) is a [[landlocked country|landlocked country]] in [[West Africa|West Africa]]. It covers an area of around and is surrounded by six countries: [[Mali|Mali]] to the north; [[Niger|Niger]] to the east; [[Benin|Benin]] to the southeast; [[Togo|Togo]] and [[Ghana|Ghana]] to the south; and [[Ivory Coast|Ivory Coast]] to the southwest. The July 2018 population estimate by the [[United Nations|United Nations]] was 19,751,651. Burkina Faso is a [[francophone|francophone]] country, with [[French|French language]] as the official language of government and business. Roughly 40% of the population speaks the [[Mossi language|Mossi language]]. Formerly called the [[Republic of Upper Volta|Republic of Upper Volta]] (1958–1984), the country was [[renamed|Geographical renaming]] "Burkina Faso" on 4   August 1984 by then-President [[Thomas Sankara|Thomas Sankara]]. Its citizens are known as Burkinabé ( ). Its capital is [[Ouagadougou|Ouagadougou]].
title: Burkina Faso

abstract: Greece (), officially the Hellenic Republic (Greek: ), historically also known as Hellas (Greek: Ελλάς), is a country located in [[Southern|Southern Europe]] and [[Southeast Europe|Southeast Europe]], with a population of approximately million as of . [[Athens|Athens]] is the nation's capital and largest city, followed by [[Thessaloniki|Thessaloniki]].
title: Greece

abstract: Albania ( ; ; ), officially the Republic of Albania (, ), is a country in [[Southeast Europe|Southeast Europe]] on the [[Adriatic|Adriatic Sea]] and [[Ionian Sea|Ionian Sea]] within the [[Mediterranean Sea|Mediterranean Sea]]. It is otherwise bounded by [[Montenegro|Montenegro]] to the northwest, [[Kosovo|Kosovo]] to the northeast, the [[Republic of Macedonia|Republic of Macedonia]] to the east and [[Greece|Greece]] to the south and southeast.
title: Albania

abstract: Azerbaijan ( ; ), officially the Republic of Azerbaijan ( ), is a [[landlocked country|landlocked country]] in the [[South Caucasus|Transcaucasia]] region of [[Eurasia|Eurasia]] at the crossroads of [[Eastern Europe|Eastern Europe]] and [[Western Asia|Western Asia]]. It is bounded by the [[Caspian Sea|Caspian Sea]] to the east, [[Russia|Russia]] to the north, [[Georgia|Georgia (country)]] to the northwest, [[Armenia|Armenia]] to the west and [[Iran|Iran]] to the south. The [[exclave|exclave]] of [[Nakhchivan|Nakhchivan Autonomous Republic]] is bound by Armenia to the north and east, [[Iran|Iran]] to the south and west, and has an 11   km long border with [[Turkey|Turkey]] in the northwest.
title: Azerbaijan

abstract: Nauru ( or ; ), officially the Republic of Nauru () and formerly known as Pleasant Island, is an [[island country|island country]] in [[Micronesia|Micronesia]], a subregion of [[Oceania|Oceania]], in the [[Central Pacific|Pacific Ocean]]. Its nearest neighbour is [[Banaba Island|Banaba Island]] in [[Kiribati|Kiribati]], to the east. It further lies northwest of [[Tuvalu|Tuvalu]], north of the [[Solomon Islands|Solomon Islands]], east-northeast of [[Papua New Guinea|Papua New Guinea]], southeast of the [[Federated States of Micronesia|Federated States of Micronesia]] and south of the [[Marshall Islands|Marshall Islands]]. With residents in a area, Nauru is the smallest state in the [[South Pacific|Pacific Ocean]], smallest republic and [[third-smallest state by area in the world|list of countries and dependencies by area]], behind only [[Vatican City|Vatican City]] and [[Monaco|Monaco]].
title: Nauru

abstract: Poland ( ), officially the Republic of Poland ( ), is a country located in [[Central Europe|Central Europe]]. It is divided into 16 [[administrative subdivisions|Voivodeships of Poland]], covering an area of , and has a largely [[temperate seasonal|Temperate climate]] climate. With a population of approximately 38.5   million people, Poland is the sixth most populous [[member state of the European Union|member state of the European Union]]. Poland's capital and largest [[metropolis|List of cities and towns in Poland]] is [[Warsaw|Warsaw]]. Other major cities include [[Kraków|Kraków]], [[Łódź|Łódź]], [[Wrocław|Wrocław]], [[Poznań|Poznań]], [[Gdańsk|Gdańsk]], and [[Szczecin|Szczecin]].
title: Poland

abstract: Papua New Guinea (PNG; , ; ; ), officially the Independent State of Papua New Guinea, is an [[Oceania|Oceanian]] country that occupies the eastern half of the island of [[New Guinea|New Guinea]] and its offshore islands in [[Melanesia|Melanesia]], a region of the southwestern [[Pacific Ocean|Pacific Ocean]] north of Australia. Its capital, located along its southeastern coast, is [[Port Moresby|Port Moresby]]. The [[western half of New Guinea|Western New Guinea]] forms the [[Indonesia|Indonesian]] provinces of [[Papua|Papua (province)]] and [[West Papua|West Papua (province)]].
title: Papua New Guinea

abstract: The Philippines ( ; or ), officially the Republic of the Philippines (), is an [[archipelagic country|archipelagic state]] in [[Southeast Asia|Southeast Asia]]. Situated in the western Pacific Ocean, it consists of about 7,641 islands that are categorized broadly under three main geographical divisions from north to south: [[Luzon|Luzon]], [[Visayas|Visayas]], and [[Mindanao|Mindanao]]. The capital city of the Philippines is [[Manila|Manila]] and the most populous city is [[Quezon City|Quezon City]], both part of [[Metro Manila|Metro Manila]]. Bounded by the [[South China Sea|South China Sea]] on the west, the [[Philippine Sea|Philippine Sea]] on the east and the [[Celebes Sea|Celebes Sea]] on the southwest, the Philippines shares maritime borders with [[Taiwan|Taiwan]] to the north, [[Vietnam|Vietnam]] to the west, [[Palau|Palau]] to the east and [[Malaysia|Malaysia]] and [[Indonesia|Indonesia]] to the south.
title: Philippines

abstract: Myanmar (below[Myanmar#English pronunciations of Myanmar]; ), officially the Republic of the Union of Myanmar and also known as Burma, is a country in Southeast Asia. Myanmar is bordered by [[India|India]] and [[Bangladesh|Bangladesh]] to its west, [[Thailand|Thailand]] and [[Laos|Laos]] to its east and [[China|People's Republic of China]] to its north and northeast. To its south, about one third of Myanmar's total perimeter of forms an uninterrupted coastline of along the [[Bay of Bengal|Bay of Bengal]] and the [[Andaman Sea|Andaman Sea]]. The country's [[2014 census|2014 Burma Census]] counted the population to be 51 million people. As of 2017, the population is about 54 million. Myanmar is in size. Its capital city is [[Naypyidaw|Naypyidaw]], and its largest city and former capital is [[Yangon|Yangon]] (Rangoon). Myanmar has been a member of the [[Association of Southeast Asian Nations|Association of Southeast Asian Nations]] (ASEAN) since 1997.
title: Myanmar

abstract: Lithuania (; ), officially the Republic of Lithuania (), is a country in the [[Baltic region|Baltic region]] of [[Europe|Europe]]. Since its independence, Lithuania has been referred to as one of the [[Baltic states|Baltic states]]. It is situated along the southeastern shore of the [[Baltic Sea|Baltic Sea]], to the east of [[Sweden|Sweden]] and [[Denmark|Denmark]]. It is bordered by [[Latvia|Latvia]] to the north, [[Belarus|Belarus]] to the east and south, [[Poland|Poland]] to the south, and [[Kaliningrad Oblast|Kaliningrad Oblast]] (a [[Russia|Russian]] [[exclave|Enclave and exclave]]) to the southwest. Lithuania has an estimated population of 2.8 million people , and its capital and largest city is [[Vilnius|Vilnius]]. Other major cities are [[Kaunas|Kaunas]] and [[Klaipėda|Klaipėda]]. [[Lithuanians|Lithuanians]] are [[Baltic people|Baltic people]]. The official language, [[Lithuanian|Lithuanian language]], along with [[Latvian|Latvian language]], is one of only two living languages in the [[Baltic branch|Baltic languages]] of the [[Indo-European|Indo-European languages]] language family.
title: Lithuania

abstract: Present-day Laos traces its historic and cultural identity to the kingdom of [[Lan Xang Hom Khao|Lan Xang]] (Kingdom of a Million Elephants Under the White Parasol), which existed for four centuries as one of the largest kingdoms in [[Southeast Asia|Southeast Asia]]. Due to Lan Xang's central geographical location in Southeast Asia, the kingdom became a popular hub for overland trade, becoming wealthy economically as well as culturally. After a period of internal conflict, Lan Xang broke off into three separate kingdoms—[[Luang Phrabang|Kingdom of Luang Phrabang]], [[Vientiane|Kingdom of Vientiane]] and [[Champasak|Kingdom of Champasak]]. In 1893, it became a [[French protectorate|French colonial empire]], with the three territories uniting to form what is now known as the country of Laos. It briefly gained independence in 1945 after [[Japanese occupation|History of Laos to 1945#Japanese occupation of Laos]], but was recolonised by France until it won autonomy in 1949. Laos became independent in 1953, with a [[constitutional monarchy|constitutional monarchy]] under [[Sisavang Vong|Sisavang Vong]]. Shortly after independence, a long [[civil war|Laos Civil War]] began, which saw the [[communist resistance|Lao People's Revolutionary Party]], supported by the [[Soviet Union|Soviet Union]], fight against, first, the monarchy and then a number of military dictatorships, supported by the [[United States|United States]]. After the [[Vietnam War|Vietnam War]] ended in 1975, the [[Communist|Communism]] [[Pathet Lao|Pathet Lao]] movement came to power, seeing the end to the civil war. During the first years of Communist rule, Laos was dependent on military and economic aid supported by the Soviet Union until its [[dissolution|Dissolution of the Soviet Union]] in 1991.
title: Laos

abstract: Liberia (), officially the Republic of Liberia, is a country on the [[West Africa|West African]] coast. It is bordered by [[Sierra Leone|Sierra Leone]] to its west, [[Guinea|Guinea]] to its north and [[Ivory Coast|Ivory Coast]] to its east, the [[Atlantic Ocean|Atlantic Ocean]] to its south. It covers an area of and has a population of around 4,700,000 people. [[English|English language]] is the official language and over 20 indigenous languages are spoken, representing the numerous ethnic groups who make up more than 95% of the population. The country's capital and largest [[city|List of cities in Liberia]] is [[Monrovia|Monrovia]].
title: Liberia

abstract: Liechtenstein ( ; ), officially the Principality of Liechtenstein (), is a [[doubly landlocked|Landlocked country#Doubly landlocked]] [[German|German language]]-speaking [[microstate|microstate]] in [[Central Europe|Central Europe]]. The [[principality|principality]] is a [[constitutional monarchy|constitutional monarchy]] headed by the [[Prince of Liechtenstein|Prince of Liechtenstein]].
title: Liechtenstein

abstract: Russia (), officially the Russian Federation (), is a transcontinental [[country|Sovereign state]] in [[Eastern Europe|Eastern Europe]] and [[North Asia|North Asia]]. At , Russia is the [[largest country in the world|List of countries and dependencies by area]] by area, covering more than one-eighth of the Earth's inhabited land area, and the [[ninth most populous|List of countries and dependencies by population]], with about 146.8   million people , excluding [[Crimea|Crimea]]. About 77% of the population live in the [[western, European part|European Russia]] of the country. Russia's capital, [[Moscow|Moscow]], is the largest metropolitan area in Europe proper and one of the [[largest cities in the world|largest cities in the world]]; other major [[cities|List of cities and towns in Russia by population]] include [[Saint Petersburg|Saint Petersburg]], [[Novosibirsk|Novosibirsk]], [[Yekaterinburg|Yekaterinburg]] and [[Nizhny Novgorod|Nizhny Novgorod]]. Extending across the entirety of [[Northern Asia|North Asia]] and much of [[Eastern Europe|Eastern Europe]], Russia spans [[eleven time zones|Time in Russia]] and incorporates a wide range of [[environments|Environment of Russia]] and landforms. From northwest to southeast, Russia [[shares land borders|borders of Russia]] with [[Norway|Norway]], [[Finland|Finland]], [[Estonia|Estonia]], [[Latvia|Latvia]], [[Lithuania|Lithuania]] and [[Poland|Poland]] (both with [[Kaliningrad Oblast|Kaliningrad Oblast]]), [[Belarus|Belarus]], [[Ukraine|Ukraine]], [[Georgia|Georgia (country)]], [[Azerbaijan|Azerbaijan]], [[Kazakhstan|Kazakhstan]], [[China|China]], [[Mongolia|Mongolia]] and [[North Korea|North Korea]]. It shares [[maritime border|maritime borders]] with [[Japan|Japan]] by the [[Sea of Okhotsk|Sea of Okhotsk]] and the [[U.S.|United States]] state of [[Alaska|Alaska]] across the [[Bering Strait|Bering Strait]]. However, Russia recognises two more countries that border it, [[Abkhazia|Abkhazia]] and [[South Ossetia|South Ossetia]], both of which are internationally recognized as parts of Georgia.
title: Russia

abstract: Singapore (), officially the Republic of Singapore ([[Malay|Malay language]]: ; Chinese: ; [[Tamil|Tamil language]]: ), is a [[sovereign|sovereignty]] [[city-state|city-state]] and [[island country|island country]] in Southeast Asia. It lies one degree () north of the [[equator|equator]], at the southern tip of the [[Malay Peninsula|Malay Peninsula]], with [[Indonesia|Indonesia]]'s [[Riau Islands|Riau Islands]] to the south and [[Peninsular Malaysia|Peninsular Malaysia]] to the north. Singapore's territory consists of one [[main island|Pulau Ujong]] along with [[62 other islets|List of islands of Singapore]]. Since independence, extensive [[land reclamation|land reclamation]] has increased its total size by 23% (). The country is known for its transition from a [[developing|Developing country]] to a [[developed|Developed country]] one in a single generation under the leadership of its founding father, [[Lee Kuan Yew|Lee Kuan Yew]].
title: Singapore

abstract: In terms of culture, religion, ethnicity and linguistics, it has been described as the "only" and the "most" homogeneous country in Africa. Somalia has an estimated population of around million. Around 85% of its residents are ethnic [[Somalis|Somalis]], who have historically inhabited the northern part of the country. Ethnic minorities are largely concentrated in the southern regions. The official languages of Somalia are [[Somali|Somali language]] and [[Arabic|Arabic]], both of which belong to the [[Afroasiatic|Afroasiatic languages]] family. Most people in the country are [[Muslim|Muslim]], with the majority being [[Sunni|Sunni Islam]].
title: Somalia

abstract: The United Kingdom, officially the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland but more commonly known as the UK or Britain, is a [[sovereign country|sovereign country]] lying off the north-western coast of the [[European mainland|European mainland]]. The United Kingdom includes the island of [[Great Britain|Great Britain]], the north-eastern part of the island of [[Ireland|Ireland]] and many smaller islands. [[Northern Ireland|Northern Ireland]] is the only part of the United Kingdom that shares [[a land border|Republic of Ireland–United Kingdom border]] with another sovereign statethe [[Republic of Ireland|Republic of Ireland]]. Apart from this land border, the United Kingdom is surrounded by the Atlantic Ocean, with the [[North Sea|North Sea]] to the east, the [[English Channel|English Channel]] to the south and the [[Celtic Sea|Celtic Sea]] to the south-west, giving it the [[12th-longest coastline in the world|List of countries by length of coastline]]. The [[Irish Sea|Irish Sea]] lies between Great Britain and Ireland. With an area of , the United Kingdom is the [[78th-largest sovereign state in the world|List of countries by area]]. It is also the [[22nd-most populous country|List of countries and dependencies by population]], with an estimated 66.0 million inhabitants in 2017.
title: United Kingdom

abstract: Ukraine (; ), [[sometimes called|Name of Ukraine#English definite article]] the Ukraine, is a country in [[Eastern Europe|Eastern Europe]]. Excluding [[Crimea|Crimea]], Ukraine has a population of about 42.5 million, making it the [[32nd|List of countries and dependencies by population]] most populous country in the world. Its capital and largest city is [[Kiev|Kiev]]. [[Ukrainian|Ukrainian language]] is the [[official language|official language]] and its alphabet is [[Cyrillic|Ukrainian alphabet]]. The dominant religions in the country are [[Eastern Orthodoxy|Eastern Orthodox Church]] and [[Greek Catholicism|Eastern Catholic Churches]]. Ukraine is currently in a [[territorial dispute|territorial dispute]] with Russia over the [[Crimean Peninsula|Crimea]], which [[Russia annexed in 2014|Annexation of Crimea by the Russian Federation]]. Including Crimea, Ukraine has an area of , making it the largest country entirely within [[Europe|Europe]] and the [[46th|List of countries and dependencies by area]] largest country in the world.
title: Ukraine

abstract: Uganda, officially the Republic of Uganda (), is a [[landlocked country|landlocked country]] (except for its borders with [[Lake Victoria|Lake Victoria]] and [[Lake Albert|Lake Albert (Africa)]]) in [[East-Central Africa|East Africa]]. It is bordered to the east by [[Kenya|Kenya]], to the north by [[South Sudan|South Sudan]], to the west by the [[Democratic Republic of the Congo|Democratic Republic of the Congo]], to the south-west by [[Rwanda|Rwanda]], and to the south by [[Tanzania|Tanzania]]. The southern part of the country includes a substantial portion of [[Lake Victoria|Lake Victoria]], shared with Kenya and Tanzania. Uganda is in the [[African Great Lakes|African Great Lakes]] region. Uganda also lies within the [[Nile basin|Nile]], and has a varied but generally a modified equatorial climate.
title: Uganda

abstract: Uzbekistan (, ; ; ), officially also the Republic of Uzbekistan (; ), is a [[landlocked country|landlocked country]] in [[Central Asia|Central Asia]]. The [[sovereign state|sovereign state]] is a [[secular|secular]], [[unitary|unitary state]] constitutional republic, comprising 12 provinces, one autonomous republic, and a capital city. Uzbekistan is bordered by five landlocked countries: [[Kazakhstan|Kazakhstan]] to the north; [[Kyrgyzstan|Kyrgyzstan]] to the northeast; [[Tajikistan|Tajikistan]] to the southeast; [[Afghanistan|Afghanistan]] to the south; and [[Turkmenistan|Turkmenistan]] to the southwest. Along with [[Liechtenstein|Liechtenstein]], it is one of the world's only two doubly landlocked countries (i.e. sharing borders only with other landlocked countries).
title: Uzbekistan

abstract: Adjara is home to the [[Adjarians|Adjarians]], a regional subgroup of [[Georgians|Georgians]]. Adjara's name can be spelled in a number of ways, including Ajara, Ajaria, Adjaria, Adzharia, Atchara and Achara, among others. Under the [[Soviet Union|Soviet Union]], Adjara was part of the [[Georgian Soviet Socialist Republic|Georgian Soviet Socialist Republic]] as the [[Adjarian ASSR|Adjar Autonomous Soviet Socialist Republic]].
title: Adjara

abstract: Curaçao (; , ; , ) is a [[Lesser Antilles|Lesser Antilles]] island in the southern [[Caribbean Sea|Caribbean Sea]] and the [[Dutch Caribbean|Dutch Caribbean]] region, about north of the Venezuelan coast. It is a constituent country () of the [[Kingdom of the Netherlands|Kingdom of the Netherlands]].
title: Curaçao

abstract: Palestinian territories has been used for many years to describe the territories occupied by Israel since 1967, namely the [[West Bank|West Bank]] (including [[East Jerusalem|East Jerusalem]]) and the [[Gaza Strip|Gaza Strip]]. More recently, the official [[United Nations|United Nations]] terminology has been used, occupied Palestinian territory (OPT or oPt) increasingly replacing other terms since 1999. The [[European Union|European Union]] also has adopted this usage The [[International Court of Justice|International Court of Justice]] refers to the West Bank, including East Jerusalem, as "the Occupied Palestinian Territory" and this term is used as the legal definition by the International Court of Justice in the ruling in July 2004. The term occupied Palestinian territories is also still in common use.
title: Palestinian territories

abstract: The island of [[Trinidad|Trinidad]] was a [[Spanish colony|Spanish Empire]] from the arrival of [[Christopher Columbus|Christopher Columbus]] in 1498 until Spanish governor Don [[José María Chacón|José María Chacón]] surrendered the island to a British fleet under the command of [[Sir Ralph Abercromby|Ralph Abercromby]] in 1797. During the same period, the island of [[Tobago|Tobago]] changed hands among [[Spanish|Spanish colonization of the Americas]], [[British|British colonization of the Americas]], [[French|French colonization of the Americas]], [[Dutch|Dutch colonization of the Americas]] and [[Courlander|Courland colonization of the Americas]] colonizers more times than any other island in the Caribbean. Trinidad and Tobago were ceded to Britain in 1802 under the [[Treaty of Amiens|Treaty of Amiens]] as separate states and unified in 1889. Trinidad and Tobago obtained independence in 1962 and became a republic in 1976.
title: Trinidad and Tobago

abstract: The West Herzegovina Canton (, ) is one of the [[cantons of the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina|cantons of the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina]]. The West Herzegovina Canton is in the [[Herzegovina|Herzegovina]] region in the southwest of [[Bosnia and Herzegovina|Bosnia and Herzegovina]]. Its seat of government is in [[Široki Brijeg|Široki Brijeg]], while other municipalities within the Canton are [[Grude|Grude]], [[Ljubuški|Ljubuški]] and [[Posušje|Posušje]]. It has 94,898 inhabitants, of whom more than 98% are ethnic [[Croats|Croats of Bosnia and Herzegovina]].
title: West Herzegovina Canton

abstract: New Zealand ( ) is a [[sovereign|sovereign state]] [[island country|island country]] in the southwestern [[Pacific Ocean|Pacific Ocean]]. The country geographically comprises two main landmasses—the [[North Island|North Island]] (Te Ika-a-Māui), and the [[South Island|South Island]] (Te Waipounamu)—and around 600 [[smaller islands|List of islands of New Zealand]]. New Zealand is situated some east of [[Australia|Australia]] across the [[Tasman Sea|Tasman Sea]] and roughly south of the [[Pacific island areas|Pacific Islands]] of [[New Caledonia|New Caledonia]], [[Fiji|Fiji]], and [[Tonga|Tonga]]. Because of its remoteness, it was one of the last lands to be settled by humans. During its long period of isolation, New Zealand developed a distinct [[biodiversity|Biodiversity of New Zealand]] of animal, fungal, and plant life. The country's varied topography and its sharp mountain peaks, such as the [[Southern Alps|Southern Alps]], owe much to the [[tectonic uplift|tectonic uplift]] of land and volcanic eruptions. New Zealand's [[capital city|Capital of New Zealand]] is [[Wellington|Wellington]], while its most populous city is [[Auckland|Auckland]].
title: New Zealand

abstract: Various [[indigenous peoples|Indigenous peoples in Canada]] have inhabited what is now Canada for thousands of years prior to European colonization. Beginning in the 16th century, [[British|British colonization of the Americas]] and [[French|French colonization of the Americas]] expeditions explored, and later settled, along the Atlantic coast. As a consequence of [[various armed conflicts|Military history of Canada]], France ceded nearly all of [[its colonies in North America|New France]] in 1763. In 1867, with the union of three [[British North America|British North American]] colonies through [[Confederation|Canadian Confederation]], Canada was formed as a [[federal|federalism]] [[dominion|British Dominions]] of four provinces. This began an [[accretion of provinces and territories|Territorial evolution of Canada]] and a process of increasing autonomy from the [[United Kingdom|United Kingdom]]. This widening autonomy was highlighted by the [[Statute of Westminster|Statute of Westminster 1931]] of 1931 and culminated in the [[Canada Act|Canada Act 1982]] of 1982, which severed the vestiges of legal dependence on the [[British parliament|Parliament of the United Kingdom]].
title: Canada

abstract: Kosovo and Metohija ( / Kosovo i Metohija (КиМ / KiM), ), officially the Autonomous Province of Kosovo and Metohija ( / Autonomna Pokrajina Kosovo i Metohija, ), known as short Kosovo (, ) or simply Kosmet (from [[Kosovo|Kosovo (region)]] and [[Metohija|Metohija]]; Serbian Cyrillic: Космет), refers to the region of [[Kosovo|Kosovo]] as defined in the [[Constitution of Serbia|Constitution of Serbia]]. The territory of the province is [[disputed|List of territorial disputes]] between [[Serbia|Serbia]] and the self-proclaimed [[Republic of Kosovo|Republic of Kosovo]], the latter of which has [[de facto|de facto]] control. The region had functioned as part of Serbia (mainly while Serbia had been part of a Yugoslav state) for most of the period between 1912 and 1999.The territory of the province, as recognized by Serbian laws, lies in the southern part of Serbia and covers the regions of [[Kosovo|Kosovo (region)]] and [[Metohija|Metohija]]. The capital of the province is [[Pristina|Pristina]]. The territory was previously an [[autonomous province|Socialist Autonomous Province of Kosovo]] of [[Serbia|Socialist Republic of Serbia]] during [[Socialist Yugoslavia|Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia]] (1946–1990), and acquired its current status in 1990. The province was governed as part of Serbia until the [[Kosovo War|Kosovo War]] (1998–99), when it became a United Nations (UN) protectorate in accordance with [[United Nations Security Council Resolution 1244|United Nations Security Council Resolution 1244]], but still internationally recognized as part of Serbia. The control was then transferred to the UN administration of [[UNMIK|UNMIK]]. In 2008, Kosovo authorities unilaterally declared independence, which is recognized by 110 UN members, but not by Serbia which still regards it as its province.
title: Autonomous Province of Kosovo and Metohija

abstract: American Samoa (; , ; also or ) is an [[unincorporated territory of the United States|unincorporated territories of the United States]] located in the South [[Pacific Ocean|Pacific Ocean]], southeast of [[Samoa|Samoa]]. Its location is centered around 14.2710° S, 170.1322° W. It is on the eastern border of the [[International Date Line|International Date Line]], while independent Samoa is west of it.
title: American Samoa

abstract: The region was dominated by [[Bantu|Bantu peoples]]-speaking tribes at least 3,000 years ago, who built trade links leading into the [[Congo River|Congo River]] basin. Congo was formerly part of the [[French colony|French colonial empire]] of [[Equatorial Africa|French Equatorial Africa]]. The Republic of the Congo was established on the 28th of November 1958 but gained independence from France in 1960. The [[sovereign state|sovereign state]] has had multi-party elections since 1992, although a democratically elected government was ousted in the 1997 [[Republic of the Congo Civil War|Republic of the Congo Civil War (1997–99)]], and President [[Denis Sassou Nguesso|Denis Sassou Nguesso]], who first came to power in 1979, has ruled for 33 of the past 38 years.
title: Republic of the Congo

abstract: The supporters of the region argue that it is an officially [[secular|secularism]] [[polity|polity]] based on a [[libertarian socialist ideology|Abdullah Öcalan#Democratic confederalism]] promoting [[decentralization|decentralization]], [[gender equality|gender equality]], environmental [[sustainability|sustainability]] and pluralistic tolerance for religious, cultural and political diversity, and that these values are mirrored in its [[constitution|Constitution of the Democratic Federation of Northern Syria]], society, and politics, claiming it to be a model for a [[federalized Syria|Federalization of Syria]] as a whole, rather than outright independence. Some of the criticism against the region has included claims of [[authoritarianism|authoritarianism]], [[kurdification|kurdification]], [[forced recruitment|Impressment]], the imprisonment and harassment of dissidents and journalists, the promotion of a radical [[anti-capitalist|Anti-capitalism]] ideology, and influence from the militant [[Kurdistan Workers Party|Kurdistan Workers Party]].
title: Democratic Federation of Northern Syria

abstract: Self-proclaimed as an independent "[[Republic|Republic]]", the Parva Domus is a micronation with a social and recreational aim. As usual in this type of organizations its citizens employ all sorts of flamboyant appellations and honours. It counts with a government addressed by a President and a Cabinet of Ministers, including a secretary of Foreign Affairs.
title: Parva Domus

abstract: The Åland Islands or Åland (, ; ) is an [[archipelago|archipelago]] [[province|province]] at the entrance to the [[Gulf of Bothnia|Gulf of Bothnia]] in the [[Baltic Sea|Baltic Sea]] belonging to [[Finland|Finland]]. It is [[autonomous|Federacy]], [[demilitarised|Demilitarized zone]] and is the only [[monolingually|Monolingualism]] [[Swedish-speaking|Swedish language]] region in Finland. It is the smallest [[region of Finland|Regions of Finland]], constituting 0.49% of its land area and 0.50% of its population.
title: Åland Islands

abstract: The Royal Lao Government in Exile claims that it is an interim democratic government consisting of eighty representatives from Lao political organizations and associations elected by the Lao people inside Laos and abroad. The Royal Lao Government in Exile is chaired by Professor Khamphoui Sisavatdy, who claims to have previously served in the former [[Royal Lao Government|Lao Royal Family]] under H.M. King Savang Vatthana of Laos as a Deputy in the National Assembly and was a Professor of Lao History at [[Sisavangvong University|Sisavangvong University]]. In 1972, he traveled to the [[United States|United States]] with a Lao delegation to speak to Secretary of State [[Henry Kissinger|Henry Kissinger]] concerning a series of proposed [[Geneva Convention|Geneva Conventions]] treaties.
title: Royal Lao Government in Exile

abstract: The Kingdom of the Netherlands (; ), commonly known as the Netherlands, is a [[sovereign state|sovereign state]] and [[constitutional monarchy|constitutional monarchy]] with the large majority of its territory in [[Western Europe|Western Europe]] and with several small island territories in the [[Caribbean Sea|Caribbean Sea]], in the [[West Indies|West Indies]] islands ([[Leeward Islands|Leeward Islands]] and [[Lesser Antilles|Lesser Antilles]]).The four parts of the kingdom—the [[Netherlands|Netherlands]], [[Aruba|Aruba]], [[Curaçao|Curaçao]] and [[Sint Maarten|Sint Maarten]]—are [[constituent countries|Constituent state]] (landen in [[Dutch|Dutch language]]) and participate on a basis of equality as partners in the kingdom. In practice, however, most of the kingdom's affairs are administered by the Netherlands—which comprises roughly 98% of the kingdom's land area and population—on behalf of the entire kingdom. Consequently, the [[Caribbean Sea|Caribbean Sea]] islands countries of Aruba, Curaçao, and Sint Maarten are dependent on the Netherlands for matters like [[foreign policy|foreign policy]] and [[defence|Defense (military)]], although they are autonomous to a certain degree with their own [[parliament|parliaments]].
title: Kingdom of the Netherlands

abstract: Bouvet Island () is an uninhabited [[subantarctic|subantarctic]] [[high island|high island]] and [[dependency|dependencies of Norway]] of [[Norway|Norway]] located in the South [[Atlantic Ocean|Atlantic Ocean]] at <COORD SDEC:54,25>, thus putting it north of and outside the [[Antarctic Treaty System|Antarctic Treaty System]]. It lies at the southern end of the [[Mid-Atlantic Ridge|Mid-Atlantic Ridge]] and is [[the most remote island|extreme points of Earth#Remoteness]] in the world, approximately north of the [[Princess Astrid Coast|Princess Astrid Coast]] of [[Queen Maud Land|Queen Maud Land]], [[Antarctica|Antarctica]] and south-southwest of the coast of [[South Africa|South Africa]].
title: Bouvet Island

abstract: The Scattered Islands in the Indian Ocean ( or Îles Éparses de l'océan Indien) consist of four small coral islands, an [[atoll|atoll]], and a [[reef|reef]] in the [[Indian Ocean|Indian Ocean]], and have constituted the 5th district of the [[French Southern and Antarctic Lands|French Southern and Antarctic Lands]] (TAAF) since February 2007. They have never had a permanent population. Two of the islands—[[Juan de Nova|Juan de Nova]] and [[Europa|Europa Island]]—and the [[Bassas da India|Bassas da India]] atoll lie in the [[Mozambique Channel|Mozambique Channel]] west of Madagascar, while a third island, [[Tromelin|Tromelin Island]], lies about east of Madagascar and the [[Glorioso Islands|Glorioso Islands]] lies about northwest of Madagascar. Also in the Mozambique Channel is the [[Banc du Geyser|Banc du Geyser]], a reef under French control claimed by Madagascar since 1976. France and the Comoros view the Banc du Geyser as part of the Glorioso Islands.
title: Scattered Islands in the Indian Ocean

abstract: Ambazonia, also known as Amba Land, is a self-declared state consisting of the Anglophone portions of Cameroon which previously comprised [[Southern Cameroons|Southern Cameroons]]. The Southern Cameroons was formerly the United Nations Trust Territory of Southern Cameroons under United Kingdom administration (1922–1961), which in 1961 voted to become independent from the United Kingdom by federating with the French-speaking Republic of Cameroon.
title: Ambazonia

abstract: Equatorial Guinea (; ; ), officially the Republic of Equatorial Guinea (, , ), is a country located in [[Central Africa|Central Africa]], with an area of . Formerly the colony of [[Spanish Guinea|Spanish Guinea]], its post-independence name evokes its location near both the [[Equator|Equator]] and the [[Gulf of Guinea|Gulf of Guinea]]. Equatorial Guinea is the only sovereign African state in which [[Spanish|Spanish language]] is an official language. , the country had an estimated population of 1,222,245.
title: Equatorial Guinea

abstract: Guinea (), officially the Republic of Guinea (), is a country on the western coast of [[Africa|Africa]]. Formerly known as [[French Guinea|French Guinea]] (), the modern country is sometimes referred to as Guinea-Conakry in order to distinguish it from other countries with "Guinea" in the name and the [[eponymous region|Guinea (region)]], such as [[Guinea-Bissau|Guinea-Bissau]] and [[Equatorial Guinea|Equatorial Guinea]]. Guinea has a population of million and an area of .
title: Guinea

abstract: The Federated States of Micronesia (; abbreviated FSM and also known simply as Micronesia) is an independent republic [[associated to|associated state]] the [[United States|United States]]. It consists of four [[states|Federal state]] from west to east, [[Yap|Yap State]], [[Chuuk|Chuuk State]], [[Pohnpei|Pohnpei State]] and [[Kosrae|Kosrae State]]that are spread across the [[Western Pacific Ocean|Western Pacific Ocean]]. Together, the states comprise around 607 islands (a combined [[land area|land area]] of approximately ) that cover a [[longitudinal|Longitude]] distance of almost just north of the [[equator|equator]]. They lie northeast of [[New Guinea|New Guinea]], south of [[Guam|Guam]] and the [[Marianas|Marianas]], west of [[Nauru|Nauru]] and the [[Marshall Islands|Marshall Islands]], east of [[Palau|Palau]] and the [[Philippines|Philippines]], about north of eastern [[Australia|Australia]] and some southwest of the main islands of [[Hawaii|Hawaii]].
title: Federated States of Micronesia

abstract: The Czech Republic (; ), also known by its short-form name, Czechia (; ), is a [[landlocked|landlocked country]] [[country|country]] in [[Central Europe|Central Europe]] bordered by [[Germany|Germany]] to the west, [[Austria|Austria]] to the south, [[Slovakia|Slovakia]] to the east and [[Poland|Poland]] to the northeast. The Czech Republic covers an area of with a mostly temperate [[continental climate|Humid continental climate]] and [[oceanic climate|oceanic climate]]. It is a [[unitary|Unitary state]] [[parliamentary republic|parliamentary republic]], with   million inhabitants; its capital and largest city is [[Prague|Prague]], with 1.3   million residents. Other major cities are [[Brno|Brno]], [[Ostrava|Ostrava]] and [[Pilsen|Plzeň]]. The Czech Republic is a member of the [[European Union|European Union]] (EU), [[NATO|NATO]], the [[OECD|Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development]], the [[United Nations|United Nations]], the [[OSCE|Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe]], and the [[Council of Europe|Council of Europe]].
title: Czech Republic

abstract: Chad has several regions: a [[desert|desert]] zone in the north, an arid [[Sahel|Sahelian]] belt in the centre and a more fertile [[Sudanian Savanna|Sudanian Savanna]] zone in the south. [[Lake Chad|Lake Chad]], after which the country is named, is the largest [[wetland|wetland]] in Chad and the second-largest in Africa. The capital [[N'Djamena|N'Djamena]] is the largest [[city|List of cities in Chad]]. Chad's official languages are [[Arabic|Arabic]] and [[French|French language]]. Chad is home to over 200 different [[ethnic|List of ethnic groups in Chad]] and [[linguistic groups|Languages of Chad]]. The most popular religion of Chad is [[Islam|Islam in Chad]] (at 55%), followed by [[Christianity|Christianity in Chad]] (at 40%).
title: Chad

abstract: The Territory of Cocos (Keeling) Islands is an [[Australian|Australia]] [[external territory|Dependent territory#Australia]] in the [[Indian Ocean|Indian Ocean]], comprising a small archipelago approximately midway between Australia and [[Sri Lanka|Sri Lanka]] and closer to the Indonesian island of [[Sumatra|Sumatra]]. It is part of [[Southeast Asia|Southeast Asia]] and is in the [[Southern Hemisphere|Southern Hemisphere]]. The territory's [[dual name|Dual naming]] (official since the islands’ incorporation into Australia in 1955) reflects that the islands have historically been known as either the Cocos Islands or the Keeling Islands.
title: Cocos (Keeling) Islands

abstract: Belgium, officially the Kingdom of Belgium, is a [[sovereign state|sovereign state]] in [[Western Europe|Western Europe]]. It is bordered by the [[Netherlands|Netherlands]] to the north, [[Germany|Germany]] to the east, [[Luxembourg|Luxembourg]] to the southeast, [[France|France]] to the southwest, and the [[North Sea|North Sea]] to the northwest. It covers an area of and has a population of more than 11.4 million. The capital and largest city is [[Brussels|Brussels]]; other major cities are [[Antwerp|Antwerp]], [[Ghent|Ghent]], [[Charleroi|Charleroi]] and [[Liège|Liège]].
title: Belgium

abstract: One of the earliest societies in the lands of modern-day Bulgaria was the [[Neolithic|Neolithic]] [[Karanovo culture|Karanovo culture]], which dates back to 6,500 BC. In the 6th to 3rd century BC the region was a battleground for [[Thracians|Thracians]], [[Persians|Persians]], [[Celts|Celts]] and [[ancient Macedonians|ancient Macedonians]]; stability came when the [[Roman Empire|Roman Empire]] conquered the region in AD 45. The Eastern Roman, or Byzantine, Empire lost some of these territories to an invading [[Bulgar|Bulgars]] horde in the late 7th century. The Bulgars founded the [[First Bulgarian Empire|First Bulgarian Empire]] in AD 681, which dominated most of the [[Balkans|Balkans]] and significantly influenced [[Slavic|Slavs]] cultures by developing the [[Cyrillic script|Cyrillic script]]. This state lasted until the early 11th century, when Byzantine emperor [[Basil II|Basil II]] conquered and dismantled it. A successful Bulgarian revolt in 1185 established a [[Second Bulgarian Empire|Second Bulgarian Empire]], which reached its apex under [[Ivan Asen II|Ivan Asen II]] (1218–1241). After numerous exhausting wars and feudal strife, the Second Bulgarian Empire disintegrated in 1396 and its territories fell under [[Ottoman|Ottoman Empire]] rule for nearly five centuries.
title: Bulgaria

abstract: The [[official language|official language]] of Benin is [[French|French language]]. However, indigenous languages such as [[Fon|Fon language]] and [[Yoruba|Yoruba language]] are commonly spoken. The largest religious group in Benin is [[Roman Catholicism|Catholic Church]], followed closely by [[Islam|Islam]], [[Vodun|Vodun]] and [[Protestantism|Protestants]]. Benin is a member of the [[United Nations|United Nations]], the [[African Union|African Union]], the [[Organisation of Islamic Cooperation|Organisation of Islamic Cooperation]], the [[South Atlantic Peace and Cooperation Zone|South Atlantic Peace and Cooperation Zone]], [[La Francophonie|Organisation internationale de la Francophonie]], the [[Community of Sahel-Saharan States|Community of Sahel-Saharan States]], the [[African Petroleum Producers Association|African Petroleum Producers Association]] and the [[Niger Basin Authority|Niger Basin Authority]].
title: Benin

abstract: The British Virgin Islands (BVI), officially simply the Virgin Islands, are a [[British Overseas Territory|British Overseas Territory]] in the [[Caribbean|Caribbean]], to the east of [[Puerto Rico|Puerto Rico]]. The islands are geographically part of the [[Virgin Islands archipelago|Virgin Islands]] and are located in the [[Leeward Islands|Leeward Islands]] of the [[Lesser Antilles|Lesser Antilles]].
title: British Virgin Islands

abstract: Namibia, the driest country in Sub-Saharan Africa, was inhabited since early times by the [[San|San people]], [[Damara|Damara people]], and [[Nama people|Nama peoples]]. Around the 14th century, [[immigrating|immigrating]] [[Bantu peoples|Bantu peoples]] arrived as part of the [[Bantu expansion|Bantu expansion]]. Since then, the Bantu groups, one of which is known as the [[Ovambo people|Ovambo people]], have dominated the population of the country; since the late 19th century, they have constituted a majority.
title: Namibia

abstract: Niger is a [[developing country|developing country]], which consistently ranks near the bottom in the [[United Nations|United Nations]]' [[Human Development Index|Human Development Index]] (HDI); it was ranked 187th of 188 countries for 2015 and 189th out of 189 countries in the 2018 report. Much of the non-desert portions of the country are threatened by periodic drought and [[desertification|desertification]]. The economy is concentrated around [[subsistence|subsistence agriculture]], with some export agriculture in the more fertile south, and export of raw materials, especially [[uranium ore|uranium ore]]. Niger faces serious challenges to development due to its landlocked position, desert terrain, inefficient [[agriculture|Agriculture in Niger]], high [[fertility rate|fertility rates]] without [[birth control|birth control]], and the resulting [[overpopulation|overpopulation]], the poor educational level and the poverty of its people, the lack of infrastructure, the poor health care, and the environmental degradation.
title: Niger

abstract: The Northern Mariana Islands, officially the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands (CNMI; ; [[Refaluwasch or Carolinian|Carolinian language]]: Commonwealth Téél Falúw kka Efáng llól Marianas), is an insular area and [[commonwealth|Commonwealth (U.S. insular area)]] of the United States consisting of 14 islands in the northwestern [[Pacific Ocean|Pacific Ocean]]. The CNMI includes the 14 northernmost islands in the [[Mariana Archipelago|Mariana Islands]] except the southernmost island of the chain, [[Guam|Guam]], which is a separate U.S. territory. The CNMI and Guam are the westernmost point (in terms of jurisdiction) and territory of the United States.
title: Northern Mariana Islands

abstract: According to the ancient manuscript [[Landnámabók|Landnámabók]], the [[settlement of Iceland|settlement of Iceland]] began in 874 AD when the [[Norwegian|Norway]] chieftain [[Ingólfr Arnarson|Ingólfr Arnarson]] became the first permanent settler on the island. In the following centuries, [[Norwegians|Norwegians]], and to a lesser extent other [[Scandinavia|Scandinavians]], emigrated to Iceland, bringing with them [[thrall|thralls]] (i.e., slaves or serfs) of [[Gaelic|Gaels]] origin.
