The island was governed as an [[independent commonwealth|Icelandic Commonwealth]] under the [[Althing|Althing]], one of the world's oldest functioning legislative assemblies. Following a [[period of civil strife|Age of Sturlungs]], Iceland acceded to Norwegian rule in the 13th century. The establishment of the [[Kalmar Union|Kalmar Union]] in 1397 united the kingdoms of Norway, Denmark, and Sweden. Iceland thus followed Norway's integration into that union, coming under Danish rule after Sweden's secession from the union in 1523. Although the Danish kingdom introduced [[Lutheranism|Lutheranism]] forcefully in 1550, Iceland remained a distant semi-colonial territory in which Danish institutions and infrastructures were conspicuous by their absence. In the wake of the [[French Revolution|French Revolution]] and the [[Napoleonic Wars|Napoleonic Wars]], Iceland's struggle for independence took form and culminated in [[independence in 1918|Danish–Icelandic Act of Union]] and the founding of a [[republic in 1944|Founding of the Republic of Iceland]]. Until the 20th century, Iceland relied largely on subsistence fishing and agriculture, and was among the poorest countries in Europe. Industrialisation of the fisheries and [[Marshall Plan|Marshall Plan]] aid following [[World War II|World War II]] brought prosperity and Iceland became one of the wealthiest and most developed nations in the world. In 1994, it became a part of the [[European Economic Area|European Economic Area]], which further diversified the economy into sectors such as finance, biotechnology, and manufacturing.
title: Iceland

abstract: Iran ( ), also called Persia () and officially known as the Islamic Republic of Iran ( ), is a country in [[Western Asia|Western Asia]]. With over 81 million inhabitants, Iran is the world's [[18th most populous country|List of countries and dependencies by population]]. Comprising a land area of , it is the second largest country in the [[Middle East|Middle East]] and the [[17th largest in the world|List of countries and dependencies by area]]. Iran is bordered to the northwest by [[Armenia|Armenia]] and the [[Republic of Azerbaijan|Azerbaijan]], to the north by the [[Caspian Sea|Caspian Sea]], to the northeast by [[Turkmenistan|Turkmenistan]], to the east by [[Afghanistan|Afghanistan]] and [[Pakistan|Pakistan]], to the south by the [[Persian Gulf|Persian Gulf]] and the [[Gulf of Oman|Gulf of Oman]], and to the west by [[Turkey|Turkey]] and [[Iraq|Iraq]]. The country's central location in [[Eurasia|Eurasia]] and Western Asia, and its proximity to the [[Strait of Hormuz|Strait of Hormuz]], give it [[geostrategic|geostrategy]] importance. [[Tehran|Tehran]] is the country's capital and largest city, as well as its leading economic and cultural center.
title: Iran

abstract: The Maldives (, ; Dhivehi Raa'jey), officially the Republic of Maldives, is an Asian country, located in the [[Indian Ocean|Indian Ocean]], situated in the [[Arabian Sea|Arabian Sea]]. It lies southwest of [[Sri Lanka|Sri Lanka]] and [[India|India]], about from the [[Asian continent|Asian continent]]. The chain of [[26 atolls|Atolls of the Maldives]] stretches from [[Ihavandhippolhu Atoll|Atolls of the Maldives]] in the north to the [[Addu City|Addu City]] in the south. Comprising a [[territory|Territory (country subdivision)]] spanning roughly , the Maldives is one of the world's most geographically dispersed [[sovereign state|sovereign states]] as well as the [[smallest Asian country|List of sovereign states and dependent territories in Asia]] by land area and population, with around inhabitants. [[Malé|Malé]] is the capital and most populated city, traditionally called the "[[King's Island|List of sultans of the Maldives]]" for its central location.
title: Maldives

abstract: Uruguay was inhabited by the [[Charrúa people|Charrúa people]] for approximately 4,000 years before the [[Portuguese|Portuguese Empire]] established [[Colonia del Sacramento|Colonia del Sacramento]] in 1680; Uruguay was colonized by Europeans relatively late compared with neighboring countries. Montevideo was founded as a military stronghold by the [[Spanish|Spanish Empire]] in the early 18th century, signifying the competing claims over the region. Uruguay won its independence between 1811 and 1828, following a four-way struggle between Spain, Portugal, and later Argentina and Brazil. It remained subject to foreign influence and intervention throughout the 19th century, with the military playing a recurring role in domestic politics.
title: Uruguay

abstract: Sudan's history goes back to the [[Pharaonic period|Ancient Egypt]], witnessing the [[kingdom of Kerma|Kerma culture]] ( 2500 BC–1500 BC), the subsequent rule of the [[Egyptian New Kingdom|New Kingdom of Egypt]] ( 1500 BC–1070 BC) and the rise of the [[kingdom of Kush|kingdom of Kush]] ( 785 BC–350 AD), which would in turn [[control Egypt|Twenty-fifth Dynasty of Egypt]] itself for nearly a century. After the fall of Kush the [[Nubians|Nubians]] formed the three Christian kingdoms of [[Nobatia|Nobatia]], [[Makuria|Makuria]] and [[Alodia|Alodia]], with the latter two lasting until around 1500. Between the 14th and 15th centuries much of Sudan was settled by Muslim [[Arabs|Arabs]]. From the 16th–19th centuries, central and eastern Sudan were dominated by the [[Funj sultanate|Sultanate of Sennar]], while [[Darfur|Sultanate of Darfur]] ruled the west and the [[Ottomans|Ottoman Empire]] the far north. This period saw extensive [[Islamization|Islamization]] and [[Arabization|Arabization]].
title: Sudan

abstract: Eswatini ( ), officially the Kingdom of Eswatini () and formerly known as Swaziland (), is a [[landlocked country|landlocked country]] in [[Southern Africa|Southern Africa]]. It is bordered by [[Mozambique|Mozambique]] to its northeast and [[South Africa|South Africa]] to its north, west and south. The country and the [[Swazi people|Swazi people]] take their names from [[Mswati II|Mswati II]], the 19th-century king under whose rule Swazi territory was expanded and unified.
title: Eswatini

abstract: Saint Helena ( ) is a [[volcanic|Volcano]] [[tropical island|Island#Tropical islands]] in the [[South Atlantic Ocean|South Atlantic Ocean]], east of [[Rio de Janeiro|Rio de Janeiro]] and 1,950 kilometres (1,210   mi) west of the [[Cunene River|Cunene River]], which marks the border between [[Namibia|Namibia]] and [[Angola|Angola]] in southwestern Africa. It is part of the [[British Overseas Territory|British Overseas Territories]] of [[Saint Helena, Ascension and Tristan da Cunha|Saint Helena, Ascension and Tristan da Cunha]]. Saint Helena measures about 16 by 8 kilometres (10 by 5   mi) and has a population of 4,534 (2016 census). It was named after [[Saint Helena of Constantinople|Helena (empress)]].
title: Saint Helena

abstract: Tunisia (officially the Republic of Tunisia) is a country in the [[Maghreb|Maghreb]] region of [[North Africa|North Africa]], covering . Its northernmost point, [[Cape Angela|Cape Angela]], is the northernmost point on the African continent. It is bordered by [[Algeria|Algeria]] to the west and southwest, [[Libya|Libya]] to the southeast, and the [[Mediterranean Sea|Mediterranean Sea]] to the north and east. Tunisia's population was 11.435 million in 2017. Tunisia's name is derived from its capital city, [[Tunis|Tunis]], which is located on its northeast coast.
title: Tunisia

abstract: Kyrgyzstan's recorded history spans over 2,000 years, encompassing a variety of cultures and empires. Although geographically isolated by its highly mountainous terrain, which has helped preserve its ancient culture, Kyrgyzstan has been at the crossroads of several great civilizations as part of the [[Silk Road|Silk Road]] and other commercial and cultural routes. Though long inhabited by a succession of independent tribes and clans, Kyrgyzstan has periodically fallen under foreign domination and attained sovereignty as a nation-state only after the breakup of the [[Soviet Union|Soviet Union]] in 1991.
title: Kyrgyzstan

abstract: The Autonomous Region of Bougainville ( ), previously known as the North Solomons Province, is an [[autonomous region|Provinces of Papua New Guinea]] in [[Papua New Guinea|Papua New Guinea]]. The largest island is [[Bougainville Island|Bougainville Island]] (also the largest of the [[Solomon Islands archipelago|Solomon Islands (archipelago)]]). The region also includes [[Buka Island|Buka Island]] and assorted outlying nearby islands including the [[Carterets|Carteret Islands]]. The interim capital is [[Buka|Buka, Papua New Guinea]], though it is expected that [[Arawa|Arawa, Papua New Guinea]] will become the permanent capital in the future. The population of the region is 249,358 (2011 census).
title: Autonomous Region of Bougainville

abstract: Karakalpakstan ( / ; ), officially the Republic of Karakalpakstan ( / ; ) is an [[autonomous republic|autonomous republic]] within [[Uzbekistan|Uzbekistan]]. It occupies the whole northwestern end of Uzbekistan. The capital is [[Nukus|Nukus]] ( / ). The Republic of Karakalpakstan has an area of . Its territory covers the classical land of [[Khwarezm|Khwarezm]], though in classical [[Persian literature|Persian literature]] the area was known as ().
title: Karakalpakstan

abstract: The Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina (abbreviated FB&H; [[Bosnian|Bosnian language]] and [[Serbian|Serbian language]]: Federacija Bosna i Hercegovina (FBiH) / Федерација Боснa и Херцеговина (ФБиХ), [[Croatian|Croatian language]]: Federacija Bosna i Hercegovina (FBiH) ) is one of the two [[political entities|Politics of Bosnia and Herzegovina]] that compose [[Bosnia and Herzegovina|Bosnia and Herzegovina]], the other being [[Republika Srpska|Republika Srpska]]. The Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina consists of 10 autonomous [[cantons|Cantons of the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina]] with their own governments. It is inhabited primarily by [[Bosniaks|Bosniaks]] and [[Bosnian Croats|Bosnian Croats]], which is why it is sometimes informally referred to as the Bosniak-Croat Federation (with the [[Bosnian Serbs|Bosnian Serbs]] as the third constituency of the entity). It is sometimes known by the shorter name Federation of B&H.
title: Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina

abstract: Aruba ( ; ; Papiamento: ) is an island and a [[constituent country|Countries of the Kingdom of the Netherlands]] of the [[Kingdom of the Netherlands|Kingdom of the Netherlands]] in the southern [[Caribbean Sea|Caribbean Sea]], located about west of the main part of the [[Lesser Antilles|Lesser Antilles]] and north of the coast of [[Venezuela|Venezuela]]. It measures long from its northwestern to its southeastern end and across at its widest point. Together with [[Bonaire|Bonaire]] and [[Curaçao|Curaçao]], Aruba forms a group referred to as the [[ABC islands|ABC islands (Lesser Antilles)]]. Collectively, Aruba and the other Dutch islands in the Caribbean are often called the [[Dutch Caribbean|Dutch Caribbean]].
title: Aruba

abstract: The [[island of Antigua|Antigua]] was explored by [[Christopher Columbus|Christopher Columbus]] in 1493 and named for the [[Church of Santa María La Antigua|Santa María La Antigua]]. Antigua was colonized by [[Britain|Great Britain]] in 1632; [[Barbuda island|Barbuda]] was first colonized in 1678. Antigua and Barbuda joined the [[West Indies Federation|West Indies Federation]] in 1958. With the breakup of the federation, it became one of the [[West Indies Associated States|West Indies Associated States]] in 1967. Following by self-governing on its internal affairs, independence was granted from [[United Kingdom|United Kingdom]] on 1 November 1981.
title: Antigua and Barbuda

abstract: Cameroon (; ), officially the Republic of Cameroon (), is a country wedged in West and Central [[Africa|Africa]]. It is bordered by [[Nigeria|Nigeria]] to the west and north; [[Chad|Chad]] to the northeast; the [[Central African Republic|Central African Republic]] to the east; and [[Equatorial Guinea|Equatorial Guinea]], [[Gabon|Gabon]] and the [[Republic of the Congo|Republic of the Congo]] to the south. Cameroon's coastline lies on the [[Bight of Biafra|Bight of Biafra]], part of the [[Gulf of Guinea|Gulf of Guinea]] and the [[Atlantic Ocean|Atlantic Ocean]]. Although Cameroon is not an ECOWAS member state, it geographically and historically is in West Africa with the [[Southern Cameroons|Southern Cameroons]] which now form her [[Northwest|Northwest Region (Cameroon)]] and [[Southwest|Southwest Region (Cameroon)]] Regions having a strong West African history. The country is sometimes identified as West African and other times as Central African due to its strategic position at the crossroads between West and Central Africa.
title: Cameroon

abstract: Niue ( ; ) is an [[island country|island country]] in the [[South Pacific Ocean|South Pacific Ocean]], northeast of [[New Zealand|New Zealand]], east of [[Tonga|Tonga]], south of [[Samoa|Samoa]], and west of the [[Cook Islands|Cook Islands]]. Niue's land area is about and its population, predominantly [[Polynesian|Polynesians]], was about 1,600 in 2016. The island is commonly referred to as "The Rock", which comes from the traditional name "Rock of [[Polynesia|Polynesia]]". Niue is one of the world's largest [[coral|coral]] islands. The [[terrain|terrain]] of the island has two noticeable levels. The higher level is made up of a [[limestone|limestone]] [[cliff|cliff]] running along the coast, with a plateau in the centre of the island reaching approximately 60 metres (200 feet) high above sea level. The lower level is a coastal terrace approximately 0.5   km (0.3 miles) wide and about 25–27 metres (80–90 feet) high, which slopes down and meets the sea in small cliffs. A [[coral reef|coral reef]] surrounds the island, with the only major break in the reef being in the central western coast, close to Alofi. A notable feature are the many limestone [[caves|caves]] near the coast.
title: Niue

abstract: Norway ([[Norwegian|Norwegian language]]: ([[Bokmål|Bokmål]]) or ([[Nynorsk|Nynorsk]]); ), officially the Kingdom of Norway, is a [[Nordic country|Nordic country]] in [[Northwestern Europe|Northwestern Europe]] whose territory comprises the western and northernmost portion of the [[Scandinavian Peninsula|Scandinavian Peninsula]]; the remote island of [[Jan Mayen|Jan Mayen]] and the archipelago of [[Svalbard|Svalbard]] are also part of the Kingdom of Norway. The Antarctic [[Peter I Island|Peter I Island]] and the sub-Antarctic [[Bouvet Island|Bouvet Island]] are [[dependent territories|Dependencies of Norway]] and thus not considered part of the kingdom. Norway also lays claim to a section of [[Antarctica|Antarctica]] known as [[Queen Maud Land|Queen Maud Land]].
title: Norway

abstract: Mongolia (; in [[Mongolian Cyrillic|Mongolian Cyrillic alphabet]]; [transliterated] in [[Mongolian script|Mongolian script]]) is a [[landlocked country|landlocked country]] in [[East Asia|East Asia]]. Its area is roughly equivalent with the historical territory of [[Outer Mongolia|Outer Mongolia]], and that term is sometimes used to refer to the current state. It is sandwiched between [[China|China]] to the south and [[Russia|Russia]] to the north. Mongolia does not share a border with [[Kazakhstan|Kazakhstan]], although only separates them.
title: Mongolia

abstract: Palau (, historically Belau, Palaos, or Pelew), officially the Republic of Palau (), is an [[island country|island country]] located in the western [[Pacific Ocean|Pacific Ocean]]. The country contains approximately 340 islands, forming the western chain of the [[Caroline Islands|Caroline Islands]] in [[Micronesia|Micronesia]], and has an area of . The most populous island is [[Koror|Koror]]. The capital [[Ngerulmud|Ngerulmud]] is located on the nearby island of [[Babeldaob|Babeldaob]], in [[Melekeok State|Melekeok]]. Palau shares [[maritime boundaries|maritime boundary]] with the [[Philippines|Philippines]], [[Indonesia|Indonesia]], and the [[Federated States of Micronesia|Federated States of Micronesia]].
title: Palau

abstract: Paraguay (; ; , ), officially the Republic of Paraguay (; ), is one of only two [[landlocked countries|landlocked country]] in [[South America|South America]] (the other is [[Bolivia|Bolivia]]). It is bordered by [[Argentina|Argentina]] to the south and southwest, [[Brazil|Brazil]] to the east and northeast, and Bolivia to the northwest. Paraguay lies on both banks of the [[Paraguay River|Paraguay River]], which runs through the center of the country from north to south. Due to its central location in South America, it is sometimes referred to as Corazón de Sudamérica ("Heart of South America").
title: Paraguay

abstract: Spain ( ), officially the Kingdom of Spain (), is a country mostly located on the [[Iberian Peninsula|Iberian Peninsula]] in [[Europe|Europe]]. Its territory also includes two [[archipelago|archipelagoes]]: the [[Canary Islands|Canary Islands]] off the coast of Africa, and the [[Balearic Islands|Balearic Islands]] in the [[Mediterranean Sea|Mediterranean Sea]]. The African [[enclave|enclaves]] of [[Ceuta|Ceuta]] and [[Melilla|Melilla]] make Spain the only European country to have a physical border with an African country ([[Morocco|Morocco]]). [[Several small islands|plazas de soberanía]] in the [[Alboran Sea|Alboran Sea]] are also part of Spanish territory. [[The country's mainland|Peninsular Spain]] is bordered to the south and east by the Mediterranean Sea except for a small land boundary with [[Gibraltar|Gibraltar]]; to the north and northeast by [[France|France]], [[Andorra|Andorra]], and the [[Bay of Biscay|Bay of Biscay]]; and to the west and northwest by [[Portugal|Portugal]] and the Atlantic Ocean.
title: Spain

abstract: Saint Kitts and Nevis (), also known as the Federation of Saint Christopher and Nevis, is an [[island country|island country]] in the [[West Indies|West Indies]]. Located in the [[Leeward Islands|Leeward Islands]] chain of the [[Lesser Antilles|Lesser Antilles]], it is the smallest [[sovereign state|sovereign state]] in the Western Hemisphere, in both [[area|List of countries by area]] and [[population|List of countries by population]]. The country is a [[Commonwealth realm|Commonwealth realm]], with [[Elizabeth II|Elizabeth II]] as queen and [[head of state|head of state]].
title: Saint Kitts and Nevis

abstract: Saint Lucia (; ) is a [[sovereign|sovereign state]] [[island country|island country]] in the West Indies in the eastern [[Caribbean Sea|Caribbean Sea]] on the boundary with the Atlantic Ocean. Part of the [[Lesser Antilles|Lesser Antilles]], it is located north/northeast of the island of [[Saint Vincent|Saint Vincent (Antilles)]], northwest of [[Barbados|Barbados]] and south of [[Martinique|Martinique]]. It covers a land area of and reported a population of 165,595 in the 2010 census. Its capital is [[Castries|Castries]].
title: Saint Lucia

abstract: Togo (), officially the Togolese Republic (), is a country in [[West Africa|West Africa]] bordered by [[Ghana|Ghana]] to the west, [[Benin|Benin]] to the east and [[Burkina Faso|Burkina Faso]] to the north. The [[sovereign state|sovereign state]] extends south to the [[Gulf of Guinea|Gulf of Guinea]], where its [[capital|capital city]] [[Lomé|Lomé]] is located. Togo covers , making it one of the smallest countries in Africa, with a population of approximately million.
title: Togo

abstract: Ivory Coast or Côte d'Ivoire, officially the Republic of Côte d'Ivoire, is a country located in [[West Africa|West Africa]]. Ivory Coast's political capital is [[Yamoussoukro|Yamoussoukro]], while its economic capital and largest city is the port city of [[Abidjan|Abidjan]]. It borders [[Guinea|Guinea]] and [[Liberia|Liberia]] to the west, [[Burkina Faso|Burkina Faso]] and [[Mali|Mali]] to the north, [[Ghana|Ghana]] to the east, and the [[Gulf of Guinea|Gulf of Guinea]] (Atlantic Ocean) to the south.
title: Ivory Coast

abstract: Bhutan (; ), officially the Kingdom of Bhutan ( ), is a [[landlocked country|landlocked country]] in [[South Asia|South Asia]]. Located in the [[Eastern Himalaya|Eastern Himalayas]], it is bordered by [[Tibet Autonomous Region|Tibet Autonomous Region]] of [[China|China]] in the north, the [[Sikkim|Sikkim]] state of [[India|India]] and the [[Chumbi Valley|Chumbi Valley]] of [[Tibet|Tibet]] in the west, the [[Arunachal Pradesh|Arunachal Pradesh]] state of India in the east, and the states of [[Assam|Assam]] and [[West Bengal|West Bengal]] in the south. Bhutan is geopolitically in South Asia and is the region's second least populous nation after the [[Maldives|Maldives]]. [[Thimphu|Thimphu]] is its capital and largest city, while [[Phuntsholing|Phuntsholing]] is its financial center.
title: Bhutan

abstract: Broadly speaking, Central Serbia is the historical core of [[modern Serbia|History of Serbia (1804–1918)]], which emerged from the [[Serbian Revolution|Serbian Revolution]] (1804–17) and subsequent wars against the Ottoman Empire. In the following century, Serbia gradually expanded south, acquiring South Serbia, Kosovo, [[Sandžak|Sandžak]] and [[Vardar Macedonia|Vardar Macedonia]], and in 1918 – following the unification and annexation of [[Montenegro|Kingdom of Montenegro]] and unification of Austro-Hungarian areas left of the [[Danube|Danube]] and [[Sava|Sava]] (Vojvodina) – it merged with other South Slavic territories into the [[Kingdom of Yugoslavia|Kingdom of Yugoslavia]]. The current borders of Central Serbia were defined after World War II, when Serbia became a [[republic|Socialist Republic of Serbia]] within [[SFR Yugoslavia|SFR Yugoslavia]], with Kosovo and Vojvodina as its autonomous provinces.
title: Central Serbia

abstract: It is divided into municipalities (usually eponymous with towns) of [[Bihać|Bihać]], [[Bosanska Krupa|Bosanska Krupa]], [[Bosanski Petrovac|Bosanski Petrovac]], [[Bužim|Bužim]], [[Cazin|Cazin]], [[Ključ|Ključ, Una-Sana Canton]], [[Sanski Most|Sanski Most]] and [[Velika Kladuša|Velika Kladuša]].
title: Una-Sana Canton

abstract: Malaysia ( ; ) is a country in [[Southeast Asia|Southeast Asia]]. The [[federal|federation]] [[constitutional monarchy|constitutional monarchy]] consists of [[13 states and three federal territories|States and federal territories of Malaysia]], separated by the [[South China Sea|South China Sea]] into two similarly sized regions, [[Peninsular Malaysia|Peninsular Malaysia]] and [[East Malaysia|East Malaysia]] (Malaysian Borneo). Peninsular Malaysia shares a land and maritime border with [[Thailand|Thailand]] in the north and maritime borders with [[Singapore|Singapore]] in the south, [[Vietnam|Vietnam]] in the northeast, and [[Indonesia|Indonesia]] in the west. East Malaysia shares land and maritime borders with [[Brunei|Brunei]] and Indonesia and a maritime border with the [[Philippines|Philippines]] and Vietnam. [[Kuala Lumpur|Kuala Lumpur]] is the national capital and largest city while [[Putrajaya|Putrajaya]] is the seat of federal government. With a population of over 30 million, Malaysia is the [[world's 44th most populous country|List of countries by population]]. The southernmost point of continental [[Eurasia|Eurasia]], [[Tanjung Piai|Tanjung Piai]], is in Malaysia. In the [[tropics|tropics]], Malaysia is one of 17 [[megadiverse countries|megadiverse countries]], with large numbers of [[endemic species|Wildlife of Malaysia]].
title: Malaysia

abstract: The Federation of Rhodesia and Nyasaland (also known as the Central African Federation, CAF) was a [[federal|federation]] [[semi-Dominion|Dominion#Southern Rhodesia]] that consisted of three [[southern Africa|southern African]] territories—the [[self-governing British colony|Self-governing colony]] of [[Southern Rhodesia|Southern Rhodesia]] and the [[British protectorate|British protectorates]] of [[Northern Rhodesia|Northern Rhodesia]] and [[Nyasaland|Nyasaland]]—between 1953 and 1963.The Federation was established on 1 August 1953. The Federation was established with a Governor-General as the Queen's representative at the centre. An interesting and novel feature was the African Affairs Board, set up to safeguard the interests of Africans and endowed with statutory powers for that purpose, particularly in regard to discriminatory legislation. The constitutional status of the three territories a self-governing Colony and two Protectorates was not affected, though certain enactments applied to the Federation as a whole as if it were part of Her Majesty's dominions and a Colony. The economic advantages to the Federation were never seriously called into question, and the causes of the Federation's failure were purely political: the strong and growing opposition of the African inhabitants.
title: Federation of Rhodesia and Nyasaland

abstract: Galmudug, officially Galmudug State, is an [[autonomous region|States and regions of Somalia]] in central [[Somalia|Somalia]]. It is bordered to the north by the [[Puntland|Puntland]] region, to the west by [[Ethiopia|Ethiopia]], to the east by [[Somali Sea|Somali Sea]] and to the south by [[Hirshabelle|Hirshabelle]].
title: Galmudug

abstract: Egypt ( ; , , ), officially the Arab Republic of Egypt, is a country spanning the [[northeast corner of Africa|North Africa]] and [[southwest corner of Asia|Western Asia]] by a [[land bridge|land bridge]] formed by the [[Sinai Peninsula|Sinai Peninsula]]. Egypt is a [[Mediterranean country|Mediterranean Sea]] bordered by the [[Gaza Strip|Gaza Strip]] and [[Israel|Israel]] to the northeast, the [[Gulf of Aqaba|Gulf of Aqaba]] to the east, the [[Red Sea|Red Sea]] to the east and south, [[Sudan|Sudan]] to the south, and [[Libya|Libya]] to the west. Across the Gulf of Aqaba lies [[Jordan|Jordan]], across the Red Sea lies [[Saudi Arabia|Saudi Arabia]], and across the Mediterranean lie [[Greece|Greece]], [[Turkey|Turkey]] and [[Cyprus|Cyprus]], although none share a land border with Egypt.
title: Egypt

abstract: Israel (; ; ), officially the State of Israel, is a country in [[Western Asia|Western Asia]], located on the [[southeastern shore|Eastern Mediterranean]] of the [[Mediterranean Sea|Mediterranean Sea]] and the northern shore of the [[Red Sea|Red Sea]]. It has land [[borders|Borders of Israel]] with [[Lebanon|Lebanon]] to the north, [[Syria|Syria]] to the northeast, [[Jordan|Jordan]] on the east, the [[Palestinian territories|Palestinian territories]] of the [[West Bank|West Bank]] and [[Gaza Strip|Gaza Strip]] to the east and west, respectively, and [[Egypt|Egypt]] to the southwest. The country contains [[geographically diverse features|Geography of Israel]] within its relatively small area. [[Israel's economic|Economy of Israel]] and [[technological|Science and technology in Israel]] center is [[Tel Aviv|Tel Aviv]], while its [[seat of government|seat of government]] and proclaimed [[capital|Capital city]] is [[Jerusalem|Jerusalem]], although the state's [[sovereignty|sovereignty]] over Jerusalem has only [[partial recognition|Status of Jerusalem]].
title: Israel

abstract: Armenia (; , ), officially the Republic of Armenia (, ), is a [[country|country]] in the [[South Caucasus|South Caucasus]] region of [[Eurasia|Eurasia]]. Located in [[Western Asia|Western Asia]] on the [[Armenian Highlands|Armenian Highlands]], it is bordered by [[Turkey|Turkey]] to the west, [[Georgia|Georgia (country)]] to the north, the de facto independent [[Republic of Artsakh|Republic of Artsakh]] and [[Azerbaijan|Azerbaijan]] to the east, and [[Iran|Iran]] and Azerbaijan's [[exclave|exclave]] of [[Nakhchivan|Nakhchivan Autonomous Republic]] to the south.
title: Armenia

abstract: Saint Barthélemy (), officially the Territorial collectivity of Saint-Barthélemy (), called Ouanalao by the indigenous people, is an [[overseas collectivity|overseas collectivity]] of [[France|France]] in the [[West Indies|French West Indies]]. Often abbreviated to St-Barth in French, and St. Barths or St. Barts in English, the island lies about southeast of [[St. Martin|Saint Martin]] and north of [[St. Kitts|Saint Kitts and Nevis]]. [[Puerto Rico|Puerto Rico]] is to the west in the [[Greater Antilles|Greater Antilles]].Saint Barthélemy was for many years a French commune forming part of [[Guadeloupe|Guadeloupe]], which is an overseas region and department of France. In 2003, the island voted in favour of [[secession|secession]] from Guadeloupe in order to form a separate [[overseas collectivity|overseas collectivity]] (COM) of France. The collectivity is one of four territories among the [[Leeward Islands|Leeward Islands]] in the northeastern [[Caribbean|Caribbean]] that comprise the [[French West Indies|French West Indies]], along with [[Saint Martin|Collectivity of Saint Martin]], [[Guadeloupe|Guadeloupe]] ( southeast), and [[Martinique|Martinique]].
title: Saint Barthélemy

abstract: On Deadly Ground is a 1994 environmental [[action-adventure|Action film]] [[film|film]], directed, co-produced by and starring [[Steven Seagal|Steven Seagal]], and co-starring [[Michael Caine|Michael Caine]], [[Joan Chen|Joan Chen]], [[John C. McGinley|John C. McGinley]] and [[R. Lee Ermey|R. Lee Ermey]]. It is, to date, Seagal's only directorial effort, and features a minor appearance by [[Billy Bob Thornton|Billy Bob Thornton]] in one of his early roles.
title: On Deadly Ground

abstract: Scorsese initially titled the film Wise Guy and postponed making it; later, he and Pileggi changed the title to Goodfellas. To prepare for their roles in the film, [[Robert De Niro|Robert De Niro]], [[Joe Pesci|Joe Pesci]], and [[Ray Liotta|Ray Liotta]] often spoke with Pileggi, who shared research material left over from writing the book. According to Pesci, improvisation and ad-libbing came out of rehearsals wherein Scorsese gave the actors freedom to do whatever they wanted. The director made transcripts of these sessions, took the lines he liked best and put them into a revised script, which the cast worked from during principal photography.
title: Goodfellas

abstract: Miyazaki wrote the script after he decided the film would be based on the 10-year-old daughter of his friend, associate producer Seiji Okuda, who came to visit his house each summer. At the time, Miyazaki was developing two personal projects, but they were rejected. With a budget of [[US$|United States dollar]]19 million, production of Spirited Away began in 2000. [[Pixar|Pixar]] director [[John Lasseter|John Lasseter]], a fan of Miyazaki, was approached by [[Walt Disney Pictures|Walt Disney Pictures]] to supervise an English language translation for the film's North American release. Lasseter hired [[Kirk Wise|Kirk Wise]] as director and [[Donald W. Ernst|Donald W. Ernst]] as producer of the adaptation. Screenwriters Cindy Davis Hewitt and Donald H. Hewitt wrote the English language dialogue, which they wrote to match the characters' original Japanese language lip movements.
title: Spirited Away

abstract: The Quiet Man is a 1952 [[Technicolor|Technicolor]] American [[romantic|Romance film]] [[comedy-drama film|Comedy-drama]] directed by [[John Ford|John Ford]]. It stars [[John Wayne|John Wayne]], [[Maureen O'Hara|Maureen O'Hara]], [[Barry Fitzgerald|Barry Fitzgerald]], [[Ward Bond|Ward Bond]] and [[Victor McLaglen|Victor McLaglen]]. The screenplay by [[Frank S. Nugent|Frank S. Nugent]] was based on a 1933 [[Saturday Evening Post|Saturday Evening Post]] short story of the same name by [[Maurice Walsh|Maurice Walsh]], later published as part of a collection titled The Green Rushes. The film is notable for [[Winton Hoch|Winton Hoch]]'s lush photography of the [[Irish|Ireland]] countryside and a long, climactic, semi-comic fist fight. It was an official selection of the 1952 [[Venice Film Festival|Venice Film Festival]].
title: The Quiet Man

abstract: Blacksmith Scene (also known as Blacksmith Scene #1 and Blacksmithing Scene) is an 1893 American [[short|Short film]] [[black-and-white|black-and-white]] [[silent film|silent film]] directed by [[William K.L. Dickson|William Kennedy Dickson]], the [[Scottish|Scottish people]]-[[French|French people]] [[inventor|inventor]] who, while under the employ of [[Thomas Edison|Thomas Edison]], developed the first fully functional [[motion picture|film]] [[camera|movie camera]]. It is historically significant as the first [[Kinetoscope|Kinetoscope]] film shown in public exhibition on May 9, 1893 and is the earliest known example of actors performing a role in a film. 102 years later, in 1995, Blacksmithing Scene was selected for preservation in the United States [[National Film Registry|National Film Registry]] by the [[Library of Congress|Library of Congress]] as being "culturally, historically, or aesthetically significant". It is the second-oldest film included in the Registry, after [[Newark Athlete|Newark Athlete]] (1891).
title: Blacksmith Scene

abstract: Do the Right Thing is a 1989 American [[comedy-drama|comedy-drama]] film produced, written, and directed by [[Spike Lee|Spike Lee]]. It stars Lee and [[Danny Aiello|Danny Aiello]], [[Ossie Davis|Ossie Davis]], [[Ruby Dee|Ruby Dee]], [[Richard Edson|Richard Edson]], [[Giancarlo Esposito|Giancarlo Esposito]], [[Bill Nunn|Bill Nunn]], [[John Turturro|John Turturro]], and [[Samuel L. Jackson|Samuel L. Jackson]], and is the feature film debut of [[Martin Lawrence|Martin Lawrence]] and [[Rosie Perez|Rosie Perez]]. The story follows a Brooklyn neighborhood's simmering racial tension, which culminates in tragedy on a hot summer day.
title: Do the Right Thing

abstract: Rear Window is a 1954 American [[Technicolor|Technicolor]] [[mystery|mystery film]] [[thriller film|thriller film]] directed by [[Alfred Hitchcock|Alfred Hitchcock]] and written by [[John Michael Hayes|John Michael Hayes]] based on [[Cornell Woolrich|Cornell Woolrich]]'s 1942 [[short story|short story]] "It Had to Be Murder". Originally released by [[Paramount Pictures|Paramount Pictures]], the film stars [[James Stewart|James Stewart]], [[Grace Kelly|Grace Kelly]], [[Wendell Corey|Wendell Corey]], [[Thelma Ritter|Thelma Ritter]], and [[Raymond Burr|Raymond Burr]]. It was screened at the 1954 [[Venice Film Festival|Venice Film Festival]].
title: Rear Window

abstract: The Cremaster Cycle was made over a period of eight years (1994–2002) and culminated in a major museum exhibition organized by [[Nancy Spector|Nancy Spector]] of the [[Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum|Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum]] in New York City, which traveled to the [[Museum Ludwig|Museum Ludwig]] in Cologne and the [[Musée d'art Moderne|Musée d'Art Moderne de la Ville de Paris]] in Paris from 2002-03. Barney's longtime collaborator Jonathan Bepler composed and arranged the soundtracks for the films.
title: The Cremaster Cycle

abstract: is a 1993 [[Japanese animated|anime]] [[jidaigeki|jidaigeki]]-[[chanbara|Samurai cinema]] film written and directed by [[Yoshiaki Kawajiri|Yoshiaki Kawajiri]], starring the voices of [[Kōichi Yamadera|Kōichi Yamadera]], [[Emi Shinohara|Emi Shinohara]], [[Takeshi Aono|Takeshi Aono]], [[Daisuke Gōri|Daisuke Gōri]], [[Toshihiko Seki|Toshihiko Seki]] and [[Shūichirō Moriyama|Shūichirō Moriyama]]. The film was a co-production between [[JVC|JVC]], [[Toho|Toho]], [[Movic|Movic]] and [[Animate|Animate]], with [[Madhouse|Madhouse (company)]] serving as the animation studio. Ninja Scroll was theatrically released in Japan on June 5, 1993, and received an English-[[dubbed|Dubbing (filmmaking)]] release in Western countries through [[Manga Entertainment|Manga Entertainment]] in 1995.
title: Ninja Scroll

abstract: Night Falls on Manhattan is a 1996 American [[crime drama|Crime film]] film directed by [[Sidney Lumet|Sidney Lumet]], set and filmed on location in New York City. Its screenplay is by Lumet, based on a novel by [[Robert Daley|Robert Daley]] entitled Tainted Evidence.
title: Night Falls on Manhattan

abstract: Queen at Wembley is a video recorded at the original [[Wembley Stadium|Wembley Stadium (1923)]], London, England on Saturday 12 July 1986 during [[Queen|Queen (band)]]'s [[Magic Tour|Magic Tour (Queen)]] and later debuted as a mono ‘The Tube Special’ on TV with a simultaneous stereo radio broadcast so that viewers had the option to mute their televisions; play the audio on a nearby radio and enjoy “the world’s first ever stereo simulcast” in a similar way that previous live (as opposed to, in this case, pre-recorded) classical performances had sometimes been offered. It was first released in December 1990 as an edited VHS (missing 9 songs), then as an audio CD in 1992, followed by a DVD release as Queen: Live at Wembley Stadium (in its entirety) to coincide with the CD rerelease in 2003. The DVD has gone five times platinum in the United States, four times platinum in the United Kingdom, and achieved multi platinum status around the world. On 5 September 2011, the 25th Anniversary Edition of the concert was released as a standard 2-DVD set and a deluxe 2-DVD and 2-CD set. Eagle Rock Entertainment released a 25th Anniversary Edition in the USA and Canada on 12 March 2013.
title: Queen at Wembley

abstract: Agni Natchathiram () is a 1988 Indian [[Tamil-language|Tamil language]] [[action|Action film]] [[drama film|Drama (film and television)]] directed by [[Mani Ratnam|Mani Ratnam]]. The film is about two half-brothers who come into conflict with each other in their claim for legitimacy as sons of a common father. [[Prabhu|Prabhu (actor)]] and [[Karthik|Karthik (actor)]] played the lead roles along with [[Amala|Amala (actress)]] and [[Nirosha|Nirosha]] as their pairs. This film marks the debut film for [[Nirosha|Nirosha]]. The film's score and soundtrack composed by [[Ilaiyaraaja|Ilaiyaraaja]] was well received. The film was a blockbuster and completed a 200-day run at the box office.
title: Agni Natchathiram

abstract: LOC Kargil is 2003 Indian [[historical|historical period drama]] [[war|war film]] [[drama film|Drama (film and television)]] based on the [[Kargil War|Kargil War]] fought between India and Pakistan, produced and directed by [[J. P. Dutta|J. P. Dutta]] under his J.P. Films Banner. Featuring a large number of [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] stars and music composed by [[Aadesh Shrivastava|Aadesh Shrivastava]] and [[Anu Malik|Anu Malik]], with the former composing the score and the latter composing the songs. The film recorded as average returns at the box-office.
title: LOC Kargil

abstract: The Keys to the House ([[Italian|Italian language]] title: Le chiavi di casa) is an Italian [[2004|2004 in film]] dramatic family [[film|film]] based on the story Born Twice ([[Italian|Italian language]] title: Nati due volte) telling the story of a young father meeting his handicapped son for the first time and attempts to forge a relationship with the teenager. The film was [[directed|Film director]] by [[Gianni Amelio|Gianni Amelio]].
title: The Keys to the House

abstract: Patthar Ke Phool (Flowers of Stone) is a [[1991|Bollywood films of 1991]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] film starring [[Salman Khan|Salman Khan]] who plays a police officer fighting an underworld gang. [[Raveena Tandon|Raveena Tandon]] (in her film debut) plays the female lead role while [[Vinod Mehra|Vinod Mehra]], [[Kiran|Kiran Kumar]], [[Reema Lagoo|Reema Lagoo]] and [[Manohar Singh|Manohar Singh]] appear in supporting roles.
title: Patthar Ke Phool

abstract: The Star Wars sequel trilogy is the third and final set of three films in the [[Star Wars|Star Wars]] franchise, an American [[space opera|space opera]] created by [[George Lucas|George Lucas]]. It is being produced by [[Lucasfilm Ltd.|Lucasfilm Ltd.]] and distributed by [[Walt Disney Studios Motion Pictures|Walt Disney Studios Motion Pictures]]. The trilogy is to consist of episodes VII through IX, and chronologically follows [[Episode VI: Return of the Jedi|Return of the Jedi]] (1983). Lucas had planned a sequel trilogy as early as 1976, but had cancelled it by 1981 and produced only the first six episodes. [[The Walt Disney Company|The Walt Disney Company]] acquired Lucasfilm in late 2012 and announced plans to produce the sequel films.
title: Star Wars sequel trilogy

abstract: Down to You is a 2000 American romantic comedy film about losing a first love. It was directed by Kris Isacsson. The film stars [[Freddie Prinze, Jr.|Freddie Prinze, Jr.]], [[Julia Stiles|Julia Stiles]], [[Selma Blair|Selma Blair]], [[Shawn Hatosy|Shawn Hatosy]], [[Ashton Kutcher|Ashton Kutcher]], [[Rosario Dawson|Rosario Dawson]], [[Lucie Arnaz|Lucie Arnaz]], [[Henry Winkler|Henry Winkler]], and [[Zak Orth|Zak Orth]].
title: Down to You

abstract: The Junkman Is a 1982 independent film which spent two years in production. To make the film, [[H. B. Halicki|H. B. Halicki]] used his own personal collection of over 200 cars, toys, and guns - including [[Eleanor|Eleanor (1973 Ford Mustang)]], the star of his 1974 cult classic [[Gone in 60 Seconds|Gone in 60 Seconds (1974 film)]].
title: The Junkman

abstract: Ram Jaane () is a [[1995|Bollywood films of 1995]] Indian [[Hindi|Hindi]] [[crime drama film|crime drama film]] directed by [[Rajiv Mehra|Rajiv Mehra]] about an unnamed kid (portrayed by [[Shah Rukh Khan|Shah Rukh Khan]]) who grows up to become a gangster. He uses the name Ram Jaane after meeting with a priest who in response to the kid asking what his real name was, said Ram Jaane (God knows). It is the fourth time when [[Shah Rukh Khan|Shah Rukh Khan]] played a negative role after [[Baazigar|Baazigar]], [[Darr|Darr]] and [[Anjaam|Anjaam]]. The film clashed with [[Akele Hum Akele Tum|Akele Hum Akele Tum]] starring [[Aamir Khan|Aamir Khan]]. Ram Jaane released to a positive reception from audiences and was a commercial success, receiving a Hit verdict. However, Akele Hum Akele Tum did not enjoy the same and became a Flop at the box office. [[Shah Rukh Khan|Shah Rukh Khan]] has bought the rights to this film under his banner, [[Red Chillies Entertainment|Red Chillies Entertainment]]. It was inspired by the 1938 film, [[Angels with Dirty Faces|Angels with Dirty Faces]].
title: Ram Jaane

abstract: Kevin & Perry Go Large is a 2000 English [[teen|Teen film]] [[comedy film|comedy film]] based on the [[Harry Enfield|Harry Enfield]] sketch [[Kevin the Teenager|Kevin the Teenager]]. The film was written by Dave Cummings and [[Harry Enfield|Harry Enfield]] and directed by [[Ed Bye|Ed Bye]]. Enfield, [[Kathy Burke|Kathy Burke]] and [[Louisa Rix|Louisa Rix]] all return to their roles after previously appearing in [[Harry Enfield's Television Programme|Harry Enfield's Television Programme]], and later [[Harry Enfield and Chums|Harry Enfield's Television Programme]]. [[James Fleet|James Fleet]] replaced [[Stephen Moore|Stephen Moore (actor)]] as Kevin's father. Although the film received mixed reviews upon release, it has since gained a [[cult following|cult following]].
title: Kevin & Perry Go Large

abstract: Trapped in the Closet is an [[opera|opera]] by American [[R&B|contemporary R&B]] singer [[R. Kelly|R. Kelly]], which currently consists of 33 "chapters" released from 2005 to 2012. Written and produced by R. Kelly, the series tells a story of a [[one-night stand|one-night stand]] which sets off a chain of events, gradually revealing a greater web of lies, sex and deceit. The music follows a distinct [[E major|E major]] pattern, and most chapters of the story feature the same melodic theme.
title: Trapped in the Closet

abstract: Crash Dive is a [[World War II|World War II]] film in [[Technicolor|Technicolor]] released in 1943. It was directed by [[Archie Mayo|Archie Mayo]], written by [[Jo Swerling|Jo Swerling]] and [[W.R. Burnett|W.R. Burnett]], and starred [[Tyrone Power|Tyrone Power]], [[Dana Andrews|Dana Andrews]] and [[Anne Baxter|Anne Baxter]]. The film was the last for Power, already enlisted in the [[United States Marine Corps|United States Marine Corps]], before assignment to [[recruit training|recruit training]] also known as boot camp.
title: Crash Dive

abstract: Chapter 27 is a 2007 [[biographical|Biographical film]] [[drama|Drama (film and television)]] film depicting the [[murder of John Lennon|murder of John Lennon]] by [[Mark David Chapman|Mark David Chapman]]. It was written and directed by [[Jarrett Schaefer|Jarrett Schaefer]], based on the book Let Me Take You Down by Jack Jones, produced by [[Robert Salerno|Robert Salerno]], and stars [[Jared Leto|Jared Leto]] as Chapman. The film takes place in December 1980, and is intended to be an exploration of Chapman's [[psyche|Psyche (psychology)]]. Its title is a reference to [[J. D. Salinger|J. D. Salinger]]'s novel [[The Catcher in the Rye|The Catcher in the Rye]], which has twenty-six chapters, and suggests a continuation of the book.
title: Chapter 27

abstract: My Sassy Girl (; literally, That Bizarre Girl) is a [[2001|2001 in film]] [[South Korea|South Korean]] [[romantic comedy|romantic comedy]] film directed by [[Kwak Jae-yong|Kwak Jae-yong]], starring [[Jun Ji-hyun|Jun Ji-hyun]] and [[Cha Tae-hyun|Cha Tae-hyun]]. The film is based on a true story told in a series of [[blog|blog]] posts written by [[Kim Ho-sik|Kim Ho-sik]], who later adapted them into a fictional [[novel|novel]].
title: My Sassy Girl

abstract: Herbie: Fully Loaded is a 2005 American [[sports|Sports film]]-[[comedy|Comedy film]] film directed by [[Angela Robinson|Angela Robinson]] and produced by [[Robert Simonds|Robert Simonds]] for [[Walt Disney Pictures|Walt Disney Pictures]]. It stars [[Lindsay Lohan|Lindsay Lohan]] as the youngest member of an automobile-racing family, [[Justin Long|Justin Long]] as her best friend and mechanic, [[Michael Keaton|Michael Keaton]] as her father, [[Breckin Meyer|Breckin Meyer]] as her brother, [[David Collins|The Umbilical Brothers]] as her second brother and [[Matt Dillon|Matt Dillon]] as a competing racer. The film features cameos by many [[NASCAR|NASCAR]] drivers, including [[Jeff Gordon|Jeff Gordon]], [[Jimmie Johnson|Jimmie Johnson]], [[Tony Stewart|Tony Stewart]], [[Dale Earnhardt Jr.|Dale Earnhardt Jr.]] and [[Mark Martin|Mark Martin]]. It is the sixth and final installment of the [[Herbie franchise|Herbie]], following the television film [[The Love Bug|The Love Bug (1997 film)]] (1997) and the only theatrical Herbie film since [[Herbie Goes Bananas|Herbie Goes Bananas]] (1980). This film serves as a direct [[sequel|sequel]] to the original films and ignores the events from the fifth film The Love Bug. The film was released on June 22, 2005 and grossed over $144 million worldwide.
title: Herbie: Fully Loaded

abstract: Jesus of Montreal () is a 1989 French Canadian comedy-drama film written and directed by [[Denys Arcand|Denys Arcand]], and starring [[Lothaire Bluteau|Lothaire Bluteau]], [[Catherine Wilkening|Catherine Wilkening]] and [[Johanne-Marie Tremblay|Johanne-Marie Tremblay]]. The film tells the story of a group of actors in [[Montreal|Montreal]] who perform a [[Passion play|Passion play]] in a Quebec church (the film uses the grounds of St Joseph's Oratory on Mount Royal), combining religious belief with unconventional theories on a [[historical Jesus|historical Jesus]]. As the church turns against the main actor and author of the play, his life increasingly mirrors the story of [[Jesus|Jesus]], and the film adapts numerous stories from the [[New Testament|New Testament]].
title: Jesus of Montreal

abstract: Loopy De Loop is the only theatrical cartoon short series produced and directed by [[William Hanna|William Hanna]] and [[Joseph Barbera|Joseph Barbera]] after leaving [[MGM|MGM]] and opening their new studio, [[Hanna-Barbera Productions|Hanna-Barbera Productions]]. The series, distributed to theatres by [[Columbia Pictures|Columbia Pictures]], ran from to .
title: Loopy De Loop

abstract: A [[direct-to-video|direct-to-video]] [[stand-alone sequel|Sequel#Stand-alone sequels]] called [[Hollow Man 2|Hollow Man 2]], starring [[Christian Slater|Christian Slater]] and [[Peter Facinelli|Peter Facinelli]], was released in 2006.
title: Hollow Man

abstract: Booty Call is a 1997 American [[comedy film|comedy film]], [[written|Screenwriter]] by J. Stanford Parker (credited as Bootsie) and Takashi Bufford, and directed by [[Jeff Pollack|Jeff Pollack]]. The film stars [[Jamie Foxx|Jamie Foxx]], [[Tommy Davidson|Tommy Davidson]], [[Vivica A. Fox|Vivica A. Fox]], and [[Tamala Jones|Tamala Jones]].
title: Booty Call

abstract: Les Vampires is a 1915–16 French [[silent|Silent film]] crime [[serial film|serial film]] written and directed by [[Louis Feuillade|Louis Feuillade]]. Set in Paris, it stars [[Édouard Mathé|Édouard Mathé]], [[Musidora|Musidora]] and [[Marcel Lévesque|Marcel Lévesque]]. The main characters are a journalist and his friend who become involved in trying to uncover and stop a bizarre underground [[Apache|Apache (gang)]] gang, known as The Vampires (who are not [[the mythological beings|Vampire]] their name suggests). The serial consists of ten episodes, which vary greatly in length. Being roughly 7 hours long, it is considered [[one of the longest films ever made|List of longest films by running time]]. It was produced and distributed by Feuillade's company [[Gaumont|Gaumont Film Company]]. Due to its stylistic similarities with Feuillade's other crime serials [[Fantômas|Fantômas (1913 serial)]] and [[Judex|Judex (1916 film)]], the three are often considered a trilogy.
title: Les Vampires

abstract: Dead & Breakfast is a 2004 musical [[zombie comedy film|Zombie comedy]] directed by [[Matthew Leutwyler|Matthew Leutwyler]] starring [[Ever Carradine|Ever Carradine]], [[Gina Philips|Gina Philips]], [[Erik Palladino|Erik Palladino]], [[Bianca Lawson|Bianca Lawson]], [[Jeremy Sisto|Jeremy Sisto]] and [[Oz Perkins|Oz Perkins]]. The film premiered at The South By Southwest Film Festival and went on to win over a dozen awards and was nominated for a [[Saturn Award|Saturn Award]].
title: Dead & Breakfast

abstract: Khoey Ho Tum Kahan ([[Urdu|Urdu]]: کهوے هو توم کهاں ) is a 2001 Pakistani Urdu film directed by [[Ajab Gul|Ajab Gul]]. The film starred [[Babar Ali|Babar Ali]], [[Ajab Gul|Ajab Gul]] and [[Meera|Meera (actress)]] in the lead roles.Is is super hit movie in 2001 5 awards winner movie.
title: Khoey Ho Tum Kahan

abstract: It is the first DreamWorks animated feature to feature characters from the [[Classic Media|DreamWorks Classics]] library since DreamWorks Animation's 2012 acquisition of Classic Media, the first animated adaptation of a Jay Ward property, and Rob Minkoff's first animated film after having co-directed [[The Lion King|The Lion King]] for [[Disney|Walt Disney Animation Studios]] in 1994. The film premiered on February 7, 2014 in the United Kingdom, and was released theatrically on March 7, 2014 in the United States. Grossing a worldwide total of $275 million on its $145 million budget, the film underperformed at the box office, forcing a writedown of $57 million. A TV series based on the film, titled [[The Mr. Peabody & Sherman Show|The Mr. Peabody & Sherman Show]], premiered on [[Netflix|Netflix]] on October 9, 2015, with [[Chris Parnell|Chris Parnell]] replacing Ty Burrell as Mr. Peabody while Max Charles reprises his role as Sherman.
title: Mr. Peabody & Sherman

abstract: Moondram Pirai () is a 1982 Indian [[Tamil-language|Tamil language]] [[romantic drama|romantic drama]] film written, directed and filmed by [[Balu Mahendra|Balu Mahendra]]. The film features [[Kamal Haasan|Kamal Haasan]] and [[Sridevi|Sridevi]] in the lead roles, while [[Silk Smitha|Silk Smitha]], [[Poornam Vishwanathan|Poornam Vishwanathan]] and [[Y. G. Mahendra|Y. G. Mahendra]] play supporting roles. The music for the film was composed by [[Ilaiyaraaja|Ilaiyaraaja]], with lyrics written by [[Kannadasan|Kannadasan]], [[Vairamuthu|Vairamuthu]] and [[Gangai Amaran|Gangai Amaran]]. It also featured the last song written by Kannadasan to be recorded before his death in 1981.
title: Moondram Pirai

abstract: Asterix and the Vikings (released in [[French|French language]] as Astérix et les Vikings) is a 2006 French-Danish animated [[feature film|feature film]], written by Stefan Fjeldmark in collaboration with [[Jean-Luc Gossens|Jean-Luc Gossens]], and directed by Stefan Fjeldmark and Jesper Møller. The film is a loose adaptation of the story from the [[graphic novel|graphic novel]] [[Asterix and the Normans|Asterix and the Normans]], which was written by René Goscinny and illustrated by Albert Uderzo. The plot concerns Asterix and Obelix trying to train the nephew of their village's chief, only to find themselves rescuing him from a tribe of vikings who believe him to be a Champion of Fear.
title: Asterix and the Vikings

abstract: Ernest Rides Again is a 1993 American [[comedy film|comedy film]] written and directed by [[John R. Cherry III|John R. Cherry III]] and starring [[Jim Varney|Jim Varney]]. It opens with the song "There Once Was A Man Named Worrell". It is the sixth film to feature the character [[Ernest P. Worrell|Ernest P. Worrell]], the fifth film in the Ernest series, and the last to be released [[theatrically|Movie theater]]. Its gross was $1,433,496. In this movie, Ernest and a history professor discover a long-lost [[Revolutionary War|American Revolutionary War]] cannon and must protect it from others who want the precious jewels hidden inside. Its budget was $7,000,000.
title: Ernest Rides Again

abstract: The Best Intentions () is a 1992 Swedish [[drama film|drama film]] directed by [[Bille August|Bille August]] and written by [[Ingmar Bergman|Ingmar Bergman]]. It is semi-autobiographical, telling the story of the complex relationship between Bergman's parents, [[Erik Bergman|Erik Bergman (Lutheran minister)]] and Karin Åkerblom, who are renamed Henrik and Anna in the film but retain their true surnames. The film documents the courtship and the difficult early years of their marriage, until the point when Anna becomes pregnant with their second son, who corresponds to Ingmar himself. [[Samuel Fröler|Samuel Fröler]] and [[Pernilla August|Pernilla August]] played Henrik and Anna, respectively.
title: The Best Intentions

abstract: Raavanaprabhu () is a 2001 Indian [[Malayalam|Malayalam]]-language [[action|Action film]] [[drama|Drama (film and television)]] film written and directed by [[Ranjith|Ranjith (director)]]. It is a sequel to the 1993 film [[Devaasuram|Devaasuram]] scripted by Ranjith and marks his directorial debut. The film stars [[Mohanlal|Mohanlal]] in the dual role of father and son, Mangalassery Neelakandan and Mangalassery Karthikeyan. [[Napoleon|Napoleon (actor)]] reprises the role of Mundackal Shekharan, the [[archenemy|archenemy]] of Neelakandan.
title: Raavanaprabhu

abstract: The film takes place in the 19th Century British India and is the story of the fight for independence from the British between 1825 and 1875. The film tells the story of men that lead the war against [[British Rule|British Rule]]: Sanga (Dilip Kumar), Bharat (Manoj Kumar) known as Kranti, a prince (Shashi Kapoor) and a freedom fighter (Shatrughan Sinha). Sanga is an honest and dedicated employee in the kingdom of Ramgarh, owing allegiance and loyalty to no one except Raja Laxman Singh. When Laxman Singh conditionally permits the British to use the port for trading purposes, Sangha finds out that the British are taking out gold and jewellery and bringing in ammunition, and puts a stop to this. He goes to report this outrage to Laxman Singh, only to find him stabbed to death. Sanga is charged with treason and of killing Laxman Singh. Sentenced to death, he escapes and forms a group of revolutionaries who have only one goal - to drive the British out of India. This group multiplies into several armies, all united with one slogan - an Independent India, also known as Kranti.
title: Kranti

abstract: Greatest Video Hits 2 is the second [[DVD|DVD]] of [[music videos|music videos]] from the [[English|England]] band, [[Queen|Queen (band)]]. It was released in November 2003, and included video hits of the band from 1981 to 1989. It was at number one in [[UK|United Kingdom]], in its first week. It also peaked at number 1 in [[Ireland|Republic of Ireland]]. In that same year the DVD was number 2 in [[Spain|Spain]], and number 4 in [[Italy|Italy]]. It was certified 2 platinum awards in UK, platinum in [[France|France]] and [[Australia|Australia]], gold in [[Germany|Germany]], Spain, [[Poland|Poland]] and other countries.
title: Greatest Video Hits 2

abstract: Bullet Boy is a 2004 British drama film directed by [[Saul Dibb|Saul Dibb]], written by Saul Dibb and [[Catherine Johnson|Catherine Johnson (novelist)]], and stars [[Ashley Walters|Ashley Walters (actor)]]. The film’s original music was composed and performed by [[Robert Del Naja|Robert Del Naja]] of [[Massive Attack|Massive Attack]], who released it as an [[album|Bullet Boy (soundtrack)]]. The film is about a family in crime-ridden east London, the eldest son’s involvement in gun crime, and the effects of this on his younger brother.
title: Bullet Boy

abstract: Boogeymen: The Killer Compilation is a horror compilation video released in 2001 by FlixMix. Marketed as "The Killer Compilation," the film consists of seventeen scenes from notable, revolutionary horror titles, along with short screens describing the apropos villain.
title: Boogeymen: The Killer Compilation

abstract: Chamatkar (, Translation: Miracle) is a [[1992|Bollywood films of 1992]] Indian [[Hindi|Hindi]] [[ghost|ghost]] [[comedy movie|comedy movie]] directed by [[Rajiv Mehra|Rajiv Mehra]]. It cast [[Naseeruddin Shah|Naseeruddin Shah]], [[Shah Rukh Khan|Shah Rukh Khan]] and [[Urmila Matondkar|Urmila Matondkar]] in pivotal roles. Rajiv Mehra chose to work again with Khan in the 1995 film [[Ram Jaane|Ram Jaane]]. The film was quite popular among children. As of 2016, the rights of this film are owned by [[Shah Rukh Khan|Shah Rukh Khan]]'s Red Chillies Entertainment. This film is an unofficial remake of Hollywood movie [[Blackbeard's Ghost|Blackbeard's Ghost]].
title: Chamatkar

abstract: Kaise Kahoon Ke... Pyaar Hai is a 2003 [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] film. It stars Amit Hingorani, Dharmendra, and Farida Jalal. The movie was directed by Anil Kumaar Sharma and produced by [[Arjun Hingorani|Arjun Hingorani]].
title: Kaise Kahoon Ke... Pyaar Hai

abstract: What Lies Beneath is a 2000 American [[supernatural horror film|supernatural horror film]] directed by [[Robert Zemeckis|Robert Zemeckis]]. It was the first film by the film studio [[ImageMovers|ImageMovers]]. It stars [[Harrison Ford|Harrison Ford]] and [[Michelle Pfeiffer|Michelle Pfeiffer]] as a couple who experience a strange haunting of their home. The film opened in 2,813 theaters in North America, and grossed $291 million at the worldwide box office, becoming the [[tenth-highest grossing film of the year|2000 in film]]. It received mixed reviews, but was nominated for three [[Saturn Award|Saturn Awards]].
title: What Lies Beneath

abstract: The Cell is a 2000 [[science fiction|Science fiction film]] [[horror film|horror film]] directed by [[Tarsem Singh|Tarsem Singh]] in his [[directorial debut|directorial debut]], and starring [[Jennifer Lopez|Jennifer Lopez]], [[Vince Vaughn|Vince Vaughn]], and [[Vincent D'Onofrio|Vincent D'Onofrio]]. It received mixed reviews upon its release, with critics praising its visuals, direction, make-up, costumes and D'Onofrio's performance, while criticizing its [[Silence of the Lambs|The Silence of the Lambs (film)]]-inspired plot, an emphasis on style rather than substance, and masochistic imagery.
title: The Cell

abstract: Jimmy Neutron: Boy Genius is a 2001 American [[computer-animated|computer animation]] [[adventure|Adventure film]] [[comic science fiction|comic science fiction]] film produced by [[Nickelodeon Movies|Nickelodeon Movies]], [[O Entertainment|O Entertainment]], and [[DNA Productions|DNA Productions]], and distributed by [[Paramount Pictures|Paramount Pictures]]. The film was directed by creator [[John A. Davis|John A. Davis]] and written by Davis and producer [[Steve Oedekerk|Steve Oedekerk]], with voice talents by [[Debi Derryberry|Debi Derryberry]], [[Patrick Stewart|Patrick Stewart]], [[Martin Short|Martin Short]], [[Rob Paulsen|Rob Paulsen]], and [[Jeffrey Garcia|Jeffrey Garcia]]. The precursor to the TV show, [[The Adventures of Jimmy Neutron: Boy Genius|The Adventures of Jimmy Neutron: Boy Genius]], which followed shortly after, Jimmy Neutron follows the title character, a schoolboy with super-genius powers who must save all the adults of the world from a race of egg-like aliens known as the Yolkians.
title: Jimmy Neutron: Boy Genius

abstract: is a 1995 Japanese [[science fiction|Science fiction film]] [[tokusatsu|tokusatsu]] [[kaiju film|Kaiju]] featuring [[Godzilla|Godzilla]], produced and distributed by [[Toho|Toho]]. It is the 22nd installment in the [[Godzilla franchise|Godzilla (franchise)]] and the seventh and final film in the [[Heisei series|Godzilla (franchise)#Heisei period (1984–1995)]]. The film is directed by [[Takao Okawara|Takao Okawara]], written by [[Kazuki Ōmori|Kazuki Ōmori]] and stars Takuro Tatsumi, [[Yōko Ishino|Yōko Ishino]], Yasufumi Hayashi, Sayaka Osawa, [[Megumi Odaka|Megumi Odaka]], [[Masahiro Takashima|Masahiro Takashima]], [[Momoko Kochi|Momoko Kochi]], [[Akira Nakao|Akira Nakao]], Shigeru Kamiyama and Saburo Shinoda. In Godzilla vs. Destoroyah, Godzilla is nearing a nuclear meltdown which threatens the Earth and to further worsen the situation, vicious creatures called Destoroyah emerge from the water and start terrorizing Japan, and the Japanese Self-Defense Force must come up with a daring plan to take down both threats.
title: Godzilla vs. Destoroyah

abstract: The Entity is a 1982 American [[horror film|horror film]] directed by [[Sidney J. Furie|Sidney J. Furie]] and written by [[Frank De Felitta|Frank De Felitta]], who adapted his 1978 novel of the same name. It stars [[Barbara Hershey|Barbara Hershey]] as a woman who is raped and tormented by an invisible assailant. Despite being filmed and planned for a release in 1981, the movie was not released in worldwide theaters until September 1982 and February 1983 in the United States. Like the novel, the film is based on the 1974 [[Doris Bither case|Doris Bither case]].
title: The Entity

abstract: The Seven Year Itch is a 1955 American [[romantic comedy|romantic comedy]] film based on a three-act play [[with the same name|The Seven Year Itch (play)]] by [[George Axelrod|George Axelrod]]. The film was co-written and directed by [[Billy Wilder|Billy Wilder]], and stars [[Marilyn Monroe|Marilyn Monroe]] and [[Tom Ewell|Tom Ewell]], reprising his Broadway role from [[the play|The Seven Year Itch (play)]]. It contains one of the most notable images of the 20th century   – Monroe standing on a subway grate as [[her white dress|Marilyn Monroe's white dress]] is blown upwards by a passing train. The titular phrase, which refers to declining interest in a [[monogamous relationship|monogamous relationship]] after seven years of marriage, has been used by [[psychologists|psychology]].
title: The Seven Year Itch

abstract: Hard Boiled () is a [[1992|List of Hong Kong films of 1992]] [[Hong Kong|Hong Kong action cinema]] [[action thriller|action thriller]] film written by [[Barry Wong|Barry Wong]] and directed by [[John Woo|John Woo]]. It stars [[Chow Yun-fat|Chow Yun-fat]] as [[Inspector "Tequila" Yuen|Tequila Yuen]], [[Tony Leung Chiu-Wai|Tony Leung Chiu-Wai]] as Alan an undercover cop, and [[Anthony Wong|Anthony Wong (Hong Kong actor)]] as Johnny Wong, a leader of the criminal [[triads|Triad (underground society)]].
title: Hard Boiled

abstract: Tezaab (translation: Acid) is a [[1988|Bollywood films of 1988]] Indian [[action|Action film]] [[romantic|romance film]] [[Hindi movie|Bollywood]], starring [[Anil Kapoor|Anil Kapoor]] and [[Madhuri Dixit|Madhuri Dixit]] in lead roles. The film gave actress Madhuri Dixit her first big break, making her an overnight star. It reaffirmed Anil Kapoor's star status, after a successful [[Mr India|Mr. India (1987 film)]] (1987).
title: Tezaab

abstract: The Care Bears Movie is a 1985 Canadian-American [[animated|animation]] [[fantasy film|fantasy film]] and the second feature film from the Canadian animation studio [[Nelvana|Nelvana]]. One of the first films based directly on a toy line, it introduced the [[Care Bears|Care Bears]] characters and their companions the [[Care Bear Cousins|Care Bear Cousins]]. In the film, an orphanage owner ([[Mickey Rooney|Mickey Rooney]]) tells a story about the Care Bears, who live in a cloud-filled land called Care-a-Lot. Traveling across Earth, the Bears help two lonely children named Kim and Jason, who lost their parents in a car accident, and also save a young magician's apprentice named Nicholas from an evil spirit's influence. Deep within a place called the Forest of Feelings, Kim, Jason, and their friends soon meet another group of creatures, the Care Bear Cousins.
title: The Care Bears Movie

abstract: The event was filmed by director [[Martin Scorsese|Martin Scorsese]] and made into a [[documentary|Documentary film]] of the same title, released in 1978. [[Jonathan Taplin|Jonathan Taplin]], who was The Band's tour manager from 1969 to 1972 and later produced Scorsese's film [[Mean Streets|Mean Streets]], suggested that Scorsese would be the ideal director for the project and introduced [[Robbie Robertson|Robbie Robertson]] and Scorsese. Taplin served as executive producer. The film features concert performances, intermittent song renditions shot on a studio soundstage, and interviews by Scorsese with members of The Band. A [[triple-LP soundtrack recording|The Last Waltz (1978 album)]], produced by Simon and [[Rob Fraboni|Rob Fraboni]], was issued in 1978. The film was released on DVD in 2002 as was a four-CD [[box set|The Last Waltz (2002 album)]] of the concert and related studio recordings.
title: The Last Waltz

abstract: The SpongeBob SquarePants Movie is a 2004 American [[live-action/animated|Live-action/animated film]] [[comedy film|comedy film]] based on the [[Nickelodeon|Nickelodeon]] [[animated television series|animated television series]] [[SpongeBob SquarePants|SpongeBob SquarePants]]. The film was co-written, directed, and produced by series creator [[Stephen Hillenburg|Stephen Hillenburg]], with live-action sequences directed by [[Mark Osborne|Mark Osborne (filmmaker)]], and features the series' cast of [[Tom Kenny|Tom Kenny]], [[Bill Fagerbakke|Bill Fagerbakke]], [[Clancy Brown|Clancy Brown]], [[Rodger Bumpass|Rodger Bumpass]] and [[Mr. Lawrence|Mr. Lawrence]], while also starring [[Scarlett Johansson|Scarlett Johansson]], [[Jeffrey Tambor|Jeffrey Tambor]], [[Alec Baldwin|Alec Baldwin]] and [[David Hasselhoff|David Hasselhoff]]. It was distributed by [[Paramount Pictures|Paramount Pictures]] and produced by Hillenburg's production company [[United Plankton Pictures|United Plankton Pictures]] along with [[Nickelodeon Movies|Nickelodeon Movies]], with animation provided by [[Rough Draft Korea|Rough Draft Studios]]. The events of the movie take place at the end of the series. It is the first film in the [[SpongeBob SquarePants|SpongeBob SquarePants (film series)]] film series. In this film, [[Plankton|Plankton (character)]] devises a plan to discredit his business rival [[Mr. Krabs|Mr. Krabs]] by stealing [[King Neptune|Neptune (mythology)]]'s crown and framing Mr. Krabs for the crime. [[SpongeBob|SpongeBob SquarePants (character)]] and [[Patrick|Patrick Star]] team up to retrieve the crown from Shell City to save Mr. Krabs from Neptune's wrath and the oceanic world from Plankton's plan.
title: The SpongeBob SquarePants Movie

abstract: Dames is a 1934 [[Warner Bros.|Warner Bros.]] [[musical|musical film]] [[comedy film|comedy film]] directed by [[Ray Enright|Ray Enright]] with dance numbers created by [[Busby Berkeley|Busby Berkeley]]. The film stars [[Ruby Keeler|Ruby Keeler]], [[Dick Powell|Dick Powell]], [[Joan Blondell|Joan Blondell]], [[Guy Kibbee|Guy Kibbee]], [[ZaSu Pitts|ZaSu Pitts]], and [[Hugh Herbert|Hugh Herbert]]. Production numbers and songs include "When You Were a Smile on Your Mother's Lips (and a Twinkle in Your Daddy's Eye)", "The Girl at the Ironing Board", "[[I Only Have Eyes for You|I Only Have Eyes for You]]", "Dames" and "Try to See It My Way".
title: Dames

abstract: The March of Time organization also produced four feature films for theatrical release, and created documentary series for early television. Its first TV series, [[Crusade in Europe|Crusade in Europe]] (1949), received a [[Peabody Award|List of Peabody Award winners (1940–1949)#1949]] and one of the first [[Emmy Award|Emmy Awards]].
title: The March of Time

abstract: Class of '44 is a 1973 American [[coming-of-age|coming-of-age]] [[comedy-drama|comedy-drama]] film based on the memoirs of screenwriter [[Herman Raucher|Herman Raucher]]. Directed by [[Paul Bogart|Paul Bogart]], it is structured as a sequel to the 1971 film [[Summer of '42|Summer of '42]] which recounted the events in the earlier portion of Raucher's memoirs.
title: Class of '44

abstract: Prem Rog (; Love Sickness) is a 1982 [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[romantic film|Romance film]] directed by [[Raj Kapoor|Raj Kapoor]]. The film tells the story of a man's love towards a woman who is a widow and of a higher status. The film is considered a classic work by the director [[Raj Kapoor|Raj Kapoor]]. Raj Kapoor returned to social themes with this film. The film earned high critical acclaim. The screenplay was written by [[Jainendra Jain|Jainendra K. Jain (screenwriter)]] and [[Kamna Chandra|Kamna Chandra]].
title: Prem Rog

abstract: Lapitch the Little Shoemaker () is a 1997 [[animated feature|animation]] that was originally released in [[Croatia|Croatian]] theatres in 1997 by [[Croatia Film|Croatia Film]]. Produced on vintage [[cel|cel]] equipment during the early 1990s, this was the third feature from Croatia Film's animation unit and director [[Milan Blažeković|Milan Blažeković]], after [[The Elm-Chanted Forest|The Elm-Chanted Forest]] (1986) and [[The Magician's Hat|The Magician's Hat (film)]] (1990).
title: Lapitch the Little Shoemaker

abstract: Anpadh ([[Hindi|Hindi]]: अन्पढ, [[Urdu|Urdu]]: اَنپڑھ, [[translation|translation]]: illiterate) is a [[1962|Bollywood films of 1962]] Hindi film. The film stars [[Dharmendra|Dharmendra]], [[Mala Sinha|Mala Sinha]], [[Shashi Kala|Shashi Kala]] and [[Balraj Sahni|Balraj Sahni]]. The music is by [[Madan Mohan|Madan Mohan]] and the lyrics by [[Raja Mehdi Ali Khan|Raja Mehdi Ali Khan]]. The film focuses on the importance of education for girls. This movie also has hit songs such as the evergreen song "Aap Ki Nazron Nay Samjha", sung by [[Lata Mangeshkar|Lata Mangeshkar]].
title: Anpadh

abstract: Adventures in Voice Acting contains interviews up to 100 [[voice actor|voice actings]], producers, and casting directors that are in [[anime|anime]] [[dub|dubbing (filmmaking)s]] and [[video game|video games]]. The DVD was released on July 3, 2008, after first of three volumes were released at [[Anime Expo|Anime Expo]]. It took three years to complete, from concept to release, and was created by Bang Zoom to answer many questions they received from people wanted to know how to become a voice actor. Each episode is introduced by the animated character Mr. Mic, which was designed specifically for the documentary.
title: Adventures in Voice Acting

abstract: Manasellam (English : All over heart) is a 2003 medium-budget Tamil film starring [[Srikanth|Srikanth (Tamil actor)]] and [[Trisha|Trisha (actress)]]. The film is [[directed|Film director]] by Santhosh. The [[score|Film score]] and [[soundtrack|soundtrack]], [[composed|musical composition]] by [[Illayaraja|Illayaraja]], was [[released|Release (music)]] on March 2003 and failed both critically and commercially. It got dubbed as Manasantha in [[Telugu|Telugu language]].
title: Manasellam

abstract: Rajavin Parvaiyile; () is a 1995 [[Tamil|Tamil language]] [[romantic|Romance film]] [[drama film|Drama (film and television)]], directed by Janaki Soundar, starring [[Vijay|Vijay (actor)]] and [[Indraja|Indraja (actress)]] in the lead roles, with [[Ajith Kumar|Ajith Kumar]] in second lead role. This was the only film to feature [[Vijay|Vijay (actor)]] and [[Ajith Kumar|Ajith Kumar]] together. The film, which featured music composed by [[Ilaiyaraaja|Ilaiyaraaja]], was released in August 1995. However, it did not match the expectation of the audience and was criticized as a failure.
title: Rajavin Parvaiyile

abstract: An English-language version made by Films by Jove was released direct-to-video in 1996 under the name Adventures of Mowgli. [[Charlton Heston|Charlton Heston]] is the narrator in the English version.
title: Adventures of Mowgli

abstract: Vattaram is a 2006 [[Tamil|Tamil language]] [[gangster film|gangster film]] written, produced, and directed by [[Saran|Saran (director)]]. The film stars [[Arya|Arya (actor)]], [[Napoleon|Napoleon (actor)]], and [[Kirat Bhattal|Kirat Bhattal]] in the lead roles. The film's score and soundtrack are composed by [[Bharathwaj|Bharathwaj]]. The film released on 21 October 2006. This film declared average at the box office. The film was dubbed in Hindi as Are You Ready To Fight.
title: Vattaram

abstract: Yeh Dillagi (English:This Light Hearted Jest) is a [[1994|Bollywood films of 1994]] Indian [[romantic drama film|romantic drama film]], produced by [[Yash Chopra|Yash Chopra]] and directed by Naresh Malhotra under the banner of [[Yash Raj Films|Yash Raj Films]]. It stars [[Saif Ali Khan|Saif Ali Khan]], [[Akshay Kumar|Akshay Kumar]] and [[Kajol|Kajol]]. [[Karisma Kapoor|Karisma Kapoor]] has a special appearance. It was the sixth highest-grossing film of 1994. Akshay Kumar was nominated as Best Actor and Kajol for Best Actress at the [[Filmfare Awards|Filmfare Awards]].
title: Yeh Dillagi

abstract: The Amazing Transparent Man is a 1960 [[science fiction film|science fiction film]] starring [[Marguerite Chapman|Marguerite Chapman]]. It is an [[American|United States]] [[B-movie|B-movie]] which follows the story of an insane ex–U.S. Army major who uses an escaped criminal to steal materials to improve the invisibility machine his scientist prisoner made. It was one of two sci-fi films shot back-to-back in Dallas, Texas by director [[Edgar G. Ulmer|Edgar G. Ulmer]] (the other being [[Beyond the Time Barrier|Beyond the Time Barrier]], also released in that same year). The combined filming schedule for both films was only two weeks. The film was later featured in an episode of [[Mystery Science Theater 3000|Mystery Science Theater 3000]].
title: The Amazing Transparent Man

abstract: Passage to Marseille, also known as Message to Marseille, is a 1944 [[war film|war film]] made by [[Warner Brothers|Warner Brothers]], directed by [[Michael Curtiz|Michael Curtiz]]. The [[screenplay|screenplay]] was by [[Casey Robinson|Casey Robinson]] and [[Jack Moffitt|Jack Moffitt]] from the novel Sans Patrie (Men Without Country) by [[Charles Nordhoff|Charles Nordhoff]] and [[James Norman Hall|James Norman Hall]]. The music score was by [[Max Steiner|Max Steiner]] and the cinematography was by [[James Wong Howe|James Wong Howe]].
title: Passage to Marseille

abstract: The plot revolves around Padayappa (Rajinikanth), an engineer whose father (Sivaji Ganesan) dies of shock soon after he is defrauded and loses his property to his foster brother ([[Manivannan|Manivannan]]). Neelambari (Ramya Krishnan) initially loves Padayappa, but plans to take revenge on him and his love interest Vasundhara (Soundarya) after his family humiliates her father (Radha Ravi). The rest of the story deals with Padayappa climbing back to financial success and arranging his daughters' marriage while overcoming all the obstacles placed by Neelambari.
title: Padayappa

abstract: Ta Ra Rum Pum is a 2007 Indian [[sports|sports film]]-[[drama film|Drama (film and television)]]. The film stars [[Saif Ali Khan|Saif Ali Khan]], [[Rani Mukerji|Rani Mukerji]], Angelina Idani, [[Ali Haji|Ali Haji (actor)]] and [[Javed Jaffrey|Javed Jaffrey]]. This is the second time the lead pair worked together after the success of their last film, [[Hum Tum|Hum Tum]] (2004). It was directed by [[Siddharth Anand|Siddharth Anand]], who directed 2005's [[Salaam Namaste|Salaam Namaste]] (Also starring Khan), and also wrote Hum Tum. The film was a hit at the box office in India and was one of the highest-grossing films of 2007. Ta Ra Rum Pum marks the final commercial success in a romance film of [[Rani Mukerji|Rani Mukerji]], who was the highest-paid actress in Bollywood during the 2000s.
title: Ta Ra Rum Pum

abstract: Jaani Dushman (English: Lifetime Enemy) is a [[1979|Bollywood films of 1979]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[horror|horror film]] [[fantasy|fantasy]] [[thriller|thriller (genre)]] film, produced and directed by [[Rajkumar Kohli|Rajkumar Kohli]] under the Shankar Movies banner. It features a huge ensemble cast including [[Sunil Dutt|Sunil Dutt]], [[Sanjeev Kumar|Sanjeev Kumar]], [[Jeetendra|Jeetendra]], [[Shatrughan Sinha|Shatrughan Sinha]], [[Vinod Mehra|Vinod Mehra]], [[Reena Roy|Reena Roy]], [[Rekha|Rekha]], [[Neetu Singh|Neetu Singh]] in the lead roles and music composed by [[Laxmikant-Pyarelal|Laxmikant-Pyarelal]]. The film is recorded as a Super Hit at the box office.
title: Jaani Dushman

abstract: Universal Classic Monsters is a phrase used to describe the [[horror|Horror film]], [[fantasy|Dark fantasy]], [[suspense|Thriller (genre)]] and [[science fiction|science fiction film]] films made by [[Universal Pictures|Universal Pictures]] during the decades of the 1920s through the 1950s. They began with [[The Hunchback of Notre Dame|The Hunchback of Notre Dame (1923 film)]] and [[The Phantom of the Opera|The Phantom of the Opera (1925 film)]], both [[silent films|silent films]] starring [[Lon Chaney|Lon Chaney]]. Universal continued with [[talkies|Sound film]] including monster franchises [[Dracula|Dracula (1931 English-language film)]], [[Frankenstein|Frankenstein (1931 film)]], [[The Mummy|The Mummy (1932 film)]], [[The Invisible Man|The Invisible Man (1933 film)]], [[The Wolf Man|The Wolf Man (1941 film)]] and [[Creature from the Black Lagoon|Creature from the Black Lagoon]]. The films often featured [[Bela Lugosi|Bela Lugosi]], [[Boris Karloff|Boris Karloff]] and [[Lon Chaney Jr.|Lon Chaney Jr.]]
title: Universal Classic Monsters

abstract: Le Doulos () is a 1963 French [[crime film|crime film]] written and directed by [[Jean-Pierre Melville|Jean-Pierre Melville]], adapted from the novel of the same name by [[Pierre Lesou|Pierre Lesou]]. It was released theatrically as The Finger Man in the [[English-speaking world|English-speaking world]], but all [[video|video]] and [[DVD|DVD]] releases have used the French title. Intertitles at the beginning of the film explain that its title refers both to a kind of [[hat|hat]] and to the slang term for a police [[informant|informant]].
title: Le Doulos

abstract: Chithiram Pesuthadi () is a 2006 Indian Tamil [[romantic drama|romantic drama]] [[thriller film|thriller film]] written and directed by [[Mysskin|Mysskin]]. The film stars [[Narain|Narain (actor)]] and [[Bhavana|Bhavana (actress)]], both making their debuts in Tamil cinema. The film's score and soundtrack are composed by [[Sundar C Babu|Sundar C Babu]]. Produced by Dreambridge Productions on a budget of 1.20 crores, the film faced publicity issues but later released in Chennai and the rest of Tamil Nadu. The movie became a massive hit of that year.
