The film was later remade to [[Telugu|Telugu cinema]] as [[Raju Bhai|Raju Bhai]], in Kannada as [[Kichha Huchha|Kichha Huchha]] and in Oriya as Abhimanyu. [[Bhavana|Bhavana (actress)]]'s performance as Charu received critical acclaim and earned her the [[Filmfare Award for Best Actress – Tamil|Filmfare Award for Best Actress – Tamil]].
title: Chithiram Pesuthadi

abstract: The Return of Captain Invincible is a 1983 Australian [[musical|musical film]] [[comedy|comedy film]] [[superhero|superhero]] film starring [[Alan Arkin|Alan Arkin]] and [[Christopher Lee|Christopher Lee]]. It grossed a mere $55,110 at the Australian box office despite a budget of $7 million.
title: The Return of Captain Invincible

abstract: Gang Leader is a 1991 Indian [[Telugu|Telugu cinema]] [[language action crime film|crime film]] starring [[Chiranjeevi|Chiranjeevi]] and [[Vijayashanti|Vijayashanti]], directed by [[Vijaya Bapineedu|Vijaya Bapineedu]], with soundtrack by [[Bappi Lahiri|Bappi Lahiri]], and dance choreography by [[Prabhu Deva|Prabhu Deva]]. The film was recorded as an Industry Hit and a cult classic by becoming the Telugu's daily vernacular. The film is often credited as one of the biggest hits in [[Chiranjeevi|Chiranjeevi]]'s career. It surpassed the box office collections of the blockbuster and industry hit [[Jagadeka Veerudu Athiloka Sundari|Jagadeka Veerudu Athiloka Sundari]]. Later it was dubbed in Tamil with same title. The film was later remade in Hindi as [[Aaj Ka Goonda Raj|Aaj Ka Goonda Raj]], which [[Chiranjeevi|Chiranjeevi]] reprising his role and [[Meenakshi Seshadri|Meenakshi Seshadri]] in lead roles, and in Kannada as [[Kutumba|Kutumba]], starring [[Upendra|Upendra (actor)]].
title: Gang Leader

abstract: The Alien Encounters is a 1979 [[science fiction|science fiction]] film written and directed by [[James T. Flocker|James T. Flocker]]. It is an American [[B movie|B movie]] which follows the story of an investigator who is sent to locate an alien [[probe|Space probe]] which has landed on [[Earth|Earth]]. Aliens from [[Barnard's Star|Barnard's Star]] have created a machine known as a betatron which has remarkable rejuvenating effects.
title: The Alien Encounters

abstract: Madhuchandralekha is a [[Malayalam film|Malayalam film]] directed by [[Rajasenan|Rajasenan]]. This film stars [[Jayaram|Jayaram]], [[Urvashi|Urvashi (actress)]] and [[Mamta Mohandas|Mamta Mohandas]] in the lead.
title: Madhuchandralekha

abstract: Piya Ka Ghar ([[Devanagari|Devanagari]]: पिया का घर, [[Nastaliq|Nastaliq]]: پیا کا گھر, [[translation|translation]]: "My Beloved's House") is a [[1972|List of Bollywood films of 1972]] [[Hindi|Hindi]] [[comedy|comedy]] set (mainly) in [[Mumbai|Mumbai]] in the 1970s. It is a remake of [[Raja Thakur|Raja Thakur]]'s Marathi film [[Mumbaicha Jawai|Mumbaicha Jawai]]. It portrays the difficulties of life in India's biggest city during the 1970s in the form of a comic family drama.
title: Piya Ka Ghar

abstract: Carla's Song is a 1996 [[British|United Kingdom]] film, directed by [[Ken Loach|Ken Loach]] and written by [[Paul Laverty|Paul Laverty]], that deals with the impact of the [[Contra War|Contra War]].
title: Carla's Song

abstract: Aloha from Hawaii Via Satellite is a [[concert|concert]] that was headlined by [[Elvis Presley|Elvis Presley]], and was broadcast live via satellite on January 14, 1973. The concert took place at the Honolulu International Center (HIC) in [[Honolulu|Honolulu]] (now known as the [[Neal S. Blaisdell Center|Neal S. Blaisdell Center]]) and aired in over 40 countries across Asia and Europe (who received the telecast the next day, also in primetime). Despite the satellite innovation, [[NBC|NBC]] did not broadcast an edited version of the concert in the United States until April 4, 1973 because the concert took place the same day as [[Super Bowl VII|Super Bowl VII]]. The decision paid off handsomely for the network, attracting 51 percent of the television viewing audience to become NBC’s highest rated program of the year. Viewing figures were estimated to be between 1 and 1.5 billion viewers worldwide: more people than saw man landing on the moon. The show was the most expensive entertainment special at the time, costing $2.5 million.
title: Aloha from Hawaii Via Satellite

abstract: Street Fighter Alpha: The Animation, released in Japan as , and also known as Street Fighter Alpha: The Movie, is a 2000 [[OVA|Original Video Animation]] film based on the [[Street Fighter Alpha|Street Fighter Alpha]] [[fighting game|fighting games]]. It was [[directed|film director]] by Shigeyasu Yamauchi, with character designs by Yoshihiko Umakoshi. An [[English adaptation|dubbing (filmmaking)]] was produced by [[Manga Entertainment|Manga Entertainment]] and released in 2001.
title: Street Fighter Alpha: The Animation

abstract: Hirak Rajar Deshe ( [[Hirok Rajar Deshe|Romanization of Bengali]], lit. "in the land of the Diamond King". English title: Kingdom of Diamonds, 1980) is an Indian Bengali [[dystopian film|dystopian film]], sequel to the 1969 film [[Goopy Gyne Bagha Byne|Goopy Gyne Bagha Byne]] and the second installment of [[Goopy Gyne Bagha Byne series|Goopy Gyne Bagha Byne (film series)]] directed by [[Satyajit Ray|Satyajit Ray]]. A unique aspect of the film is that most of the dialogues exchanged by the protagonists of the film are rhyming. The only person who did not speak in rhyme was the teacher, symbolizing that though the thoughts of everybody else are bound, the teacher was a free-thinker. The film was followed by the third film of the series directed by Satyajit Ray's son, [[Sandip Ray|Sandip Ray]].
title: Hirak Rajar Deshe

abstract: Flesh for Frankenstein is a 1973 [[horror film|horror film]] written and directed by [[Paul Morrissey|Paul Morrissey]]. It stars [[Udo Kier|Udo Kier]], [[Joe Dallesandro|Joe Dallesandro]], [[Monique van Vooren|Monique van Vooren]] and Arno Juerging. Interiors were filmed at [[Cinecittà|Cinecittà]] in [[Rome|Rome]] by a crew of Italian filmmakers.
title: Flesh for Frankenstein

abstract: The Last Wave is a 1977 Australian [[mystery|Mystery film]] [[drama film|Drama (film and television)]] directed by [[Peter Weir|Peter Weir]]. It is about a white solicitor in [[Sydney|Sydney]] whose seemingly normal life is disrupted after he takes on a murder case and discovers that he shares a strange, mystical connection with the small group of local [[Australian Aborigines|Australian Aborigines]] accused of the crime.
title: The Last Wave

abstract: Public Access is a 1993 American [[drama|Drama (film and television)]] film directed by [[Bryan Singer|Bryan Singer]] in his feature film debut. Singer also wrote the screenplay with [[Christopher McQuarrie|Christopher McQuarrie]] and Michael Feit Dougan. The film was shot in 18   days for US$250,000. It was screened at the 1993 [[Sundance Film Festival|Sundance Film Festival]], where it was a joint winner of the Grand Jury Prize. Critics praised the technical direction of Public Access but did not lend similar praise to the film's story and the characters.
title: Public Access

abstract: Set 22 years after the events of [[Jurassic Park|Jurassic Park (film)]], Jurassic World takes place on the same fictional [[Central American|Central American]] island of [[Isla Nublar|Isla Nublar]], which is located off the Pacific coast of [[Costa Rica|Costa Rica]], where a [[theme park|Animal theme park]] of [[cloned|Cloning]] [[dinosaur|dinosaurs]] has operated for nearly a decade. The park plunges into chaos when a [[genetically-engineered|Genetic engineering]] dinosaur escapes from its enclosure and goes on a rampage.
title: Jurassic World

abstract: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice is a 2016 American [[superhero film|superhero film]] featuring the [[DC Comics|DC Comics]] characters [[Batman|Batman]] and [[Superman|Superman]]. Directed by [[Zack Snyder|Zack Snyder]], the film is the second installment in the [[DC Extended Universe|DC Extended Universe]] (DCEU), following 2013's [[Man of Steel|Man of Steel (film)]]. It was written by [[Chris Terrio|Chris Terrio]] and [[David S. Goyer|David S. Goyer]], and features an [[ensemble cast|ensemble cast]] that includes [[Ben Affleck|Ben Affleck]], [[Henry Cavill|Henry Cavill]], [[Amy Adams|Amy Adams]], [[Jesse Eisenberg|Jesse Eisenberg]], [[Diane Lane|Diane Lane]], [[Laurence Fishburne|Laurence Fishburne]], [[Jeremy Irons|Jeremy Irons]], [[Holly Hunter|Holly Hunter]], and [[Gal Gadot|Gal Gadot]]. Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice is the first live-action film to feature Batman and Superman together, as well as the first live-action cinematic portrayal of [[Wonder Woman|Wonder Woman]]. In the film, criminal mastermind [[Lex Luthor|Lex Luthor]] (Eisenberg) manipulates Batman (Affleck) into a preemptive battle with Superman (Cavill), whom Luthor is obsessed with to defeat him.
title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice

abstract: All for the Winner (Chinese: 賭聖 Literal translation: Saint of Gambling) is a 1990 Hong Kong [[comedy film|comedy film]] directed by [[Jeffrey Lau|Jeffrey Lau]] and [[Corey Yuen|Corey Yuen]].
title: All for the Winner

abstract: A popular piece in the [[Cinema of Quebec|Cinema of Quebec]], C.R.A.Z.Y. was one of the highest-grossing films of the year in the province. The film won numerous honours, among them 11 [[Genie Awards|26th Genie Awards]], including [[Best Motion Picture|Academy of Canadian Cinema and Television Award for Best Motion Picture]]. At Quebec's [[Prix Jutra|Prix Jutra]] film awards, it won 13 awards in the competitive categories from 14 nominations, becoming the all-time record holder for most award wins at that ceremony; it also won both of the box-office based awards, the Billet d'or and the Film s'étant le plus illustré à l'extérieur du Québec, for a total of 15 awards overall.
title: C.R.A.Z.Y.

abstract: The Wrong Box (1966) is a British [[comedy film|comedy film]] made by Salamander Film Productions and distributed by [[Columbia Pictures|Columbia Pictures]]. It was produced and directed by [[Bryan Forbes|Bryan Forbes]] from a screenplay by [[Larry Gelbart|Larry Gelbart]] and [[Burt Shevelove|Burt Shevelove]], based on the 1889 novel [[The Wrong Box|The Wrong Box (novel)]] by [[Robert Louis Stevenson|Robert Louis Stevenson]] and [[Lloyd Osbourne|Lloyd Osbourne]].
title: The Wrong Box

abstract: Tere Naam (English: In your name) is a 2003 Indian Hindi-language [[romantic drama|romantic drama]] film directed by [[Satish Kaushik|Satish Kaushik]]. Written by [[Bala|Bala (director)]] and [[Jainendra Jain|Jainendra Jain (screenwriter)]], the film stars [[Salman Khan|Salman Khan]] and [[Bhumika Chawla|Bhumika Chawla]] in her [[Hindi|Hindi]] film debut. The film is a remake of Bala's own Tamil film [[Sethu|Sethu (film)]] (1999).
title: Tere Naam

abstract: The Star Wars prequel trilogy is a set of three prequel films in the [[Star Wars|Star Wars]] franchise, an American [[space opera|space opera]] created by [[George Lucas|George Lucas]]. Like the [[original trilogy|Star Wars Trilogy]], it was produced by [[Lucasfilm Ltd.|Lucasfilm Ltd.]] and distributed by [[20th Century Fox|20th Century Fox]]. The trilogy consists of [[The Phantom Menace|Star Wars: Episode I – The Phantom Menace]] (1999), [[Attack of the Clones|Star Wars: Episode II – Attack of the Clones]] (2002), and [[Revenge of the Sith|Star Wars: Episode III – Revenge of the Sith]] (2005). The first two films received mixed reviews, while the third was somewhat more well received.
title: Star Wars prequel trilogy

abstract: The movie is sometimes referred to as C'est la vie, mon chérie even though this is grammatically incorrect in [[French|French language]] (either "mon chéri" or "ma chérie" is grammatically correct). The title may be roughly translated as "That's life, my darling/love".
title: C'est la vie, mon chéri

abstract: Awaara (, ), also written Awāra and known overseas as The Vagabond, is a [[1951|1951 in film]] [[Indian film|Indian film]], produced and directed by [[Raj Kapoor|Raj Kapoor]], and written by [[Khwaja Ahmad Abbas|Khwaja Ahmad Abbas]]. It stars Raj Kapoor, [[Nargis|Nargis]], Raj's real-life father [[Prithviraj Kapoor|Prithviraj Kapoor]], [[Leela Chitnis|Leela Chitnis]], and [[K. N. Singh|K. N. Singh]]. Other members of the [[Kapoor family|Kapoor family]] make an appearance, including Raj's youngest real-life brother [[Shashi Kapoor|Shashi Kapoor]], who plays the younger version of his character, and Prithiviraj's father Dewan Bashwanath Kapoor, playing a cameo role in his only film appearance. The film's music was composed by [[Shankar Jaikishan|Shankar Jaikishan]].The film centers on the intertwining lives of poor Raj (Kapoor) and privileged Rita (Nargis). In the film, Kapoor's poor, innocent "[[little tramp|The Tramp]]" character references [[Charlie Chaplin|Charlie Chaplin]] and was further developed in other Kapoor films such as [[Shree 420|Shree 420]].
title: Awaara

abstract: Chaudhvin Ka Chand () is a [[1960|Bollywood films of 1960]] Urdu-language feature film directed by Mohammed Sadiq. This film was a box-office hit, one of the top grossing films of 1960.[1] production of [[Guru Dutt|Guru Dutt]], the film centers on a love triangle between [[Guru Dutt|Guru Dutt]], [[Rehman|Rehman (actor)]] and [[Waheeda Rehman|Waheeda Rehman]], and features [[music|music]] by [[Ravi|Ravi (music director)]]. [[Farida Jalal|Farida Jalal]] makes a guest appearance in the film, her debut. After the disastrous box office performance of [[Kaagaz Ke Phool|Kaagaz Ke Phool]], this was a highly commercially successful comeback film for [[Guru Dutt|Guru Dutt]], which saved [[Guru Dutt|Guru Dutt]]'s production studio from ruins.
title: Chaudhvin Ka Chand

abstract: The Thirteenth Floor is a 1999 [[neo-noir|neo-noir]] [[science fiction|science fiction]] [[crime|crime]] [[thriller|Thriller (genre)]] film written and directed by [[Josef Rusnak|Josef Rusnak]], and produced by [[Roland Emmerich|Roland Emmerich]]. It is loosely based upon [[Simulacron-3|Simulacron-3]] (1964), a novel by [[Daniel F. Galouye|Daniel F. Galouye]]. The film stars [[Craig Bierko|Craig Bierko]], [[Gretchen Mol|Gretchen Mol]], [[Armin Mueller-Stahl|Armin Mueller-Stahl]], [[Vincent D'Onofrio|Vincent D'Onofrio]], and [[Dennis Haysbert|Dennis Haysbert]]. In 2000, The Thirteenth Floor was nominated for the [[Saturn Award for Best Science Fiction Film|Saturn Award for Best Science Fiction Film]], but lost to [[The Matrix|The Matrix]].
title: The Thirteenth Floor

abstract: So Close is a 2002 [[Hong Kong|Hong Kong]] action film directed by [[Corey Yuen|Corey Yuen]] and starring [[Shu Qi|Shu Qi]], [[Zhao Wei|Zhao Wei]] and [[Karen Mok|Karen Mok]].
title: So Close

abstract: Idaya Kovil () is a 1985 Indian [[Tamil language|Tamil language]] film directed by [[Mani Ratnam|Mani Ratnam]], starring [[Mohan|Mohan (actor)]], [[Ambika|Ambika (actress)]], [[Radha|Radha (actress)]] and [[Goundamani|Goundamani]]. The score and soundtrack were composed by [[Ilaiyaraaja|Ilaiyaraaja]] which went on to become huge hits. The film did well at the box office.
title: Idaya Kovil

abstract: Unaru () is a 1984 Indian [[Malayalam|Malayalam]]-language film directed by [[Mani Ratnam|Mani Ratnam]], starring [[Mohanlal|Mohanlal]], [[Sukumaran|Sukumaran]], [[Ratheesh|Ratheesh]], [[Sabitha Anand|Sabitha Anand]], [[Ashokan|Ashokan (actor)]] and [[Balan K. Nair|Balan K. Nair]]. The film gives the inside view of the problems that arose in the labour trade union parties in Kerala, with music composed by [[Ilaiyaraaja|Ilaiyaraaja]] and cinematography by [[Ramachandra Babu|Ramachandra Babu]].
title: Unaru

abstract: Taylor's Wall is a 2001 [[television film|television film]] directed by Craig Ross Jr., written by [[Cheryl McKay|Cheryl McKay]] and starring [[Sam Doumit|Sam Doumit]] and Lukas Behnken.
title: Taylor's Wall

abstract: Dragon Ball Z: Lord Slug, also known by its Japanese title , is a 1991 Japanese [[animated|Anime]] [[science fiction|Science fiction film]] [[martial arts film|martial arts film]] and the fourth [[Dragon Ball Z|Dragon Ball Z]] feature movie. It was originally released in [[Japan|Japan]] on March 9 between episodes 81 and 82 at the Toei Anime Fair as part of a double feature with the first [[Magical Tarurūto-kun|Magical Tarurūto-kun]] movie. An American English dub was produced by [[Funimation|Funimation]] and released to VHS and DVD on August 7, 2001. Two other English dubs were also produced, one in France by [[AB Groupe|AB Groupe]] done for European markets which was released under the misspelt title Super Saiya Son Goku, and another one for a [[Malaysia|Malaysian]] [[VCD|VCD]] release by Speedy Video which had the title Super Saiya People, Goku. While the Malaysian dub's cast remains unknown, the AB Groupe dub was revealed to have been recorded by English-speaking actors based in France who have also done voices for animated television series such as [[Code Lyoko|Code Lyoko]] and [[Chris Colorado|Chris Colorado]].
title: Dragon Ball Z: Lord Slug

abstract: Glorious Betsy is a 1928 [[silent film|silent film]] with talking sequences. It is based on a play of the same name by [[Rida Johnson Young|Rida Johnson Young]], and it stars [[Dolores Costello|Dolores Costello]]. It was produced by [[Warner Bros.|Warner Bros.]] and nominated for an [[Academy Award|Academy Awards]] for [[Best Writing, Adaptation|Academy Award for Best Adapted Screenplay]] in 1929. The film was directed by [[Alan Crosland|Alan Crosland]] with [[cinematography|cinematography]] by [[Hal Mohr|Hal Mohr]]. A mute print of this film survives in the [[Library of Congress|Library of Congress]], and while the copy is missing some of the sound reels, it's unknown whether other copies of the sound have been preserved elsewhere. Vitaphone track survive incomplete at [[UCLA Film and Television Archive|UCLA Film and Television Archive]].
title: Glorious Betsy

abstract: Dil Aashna Hai () is a [[1992|Bollywood films of 1992]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[romantic film|romantic film]], produced & directed by [[Hema Malini|Hema Malini]] under the H. M. Creations banner. It stars [[Shah Rukh Khan|Shah Rukh Khan]], [[Divya Bharti|Divya Bharti]] in the lead roles along with [[Jeetendra|Jeetendra]], [[Mithun Chakraborty|Mithun Chakraborty]], [[Dimple Kapadia|Dimple Kapadia]], [[Amrita Singh|Amrita Singh]], [[Sonu Walia|Sonu Walia]] in the pivotal roles, with music composed by [[Anand-Milind|Anand-Milind]]. This was the first film Shahrukh Khan signed in 1991 but due to delays, [[Deewana|Deewana (1992 film)]] ended up releasing first which marked his debut in Bollywood. The movie is adapted from the TV miniseries [[Lace|Lace (miniseries)]], which was based on the novel of the same name by author [[Shirley Conran|Shirley Conran]].
title: Dil Aashna Hai

abstract: Space Chimps is a 2008 [[3D|3D film]] [[computer-animated|Computer animation]] [[comic science fiction|comic science fiction]] film directed by [[Kirk DeMicco|Kirk DeMicco]] and written by DeMicco and Rob Moreland. It features the voices of [[Andy Samberg|Andy Samberg]], [[Cheryl Hines|Cheryl Hines]], [[Jeff Daniels|Jeff Daniels]], [[Patrick Warburton|Patrick Warburton]], [[Kristin Chenoweth|Kristin Chenoweth]], [[Kenan Thompson|Kenan Thompson]], [[Zack Shada|Zack Shada]], [[Carlos Alazraqui|Carlos Alazraqui]], [[Omid Abtahi|Omid Abtahi]], [[Patrick Breen|Patrick Breen]], [[Jane Lynch|Jane Lynch]], [[Kath Soucie|Kath Soucie]], and [[Stanley Tucci|Stanley Tucci]].
title: Space Chimps

abstract: is a 1992 [[Indo|India]]-[[Japanese|Anime]] [[traditional animation|traditional animation]] feature film directed by and produced by [[Yugo Sako|Yugo Sako]] and based on the [[Indian epic|Indian epic]] the [[Ramayana|Ramayana]]. The original English version with [[Sanskrit|Sanskrit]] songs was screened and released on home video under various names including Ramayana: The Legend of Prince Rama and Warrior Prince.
title: Ramayana: The Legend of Prince Rama

abstract: Opal Dream (also known as Pobby and Dingan) is a 2006 Australian [[drama|drama film]] film, based on the [[Ben Rice|Ben Rice (author)]] [[novella|novella]] [[Pobby and Dingan|Pobby and Dingan]], directed by [[Peter Cattaneo|Peter Cattaneo]] and starring an ensemble cast including [[Vince Colosimo|Vince Colosimo]], [[Jacqueline McKenzie|Jacqueline McKenzie]], [[Christian Byers|Christian Byers]] and [[Sapphire Boyce|Sapphire Boyce]]. It was filmed on location around [[South Australia|South Australia]], in [[Adelaide|Adelaide]], [[Coober Pedy|Coober Pedy]] and [[Woomera|Woomera, South Australia]]. Opal Dream was released in Australia on 28 September 2006, with eventual release around the world.
title: Opal Dream

abstract: Daku Mangal Singh is a 1966 [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] action movie directed by [[Chand|Chand (director)]] and starring [[Dara Singh|Dara Singh]], [[Mumtaz|Mumtaz (actress)]] and [[Prithviraj Kapoor|Prithviraj Kapoor]].
title: Daku Mangal Singh

abstract: Édith et Marcel is a 1983 [[French|France]] film directed by [[Claude Lelouch|Claude Lelouch]].
title: Édith et Marcel

abstract: Ramji Londonwaley () is a 2005 [[Hindi|Hindi]]-language [[comedy-drama|comedy-drama]] film directed by Sanjay Dayma and produced by [[Sunanda Murali Manohar|Sunanda Murali Manohar]]. The film features [[R. Madhavan|R. Madhavan]] and [[Samita Bangargi|Samita Bangargi]] in the lead roles, with Madhavan also working as the dialogue writer. Featuring a story written by [[Kamal Haasan|Kamal Haasan]], the film is the remake of the Tamil film, [[Nala Damayanthi|Nala Damayanthi]] (2003). The film had a theatrical release across India on 2 September 2005.
title: Ramji Londonwaley

abstract: Rishtey () is an Indian [[Hindi|Bollywood]] [[drama film|drama film]] released on 6 December 2002. The film directed by Indra Kumar stars [[Anil Kapoor|Anil Kapoor]], [[Karisma Kapoor|Karisma Kapoor]], [[Shilpa Shetty|Shilpa Shetty]] and [[Amrish Puri|Amrish Puri]] in the lead roles. The film had a "Below Average" opening and flopped at the Box Office.
title: Rishtey

abstract: One Nite in Mongkok () is a 2004 Hong Kong [[crime thriller|crime thriller]] film written and directed by [[Derek Yee|Derek Yee]] and starring [[Daniel Wu|Daniel Wu]], [[Cecilia Cheung|Cecilia Cheung]] and [[Alex Fong|Alex Fong (actor)]]. The film is a sequel to the Yee produced 200 film, [[Double Tap|Double Tap (film)]], with Fong reprising his role from the previous installment. A sequel to the film, [[Triple Tap|Triple Tap]], was released in 2010, which was once again directed by Yee and featured Fong reprising his role, while also starring Wu in a different role.
title: One Nite in Mongkok

abstract: Innale (Translation: Yesterday) is a 1990 [[Malayalam|Malayalam]] film written and directed by [[P. Padmarajan|P. Padmarajan]] with [[Suresh Gopi|Suresh Gopi]],[[Shobhana|Shobhana]], [[Jayaram|Jayaram]] and [[Srividya|Srividya]] in pivotal roles. Innale was not a major critical or commercial success at the time of release but over the years, it has become a [[cult film|cult film]]. Director [[Ranjith|Ranjith (director)]] recognises it as one of his favourite films.
title: Innale

abstract: Belli Moda () is a 1967 [[Kannada|Kannada]]-language film directed by [[Puttanna Kanagal|Puttanna Kanagal]]. It was based on a novel by the same name, written by [[Triveni|Anasuya Shankar]].
title: Belli Moda

abstract: Bal-Can-Can (, [[transliterated|Transliteration of Macedonian]] Bal-Kan-Kan) is a 2005 Macedonian-Italian joint production film about a [[deserter|Desertion]] who travels throughout the [[Balkans|Balkans]] as a political immigrant in search of his dead mother-in-law who is wrapped in a carpet.
title: Bal-Can-Can

abstract: Aasra () is a 1966 Hindi movie produced by Madan Mohla and directed by [[Satyen Bose|Satyen Bose]]. The film stars [[Mala Sinha|Mala Sinha]], [[Biswajeet|Biswajeet]], [[Balraj Sahni|Balraj Sahni]], [[Jagdeep|Jagdeep]] and [[Nirupa Roy|Nirupa Roy]]. The film's music is by [[Laxmikant Pyarelal|Laxmikant Pyarelal]]. The movie is loosely based on the 1961 Bengali movie Madhyarater Tara.
title: Aasra

abstract: Asli-Naqli (English: Real And Fake) is a [[1962|Bollywood films of 1962]] [[Hindi|Hindi]] film produced by L.B Lachman and L.B Thakur. The film is directed by [[Hrishikesh Mukherjee|Hrishikesh Mukherjee]] and stars [[Dev Anand|Dev Anand]], [[Sadhana|Sadhana Shivdasani]], [[Leela Chitnis|Leela Chitnis]], [[Anwar Hussain|Anwar Hussain (actor)]], Sandhya Roy and [[Keshto Mukherjee|Keshto Mukherjee]]. The film's music is by [[Shankar Jaikishan|Shankar Jaikishan]] and the lyrics by [[Hasrat Jaipuri|Hasrat Jaipuri]]. The film became a box office hit.
title: Asli-Naqli

abstract: Yamaleela is a [[Telugu|Cinema of Andhra Pradesh]] film released in 1994. The film was directed by [[S. V. Krishna Reddy|S. V. Krishna Reddy]], introducing comedian [[Ali|Ali (actor)]] as the hero for the first time. This film was a huge box office success. This film was later remade in [[Hindi|Hindi]] as [[Taqdeerwala|Taqdeerwala]], with [[Venkatesh|Daggubati Venkatesh]] and [[Raveena Tandon|Raveena Tandon]] and in Tamil as [[Lucky Man|Lucky Man (film)]], starring Kartik, Sanghavi and Manjula. A sequel for the movie titled [[Yamaleela 2|Yamaleela 2]] was released on November 2014.
title: Yamaleela

abstract: Kinky Business is an American [[pornographic movie|pornographic movie]] takeoff of the mainstream film [[Risky Business|Risky Business]]. It stars [[Tom Byron|Tom Byron]] in the [[Tom Cruise|Tom Cruise]] role, and Tanya Lawson in the [[Rebecca De Mornay|Rebecca De Mornay]] part. Others stars include [[Ginger Lynn|Ginger Lynn]], Misty Mallory, Laurie Smith, [[Lois Ayres|Lois Ayres]], [[Jerry Butler|Jerry Butler (porn star)]], [[Raven|Raven (pornographic actress)]], Crystal Breeze, Cynthia Brooks and [[Gina Carrera|Gina Carrera]]. [[Ron Jeremy|Ron Jeremy]] and (uncredited) Kristara Barrington are featured in non-sex roles. [[Traci Lords|Traci Lords]] had one scene in the film. Controversy would come after the news that Traci Lords was underage at the time of production, the film was later re-released with her sex scene removed. Even so, the original, uncut version is still very widely available. A scene with Lynn and Byron won the 1985 [[AVN Award|AVN Award]] for Best Couples Sex Scene.
title: Kinky Business

abstract: Mano Po 5: Gua Ai Di (also billed parenthetically as Mano Po 5: Gua Ai Di (I Love You); 我愛你; Mandarin: Wǒ ài nǐ) is a [[2006|2006 in film]] Filipino film starring [[Filipino|Philippines]] actors [[Angel Locsin|Angel Locsin]] as Charity and [[Richard Gutierrez|Richard Gutierrez]] as Nathan. Nathan is a veterinarian with playboy tendencies who falls in love with Charity, a [[Chinese Filipino|Chinese Filipino]] who always follows tradition. In order to woo not only Charity but also her family, Nathan tries to follow and adapt Chinese culture, but with hilarious results.
title: Mano Po 5: Gua Ai Di

abstract: Kill the Irishman is a 2011 American [[biographical|Biopic]] [[crime|Crime film]] film directed by [[Jonathan Hensleigh|Jonathan Hensleigh]], and starring [[Ray Stevenson|Ray Stevenson (actor)]], [[Vincent D'Onofrio|Vincent D'Onofrio]], [[Christopher Walken|Christopher Walken]], and [[Val Kilmer|Val Kilmer]]. Written by Hensleigh (along with Jeremy Walters), it is based on the life of Irish-American gangster [[Danny Greene|Danny Greene]], and was adapted from the book To Kill the Irishman: The War That Crippled the Mafia by Rick Porrello.
title: Kill the Irishman

abstract: Step Up 3D (also known as Step Up 3) is a 2010 American [[3D|3-D film]] [[dance film|dance film]] written by Amy Andelson and Emily Meyer and directed by [[Step Up 2: The Streets|Step Up 2: The Streets]]s [[Jon M. Chu|Jon M. Chu]]. The sequel sees the return of [[Adam Sevani|Adam Sevani]] and [[Alyson Stoner|Alyson Stoner]], who portrayed Moose from Step Up 2: The Streets and Camille Gage from Step Up. As the third installment in the [[Step Up series|Step Up (film series)]] and the first shot in 3D, the film follows Moose and Camille Gage as they head to [[New York University|New York University]], the former dancer of whom is majoring in [[electrical engineering|electrical engineering]] after promising his father that he would not dance anymore. However, he soon stumbles upon a dance battle, meeting Luke Katcher and his House of Pirates dance crew and later teaming up with them to compete in the World Jam dance contest against their rival, the House of Samurai dance crew.
title: Step Up 3D

abstract: Prem Granth (English: Scripture of Love) is a [[Hindi|Hindi]] film which was released in [[India|India]] on 22 May [[1996|Bollywood films of 1996]]. Directed by [[Rajiv Kapoor|Rajiv Kapoor]], the movie stars [[Rishi Kapoor|Rishi Kapoor]] and [[Madhuri Dixit|Madhuri Dixit]] and deals with the subject of rape. The movie was a commercial failure.
title: Prem Granth

abstract: Twelve Mile Road is a 2003 American [[made-for-television|television film]] [[drama film|drama (film and television)]] based on the [[New York Times|New York Times]] [[best selling book|The New York Times Best Seller list]] Mystery Ride by [[Robert Boswell|Robert Boswell]]. The film was directed and written for teleplay by [[Richard Friedenberg|Richard Friedenberg]]. The story is set in [[Idaho|Idaho]] and follows the challenging relationship between a daughter and her estranged father as they reunite and attempt to work out their complicated family issues. Twelve Mile Road is a [[made-for-television|made-for-television]] film starring [[Tom Selleck|Tom Selleck]] that debuted on [[CBS|CBS]] in 2003.
title: Twelve Mile Road

abstract: Sitapur Ki Geeta is a [[1987|Bollywood films of 1987]] Hindi movie which stars [[Hema Malini|Hema Malini]], [[Rajesh Khanna|Rajesh Khanna]] and [[Pran|Pran (actor)]]. The music is by Om Prakash Sharma and Master Sonik. The movie, set against a rural backdrop, was most successful in the North and the East of India. Lachak Lachak Jaye Jawani is the most famous song from this film, sung by [[Amit Kumar|Amit Kumar]] and [[Asha Bhosle|Asha Bhosle]]. Rajesh Khanna makes special appearances in the film as the presumably intended groom of Hema Malini. The film was dubbed into Bhojpuri and re-released in 2006.
title: Sitapur Ki Geeta

abstract: Muallaf is a 2008 Malaysian drama film directed by [[Yasmin Ahmad|Yasmin Ahmad]]. It tells a tale of three souls finding solace in religion. This is Yasmin Ahmad's fifth film after [[Rabun|Rabun]], [[Sepet|Sepet]], [[Gubra|Gubra]] and [[Mukhsin|Mukhsin]].
title: Muallaf

abstract: Jannat Ki Talash is a 1999 [[Pakistani|Cinema of Pakistan]] film which won the [[Nigar Award|Nigar Award]] for Best Film of the Year for 1999.
title: Jannat Ki Talash

abstract: Poova Thalaiya (English: Heads or Tails?) is a [[1969|Tamil films of 1969]] [[Tamil language|Tamil language]] [[comedy film|comedy film]] directed by [[K. Balachander|K. Balachander]]. The film features [[Gemini Ganesan|Gemini Ganesan]], [[Jaishankar|Jaishankar]], [[Rajasree|Rajasree]], [[Vennira Aadai Nirmala|Vennira Aadai Nirmala]] and [[S. Varalakshmi|S. Varalakshmi]] in lead roles. The film, produced by M. L. A. Rama. Arangakannal, had musical score by [[M. S. Viswanathan|M. S. Viswanathan]] and was released on May 1969.
title: Poova Thalaiya

abstract: Blame It on the Bellboy is a 1992 British-American [[comedy film|comedy film]] written and directed by [[Mark Herman|Mark Herman]], revolving around a case of mistaken identity of three individuals with similar-sounding surnames staying at the same hotel. [[Dudley Moore|Dudley Moore]] plays the role of Melvyn Orton in the film. The Bollywood film [[One Two Three|One Two Three]] is an uncredited remake of Blame It On The Bellboy.
title: Blame It on the Bellboy

abstract: Koodum Thedi is a 1985 [[Malayalam film|Malayalam film]] starring [[Mohanlal|Mohanlal]], [[Radhika|Radhika (actress)]], [[Rahman|Rahman (actor)]], [[Nadia Moidu|Nadia Moidu]], [[Soman|M. G. Soman]], [[Thilakan|Thilakan]], [[Sankaradi|Sankaradi]] etc. Written by [[S. N. Swamy|S. N. Swamy]] and Rajmohan, the film is directed by Paul Babu, and features music by [[Jerry Amaldev|Jerry Amaldev]]. The cinematography has been handled by [[P. C. Sreeram|P. C. Sreeram]].
title: Koodum Thedi

abstract: Kanamarayathu is a 1984 [[Malayalam film|Malayalam film]] written by [[Padmarajan|Padmarajan]] and directed by [[I. V. Sasi|I. V. Sasi]]. It stars [[Mammootty|Mammootty]], [[Shobhana|Shobhana]], [[Rahman|Rahman (actor)]], [[Lalu Alex|Lalu Alex]] and [[Seema|Seema (actress)]]. This film won 1984 [[Kerala State Film Awards|Kerala State Film Awards]] for the [[Best Story|Kerala State Film Award for Best Story]] (Padmarajan), [[Best Music Director|Kerala State Film Award for Best Music Director]] ([[Shyam|Shyam (composer)]]) and [[Best Female Singer|Kerala State Film Award for Best Singer]] ([[S. Janaki|S. Janaki]]). The story was an adaptation of the 1912 novel [[Daddy-Long-Legs|Daddy-Long-Legs (novel)]] by [[Jean Webster|Jean Webster]].
title: Kanamarayathu

abstract: Hum Ho Gaye Aapke is a 2001 [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] film, directed by [[Agathiyan|Agathiyan]] and stars [[Fardeen Khan|Fardeen Khan]] and [[Reema Sen|Reema Sen]] in the lead roles. The film is known to be the Bollywood debut of [[Reema Sen|Reema Sen]]. It was released on 13 August 2001. It is a remake of Tamil movie [[Gokulathil Seethai|Gokulathil Seethai]] (1996).
title: Hum Ho Gaye Aapke

abstract: Ente Ammu Ninte Thulasi Avarude Chakki is 1985 family melodrama film in [[Malayalam language|Malayalam language]] starring [[Balachandra Menon|Balachandra Menon]], [[Venu Nagavalli|Venu Nagavalli]] and [[Urvashi|Urvashi]]. The film was directed and written by [[Balachandra Menon|Balachandra Menon]] .
title: Ente Ammu Ninte Thulasi Avarude Chakki

abstract: Chandra Mukhi () is a [[1993|Bollywood films of 1993]] [[Hindi|Hindi]] language film. Chandra Mukhi, along with Chaand Kaa Tukdaa, created huge expectations as [[Salman Khan|Salman Khan]] and [[Sridevi|Sridevi]] were paired together. Although Chaand Kaa Tukdaa is Salman-Sridevi team's first signed film, their first release was Chandra Mukhi. The story idea was written by [[Salman Khan|Salman Khan]]. The film resembled the 1990 [[Telugu|Cinema of Andhra Pradesh]] [[supernatural|supernatural thriller]]-[[fantasy film|fantasy film]], [[Jagadeka Veerudu Atiloka Sundari|Jagadeka Veerudu Atiloka Sundari]].
title: Chandra Mukhi

abstract: !Women Art Revolution is a documentary film, created by [[Lynn Hershman Leeson|Lynn Hershman Leeson]], to examine the under-recognized world of [[feminist art|feminist art]]. Through interviews, documentary footage, and artworks, the film tracks the trajectory of feminist art. It begins at the start of the 1960s with antiwar and civil rights protests, it follows developments in feminist art through the 1970s.
title: !Women Art Revolution

abstract: Magic City Memoirs is a 2015 American [[coming of age|coming of age]] drama film directed by Aaron J. Salgado, and stars [[Natalie Martinez|Natalie Martinez]], [[Dominik Garcia-Lorido|Dominik Garcia-Lorido]], [[Nestor Serrano|Nestor Serrano]], [[Julio Oscar Mechoso|Julio Oscar Mechoso]], J.R. Villarreal and Michael Cardelle. The film is based on the true stories from Salgado's adolescence.
title: Magic City Memoirs

abstract: Huchcha () is a 2001 [[Kannada|Kannada]] drama film directed by [[Om Prakash Rao|Om Prakash Rao]], starring [[Sudeep|Sudeep]] and [[Rekha Vedavyas|Rekha Vedavyas]] in the lead roles. The film, a remake of [[Tamil|Tamil language]] film [[Sethu|Sethu (film)]] directed by [[Bala|Bala (director)]] and starring [[Vikram|Vikram Kennedy]], brought lot of fame to Sudeep.
title: Huchcha

abstract: The Dark Knight Rises is a 2012 American-British [[superhero film|superhero film]] directed by [[Christopher Nolan|Christopher Nolan]], who co-wrote the screenplay with his brother [[Jonathan Nolan|Jonathan Nolan]], and the story with [[David S. Goyer|David S. Goyer]]. Featuring the [[DC Comics|DC Comics]] character [[Batman|Batman]], the film is the final installment in [[Nolan's The Dark Knight Trilogy|The Dark Knight Trilogy]], and the sequel to [[The Dark Knight|The Dark Knight (film)]] (2008). [[Christian Bale|Christian Bale]] reprises the lead role of Bruce Wayne/Batman, with a returning cast of allies: [[Michael Caine|Michael Caine]] as [[Alfred Pennyworth|Alfred Pennyworth]], [[Gary Oldman|Gary Oldman]] as [[James Gordon|James Gordon (comics)]], and [[Morgan Freeman|Morgan Freeman]] as [[Lucius Fox|Lucius Fox]]. The film introduces [[Selina Kyle|Catwoman]] ([[Anne Hathaway|Anne Hathaway]]) and [[Bane|Bane (comics)]] ([[Tom Hardy|Tom Hardy]]). Eight years after the events of The Dark Knight, merciless revolutionary Bane forces an older Bruce Wayne to resume his role as Batman and save [[Gotham City|Gotham City]] from nuclear destruction.
title: The Dark Knight Rises

abstract: Tower Heist began development as early as 2005, based on an idea by Murphy that would star himself and an all-black cast of comedians as a heist group who rob [[Trump International Hotel and Tower|Trump International Hotel and Tower (New York City)]]. As the script developed and changed into an [[Ocean's Eleven|Ocean's Eleven (2001 film)]]–style caper, Murphy left the project. Ratner continued to develop the idea into what would eventually become Tower Heist, with Murphy later rejoining the production. Filming took place entirely in [[New York City|New York City]] on a budget of $75   million (after tax rebates), with several buildings provided by [[Donald Trump|Donald Trump]] used to represent the eponymous tower. The film score was composed by [[Christophe Beck|Christophe Beck]] and released commercially on November 1, 2011.
title: Tower Heist

abstract: Gair Kanooni (Illegal) is a 1989 Indian [[action|action film]] [[drama film|drama film]] directed and written by Prayag Raj. The film stars [[Sridevi|Sridevi]] and [[Govinda|Govinda (actor)]] in the lead roles. [[Rajinikanth|Rajinikanth]], [[Kimi Katkar|Kimi Katkar]], [[Shashi Kapoor|Shashi Kapoor]] and [[Kader Khan|Kader Khan]] are featured in supporting role.
title: Gair Kanooni

abstract: Rani Lalithangi () is a [[Tamil language|Tamil language]] [[Folklore|Folklore]] film starring [[Sivaji Ganesan|Sivaji Ganesan]] and [[P. Bhanumathi|Bhanumathi Ramakrishna]] in the lead roles. The film, directed by T. R. Raghunath, had musical score by [[G. Ramanathan|G. Ramanathan]] and was released on 21 September 1957.
title: Rani Lalithangi

abstract: La Petite Vendeuse de Soleil (or The Little Girl Who Sold the Sun) is a [[1999|1999 in film]] [[Senegalese|cinema of Senegal]] [[short|short film]] [[drama film|drama film]], directed by [[Djibril Diop Mambéty|Djibril Diop Mambéty]] which premiered posthumously after his death in 1998.
title: La Petite Vendeuse de Soleil

abstract: Avtaar is a [[1983|Bollywood films of 1983]] drama film starring [[Rajesh Khanna|Rajesh Khanna]] and [[Shabana Azmi|Shabana Azmi]]. It was directed by [[Mohan Kumar|Mohan Kumar]], and the music was by [[Laxmikant Pyarelal|Laxmikant Pyarelal]]. Avtaar was a commercial hit, and was critically acclaimed. The film earned several [[Filmfare|Filmfare]] award nominations. Rajesh Khanna achieved success with [[Amardeep|Amar Deep (1979 film)]] and [[Prem Bandhan|Prem Bandhan]] onwards, but this was [[Rajesh Khanna|Rajesh Khanna]]'s biggest film in terms of box office collections since 1973. However, Rajesh Khanna lost the Best Actor award to [[Naseeruddin Shah|Naseeruddin Shah]] for [[Masoom|Masoom (1983 film)]]. In 1986, [[Mohan Kumar|Mohan Kumar]] made [[Amrit|Amrit (film)]] with Rajesh Khanna in the lead as an old man, but with a different story line. Rajesh Khanna received an All-India Critics Association (AICA) Best Actor Award for his performance in this film in 1983.
title: Avtaar

abstract: Marupadiyum was released on 14 January 1993. The film was both a critical and commercial success. Revathi won the [[Filmfare Award for Best Tamil Actress|Filmfare Award for Best Actress – Tamil]] at the [[41st Filmfare Awards South|41st Filmfare Awards South]] for her performance as Thulasi in the film.__TOC__
title: Marupadiyum

abstract: Galatta Kalyanam () is a 1968 Indian Tamil-language [[romantic comedy|romantic comedy]] film, starring [[Sivaji Ganesan|Sivaji Ganesan]], [[Jayalalithaa|Jayalalithaa]], [[K. A. Thangavelu|K. A. Thangavelu]], Cho Ramaswamy, [[A. V. M. Rajan|A. V. M. Rajan]], [[Nagesh|Nagesh]], [[V. Goplakrishnan|V. Gopalakrishnan (actor)]], [[V. S. Raghavan|V. S. Raghavan]], Senthamarai, Sachu and [[Manorama|Manorama (Tamil actress)]]. It is based on the play of the same name. The film was later remade in [[Malayalam|Malayalam]] as Snehikaan Samayamilla and in [[Kannada|Kannada]] as Aliya Devaru.
title: Galatta Kalyanam

abstract: Oh! That Wife of Mine ( Ah! Afti i gynaika mou) was a 1967 Greek film based on a theatrical work and was directed by [[Nikos Tsiforos|Nikos Tsiforos]] and [[Polyvios Vassiliadis|Polyvios Vassiliadis]].
title: Oh! That Wife of Mine

abstract: Mannadhi Mannan ("King of Kings") is a 1960 Indian [[Tamil-language|Tamil language]] [[swashbuckler film|swashbuckler film]] directed and produced by M. Natesan. The film features [[M. G. Ramachandran|M. G. Ramachandran]], [[Anjali Devi|Anjali Devi]] and [[Padmini|Padmini (actress)]] in the lead roles. The film, written by [[Kannadasan|Kannadasan]], had musical score by [[Viswanathan–Ramamoorthy|Viswanathan–Ramamoorthy]] and was released on diwali 1960. The film achieve cult status and remembered for the melodious music, meaningful lyrics and dialogue, the dances by Padmini, Ragini and Anjali Devi and the impressive performance by MGR, and the opening song, ‘Acchham Enbathu' helped MGR become a cultural icon. Though the on-screen presentation by Natesan appears somewhat disjointed, the film sustains interest, managed to run 92 days in theatres and fared well at the box office. It had to be shifted in view of the new releases of MGR
title: Mannadhi Mannan

abstract: Sabaash Mapillai is a [[Tamil language|Tamil language]] [[drama film|drama film]] directed and produced by S. Raghavan. The film features [[M. G. Ramachandran|M. G. Ramachandran]], [[M. R. Radha|M. R. Radha]] and Malini in lead roles. Relative to other MGR movies, this film had a mediocre run for 70 days.
title: Sabaash Mapillai

abstract: Kaanchi Thalaivan () is a 1963 [[Tamil language|Tamil language]] [[historical|historical fiction]] [[action film|action film]], directed by A. Kasilingam. The film features [[M. G. Ramachandran|M. G. Ramachandran]], [[S. S. Rajendran|S. S. Rajendran]], [[P. Bhanumathi|Bhanumathi Ramakrishna]] and [[C. R. Vijayakumari|C. R. Vijayakumari]] in the lead roles, with [[M. R. Radha|M. R. Radha]] and [[S. A. Ashokan|S. A. Ashokan]] as villain. The film, produced by [[Mu. Karunanidhi|Karunanidhi]], A. Kasilingam and [[Murasoli Maran|Murasoli Maran]] under Mekala Pictures, had musical score by [[K. V. Mahadevan|K. V. Mahadevan]] and was released on Diwali day of 26 October 1963. The film flopped at the box office and ran for 70 days.
title: Kaanchi Thalaivan

abstract: Thaayin Madiyil () is a [[Tamil language|Tamil language]] film starring [[M. G. Ramachandran|M. G. Ramachandran]] and [[B. Saroja Devi|B. Saroja Devi]] in the lead roles.
title: Thaayin Madiyil

abstract: Kanni Thaai () is a [[Tamil-language|Tamil language]] [[road film|road movie]] directed by [[M. A. Thirumugam|M. A. Thirumugam]], starring [[M. G. Ramachandran|M. G. Ramachandran]] in the lead role. The film was produced by [["Sandow" M.M.A.Chinnappa Devar|Sandow M. M. A. Chinnappa Thevar]] under his [[Devar Films|Sandow M. M. A. Chinnappa Thevar]] banner, released on 10 September 1965.
title: Kanni Thaai

abstract: Panam Padaithavan ()is a [[Tamil language|Tamil language]] film starring [[M. G. Ramachandran|M. G. Ramachandran]] in the lead role. The film was released in 1965. The film ran successfully at many centres for more than 100 days and was declared a box office hit.
title: Panam Padaithavan

abstract: XXX: Return of Xander Cage (released as XXX: Reactivated in some countries and stylized as xXx: Return of Xander Cage in promotional materials) is a 2017 American [[action film|action film]] directed by [[D. J. Caruso|D. J. Caruso]] and written by F. Scott Frazier. The film stars [[Vin Diesel|Vin Diesel]], [[Donnie Yen|Donnie Yen]], [[Deepika Padukone|Deepika Padukone]], [[Kris Wu|Kris Wu]], [[Ruby Rose|Ruby Rose]], [[Tony Jaa|Tony Jaa]], [[Nina Dobrev|Nina Dobrev]], [[Toni Collette|Toni Collette]], [[Ariadna Gutiérrez|Ariadna Gutiérrez]], [[Hermione Corfield|Hermione Corfield]], and [[Samuel L. Jackson|Samuel L. Jackson]]. It is the third installment in the [[XXX franchise|XXX (franchise)]] and a sequel to both [[XXX|XXX (2002 film)]] (2002) and [[XXX: State of the Union|XXX: State of the Union]] (2005).
title: XXX: Return of Xander Cage

abstract: It is the first Philippine film shown at the [[Cannes Film Festival|Cannes Film Festival]], and to use Tondo as a shooting location. A [[box-office failure|box office bomb]], Insiang received good reviews from critics (some of whom regarded it as one of Brocka's best). The film's rights were transferred to the [[Film Development Council of the Philippines|Film Development Council of the Philippines]] in 2015 by producer Ruby Tiong Tan for the council's discussion with [[Martin Scorsese|Martin Scorsese]]'s [[The Film Foundation|The Film Foundation]], a [[nonprofit organization|nonprofit organization]] dedicated to [[film preservation|film preservation]], about its restoration. The restored version was selected for screening in the Cannes Classics section of the [[2015 Cannes Film Festival|2015 Cannes Film Festival]], and played at a number of other [[film festivals|film festivals]].
title: Insiang

abstract: Benny's Bathtub (Original title: Bennys badekar) is a 1971 [[Danish|Danish language]] animated film directed by [[Jannik Hastrup|Jannik Hastrup]] and [[Flemming Quist Møller|Flemming Quist Møller]]. The film relates the story of a boy who flees the boring world of adults into a magical land in the bottom of his bathtub. The film featured the voices and songs of [[Peter Belli|Peter Belli]], [[Otto Brandenburg|Otto Brandenburg]] and [[Poul Dissing|Poul Dissing]] as well as the jazz music of [[Kenny Drew|Kenny Drew]] and [[Niels-Henning Ørsted Pedersen|Niels-Henning Ørsted Pedersen]]. Benny's Bathtub received a special [[Bodil Award|Bodil Award]] for animated film in 1971 and is one of the ten films chosen for [[Denmark's cultural canon|Danish Culture Canon]] by the Danish Ministry of Culture.
title: Benny's Bathtub

abstract: Picture Claire is a 2001 [[thriller film|thriller film]] directed by [[Bruce McDonald|Bruce McDonald (director)]] of a screenplay by [[Semi Chellas|Semi Chellas]]. The film stars [[Juliette Lewis|Juliette Lewis]], [[Gina Gershon|Gina Gershon]], [[Callum Keith Rennie|Callum Keith Rennie]], Kelly Harms, [[Camilla Rutherford|Camilla Rutherford]], [[Peter Stebbings|Peter Stebbings]], and [[Mickey Rourke|Mickey Rourke]]. The film premiered at the [[Toronto International Film Festival|Toronto International Film Festival]], and also appeared at [[Cinéfest|Cinéfest]] in [[Sudbury|Greater Sudbury]], where the film received Best Ontario Feature Award.
title: Picture Claire

abstract: Lilla Jönssonligan () is a [[Swedish|Sweden]] [[film series|film series]] that consists of four movies. The film series is a spin-off of the original [[Jönssonligan film series|Jönssonligan]]. The main difference about the two series is that the main characters are portrayed as kids instead of adults in this one, hence the word "little" in the title. Rocky, the original third member, is not featured in any of the films. Unlike the "adult Jönssonligan", where the gang where bumbling anti-heroes, the "litte Jönssonligan" is often straight up heroic.
title: Lilla Jönssonligan

abstract: Money No Enough 2 () is a Singaporean film written and directed by [[Jack Neo|Jack Neo]] and produced by Neo Studios, [[Mediacorp Raintree Pictures|Mediacorp Raintree Pictures]] and [[Scorpio East Pictures|Scorpio East Pictures]].
title: Money No Enough 2

abstract: Chalo Let's Go is a 2008 Indian movie in Bengali starring [[Ritwick Chakraborty|Ritwick Chakraborty]], [[Rudranil Ghosh|Rudranil Ghosh]], [[Saswata Chatterjee|Saswata Chatterjee]] and [[Parambrata Chatterjee|Parambrata Chatterjee]], written and directed by [[Anjan Dutt|Anjan Dutt]].
title: Chalo Let's Go

abstract: The film is directed by [[Cyrus Nowrasteh|Cyrus Nowrasteh]], and stars [[Academy Award|Academy Award]] nominee [[Shohreh Aghdashloo|Shohreh Aghdashloo]] (as Zahra), [[James Caviezel|James Caviezel]] (as [[Freidoune Sahebjam|Freidoune Sahebjam]], the foreign journalist), and [[Mozhan Marnò|Mozhan Marnò]] (as [[Soraya Manutchehri|Soraya Manutchehri]], the title character). The Stoning of Soraya M. had its [[world premiere|Film premiere]] at the [[2008 Toronto International Film Festival|2008 Toronto International Film Festival]], where it won the Director's Choice Award. It was also the second runner-up for the Cadillac People's Choice Award. The book has been banned in Iran.
title: The Stoning of Soraya M.

abstract: Salgira (Urdu: سالگرہ) (English: Birthday) is an [[Urdu|Urdu]]-language [[Pakistan|Pakistani]] black-and-white film released in 1969. It is a melodious love story directed by Qamar Zaidi and produced by Najma Hassan and written by Shams Hanafi. The film cast [[Waheed Murad|Waheed Murad]], [[Shamim Ara|Shamim Ara]], [[Tariq Aziz|Tariq Aziz (TV personality)]], Santosh Rissal, [[Nirala|Nirala]], Nighat Sultana and [[Talish|Talish]]. Included in the soundtrack are two hits songs, Meri zindagi hai naghma, meri zindagi tarana... and Lay aai phir kahan par qismat hamein kahan se... sung by [[Noor Jehan|Noor Jehan]].
title: Salgira

abstract: Koondukkili (), also spelled as Goondukili, is a 1954 Indian [[Tamil-language|Tamil language]] [[romance film|romance film]] directed and co-produced by [[T. R. Ramanna|T. R. Ramanna]]. The film stars [[M. G. Ramachandran|M. G. Ramachandran]], [[Sivaji Ganesan|Sivaji Ganesan]] and [[B. S. Saroja|B. S. Saroja]] in the lead roles.
title: Koondukkili

abstract: Raja Mukthi () is a [[Tamil language|Tamil language]] film starring [[M. K. Thyagaraja Bhagavathar|M. K. Thyagaraja Bhagavathar]], [[V. N. Janaki|V. N. Janaki]] and [[P. Bhanumathi|Bhanumathi Ramakrishna]] in the lead roles. [[M. G. Ramachandran|M. G. Ramachandran]] had done a supporting role. The film was released on 9 October 1948.
title: Raja Mukthi

abstract: Panakkaari () is a 1953 [[Tamil language|Tamil language]] film directed by K. S. Gopalakrishnan. Starring [[T. R. Rajakumari|T. R. Rajakumari]] and [[M. G. Ramachandran|M. G. Ramachandran]] in the lead roles, it is an adaptation of the novel [[Anna Karenina|Anna Karenina]] by Russian writer [[Leo Tolstoy|Leo Tolstoy]].
title: Panakkaari

abstract: Thaai Magalukku Kattiya Thaali is a 1959 [[Tamil language|Tamil language]] film starring [[M. G. Ramachandran|M. G. Ramachandran]], [[Jamuna|Jamuna (actress)]] and [[P. Kannamba|Pasupuleti Kannamba]] in the lead roles and directed by R. R. Chandiran who also was a well known cinematographer in his time.
title: Thaai Magalukku Kattiya Thaali

abstract: Aakhri Goli is a [[1977|Bollywood films of 1977]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[action film|action film]] directed by [[Shibu Mitra|Shibu Mitra]]. It stars [[Sunil Dutt|Sunil Dutt]] and [[Leena Chandavarkar|Leena Chandavarkar]] in pivotal roles.
title: Aakhri Goli

abstract: Raja Makutam ([[English|English language]]: King's Sceptre) is a 1960 bilingual [[Telugu|Telugu cinema]]-[[Tamil|Tamil language]] [[swashbuckling film|swashbuckling]], produced and directed by [[B. N. Reddy|B. N. Reddy]] under the [[Vauhini Studios|Vauhini Studios]] banner. It stars [[N. T. Rama Rao|N. T. Rama Rao]], [[Rajasulochana|Rajasulochana]] in the lead roles and music composed by [[Master Venu|Master Venu]].
title: Raja Makutam

abstract: The film was produced with cel animation and 2-D collage elements, a look developed by production designer John Kleber. From a set of four short/featurettes planned by Disney and [[MovieToons|DisneyToon Studios]] (to be titled "Totally Twisted Fairy Tales"), which was also to include "Jack in the Beanstalk," "The Three Little Pigs" and a fourth cartoon that was never finalized. The idea was to make a more adult short by combining Disney artists and high-quality writers and their takes on classic fairy tales. However, only Redux Riding Hood was released on in [[Encino, California|Encino, California]] to qualify it for the [[Academy Awards|Academy Awards]].
title: Redux Riding Hood

abstract: Maathaad Maathaadu Mallige ([[Kannada|Kannada]]:ಮಾತಾಡ್ ಮಾತಾಡು ಮಲ್ಲಿಗೆ, [[translation|translation]]: Speak, Speak out, Jasmine) is a [[Kannada|Kannada]] language film directed by [[Nagathihalli Chandrashekhar|Nagathihalli Chandrashekhar]]. Maathaad Maathaadu Mallige can be roughly transliterated from North Karnataka's colloquial Kannada as Speak, Speak out, Jasmine. Maathaad Maathaad Mallige depicts the challenges faced by the people living in rural sectors of India. Dr. Vishnuvardhan's Performance and Nagathihalli's Narration was much praised by critics. Dr.Vishnuvardhan was the right choice for the film, his build, looks and age made the role look strong. His Performance was emotional, graceful and touching.It is also said that it was courageous on his part to accept such a role that had no space for his action image. It is certainly one of his best performances.
title: Maathaad Maathaadu Mallige

abstract: Inspired by [[darkness|darkness]] and by a photo of a couple that Almodóvar took of El Golfo beach in [[Lanzarote|Lanzarote]] in the late 1990s, the film serves as an [[homage|Homage (arts)]] to [[filmmaking|filmmaking]], [[cinema|Filmmaking]] and its various [[film genre|film genres]]. Stylistically, it is a complex [[noir-ish|Film noir]] [[melodrama|melodrama]], that also blends comic elements with a [[film within a film|film within a film]]—a broad comedy, that hearkens back to Almodóvar's 1988 release, [[Women on the Verge of a Nervous Breakdown|Women on the Verge of a Nervous Breakdown]]. Thematically, Broken Embraces addresses themes like [[voyeurism|voyeurism]], [[repression|Repression (psychology)]], [[prostitution|prostitution]], [[death|death]], [[vengeance|Vengeance (concept)]], [[fixation|Fixation (psychology)]], [[illness|illness]], and [[drugs|Psychoactive drug]].
title: Broken Embraces

abstract: Why the Swallow Has the Tail with Little Horns (; [[tr.|Romanization of Russian]]:Pochemu u lastochki khvostik rozhkami) is the first [[animated film|animation]] made in the [[Kazakh SSR|Kazakh Soviet Socialist Republic]]. It was directed by [[Amen Khaydarov|Amen Khaydarov]] and released in 1967.
title: Why the Swallow Has the Tail with Little Horns

abstract: How Democracy Works Now: Twelve Stories is a 12-part documentary film series that examines the American political system through the lens of [[immigration reform|immigration reform]] during 2001–2007. The films were directed and produced by award-winning filmmaking team [[Shari Robertson|Shari Robertson]] and [[Michael Camerini|Michael Camerini]].
title: How Democracy Works Now: Twelve Stories

abstract: Prema Pasam is a 1956 [[Tamil-language|Tamil language]] [[drama film|Drama (film and television)]], produced by V. L. Narasu under the Narasu Studios banner and directed by [[Vedantam Raghavaiah|Vedantam Raghavaiah]]. It is a remake of the [[Hindi|Hindi]] film [[Kismet|Kismet (1943 film)]] (1943). The film stars [[Gemini Ganesan|Gemini Ganesan]] and [[Savitri|Savitri (actress)]] in the lead roles, with music composed by [[S. Rajeswara Rao|S. Rajeswara Rao]]. It was simultaneously shot in [[Telugu|Telugu language]] as [[Bhale Ramudu|Bhale Ramudu]] (1956).
title: Prema Pasam

abstract: Megham ([[Malayalam|Malayalam]]: മേഘം, [[English|English language]]: The Cloud) is a 1999 [[Malayalam|Malayalam film]] [[musical|musical film]] [[comedy film|comedy film]] directed by [[Priyadarshan|Priyadarshan]], starring [[Mammootty|Mammootty]], [[Dileep|Dileep]], [[Priya Gill|Priya Gill]], [[Pooja Batra|Pooja Batra]], [[K. P. A. C. Lalitha|K. P. A. C. Lalitha]], [[Sreenivasan|Sreenivasan (actor)]], [[Nedumudi Venu|Nedumudi Venu]], [[Captain Raju|Captain Raju]], and [[Cochin Haneefa|Cochin Haneefa]]. The music was composed by [[Ouseppachan|Ouseppachan]].
title: Megham

abstract: The film depicts the interconnected lives of ten women, exploring their lives and struggles as [[women of color|Person of color]]. It is the first film to be produced by 34th Street Films, an imprint of [[Tyler Perry Studios|Tyler Perry Studios]], and distributed by [[Lionsgate Films|Lionsgate Films]]. It is also the first R-rated film directed by Perry. With a budget of $21 million, For Colored Girls was released on November 5, 2010, grossing $20.1 million in its opening weekend.
title: For Colored Girls

abstract: When a Man Loves is a 1927 American silent [[historical drama film|Historical fiction]] directed by [[Alan Crosland|Alan Crosland]] and produced and distributed by [[Warner Bros.|Warner Bros.]]. The picture stars [[John Barrymore|John Barrymore]] and features [[Dolores Costello|Dolores Costello]] in the frequently filmed story of [[Abbe Prevost|Abbe Prevost]]'s 1731 novel [[Manon Lescaut|Manon Lescaut]]. The UK release title was His Lady.
title: When a Man Loves

abstract: The film premiered at the [[Tribeca Film Festival|Tribeca Film Festival]] on April 21, 2010. It was theatrically released in the [[United States|United States]] by [[Paramount Pictures|Paramount Pictures]] on May 21, 2010, in [[3D|3D film]] and [[IMAX 3D|IMAX#IMAX 3D]] formats. The film debuted as the top-grossing film at the box office, a position it held for three consecutive weeks in the United States and Canada, grossing a worldwide total of $752   million and becoming the [[fifth-highest-grossing film of 2010|2010 in film]]. In addition, Shrek Forever After became DreamWorks Animation's second-highest-grossing film at the foreign box office. Although originally marketed as the final installment in the film franchise, a [[fifth Shrek film|Shrek (franchise)]] has unofficially been reported to be in production with speculation it could be released as early as 2019.
title: Shrek Forever After

abstract: Manivathoorile Aayiram Sivarathrikal (English:The 1000 [[Sivarathri|Sivarathries]] of Manivathoor) is 1987 [[Malayalam|Cinema of Kerala]] film starring [[Mammootty|Mammootty]] and directed by [[Fazil|Fazil (director)]].
title: Manivathoorile Aayiram Sivarathrikal

abstract: Rasikan (English: Admirer) is a 2004 [[Malayalam film|Malayalam film]] directed by [[Lal Jose|Lal Jose]] and written by [[Murali Gopy|Murali Gopy]] starring [[Dileep|Dileep]], Murali Gopy, [[Biju Menon|Biju Menon]] and [[Samvrutha Sunil|Samvrutha Sunil]] in the lead roles.
title: Rasikan

abstract: Mongo's Back in Town is a 1971 crime [[television film|television film]], directed by [[Marvin J. Chomsky|Marvin J. Chomsky]], with [[Telly Savalas|Telly Savalas]], [[Joe Don Baker|Joe Don Baker]] and [[Martin Sheen|Martin Sheen]]. It was released in some regions under the title Steel Wreath.
title: Mongo's Back in Town

abstract: London Calling: Live in Hyde Park is a [[concert video|concert film]] of [[Bruce Springsteen|Bruce Springsteen]] & the [[E Street Band|E Street Band]]'s performance during the [[Hard Rock Calling|Hard Rock Calling]] music festival in [[Hyde Park, London|Hyde Park, London]] on June 28, 2009. The film was released on [[DVD|DVD]] and [[Blu-ray|Blu-ray Disc]] formats by [[Columbia Records|Columbia Records]] on June 22, 2010.
title: London Calling: Live in Hyde Park

abstract: Kudumbam Oru Kadambam (English: Family Life is a Flower) is a 1981 [[Tamil|Tamil language]] drama film about the role of money and working women in 1980s [[India|Indian]] middle-class society. The film was remade in Kannada as [[Ananda Sagara|Ananda Sagara]] starring Master Hirannayya, Aarathi, Srinivasamurthy, Jai Jagadish, Pramila Joshai and in Telugu as [[Manishiki Charithra|Manishiki Charithra]] with Chandramohan, Suhasini and Murali Mohan and in Hindi as [[Aaj Ka Daur|Aaj Ka Daur]] with [[Jackie Shroff|Jackie Shroff]].
title: Kudumbam Oru Kadambam

abstract: The Art of Getting By is a 2011 American [[romantic|romantic comedy]] [[comedy-drama|comedy-drama]] film starring [[Freddie Highmore|Freddie Highmore]], [[Emma Roberts|Emma Roberts]], [[Michael Angarano|Michael Angarano]], [[Elizabeth Reaser|Elizabeth Reaser]], [[Sam Robards|Sam Robards]], [[Rita Wilson|Rita Wilson]] and [[Blair Underwood|Blair Underwood]]. It is the [[first feature|List of directorial debuts]] by writer-director [[Gavin Wiesen|Gavin Wiesen]]. The film premiered under the title Homework at the 2011 [[Sundance Film Festival|Sundance Film Festival]].
title: The Art of Getting By

abstract: Akale is a 2004 [[Malayalam film|Malayalam film]] by [[Shyamaprasad|Shyamaprasad]], inspired by the American classic play [[The Glass Menagerie|The Glass Menagerie]] by [[Tennessee Williams|Tennessee Williams]]. The movie stars [[Prithviraj Sukumaran|Prithviraj Sukumaran]], [[Sheela|Sheela]], [[Geetu Mohandas|Geetu Mohandas]] and [[Tom George Kolath|Tom George Kolath]] in lead roles.
title: Akale

abstract: The film began production on October 30 and was shot in China and Taiwan. While shooting, John Woo was on set continually advising director Su Chao-pin, which led to Woo being credited as a co-director. On September 3, 2010, Reign of Assassins had its premiere at the 67th annual [[Venice Film Festival|Venice Film Festival]], where it met acclaim from critics. It premiered in China on September 28, 2010, and was purchased by [[The Weinstein Company|The Weinstein Company]] for North American release rights and by [[Lions Gate Pictures|Lions Gate Pictures]] for United Kingdom release rights.
title: Reign of Assassins

abstract: Resident Evil: Damnation, known as in Japan, is a 2012 Japanese feature-length [[3D animated|3D animated]] [[biopunk|biopunk]] [[horror|horror (genre)]] [[action film|action film]] by [[Capcom|Capcom]] and [[Sony Pictures Entertainment Japan|Sony Pictures Entertainment]], directed by Makoto Kamiya and produced by [[Hiroyuki Kobayashi|Hiroyuki Kobayashi (producer)]]. It is a sequel to [[Resident Evil: Degeneration|Resident Evil: Degeneration]] and prequel to the video game [[Resident Evil 6|Resident Evil 6]]. The movie was released on October 27, 2012 in Japan, premièring in [[Shinjuku, Tokyo|Shinjuku, Tokyo]].
title: Resident Evil: Damnation

abstract: Churam is a 1997 [[Malayalam film|Malayalam film]] by [[Bharathan|Bharathan]] starring [[Manoj K. Jayan|Manoj K. Jayan]] and [[Divya Unni|Divya Unni]] in the lead roles. This is one of the last films of [[Bharathan|Bharathan]] before his death.
title: Churam

abstract: Muro: Damn the Humanist Inside () is a 2008 Turkish [[comedy film|comedy film]], directed by [[Zübeyr Şaşmaz|Zübeyr Şaşmaz]], starring [[Mustafa Üstündağ|Mustafa Üstündağ]] and [[Şefik Onatoğlu|Şefik Onatoğlu]] as two revolutionaries recently released from prison, who stumble across an illegal organization run by a former friend. The film, which went on general release across Turkey on , is the third highest-grossing [[Turkish film of 2008|Turkish films of 2008]]. It is a spin-off from the [[Valley of the Wolves|Valley of the Wolves]] media franchise, based on the Turkish television series [[of the same name|Valley of the Wolves (TV series)]] using characters from the sequel series [[Valley of the Wolves: Ambush|Valley of the Wolves: Ambush]].
title: Muro: Damn the Humanist Inside

abstract: My Run tells the true story of two journeys. The first, which began in 1984, opens the film when Terry Hitchcock's wife Sue dies of breast cancer. Only a few days later he loses his job. Suddenly, he finds himself alone with his three young children and no income.
title: My Run

abstract: Body Troopers (), also known as Chasing the Kidneystone, is a 1996 [[Norwegian|Norway]] [[Children's film|Children's film]] directed by [[Vibeke Idsøe|Vibeke Idsøe]], starring [[Torbjörn T. Jensen|Torbjörn T. Jensen]] and [[Kjersti Holmen|Kjersti Holmen]]. Eight-year-old Simon shrinks himself to microscopic size in order to travel through his ailing grandfather's body in search of a [[kidney stone|kidney stone]]. On his journey he meets [[anthropomorphic|anthropomorphic]] characters such as the [[taste buds|taste buds]], [[white|white blood cell]] and [[red blood cells|red blood cells]], and the [[vocal cords|vocal cords]].
title: Body Troopers

abstract: Le p'tit Parigot (The Small Parisian One) is a 1926 [[French|France]] [[movie serial|movie serial]] in six parts.
title: Le p'tit Parigot

abstract: "Looney Tunes Super Stars' Tweety & Sylvester: Feline Fwenzy is a DVD of 15 [[Sylvester|Sylvester (Looney Tunes)]] and [[Tweety|Tweety Bird]] cartoons that was released on November 30, 2010. Unlike the previous Super Stars discs, this disc features 15 cartoons that were previously on the Golden Collection sets as the new plan for the Super Stars volumes is one with new-to-DVD cartoons and one with previously-on-DVD cartoons. The reason for the double-dip release in each wave is so the Warner Home Video department can pay back for the remastering of other restorations. Also, unlike the previous Super Stars discs, the cartoons are presented in original full screen.
title: Looney Tunes Super Stars' Tweety & Sylvester: Feline Fwenzy

abstract: Konjum Salangai () is a 1962 Indian [[Tamil-language|Tamil language]] [[musical film|musical film]] directed by M. V. Raman. The film features [[Gemini Ganesan|Gemini Ganesan]], [[Savitri|Savitri (actress)]], [[R. S. Manohar|R. S. Manohar]] and [[Kumari Kamala|Kumari Kamala]] in lead roles. The film, had musical score by [[S. M. Subbaiah Naidu|S. M. Subbaiah Naidu]] and was released on 14 January 1962. The film was dubbed into [[Telugu|Telugu language]] as [[Muripinche Muvvalu|Muripinche Muvvalu]]. This film is the Indian [[Tamil cinema|Tamil cinema]]'s one and only Tamil film to be entirely shot and released in [[Technicolor|Technicolor]].

abstract: Bamboo Boys movie tells the story of four tribals (Kalabhavan Mani, Harishree Ashokan, Cochin Haneefa and Salim Kumar) from the jungle who come to town in search of a doctor to cure their headman’s wife and to win the hands of Kuduki, the headman's daughter. Being in town for the first time, everything seems new and strange for them.
title: Bamboo Boys

abstract: Chiru Navvuto (English: With a Smile) is a successful 2000 [[Telugu film|Telugu film]] starring [[Venu Thottempudi|Venu Thottempudi]] and [[Shahin|Shaheen Khan]]. This was Venu's second film as an actor after his first hit [[Swayamvaram|Swayamvaram_(1999 film)]]. This film was also a hit and was later remade into [[Kannada|Kannada]] as [[Premakke Sai|Premakke Sai]], starring [[V. Ravichandran|V. Ravichandran]] and in [[Tamil|Tamil language]] as [[Youth|Youth (2002 film)]], starring [[Joseph Vijay|Joseph Vijay]]. A few scenes were inspired by the 1997 Italian movie [[Life is beautiful|Life Is Beautiful]].The dialogues of this movie are one of the best works in Tollywood till date.

abstract: ParaNorman was released on August 17, 2012. It received mainly positive reviews and was a modest box office success, earning $107 million worldwide against its budget of $60 million. The film was nominated for that year's [[Academy Award for Best Animated Feature|Academy Award for Best Animated Feature]] and [[BAFTA Award for Best Animated Film|BAFTA Award for Best Animated Film]].

abstract: Starring different fighters in different points in their careers, Fight Life brings you a spectrum of different point of views in the fight game. From the 15 long minutes inside the cage to the countless hours in the gym, this profession of mixed-martial arts has finally flourished into mainstream America. The evolution of the sport within the last ten years from an underground sport to Spike TV and CBS has brought MMA into the category of professional sport. Along with this new sport comes the lifestyle of professional fighters who are paving the way for the next big thing. Fight Life chronicles the early struggles of the sport of MMA through the lives of selected fighters. Focusing on our three main protagonists' lives both inside and outside of the ring, the behind the scenes view of both the triumphant and inglorious times the fighters go through in their daily lives. From the moment of victory every fighter is chasing after, to the devastating knockout in defeat, Fight Life follows these fighters during their journey chasing a dream few dare.
title: Fight Life

abstract: The Essential Bugs Bunny is a DVD set featuring cartoons focusing on [[Bugs Bunny|Bugs Bunny]]. It was released on October 12, 2010.
title: The Essential Bugs Bunny

abstract: Camp Cuddly Pines Powertool Massacre is a 2005 [[pornographic|pornographic]] [[horror comedy|horror comedy]] film released by [[Wicked Pictures|Wicked Pictures]]. The film, originally released on September 14, 2005, is the first adult film to be released on the [[HD DVD|HD DVD]] format.
title: Camp Cuddly Pines Powertool Massacre

abstract: A Huey P. Newton Story (2001) is an American film adaptation directed by [[Spike Lee|Spike Lee]]. The movie was created, written and performed, as a solo performance, by [[Roger Guenveur Smith|Roger Guenveur Smith]] at The [[Joseph Papp Public Theater|Joseph Papp Public Theater]]. In this performance, Smith creates a representation of the activist [[Huey P. Newton|Huey P. Newton]]'s life and time as a person, a citizen and an activist. During the performance, images are shown up-stage from activist movement era. The simple arrangement of Smith sitting in a chair stage-center makes the audience focus on the dialogue of the performer. Smith captures the attention of the audience throughout the film by putting into play his solo performance skills. Smith's idea for the performance originated in 1989 and took root as a stage play in 1996. Smith's performance attempt to show a shy individual that Huey P. Newton believed himself to be. He did not consider himself a charismatic person, although he had made many contributions to his community. Smith shows Newton as a conservative individual who is disgusted by having microphones and cameras close to him.
title: A Huey P. Newton Story

abstract: Pigsy Eats Watermelon (Chinese: 猪八戒吃西瓜) is a [[chinese animation|chinese animation]] produced at the [[Shanghai Animation Film Studio|Shanghai Animation Film Studio]] by [[Wan Laiming|Wan Laiming]] and [[Wan Guchan|Wan Guchan]]. It is also referred to as "Mr. Pig Eats Watermelon" or "Zhu Bajie Eats Watermelon".
title: Pigsy Eats Watermelon

abstract: Naqaab (English: Mask) is a 2007 Indian [[suspense thriller film|suspense thriller film]] directed by the famous duo [[Abbas-Mustan|Abbas-Mustan]]. The film reunites [[Bobby Deol|Bobby Deol]] and [[Akshaye Khanna|Akshaye Khanna]] after [[Humraaz|Humraaz]] which was also directed by Abbas-Mustan. Former model [[Urvashi Sharma|Urvashi Sharma]] makes her film debut as the leading actress of the film. The story of the film is inspired by the Hollywood movie [[Dot the I|Dot the I]]. Deol plays the [[antagonist|antagonist]].
title: Naqaab

abstract: Closed Mondays is an eight-minute [[animated film|animated film]] using animated, three-dimensional clay figures, created by [[Bob Gardiner|Bob Gardiner (animator)]] and filmed by [[Will Vinton|Will Vinton]] in 1974. It was produced by Lighthouse Productions, released by Pyramid Films in the United States, and won the [[Academy Award for Best Animated Short Film|Academy Award for Best Animated Short Film]] in 1975.
title: Closed Mondays

abstract: The film's Hong Kong [[English language|English language]] title is Righting Wrongs. The international version (dubbed in English) is titled Above the Law, which was also the title adopted for [[The Weinstein Company|The Weinstein Company]]'s 2007 US DVD release on their [[Dragon Dynasty|Dragon Dynasty]] label.
title: Righting Wrongs

abstract: Around the World Under the Sea is a 1966 [[science fiction film|science fiction film]] directed by [[Andrew Marton|Andrew Marton]] and starring [[Lloyd Bridges|Lloyd Bridges]], with [[Marshall Thompson|Marshall Thompson]], [[Shirley Eaton|Shirley Eaton]], [[Gary Merrill|Gary Merrill]], and [[David McCallum|David McCallum]]. It follows the adventures of a crew of the deep-diving nuclear-powered civilian research [[submarine|submarine]] Hydronaut making a submerged [[circumnavigation|circumnavigation]] of the world to plant monitoring sensors on the ocean floor that will help scientists better predict impending [[earthquakes|earthquakes]]. Although [[Jules Verne|Jules Verne]] isn't credited by the film makers, his influence can be seen throughout the film.
title: Around the World Under the Sea

abstract: Presented as a story to a group of students by their teacher Lena that takes place in the distant future, The Last Mimzy is the story of the attempt by humans in the distant future to avert a catastrophic [[ecological disaster|ecological disaster]] that has destroyed their world. Humanity has become "isolated and warlike," and one scientist is desperately working to save the earth and its people. [[High-tech|High tech]] devices disguised as [[toy|toys]] are sent back in time, where they are found by Noah (Chris O'Neil) and Emma (Rhiannon Leigh Wryn) Wilder, children living in early-21st-century [[Seattle|Seattle]]. The "toys" are incomprehensible to them, except for what appears to be a [[stuffed|Stuffed animal]] [[rabbit|rabbit]]. Sensing the paranormal strangeness of the devices, the children initially keep their discovery secret from their parents.
title: The Last Mimzy

abstract: Qayamat: City Under Threat is a 2003 Indian [[Hindi|Bollywood]] [[romantic thriller|romantic thriller]] film directed by [[Harry Baweja|Harry Baweja]]. It is a remake of the 1996 film [[The Rock|The Rock (film)]]. [[Neha Dhupia|Neha Dhupia]]'s voice was dubbed by dubbing artist Rajanika Ganguly Mukherjee as the director thought her voice did not suit her character perfectly.
title: Qayamat: City Under Threat

abstract: Shaheed-e-Mohabbat Boota Singh also known as Shaheed-e-Mohabbat, is a 1999 [[Punjabi|Punjabi language]] feature film based on the real-life love story of [[Boota Singh|Boota Singh]] and [[Zainab|Zainab Singh]], starring [[Gurdas Maan|Gurdas Maan]] as Boota Singh and [[Divya Dutta|Divya Dutta]] as Zainab. The film is directed by [[Manoj Punj|Manoj Punj]] and produced by [[Manjeet Maan|Manjeet Maan]]. [[Arun Bakshi|Arun Bakshi]], [[Gurkirtan|Gurkirtan (actor)]] and [[Chetana Das|Chetana Das]] played supporting roles. The film won the [[National Film Award for Best Feature Film in Punjabi|National Film Award for Best Feature Film in Punjabi]] at the [[46th National Film Awards|46th National Film Awards]].
title: Shaheed-e-Mohabbat Boota Singh

abstract: Aag Aur Shola () is a [[1986|Bollywood films of 1986]] Indian [[Hindi|Hindi]]-language [[action|Action film]] [[romance film|romance film]], produced by Prasan Kapoor under the Tirupati Pictures Enterprises banner and directed by [[K. Bapaiah|K. Bapaiah]]. It stars [[Jeetendra|Jeetendra]], [[Sridevi|Sridevi]], [[Mandakini|Mandakini (actress)]], Ashish Chanana in the lead roles and music composed by [[Laxmikant-Pyarelal|Laxmikant-Pyarelal]]. The film was a remake of the Tamil film [[Uyirullavarai Usha|Uyirullavarai Usha]].
title: Aag Aur Shola

abstract: Will Burton ([[Gaelan Connell|Gaelan Connell]]) is a music enthusiast and a [[David Bowie|David Bowie]] fan with a hint of rock and roll and boy next door. Throughout the movie, Will writes journal-like e-mails to Bowie every day, although Bowie never answers. When Will's mother Karen ([[Lisa Kudrow|Lisa Kudrow]]) finds a new job, he switches to a new school, which he is eager to do since he was bullied at his previous one. During lunch one day at his new school, he meets a girl who says her name is written Sa5m but pronounced Sam, the 5 is silent ([[Vanessa Hudgens|Vanessa Hudgens]]). She tells him about Bandslam, an annual music competition in which the winning band gets a recording contract. Will and Sa5m quickly become friends but, shortly after, he is sought after by another girl named Charlotte Barnes ([[Aly Michalka|Aly Michalka]]). One afternoon, Charlotte asks Will to join her in an after-school day-care center. When she starts inviting him to hang out with her, the teenager is stunned—as is his single mother Karen. Impressed by his eclectic knowledge of music, Charlotte, who is a gifted singer-songwriter, asks Will to manage her rock/[[ska|ska]] band.
title: Bandslam

abstract: Maidan-E-Jung is a [[1995|Bollywood films of 1995]] [[Hindi|Hindi]] film directed by K.C. Bokadia, starring [[Dharmendra|Dharmendra]], [[Akshay Kumar|Akshay Kumar]] and [[Karishma Kapoor|Karishma Kapoor]]. Other cast members include [[Amrish Puri|Amrish Puri]], [[Manoj Kumar|Manoj Kumar]] (in his last film appearance), [[Jayapradha|Jayapradha]], [[Gulshan Grover|Gulshan Grover]], [[Kader Khan|Kader Khan]], [[Shakti Kapoor|Shakti Kapoor]], [[Mukesh Khanna|Mukesh Khanna]] and [[Dina Pathak|Dina Pathak]].
title: Maidan-E-Jung

abstract: El Húsar de la Muerte () is a [[1925|1925 in film]] [[Chile|Chilean]] [[silent film|silent film]] [[movie|movie]]. El Húsar de la Muerte was directed and starred by [[Pedro Sienna|Pedro Sienna]].
title: El Húsar de la Muerte

abstract: Paraya Dhan ([[Devanagari|Devanagari]]: पराया धन (Parāyā dhana); [[English|English language]]: Estranged Money) is a [[1971|List of Bollywood films of 1971]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] film directed by [[Rajendra Bhatia|Rajendra Bhatia]], starring [[Balraj Sahni|Balraj Sahni]], [[Hema Malini|Hema Malini]], [[Rakesh Roshan|Rakesh Roshan]] and [[Ajit Khan|Ajit Khan]].
title: Paraya Dhan

abstract: You Stupid Man is a 2002 [[romantic comedy|romantic comedy]] film written and directed by [[Brian Burns|Brian Burns]].
title: You Stupid Man

abstract: Aakhri Daao ([[English|English language]]: Final Trick; [[Hindi|Hindi]]: आखरी दाँव) is a [[1975|Bollywood films of 1975]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[crime film|crime film]], directed by A. Salaam, written by [[Salim-Javed|Salim-Javed]], and produced by M.M. Malhotra Kala Bharathi. It stars [[Jeetendra|Jeetendra]], [[Saira Banu|Saira Banu]] in the lead roles and music composed by [[Laxmikant-Pyarelal|Laxmikant-Pyarelal]]. The film is based on [[Bhagwati Charan Verma|Bhagwati Charan Verma]]'s 1950 novel of the same name.
title: Aakhri Daao

abstract: The story belongs to the criollo [[grotesque|grotesque]] ([[costumbrismo|costumbrismo]]) genre or [[black comedy|black comedy]]. It's based on the play of the same name by Jacobo Langsner, premiered by the Comedia Nacional company in 1962. The film adaptation starred some great local stars from the theater world like [[Antonio Gasalla|Antonio Gasalla]], [[China Zorrilla|China Zorrilla]], [[Luis Brandoni|Luis Brandoni]] and [[Betiana Blum|Betiana Blum]]. In the [[River Plate|Río de la Plata]] culture, it's considered to be a classic and its reruns on TV still draw large audiences. On April 2, 2009, 23 years after the original film's release, a sequel, Waiting for the Hearse 2, was released.
title: Waiting for the Hearse
