abstract: Lalach is [[1983|Bollywood films of 1983]] Indian Hindi film directed by [[Shankar Nag|Shankar Nag]] starring [[Vinod Mehra|Vinod Mehra]], [[Bindiya Goswami|Bindiya Goswami]], [[Ranjeet|Ranjeet]], [[Pran|Pran (actor)]], [[Kajal Kiran|Kajal Kiran]] and [[Anant Nag|Anant Nag]]. The film is a remake of director's own 1980 Kannada movie [[Minchina Ota|Minchina Ota (1980 film)]].
title: Lalach

abstract: New Jersey Drive is a 1995 [[crime drama|crime drama]] film about [[joy riding|Joyride (crime)]] black teenagers in 1990s [[Newark, New Jersey|Newark, New Jersey]], then known as the "[[car theft|car theft]] capital of the world".
title: New Jersey Drive

abstract: Harold & Kumar is the name for a series of American [[stoner comedy|Stoner film]] films starring [[John Cho|John Cho]] (Harold) and [[Kal Penn|Kal Penn]] (Kumar). The first film, [[Harold & Kumar Go to White Castle|Harold & Kumar Go to White Castle]], was released on July 30, 2004, by [[New Line Cinema|New Line Cinema]] and spawned a [[sequel|sequel]] titled [[Harold & Kumar Escape from Guantanamo Bay|Harold & Kumar Escape from Guantanamo Bay]], released four years later. [[A Very Harold & Kumar 3D Christmas|A Very Harold & Kumar 3D Christmas]], the third installment of the series, opened nationwide in the U.S. on November 4, 2011.
title: Harold & Kumar

abstract: Miracle at St. Anna is a 2008 AmericanItalian [[epic|epic film]] [[war film|war film]] [[adapted|film adaptation]] by [[James McBride|James McBride (writer)]] from his 2003 novel of the same name. Directed by [[Spike Lee|Spike Lee]], it stars [[Derek Luke|Derek Luke (actor)]], [[Michael Ealy|Michael Ealy]], [[Laz Alonso|Laz Alonso]], [[Omar Benson Miller|Omar Benson Miller]], [[Pierfrancesco Favino|Pierfrancesco Favino]] and [[Valentina Cervi|Valentina Cervi]]. Set primarily [[in Italy|Italian Campaign (World War II)]] during [[German-occupied Europe|German-occupied Europe]] in [[World War II|World War II]], the film tells the story of four [[Buffalo Soldier|Buffalo Soldiers]] of the [[92nd Infantry Division|92nd Infantry Division (United States)]] who seek refuge in a small [[Tuscan|Tuscany]] village, where they form a bond with the residents. The story is presented as a [[flashback|Flashback (narrative)]], as one survivor, Hector Negron (Alonso), reflects upon his experiences in a [[frame story|frame story]] set in 1980s New York. Several real-life events that occurred during the war, such as the [[Sant'Anna di Stazzema massacre|Sant'Anna di Stazzema massacre]], are re-enacted, placing Miracle at St. Anna within the genre of [[historical fiction|historical fiction]].
title: Miracle at St. Anna

abstract: Soothradharan (English: Strategist) is a [[Malayalam film|Malayalam film]] written and directed by [[A. K. Lohithadas|A. K. Lohithadas]]. The film stars [[Dileep|Dileep]] and [[Meera Jasmine|Meera Jasmine]]. Music is by Raveendran master. The movie was a disaster in the box office . This was the first flop of Dileep after delivering 9 back to back successful movies [[Udayapuram Sulthan|Udayapuram Sulthan]] , [[Varnakkazchchakal|Varnakkazchchakal]] , [[Mister Butler|Mister Butler]] , [[Darling Darling|Darling Darling (2000 film)]] , [[Joker|Joker (2000 film)]] , [[Thenkasipattanam|Thenkasipattanam]], [[Dhosth|Dhosth (2001 Malayalam film)]] , [[Ee Parakkum Thalika|Ee Parakkum Thalika]] & [[Ishtam|Ishtam (2001 Malayalam film)]]. This is national award-winning actress Meera Jasmines debut film.
title: Soothradharan

abstract: Fantômas contre Scotland Yard (, "Fantomas Against Scotland Yard") is the final installment of a trilogy of films starring [[Jean Marais|Jean Marais]] as the arch villain with the same name opposite [[Louis de Funès|Louis de Funès]] as the earnest but outclassed [[commissaire|Commissioner]] Juve and the journalist Fandor, also played by Marais. The [[trilogy|trilogy]] was [[France|France]]'s humorous answer, starting in 1964, to the [[James Bond|James Bond]] phenomenon that swept the world at around the same time. The Fantômas films became extremely successful in [[Europe|Europe]] and [[USSR|USSR]], and found success even in the [[United States|United States]] and [[Japan|Japan]] where fan websites exist to this day.
title: Fantômas contre Scotland Yard

abstract: Once Upon a Time in China is a 1991 Hong Kong–Chinese [[martial arts film|martial arts film]] written and directed by [[Tsui Hark|Tsui Hark]], starring [[Jet Li|Jet Li]] as [[Chinese|Han Chinese]] martial arts master and [[folk hero|folk hero]] of [[Cantonese|Cantonese people]] ethnicity, [[Wong Fei-hung|Wong Fei-hung]]. It is the first installment in the [[Once Upon a Time in China film series|Once Upon a Time in China (film series)]].
title: Once Upon a Time in China

abstract: Sankarlal is a 1981 [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Tamil language|Tamil language]] drama film written and produced by T. N. Balu. Starring [[Kamal Haasan|Kamal Haasan]] and [[Sridevi|Sridevi]] in the dual lead roles, the film was partially directed by Balu who died half-way during production. The film was eventually completed with [[N. K. Vishwanathan|N. K. Vishwanathan]] as director.
title: Sankarlal

abstract: Thaayillamal Naan Illai () is a 1979 [[Tamil language|Tamil language]] film starring [[Kamal Haasan|Kamal Haasan]], [[Sridevi|Sridevi]], [[Major Sundarrajan|Major Sundarrajan]] and [[Jaiganesh|Jaiganesh]] in the lead roles with [[Rajnikanth|Rajnikanth]] and [[Nagesh|Nagesh]] in guest roles. The movie was a super hit at the box office and it was dubbed into [[Telugu|Telugu language]] as Paatagaadu and [[Hindi|Hindi]] as Aakhri Sangram.
title: Thaayillamal Naan Illai

abstract: Samasya is a [[1976|Malayalam films of 1976]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed by K. Thankappan. The film stars [[Madhu|Madhu (actor)]], [[Srividya|Srividya]], [[Kamalahasan|Kamalahasan]] and [[Sankaradi|Sankaradi]] in the lead roles. The film has musical score by [[Shyam|Shyam (composer)]] and K. P. Udayabhanu.
title: Samasya

abstract: Agni Pushpam is a [[1976|Malayalam films of 1976]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed by Jeasy and produced by D. P. Nair. The film stars [[Jayabharathi|Jayabharathi]], [[Kamal Haasan|Kamal Haasan]], [[Jayan|Jayan]] and [[Sukumari|Sukumari]] in the lead roles. The film has musical score by [[M. K. Arjunan|M. K. Arjunan]].
title: Agni Pushpam

abstract: Yeh To Kamaal Ho Gaya (English: This is just amazing) is a [[1982|Bollywood films of 1982]] [[Hindi|Hindi]] language film directed by [[T. Rama Rao|T. Rama Rao]]. It stars [[Kamal Haasan|Kamal Haasan]] in a dual-role and is a remake of his own acted Tamil film [[Sattam En Kaiyil|Sattam En Kaiyil]] (1978).
title: Yeh To Kamaal Ho Gaya

abstract: Japanil Kalyanaraman (Kalyanaraman in Japan) is a 1985 Tamil language film starring [[Kamal Haasan|Kamal Haasan]] in the lead role of the protagonist. This was the first Tamil movie [[sequel|sequel]] (of [[Kalyanaraman|Kalyanaraman (1979 film)]]). It garnered mixed reviews and performed average business at the box office.
title: Japanil Kalyanaraman

abstract: Panathukkaga () is a 1974 Tamil language film. It stars [[Sivakumar|Sivakumar]] in the lead role of the protagonist. [[Jayachitra|Jayachitra]], [[Sripriya|Sripriya]], Shasikumar, [[Kamal Haasan|Kamal Haasan]] and [[Thengai Srinivasan|Thengai Srinivasan]] play supporting roles.
title: Panathukkaga

abstract: Cinema Paithiyam () is a [[1975|Tamil films of 1975]] [[Tamil language|Tamil language]] [[drama film|drama film]], directed by [[Muktha Srinivasan|Muktha Srinivasan]]. The film features [[Jayachitra|Jayachitra]] and [[Kamal Haasan|Kamal Haasan]] in lead roles. The film was produced by A. L. Srinivasan under his A. L. S. Productions. It is a remake of the Hindi film [[Guddi|Guddi (1971 film)]] (1971).
title: Cinema Paithiyam

abstract: Maro Charitra () is a 1978 [[Telugu-language|Telugu language]] Indian [[romantic|romance film]] [[tragedy|tragedy]] film written and directed by [[K. Balachander|K. Balachander]]. It stars [[Kamal Haasan|Kamal Haasan]] and [[Saritha|Saritha]] in the lead with [[Madhavi|Madhavi (actress)]] appearing in prominent roles. The film deals with [[cross-cultural|cross-cultural]] romance between a [[Tamil|Tamil people]] boy and a [[Telugu|Telugu people]] girl. Upon release, it was commercially successful and remains a cult classic. Owing to its success in [[Andhra Pradesh|Andhra Pradesh]], the film was released in the neighboring states of [[Tamil Nadu|Tamil Nadu]] and [[Karnataka|Karnataka]] without being dubbed into the respective languages. Balachander won a [[Best Director|Filmfare Award for Best Director – Telugu]] at the [[Southern Filmfare Awards|Filmfare Awards South]] in 1979. Later in 1981, Balachander remade the film in [[Hindi|Hindi language]] as [[Ek Duuje Ke Liye|Ek Duuje Ke Liye]] with Kamal Haasan reprising his role. Saritha, the female lead, was, however, replaced by [[Punjabi|Punjabi people]] actress [[Rati Agnihotri|Rati Agnihotri]]. The Hindi remake became a success as well. Both the films were listed among [[CNN-IBN|CNN-IBN]]'s 100 greatest Indian films of all time in 2013.
title: Maro Charitra

abstract: Swarg Narak ([[English|English language]]: Heaven - Hell; [[Hindi|Hindi]]: स्वर्ग नरक) is a [[1978|Bollywood films of 1978]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[drama film|drama film]], produced by [[B. Nagi Reddy|B. Nagi Reddy]] under the Vijaya Productions Pvt. Ltd. banner and directed by [[Dasari Narayana Rao|Dasari Narayana Rao]]. It stars [[Sanjeev Kumar|Sanjeev Kumar]], [[Jeetendra|Jeetendra]], [[Vinod Mehra|Vinod Mehra]], [[Moushumi Chatterjee|Moushumi Chatterjee]], [[Shabana Azmi|Shabana Azmi]] in the lead roles and music is composed by [[Rajesh Roshan|Rajesh Roshan]]. All three songs became popular. He sang one of his songs at Leena Jaitley's wedding 5 yrs ago. The film is a remake of the [[Telugu|Telugu language]] [[Silver Jubilee|Silver Jubilee]] movie [[Swargam Narakam|Swargam Narakam]] (1975) made by the same director.
title: Swarg Narak

abstract: Akayla () is a 1991 [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] film directed by [[Ramesh Sippy|Ramesh Sippy]] and produced by the [[Mushir - Riaz|Mushir - Riaz]] duo. It was the fourth film collaboration of [[Ramesh Sippy|Ramesh Sippy]] and [[Amitabh Bachchan|Amitabh Bachchan]] after [[Sholay|Sholay]] (1975), [[Shaan|Shaan (film)]] (1980) and [[Shakti|Shakti (1982 film)]] (1982). Although their previous films were successful at the box office, Akayla did not do as well as expected. The story was written by [[Salim Khan|Salim Khan]]. The film had the famous fictional [[Ram Pyari|Ram Pyari]] car, originally a customized [[Volkswagen Beetle|Volkswagen Beetle]].
title: Akayla

abstract: Marudhamalai ([[Arjun|Arjun Sarja]]), a police constable, goes to work in the village of [[Nachiapuram|Nachiapuram]] after passing his police exams and getting a merit. Here he meets 'Encounter' Ekambaram ([[Vadivelu|Vadivelu]]), his senior officer. He is asked to do all sorts of work for him, and one day, Marudhamalai loses a convict on the way to the court due to Ekambaram's soft heart. He then is to clean the floors of the inspector's house and there he falls in love with Divya ([[Nila|Meera Chopra]]). Then, later in the market, after Ekambaram is humiliated by a beggar, Marudhamalai sees Maasi ([[Lal|Lal (actor)]]), the 'boss' of the city, killing a person who stood for a candidate in the elections. Then the election commissioner comes to the place, and he discovers that elections have not been held for 16 years in the city due to Maasi's opposition.
title: Marudhamalai

abstract: Doli Saja Ke Rakhna (English: Keep the wedding carriage decorated) is a [[1998|Bollywood films of 1998]] Indian [[Hindi|Bollywood]] [[romance film|romance film]] directed by [[Priyadarshan|Priyadarshan]], with [[Jyothika|Jyothika]] and [[Akshaye Khanna|Akshaye Khanna]] in lead roles. The plot is adapted from the [[Malayalam|Malayalam]] film [[Aniyathipraavu|Aniyathipraavu]] which was also remade in Tamil as [[Kadhalukku Mariyadhai|Kadhalukku Mariyadhai]] and in Kannada as [[Preethigaagi|Preethigaagi]]. The music was composed by [[A. R. Rahman|A. R. Rahman]]. This was [[Jyothika|Jyothika]]'s First Film. She was considered for [[Filmfare Award for Best Female Debut|Filmfare Award for Best Female Debut]], but lost to [[Preity Zinta|Preity Zinta]] for [[Dil Se..|Dil Se..]]. The soundtrack went on to be used in the 1999 Tamil movie [[Jodi|Jodi (1999 film)]] and its Kannada version [[Sajni|Sajni]](2007).
title: Doli Saja Ke Rakhna

abstract: Talk Dirty to Me Part III was a 1984 [[pornographic|pornographic]] film and a spoof on the mainstream film [[Splash|Splash (film)]] and is the second sequel to the original 1980 film [[Talk Dirty to Me|Talk Dirty to Me (1980 film)]]. [[John Leslie|John Leslie (porn actor)]] had the lead role, playing "Jack", a character he had played in the first two installments of the Talk Dirty to Me series. Other cast members include [[Amber Lynn|Amber Lynn]], [[Peter North|Peter North (actor)]], [[Jamie Gillis|Jamie Gillis]] and [[Ginger Lynn|Ginger Lynn]]. It won Best Film at the 1985 [[AVN Awards|AVN Awards]].
title: Talk Dirty to Me Part III

abstract: Mahaan (English: Great) is a [[1983|Bollywood films of 1983]] Hindi action drama film produced by Satyanarayana and Suryanarayana and directed by [[S. Ramanathan|S. Ramanathan (film director)]]. The film stars [[Amitabh Bachchan|Amitabh Bachchan]] in triple roles alongside [[Waheeda Rehman|Waheeda Rehman]], [[Parveen Babi|Parveen Babi]], [[Zeenat Aman|Zeenat Aman]], [[Ashok Kumar|Ashok Kumar]], [[Amjad Khan|Amjad Khan (actor)]], [[Kader Khan|Kader Khan]], [[Aruna Irani|Aruna Irani]], [[Sujit Kumar|Sujit Kumar]] and [[Shakti Kapoor|Shakti Kapoor]]. The music is by [[R.D. Burman|R.D. Burman]].
title: Mahaan

abstract: Pyar Hi Pyar (, "love, only love") is a [[1969|List of Bollywood films of 1969]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] film produced by Rajaram and Satish Wagle, the film is directed by [[Bhappi Sonie|Bhappi Sonie]]. The film stars [[Dharmendra|Dharmendra]], [[Vyjayanthimala|Vyjayanthimala]], [[Pran|Pran (actor)]], [[Helen|Helen (actress)]], [[Madan Puri|Madan Puri]] and [[Mehmood|Mehmood Ali]]. This was the only movie of Dharmendra and Vyjayanthimala together. It was very successful at the box office at that time.
title: Pyar Hi Pyar

abstract: Bemisal (English: unparalleled, or, unprecedented) is a [[1982|Bollywood films of 1982]] movie produced by Debesh Gosh and directed by [[Hrishikesh Mukherjee|Hrishikesh Mukherjee]]. The film stars [[Amitabh Bachchan|Amitabh Bachchan]], [[Vinod Mehra|Vinod Mehra]], [[Raakhee|Raakhee]], [[Deven Verma|Deven Verma]], [[Aruna Irani|Aruna Irani]] and [[Om Shivpuri|Om Shivpuri]]. The music was by [[R.D. Burman|R.D. Burman]].
title: Bemisal

abstract: Haath Ki Safai (; figuratively: skill in pickpocketing) is a [[1974|Bollywood films of 1974]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] film, written by [[Salim-Javed|Salim-Javed]], produced by I.A Nadiadwala, and directed by [[Prakash Mehra|Prakash Mehra]]. The film stars [[Vinod Khanna|Vinod Khanna]], who won the [[Filmfare Best Supporting Actor Award|Filmfare Best Supporting Actor Award]], the only nomination and win for the film. The rest of the cast include [[Hema Malini|Hema Malini]], [[Randhir Kapoor|Randhir Kapoor]], [[Simi Garewal|Simi Garewal]], [[Ranjeet|Ranjeet]] and Satyen Kappu. The music is by [[Kalyanji Anandji|Kalyanji Anandji]]. The film became a "semi-hit" at the box office.
title: Haath Ki Safai

abstract: Amir Garib () is a [[1974|Bollywood films of 1974]] Hindi movie produced and directed by [[Mohan Kumar|Mohan Kumar]]. The film stars [[Dev Anand|Dev Anand]], [[Hema Malini|Hema Malini]], [[Premnath|Premnath]], [[Tanuja|Tanuja]], Sujit Kumar and Ranjit. The film's music is by [[Laxmikant Pyarelal|Laxmikant Pyarelal]].
title: Amir Garib

abstract: Dil Bhi Tera Hum Bhi Tere is a [[1960|Bollywood films of 1960]] [[Hindi movie|Bollywood]]. Produced by Bihari Masand for Kanwar Kala Mandir, the film is directed by [[Arjun Hingorani|Arjun Hingorani]]. The film stars [[Balraj Sahni|Balraj Sahni]], [[Dharmendra|Dharmendra]] and [[Kum Kum|Kum Kum]]. The film was Dharmendra's debut film.
title: Dil Bhi Tera Hum Bhi Tere

abstract: Pooja Ke Phool () is a [[1964|Bollywood films of 1964]] Hindi movie. Produced by [[A. V. Meiyappan|A. V. Meiyappan]] and directed by Bhimsingh, the film stars [[Ashok Kumar|Ashok Kumar]], [[Mala Sinha|Mala Sinha]], [[Dharmendra|Dharmendra]], [[Pran|Pran (actor)]], [[Nimmi|Nimmi]] and [[Leela Chitnis|Leela Chitnis]]. The films music is given by [[Madan Mohan|Madan Mohan]]. This is a remake of the Tamil film [[Kumudham|Kumudham]].
title: Pooja Ke Phool

abstract: Ek Bechara ([[English|English language]]: One Wretch; [[Hindi|Hindi]]: एक बेचारा) is a [[1972|List of Bollywood films of 1972]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[Action|Action film]] [[drama film|drama film]], produced by B.N. Ghosh under the SR International Productions banner and directed by S. M. Abbas. It stars [[Jeetendra|Jeetendra]], [[Rekha|Rekha]], [[Vinod Khanna|Vinod Khanna]] in the pivotal roles and music composed by [[Laxmikant Pyarelal|Laxmikant Pyarelal]].
title: Ek Bechara

abstract: Mehbooba is a [[1976|Bollywood films of 1976]] Hindi film produced by Mushir-Riaz and directed by [[Shakti Samanta|Shakti Samanta]]. The film stars [[Rajesh Khanna|Rajesh Khanna]], [[Hema Malini|Hema Malini]],[[Ummer Yaqoob|Ummer Yaqoob]] and [[Prem Chopra|Prem Chopra]]. The story is based on the reincarnation theme. The music is composed by [[Rahul Dev Burman|Rahul Dev Burman]]. The film is noted for an impressive performance by the lead pair and for its haunting melodies such as the solo song "Mere Naian Sawan Bhadon", sung by both Lata Mangeshkar and Kishore Kumar, "Chalo Ri" by Lata and the duet song "Parbat Ke Peeche". The plot is based on [[Gulshan Nanda|Gulshan Nanda]]'s novel Sisakate Saaz, and Nanda also wrote the screenplay himself. Upon its release, the film was big flop.This film has gained a cult following over the years and appreciation from audiences in its screening on television.
title: Mehbooba

abstract: Paduvaaralli Pandavaru is a 1978 Indian [[Kannada language|Kannada language]] film directed by [[Puttanna Kanagal|Puttanna Kanagal]]. It stars [[Ambarish|Ambarish]], [[Ramakrishna|Ramakrishna (Kannada actor)]], [[Jai Jagadish|Jai Jagadish]] in lead roles. The film features [[Dheerendra Gopal|Dheerendra Gopal]] and [[Musuri Krishnamurthy|Musuri Krishnamurthy]] in antagonist roles while [[Aarathi|Aarathi]] among others are in the supporting cast.
title: Paduvaaralli Pandavaru

abstract: Kangaroo Palace is an Australian television [[drama|drama]] miniseries which aired in 1997 on the [[Seven Network|Seven Network]].
title: Kangaroo Palace

abstract: Mangudi Minor is a 1978 Tamil film directed by V. C. Gunanathan. [[Vijayakumar|Vijayakumar (actor)]] played the lead role and [[Rajinikanth|Rajinikanth]] acted as villain in this film. The film was based on the Hindi film [[Rampur Ka Lakshman|Rampur Ka Lakshman]].
title: Mangudi Minor

abstract: Justice Gopinath is a [[1978|List of Tamil films of 1978]] Indian [[Tamil language|Tamil language]] film, directed by [[D. Yoganand|Dasari Yoganand]]. The film stars [[Sivaji Ganesan|Sivaji Ganesan]], [[Rajinikanth|Rajinikanth]], [[K. R. Vijaya|K. R. Vijaya]] and [[Major Sundarrajan|Major Sundarrajan]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[M. S. Viswanathan|M. S. Viswanathan]].
title: Justice Gopinath

abstract: Garjanam () is a 1981 [[Malayalam-language|Malayalam]] Indian [[action film|action film]] directed by [[C. V. Rajendran|C. V. Rajendran]], The film has [[Rajinikanth|Rajinikanth]] in the lead role supported by [[Balan K. Nair|Balan K. Nair]], [[Madhavi|Madhavi (actress)]] and [[Sukumari|Sukumari]]. [[Jayan|Jayan]] was the original lead actor of the film and had already shot some scenes. But because of his sudden and unexpected death, it was later completed with Rajinikanth. This was the second and last Malayalam movie of Rajinikanth.
title: Garjanam

abstract: Thai Veedu (Mother's House) is a 1983 Tamil language film directed by R. Thyagarajan, starring [[Rajinikanth|Rajinikanth]] and [[Anita Raj|Anita Raj]] in the lead roles. The film was a success and was remade in [[Hindi|Hindi]] as [[Jeet Hamaari|Jeet Hamaari]] with Rajinikanth returning.
title: Thai Veedu

abstract: Sivappu Sooriyan (English: Red Sun) is a 1983 Tamil language film directed by V.Srinivasan and starring [[Rajinikanth|Rajinikanth]], [[Radha|Radha (actress)]] and [[Saritha|Saritha]] in the lead roles. The movie was a failure at the box office.
title: Sivappu Sooriyan

abstract: A Heavenly Vintage is a 2009 internationally co-produced [[romantic|romance film]] [[drama film|drama film]] co-written and directed by [[Niki Caro|Niki Caro]]. It is loosely based on the novel The Vintner's Luck by [[Elizabeth Knox|Elizabeth Knox]]. The film had its international premiere at the [[Toronto International Film Festival|Toronto International Film Festival]] on 12 September 2009.
title: A Heavenly Vintage

abstract: In the present, a mysterious [[Taiwan|Taiwanese]] fisherman, Muo Sei, lands in the town of [[Cuyo|Cuyo, Palawan]], [[Palawan|Palawan]] beside the sea where he immediately looks for someone named "Ploning". In a flashback to some years ago, Ploning is known as a hardworking and thoughtful woman who, despite her age and beauty, decided not to marry. She had loved a man named Tomas fourteen years ago who left for a better life in [[Manila|Metro Manila]] leaving her heartbroken and pining for his return. Despite this, Ploning continues her roles as a dutiful daughter to the town patriarch Susing and to Tomas' grieving mother Intang, a compassionate friend to outsider Alma, and a caretaker of the invalid Juaning, whose son Digo she has taken under her care as well.
title: Ploning

abstract: Young Cassidy is a [[1965|1965 in film]] film directed by [[Jack Cardiff|Jack Cardiff]] and [[John Ford|John Ford]]. The film stars [[Rod Taylor|Rod Taylor]], [[Julie Christie|Julie Christie]], and [[Maggie Smith|Maggie Smith]]. The film is a biographical drama based upon the life of the playwright [[Seán O'Casey|Seán O'Casey]].
title: Young Cassidy

abstract: The series continued with the television series Dark Rising: The Savage Tales of Summer Vale (2011), the television film Dark Rising: Summer Strikes Back (2011) and the five-episode television series Dark Rising: Warrior of Worlds (2014). The franchise is a joint production of Harilaid's Black Walk Films and Cymek's Defiant Empire Films.
title: Dark Rising

abstract: Director-producer J. Om Prakash included in Aas Paas (1981) another brief "Lucky Mascot" screen appearance of his grandson — future Hindi film superstar actor [[Hrithik Roshan|Hrithik Roshan]], then age 7 — as the (credited) boy dancing in the song "Shehar Main Charcha Hai" who winks at Hema Malini and passes her a love note from Dharmendra.
title: Aas Paas

abstract: Jeevana Chaitra () is a 1992 Indian [[Kannada language|Kannada language]] feature film directed by the duo Dorai   — Bhagavan starring [[Rajkumar|Rajkumar (actor)]] and [[Madhavi|Madhavi (actress)]] in lead roles. It marked the re-entry of [[Rajkumar|Rajkumar (actor)]] in films after a hiatus of 3 years and was an instant hit. The film is based on a Kannada novel Vyapthi Prapthi written by [[Vishalakshi Dakshinamurthy|Vishalakshi Dakshinamurthy]] and was earlier named as Simhadriya Simha. The film re-affirmed the hold Rajkumar had on Kannada audiences.The film was highly successful at the box office.The movie saw a theatrical run of 52 weeks.
title: Jeevana Chaitra

abstract: Ephron's screenplay is adapted from two books: [[My Life in France|My Life in France]], Child's autobiography written with [[Alex Prud'homme|Alex Prud'homme]], and a [[memoir|Julie Powell#Julie .26 Julia: 365 Days.2C 524 Recipes.2C 1 Tiny Apartment Kitchen]] by Powell, Julie & Julia: 365 Days, 524 Recipes, 1 Tiny Apartment Kitchen (later retitled Julie & Julia: My Year of Cooking Dangerously). Both of these books were written and published in the same time frame (2004–06). Powell's book was based on her blog The Julie/Julia Project, where she had started documenting online her daily experiences cooking each of the 524 recipes in Child's [[Mastering the Art of French Cooking|Mastering the Art of French Cooking]]. The film is the first major motion picture based on a blog.
title: Julie & Julia

abstract: Elina: As If I Wasn't There () is a 2002 film directed by [[Klaus Härö|Klaus Härö]] and based on a novel by [[Kerstin Johansson i Backe|Kerstin Johansson i Backe]].
title: Elina: As If I Wasn't There

abstract: Jigar is a 1992 [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[martial arts|martial arts]] [[action film|action film]] directed by Farogh Siddique. Jigar was released during the Diwali weekend and proved to be a successful hit. It was [[Ajay Devgn|Ajay Devgn]]'s second success after [[Phool Aur Kaante|Phool Aur Kaante]] and premiered at the [[Plaza|Plaza]] cinema, [[Mumbai|Mumbai]]. The film is an unofficial and uncredited remake of [[Jean-Claude Van Damme|Jean-Claude Van Damme]]'s [[Bloodsport|Bloodsport (film)]] and [[Kickboxer|Kickboxer (1989 film)]]. The movie was [[Ajay Devgn|Ajay Devgn]]'s second hit collecting a total of 9 [[Cr|Crore]] at the Indian box office.
title: Jigar

abstract: Shikast () is a 1953 Hindi film produced and directed by Ramesh Saigal. The film stars [[Dilip Kumar|Dilip Kumar]], Nalini Jaywant, [[Durga Khote|Durga Khote]], [[Om Prakash|Om Prakash]] and K. N. Singh. The film's music is by [[Shankar Jaikishan|Shankar Jaikishan]]. [[Wajahat Mirza|Wajahat Mirza]] wrote the story and dialogues for this film. The movie is loosely based on the Bengali movie Palli Samaj.
title: Shikast

abstract: Mungiu and cinematographer [[Oleg Mutu|Oleg Mutu]] shot it in [[Bucharest|Bucharest]] and other Romanian locations in 2006. After making its world premiere at Cannes, 4 Months, 3 Weeks and 2 Days made its Romanian debut on 1 June 2007, at the [[Transilvania International Film Festival|Transilvania International Film Festival]]. It opened to critical acclaim, and was noted for its [[minimalism|minimalism]] and intense themes.
title: 4 Months, 3 Weeks and 2 Days

abstract: Yaaradi Nee Mohini was released on 4 April 2008, becoming highly successful at the [[box office|box office]], emerging as one of the highest grossing Tamil films of the year. It received seven nominations at the [[56th Filmfare Awards South|56th Filmfare Awards South]].
title: Yaaradi Nee Mohini

abstract: My Chauffeur is a 1986 American [[comedy film|comedy film]] produced by [[Crown International Pictures|Crown International Pictures]] and Marimark Productions starring [[Deborah Foreman|Deborah Foreman]], [[Sam J. Jones|Sam J. Jones]], [[Howard Hesseman|Howard Hesseman]] and [[E. G. Marshall|E. G. Marshall]]. It was written and directed by [[David Beaird|David Beaird]]. The original music score was composed by [[Paul Hertzog|Paul Hertzog]] with additional music by [[The Wigs|The Wigs]].
title: My Chauffeur

abstract: Lost in Transit (original title: Tombés du ciel; literally "Fallen from the Sky") is a 1993 French film directed by [[Philippe Lioret|Philippe Lioret]]. The film is about a man who loses his passport and spends a couple of days at a Paris airport, where he meets four people in similar circumstances. The film won the Grand Prize at the 6th [[Yubari International Fantastic Film Festival|Yubari International Fantastic Film Festival]] held in February 1995. The film dramatizes the life of [[Mehran Karimi Nasseri|Mehran Karimi Nasseri]].
title: Lost in Transit

abstract: Saajan Chale Sasural () is a [[1996|Bollywood films of 1996]] Indian [[Hindi|Hindi]] [[romantic comedy|romantic comedy]] film starring [[Govinda|Govinda (actor)]], [[Karisma Kapoor|Karisma Kapoor]], [[Tabu|Tabu (actress)]], [[Kader Khan|Kader Khan]] and [[Satish Kaushik|Satish Kaushik]]. It was directed by [[David Dhawan|David Dhawan]]. It is a remake of the Telugu movie [[Allari Mogudu|Allari Mogudu]]. A French [[dubbing|Dubbing (filmmaking)]] parody of this film called New Délire was released in 2007.. Saajan Chale Sasural was a commercial success and was listed second and top five "super-hits" of 1996 by the [[Indian Express|Indian Express]].
title: Saajan Chale Sasural

abstract: Illegally Yours is a 1988 American [[comedy film|comedy film]] set in [[St. Augustine, Florida|St. Augustine, Florida]] where a series of comic mishaps take place involving a blackmailer, a corpse, an incriminating audiotape, an innocent woman who accidentally picks up the tape, and a pair of teenage blackmail victims. The film was directed by [[Peter Bogdanovich|Peter Bogdanovich]] with [[Rob Lowe|Rob Lowe]] starring as Richard Dice, the college dropout who came back home to get his act together. The film's theme song was performed by [[Johnny Cash|Johnny Cash]].
title: Illegally Yours

abstract: Behind the Yellow Line (緣份, also known as Fate, is a 1984 Hong Kong [[romantic comedy|romantic comedy]] film directed by Taylor Wong and starring [[Leslie Cheung|Leslie Cheung]], [[Maggie Cheung|Maggie Cheung]], and [[Anita Mui|Anita Mui]]. The film was released in Hong Kong on 3 October 1984.
title: Behind the Yellow Line

abstract: Yeh Lamhe Judaai Ke (, [[translation|Indian English]]: "The Moments of Separation") is a [[delayed|delayed release (film)]] 2004 [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[romance|Romance film]] [[mystery film|mystery film]] directed by Birendra Nath Tiwari and produced by Ram sharma PB04. The film stars [[Shah Rukh Khan|Shahrukh Khan]], [[Raveena Tandon|Raveena Tandon]], [[Navneet Nishan|Navneet Nishan]], [[Divya Desai|Divya Desai]], [[Mohnish Behl|Mohnish Behl]] and [[Kiran Kumar|Kiran Kumar]].
title: Yeh Lamhe Judaai Ke

abstract: Damini – Lightning is a [[1993|Bollywood films of 1993]] Indian [[crime drama|crime drama]] film directed by [[Rajkumar Santoshi|Rajkumar Santoshi]] starring [[Meenakshi Seshadri|Meenakshi Seshadri]] in the title role alongside [[Sunny Deol|Sunny Deol]], [[Rishi Kapoor|Rishi Kapoor]], [[Amrish Puri|Amrish Puri]], [[Tinu Anand|Tinu Anand]], [[Paresh Rawal|Paresh Rawal]] in pivotal roles and [[Aamir Khan|Aamir Khan]] in a special appearance. The story is of how a woman fights against society for justice. The film is considered to be one of the best woman-centric films ever made in Bollywood.
title: Damini

abstract: My Name Is Fame is a 2006 Hong Kong [[comedy-drama|comedy-drama]] film starring [[Lau Ching-wan|Sean Lau]] as a has-been [[actor|actor]] and newcomer [[Huo Siyan|Huo Siyan]] as an aspiring [[actress|actress]] and his apprentice.
title: My Name Is Fame

abstract: Like several other 1980s films by Mahesh Bhatt, Awaargi, containing serious and realistic content, belongs to the [[arthouse|arthouse]] cinematic genre, known in India as [[parallel cinema|parallel cinema]]. On its release, it received critical acclaim.
title: Awaargi

abstract: Doosri Dulhan is a 1983 [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] film directed by [[Lekh Tandon|Lekh Tandon]]. The film centers on a childless couple ([[Victor Banerjee|Victor Banerjee]] and [[Sharmila Tagore|Sharmila Tagore]]) and a prostitute ([[Shabana Azmi|Shabana Azmi]]), who is hired as a surrogate mother. The movie was released in Bengali under the name Uttarayan in 2006. The movie was also remade as [[Chori Chori Chupke Chupke|Chori Chori Chupke Chupke]].
title: Doosri Dulhan

abstract: There is another stand-alone sequel starring Hung and [[Lam Ching-ying|Lam Ching-ying]], [[Encounters of the Spooky Kind II|Encounters of the Spooky Kind II]] (a.k.a. Close Encounters of the Spooky Kind 2), which has no relation to Encounters of the Spooky Kind. The Chinese name for the movie accurately translates as "Ghost Fights Ghost".
title: Encounters of the Spooky Kind

abstract: Ghatak: Lethal is a [[1996|Bollywood films of 1996]] Indian [[Hindi|Hindi]] [[action|action film]] [[crime drama film|crime drama film]] directed by [[Rajkumar Santoshi|Rajkumar Santoshi]]. The film stars [[Sunny Deol|Sunny Deol]], [[Meenakshi Seshadri|Meenakshi Seshadri]] and [[Danny Denzongpa|Danny Denzongpa]] in pivotal roles. This is Meenakshi Seshadri's last movie to date. The film was remade in Telugu as Aapthudu, with [[Rajasekhar|Rajasekhar (actor)]].
title: Ghatak: Lethal

abstract: Yaad Rakhegi Duniya is a [[1992|Bollywood films of 1992]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[romantic comedy|romantic comedy]] film directed by [[Deepak Anand|Deepak Anand]] on his debut. Starring [[Aditya Pancholi|Aditya Pancholi]] and Rukhsar, it premiered on 1 March 1992 in [[Mumbai|Mumbai]]. It is a remake of the Telugu blockbuster [[Geethanjali|Geethanjali (1989 film)]], directed by [[Mani Ratnam|Mani Ratnam]].
title: Yaad Rakhegi Duniya

abstract: Born to Win is a 1971 [[black comedy|black comedy]] film directed by [[Ivan Passer|Ivan Passer]] and starring [[George Segal|George Segal]], [[Karen Black|Karen Black]], [[Paula Prentiss|Paula Prentiss]], [[Hector Elizondo|Hector Elizondo]] and [[Robert De Niro|Robert De Niro]]. Filming locations took place in [[Manhattan|Manhattan]], specifically [[Times Square|Times Square]].
title: Born to Win

abstract: Subramani ([[Dhanush|Dhanush]]), known as Sullan among his friends, is the son of a corporation garbage lorry driver Mani ([[Manivannan|Manivannan]]). A first-year college student, his only objective in life is to have fun with his friends. He has a few unexceptional run-ins with Soori ([[Pasupathy|Pasupathy]]), a moneylender who charges atrocious rates and then goes after those who fail to pay him back, but when Soori's actions touch his own family and friends, Sullan is forced to strike back.
title: Sullan

abstract: A Very Special Love is a 2008 Filipino [[comedy|comedy]] [[romance film|romance film]] produced by [[Star Cinema|Star Cinema]] and [[Viva Films|Viva Films]] and starring [[John Lloyd Cruz|John Lloyd Cruz]] and [[Sarah Geronimo|Sarah Geronimo]]. The film was directed by [[Cathy Garcia Molina|Cathy Garcia Molina]] and had received an “A” rating from the Cinema Evaluation Board.
title: A Very Special Love

abstract: Tu Chor Main Sipahi (English:You the burglar, me the soldier) is a [[1996|Bollywood films of 1996]] Indian [[action film|action film]] starring [[Akshay Kumar|Akshay Kumar]], [[Saif Ali Khan|Saif Ali Khan]], [[Tabu|Tabu (actress)]] and [[Pratibha Sinha|Pratibha Sinha]] in the lead roles. It was released on 10 May 1996 and was directed by Guddu Dhanoa. The screenplay was written by Robin Henry. It was a box office blockbuster, managed to recreate the magic of [[Main Khiladi Tu Anari|Main Khiladi Tu Anari]] which also had Akshay Kumar and Saif Ali Khan in the lead roles. This was the second highest grossing movies of the year 1996.
title: Tu Chor Main Sipahi

abstract: People's Encounter is an Indian film released by [[Ushakiran Movies|Ushakiran Movies]] in 1991. The film is based on the situations in [[Andhra Pradesh|Andhra Pradesh]] in the early 1990s. It was the debut film of [[Meka Srikanth|Meka Srikanth]].
title: People's Encounter

abstract: Pavithram is a 1994 Indian [[Malayalam|Malayalam]]-language [[drama film|Drama (film and television)]] directed by [[T. K. Rajeev Kumar|T. K. Rajeev Kumar]] and scripted by [[P. Balachandran|P. Balachandran]]. The film stars [[Mohanlal|Mohanlal]], [[Shobana|Shobana]], Vinduja Menon, [[Thilakan|Thilakan]], [[Srividya|Srividya]], [[Sreenivasan|Sreenivasan (actor)]], [[Nedumudi Venu|Nedumudi Venu]] and [[Innocent|Innocent Vincent]]. The music was composed by [[Sharreth|Sharreth]] and the cinematography was by [[Santosh Sivan|Santosh Sivan]].
title: Pavithram

abstract: Mazha Peyyunnu Maddalam Kottunnu is a [[1986|Malayalam films of 1986]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam film]] [[comedy film|comedy film]] directed by [[Priyadarshan|Priyadarshan]]. Starring [[Mohanlal|Mohanlal]], [[Mukesh|Mukesh (actor)]], [[Lizy|Lizy (actress)]], [[Sreenivasan|Sreenivasan (actor)]], [[Jagathi Sreekumar|Jagathi Sreekumar]], [[Maniyanpilla Raju|Maniyanpilla Raju]], and [[Kuthiravattam Pappu|Kuthiravattam Pappu]] in the main roles. This film was a huge hit and considered as one of the best comedy films in Malayalam cinema. It was remade in Telugu as [[Saradaga Kasepu|Saradaga Kasepu]].
title: Mazha Peyyunnu Maddalam Kottunnu

abstract: Ek Kunwari Ek Kunwara is a [[1973|Bollywood films of 1973]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[drama film|drama film]] directed by [[Prakash Mehra|Prakash Mehra]]. The film stars [[Leena Chandavarkar|Leena Chandavarkar]], [[Rakesh Roshan|Rakesh Roshan]], Pran, Kumkum and Rajendra Nath. Two of the songs namely, "Agar Dil Hamara Sheeshe Ke Badle Patthar Ka Hota", sung by [[Kishore Kumar|Kishore Kumar]] and "Chal Diye Tum Kahan", sung by Rafi and Asha are still popular. The film had a nice story and good acting by main cast Pran, Leena, Rakesh Roshan and Kumkum, and did well at the box office.
title: Ek Kunwari Ek Kunwara

abstract: Jaise Ko Taisa ([[English|English language]]: Tit for Tat; [[Hindi|Hindi]]: जैसे को तैसा) is a [[1973|Bollywood films of 1973]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[comedy film|comedy film]], produced by [[M. Saravanan|M. Saravanan (film producer)]] and M. Balasubramaniam under the [[AVM Productions|AVM Productions]] banner and directed by Murugan Kumaran. It stars [[Jeetendra|Jeetendra]], [[Reena Roy|Reena Roy]] in the lead roles and music composed by [[R. D. Burman|R. D. Burman]]. The film is recorded as a Super Hit at the box office. The film is a remake of 1970 Kannada movie [[Bhale Jodi|Bhale Jodi]], which was earlier remade in Telugu as Bullema Bullodu (1972).
title: Jaise Ko Taisa

abstract: Shareef Budmaash is a [[1973|Bollywood films of 1973]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] action [[thriller film|thriller film]] directed by [[Raj Khosla|Raj Khosla]]. The film stars [[Dev Anand|Dev Anand]], [[Hema Malini|Hema Malini]], [[Shatrughan Sinha|Shatrughan Sinha]] and [[Ajit|Ajit Khan]] in pivotal roles.
title: Shareef Budmaash

abstract: Do Nambar Ke Amir is a [[1974|Bollywood films of 1974]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] social [[drama film|drama film]] directed by P.D. Shenoy.
title: Do Nambar Ke Amir

abstract: Kasauti () is a [[1974|Bollywood films of 1974]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[drama film|drama film]] directed by Aravind Sen. The film stars [[Hema Malini|Hema Malini]] and [[Amitabh Bachchan|Amitabh Bachchan]].
title: Kasauti

abstract: Do Jhoot is a [[1975|Bollywood films of 1975]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[romance film|romance film]] directed by Jitu Thakar. The film stars [[Vinod Mehra|Vinod Mehra]] and [[Moushumi Chatterjee|Moushumi Chatterjee]] .
title: Do Jhoot

abstract: Aaj Ka Mahaatma is a [[1976|Bollywood films of 1976]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] romantic [[action film|action film]] directed by Kundan Kumar. The film stars [[Randhir Kapoor|Randhir Kapoor]] and [[Rekha|Rekha]] .
title: Aaj Ka Mahaatma

abstract: Rangila Ratan is a [[1976|Bollywood films of 1976]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[action film|action film]] directed by [[S. Ramanathan|S. Ramanathan (film director)]].
title: Rangila Ratan

abstract: Joshila (; [[English|English language]]: Spirited) is a [[1973|Bollywood films of 1973]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[thriller film|thriller film]] directed by [[Yash Chopra|Yash Chopra]]. The film stars [[Dev Anand|Dev Anand]], [[Raakhee|Raakhee]] and [[Hema Malini|Hema Malini]].
title: Joshila

abstract: Farishta Ya Qatil is a [[1977|Bollywood films of 1977]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[action film|action film]] directed by S.M. Abbas. The film stars [[Shashi Kapoor|Shashi Kapoor]] and [[Rekha|Rekha]].
title: Farishta Ya Qatil

abstract: Paapi is a [[1977|Bollywood films of 1977]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[film|film]] directed by [[O. P. Ralhan|O. P. Ralhan]]. Zeenat Aman plays a young woman who was raised on the wrong side of the law. Her estranged brother, played by Sunil Dutt, has become a police officer. The story follows Zeenat Aman as she learns what it is to take responsibility for one's actions and Sunil Dutt as he learns to separate crime from the criminal.
title: Paapi

abstract: Shankar Hussain is a [[1977|Bollywood films of 1977]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[film|film]] directed by Yusuf Naqvi. It has memorable songs; Kahin ek Masum Nazuk si Lardki, sung by Rafi and Aaap yun Faaslon Se, sung by Lata, both classics of Khayyam's repertoire.
title: Shankar Hussain

abstract: Damaad is a [[1978|Bollywood films of 1978]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[film|film]] directed by [[Rajat Rakshit|Rajat Rakshit]]. It is a comedy.
title: Damaad

abstract: Ram Kasam is a [[1978|Bollywood films of 1978]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[action film|action film]] directed by Chand, with music by Sonik Omi.
title: Ram Kasam

abstract: Hum Tere Aashiq Hain ([[English|English language]]: We are your Lovers; [[Hindi|Hindi]]: हम तेरे आशिक हैं) is a [[1979|Bollywood films of 1979]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[romance film|romance film]], produced and directed by Prem Sagar under the Sagar Art Enterprises banner. It stars [[Jeetendra|Jeetendra]], [[Hema Malini|Hema Malini]] in the pivotal roles and music composed by [[Ravindra Jain|Ravindra Jain]].
title: Hum Tere Aashiq Hain

abstract: Iskul Bukol 20 Years After (Ungasis and Escaleras Adventure) is a Philippine comedy movie starring actors [[Tito Sotto|Tito Sotto]], [[Vic Sotto|Vic Sotto]], and [[Joey de Leon|Joey de Leon]]. It is part of the [[Iskul Bukol|Iskul Bukol]] franchise, depicting its characters 20 years after the end of the original TV series. It is also the fourth Iskul Bukol film (after 1977's Iskul Bukol the Movie, 1980's Iskul Bukol Freshmen, and 1987's The Best of Iskul Bukol: The Movie).
title: Iskul Bukol 20 Years After (Ungasis and Escaleras Adventure)

abstract: The Arabic Numeral Series, sometimes referred to as the Arabics, is a series of 19 short [[16mm|16mm]] films completed by the American [[experimental film|experimental filmmaker]] [[Stan Brakhage|Stan Brakhage]] in 1981 and 1982. The Arabic Numeral Series gets its name from the fact that none of the films included in it have titles, instead opening with an [[arabic numeral|arabic numeral]]. Brakhage produced another cycle, the [[Roman Numeral Series|Roman Numeral Series (Stan Brakhage)]], whose films all have [[Roman numerals|Roman numerals]] instead of titles, around the same time. All of the Arabics are [[silent|silent film]] and are intended to be projected at 18 [[frames per second|frames per second]].
title: Arabic Numeral Series

abstract: Mary and Max is a 2009 Australian [[stop motion animated|stop motion]] [[comedy-drama film|Comedy-drama]] written and directed by [[Adam Elliot|Adam Elliot]] as his first animated feature film with music by Dale Cornelius and produced by Melanie Coombs and Melodrama Pictures. The voice cast included [[Philip Seymour Hoffman|Philip Seymour Hoffman]], [[Toni Collette|Toni Collette]], [[Eric Bana|Eric Bana]], [[Bethany Whitmore|Bethany Whitmore]] with narration by [[Barry Humphries|Barry Humphries]]. The film premiered on the opening night of the [[2009 Sundance Film Festival|2009 Sundance Film Festival]] on January 15, 2009. The film won the Annecy Cristal in June 2009 from the [[Annecy International Animated Film Festival|Annecy International Animated Film Festival]], and Best Animated Feature Film at the [[Asia Pacific Screen Awards|Asia Pacific Screen Awards]] in November 2009. The film was theatrically released on April 9, 2009 by [[Icon Entertainment International|Icon Productions]]. Mary and Max received very positive reviews from critics and it earned US$1.7 million on an $8.2 million AUD budget.
title: Mary and Max

abstract: Jal Bin Machhli Nritya Bin Bijli () is a [[1971|List of Bollywood films of 1971]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[romance film|romance film]] directed by [[V. Shantaram|V. Shantaram]], with [[Sandhya|Sandhya (actress)]] and [[Abhijeet|Abhijeet (actor)]] as leads, along with Vatsala Deshmukh and [[Dina Pathak|Dina Pathak]].
title: Jal Bin Machhli Nritya Bin Bijli

abstract: Jawan Mohabbat is a [[1971|List of Bollywood films of 1971]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[romance film|romance film]] directed by [[Bhappi Sonie|Bhappi Sonie]]. The film stars [[Shammi Kapoor|Shammi Kapoor]], [[Asha Parekh|Asha Parekh]] and [[Pran|Pran (actor)]].
title: Jawan Mohabbat

abstract: Cameraperson is a 2016 [[autobiographical|Biographical film]] [[collage|Collage film]] [[documentary film|documentary film]]. The film is an account by director [[Kirsten Johnson|Kirsten Johnson]] about her life and career as a cinematographer. It relies on footage shot by Johnson across the years in numerous different countries.
title: Cameraperson

abstract: Kuvaputki is a multi-angle DVD by [[Embryoroom|Embryoroom]] produced and directed by [[Edward Quist|Edward Quist]] and co-produced by [[Derek Gruen|Del Marquis]] aka [[Del Marquis|Del Marquis]], with music by [[Pan Sonic|Pan Sonic]], the [[Finnish|Finland]] experimental [[electronic music|electronic music]] duo consisting of Mika Vainio and Ilpo Väisänen.
title: Kuvaputki

abstract: The film, produced by [[N. Subash Chandra Bose|N. Subash Chandra Bose]] under the banner of [[Thirupathi Brothers|Thirupathi Brothers]] and distributed by [[Dhayanidhi Alagiri|Dhayanidhi Alagiri]]'s [[Cloud Nine Movies|Cloud Nine Movies]], features a film score and [[soundtrack|Paiyaa (soundtrack)]] composed by [[Yuvan Shankar Raja|Yuvan Shankar Raja]], cinematography by [[Madhi|Madhi (cinematographer)]] and editing by [[Anthony Gonsalves|Anthony (film editor)]]. Following a lengthy pre-production phase, during which the film underwent major changes in its main cast and its technical crew, it began shooting in December 2008 at various locations throughout [[South India|South India]], most notably in [[Karnataka|Karnataka]], [[Andhra Pradesh|Andhra Pradesh]] and [[Maharashtra|Maharashtra]]. The film was released on 2 April 2010 to predominantly positive reviews and was commercially successful. A [[Telugu|Telugu language]] dubbed version of the film titled Awara was released on 21 May in [[Andhra Pradesh|Andhra Pradesh]] and also received positive response. The film was also dubbed into [[Hindi|Hindi]] as Aakhri Baazi in 2013 for direct telecast on [[Zee Cinema|Zee Cinema]].
title: Paiyaa

abstract: Sing! is a 2001 American [[short|short film]] [[documentary film|documentary film]] about the [[Los Angeles Children's Chorus|Los Angeles Children's Chorus]], directed by [[Freida Lee Mock|Freida Lee Mock]]. It was nominated for an [[Academy Award|Academy Award]] for [[Best Documentary Short|Academy Award for Best Documentary (Short Subject)]].
title: Sing!

abstract: Ek Nanhi Munni Ladki Thi is a [[1970|Bollywood films of 1970]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[drama film|drama film]] directed by Vishram Bedekar. The film stars [[Prithviraj Kapoor|Prithviraj Kapoor]], [[Mumtaz|Mumtaz (actress)]] and [[Helen|Helen Jairag Richardson]]. This movie is supposed to be the first or one of the first attempts of the Ramsay Brothers in the horror genre, notwithstanding the fact that consequently, the name Ramsay Brothers had become synonymous with horror movies in Indian cinema.
title: Ek Nanhi Munni Ladki Thi

abstract: Ghar Ghar Ki Kahani is a [[1970|Bollywood films of 1970]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[drama film|drama film]] directed by [[T. Prakash Rao|T. Prakash Rao]]. The film stars [[Balraj Sahni|Balraj Sahni]], [[Nirupa Roy|Nirupa Roy]] and [[Om Prakash|Om Prakash]] in lead roles.
title: Ghar Ghar Ki Kahani

abstract: Raaton Ka Raja is a [[1970|Bollywood films of 1970]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[drama film|drama film]]. The film stars Dheeraj Kumar and [[Shatrughan Sinha|Shatrughan Sinha]].
title: Raaton Ka Raja

abstract: Suhana Safar is a [[1970|Bollywood films of 1970]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[drama film|drama film]] directed by Vijay. The film stars [[Shashi Kapoor|Shashi Kapoor]] and [[Sharmila Tagore|Sharmila Tagore]].
title: Suhana Safar

abstract: Puraskar is a [[1970|Bollywood films of 1970]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[action film|action film]]. The film stars [[Joy Mukherjee|Joy Mukherjee]] and [[Farida Jalal|Farida Jalal]].
title: Puraskar

abstract: Jaane-Anjaane() is a [[1971|List of Bollywood films of 1971]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[drama film|drama film]] directed by Shakti Samanta . The film stars [[Shammi Kapoor|Shammi Kapoor]], [[Vinod Khanna|Vinod Khanna]] and [[Leena Chandavarkar|Leena Chandavarkar]].
title: Jaane-Anjaane

abstract: Bhai Ho To Aisa ([[English|English language]]: Brother Must be Like This; [[Hindi|Hindi]]: भाई होटो ऐसा) is a [[1972|List of Bollywood films of 1972]] Bollywood [[Action film|Action film]], produced by A.K. Nadiadwala under the A.K. Movies Pvt Ltd banner and directed by Manmohan Desai. It stars [[Jeetendra|Jeetendra]], [[Hema Malini|Hema Malini]], [[Shatrughan Sinha|Shatrughan Sinha]] in the lead roles and music composed by Sonik-Omi. The film is a remake of [[Telugu|Telugu language]] movie [[Aastiparulu|Aastiparulu]] (1966). The film is recorded as a Super Hit at the box office.
title: Bhai Ho To Aisa

abstract: Jangal Mein Mangal is a [[1972|List of Bollywood films of 1972]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[romance film|romance film]] directed by Rajendra Bhatia. The film stars [[Kiran Kumar|Kiran Kumar]] and [[Reena Roy|Reena Roy]] .
title: Jangal Mein Mangal

abstract: Thirumal Perumai (English: Pride of Lord [[Vishnu|Vishnu]]) is a 1968 [[Tamil-language film|Tamil language]], directed by [[A. P. Nagarajan|A. P. Nagarajan]] and released in 1968. It was his 9th film and also his first for 1968. The film features [[Sivaji Ganesan|Sivaji Ganesan]] and [[Padmini|Padmini (actress)]] in the lead roles. [[Sivakumar|Sivakumar]] starred in this film, one of his best roles ever.
title: Thirumal Perumai

abstract: Kalishankar or Kalisankar (,) is the [[bilingual|bilingual]] film in Oriya and Bengali language by director [[Prashanta Nanda|Prashanta Nanda]] in 2007. This [[Bengali|Cinema of West Bengal]]-[[Oriya film|Oriya film]] is a remake of [[Rakesh Roshan|Rakesh Roshan]]'s film [[vima nakula|vima nakula]] on the theme of reincarnation. Director Prashant Nanda turned the story around: Instead of being the story of the offspring (played by [[Salman Khan|Salman Khan]] and [[Shahrukh Khan|Shahrukh Khan]] in the original) it is the story of a pair of grandchildren and their grandfather's revenge on their wrongdoers. He plays the grandfather. The film has much stick-wielding action. Kalishankar is similar to old Manmohan Desai films wherein brothers separated in childhood grow up to find themselves on two sides of the fence. Then, when they recognise their blood link through a birthmark or a talisman, they join forces to fight the enemy together.
title: Kalishankar

abstract: All My Compatriots, also known as All My Countrymen (), is a 1968 Czechoslovak film directed by [[Vojtěch Jasný|Vojtěch Jasný]]. Considered the "most Czech" of his contemporary filmmakers, Jasný's style was primarily lyricist. It took nearly 10 years to complete the script and it was his greatest work. The film was banned and the director went into exile rather than recant. It was entered into the [[1969 Cannes Film Festival|1969 Cannes Film Festival]] where Jasný won the award for [[Best Director|Best Director Award (Cannes Film Festival)]].
title: All My Compatriots

abstract: Thaali Bhagyam () is a Tamil film directed by [[K. B. Nagabhushanam|K. B. Nagabhushanam]] and released in 1966.
title: Thaali Bhagyam

abstract: Thedi Vandha Mappillai () is a Tamil [[spy|Spy film]] [[thriller film|thriller film]] directed by [[B. R. Panthulu|B. R. Panthulu]] released in 1970. The film was a blockbuster at the box office, and ran more than 100 days in theatres all over Tamil Nadu. The movie is a remake of the director's own 1967 Kannada movie [[Beedi Basavanna|Beedi Basavanna]], starring [[Rajkumar|Rajkumar (actor)]], with minor changes.
title: Thedi Vandha Mappillai

abstract: You're in the Army Now is a 1941 [[comedy film|comedy film]] starring [[Jimmy Durante|Jimmy Durante]], [[Phil Silvers|Phil Silvers]], [[Jane Wyman|Jane Wyman]], and [[Regis Toomey|Regis Toomey]].
title: You're in the Army Now

abstract: Though not widely seen at the time of its release, it finally appeared on DVD, included in the boxed set, "Columbia Pictures Film Noir Classics, Vol. 1 (The Big Heat / 5 Against the House / The Lineup / Murder by Contract / The Sniper)," released November 3, 2009. The film has exerted an influence on [[American cinema|American cinema]], most notably on director [[Martin Scorsese|Martin Scorsese]], who famously cited Murder by Contract as "the film that has influenced [him] most."
title: Murder by Contract

abstract: Yeh Zindagi Ka Safar ([[English|English language]]: Journey of Life) is a 2001 [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] film, directed by [[Tanuja Chandra|Tanuja Chandra]] and produced by [[Mukesh Bhatt|Mukesh Bhatt]]. Upon release, it flopped miserably at the box office.
title: Yeh Zindagi Ka Safar

abstract: Jajabara is a 1975 [[Odia language|Odia language]] [[India|Indian]] movie. The music was composed by Akshya Mohanty. It was produced by Mr. Bijay Pattnaik, directed by Akshaya Mohanty, Hemanta Das and Bijay Mishra (Trimurty). It stars [[Sriram Panda|Sriram Panda]], Banaja Mohanty & Tripura Mishra. Jajabar was the first black-and-white [[Odia|Odia language]] film and also the first regional film in [[India|India]] to be digitally coloured and the first to be given a theatrical re-release in the state.
title: Jajabara

abstract: En Jeevan Paduthu (My Soul is singing) is a 1988 [[Tamil-language|Tamil language]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[feature film|feature film]] [[directed|Film director]] by [[R. Sundarrajan|R. Sundarrajan (director)]], starring [[Karthik|Karthik Muthuraman]] and [[Saranya|Saranya Ponvannan]] in lead roles, supported by [[Sudha Swarnalakshmi|Sudha (actress)]], [[Captain Raju|Captain Raju]] and [[Kapil Dev|Kapil Dev (actor)]]. The movie was dubbed into Telugu as "Akarshana", and some scenes were re-edited, as the Tamil version was not a box office success. However, the soundtrack was very popular, especially in Tamil.
title: En Jeevan Paduthu

abstract: Love & Other Drugs is a 2010 American [[erotic|Erotic film]] [[romantic drama|romantic drama]] [[comedy film|comedy film]] directed, produced and co-written by [[Edward Zwick|Edward Zwick]], based on the non-fiction book Hard Sell: The Evolution of a Viagra Salesman by [[Jamie Reidy|Jamie Reidy]]. The film stars [[Jake Gyllenhaal|Jake Gyllenhaal]] and [[Anne Hathaway|Anne Hathaway]], who originally starred together in [[Brokeback Mountain|Brokeback Mountain]]; [[Oliver Platt|Oliver Platt]], [[Hank Azaria|Hank Azaria]], [[Josh Gad|Josh Gad]] and [[Gabriel Macht|Gabriel Macht]] also star. The film was released in the United States on November 26, 2010, received mixed reviews from critics and grossed $103 million.
title: Love & Other Drugs

abstract: The film was also released in the United States under a variety of alternate titles such as, "Honeybaby, Honeybaby", "Honeybaby", and "Three Days in Beirut".
title: Honeybaby, Honeybaby

abstract: Mort's End is a popular webshow found on [1] that began in early 2009 and will have its final season in 2010. The show originally aired its first episode back when it was necessary to download each individual episode. Now, with a home on Blip, the audience can watch whichever episode they want. During its two season run, the show has gained a wide cult following among those who visit the website and those who come across the viral marketing.
title: Mort's End

abstract: Anveshana () is a [[1985|Telugu films of 1985]] [[Telugu|Telugu language]] thriller film directed by [[Vamsy|Vamsy]]. The film stars [[Karthik|Karthik Muthuraman]], [[Bhanupriya|Bhanupriya]], [[Kaikala Satyanarayana|Kaikala Satyanarayana]] and [[Sharat Babu|Sharat Babu]] in important roles. This is the third film for Vamsy as a director after Sitara and Alapana. The film was also dubbed in [[Tamil|Tamil language]] as Paadum Paravaigal.
title: Anveshana

abstract: Spirits of the Air, Gremlins of the Clouds is a 1989 Australian [[post-apocalyptic|post-apocalyptic]] [[sci-fi|Science fiction film]] [[adventure film|adventure film]] directed by [[Alex Proyas|Alex Proyas]]. It was his first feature.
title: Spirits of the Air, Gremlins of the Clouds

abstract: Agnisaram (1981) is an [[India|Indian]] film in [[Malayalam|Malayalam]] language by [[A. B. Raj|A. B. Raj]] starring [[Jayan|Jayan]], [[Sukumaran|Sukumaran]], [[Jose Prakash|Jose Prakash]], and [[Jayabharathi|Jayabharathi]].
title: Agnisaram

abstract: The Crimson Wing: Mystery of the Flamingos is a 2008 British-American [[nature documentary|nature documentary]] that explores the massive gathering of [[lesser flamingo|lesser flamingos]] in [[Tanzania|Tanzania]]. It was the very first movie released under the then-new [[Disneynature|Disneynature]] label. It premiered in [[France|France]] on October 26, 2008, with narration by [[Zabou Breitman|Zabou Breitman]], and was released theatrically in the [[UK|United Kingdom]] in September 2009 and [[direct-to-video|direct-to-video]] in the [[United States|United States]] in 2010 with narration by [[Mariella Frostrup|Mariella Frostrup]].
title: The Crimson Wing: Mystery of the Flamingos

abstract: Makkala Sainya in Kannada, Mazhalai Pattalam (English: Group of Children) in Tamil is an bilingual Indian children's film directed by actress [[Lakshmi|Lakshmi (actress)]] under the supervision of [[K. Balachander|K. Balachander]]. This was the only film directed by Lakshmi so far. It stars [[Vishnuvardhan|Vishnuvardhan (actor)]] and [[Sumithra|Sumithra (actress)]] in the lead. The story is based on the 1968 movie [[Yours, Mine and Ours|Yours, Mine and Ours (1968 film)]]. The film was remade in Telugu as [[Ramadandu|Ramadandu]] with Murali Mohan.
title: Makkala Sainya

abstract: [[Sudeep|Sudeep]] first approached producer Shanker Gowda to produce an action film which he wanted to direct. But, during discussions of the script, the topic of Just Maath Maathalli came up and Shanker Gowda showed immense interest in producing it. [[Sudeep|Sudeep]] had no qualms about it and agreed to direct the film.
title: Just Maath Maathalli

abstract: Branding Broadway is a 1918 American western film directed by and starring [[William S. Hart|William S. Hart]], written by [[C. Gardner Sullivan|C. Gardner Sullivan]], and produced by [[Thomas H. Ince|Thomas H. Ince]] and Hart.
title: Branding Broadway

abstract: Recep İvedik 3 is a 2010 Turkish [[comedy film|comedy film]], directed by [[Togan Gökbakar|Togan Gökbakar]], which stars [[Şahan Gökbakar|Şahan Gökbakar]] as an oafish character who is attempting to combat depression following the death of his grandmother. The film, which was released nationwide in Turkey on , was the highest grossing Turkish film of 2010. The film's titular comic character was created by Şahan Gökbakar for his Turkish comedy television show Dikkat Şahan Çıkabilir, which ran from 2005 to 2006. The series subsequently generated several sequel films, starting with [[Recep İvedik|Recep İvedik]] (2008), to which this is the second sequel.
title: Recep İvedik 3

abstract: Nokkethadhoorathu Kannum Nattu is a 1985 Indian [[Malayalam|Malayalam]] [[drama film|drama film]] written and directed by [[Fazil|Fazil (director)]], and starring [[Mohanlal|Mohanlal]], [[Nadhiya Moidu|Nadhiya]], and [[Padmini|Padmini (actress)]]. The film was one of the highest-grossing Malayalam films of the year at the box office, and received the [[Kerala State Film Award|Kerala State Film Award]] for [[Best Film with Popular Appeal and Aesthetic Value|Kerala State Film Award for Best Film with Popular Appeal and Aesthetic Value]].
title: Nokkethadhoorathu Kannum Nattu

abstract: Ekam – Son of Soil is a 2010 [[Punjabi|Cinema of Punjab]] film directed by Mandeep Benipal (who earlier assisted Gaurav Trehan in [[Hashar|Hashar]]) with story, screenplay and dialogues by Master Tarlochan Singh, produced by B S Maan (Khant) and Darshan Singh Grewal (executive producer), and starring [[Babbu Maan|Babbu Maan]], Mandy Takhar, Mohitinder Bawa, [[Bhagwant Mann|Bhagwant Mann]], Amrik Gill, Binnu Dhillon, Anita Shabdeesh, Tarsem Paul, Surinder Rehal, Garry Waraich and Ravinder Mand.
title: Ekam – Son of Soil

abstract: Aye Auto is a 1990 Indian [[Malayalam|Malayalam]] [[romantic|Romance film]]-[[musical film|musical film]] directed by [[Venu Nagavalli|Venu Nagavalli]] and starring [[Mohanlal|Mohanlal]] and [[Rekha|Rekha (South Indian actress)]] in the lead roles. The plot follows the life of [[auto|Auto rickshaw]] drivers in the city of [[Kozhikode|Kozhikode]] in [[Kerala|Kerala]]. Aye Auto was the second highest-grossing Malayalam film of 1990 at the box office, behind [[His Highness Abdullah|His Highness Abdullah]].
title: Aye Auto

abstract: Kunguma Chimil (English: A Saffron Kit) is a 1985 [[Tamil|Tamil language]] [[film|film]] starring [[Mohan|Mohan (actor)]], [[Ilavarasi|Ilavarasi]] and [[Revathi|Revathi]] in lead. It is a lovers quadrangle story, with a memorable soundtrack of the [[Tamil maestro|Ilaiyaraaja]].
title: Kunguma Chimil

abstract: South of Caliente is a 1951 American film directed by [[William Witney|William Witney]] and starring [[Roy Rogers|Roy Rogers]].
title: South of Caliente

abstract: Preah Vesandor is a [[1993|1993 in film]] [[musical|musical film]] movie starring [[Tep Rundaro|Tep Rundaro]], [[Pisith Pilika|Pisith Pilika]], [[Oum Sovanny|Oum Sovanny]], [[Ampor Tevi|Ampor Tevi]] and other stars of the time.
title: Preah Vesandor

abstract: Oru Minnaminunginte Nurunguvettam (Glimpse of the Light of a Firefly) is a 1987 [[Malayalam|Malayalam]] [[drama film|drama film]] directed by [[Bharathan|Bharathan]], written by [[John Paul|John Paul (writer)]] and starring [[Nedumudi Venu|Nedumudi Venu]], [[Sharada|Sharada (actress)]] and [[Parvathy|Parvathy Jayaram]]. The film is about an elderly teacher couple, who bring up a girl with devotion — only to lose her as well as her son. It won two [[Kerala State Film Awards|Kerala State Film Awards]]: [[Best Actor|Kerala State Film Award for Best Actor]] (Nedumudi Venu) and [[Best Film with Popular Appeal and Aesthetic Value|Kerala State Film Award for Best Popular Film]]. This film won two [[Filmfare Awards South|Filmfare Awards South]] for [[Filmfare Award for Best Actor - Malayalam|Filmfare Award for Best Actor - Malayalam]] & [[Filmfare Award for Best Actress - Malayalam|Filmfare Award for Best Actress - Malayalam]].
title: Oru Minnaminunginte Nurunguvettam

abstract: Kandam Becha Kottu (, ) is a 1961 [[India|Indian]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam]] film, directed by [[T. R. Sundaram|T. R. Sundaram]], starring [[Thikkurissy Sukumaran Nair|Thikkurissy Sukumaran Nair]] and [[Aranmula Ponnamma|Aranmula Ponnamma]]. It is the first [[colour film|colour film]] in Malayalam. Based on a popular novel, which was also staged as a play under the same title, the screen version in [[Gevacolor|Gevacolor]] was a big box office success. Its dialogues were written by renowned writer [[K. T. Muhammed|K. T. Muhammed]] and it is based on the "Kozhikkodan slang" of Malayalam. The film received a certificate of merit at the [[National Film Awards|National Film Awards]].
title: Kandam Becha Kottu

abstract: Pandippada is a 2005 [[Malayalam|Malayalam film]] [[comedy film|comedy film]] written and directed by [[Rafi Mecartin|Rafi Mecartin]], starring [[Dileep|Dileep]], [[Navya Nair|Navya Nair]], and [[Prakash Raj|Prakash Raj]] in the lead roles. It also stars [[Harisree Asokan|Harisree Asokan]], [[Rajan P. Dev|Rajan P. Dev]], [[Salim Kumar|Salim Kumar]], [[Ambika|Ambika (actress)]], [[Cochin Haneefa|Cochin Haneefa]], [[Indrans|Indrans]], and [[Sukumari|Sukumari]] in other pivotal roles. The film was co-produced by Dileep under the banner of Graand Productions.
title: Pandippada

abstract: Delta Heat is a [[1992|1992 in film]] film directed by Michael Fischa and written by Sam A. Scribner. The buddy police film was shot in [[New Orleans|New Orleans]], [[Louisiana|Louisiana]]. The screenplay was originally written by Bruce Akiyama to be a television pilot, commissioned by Sawmill Entertainment, but after producer [[Richard L. Albert|Richard L. Albert]] made [[The Forbidden Dance|The Forbidden Dance]], he decided to hire writer Sam Scribner to expand the script to feature film length. During production, producer Albert spent six hours in the bayous north of New Orleans convincing alligator hunter Bob Raymond to catch 40 alligators which appear in the final scene.
title: Delta Heat

abstract: The Revolutionary is a 1970 American [[political|Political cinema]] [[drama film|drama film]] directed by [[Paul Williams|Paul Williams (director)]]. The screenplay was written by [[Hans Koning|Hans Koning]] (credited as Hans Koningsberger), based on his novel of the same name. It was the film debut for actor [[Jeffrey Jones|Jeffrey Jones]].
title: The Revolutionary

abstract: The film premiered on September 17, 2009 in mainland China. The film was produced with the backing of the [[Communist Party|Communist Party of China]], but in response to some reactions outside Mainland China, [[Huang Jianxin|Huang Jianxin]], the film's co-director, "has said it was unfair to describe The Founding of a Republic as propaganda, since modern Chinese audience were too sophisticated to swallow a simplistic rendering of history." While the government of the [[Republic of China|Republic of China]] in Taiwan has asserted that it has no plans to actively censor the film, it has yet to be released because Taiwan's 2009 annual quota of 10 mainland films was already reached.
title: The Founding of a Republic

abstract: Swantham Lekhakan, also known as Swa. Le., is a 2009 [[Malayalam|Malayalam]] film directed and co-produced by debuting filmmaker P. Sukumar and scripted by Kalavoor Ravikumar. [[Dileep|Dileep]] and [[Gopika|Gopika]] play the lead roles while [[Nedumudi Venu|Nedumudi Venu]], [[Innocent|Innocent (actor)]] and [[Salim Kumar|Salim Kumar]] play major supporting roles.
title: Swantham Lekhakan

abstract: Tropeang Peay is a 1970 Khmer film starring Kong Som Eun and Vichara Dany.
title: Tropeang Peay

abstract: Chek Deth is a 1972 Khmer film directed by Yvon Hem. The film stars [[Kong Som Eun|Kong Som Eun]] and [[Vichara Dany|Vichara Dany]].
title: Chek Deth

abstract: Dav Bakdong Meas is a 1972 Khmer film directed by So Min Chiv. The film stars [[Vann Vannak|Vann Vannak]] and [[Vichara Dany|Vichara Dany]].It is the sequence to the 1971's Chaúng Dai Onpuk.
title: Dav Bakdong Meas

abstract: Looney Tunes Super Stars' Daffy Duck: Frustrated Fowl is a DVD of 15 new-to-DVD [[Daffy Duck|Daffy Duck]] cartoons that was released on August 10, 2010.
title: Looney Tunes Super Stars' Daffy Duck: Frustrated Fowl

abstract: Yuvajanotsavam is a 1986 Indian [[Malayalam|Malayalam]] [[romantic|Romance film]] [[comedy|Comedy film]] film written, directed, and produced by [[Shrikumaran Thampi|Shrikumaran Thampi]]. It stars [[Mohanlal|Mohanlal]], [[Urvashi|Urvashi (actress)]], and [[Menaka|Menaka (actress)]]. The film mark the return of [[Suresh Gopi|Suresh Gopi]], who started his career as a child artist in [[Odayil Ninnu|Odayil Ninnu (film)]] (1965).
title: Yuvajanotsavam

abstract: Kiccha Huccha () is an Indian Kannada-language film starring [[Sudeep|Sudeep]], [[Ramya|Ramya]] and Srinath. It is directed by [[Chi. Guru Dutt|Chi. Guru Dutt]] and produced by K Manju. The film was released on 15 October 2010. This movie was later released in Telugu as Kicha in 2012. The film is a remake of the [[Tamil|Tamil language]] successful film [[Chithiram Pesuthadi|Chithiram Pesuthadi]] which was also remade int Telugu as [[Raju Bhai|Raju Bhai]] and in Odia as Abhimanyu . The film was also later dubbed into Hindi as Ek Aur Ladaaku in 2012.
title: Kiccha Huccha

abstract: Maseeha (Messiah), is a [[2002|2002 in film]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[action film|action film]] written by Pradeep Ghatak and directed by [[Partho Ghosh|Partho Ghosh]]. The film stars [[Sunil Shetty|Sunil Shetty]] and [[Namrata Shirodkar|Namrata Shirodkar]].
title: Maseeha

abstract: Golmaal 3 (translation: Hotchpotch 3) is a 2010 Indian [[Hindi|Bollywood]] [[comedy film|comedy film]] directed by [[Rohit Shetty|Rohit Shetty]] and the sequel to the 2008 film [[Golmaal Returns|Golmaal Returns]] and the third film in the [[Golmaal|Golmaal (film series)]] series. The film stars Superstar [[Ajay Devgn|Ajay Devgn]], [[Arshad Warsi|Arshad Warsi]], [[Tusshar Kapoor|Tusshar Kapoor]], [[Kunal Khemu|Kunal Khemu]], [[Shreyas Talpade|Shreyas Talpade]], [[Kareena Kapoor|Kareena Kapoor]], [[Johnny Lever|Johnny Lever]], [[Ratna Pathak Shah|Ratna Pathak]] and [[Mithun Chakraborty|Mithun Chakraborty]] in the lead roles while [[Mukesh Tiwari|Mukesh Tiwari]], [[Ashwini Kalsekar|Ashwini Kalsekar]], [[Sanjay Mishra|Sanjay Mishra (actor)]], [[Vrajesh Hirjee|Vrajesh Hirjee]], [[Murali Sharma|Murali Sharma]], [[Vijay Patkar|Vijay Patkar]] are featured in supporting roles, [[Prem Chopra|Prem Chopra]] and [[Viju Khote|Viju Khote]] make special appearances.
title: Golmaal 3

abstract: Just Go with It is a 2011 American [[romantic|Romance film]] [[comedy film|comedy film]] directed by [[Dennis Dugan|Dennis Dugan]], written by [[Allan Loeb|Allan Loeb]] and Timothy Dowling and starring [[Adam Sandler|Adam Sandler]] (who also co-produced), [[Jennifer Aniston|Jennifer Aniston]], [[Nicole Kidman|Nicole Kidman]], [[Nick Swardson|Nick Swardson]] and [[Brooklyn Decker|Brooklyn Decker]]. The film is based on the 1969 film [[Cactus Flower|Cactus Flower (film)]], which was adapted from an earlier [[Broadway stage play|Cactus Flower (play)]] written by [[Abe Burrows|Abe Burrows]], which in turn was based upon the French play Fleur de cactus.
title: Just Go with It

abstract: Ye Maaya Chesave () is a 2010 [[Telugu|Telugu language]]-language [[romantic drama|romantic drama]] film written and directed by [[Gautham Menon|Gautham Menon]], with dialogues by [[Umarji Anuradha|Umarji Anuradha]]. The film stars [[Naga Chaitanya|Naga Chaitanya]] and debutant [[Samantha Ruth Prabhu|Samantha Ruth Prabhu]] in the lead roles. It was produced by [[Manjula Ghattamaneni|Manjula Ghattamaneni]] under the banner Indira Productions and features a critically acclaimed soundtrack and background score composed by [[A. R. Rahman|A. R. Rahman]]. Other credits include cinematography by [[Manoj Paramahamsa|Manoj Paramahamsa]], dialogues by [[Umarji Anuradha|Umarji Anuradha]] and editing by [[Anthony Gonsalves|Anthony (film editor)]]. The lead actors of the movie [[Naga Chaitanya|Naga Chaitanya]] and [[Samantha Ruth Prabhu|Samantha Ruth Prabhu]] fell in love during this movie and married one another on October 6, 2017 in a traditional Hindu ceremony followed by a Christian ceremony on October 7, 2017.
title: Ye Maaya Chesave

abstract: Guess What We Learned in School Today? (also released in the United States as I Ain't No Buffalo) is a 1970 film directed by [[John G. Avildsen|John G. Avildsen]] and written by Eugene Price. The movie premiered at the [[Cannes Film Festival|Cannes Film Festival]] in 1970 and opened in the United States in 1971. Although it was shot before Avildsen's [[Joe|Joe (1970 film)]], it got distribution afterward due to Joe's success.
title: Guess What We Learned in School Today?

abstract: Turn on to Love is a 1969 film directed by [[John G. Avildsen|John G. Avildsen]] and starring Sharon Kent, Richard Michaels, and Luigi Mastroianni. The film marks Avildsen's directorial debut.
title: Turn on to Love

abstract: Gumnaam – The Mystery starts with an unknown lady ([[Mahima Chaudhry|Mahima Chaudhry]]) driving in a rainy night, who is eventually murdered as she drives, and her finger is cut off.
title: Gumnaam – The Mystery

abstract: Uttar Dakshin () is a [[1987|Bollywood films of 1987]] [[Hindi|Hindi]] film produced by [[Ashok Khanna|Ashok Khanna]] and [[Subhash Ghai|Subhash Ghai]], directed by Prabhat Khanna and featuring [[Rajinikanth|Rajinikanth]], [[Jackie Shroff|Jackie Shroff]], [[Bharathi|Bharathi (actress)]] and [[Madhuri Dixit|Madhuri Dixit]] in the lead roles. [[Laxmikant Pyarelal|Laxmikant Pyarelal]] have composed the music, while [[Anand Bakshi|Anand Bakshi]] has written the lyrics for the film.
title: Uttar Dakshin

abstract: In the movie, [[Rekha|Rekha]] had the controversial role of a married woman who turns into a prostitute, which was severely criticized by the audience. About her role in the movie, Rekha said, "After 'Aastha: In the Prison of Spring' people had a lot to say about my role of a wife who moonlights as a prostitute. I don't have problems playing anything. I've reached a stage where I could do justice to any role that came my way. It could be role of a mother, a sister-in-law; negative, positive, sensational or anything."
title: Aastha: In the Prison of Spring

abstract: The Descendants is a 2011 American [[comedy-drama|comedy-drama]] film directed by [[Alexander Payne|Alexander Payne]]. The screenplay by Payne, [[Nat Faxon|Nat Faxon]] and [[Jim Rash|Jim Rash]] is based on the [[2007 novel of the same name|The Descendants (novel)]] by [[Kaui Hart Hemmings|Kaui Hart Hemmings]]. The film stars [[George Clooney|George Clooney]], [[Shailene Woodley|Shailene Woodley]], [[Amara Miller|Amara Miller]], [[Beau Bridges|Beau Bridges]], [[Judy Greer|Judy Greer]], [[Matthew Lillard|Matthew Lillard]], and [[Robert Forster|Robert Forster]], and was released by [[Fox Searchlight Pictures|Fox Searchlight Pictures]] in the United States on November 18, 2011 after being screened at the [[2011 Toronto International Film Festival|2011 Toronto International Film Festival]].
title: The Descendants

abstract: Ivide Thudangunnu is a [[1984|Malayalam films of 1984]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed by [[J. Sasikumar|J. Sasikumar]] and produced by Mohan Sharma. The film stars [[Sukumari|Sukumari]], [[Mohanlal|Mohanlal]], [[Rohini|Rohini (actress)]] and [[Balan K Nair|Balan K Nair]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[Johnson|Johnson (composer)]]. The film was remake of Kannada superhit movie Aasha and lead role played by Rebel Star Ambarish.
title: Ivide Thudangunnu

abstract: Aavanazhi is a 1986 [[India|Indian]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam]]-language action film directed by [[I. V. Sasi|I. V. Sasi]], based on the script written by [[T. Damodaran|T. Damodaran]], Aavanazhi. [[Mammootty|Mammootty]] appears in the lead role of Balram, a police inspector. This film deals with social and political issues of that time. Starring with Mammootty in lead roles are[[Geetha|Geetha (actress)]], [[Seema|Seema (actress)]], [[Sukumaran|Sukumaran]], [[Captain Raju|Captain Raju]], [[Janardanan|Janardhanan (actor)]], [[Jagannatha Varma|Jagannatha Varma]], [[Innocent|Innocent (actor)]], [[Thikkurisi Sukumaran Nair|Thikkurisi Sukumaran Nair]], [[Sreenivasan|Sreenivasan]] and [[Sankaradi|Sankaradi]]. The big success of Aavanazhi led to its remake in Tamil as [[Kadamai Kanniyam Kattupaadu|Kadamai Kanniyam Kattupaadu]], in Telugu as Marana Sasanam and in Hindi as [[Satyamev Jayate|Satyamev Jayate (1987 film)]]. I.V. Sasi brought out two sequels — [[Inspector Balram|Inspector Balram]] in 1991 and [[Balram vs. Taradas|Balram vs. Taradas]] in 2006.
title: Aavanazhi

abstract: Filmed over a period of two months after nearly three years of research, The Mirror Never Lies was sponsored in part by the Indonesian branch of the [[World Wide Fund for Nature|World Wide Fund for Nature]] and the [[Wakatobi regency|Wakatobi regency]] government. The first feature film to star the Bajau, it used [[their language|Bajaw language]] extensively. Although a commercial failure domestically, it has been screened at many international film festivals and won several awards both inside and outside of Indonesia. Critical reviews have generally been positive, mostly emphasising the film's visuals.
title: The Mirror Never Lies

abstract: I Love Hong Kong 2013 is a [[2013|List of Hong Kong films of 2013]] [[Hong Kong|Cinema of Hong Kong]] [[comedy film|comedy film]] and the third film of the [[I Love Hong Kong|I Love Hong Kong]] film series. Film stars [[Alan Tam|Alan Tam]], [[Veronica Yip|Veronica Yip]], [[Natalis Chan|Natalis Chan]] and [[Eric Tsang|Eric Tsang]], who also served as producer. This is also Veronica Yip's first film role since 1996's Hong Kong Showgirls. The film was released on 7 February 2013 to celebrate [[Chinese New Year|Chinese New Year]].
title: I Love Hong Kong 2013

abstract: Deadmeat is a 2007 [[British|United Kingdom]] urban [[crime|Crime film]] [[drama|Drama film]] [[thriller film|thriller film]] written, directed, produced by, and starring Q. The film is about a man who has just been released from prison and sets out to exact violent revenge against the gang who murdered his brother.
title: Deadmeat

abstract: Sahebzaade is a [[1992|Bollywood films of 1992]] Bollywood [[action film|action film]], starring [[Sanjay Dutt|Sanjay Dutt]] and [[Neelam Kothari|Neelam Kothari]] in the title roles, while some ensemble cast have supporting roles. The story is written by Ranbir Pushp.
title: Sahebzaade

abstract: Ek Hi Maqsad is a [[1988|Bollywood films of 1988]] Social Bollywood film directed by [[Pravin Bhatt|Pravin Bhatt]]. The film stars [[Om Puri|Om Puri]] and [[Divya Rana|Divya Rana]] in the lead roles.
title: Ek Hi Maqsad

abstract: Muppets Most Wanted is a 2014 American [[musical|Musical film]] [[comedy film|comedy film]] and the eighth theatrical film featuring [[the Muppets|the Muppets]]. Directed by [[James Bobin|James Bobin]] and written by Bobin and [[Nicholas Stoller|Nicholas Stoller]], the film is a [[sequel|sequel]] to 2011's [[The Muppets|The Muppets (film)]] and stars [[Ricky Gervais|Ricky Gervais]], [[Ty Burrell|Ty Burrell]], and [[Tina Fey|Tina Fey]], as well as Muppet performers [[Steve Whitmire|Steve Whitmire]], [[Eric Jacobson|Eric Jacobson]], [[Dave Goelz|Dave Goelz]], [[Bill Barretta|Bill Barretta]], [[David Rudman|David Rudman]], [[Matt Vogel|Matt Vogel (puppeteer)]], and [[Peter Linz|Peter Linz]]. In the film, the Muppets find themselves unwittingly involved in an international crime caper while on tour in Europe.
title: Muppets Most Wanted

abstract: Bhai Jaan is a [[1945|Bollywood films of 1945]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[film|film]]. It was released on 15 September 1945 in [[Bombay|Bombay]]. Directed by Syed Khalil. The actors were [[Karan Dewan|Karan Dewan]], [[Noor Jehan|Noor Jehan]], Anees Khatoon, [[Meena Shorey|Meena Shorey]], Shah Nawaz, Ansari and Nazir. It was a family drama, made under the banner of United Films. The print has been lost now.
title: Bhai Jaan

abstract: Scugnizzi is a [[1989|1989 in film]] [[Italian|Italy]] [[musical|Musical film]] [[drama|Drama film]], directed by [[Nanni Loy|Nanni Loy]]. The film is also called "Street Kids" in the [[American|United States]] market.
title: Scugnizzi

abstract: The film competed for the [[Golden Lion|Golden Lion]] at the [[69th Venice International Film Festival|69th Venice International Film Festival]]. Although it did not bag the top honors, Thy Womb was awarded three special prizes by other Italian film groups — La Navicella Venezia Cinema Award, the P. Nazareno Taddei Award - Special Mention, and the Bisato d' Oro Award for Best Actress (for Nora Aunor) given by an independent Italian critics group called Premio Della Critica Indipendiente. The film was also invited to the [[37th Toronto International Film Festival|2012 Toronto International Film Festival]] and the [[17th Busan International Film Festival|17th Busan International Film Festival]].
title: Thy Womb
