abstract: Yaare Koogadali () is a 2012 [[Kannada|Kannada]] action comedy film written and directed by [[Samuthirakani|Samuthirakani]], starring [[Puneeth Rajkumar|Puneeth Rajkumar]], [[Yogesh|Yogesh (actor)]] and [[Bhavana|Bhavana (Malayalam actress)]] in the lead roles. [[Parvathamma Rajkumar|Parvathamma Rajkumar]] and [[Raghavendra Rajkumar|Raghavendra Rajkumar]] are producing the film under for [[Poornima Enterprises|Poornima Enterprises]]. The film is a remake of [[Samuthirakani|Samuthirakani]]'s Tamil film [[Poraali|Poraali]] (2011).
title: Yaare Koogadali

abstract: Koi Aap Sa is a 2005 Indian [[Hindi|Bollywood]] [[romance film|romance film]] directed by [[Partho Mitra|Partho Mitra]]. It stars [[Aftab Shivdasani|Aftab Shivdasani]], [[Dipannita Sharma|Dipannita Sharma]] and [[Anita Hassanandani Reddy|Anita Hassanandani Reddy]] in pivotal roles.
title: Koi Aap Sa

abstract: Suddenly It's Magic is a 2012 [[Filipino|Philippines]]-[[Thai|Thailand]] [[romantic film|romantic film]] directed by Filipino film director [[Rory Quintos|Rory Quintos]], starring Thai actor [[Mario Maurer|Mario Maurer]] and Filipina actress [[Erich Gonzales|Erich Gonzales]]. The film is produced by [[Star Cinema|Star Cinema]] and was released last October 31, 2012, in the [[Philippines|Philippines]]. On March 7, 2013, [[Baifern Pimchanok|Pimchanok Luevisadpaibul]] confirmed on her Twitter account that the movie will screen in Thailand on March 14, 2013 at the Major Cineplex theater. Following Thailand's premiere of the movie, on March 25, 2013, Cambodia's Legend Cinemas confirmed on their Facebook fanpage of the official screening of the movie in the country on March 28, 2013.
title: Suddenly It's Magic

abstract: Adhisaya Ulagam (World of Wonders) is a 2012 Indian [[Tamil|Tamil language]] [[science fantasy|science fantasy]] film written and directed by Shakti Scott and produced by R. Banuchitra. The film stars [[J. Livingston|Livingston (actor)]], Sree Lakshmi, Mannan Prithivraj, [[Anandha Kannan|Anandha Kannan]], and Latha Rao, in a project combining animation with live action as India's first [[3D film|3D film]] that featured dinosaurs. In the film, Neelakantan, an Indian scientist, invents a time machine through which he and his grandchildren are accidentally transported to the prehistoric world. There they encounter numerous now extinct animals, including dinosaurs. The film was released on 10 August 2012 in India and received mostly negative reviews. According to [[The Times of India|The Times of India]], the director of the film failed as a storyteller and the film was "a bland Jurassic adventure".
title: Adhisaya Ulagam

abstract: Nachavule () is a [[2008|2008 in film]] [[Telugu|Telugu language]] film directed by [[Ravi Babu|Ravi Babu]] and produced by [[Ramoji Rao|Ramoji Rao]]. Starring a debut lead pair [[Tanish|Tanish]] and [[Maadhavi Latha|Maadhavi Latha]], the film is a teenage romantic comedy. Released on 19 December. 2008, it was a big musical hit. The film also won three Nandi awards for – "Best Supporting Actress" (Raksha), Best Female Playback singer ([[Geetha Madhuri|Geetha Madhuri]]) and Best Female Dubbing Artist (R Haritha).
title: Nachavule

abstract: Celluloid Man is a 2012 [[documentary film|documentary film]] directed by Shivendra Singh Dungarpur that explores the life and work of legendary Indian archivist [[P. K. Nair|P. K. Nair]], founder of the [[National Film Archive of India|National Film Archive of India]] and guardian of Indian cinema.
title: Celluloid Man

abstract: Glory & Honor is a 1998 [[television film|television film]] directed by [[Kevin Hooks|Kevin Hooks]]. The film is based on the true story of [[Robert Peary|Robert Peary]] ([[Henry Czerny|Henry Czerny]]) and [[Matthew Henson|Matthew Henson]]'s ([[Delroy Lindo|Delroy Lindo]]) 1909 journey to the [[Geographic North Pole|Geographic North Pole]], and their nearly 20-year history of exploring the [[Arctic|Arctic]] together.
title: Glory & Honor

abstract: In addition to being an official selection at the [[Raindance|Raindance Film Festival]], [[Fantastic Fest|Fantastic Fest]] and [[Mill Valley|Mill Valley Film Festival]] film festivals, A House, A Home was nominated for numerous awards ultimately winning thirty-two accolades including Best Short Film at the 32nd [[New Jersey Film Festival|New Jersey Film Festival]] and Best of Festival at the 55th [[Rochester International Film Festival|Rochester International Film Festival]]. A House, A Home was selected as an Official Honoree in The 17th Annual [[Webby Award|Webby Awards]] in the Music category.
title: A House, A Home

abstract: Selamsız Bandosu (literally "No greetings Band") is a 1987 [[Turkish|Turkey]] film.
title: Selamsız Bandosu

abstract: Jaan Ki Kasam is a [[1991|Bollywood films of 1991]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] film directed by Sushil Malik and produced by Javed Riaz. It stars Krishna and Saathi Ganguly in pivotal roles.
title: Jaan Ki Kasam

abstract: Beta Ho To Aisa is a [[1994|Bollywood films of 1994]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] film directed by C.P. Dixit and produced by Praveen Khanna. It stars [[Govinda|Govinda (actor)]], Anuradha and [[Varsha Usgaonkar|Varsha Usgaonkar]] in pivotal roles.
title: Beta Ho To Aisa

abstract: Krishna Aur Kans is a [[2012|List of Bollywood films of 2012]] Hindi [[Flash-animated|computer animation]] film produced and distributed by [[Reliance Entertainment|Reliance Entertainment]]. It was directed by Vikram Veturi. It was tax free in six states at the time of his release and released in Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, and English. A new mobile game was also launched on the occasion of Janmashtami after being inspired from film. It was the widest ever released animation movie in India.
title: Krishna Aur Kans

abstract: Sherlock Gnomes and his assistant, Gnome Watson, storm into [[London|London]]'s natural history museum, where their nemesis, a pie mascot named Moriarty, is holding gnomes hostage, planning to smash them. After a brief battle, Moriarty is defeated by getting seemingly crushed by a dinosaur skeleton.
title: Sherlock Gnomes

abstract: In a World... is a 2013 American [[comedy film|comedy film]] written, directed and co-produced by [[Lake Bell|Lake Bell]].
title: In a World...

abstract: Tiny Times (Chinese: 小时代), also known as Tiny Times 1.0 is the first installment of the [[film series|Tiny Times (film series)]] written and directed by [[Guo Jingming|Guo Jingming]] and based on the best-selling novel of the same name also by Guo.
title: Tiny Times

abstract: Miss Stevens is a 2016 American [[drama|Drama (film and television)]] film directed by [[Julia Hart|Julia Hart]] in her directorial debut, from a [[screenplay|screenplay]] by Hart and [[Jordan Horowitz|Jordan Horowitz]]. The film stars [[Lily Rabe|Lily Rabe]], [[Timothée Chalamet|Timothée Chalamet]], [[Lili Reinhart|Lili Reinhart]], Anthony Quintal, [[Oscar Nunez|Oscar Nunez]], and [[Rob Huebel|Rob Huebel]]. The plot follows a teacher who chaperones a small group of high school students to a weekend state drama competition.
title: Miss Stevens

abstract: Girl, Boy, Bakla, Tomboy (English: Female, Male, Gay, Lesbian) is a 2013 Filipino [[comedy|Comedy film]] [[parody film|parody film]] produced by [[Star Cinema|Star Cinema]] and [[Viva Films|Viva Films]] starring [[Maricel Soriano|Maricel Soriano]], [[Joey Marquez|Joey Marquez]], [[Vice Ganda|Vice Ganda]], [[Ruffa Gutierrez|Ruffa Gutierrez]], and [[Cristine Reyes|Cristine Reyes]]. It is one of the official entries of the [[2013 Metro Manila Film Festival|2013 Metro Manila Film Festival]].
title: Girl, Boy, Bakla, Tomboy

abstract: Onnum Mindatha Bharya () is a [[1984|Malayalam films of 1984]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed by [[Balu Kiriyath|Balu Kiriyath]] and produced by Thiruppathi Chettiyar. The film stars [[Mammootty|Mammootty]], [[Jalaja|Jalaja]], [[Viji|Viji]] and [[Menaka|Menaka (actress)]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[Raghu Kumar|Raghu Kumar]]. The film is a typical tear-buster family-drama of the 1980s of the mammootty-kutty-petty (mammootty-child-briefcase) genre.
title: Onnum Mindatha Bharya

abstract: Thuppakki commenced production in January 2012 and was filmed mostly in Mumbai, except for some song sequences. It was released on 13 November 2012, coinciding with the festival of [[Diwali|Diwali]]. Upon release, the film received positive reviews and became a major commercial success. It was also released in [[Telugu|Telugu language]] under the same title. Thuppakki went on to win six [[Vijay Awards|Vijay Awards]] from sixteen nominations, and was nominated for seven [[South Filmfare Awards|Filmfare Awards South]], including [[Best Film (Tamil)|Filmfare Award for Best Film – Tamil]], [[Best Director (Tamil)|Filmfare Award for Best Director – Tamil]] and [[Best Actor (Tamil)|Filmfare Award for Best Actor – Tamil]] for Vijay. Murugadoss remade the film in [[Hindi|Hindi]] as [[Holiday: A Soldier Is Never Off Duty|Holiday: A Soldier Is Never Off Duty]] in 2014, while [[Baba Yadav|Baba Yadav]] remade it in [[Bengali|Bengali language]] as [[Game: He Plays To Win|Game: He Plays To Win]] in that same year.
title: Thuppakki

abstract: Pyaar Koi Khel Nahin (English: Love is not a game) (Hindi: प्यार कोई खेल नहीं) is a [[1999|Bollywood films of 1999]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] film directed by Subhash Sehgal and produced by Sibte Hassan Rizvi. It stars [[Sunny Deol|Sunny Deol]], [[Apoorva Agnihotri|Apoorva Agnihotri]] and [[Mahima Chaudhry|Mahima Chaudhry]] in pivotal roles.Music is directed by [[Jatin Lalit|Jatin Lalit]] and songs lyrics written by [[Majrooh Sultanpuri|Majrooh Sultanpuri]].
title: Pyaar Koi Khel Nahin

abstract: Adimaippenn (English: Slave Girl) is a 1969 Indian [[Tamil-language|Tamil language]] [[peplum|Peplum (film genre)]] film, directed by [[K. Shankar|K. Shankar]].
title: Adimaippenn

abstract: Dwaar (, The Voyage out) is a 2013 [[Assamese|Cinema of Assam]] [[drama film|drama film]] directed by [[Bidyut Chakravarty|Bidyut Chakravarty]], with his own screenplay, and produced by Sanjive Narain and Bidyut Chakravarty himself. It was adapted from the [[Assamese|Assamese language]] short story Bahiroloi Jowa Baat by Apurba Sarma. Dwaar stars [[Kapil Bora|Kapil Bora]], [[Zerifa Wahid|Zerifa Wahid]] and [[Mahika Sharma|Mahika Sharma]] in the lead roles. The literal translation of the title means [[Door|Door]].
title: Dwaar

abstract: Let asfaltového holuba ("Fly of the Asphalt Pigeon") is a 1991 [[Czechoslovak|Czech and Slovak Federal Republic]] [[psychodrama|psychodrama]], starring [[Ondřej Vetchý|Ondřej Vetchý]], [[Szidi Tobias|Szidi Tobias]], Roman Luknár and [[György Cserhalmi|György Cserhalmi]].
title: Let asfaltového holuba

abstract: Annaiyin Aanai () is a [[Tamil language|Tamil language]] [[drama film|Drama (film and television)]] starring [[Sivaji Ganesan|Sivaji Ganesan]], [[Savitri|Savitri (actress)]] and [[Pandari Bai|Pandari Bai]] in the lead roles. The film, directed by [[Ch. Narayana Murthy|Chitrapu Narayana Rao]], had musical score by [[S. M. Subbaiah Naidu|S. M. Subbaiah Naidu]] and was released on 4 July 1958. The film won the [[National Film Award for Best Feature Film in Tamil|National Film Award for Best Feature Film in Tamil]] in 1959.
title: Annaiyin Aanai

abstract: Kudiyirundha Koyil (), is a 1968 Indian [[Tamil-language|Tamil language]] [[spy film|spy film]] directed by [[K. Shankar|K. Shankar]], starring [[M. G. Ramachandran|M. G. Ramachandran]], [[Jayalalithaa|Jayalalithaa]], [[Rajasree|Rajasree]], [[M. N. Nambiar|M. N. Nambiar]], [[Pandari Bai|Pandari Bai]], [[Nagesh|Nagesh (actor)]] and [[L. Vijayalakshmi|L. Vijayalakshmi]]. The dual role by MGR and the Bhangra dance sequence in Sardharji role with L. Vijayalakshmi were a major hits. All songs were popular and it became the box office hit of the year 1968 and crossed more than 100 days in Chennai and other major cities. The movie is a remake of the 1962 Hindi movie [[China Town|China Town (1962 film)]].
title: Kudiyirundha Koyil

abstract: Kappalottiya Thamizhan (The [[Tamilian|Tamils]] who launched a Ship) is a 1961 [[Tamil-language|Tamil language]] Indian [[drama film|Drama (film and television)]] directed by [[B. R. Panthulu|B. R. Panthulu]]. The film features [[Sivaji Ganesan|Sivaji Ganesan]] and [[Gemini Ganesan|Gemini Ganesan]] in the lead roles, while [[S. V. Subbaiah|S. V. Subbaiah]], T. K. Shanmugham, [[S. V. Ranga Rao|S. V. Ranga Rao]], [[Savitri|Savitri (actress)]] and [[S. A. Ashokan|S. A. Ashokan]] appear in supporting roles. The film is based on the life of [[V. O. Chidambaram Pillai|V. O. Chidambaram Pillai]] written by [[Ma. Po. Si.|Ma. Po. Si.]] (M. P. Sivagnanam). Upon release, the film received critical acclaim and was adjudged the [[Best Tamil Film|National Film Award for Best Feature Film in Tamil]] at the [[9th National Film Awards|9th National Film Awards]], however it failed at the box office.
title: Kappalottiya Thamizhan

abstract: Nadodi (pronounced "Nāţōţi"; ), is a 1966 Indian [[Tamil|Tamil language]]-language film, produced and directed by [[B. R. Panthulu|B. R. Panthulu]]. The film stars [[M. G. Ramachandran|M. G. Ramachandran]] and B. Saroja Devi in the lead roles. It ran for 70 days in theatres.
title: Nadodi

abstract: Raanjhanaa (English: Beloved One) is a [[2013|Bollywood films of 2013]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[romantic drama film|romantic drama film]] directed by [[Aanand L. Rai|Aanand L. Rai]] and written by [[Himanshu Sharma|Himanshu Sharma]]. The film is produced by [[Krishika Lulla|Krishika Lulla]] under the banner [[Eros International|Eros International]]. It stars [[Dhanush|Dhanush]], in his [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] debut, [[Sonam Kapoor|Sonam Kapoor]] and [[Abhay Deol|Abhay Deol]] in lead roles. The film was released on 21 June 2013 worldwide, while the dubbed Tamil version titled Ambikapathy was released a week later. The dialogues for the Tamil version were written by [[John Mahendran|John Mahendran]].
title: Raanjhanaa

abstract: Nalla Neram ( ), is a 1972 [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Tamil language action|Tamil cinema]] [[drama|Action film]] film, directed by [[M. A. Thirumugam|M. A. Thirumugam]], starring [[M. G. Ramachandran|M. G. Ramachandran]] in the lead role, with [[K. R. Vijaya|K. R. Vijaya]], [[Nagesh|Nagesh]] and others. This film was the 16th and last collaboration of [[MGR|MGR]] and [[Chinnappa Devar|Sandow M. M. A. Chinnappa Thevar]] and the only one color movie in the list. It is a remake of the 1971 Hindi movie [[Haathi Mere Saathi|Haathi Mere Saathi (1971 film)]]. It ran 100 days in Chennai.
title: Nalla Neram

abstract: Mondomanila merges drama, musical, horror, experimental, and exploitation cinema. It tells the story of teenage anti-hero Tony de Guzman and the rough neighborhood he calls home.
title: Mondomanila

abstract: All Our Desires () is a 2011 French [[drama film|drama film]] directed by [[Philippe Lioret|Philippe Lioret]]. [[Marie Gillain|Marie Gillain]] was nominated for the [[Magritte Award for Best Actress|Magritte Award for Best Actress]] for her role.
title: All Our Desires

abstract: Kodanda Ramudu is a 2000 [[Telugu|Telugu film]] [[Romance film|Romance film]], directed by [[S. V. Krishna Reddy|S. V. Krishna Reddy]]. The film stars [[J. D. Chakravarthy|J. D. Chakravarthy]], Saptaparna Saha ,[[Rambha|Rambha (actress)]] and [[Laya|Laya (actress)]] in the lead roles, with music composed by [[S. V. Krishna Reddy|S. V. Krishna Reddy]].
title: Kodanda Ramudu

abstract: Do Waqt Ki Roti is a [[1988|Bollywood films of 1988]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] film directed by Satpal and produced by M.P. Agrawal. It stars [[Feroz Khan|Feroz Khan (actor, born 1939)]], [[Sanjeev Kumar|Sanjeev Kumar]], [[Reena Roy|Reena Roy]] and [[Sulakshana Pandit|Sulakshana Pandit]] in pivotal roles.
title: Do Waqt Ki Roti

abstract: Nasibo (), also spelled as Naseebo, is a 1994 [[Punjabi|Punjabi language]] film, directed by Manmohan Singh, starring Raj Babbar, Kavita Kamal (Kimi Verma), Preeti Sapru, Amitoj Maan and others. [[Gurdas Maan|Gurdas Maan]] gave a special appearance.
title: Nasibo

abstract: One Piece Film: Z (stylized in Japan as ONE PIECE FILM Z) is a 2012 Japanese [[anime|anime]] [[fantasy|fantasy]] [[action|action film]] [[adventure film|adventure film]] directed by [[Tatsuya Nagamine|Tatsuya Nagamine]]. It is the twelfth feature film based on the shōnen manga series [[One Piece|One Piece]] by [[Eiichiro Oda|Eiichiro Oda]]. The film stars the regular television cast of [[Mayumi Tanaka|Mayumi Tanaka]], [[Kazuya Nakai|Kazuya Nakai]], [[Akemi Okamura|Akemi Okamura]], [[Kappei Yamaguchi|Kappei Yamaguchi]], [[Hiroaki Hirata|Hiroaki Hirata]], [[Ikue Otani|Ikue Otani]], [[Yuriko Yamaguchi|Yuriko Yamaguchi (voice actress)]], [[Kazuki Yao|Kazuki Yao]], and [[Chō|Chō]]. It also features [[Hōchū Ōtsuka|Hōchū Ōtsuka]] as Zephyr, an ex-naval Admiral, with [[Ryoko Shinohara|Ryoko Shinohara]] and [[Teruyuki Kagawa|Teruyuki Kagawa]] as Zephyr's henchmen. The film revolves around the Straw Hat Pirates battling against Zephyr, considered to be the most powerful enemy they've faced yet.
title: One Piece Film: Z

abstract: Mera Dharam (My Religion) is a [[1986|Bollywood films of 1986]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] film directed by [[Bapu|Bapu (artist)]] and produced by Ratan Irani. It stars [[Jackie Shroff|Jackie Shroff]] and [[Amrita Singh|Amrita Singh]] in pivotal roles.
title: Mera Dharam

abstract: Himmat Aur Mehanat ([[English|English language]]: Courage & Effort; [[Hindi|Hindi]]: हिम्मत और मेहनत) is a [[1987|Bollywood films of 1987]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[drama film|drama film]], produced by B. S. Shaad under the BRAR Productions banner and directed by [[K. Bapaiah|K. Bapaiah]]. It stars [[Jeetendra|Jeetendra]], [[Sridevi|Sridevi]] in the pivotal roles and music composed by [[Bappi Lahiri|Bappi Lahiri]]. The film is a remake of the [[Telugu|Telugu language]] movie Pachani Samsaram (1970), starring [[Krishna|Krishna (Telugu actor)]], [[Vanisri|Vanisri]] in the lead roles.
title: Himmat Aur Mehanat

abstract: Aasegobba Meesegobba (English: One for desire, one for moustache) is a 1990 [[India|Indian]] [[Kannada|Cinema of Karnataka]] film directed by [[M. S. Rajashekar|M. S. Rajashekar]]. The film stars [[Shiva Rajkumar|Shiva Rajkumar]], [[Lokesh|Lokesh]] and [[Sudha Rani|Sudha Rani]] in lead roles whilst [[Raghavendra Rajkumar|Raghavendra Rajkumar]] appears in an extended cameo. [[Ambareesh|Ambareesh]] and [[K. S. Ashwath|K. S. Ashwath]] are in guest roles. The music of the film was composed by [[Upendra Kumar|Upendra Kumar]]. The film is a remake of [[Amol Palekar|Amol Palekar]]'s 1979 Hindi comedy film [[Gol Maal|Gol Maal]]. Actress [[Shruti|Shruti (actress)]] debuted in this movie by playing the role of [[Shiva Rajkumar|Shiva Rajkumar]]'s sister ( credited as Priyadarshini).
title: Aasegobba Meesegobba

abstract: Sidlingu () is a comedy-emotional [[coming of age|coming of age]] [[Cinema of Karnataka|Kannada film]] starring [[Yogesh|Yogesh (actor)]] and [[Ramya|Ramya]] in the lead roles. The film has been directed and written by [[Vijaya Prasad|Vijaya Prasad]], who makes his big screen debut after directing many TV series. The film is produced by Yogesh's father, T. P. Siddaraju of [[Duniya|Duniya (2007 film)]] fame. [[Anoop Seelin|Anoop Seelin]] has composed the music. Sugnan aka Gnana Murthy who has worked for movies like Mani, Lifeu Isthene, Premism, Manasology and many more is the director of cinematography.
title: Sidlingu

abstract: Nizhal Thedum Nenjangal is a [[1982|1982 in film]] [[Kollywood|Kollywood]] film directed by [[P. S. Nivas|P. S. Nivas]], starring, [[Rajeev|Rajeev (actor)]], [[Vijayashanti|Vijayashanti]], [[Vadivukkarasi|Vadivukkarasi]], [[Subhadra|Subhadra]], [[Banuchandar|Banuchandar]], [[Goundamani|Goundamani]], [[Master Suresh|Master Suresh]], [[Moorthi|Moorthi]], and [[Sreekanth|Sreekanth]].
title: Nizhal Thedum Nenjangal

abstract: I Don't Want to Go Back Alone () is a 2010 Brazilian short film directed by [[Daniel Ribeiro|Daniel Ribeiro]]. The short won the 2011 [[Iris Prize|Iris Prize]].It was later expanded into Ribeiro's 2014 feature film [[The Way He Looks|The Way He Looks]].
title: I Don't Want to Go Back Alone

abstract: Rajaparambara is a 1977 Indian [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed by [[Dr. Balakrishnan|Dr. Balakrishnan]] and produced by M. P. Bhaskaran. The film stars [[Jayan|Jayan]], [[Jayabharathi|Jayabharathi]], [[Jose Prakash|Jose Prakash]] and [[Shobha|Shobha]] in the lead roles. The film has musical score by [[A. T. Ummer|A. T. Ummer]].
title: Rajaparambara

abstract: Development of Thor: The Dark World began in April 2011, when producer [[Kevin Feige|Kevin Feige]] announced plans for a sequel to follow the crossover film [[The Avengers|The Avengers (2012 film)]]. In July 2011, [[Kenneth Branagh|Kenneth Branagh]], the director of Thor, withdrew from the project. [[Brian Kirk|Brian Kirk]] and [[Patty Jenkins|Patty Jenkins]] were considered to direct the film before Taylor was hired in January 2012. The supporting cast filled out in August 2012, with the hiring of Eccleston, Dennings, and Akinnuoye-Agbaje. Principal photography began in September 2012 in [[Surrey|Surrey]], England with filming continuing in [[Iceland|Iceland]] and London, before wrapping up in December 2012. Thor: The Dark World was converted to [[3D|3D film]] in post-production.
title: Thor: The Dark World

abstract: Nigahen: Nagina Part II is an Indian [[Fantasy|Fantasy]] film directed by [[Harmesh Malhotra|Harmesh Malhotra]], released in 1989. The movie stars [[Sridevi|Sridevi]], [[Sunny Deol|Sunny Deol]], [[Anupam Kher|Anupam Kher]], [[Gulshan Grover|Gulshan Grover]]. It is the sequel to the Sridevi starrer [[blockbuster|blockbuster (entertainment)]] [[Nagina.|Nagina (1986 film)]] It is the first [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] movie sequel. However, the movie performed poorly and bombed at the box office.
title: Nigahen: Nagina Part II

abstract: Manzil Manzil is a 1984 Indian [[romantic drama film|romantic drama film]], directed by [[Nasir Hussain|Nasir Hussain]], with his nephew [[Aamir Khan|Aamir Khan]] as his [[assistant director|assistant director]]. The film stars [[Kulbhushan Kharbanda|Kulbhushan Kharbanda]], [[Dimple Kapadia|Dimple Kapadia]], [[Sunny Deol|Sunny Deol]], [[Prem Chopra|Prem Chopra]], and [[Danny Denzongpa|Danny Denzongpa]], with [[Asha Parekh|Asha Parekh]] in a cameo.
title: Manzil Manzil

abstract: Saveray Wali Gaadi () is a [[1986|Bollywood films of 1986]] Indian drama film directed by [[P. Bharathiraja|P. Bharathiraja]]. The film stars [[Sunny Deol|Sunny Deol]] and [[Poonam Dhillon|Poonam Dhillon]] in the lead roles. It is a remake of Bharathiraja's [[Tamil|Tamil language]] film [[Kizhakke Pogum Rail|Kizhakke Pogum Rail]].
title: Saveray Wali Gaadi

abstract: Looney Tunes Super Stars' Bugs Bunny: Wascally Wabbit is a DVD of 15 [[Bugs Bunny|Bugs Bunny]] cartoons that was released on May 4, 2011 (in Region 2). Like the Sylvester & Tweety: Feline Fwenzy disc, this disc features 15 cartoons that were previously on the Golden Collection sets as the new plan for the Super Stars volumes is one with new-to-DVD cartoons and one with previously-on-DVD cartoons. The reason for the double-dip release in each wave is so the Warner Home Video department can pay back for the remastering of other restorations. Also, unlike the previous Super Stars discs, the cartoons are presented in original full screen.
title: Looney Tunes Super Stars' Bugs Bunny: Wascally Wabbit

abstract: Unofficially Yours (stylized as ÜnOfficially Yours) is a 2012 Filipino [[romantic film|romantic film]] directed by [[Cathy Garcia-Molina|Cathy Garcia-Molina]], starring [[John Lloyd Cruz|John Lloyd Cruz]] and [[Angel Locsin|Angel Locsin]] with [[Edgar Mortiz|Edgar Mortiz]], [[Tetchie Agbayani|Tetchie Agbayani]] and [[Edgar Allan Guzman|Edgar Allan Guzman]] as Kelvin. It was produced and released by [[Star Cinema|Star Cinema]]. The film was released domestically on February 15, 2012. It was [[third highest grossing Filipino film of 2012|List of highest-grossing films in the Philippines#Local movies]].
title: Unofficially Yours

abstract: Dost Garibon Ka is a [[Hindi language movie|Bollywood]] produced by [[Firoz A. Nadiadwala|Firoz A. Nadiadwala]] starring [[Govinda|Govinda (actor)]] and [[Neelam|Neelam Kothari]]. The movie was directed by [[C.P. Dixit|C.P. Dixit]] and was released in 1989.
title: Dost Garibon Ka

abstract: Santhwanam is a [[1991|1991 in film]] [[Malayalam-language|Cinema of Kerala]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[feature film|feature film]] [[directed|Film director]] by [[Sibi Malayil|Sibi Malayil]], starring [[Nedumudi Venu|Nedumudi Venu]], [[Bharathi|Bharathi Vishnuvardhan]], [[Meena|Meena Durairaj]] and [[Suresh Gopi|Suresh Gopi]].
title: Santhwanam

abstract: The second adaptation of the Ronggeng Dukuh Paruk trilogy, Sang Penari required two years of research to better present the historical context, including the [[30 September Movement|30 September Movement]] and ensuing [[anti-communist actions|Indonesian killings of 1965–1966]]; these details, censored in the original trilogy by the [[New Order|New Order (Indonesia)]] government, were more explicit than in the novels. Although the film was set and shot in [[Purwokerto|Purwokerto]], [[Central Java|Central Java]], neither of the leads was [[ethnic Javanese|Javanese people]]. Nasution, cast in her debut role, is [[Batak|Batak (Indonesia)]], while Antara is [[Balinese|Balinese people]].
title: Sang Penari

abstract: Sadda Adda is a 2012 Indian [[comedy film|comedy film]] directed by [[Muazzam Beg|Muazzam Beg]]. The film was Muazzam Beg's directorial debut. Sadda Adda was produced by Rajeev Agarwal, Ramesh Agarwal and Tarun Agarwal, under the banner of Rajtaru Studios Limited.
title: Sadda Adda

abstract: Humse Badhkar Kaun is a [[1998|Bollywood films of 1998]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] film directed by [[Deepak Anand|Deepak Anand]] and produced by Shyam Bajaj. It stars [[Sunil Shetty|Sunil Shetty]], [[Saif Ali Khan|Saif Ali Khan]], [[Sonali Bendre|Sonali Bendre]] and [[Deepti Bhatnagar|Deepti Bhatnagar]] in pivotal roles.
title: Humse Badhkar Kaun

abstract: Edhir Paradhathu () is a 1954 Indian [[Tamil-language|Tamil language]] film directed by Ch. Narayana Moorthy. The script was written by [[C. V. Sridhar|C. V. Sridhar]], with music by Pandurangam. The film features [[Sivaji Ganesan|Sivaji Ganesan]] and [[Padmini|Padmini (actress)]] in the lead roles with [[Chittoor V. Nagaiah|Chittoor V. Nagaiah]], [[S. V. Sahasranamam|S. V. Sahasranamam]], [[S. Varalakshmi|S. Varalakshmi]] and Friends Ramasamy in supporting roles. The film was remade in [[Malayalam|Malayalam]] as [[Nithyakanyaka|Nithyakanyaka]] (1963), in [[Telugu|Telugu language]] as [[Ilavelpu|Ilavelpu]] (1956) and in [[Hindi|Hindi]] as [[Sharada|Sharada (1957 film)]] (1957).
title: Edhir Paradhathu

abstract: Dharamyudh is a [[1988|Bollywood films of 1988]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] film directed by Sudarshan Nag. It stars [[Sunil Dutt|Sunil Dutt]], [[Shatrughan Sinha|Shatrughan Sinha]] and [[Kimi Katkar|Kimi Katkar]] in pivotal roles. This film is a remake of Pakistani film Wadera (1985).
title: Dharamyudh

abstract: Janam Kundli ([[English|English language]]: [[Birth Chart|Birth Chart]]; [[Hindi|Hindi]]: जन्म कुण्डली) is a [[1995|Bollywood films of 1995]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[Action|Action film]] [[drama film|drama film]], produced by Ibrahim Khan and Hiralal N. Patel under the Uma Productions banner and directed by Tariq Shahand. It stars [[Jeetendra|Jeetendra]], [[Vinod Khanna|Vinod Khanna]], [[Reena Roy|Reena Roy]], [[Anu Agarwal|Anu Agarwal]] in the pivotal roles and music composed by [[Anand-Milind|Anand-Milind]].
title: Janam Kundli

abstract: Back to Stay () is a 2011 Argentine-Swiss [[comedy|comedy film]]-[[drama film|drama film]], written and directed by [[Milagros Mumenthaler|Milagros Mumenthaler]] and is her first full-length feature film. The film won the [[Golden Leopard|Golden Leopard]] at the 2011 [[Locarno International Film Festival|Locarno International Film Festival]] and the Golden Astor at the [[Mar del Plata International Film Festival|Mar del Plata International Film Festival]].
title: Back to Stay

abstract: Karz Chukana Hai is a [[1991|Bollywood films of 1991]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] film directed and produced by Vimal Kumar. It stars [[Govinda|Govinda (actor)]] and [[Juhi Chawla|Juhi Chawla]] in pivotal roles.
title: Karz Chukana Hai

abstract: Ghar Ho To Aisa is a [[1990|Bollywood films of 1990]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] drama film directed by Kalpataru and produced by Firoz Nadiadwala. It stars [[Anil Kapoor|Anil Kapoor]] and [[Meenakshi Seshadri|Meenakshi Seshadri]] in pivotal roles. The movie has since formed a [[cult|cult]] in the Indian cinema industry. The film was remade in Telugu as [[Attintlo Adde Mogudu|Attintlo Adde Mogudu]].
title: Ghar Ho To Aisa

abstract: Haathon Ki Lakeeren ([[Lines On the Palm|Palmistry#Lines]]) is a [[1986|Bollywood films of 1986]] [[India|Indian]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] film produced and directed by [[Chetan Anand|Chetan Anand (director)]]. It stars [[Sanjeev Kumar|Sanjeev Kumar]], [[Zeenat Aman|Zeenat Aman]], [[Jackie Shroff|Jackie Shroff]] Yashodhan Pandit and [[Priya Rajvansh|Priya Rajvansh]] in pivotal roles.
title: Haathon Ki Lakeeren

abstract: Julai (Vagabond) is a 2012 [[Telugu|Telugu language]] [[action film|action film]] written and directed by [[Trivikram Srinivas|Trivikram Srinivas]]. The film stars [[Allu Arjun|Allu Arjun]], [[Ileana D'Cruz|Ileana D'Cruz]] and [[Rajendra Prasad|Gadde Rajendra Prasad]] in lead roles. The film was produced by S. Radha Krishna under Haarika & Hassine Creations banner and was presented by [[DVV Danayya|DVV Danayya]]. The soundtrack was composed by [[Devi Sri Prasad|Devi Sri Prasad]]. The film was released worldwide on over 1600 screens on 9 August 2012 to positive reviews, and has garnered the [[Nandi Award for Best Popular Feature Film|Nandi Award for Best Popular Feature Film]]. The film was dubbed into [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] as Gajapokkiri and was released on 17 August 2012 and into [[Hindi|Hindi]] as Dangerous Khiladi by Goldmines Telefilms in 2013 with Allu Arjun's voice dubbed by [[Sanket Mhatre|Sanket Mhatre]]. The film was remade into Tamil titled as [[Saagasam|Saagasam]] which was a success.
title: Julai

abstract: Doodh Ka Karz is a [[1990|Bollywood films of 1990]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] film directed by Ashok Gaekwad and produced by Salim Akhtar. It is a Hindi & Marathi Film (Dudhache Upkar in Marathi). It stars [[Jackie Shroff|Jackie Shroff]] and [[Neelam Kothari|Neelam Kothari]] in pivotal roles.
title: Doodh Ka Karz

abstract: Apne Huye Paraye is a [[1964|Bollywood films of 1964]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] film produced and directed by Ajit Chakraborty. It stars [[Manoj Kumar|Manoj Kumar]] and [[Mala Sinha|Mala Sinha]] in pivotal roles.
title: Apne Huye Paraye

abstract: Saravarsham is a 1982 [[Malayalam|Malayalam]] [[drama film|drama film]] starring [[Sukumaran|Sukumaran]], [[Zarina Wahab|Zarina Wahab]], [[Mammootty|Mammootty]] and [[Sathyakala|Sathyakala]].
title: Saravarsham

abstract: Yaaran Naal Baharan ([[Punjabi|Punjabi language]]: ਯਾਰਾਂ ਨਾਲ ਬਹਾਰਾਂ) is a [[Punjabi|Punjabi language]] feature film, released in 2005. It stars [[Jimmy Sheirgill|Jimmy Sheirgill]] in the lead role with [[Juhi Babbar|Juhi Babbar]]. It was directed by Manmohan Singh. It is one of the very successful movie in Punjabi cinema.
title: Yaaran Naal Baharan

abstract: Sapnon Ka Mandir ([[English|English language]]: Temple of Dreams; [[Hindi|Hindi]]: सपनों का मन्दिर) is a [[1991|Bollywood films of 1991]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[drama film|drama film]], produced by Suresh Kumar under the Kamla Productions banner and directed by Pradip Jain. It stars [[Jeetendra|Jeetendra]], [[Jaya Prada|Jaya Prada]] in the pivotal roles and music composed by [[Laxmikant-Pyarelal|Laxmikant-Pyarelal]].
title: Sapnon Ka Mandir

abstract: Agneekaal is a [[1990|Bollywood films of 1990]] Indian [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[Political film|Political film]], produced by Ranjit Herma under the Siddharth Pictures banner, directed by [[Abbas-Mustan|Abbas-Mustan]]. It stars [[Raj Babbar|Raj Babbar]], [[Jeetendra|Jeetendra]], [[Madhavi|Madhavi (actress)]], [[Sonu Walia|Sonu Walia]] in the pivotal roles and music composed by Pankaj Bhatt. It is the debut Hindi movie for director duo [[Abbas-Mustan|Abbas-Mustan]]. They had made Gujarathi movies previously. The movie has the famous song "Pankhida o Pankhida"
title: Agneekaal

abstract: The film's narrative follows siblings Janki and Lalita who both fall for Ram, their good friend. When Lalita learns that Janki loves Ram, she steps back and allows her sister to marry him. It was a direct remake of Raghavendra Rao's Telugu blockbuster [[Devatha|Devatha (1982 film)]] (1982), with Sridevi and Jaya Prada reprising their roles. At the [[32nd Filmfare Awards|32nd Filmfare Awards]], Tohfa received three nominations: [[Best Comic Actor|Filmfare Award for Best Performance in a Comic Role]] (Kapoor), [[Best Music|Filmfare Award for Best Music Director]] and [[Best Lyrics|Filmfare Award for Best Lyricist]] "Pyaar Ka Tohfa Tera.".
title: Tohfa

abstract: Dukhless () sometimes referred to as Soulless, is a 2012 Russian [[black comedy|black comedy]]-[[drama|Drama (genre)]] film directed by Roman Prygunov and based on the novel Soulless: Tale of an Unreal Man by [[Sergey Minaev|Sergey Minaev]]. It was selected as the opening film of the 34th Moscow International Film Festival.
title: Dukhless

abstract: [[K. Ramnoth|K. Ramnoth]], who had left [[Gemini Studios|Gemini Studios]] on 15 August 1947, worked for Narayanan & Company, for which he made the film Thai Ullam, an adaptation of the English-language novel [[East Lynne|East Lynne]] by [[Ellen Wood|Ellen Wood (author)]]. While [[R. S. Manohar|R. S. Manohar]] was cast as the male lead, [[T. S. Balaiah|T. S. Balaiah]] was considered for playing the antagonist. He however opted out of the project after demanding a salary of 75,000, which he was refused. Subsequently, he was replaced by a then struggling actor named R. Ganesh, who later became known as [[Gemini Ganesan|Gemini Ganesan]]. The film became a major breakthrough for Ganesan, who would later become a part of the "Big Three" of [[Tamil cinema|Tamil cinema]], the other two being [[Sivaji Ganesan|Sivaji Ganesan]] and [[M. G. Ramachandran|M. G. Ramachandran]].
title: Thai Ullam

abstract: Chand Sa Roshan Chehra (English: Moonlike Glowing Face) is a 2005 Indian [[Hindi language|Hindi language]] [[romance film|romance film]] directed by Shabah Shamsi and produced by Salim. It stars Samir Aftab and [[Tamannaah Bhatia|Tamannaah Bhatia]] in pivotal roles. This movie is the Bollywood debut movie for the successful actress Tamannaah Bhatia. The film received very positive reviews from critics and was praised for Tamannaah's performance. However, the film was a commercial failure.
title: Chand Sa Roshan Chehra

abstract: Looney Tunes Mouse Chronicles: The Chuck Jones Collection is a DVD and Blu-ray set featuring cartoons focusing on [[Hubie and Bertie|Hubie and Bertie]] and [[Sniffles|Sniffles]] and featuring various other mouse characters in [[Merrie Melodies|Merrie Melodies]] and [[Looney Tunes|Looney Tunes]] shorts. It was released on August 28, 2012.
title: Looney Tunes Mouse Chronicles: The Chuck Jones Collection

abstract: Curry and Pepper are two CID detectives that do not take their jobs seriously. When newspaper reporter Joey Law decides to film a documentary about daily police life, she chooses to film Curry and Pepper. As Curry and Pepper fight for Joey's affection, their friendship is seriously jeopardized. Eventually, the two reconcile and work together to take down a vicious hit man named Abalone.
title: Curry and Pepper

abstract: Tarkieb is a 2000 Indian [[crime drama|crime drama]] film directed by [[Esmayeel Shroff|Esmayeel Shroff]] and produced by [[Jay Mehta|Jay Mehta (actor)]]. It stars [[Nana Patekar|Nana Patekar]], [[Tabu|Tabu (actress)]], [[Shilpa Shetty|Shilpa Shetty]], [[Aditya Pancholi|Aditya Pancholi]], [[Milind Soman|Milind Soman]] and [[Ashutosh Rana|Ashutosh Rana]] in pivotal roles. The film was shot in [[Panchmarhi|Panchmarhi]].
title: Tarkieb

abstract: Sisila Gini Gani (Fire on Ice) is a 1992 [[Sri Lanka|Sri Lankan]], [[Sinhala|Sinhala language]] language film. It was the first film directed by [[Prasanna Vithanage|Prasanna Vithanage]]. Sisila Gini Gani had a short run in Sri Lanka. The music for the film was composed by Dr. [[Premasiri Khemadasa|Premasiri Khemadasa]]. It made a great impression on the audience.
title: Sisila Gini Gani

abstract: The Best Offer ( – entitled Deception in the UK) is a 2013 English-language Italian [[psychological thriller|psychological thriller]] written and directed by [[Giuseppe Tornatore|Giuseppe Tornatore]]. The film stars [[Geoffrey Rush|Geoffrey Rush]], [[Jim Sturgess|Jim Sturgess]], [[Sylvia Hoeks|Sylvia Hoeks]], and [[Donald Sutherland|Donald Sutherland]], and the music score is composed by [[Ennio Morricone|Ennio Morricone]].
title: The Best Offer

abstract: Evolution's Child is a 1999 American [[sci-fi|Science fiction film]] [[fantasy|Fantasy film]] [[drama|Drama (film and television)]] [[television film|television film]] directed by [[Jeffrey Reiner|Jeffrey Reiner]] and aired on [[USA Network|USA Network]]. Its teleplay, written by [[Walter Klenhard|Walter Klenhard]], was based on the 1995 book Toys of Glass by [[Martin Booth|Martin Booth]]. The film starred [[Ken Olin|Ken Olin]], [[Taylor Nichols|Taylor Nichols]], [[Heidi Swedberg|Heidi Swedberg]], and [[Jacob Smith|Jacob Smith (actor)]].
title: Evolution's Child

abstract: Chaarulatha (also spelled as Charulatha) is a 2012 Indian [[horror film|horror film]] made in [[Kannada|Kannada language]] and [[Tamil|Tamil language]]. The film was directed by [[Pon Kumaran|Pon Kumaran]], a former associate to [[K. Bhagyaraj|K. Bhagyaraj]] and [[K. S. Ravikumar|K. S. Ravikumar]], and features [[Priyamani|Priyamani]] in the lead role. The film was an adaptation of the Thai horror film [[Alone|Alone (2007 film)]] which itself was based on My Brothers Keeper an episode of Tale From The Crypt season 2. [[Sundar C Babu|Sundar C Babu]] composed the film's music. The film’s story is about conjoined twins. Produced by Global One Studios and distributed by [[Hansraj Saxena|W. Hansraj Saxena]]'s [[Sax Pictures|W. Hansraj Saxena#Sax Pictures]], Charulatha released on 21 September 2012 with dubbed [[Malayalam|Malayalam]] and [[Telugu|Telugu language]] versions with the same title.
title: Chaarulatha

abstract: The title of the film is a reference to the generations of older LGBT people who remain in the closet or re enter the closet out of concern for their safety or quality of life. As a result of the documentary, the term Gen Silent has increased in use as a way to refer to this group.
title: Gen Silent

abstract: Mr. Azaad is a [[1994|Bollywood films of 1994]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] film directed by [[Rama Rao Tatineni|Tatineni Rama Rao]] and produced by Vishal Nihalani. It stars [[Anil Kapoor|Anil Kapoor]] and [[Chandni|Chandni (actress)]] in pivotal roles.
title: Mr. Azaad

abstract: Jyoti Bane Jwala ([[English|English language]]: The Flame of Light; [[Hindi|Hindi]]: ज्योति बने ज्वाला) is a [[1980|Bollywood films of 1980]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[Action film|Action film]], produced by Prasan Kapoor under the Tirupati Pictures Enterprises banner and directed by [[Dasari Narayana Rao|Dasari Narayana Rao]]. It stars [[Jeetendra|Jeetendra]], [[Vinod Mehra|Vinod Mehra]], [[Waheeda Rehman|Waheeda Rehman]], [[Moushumi Chatterjee|Moushumi Chatterjee]], [[Sarika|Sarika]] in the pivotal roles and music composed by [[Laxmikant-Pyarelal|Laxmikant-Pyarelal]]. The film is a remake of the [[Telugu|Telugu language]] movie [[Katakataala Rudraiah|Katakataala Rudraiah]], starring [[Krishnam Raju|Krishnam Raju]], [[Jayasudha|Jayasudha]] in the lead roles. The film was a box office success.
title: Jyoti Bane Jwala

abstract: An employee of Lentera Merah, the campus newspaper of the [[University of Indonesia|University of Indonesia]], is found dead in the office with the number 65 written in blood by his body. In the meantime, five students compete for a position at the publication: Risa Priliyanti (Laudya Cynthia Bella), Riki (Tesadesrada Ryza), Lia (Beauty Oehmke), Muti (Auxilia Paramitha) and Yoga (Zainal Arifin).
title: Lentera Merah

abstract: After Lucia () is a 2012 Mexican [[drama film|drama film]] directed by [[Michel Franco|Michel Franco]]. The film competed in the [[Un Certain Regard|Un Certain Regard]] section at the [[2012 Cannes Film Festival|2012 Cannes Film Festival]] where it won the top prize. The film was also selected as the Mexican entry for the [[Best Foreign Language Oscar|Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film]] at the [[85th Academy Awards|85th Academy Awards]], but it did not make the final shortlist. The style of the film has been described as being influenced by Austrian director [[Michael Haneke|Michael Haneke]].
title: After Lucia

abstract: Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters (also known as Percy Jackson & the Olympians: The Sea of Monsters and Percy Jackson and the Sea of Monsters) is a 2013 American [[fantasy|Fantasy film]] [[adventure film|adventure film]] directed by [[Thor Freudenthal|Thor Freudenthal]]. It is the second installment in the [[Percy Jackson film series|Percy Jackson (film series)]] and is based on the 2006 novel [[The Sea of Monsters|The Sea of Monsters]] by [[Rick Riordan|Rick Riordan]]. It is a sequel to the 2010 film [[Percy Jackson & the Olympians: The Lightning Thief|Percy Jackson & the Olympians: The Lightning Thief]].
title: Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters

abstract: Fariyaad (The Complaint) is a [[1942|List of Bollywood films of 1942]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] film directed by [[Jayant Desai|Jayant Desai]] and starring Shamim, Mubarak, Ishwarlal, Rama Shukul and Nurjahan. The film was made for producer [[Chandulal Shah|Chandulal Shah]]'s [[Ranjit Studios|Ranjit Studios]].
title: Fariyaad

abstract: Punjab Bolda is a [[Punjabi|Cinema of Punjab]] film starring [[Sarbjit Cheema|Sarbjit Cheema]] and [[Anisha Dixit|Anisha Dixit]] (a.k.a. Rickshawali on YouTube).
title: Punjab Bolda

abstract: Revel Films Pvt. Ltd. is an entertainment-based film production company. It was founded in 2009 by Ashok Pandey and Pragati Pandey. As part of its agenda, the company invests in and nurtures talent, ensuring that the films they churn out are sensible and entertaining.
title: Revel Films

abstract: Paisa Yeh Paisa is a [[1985|Bollywood films of 1985]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] film directed by Sohanlal Kanwar and produced by Ashok Khanna. It stars [[Jackie Shroff|Jackie Shroff]] and [[Meenakshi Seshadri|Meenakshi Seshadri]] in pivotal roles. it was released on September 30, 1985 in India.
title: Paisa Yeh Paisa

abstract: En Rathathin Rathame (English: Oh, blood of my blood) is a Tamil-language science fiction action film. The film is the Tamil debut of actress [[Meenakshi Seshadri|Meenakshi Seshadri]]. It is a remake of the [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] film [[Mr. India|Mr. India (1987 film)]] (1987).
title: En Rathathin Rathame

abstract: 'Ozhimuri' is based on the story of the book 'Uravidangal' by veteran bilingual writer [[Jeyamohan|Jeyamohan]], which is, the matrilineal system that prevailed in the Nair community in the erstwhile southern Travancore. The advantage of the matrilineal system was that the property was enjoyed by successors of the women in the family. The women were educated and bold. They enjoyed freedom in all respects. The mother in the family was stronger than the father. But by the end of this system, in the 1940s, women lost all their powers and soon became 'slaves' in the hands of a feudal male-dominated society. The movie exposes the complexities of a period of transition from matrilineal to patrilineal.
title: Ozhimuri

abstract: Pagalil Oru Iravu (; also spelled Pakalil Oru Iravu) is a 1979 [[Tamil-language|Tamil language]] Indian film, directed by [[I. V. Sasi|I. V. Sasi]] and starring [[Vijayakumar|Vijayakumar (actor)]], [[Sridevi|Sridevi]], [[Seema|Seema (actress)]], [[Ravikumar|Ravikumar (actor)]] and [[Major Sundarrajan|Major Sundarrajan]].
title: Pagalil Oru Iravu

abstract: Zindagi Khoobsoorat Hai () is a 2002 Indian film produced by Manjeet Maan and directed by Manoj Punj. It stars Gurdas Maan, Tabu, Divya Dutta and Rajat Kapoor in lead roles.
title: Zindagi Khoobsoorat Hai

abstract: Rene is a gay man who came out of the closet at age 60. Ailing in his twilight years, he thinks it is now too late for love, even companionship, and that all there is to look forward to is Death. He has made a will, bequeathing his few possessions to his even fewer friends. Everything is packed and labeled, ready for distribution. He has even paid for a coffin, taking advantage of a funeral home's Summer Sale. Nowadays the only companion Rene has is Bwakaw, a stray dog that hangs around his house and follows him wherever he goes. As Rene waits for the day of his death, he gets the surprise of his life when it is Bwakaw who suddenly falls ill and is diagnosed with cancer. Rene is surprisingly affected, and he realizes that he values Bwakaw more than he thinks. In his struggle to get Bwakaw cured, Rene finds comfort in the most unlikely person: Sol, a tricycle driver who helps him bring Bwakaw to the vet and befriends him. Buoyed by Sol's friendship, Rene starts living. Little by little he discovers simple joys. To the surprise of his friends, he even has his hair dyed to look younger. One day, he finally decides to make a move on Sol. The revelation that Rene is gay and has feelings for him surprises and disgusts Sol. He rejects Rene and leaves in anger. In the meantime, Bwakaw's condition gets worse. Not even Rene's ancient Santo Entierro (a supposedly miraculous statue of Jesus Christ) can save Bwakaw. Bwakaw dies, and Rene's neighbors help him bury the faithful dog. But Bwakaw's death, even while it was still only imminent, has made a difference. Rene has found a new appreciation for life and what is most important. He decides to unpack the things that he has already willed to other people and make his house more habitable. He is, after all, still alive.
title: Bwakaw

abstract: It is loosely based on 2009 Bollywood film [[Do Knot Disturb|Do Knot Disturb]] which in turn was a remake of the 2006 French film [[The Valet|The Valet]] (French: La Doublure). Disco Singh was remade in [[Bengali|Bengali language]] as [[Haripad Bandwala|Haripad Bandwala]] under the banner of [[Shree Venkatesh Films|Shree Venkatesh Films]] starring [[Ankush Hazra|Ankush Hazra]] and [[Nusrat Jahan|Nusrat Jahan]] in the lead roles.
title: Disco Singh

abstract: S.I.N. Theory (abbreviation for [[Social Insurance Number|Social Insurance Number]] Theory) is a 2012 Canadian science fiction drama film about a mathematics professor creating an algorithm capable of predicting an individual's future. The film was written and directed by Richie Mitchell, and stars Jeremy Larter and Allison Dawn Doiron. S.I.N. Theory was produced on a shoestring budget and makes notable use of existing mathematical theories to affirm the concept's plausibility. The film has been screened at science fiction film festivals in Canada and the US, whereas it has been picked up for distribution by MCTV with an anticipated release Fall 2013.
title: S.I.N. Theory

abstract: Philips and the Monkey Pen is a 2013 Indian [[Malayalam|Malayalam cinema]] [[children's film|children's film]] written by [[Rojin Thomas|Rojin Thomas]] and directed by Rojin Thomas and Shanil Muhammed. The film stars [[Sanoop Santhosh|Sanoop Santhosh]], [[Jayasurya|Jayasurya]], [[Remya Nambeesan|Remya Nambeesan]], [[Vijay Babu|Vijay Babu]] and [[Joy Mathew|Joy Mathew]].
title: Philips and the Monkey Pen

abstract: Adutha Veettu Penn () is a 1960 Indian [[Tamil-language|Tamil language]] [[romantic comedy|romantic comedy]] film, directed by [[Vedantam Raghavaiah|Vedantam Raghavaiah]]. The film stars [[Anjali Devi|Anjali Devi]] (who co-produced the film with her husband, music director [[P. Adinarayana Rao|P. Adinarayana Rao]]), [[T. R. Ramachandran|T. R. Ramachandran]] and [[K. A. Thangavelu|K. A. Thangavelu]] in the lead roles. It is a remake of the [[Bengali|Bengali language]] film [[Pasher Bari|Pasher Bari]] (1952), itself based on the namesake short story by Arun Chowdhury. In Adutha Veettu Penn, a simple man wants to impress a woman he loves by singing, but since he cannot, his friend, a singer, sings in secret while the simple man merely [[lip sync|lip syncs]], and wins the woman's love. The film was released on 11 February 1960, and became a success.
title: Adutha Veettu Penn

abstract: Bhaji in Problem () is a 2013 [[India|Indian]] Punjabi-language [[comedy film|comedy film]] directed by [[Smeep Kang|Smeep Kang]], who had earlier directed films like [[Carry on Jatta|Carry on Jatta]] and [[Lucky Di Unlucky Story|Lucky Di Unlucky Story]], both of which featured [[Gippy Grewal|Gippy Grewal]] in the lead role. Grewal also appears in this film, along with an ensemble cast including [[Ragini Khanna|Ragini Khanna]], [[Gurpreet Ghuggi|Gurpreet Ghuggi]], [[B.N. Sharma|B.N. Sharma]], [[Karamjit Anmol|Karamjit Anmol]], [[Japji Khaira|Japji Khaira]], [[Khushboo Grewal|Khushboo Grewal]] and Misha Bajwa amongst others. The film is produced by Ashvini Yardi, and Bollywood actor [[Akshay Kumar|Akshay Kumar]] who also appears in the film shortly, enacting as a lookalike of himself.
title: Bhaji in Problem

abstract: When the Love Is Gone is a 2013 Filipino [[romantic|Romance film]] [[drama film|drama film]] directed by Andoy Ranay, starring [[Cristine Reyes|Cristine Reyes]], [[Gabby Concepcion|Gabby Concepcion]], [[Alice Dixson|Alice Dixson]], [[Andi Eigenmann|Andi Eigenmann]], and [[Jake Cuenca|Jake Cuenca]]. The film is distributed by [[Viva Films|Viva Films]] with co-production of Multivision Pictures and was released November 27, 2013 nationwide as part of Viva Films' 32nd anniversary.
title: When the Love Is Gone

abstract: El Americano: The Movie (also known as Americano) is a 2016 [[3D|3D film]] [[Mexican|Mexico]]-[[American|United States]] [[animated|animated film]] [[family film|family film]] produced by [[Animex Producciones|Animex Producciones]], [[Olmos Productions|Edward James Olmos]], and [[Phil Roman Entertainment|Phil Roman Entertainment]], and is directed by Ricardo Arnaiz and ex-[[Disney|Disney]] animator, Mike Kunkel. The film features an [[ensemble voice cast|ensemble cast]] of mostly [[Hispanic American|Hispanic and Latino Americans]] and [[Mexican|Mexican people]] actors led by [[Rico Rodriguez|Rico Rodriguez (actor)]], [[Edward James Olmos|Edward James Olmos]], [[Cheech Marin|Cheech Marin]], [[Kate del Castillo|Kate del Castillo]], [[Paul Rodriguez|Paul Rodriguez (actor)]], [[Gabriel Iglesias|Gabriel Iglesias]], [[Erik Estrada|Erik Estrada]], and [[Lisa Kudrow|Lisa Kudrow]].
title: El Americano: The Movie

abstract: Mard Ki Zabaan is a [[1987|Bollywood films of 1987]] Bollywood film starring [[Dharmendra|Dharmendra]], [[Jackie Shroff|Jackie Shroff]], [[Poonam Dhillon|Poonam Dhillon]] and [[Kimi Katkar|Kimi Katkar]]. The film was a remake of the Telugu film [[Yuga Purushudu|Yuga Purushudu]].
title: Mard Ki Zabaan

abstract: Kasam Suhaag Ki is a 1989 Bollywood film directed by Mohan Segal and starring [[Dharmendra|Dharmendra]] and [[Rekha|Rekha]].
title: Kasam Suhaag Ki

abstract: Himmatvar is a [[1996|Bollywood films of 1996]] Bollywood film directed by Talat Jani, starring [[Dharmendra|Dharmendra]], Hitesh and Rubaina Khan.
title: Himmatvar

abstract: Dharma Karma ([[English|English language]]: Piety - Act; [[Hindi|Hindi]]: धर्म कार्म) is a 1997 [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[Action film|Action film]], produced by Gyanchand Chauhan & Shamjee B. Patel on Prince Pictures banner and directed by Ravi Varma. Starring [[Dharmendra|Dharmendra]], [[Jeetendra|Jeetendra]], [[Rahul Roy|Rahul Roy]], Rohit Kumar, [[Upasana Singh|Upasana Singh]], [[Eva Grover|Eva Grover]], Trishna, in the lead roles and music composed by [[Bappi Lahiri|Bappi Lahiri]].
title: Dharma Karma

abstract: Jetuka Pator Dore won the [[Best Feature Film in Assamese|National Film Award for Best Feature Film in Assamese]] award in the [[58th National Film Awards|58th National Film Awards]] for 2010.
title: Jetuka Pator Dore

abstract: Wreck-It Ralph premiered at the [[El Capitan Theatre|El Capitan Theatre]] on October 29, 2012, and went into general release on November 2. The film was a critical and commercial success, grossing $471 million worldwide against a $165 million budget and winning the [[Annie Award for Best Animated Feature|Annie Award for Best Animated Feature]], as well as receiving nominations for the [[Golden Globe|Golden Globe Award for Best Animated Feature Film]] and [[Academy Award for Best Animated Feature|Academy Award for Best Animated Feature]]. The film was released on [[Blu-ray|Blu-ray]] and [[DVD|DVD]] on March 5, 2013.
title: Wreck-It Ralph

abstract: Karyam Nissaram () is a [[1983|Malayalam films of 1983]] Family Drama [[Malayalam film|Malayalam film]] written, and directed by [[Balachandra Menon|Balachandra Menon]], starring [[Balachandra Menon|Balachandra Menon]] and [[Prem Nazir|Prem Nazir]] along with [[Lakshmi|Lakshmi (actress)]], [[Poornima Jayaram|Poornima Jayaram]], [[Sukumari|Sukumari]], [[Jalaja|Jalaja]], [[Lalu Alex|Lalu Alex]], Baiju and K P Ummer. The music is composed by [[Johnson|Johnson]]. It gives us a glimpse into a Malayali family during the period when their children marry off. It is mainly focussing on marriage and the fact the problems in marriage are caused by simple matters which individuals due to their ego and other problems make into huge problems. All family problems can be overcome.The film was a blockbuster of 1983. The film had musical score by [[Kannur Rajan|Kannur Rajan]].
title: Karyam Nissaram

abstract: 'Merika is a 1984 drama film directed by [[Gil Portes|Gil Portes]] and starred by [[Nora Aunor|Nora Aunor]] and [[Bembol Roco|Bembol Roco]]. Aunor portrayed the role Mila, an [[Overseas Filipino Worker|Overseas Filipino Worker]] (OFW) who works as a [[nurse|nurse]] in America. Mila is in effect living The American Dream, or at least the Filipino's idea of the American Dream On the contrary, Mila was struggling to fight loneliness and homesickness in the foreign land. The film also tackles the story of [[Filipino|Philippines]] [[illegal aliens|alien (law)]] who will do anything just to get a Green card.
title: 'Merika

abstract: Insaaf: The Justice is a [[2004|List of Bollywood films of 2004]] Hindi [[Drama|Drama]] film directed by Shrey Shrivastav and produced by Mohammed Fasih.The film features Dino Morea,Sanjay Suri and Namrata Shirodkar as main characters and Rajpal Yadav in a supporting role.
title: Insaaf: The Justice

abstract: Neram () is a 2013 Indian bilingual [[black comedy|black comedy]]-[[thriller|thriller (genre)]] film, written, directed and edited by [[Alphonse Puthren|Alphonse Puthren]] in his directorial debut. Simultaneously made in [[Malayalam|Malayalam]] and [[Tamil|Tamil language]] languages, it stars [[Nivin Pauly|Nivin Pauly]], [[Nazriya Nazim|Nazriya Nazim]] and [[Bobby Simha|Bobby Simha]] in both versions. Supporting roles were played by [[Manoj K. Jayan|Manoj K. Jayan]], [[Shammi Thilakan|Shammi Thilakan]], and [[Lalu Alex|Lalu Alex]] in Malayalam and [[Nassar|Nassar]], [[Thambi Ramiah|Thambi Ramiah]], [[John Vijay|John Vijay]] and [[Shabareesh Varma|Shabareesh Varma]] portrayed the characters in Tamil. The whole film is set within one day in [[Chennai|Chennai]]. The music was scored by debutant [[Rajesh Murugesan|Rajesh Murugesan]]. The Malayalam version released on 10 May 2013, while the Tamil version released on 17 May. The film's both versions received positive reviews upon release and was a commercial success at the box-office.
title: Neram

abstract: The earlier title of this film Radhikan Ganda kicked up a row for some time because of the name Radhika. The title had an uncanny reference towards former chief minister of Karnataka [[H. D. Kumaraswamy|H. D. Kumaraswamy]] who had a secret relationship with former actress [[Radhika Kumaraswamy|Radhika Kumaraswamy]]. Radhika had objected to the title name during its production. However, the makers have denied any relation between the film and the private life of the former chief minister. But due to the continuous objections raised, the director decided to rename the title as "Radhan Ganda".
title: Radhan Ganda

abstract: Hadh: Life on the Edge of Death is a 2001 [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] film directed by [[Thampi Kannanthanam|Thampi Kannanthanam]] in his Bollywood debut and produced by Sandeep D. Shinde. It stars [[Jackie Shroff|Jackie Shroff]], [[Sharad Kapoor|Sharad Kapoor]], [[Ayesha Jhulka|Ayesha Jhulka]] and [[Suman Ranganathan|Suman Ranganathan]] in pivotal roles.
title: Hadh: Life on the Edge of Death

abstract: Kaun Jeeta Kaun Haara () is a [[1987|List of Bollywood films of 1987]] Hindi [[drama film|Drama (film and television)]] directed and produced by Rakesh Kumar. The film features Aruna Irani, Kishore Kumar and Amrish Puri as main characters.
title: Kaun Jeeta Kaun Haara

abstract: Lone Survivor is a 2013 American [[biographical|biographical film]] [[war|war film]] [[drama film|drama film]] based on the [[eponymous 2007 non-fiction book|Lone Survivor (book)]] by [[Marcus Luttrell|Marcus Luttrell]] with [[Patrick Robinson|Patrick Robinson (author)]]. Set during the [[war in Afghanistan|War in Afghanistan (2001–present)]], it dramatizes the unsuccessful [[United States Navy SEALs|United States Navy SEALs]] [[counter-insurgent|counter-insurgency]] mission [[Operation Red Wings|Operation Red Wings]], during which a four-man SEAL [[reconnaissance|reconnaissance]] and surveillance team was tasked to track down the [[Taliban|Taliban]] leader [[Ahmad Shah|Ahmad Shah (Taliban)]]. Written and directed by [[Peter Berg|Peter Berg]], the film stars [[Mark Wahlberg|Mark Wahlberg]], [[Taylor Kitsch|Taylor Kitsch]], [[Emile Hirsch|Emile Hirsch]], [[Ben Foster|Ben Foster]], and [[Eric Bana|Eric Bana]].
title: Lone Survivor

abstract: Million Dollar Arm is a 2014 American [[biographical|Biographical film]] [[sports|Sports film]] [[drama film|drama film]] directed by [[Craig Gillespie|Craig Gillespie]] and produced by [[Walt Disney Pictures|Walt Disney Pictures]] from a screenplay written by [[Thomas McCarthy|Tom McCarthy (director)]]. The film is based on the true story of baseball pitchers [[Rinku Singh|Rinku Singh]] and [[Dinesh Patel|Dinesh Patel]] who were discovered by sports agent [[J. B. Bernstein|J. B. Bernstein]] after winning a reality show competition.
title: Million Dollar Arm

abstract: The film was selected to compete for the [[Palme d'Or|Palme d'Or]] in the main competition section at the [[2014 Cannes Film Festival|2014 Cannes Film Festival]] and received a North American [[limited release|limited release]] on November 14, 2014 by [[Roadside Attractions|Roadside Attractions]]. The Homesman has received mostly positive reviews from critics. [[Rotten Tomatoes|Rotten Tomatoes]] gave the film a rating average of 7.1/10.
title: The Homesman

abstract: Paappi Devataa ([[English|English language]]: Sinners - Goddess; [[Hindi|Hindi]]: पापी देवता) is a [[1995|Bollywood films of 1995]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[Action film|Action film]], produced by M. M. Malhotra and Baldev Pushkarna under the R. K. Duggal Studios Productions banner and directed by Harmesh Malhotra. It stars [[Dharmendra|Dharmendra]], [[Jeetendra|Jeetendra]], [[Jayapradha|Jayapradha]], [[Madhuri Dixit|Madhuri Dixit]] in the pivotal roles and music composed by [[Laxmikant Pyarelal|Laxmikant Pyarelal]].
title: Paappi Devataa

abstract: Darling, Darling, Darling is a 1982 Tamil film, written and directed by [[K. Bhagyaraj|K. Bhagyaraj]]. The film was remade in Kannada as Premi No. 1, with Ramesh and Prema.
title: Darling, Darling, Darling

abstract: Vidiyum Varai Kaathiru is a 1981 Tamil thriller film, written and directed by [[K. Bhagyaraj|K. Bhagyaraj]]. The movie is thematically similar to the 1971 movie [[A New Leaf|A New Leaf (film)]]. The movie received positive reviews during the release.
title: Vidiyum Varai Kaathiru

abstract: Oru Kai Osai is a Tamil film, written and directed by [[K. Bhagyaraj|K. Bhagyaraj]]. This is Bhagyaraj's second film as a director. This film created an impact and was well received by the audience for its unique characterization and unexpected climax.
title: Oru Kai Osai

abstract: Bhanwara is an Indian [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] film. It was the third highest grossing Indian film of 1944. It was released in [[1944|Bollywood films of 1944]]. The film was directed by [[Kidar Sharma|Kidar Sharma]] for [[Ranjit Movietone|Ranjit Studios]]. It starred [[K. L. Saigal|K. L. Saigal]], [[Arun|Arun Kumar Ahuja]], Kamala Chatterjee, [[Monica Desai|Monica Desai]], Lala Yakub and Brijmala.
title: Bhanwara

abstract: Phoolwari (The Bower) is a [[1946|Bollywood films of 1946]] Indian [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] film. It was the third highest grossing Indian film of 1946. The film was directed by [[Chaturbhuj Doshi|Chaturbhuj Doshi]] for [[Ranjit Studios|Ranjit Studios]] and is cited as one of the important films of actor [[Motilal|Motilal (actor)]]. Music was composed by [[Hansraj Behl|Hansraj Behl]], while the lyricist was Pandit Indra. Motilal's co-stars in the film were [[Khursheed|Khursheed Bano]], [[Madhubala|Madhubala]], Dixit, Nazira and Tiwari.
title: Phoolwari

abstract: Chilambu is a 1986 Malayalam film. Directed by [[Bharathan|Bharathan]], this film is about the revenge by a young man against his uncle who grabbed his family properties by expelling his mother and grandfather from the house. [[Rahman|Rahman (actor)]], [[Thilakan|Thilakan]], [[Shobhana|Shobhana]], [[Nedumudi Venu|Nedumudi Venu]], [[Ashokan|Ashokan (actor)]], [[Santhakumari|Santhakumari (Malayalam actress)]] and [[Babu Antony|Babu Antony]] appeared in leading roles. The script was written by Bharathan himself, based on a novel by N.T Balachandran by the same title.
title: Chilambu

abstract: Chinna Thambi Periya Thambi (),() is a 1987 Tamil Romantic Comedy film, directed by [[Manivannan|Manivannan]]. The film casts [[Sathyaraj|Sathyaraj]] and [[Prabhu Ganesan|Prabhu Ganesan]] in lead roles, along with [[Nadia|Nadia Moidu]]. The film was a box office blockbuster and completed a 100-day run at all centres. The film was remade in Telugu as [[Chinnodu Peddodu|Chinnodu Peddodu]].
title: Chinna Thambi Periya Thambi

abstract: Indru Pol Endrum Vaazhga (, ), is a 1977 [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Tamil|Tamil cinema]] movie, directed by [[K. Shankar|K. Shankar]], starring [[M. G. Ramachandran|M. G. Ramachandran]] in the lead role, with [[Radha Saluja|Radha Saluja]], [[Pandari Bai|Pandari Bai]], [[M. N. Nambiar|M. N. Nambiar]], [[Vijayakumar|Vijayakumar (actor)]] and [[Vennira Aadai Nirmala|Vennira Aadai Nirmala]] enacting supporting roles.
title: Indru Pol Endrum Vaazhga

abstract: Naan Yen Pirandhen () is a 1972 Indian [[Tamil language|Tamil language]] film directed by [[M. Krishnan|M. Krishnan Nair (director)]], starring [[M. G. Ramachandran|M. G. Ramachandran]] in the lead role, with [[K. R. Vijaya|K. R. Vijaya]], [[Kanchana|Kanchana (actress)]], [[M. N. Nambiar|M. N. Nambiar]], [[Nagesh|Nagesh]] and [[Major Sundarrajan|Major Sundarrajan]]. It is a remake of the Telugu film [[Bratuku Teruvu|Bratuku Teruvu]].
title: Naan Yen Pirandhen

abstract: Ragasiya Police 115 (), is a 1968 [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Tamil|Tamil cinema]] film, directed by [[B. R. Panthulu|B. R. Panthulu]], starring [[M. G. Ramachandran|M. G. Ramachandran]] in the lead role, with [[Jayalalithaa|Jayalalithaa]], [[M. N. Nambiar|M. N. Nambiar]], [[S. A. Ashokan|S. A. Ashokan]] and [[Nagesh|Nagesh]] among others, enacting supporting roles. There was grand opening and record collection within 10 days and the film ran more than 100 days in Trichy.
title: Ragasiya Police 115

abstract: Ajeyo () is a [[2014|List of Assamese films of 2014]] [[Assamese|Cinema of Assam]] [[language|Assamese language]] [[drama film|drama film]] directed by [[Jahnu Barua|Jahnu Barua]]; based on the [[Sahitya Akademi Award|Sahitya Akademi Award]] [[winner|List of Sahitya Akademi Award winners for Assamese]] 1997 Assamese novel Ashirbador Rong written by [[Arun Sharma|Arun Sharma (dramatist)]] and adapted as screenplay by the director himself. It was produced by Shankar Lall Goenka and stars Rupam Chetia and [[Jupitora Bhuyan|Jupitora Bhuyan]] in the lead roles. The film was released on 3 January 2014.
title: Ajeyo

abstract: Baa Baaro Rasika (; ) is a 2004 Indian Kannada-language romantic film starring [[Sunil Raoh|Sunil Raoh]], [[Ramya Krishna|Ramya Krishna]] and Ashitha in the lead roles. The film is directed by [[Dayal Padmanabhan|Dayal Padmanabhan]] and produced by Prasad Reddy and Sayendra Reddy for Shanti Shree creations banner. The film features a soundtrack by Mahesh.
title: Baa Baaro Rasika

abstract: Kalavida (; ) is a 1997 Kannada film produced, written, directed and enacted by [[V. Ravichandran|V. Ravichandran]]. The rest of the cast includes [[Heera Rajagopal|Heera Rajagopal]], [[Roja|Roja Selvamani]], [[Umashree|Umashree]], [[Raghuvaran|Raghuvaran]] amongst others.
title: Kalavida

abstract: Aalay Pathu Malai Mathu is a [[1990|1990 in film]] [[Tamil|Tamil language]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[feature film|feature film]], written and [[directed|Film director]] by M. Venkat Vasu and produced by A. K. Kuppu Raj. It stars [[Nizhalgal Ravi|Nizhalgal Ravi]], [[Chandrasekhar|Chandrasekhar (Tamil actor)]], [[Madhuri|Madhuri (Tamil actress)]] and [[Radha Ravi|Radha Ravi]] in the lead roles.
title: Aalay Pathu Malai Mathu

abstract: Ab Ayega Mazaa () is a [[1984|1984 in film]] [[Hindi|Bollywood]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[feature film|feature film]] [[directed|Film director]] by [[Pankaj Parashar|Pankaj Parashar]] and produced by actors [[Alok Nath|Alok Nath]] and Girija Shankar. It stars [[Farooq Sheikh|Farooq Sheikh]] and [[Anita Raj|Anita Raj]] in the lead roles. This film introduced [[Anand-Milind|Anand-Milind]] who went on to make it big after the film [[Qayamat Se Qayamat Tak|Qayamat Se Qayamat Tak]].
title: Ab Ayega Mazaa

abstract: Anbu Kattalai (English: Kind Condition) is a [[1989|1989 in film]] [[Tamil-language|Cinema of Tamil Nadu]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[feature film|feature film]] [[directed|Film director]] by [[Yaar Kannan|Yaar Kannan]], starring [[Ramarajan|Ramarajan]], [[Pallavi|Pallavi (actress)]] and [[K. R. Vijaya|K. R. Vijaya]].
title: Anbu Kattalai

abstract: Poomadhathe Pennu is a [[1984|Malayalam films of 1984]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed by [[Hariharan|Hariharan (director)]] and produced by GP Vijayakumar. The film stars [[Prem Nazir|Prem Nazir]], [[Unnimary|Unnimary]], [[K. P. Ummer|K. P. Ummer]] and [[MG Soman|MG Soman]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[G. Devarajan|G. Devarajan]].
title: Poomadhathe Pennu

abstract: Raju Uncle is a 2005 [[Bengali film|Cinema of West Bengal]] directed by [[Haranath Chakraborty|Haranath Chakraborty]] and produced by Pijush Saha The film features actors [[Prosenjit Chatterjee|Prosenjit Chatterjee]] and [[Sayantani Ghosh|Sayantani Ghosh]] in the lead roles. Music of the film has been coposed by [[Ashok Raj|Ashok Raj]].
title: Raju Uncle

abstract: Difret is a 2014 Ethiopian [[drama film|drama film]] written and directed by [[Zeresenay Berhane Mehari|Zeresenay Berhane Mehari]]. The film had its premiere in-competition at the [[2014 Sundance Film Festival|2014 Sundance Film Festival]] where it won the World Cinematic Dramatic Audience Award. [[Angelina Jolie|Angelina Jolie]] served as the executive producer of the film.
title: Difret

abstract: The Babadook was initially not a strong commercial success in Australia and was given a limited release in [[art house|Art film]] theatres. However, largely after its strong reception at the [[2014 Sundance Film Festival|2014 Sundance Film Festival]], the film generated more attention in the United States and Europe, garnering very positive reviews and grossing $7.5 million against a $2 million budget.
title: The Babadook

abstract: Aasheervaadam is a [[1977|Malayalam films of 1977]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed by [[I. V. Sasi|I. V. Sasi]] and produced by Thayyil Kunjikandan. The film stars [[Sheela|Sheela]], [[Kamalahasan|Kamalahasan]], [[Sridevi|Sridevi]] and [[Bahadoor|Bahadoor]] in the lead roles. The film has musical score by [[M. K. Arjunan|M. K. Arjunan]].
title: Aasheervaadam

abstract: Ashtamangalyam is a [[1977|Malayalam films of 1977]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed by P. Gopikumar and produced by K. H. Khan Sahib. The film stars [[Kamalahasan|Kamalahasan]], [[Kanakadurga|Kanakadurga]], [[Mallika Sukumaran|Mallika Sukumaran]], [[P. K. Abraham|P. K. Abraham]] and [[Padmapriya|Padmapriya (actress)]] in the lead roles. The film has musical score by [[M. K. Arjunan|M. K. Arjunan]].
title: Ashtamangalyam

abstract: Doctor Krishna is a 1989 [[India|Indian]] [[Kannada|Cinema of Karnataka]] [[drama film|drama film]] directed and written by [[Phani Ramachandra|Phani Ramachandra]]. The film starred [[Vishnuvardhan|Vishnuvardhan (actor)]] in the title role along with [[Suman Ranganathan|Suman Ranganathan]] and [[Tara|Tara (Kannada actress)]] in leading roles. The music of the film was composed by [[Rajan-Nagendra|Rajan-Nagendra]].
title: Doctor Krishna

abstract: Vikramadithyan is a 2014 Malayalam [[comedy-drama|comedy-drama]] film co-produced and directed by [[Lal Jose|Lal Jose]]. The film stars [[Dulquer Salmaan|Dulquer Salmaan]], [[Unni Mukundan|Unni Mukundan]] and [[Namitha Pramod|Namitha Pramod]] in the lead roles, along with an extended cameo appearance of [[Nivin Pauly|Nivin Pauly]]. The screenplay is by Iqbal Kuttippuram, while [[Jomon T. John|Jomon T. John]] handles the cinematography. The music is composed by Bijibal. The film was released on 25 July 2014 and was a commercial success .
title: Vikramadithyan

abstract: The film narrates 6-years long struggle of townspeople of [[Marmato, Caldas|Marmato, Caldas]] with Canadian mining company that wants the $20 billion in gold beneath their homes.
title: Marmato

abstract: O Premave () is a 1999 Indian [[Kannada language|Kannada language]] romance-drama musical film directed by [[Naganna|Naganna]]. The film stars [[V. Ravichandran|V. Ravichandran]] along with [[Rambha|Rambha (actress)]], [[Doddanna|Doddanna]] and [[Srinivasa Murthy|Srinivasa Murthy]] in prominent roles. Telugu actor [[Srihari|Srihari]] made his debut in Kannada cinema with this film.
title: O Premave

abstract: Ocho apellidos vascos (), known as Spanish Affair in English, is a 2014 Spanish [[comedy|comedy]] film directed by [[Emilio Martínez-Lázaro|Emilio Martínez-Lázaro]]. It premiered in Spain on 14 March 2014. Six weeks after its release, it became the second biggest box office hit ever in Spain, behind [[Avatar|Avatar (2009 film)]].
title: Ocho apellidos vascos

abstract: Ondagona Baa () is a 2003 Indian [[Kannada language|Kannada language]] romance-drama musical film directed by [[Udayasankar|Director Udayasankar]] and produced by [[Rockline Venkatesh|Rockline Venkatesh]]. The film stars [[V. Ravichandran|V. Ravichandran]] and [[Shilpa Shetty|Shilpa Shetty]] in the lead roles. Yester-year veteran actors [[J. V. Somayajulu|J. V. Somayajulu]] and [[K. R. Vijaya|K. R. Vijaya]] too feature in prominent roles. The film is a remake of [[Telugu|Telugu language]] blockbuster film [[Kalisundam Raa|Kalisundam Raa]] (2000) starring [[Venkatesh|Venkatesh (actor)]] and [[Simran|Simran]] in the lead roles. The film also marked the reunion of actor Ravichandran with music composer [[Hamsalekha|Hamsalekha]] who had parted ways due to some differences for many years.
title: Ondagona Baa

abstract: Maduve Maduve Maduve (Kannada: ಮದುವೆ ಮದುವೆ ಮದುವೆ) is a [[1969|Kannada films of 1969]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Kannada|Kannada language]] film, directed by [[Geethapriya|Geethapriya]] and produced by Boraiah and Sharadamma Vasanna. The film stars [[Udaykumar|Udaykumar]], [[Jayanthi|Jayanthi (actress)]], B M Venkatesh and Poornima in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[Chellapilla Satyam|Chellapilla Satyam]].
title: Maduve Maduve Maduve

abstract: Jeevana Jokali (Kannada: ಜೀವನ ಜೋಕಾಲಿ) is a [[1972|Kannada films of 1972]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Kannada|Kannada language]] film, directed by [[Geethapriya|Geethapriya]]. The film stars [[Gangadhar|Gangadhar (Kannada actor)]], [[Bharathi|Bharathi Vishnuvardhan]], Suma and [[T. N. Balakrishna|T. N. Balakrishna]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[Vijaya Bhaskar|Vijaya Bhaskar]].
title: Jeevana Jokali

abstract: Malli Maduve (Kannada: ಮಲ್ಲಿ ಮದುವೆ) is a [[1963|Kannada films of 1963]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Kannada|Kannada language]] film, directed by G. R. Nathan. The film stars [[Rajkumar|Rajkumar (actor)]], [[Udaykumar|Udaykumar]], Rajashankar and [[K. S. Ashwath|K. S. Ashwath]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[G. K. Venkatesh|G. K. Venkatesh]]. The film was a remake of Tamil film [[Velaikaari|Velaikaari]] (1949).
title: Malli Maduve

abstract: Maagiya Kanasu (Kannada: ಮಾಗಿಯ ಕನಸು) is a [[1977|Kannada films of 1977]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Kannada|Kannada language]] film, directed by [[K. S. L. Swamy|K. S. L. Swamy]] and produced by K A Gopal and Lakshman. The film stars [[Srinath|Srinath]], [[Aarathi|Aarathi]], S Shivaram and Chandrashekhar in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[Vijaya Bhaskar|Vijaya Bhaskar]].
title: Maagiya Kanasu

abstract: Thayi Karulu (Kannada: ತಾಯಿ ಕರುಳು) is a [[1962|Kannada films of 1962]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Kannada|Kannada language]] film, directed and produced by [[G V Iyer|G V Iyer]]. The film stars [[Kalyan Kumar|Kalyan Kumar]], [[Udaykumar|Udaykumar]] and [[M. V. Rajamma|M. V. Rajamma]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[G. K. Venkatesh|G. K. Venkatesh]].
title: Thayi Karulu

abstract: Maduve Madi Nodu (Kannada: ಮದುವೆ ಮಾಡಿ ನೋಡು) is a [[1965|Kannada films of 1965]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Kannada|Kannada language]] film, directed by [[Hunsur Krishnamurthy|Hunsur Krishnamurthy]] and produced by Nagi Reddy and Chakrapani. The film stars [[Rajkumar|Rajkumar (actor)]], [[R. Nagendra Rao|R. Nagendra Rao]], [[Udaykumar|Udaykumar]] and [[Narasimharaju|Narasimharaju (Kannada actor)]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by Ghantasala. It is a remake of the Telugu film [[Pelli Chesi Choodu|Pelli Chesi Choodu]] (1952).
title: Maduve Madi Nodu

abstract: Kanne Pappa (Tamil: கண்ணே பாப்பா) is a [[1969|Tamil films of 1969]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Tamil|Tamil language]] film, directed by [[P. Madhavan|P. Madhavan]]. The film stars [[K. R. Vijaya|K. R. Vijaya]], [[R. Muthuraman|R. Muthuraman]], Baby Rani and [[J. P. Chandrababu|J. P. Chandrababu]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[M. S. Viswanathan|M. S. Viswanathan]].
title: Kanne Pappa

abstract: Shakuntala Aru Sankar Joseph Ali () is a 1984 [[Assamese language|Assamese language]] film directed by Nip Barua. The country this film derived from was from India. Some of the actors that have roles within this film include:
title: Shakuntala Aru Sankar Joseph Ali

abstract: Macadam Stories () is a 2015 French [[comedy-drama film|comedy-drama film]] written and directed by [[Samuel Benchetrit|Samuel Benchetrit]], and based on the first volume of Benchetrit's autobiography Les Chroniques de l'Asphalte. The film was selected to be screened in the Special Screenings section at the [[2015 Cannes Film Festival|2015 Cannes Film Festival]].
title: Macadam Stories

abstract: Krisha is a 2015 American [[drama film|drama film]] written and directed by [[Trey Edward Shults|Trey Edward Shults]] in his feature-length [[directorial debut|List of directorial debuts]], starring his real-life aunt [[Krisha Fairchild|Krisha Fairchild]], and is the feature-length adaption of the 2014 short film Krisha also directed by Shults.
title: Krisha

abstract: In the Shadow of Women () is a 2015 French-Swiss [[drama film|drama film]] directed by [[Philippe Garrel|Philippe Garrel]], starring [[Clotilde Courau|Clotilde Courau]], [[Stanislas Merhar|Stanislas Merhar]], and Lena Paugam. It was selected to open the [[Directors' Fortnight|Directors' Fortnight]] section at the [[2015 Cannes Film Festival|2015 Cannes Film Festival]]. It is the second installment in Garrel's trilogy of love, the first being [[Jealousy|Jealousy (2013 film)]] (2013) and the third being [[Lover for a Day|Lover for a Day]] (2017).
title: In the Shadow of Women

abstract: L'Astragale is a 2015 French [[drama film|drama film]] directed by [[Brigitte Sy|Brigitte Sy]]. It is the second film adaptation of the 1965 [[semi-autobiographical novel|Autobiographical novel]] L'Astragale by [[Albertine Sarrazin|Albertine Sarrazin]], after Guy Casaril's L'Astragale (1968).
title: L'Astragale

abstract: Deadpool 2 is a 2018 American [[superhero film|superhero film]] based on the [[Marvel Comics|Marvel Comics]] character [[Deadpool|Deadpool]], distributed by [[20th Century Fox|20th Century Fox]]. It is the eleventh installment in the [[X-Men film series|X-Men (film series)]], and a direct sequel to the 2016 film [[Deadpool|Deadpool (film)]]. The film is directed by [[David Leitch|David Leitch (director)]] from a script by [[Rhett Reese|Rhett Reese]], [[Paul Wernick|Paul Wernick]], and [[Ryan Reynolds|Ryan Reynolds]]. Reynolds stars in the title role alongside [[Josh Brolin|Josh Brolin]], [[Morena Baccarin|Morena Baccarin]], [[Julian Dennison|Julian Dennison]], [[Zazie Beetz|Zazie Beetz]], [[T.J. Miller|T.J. Miller]], [[Brianna Hildebrand|Brianna Hildebrand]], and [[Jack Kesy|Jack Kesy]]. In the film, Deadpool forms the [[X-Force|X-Force]] to protect a young mutant from the time-traveling soldier [[Cable|Cable (comics)]].
title: Deadpool 2

abstract: Le Sucre (or The Sugar) is a 1978 French [[crime drama|crime drama]] thriller film directed by [[Jacques Rouffio|Jacques Rouffio]].
title: Le Sucre

abstract: Ammayilu Abbayilu is the second film of Ravi Babu where he tries to build on the success of his first rom-com and gives his second film a larger scope and setting.
title: Ammayilu Abbayilu

abstract: Mudhalali () is [[Muktha Srinivasan|Muktha Srinivasan]]'s 1957 Tamil directorial debut. This [[drama film|Drama (modern genre)]] was produced by M. A. Venu under M. A. V. Pictures. The movie stars [[S. S. Rajendran|S. S. Rajendran]] and debutante [[Devika|Devika]] in the lead roles, while [[M. N. Rajam|M. N. Rajam]], A. Kannaiyan and [[T. P. Muthulakshmi|T. P. Muthulakshmi]] play in supporting roles. The film's soundtrack and background score were composed by [[K. V. Mahadevan|K. V. Mahadevan]], while the lyrics for the songs were written by Ka. Mu. Sheriff.
title: Mudhalali
