abstract: 21 Nights with Pattie (original title: 21 nuits avec Pattie) is a 2015 French [[comedy-drama film|comedy-drama film]] written and directed by [[Arnaud|Arnaud Larrieu]] and [[Jean-Marie Larrieu|Jean-Marie Larrieu]].
title: 21 Nights with Pattie

abstract: Hum Naujawan is a [[1985|Bollywood films of 1985]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[drama film|drama film]] directed by [[Dev Anand|Dev Anand]]. He himself played the central character in the film dedicated to young students. It marked the debut of [[Richa Sharma|Richa Sharma (actress)]], [[Tabu|Tabu (actress)]], Bunty Behl and Atlee Brar with [[Anupam Kher|Anupam Kher]] and [[Shriram Lagoo|Shriram Lagoo]], among others, playing lead roles. The music was composed by [[R. D. Burman|R. D. Burman]].
title: Hum Naujawan

abstract: Manamagal (The Bride) is a 1951 Indian [[Tamil|Tamil language]] [[drama film|drama film]], directed and produced by [[N. S. Krishnan|N. S. Krishnan]]. The film stars [[Padmini|Padmini (actress)]], [[Lalitha|Lalitha (actress)]], [[S. V. Sahasranamam|S. V. Sahasranamam]] and [[T. S. Balaiah|T. S. Balaiah]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[C. R. Subbaraman|C. R. Subbaraman]]. This film was based on a popular Malayalam play Suprabha by playwright Munshi Paramu Pillai. The film was dubbed into Telugu as Pelli Kuthuru.
title: Manamagal

abstract: Sankeerthanam Pole is a [[1997|Malayalam films of 1997]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed by Jeasy. The film stars [[Murali|Murali (Malayalam actor)]], [[Rekha|Rekha (South Indian actress)]], [[Captain Raju|Captain Raju]] and [[K. B. Ganesh Kumar|K. B. Ganesh Kumar]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[Johnson|Johnson (composer)]]. This was Jeasy's last film as director.
title: Sankeerthanam Pole

abstract: The Aviation Cocktail is a 2012 independent American drama film about the entangled lives of three [[World War II|World War II]] [[veteran|veterans]] living in the [[Midwestern United States|Midwestern United States]] in the 1950s. The film's title refers to a famous drink, the [[aviation|aviation (cocktail)]].
title: The Aviation Cocktail

abstract: Thanga Surangam (Tamil: தங்க சுரங்கம்) (English: Gold Mine) is a [[1969|Tamil films of 1969]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Tamil|Tamil language]] film, directed by [[T. R. Ramanna|T. R. Ramanna]] and produced by E. V. Rajan. The film stars [[Sivaji Ganesan|Sivaji Ganesan]], [[Bharathi|Bharathi (actress)]], [[Vennira Aadai Nirmala|Vennira Aadai Nirmala]], and [[Nagesh|Nagesh]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[T. K. Ramamurthy|T. K. Ramamurthy]].
title: Thanga Surangam

abstract: Nichaya Thaamboolam () is a [[1962|Tamil films of 1962]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Tamil language|Tamil language]] film, directed and produced by [[B. S. Ranga|B. S. Ranga]]. The film stars [[Sivaji Ganesan|Sivaji Ganesan]], [[Jamuna|Jamuna (actress)]], [[Rajasree|Rajasree]], [[M. N. Nambiar|M. N. Nambiar]], [[S. V. Ranga Rao|S. V. Ranga Rao]] and [[P. Kannamba|Pasupuleti Kannamba]] in lead roles. The film had a musical score by [[Viswanathan–Ramamoorthy|Viswanathan–Ramamoorthy]]. The film was released in Telugu as Pelli Thambulam.
title: Nichaya Thaamboolam

abstract: Kuzhandhaigal Kanda Kudiyarasu () is a 1960 Indian [[Tamil language|Tamil language]] film, directed by [[B. R. Panthulu|B. R. Panthulu]]. The film stars Panthulu, [[M. V. Rajamma|M. V. Rajamma]], [[K. Sarangapani|K. Sarangapani]] and [[Javar Seetharaman|Javar Seetharaman]] in the lead roles. The film had musical score by [[T. G. Lingappa|T. G. Lingappa]]. It was simultaneously released in Kannada language as [[Makkala Rajya|Makkala Rajya]] and Telugu as Pillalu Techina Challani Rajyam. This film was partly coloured by [[Gevacolor|Gevacolor]] and prossessed at the Film Centre, Mumbai.
title: Kuzhandhaigal Kanda Kudiyarasu

abstract: Mannavan Vanthaanadi (English: The King Has Arrived) is a [[1975|Tamil films of 1975]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Tamil|Tamil language]] film, directed by [[P. Madhavan|P. Madhavan]]. The film stars [[Sivaji Ganesan|Sivaji Ganesan]], [[Manjula|Manjula Vijayakumar]], [[Jayasudha|Jayasudha]], [[M. N. Nambiar|M. N. Nambiar]] and [[Nagesh|Nagesh]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[M. S. Viswanathan|M. S. Viswanathan]].
title: Mannavan Vanthaanadi

abstract: Velundu Vinaiyillai (Tamil: வேலுண்டு வினையில்லை) is a 1987 [[Tamil|Tamil language]] Devotional film, directed by [[K. Shankar|K. Shankar]] and produced by S. Valliammai. The film stars [[Vijayakanth|Vijayakanth]], [[Ambika|Ambika (actress)]], [[M. N. Nambiar|M. N. Nambiar]] and [[Jaiganesh|Jaiganesh]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[M. S. Viswanathan|M. S. Viswanathan]].
title: Velundu Vinaiyillai

abstract: Chukkan is a [[1994|Malayalam films of 1994]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed and produced by [[Thampi Kannanthanam|Thampi Kannanthanam]]. The film stars [[Suresh Gopi|Suresh Gopi]], [[Gouthami|Gouthami]], [[Thilakan|Thilakan]] and [[Kaviyoor Ponnamma|Kaviyoor Ponnamma]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[S. P. Venkatesh|S. P. Venkatesh]].
title: Chukkan

abstract: Unni Vanna Divasam is a [[1984|Malayalam films of 1984]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed by Rajan Balakrishnan and produced by KG Mohan. The film stars [[Sukumari|Sukumari]], [[Sankaradi|Sankaradi]], [[Captain Raju|Captain Raju]] and [[Rajkumar|Rajkumar Sethupathi]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[A. T. Ummer|A. T. Ummer]]. The film was dubbed in Tamil as Love Birds.
title: Unni Vanna Divasam

abstract: Kakkathamburatti is a [[1970|Malayalam films of 1970]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed by [[P. Bhaskaran|P. Bhaskaran]] and produced by C. J. Baby and P. C. Ittoop. The film stars [[Prem Nazir|Prem Nazir]], [[Madhu|Madhu (actor)]], [[Sharada|Sharada (actress)]] and [[Jayabharathi|Jayabharathi]] in the lead roles. The film had musical score by [[K. Raghavan|K. Raghavan]].
title: Kakkathamburatti

abstract: Nadan Pennum Natupramaniyum is a [[2000|Malayalam films of 2000]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed by [[Rajasenan|Rajasenan]]. The film stars [[Jayaram|Jayaram]], [[Samyuktha Varma|Samyuktha Varma]], [[Srividya|Srividya]] and [[Jagathy Sreekumar|Jagathy Sreekumar]] . The film had musical score by A. B. Murali.
title: Nadan Pennum Natupramaniyum

abstract: Parasparam is a [[1983|Malayalam films of 1983]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed by Shajiyem and produced by Jose Brothers. The film stars [[Venu Nagavally|Venu Nagavally]], [[Zarina Wahab|Zarina Wahab]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by MB Sreenivasan.
title: Parasparam

abstract: Chiriyo Chiri is a [[1982|Malayalam films of 1982]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed by [[Balachandra Menon|Balachandra Menon]] and produced by [[P. V. Gangadharan|PV Gangadharan]]. The film stars [[Balachandra Menon|Balachandra Menon]], [[Kaviyoor Ponnamma|Kaviyoor Ponnamma]], [[Adoor Bhasi|Adoor Bhasi]] and [[Maniyanpilla Raju|Maniyanpilla Raju]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[Raveendran|Raveendran]]. Art direction by [[Kalalayam Ravi|Kalalayam Ravi]].
title: Chiriyo Chiri

abstract: Maami (English: My Mother) is a 2011 Nigerian [[drama film|drama film]] produced and directed by [[Tunde Kelani|Tunde Kelani]]. It is based on a novel of the same name, written by [[Femi Osofisan|Femi Osofisan]], and adapted to screen by Tunde Babalola. It stars [[Funke Akindele|Funke Akindele]] as Maami, along with Wole Ojo and Olumide Bakare. Though the film was a commercial failure, it was generally met with positive critical reviews.
title: Maami

abstract: Nanda Gokula () is a 1972 Indian [[Kannada language|Kannada language]] drama directed by Y. R. Swamy and produced by Shyamprasad Enterprises. It starred [[Rajkumar|Rajkumar (actor)]], Ramesh and [[Jayanthi|Jayanthi (actress)]] in the lead roles. [[Vijaya Bhaskar|Vijaya Bhaskar]] scored the music and the story was written by [[Chi. Udaya Shankar|Chi. Udaya Shankar]].
title: Nanda Gokula

abstract: Dudde Doddappa (Kannada: ದುಡ್ಡೇ ದೊಡ್ಡಪ್ಪ) is a 1966 [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Kannada|Kannada language]] film, directed and produced by [[B. R. Panthulu|B. R. Panthulu]]. The film stars [[B. R. Panthulu|B. R. Panthulu]], [[M. V. Rajamma|M. V. Rajamma]], Ramesh and [[Narasimharaju|Narasimharaju (Kannada actor)]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[T. G. Lingappa|T. G. Lingappa]].
title: Dudde Doddappa

abstract: Fidelio: Alice's Odyssey (), also titled Fidelio: Alice's Journey, is a 2014 French [[drama film|drama film]] directed by [[Lucie Borleteau|Lucie Borleteau]].
title: Fidelio: Alice's Odyssey

abstract: Yare Nee Abhimani (Kannada: ಯಾರೇ ನೀ ಅಭಿಮಾನಿ; English: Who are you, my admirer) is a [[2000|Kannada films of 2000]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Kannada|Kannada language]] film, directed by [[D. Rajendra Babu|D. Rajendra Babu]] and produced by Lakshman Pramod Kumar. The film stars [[Shiva Rajkumar|Shiva Rajkumar]], [[Ramya Krishnan|Ramya Krishnan]], [[Sangita|Sangita Madhavan Nair]] and [[Srinath|Srinath]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by Hamsalekha. The film is a remake of 1993 Hindi film [[Aaina|Aaina (1993 film)]].
title: Yare Nee Abhimani

abstract: Avan Oru Sarithiram () is a 1977 Indian [[Tamil-language|Tamil language]] film directed by [[K. S. Prakash Rao|K. S. Prakash Rao]] and produced by K. S. Kutralingam. The film stars [[Sivaji Ganesan|Sivaji Ganesan]], [[Manjula|Manjula Vijayakumar]], [[Kanchana|Kanchana (actress)]] and [[Manorama|Manorama (Tamil actress)]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[M. S. Viswanathan|M. S. Viswanathan]].
title: Avan Oru Sarithiram

abstract: Maragatham is a 1959 Indian [[Tamil|Tamil language]] [[crime|Crime film]]-[[thriller|Thriller (genre)]] film, directed by [[S. M. Sriramulu Naidu|S. M. Sriramulu Naidu]], who also co-produced the film along with K. R. Seenivasan and N. Naga Subramaniyam. The film stars [[Sivaji Ganesan|Sivaji Ganesan]], [[Padmini|Padmini (actress)]], [[Balachander|Sundaram Balachander]] and Sandhya in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[S. M. Subbaiah Naidu|S. M. Subbaiah Naidu]]. The movie is based on a novel by D. S. Duraisami, named as Karunkuyil Kunrathu Kolai.
title: Maragatham

abstract: Naan Paadum Paadal () is a 1984 Indian [[Tamil-language|Tamil language]] film directed by [[R. Sundarrajan|R. Sundarrajan (director)]] and produced by C. S. Rajesh Khanna, A. Francis Xaviour and R. Palanisamy. The film stars [[Sivakumar|Sivakumar]], [[Mohan|Mohan (actor)]], [[Ambika|Ambika (actress)]] and [[Pandiyan|Pandiyan (actor)]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[Ilayaraja|Ilayaraja]]. The film was remade in Telugu as [[Mangalya Bandham|Mangalya Bandham]].
title: Naan Paadum Paadal

abstract: Inspired from true events, Jigariyaa tells the story of Shyamlal Gupta (Shaamu) and Radhika Sharma (Raadha). Shaamu, the only son of halwaai Ramlal Gupta is a happy go lucky boy based in [[Agra|Agra]]. He spends his days writing sheyr-o-shayari admired by his motley group of good-for-nothing friends. Radhika, the only daughter of Pandit Shankar Dayal Sharma is a well-educated and caring girl who helps her father in his endeavours as a social do gooder and a man of high reputation in [[Mathura|Mathura]]. Shaamu falls in love with Raadha at first sight, who is visiting her Nani’s house in Agra, thus begins his quest to find this elusive girl in the streets of Agra. As they grow fond and close to each other, the destiny takes another turn and the two lovers break apart.
title: Jigariyaa

abstract: Andaman Kadhali (Tamil: அந்தமான் காதலி; English: Andaman Lover) is a [[1978|Tamil films of 1978]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Tamil|Tamil language]] film, directed by [[Muktha Srinivasan|Muktha Srinivasan]] and produced by V. Ramasamy. The film stars [[Sivaji Ganesan|Sivaji Ganesan]], [[Sujatha|Sujatha (actress)]], [[Chandra Mohan|Chandra Mohan (Telugu actor)]] and [[Thengai Srinivasan|Thengai Srinivasan]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[M. S. Viswanathan|M. S. Viswanathan]]. The film was remade in Telugu as [[Andaman Ammayi|Andaman Ammayi]].
title: Andaman Kadhali

abstract: I'll Take My Chances is a 2011 Nigerian [[dance|dance film]] [[romantic drama film|romantic drama film]], produced by Emem Isong and directed by [[Desmond Elliot|Desmond Elliot]]. It stars [[Ini Edo|Ini Edo]] and [[Bryan Okwara|Bryan Okwara]] in lead roles, with [[Sam Loco Efe|Sam Loco Efe]], [[Jide Kosoko|Jide Kosoko]], [[Ini Ikpe|Ini ikpe]], Ashleigh Clark and Abiola Segun Williams in supporting roles. The film's synopsis says: "Tradition demands that a troubled young woman take the position of priestess of the land or else allow calamity to befall the village. She refuses to accept her fate and is further convinced not to heed custom's call by a handsome stranger".
title: I'll Take My Chances

abstract: Sevanthi Sevanthi () is a 2006 Indian [[Kannada language|Kannada language]] romance-drama musical film directed and written by [[S. Narayan|S. Narayan]]. The film stars [[Vijay Raghavendra|Vijay Raghavendra]] and [[Ramya|Ramya]] in the lead roles. The film is presented by [[Parvathamma Rajkumar|Parvathamma Rajkumar]] and produced by Jayamma Chinne Gowda in association with [[S. A. Chinne Gowda|S. A. Chinne Gowda]]. The music is composed by [[S. A. Rajkumar|S. A. Rajkumar]] who has reproduced the best known Kannada [[folk|folk music]] songs since the story is about Devu (Vijay Raghavendra), a son of butter seller, who is very good at singing folk songs.
title: Sevanthi Sevanthi

abstract: The Divergent Series is a feature film trilogy based on the [[Divergent|Divergent trilogy]] novels by the American author [[Veronica Roth|Veronica Roth]]. Distributed by [[Summit Entertainment|Summit Entertainment]] and [[Lionsgate Films|Lionsgate Films]], the series consists of three [[science fiction|science fiction film]] films set in a [[dystopian|dystopian]] society. They have been produced by [[Lucy Fisher|Lucy Fisher]], Pouya Shabazian, and [[Douglas Wick|Douglas Wick]].
title: The Divergent Series

abstract: Black Hunters () is a 2008 [[Russian language|Russian language]] [[action|action film]] [[drama film|drama film]] directed by Andrey Malyukov. The film features [[Danila Kozlovsky|Danila Kozlovsky]], Andrey Terentev, Vladimir Yaglych, Dmitriy Volkostrelov and [[Ekaterina Klimova|Ekaterina Klimova]] in the lead roles. The movie is about time travel.
title: Black Hunters

abstract: Kudumba Thalaivan () is a 1962 [[Tamil language|Tamil language]] [[drama film|drama film]], directed by [[M. A. Thirumugam|M. A. Thirumugam]]. The film features [[M. G. Ramachandran|M. G. Ramachandran]], [[M. R. Radha|M. R. Radha]] and [[B. Saroja Devi|B. Saroja Devi]] in the lead roles. The film, produced by [[Sandow M. M. A. Chinnappa Thevar|Sandow M. M. A. Chinnappa Thevar]], had a musical score by [[K. V. Mahadevan|K. V. Mahadevan]] and was released on 15 August 1962. The film was a big hit at the box office and ran for 120 days.
title: Kudumba Thalaivan

abstract: Pattikaattu Ponnaiya (The Farmer Ponnaiya) is a [[1973|Tamil films of 1973]] [[Tamil language|Tamil language]] [[drama film|Drama (film and television)]], directed by [[B. S. Ranga|B. S. Ranga]]. The film features [[M. G. Ramachandran|M. G. Ramachandran]], [[Jayalalithaa|Jayalalithaa]] and [[Rajasree|Rajasree]] in lead roles.
title: Pattikaattu Ponnaiya

abstract: Naanum Indha Ooruthan (Tamil: நானும் இந்த ஊருதான்) is a [[1990|Tamil films of 1990]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Tamil|Tamil language]] film, directed by Shegar Raja and produced by Florida Fernando. The film features [[Murali|Murali (Tamil actor)]], [[Kushboo|Kushboo]], [[Ravichandran|Ravichandran (actor)]] and Nagaraja Cholan in lead roles. The film, had musical score by [[Sankar Ganesh|Sankar Ganesh]].
title: Naanum Indha Ooruthan

abstract: Chakravalam Chuvannappol is a [[1983|Malayalam films of 1983]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed by [[J. Sasikumar|J. Sasikumar]]. The film stars [[Prem Nazir|Prem Nazir]], [[Mammootty|Mammootty]], [[Mohanlal|Mohanlal]] and [[Sumalatha|Sumalatha]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[M. K. Arjunan|M. K. Arjunan]].
title: Chakravalam Chuvannappol

abstract: Muhurtham Pathnonnu Muppathinu is a [[1985|Malayalam films of 1985]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed by [[Joshiy|Joshiy]]. The film stars [[Mammootty|Mammootty]], [[Saritha|Saritha]], [[Jagathy Sreekumar|Jagathy Sreekumar]] and [[Ratheesh|Ratheesh]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[Shyam|Shyam (composer)]].
title: Muhurtham Pathnonnu Muppathinu

abstract: Rani Honnamma () is a 1960 Indian [[historical drama film|List of historical drama films]] in [[Kannada language|Kannada language]], directed and written by [[K. R. Seetharama Sastry|K. R. Seetharama Sastry]] and produced by Karibasaiah. The film stars [[Rajkumar|Rajkumar (actor)]] and [[Leelavathi|Leelavathi (actress)]] in the lead roles.
title: Rani Honnamma

abstract: En Purushanthaan Enakku Mattumthaan (English: My husband is mine only) is a 1989 [[Tamil|Tamil language]] [[romantic|Romance film]] [[drama film|drama film]], directed by [[Manobala|Manobala]] and produced by V. N. J. Manivannan. The film stars [[Vijayakanth|Vijayakanth]], [[Suhasini Mani Ratnam|Suhasini Mani Ratnam]] and [[Rekha|Rekha (South Indian actress)]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[Ilaiyaraaja|Ilaiyaraaja]]. The film was remade in Hindi as [[Mera Pati Sirf Mera Hai|Mera Pati Sirf Mera Hai]], starring [[Jeetendra|Jeetendra]]. Manobala also directed the Hindi version. It was also remade in Telugu as Naa Mogudu Naake Sontham. This movie is possibly inspired by the movie Chinnakuyil Paduthu, which was released in 1987.
title: En Purushanthaan Enakku Mattumthaan

abstract: Ente Entethu Mathrem is a [[1986|Malayalam films of 1986]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed by [[J. Sasikumar|J. Sasikumar]]. The film stars [[Mohanlal|Mohanlal]], [[Karthika|Karthika (actress)]], [[Baby Shalini|Shalini]] and [[Lalu Alex|Lalu Alex]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[Johnson|Johnson (composer)]].
title: Ente Entethu Mathrem

abstract: Enga Mama ("Our Uncle") is a [[1970|Tamil films of 1970]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Tamil language|Tamil language]] film, directed by [[A. C. Tirulokchandar|A. C. Tirulokchandar]] and produced by P. K. V. Sankaran and Arumugam. The film stars [[Sivaji Ganesan|Sivaji Ganesan]], [[Jayalalithaa|Jayalalithaa]], [[Vennira Aadai Nirmala|Vennira Aadai Nirmala]] and [[Cho|Cho Ramaswamy]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[M. S. Viswanathan|M. S. Viswanathan]]. The film was a remake of Hindi film [[Brahmachari|Brahmachari (Hindi film)]] and turned out to be a box-office hit, running successfully for over 100 days.
title: Enga Mama

abstract: Mooru Janma (Kannada: ಮೂರು ಜನ್ಮ) is a [[1984|Kannada films of 1984]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Kannada|Kannada language]] film, directed by [[H. R. Bhargava|H. R. Bhargava]] and produced by S N Parthanath Brothers. The film stars [[Ambarish|Ambarish]], [[Ambika|Ambika (actress)]], [[Anuradha|Anuradha (actress)]] and [[Lokesh|Lokesh]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[Rajan-Nagendra|Rajan-Nagendra]]. The movie is based on novel of same name by [[T. K. Rama Rao|T. K. Rama Rao]].
title: Mooru Janma

abstract: Bandhukkal Sathrukkal is a [[1993|Malayalam films of 1993]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, written, directed and produced by [[Sreekumaran Thampi|Sreekumaran Thampi]], who also wrote and composed the songs. The film stars [[Jayaram|Jayaram]], [[Mukesh|Mukesh (actor)]], [[Rohini|Rohini (actress)]], and [[Rupini|Rupini (actress)]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[Sreekumaran Thampi|Sreekumaran Thampi]]. The songs of this film were declared blockbusters.
title: Bandhukkal Sathrukkal

abstract: Thaaiku Oru Thaalaattu () is a [[1986|Tamil films of 1986]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Tamil|Tamil language]] film, directed by [[Balachandra Menon|Balachandra Menon]] and produced by [[K. R. Gangadharan|K. R. Gangadharan]]. The film stars [[Sivaji Ganesan|Sivaji Ganesan]], [[Padmini|Padmini (actress)]], [[Visu|Visu]] and [[Pandiyan|Pandiyan (actor)]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[Ilaiyaraaja|Ilaiyaraaja]]. The film was a remake of the director's own Malayalam film [[Oru Painkilikatha|Oru Painkilikatha]].
title: Thaaiku Oru Thaalaattu

abstract: Raat Ke Rahi is a [[1959|List of Bollywood films of 1959]] Indian Hindi [[drama film|drama film]] written and directed by [[Naseem|Naseem Salamuddin]]. It was a Pushpanjali production with music by [[Bipin Babul|Bipin Babul]] and lyrics by [[Vishwamitra Adil|Vishwamitra Adil]]. The cast included [[Shammi Kapoor|Shammi Kapoor]], [[Jabeen|Jabeen (actress)]], [[Nazir Hussain|Nazir Hussain]], [[Anwar Hussain|Anwar Hussain (actor)]] and [[Achala Sachdev|Achala Sachdev]]. Naseem (Salamuddin) went on to direct the successful Bhojpuri film Hamar Sansar (1967) which was produced by Nazir Hussain.
title: Raat Ke Rahi

abstract: 6 Years is a 2015 American [[romantic|romance film]] [[drama film|drama film]] written and directed by [[Hannah Fidell|Hannah Fidell]] and starring [[Taissa Farmiga|Taissa Farmiga]], [[Ben Rosenfield|Ben Rosenfield]], [[Lindsay Burdge|Lindsay Burdge]], [[Joshua Leonard|Joshua Leonard]], [[Peter Vack|Peter Vack]], and [[Dana Wheeler-Nicholson|Dana Wheeler-Nicholson]]. Filmmakers [[Mark|Mark Duplass]] and [[Jay Duplass|Jay Duplass]] served as executive producers under their [[Duplass Brothers Productions|Duplass Brothers Productions]] banner. The film depicts two weeks in the relationship of college students Melanie Clark and Dan Mercer, as their 6-year romance turns violent.
title: 6 Years

abstract: Thenum Paalum () is a [[1971|Tamil films of 1971]] [[Tamil language|Tamil language]] [[drama film|drama film]] directed by [[P. Madhavan|P. Madhavan]]. The film features [[Sivaji Ganesan|Sivaji Ganesan]], [[Padmini|Padmini (actress)]] and [[B. Saroja Devi|B. Saroja Devi]] in lead roles.
title: Thenum Paalum

abstract: Darker Than Midnight () is a 2014 Italian [[drama film|drama film]] directed by [[Sebastiano Riso|Sebastiano Riso]]. It was screened as part of the [[International Critics' Week|International Critics' Week]] section at the [[2014 Cannes Film Festival|2014 Cannes Film Festival]].
title: Darker Than Midnight

abstract: Deivapiravi () is a 1960 Indian [[Tamil-language|Tamil language]] film, directed by [[Krishnan–Panju|Krishnan–Panju]]. The film stars [[Sivaji Ganesan|Sivaji Ganesan]], [[Padmini|Padmini (actress)]], [[S. S. Rajendran|S. S. Rajendran]], [[K. A. Thangavelu|K. A. Thangavelu]] and [[M. N. Rajam|M. N. Rajam]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by R. Sudarsanam. The film was dubbed and released in [[Telugu|Telugu language]] as Anumanam and released on 24 June 1961. At the [[8th National Film Awards|8th National Film Awards]], the film won the [[All India Certificate of Merit for the Third Best Feature Film|Discontinued and Intermittent National Film Awards#Third Best Feature Film]]. It was remade in [[Hindi|Hindi]] as [[Bindiya|Bindiya (1960 film)]], and in [[Sinhalese|Sinhalese language]] as Sekaya.
title: Deivapiravi

abstract: Paattukku Naan Adimai (English : I'm a slave for songs) is a [[1990|Tamil films of 1990]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Tamil|Tamil language]] film, directed by Ramadas E. and produced by S. Rameshchand Jain. The film stars [[Ramarajan|Ramarajan]], [[Rekha|Rekha (South Indian actress)]], [[Kushboo|Kushboo]] and [[Ravichandran|Ravichandran (actor)]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[Ilaiyaraaja|Ilaiyaraaja]].
title: Paattukku Naan Adimai

abstract: Puthu Paatu is a [[1990|Tamil films of 1990]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Tamil|Tamil language]] film, directed by [[Panju Arunachalam|Panju Arunachalam]] and produced by [[Ilaiyaraaja|Ilaiyaraaja]]. The film stars [[Ramarajan|Ramarajan]], Vaidegi, [[Suma|Suman Ranganathan]] and [[Rajeev|Rajeev (Tamil actor)]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by Ilaiyaraaja.
title: Puthu Paatu

abstract: Hello, My Name Is Doris is a 2015 American [[romantic|romance film]] [[comedy-drama film|comedy-drama]] directed by [[Michael Showalter|Michael Showalter]] from a screenplay by Showalter and Laura Terruso, about a woman in her 60s who tries to act on her attraction to a younger co-worker. It stars [[Sally Field|Sally Field]] in the title role, alongside [[Max Greenfield|Max Greenfield]], [[Beth Behrs|Beth Behrs]], [[Wendi McLendon-Covey|Wendi McLendon-Covey]], [[Stephen Root|Stephen Root]], [[Elizabeth Reaser|Elizabeth Reaser]], [[Natasha Lyonne|Natasha Lyonne]] and [[Tyne Daly|Tyne Daly]]. The film had its world premiere at the [[SXSW Film Festival|South by Southwest]] on March 14, 2015, and was theatrically released on March 11, 2016, by [[Roadside Attractions|Roadside Attractions]] and [[Stage 6 Films|Stage 6 Films]].
title: Hello, My Name Is Doris

abstract: Ekta Jeev Sadashiv is 1972 [[Marathi film|Marathi film]] directed by Govind Kulkarni and starring [[Dada Kondke|Dada Kondke]] and [[Usha Chavan|Usha Chavan]] as leads. It was remade in Hindi as [[Jis Desh Mein Ganga Rehta Hain|Jis Desh Mein Ganga Rehta Hain]] which was released in 2000. The core plot of the 1974 Kannada movie [[Bangaarada Panjara|Bangaarada Panjara]] was thematically similar to this movie.
title: Ekta Jeev Sadashiv

abstract: Badavara Bandhu () is a 1976 Indian [[Kannada language|Kannada language]] film directed by Vijay. It stars [[Rajkumar|Rajkumar (actor)]] and [[Jayamala|Jaimala (actress)]] in the lead roles. The movie is also notable for the negative character played by [[K. S. Ashwath|K. S. Ashwath]].The movie saw a theatrical run of 25 weeks.
title: Badavara Bandhu

abstract: Punjab 1984 is a 2014 Indian [[Punjabi|Cinema of Punjab]] [[period drama|Period film]] film directed by Anurag Singh. It is based on the 1984–86 [[Punjab insurgency|Punjab insurgency]]'s impact on social life, notably it is a story of a mother and her missing son. Starring [[Diljit Dosanjh|Diljit Dosanjh]] and [[Kirron Kher|Kirron Kher]], the film is the fourth collaboration between director Singh and actor Dosanjh. Punjab 1984 released on 27 June 2014 to excellent box office collections.
title: Punjab 1984

abstract: Pachai Vilakku (English: Green Light) is a 1964 Indian [[Tamil-language|Tamil language]] film, directed by [[A. Bhimsingh|A. Bhimsingh]] and produced by Rama. Arangannal, A. R. Hassan Khan and T. S. Aadhi Narayanan. The film stars [[Sivaji Ganesan|Sivaji Ganesan]], [[C. R. Vijayakumari|C. R. Vijayakumari]], [[S. S. Rajendran|S. S. Rajendran]] and [[S. V. Ranga Rao|S. V. Ranga Rao]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[Viswanathan–Ramamoorthy|Viswanathan–Ramamoorthy]].
title: Pachai Vilakku

abstract: Senthamarai () is a [[1962|Tamil films of 1962]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Tamil|Tamil language]] film, directed by [[A. Bhimsingh|A. Bhimsingh]]. The film stars [[Sivaji Ganesan|Sivaji Ganesan]], [[Padmini|Padmini (actress)]], [[K. R. Ramasamy|K. R. Ramasamy]] and [[S. S. Rajendran|S. S. Rajendran]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[Viswanathan–Ramamoorthy|Viswanathan–Ramamoorthy]]. Padmini has given a splendid performance. Sivaji and Ramasami also excel in their respective roles. Senthamarai was an average success in spite of the excellent cast, melodious music and song and dance numbers by Padmini.
title: Senthamarai

abstract: Muradan Muthu (English: Rogue Muthu) is a 1964 Indian [[Tamil language|Tamil language]] film, directed and produced by [[B. R. Panthulu|B. R. Panthulu]]. The film stars [[Sivaji Ganesan|Sivaji Ganesan]], [[Devika|Devika]], [[M. V. Rajamma|M. V. Rajamma]] and Chandrakantha in the lead roles. The film had musical score by [[T. G. Lingappa|T. G. Lingappa]]. The film was a remake of the Kannada film [[Chinnada Gombe|Chinnada Gombe]]. The film did well at the box office and ran not less than 80 days all over Tamil Nadu. This was the last picture combination of B. R. Panthulu and Sivaji Ganesan.
title: Muradan Muthu

abstract: Paramashiva is a 2014 Indian [[Kannada language|Kannada language]] drama musical film directed by Mahesh Babu and produced by Anaji Nagaraj. The film stars [[V. Ravichandran|V. Ravichandran]], [[Saranya Mohan|Saranya Mohan]], [[Vijay Raghavendra|Vijay Raghavendra]] and [[Sakshi Shivanand|Sakshi Shivanand]] in prominent roles. The film is about a family bonding between a brother and his sister and the emotional trauma they face as their life moves on.
title: Paramashiva

abstract: Anbalippu (English: Presentation) is a 1969 Indian [[Tamil-language|Tamil language]] film, directed by [[A. C. Tirulokchandar|A. C. Tirulokchandar]] and produced by S. Gandhiraj. The film stars [[Sivaji Ganesan|Sivaji Ganesan]], [[B. Sarojadevi|B. Sarojadevi]], [[Jaishankar|Jaishankar]], [[Vijayanirmala|Vijayanirmala]] and [[M. N. Nambiar|M. N. Nambiar]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[M. S. Viswanathan|M. S. Viswanathan]]. The film was hit at box-office.
title: Anbalippu

abstract: Raman Ethanai Ramanadi () is a [[1970|Tamil films of 1970]] [[Tamil language|Tamil language]] film, directed by [[P. Madhavan|P. Madhavan]]. The film features [[Sivaji Ganesan|Sivaji Ganesan]], [[K. R. Vijaya|K. R. Vijaya]] and [[R. Muthuraman|R. Muthuraman]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[M. S. Viswanathan|M. S. Viswanathan]]. The film won the [[National Film Award for Best Feature Film in Tamil|National Film Award for Best Feature Film in Tamil]] for the year. P. Madhavan also directed the Hindi remake [[Ram Tere Kitne Naam|Ram Tere Kitne Naam]].
title: Raman Ethanai Ramanadi

abstract: Bhoopathi Ranga () is a 1970 Indian [[Kannada language|Kannada language]] drama film written and directed by [[Geethapriya|Geethapriya]]. It stars [[Rajkumar|Rajkumar (actor)]], [[Udaya Chandrika|Udaya Chandrika]] and Renuka in the lead roles. The film's story was written and produced by Bhaskar Movies. The future director [[H. R. Bhargava|H. R. Bhargava]] worked as an associate director in this film.
title: Bhoopathi Ranga

abstract: Hasiru Thorana ({{lang-kn|ಹಸಿರು ತೋರಣ} (in English : The leaf bunting) is a 1970 Indian [[Kannada language|Kannada language]] drama film directed by T. V. Singh Thakur and written by Sundaramma. It stars [[Rajkumar|Rajkumar (actor)]], [[Uday Kumar|Udaya Kumar (actor)]] and [[Bharathi|Bharathi (actress)]] in the lead roles. The film was released under Sri Indira Movies banner and produced by Y. Anantharama Rao. The film, featuring the soundtrack composed by [[Upendra Kumar|Upendra Kumar]] was received well upon release.
title: Hasiru Thorana

abstract: Pudhiya Vazhkai (Tamil: புதிய வாழ்க்கை) is a [[1971|Tamil films of 1971]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Tamil|Tamil language]] film, directed by [[C. V. Rajendran|C. V. Rajendran]]. The film stars [[Jaishankar|Jaishankar]], [[R. Muthuraman|R. Muthuraman]], [[Nagesh|Nagesh]], [[Jayabharathi|Jayabharathi]] and A. Sakunthala in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[K. V. Mahadevan|K. V. Mahadevan]].
title: Pudhiya Vazhkai

abstract: Nerariyum Nerathu is a [[1985|1985 in film]] [[Malayalam-language|Cinema of Kerala]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[feature film|feature film]] [[directed|Film director]] by Salaam Chembazhanthy for Sahrudaya Chithra starring [[Prem Nazir|Prem Nazir]], [[Shankar|Shankar (actor)]] and [[Ratheesh|Ratheesh]] in lead roles, supported by [[T. G. Ravi|T. G. Ravi]], [[Unnimary|Unnimary]] and [[Rohini|Rohini (actress)]] playing other important roles.
title: Nerariyum Nerathu

abstract: The Dead Lands is a 2014 New Zealand [[action film|action film]] directed by [[Toa Fraser|Toa Fraser]]. It was screened in the Special Presentations section at the [[2014 Toronto International Film Festival|2014 Toronto International Film Festival]] where it had its world premier on 4 September 2014. It was selected as the New Zealand entry for the [[Best Foreign Language Film|Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film]] at the [[87th Academy Awards|87th Academy Awards]], but was not nominated.
title: The Dead Lands

abstract: Onek Sadher Moyna () is a 2014 Bangladeshi [[Bengali-language|Bengali-language]] [[romantic drama|romantic drama]] film directed by [[Jakir Hossain Raju|Jakir Hossain Raju]] and written by Farzana. distributed by [[Jaaz Multimedia|Jaaz Multimedia]]. It stars [[Mahiya Mahi|Mahiya Mahi]] and [[Bappy Chowdhury|Bappy Chowdhury]] in the lead roles.
title: Onek Sadher Moyna

abstract: Kalyana Kurimanam is a [[2005|Malayalam films of 2005]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed by Udaya Kumar and produced by S Kumar. The film stars [[Abbas|Abbas (actor)]], [[Vijayaraghavan|Vijayaraghavan (actor)]] and [[Nandana|Nandana (actress)]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by Ronnie R Raphel.
title: Kalyana Kurimanam

abstract: Vadhu Doctoranu is a [[1994|Malayalam films of 1994]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed by [[K. K. Haridas|K. K. Haridas]] and produced by Alex-Bright. The film stars [[Jayaram|Jayaram]], [[Nadhiya|Nadhiya]], [[Oduvil Unnikrishnan|Oduvil Unnikrishnan]] and [[K. P. A. C. Lalitha|K. P. A. C. Lalitha]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[Johnson|Johnson (composer)]] and [[Kannur Rajan|Kannur Rajan]]. the story revolves around Sidharthan who wanted to become a doctor but ended up being electricity board engineer. He is determined to marry a doctor. When he meets Ammukutty, he discovers that she is a doctor and he is determined to marry her. His sister Nirmala loves Vinayan a bank employee but Sidharthan doesn't approve of him. Then its decided that both Nirmala and Vinayan and Sidharthan and Ammukutty will be married on the same day. But after marriage Sidharthan discovers that Ammukutty is a veterinarian. There are a lot of ups and downs between them but in the end they are reunited and Sidharthan promises never to create a situation like this.
title: Vadhu Doctoranu

abstract: Puthiya Karukkal is a [[1989|Malayalam films of 1989]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed by [[Thampi Kannanthanam|Thampi Kannanthanam]] and produced by [[Thampi Kannanthanam|Thampi Kannanthanam]]. The film stars [[Jayaram|Jayaram]], [[Parvathy Jayaram|Parvathy Jayaram]], [[Lalu Alex|Lalu Alex]] and [[M. G. Soman|M. G. Soman]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[S. P. Venkatesh|S. P. Venkatesh]].
title: Puthiya Karukkal

abstract: Aana Valarthiya Vanampadi is a 1959 [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed and produced by [[P. Subramaniam|P. Subramaniam]]. The film stars [[Prem Nawas|Prem Nawas]] and [[Ambika Sukumaran|Ambika Sukumaran]] in the lead roles. The film had musical score by Br. Lakshmanan.
title: Aana Valarthiya Vanampadi

abstract: Archana Aaradhana is a [[1985|Malayalam films of 1985]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed [[Sajan|Sajan (director)]]. The film stars [[Shankar Panicker|Shankar Panicker]], [[Menaka|Menaka (actress)]], [[Ambika|Ambika (actress)]] and [[Sukumari|Sukumari]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[Shyam|Shyam (composer)]].
title: Archana Aaradhana

abstract: Theekkadal is a [[1980|Malayalam films of 1980]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed and produced by [[Navodaya Appachan|Navodaya Appachan]]. The film stars [[Prem Nazir|Prem Nazir]], [[Madhu|Madhu (actor)]], [[Sukumaran|Sukumaran]] and [[Srividya|Srividya]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by Guna Singh.
title: Theekkadal

abstract: Rashtram is a [[2006|Malayalam films of 2006]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed by Anil C Menon and produced by C Karunakaran. The film stars [[Suresh Gopi|Suresh Gopi]], [[Laya|Laya (actress)]], [[Madhu|Madhu (actor)]] and [[K. P. A. C. Lalitha|K. P. A. C. Lalitha]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[Deepak Dev|Deepak Dev]].
title: Rashtram

abstract: Sriramachandra is a 1992 Indian [[Kannada|Kannada language]] romantic drama film directed by [[D. Rajendra Babu|D. Rajendra Babu]] and produced by P. Dhanraj. The film stars [[Ravichandran|V. Ravichandran]] in dual roles along with [[Mohini|Mohini (Tamil actress)]], [[Vajramuni|Vajramuni]], [[Srinath|Srinath]] amongst others. Music and lyrics was composed by [[Hamsalekha|Hamsalekha]]. The film is a remake of Tamil film [[Kalyanaraman|Kalyanaraman (1979 film)]] (1979) written by [[Panchu Arunachalam|Panchu Arunachalam]].
title: Sriramachandra

abstract: Vidhichathum Kothichathum is a [[1982|Malayalam films of 1982]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed and produced by TS Mohan. The film stars Vincent, Vijayan, [[Mammootty|Mammootty]], [[Adoor Bhasi|Adoor Bhasi]], [[Jose|Jose (actor)]] and [[Krishnachandran|Krishnachandran]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[Raveendran|Raveendran]].
title: Vidhichathum Kothichathum

abstract: Bhaaratheeyam is a 1997 Indian [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film directed by Suresh Krishnan and starring [[Suresh Gopi|Suresh Gopi]], [[Kalabhavan Mani|Kalabhavan Mani]], [[Maniyanpilla Raju|Maniyanpilla Raju]], [[Anusha|Anusha_(actress)]] and [[Suhasini|Suhasini]]. The film has a musical score by [[Berny-Ignatius|Berny-Ignatius]].
title: Bhaaratheeyam

abstract: Jeena Teri Gali Mein is an Indian musical romantic film directed by [[Tinnu Anand|Tinnu Anand]] and produced by [[Gulshan Kumar|Gulshan Kumar]]. It stars [[Suraj|Suraj (actor)]], [[Kavita Kapoor|Kavita Kapoor]], [[Amita Nangia|Amita Nangia]], [[Archana Puran Singh|Archana Puran Singh]] and [[Kunika|Kunika]]. The movie was initially planned for Home Video viewing. However, after the tremendous response received for the music, it was released in theaters.
title: Jeena Teri Gali Mein

abstract: Mayoora Nritham is a [[1996|Malayalam films of 1996]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed by [[Vijayakrishnan|Vijayakrishnan]]. The film stars [[Vikram|Vikram (actor)]], Kumarakam Raghunath, [[Mohini|Mohini (Tamil actress)]], [[Madhupal|Madhupal]] and [[Beena Antony|Beena Antony]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[G. Devarajan|G. Devarajan]].
title: Mayoora Nritham

abstract: Kudumbakodathi is a [[1996|Malayalam films of 1996]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed by Viji Thampy and produced by VS Suresh. The film stars [[Innocent|Innocent (actor)]], [[Dileep|Dileep]], [[Ashokan|Ashokan (actor)]] and [[Kalpana|Kalpana (Malayalam actress)]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[S. P. abstract: Ode to My Father (; lit. "Gukje (International) Market") is a 2014 [[South Korea|South Korean]] [[drama film|drama film]] directed by [[Yoon Je-kyoon|Yoon Je-kyoon]]. Starring [[Hwang Jung-min|Hwang Jung-min]] and [[Yunjin Kim|Yunjin Kim]], it depicts modern Korean history from the 1950s to the present day through the life of an ordinary man, as he experiences events such as the [[Hungnam Evacuation of 1950|Hungnam evacuation]] during the [[Korean War|Korean War]], the government's decision to dispatch nurses and miners to [[West Germany|West Germany]] in the 1960s, and the [[Vietnam War|Vietnam War]].

abstract: It stars [[Kirk Cameron|Kirk Cameron]] as a fictional version of himself. In Saving Christmas, Cameron, after explaining his views on Christmas directly to the audience, tries to convince his fictional brother-in-law, played by the film's director, that Christmas is still a Christian holiday. The film combines a comedic narrative with educational elements, in order to "put Christ back in Christmas"; it says that most of Christmas' popular elements are biblical in origin, while criticizing the modern-day view of the holiday, especially from [[atheists|Atheism]]. During the story, the film [[depicts|Story within a story]] some of the biblical events mentioned by Cameron, while he provides narration for the audience.
title: Saving Christmas

abstract: Vellam is a [[1985|1985 in film]] [[Malayalam-language|Cinema of Kerala]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[feature film|feature film]] directed by [[Hariharan|Hariharan (director)]] starring [[Prem Nazir|Prem Nazir]] and [[Madhu|Madhu (actor)]] in lead roles, supported by [[K. R. Vijaya|K. R. Vijaya]] and [[Srividya|Srividya]] with [[Sathaar|Sathaar]], [[Sukumari|Sukumari]], [[Adoor Bhasi|Adoor Bhasi]] and [[Balan K. Nair|Balan K. Nair]] playing other important roles.
title: Vellam

abstract: Aaroodam is a 1983 Indian [[Malayalam|Malayalam]] film, directed by [[I. V. Sasi|I. V. Sasi]] and produced by Rosamma George. The film stars [[Nedumudi Venu|Nedumudi Venu]], [[Lakshmi|Lakshmi (actress)]], [[Seema|Seema (actress)]] and [[Adoor Bhasi|Adoor Bhasi]] in prominent roles. The film had musical score by [[Shyam|Shyam (composer)]]. The film won the [[Nargis Dutt Award for Best Feature Film on National Integration|Nargis Dutt Award for Best Feature Film on National Integration]] in 1983.
title: Aaroodam

abstract: Varanmaare Aavashyamundu is a [[1983|Malayalam films of 1983]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed by [[Hariharan|Hariharan (director)]] and produced by Joy. The film stars [[Sukumari|Sukumari]], [[Pattom Sadan|Pattom Sadan]], [[V. D. Rajappan|V. D. Rajappan]] and [[Rajkumar|Rajkumar Sethupathi]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[KJ Joy|KJ Joy]].
title: Varanmaare Aavashyamundu

abstract: Swapname Ninakku Nandi is a [[1983|Malayalam films of 1983]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed by Kallayam Krishnadas. The film stars [[Jayabharathi|Jayabharathi]], [[Sukumaran|Sukumaran]] and [[Bahadoor|Bahadoor]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[G. Devarajan|G. Devarajan]].
title: Swapname Ninakku Nandi

abstract: Onnum Onnum Pathinonnu is a [[1988|Malayalam films of 1988]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed by Ravi Gupthan and produced by Ravi Gupthan. The film stars [[Ratheesh|Ratheesh]],[[Saritha|Saritha]], [[T G Ravi|T G Ravi]], [[Madhuri|Madhuri (Tamil actress)]], [[Kuthiravattam Pappu|Kuthiravattam Pappu]] and [[Disco Shanti|Disco Shanti]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[Raveendran|Raveendran]].
title: Onnum Onnum Pathinonnu

abstract: Vida Parayaanmathram is a [[1988|Malayalam films of 1988]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed by [[PK Joseph|PK Joseph]]. The film stars [[Devan|Devan (actor)]], [[Sandhya|Sandhya (actress)]], [[Jagathy Sreekumar|Jagathy Sreekumar]] and [[Kaviyoor Ponnamma|Kaviyoor Ponnamma]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[M. K. Arjunan|M. K. Arjunan]].
title: Vida Parayaanmathram

abstract: Rahasyam Parama Rahasyam is a [[1988|Malayalam films of 1988]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed by [[PK Joseph|PK Joseph]] and produced by EK Thyagarajan. The film stars [[Ratheesh|Ratheesh]], [[Balan K Nair|Balan K Nair]], [[Seema|Seema (actress)]] and [[Shari|Shari (actress)]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[S. P. Venkatesh|S. P. Venkatesh]].
title: Rahasyam Parama Rahasyam

abstract: Mamalakalkkappurathu is a [[1988|Malayalam films of 1988]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed by Ali Akbar. The film stars [[Manoj K Jayan|Manoj K Jayan]], Anil, Elias and Kilimol in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[Mohan Sithara|Mohan Sithara]].
title: Mamalakalkkappurathu

abstract: Rowdy Ranganna is a [[1968|Kannada films of 1968]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Kannada|Kannada language]] film, directed and produced by R Ramamurthy. The film stars [[Rajkumar|Rajkumar (actor)]], Rajashankar, [[Balakrishna|Balakrishna (Kannada actor)]] and Dinesh in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[Chellapilla Satyam|Chellapilla Satyam]]. The movie is a remake of 1967 Telugu movie [[Poola Rangadu|Poola Rangadu]] which itself was based on [[A. J. Cronin|A. J. Cronin]]'s novel [[Beyond This Place|Beyond This Place]].
title: Rowdy Ranganna

abstract: Recep İvedik 4 is a 2014 Turkish comedy film directed by [[Togan Gökbakar|Togan Gökbakar]]. The title role is played by [[Şahan Gökbakar|Şahan Gökbakar]].
title: Recep İvedik 4

abstract: State Express involved a masked heroine (Sardar Akhtar) who performed several stunts, a young prince (Jayant), and his scheming uncle. The film had the basic ‘stunt’ film features, masked characters, a gorilla, two dogs Tommy and Tiger (given poster credit) and crashing trains.
title: State Express

abstract: In Her Place () is a [[Canadian|Cinema of Canada]]-[[South Korean|Cinema of South Korea]] film directed and written by [[Albert Shin|Albert Shin]]. The film premiered on September 4, 2014 in the [[Toronto International Film Festival|Toronto International Film Festival]]'s Discovery program. The film received positive reviews from critics as well as several awards.
title: In Her Place

abstract: Baby Driver is a 2017 [[action film|action film]] written and directed by [[Edgar Wright|Edgar Wright]]. It stars [[Ansel Elgort|Ansel Elgort]] as a young, musically driven [[getaway driver|getaway driver]] seeking freedom from a life of heisting with his lover Debora ([[Lily James|Lily James]]). [[Kevin Spacey|Kevin Spacey]], [[Jon Hamm|Jon Hamm]], [[Eiza González|Eiza González]], [[Jamie Foxx|Jamie Foxx]], and [[Jon Bernthal|Jon Bernthal]] (among others) appear in supporting roles. [[Eric Fellner|Eric Fellner]] and his [[Working Title Films|Working Title Films]] partner [[Tim Bevan|Tim Bevan]] produced Baby Driver alongside [[Big Talk Productions|Big Talk Productions]]' [[Nira Park|Nira Park]]. [[Sony|Sony Pictures Motion Picture Group#Sony Pictures Releasing]] and [[TriStar Pictures|TriStar Pictures]] handled commercial distribution of the film. Baby Driver was financed through a partnership between TriStar and [[Media Rights Capital|Media Rights Capital]].
title: Baby Driver

abstract: Nilalang or is a 2015 [[Filipino|Cinema of the Philippines]]-Japanese [[action|action film]] [[horror|horror film]] film directed by Pedring Lopez starring [[Cesar Montano|Cesar Montano]] and [[Maria Ozawa|Maria Ozawa]]. It is an official entry to the [[2015|2015 Metro Manila Film Festival]] [[Metro Manila Film Festival|Metro Manila Film Festival]] and it was released on December 25, 2015. Nilalang is about a local [[forensic expert|Forensics science]] who teams up with an heiress to a transnational [[organized crime syndicate|organized crime syndicate]] originating from [[Japan|Japan]].
title: Nilalang

abstract: Apne Apne ([[English|English language]]: Our Own; is a [[1987|Bollywood films of 1987]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[drama film|drama film]], produced and directed by Ramesh Behl under the Rose Movies banner. It stars [[Jeetendra|Jeetendra]], [[Hema Malini|Hema Malini]], [[Rekha|Rekha]] in the lead roles and music composed by [[R. D. Burman|R. D. Burman]]. The film is recorded as a flop at the box office.
title: Apne Apne

abstract: The First, the Last () is a Belgian-French [[drama film|drama film]] written, directed by and starring [[Bouli Lanners|Bouli Lanners]]. It was shown in the Panorama section at the [[66th Berlin International Film Festival|66th Berlin International Film Festival]]. At Berlin, it won the [[Prize of the Ecumenical Jury|Prize of the Ecumenical Jury]] and the Europa Cinemas Label. It received eight nominations at the [[7th Magritte Awards|7th Magritte Awards]], winning five, including [[Best Film|Magritte Award for Best Film]] and [[Best Director|Magritte Award for Best Director]] for Lanners.
title: The First, the Last

abstract: Ho Sakta Hai! () is a 2006 Indian [[horror film|horror film]] directed by Wilson Louis and produced by Ashok Kotwani. The film stars [[Khalid Siddiqui|Khalid Siddiqui]], [[Hazel Crowney|Hazel Crowney]], [[Victor Banerjee|Victor Banerjee]] in important roles. The film focuses on a family living their lives peacefully until they discover that they are falling prey to [[black magic|black magic]]. The film was screened in many international [[film festival|film festivals]], albeit was a "[[major flop|Box office bomb]]" at the Indian box-office.
title: Ho Sakta Hai

abstract: Anvatt is a 2014 Indian [[Marathi|Marathi language]]-language psychological thriller film.
title: Anvatt

abstract: Prema Shikharam () is a 1992 [[Telugu|Telugu film]] - [[Hindi|Hindi film]] bilingual [[romance film|romance film]] directed by Satya Gopal Ram. It was released in Hindi as Anokha Premyudh in 1994. The film stars [[Prashanth|Prashanth (actor)]], [[Mamta Kulkarni|Mamta Kulkarni]] and [[Arun Pandiyan|Arun Pandiyan]]. The music was composed by [[Manoj Saran|Manoj Gyan]]. The film was also dubbed in Tamil as Rojakkal Unakkaga.
title: Prema Shikharam

abstract: Sankoch ([[English|English language]]: Hesitation; [[Hindi|Hindi]]: संकोच) is a 1976 [[Bollywood|Bollywood]], [[drama film|drama film]], produced by R. K. Soral on Suyog Films banner and directed by [[Anil Ganguly|Anil Ganguly]]. Starring [[Jeetendra|Jeetendra]], [[Sulakshana Pandit|Sulakshana Pandit]] in the lead roles and music composed by [[Kalyanji–Anandji|Kalyanji–Anandji]]. The movie is based on the novel [[Parineeta|Parineeta (novel)]] by [[Sarat Chandra Chattopadhyay|Sarat Chandra Chattopadhyay]].
title: Sankoch

abstract: All Mistakes Buried is about a lone, struggling addict who takes on a dangerous underground criminal ring in his small Southern town to retrieve a stolen pendant he believes will save his marriage.
title: All Mistakes Buried

abstract: Trivisa is a 2016 Hong Kong [[action|Hong Kong action cinema]] [[crime thriller|crime thriller]] film produced by [[Johnnie To|Johnnie To]] and [[Yau Nai-hoi|Yau Nai-hoi]], featuring the directorial debuts of newcomers Frank Hui, Jevons Au and [[Vicky Wong|Vicky Wong Wai-Kit]]. The film is a fictionalized story about three real-life notorious Hong Kong mobsters, , [[Yip Kai Foon|Yip Kai Foon]] and [[Cheung Tze-keung|Cheung Tze-keung]], who are portrayed in the film by [[Gordon Lam|Gordon Lam]], [[Richie Jen|Richie Jen]] and [[Jordan Chan|Jordan Chan]] respectively. The film had its world premiere at the [[66th Berlin International Film Festival|66th Berlin International Film Festival]]'s Forum section. The film also opened the 40th [[Hong Kong International Film Festival|Hong Kong International Film Festival]] on 21 March 2016 and was theatrically released in Hong Kong on 7 April.
title: Trivisa

abstract: Morris from America is a 2016 American-German [[coming-of-age|coming-of-age]] [[comedy-drama film|comedy-drama film]] written and directed by [[Chad Hartigan|Chad Hartigan]], and produced by Martin Heisler, Sara Murphy, [[Adele Romanski|Adele Romanski]], and Gabriele Simon. It stars [[Craig Robinson|Craig Robinson (actor)]], Markees Christmas, [[Carla Juri|Carla Juri]], Lina Keller and [[Jakub Gierszał|Jakub Gierszał]]. It is about a 13-year-old boy who dreams of becoming a rapper in an [[EDM|electronic dance music]]-dominated culture.
title: Morris from America

abstract: Everything Will Be Okay (German: Alles wird gut) is a short film written and directed by [[Patrick Vollrath|Patrick Vollrath]].
title: Everything Will Be Okay

abstract: Bambukat is a 2016 Indian [[Punjabi-language|Punjabi language]] film directed by [[Pankaj Batra|Pankaj Batra]], written by Jass Grewal and starring [[Ammy Virk|Ammy Virk]], [[Binnu Dhillon|Binnu Dhillon]], [[Simi Chahal|Simi Chahal]] and [[Sheetal Thakur|Sheetal Thakur]] as the main cast of the film and was released worldwide on 29 July 2016. The film is set in a small village in Punjab, Channan.
title: Bambukat

abstract: Chalay Thay Saath () is a 2017 [[Pakistan|Pakistani]] [[romance film|romance film]] directed by Umer Adil with producer Beenish Umer & Executive Producer Sheikh Shiraz Mubashir starring [[Syra Shehroz|Syra Shehroz]], Osama Tahir, [[Zhalay Sarhadi|Zhalay Sarhadi]], [[Behroze Sabzwari|Behroze Sabzwari]], [[Mansha Pasha|Mansha Pasha]], Faris Khalid, Kent S. Leung, Shamim Halai and Sherbaaz Kaleem. It is executively produced by Sheikh Shiraz Mubashir. The film was released on 21 April 2017.
title: Chalay Thay Saath

abstract: Manjina There (Kannada: ಮಂಜಿನ ತೆರೆ) is a [[1980|Kannada films of 1980]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Kannada|Kannada language]] film, directed by Bangalore Nagesh and produced by K. R. Narayana Murthy. The film stars [[Srinath|Srinath]], [[Manjula|Manjula (Kannada actress)]], [[Thoogudeepa Srinivas|Thoogudeepa Srinivas]] and Dinesh in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[Upendra Kumar|Upendra Kumar]].
title: Manjina There

abstract: Pulimurugan is a 2016 Indian [[Malayalam|Malayalam]]-language [[action|Action film]] film directed by [[Vysakh|Vysakh]] and starring [[Mohanlal|Mohanlal]] in the title role. It was produced by [[Tomichan Mulakuppadam|Tomichan Mulakuppadam]] through [[Mulakuppadam Films|Mulakuppadam Films]] and was written by Udayakrishna—half of the duo [[Udayakrishna and Sibi K. Thomas|Udaykrishna–Sibi K. Thomas]]—in his first independent screenplay. The film also stars [[Kamalinee Mukherjee|Kamalinee Mukherjee]], [[Jagapati Babu|Jagapati Babu]], [[Lal|Lal (actor)]], [[Vinu Mohan|Vinu Mohan]], and [[Bala|Bala (actor)]]. The film score and soundtrack were composed by [[Gopi Sundar|Gopi Sundar]], while cinematography was handled by [[Shaji Kumar|Shaji Kumar]] and edited by [[Johnkutty|Johnkutty]].
title: Pulimurugan

abstract: Crossroads Guitar Festival 2007 is the Rhino Entertainment and Warner Brothers release to the 2007 [[Eric Clapton|Eric Clapton]] [[Crossroads Guitar Festival|Crossroads Guitar Festival]]. The concert was recorded on July 28, 2007 at the [[Toyota Park|Toyota Park]] in [[Bridgeview, Illinois|Bridgeview, Illinois]]. The recordings were released on both [[Compact Disc|Compact Disc]] and [[DVD|DVD]] on November 28, 2007 in the [[United States|United States]]. The CD and DVD releases sold more than two million copies worldwide and reached various international charts.
title: Crossroads Guitar Festival 2007

abstract: Pitch Perfect 3 is a 2017 American [[musical|Musical film]] [[comedy film|comedy film]] directed by [[Trish Sie|Trish Sie]] and written by [[Kay Cannon|Kay Cannon]] and [[Mike White|Mike White (filmmaker)]]. A sequel to [[Pitch Perfect 2|Pitch Perfect 2]] (2015), and the third installment in the [[Pitch Perfect series|Pitch Perfect (film series)]], the film stars [[Anna Kendrick|Anna Kendrick]], [[Anna Camp|Anna Camp]], [[Rebel Wilson|Rebel Wilson]], [[Brittany Snow|Brittany Snow]], [[Hailee Steinfeld|Hailee Steinfeld]], [[Hana Mae Lee|Hana Mae Lee]], [[Ester Dean|Ester Dean]], [[Chrissie Fit|Chrissie Fit]], [[Alexis Knapp|Alexis Knapp]], [[John Lithgow|John Lithgow]], [[Matt Lanter|Matt Lanter]], [[Ruby Rose|Ruby Rose]], [[Kelley Jakle|Kelley Jakle]], [[Shelley Regner|Shelley Regner]], [[Elizabeth Banks|Elizabeth Banks]], and [[John Michael Higgins|John Michael Higgins]]. The film follows the Bellas, now graduated from college, reuniting for one final performance together during an overseas [[USO|United Service Organizations]] tour.
title: Pitch Perfect 3

abstract: O Kadhal Kanmani ( Oh love, apple of my eye), also known as OK Kanmani, is a 2015 Indian [[Tamil-language|Tamil-language]] [[romantic drama film|romantic drama film]] written, directed and produced by [[Mani Ratnam|Mani Ratnam]]. The film stars [[Dulquer Salmaan|Dulquer Salmaan]] and [[Nithya Menen|Nithya Menen]] in the lead roles, portraying a young couple in a [[live-in relationship|Cohabitation in India]] in Mumbai. [[Prakash Raj|Prakash Raj]] and [[Leela Samson|Leela Samson]] play supporting roles as an older couple in the film, portraying the younger couple's landlords. The film was said to be a "reflection of the modern mindset of urban India", dealing with issues such as marriage and traditional values.
title: O Kadhal Kanmani

abstract: Anukoolakkobba Ganda is a 1990 [[India|Indian]] [[Kannada|Cinema of Karnataka]] film directed by [[M. S. Rajashekar|M. S. Rajashekar]]. The film stars [[Raghavendra Rajkumar|Raghavendra Rajkumar]] and [[Vidhyashree|Sunitha (actress)]] in lead roles. The music of the film was composed by [[Upendra Kumar|Upendra Kumar]]. The film is a remake of [[Joroo Ka Ghulam|Joroo Ka Ghulam]].
title: Anukoolakkobba Ganda

abstract: Adventures of Malia is a 2015 award-winning independent animation short film directed, animated and written by [[Shubhavi Arya|Shubhavi Arya]]. The film was completed by [[Shubhavi Arya|Shubhavi Arya]] at the age of 16 years.
title: Adventures of Malia

abstract: Buy Now, Die Later (formerly Death and Senses) is a 2015 [[Filipino|Cinema of the Philippines]] [[supernatural|supernatural]] [[psychological|Psychological horror]] [[horror suspense film|Horror Thriller]] directed by Randolph Longjas starring [[Vhong Navarro|Vhong Navarro]], [[Alex Gonzaga|Alex Gonzaga]], [[Rayver Cruz|Rayver Cruz]], [[John Lapus|John Lapus]], [[Lotlot de Leon|Lotlot de Leon]], [[TJ Trinidad|TJ Trinidad]] and [[Janine Gutierrez|Janine Gutierrez]]. It is an official entry to the [[2015 Metro Manila Film Festival|2015 Metro Manila Film Festival]].
title: Buy Now, Die Later

abstract: Just Say Hi was released on 1 July 2013 and was positively received by critics. Amber Wilkinson of Eye for Film wrote: Robbie Collins of the Daily Telegraph described the film as:
title: Just Say Hi

abstract: Anmol Moti ([[English|English language]]: Precious Pearl; [[Hindi|Hindi]]: अनमोल मोती) is a [[1969|Bollywood films of 1969]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]], [[Action film|Action film]], produced and directed by S.D. Narang on Narang Films banner. Starring [[Jeetendra|Jeetendra]], [[Babita|Babita]] in the lead roles and music composed by Ravi.
title: Anmol Moti

abstract: Sala Budha ([[Odia|Odia language]]: ଶଲା ବୁଢା English: The Stupid old man) is a 2012 released Indian regional ([[Odia language|Odia language]]) movie which won National award and acclaimed as one of the best movie by many critics.The movie is based on an ancient village story (Loka Katha).
title: Sala Budha

abstract: Mune: Guardian of the Moon ([[French|French language]]: Mune, le gardien de la lune) is a 2014 French [[3D|List of 3D films]] children's [[computer-animated|computer animation]] [[adventure|adventure film]] [[fantasy film|fantasy film]] directed by Benoît Philippon and Alexandre Heboyan and written by Jérôme Fansten and Benoît Philippon. Set in an imaginary world, this poetic tale tells the adventure of a small creature (who is the guardian of the Moon) who must recover the Sun that was stolen by his fault. The film was made in computer graphics and 3D stereoscopy, and features the voices of Michael Gregorio, [[Omar Sy|Omar Sy]] and [[Izïa Higelin|Izïa Higelin]]. The film premiered at Forum des images on 6 December 2014 and was theatrically released in France on 14 October 2015.
title: Mune: Guardian of the Moon

abstract: Justice Chaudhury is a [[1983|Bollywood films of 1983]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[Action film|Action film]], produced by G.A. Seshagiri Rao under the [[Padmalaya Studios|Padmalaya Studios]] banner, presented by [[Krishna|Krishna (Telugu actor)]] and directed by [[K. Raghavendra Rao|K. Raghavendra Rao]]. The film stars [[Jeetendra|Jeetendra]] in the titular role. It aslo stars [[Hema Malini|Hema Malini]], [[Sridevi|Sridevi]], [[Moushumi Chatterjee|Moushumi Chatterjee]], [[Raj Kiran|Raj Kiran (actor)]], [[Debashree Roy|Debashree Roy]], [[Arun Govil|Arun Govil]] and [[Shakti Kapoor|Shakti Kapoor]]. The music of the film was composed by [[Bappi Lahiri|Bappi Lahiri]]. The film is a remake of [[Telugu|Telugu language]] blockbuster movie [[Justice Chowdary|Justice Chowdary]] (1982), which also stars [[Sridevi|Sridevi]] in the same role.
title: Justice Chaudhury

abstract: Jeedar was a film released on (Eid-ul-Azha ) 1401 hijri (on Friday, October 9, 1981).
title: Jeedar

abstract: Molly's Game is a 2017 American [[biographical|biographical film]] [[crime drama film|crime drama]] written and directed by [[Aaron Sorkin|Aaron Sorkin]] (in his directorial debut), based on the memoir of the same name by [[Molly Bloom|Molly Bloom (author)]]. It stars [[Jessica Chastain|Jessica Chastain]], [[Idris Elba|Idris Elba]], [[Kevin Costner|Kevin Costner]], [[Michael Cera|Michael Cera]], [[Brian d'Arcy James|Brian d'Arcy James]], [[Chris O'Dowd|Chris O'Dowd]], [[Bill Camp|Bill Camp]], [[Graham Greene|Graham Greene (actor)]], [[Claire Rankin|Claire Rankin]], [[Joe Keery|Joe Keery]], and [[Jeremy Strong|Jeremy Strong (actor)]]. The film follows Bloom (Chastain), who becomes the target of an FBI investigation of the underground poker empire she runs for Hollywood celebrities, athletes, business tycoons, and the Russian mob.
title: Molly's Game

abstract: AmaZulu: The Children of Heaven is a 2006 [[British|United Kingdom]] [[documentary film|documentary film]] directed by [[Hannan Majid|Hannan Majid]] and Richard York. The film follows seven teenagers in a township in Umlazi as they come together to learn under the leadership of headmaster, Mr. Mtshali at Velabahleke High School.
title: AmaZulu: The Children of Heaven

abstract: Tears in the Fabric is a 2014 [[British|United Kingdom]] [[documentary film|documentary film]] directed by [[Hannan Majid|Hannan Majid]] and Richard York. The film observes the toll the [[Rana Plaza tragedy|2013 Savar building collapse]] has taken on a Bangladeshi woman named Razia Begum.
title: Tears in the Fabric

abstract: Sarvamangala is a [[1968|Kannada films of 1968]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Kannada|Kannada]] film, directed by [[Chaduranga|Chaduranga]] based on his novel of the same name. The film was produced by Doddammanni Urs. The film stars [[Rajkumar|Rajkumar (actor)]], [[K. S. Ashwath|K. S. Ashwath]], [[Kalpana|Kalpana (Kannada actress)]] and Sampath in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[Chellapilla Satyam|Chellapilla Satyam]].
title: Sarvamangala

abstract: The Blue Elephant (, [[translit.|Transliteration]]   El Fil El Azrak) is a 2014 Egyptian [[Drama|Drama]]/[[Horror|Horror film]]/[[Mystery|Mystery film]] film produced and directed by [[Marwan Hamed|Marwan Hamed]] in [[Cairo|Cairo]], [[Egypt|Egypt]]. The story was originally translated into film from an Arabic novel written by the famous Egyptian writer [[Ahmed Mourad|Ahmed Mourad]], and starring Egyptian actors Karim Abdel Aziz, Khaled El Sawy and Nelly Karim. The film talks about a man called Yehia, who voluntarily comes out of isolation after five years, to resume his service in El-Abbaseya psychiatric hospital, where he is in charge of evaluating the mental health of the criminally insane.
title: The Blue Elephant

abstract: Aagatha is a 1995 Indian [[Kannada language|Kannada language]] thriller - drama film directed by [[Suresh Heblikar|Suresh Heblikar]] and based on a novel by Dr. Ashok Pai. It was produced by Manasa Arts banner. Besides Heblikar, the film features [[Girish Karnad|Girish Karnad]], [[Shruti|Shruti (actress)]] and Srikanth in pivotal roles. The music was composed by [[Vijaya Bhaskar|Vijaya Bhaskar]].
title: Aagatha

abstract: Maze Runner: The Death Cure (also known simply as The Death Cure) is a 2018 American [[dystopian|Dystopian movies]] [[science fiction|science fiction film]] [[action film|action film]] directed by [[Wes Ball|Wes Ball]] and written by [[T.S. Nowlin|T.S. Nowlin]], based on the novel [[The Death Cure|The Death Cure]] written by [[James Dashner|James Dashner]]. It is the sequel to the 2015 film [[Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials|Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials]] and the third and final installment in the [[Maze Runner film series|Maze Runner (film series)]]. The film stars [[Dylan O'Brien|Dylan O'Brien]], [[Kaya Scodelario|Kaya Scodelario]], [[Thomas Brodie-Sangster|Thomas Brodie-Sangster]], [[Dexter Darden|Dexter Darden]], [[Nathalie Emmanuel|Nathalie Emmanuel]], [[Giancarlo Esposito|Giancarlo Esposito]], [[Aidan Gillen|Aidan Gillen]], [[Walton Goggins|Walton Goggins]], [[Ki Hong Lee|Ki Hong Lee]], [[Jacob Lofland|Jacob Lofland]], [[Katherine McNamara|Katherine McNamara]], [[Barry Pepper|Barry Pepper]], [[Will Poulter|Will Poulter]], [[Rosa Salazar|Rosa Salazar]], and [[Patricia Clarkson|Patricia Clarkson]].
title: Maze Runner: The Death Cure

abstract: Raakhandaar (Marathi: राखानदार) is a 2014 Fiction, Philosophy, Drama [[Marathi film|Marathi cinema]] directed & produced by [[Mrunalinni Patil|Mrunalinni Patil]]. It stars [[Jitendra Joshi|Jitendra Joshi]], [[Anuja Sathe|Anuja Sathe]], [[Ajinkya Deo|Ajinkya Deo]] in lead roles The film was released on 26 September 2014.
title: Raakhandaar

abstract: Igualita a mí is a 2010 Argentine [[comedy film|comedy film]] directed by Diego Kaplan and starring [[Florencia Bertotti|Florencia Bertotti]] and [[Adrián Suar|Adrián Suar]]. The film was the highest-grossing Argentine film of 2010.
title: Igualita a mí

abstract: The DC Extended Universe (DCEU) is the unofficial term used to refer to an American [[media franchise|media franchise]] and [[shared universe|shared universe]] that is centered on a [[series|film series]] of [[superhero film|superhero films]], distributed by [[Warner Bros. Pictures|Warner Bros. Pictures]] and based on characters that appear in [[American comic book|American comic books]] by [[DC Comics|DC Comics]]. The shared universe, much like the original [[DC Universe|DC Universe]] in comic books and the [[television programs|Arrowverse]], was established by [[crossing over|fictional crossover]] common plot elements, settings, cast, and characters. The films have been in production since 2011 and in that time Warner Bros. has distributed six films. The series has grossed over $4.80 billion at the global box office, currently making it the [[12th highest-grossing film franchise|List of highest-grossing franchises and film series]].
title: DC Extended Universe

abstract: In Bed with Victoria (original title: Victoria) is a 2016 French [[romantic|Romance film]] [[comedy-drama|comedy-drama]] film directed by [[Justine Triet|Justine Triet]]. It was screened in the [[International Critics' Week|International Critics' Week]] section at the [[2016 Cannes Film Festival|2016 Cannes Film Festival]]. Efira received a [[Magritte Award for Best Actress|Magritte Award for Best Actress]] at the [[7th Magritte Awards|7th Magritte Awards]] for her role in the film.
title: In Bed with Victoria

abstract: Mo Suna Pua is an [[Odia language|Odia language]] movie released in 2007. It was written and directed by Jyotipraksh Das and produced by Gyana Pattanaik starring [[Samaresh Routray|Samaresh Routray]], Snigdha Mohanty, [[Bijoy Mohanty|Bijoy Mohanty]].
title: Mo Suna Pua

abstract: Daddy's Home 2 is a 2017 American [[Christmas|Christmas films]] [[comedy film|comedy film]] directed by [[Sean Anders|Sean Anders]] and written by Anders and John Morris. A sequel to [[Daddy's Home|Daddy's Home (film)]] (2015), it stars [[Will Ferrell|Will Ferrell]], [[Mark Wahlberg|Mark Wahlberg]], [[Linda Cardellini|Linda Cardellini]], [[John Cena|John Cena]], with [[John Lithgow|John Lithgow]] and [[Mel Gibson|Mel Gibson]]. The plot follows now reformed-fathers Brad and Dusty (Ferrell and Wahlberg), now co-parenting Dusty's kids, who have to deal with their own fathers (Lithgow and Gibson) visiting for the holidays.
title: Daddy's Home 2

abstract: K3 Bengeltjes is the fourth movie with K3. It was directed by Bart Van Leemputten. It is the first movie with new member [[Josje Huisman|Josje Huisman]].
title: K3 Bengeltjes

abstract: Hamilius: Hip Hop Culture in Luxembourg is a 2010 documentary film produced and directed by independent [[Luxembourgian|Luxembourg]] film crew Antevita Films.
title: Hamilius: Hip Hop Culture in Luxembourg

abstract: Red Cobex are a gang of mothers from different Indonesian tribes and regions who act as vigilantes to protect the vulnerable and defend the weak while punishing criminals. Mama Ana (Tika Panggabean) and Yopie ([[Lukman Sardi|Lukman Sardi]]), her only child, and the Red Cobex avenge gamblers, porn DVD sellers, as well as a jewelry store owned by Albert (Edo Kondologit), Mama Ana’s remarried ex-husband. Eventually the Red Cobex gang are arrested by the police and charged. A year after the arrest, Yopie is released from prison and stays with Ramli (Irfan Hakim), his friend, and then falls in love with Astuti ([[Revalina S. Temat|Revalina S. Temat]]), but Astuti’s family doesn’t agree with their relationship due to the fact that Yopie’s mother is still imprisoned. When a theft occurs at the restaurant where they work, Yopie is accused of the crime – even by Astuti. Astuti discovers that Yopie was innocent, makes up with him and they are engaged. A riot breaks out during the engagement ceremony. Thugs employed by Mama Ana’s former husband fight the Red Cobex.
title: Red Cobex

abstract: Doctor Savithri is a 1955 Indian [[Tamil-language|Tamil language]] [[drama film|Drama (film and television)]] directed by R. M. Krishnaswamy and written by T. G. Raghavachari. A contemporary adaptation of the [[Hindu|Hindu]] story of [[Savitri and Satyavan|Savitri and Satyavan]], the film features [[Anjali Devi|Anjali Devi]] and [[B. R. Panthulu|B. R. Panthulu]] in the lead roles.
title: Doctor Savithri

abstract: The Unmarried Wife is a 2016 [[Filipino|Cinema of the Philippines]] [[romance|Romance film]] [[drama|drama]] film starring [[Angelica Panganiban|Angelica Panganiban]], [[Dingdong Dantes|Dingdong Dantes]] and [[Paulo Avelino|Paulo Avelino]]. The film is directed by [[Maryo J. de los Reyes|Maryo J. de los Reyes]] while the story is written by Keiko Aquino under the production of [[Star Cinema|Star Cinema]]. The film project marks the reunion of Angelica and Dingdong after their box-office success with [[One More Try|One More Try (film)]] (2012) with [[Angel Locsin|Angel Locsin]]. It is also Dingdong's fourth time to lead in [[Star Cinema|Star Cinema]] movies after [[Segunda Mano|Segunda Mano]] (2011), [[One More Try|One More Try (film)]] (2012) and [[She's the One|She's the One (2013 film)]] (2013).
title: The Unmarried Wife

abstract: Hang in There, Kids! ([[Atayal|Atayal language]]:Lokah Laqi, ) is a 2016 Taiwanese [[drama film|drama film]] directed by [[Laha Mebow|Laha Mebow]]. It was selected as the Taiwanese entry for the [[Best Foreign Language Film|Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film]] at the [[89th Academy Awards|89th Academy Awards]] but it was not nominated.
title: Hang in There, Kids!

abstract: Sahodari (also written as Sahodhari) (English: Sister) is a [[Tamil language|Tamil language]] film, released in 1959 with [[K. Balaji|K. Balaji]], [[Rajasulochana|Rajasulochana]], [[Prem Nazir|Prem Nazir]], [[Devika|Devika]] and [[J. P. Chandrababu|J. P. Chandrababu]] in the lead roles.
title: Sahodhari

abstract: And You Were Wonderful, On Stage is a 2016 [[musical|musical film]] film written and directed by Cally Spooner and starring [[Rhiannon Drake|Rhiannon Drake]], Jenny Minton, Piya Malik, Rebecca Thorn and Chloë Turpin. The film is based on the performance artwork of the same name, which toured internationally from 2013-15. It premiered at the [[Stedelijk Museum|Stedelijk Museum Amsterdam]] on 15 January 2016. The piece is delivered by a chorus line of women, who gossip about celebrities and the media, with text based on notes from a meeting of an advertising agency.
title: And You Were Wonderful, On Stage

abstract: Paasa Paravaigal () is 1988 [[Tamil|Tamil language]] [[Family|Family]] - [[Drama|Drama (genre)]] film was directed by [[Cochin Haneefa|Cochin Haneefa]] and produced by Murasoli Selvam. The film script were written by [[M. Karunanidhi|M. Karunanidhi]]. Music by [[Ilaiyaraaja|Ilaiyaraaja]] assets to the film. It stars [[Sivakumar|Sivakumar]], [[Lakshmi|Lakshmi (actress)]], [[Mohan|Mohan (actor)]] and [[Radhika|Raadhika]] played major role. It is the remake of [[Moonnu Masangalkku Munpu|Moonnu Masangalkku Munpu]]
title: Paasa Paravaigal

abstract: The Distinguished Citizen () is a 2016 Argentine-Spanish [[drama film|drama film]] directed by [[Gastón Duprat & Mariano Cohn|Gastón Duprat & Mariano Cohn]]. It was selected to compete for the [[Golden Lion|Golden Lion]] at the [[73rd Venice International Film Festival|73rd Venice International Film Festival]]. At Venice [[Oscar Martínez|Oscar Martínez (actor)]] won the [[Volpi Cup for Best Actor|Volpi Cup for Best Actor]]. It was selected as the Argentine entry for the [[Best Foreign Language Film|Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film]] at the [[89th Academy Awards|89th Academy Awards]] but it was not nominated. It won [[Best Ibero-American Film|Platino Award for Best Ibero-American Film]] at the [[4th Platino Awards|4th Platino Awards]].
title: The Distinguished Citizen

abstract: Le Building is a 2005 French animated short film directed by a team of final year students at [[Gobelins, l'École de l'image|Gobelins, l'École de l'image]]. The story depicts a series of [[slapstick|slapstick]] accidents that cause destruction to a three-story [[apartment complex|apartment complex]]. Le Building's team of five directors is composed of [[Pierre Perifel|Pierre Perifel]] and [[Olivier Staphylas|Olivier Staphylas]], both of whom went on to become [[Annie Award|Annie Award]]-recognized [[animators|animators]] at [[DreamWorks|DreamWorks animation]], [[Marco Nguyen|Marco Nguyen]] and [[Xavier Ramonède|Xavier Ramonède]], who have continued their careers with animation credits on various high-profile French productions (Nguyen has received an Annie Award nomination as well), and [[Rémi Zaarour|Rémi Zaarour]], who has since become a [[comic book artist|comic book artist]], published under the pseudonym [[Pozla|Pozla]].
title: Le Building

abstract: Die Beautiful is a [[Filipino|Filipinos]] [[comedy-drama|comedy-drama]] film directed by [[Jun Robles Lana|Jun Lana]] and produced by Jun Robles Lana and Ferdinand Lapuz starring [[Paolo Ballesteros|Paolo Ballesteros]].
title: Die Beautiful

abstract: Deivathin Deivam () is [[1962|List of Tamil films of 1962]] Indian, [[Tamil|Tamil language]] [[Drama|Drama (genre)]] film, written and directed by [[K. S. Gopalakrishnan|K. S. Gopalakrishnan]], with music by [[G. Ramanathan|G. Ramanathan]]. It stars [[S. S. Rajendran|S. S. Rajendran]], [[C. R. Vijayakumari|C. R. Vijayakumari]], Kumari Manimala and [[S. V. Ranga Rao|S. V. Ranga Rao]] in the lead roles.
title: Deivathin Deivam

abstract: Brawl in Cell Block 99 is a 2017 American [[action|action film]] [[thriller film|thriller film]] written, directed and [[scored|film score]] by [[S. Craig Zahler|S. Craig Zahler]]. It stars [[Vince Vaughn|Vince Vaughn]], [[Jennifer Carpenter|Jennifer Carpenter]], [[Don Johnson|Don Johnson]], [[Udo Kier|Udo Kier]], [[Marc Blucas|Marc Blucas]] and [[Tom Guiry|Tom Guiry]]. It was screened out of competition at the [[74th Venice International Film Festival|74th Venice International Film Festival]]. The film was released in theaters on October 6, 2017, and on digital HD and video on demand on October 13, 2017, by [[RLJE Films|RLJE Films]].
title: Brawl in Cell Block 99

abstract: A Kid () is a 2016 French-Canadian [[drama film|drama film]] written and directed by [[Philippe Lioret|Philippe Lioret]] and starring [[Pierre Deladonchamps|Pierre Deladonchamps]], [[Gabriel Arcand|Gabriel Arcand]] and [[Catherine de Léan|Catherine de Léan]]. It is loosely based on the book Si ce livre pouvait me rapprocher de toi by [[Jean-Paul Dubois|Jean-Paul Dubois]].
title: A Kid

abstract: Ma Su Chen aka Rebel Boxer or Bloody Struggle is a [[1972 Hong Kong film|Hong Kong films of 1972]] directed and co-written by [[Ting Shan-hsi|Ting Shan-hsi]] who also directed and wrote the film [[Furious Slaughter|Furious Slaughter]] 1972. It is a martial arts film that stars Nancy Yen, Jimmy Wang Yu, and Sally Chen. It's a sequel to Furious Slaughter 1972 in which Jimmy Wang Yu plays the lead role. It was released in Hong Kong on 14 June 1972 but in Taiwan on 30th May 1972.
title: Ma Su Chen

abstract: Can You Ever Forgive Me? is a 2018 American [[biographical|Biographical film]] [[crime drama|crime drama]] film directed by [[Marielle Heller|Marielle Heller]] and with a screenplay by [[Nicole Holofcener|Nicole Holofcener]] and [[Jeff Whitty|Jeff Whitty]], based on [[Lee Israel|Lee Israel]]'s 2008 memoir of the same name. It stars [[Melissa McCarthy|Melissa McCarthy]] as Israel and follows her as she tries to revitalize her failing writing career by forging letters from deceased authors and playwrights. It also features [[Richard E. Grant|Richard E. Grant]], [[Dolly Wells|Dolly Wells]], [[Jane Curtin|Jane Curtin]], [[Anna Deavere Smith|Anna Deavere Smith]], [[Stephen Spinella|Stephen Spinella]], and [[Ben Falcone|Ben Falcone]] in supporting roles.
title: Can You Ever Forgive Me?

abstract: The Conjuring Universe is a series of American [[horror films|horror film]] produced by [[New Line Cinema|New Line Cinema]], [[The Safran Company|The Safran Company]], [[Atomic Monster Productions|Atomic Monster Productions]] and distributed by [[Warner Bros. Pictures|Warner Bros. Pictures]].
title: The Conjuring Universe

abstract: Varaprasadham () is 1976 [[Tamil language|Tamil language]] [[drama film|Drama (film and television)]], directed by K. Narayanan and produced by Raghu, Kasthuri and Narasimman. The film dialogue and screenplay were written by K. S. Mathangan and the story was written by K. Narayanan. Music was by R. Govarthanan. The film stars [[Ravichandran|Ravichandran (actor)]], [[Jayachitra|Jayachitra]] [[Vijayakumar|Vijayakumar (actor)]] and [[M. N. Rajam|M. N. Rajam]] playing lead, with [[Major Sundararajan|Major Sundararajan]] [[S. A. Ashokan|S. A. Ashokan]] [[Manorama|Manorama (Tamil actress)]] and [[Suruli Rajan|Suruli Rajan]] in supporting roles.
title: Varaprasadham

abstract: Vinodam is a Telugu comedy film released in 1996 directed by [[S. V. Krishna Reddy|S. V. Krishna Reddy]]. K. Achi Reddy produced the film under [[Manisha Films|Manisha Films]] banner. S. V. Krishna Reddy also composed the music for this film.
title: Vinodam

abstract: Velum Mayilum Thunai () is a 1979 [[Tamil|Tamil language]] [[Hindu|Hindu]] devotional film directed and written by [[Ra. Sankaran|Ra. Sankaran]] with dialogue by Rajasekaran. The film was produced by Ra. Ma. Narayanan and Vijayalakshmi Subramaniyam. The music was composed by [[Shankar - Ganesh|Shankar - Ganesh]]. The film stars [[M. R. Radha|M. R. Radha]](dual role) and Baby Sudha.
title: Velum Mayilum Thunai

abstract: Tomthin Shija (English: My Mom & Me) is a 2017 [[Manipuri film|Manipuri film]] directed by Bobby Haobam, written by Binoranjan Oinam and produced by Geeta Konsam. The film features Maya Choudhory and Amar Mayanglambam in the titular roles. [[Soma Laishram|Soma Laishram]], Raju Nong, Sweety Wahengbam, Edhou, Indu, Shyamdhani, Dhanamanjuri are cast in the film in supporting roles. The film was released on 23 September 2017 at MSFDS (Manipur State Film Development Society), Palace Compound, Imphal and Indrani Hall, Kakching. The film was also premiered at Hindu College Auditorium, North Campus, University of Delhi, New Delhi, on 14 October 2017.
title: Tomthin Shija
