abstract: Poomaram released in 2018 Indian [[Malayalam|Malayalam]]-language [[musical|musical film]] [[drama film|drama film]] written, co-produced and directed by [[Abrid Shine|Abrid Shine]]. The film stars [[Kalidas Jayaram|Kalidas Jayaram]]. Principal photography began on 12 September 2016 in [[Ernakulam|Ernakulam]].
title: Poomaram

abstract: Resident Evil: Vendetta, known as in [[Japan|Japan]], is a 2017 Japanese [[3D-animated|Computer animation]] [[biopunk|biopunk]] [[action|Action film]]- [[horror film|horror film]] which makes part of the [[Resident Evil|Resident Evil]] franchise, set in the same universe as the associated video games (unlike [[the live-action films|Resident Evil (film series)]] starring [[Milla Jovovich|Milla Jovovich]]). The film features the characters [[Chris Redfield|Chris Redfield]], [[Leon S. Kennedy|Leon S. Kennedy]], and [[Rebecca Chambers|Rebecca Chambers (character)]]. It is the third CG movie, after [[Resident Evil: Degeneration|Resident Evil: Degeneration]] in 2008, followed by [[Resident Evil: Damnation|Resident Evil: Damnation]] in 2012, and this film marks the third with Leon as a main character.
title: Resident Evil: Vendetta

abstract: Show Dogs received largely negative reviews. A week after its release, the film came under fire when several critics and parents' groups accused it of including a scene normalizing [[child grooming|child grooming]]. As a result, the studio apologized and recut the film, re-releasing it on its second weekend in theaters. Despite all this the film was a moderate financial success, grossing $39 million against its $5 million budget.
title: Show Dogs

abstract: Prevenge is a 2016 British [[comedy|comedy film]] [[slasher film|slasher film]] written by, directed by and starring [[Alice Lowe|Alice Lowe]] in her [[directorial debut|list of directorial debuts]]. The film also stars [[Kate Dickie|Kate Dickie]], [[Kayvan Novak|Kayvan Novak]], [[Jo Hartley|Jo Hartley]], [[Gemma Whelan|Gemma Whelan]] and [[Tom Davis|Tom Davis (British actor)]]. The plot follows a pregnant widow who is convinced her unborn foetus is compelling her to embark on a killing spree as revenge for the death of her husband.
title: Prevenge

abstract: Film Stars Don't Die in Liverpool is a 2017 [[biographical|Biographical film]] [[romantic drama|romantic drama]] film directed by [[Paul McGuigan|Paul McGuigan (filmmaker)]] and starring [[Annette Bening|Annette Bening]] and [[Jamie Bell|Jamie Bell]], with a cast that includes [[Vanessa Redgrave|Vanessa Redgrave]] and [[Julie Walters|Julie Walters]]. It is based on the memoir of the same name by Peter Turner, which tells of his relationship with aging [[Academy Award-winning|Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress]] American actress [[Gloria Grahame|Gloria Grahame]] in 1970s [[Liverpool|Liverpool]] and, some years later, her death from breast cancer.
title: Film Stars Don't Die in Liverpool

abstract: White Sun or Seto Surya is a 2016 [[drama|drama]] [[war|war]] [[biographical|biographical]] film directed by [[Deepak Rauniyar|Deepak Rauniyar]]. Written by [[Deepak Rauniyar|Deepak Rauniyar]], David Barker and Produced by Joslyn Barnes, [[Danny Glover|Danny Glover]], [[Tsering Rhitar Sherpa|Tsering Rhitar Sherpa]], and [[Deepak Rauniyar|Deepak Rauniyar]], under the banner of Aadi Productions with Louverture Films, The Bertha Foundation, Doha Film Institute, The Film Kitchen, Hubert Bals Fund, Mila Productions, Netherlands Fund for Film and Worley Works. The film stars [[Dayahang Rai|Dayahang Rai]] and [[Rabindra Singh Baniya|Rabindra Singh Baniya]] in the lead roles alongside with Asha Magrati, Sumi Malla, Amrit Pariyar, Deepak Chetri and Deshbhakta Khanal. The film is based on [[Nepalese Civil War|Nepalese Civil War]]'s conflict between royalists and Maoists.
title: White Sun

abstract: Stowaways on the Ark is a 1988 German [[animated|Animation]] [[adventure film|adventure film]], released theatrically in [[Germany|Germany]] as In der Arche ist der Wurm drin by [[United International Pictures|United International Pictures]] on 24 March 1988. It's inspired by the story of [[Noah's Ark|Noah's Ark]] from the [[Book of Genesis|Book of Genesis]]. The film was later dubbed in English and released in the [[United States|United States]] and [[Canada|Canada]].
title: Stowaways on the Ark

abstract: Irresistible Love () also known as, Uncontrolled Love), is a 2016 Chinese movie starring [[Meng Rui|Meng Rui]] and [[Wang Bowen|Wang Bowen]]. The movie was directed by Sun Cheng Zhi and Meng Rui, and its novel was written by Lan Lin. The novel is also known by another name "Force Majeure".
title: Irresistible Love

abstract: Confidential Assignment (; lit. Cooperation) is a 2017 [[South Korean|Cinema of Korea]] [[action film|action film]] directed by [[Kim Sung-hoon|Kim Sung-hoon (director)]]. It stars [[Hyun Bin|Hyun Bin]], [[Yoo Hae-jin|Yoo Hae-jin]] and [[Kim Joo-hyuk|Kim Joo-hyuk]].
title: Confidential Assignment

abstract: Valobasha Emoni Hoy () is the first directorial venture for model and actress [[Tania Ahmed|Tania Ahmed]] and produced by Faridur Reza Sagar under the banner of Impress Telefilm Limited. [[Irfan Sazzad|Irfan Sazzad]] makes his debut as film actor in this movie with prominent actress, [[Bidya Sinha Saha Mim|Bidya Sinha Saha Mim]], will be seen as the lead actress with [[Mishu Sabbir|Mishu Sabbir]], and [[Tariq Anam Khan|Tariq Anam Khan]].
title: Valobasha Emoni Hoy

abstract: Loev (pronounced love) is a 2015 Indian [[romantic|romance film]] [[drama film|Drama (film and television)]] written and directed by [[Sudhanshu Saria|Sudhanshu Saria]]. Produced by Saria and Bombay Berlin Film Productions, the film stars Dhruv Ganesh and [[Shiv Pandit|Shiv Pandit]] as two friends who set off to the [[Western Ghats|Western Ghats]] for a weekend trip and focuses on their complex emotional and sexual relationship. It was Ganesh's final film role as he died from [[tuberculosis|tuberculosis]] prior to the production's release. Loev also features [[Siddharth Menon|Siddharth Menon]] and Rishabh Chaddha in supporting roles. The film's title is a [[deliberate misspelling|Sensational spelling]] of the word "love".
title: Loev

abstract: HyperNormalisation is a 2016 [[BBC|BBC]] documentary by British filmmaker [[Adam Curtis|Adam Curtis]]. It argues that governments, financiers, and [[technological utopians|technological utopians]] have, since the 1970s, given up on the complex "real world" and built a simpler "fake world" run by corporations and kept stable by politicians. The film was released on 16 October 2016 on the [[BBC iPlayer|BBC iPlayer]].
title: HyperNormalisation

abstract: Mirror Game is an Indian psychological thriller film written and directed by Vijit Sharma and produced by Rahula Kochar under the for Icelerate Films. The film was released by [[PVR Pictures|PVR Pictures]] on 2 June 2017. The film stars [[Parvin Dabas|Parvin Dabas]], [[Pooja Batra|Pooja Batra]] and [[Omi Vaidya|Omi Vaidya]] in lead roles.
title: Mirror Game

abstract: Glass Garden (Korean: 유리정원) is a 2017 South Korean [[mystery|mystery film]] [[drama film|drama film]] directed by [[Shin Su-won|Shin Su-won]]. The film stars [[Moon Geun-young|Moon Geun-young]], [[Kim Tae-hoon|Kim Tae-hoon (actor)]], Seo Tae-hwa, Lim Jung-woon and [[Park Ji-soo|Park Ji-soo (actress)]].
title: Glass Garden

abstract: Eena Meena Deeka is a [[1994|Bollywood films of 1994]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[comedy film|comedy film]] directed by [[David Dhawan|David Dhawan]] and produced by Nitin Manmohan. It stars [[Vinod Khanna|Vinod Khanna]], [[Rishi Kapoor|Rishi Kapoor]] and [[Juhi Chawla|Juhi Chawla]] in pivotal roles. The story line is similar to the 1989 movie [[Three Fugitives|Three Fugitives]].
title: Eena Meena Deeka

abstract: Dagudu Moothalu () is a 1964 [[Telugu-language|Telugu language]] [[comedy film|comedy film]] produced by D. B. Narayana and directed by [[Adurthi Subba Rao|Adurthi Subba Rao]], who also wrote the screenplay. Based on a story by [[Mullapudi Venkata Ramana|Mullapudi Venkata Ramana]], it stars [[N. T. Rama Rao|N. T. Rama Rao]], [[B. Saroja Devi|B. Saroja Devi]] in the lead roles. In Dagudu Moothalu, the distant relatives of an ailing man attempt to usurp his wealth, while making sure that his grandson, the rightful heir, does not inherit the said wealth.
title: Dagudu Moothalu

abstract: Alifu, the Prince/ss is a 2017 Taiwanese [[drama film|drama film]] directed by Wang Yu-lin. It premiered at the 30th [[Tokyo International Film Festival|Tokyo International Film Festival]].
title: Alifu, the Prince/ss

abstract: Love Means Zero is a 2017 American [[documentary film|documentary film]] directed by Jason Kohn about tennis coach [[Nick Bollettieri|Nick Bollettieri]] and his troubled relationship with [[Andre Agassi|Andre Agassi]].
title: Love Means Zero

abstract: The Ex-File 3: The Return of the Exes (), also known as Ex-File 3, is a 2017 Chinese [[romantic comedy|romantic comedy]] film directed by Tian Yusheng and is a sequel to the 2014 film [[Ex-Files|Ex-Files]] and 2015 film [[Ex-Files 2|Ex-Files 2]].
title: The Ex-File 3: The Return of the Exes

abstract: Funny Story is a 2018 tragi-comedy, directed by Michael J. Gallagher and co-written by Gallagher and Steve Greene. Starring [[Matthew Glave|Matthew Glave]], [[Emily Bett Rickards|Emily Bett Rickards]] and Jana Winternitz. The film premiered as an official selection at the 2018 [[Slamdance Film Festival|Slamdance Film Festival]] on January 21, 2018.
title: Funny Story

abstract: Vee Beyvafa is a 2016 Maldivian [[romantic film|romantic film]] directed by Ibrahim Wisan. Produced by Ahmed Shah and Hussain Munawwar under Sunshine Production, the film stars [[Niuma Mohamed|Niuma Mohamed]], [[Yoosuf Shafeeu|Yoosuf Shafeeu]], [[Zeenath Abbas|Zeenath Abbas]], Abdulla Muaz and [[Fathimath Fareela|Fathimath Fareela]] in pivotal roles. The film was released on 18 October 2016.
title: Vee Beyvafa

abstract: Gonjiam: Haunted Asylum () is a 2018 South Korean [[found footage|Found footage (film technique)]] [[horror film|horror film]] directed by Jung Bum-shik.
title: Gonjiam: Haunted Asylum

abstract: The Villainess is a 2017 South Korean [[action film|action film]] directed by [[Jung Byung-gil|Jung Byung-gil]], starring [[Kim Ok-bin|Kim Ok-bin]]. The film had its world premiere at the [[70th Cannes Film Festival|70th Cannes Film Festival]] in May 2017.
title: The Villainess

abstract: The Discloser is a 2017 South Korean [[thriller film|thriller film]] directed by Hong Ki-seon. The film stars [[Kim Sang-kyung|Kim Sang-kyung]], [[Kim Ok-bin|Kim Ok-bin]], [[Choi Moo-sung|Choi Moo-sung]] and Choi Gwi-hwa.
title: The Discloser

abstract: Jalachhayam is a 2010 Indian [[Malayalam-language|Malayalam]] [[Experimental film|Experimental film]], produced and directed by [[Sathish Kalathil|Sathish Kalathil]] under the banner of The People's Films. The story was written by Sujith Aalungal and describes the warm relationship between a village man and an artist ([[painter|painter]]) from the city. The film was shot entirely on a [[mobile phone camera|Camera phone]] which turn out to be a touchstone in the world film history, [[Nokia N95|Nokia N95]] Music edition (8gb internal memory with 5 [[megapixel|megapixel]] [[resolution|Image resolution]]) mobile phone was entirely used without assistance of traditional or outside camera lenses to film.[1][2][3]
title: Jalachhayam

abstract: Mwdwi([[Bodo|Bodo language]]: मोदै) is a 2016 [[Indian|India]] [[Bodo language|Bodo language]] [[teen comedy|teen comedy]] film based on [[Bodo culture|Bodo culture]]. The film is written, directed by Michael Mushahary and Produced by Arya Basumatary from Simen Capari under the banner of [[Arya Production Presents|Arya Production Presents]]. It is the second film directed by Michael Mushahary in Bodo film industry. The film stars Jwngsar Basumatary and Rinki Brahma in the lead roles. Premjit Goyary, Peterson Brahma and Birphung Mohilary as supporting roles in the film. It was released on 7 September 2016 simultaneously at [[Chirang|Chirang district]], [[Kokrajhar|Kokrajhar]], [[Baksa|Baksa district]], [[Udalguri|Udalguri]].
title: Mwdwi

abstract: Surangathan (T. R. Mahalingam) is a prince who hates women because of his father's bitter experience with women. Mayavathi (Anjali Devi) is a princess for whose pleasure her father creates lake with silver fish and pretty flowers. When Surangathan goes of hunting, he meets Mayavathi and they both fall in love with each other. There is a barber who puts on many disguises to win the love of the princess. Surangathan leaves Mayavathi saying he hates women. But Mayavathi vows to get him. How she does it forms the rest of the story.
title: Mayavathi

abstract: Marlina the Murderer in Four Acts () is a 2017 Indonesian [[drama film|drama film]] directed by Mouly Surya and written by Surya and Rama Adi, based on a story conceived by [[Garin Nugroho|Garin Nugroho]]. The film has been described as a "Satay Western", combining aspects of the feminist Western genre with an Indonesian setting. It was screened in the [[Directors' Fortnight|Directors' Fortnight]] section at the [[2017 Cannes Film Festival|2017 Cannes Film Festival]]. The song "Lazuardi" from the soundtrack is composed and performed by Jakarta indie rock band [[Efek Rumah Kaca|Efek Rumah Kaca]]. It was selected as the Indonesian entry for the [[Best Foreign Language Film|Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film]] at the [[91st Academy Awards|91st Academy Awards]], but it was not nominated.
title: Marlina the Murderer in Four Acts

abstract: This Is Not What I Expected () is a 2017 [[romantic comedy|romantic comedy]] film directed by Derek Hui and produced by [[Peter Chan|Peter Chan]], starring [[Zhou Dongyu|Zhou Dongyu]] and [[Takeshi Kaneshiro|Takeshi Kaneshiro]]. It is adapted from the novel Finally I Get You written by Lan Bai Se. The film was released on April 27, 2017.
title: This Is Not What I Expected

abstract: The Yuppie Fantasia is a 1989 Hong Kong [[comedy film|comedy film]] written and directed by [[Gordon Chan|Gordon Chan]], and storied, produced by and starring [[Lawrence Cheng|Lawrence Cheng]] based on the hit radio series of the same name created by Cheng and Chan Hing-ka for [[RTHK|RTHK]] in 1986 which also starred Cheng. The film was followed by two sequels, titled [[Brief Encounter in Shinjuku|Brief Encounter in Shinjuku]] released in 1990, and [[The Yuppie Fantasia 3|The Yuppie Fantasia 3]] released in 2017.
title: The Yuppie Fantasia

abstract: Fathis Handhuvaruge Feshun 3D is a 2013 Maldivian romantic horror film directed by Ali Shifau. Produced by Mohamed Ali under Dark Rain Entertainment, the film stars [[Yoosuf Shafeeu|Yoosuf Shafeeu]], [[Fathimath Fareela|Fathimath Fareela]] and [[Ahmed Nimal|Ahmed Nimal]] in pivotal roles. The film was released on 4 April 2013. It serves as a prequel to Fathishandhuvaru (1997) which starred [[Reeko Moosa Manik|Reeko Moosa Manik]] and [[Niuma Mohamed|Niuma Mohamed]] in lead roles. It also celebrates the first 3D Maldivian film released in the cinema.
title: Fathis Handhuvaruge Feshun 3D

abstract: Bathtubs Over Broadway is a 2018 American [[documentary film|documentary film]] directed by Dava Whisenant. Comedy writer [[Steve Young|Steve Young (writer)]]’s assignment to scour bargain-bin vinyl for a Late Night segment becomes an unexpected, decades-spanning obsession when he stumbles upon the strange and hilarious world of [[industrial musical|industrial musicals]]. The film premiered at the [[2018 Tribeca Film Festival|Tribeca Film Festival]] and was released on November 30, 2018 by [[Focus World|Focus Features]].
title: Bathtubs Over Broadway

abstract: Heyonuvaane is a 2010 drama film directed by [[Yoosuf Shafeeu|Yoosuf Shafeeu]]. Written and produced by Fathimath Nahula under Crystal Entertainment, the film stars [[Yoosuf Shafeeu|Yoosuf Shafeeu]], [[Fathimath Fareela|Fathimath Fareela]] and [[Sheela Najeeb|Sheela Najeeb]] in pivotal roles. The film was released on 28 December 2010.
title: Heyonuvaane

abstract: Miss Baek () is a 2018 South Korean [[drama film|drama film]] directed by Lee Ji-won and starring [[Han Ji-min|Han Ji-min]], Kim Si-a, and [[Lee Hee-joon|Lee Hee-joon]]. The film was released in South Korea on October 11, 2018.
title: Miss Baek

abstract: Dhilakani is a 2013 Maldivian romantic thriller film directed by Hussain Munawwar. Produced under Antharees Production, the film stars [[Ismail Rasheed|Ismail Rasheed]], [[Niuma Mohamed|Niuma Mohamed]], [[Mohamed Manik|Mohamed Manik]], [[Aminath Rishfa|Aminath Rishfa]] and Mohamed Faisal in pivotal roles. The film was released on 27 May 2013.
title: Dhilakani

abstract: Kuhveriakee Kaakuhey? is a 2011 Maldivian romantic horror film directed by Aishath Ali Manik. Produced by Abdul Hannan Moosa Didi under UR3A Production, the film stars [[Ahmed Azmeel|Ahmed Azmeel]], [[Aishath Rishmy|Aishath Rishmy]] and Sheereen Abdul Wahid in pivotal roles. The film was released on 17 May 2011. Upon release, the film received negative response from critics and was declared a flop at box office.
title: Kuhveriakee Kaakuhey?

abstract: Insaana is a 2014 Maldivian psychological thriller film directed by [[Ali Seezan|Ali Seezan]]. Produced by Ahmed Shizan and Seezan under C-Xanal Movies, the film stars [[Ali Seezan|Ali Seezan]], [[Aishath Rishmy|Aishath Rishmy]] and [[Fathimath Fareela|Fathimath Fareela]] in pivotal roles. The film was released on 21 September 2014.
title: Insaana

abstract: Mr. Rossi Looks for Happiness (in Italian Il signor Rossi cerca la felicità) is a 1976 [[traditionally animated|traditional animation]] Italian feature film directed by [[Bruno Bozzetto|Bruno Bozzetto]]. Is the first feature film of [[Mr. Rossi|Mr. Rossi]].
title: Mr. Rossi Looks for Happiness

abstract: Sadan miekan mies, direct translation "man of a hundred swords", is a Finnish historical adventure comedy movie from 1951 directed by Ilmari Unhola. The movie takes place in the 1630s in the Finnish county Varsinais-Suomi, and tells the story of a heroic swordsman on an assignment from the king. On their journey the swordsman and he's partner encounter foes and damsels. The movie was first televised on 7.3.1964.
title: Sadan miekan mies

abstract: The Heart of Jenin is a 2008 documentary film written and directed by [[Marcus Vetter|Marcus Vetter]] and Leon Geller. The film tells the story of Ismael Khatib from [[Jenin|Jenin]], a Palestinian whose son was shot by Israeli soldiers. Instead of seeking revenge, he donated his son's organs to Israeli children. In April 2010, The Heart of Jenin won the [[German Film Award|German Film Award]] for [[Best Documentary Film|German Film Award for Best Documentary_Film]]. The film also served as a springboard for the project [[Cinema Jenin|Cinema Jenin]].
title: The Heart of Jenin

abstract: The Witch: Part 1. The Subversion () is a 2018 South Korean [[mystery|mystery film]] [[action film|action film]] written and directed by [[Park Hoon-jung|Park Hoon-jung]]
title: The Witch: Part 1. The Subversion

abstract: Janaadhipan () is an upcoming Indian [[Malayalam|Malayalam]]-language [[political thriller|political thriller]] film written and directed by Thanseer M A, starring [[Hareesh Peradi|Hareesh Peradi]], [[Vinu Mohan|Vinu Mohan]] and Anil Nedumangad in the lead roles.. The music is composed by [[Mejo Joseph|Mejo Joseph]]. The film began production in January 2018.
title: Janaadhipan

abstract: Jindua is [[family|Family film]] film directed by [[Navaniat Singh|Navaniat Singh]] starring [[Jimmy Sheirgill|Jimmy Sheirgill]], [[Neeru Bajwa|Neeru Bajwa]] & [[Sargun Mehta|Sargun Mehta]] in lead roles. Film was released on 17 March 2017.
title: Jindua

abstract: Bulbul Can Sing is a 2018 [[Assamese language|Assamese language]] Indian [[drama film|drama film]] directed by [[Rima Das|Rima Das]]. It was screened in the Contemporary World Cinema section at the [[2018 Toronto International Film Festival|2018 Toronto International Film Festival]]. The film centres on three teenagers trying to come to terms with their sexual identities.
title: Bulbul Can Sing

abstract: Aadheys is a 2014 Maldivian family drama film directed by Abdul Fattah. Written and produced by Hassan Ali under Dash Studio, the film stars [[Niuma Mohamed|Niuma Mohamed]], Hussain Sobah, [[Amira Ismail|Amira Ismail]], Moosa Zakariyya and [[Fathimath Azifa|Fathimath Azifa]] in pivotal roles. The film was released on 1 October 2014. Filming took place in [[R. Ungoofaaru|Ungoofaaru]] simultaneously with director's romantic film [[Love Story|Love Story (2012 film)]] (2012). Filming was completed on 6 September 2011 and spent 25 days for shooting.
title: Aadheys

abstract: Burn the Stage: The Movie () is a film documenting the behind the scenes of South Korean [[boy band|boy band]] [[BTS|BTS (band)]]' 2017 [[The Wings Tour|2017 BTS Live Trilogy Episode III: The Wings Tour]] that drew in more than half a million fans in 19 different cities around the world. It is directed by Park Jun Soo and produced by Yoon Jiwon. It was released on November 15, 2018, and its distribution was handled by Trafalgar Releasing.
title: Burn the Stage: The Movie

abstract: Hiyani is a 2006 Maldivian revenge thriller film written and directed by [[Ahmed Nimal|Ahmed Nimal]]. Produced by Mohamed Abdulla under Dhekedheke Ves Productions, the film stars [[Niuma Mohamed|Niuma Mohamed]], [[Ravee Farooq|Ravee Farooq]], [[Ahmed Nimal|Ahmed Nimal]] and [[Lufshan Shakeeb|Lufshan Shakeeb]] in pivotal roles. Shooting of the film took place in [[R. Inguraidhoo|Inguraidhoo]] and [[R. Maduvvaree|Maduvvaree (Raa Atoll)]].
title: Hiyani

abstract: The Tag-Along (紅衣小女孩) is a 2015 Taiwanese [[horror film|horror film]] directed by [[Cheng Wei-hao|Cheng Wei-hao]] and adapted from a well-known Taiwanese urban legend, "The Little Girl in Red". The film received funding from Taiwan's [[Bureau of Audiovisual and Music Industry Development|Bureau of Audiovisual and Music Industry Development]] and stars [[Hsu Wei-ning|Hsu Wei-ning]], [[River Huang|River Huang]] and Liu Yin-shang. The film was released in Taiwan on November 27, 2015, and was screened at the [[Bucheon International Fantastic Film Festival|Bucheon International Fantastic Film Festival]] and the 2015 [[Golden Horse Film Festival|Golden Horse Film Festival]] as the closing film. It received four nominations at the 53rd [[Golden Horse Awards|Golden Horse Awards]].
title: The Tag-Along

abstract: The Ballad of Buster Scruggs is a 2018 American [[western|Western (genre)]] [[anthology|anthology film]] [[comedy film|comedy film]] written, directed, and produced by the [[Coen brothers|Coen brothers]]. It stars [[Tim Blake Nelson|Tim Blake Nelson]], [[Liam Neeson|Liam Neeson]], [[James Franco|James Franco]], [[Brendan Gleeson|Brendan Gleeson]], [[Zoe Kazan|Zoe Kazan]], [[Tyne Daly|Tyne Daly]], [[Harry Melling|Harry Melling (actor)]], and [[Tom Waits|Tom Waits]], and features six vignettes that take place in the [[American frontier|American frontier]]. The film premiered at the [[75th Venice International Film Festival|75th Venice International Film Festival]] on August 31, 2018, where it won the [[Golden Osella Award for Best Screenplay|Golden Osella]]. After a limited theatrical run beginning on November 9, 2018, it was released on [[Netflix|Netflix]] on November 16. The [[National Board of Review|National Board of Review]] named it as one of its [[top ten best films of 2018|National Board of Review: Top Ten Films]].
title: The Ballad of Buster Scruggs

abstract: Outlaw King is a 2018 [[historical|historical film]] [[action|Action film]] [[drama|Drama (film and television)]] film about [[Robert the Bruce|Robert the Bruce]], the 14th-century Scottish lord who launched a [[guerilla war|Guerrilla warfare]] against the larger English army. It was co-written, produced, and directed by [[David Mackenzie|David Mackenzie (director)]]. It stars [[Chris Pine|Chris Pine]], [[Aaron Taylor-Johnson|Aaron Taylor-Johnson]], [[Florence Pugh|Florence Pugh]], [[Billy Howle|Billy Howle]], [[Tony Curran|Tony Curran]], [[Callan Mulvey|Callan Mulvey]], [[Stephen Dillane|Stephen Dillane]], and Alan Cooney.
title: Outlaw King

abstract: All You Can Eat Buddha () is a 2017 Canadian film directed by [[Ian Lagarde|Ian Lagarde]]. It was screened in the Discovery section at the [[2017 Toronto International Film Festival|2017 Toronto International Film Festival]]. The film centres on Mike, a mysterious guest at a vacation resort in [[Cuba|Cuba]] who appears to have the ability to perform miracles.
title: All You Can Eat Buddha

abstract: Midnight Runners () is a 2017 [[South Korean|South Korean film]] [[action|action film]] [[comedy|Comedy film]] film directed by [[Jason Kim|Jason Kim (director)]] (Kim Ju-hwan) and starring [[Park Seo-joon|Park Seo-joon]] and [[Kang Ha-neul|Kang Ha-neul]]. The film was released on August 9, 2017.
title: Midnight Runners

abstract: Dirty, Yellow, Darkness (also known as Premaya Nam in Sri Lanka and certain Asian countries) () is a 2017 Sri Lankan [[drama|drama]] film written and directed by Kalpana Ariyawansha and Vindana Ariyawansha. Produced by Kalpana Ariyawansha (under his banner East West Entertainment), Prem Dissanayake, Athula Mahawalage, and Sujeewa Wijesinghe. The film stars Shyam Fernando, Samanalee Fonseka in lead roles along with Suranga Ranawaka, Buddhadasa Vithanarachchi and Sathis Wijemanne in supportive roles. It is the 1270th Sri Lankan film in the [[Sinhala cinema|Cinema of Sri Lanka]].
title: Premaya Nam

abstract: Aav Taru Kari Nakhu is a 2017 Gujarati comedy film Produced by Vikas Verma & Sunny Agrawal, Directed by Rrahul Mevawala, Creative supervision and edited by Imtiaz Alam. The film stars [[Tiku Talsania|Tiku Talsania]], [[Amar Upadhyay|Amar Upadhyay]], Aditya Kapadia, [[Monal Gajjar|Monal Gajjar]], [[Tanvi Thakkar|Tanvi Thakkar]], Manisha Kanojia, Tapan bhatt and Vikas Verma. Amar Upadhyay, who formerly played the role of ‘Mihir’ in [[Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi|Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi]] TV show marks his debut in the Gujarati Film Industry with this film.
title: Aav Taru Kari Nakhu

abstract: Duck Butter is an 2018 American [[experimental|experimental film]] [[comedy film|comedy film]] directed by [[Miguel Arteta|Miguel Arteta]], from a screenplay by Arteta and [[Alia Shawkat|Alia Shawkat]]. It stars Shawkat, [[Laia Costa|Laia Costa]], [[Mae Whitman|Mae Whitman]], [[Hong Chau|Hong Chau]] and [[Kate Berlant|Kate Berlant]].
title: Duck Butter

abstract: A Better Tomorrow 2018 (), alternatively known as A Better Tomorrow 4, is a Chinese [[action film|action film]] directed by [[Ding Sheng|Ding Sheng (director)]], starring [[Wang Kai|Wang Kai (actor)]], [[Ma Tianyu|Ma Tianyu]], [[Wang Talu|Wang Talu]], Yu Ailei, [[Lam Suet|Lam Suet]] and [[Wu Yue|Wu Yue (actor)]]. In this remake of John Woo’s 1986 classic, director Ding Sheng delivers a similar story but with a different setting. Filming took place in a seaside location in the Northern Chinese city of Qingdao, and Japan.
title: A Better Tomorrow 2018

abstract: A Maharshi (sage) blesses King Vikramasenan and Queen Saudamini to beget a child. The queen becomes pregnant. But the king is lured by the court dancer and he neglects the queen. The minister advises the queen to drive away the court dancer from the country. But the court dancer sows seeds of doubt in the king's mind that the queen is having an affair with the minister. So, the king orders the minister to be executed and sends the queen to the forest. The queen delivers a son, Udhayasenan, in the forest and he is growing up. In the meantime, the court dancer and her paramour, the commander blinds the king and take over the administration. Hearing this, the queen sends her son to get his father freed and regain the Kingdom. On his way, the prince meets princess Hemavathi and they fall in love with each other. The son defeats the commander and recaptures the Kingdom. The king's eyesight is restored with the help of an angel. The family is united.
title: Saudamini

abstract: Kadavulin Kuzhandhai () is a [[1960|List of Tamil films of 1960]] Indian, [[Tamil language|Tamil language]] film directed by Dada Mirasi. The film featured [[Kalyan Kumar|Kalyan Kumar]] and [[Jamuna|Jamuna (actress)]] in the lead roles. The film was based on 1960 Hollywood film Nobody's Child.
title: Kadavulin Kuzhandhai

abstract: Ek Kali Muskai is a [[1968|Bollywood films of 1968]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] drama film starring [[Ashok Kumar|Ashok Kumar]], Meera Joglekar and Joy Mukherjee in the lead roles. The music album was composed by maestro Madan Mohan while Lata Mangeshkar's song "Na Tum Bewafa Ho" became one of the most popular songs.
title: Ek Kali Muskai

abstract: Professor Marston and the Wonder Women is a 2017 American [[biographical|biographical film]] [[drama|Drama (film and television)]] film about American psychologist [[William Moulton Marston|William Moulton Marston]], who created the fictional character [[Wonder Woman|Wonder Woman]]. The film, directed and written by [[Angela Robinson|Angela Robinson]], stars [[Luke Evans|Luke Evans (actor)]] as Marston, [[Rebecca Hall|Rebecca Hall]] as his legal wife [[Elizabeth|Elizabeth Holloway Marston]] and [[Bella Heathcote|Bella Heathcote]] as the Marstons' [[polyamorous|Polyamory]] [[life partner|Significant other]], [[Olive Byrne|Olive Byrne]]. [[JJ Feild|JJ Feild]], [[Oliver Platt|Oliver Platt]] and [[Connie Britton|Connie Britton]] also star.
title: Professor Marston and the Wonder Women

abstract: Siphayo (English: Dismay) is a 2016 Philippine [[erotic thriller|erotic thriller]] [[independent film|independent film]] directed by [[Joel Lamangan|Joel Lamangan]], and starring [[Luis Alandy|Luis Alandy]], [[Joem Bascon|Joem Bascon]], and [[Nathalie Hart|Nathalie Hart]].
title: Siphayo

abstract: Life, Animated is a 2016 American documentary by director [[Roger Ross Williams|Roger Ross Williams]]. It is co-produced by Williams with [[Julie Goldman|Julie Goldman (producer)]], Carolyn Hepburn and Christopher Clements. Life, Animated is based on journalist [[Ron Suskind|Ron Suskind]]'s 2014 book Life, Animated: A Story of Sidekicks, Heroes, and Autism, which tells the story of his son, Owen Suskind who struggled with [[autism|autism]] and learned how to communicate with the outside world through his love of [[Disney films|Disney films]].
title: Life, Animated

abstract: Night Is Short, Walk On Girl (夜は短し歩けよ乙女 Yoru wa Mijikashi Aruke yo Otome; alternately titled The Night Is Short, Walk On Girl in North America), is a Japanese [[animated|Anime]] [[romantic comedy|romantic comedy]] film directed by [[Masaaki Yuasa|Masaaki Yuasa]]. The film is based on the novel of the same name written by [[Tomihiko Morimi|Tomihiko Morimi]] and illustrated by [[Yūsuke Nakamura|Yūsuke Nakamura (illustrator)]], who also serves as the film's original character designer.
title: Night Is Short, Walk On Girl

abstract: Kongunattu Thangam is the story of a young woman named Thangam and her boy friend Rajavel rescuing Muthurathina Boopathy, [[Zamindar|Zamindar]] of Kongu Naadu, from the clutches of his concubine Amutha and uniting the Zamindar with his wife.
title: Kongunattu Thangam

abstract: Hanna-Barbera Educational Filmstrips is a series of [[animated|animation]] [[filmstrip|filmstrips]] of educational material produced by [[Hanna-Barbera Productions|Hanna-Barbera]]' education division. The series ran from 1978 to 1980 for a total of 26 titles and featured the studio's popular cartoon characters: [[The Flintstones|The Flintstones]], [[Yogi Bear|Yogi Bear]], [[The Jetsons|The Jetsons]], [[Scooby-Doo|Scooby-Doo (character)]], [[The Banana Splits|The Banana Splits]], [[Jabberjaw|Jabberjaw]] and [[Around the World Kids|Cattanooga Cats#Around the World in 79 Days]].
title: Hanna-Barbera Educational Filmstrips

abstract: Sesh Chithi is a Bengali drama film directed by Tanmoy Roy for D.Sudhir Productions. The music is directed by Sudhir Dutta. The film is about a handful of cunning family members who plan to take over a [[Zamindar|Zamindar]] bari after the death of the patriarch. [[Soumitra Chatterjee|Soumitra Chatterjee]] was felicitated on the sets for receiving [[Légion d'honneur|Legion of Honour]]. [[Soumitra Chatterjee|Soumitra Chatterjee]] and [[Lily Chakravarty|Lily Chakravarty]] will be seen in the film after the great success of [[Posto|Posto (film)]].
title: Sesh Chithi

abstract: The Cakemaker (in [[Hebrew|Modern Hebrew]] האופה מברלין haOfeh miBerlin) is a 2017 Israeli-German [[drama|drama]] film directed by Ofir Raul Grazier. It stars [[Sarah Adler|Sarah Adler]], Tim Kalkhof, [[Zohar Strauss|Zohar Strauss]] and Roy Miller.
title: The Cakemaker

abstract: Finding Kukan is a 2016 feature-length documentary investigating the story of Chinese Hawaii-born producer [[Li Ling-Ai|Li Ling-Ai]], the female co-producer of the film [[Kukan|Kukan]] (1941).
title: Finding Kukan

abstract: E Dharifulhu is a 2009 Maldivian drama film directed by [[Ahmed Nimal|Ahmed Nimal]]. Produced by Yoosuf Shafeeu under Eupe Productions in collaboration with Future TV and Mai Dream Entertainments, the film stars [[Yoosuf Shafeeu|Yoosuf Shafeeu]], [[Niuma Mohamed|Niuma Mohamed]], [[Mohamed Manik|Mohamed Manik]], [[Sheela Najeeb|Sheela Najeeb]] and [[Ahmed Nimal|Ahmed Nimal]] in pivotal roles.
title: E Dharifulhu

abstract: Ginihila is a 2003 Maldivian [[horror film|horror film]] directed by Easa Shareef. Produced under EMA Productions, the film stars [[Ali Seezan|Ali Seezan]], [[Mariyam Nisha|Mariyam Nisha]], [[Reeko Moosa Manik|Reeko Moosa Manik]] and [[Niuma Mohamed|Niuma Mohamed]] in pivotal roles. The film is an unofficial remake of [[Vikram Bhatt|Vikram Bhatt]]'s [[Indian|Bollywood]] [[horror film|horror film]] [[Raaz|Raaz (2002 film)]] (2002) featuring [[Bipasha Basu|Bipasha Basu]], [[Dino Morea|Dino Morea]], [[Malini Sharma|Malini Sharma]] and [[Ashutosh Rana|Ashutosh Rana]] which itself is an unofficial adaptation of [[What Lies Beneath|What Lies Beneath]].
title: Ginihila

abstract: Yoosuf is a 2008 Maldivian romantic drama film written and directed by Fathimath Nahula. Produced under Crystal Entertainment, the film stars [[Yoosuf Shafeeu|Yoosuf Shafeeu]], [[Niuma Mohamed|Niuma Mohamed]], [[Sheela Najeeb|Sheela Najeeb]], [[Mohamed Manik|Mohamed Manik]], Ahmed Nimal and Ahmed Lais Asim in pivotal roles.
title: Yoosuf

abstract: Our Struggles () is a 2018 Belgian-French [[comedy-drama film|comedy-drama film]] directed by [[Guillaume Senez|Guillaume Senez]]. It was screened in the [[International Critics' Week|International Critics' Week]] section at the [[2018 Cannes Film Festival|2018 Cannes Film Festival]]. It received seven nominations at the [[9th Magritte Awards|9th Magritte Awards]], including [[Best Film|Magritte Award for Best Film]] and [[Best Director|Magritte Award for Best Director]] for Guillaume Senez.
title: Our Struggles

abstract: At the [[74th Academy Awards|74th Academy Awards]], the film was nominated for eight [[Oscars|Academy Award]], including [[Best Picture|Academy Award for Best Picture]] and [[Best Actress|Academy Award for Best Actress]] for Nicole Kidman, winning two: for [[Best Art Direction|Academy Award for Best Art Direction]] and [[Best Costume Design|Academy Award for Best Costume Design]]. It was the first musical nominated for Best Picture in 10 years, following Disney's [[Beauty and the Beast|Beauty and the Beast (1991 film)]] (1991). In [[BBC|BBC]]'s 2016 poll of the greatest films since 2000, Moulin Rouge! ranked 53rd.
title: Moulin Rouge!

abstract: Breaking Away won the 1979 [[Academy Award|Academy Awards]] for [[Best Original Screenplay|Academy Award for Best Original Screenplay]] for Tesich, and received nominations in four other categories, including [[Best Picture|Academy Award for Best Picture]]. It also won the 1979 [[Golden Globe Award|Golden Globe Award]] for Best Film (Comedy or Musical), and received nominations in three other Golden Globe categories.
title: Breaking Away

abstract: Death Becomes Her won the [[Academy Award for Best Visual Effects|Academy Award for Best Visual Effects]]. The film received mixed reviews from critics, but was a commercial success, grossing $149 million worldwide ($58 million domestic, $90 million international) at the box office. It has developed a strong [[cult following|cult following]], particularly among the [[LGBT|LGBT]] community.
title: Death Becomes Her

abstract: Financed by [[EMI Films|EMI Films]], Tender Mercies was shot largely in [[Waxahachie, Texas|Waxahachie, Texas]]. The script was rejected by several American directors before the Australian Beresford accepted it. Duvall, who sang his own songs in the film, drove more than throughout the state, tape recording local accents and playing in country music bands to prepare for the role. He and Beresford repeatedly clashed during production, at one point prompting the director to walk off the set and reportedly consider quitting the film.
title: Tender Mercies

abstract: In contrast to the way animals are portrayed in an [[anthropomorphic|Anthropomorphism]] style in other animated features, Spirit and his fellow horses communicate with each other through sounds and body language like real horses. Spirit's thoughts are narrated by his voice actor [[Matt Damon|Matt Damon]], but otherwise, he has no vocal dialogue. Spirit: Stallion of the Cimarron was released in theaters on May 24, 2002, and earned $122.6 million on an $80 million budget.
title: Spirit: Stallion of the Cimarron

abstract: Spider-Man 3 is a 2007 American [[superhero film|superhero film]] based on the fictional [[Marvel Comics|Marvel Comics]] character [[Spider-Man|Spider-Man]]. It was directed by [[Sam Raimi|Sam Raimi]] from a screenplay by Raimi, his older brother [[Ivan|Ivan Raimi]], and [[Alvin Sargent|Alvin Sargent]]. It is the third and final installment in Raimi's original [[Spider-Man film trilogy|Spider-Man in film#Sam Raimi films]], following [[Spider-Man|Spider-Man (2002 film)]] (2002) and [[Spider-Man 2|Spider-Man 2]] (2004). The film stars [[Tobey Maguire|Tobey Maguire]], [[Kirsten Dunst|Kirsten Dunst]], [[James Franco|James Franco]], [[Thomas Haden Church|Thomas Haden Church]], [[Topher Grace|Topher Grace]], [[Bryce Dallas Howard|Bryce Dallas Howard]], [[Rosemary Harris|Rosemary Harris]], [[Cliff Robertson|Cliff Robertson]], [[J. K. Simmons|J. K. Simmons]], and [[James Cromwell|James Cromwell]]. It is [[the highest-grossing Spider-Man film|List of highest-grossing films#Highest grossing franchises and film series]] ever made. Following the events of Spider-Man 2, [[Peter Parker|Spider-Man]] has become a cultural phenomenon as Spider-Man, while [[Mary Jane Watson|Mary Jane Watson]] continues her [[Broadway|Broadway theater]] career. [[Harry Osborn|Harry Osborn]] still seeks vengeance for his father's death, and an escaped [[Flint Marko|Sandman (Marvel Comics)]] falls into a [[particle accelerator|particle accelerator]] and is transformed into a shape-shifting sand manipulator. An extraterrestrial [[symbiote|Symbiote (comics)]] crashes to Earth and bonds with Peter, negatively influencing his behavior.
title: Spider-Man 3

abstract: Mr. Blandings Builds His Dream House (1948) is an American [[comedy film|comedy film]] directed by [[H. C. Potter|H. C. Potter]] and starring [[Cary Grant|Cary Grant]], [[Myrna Loy|Myrna Loy]], and [[Melvyn Douglas|Melvyn Douglas]]. The film was written and produced by the team of [[Melvin Frank|Melvin Frank]] and [[Norman Panama|Norman Panama]], and was an adaptation of [[Eric Hodgins|Eric Hodgins]]' popular [[1946 novel|Mr. Blandings Builds His Dream House (novel)]], illustrated by [[Shrek!|Shrek!]] author [[William Steig|William Steig]].
title: Mr. Blandings Builds His Dream House

abstract: Angel Heart is a 1987 American [[neo-noir|neo-noir]] [[psychological horror|psychological horror]] film, and an [[adaptation|film adaptation]] of [[William Hjortsberg|William Hjortsberg]]'s 1978 novel [[Falling Angel|Falling Angel]]. Written and directed by [[Alan Parker|Alan Parker]], the film stars [[Mickey Rourke|Mickey Rourke]], [[Robert De Niro|Robert De Niro]] and [[Lisa Bonet|Lisa Bonet]]. The story follows Harry Angel (Rourke), a [[New York City|New York City]] private investigator hired to solve the disappearance of a man known as Johnny Favorite. Angel's investigation takes him to [[New Orleans|New Orleans]], where he becomes embroiled in a series of brutal murders.
title: Angel Heart

abstract: Dead Presidents is based partly on the real-life experiences of Haywood T. Kirkland (aka Ari S. Merretazon), whose true story was detailed in the book Bloods: An Oral History of the Vietnam War by Black Veterans by [[Wallace Terry|Wallace Terry]]. Certain characters from the film are based on real acquaintances of Kirkland, who served time in prison after committing robbery in [[facepaint|facepaint]]. The film also is loosely based on several incidents involving the [[Black Liberation Army|Black Liberation Army]] notably the [[Brink's armored truck robbery|Brink's robbery (1981)]].
title: Dead Presidents

abstract: Kuch Kuch Hota Hai (English: Something... Something Happens) also known as KKHH, is a 1998 Indian [[Hindi|Hindi]]-language [[romantic|romance film]] [[drama|Drama (film and television)]] film, released in India and the United Kingdom on 16 October 1998. It was written and directed by [[Karan Johar|Karan Johar]], and starred the popular on-screen pair of [[Shah Rukh Khan|Shah Rukh Khan]] and [[Kajol|Kajol]] in their fourth film together. [[Rani Mukerji|Rani Mukerji]] featured in a supporting role, while [[Salman Khan|Salman Khan]] also had an extended-cameo appearance. [[Sana Saeed|Sana Saeed]], who was featured in a supporting role, made her debut in this film. The plot combines two love triangles set years apart. The first half covers friends on a college campus, while the second tells the story of a widower's young daughter who tries to reunite her dad with his old friend.
title: Kuch Kuch Hota Hai

abstract: The Preacher's Wife is a 1996 American [[family film|family film]] directed by [[Penny Marshall|Penny Marshall]] and starring [[Denzel Washington|Denzel Washington]], [[Whitney Houston|Whitney Houston]], and [[Courtney B. Vance|Courtney B. Vance]]. It is a [[remake|remake]] of the 1947 film [[The Bishop's Wife|The Bishop's Wife]], which in turn was based on the novel of the same name by [[Robert Nathan|Robert Nathan]].
title: The Preacher's Wife

abstract: The Fabulous Baker Boys was theatrically released on October 13, 1989 by [[20th Century Fox|20th Century Fox]]. It received critical acclaim with major praise drawn towards Pfeiffer's performance but was a box office disappointment grossing $18.4 million on a $11.5 million budget.
title: The Fabulous Baker Boys

abstract: The low-budget horror film attracted the interest of producer [[Irvin Shapiro|Irvin Shapiro]], who helped screen the film at the [[1982 Cannes Film Festival|1982 Cannes Film Festival]]. Horror author [[Stephen King|Stephen King]] gave a rave review of the film, which helped convince [[New Line Cinema|New Line Cinema]] to serve as its distributor. Though a modest commercial success in the United States, grossing just $2.4 million, it was a bigger success internationally, grossing more than $27 million for a worldwide gross of $29.4 million. Both early and later critical reception were universally positive and in the years since its release, The Evil Dead has developed a reputation as one of the largest [[cult film|cult films]] and has been cited among the greatest horror films of all time. The Evil Dead launched the careers of Campbell and Raimi, who would collaborate on several films together throughout the years, including Raimi's [[Spider-Man trilogy|Spider-Man in film#Sam Raimi films]].
title: The Evil Dead

abstract: Full Metal Jacket is a 1987 [[war film|war film]] directed, co-written, and produced by [[Stanley Kubrick|Stanley Kubrick]] and starring [[Matthew Modine|Matthew Modine]], [[R. Lee Ermey|R. Lee Ermey]], [[Vincent D'Onofrio|Vincent D'Onofrio]] and [[Adam Baldwin|Adam Baldwin]]. The screenplay by Kubrick, [[Michael Herr|Michael Herr]], and [[Gustav Hasford|Gustav Hasford]] was based on Hasford's novel [[The Short-Timers|The Short-Timers]] (1979). The storyline follows a [[platoon|platoon]] of [[U.S. Marines|United States Marine Corps]] through their [[training|United States Marine Corps Recruit Training]], primarily focusing on two privates, Joker and Pyle, who struggle to get through boot camp under their abusive drill instructor, Gunnery Sergeant Hartman, and the experiences of two of the platoon's Marines in the [[Tet Offensive|Tet Offensive]] during the [[Vietnam War|Vietnam War]]. The film's title refers to the [[full metal jacket bullet|full metal jacket bullet]] used by soldiers. The film was released in the United States on June 26, 1987. It was the last of Kubrick's films to be released during his lifetime.
title: Full Metal Jacket

abstract: Triumph of the Will was released in 1935 and became a major example of film used as propaganda. Riefenstahl's techniques—such as moving cameras, [[aerial photography|aerial photography]], the use of [[long focus lens|long focus lenses]] to create a distorted [[perspective|Perspective (graphical)]], and the revolutionary approach to the use of music and [[cinematography|cinematography]]—have earned Triumph of the Will recognition as one of the [[greatest propaganda films in history|Films considered the greatest ever#Propaganda]]. Riefenstahl helped to stage the scenes, directing and rehearsing some of them at least fifty times. Riefenstahl won several awards, not only in Germany but also in the United States, France, Sweden and other countries. The film was popular in the [[Third Reich|Third Reich]], and has continued to influence films, documentaries and commercials to this day. In Germany, the film is not censored but the courts commonly classify it as [[Nazi propaganda|Propaganda in Nazi Germany]] which requires an educational context to public screenings.
title: Triumph of the Will

abstract: My Life Without Me is a 2003 Canadian [[drama film|Drama (film and television)]] directed by [[Isabel Coixet|Isabel Coixet]] and starring [[Sarah Polley|Sarah Polley]], [[Mark Ruffalo|Mark Ruffalo]], [[Scott Speedman|Scott Speedman]], and [[Leonor Watling|Leonor Watling]]. Based on the book Pretending the Bed Is a Raft by [[Nanci Kincaid|Nanci Kincaid]], it tells a story of a 23-year-old woman, with a husband and two daughters, who finds out she is going to die soon. The film was produced by [[Pedro Almodóvar|Pedro Almodóvar]]'s production company, [[El Deseo|El Deseo]].
title: My Life Without Me

abstract: The film takes place two years after the [[first film|Scream (1996 film)]] and again follows the character of [[Sidney Prescott|Sidney Prescott]] (Campbell), now a student at the fictional Windsor College, who becomes the target of a [[copycat|Copycat crime]] killer using the guise of [[Ghostface|Ghostface (Scream)]]. Sidney is accompanied by film-geek Randy Meeks (Kennedy), retired [[deputy sheriff|deputy sheriff]] Dewey Riley (Arquette) and [[news reporter|news reporter]] Gale Weathers (Cox). Like its predecessor, Scream 2 combines the violence of the slasher genre with elements of comedy and "[[whodunit|whodunit]]" mystery while satirizing the [[cliché|cliché]] of film [[sequel|sequels]]. The film was followed by two sequels, [[Scream 3|Scream 3]] (2000) and [[Scream 4|Scream 4]] (2011).
title: Scream 2

abstract: The film takes place three years after the [[previous film|Scream 2]] and follows [[Sidney Prescott|Sidney Prescott]] (Campbell), who has gone into self-imposed isolation following the events of the previous two films but is drawn to [[Hollywood|Hollywood]] after a new [[Ghostface|Ghostface (Scream)]] begins killing the cast of the [[film within a film|film within a film]] Stab 3. Scream 3 combines the violence of the slasher genre with comedy and "[[whodunit|whodunit]]" mystery, while satirizing the [[cliché|cliché]] of [[film trilogies|Film trilogy]]. Unlike the previous Scream films, there was an increased emphasis on comedic elements in this installment, and the violence and horror were reduced in response to increased public scrutiny about violence in media, following the [[Columbine High School massacre|Columbine High School massacre]].
title: Scream 3

abstract: One Hour Photo is a 2002 American [[psychological thriller|psychological thriller]] film written and directed by [[Mark Romanek|Mark Romanek]] and starring [[Robin Williams|Robin Williams]], [[Connie Nielsen|Connie Nielsen]], [[Michael Vartan|Michael Vartan]], [[Gary Cole|Gary Cole]], and [[Eriq La Salle|Eriq La Salle]]. Released by [[Fox Searchlight Pictures|Fox Searchlight Pictures]], One Hour Photo received positive reviews from film critics, with praise for Romanek's writing and Cronenweth's cinematography, while Williams' against-[[type|typecasting (acting)]] performance received universal critical acclaim, earning him a [[Saturn Award|Saturn Award]] for [[Best Actor|Saturn Award for Best Actor]].
title: One Hour Photo

abstract: Blue Denim is a 1958 [[Broadway|Broadway theatre]] play by writer [[James Leo Herlihy|James Leo Herlihy]]. It starred [[Carol Lynley|Carol Lynley]], [[Warren Berlinger|Warren Berlinger]] and newcomer [[Burt Brinckerhoff|Burt Brinckerhoff]] in the lead male role. Opening on February 27, 1958, the play ran for 166 performances at the [[Playhouse Theatre|Playhouse Theatre (New York City)]].
title: Blue Denim

abstract: Ingmar Bergman Makes a Movie () is a 1963 Swedish documentary film directed by [[Vilgot Sjöman|Vilgot Sjöman]] which depicts the making of [[Ingmar Bergman|Ingmar Bergman]]'s film [[Winter Light|Winter Light]] from screenwriting to the film's premiere and critical reaction.
title: Ingmar Bergman Makes a Movie

abstract: The Last Hunt is a 1956 [[MGM|MGM]] [[western|western (genre)]] film directed by [[Richard Brooks|Richard Brooks]] and produced by Dore Schary. The [[screenplay|screenplay]] was by Richard Brooks from the novel [[The Last Hunt|The Last Hunt (novel)]], by [[Milton Lott|Milton Lott]]. The music score was by [[Daniele Amfitheatrof|Daniele Amfitheatrof]] and the cinematography by [[Russell Harlan|Russell Harlan]].
title: The Last Hunt

abstract: The Kid & I is a 2005 American [[comedy film|comedy film]] directed by [[Penelope Spheeris|Penelope Spheeris]] and starring [[Tom Arnold|Tom Arnold (actor)]] and [[Eric Gores|Eric Gores]].
title: The Kid & I

abstract: The Crop is a 2004 Australian comedy film set during the 1980s.
title: The Crop

abstract: Andhra Kesari is a historical Telugu film on the life of [[Tanguturi Prakasam|Tanguturi Prakasam]].
title: Andhra Kesari

abstract: Deewane Huye Paagal (Lovers Gone Mad) is a [[2005|Bollywood films of 2005]] Indian [[Hindi|Bollywood]] [[romantic|Romance film]] [[action comedy|action comedy]] film directed by [[Vikram Bhatt|Vikram Bhatt]], and produced by Firoz A. Nadiadwala. The film features [[Akshay Kumar|Akshay Kumar]], [[Shahid Kapoor|Shahid Kapoor]], [[Sunil Shetty|Sunil Shetty]], [[Rimi Sen|Rimi Sen]], [[Paresh Rawal|Paresh Rawal]] along with many others. [[Aftab Shivdasani|Aftab Shivdasani]] and [[Vivek Oberoi|Vivek Oberoi]] make guest appearances. [[Amisha Patel|Amisha Patel]] was suppose to featured in leading role, however things didn’t go as planned because of rift between patel and Kareena kapoor the ex-love of Shahid kapoor.
title: Deewane Huye Paagal

abstract: [[Stan Winston|Stan Winston]]'s make-up work for Heartbeeps made him one of the nominees for the inaugural [[Academy Award for Best Makeup|Academy Award for Best Makeup and Hairstyling]] in 1982, losing to [[An American Werewolf in London|An American Werewolf in London]].
title: Heartbeeps

abstract: The Star Wars Trilogy, often colloquially referred to as the original trilogy or the classic trilogy, is the first set of three films produced in the [[Star Wars|Star Wars]] franchise, an American [[space opera|space opera]] created by [[George Lucas|George Lucas]]. It was produced by [[Lucasfilm Ltd.|Lucasfilm Ltd.]] and distributed by [[20th Century Fox|20th Century Fox]], and consisted of the [[original Star Wars film|Star Wars (film)]] (1977), [[The Empire Strikes Back|The Empire Strikes Back]] (1980) and [[Return of the Jedi|Return of the Jedi]] (1983).
title: Star Wars Trilogy

abstract: Make Mine Music is a 1946 American animated [[anthology film|anthology film]] produced by [[Walt Disney|Walt Disney]] and released to [[theatres|Movie theater]] on April 20, 1946. It is the 8th [[Disney animated feature film|List of Walt Disney Animation Studios films]].
title: Make Mine Music

abstract: Poochakkoru Mookkuthi (translation: A Nose-Ring for the Cat) is a 1984 [[screwball comedy|screwball comedy]] [[Malayalam film|Malayalam cinema]] written and directed by [[Priyadarshan|Priyadarshan]], based on Charles Dickens's play The Strange Gentleman . The film features an [[ensemble cast|ensemble cast]] featuring [[Shankar|Shankar (actor)]], [[Mohanlal|Mohanlal]], [[Menaka|Menaka (actress)]], [[M G Soman|M G Soman]], [[Nedumudi Venu|Nedumudi Venu]], [[CI Paul|C.I. Paul]], [[Sukumari|Sukumari]], [[Jagathy Sreekumar|Jagathy Sreekumar]], [[Kuthiravattam Pappu|Kuthiravattam Pappu]], [[Sreenivasan|Sreenivasan (actor)]] and [[Baiju|Baiju]].
title: Poochakkoru Mookkuthi

abstract: Pokémon 4Ever: Celebi – Voice of the Forest, commonly referred to as Pokémon 4Ever, originally released in Japan as , is a 2001 [[Japanese|Japanese language]] [[anime|anime]] film directed by [[Kunihiko Yuyama|Kunihiko Yuyama]] and based on the television series [[Pokémon|Pokémon]]. It is the fourth official [[Pokémon film|Pokémon (anime)#Movies]]. It was released in Japan on July 7, 2001. The film was directed in Japan by [[Kunihiko Yuyama|Kunihiko Yuyama]], and written by Hideki Sonoda. It stars the regular television cast of [[Rica Matsumoto|Rica Matsumoto]], [[Ikue Ōtani|Ikue Ōtani]], [[Mayumi Iizuka|Mayumi Iizuka]], [[Yūji Ueda|Yūji Ueda]], [[Megumi Hayashibara|Megumi Hayashibara]], and [[Shin-ichiro Miki|Shin-ichiro Miki]]. The events of the film take place during the fourth season of [[Pokémon: Johto League Champions|List of Pokémon: Johto League Champions episodes]].
title: Pokémon 4Ever

abstract: Produced by Durga Arts, the film went on to become a [[sleeper hit|sleeper hit]] with its second theatrical release in [[Andhra Pradesh|Andhra Pradesh]], [[Telangana|Telangana]], and [[Tamil Nadu|Tamil Nadu]], along with a dubbed [[Hindi|Hindi]] version titled Hairaan which gathered positive reports from [[bollywood|bollywood]] critics, and was screened at the [[International Film Festival of India|International Film Festival of India]], [[Ann Arbor Film Festival|Ann Arbor Film Festival]], and the [[Fribourg International Film Festival|Fribourg International Film Festival]]. The path breaking film received critical acclaim which led to four state [[Nandi Award|Nandi Awards]], including the Nandi Award for Best Direction, the [[Nandi Award for Best Screenplay Writer|Nandi Award for Best Screenplay Writer]], and a [[Filmfare Award South|Filmfare Award for Best Actress – Telugu]]. Varma later remade the film in Hindi as [[Daud|Daud (film)]], and also donned films such as [[Thiruda Thiruda|Thiruda Thiruda]], [[Anaganaga Oka Roju|Anaganaga Oka Roju]] and [[Road|Road (film)]] on the lines of Kshana Kshanam.
title: Kshana Kshanam

abstract: My Little Bride is a Korean [[remake|remake]] of the 2002 [[Hong Kong|Hong Kong]] film [[My Wife Is 18|My Wife Is 18]], starring [[Charlene Choi|Charlene Choi]] and [[Ekin Cheng|Ekin Cheng]].
title: My Little Bride

abstract: Seraphim Falls is a 2006 American [[Revisionist Western|Revisionist Western]] film directed by television producer and director [[David Von Ancken|David Von Ancken]] in his first [[feature film|feature film]]. The storyline was conceived from a screenplay written by Von Ancken and Abby Everett Jaques. The fictional story focuses on a [[bounty hunt|Bounty hunter]] for a Union soldier by a Confederate colonel following the [[American Civil War|American Civil War]] in the late 1860s. [[Pierce Brosnan|Pierce Brosnan]], [[Liam Neeson|Liam Neeson]], [[Michael Wincott|Michael Wincott]], [[Tom Noonan|Tom Noonan]], and [[Ed Lauter|Ed Lauter]] star in principal roles. Seraphim Falls explores civil topics, such as violence, human survival and war.
title: Seraphim Falls

abstract: In Like Flint (1967) is a film directed by [[Gordon Douglas|Gordon Douglas (director)]], the sequel to the parody spy film [[Our Man Flint|Our Man Flint]] (1966).
title: In Like Flint

abstract: Pokémon Ranger and the Temple of the Sea, originally released in Japan as , is a 2006 Japanese anime film directed by [[Kunihiko Yuyama|Kunihiko Yuyama]], and the ninth [[Pokémon film|List of Pokémon films]]. The story follows the [[Pokémon|List of Pokémon]] trainer [[Ash Ketchum|Ash Ketchum]], his [[Pikachu|Pikachu]] ([[Ikue Ōtani|Ikue Ōtani]]), and his friends May, Max and [[Brock|Brock (Pokémon)]] as they help a Pokémon Ranger called Jack Walker deliver the Mythical Pokémon Manaphy to an undersea palace called Samiya while evading mercenaries led by Phantom the Pirate.
title: Pokémon Ranger and the Temple of the Sea

abstract: Shaadi No. 1 (Translation: Marriage No. 1) is an Indian [[comedy|comedy]] film released in November 2005. The film, directed by [[David Dhawan|David Dhawan]], stars [[Fardeen Khan|Fardeen Khan]], [[Zayed Khan|Zayed Khan]], [[Sharman Joshi|Sharman Joshi]], [[Ayesha Takia|Ayesha Takia]], [[Esha Deol|Esha Deol]], [[Soha Ali Khan|Soha Ali Khan]], [[Riya Sen|Riya Sen]], [[Aarti Chhabria|Aarti Chhabria]], [[Sophia Chaudhary|Sophia Chaudhary]], [[Sanjay Dutt|Sanjay Dutt]] and [[Satish Shah|Satish Shah]]. The film was produced by [[Vashu Bhagnani|Vashu Bhagnani]]. The film is remake of 2001 Kannada movie [[Kothigalu Saar Kothigalu|Kothigalu Saar Kothigalu]] which was also remade in Telugu in 2002 as [[Sandade Sandadi|Sandade Sandadi]].
title: Shaadi No. 1

abstract: Four Daughters is a 1938 American [[musical|musical film]] [[drama film|drama (film and television)]] that tells the story of a happy musical family whose lives and loves are disrupted by the arrival of a cynical young composer who interjects himself into the daughters' romantic lives. The movie stars the [[Lane Sisters|Lane Sisters]] ([[Priscilla Lane|Priscilla Lane]], [[Rosemary Lane|Lane Sisters]], and [[Lola Lane|Lane Sisters]]) and [[Gale Page|Gale Page]], and features [[Claude Rains|Claude Rains]], [[Jeffrey Lynn|Jeffrey Lynn]], [[John Garfield|John Garfield]], and [[Dick Foran|Dick Foran]]. The three Lanes were sisters and members of a family singing trio.
title: Four Daughters

abstract: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington is a 1939 American [[political|Political drama]] [[comedy-drama film|Comedy-drama]] directed by [[Frank Capra|Frank Capra]], starring [[Jean Arthur|Jean Arthur]] and [[James Stewart|James Stewart]], and featuring [[Claude Rains|Claude Rains]] and [[Edward Arnold|Edward Arnold (actor)]]. The film is about a newly appointed [[United States Senator|United States Senator]] who fights against a corrupt political system, and was written by [[Sidney Buchman|Sidney Buchman]], based on [[Lewis R. Foster|Lewis R. Foster]]'s unpublished story "The Gentleman from Montana". The film was controversial when it was first released, but was also successful at the box office, and made Stewart a major movie star.
title: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington

abstract: The Castle of Cagliostro follows [[gentleman thief|gentleman thief]] [[Arsène Lupin III|Arsène Lupin III]], who successfully robs a casino – only to find the money to be [[counterfeit|counterfeit]]. He heads to the tiny country of Cagliostro, the rumoured source of the bills, and attempts to save the runaway Clarisse from the Count Cagliostro's men. Lupin enlists his associates, Jigen and Goemon, and sends his calling card to the Count to get Inspector Zenigata, his longtime nemesis, to the castle. After becoming trapped in the dungeon under the castle, Lupin and Zenigata form a pact to escape and foil the Count's counterfeit operation and save Clarisse from her forced marriage to the Count.
title: The Castle of Cagliostro

abstract: A Letter to Three Wives is a 1949 American [[romantic|romantic drama]] [[drama film|Drama (film and television)]] which tells the story of a woman who mails a letter to three women, telling them she has left town with the husband of one of them. It stars [[Jeanne Crain|Jeanne Crain]], [[Linda Darnell|Linda Darnell]], [[Ann Sothern|Ann Sothern]], [[Paul Douglas|Paul Douglas (actor)]] in his film debut, [[Kirk Douglas|Kirk Douglas]], [[Jeffrey Lynn|Jeffrey Lynn]], and [[Thelma Ritter|Thelma Ritter]]. An uncredited [[Celeste Holm|Celeste Holm]] provides the voice of Addie Ross, the unseen woman who wrote the titular letter.
title: A Letter to Three Wives

abstract: America America ([[British|UK]] title The Anatolian Smile—a reference to an ongoing acknowledgment of the character Stavros' captivating smile) is a 1963 [[American|United States]] dramatic film directed, produced and written by [[Elia Kazan|Elia Kazan]], adapted from his own book, published in 1962. The dust jacket of the novel has no comma in the title, nor does the title in the film itself. Many listings of the film include a comma.
title: America America

abstract: True Lies was the first [[Lightstorm Entertainment|Lightstorm Entertainment]] project to be distributed under Cameron's multimillion-dollar production deal with [[20th Century Fox|20th Century Fox]], as well as the first major production for the visual effects company [[Digital Domain|Digital Domain]], which was co-founded by Cameron.
title: True Lies

abstract: Schindler's List is a 1993 American [[epic|epic film]] [[historical period drama|historical period drama]] film directed and co-produced by [[Steven Spielberg|Steven Spielberg]] and written by [[Steven Zaillian|Steven Zaillian]]. It is based on the novel [[Schindler's Ark|Schindler's Ark]] by [[Australia|Australian]] novelist [[Thomas Keneally|Thomas Keneally]]. The film follows [[Oskar Schindler|Oskar Schindler]], a [[Sudeten German|Sudeten German]] businessman, who saved the lives of more than a thousand mostly [[Polish-Jewish|History of the Jews in Poland]] refugees from [[the Holocaust|the Holocaust]] by employing them in his factories during [[World War II|World War II]]. It stars [[Liam Neeson|Liam Neeson]] as Schindler, [[Ralph Fiennes|Ralph Fiennes]] as [[SS|Schutzstaffel]] officer [[Amon Göth|Amon Göth]], and [[Ben Kingsley|Ben Kingsley]] as Schindler's Jewish accountant [[Itzhak Stern|Itzhak Stern]].
title: Schindler's List

abstract: A [[direct-to-video|direct-to-video]] sequel, [[Lady and the Tramp II: Scamp's Adventure|Lady and the Tramp II: Scamp's Adventure]], was released in 2001. An upcoming [[live-action remake|Lady and the Tramp (upcoming film)]] of the film is in active development for Disney's planned streaming service [[Disney+|Disney+]].
title: Lady and the Tramp

abstract: The film was produced on a budget of . It received generally unfavorable reviews from critics. Carrey's performance led to the film having a [[cult following|cult following]] among male [[adolescents|Adolescence]]. At the worldwide box office, it grossed . In addition to launching Carrey's film career, it also spawned the sequel film [[Ace Ventura: When Nature Calls|Ace Ventura: When Nature Calls]] (1995), the animated TV series [[Ace Ventura: Pet Detective|Ace Ventura: Pet Detective (TV series)]] (three seasons, 1995–2000), and later, the direct-to-video spin-off sequel [[Ace Ventura Jr.: Pet Detective|Ace Ventura Jr.: Pet Detective]] (2009).
title: Ace Ventura: Pet Detective

abstract: Released on 30 April 1986 in Australia, and on 26 September 1986 in the United States, it was the highest-grossing film of all-time in Australia, [[second-highest-grossing film in the United States in that year|1986 in film#Top grossing films (U.S.)]] and went on to become the second-highest-grossing film worldwide at the [[box office|box office]] as well, with an estimated 46 million tickets sold in the US. There are two versions of the film: the Australian version, and an international version, which had much of the Australian slang replaced with more commonly understood terms, and was slightly shorter. As the first film in the [[Crocodile Dundee film series|Crocodile Dundee (film series)]], it was followed by two [[sequel|sequels]]: [[Crocodile Dundee II|Crocodile Dundee II]] (1988) and [[Crocodile Dundee in Los Angeles|Crocodile Dundee in Los Angeles]] (2001), although both films failed to match the critical success of the predecessor.
title: Crocodile Dundee

abstract: Silent Movie is a 1976 American [[satirical|Satire]] [[comedy film|comedy film]] co-written, directed by, and starring [[Mel Brooks|Mel Brooks]], and released by [[20th Century Fox|20th Century Fox]] on June 17, 1976. The [[ensemble cast|ensemble cast]] includes [[Dom DeLuise|Dom DeLuise]], [[Marty Feldman|Marty Feldman]], [[Bernadette Peters|Bernadette Peters]], and [[Sid Caesar|Sid Caesar]], with appearances by [[Anne Bancroft|Anne Bancroft]], [[Liza Minnelli|Liza Minnelli]], [[Burt Reynolds|Burt Reynolds]], [[James Caan|James Caan]], [[Marcel Marceau|Marcel Marceau]], and [[Paul Newman|Paul Newman]] playing themselves. While indeed silent (except for one word, music, and numerous sound effects), the film is a [[parody|parody]] of the [[silent film|silent film]] genre, particularly the slapstick comedies of [[Charlie Chaplin|Charlie Chaplin]], [[Mack Sennett|Mack Sennett]], and [[Buster Keaton|Buster Keaton]]. Among the film's most famous gags is the fact that the only audible word in the film is spoken by [[Marcel Marceau|Marcel Marceau]], a noted [[mime|mime]]. Sound is a big factor in the film's humor, as when a scene that shows the New York City skyline begins with the song "[[San Francisco|Theme from San Francisco]]", only to have it come to a sudden stop as if the musicians realize they are playing the wrong music. They then go into "[[I'll Take Manhattan|Manhattan (song)]]" instead. A play on the current trend of large corporations buying up film studios is parodied by the attempt of the Engulf and Devour Corporation to take control of a studio (a thinly veiled reference to [[Gulf+Western|Gulf+Western]]'s takeover of [[Paramount Pictures|Paramount Pictures]]).
title: Silent Movie

abstract: Atlantis: The Lost Empire is a 2001 American [[animated|animated cartoon]] [[science fantasy|science fantasy]] [[action|action film]] [[adventure film|adventure film]] created by [[Walt Disney Feature Animation|Walt Disney Feature Animation]]—the first [[science fiction film|science fiction film]] in [[Disney's animated features canon|List of Disney theatrical animated features]] and the 41st overall. Written by [[Tab Murphy|Tab Murphy]], directed by [[Gary Trousdale|Gary Trousdale]] and [[Kirk Wise|Kirk Wise]], and produced by [[Don Hahn|Don Hahn]], the film features an ensemble cast with the voices of [[Michael J. Fox|Michael J. Fox]], [[Cree Summer|Cree Summer]], [[James Garner|James Garner]], [[Leonard Nimoy|Leonard Nimoy]], [[Don Novello|Don Novello]], [[Phil Morris|Phil Morris (actor)]], [[Claudia Christian|Claudia Christian]], [[Jacqueline Obradors|Jacqueline Obradors]], [[Jim Varney|Jim Varney]] (in his final role before his death), [[Florence Stanley|Florence Stanley]], [[John Mahoney|John Mahoney]], [[David Ogden Stiers|David Ogden Stiers]] and [[Corey Burton|Corey Burton]]. Set in 1914, the film tells the story of a young man who gains possession of a sacred book, which he believes will guide him and a crew of mercenaries to the lost city of [[Atlantis|Atlantis]].
title: Atlantis: The Lost Empire

abstract: During the early 1960s, Bedknobs and Broomsticks entered development when the negotiations for the film rights to [[Mary Poppins|Mary Poppins (film)]] were placed on hold. When the rights were acquired, the film was shelved repeatedly due to the similarities with Mary Poppins until it was revived in 1969. Originally at a length of 141 minutes, Bedknobs and Broomsticks was edited down to almost two hours prior to its premiere at the [[Radio City Music Hall|Radio City Music Hall]]. The film was released on December 13, 1971 to mixed reviews from critics, some of whom praised the live-action/animated sequence. The film received five [[Academy Awards|Academy Awards]] nominations winning one for [[Best Special Visual Effects|Academy Award for Best Visual Effects]]. This was the last film released prior to the death of [[Walt Disney|Walt Disney]]'s surviving brother, [[Roy O. Disney|Roy O. Disney]], who died one week later. It is also the last theatrical film [[Reginald Owen|Reginald Owen]] appeared in before his death in 1972; his last two acting credits were for television.
title: Bedknobs and Broomsticks

abstract: Gremlins is a 1984 American [[comedy horror|comedy horror]] film directed by [[Joe Dante|Joe Dante]] and released by [[Warner Bros.|Warner Bros.]] The film is about a young man who receives a strange creature called a [[mogwai|Mogwai (Chinese culture)]] as a pet, which then spawns other creatures who transform into small, destructive, evil monsters. This story was continued with a sequel, [[Gremlins 2: The New Batch|Gremlins 2: The New Batch]], released in 1990. Unlike the more satirical tone of the sequel (which parodies Hollywood sequels), Gremlins opts for more [[black comedy|black comedy]], balanced against a [[Christmastime setting|Christmas film]]. Both films were the center of large [[merchandising|merchandising]] campaigns.
title: Gremlins

abstract: The Day After Tomorrow is a 2004 American [[science-fiction|science-fiction]] [[disaster film|disaster film]] co-written, directed, and produced by [[Roland Emmerich|Roland Emmerich]] and starring [[Dennis Quaid|Dennis Quaid]], [[Jake Gyllenhaal|Jake Gyllenhaal]], [[Ian Holm|Ian Holm]], [[Emmy Rossum|Emmy Rossum]], and [[Sela Ward|Sela Ward]]. It is based on the book [[The Coming Global Superstorm|The Coming Global Superstorm]] by [[Art Bell|Art Bell]] and [[Whitley Strieber|Whitley Strieber]]. The film depicts catastrophic climatic effects following the [[disruption of the North Atlantic Ocean circulation|Shutdown of thermohaline circulation]] in a series of [[extreme weather|extreme weather]] events that usher in [[global cooling|global cooling]] and lead to a new [[ice age|ice age]]. Filmed in [[Toronto|Toronto]] and [[Montreal|Montreal]], it is the highest-grossing Hollywood film made in Canada (adjusted for [[inflation|inflation]]).
title: The Day After Tomorrow

abstract: Most scenes were shot at the [[Karl-Marx-Allee|Karl-Marx-Allee]] in Berlin and around [[Plattenbau|Plattenbauten]] near [[Alexanderplatz|Alexanderplatz]]. Good Bye, Lenin! received numerous honours, including the [[European Film Award for Best Film|European Film Award for Best Film]] and [[German Film Award for Best Feature Film|German Film Award for Best Feature Film]].
title: Good Bye, Lenin!

abstract: The Apu Trilogy comprises three [[Bengali films|Cinema of West Bengal]] directed by [[Satyajit Ray|Satyajit Ray]]: [[Pather Panchali|Pather Panchali]] (1955), [[Aparajito|Aparajito]] (1956) and [[The World of Apu|The World of Apu]] (1959). They are frequently listed among the [[greatest films of all time|Films considered the greatest ever]] and are often cited as the greatest movies in the history of Indian cinema. The original music for the films was composed by [[Ravi Shankar|Ravi Shankar]].
title: The Apu Trilogy

abstract: Volcano High () is a [[2001|2001 in film]] [[South Korean|Cinema of South Korea]] [[martial arts|Martial arts film]] [[action|Action film]] [[comedy film|comedy film]].
title: Volcano High

abstract: Pokémon: Destiny Deoxys, originally released in Japan as is the seventh film in the [[Pokémon|Pokémon (anime)]] series, complementing the seventh season (Pokémon: Advanced Challenge). It is the second film released under Pocket Monsters Advanced Generation in Japan. The film stars the voices of [[Rica Matsumoto|Rica Matsumoto]], [[Ikue Otani|Ikue Otani]], [[Yuji Ueda|Yuji Ueda]], [[KAORI|KAORI]], [[Fushigi Yamada|Fushigi Yamada]], [[Noriko Hidaka|Noriko Hidaka]], [[Koichi Yamadera|Koichi Yamadera]], [[Susumu Chiba|Susumu Chiba]], [[Kenji Nojima|Kenji Nojima]], and [[Becky|Becky (television personality)]]. The events of the film take place during the seventh season of [[Pokémon: Advanced Challenge|List of Pokémon: Advanced Challenge episodes]].
title: Pokémon: Destiny Deoxys

abstract: Vampire Hunter D: Bloodlust (吸血鬼(バンパイア)ハンターD ブラッドラスト Banpaia Hantā Dī: Buraddorasuto) is a 2000 [[anime|anime]] film written and directed by [[Yoshiaki Kawajiri|Yoshiaki Kawajiri]]. The film is based on the third novel of [[Hideyuki Kikuchi|Hideyuki Kikuchi]]'s [[Vampire Hunter D|Vampire Hunter D]] series, [[Demon Deathchase|List of Vampire Hunter D novels#D - Demon Deathchase]].
title: Vampire Hunter D: Bloodlust

abstract: Atanarjuat: The Fast Runner () is a 2001 Canadian [[epic film|epic film]] directed by [[Inuit|Inuit]] filmmaker [[Zacharias Kunuk|Zacharias Kunuk]] and produced by his company [[Isuma Igloolik Productions|Isuma]]. It was the first feature film ever to be written, directed and acted entirely in the [[Inuktitut|Inuktitut]] language.
title: Atanarjuat: The Fast Runner

abstract: Originally conceived by Berlinger and co-writer Dick Beebe as a psychological thriller and meditation on [[mass hysteria|mass hysteria]], Book of Shadows: Blair Witch 2 was significantly altered in post-production, which Berlinger would later claim compromised his original vision. Among the changes were a new soundtrack, additional editing, and the integration of entirely new sequences.
title: Book of Shadows: Blair Witch 2

abstract: Maine Pyar Kiya (), also known as MPK, is a [[1989|List of Bollywood films of 1989]] Indian [[musical|Musical film]] [[romance film|romance film]], directed by [[Sooraj R. Barjatya|Sooraj R. Barjatya]] and written by Barjatya with S. M. Ahale. Starring [[Salman Khan|Salman Khan]] and [[Bhagyashree|Bhagyashree Patwardhan]] in the lead roles, it was produced by [[Rajshri Productions|Rajshri Productions]]. It was Barjatya's directorial debut, Khan's first leading role (after a supporting role in the previous year's [[Biwi Ho To Aisi|Biwi Ho To Aisi]]). It became an All Time Blockbuster in the hindi film industry.
title: Maine Pyar Kiya

abstract: Written on the Wind is a 1956 American [[Technicolor|Technicolor]] [[drama film|Drama (film and television)]] directed by [[Douglas Sirk|Douglas Sirk]] and starring [[Rock Hudson|Rock Hudson]], [[Lauren Bacall|Lauren Bacall]], [[Robert Stack|Robert Stack]] and [[Dorothy Malone|Dorothy Malone]].
title: Written on the Wind

abstract: Koyla (English: Coal) is a [[1997|Bollywood films of 1997]] Indian [[action thriller|action thriller]] film written, produced and directed by [[Rakesh Roshan|Rakesh Roshan]]. The film stars [[Shah Rukh Khan|Shah Rukh Khan]], [[Madhuri Dixit|Madhuri Dixit]], [[Amrish Puri|Amrish Puri]], [[Himani Shivpuri|Himani Shivpuri]], [[Salim Ghouse|Salim Ghouse]] and [[Johnny Lever|Johnny Lever]] in pivotal roles. Some scenes of this movie were filmed in [[Tawang|Tawang]] [[Arunachal Pradesh|Arunachal Pradesh]].
title: Koyla

abstract: Don't Look Now () is a 1973 independent film directed by [[Nicolas Roeg|Nicolas Roeg]]. It is a thriller adapted from [[the short story|"Don't Look Now"]] by [[Daphne du Maurier|Daphne du Maurier]]. [[Julie Christie|Julie Christie]] and [[Donald Sutherland|Donald Sutherland]] portray a married couple who travel to Venice following the recent accidental death of their daughter, after the husband accepts a commission to restore a church. They encounter two sisters, one of whom claims to be clairvoyant and informs them that their daughter is trying to contact them and warn them of danger. The husband at first dismisses their claims, but starts to experience mysterious sightings himself.
title: Don't Look Now

abstract: Coach Carter is a 2005 American biographical [[sports|sports film]] [[drama film|Drama (film and television)]] directed by [[Thomas Carter|Thomas Carter (director)]]. It is based on the true story of [[Richmond High School|Richmond High School (Richmond, California)]] basketball coach [[Ken Carter|Ken Carter]] (portrayed by [[Samuel L. Jackson|Samuel L. Jackson]]), who made headlines in 1999 for suspending his undefeated high school basketball team due to poor academic results. The story was conceived from a screenplay co-written by John Gatins and [[Mark Schwahn|Mark Schwahn]], who created the TV series [[One Tree Hill|One Tree Hill (TV series)]]. The film also recycles a handful of plot devices from another television series, [[The White Shadow|The White Shadow (TV series)]], which director Carter also co-starred in. The ensemble cast features [[Rob Brown|Rob Brown (actor)]], [[Channing Tatum|Channing Tatum]], [[Debbi Morgan|Debbi Morgan]], and musical entertainer [[Ashanti|Ashanti (entertainer)]].
title: Coach Carter

abstract: While critical reception of Mighty Aphrodite overall was mildly positive, Sorvino was widely praised for her performance, winning the 1995 [[Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress|Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress]], as well as a [[Golden Globe Award|Golden Globe Award]], [[New York Film Critics Circle Award|New York Film Critics Circle Award]], [[Critics' Choice Movie Award|Critics' Choice Movie Award]], [[National Board of Review Award|National Board of Review]], and a [[Dallas–Fort Worth Film Critics Association Award|Dallas–Fort Worth Film Critics Association]].
title: Mighty Aphrodite

abstract: Reach for the Sky is a 1956 British [[biographical film|biographical film]] about aviator [[Douglas Bader|Douglas Bader]], based on the 1954 biography of the same name by [[Paul Brickhill|Paul Brickhill]]. The film stars [[Kenneth More|Kenneth More]] and was directed by [[Lewis Gilbert|Lewis Gilbert]]. It won the [[BAFTA Award for Best British Film|BAFTA Award for Best British Film]] of 1956. The film's composer [[John Addison|John Addison]] was Bader's brother-in-law.
title: Reach for the Sky

abstract: Japanese Story is a 2003 Australian [[romantic drama|romantic drama]] [[film|film]] directed by [[Sue Brooks|Sue Brooks]]. It was screened in the [[Un Certain Regard|Un Certain Regard]] section at the [[2003 Cannes Film Festival|2003 Cannes Film Festival]].
title: Japanese Story

abstract: Final Destination 2 is a 2003 American [[supernatural horror film|supernatural horror film]] directed by [[David R. Ellis|David R. Ellis]]. The screenplay was written by [[J. Mackye Gruber|J. Mackye Gruber]] and [[Eric Bress|Eric Bress]], based on a story by Gruber, Bress, and series creator [[Jeffrey Reddick|Jeffrey Reddick]]. It is the sequel to the 2000 film [[Final Destination|Final Destination (film)]] and the second installment of the [[Final Destination film series|Final Destination]].
title: Final Destination 2

abstract: It was released on 6 October 2000 in [[Denmark|Denmark]], 10 August 2001 in United Kingdom, and 5 September 2006 in the United States. Danish teen-pop girl-group [[Little Trees|Little Trees (band)]] performed the title track, "[[Help! I'm a Fish (Little Yellow Fish)|Help! I'm a Fish (Little Yellow Fish)]]", which was released as a single in the UK. Fellow Danish girl group [[Creamy|Creamy]] also recorded a version of the song.
