abstract: Mister Butler is a [[Malayalam language|Malayalam language]] [[film|film]]. It was released in 2000. It was a remake of [[Pandiarajan|Pandiarajan]]'s [[Gopala Gopala|Gopala Gopala (1996 film)]] released in 1996. The film was average in the box office.
title: Mister Butler

abstract: Sathyameva Jayathe () is a [[2001|Malayalam films of 2001]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] action thriller film, directed by [[Viji Thampi|Viji Thampi]]. The film stars [[Suresh Gopi|Suresh Gopi]], [[Aishwarya|Aishwarya (actress)]], [[Balachandramenon|Balachandramenon]], Mini Nair and [[Siddique|Siddique (actor)]]. This film became a superhit and the turning point of Siddique's career as the top villain in [[Malayalam films|Malayalam cinema]]. The film had musical score by C. Rajamani and songs by [[M. Jayachandran|M. Jayachandran]].
title: Sathyameva Jayathe

abstract: Swayamvara Panthal movie tells the story of Deepu ([[Jayaram|Jayaram]]) who is the pet and indispensable brother of his five sisters. They need him right from taking their children for an outing to replacing gas cylinders and buying cosmetics. Deepu on his part is only too glad to be of help and thus has a special place in their hearts. As he comes of age, his sisters start searching for a suitable girl and after a great deal of hunting the unanimous choice is Priya ([[Samyuktha Varma|Samyuktha Varma]]). Deepu too likes her and the marriage is conducted much ceremoniously. But soon after, some shocking revelations dawn upon him and that too while he's on his honeymoon.
title: Swayamvara Panthal

abstract: Kabaddi Kabaddi is produced by Cinema Art Pvt. Ltd and presented by Black Horse Pictures. The film is a Nepali social drama and romantic comedy. It features [[Dayahang Rai|Dayahang Rai]], [[Saugat Malla|Saugat Malla]], [[Rishma Gurung|Rishma Gurung]], Bijay Baral, [[Buddhi Tamang|Buddhi Tamang]], Maotse Gurung, [[Upendra Subba|Upendra Subba]], Shisheer Bangdel, Pushkar Gurung, Kabita Ale, Birmaya Gurung, Aruna Karki Pokhrel, Pashupati Rai, Junu Bista, Mani Ram Pokhrel and Kamal Mani Nepal. The film is directed by [[Ram Babu Gurung|Ram Babu Gurung]] and producers are [[Raunak Bikram Kandel|Raunak Bikram Kandel]] and [[Om Chand Rauniyar|Om Chand Rauniyar]]. Its written by [[Ram Babu Gurung|Ram Babu Gurung]] him self and Upendra Subba and its cinematography is done by Shailendra D. Karki. The film's music is composed by Kali Prasad Baskota with art direction by Suresh Karki and Hom BC and editing by Nimesh Shrestha.
title: Kabaddi Kabaddi

abstract: Vaidehi Kathirunthal () is a [[1984|List of Tamil films of 1984]] Indian [[Tamil-language|Tamil language]] [[romantic drama|romantic drama]] film written and directed by [[R. Sundarrajan|R. Sundarrajan (director)]]. The film stars [[Vijayakanth|Vijayakanth]], [[Revathi|Revathi]], [[Parimalam|Pramila Joshai]], [[Goundamani|Goundamani]] and [[Senthil|Senthil (actor)]]. The film was successful, and emerged a major breakthrough in Vijayakanth's career. It was remade in [[Telugu|Telugu language]] as Manchi Manasulu and in [[Kannada|Kannada]] as Preethi Nee Illade Naa Hegirali.
title: Vaidehi Kathirunthal

abstract: Poonthotta Kaavalkaaran (English: The guard of the flower garden) is a 1988 [[Tamil|Tamil language]] [[drama film|drama film]], directed by [[Senthilnathan|Senthilnathan]], making his directorial debut. The film features [[Vijayakanth|Vijayakanth]], [[Raadhika|Raadhika]], [[Anand|Anand (actor)]], [[Vani Viswanath|Vani Viswanath]] and [[Livingston|Livingston (actor)]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[Ilaiyaraaja|Ilaiyaraaja]] and was released on 10 June 1988. It was remade in [[Sinhala|Sinhala language]] as Ran Hadawatha, starring [[Jeevan Kumaratunga|Jeevan Kumaratunga]], [[Ranjan Ramanayake|Ranjan Ramanayake]], Nadeeka Gunasekara, [[Anoja Weerasinghe|Anoja Weerasinghe]] and it was also remade in Telugu as [[Dharma Teja|Dharma Teja]], with Krishnam Raju.
title: Poonthotta Kaavalkaaran

abstract: Vishnu Vijaya (or Ashaant) is a [[1993|Bollywood films of 1993]] multi-lingual Indian film directed by [[Keshu Ramsay|Keshu Ramsay]] and released simultaneously in [[Hindi|Hindi language]] and [[Kannada|Kannada language]]. The film stars [[Akshay Kumar|Akshay Kumar]], [[Vishnuvardhan|Vishnuvardhan (actor)]], [[Ashwini Bhave|Ashwini Bhave]] and [[Pankaj Dheer|Pankaj Dheer]].
title: Vishnu Vijaya

abstract: Ikke Pe Ikka is a [[1994|Bollywood films of 1994]] Indian film directed by Raj N. Sippy. It stars [[Akshay Kumar|Akshay Kumar]], Shanti Priya and [[Chandni|Chandni (actress)]].
title: Ikke Pe Ikka

abstract: Kokilamma is a 1983 Telugu film directed by [[K. Balachander|K. Balachander]]. The title role of Kokilamma is played with humility by [[Saritha|Saritha]].
title: Kokilamma

abstract: The Lonely Profession, also known as The Savarona Syndrome, is a 1969 American [[crime|Crime film]] [[drama|Drama (film and television)]] [[television film|television film]] directed and written by [[Douglas Heyes|Douglas Heyes]], based on his 1963 novel The Twelfth of Never. It stars [[Harry Guardino|Harry Guardino]] as Leo Gordon, a [[private investigator|private investigator]] who seeks the killer of a tycoon's mistress and becomes a suspect.
title: The Lonely Profession

abstract: Fast Five (alternatively known as Fast & Furious   5 or Fast & Furious   5: Rio Heist) is a 2011 American [[action film|action film]] directed by [[Justin Lin|Justin Lin]] and written by [[Chris Morgan|Chris Morgan (writer)]]. It is the fifth installment in [[The Fast and the Furious franchise|The Fast and the Furious]]. It was released first in [[Australia|Australia]] on April 20, 2011, and then in the [[United States|United States]] on April 29, 2011. Fast Five follows [[Dominic Toretto|Dominic Toretto]] ([[Vin Diesel|Vin Diesel]]), [[Brian O'Conner|Brian O'Conner]] ([[Paul Walker|Paul Walker]]), and Mia Toretto ([[Jordana Brewster|Jordana Brewster]]) as they plan a heist to steal $100   million from corrupt businessman Hernan Reyes ([[Joaquim de Almeida|Joaquim de Almeida]]) while being pursued for arrest by [[U.S. Diplomatic Security Service|Diplomatic Security Service]] (DSS) agent [[Luke Hobbs|Luke Hobbs]] ([[Dwayne Johnson|Dwayne Johnson]]).
title: Fast Five

abstract: Hemingway & Gellhorn is an [[HBO|HBO]] biopic film about the lives of journalist [[Martha Gellhorn|Martha Gellhorn]] and her husband, writer [[Ernest Hemingway|Ernest Hemingway]]. It was directed by [[Philip Kaufman|Philip Kaufman]], and first aired on HBO on May 28, 2012.
title: Hemingway & Gellhorn

abstract: Ponmuttayidunna Tharavu () is a 1988 Indian [[Malayalam|Malayalam]]-language [[comedy-drama|comedy-drama]] film written by [[Raghunath Paleri|Raghunath Paleri]] and directed by [[Sathyan Anthikad|Sathyan Anthikad]]. It stars [[Sreenivasan|Sreenivasan]], [[Jayaram|Jayaram]], [[Urvashi|Urvashi (actress)]], [[Innocent|Innocent (actor)]], [[Parvathy|Parvathy Jayaram]], and Shari.
title: Ponmuttayidunna Tharavu

abstract: Mission: Impossible vs. the Mob is a 1968 American [[spy film|spy film]]. It is the first film based on the television series [[Mission: Impossible|Mission: Impossible]], consisting of a compilation of a two-part episode of the original series from 1967 called The Council.
title: Mission: Impossible vs. the Mob

abstract: Aniyan Bava Chetan Bava () is a 1995 [[Malayalam|Malayalam film]] [[comedy|comedy film]] [[musical film|musical film]] directed by [[Rajasenan|Rajasenan]], based on the script by [[Rafi Mecartin|Rafi Mecartin]]. The movie was remade in Telugu as [[Subhamastu|Subhamastu]].
title: Aniyan Bava Chetan Bava

abstract: Bekaraar is a [[1983|Bollywood films of 1983]] Indian film directed by Rajendra Prasad V.B. The movie stars [[Sanjay Dutt|Sanjay Dutt]], [[Padmini Kolhapure|Padmini Kolhapure]], [[Mohnish Bahl|Mohnish Bahl]], [[Supriya Pathak|Supriya Pathak]]. The film was a remake of the Telugu film [[Nalugu Stambhalata|Nalugu Stambhalata (film)]].
title: Bekaraar

abstract: Rowdy Rathore was shot primarily in [[Mumbai|Mumbai]] at SLB production house and then in the state of [[Karnataka|Karnataka]] at locations of [[UNESCO World Heritage|UNESCO World Heritage]] sites including [[Hampi|Hampi]]. Made on a budget of , released on 1 June 2012 on 2700 screens worldwide. It received mixed response from critics, whilst opening to strong box office collections and became a major commercial success with a worldwide gross of . The film was declared a "Blockbuster" in [[India|India]] and "average" in Overseas by [[Box Office India|Box Office India]].
title: Rowdy Rathore

abstract: Yateem is a [[1988|Bollywood films of 1988]] Indian film directed by [[J. P. Dutta|J. P. Dutta]] and released in 1988. The movie stars [[Sunny Deol|Sunny Deol]], [[Farha Naaz|Farha Naaz]], [[Kulbhushan Kharbanda|Kulbhushan Kharbanda]], [[Danny Denzongpa|Danny Denzongpa]] and [[Amrish Puri|Amrish Puri]].
title: Yateem

abstract: Main Tera Dushman is a [[1989|Bollywood films of 1989]] Indian film directed by Vijay Reddy. The movie stars [[Sunny Deol|Sunny Deol]], [[Jackie Shroff|Jackie Shroff]], [[Jaya Prada|Jaya Prada]] and [[Sridevi|Sridevi]] in a special appearance.
title: Main Tera Dushman

abstract: A Few Days with Me (original title: Quelques jours avec moi) is a 1988 French film directed by [[Claude Sautet|Claude Sautet]]. It received three [[César Award|César Award]] nominations at the [[1989 César Awards|1989 César Awards]].
title: A Few Days with Me

abstract: Jawani Zindabad (English: Long live youth) is an [[India|Indian]] [[romantic film|romantic film]] directed by [[Arun Bhatt|Arun Bhatt]]. This film was released in 1990, starring by [[Aamir Khan|Aamir Khan]] and [[Farha Naaz|Farha Naaz]]. It was released on 17 August 1990 and turned out to be a flop at the box office.
title: Jawani Zindabad

abstract: I Am Sorry Mathe Banni Preethsona is a 2011 [[Kannada|Kannada cinema]] film in the [[romance|Romance film]] genre starring [[Prem Kumar|Prem Kumar (Kannada actor)]] and [[Karishma Tanna|Karishma Tanna]] in the lead roles. The film is directed by Ravindra H P Das. [[Anoop Seelin|Anoop Seelin]] is the music director of the film. Vinay Narkar has jointly produced the film with Ravindra. The film released on 17 June 2011. Ravindra H.P. Das got the [[Best Screenplay Award|Karnataka State Film Award for Best Screenplay]] from [[Karnataka State Film Awards|Karnataka State Film Awards]] for the movie.
title: I Am Sorry Mathe Banni Preethsona

abstract: Varusham Padhinaaru () is a [[1989|1989 in film]] [[Tamil-language|Tamil language]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[feature film|feature film]], [[directed|Film director]] by [[Fazil|Fazil (director)]], starring [[Karthik|Karthik Muthuraman]], [[Kushboo|Kushboo Sundar]], [[Sukumari|Sukumari]], [[V. K. Ramaswamy|V. K. Ramaswamy (actor)]], [[Janagaraj|Janagaraj]] and [[Vadivukkarasi|Vadivukkarasi]]. The film is a remake of Fazil's own [[Malayalam|Malayalam]] film, [[Ennennum Kannettante|Ennennum Kannettante]] The film won the [[Filmfare Award for Best Actor|Filmfare Award for Best Actor – Tamil]] for [[Karthik|Karthik Muthuraman]]. The film went on to become a super-grosser in cinemas and completed a 100-day run in many parts of the state.
title: Varusham Padhinaaru

abstract: Girls in the Sun (, [[translit.|Transliteration]]   Koritsia ston Ilio) is a 1968 Greek [[drama film|drama film]] directed by [[Vasilis Georgiadis|Vasilis Georgiadis]]. The film was selected as the Greek entry for the [[Best Foreign Language Film|Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film]] at the [[42nd Academy Awards|42nd Academy Awards]], but was not accepted as a nominee. The film was nominated for the [[Golden Globe Award for Best Foreign Language Film|Golden Globe Award for Best Foreign Language Film]].
title: Girls in the Sun

abstract: Swapna Sanchari revolves around the gulf-returned Ajaychandran Nair ([[Jayaram|Jayaram]]). He has a lovely wife ([[Samvrutha Sunil|Samvrutha Sunil]]) and a 9th standard daughter ([[Anu Emmanuel|Anu Emmanuel]]) who does not speak more. His father ([[Innocent|Innocent (actor)]]) believes in old ways. The movie tracks his ups in life in the first half, where he returns from Gulf with a huge pocket. He dreams of earning a big name in the society, thus buys a [[Mercedes-Benz|Mercedes-Benz]], an old theatre, land in front of panchayat hall, promised hefty contributions for community hall and several other charitable organizations where he can put his name in front. He undertakes running the village festival completely by himself to earn a big name. Thus he dreams big but falls short in no time after his business in Dubai falls down. In no time Ajaychandran reduces nothing to big zero. The movie sketches the plot of those who falls into debt due to show-off.
title: Swapna Sanchari

abstract: Zakhmi Sher ([[English|English language]]: Wounded Tiger; [[Hindi|Hindi]]: जख्मी शेर) is a [[1984|Bollywood films of 1984]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[Action film|Action film]], produced by Pradeep Sharma under the TUTU Films banner and directed by [[Dasari Narayana Rao|Dasari Narayana Rao]]. It stars [[Jeetendra|Jeetendra]], [[Dimple Kapadia|Dimple Kapadia]] in the lead roles and music composed by [[Laxmikant-Pyarelal|Laxmikant-Pyarelal]]. The film is a remake of the [[Telugu|Telugu language]] Blockbuster movie [[Bobbili Puli|Bobbili Puli]], (1982) starring [[N. T. Rama Rao|N. T. Rama Rao]], [[Sridevi|Sridevi]] in the pivotal roles.
title: Zakhmi Sher

abstract: Oru Kochu Swapnam is a [[1984|Malayalam films of 1984]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film directed by [[Vipin Das|Vipin Das]]. The film stars [[Mohanlal|Mohanlal]], [[Nedumudi Venu|Nedumudi Venu]], [[Unnimary|Unnimary]] and [[Ilavarasi|Ilavarasi]]. The film's score is by [[MB Sreenivasan|MB Sreenivasan]].
title: Oru Kochu Swapnam

abstract: Indru Poi Naalai Vaa (English: Leave Now, See you tomorrow) is a 1981 Tamil film written and directed by [[K. Bhagyaraj|K. Bhagyaraj]]. A coming-of-age story of three carefree teenagers, complete with bell bottoms and thick-framed goggles of the 1980s, the film attained cult status among viewers. [[Chashme Buddoor|Chashme Buddoor (1981 film)]] had similar story with this movie. The 2003 Hindi film [[Nayee Padosan|Nayee Padosan]] was partially inspired by this movie. The movie was unofficially remade as [[Kanna Laddu Thinna Aasaiya|Kanna Laddu Thinna Aasaiya]] in 2013.
title: Indru Poi Naalai Vaa

abstract: Valibamey Vaa Vaa is a Tamil film directed by Bharathiraja.
title: Valibamey Vaa Vaa

abstract: Sundara Kandam () is 1992 [[Tamil-language|Tamil language]] [[comedy film|comedy film]], written and directed by [[K. Bhagyaraj|K. Bhagyaraj]], who also stars. The film's name is adapted from the title of the [[fifth major division|Sundara Kanda]] or "Kaandam" of the Indian epic [[Ramayana|Ramayana]]. The film was remade in Hindi as [[Andaz|Andaz (1994 film)]] with [[Anil Kapoor|Anil Kapoor]]. It was also remade in Telugu and Kannada as [[Sundarakanda|Sundarakanda (1992 film)]], with [[Venkatesh|Daggubati Venkatesh]] and [[Shivarajkumar|Shivarajkumar]] respectively. The [[Mammootty|Mammootty]]-starrer Malayalam film [[Mazhayethum Munpe|Mazhayethum Munpe]] was partially inspired by this film.
title: Sundara Kandam

abstract: Pattakkathi Bhairavan ([[Sivaji Ganesan|Sivaji Ganesan]]) is a notorious criminal sought by the police for several murders which he commits using his customary dagger (pattakkathi). When in jail, he encounters his adopted father and after an escapade he murders his boss Dharmalingam ([[R. S. Manohar|R. S. Manohar]]), who had ruined his adopted family. He also reunites with his step-sister Deepa ([[Sridevi|Sridevi]]) and camouflages himself as Karnan, a rich businessman to deceive the Police. Deepa's close friend ([[Jayasudha|Jayasudha]]) is Bhairavan's romantic interest, but in a twist, Deepa herself is in love with Police officer Arjunan ([[Jaiganesh|Jaiganesh]]), who is actually on a mission to find and eliminate the elusive Pattakkathi Bhairavan. Bhairavan approaches Arjunan quite convincingly masquerading as businessman Karnan, but Arjunan's mother ([[Sowcar Janaki|Sowcar Janaki]]) realizes Pattakkathi Bhairavan a.k.a. Karnan is none other than her own first son whom she had borne out of wedlock, but struggles to tell him the truth, since he professes a profound hatred for his unknown mother, who he believes had dumped him in a garbage bin as a baby. How the events unfold form the rest of the story.
title: Pattakkathi Bhairavan

It premiered in the Orizzonti ("Horizons") section of the [[71st Venice International Film Festival|71st Venice International Film Festival]], and won Best Film at the 34th [[Korean Association of Film Critics Awards|Korean Association of Film Critics Awards]] and the 36th [[Three Continents Festival|Three Continents Festival]]. Hill of Freedom also made [[The New Yorker|The New Yorker]]'s list of Best Undistributed Films of 2014.
title: Hill of Freedom

abstract: Fantastic Beasts: The Crimes of Grindelwald is a 2018 [[fantasy film|fantasy film]] directed by [[David Yates|David Yates]] and written by [[J. K. Rowling|J. K. Rowling]]. A joint British and American production, it is the sequel to [[Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them|Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them (film)]] (2016). It is the second instalment in the [[Fantastic Beasts film series|Fantastic Beasts (film series)]], and the tenth overall in the [[Wizarding World|Wizarding World]] franchise, which began with the [[Harry Potter film series|Harry Potter (film series)]]. The film features an [[ensemble cast|ensemble cast]] that includes [[Eddie Redmayne|Eddie Redmayne]], [[Katherine Waterston|Katherine Waterston]], [[Dan Fogler|Dan Fogler]], [[Alison Sudol|Alison Sudol]], [[Ezra Miller|Ezra Miller]], [[Zoë Kravitz|Zoë Kravitz]], [[Callum Turner|Callum Turner]], [[Claudia Kim|Claudia Kim]], [[William Nadylam|William Nadylam]], [[Kevin Guthrie|Kevin Guthrie]], [[Jude Law|Jude Law]], and [[Johnny Depp|Johnny Depp]]. The plot follows [[Newt Scamander|Newt Scamander]] and [[Albus Dumbledore|Albus Dumbledore]] as they attempt to take down the dark wizard [[Gellert Grindelwald|Gellert Grindelwald]], while facing new threats in a more divided wizarding world.
title: Fantastic Beasts: The Crimes of Grindelwald

abstract: In January 2013, [[Laura Poitras|Laura Poitras]], an American documentary film director/producer who had been working for several years on a film about monitoring programs in the United States that were the result of the [[September 11 attacks|September 11 attacks]], receives an encrypted e-mail from a stranger who calls himself, "Citizenfour." In it, he offers her inside information about illegal [[wiretapping|wiretapping]] practices of the US [[National Security Agency|National Security Agency]] (NSA) and other intelligence agencies. In June 2013, accompanied by investigative journalist [[Glenn Greenwald|Glenn Greenwald]] and [[The Guardian|The Guardian]] intelligence reporter [[Ewen MacAskill|Ewen MacAskill]], she travels to Hong Kong with her camera for the first meeting with the stranger in a hotel, who reveals himself as [[Edward Snowden|Edward Snowden]]. Scenes of their meeting take place in Snowden's hotel room, where he maintains his privacy. Shots of Snowden in his bed, in front of his mirror and of the hotel from a distance form the character of Snowden as a trapped political agent.After four days of interviews, on June 9, Snowden's identity is made public at his request. As media outlets begin to discover his location at [[The Mira Hong Kong|The Mira Hong Kong]], Snowden relocates to Poitras' room in an attempt to elude phone calls made to his room. Facing potential extradition and prosecution in the United States, Snowden schedules a meeting with the [[United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees|United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees]] and applies for refugee status. After Poitras believes she is being followed, she leaves Hong Kong for Berlin.
title: Citizenfour
