title: Nee!

abstract: The Huntsman: Winter's War is a 2016 American [[fantasy|fantasy film]] [[adventure film|adventure film]], both a [[prequel|prequel]] and [[sequel|sequel]] to [[Snow White and the Huntsman|Snow White and the Huntsman]] (2012), it takes place before and after the events of the first film. The film is the [[directorial debut|list of directorial debuts]] of [[Cedric Nicolas-Troyan|Cedric Nicolas-Troyan]], who was a [[visual effects supervisor|visual effects supervisor]] and [[second unit director|second unit director]] on the first film. It is written by [[Craig Mazin|Craig Mazin]] and [[Evan Spiliotopoulos|Evan Spiliotopoulos]], based on characters created by [[Evan Daugherty|Evan Daugherty]], which like the first film were inspired by the fairy tale "[[Snow White|Snow White]]" compiled by the [[Brothers Grimm|Brothers Grimm]], as well as "[[The Snow Queen|The Snow Queen]]" by [[Hans Christian Andersen|Hans Christian Andersen]]. Reprising their roles from the first film, the cast includes [[Chris Hemsworth|Chris Hemsworth]], [[Charlize Theron|Charlize Theron]], [[Nick Frost|Nick Frost]], and [[Sam Claflin|Sam Claflin]]. The film also introduced new characters played by [[Emily Blunt|Emily Blunt]], [[Jessica Chastain|Jessica Chastain]], and [[Rob Brydon|Rob Brydon]].
title: The Huntsman: Winter's War

abstract: The True North trilogy is a series of [[horror comedy|horror comedy]] films written and directed by [[Kevin Smith|Kevin Smith]]. The trilogy consists of the films [[Tusk|Tusk (2014 film)]], [[Yoga Hosers|Yoga Hosers]], and [[Moose Jaws|#Moose Jaws]].
title: True North trilogy

abstract: Zubaan is a 2016 Indian musical drama film written and directed by Mozez Singh, starring [[Vicky Kaushal|Vicky Kaushal]] and [[Sarah Jane Dias|Sarah-Jane Dias]], with music composed by [[Ashutosh Phatak|Ashutosh Phatak]].
title: Zubaan

abstract: Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Men Tell No Tales (released in some countries as Pirates of the Caribbean: Salazar's Revenge) is a 2017 American [[swashbuckler|Swashbuckler film]] [[fantasy film|fantasy film]], the fifth installment in the [[Pirates of the Caribbean film series|Pirates of the Caribbean (film series)]] and the sequel to [[On Stranger Tides|Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides]] (2011). The film is directed by [[Joachim Rønning|Joachim Rønning]] and [[Espen Sandberg|Espen Sandberg]] from a script by [[Jeff Nathanson|Jeff Nathanson]], with [[Jerry Bruckheimer|Jerry Bruckheimer]] serving again as producer. [[Johnny Depp|Johnny Depp]], [[Kevin McNally|Kevin McNally]] and [[Geoffrey Rush|Geoffrey Rush]] reprise their roles as [[Jack Sparrow|Jack Sparrow]], [[Joshamee Gibbs|Joshamee Gibbs]] and [[Hector Barbossa|Hector Barbossa]], respectively, and are joined in the cast by [[Javier Bardem|Javier Bardem]], [[Brenton Thwaites|Brenton Thwaites]] and [[Kaya Scodelario|Kaya Scodelario]].
title: Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Men Tell No Tales

abstract: Glasha and Kikimora () is a 1992 [[Russia|Russian]] Animation film by Alexander Mazaev. This cartoon was produced by [[Soyuzmultfilm studio|Soyuzmultfilm]]. <SEP> "Glasha and Kikimora" is The Fairy Tale cartoon.
title: Glasha and Kikimora

abstract: Sri Bannari Amman is a [[2002|List of Tamil films of 2002]] Tamil devotional film written and directed by Bharathi Kannan. The film featured [[Vijayashanti|Vijayashanti]] in the title role being her 175th project alongside [[Karan|Karan (actor)]] and [[Laya|Laya (actress)]], while [[Vadivelu|Vadivelu]] plays a supporting role. The film, which had music composed by [[T. Rajendar|T. Rajendar]], released in April 2002.
title: Sri Bannari Amman

abstract: Dukhtar ( ; English: Daughter) is a 2014 Pakistani [[drama|drama film]]-[[thriller film|Thriller (genre)]] directed by [[Afia Nathaniel|Afia Nathaniel]]. The film stars [[Samiya Mumtaz|Samiya Mumtaz]], [[Mohib Mirza|Mohib Mirza]], Saleha Aref, Asif Khan, Ajab Gul and [[Samina Ahmad|Samina Ahmad]]. The film is Afia Nathaniel's feature directorial debut; she also wrote and produced the film. It is the story of a mother and her ten-year-old daughter, who leave their home to save the girl from an arranged marriage to a tribal leader.
title: Dukhtar

abstract: Naan Aanaiyittal (If I Order) is a [[1966|Tamil films of 1966]] [[Tamil language|Tamil language]] [[drama film|drama film]], directed by [[Tapi Chanakya|Tapi Chanakya]]. The film features [[M. G. Ramachandran|M. G. Ramachandran]] and [[B. Saroja Devi|B. Saroja Devi]] in the lead roles. The film, produced by [[R. M. Veerappan|R. M. Veerappan]] under Sathiya Movies, had musical score by [[M. S. Viswanathan|M. S. Viswanathan]]. The film ran for 60 days.The film is named after the legendary song from MGR's blockbuster hit [[Enga Veettu Pillai|Enga Veettu Pillai]].
title: Naan Aanaiyittal

abstract: Petralthan Pillaiya () is a 1966 Indian [[Tamil-language|Tamil language]] [[drama film|Drama (film and television)]] directed by [[Krishnan–Panju|Krishnan–Panju]]. The film features [[M. G. Ramachandran|M. G. Ramachandran]] and [[B. Saroja Devi|B. Saroja Devi]] in lead roles. It is based on [[Charlie Chaplin|Charlie Chaplin]]'s 1921 American comedy-drama film, [[The Kid|The Kid (1921 film)]]. It was produced by Vasu, under Sri Muthukumaran Pictures. The film was the last time that [[T. S. Balaiah|T. S. Balaiah]] and [[M. R. Radha|M. R. Radha]] played beside Ramachandran. This is the 25th and final collaboration between Ramachandran and M. R. Radha, as a few days after the film was completed, Radha shot Ramachandran, wounding him. This is also the 25th film for the M. G. R and B. Saroja Devi pair.
title: Petralthan Pillaiya

abstract: Serial (Bad) Weddings () is a French [[comedy film|comedy film]] directed by [[Philippe de Chauveron|Philippe de Chauveron]] released in [[2014|2014 in film]].
title: Serial (Bad) Weddings

abstract: In Concert: A Benefit for the Crossroads Centre at Antigua is a live [[concert film|concert film]] featuring performances by the [[British|United Kingdom]] [[rock music|rock musician]] [[Eric Clapton|Eric Clapton]] and invited friends, such as [[David Sanborn|David Sanborn]], [[Sheryl Crow|Sheryl Crow]], [[Mary J. Blige|Mary J. Blige]] and [[Bob Dylan|Bob Dylan]]. The [[DVD|DVD]] and [[VHS|Video Home System]] releases hit the market on 26 October 1999 under license of [[Warner Bros. Records|Warner Bros. Records]]. The concert tickets revenue was donated to the [[Crossroads Centre Foundation|Crossroads Centre]]. It was the first [[Crossroads Guitar Festival|Crossroads Guitar Festival]], although titled differently at the time. The release reached various national charts and sold more than 225,000 copies worldwide.
title: In Concert: A Benefit for the Crossroads Centre at Antigua

abstract: Dukhai () is a [[Bangladesh|Bangladeshi]] film written and directed by [[Morshedul Islam|Morshedul Islam]]. The film got [[National Film Awards|National Film Awards (Bangladesh)]] in 9 different categories.
title: Dukhai

abstract: Mother! (stylized as mother!) is a 2017 American [[psychological horror|psychological horror]] film written and directed by [[Darren Aronofsky|Darren Aronofsky]], and starring [[Jennifer Lawrence|Jennifer Lawrence]], [[Javier Bardem|Javier Bardem]], [[Ed Harris|Ed Harris]], and [[Michelle Pfeiffer|Michelle Pfeiffer]]. The plot follows a young woman whose tranquil life with her husband at their country home is disrupted by the arrival of a mysterious couple.
title: Mother!

abstract: Shuvoda () is [[Bangladesh|Bangladeshi]] Bengali language film directed by [[Chashi Nazrul Islam|Chashi Nazrul Islam]] from the novel of the same name, [[Sarat Chandra Chattopadhyay|Sarat Chandra Chattopadhyay]]'s Shuvoda.
title: Shuvoda

abstract: Poshter Girl takes the viewer on a mad roller coaster ride of a quaint, little village in Maharashtra - Paragao-Tekawde, which is infamous for female infanticide. As a result there are no girls left in the village. When the question of boys' marriage arises, a beautiful and intelligent girl enters the scenario and changes everything. This is the story of the girl Rupali and her chosen five candidates who would do anything to win her heart.
title: Poshter Girl

abstract: The Edge of Seventeen is a 2016 American [[coming-of-age|coming-of-age story]] [[comedy-drama|comedy-drama]] film written and directed by [[Kelly Fremon Craig|Kelly Fremon Craig]]. The film stars [[Hailee Steinfeld|Hailee Steinfeld]], [[Woody Harrelson|Woody Harrelson]], [[Kyra Sedgwick|Kyra Sedgwick]], and [[Haley Lu Richardson|Haley Lu Richardson]]. [[Principal photography|Principal photography]] began on October 21, 2015, in [[Vancouver|Vancouver]] and ended on December 3, 2015.
title: The Edge of Seventeen

abstract: No Bed of Roses(Doob in Bengali) is a 2017 [[Bangladesh-India|Indo-Bangla joint production]] co-production [[drama|Drama (film and television)]] film written and directed by [[Mostofa Sarwar Farooki|Mostofa Sarwar Farooki]]. It was produced by [[Abdul Aziz|Jaaz Multimedia]], [[Himanshu Dhanuka|Himanshu Dhanuka]] and [[Irrfan Khan|Irrfan Khan]] under the banner of [[Jaaz Multimedia|Jaaz Multimedia]] and [[Eskay Movies|Eskay Movies]] along with Irrfan Khan Films. It stars Irrfan Khan, [[Nusrat Imrose Tisha|Nusrat Imrose Tisha]], [[Rokeya Prachy|Rokeya Prachy]] and [[Parno Mittra|Parno Mittra]]. The story builds up around the members of two families discovering the finer fabric of love when the headman of a family dies. The theme is that death doesn't always take things away: Sometimes it gives back. It was selected as the Bangladeshi entry for the [[Best Foreign Language Film|Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film]] at the [[91st Academy Awards|91st Academy Awards]], but it was not nominated.
title: No Bed of Roses

abstract: This Is Our Land () is a 2017 French-Belgian [[drama film|drama film]] directed by [[Lucas Belvaux|Lucas Belvaux]] and starring [[Émilie Dequenne|Émilie Dequenne]], [[André Dussollier|André Dussollier]] and [[Guillaume Gouix|Guillaume Gouix]]. It received seven nominations at the [[8th Magritte Awards|8th Magritte Awards]], including [[Best Film|Magritte Award for Best Film]] and [[Best Director|Magritte Award for Best Director]] for Belvaux, and won [[Best Actress|Magritte Award for Best Actress]] for Dequenne.
title: This Is Our Land

abstract: Staying Vertical () is a 2016 French [[drama film|drama film]] written and directed by [[Alain Guiraudie|Alain Guiraudie]]. The story follows a filmmaker who has to raise a child (whom he had with a shepherdess) by himself whilst seeking inspiration for his new film. The film was selected to compete for the [[Palme d'Or|Palme d'Or]] at the [[2016 Cannes Film Festival|2016 Cannes Film Festival]].
title: Staying Vertical

abstract: A Monster with a Thousand Heads premiered at the [[72nd Venice Film Festival|72nd Venice Film Festival]] as the opening film of the Orizzonti section. The film also received seven nominations for the [[Ariel Awards|Ariel Awards]] in Mexico, including [[Best Picture|Ariel Award for Best Picture]], [[Best Direction|Ariel Award for Best Direction]] and [[Best Actress|Ariel Award for Best Actress]], winning one for Best Adapted Screenplay. The film was named on the shortlist for Mexico's entry for the [[Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film|Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film]] at the [[89th Academy Awards|89th Academy Awards]], but it was not selected.
title: A Monster with a Thousand Heads

abstract: Tharlo () is a 2015 Chinese Tibetan-language [[comedy-drama film|comedy-drama film]] written and directed by [[Pema Tseden|Pema Tseden]]. It premiered in the Horizons section at the [[72nd edition|72nd Venice International Film Festival]] of the [[Venice Film Festival|Venice Film Festival]]. It was released in China on December 9, 2016.
title: Tharlo

abstract: Konjum Kumari (தமிழ்: கொஞ்சும் குமரி, English: Enticing Girl) is 1963 [[Tamil language|Tamil language]] [[action film|action film]], directed by G. Viswanathan and produced by [[T. R. Sundaram|T. R. Sundaram]] under his own company [[Modern Theatres|Modern Theatres]]. The script was written by Mana and K. Devarajan, an expert at writing comedy scenes. Music was by Vedha. The film stars [[Manorama|Manorama (Tamil actress)]] and [[R. S. Manohar|R. S. Manohar]] in the lead roles, with [[S. V. Ramadoss|S. V. Ramadoss]], A. Karunanidhi and K. K. Soundar in supporting roles. The film ran successfully in many centers in [[Madras|Madras]]. Konjum Kumari was [[Modern Theatres|Modern Theatres]]' 99th film.
title: Konjum Kumari

abstract: Welcome to Central Jail is a 2016 Indian [[Malayalam|Malayalam]]-language [[comedy film|comedy film]] written by [[Benny P. Nayarambalam|Benny P. Nayarambalam]] and directed by [[Sundar Das|Sundar Das]]. The cinematography is handled by [[Alagappan N|Alagappan N]]. The film features [[Dileep|Dileep]] and [[Vedhika|Vedhika]] in the lead roles, whereas [[Renji Panicker|Renji Panicker]], [[Kailash|Kailash (actor)]], [[Aju Varghese|Aju Varghese]], [[Siddique|Siddique (actor)]], Sudheer Sukumaran, [[Vinaya Prasad|Vinaya Prasad]] and [[Thesni Khan|Thesni Khan]] portray supporting roles. The film released on 10 September 2016.
title: Welcome to Central Jail

abstract: L'Odeur de la mandarine is a 2015 French [[drama film|drama film]] directed by Gilles Legrand. It stars [[Olivier Gourmet|Olivier Gourmet]] and Georgia Scalliet. It was nominated for two [[César Awards|César Awards]] at the [[41st César Awards|41st César Awards]].
title: L'Odeur de la mandarine

abstract: Loving Vincent is a 2017 [[experimental|Experimental film]] [[animated|Animated film]] [[biographical|Biographical film]] [[drama film|Drama (film and television)]] about the life of painter [[Vincent van Gogh|Vincent van Gogh]], and in particular, the circumstances of [[his death|Death of Vincent van Gogh]]. It is the first fully painted animated feature film. The film, written and directed by [[Dorota Kobiela|Dorota Kobiela]] and [[Hugh Welchman|Hugh Welchman]], is a Polish-UK co-production, funded by the [[Polish Film Institute|Polish Film Institute]], and partially through a [[Kickstarter|Kickstarter]] campaign.
title: Loving Vincent

abstract: The Meyerowitz Stories was selected to compete for the [[Palme d'Or|Palme d'Or]] in the main competition section and also won the [[Palm Dog|Palm Dog]] award at the [[2017 Cannes Film Festival|2017 Cannes Film Festival]]. It received positive reviews from critics, who praised Baumbach's script and direction as well as the performances, with Sandler especially singled out for praise. It was released in select theaters and on streaming by [[Netflix|Netflix]] on October 13, 2017.
title: The Meyerowitz Stories

abstract: Main Teri Tu Mera is a 2016 Indian [[Punjabi-language|Punjabi language]] film directed by [[Ksshitij Chaudhary|Ksshitij Chaudhary]], written by Pali Bhupinder Singh and starring [[Roshan Prince|Roshan Prince]], Yamini Malhotra, Mankirt Aulakh, Jazz Sodhi, [[Karamjit Anmol|Karamjit Anmol]]. The film was released on 19 August 2016. The movie has been majorly shot in border areas of village Ferozepur very near to Pakistan and some scenes of movie have also been shot in Chandigarh. Malhotra, Aulakh and Sodhi make their Punjabi film debut in Main Teri Tu Mera.
title: Main Teri Tu Mera

abstract: Chhoo Mantar is a [[1956|List of Bollywood films of 1956]] Bollywood film starring [[Shyama|Shyama]], [[Anita Guha|Anita Guha]], and [[Johnny Walker|Johnny Walker (actor)]]. It was directed by M. Sadiq.
title: Chhoo Mantar

abstract: Imoinu is a 2015 [[Manipur film|cinema of Manipur]] directed by Bijgupta Laishram and produced by Tarunkumar Heisnam, under the banner of Heisnam Brothers Films and presented by Shrabankumar. The film features [[Gokul Athokpam|Gokul Athokpam]], Sonia Samjetsabam and Sonia Hijam in the lead roles. Danny Likmabam, Maya Choudhory, Pritam, Prameshwori, Sanajaoba, Loken, Dhanamanjuri and Puneshori are cast as supporting roles. Imoinu was released at Bheigyachandra Open Air Theatre (BOAT), Imphal, on 30 October 2015. The film was also screened at different theatres of [[Manipur|Manipur]], including Pratap Talkies, Imphal in January 2016, and it was well received by the audiences.
title: Imoinu

abstract: The Very Private Life of Mister Sim (original title: La Vie très privée de Monsieur Sim; also known as The Terrible Privacy of Mr. Sim) is a 2015 French [[comedy-drama film|comedy-drama film]] directed by [[Michel Leclerc|Michel Leclerc]] and starring [[Jean-Pierre Bacri|Jean-Pierre Bacri]]. It is an adaptation of the novel [[The Terrible Privacy of Maxwell Sim|The Terrible Privacy of Maxwell Sim]] by English author [[Jonathan Coe|Jonathan Coe]]. It was released in France on 16 December 2015.
title: The Very Private Life of Mister Sim

abstract: Long Way North (, ) is a 2015 French-Danish [[animated film|animated film]] directed by Rémi Chayé. The film premiered at the [[Annecy International Animated Film Festival|Annecy International Animated Film Festival]], where it won the Audience Award.
title: Long Way North

abstract: He Died with His Eyes Open (original title: On ne meurt que deux fois) is a 1985 French erotic noir [[thriller film|thriller film]] directed by [[Jacques Deray|Jacques Deray]]. It was based on the 1984 English-language novel He Died with His Eyes Open by [[Derek Raymond|Derek Raymond]]. It starred [[Charlotte Rampling|Charlotte Rampling]] and [[Michel Serrault|Michel Serrault]]. The film won the [[César Award for Best Cinematography|César Award for Best Cinematography]]. Charlotte Rampling and Michel Serrault were nominated for César Award for Best Actor and Actress.
title: He Died with His Eyes Open

abstract: Felices 140 is a 2015 Spanish [[comedy-drama|comedy-drama]] film directed by [[Gracia Querejeta|Gracia Querejeta]]. It was co-written by Querejeta and [[Antonio Mercero|Antonio Mercero]]. It was released in Spain on April 10, 2015. On September 8, 2015 it was one of the three entries shortlisted to represent Spain at the [[88th Academy Awards|88th Academy Awards]] in the category for [[Best Foreign Language Film|Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film]], but was not selected.
title: Felices 140

abstract: Fundi-Mentals is a 2015 [[Kenya|Kenyan]] erotic [[comedy|comedy]] that was directed by Alexandros Konstantaras, who was also behind the [[House of Lungula|House of Lungula]] that featured judge Ian Mbugua, the comedy has already been nominated in this year's Africa Magic Viewer's Choice Awards in the best actor in comedy award. The film stars [[Charlie Karumi|Charlie Karumi]], [[Gerald Langiri|Gerald Langiri]] and [[Lizz Njagah|Lizz Njagah]].
title: Fundi-Mentals

abstract: Jimmy Rivière is passionate about [[Muay Thai|Muay Thai]]. He seeks a possible life where he could reconcile his faith and his love for Sonia, a young Muslim girl, also in love with him. But Jimmy is also a nervous young gypsy in search of ideal and plagued by doubts, who lives in his loosely truck fitted a bed, not far from his family of caravans : his mother and "sister love" married without love. His conversion to [[Pentecostalism|Pentecostalism]], a very assertive and fundamental branch in [[Protestantism|Protestantism]] led him to question himself on his two passions : boxing and Sonia. Indeed, [[Pentecostals|Pentecostals]] believe that to become a better man, they must renounce to violence and desire. Under pressure from the community, Jimmy applies but is struggling to put in agreement his will and acts. Gina, his boxing coach keeps reminding him that he would fine battles to fight and tries to make him back to his sporting passion.
title: Jimmy Rivière

abstract: In Jackson Heights is a 2015 [[documentary film|documentary film]] about the communities of [[Jackson Heights, Queens|Jackson Heights, Queens]], [[New York City|New York City]] directed by [[Frederick Wiseman|Frederick Wiseman]]. The film received widespread critical acclaim and is widely regarded as one of the best documentary films released in the 21st century. In 2017, the film was considered the thirteenth "Best Film of the 21st Century So Far" by [[The New York Times|The New York Times]].
title: In Jackson Heights

abstract: The Emoji Movie is a 2017 American computer [[animated film|Animation]] directed by [[Tony Leondis|Tony Leondis]], and written by Leondis, Eric Siegel and [[Mike White|Mike White (filmmaker)]], based on [[emoji|emoji]] graphics used in electronic messages. It stars the voices of [[T.J. Miller|T.J. Miller]], [[James Corden|James Corden]], [[Anna Faris|Anna Faris]], [[Maya Rudolph|Maya Rudolph]], [[Steven Wright|Steven Wright]], [[Rob Riggle|Rob Riggle]], [[Jennifer Coolidge|Jennifer Coolidge]], [[Christina Aguilera|Christina Aguilera]], [[Sofía Vergara|Sofía Vergara]], [[Sean Hayes|Sean Hayes (actor)]] and [[Patrick Stewart|Patrick Stewart]]. The film centers on Gene, a multi-expressional emoji who lives in a teenager's [[smartphone|smartphone]] and sets out on a journey to become a normal [[meh|meh]] emoji like his parents.
title: The Emoji Movie

abstract: Three Many Weddings () is a 2013 Spanish romantic comedy directed by Javier Ruiz Caldera and starring [[Inma Cuesta|Inma Cuesta]] and [[Martiño Rivas|Martiño Rivas]]. It was nominated to seven [[Goya Awards|Goya Awards]] and won the [[Best Comedy|Premio Feroz for Best Comedy]] award in the first edition of [[Premios Feroz|Premios Feroz]].
title: Three Many Weddings

abstract: Mah e Mir is a 2016 Pakistani [[biographical film|biographical film]] directed by Anjum Shahzad, produced by Khurram Rana, Sahir Rasheed, Badar Ikram and written by [[Sarmad Sehbai|Sarmad Sehbai]]. The film is based on the life of the famous poet [[Mir Taqi Mir|Mir Taqi Mir]], role played by [[Fahad Mustafa|Fahad Mustafa]]. Film also stars [[Iman Ali|Iman Ali]], [[Sanam Saeed|Sanam Saeed]], [[Alyy Khan|Alyy Khan]] and [[Manzar Sehbai|Manzar Sehbai]] in lead roles. It was the [[official submission|List of Pakistani submissions for the Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film]] by the [[Pakistani Academy Selection Committee|Pakistani Academy Selection Committee]] as the country's entry for the [[Best Foreign Language Film|Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film]] at the [[89th Academy Awards|89th Academy Awards]] but it was not nominated.
title: Mah e Mir

abstract: Uyyale ({{lang-kn|ಉಯ್ಯಾಲೆ}(in english : The Swing) is a 1969 [[Kannada language|Kannada language]] [[romantic drama|romantic drama]] film directed by N. Lakshminarayan and starring [[Rajkumar|Rajkumar (actor)]] and [[Kalpana|Kalpana (Kannada actress)]] in the lead roles. The film is a direct screen adaptation of the novel of the same name written by the acclaimed novelist [[Chaduranga|Chaduranga]] (Subramanyaraja Urs).
title: Uyyale

abstract: C.I.D. Rajanna () is a 1970 Indian [[Kannada language|Kannada language]] film produced and directed by R. Ramamurthy. It stars [[Rajkumar|Rajkumar (actor)]] in the lead role. The supporting cast features [[Rajasree|Rajasree]], Premalatha, Dinesh, Ranga, [[Dwarakish|Dwarakish]] and [[K. S. Ashwath|K. S. Ashwath]].
title: C.I.D. Rajanna

abstract: The Reincarnation of Golden Lotus is a 1989 Hong Kong film directed by [[Clara Law|Clara Law]] and produced by [[Teddy Robin|Teddy Robin]], and written by [[Lilian Lee|Lilian Lee]]. The film stars [[Joey Wong|Joey Wong]], [[Eric Tsang|Eric Tsang]], Wilson Lam, Pal Sinn, and [[Ku Feng|Ku Feng]]. The film premiered in [[Taiwan|Taiwan]] on 4 August 1989.
title: The Reincarnation of Golden Lotus

abstract: Amma Pillai is a [[1990|1990 in film]] [[Tamil|Tamil language]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[feature film|feature film]], [[directed|Film director]] by R. C. Shakthi and produced by M. K. Raju. It stars [[Ramki|Ramki]] and [[Seetha|Seetha (actress)]] in the lead roles. It is a remake of the Malayalam film [[Mortuary|Mortuary (1983 Indian film)]].
title: Amma Pillai

abstract: Surajya is a 2014 Indian [[Marathi|Marathi language]] language movie. The movie marks the debut of Vaibbhav Tatwawdi and is directed by award-winning Director of Mi Shivaji Raje Bhosale Boltoi fame Santosh Manjrekar. Music and Background score is given by Pankaj Padgham and Cinematography is by Vikramkumar Amladi. Vector Projects mark their entry into the Movie Industry with this movie.
title: Surajya

abstract: Bangaarada Panjara () is a [[1974|Kannada films of 1974]] Indian [[Kannada|Cinema of Karnataka]] [[comedy film|comedy film]] directed by [[V. Somashekhar|V. Somashekhar]] and starring [[Rajkumar|Rajkumar (actor)]] in the lead role. The supporting cast features [[Aarathi|Aarathi]], [[K. S. Ashwath|K. S. Ashwath]], [[Pandari Bai|Pandari Bai]] and [[Lokanath|Lokanath]]. The movie saw a theatrical run of 25 weeks.
title: Bangaarada Panjara

abstract: Tulip Fever is a 2017 [[historical|List of historical period drama films and series]] [[romantic drama|romantic drama]] film directed by [[Justin Chadwick|Justin Chadwick]] and written by [[Deborah Moggach|Deborah Moggach]] and [[Tom Stoppard|Tom Stoppard]], adapted from Moggach's novel of the same name. It stars [[Alicia Vikander|Alicia Vikander]], [[Dane DeHaan|Dane DeHaan]], [[Jack O'Connell|Jack O'Connell (actor)]], [[Zach Galifianakis|Zach Galifianakis]], [[Judi Dench|Judi Dench]], [[Christoph Waltz|Christoph Waltz]], [[Holliday Grainger|Holliday Grainger]], [[Matthew Morrison|Matthew Morrison]] and [[Cara Delevingne|Cara Delevingne]]. The plot follows a [[17th-century|Tulip mania]] painter in [[Amsterdam|Amsterdam]] who falls in love with a married woman whose portrait he has been commissioned to paint.
title: Tulip Fever

abstract: Kaatrinile Varum Geetham () is a [[1978|1978 in film]] [[Tamil|Tamil language]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[feature film|feature film]], [[directed|Film director]] by [[S. P. Muthuraman|S. P. Muthuraman]] for Vijayabhaskar Films. The film stars [[Muthuraman|Muthuraman (actor)]] and [[Kavitha|Kavitha (actress)]] in the lead roles.
title: Kaatrinile Varum Geetham

abstract: Found Footage 3D is a 2016 American [[found footage|found footage (pseudo-documentary)]] [[horror film|horror film]]. It is the debut feature film of writer/director Steven DeGennaro, and is being [[produced|Film producer]] by [[Texas Chainsaw Massacre|The Texas Chain Saw Massacre]] co-creator [[Kim Henkel|Kim Henkel]]. It is the first found footage horror movie shot natively in [[3D|3D film]]. Filming began on May 26, 2014 in [[Gonzales, Texas|Gonzales, Texas]], starring Carter Roy, Alena von Stroheim, Chris O'Brien, Tom Saporito, Scott Allen Perry, Jessica Perrin, and Scott Weinberg, and wrapped mid-June 2014.
title: Found Footage 3D

abstract: Munnettam is a [[1981|Malayalam films of 1981]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed by [[Sreekumaran Thampi|Sreekumaran Thampi]] and produced by S Kumar. The film stars [[Mammootty|Mammootty]],[[Sumalatha|Sumalatha]],[[Ratheesh|Ratheesh]], [[Menaka|Menaka (actress)]] and [[Jalaja|Jalaja]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[Shyam|Shyam (composer)]].
title: Munnettam

abstract: Therkathi Kallan is a 1988 [[Tamil|Tamil language]] [[comedy|comedy]] [[drama film|drama film]] directed by [[P. Kalaimani|P. Kalaimani]]. The film stars [[Vijayakanth|Vijayakanth]] and [[Radhika|Radhika (actress)]] in the lead roles. The movie was dubbed in Telegu as Maa Oori Kittayya.
title: Therkathi Kallan

abstract: Gadibidi Aliya () is a 1995 Indian [[Kannada|Kannada language]] [[comedy drama|comedy drama]] film, directed by [[Sai Prakash|Sai Prakash]] and produced by K. Raghava Rao. This film stars [[Shivrajkumar|Shivrajkumar]] in a dual role, [[Malashri|Malashri]] and [[Mohini|Mohini (Tamil actress)]] in the lead roles whilst [[Jayamala|Jayamala]] and [[Srinath|Srinath]] play other pivotal roles.
title: Gadibidi Aliya

abstract: Kamalatho Naa Prayanam is a Telugu film directed by [[Narasimha Nandi|Narasimha Nandi]] marking his third film after the [[National Film Award|National Film Award for Best Feature Film in Telugu]] and multi [[Nandi Award|Nandi Award]] winning 2008 film [[1940 Lo Oka Gramam|1940 Lo Oka Gramam]]. This film produced by Isanaka Sunil Reddy and Siddharth Bogulu on Livitha Universal Films features [[Sivaji|Sivaji (Telugu actor)]] and [[Archana Veda Sastry|Veda Sastry]] in the lead roles. It is about a woman who is striving to get out of her job as a sex worker and the betrayal she faced from the person she loved after believing rumors about her private life.
title: Kamalatho Naa Prayanam

abstract: On 16 December 2012, a [[horrific gang-rape|2012 Delhi gang rape]] of an Indian girl took place in a moving bus in [[New Delhi|New Delhi]], the national capital of India. The event was followed by various [[protest|protests]] in which masses took to the streets in various Indian states, demanding the government to form stricter laws regarding women safety. The media industry voiced its concern in its own way. One such way was the women-empowerment [[ad campaign|ad campaign]] 'Dekh Le', launched one year after the incident.
title: Dekh Le

abstract: Golmaal Radhakrishna is a 1990 [[India|Indian]] [[Kannada|Cinema of Karnataka]] [[comedy film|comedy film]] directed and written by [[Om Sai Prakash|Om Sai Prakash]]. The film starred [[Anant Nag|Anant Nag]] in the title role along with Chandrika and Vanitha Vasu in leading roles. The music of the film was composed by [[M. Ranga Rao|M. Ranga Rao]].
title: Golmaal Radhakrishna

abstract: Strangerland is a 2015 Australian-Irish [[drama|Drama film]] [[suspense film|suspense film]] directed by Kim Farrant at her [[directorial debut|list of directorial debuts]], and written by Michael Kinirons and Fiona Seres. The film stars [[Nicole Kidman|Nicole Kidman]], [[Joseph Fiennes|Joseph Fiennes]], and [[Hugo Weaving|Hugo Weaving]]. The film premiered at the [[Sundance Film Festival|Sundance Film Festival]] on 23 January 2015 and in a [[limited release|limited release]] in cinemas and through [[video on demand|video on demand]] on 10 July 2015 by [[Alchemy|Alchemy]]. It was a [[box office bomb|box office bomb]], grossing $1 million against a $10 million budget.
title: Strangerland

abstract: Ninagagi (; ) is a 2002 Indian [[Kannada language|Kannada language]] romance-drama musical film directed by [[S. Mahendar|S. Mahendar]]. The film stars [[Vijay Raghavendra|Vijay Raghavendra]] in his first role as an adult and newcomer [[Radhika|Kutty Radhika]] in the lead roles. The film is about a special friendship between a boy and girl. The film is a remake of [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] blockbuster film [[Niram|Niram]] (1999) which was also remade in Telugu as [[Nuvve Kavali|Nuvve Kavali]] (2001). The film was produced by [[Ramoji Rao|Ramoji Rao]] and the music was composed by [[Gurukiran|Gurukiran]].
title: Ninagagi

abstract: Mad About Dance is an [[2014|2014 in film]] Indian [[dance film|dance film]]. The film is directed by [[Saahil Prem|Saahil Prem]]. The film stars [[Saahil Prem|Saahil Prem]] and [[Amrit Maghera|Amrit Maghera]] in the lead roles. [[Saahil Prem|Saahil Prem]] debuted as an actor alongside [[Sunny Leone|Sunny Leone]] in the 2014 film [[Ragini MMS 2|Ragini MMS 2]], and is now making his debut as a director with Mad About Dance.
title: Mad About Dance

abstract: 20 Once Again (Chinese: 重返20岁 Chóng fǎn èrshí suì) is the 2015 Chinese comedy film directed by [[Leste Chen|Leste Chen]] and starring [[Yang Zishan|Yang Zishan]], [[Gua Ah-leh|Gua Ah-leh]], [[Bolin Chen|Bolin Chen]] and [[Lu Han|Lu Han (singer)]]. The film is a [[remake|remake]] of the South Korean movie [[Miss Granny|Miss Granny]]. It was released on January 8, 2015.
title: 20 Once Again

abstract: Along with the Gods: The Two Worlds () is a 2017 South Korean [[action|Action film]] [[fantasy|Fantasy film]] [[drama film|Drama (film and television)]] directed by [[Kim Yong-hwa|Kim Yong-hwa]] and based on a [[webtoon|webtoon]] by Joo Ho-min, [[Along with the Gods|Along with the Gods]]. It stars [[Ha Jung-woo|Ha Jung-woo]], [[Cha Tae-hyun|Cha Tae-hyun]], [[Ju Ji-hoon|Ju Ji-hoon]] and [[Kim Hyang-gi|Kim Hyang-gi]].
title: Along with the Gods: The Two Worlds

abstract: How to Be Yours is a 2016 [[Filipino|Cinema of the Philippines]] romantic drama film directed by [[Dan Villegas|Dan Villegas]] starring [[Bea Alonzo|Bea Alonzo]] and [[Gerald Anderson|Gerald Anderson]] and executive produced by [[Charo Santos-Concio|Charo Santos-Concio]] and [[Malou Santos|Malou Santos]]. The film premiered on July 26, 2016 in a premiere night held on [[SM Megamall|SM Megamall]] that was attended by the cast and crew of the film, some celebrities, several ABS-CBN executives, and the [[Philippine Vice President|Philippine Vice President]] [[Leni Robredo|Leni Robredo]] and her daughters Aika and Jillian. The film was released by Star Cinema on July 27, 2016 in over 180 cinemas throughout the country. The film is Graded B by the [[Cinema Evaluation Board of the Philippines|Cinema Evaluation Board of the Philippines]].
title: How to Be Yours

abstract: Irréprochable (English: Faultless) is a 2016 French [[thriller film|thriller film]] written and directed by Sébastien Marnier. The film stars [[Marina Foïs|Marina Foïs]], [[Jérémie Elkaïm|Jérémie Elkaïm]], [[Joséphine Japy|Joséphine Japy]], and [[Benjamin Biolay|Benjamin Biolay]].
title: Irréprochable

abstract: Sneha Geetham's main plot revolves around three youngsters Ravi (Venky Atluri), Krishna ([[Chaitanya Krishna|Chaitanya Krishna]]) and Arjun ([[Sundeep Kishan|Sundeep Kishan]]). The movie opens with a beautiful message to youth from the voice over of sensational director [[V. V. Vinayak|V. V. Vinayak]] stating "Life is a chance, living is a choice. So, follow the heart and future is ours." Ravi, Krishna, Arjun, Shailu ([[Shreya Dhanwanthary|Shreya Dhanwanthary]]) and Pooja (Ria) are good friends who study engineering in Nalla Malla Reddy College of Engineering, Hyderabad. The movie begins with these five friends introducing themselves to seniors in their first year ragging and progresses to final year campus interviews.
title: Sneha Geetham

abstract: Barcelona: A Love Untold is a 2016 [[Philippine|Cinema of the Philippines]] [[romance|Romance film]] [[drama|drama]] film, directed by [[Olivia Lamasan|Olivia Lamasan]], starring [[Kathryn Bernardo|Kathryn Bernardo]] and [[Daniel Padilla|Daniel Padilla]]. The film was produced and released by [[Star Cinema|Star Cinema]] and was released on September 14, 2016.
title: Barcelona: A Love Untold

abstract: A Date for Mad Mary is a 2016 Irish drama film, directed by [[Darren Thornton|Darren Thornton]]. It won two [[Irish Film & Television Awards|14th Irish Film & Television Awards]], including Best Film.
title: A Date for Mad Mary

abstract: Vaazhnthu Kaattugiren is a 1975 [[Tamil language|Tamil language]] [[drama film|Drama (film and television)]] directed by [[Krishnan Panju|Krishnan Panju]] and produced by S. S. Karuppusamy. The story was written by S. S. Thennarasu. The screenplay and dialogue were written by [[J. Mahendran|J. Mahendran]]. Music was composed by [[M. S. Viswanathan|M. S. Viswanathan]]. The film starred [[R. Muthuraman|R. Muthuraman]], [[Sujatha|Sujatha (actress)]], and [[Padmapriya|Padmapriya (actress)]], with [[Sreekanth|Sreekanth]], [[M. N. Rajam|M. N. Rajam]], [[Manorama|Manorama (Tamil actress)]], and [[Suruli Rajan|Suruli Rajan]] in supporting roles.
title: Vaazhnthu Kaattugiren

abstract: Maalaiyitta Mangai () is a 1958 [[Tamil-language|Tamil language]] film directed by G. R. Nathan and produced by [[Kannadasan|Kannadasan]] under his brother's own production company ALS Productions. The film's soundtrack was composed by [[Viswanathan-Ramamoorthy|Viswanathan-Ramamoorthy]]. The film stars [[T. R. Mahalingam|T. R. Mahalingam (actor)]], [[Pandari Bai|Pandari Bai]] and [[Mynavathi|Mynavathi]] in lead roles, with [[Manorama|Manorama (Tamil actress)]] (in her acting debut), [[Kaka Radhakrishnan|Kaka Radhakrishnan]] and [[C. Lakshmi Rajyam|C. Lakshmi Rajyam]] in supporting roles. It is based on [[Sarat Chandra Chattopadhyay|Sarat Chandra Chattopadhyay]]'s novel Chandra Nath.
title: Maalaiyitta Mangai

abstract: Girls Trip premiered at the [[American Black Film Festival|American Black Film Festival]] in [[Miami|Miami]] on June 14, 2017, and was theatrically released in the United States by [[Universal Pictures|Universal Pictures]] on July 21, 2017. It received positive reviews from critics, with many praising Haddish's performance, and was chosen by [[Time|Time (magazine)]] magazine as one of its top ten films of 2017. It grossed $140 million worldwide, including over $100 million domestically, the first comedy of 2017 to do so. It was also the first time a film by an African-American female screenwriter crossed the $100 million mark.
title: Girls Trip

abstract: The Boss's Daughter (original title: La Fille du patron) is a 2015 French [[romance film|romance film]] directed and co-written by Olivier Loustau and starring Loustau and [[Christa Theret|Christa Theret]].
title: The Boss's Daughter

abstract: The film was produced by M. A. Venu who also made [[Sampoorna Ramayanam|Sampoorna Ramayanam (1958 film)]], [[Mangalyam|Mangalyam (film)]], [[Town Bus|Town Bus]], [[Panam Pandhiyile|Panam Pandhiyile]] and [[Mudhalali|Mudhalali]]. This film, Pennarasi, was produced at [[Central Studios|Central Studios]], [[Coimbatore|Coimbatore]].
title: Pennarasi

abstract: Panfilov's 28 Men (, [[translit.|Transliteration]]   28 panfilovtsev) is a 2016 [[war film|war film]] based on a [[Soviet propaganda|Propaganda in the Soviet Union]] legend about a group of soldiers – [[Panfilov's Twenty-Eight Guardsmen|Panfilov's Twenty-Eight Guardsmen]] – heroically halting and destroying German tanks headed for Moscow before all perishing together on the battlefield. It is set in the [[Eastern Front of World War II|Eastern Front (World War II)]] and covers the [[8th Guards Rifle Division|8th Guards Rifle Division]] operations during the 1941 [[Battle of Moscow|Battle of Moscow]]. On DVD, it is also known as Battle for Moscow.
title: Panfilov's 28 Men

abstract: Kalushi is brutally beaten by the police. He goes into exile following the [[1976 Soweto|Soweto uprising]] uprisings to join the liberation movement. He returns from military training in Angola. En route to their mission, his friend and comrade, Mondy, loses control and shoots two innocent people on Goch Street in [[Johannesburg|Johannesburg]]. Mondy is severely beaten and tortured; Kalushi is forced to stand trial under the common purpose doctrine.
title: Kalushi

abstract: Lipstick Under My Burkha is a 2016 Indian [[black comedy film|black comedy film]] written and directed by [[Alankrita Shrivastava|Alankrita Shrivastava]] and produced by [[Prakash Jha|Prakash Jha]]. The film stars an [[ensemble cast|ensemble cast]] including [[Ratna Pathak|Ratna Pathak]], [[Konkona Sen Sharma|Konkona Sen Sharma]], [[Aahana Kumra|Aahana Kumra]] and [[Plabita Borthakur|Plabita Borthakur]] in leading roles, along with [[Sushant Singh|Sushant Singh]], [[Sonal Jha|Sonal Jha]], [[Vikrant Massey|Vikrant Massey]], [[Shashank Arora|Shashank Arora]], [[Vaibhav Tatwawaadi|Vaibhav Tatwawaadi]] and Jagat Singh Solanki in supportive roles. The first trailer was released on 14 October 2016. The film premiered at the [[Tokyo|Tokyo Film Festival]] and [[Mumbai Film Festival|Mumbai Film Festivals]], where it won the Spirit of Asia Prize and the Oxfam Award for Best Film on Gender Equality. The film turned out to be both a critical and commercial hit at the box office. The film received two nominations at the [[63rd Filmfare Awards|63rd Filmfare Awards]], including [[Best Film (Critics)|Filmfare Critics Award for Best Film]] and [[Best Supporting Actress|Filmfare Award for Best Supporting Actress]] for Ratna Pathak.
title: Lipstick Under My Burkha

abstract: Borg vs McEnroe (, ), also known as Borg McEnroe, is a 2017 [[biographical|biographical film]] [[sports|sports film]] [[drama film|drama film]] focusing on the famous [[rivalry|Borg–McEnroe rivalry]] between [[tennis|tennis]] players [[Björn Borg|Björn Borg]] and [[John McEnroe|John McEnroe]] at the [[1980 Wimbledon Championships|1980 Wimbledon Championships]], culminating in their [[encounter in the men's singles final|1980 Wimbledon Championships – Men's singles final]]. The film is directed by [[Janus Metz Pedersen|Janus Metz Pedersen]], from a screenplay written by Ronnie Sandahl, and stars [[Sverrir Gudnason|Sverrir Gudnason]], [[Shia LaBeouf|Shia LaBeouf]], [[Stellan Skarsgård|Stellan Skarsgård]], [[Tuva Novotny|Tuva Novotny]], and [[Robert Emms|Robert Emms]]. The film opened the [[2017 Toronto International Film Festival|2017 Toronto International Film Festival]].
title: Borg vs McEnroe

abstract: Dad in Training (original title: Tout pour être heureux) is a 2015 French [[comedy film|comedy film]] written and directed by Cyril Gelblat, loosely based on the novel Un coup à prendre by Xavier de Moulins. The film stars [[Manu Payet|Manu Payet]], [[Audrey Lamy|Audrey Lamy]] and [[Aure Atika|Aure Atika]].
title: Dad in Training

abstract: South of 8 is a 2016 American [[crime film|crime film]] written by first time director Tony Olmos and Rosewood Five Productions, based on a string of bank robberies set in the near future. It officially premiered September 26, 2016 at the [[Downtown Los Angeles Film Festival|Downtown Los Angeles Film Festival]] in [[Los Angeles|Los Angeles]], [[California|California]], where it won the jury award for [[Best Dramatic Screenplay|Best Dramatic Screenplay]]. Prior to its premiere, the film won 'Best Trailer' at the [[San Diego Film Awards|San Diego Film Awards]] and was a finalist for Audience Choice #TrailerChallenge at DTLAFF via Indi.com. The film screened again on February 11, 2017 at [[San Diego Film Week|San Diego Film Week]] and took home the award for "Best Horror/SciFi/Thriller Feature."
title: South of 8

abstract: Thiruttu Payale 2 is a 2017 Indian Tamil-language thriller film directed and written by [[Susi Ganeshan|Susi Ganeshan]]. A spiritual successor to his earlier [[Thiruttu Payale|Thiruttu Payale]] (2006), the film features [[Bobby Simha|Bobby Simha]], [[Prasanna|Prasanna (actor)]] and [[Amala Paul|Amala Paul]] in the lead roles. The film features music composed by [[Vidyasagar|Vidyasagar (composer)]], while [[Raja Mohammad|Raja Mohammad]] was the editor. Produced by [[AGS Entertainment|AGS Entertainment]], the venture began production in October 2016 and was released on 30 November 2017. Satellite rights of the film were sold to [[Zee Tamil|Zee Tamil]]
title: Thiruttu Payale 2

abstract: Kirik Party is a 2016 Indian [[Kannada Language|Kannada Language]] [[campus|campus]] [[romantic comedy|romantic comedy]] film directed by [[Rishab Shetty|Rishab Shetty]], and produced by G. S. Guptha and [[Rakshit Shetty|Rakshit Shetty]]. It stars Rakshit Shetty, [[Rashmika Mandanna|Rashmika Mandanna]], [[Samyuktha Hegde|Samyuktha Hegde]], Aravinnd Iyer, Dhananjay Ranjan and Pramod Shetty in prominent roles. Rakshit wrote the story of the film and also co-wrote the script along with a team "The Seven odds" apart from playing a protagonist.
title: Kirik Party

abstract: Shankhachil is well received by critics. It has won the [[Best Feature Film in Bengali|National Film Award for Best Feature Film in Bengali]] award at [[63rd National Film Awards|63rd National Film Awards]]. It has also been selected for [[Montreal World Film Festival|Montreal World Film Festival]].
title: Shankhachil

abstract: Vaira Malai or Vaira Maalai (English: Diamond Necklace) is a [[Tamil language|Tamil language]] film released in 1954 with [[R. S. Manohar|R. S. Manohar]], [[K. A. Thangavelu|K. A. Thangavelu]], [[Padmini|Padmini (actress)]] and [[Ragini|Ragini (actress)]] in the lead roles.
title: Vaira Maalai

abstract: ‘Capital I' was premiered at [1] (South Asian Alternative Film Festival) at Paris in February 2015. Thereafter, the film was screened at various film festivals including 20th [[International Film Festival of Kerala|International Film Festival of Kerala]] in December 2015. ‘Capital I’ is distributed worldwide through the Italian sales and distribution company ‘[2]’. ‘Capital I’ is the first [[Indian film|cinema of India]] to be acquired by ‘The Open Reel’. In India, the film has been theatrically released through the Mumbai-based distribution house – [3]. The film’s initial release dates are 23 October 2016 for [[Bhubaneswar|Bhubaneswar]], 6 November 2016 for [[Kolkata|Kolkata]] and 4 December 2016 for [[Mumbai|Mumbai]].
title: Capital I

abstract: Dark Inclusion (; also known as Dark Diamond) is a 2016 [[drama film|Drama (film and television)]] directed by Arthur Harari and starring [[Niels Schneider|Niels Schneider]] and [[August Diehl|August Diehl]].
title: Dark Inclusion

abstract: Red Sparrow is a 2018 American [[spy|spy film]] [[thriller film|thriller film]] directed by [[Francis Lawrence|Francis Lawrence]] and written by [[Justin Haythe|Justin Haythe]], based on the [[2013 novel of the same name|Red Sparrow (novel)]] by [[Jason Matthews|Jason Matthews (novelist)]]. The film stars [[Jennifer Lawrence|Jennifer Lawrence]], [[Joel Edgerton|Joel Edgerton]], [[Matthias Schoenaerts|Matthias Schoenaerts]], [[Charlotte Rampling|Charlotte Rampling]], [[Mary-Louise Parker|Mary-Louise Parker]], and [[Jeremy Irons|Jeremy Irons]]. It tells the story of a [[Russian intelligence officer|Russian Intelligence Community]], who is sent to make contact with a CIA officer in the hope of discovering the identity of a [[mole|mole (espionage)]].
title: Red Sparrow

abstract: K3 en de Kattenprins (K3 and the Cat Prince) is the third movie of the Flemish [[girlband|All-female band]] [[K3|K3 (band)]]. The movie was released in 2007 and was directed by Matthias Temmermans. This was also their last movie to include former member of K3, [[Kathleen Aerts|Kathleen Aerts]]. The film was aired on [[Zappelin|Zappelin]], [[Ketnet|Ketnet]], [[Kindernet|Kindernet]] and [[RTL Telekids|RTL Telekids]]
title: K3 en de Kattenprins

abstract: The Death and Life of Otto Bloom is a 2016 Australian [[mockumentary|mockumentary]] drama film written and directed by Cris Jones, starring [[Xavier Samuel|Xavier Samuel]], [[Rachel Ward|Rachel Ward]] and [[Matilda Brown|Matilda Brown]]. The film is produced by Alicia Brown, Mish Armstrong and Melanie Coombs.
title: The Death and Life of Otto Bloom

abstract: At Cafe 6 is a 2016 Chinese-Taiwanese [[romance film|romance film]] directed by Neal Wu and starring Dong Zijian, Cherry Ngan, [[Austin Lin|Austin Lin]], Ouyang Nini and Ireine Song. It was released in Taiwan on July 15, 2016 and in China on July 29, 2016.
title: At Cafe 6

abstract: Vafaatheri Kehiveriya is a 2016 Maldivian [[romantic film|romantic film]] directed by [[Ali Seezan|Ali Seezan]]. Produced by Mohamed Abdullah under Dhedhekeves Production, the film stars [[Ali Seezan|Ali Seezan]], [[Maleeha Waheed|Maleeha Waheed]], Zeenath Abbas and Ahmed Saeed in pivotal roles. The film was released on 10 May 2016. The film was based on Ibrahim Waheedh's novel Vanhanaa. Apart from four scenes, the whole film was shot in [[Ha. Kelaa|Kelaa (Haa Alif Atoll)]].
title: Vafaatheri Kehiveriya

abstract: Mathar Kula Manickam is a 1956 [[Tamil|Tamil language]] [[drama film|drama film]], produced by A. Sankar Reddy under the Lalitha Films banner and directed by [[Tatineni Prakash Rao|Tatineni Prakash Rao]]. The film stars [[Gemini Ganesan|Gemini Ganesan]], [[A. Nageswara Rao|A. Nageswara Rao]], [[Anjali Devi|Anjali Devi]] and [[Savitri|Savitri (actress)]] in the lead roles, with music composed by [[S. Rajeswara Rao|S. Rajeswara Rao]]. The screenplay and dialogue were written by V. Sadha Sivabrahmmam and [[C. V. Sridhar|C. V. Sridhar]], respectively. The film was simultaneously made in [[Telugu|Telugu language]] under the title [[Charana Daasi|Charana Daasi]], both versions were critical and commercial successes.
title: Mathar Kula Manickam

abstract: Akka Thangai (English: Elder and Younger Sister) is a 1969 [[Tamil-language|Tamil language]] [[drama film|Drama (film and television)]], directed by [[M. A. Thirumugam|M. A. Thirumugam]] and produced and screenplay by [[Sandow M. M. A. Chinnappa Thevar|Sandow M. M. A. Chinnappa Thevar]] under his productions. The film dialogue was written by Aarudoss and the story was written by Poovai Krishnan respectively. Music was by [[Sankar Ganesh|Sankar Ganesh]]. It stars [[Jaishankar|Jaishankar]], [[K. R. Vijaya|K. R. Vijaya]], [[Sowcar Janaki|Sowcar Janaki]], [[Major Sundarrajan|Major Sundarrajan]] and [[Nagesh|Nagesh]] playing lead roles. The film was remade in Telugu as [[Akka Chellelu|Akka Chellelu]] (1970).
title: Akka Thangai

abstract: Kaakum Karangal () is a 1965 [[Tamil-language|Tamil language]] Indian [[drama film|Drama (film and television)]], directed by [[A. C. Tirulokchandar|A. C. Tirulokchandar]]. Inspired by the [[W. Somerset Maugham|W. Somerset Maugham]] novel [[The Painted Veil|The Painted Veil (novel)]], The film was produced by [[AVM Productions|AVM Productions]]. The film stars [[S. S. Rajendran|S. S. Rajendran]] and [[C. R. Vijayakumari|C. R. Vijayakumari]] in lead roles, with [[Nagesh|Nagesh]], [[L. Vijayalakshmi|L. Vijayalakshmi]], S. V. Subbaiah, [[Sivakumar|Sivakumar]] (in his acting debut) and Revathi playing supporting roles.
title: Kaakum Karangal

abstract: Blinky Bill the Movie is a 2015 [[computer-animated|computer animation]] adventure-comedy film based on the [[Blinky Bill|Blinky Bill]] character, an anthropomorphic koala created by [[Dorothy Wall|Dorothy Wall]] for a children's book series in 1933. The film was produced by [[Flying Bark Productions|Flying Bark Productions]] (formerly known as Yoram Gross Films Studio, which also produced [[Blinky Bill: The Mischievous Koala|Blinky Bill: The Mischievous Koala]], a 1992 [[traditional-animated|traditional animation]] film featuring the character, as [[Yoram Gross|Yoram Gross]] passed away four days after the release of this CGI movie), and co-produced by [[Assemblage Entertainment|Assemblage Entertainment]] (India) and Telegael (Ireland).
title: Blinky Bill the Movie

abstract: [[Walt Disney Pictures|Walt Disney Pictures]] announced the film in September 2015. Marshall was hired later that month, and Blunt and Miranda were cast in February 2016. [[Principal photography|Principal photography]] lasted from February to July 2017, and took place at [[Shepperton Studios|Shepperton Studios]] in [[Surrey|Surrey]], England. Mary Poppins Returns held its world premiere at the [[Dolby Theatre|Dolby Theatre]] in [[Los Angeles|Los Angeles]] on November 29, 2018, and was released in the United States on December 19, 2018, making it one of the longest gaps between film sequels in cinematic history at 54 years.
title: Mary Poppins Returns

abstract: Charda Suraj ([[Punjabi|Punjabi language]]: ) is a 1982 [[Lollywood|Lollywood]] [[action film|action film]] .This film is directed by Basheer Rana and produced by Mohammad Naeem Khan, starring [[Sultan Rahi|Sultan Rahi]], [[Mumtaz|Mumtaz]], [[Mustafa Qureshi|Mustafa Qureshi]] and [[Ilyas Kashmiri|Ilyas Kashmiri (actor)]].
title: Charda Suraj

abstract: Adl-e-Jehangir (The Justice Of Jehangir) also referred to as Adil-e-Jehangir, is a [[1955|List of Bollywood films of 1955]] [[black and white|black and white]] Bollywood Urdu language historical [[drama film|drama film]] directed by [[G.P. Sippy|G.P. Sippy]]. According to Sippy in an interview, it was the first film he directed, and it became a commercial success at the box office. The film had music composed by [[Husnlal Bhagatram|Husnlal Bhagatram]], assisted by Shukla, with lyrics by [[Qamar Jalalabadi|Qamar Jalalabadi]]. A popular [[ghazal|ghazal]] from the film was "Ae Meri Zindagi Tujhe Dhundhoon Kahan" sung by [[Talat Mehmood|Talat Mehmood]]. The film starred [[Pradeep Kumar|Pradeep Kumar]], [[Meena Kumari|Meena Kumari]], [[Durga Khote|Durga Khote]], [[Sapru|Sapru (actor)]] and [[Jankidas|Jankidas]].
title: Adl-e-Jehangir

abstract: Rickshawala is a remake of the 1971 [[Tamil|Tamil language]] film [[Rickshawkaran|Rickshawkaran]], and was [[Neetu Singh|Neetu Singh]]'s first film as the lead heroine.
title: Rickshawala

abstract: Ambarsariya is an Indian [[Punjabi|Cinema of Punjab]] comedy thriller film directed by Mandeep Kumar, written by Dheeraj Rattan and starring [[Diljit Dosanjh|Diljit Dosanjh]], [[Monica Gill|Monica Gill]], [[Navneet Kaur Dhillon|Navneet Kaur Dhillon]], [[Lauren Gottlieb|Lauren Gottlieb]] as the main cast of the film and was released worldwide on 25 March 2016.
title: Ambarsariya

abstract: Everything About Her is a 2016 Filipino [[comedy-drama|comedy-drama]] film directed by [[Joyce E. Bernal|Joyce E. Bernal]], starring [[Vilma Santos|Vilma Santos]], [[Xian Lim|Xian Lim]] , and Ms. [[Angel Locsin|Angel Locsin]]. It was released on 27 January 2016 under [[Star Cinema|Star Cinema]]. The film earned on its first day of release.
title: Everything About Her

abstract: Khoon Aur Paani () is a [[1981|Bollywood films of 1981]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[action film|action film]], produced by A.A. Nadiadwala under the A.G.Films Pvt. Ltd. banner and directed by Chand. It stars [[Feroz Khan|Feroz Khan (actor, born 1939)]], [[Jeetendra|Jeetendra]], [[Rekha|Rekha]], [[Parveen Babi|Parveen Babi]] in the lead roles and music composed by [[Laxmikant–Pyarelal|Laxmikant–Pyarelal]].
title: Khoon Aur Paani

abstract: [[Lianhua Film Company|Lianhua Film Company]] was the biggest film company of China in the 1930s. Eight young directors chosen to participate in the project were already praised for their previous works. Most of them became even more important several years later and today their films are considered classics. Some, like Sun Yu's [[The Big Road|The Big Road]] (1934), Cai Chusheng's [[The Spring River Flows East|The Spring River Flows East]] (1947), Fei Mu's [[Spring in a Small Town|Spring in a Small Town]] (1948), or Shen Fu's [[Myriad of Lights|Myriad of Lights]] (1949) often reappear on many "best Chinese films of all time" lists. [[Zhu Shilin|Zhu Shilin]] became a prominent figure in [[Hong Kong cinema|Cinema of Hong Kong]] of the 1950s. In this respect, today Lianhua Symphony can be considered an overview of short films created by the most important directors of the so-called "first generation" of [[Chinese filmmakers|Cinema of China]].
title: Lianhua Symphony

abstract: Prem Tapasya ([[English|English language]]: Love Penance; [[Hindi|Hindi]]: प्रेम तपस्या) is a [[1983|Bollywood films of 1983]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[romantic film|romantic film]], produced by [[Akkineni Nageswara Rao|Akkineni Nageswara Rao]] under the [[Annapurna Studios|Annapurna Studios]] banner and directed by [[Dasari Narayana Rao|Dasari Narayana Rao]]. It stars [[Jeetendra|Jeetendra]], [[Reena Roy|Reena Roy]], [[Rekha|Rekha]] in the lead roles and music composed by [[Laxmikant Pyarelal|Laxmikant Pyarelal]]. The film is a remake of the [[Telugu|Telugu language]] blockbuster movie [[Premabhishekam|Premabhishekam (1981 film)]] (1981), starring Akkineni Nageswara Rao, [[Sridevi|Sridevi]], [[Jayasudha|Jayasudha]] in the pivotal roles. Both the movies are made by the same banner and director. The film was successful and [[Reena Roy|Reena Roy]] was praised for her role as a sacrificial romantic women as she is often seen in her films.
title: Prem Tapasya

abstract: Deedar-E-Yaar is a [[1982|Bollywood films of 1982]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[romantic film|romantic film]], produced by Prasan Kapoor under the Tirupati Pictures Enterprises banner and directed by Harnam Singh Rawail. It stars [[Jeetendra|Jeetendra]], [[Rishi Kapoor|Rishi Kapoor]], [[Rekha|Rekha]], [[Tina Munim|Tina Munim]] in the lead roles and music composed by [[Laxmikant Pyarelal|Laxmikant Pyarelal]].
title: Deedar-E-Yaar

abstract: Yaar Mera ([[English|English language]]: My Friend; [[Hindi|Hindi]]: यार मेरा) is a 1972 [[Bollywood|Bollywood]], [[drama film|drama film]], produced by Rajaram, Satish Wagel on R.S.Productions banner and directed by Atma Ram. Starring [[Jeetendra|Jeetendra]], [[Rakhee Gulzar|Rakhee Gulzar]] in the lead roles and music composed by [[Shankar Jaikishan|Shankar Jaikishan]].
title: Yaar Mera

abstract: My Big Night () is a 2015 Spanish comedy film directed by [[Álex de la Iglesia|Álex de la Iglesia]], who also co-wrote it with [[Jorge Guerricaechevarría|Jorge Guerricaechevarría]]. The film's world premiere was at the [[2015 Toronto International Film Festival|2015 Toronto International Film Festival]] and it premiered in Spain on 23 October 2015.
title: My Big Night

abstract: 92 Legendary La Rose Noire is a 1992 Hong Kong [[comedy film|comedy film]] written and directed by [[Jeffrey Lau|Jeffrey Lau]] and starring [[Tony Leung|Tony Leung Ka-fai]], [[Maggie Shiu|Maggie Shiu]], [[Teresa Mo|Teresa Mo]], Wong Wan-sze and [[Fung Bo Bo|Fung Bo Bo]]. The film was nominated for eight awards at the [[12th Hong Kong Film Awards|12th Hong Kong Film Awards]], where Leung won his second [[Hong Kong Film Award for Best Actor|Hong Kong Film Award for Best Actor]] and Fung won her first [[Hong Kong Film Award for Best Supporting Actress|Hong Kong Film Award for Best Supporting Actress]]. 92 Legendary La Rose Noire was ranked number 75 of the [[Best 100 Chinese Motion Pictures|Hong Kong Film Award#Best 100 Chinese Motion Pictures]] at the [[24th Hong Kong Film Awards|24th Hong Kong Film Awards]]. The film was followed two sequels, one released in 1993 titled [[Rose Rose I Love You|Rose Rose I Love You (film)]], where Leung reprises his role but features a new storyline, and another released in 1997 confusingly titled Black Rose II, also featuring a new storyline and different cast.
title: 92 Legendary La Rose Noire

abstract: Krishna Nee Kunidaga is a 1989 Indian [[Kannada|Kannada-language]] [[romantic|romance film]]-[[drama|drama film]] film written, directed and produced by [[Dwarakish|Dwarakish]]. The film starred [[Vinod Raj|Vinod Raj]] and [[Sudharani|Sudharani]] in the lead roles along with [[C. R. Simha|C. R. Simha]], [[Jaggesh|Jaggesh]] and [[Hema Choudhary|Hema Choudhary]] in supporting roles. The music was composed by Vijayanand to the lyrics of [[Chi. Udaya Shankar|Chi. Udaya Shankar]], [[Hamsalekha|Hamsalekha]] and [[R. N. Jayagopal|R. N. Jayagopal]].
title: Krishna Nee Kunidaga

abstract: Sheborg Massacre is 2016 Australian neo-pulp film written and directed by [[Daniel Armstrong|Daniel Armstrong]] and starring [[Daisy Masterman|Daisy Masterman]], Whitney Duff, and [[Emma-Louise Wilson|Emma-Louise Wilson]].
title: Sheborg Massacre

abstract: Wolf Warrior 2 received general praise for its patriotic plot, special effects, action sequences and the cast's performances. It was a massive commercial success and has become the highest-grossing Chinese film ever released. The film broke numerous box office records, including the biggest single-day gross for a Chinese film as well as the fastest film to cross RMB 2 billion, 3 billion, 4 billion and 5 billion box office marks. It also became the fastest film to surpass US$500 million and the first film to gross more than US$600 million at the [[Chinese box office|List of highest-grossing films in China]]. At a total domestic gross of (USD$874 million), it is the second highest-grossing film of all-time in a single market behind only [[Star Wars: The Force Awakens|Star Wars: The Force Awakens]] ($936.7 million in North America), and having exceeded North America's totals from [[Avatar|Avatar (2009 film)]] ($760 million), [[Black Panther|Black Panther (film)]] ($694 million), and [[Titanic|Titanic (1997 film)]] ($659 million). The film was the [[seventh highest-grossing film of 2017|2017 in film#Highest grossing films]] at US$874 million, making it the 54th highest grossing film worldwide. It is the first and only Chinese film ever to be included in the list of 100 all-time highest-grossing films worldwide. It was selected as the Chinese entry for the [[Best Foreign Language Film|Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film]] at the [[90th Academy Awards|90th Academy Awards]].
title: Wolf Warrior 2

abstract: Padma Meghna Jamuna () is a [[Bangladesh|Bangladeshi]] [[National award-winning|National Film Awards (Bangladesh)]] film directed by [[Chashi Nazrul Islam|Chashi Nazrul Islam]]. The film was released 1991. The film produced by Mohammad Iqbal Hossain and Story written by Mohammed Mohiuddin and also Screenplay and dialogue by Jalaluddin Rumi. The film stars [[Bobita|Bobita]], [[Farooque|Farooque]], [[Champa|Champa (actress)]], [[Bulbul Ahmed|Bulbul Ahmed]], [[ATM Shamsuzzaman|ATM Shamsuzzaman]] and more. In 1991, this film received the [[National Film Award|National Film Award]] for the best film award including other six categories.
title: Padma Meghna Jamuna

abstract: Pokémon the Movie: I Choose You! is a 2017 Japanese animated [[adventure film|adventure film]] directed by [[Kunihiko Yuyama|Kunihiko Yuyama]], written by [[Shōji Yonemura|Shōji Yonemura]], and produced by [[OLM|OLM, Inc.]]. Released as the twentieth [[Pokémon movie|List of Pokémon films]], the first film in the Sun and Moon generation and the first reboot film in the anime film series. It sets up an alternate continuity to the main series and acts as a loose retelling of the original Kanto League saga of the series/show, released to commemorate the anime's twentieth anniversary. It premiered at [[Japan Expo|Japan Expo]] in France on July 6, 2017 and was released in Japan on July 15, 2017. [[The Pokémon Company International|The Pokémon Company International]] and [[Fathom Events|Fathom Events]] released the film on a limited theatrical run in the rest of the world on November 5, 2017, and this was followed by television airings on [[Disney XD|Disney XD]] in the United States on November 25, 2017, on [[CITV|CITV]] in the UK on December 8, 2017, [[9Go!|9Go!]] in Australia on December 10, 2017 and on [[Gulli|Gulli]] in France on December 25, 2017.
title: Pokémon the Movie: I Choose You!

abstract: The title Bhale Bhale Magadivoy was borrowed from a song of the same name composed by [[M. S. Viswanathan|M. S. Viswanathan]] for [[K. Balachander|K. Balachander]] 1978 Telugu film [[Maro Charitra|Maro Charitra]]. [[Gopi Sunder|Gopi Sunder]] composed the film's soundtrack and background score. [[Principal photography|Principal photography]] began in March 2013, and ended that July. Including [[post-production|post-production]] tasks, the film was completed in seven months. Though mostly shot in and around [[Hyderabad|Hyderabad]], one of the songs was filmed in [[Goa|Goa]].
title: Bhale Bhale Magadivoy

abstract: Do Boond Pani (meaning: Two Drops of Water) is a [[1971|List of Bollywood films of 1971]] [[Hindi|Hindi]] social drama film produced and directed by [[Khwaja Ahmad Abbas|Khwaja Ahmad Abbas]]. Made under the "Naya Sansar" banner; the story, screenplay and dialogues were by K. A. Abbas, with additional dialogues by [[Inder Raj Anand|Inder Raj Anand]]. The music was composed by [[Jaidev|Jaidev]]. The cast included [[Simi Garewal|Simi Garewal]], [[Jalal Agha|Jalal Agha]] and [[Madhu Chanda|Madhu Chanda]] and was the debut film of actor [[Kiran Kumar|Kiran Kumar]]. The film won the award for Best Feature film on National integration.
title: Do Boond Pani

abstract: Karpoorada Gombe is a 1996 Indian [[Kannada language|Kannada language]] romantic drama film directed and written by [[S. Mahendar|S. Mahendar]]. The film stars [[Ramesh Aravind|Ramesh Aravind]], [[Shruti|Shruti (actress)]] and [[Shwetha|Vinodhini]] in the lead roles and featured the music composed by [[Hamsalekha|Hamsalekha]]. Actor [[Sharan|Sharan (actor)]] made his debut with this film.
title: Karpoorada Gombe

abstract: Queen Mimi is a 2015 [[documentary|documentary]] film about the life of Marie Haist, an octogenarian homeless woman who lived in a Santa Monica laundromat for 18 years, directed by [[Yaniv Rokah|Yaniv Rokah]] and produced by [[Elliot V Kotek|Elliot V Kotek]].
title: Queen Mimi

abstract: Love's Coming () is a 2014 [[LGBT|LGBT]] [[Thai film|Cinema of Thailand]], starring Suttinut Uengtrakul and Norrapat Sakulsong. The movie's director is Naphat Chaithiangthum. The film was filmed in 2013 and was released on 27 February 2014.
title: Love's Coming

abstract: DSKNECTD is a 2013 [[documentary|documentary]], directed by Dominic H. White. The film is an exploration of the rise of digital communication technologies, examining how cell phones, social media and the Internet are reshaping human interactions. The film had its sneak preview at the Tacoma Film Festival October 9, 2013 and its world premiere at the ArcLight Documentary Festival October 11, 2013.
title: DSKNECTD

abstract: Mero Badloo portrays a drug mafia in Rajasthan.
title: Mero Badloo

abstract: Portia on Trial is a 1937 American film about a trial based on story of [[Faith Baldwin|Faith Baldwin]] and directed by [[George Nicholls Jr.|George Nicholls Jr.]]. It has the distinction of being nominated to win the [[Oscar for Best Music|Academy Award for Best Original Score]] in the [[10th Academy Awards|10th Academy Awards]].
title: Portia on Trial

abstract: Aval Yaar (English: Who is she?) is a [[1959|Tamil films of 1959]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Tamil|Tamil language]] film, directed by K. J. Mahadevan. abstract: Thaai (Tamil: தாய்; English: Mother) is a [[1974|Tamil films of 1974]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Tamil|Tamil language]] film, directed by [[D. Yoganand|Dasari Yoganand]]. The film stars [[Sivaji Ganesan|Sivaji Ganesan]], [[Jayalalithaa|Jayalalithaa]], [[Kumari Padmini|Kumari Padmini]] and [[S. Varalakshmi|S. Varalakshmi]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[M. S. Viswanathan|M. S. Viswanathan]].
title: Thaai

abstract: Thayi Devaru () is a 1971 Indian [[Kannada language|Kannada language]] drama film written by Shivam and directed by [[Siddalingaiah|Siddalingaiah]]. It stars [[Rajkumar|Rajkumar (actor)]], [[M. V. Rajamma|M. V. Rajamma]] and [[Bharathi|Bharathi (actress)]] in the lead roles. The film was released under Jain Movies banner and produced by Chandulal Jain. [[H. R. Bhargava|H. R. Bhargava]] worked as associate director, [[M. S. Rajashekar|M. S. Rajashekar]] as assistant director and [[G. K. Venkatesh|G. K. Venkatesh]] was the soundtrack and score composer. The dialogues and lyrics were written by [[Chi. Udaya Shankar|Chi. Udaya Shankar]].
title: Thayi Devaru

abstract: Minister Durjan Singh (Sayani Atish) takes over the management of Ramnagar after the king’s death. The king’s daughter Indira ([[Fearless Nadia|Fearless Nadia]]) has been studying abroad. On her return she hears from Vimala (Sarita Devi) and her father the pious Saibaba (Sardar Mansoor) that Durjan Singh and his men are oppressing the poor. Durjan Singh’s brother Randhir ([[Boman Shroff|Boman Shroff]]), the Army Commander, is kind-hearted and sympathises with them. Randhir and Indira are in love with each other. When Randhir opts to leave with Vimala and her father, Indira finds out the truth about Durjan Singh. She takes on the disguise of a dacoit wearing a mask and becomes Lutaru Lalna to help the victimised. She has the horse Punjab Ka Beta and two brothers Bhanu and Nanu who have the car Rolls Royce Ki Beti, to help her in her efforts. Soon Durjan Singh is out to catch her. Following some lengthy action scenes Durjan and his henchman Teesmar Khan are caught. Randhir eventually gets together with Indira.
title: Lutaru Lalna

abstract: Vazhvile Oru Naal () is a [[1956|Tamil films of 1956]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Tamil|Tamil language]] film, directed by A. Kasilingam and produced by [[U. R. Jeevarathinam|U. R. Jeevarathinam]]. The film stars [[Sivaji Ganesan|Sivaji Ganesan]], [[G. Varalakshmi|G. Varalakshmi]], Sriram and [[Rajasulochana|Rajasulochana]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[C. N. Pandurangan|C. N. Pandurangan]], [[T. G. Lingappa|T. G. Lingappa]] and [[S. M. Subbaiah Naidu|S. M. Subbaiah Naidu]].
title: Vazhvile Oru Naal

abstract: (Tamil: வீட்டுக்கு வீடு; English: Home to Home) is a [[1970|Tamil films of 1970]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Tamil|Tamil language]] film, directed by [[C. V. Rajendran|C. V. Rajendran]] and produced by S. Suryaprakash, Rajan, R. Renganathan and R. Parthasarathy. The film's script was written by [[Chitralaya Gopu|Chitralaya Gopu]]. It stars [[Jaishankar|Jaishankar]], [[Lakshmi|Lakshmi (actress)]], [[R. Muthuraman|R. Muthuraman]], [[Vennira Aadai Nirmala|Vennira Aadai Nirmala]] and [[Nagesh|Nagesh]] in lead roles, with [[V. K. Ramasamy|V. K. Ramaswamy (actor)]] and [[Major Sundararajan|Major Sundararajan]] playing supporting roles. Soundtrack was composed by [[M. S. Viswanathan|M. S. Viswanathan]]. The 2001 Tamil film [[Viswanathan Ramamoorthy|Viswanathan Ramamoorthy (film)]] is said to be based on this film. Veettuku Veedu was remade in Kannada as [[Galate Samsara|Galate Samsara]]. The story line of the movie is based on the English comedy play "Right Bed Wrong Husband".
title: Veettuku Veedu

abstract: Thrimurthy (Kannada: ತ್ರಿಮೂರ್ತಿ) is a [[1975|Kannada films of 1975]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Kannada|Kannada language]] film, directed by [[C. V. Rajendran|C. V. Rajendran]] and produced by Parvathamma Rajkumar and S P Nagamma. The film stars [[Rajkumar|Rajkumar (actor)]], [[Jayamala|Jayamala]] , R Sampath and [[Vajramuni|Vajramuni]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[G. K. Venkatesh|G. K. Venkatesh]]. The movie was the debut movie of Tamil director [[C. V. Rajendran|C. V. Rajendran]] in Kannada.
title: Thrimurthy

abstract: Kula Gourava (Kannada: ಕುಲ ಗೌರವ; English: Honour of caste) is a 1971 Indian [[Kannada language|Kannada language]] romantic drama film directed by [[Peketi Sivaram|Peketi Sivaram]] and written by G. Balasubramanyam. It stars [[Rajkumar|Rajkumar (actor)]] in triple roles along with [[Bharathi|Bharathi (actress)]] and [[Jayanthi|Jayanthi (actress)]] in the lead roles. The film was produced under Sri Eshwari Productions of N. Veeraswamy. It had a very successful soundtrack composed by [[T. G. Lingappa|T. G. Lingappa]]. Popular actor-director V. Ravichandran, son of film's producer Veerasamy appeared in this film as child artist. The film swept 5 awards at the 1970-71 [[Karnataka State Film Awards|Karnataka State Film Awards]] including the best film, best actor and best editor categories.
title: Kula Gourava

abstract: En Uyir Kannamma (Tamil: என் உயிர் கண்ணம்மா) is a [[1988|Tamil films of 1988]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Tamil|Tamil language]] film, directed by Sivachandran and produced by S. K. Shankaralinkam. The film stars [[Prabhu|Prabhu (actor)]], [[Radha|Radha (actress)]], [[Lakshmi|Lakshmi (actress)]] and [[S. S. Chandran|S. S. Chandran]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[Ilaiyaraaja|Ilaiyaraaja]].
title: En Uyir Kannamma

abstract: Vardhakya Puranam is a 1994 Indian [[Malayalam|Malayalam]]-language film directed by [[Rajasenan|Rajasenan]] and written by [[Sasidharan Arattuvazhi|Sasidharan Arattuvazhi]]. The film stars [[Manoj K Jayan|Manoj K Jayan]], [[Kanaka|Kanaka (actress)]], [[Narendra Prasad|Narendra Prasad]] and [[Jagathy Sreekumar|Jagathy Sreekumar]] in lead roles. The film featured songs composed by [[Kannur Rajan|Kannur Rajan]] and [[film score|film score]] by [[S. P. Venkatesh|S. P. Venkatesh]].

abstract: Kalyaniyin Kanavan (English: Kalyani's Husband) is a [[1963|Tamil films of 1963]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Tamil|Tamil language]] film, directed and produced by [[S. M. Sriramulu Naidu|S. M. Sriramulu Naidu]]. The film stars [[Sivaji Ganesan|Sivaji Ganesan]] and [[B. Saroja Devi|B. Saroja Devi]] in lead roles, [[M. R. Radha|M. R. Radha]] as villain and [[T. R. Ramachandran|T. R. Ramachandran]] took care of the comedy assisted by Radhika. The film had musical score by [[S. M. Subbaiah Naidu|S. M. Subbaiah Naidu]].
title: Kalyaniyin Kanavan

abstract: Beats of the Antonov is a documentary film released in 2014. A Sudanese-South African coproduction directed by [[Hajooj Kuka|Hajooj Kuka]] and produced by [[Hajooj Kuka|Hajooj Kuka]] and [[Steven Markovitz|Steven Markovitz]]. The film documents the [[Sudan–SRF conflict|Sudan–SRF conflict]] in the [[Blue Nile|Blue Nile (state)]] and [[Nuba Mountains|Nuba Mountains]] regions, focusing in particular on the role of music in helping the affected communities to sustain themselves culturally and spiritually in the face of the ongoing conflict.
title: Beats of the Antonov

abstract: Samshaya Phala () is a 1971 Indian [[Kannada language|Kannada language]] romantic drama film written, produced and directed by A. M. Sameullah under the banner of Bawa Movies. It starred [[Udaya Kumar|Udaya Kumar (actor)]] along with [[Srinath|Srinath]] and [[Jayanthi|Jayanthi (actress)]] in the lead roles. It had a very successful soundtrack composed by the veteran Hindi music composer [[Salil Chowdhary|Salil Chowdhary]].
title: Samshaya Phala

abstract: Anuragi is a [[1988|Malayalam films of 1988]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed by [[IV Sasi|IV Sasi]] and produced by KJ Joseph. The film stars [[Mohanlal|Mohanlal]], [[Urvashi|Urvashi (actress)]], [[Ramya Krishnan|Ramya Krishnan]] and [[Suresh Gopi|Suresh Gopi]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[Gangai Amaran|Gangai Amaran]].
title: Anuragi

abstract: Ethirppukal is a [[1984|Malayalam films of 1984]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed by Unni Aranmula and produced by Unni Aranmula. The film stars [[Mammootty|Mammootty]], [[Urvashi|Urvashi (actress)]], [[Ratheesh|Ratheesh]] and [[Sukumari|Sukumari]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by TS Radhakrishnan.
title: Ethirppukal

abstract: A Girl and a Dolphin ([[Russian|Russian language]]: Де́вочка и дельфи́н) is a 1979 Soviet/[[Russian|Russians]] animated film directed by [[Rosalia Zelma|Rosalia Zelma]], produced at the [[TV film studio Ekran|Studio Ekran]] in [[Moscow|Moscow]]. The film is a poetic sketch cartoon about the friendship of a girl and a dolphin. The cartoon is distinguished by a deep level of romance and moral purity. A great musical arrangement by [[Eduard Artemyev|Eduard Artemyev]] and the song were used, which precisely reflect the meaning of the story.
title: A Girl and a Dolphin

abstract: Ezhuthapurangal is a [[1987|Malayalam films of 1987]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, directed by [[Sibi Malayil|Sibi Malayil]] and produced by Mathew George. The film stars [[Suhasini|Suhasini Maniratnam]], [[Ambika|Ambika (actress)]], [[Parvathy Jayaram|Parvathy Jayaram]] and [[Murali|Murali (Malayalam actor)]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[Johnson|Johnson (composer)]] and Vidyadharan. Suhasini Mani Ratnam won the Kerala State Film Award For Best Actress for this film.
title: Ezhuthapurangal

The film stars [[Jayaram|Jayaram]], [[Shobhana|Shobhana]], [[Thilakan|Thilakan]] and [[Kaviyoor Ponnamma|Kaviyoor Ponnamma]] in lead roles. The film had musical score by [[S. P. Venkatesh|S. P. Venkatesh]].

abstract: Triads: The Inside Story is a 1989 Hong Kong [[crime|crime film]] [[drama film|drama film]] directed by Taylor Wong and starring [[Chow Yun-fat|Chow Yun-fat]] and [[Roy Cheung|Roy Cheung]].
title: Triads: The Inside Story

abstract: Kill Me Three Times is a 2014 Australian-American [[black comedy|black comedy]] [[thriller film|thriller film]] directed by [[Kriv Stenders|Kriv Stenders]]. It was selected to be screened in the Contemporary World Cinema section at the [[2014 Toronto International Film Festival|2014 Toronto International Film Festival]]. The film was released in the United States on 10 April 2015, by [[Magnet Releasing|Magnet Releasing]].
title: Kill Me Three Times

abstract: Not My Type () is a 2014 French-Belgian [[romance film|romance film]] directed by [[Lucas Belvaux|Lucas Belvaux]] and starring [[Émilie Dequenne|Émilie Dequenne]] and [[Loïc Corbery|Loïc Corbery]]. It was based on the 2011 novel Pas son genre by [[Philippe Vilain|Philippe Vilain]]. It was screened in the Contemporary World Cinema section at the [[2014 Toronto International Film Festival|2014 Toronto International Film Festival]].
title: Not My Type

abstract: Pacific Rim: Uprising is a 2018 American [[science fiction film|science fiction film]] directed by [[Steven S. DeKnight|Steven S. DeKnight]] (in his [[feature-film directorial debut|List of directorial debuts]]), and written by DeKnight, [[Emily Carmichael|Emily Carmichael (filmmaker)]], Kira Snyder, and [[T.S. Nowlin|T.S. Nowlin]]. It is the sequel to the 2013 film [[Pacific Rim|Pacific Rim (film)]], with [[Guillermo del Toro|Guillermo del Toro]], the director of the original, serving as a producer. The sequel stars [[John Boyega|John Boyega]] (also making his producer debut), as well as [[Scott Eastwood|Scott Eastwood]], [[Cailee Spaeny|Cailee Spaeny]], [[Jing Tian|Jing Tian]], [[Adria Arjona|Adria Arjona]], and [[Zhang Jin|Zhang Jin]], with [[Rinko Kikuchi|Rinko Kikuchi]], [[Charlie Day|Charlie Day]], and [[Burn Gorman|Burn Gorman]] returning from the original film. Set in the year 2035, the plot follows humanity again fighting [[Kaiju|Kaiju]], giant monsters set on destroying the world.
title: Pacific Rim: Uprising

abstract: Baalu Belagithu () is a 1970 Indian [[Kannada language|Kannada language]] drama film written and directed by [[Siddalingaiah|Siddalingaiah]]. It stars [[Rajkumar|Rajkumar (actor)]] in dual roles with [[Jayanthi|Jayanthi (actress)]] and [[Bharathi|Bharathi (actress)]] in the lead roles. The film was released under Chitrashree International banner and produced by K S Prasad, B V Srinivas and A S Bhakthavathsalam. It was remade in Telugu as [[Manchivadu|Manchivadu]] , in Hindi as [[Humshakal|Humshakal (1974 film)]] and in Tamil as [[Oorukku Uzhaippavan|Oorukku Uzhaippavan]].
title: Baalu Belagithu

abstract: Devara Makkalu () () is a 1970 Indian [[Kannada language|Kannada language]] drama film directed by [[Y. R. Swamy|Y. R. Swamy]] and based on the novel Meena written by Ma. Na. Murthy. It stars [[Rajkumar|Rajkumar (actor)]] along with [[Jayanthi|Jayanthi (actress)]], [[Kalpana|Kalpana (Kannada actress)]] and [[Rajesh|Rajesh (Kannada actor)]] in other lead roles. The film features a soundtrack from [[G. K. Venkatesh|G. K. Venkatesh]] and is produced by Bharath Enterprises.
title: Devara Makkalu

abstract: Keezh Vaanam Sivakkum (Tamil: கீழ்வானம் சிவக்கும்) is a [[1981|Tamil films of 1981]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Tamil|Tamil language]] language film, directed by [[Muktha Srinivasan|Muktha Srinivasan]] and produced by S. Ravi. The film stars [[Sivaji Ganesan|Sivaji Ganesan]], [[Saritha|Saritha]], [[Jaishankar|Jaishankar]], [[Sarath Babu|Sarath Babu]] and [[Menaka|Menaka (actress)]] in the lead roles. abstract: Thumboli Kadappuram is a [[1995|Malayalam films of 1995]] [[Indian|Cinema of India]] [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]] film, written by Unni Joseph, directed by Jayaraj, starring [[Manoj K Jayan|Manoj K Jayan]] and [[Priya Raman|Priya Raman]] in the lead roles.
title: Thumboli Kadappuram

abstract: Ho Mann Jahaan () is a 2016 Pakistani [[coming-of-age|coming-of-age]] [[drama film|Pakistani film]], written and directed by [[Asim Raza|Asim Raza]] at his [[directorial debut|List of directorial debuts]]. The screenplay was written by Rashna Abdi, Imtisal Abbasi and Asim Raza, while dialogues were written by [[Asim Raza|Asim Raza]], Imtisal Abbasi, Rashna Abdi and [[Yasir Hussain|Yasir Hussain]].
