Living in Hollywood, he began to insist, even in his private life, that he was [[Native American|Native Americans in the United States]], over time claiming membership in several different tribes. In 1996, Cody's half-sister said that he was of [[Italian|Italian American]] ancestry, but he denied it. After his death, it was revealed that he was of Sicilian parentage, and not Native American at all.
title: Iron Eyes Cody

abstract: Lucio Fulci (; 17 June 1927 – 13 March 1996) was an [[Italian|Italy]] film director, screenwriter, producer and actor.
title: Lucio Fulci

abstract: Charles-Émile Reynaud was born on 8 December 1844 in Montreuil-sous-Bois (now a suburb of Paris). His father Benoît-Claude-Brutus Reynaud was an engineer and medal engraver originally from [[Le Puy-en-Velay|Le Puy-en-Velay]] and his mother Marie-Caroline Bellanger had been a school teacher, but stayed at home to raise and educate Émile from his birth. Marie-Caroline was trained in [[watercolor painting|watercolor painting]] by [[Pierre-Joseph Redouté|Pierre-Joseph Redouté]] and taught her son drawing and painting techniques. Brutus gave him little tasks in his workshop and by the age of 13 Émile was able to build small steam engines. In 1858 he became an apprentice at a Paris company where he repaired, assembled and developed optical and physics instruments. He then learned industrial design at another company, before working as an operator for photographer [[Antoine Samuel Adam-Salomon|Antoine Samuel Adam-Salomon]]. By 1862 he started his own career as a photographer in Paris. He became an assistant to the famous [[Abbé Moigno|François-Napoléon-Marie Moigno]] in 1864. Moigno gave lecture-screenings with the [[magic lantern|magic lantern]] and converted Émile to Catholicism, since his parents had raised him without religion. When his father died in December 1865 Émile moved with his mother to Puy-en-Velay where Brutus' cousin Dr. Claude Auguste Reynaud further educated Émile in Greek, Latin, physics, chemistry, mechanics and natural science. In December 1873 Émile Reynaud started giving weekly scientific screening-lectures for the students of the industrial schools of Puy-en-Velay, free of charge and open to the general public. He used personally made photographic magic lantern slides in two projectors, sometimes dissolving from one projection to another.
title: Charles-Émile Reynaud

abstract: William Richard Werstine (born April 16, 1952), known professionally as Billy West, is an American voice actor, singer, musician, songwriter and former radio personality. He is known for his voice-over work in a number of television series, films, video games, and commercials. He has done hundreds of voice-overs in his career such as [[Ren|Ren and Stimpy (characters)]] (season 3 to season 5) and [[Stimpy|Ren and Stimpy (characters)]] on [[The Ren & Stimpy Show|The Ren & Stimpy Show]]; [[Doug Funnie|Doug Funnie]] and [[Roger Klotz|Roger Klotz]] on [[Doug|Doug (TV series)]]; and [[Philip J. Fry|Philip J. Fry]], [[Professor Farnsworth|Professor Farnsworth]], [[Dr. Zoidberg|Zoidberg]], [[Zapp Brannigan|Zapp Brannigan]] and a number of others on [[Futurama|Futurama]]. He does voices for commercials and is the current voice of [[the red M&M|M&M's#M&M's characters]] and was also the voice of [[Buzz, the Honey Nut Cheerios Bee|Honey Nut Cheerios]] until 2004. In addition to his original voices, he has voiced [[Bugs Bunny|Bugs Bunny]], [[Elmer Fudd|Elmer Fudd]], [[Shaggy Rogers|Shaggy Rogers]], [[Popeye|Popeye]] and [[Woody Woodpecker|Woody Woodpecker]] during later renditions of the respective characters. He was a cast member on [[The Howard Stern Show|The Howard Stern Show]], noted for his impersonations of [[The Three Stooges|The Three Stooges]]' [[Larry Fine|Larry Fine]], [[George Takei|George Takei]], as [[Lieutenant Sulu|Lieutenant Sulu]], of [[Star Trek|Star Trek]] fame, and [[Marge Schott|Marge Schott]], long-time President and CEO of the Cincinnati Reds baseball franchise.
title: Billy West

abstract: Katharine Isabelle Murray (born November 2, 1981) is a Canadian actress. She made her film debut in the romantic comedy film [[Cousins|Cousins (1989 film)]] (1989), followed by supporting roles in numerous films and television series. Initially credited as Katie Murray, she later began using the name Katherine Isobel and subsequently, Katharine Isabelle. She is best known for her roles as [[Ginger Fitzgerald|Ginger Fitzgerald]] in the [[werewolf|werewolf]] horror films, [[Ginger Snaps|Ginger Snaps (film)]] (2000), [[Ginger Snaps 2: Unleashed|Ginger Snaps 2: Unleashed]] (2004) and [[Ginger Snaps Back: The Beginning|Ginger Snaps Back: The Beginning]] (2004) and Margot Verger in the [[NBC|NBC]] [[psychological thriller|psychological thriller]]–[[horror|psychological horror]] television series [[Hannibal|Hannibal (TV series)]] (2014-15). Her other film credits include [[Disturbing Behavior|Disturbing Behavior]] (1998), [[Carrie|Carrie (2002 film)]] (2002), [[Freddy vs. Jason|Freddy vs. Jason]] (2003), [[30 Days of Night: Dark Days|30 Days of Night: Dark Days]] (2010) and [[American Mary|American Mary]] (2012), for which she earned several nominations for best actress, including the [[Fangoria Chainsaw Awards|Fangoria#Fangoria Chainsaw Awards]], [[Screamfest Horror Film Festival|Screamfest Horror Film Festival]] and [[Toronto After Dark Film Festival|Toronto After Dark Film Festival]].
title: Katharine Isabelle

abstract: Robert Frank (born November 9, 1924) is a Swiss-American [[photographer|Documentary photography]] and [[documentary film|documentary filmmaker]]. His most notable work, the 1958 book titled [[The Americans|The Americans (photography)]], earned Frank comparisons to a modern-day [[de Tocqueville|Alexis de Tocqueville]] for his fresh and nuanced outsider's view of American society. Critic [[Sean O'Hagan|Sean O'Hagan (journalist)]], writing in [[The Guardian|The Guardian]] in 2014, said The Americans "changed the nature of photography, what it could say and how it could say it. [   .   .   .   ] it remains perhaps the most influential photography book of the 20th century." Frank later expanded into film and video and experimented with manipulating photographs and photomontage.
title: Robert Frank

abstract: Tom Tykwer (; born 23 May 1965) is a [[German|German people]] film director, producer, screenwriter, and composer. He is best known internationally for directing the thriller films [[Run Lola Run|Run Lola Run]] (1998), [[Heaven|Heaven (2002 film)]] (2002), [[Perfume: The Story of a Murderer|Perfume: The Story of a Murderer (film)]] (2006), and [[The International|The International (2009 film)]] (2009). He collaborated with [[The Wachowskis|The Wachowskis]] as co-director for the [[science fiction|science fiction]] film [[Cloud Atlas|Cloud Atlas (film)]] (2012) and the [[Netflix|Netflix]] series [[Sense8|Sense8]] (2015–2018).
title: Tom Tykwer

abstract: Christopher Ashton Kutcher (; born February 7, 1978) is an American actor and investor. He began his acting career portraying [[Michael Kelso|Michael Kelso]] in the [[Fox|Fox Broadcasting Company]] sitcom [[That '70s Show|That '70s Show]] (1998–2006). He made his film debut in the romantic comedy [[Coming Soon|Coming Soon (1999 film)]] (1999), followed by the comedy film [[Dude, Where's My Car?|Dude, Where's My Car?]] (2000), which was a box office hit. In 2003, Kutcher moved into romantic comedies, appearing in that year's [[Just Married|Just Married]] and [[My Boss's Daughter|My Boss's Daughter]]. In 2003, he created and produced the television series [[Punk'd|Punk'd]], also serving as host for the first eight of its ten seasons. In 2004, Kutcher starred in the lead role of the psychological film [[The Butterfly Effect|The Butterfly Effect]].
title: Ashton Kutcher

abstract: Portia Lee James DeGeneres (born Amanda Lee Rogers; 31 January 1973), known professionally as Portia de Rossi, is an Australian and American model, philanthropist, and actress. She is best known for starring as [[Nelle Porter|Nelle Porter]] on the American drama series [[Ally McBeal|Ally McBeal]] (1998–2002), for which she won a [[Screen Actors Guild Award|Screen Actors Guild Award]], as [[Lindsay Bluth Fünke|Lindsay Fünke]] on the American television sitcom [[Arrested Development|Arrested Development (TV series)]] (2003–2006, 2013, 2018), and as Elizabeth North on the American [[political thriller|political thriller]] series [[Scandal|Scandal (TV series)]] (2014–2017).
title: Portia de Rossi

abstract: Monika Schnarre (born May 27, 1971) is a Canadian model, actress and television host. She is reportedly 6'2" tall.
title: Monika Schnarre

abstract: Illeana Hesselberg (born July 25, 1965), most commonly known as Illeana Douglas, is an American actress, director, screenwriter, and producer. Douglas has had a long-ranging diverse career as a character actor with a specialty in comedy. Notable works include work in a 2001 episode of [[Six Feet Under|Six Feet Under (TV series)]] – for which she received a [[Primetime Emmy|Primetime Emmy]] nomination as [[Outstanding Guest Actress in a Drama Series|Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Guest Actress in a Drama Series]] and won the Best Guest Actress in a Drama Series award from OFTA, the Online Film & Television Association – and her work in the TV series [[Action|Action (TV series)]] opposite [[Jay Mohr|Jay Mohr]] – for which she won a [[Satellite Award for Best Actress – Television Series Musical or Comedy|Satellite Award for Best Actress – Television Series Musical or Comedy]]. She can currently be seen on [[Turner Classic Movies|Turner Classic Movies]] where she hosts specials focused on unheralded women directors from film history.
title: Illeana Douglas

abstract: George Reeves (January 5, 1914   – June 16, 1959) was an American actor. He is best known for his role as [[Superman|Superman]] in the 1950s television program [[Adventures of Superman|Adventures of Superman (TV series)]].
title: George Reeves

abstract: Lina Wertmüller (; born 14 August 1928) is an Italian [[screenwriter|screenwriter]] and [[film director|film director]]. She was the first woman nominated for an [[Academy Award|Academy Awards]] for [[Best Director|Academy Award for Best Director]] for [[Seven Beauties|Seven Beauties]] in 1977. She is also known for her films [[The Seduction of Mimi|The Seduction of Mimi]], [[Love and Anarchy|Love and Anarchy]] and [[Swept Away|Swept Away (1974 film)]].
title: Lina Wertmüller

abstract: Nathan Lane (born Joseph Lane; February 3, 1956) is an American actor and writer. He has played the roles of Albert in [[The Birdcage|The Birdcage]], [[Max Bialystock|Max Bialystock]] in the musical [[The Producers|The Producers (musical)]], Ernie Smuntz in [[MouseHunt|MouseHunt (film)]], Nathan Detroit in [[Guys and Dolls|Guys and Dolls (musical)]], and Pseudolus in [[A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum|A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum]]. His voice work includes [[The Lion King|The Lion King]] as [[Timon|Timon and Pumbaa]] and [[Stuart Little|Stuart Little (film)]] as Snowbell, and has played recurring roles on [[Modern Family|Modern Family]], [[The Good Wife|The Good Wife]], and [[The People v. O. J. Simpson: American Crime Story|The People v. O. J. Simpson: American Crime Story]] as [[F. Lee Bailey|F. Lee Bailey]].
title: Nathan Lane

abstract: Joan Alexandra Molinsky (June 8, 1933 – September 4, 2014), known professionally as Joan Rivers, was an American comedian, actress, writer, producer, and television host. She was noted for her often controversial comedic persona—heavily self-deprecating or sharply acerbic, especially toward celebrities and politicians.
title: Joan Rivers

abstract: Christian Kane (born June 27, 1974) is an [[American|United States]] actor and singer-songwriter. He is known for his roles in the television shows [[Angel|Angel (1999 TV series)]], [[Leverage|Leverage (TV series)]], [[The Librarians|The Librarians (2014 TV series)]] and [[Into the West|Into the West (miniseries)]], and the movies [[Just Married|Just Married]], [[Taxi|Taxi (2004 film)]], and [[Secondhand Lions|Secondhand Lions]].
title: Christian Kane

abstract: Nicolas Chuquet (; 1445, but some sources say 1455, [[Paris|Paris]], [[France|France]] – 1488, some sources say 1500, [[Lyon|Lyon]], France) was a [[French|France]] [[mathematician|mathematics]]. He invented his own notation for algebraic concepts and [[exponentiation|exponentiation]]. He may have been the first mathematician to recognize zero and negative numbers as exponents.
title: Nicolas Chuquet

abstract: Paul Winchell (born Paul Wilchinsky; December 21, 1922 – June 24, 2005) was an American ventriloquist, comedian, actor, voice artist, humanitarian, and inventor whose career flourished in the 1950s and 1960s. From 1950 to 1954, he hosted [[The Paul Winchell Show|The Paul Winchell Show]], which also used two other titles during its prime time run on [[NBC|National Broadcasting Company]], The Speidel Show, and [[What's My Name?|What's My Name? (radio program)]]. From 1965–1968, Winchell hosted the children's television series, Winchell-Mahoney Time.
title: Paul Winchell

abstract: Katie Price (born Katrina Amy Alexandra Alexis Infield; 22 May 1978), previously known by the pseudonym Jordan, is an English television personality, model, author, singer, designer and businesswoman.
title: Katie Price

abstract: Chisholm began her solo career in late 1998 by singing with Canadian rock singer [[Bryan Adams|Bryan Adams]] on the worldwide hit "[[When You're Gone|When You're Gone (Bryan Adams song)]]". Her solo debut album [[Northern Star|Northern Star (Melanie C album)]] was released in 1999, reaching number 1 in [[Sweden|Sweden]] and number 4 on the [[UK Albums Chart|UK Albums Chart]]. It was certified internationally with seven platinum and three gold certifications, including triple-Platinum by the [[British Phonographic Industry|British Phonographic Industry]], selling over 4 million copies worldwide, and becoming the best selling solo album of any Spice Girls member. It produced four top 5s and a top 20 single, two of which reached the number 1 spot in the UK. The album was certified multi-platinum worldwide.
title: Melanie C

abstract: Richard Dean Anderson (born January 23, 1950) is an American actor and producer. He began his television career in 1976, playing [[Dr. Jeff Webber|Jeff Webber]] in the American [[soap-opera|soap-opera]] series [[General Hospital|General Hospital]], then rose to prominence as the lead actor in the television series [[MacGyver|MacGyver (1985 TV series)]] (1985–1992). He later appeared in films such as [[Through the Eyes of a Killer|Through the Eyes of a Killer]] (1992), [[Pandora's Clock|Pandora's Clock]] (1996), and [[Firehouse|Firehouse (1997 film)]] (1997).
title: Richard Dean Anderson

abstract: Dominic Bernard Patrick Luke Monaghan (; born 8 December 1976) is an English actor. Monaghan first gained fame for being Hetty Wainthropp's sidekick Geoffrey in [[Hetty Wainthropp Investigates|Hetty Wainthropp Investigates]] (1996–98). He then played [[Meriadoc "Merry" Brandybuck|Meriadoc Brandybuck]] in [[Peter Jackson's|Peter Jackson]] [[epic film|epic film]] trilogy [[The Lord of the Rings|The Lord of the Rings (film series)]] (2001–03) based on [[the novel of the same name|The Lord of the Rings]] by J.R.R Tolkien, [[Charlie Pace|Charlie Pace]] on the television show [[Lost|Lost (TV series)]] (2004–2010), and [[Chris Bradley|Chris Bradley]] in [[superhero film|superhero film]] [[X-Men Origins: Wolverine|X-Men Origins: Wolverine]] (2009). He currently hosts the nature program [[Wild Things with Dominic Monaghan|Wild Things with Dominic Monaghan]] (2012–present).
title: Dominic Monaghan

abstract: Dame Katherine Patricia Routledge, (; born 17 February 1929) is an English actress and singer. She is best known for her role as [[Hyacinth Bucket|Hyacinth Bucket]] in the [[BBC|BBC]] [[sitcom|sitcom]] [[Keeping Up Appearances|Keeping Up Appearances]] (1990–1995), for which she was nominated for the [[BAFTA TV Award for Best Light Entertainment Performance|British Academy Television Award for Best Entertainment Performance]] in 1992 and 1993. Her film appearances include [[To Sir, with Love|To Sir, with Love]] (1967) and [[Don't Raise the Bridge, Lower the River|Don't Raise the Bridge, Lower the River]] (1968).
title: Patricia Routledge

abstract: Brian Austin Green (born Brian Green; July 15, 1973) is an American actor best known for his portrayal of [[David Silver|List of Beverly Hills, 90210 characters#Main characters]] on the television series [[Beverly Hills, 90210|Beverly Hills, 90210]] (1990–2000). Green was also a series regular on [[Terminator: The Sarah Connor Chronicles|Terminator: The Sarah Connor Chronicles]], [[Freddie|Freddie (TV series)]], [[Wedding Band|Wedding Band]], and [[Anger Management|Anger Management (TV series)]].
title: Brian Austin Green

abstract: Ephron was born in New York City, the eldest of four daughters, and grew up in [[Beverly Hills, California|Beverly Hills, California]]. Her parents, [[Henry|Henry Ephron]] and [[Phoebe|Phoebe Ephron]] (née Wolkind) Ephron, were both East Coast-born and were noted playwrights and screenwriters. Ephron was named after the protagonist in the play [[A Doll’s House|A Doll's House]], written by [[Henrik Ibsen|Henrik Ibsen]]. Nora's younger sisters, [[Delia|Delia Ephron]] and [[Amy|Amy Ephron]], are also screenwriters. Her sister [[Hallie Ephron|Hallie Ephron]] is a journalist, book reviewer, and novelist who writes crime fiction. Ephron's parents based the ingenue character in the play and film version of [[Take Her, She's Mine|Take Her, She's Mine]] on the 22-year-old Nora and her letters from college. Both her parents became alcoholics during their declining years. As a high school student, Nora Ephron dreamed of going to New York City to become another Dorothy Parker, an American poet, writer, satirist, and critic. Ephron has cited her high school journalism teacher, Charles Simms, to inspire her to pursue a career in journalism. Ephron graduated from [[Beverly Hills High School|Beverly Hills High School]] in 1958, and from [[Wellesley College|Wellesley College]] in [[Wellesley|Wellesley, Massachusetts]], Massachusetts, in 1962 with a degree in political science.
title: Nora Ephron

abstract: Melanie Chartoff (born December 15, 1948) is an American actress. She first became famous for her comedy work on the [[ABC|American Broadcasting Company]] series [[Fridays|Fridays (TV series)]] (1980–82), and in the 1990s [[Fox|Fox Broadcasting]] [[sitcom|sitcom]] [[Parker Lewis Can't Lose|Parker Lewis Can't Lose]]. She voiced both Didi Pickles and Grandma Minka on the two animated shows [[Rugrats|Rugrats]] and [[All Grown Up!|All Grown Up!]].
title: Melanie Chartoff

abstract: Anna Karina (born Hanne Karin Bayer, 22 September 1940) is a [[Danish|Danes]]-[[French|French people]] film actress, director, writer, and singer. She rose to prominence as [[French New Wave|French New Wave]] director [[Jean-Luc Godard|Jean-Luc Godard]]'s [[muse|Muses]] in the 1960s, performing in several of his films, including [[The Little Soldier|The Little Soldier]] (1960), [[A Woman Is a Woman|A Woman Is a Woman]] (1961), [[Vivre sa vie|Vivre sa vie]] (1962), [[Band of Outsiders|Band of Outsiders]] (1964), and [[Pierrot le Fou|Pierrot le Fou]] and [[Alphaville|Alphaville (film)]] (both 1965). For her performance in A Woman Is a Woman, Karina won the [[Silver Bear Award for Best Actress|Silver Bear for Best Actress]] at the [[Berlin Film Festival|11th Berlin International Film Festival]].
title: Anna Karina

abstract: Judy Gold (born November 15, 1962) is an American [[standup comedian|standup comedian]], actress, television writer, and producer. She won two [[Daytime Emmy Awards|Daytime Emmy Awards]] for her work as a writer and producer on [[The Rosie O'Donnell Show|The Rosie O'Donnell Show]]. She has also been involved in many projects in various roles, including the television series [[All-American Girl|All-American Girl (1994 TV series)]] and [[HBO|HBO]] At the Multiplex segments where she asks humorous questions of unexpecting moviegoers.
title: Judy Gold

abstract: Richard E. Grant (born Richard Grant Esterhuysen; 5 May 1957) is a Swazi-English actor. He made his film debut as Withnail in the drama [[Withnail and I|Withnail and I]] (1987). In film, Grant is further recognized as [[John Seward|John Seward]] in [[Bram Stoker's Dracula|Bram Stoker's Dracula]] (1992) and [[Zander Rice|Zander Rice]] in [[Logan|Logan (film)]] (2017). In television, he played [[Bob Cratchit|Bob Cratchit]] in [[TNT|TNT (U.S. TV network)]]'s [[A Christmas Carol|A Christmas Carol (1999 film)]] (1999), Izembaro in the [[sixth season|Game of Thrones (season 6)]] of the [[HBO|HBO]] series [[Game of Thrones|Game of Thrones]], the Great Intelligence in the [[seventh series|Doctor Who (series 7)]] of [[Doctor Who|Doctor Who]] and Simon Bricker in the critically acclaimed ITV/Masterpiece program [[Downton Abbey|Downton Abbey]]. He will appear in [[Star Wars: Episode IX|Star Wars: Episode IX]] (2019) in a currently undisclosed part. Grant received widespread acclaim for his performance as Jack Hock in [[Can You Ever Forgive Me?|Can You Ever Forgive Me? (film)]] (2018), earning [[BAFTA|BAFTA Award for Best Actor in a Supporting Role]], [[Golden Globe|Golden Globe Award for Best Supporting Actor – Motion Picture]] and [[Screen Actors Guild Award|Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by a Male Actor in a Supporting Role]] nominations, as well as winning a [[New York Film Critics Circle Award|New York Film Critics Circle Award for Best Supporting Actor]].
title: Richard E. Grant

abstract: Venturing into the music industry, Goodrem signed to [[Sony Music|Sony Music Entertainment]] at the age of 15 and released her debut album, [[Innocent Eyes|Innocent Eyes (Delta Goodrem album)]] (2003), which topped the [[ARIA Albums Chart|ARIA Albums Chart]] for an all-time record of 29 consecutive weeks and reached number two on the [[UK Albums Chart|UK Albums Chart]]. It became one of the [[highest-selling albums in Australian history|List of best-selling albums in Australia]], with over four million copies sold worldwide and all five of its singles—"[[Born to Try|Born to Try]]", "[[Lost Without You|Lost Without You (Delta Goodrem song)]]", "[[Innocent Eyes|Innocent Eyes (song)]]", "[[Not Me, Not I|Not Me, Not I]]" and "[[Predictable|Predictable (Delta Goodrem song)]]—reaching number one on the [[ARIA Singles Chart|ARIA Singles Chart]] and the first three reaching the top ten in the [[UK Single Chart|UK Single Chart]]. This made Goodrem the first and only artist to have five number-one singles from a debut album. Innocent Eyes is the best-selling album of the 2000s decade in Australia and the debut album with the most number-one singles.
title: Delta Goodrem

abstract: Catherine Breillat (French; born 13 July 1948) is a French filmmaker, novelist and professor of auteur cinema at the European Graduate School. In the film business for over 40 years, Catherine Breillat chooses to normalize previously taboo subjects in cinema. Taking advantage of the medium of cinema, Breillat juxtaposes different perspectives to highlight irony found in society. Through film, she attempts to redefine the female narrative in cinema by showing female characters who undergo similar experiences as their male counterparts. Many of Breillat's films explore the transition between girlhood and adulthood. The females of her films attempt to escape their adolescence by seeking individuality. There is an unsaid silence in society for girls to hide their sexuality and desires unless directly confronted about them. Breillat offers a platform to discuss female pleasure and sexual responsibility by exposing social and sexual conflicts in her films' themes.
title: Catherine Breillat

abstract: She has performed numerous comedy specials, including three one-hour standup specials for HBO, Showtime, and Bravo. She is also known as the voice of Linda Flynn-Fletcher on the [[Disney Channel|Disney Channel]] series [[Phineas and Ferb|Phineas and Ferb]] and as a regular on [[Hollywood Squares|Hollywood Squares]] with her friend [[Whoopi Goldberg|Whoopi Goldberg]]. Rhea was chosen by [[Rosie O'Donnell|Rosie O'Donnell]] as the new [[hostess|Television presenter]] of her syndicated talk show, renamed [[The Caroline Rhea Show|The Caroline Rhea Show]] and hosted the [[reality television|reality television]] show [[The Biggest Loser|The Biggest Loser (U.S. TV series)]] on [[NBC|NBC]] for the first three seasons. She appears regularly on ABC's [[Match Game|Match Game]] with [[Alec Baldwin|Alec Baldwin]] and is reprising her roles as Eugenia Scrimmage in the [[Bruno & Boots|Bruno & Boots (TV series)]] movie franchise and Noleta Nethercott in A Very Sordid Wedding.
title: Caroline Rhea

abstract: Sarah Brightman (born 14 August 1960) is an English [[classical crossover|classical crossover]] [[soprano|soprano]], singer, songwriter, actress, dancer and musician.
title: Sarah Brightman

abstract: Michelle Jacquet DeSevren Branch (born July 2, 1983) is an American singer, songwriter, and actress. During the early 2000s, she released two top-selling albums: [[The Spirit Room|The Spirit Room]] and [[Hotel Paper|Hotel Paper]]. She won a [[Grammy Award for Best Pop Collaboration with Vocals|Grammy Award for Best Pop Collaboration with Vocals]] with [[Santana|Carlos Santana]] for "[[The Game of Love|The Game of Love (Santana and Michelle Branch song)]]".
title: Michelle Branch

abstract: Elizabeth Téa Pantaleoni (; born February 25, 1966), better known by her stage name Téa Leoni, is an American actress and producer.
title: Téa Leoni

abstract: Noah Strausser Speer Wyle (; born June 4, 1971) is an American [[film|film]], [[television|television]], and [[theatre|theatre]] actor. He is known for his roles as [[Dr. John Carter|John Carter (ER)]] in [[ER|ER (TV series)]] and as [[Tom Mason|Tom Mason (Falling Skies)]] in [[Falling Skies|Falling Skies]]. He has also played [[Steve Jobs|Steve Jobs]] in the [[docudrama|docudrama]] [[Pirates of Silicon Valley|Pirates of Silicon Valley]] (1999), Dr. Kenneth Monnitoff in [[Donnie Darko|Donnie Darko]] (2001), and [[Flynn Carsen|List of characters in The Librarian franchise#Flynn Carsen (Noah Wyle)]] in [[The Librarian franchise|The Librarian franchise]].
title: Noah Wyle

abstract: Irene Cara Escalera (born March 18, 1959), known professionally as Irene Cara, is an American singer, songwriter, dancer and actress. Cara sang and co-wrote the song '[[Flashdance... What a Feeling|Flashdance... What a Feeling]]' (from the movie [[Flashdance|Flashdance]]), for which she won an [[Academy Award for Best Original Song|Academy Award for Best Original Song]] and a [[Grammy Award for Best Female Pop Vocal Performance|Grammy Award for Best Female Pop Vocal Performance]] in 1984. Cara is also known for playing the role of Coco Hernandez in the 1980 film [[Fame|Fame (1980 film)]], and for recording the film's title song '[[Fame|Fame (Irene Cara song)]]'. Prior to her success with Fame, Cara portrayed the title character Sparkle Williams in the original 1976 musical drama film [[Sparkle|Sparkle (1976 film)]].
title: Irene Cara

abstract: Morena Baccarin (; ; born June 2, 1979) is a [[Brazilian-American|Brazilian-American]] actress. She is known for portraying [[Inara Serra|Inara Serra]] in the series [[Firefly|Firefly (TV series)]] and the follow-up film [[Serenity|Serenity (2005 film)]], [[Adria|Adria (Stargate)]] in the series [[Stargate SG-1|Stargate SG-1]] and the follow-up film [[Stargate: The Ark of Truth|Stargate: The Ark of Truth]], Anna in the 2009 version of the series [[V|V (2009 TV series)]], [[Vanessa|Copycat (Marvel Comics)]] in the superhero comedy film [[Deadpool|Deadpool (film)]] and its sequel [[Deadpool 2|Deadpool 2]], and [[Jessica Brody|Jessica Brody (character)]] in the [[Showtime|Showtime (TV network)]] series [[Homeland|Homeland (TV series)]], for which she received a [[Primetime Emmy Award|Primetime Emmy Award]] nomination for [[Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Drama Series|Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Drama Series]] in 2013. She currently portrays [[Dr. Leslie Thompkins|Leslie Thompkins]] in the [[Fox|Fox Broadcasting Company]] series [[Gotham|Gotham (TV series)]].
title: Morena Baccarin

abstract: She has also branched into singing, performing songs in both English and Japanese. She released her debut single "[[Yakusoku wa Iranai|Yakusoku wa Iranai]]" in collaboration with [[Yoko Kanno|Yoko Kanno]] under [[Victor Entertainment|Victor Entertainment]] on April 24, 1996. Her singles "[[Tune the Rainbow|List of RahXephon albums#Tune the Rainbow]]", "[[Loop|Loop (song)]]", "[[Ame ga Furu|Ame ga Furu]]", and "[[Triangler|Triangler (Maaya Sakamoto song)]]" have all reached the top 10 [[Oricon|Oricon]] singles chart: "Triangler" in particular charted at number 3 and remained charting for 26 weeks. Her albums have had similar success, with [[Shōnen Alice|Shōnen Alice]] and [[Yūnagi Loop|Yūnagi Loop]] both reaching the top 10 Oricon albums chart; and her album [[You Can't Catch Me|You Can't Catch Me (Maaya Sakamoto album)]], released on January 12, 2011, became her first release to ever reach number 1. She held a concert at the [[Nippon Budokan|Nippon Budokan]] on March 31, 2010, her thirtieth birthday. In the Japanese localization of overseas dubs, she has voiced [[Padme Amidala|Padme Amidala]] as presented in the [[Star Wars|Star Wars]] films and cartoons, as well as being the dub voice for [[Natalie Portman|Natalie Portman]] on numerous films.
title: Maaya Sakamoto

abstract: Ali Kelmendi was born on 3 November 1900 in a poor peasant family in the town of İpek in the [[Kosovo Vilayet|Kosovo Vilayet]] of the [[Ottoman Empire|Ottoman Empire]] (in present-day [[Kosovo|Kosovo]]), son of Sulejman Kelmendi. In 1920 he fled to Albania after all communist activities were banned in [[Kingdom of Yugoslavia|Yugoslavia]]. There he joined the left-wing political movement "Bashkimi" (English:Unity) of [[Avni Rustemi|Avni Rustemi]], [[Llazar Fundo|Llazar Fundo]], and Fuat Asllani.
title: Ali Kelmendi

abstract: Qiu Jin (; November 8, 1875 – July 15, 1907) was a Chinese revolutionary, feminist, and writer. Her [[courtesy name|courtesy names]] are Xuanqing () and Jingxiong (). Her [[sobriquet|Art name]] name is Jianhu Nüxia () which, when translated literally into English, means "Woman Knight of Mirror Lake". Qiu was executed after a failed uprising against the [[Qing dynasty|Qing dynasty]], and she is considered a national heroine in China.
title: Qiu Jin

abstract: Terry Gene Bollea (, born August 11, 1953), better known by his [[ring name|ring name]] as Hulk Hogan, is an American retired [[pro wrestler|Professional wrestling]], actor, television personality, [[entrepreneur|Entrepreneurship]] and [[musician|musician]].
title: Hulk Hogan

abstract: Heather Laurie Holden (born December 17, 1969) is an [[American-Canadian|American Canadians]] actress, producer, model, and [[human rights activist|human rights activist]]. She is known for her roles as [[Marita Covarrubias|Marita Covarrubias]] in [[The X-Files|The X-Files]] (1996–2002), Adele Stanton in [[The Majestic|The Majestic (film)]] (2001), Cybil Bennett in [[Silent Hill|Silent Hill (film)]] (2006), Amanda Dumfries in [[The Mist|The Mist (film)]] (2007), Olivia Murray in [[The Shield|The Shield]] (2008), [[Andrea|Andrea (The Walking Dead)]] in [[The Walking Dead|The Walking Dead (TV series)]] (2010–2013) and Renee in [[The Americans|The Americans (2013 TV series)]] (2017-2018).
title: Laurie Holden

abstract: Michael Dorn (born December 9, 1952) is an American actor and voice artist who is known for his role as the [[Klingon|Klingon]] [[Worf|Worf]] in the [[Star Trek|Star Trek]] franchise.
title: Michael Dorn

abstract: Fiona Loewi (born 1975) is a [[Canadian|Canadians]] actress. She attended [[McGill University|McGill University]] and the [[London Academy of Music and Dramatic Art|London Academy of Music and Dramatic Art]]. She is perhaps best known for [[Love and Death on Long Island|Love and Death on Long Island]]. Her married name is Fiona Loewi Reinhardt and she is the mother of three children and lives in Los Angeles, CA. She and her husband Sandro are co-owners of Cheebo, an American cuisine organic food restaurant in Los Angeles.
title: Fiona Loewi

abstract: Claude Marcelle Jorré, better known as Claude Jade (; 8 October 1948 – 1 December 2006), was a French actress. She is known for starring as [[Christine|Antoine Doinel#Christine Darbon]] in [[François Truffaut|François Truffaut]]'s three films [[Stolen Kisses|Stolen Kisses]] (1968), [[Bed and Board|Bed and Board (1970 film)]] (1970) and [[Love on the Run|Love on the Run (1979 film)]] (1979). Jade acted in theatre, film and television. Her film work outside France included the [[Soviet Union|Soviet Union]], the [[United States|United States]], [[Italy|Italy]] and [[Japan|Japan]].
title: Claude Jade

abstract: Lucy Kate Jackson (born October 29, 1948) is an American [[actress|actress]], [[director|television director]] and [[producer|Television producer]], known for her television roles as [[Sabrina Duncan|Sabrina Duncan]] in the series [[Charlie's Angels|Charlie's Angels]] (1976–79) and Amanda King in the series [[Scarecrow and Mrs. King|Scarecrow and Mrs. King]] (1983–87). Her film roles include [[Making Love|Making Love]] (1982) and [[Loverboy|Loverboy (1989 film)]] (1989). She is a three-time [[Emmy Award|Emmy Award]] nominee and four-time [[Golden Globe Award|Golden Globe Award]] nominee.
title: Kate Jackson

abstract: Justin Kirk (born May 28, 1969) is an American actor, known for portraying Prior Walter in [[Mike Nichols|Mike Nichols]]'s screen adaptation of [[Angels in America|Angels in America (miniseries)]], for which he was nominated for the [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Miniseries or a Movie|Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Miniseries or a Movie]]. He is also known for his portrayal of [[Andy Botwin|Andy Botwin]] on the [[Showtime|Showtime (TV network)]] series [[Weeds|Weeds (TV series)]].
title: Justin Kirk

abstract: Steven Tyler (born Steven Victor Tallarico; March 26, 1948) is an American singer, songwriter, musician, actor, and former television music competition judge. He is best known as the lead singer of the [[Boston|Boston]]-based rock band [[Aerosmith|Aerosmith]], in which he also plays the harmonica, piano, and percussion. He is known as the "Demon of Screamin'" due to his high screams and his wide vocal range. He is also known for his on-stage acrobatics. During his high-energy performances, Tyler usually dresses in bright, colorful outfits with his trademark scarves hanging from his microphone stand.
title: Steven Tyler

abstract: Nadim Sawalha () (born 9 September 1935) is a [[Jordan|Jordanian]]-born [[British|British people]] [[actor|actor]] and father of actresses [[Julia|Julia Sawalha]] and [[Nadia Sawalha|Nadia Sawalha]].
title: Nadim Sawalha

abstract: Jimmy Smits (born July 9, 1955) is an American actor. He played attorney Victor Sifuentes on the 1980s legal drama [[L.A. Law|L.A. Law]], [[NYPD|NYPD]] Detective [[Bobby Simone|Bobby Simone]] on the 1990s police drama [[NYPD Blue|NYPD Blue]], and [[Matt Santos|Matt Santos]] on the 1999-2006 serial political drama [[The West Wing|The West Wing]]. He also appeared as [[Bail Organa|Bail Organa]] in the [[Star Wars|Star Wars]] [[prequel trilogy|prequel trilogy]], and [[Rogue One|Rogue One]], and as ADA [[Miguel Prado|Miguel Prado]] in [[Dexter|Dexter (TV series)]]. From 2012 to 2014, he joined the main cast of [[Sons of Anarchy|Sons of Anarchy]] as [[Nero Padilla|List of Sons of Anarchy characters#Nero Padilla]].
title: Jimmy Smits

abstract: Mike Leigh (born 20 February 1943) is an English writer and director of film and theatre. He studied at the [[Royal Academy of Dramatic Art|Royal Academy of Dramatic Art]] (RADA) before honing his directing skills at [[East 15 Acting School|East 15 Acting School]] and further at the [[Camberwell School of Art|Camberwell School of Art]] and the [[Central School of Art and Design|Central School of Art and Design]]. He began as a theatre director and playwright in the mid-1960s.
title: Mike Leigh

abstract: Donna Reed (born Donna Belle Mullenger; January 27, 1921 – January 14, 1986) was an American film and television actress and producer. Her career spanned more than 40 years, with performances in more than 40 films. She is well known for her role as [[Mary Hatch Bailey|Mary Hatch Bailey]] in [[Frank Capra|Frank Capra]]'s 1946 film [[It's a Wonderful Life|It's a Wonderful Life]]. In 1953, she received the [[Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress|Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress]] for her performance as Lorene Burke in the war drama [[From Here to Eternity|From Here to Eternity]].
title: Donna Reed

abstract: Carla Estrada (born Carla Patricia Estrada Guitrón on March 11, 1956 in [[Mexico City|Mexico City]], [[D.F.|D.F.]], [[Mexico|Mexico]]) is a Mexican producer, one of the foremost [[telenovela|telenovela]] producers of Latin America.
title: Carla Estrada

abstract: Stephen Russell Davies (born 27 April 1963), better known as Russell T Davies, is a Welsh screenwriter and television producer whose works include [[Queer as Folk|Queer as Folk (UK TV series)]], [[Bob & Rose|Bob & Rose]], [[The Second Coming|The Second Coming (TV serial)]], [[Casanova|Casanova (2005 TV serial)]], the 2005 revival of the classic British science fiction series [[Doctor Who|Doctor Who]], and the trilogy [[Cucumber|Cucumber (TV series)]], [[Tofu|Tofu (web series)]], and [[Banana|Banana (TV series)]].
title: Russell T Davies

abstract: Nana Tucker ( ; born July 26, 1957), known professionally as Nana Visitor, is an American [[actress|actor]], known for playing [[Kira Nerys|Kira Nerys]] in the television series [[Star Trek: Deep Space Nine|Star Trek: Deep Space Nine]] and Jean Ritter in the television series [[Wildfire|Wildfire (TV series)]].
title: Nana Visitor

abstract: Ioan Gruffudd (; born 6 October 1973) is a Welsh actor. He first came to public attention as Fifth Officer [[Harold Lowe|Harold Lowe]] in [[Titanic|Titanic (1997 film)]] (1997), and then for his portrayal of [[Horatio Hornblower|Horatio Hornblower]] in the [[Hornblower|Hornblower (TV series)]] series of television films (1998–2003). Subsequent roles have included [[Lancelot|Lancelot]] in [[King Arthur|King Arthur (2004 film)]] (2004), [[Mister Fantastic|Mister Fantastic]] in [[Fantastic 4|Fantastic Four (2005 film)]] (2005) and its [[sequel|Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer]] (2007), [[William Wilberforce|William Wilberforce]] in [[Amazing Grace|Amazing Grace (2006 film)]] (2006), and [[Tony Blair|Tony Blair]] in [[W.|W. (film)]] (2008).
title: Ioan Gruffudd

abstract: Jeffrey Hunter (born Henry Herman "Hank" McKinnies Jr.; November 25, 1926   – May 27, 1969) was an American film and television actor and producer known for his roles in films such as [[The Searchers|The Searchers]] and [[King of Kings|King of Kings (1961 film)]]. On television, Hunter was known, following his death, for his 1965 role as Capt. [[Christopher Pike|Christopher Pike (Star Trek)]] in the original [[pilot episode|Television pilot]] of [[Star Trek|Star Trek]] and the later use of that footage in "[[The Menagerie|The Menagerie (Star Trek: The Original Series)]]".
title: Jeffrey Hunter

abstract: Nicole de Boer (born 20 December 1970) is a Canadian actress. She is best known for starring in the [[cult film|cult film]] [[Cube|Cube (film)]] as Joan Leaven, playing [[Ezri Dax|Ezri Dax]] on the final season of [[Star Trek: Deep Space Nine|Star Trek: Deep Space Nine]] (1998–1999), and as Sarah Bannerman on the series [[The Dead Zone|The Dead Zone (TV series)]] (2002–2007). From 2016 to 2018, she had a recurring role as Becca Dorasay, ex-wife of one of the series leads on the Canadian-produced crime drama [[Private Eyes|Private Eyes (TV series)]].
title: Nicole de Boer

abstract: Althea Rae Janairo (born January 2, 1967), known professionally as Tia Carrere, is an American actress who obtained her first big break as a regular on the daytime soap opera [[General Hospital|General Hospital]].
title: Tia Carrere

abstract: George Peppard Jr. (; October 1, 1928 – May 8, 1994) was an American film and television actor.Peppard secured a major role when he starred alongside [[Audrey Hepburn|Audrey Hepburn]] in [[Breakfast at Tiffany's|Breakfast at Tiffany's (film)]] (1961), and later portrayed a character based on [[Howard Hughes|Howard Hughes]] in [[The Carpetbaggers|The Carpetbaggers (film)]] (1964). On television, he played the title role of millionaire insurance investigator and sleuth Thomas Banacek in the early-1970s mystery series [[Banacek|Banacek]]. He played [[Col. John "Hannibal" Smith|John "Hannibal" Smith]], the [[cigar|cigar]]-smoking leader of a renegade [[commando|commando]] squad, in the hit 1980s action show [[The A-Team|The A-Team]].
title: George Peppard

abstract: Eve Arden (born Eunice Mary Quedens, April 30, 1908 – November 12, 1990) was an American film, radio, stage, and television actress, and comedian. She performed in leading and supporting roles for nearly six decades.
title: Eve Arden

abstract: Francis Ford Coppola (; born April 7, 1939) is an American [[film director|film director]], [[producer|film producer]], [[screenwriter|screenwriter]] and [[film composer|film composer]]. He was a central figure in the [[New Hollywood|New Hollywood]] wave of filmmaking.
title: Francis Ford Coppola

abstract: Frank Russell Capra (born Francesco Rosario Capra; May 18, 1897   – September 3, 1991) was an [[Italian American|Italian Americans]] film director, producer and [[writer|Screenwriter]] who became the creative force behind [[some of the major award-winning films of the 1930s and 1940s|Frank Capra filmography#Films that won Academy Awards]]. Born in Italy and raised in Los Angeles from the age of five, his [[rags-to-riches|Rags to riches]] story has led film historians such as [[Ian Freer|Ian Freer]] to consider him the "[[American Dream|American Dream]] personified."
title: Frank Capra

abstract: Alfonso Cuarón Orozco (; ; born 28 November 1961) is a Mexican film director, screenwriter, producer, and editor. He is best known for his dramas [[Y Tu Mamá También|Y Tu Mamá También]] (2001) and [[Roma|Roma (2018 film)]] (2018), the fantasy film [[Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban|Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (film)]] (2004), and the science fiction thrillers [[Children of Men|Children of Men]] (2006) and [[Gravity|Gravity (2013 film)]] (2013). Cuarón is the first Latino and Mexican director to win the [[Academy Award for Best Director|Academy Award for Best Director]].
title: Alfonso Cuarón

abstract: Aeschylus (, ; Aiskhylos, ; c. 525/524 – c. 456/455 BC) was an [[ancient Greek tragedian|Greek tragedy]]. He is often described as the father of tragedy. Academics' knowledge of the genre begins with his work, and understanding of earlier tragedies is largely based on inferences from his surviving plays. According to [[Aristotle|Aristotle]], he expanded the number of characters in the theater and allowed conflict among them; characters previously had interacted only with the [[chorus|Greek chorus]].
title: Aeschylus

abstract: Aaliyah Dana Haughton (; January 16, 1979   – August 25, 2001) was an American singer, actress, and model. Born in [[Brooklyn|Brooklyn]], [[New York|New York (state)]], and raised in [[Detroit|Detroit]], Michigan, she first gained recognition at the age of 10, when she appeared on the television show [[Star Search|Star Search]] and performed in concert alongside [[Gladys Knight|Gladys Knight]]. At the age of 12, Aaliyah signed with [[Jive Records|Jive Records]] and her uncle [[Barry Hankerson|Barry Hankerson]]'s [[Blackground Records|Blackground Records]]. Hankerson introduced her to [[R. Kelly|R. Kelly]], who became her mentor, as well as lead songwriter and producer of her debut album, [[Age Ain't Nothing but a Number|Age Ain't Nothing but a Number]]. The album sold three million copies in the United States and was certified double platinum by the [[Recording Industry Association of America|Recording Industry Association of America]] (RIAA). After facing allegations of an illegal marriage with Kelly, Aaliyah ended her contract with Jive and signed with [[Atlantic Records|Atlantic Records]].
title: Aaliyah

abstract: Elijah (; ; , meaning "My [[God|El (deity)]] is [[Yahweh|Yahweh]]/[[YHWH|YHWH]]") or latinized form Elias ( ) was, according to the [[Books of Kings|Books of Kings]] in the [[Hebrew Bible|Hebrew Bible]], a [[prophet|prophet]] and a [[miracle worker|thaumaturgy]] who lived in the [[northern kingdom of Israel|Kingdom of Israel (Samaria)]] during the reign of [[King Ahab|King Ahab]] (9th century BC). In 1 Kings 18, Elijah defended the worship of the [[Hebrew God|Yahweh]] over that of the Canaanite deity [[Baal|Baal]]. God also performed many miracles through Elijah, including [[resurrection|resurrection]] (raising the dead), bringing fire down from the sky, and [[entering Heaven alive|entering Heaven alive]] "by fire". He is also portrayed as leading a school of prophets known as "the sons of the prophets". Following his ascension, [[Elisha|Elisha]], his disciple and most devoted assistant took over his role as leader of this school. The [[Book of Malachi|Book of Malachi]] prophesies Elijah's return "before the coming of the great and terrible day of the ", making him a harbinger of the [[Messiah|Messiah]] and of the [[eschaton|eschatology]] in various faiths that revere the Hebrew Bible. References to Elijah appear in [[Ecclesiasticus|Sirach]], the [[New Testament|New Testament]], the [[Mishnah|Mishnah]] and [[Talmud|Talmud]], the [[Quran|Quran]], the [[Book of Mormon|Book of Mormon]], the [[Doctrine and Covenants|Doctrine and Covenants]], and [[Bahá'í|Bahá'í Faith]] writings.
title: Elijah

abstract: Paula Julie Abdul (born June 19, 1962) is an American dancer, [[choreographer|Choreography]], singer, actress, and television personality. She began her career as a [[cheerleader|National Basketball Association Cheerleading]] for the [[Los Angeles Lakers|Los Angeles Lakers]] at the age of 18 and later became the head choreographer for the [[Laker Girls|Laker Girls]], where she was discovered by [[The Jacksons|The Jacksons]]. After choreographing music videos for [[Janet Jackson|Janet Jackson]], Abdul became a choreographer at the height of the [[music video|music video]] era and soon thereafter she was signed to [[Virgin Records|Virgin Records]]. Her debut studio album [[Forever Your Girl|Forever Your Girl]] (1988) became one of the most successful debut albums at that time, selling 7 million copies in the United States and setting a record for the most number-one singles from a debut album on the [[Billboard Hot 100|Billboard Hot 100]] chart: "[[Straight Up|Straight Up (Paula Abdul song)]]", "[[Forever Your Girl|Forever Your Girl (song)]]", "[[Cold Hearted|Cold Hearted]]", and "[[Opposites Attract|Opposites Attract]]". Her six number one singles on the [[Billboard Hot 100|Billboard Hot 100]] tie her with [[Diana Ross|Diana Ross]] for seventh among the female solo performers who have topped the chart.
title: Paula Abdul

abstract: Robert Jonathan Demme ( ; February 22, 1944   – April 26, 2017) was an American director, producer, and screenwriter. He is best known for directing the [[psychological horror|psychological horror]] [[The Silence of the Lambs|The Silence of the Lambs (film)]] (1991), for which he won the [[Academy Award for Best Director|Academy Award for Best Director]]. He also directed [[Melvin and Howard|Melvin and Howard]] (1980), [[Swing Shift|Swing Shift (film)]] (1984), [[Something Wild|Something Wild (1986 film)]] (1986), [[Married to the Mob|Married to the Mob]] (1988), the concert film [[Stop Making Sense|Stop Making Sense]] (1984), [[Philadelphia|Philadelphia (film)]] (1993) and [[Rachel Getting Married|Rachel Getting Married]] (2008).
title: Jonathan Demme

abstract: Mel Brooks (born Melvin Kaminsky, June 28, 1926) is an American filmmaker, actor, comedian, and composer. He is known as a creator of broad film [[farce|farces]] and comedic [[parodies|parody]]. Brooks began his career as a comic and a writer for the early TV variety show [[Your Show of Shows|Your Show of Shows]]. He created, with [[Buck Henry|Buck Henry]], the hit [[television comedy|television comedy]] series [[Get Smart|Get Smart]], which ran from 1965 to 1970.
title: Mel Brooks

abstract: Martin Charles Scorsese (; born November 17, 1942) is an [[American|Americans]] filmmaker and historian, whose career spans more than 50 years. [[Scorsese's body of work|Martin Scorsese filmography]] addresses such themes as [[Sicilian-American|Sicilian Americans]] identity, Roman Catholic concepts of guilt and [[redemption|Salvation]], [[faith|faith]], [[machismo|machismo]], modern crime, and gang conflict. Many of his films are also known for their depiction of violence and liberal use of [[profanity|profanity]].
title: Martin Scorsese

abstract: He co-founded the [[heavy metal|heavy metal music]] band [[Body Count|Body Count (band)]], which he introduced on his 1991 rap album [[O.G.: Original Gangster|O.G.: Original Gangster]], on the track titled "Body Count". The band released their [[self-titled debut album|Body Count (album)]] in 1992. Ice-T encountered controversy over his track "[[Cop Killer|Cop Killer (song)]]", which glamorized killing police officers. Ice-T asked to be released from his contract with [[Warner Bros. Records|Warner Bros. Records]], and his next solo album, [[Home Invasion|Home Invasion (album)]], was released later in February 1993 through [[Priority Records|Priority Records]]. Body Count's [[next album|Born Dead]] was released in 1994, and Ice-T released two more albums in the late-1990s. Since 2000, he has portrayed [[NYPD|NYPD]] Detective/Sergeant [[Odafin Tutuola|Fin Tutuola]] on the [[NBC|NBC]] police drama [[Law & Order: Special Victims Unit|Law & Order: Special Victims Unit]].
title: Ice-T

abstract: Kabir Bedi (born 16 January 1946) is an Indian film actor. His career has spanned three continents covering India, the United States and especially Italy among other European countries in three media: film, television and theatre. He is noted for his role as [[Emperor Shah Jahan|Emperor Shah Jahan]] in [[Taj Mahal: An Eternal Love Story|Taj Mahal: An Eternal Love Story]] and the villainous Sanjay Verma in the 80's blockbuster [[Khoon Bhari Maang|Khoon Bhari Maang]]. He is best known in Italy and Europe for playing the pirate [[Sandokan|Sandokan (television series)]] in the popular Italian TV mini series and for his role as the villainous [[Gobinda|Gobinda]] in the 1983 [[James Bond|James Bond]] film [[Octopussy|Octopussy]]. Kabir Bedi is well-known in Italy and is fluent in Italian. He is based in India and lives in [[Mumbai|Mumbai]].
title: Kabir Bedi

abstract: Allen Kelsey Grammer (born February 21, 1955) is an American actor, voice actor, comedian, singer, producer, director, writer and activist, best known for his two-decade-long portrayal of psychiatrist Dr. [[Frasier Crane|Frasier Crane]] on the [[NBC|NBC]] sitcoms [[Cheers|Cheers]] and [[Frasier|Frasier]]. He has won five [[Primetime Emmy Award|Primetime Emmy Awards]], three [[Golden Globe Awards|Golden Globe Awards]], and one [[Tony Award|Tony Award]], and has also worked as a television producer, director, writer, and as a voice actor on [[The Simpsons|The Simpsons]] as [[Sideshow Bob|Sideshow Bob]] (for which he received his fifth [[Primetime Emmy|Primetime Emmy]]). He also recently won a [[Daytime Emmy Award|Daytime Emmy Award]] for [[Outstanding Performer in an Animated Program|Daytime Emmy Award for Outstanding Performer in an Animated Program]] for his voice work in [[Guillermo del Toro|Guillermo del Toro]]'s award-winning series [[Trollhunters|Trollhunters]].
title: Kelsey Grammer

abstract: Khandi Alexander (born September 4, 1957) is an American dancer, [[choreographer|choreography]], and actress. She began her career as a dancer in the 1980s and was a choreographer for [[Whitney Houston|Whitney Houston]]'s world tour from 1988 to 1992.
title: Khandi Alexander

abstract: Kimberly Beck (born January 9, 1956) is a former American actress and model. She is best known for her role as [[Trish Jarvis|List of Friday the 13th characters#Patricia "Trish" Jarvis]] in [[Joseph Zito|Joseph Zito]]'s [[Friday the 13th: The Final Chapter|Friday the 13th: The Final Chapter]] (1984). Her other film roles include [[Alfred Hitchcock|Alfred Hitchcock]]'s [[Marnie|Marnie (film)]] (1964), [[Luc Besson|Luc Besson]]'s [[The Big Blue|The Big Blue]] (1988), [[George T. Miller|George T. Miller]]'s [[Frozen Assets|Frozen Assets (film)]] (1992), and [[Roland Emmerich|Roland Emmerich]]'s [[Independence Day|Independence Day (1996 film)]] (1996).
title: Kimberly Beck

abstract: Quentin Jerome Tarantino (; born March 27, 1963) is an American filmmaker, author, and actor. [[His films|Quentin Tarantino filmography]] are characterized by [[nonlinear storylines|nonlinear narrative]]; [[satirical|Satire]] subject matter; an [[aestheticization of violence|aestheticization of violence]]; extended scenes of dialogue; [[ensemble cast|ensemble casts]] consisting of [[established|A-list]] and lesser-known performers; references to [[popular culture|popular culture]] and a wide variety of other films; [[soundtrack|soundtracks]] primarily containing songs and [[score pieces|film score]] from the 1960s to the 1980s; and features of [[neo-noir|neo-noir]] film.
title: Quentin Tarantino

abstract: Sarah Michelle Gellar (born April 14, 1977) is an American actress, producer, and entrepreneur. After being spotted by an agent at the age of four in New York City, she made her acting debut in the [[made-for-television film|television film]] An Invasion of Privacy (1983). Her television breakthrough came in 1993, when she originated the role of [[Kendall Hart|Kendall Hart]] on the [[ABC|American Broadcasting Company]] daytime soap opera [[All My Children|All My Children]], winning the 1995 [[Daytime Emmy Award for Outstanding Younger Actress in a Drama Series|Daytime Emmy Award for Outstanding Younger Actress in a Drama Series]].
title: Sarah Michelle Gellar

abstract: Salma Hayek Pinault (; born Salma Valgarma Hayek Jiménez; September 2, 1966) is a Mexican and American film actress, producer, and former model. She began her career in Mexico starring in the [[telenovela|telenovela]] [[Teresa|Teresa (1989 telenovela)]] and starred in the film [[El Callejón de los Milagros|Midaq Alley (film)]] (Miracle Alley) for which she was nominated for an [[Ariel Award|Ariel Award]]. In 1991 Hayek moved to Hollywood and came to prominence with roles in films such as [[Desperado|Desperado (film)]] (1995), [[From Dusk till Dawn|From Dusk till Dawn]] (1996), [[Dogma|Dogma (film)]] (1999), and [[Wild Wild West|Wild Wild West]] (1999).
title: Salma Hayek

abstract: David Edward Sutch (10 November 1940 – 16 June 1999), also known as 3rd Earl of Harrow, or simply Screaming Lord Sutch, was an English musician and serial parliamentary candidate. He was the founder of the [[Official Monster Raving Loony Party|Official Monster Raving Loony Party]] and served as its leader from 1983 to 1999, during which time he [[stood in numerous parliamentary elections|perennial candidate]]. He holds the record for losing more than 40 elections in which he stood from 1963 to 1997. As a singer he variously worked with [[Keith Moon|Keith Moon]], [[Jeff Beck|Jeff Beck]], [[Jimmy Page|Jimmy Page]], [[Ritchie Blackmore|Ritchie Blackmore]], [[Charlie Watts|Charlie Watts]] and [[Nicky Hopkins|Nicky Hopkins]].
title: Screaming Lord Sutch

abstract: Vittorio De Sica (; 7 July 1901 – 13 November 1974) was an [[Italian|Italy]] [[director|Film director]] and [[actor|actor]], a leading figure in the [[neorealist|Italian neorealism]] movement.
title: Vittorio De Sica

abstract: Leonard Alfred Schneider (October 13, 1925 – August 3, 1966), better known by his stage name Lenny Bruce, was an American stand-up comedian, social critic, and satirist. He was renowned for his open, free-style and critical form of comedy which integrated satire, politics, religion, sex, and vulgarity. His 1964 conviction in an [[obscenity|obscenity]] trial was followed by a [[posthumous|Posthumous recognition]] pardon, the first in the history of New York state, by then-Governor [[George Pataki|George Pataki]] in 2003.
title: Lenny Bruce

abstract: Ingrid Bergman (29 August 1915 – 29 August 1982) was a Swedish actress who starred in a variety of European and American films. She won three [[Academy Awards|Academy Awards]], two [[Primetime Emmy Award|Primetime Emmy Awards]], four [[Golden Globe Award|Golden Globe Awards]], a [[BAFTA Award|BAFTA Award]], and a [[Tony Award|Tony Award]]. She is best remembered for her roles as Ilsa Lund in [[Casablanca|Casablanca (film)]] (1942) and Alicia Huberman in [[Notorious|Notorious (1946 film)]] (1946).
title: Ingrid Bergman

abstract: Christophe Guy Denis Lambert (; ; born 29 March 1957), known professionally as Christopher Lambert, is a [[French|France]] actor and producer. He started his career playing supporting parts in several French films, and became internationally famous with the role of [[Tarzan|Tarzan]] in [[Greystoke: The Legend of Tarzan, Lord of the Apes|Greystoke: The Legend of Tarzan, Lord of the Apes]] in 1984. For his performance in the 1985 film [[Subway|Subway (film)]], Lambert received the [[César Award for Best Actor|César Award for Best Actor]]. His most well-known role is [[Connor MacLeod|Connor MacLeod]] in the 1986 cult adventure-fantasy film [[Highlander|Highlander (film)]] and [[the subsequent movie franchise series of the same name|Highlander (franchise)]]. He also played the thunder god [[Raiden|Raiden (Mortal Kombat)]] in the first film adaptation of the video game [[Mortal Kombat|Mortal Kombat (film)]] (1995). Other projects he is known for are [[White Material|White Material]], [[Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance|Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance]], [[NCIS: Los Angeles|NCIS: Los Angeles]], [[Kickboxer: Retaliation|Kickboxer: Retaliation]], [[Fortress|Fortress (1992 film)]], [[The Sicilian|The Sicilian (film)]], [[I Love You|I Love You (1986 film)]] and for producing [[N'oublie pas que tu vas mourir|Don't Forget You're Going to Die]], the french comedy film [[Neuf Mois|Neuf mois]] and its American remake [[Nine Months|Nine Months]].
title: Christopher Lambert

abstract: Catherine Deneuve (; born 22 October 1943) is a French actress as well as an occasional singer, model and producer. She gained recognition for her portrayal of icy, aloof and mysterious beauties for various directors, including [[Luis Buñuel|Luis Buñuel]], [[François Truffaut|François Truffaut]] and [[Roman Polanski|Roman Polanski]]. In 1985, she succeeded [[Mireille Mathieu|Mireille Mathieu]] as the official face of [[Marianne|Marianne]], France's national symbol of liberty. A 14-time [[César Award|César Award]] nominee, she won for her performances in Truffaut's [[The Last Metro|The Last Metro]] (1980), for which she also won the [[David di Donatello|David di Donatello]] for Best Foreign Actress, and [[Régis Wargnier|Régis Wargnier]]'s [[Indochine|Indochine (film)]] (1992). She is also noted for her support for a variety of [[liberal causes|Liberalism]] and sometimes controversial statements.
title: Catherine Deneuve

abstract: Janet Gaynor (born Laura Augusta Gainor; October 6, 1906 – September 14, 1984) was an American film, stage and television actress and painter.
title: Janet Gaynor

abstract: Sir Sidney Poitier, (; born February 20, 1927) is a [[Bahamian-American|Bahamian Americans]] actor, film director, [[author|author]], and diplomat.
title: Sidney Poitier

abstract: Charlton Heston (born John Charles Carter; October 4, 1923   – April 5, 2008) was an American actor and political activist.
title: Charlton Heston

abstract: Meg Ryan (born Margaret Mary Emily Anne Hyra; November 19, 1961) is an American actress and producer. Ryan began her acting career in 1981 in minor roles before joining the cast of the [[CBS|CBS]] soap opera [[As the World Turns|As the World Turns]] in 1982. Subsequently, she began to appear in supporting roles in films during the mid 1980s, achieving recognition in independent films such as [[Promised Land|Promised Land (1987 film)]] (1988) before her performance in the [[Rob Reiner|Rob Reiner]]-directed romantic comedy [[When Harry Met Sally...|When Harry Met Sally...]] (1989) brought her widespread attention and her first [[Golden Globe|Golden Globe]] nomination.
title: Meg Ryan

abstract: He was born in [[Kansas City, Missouri|Kansas City, Missouri]]. His father, Eert Ubbe Iwerks, immigrated to the U.S. in 1869 from the village of Uttum in [[East Frisia|East Frisia]] (northwest [[Germany|Germany]], today part of the municipality of [[Krummhörn|Krummhörn]]). Ub's full name can be seen on early [["Alice" shorts|Alice Comedies]] that he signed. Several years later he simplified his name to "Ub Iwerks", sometimes written as "U. B. Iwerks".
title: Ub Iwerks

abstract: Winona Ryder (born Winona Laura Horowitz; October 29, 1971) is an American actress and film producer. She is the recipient of a [[Golden Globe Award|Golden Globe Award]] and has been nominated for two [[Academy Awards|Academy Awards]], a [[BAFTA Award|BAFTA Award]], and four [[Screen Actors Guild Awards|Screen Actors Guild Awards]].
title: Winona Ryder

abstract: Martha Maria Yeardley Smith (; born July 3, 1964) is an American actress, voice actress, writer and artist, best known for her long-running role as [[Lisa Simpson|Lisa Simpson]] on the animated television series [[The Simpsons|The Simpsons]].
title: Yeardley Smith

abstract: Christine Anne Perfect (born 12 July 1943), known professionally as Christine McVie following her marriage to [[John McVie|John McVie]], is an English singer, songwriter and [[keyboardist|keyboardist]], best known as one of the three [[lead vocalist|lead vocalists]] and the keyboardist of [[Fleetwood Mac|Fleetwood Mac]]. She joined the band in 1970. She has also released three solo albums. McVie is known for her smoky, alto vocals and her direct but poignant lyrics, which concentrated on love and relationships. [[AllMusic|AllMusic]] describes her as an "Unabashedly easy-on-the-ears singer/songwriter, and the prime mover behind some of Fleetwood Mac's biggest hits." Eight of her songs appeared on Fleetwood Mac's 1988 [[Greatest Hits|Greatest Hits (1988 Fleetwood Mac album)]] album.
title: Christine McVie

abstract: Rebecca De Mornay (born Rebecca Jane Pearch; August 29, 1959) is an American actress and producer. Her breakthrough film role came in 1983, when she starred as Lana in [[Risky Business|Risky Business]]. She is also known for her portrayals of Sara in [[Runaway Train|Runaway Train (film)]] (1985), Thelma in [[The Trip to Bountiful|The Trip to Bountiful]] (1985), Helen McCaffrey in [[Backdraft|Backdraft (film)]] (1991), and Peyton Flanders in [[The Hand That Rocks the Cradle|The Hand That Rocks the Cradle (film)]] (1992).
title: Rebecca De Mornay

abstract: Barbara Stanwyck (born Ruby Catherine Stevens; July 16, 1907 – January 20, 1990) was an American actress, model, and dancer. She was a film and television star, known during her 60-year career as a consummate and versatile professional with a strong, realistic screen presence, and a favorite of directors including [[Cecil B. DeMille|Cecil B. DeMille]], [[Fritz Lang|Fritz Lang]], and [[Frank Capra|Frank Capra]]. After a short, but notable, career as a stage actress in the late 1920s, she made 85 films in 38 years in [[Hollywood|Cinema of the United States]], before turning to television.
title: Barbara Stanwyck

abstract: O'Donnell started her comedy career while still a teenager. Her big break was on the talent show [[Star Search|Star Search]] in 1984. After a TV sitcom and a series of movies introduced her to a larger national audience, she hosted [[The Rosie O'Donnell Show|The Rosie O'Donnell Show]] from 1996 to 2002, which won multiple [[Emmy Awards|Emmy Awards]]. During this time, she wrote her first [[memoir|memoir]], [[Find Me|Find Me (book)]], and developed the nickname "Queen of Nice", as well as a reputation for philanthropic efforts. She used the book's $3 million advance to establish her For All Kids [[foundation|Foundation (United States law)]] and promote other charity projects, encouraging celebrities on her show to take part. In 1999, O'Donnell did the voice of [[Terk|Terk (Tarzan)]] in the [[Disney|Disney]] animated film [[Tarzan|Tarzan (1999 film)]].
title: Rosie O'Donnell

abstract: Peter Schickele (; born July 17, 1935) is an American composer, musical educator, and [[parodist|parody]], best known for comedy albums featuring his music, but which he presents as being composed by the fictional [[P. D. Q. Bach|P. D. Q. Bach]]. He also hosted a long-running weekly radio program called Schickele Mix.From 1990 to 1993, Schickele's P.D.Q. Bach recordings earned him four consecutive wins for the [[Grammy Award for Best Comedy Album|Grammy Award for Best Comedy Album]].
title: Peter Schickele

abstract: Lea DeLaria (born May 23, 1958) is an American comedian, actress, and [[jazz|jazz]] singer. DeLaria is credited with being the first [[openly|closeted]] gay comic to appear on a late-night talk show with her 1993 appearance on [[The Arsenio Hall Show|The Arsenio Hall Show]]. She is best known for her portrayal of inmate [[Carrie "Big Boo" Black|List of Orange Is the New Black characters#Carrie "Big Boo" Black]] on [[Netflix|Netflix]] original series [[Orange Is the New Black|Orange Is the New Black]].
title: Lea DeLaria

abstract: Zenas Winsor McCay ( – 1934) was an American [[cartoonist|cartoonist]] and [[animator|animator]]. He is best known for the comic strip [[Little Nemo|Little Nemo]] (1905–14; 1924–26) and the animated film [[Gertie the Dinosaur|Gertie the Dinosaur]] (1914). For contractual reasons, he worked under the pen name Silas on the comic strip [[Dream of the Rarebit Fiend|Dream of the Rarebit Fiend]].
title: Winsor McCay

abstract: Elliot S. Maggin, also spelled Elliot S! Maggin (born 1950), is an American writer of comic books, film, television, and novels. He was a main writer for [[DC Comics|DC Comics]] during the [[Bronze|Bronze Age of comics]] and early [[Modern ages of comics|Modern Age of Comic Books]] in the 1970s and 1980s. He is particularly associated with the character of [[Superman|Superman]].
title: Elliot S. Maggin

abstract: Sandra Bernhard (born June 6, 1955) is an American actress, comedian, singer and author. She first gained attention in the late 1970s, with her [[stand-up comedy|stand-up comedy]] in which she often bitterly critiqued [[celebrity culture|celebrity culture]] and political figures.
title: Sandra Bernhard

abstract: Verónica Castro (pronounced ), full name Verónica Judith Sáinz Castro Alba (born 19 October 1952), is a [[Mexican|Mexico]] actress, singer, producer, former model and presenter. She is the mother of singer [[Cristian Castro|Cristian Castro]] and filmmaker Michel Castro.
title: Verónica Castro

abstract: Calvin Cordozar Broadus Jr. (born October 20, 1971), known professionally as Snoop Dogg, is an American rapper, singer, record producer, television personality, entrepreneur, and actor. His music career began in 1992 when he was discovered by [[Dr. Dre|Dr. Dre]] and featured on Dre's solo debut, "[[Deep Cover|Deep Cover (song)]]", and then on Dre's solo debut album, [[The Chronic|The Chronic]]. He has since sold over 23 million albums in the United States and 35 million albums worldwide.
title: Snoop Dogg

abstract: Michael Curtiz ( ; born Manó Kaminer; December 24, 1886 April 11, 1962) was a Hungarian-born American film director, recognized as one of the most prolific directors in history. He directed classic films from the silent era and numerous others during Hollywood's [[Golden Age|Classical Hollywood cinema]], when the [[studio system|studio system]] was prevalent.
title: Michael Curtiz

abstract: RuPaul Andre Charles (born November 17, 1960) is an American [[drag queen|drag queen]], actor, model, singer, songwriter, and television personality. Since 2009, he has produced and hosted the reality competition series [[RuPaul's Drag Race|RuPaul's Drag Race]], for which he has received three [[Primetime Emmy Award|Primetime Emmy Awards]], in 2016, 2017, and 2018. RuPaul is considered to be the most commercially successful drag queen in the United States. In 2017, he was included in the annual [[Time 100|Time 100]] list of the most influential people in the world.
title: RuPaul

abstract: Andrew Fleming (born March 14, 1963) is an American director and screenwriter. He directed and wrote or co-wrote the films [[Bad Dreams|Bad Dreams (film)]], [[Threesome|Threesome (1994 film)]], [[The Craft|The Craft (film)]], [[Dick|Dick (film)]], [[Nancy Drew|Nancy Drew (2007 film)]], [[Hamlet 2|Hamlet 2]], [[Barefoot|Barefoot (film)]], and [[Ideal Home|Ideal Home (film)]]. He also directed, without writing, the 2003 film [[The In-Laws|The In-Laws (2003 film)]]. He has also directed episodes of the television series [[Arrested Development|Arrested Development (TV series)]] and [[Grosse Pointe|Grosse Pointe (TV series)]], among others.
title: Andrew Fleming

abstract: Sheila Cecelia Escovedo (born December 12, 1957), better known under the stage name Sheila E., is an American percussionist, singer, author, and actress. She began her career in the mid 1970s as a percussionist and singer for [[The George Duke Band|George Duke]]. After leaving the group in 1983, Sheila began a successful solo career, starting with her critically acclaimed debut album, which included the career-defining song, "[[The Glamorous Life|The Glamorous Life]]". She became a mainstream solo star in 1985 following the success of the singles, "[[The Belle of St. Mark|The Belle of St. Mark]]", "[[Sister Fate|Sister Fate]]", and "[[A Love Bizarre|A Love Bizarre]]" with the last becoming one of her signature songs. She is commonly referred to as [[The Queen of Percussion|Honorific nicknames in popular music]].
title: Sheila E.

abstract: Lou Tellegen (born Isidor Louis Bernard Edmon van Dommelen, November 26, 1881 – October 29, 1934) was a Dutch-born [[silent film|silent film]] and stage [[actor|actor]], [[director|Film director]] and [[screenwriter|screenwriter]].
title: Lou Tellegen

abstract: Muhammad Ali (; born Cassius Marcellus Clay Jr.; January 17, 1942 – June 3, 2016) was an American [[professional boxer|professional boxer]], [[activist|activist]], and [[philanthropist|philanthropist]]. Nicknamed "The Greatest", he is widely regarded as one of the most significant and celebrated sports figures of the 20th century and one of the greatest boxers of all time.He was born and raised in [[Louisville, Kentucky|Louisville, Kentucky]], and began training as an [[amateur boxer|amateur boxer]] when he was 12 years old. At the age of 18, he won a gold medal in the [[light heavyweight|light heavyweight]] division at the [[1960 Summer Olympics|1960 Summer Olympics]] in Rome, then turned professional later that year, before converting to [[Islam|Islam]] after 1961. At the age of 22, in 1964, he won the world [[heavyweight|heavyweight]] championship from [[Sonny Liston|Sonny Liston]] in [[a major upset|Muhammad Ali vs. Sonny Liston]]. He then changed his name from Cassius Clay, which he called his "[[slave name|slave name]]", to Muhammad Ali. He set an example of racial pride for [[African Americans|African Americans]] and resistance to white domination during the [[Civil Rights Movement|Civil Rights Movement]].
title: Muhammad Ali

abstract: Paul Verhoeven (; born 18 July 1938) is a Dutch director, screenwriter and film producer. Active in both the [[Netherlands|Netherlands]] and [[Hollywood|Hollywood]], Verhoeven's blending of graphic violence and sexual content with social [[satire|satire]] are trademarks of both his [[drama|Drama film]] and [[science fiction film|science fiction films]]. He is best known for directing the films [[RoboCop|RoboCop]] (1987), [[Total Recall|Total Recall (1990 film)]] (1990), [[Basic Instinct|Basic Instinct]] (1992), [[Showgirls|Showgirls]] (1995), [[Starship Troopers|Starship Troopers (film)]] (1997) and [[Elle|Elle (film)]] (2016).
title: Paul Verhoeven

abstract: Mike Nichols (born Mikhail Igor Peschkowsky; November 6, 1931 – November 19, 2014) was an American film and theater director, producer, actor, and comedian. He was noted for his ability to work across a range of genres and an aptitude for getting the best out of actors regardless of their acting experience. Nichols began his career in the 1950s with the comedy [[improvisational|Improvisational theatre]] troupe, [[The Compass Players|Compass Players]], predecessor of [[The Second City|The Second City]], in [[Chicago|Chicago]]. He then teamed up with his improv partner, [[Elaine May|Elaine May]], to form the comedy duo [[Nichols and May|Nichols and May]]. Their live improv acts were a hit on [[Broadway|Broadway theatre]] resulting in three albums, with their debut album winning a [[Grammy Award|Grammy Award]].
title: Mike Nichols

abstract: Michael Andrew Fox (born June 9, 1961), known professionally as Michael J. Fox, is a Canadian-American actor, comedian, author, and film producer with a film and television career spanning from the 1970s. He is known for his starring roles; as [[Marty McFly|Marty McFly]] in the [[Back to the Future|Back to the Future (franchise)]] trilogy, in [[ABC|American Broadcasting Corporation]] sitcom [[Spin City|Spin City]] (1996–2000), and as [[Alex P. Keaton|Alex P. Keaton]] on the sitcom [[Family Ties|Family Ties]]. He has won five [[Primetime Emmy Award|Primetime Emmy Awards]], four [[Golden Globe Awards|Golden Globe Awards]], a [[Grammy Award|Grammy Award]] and two [[Screen Actors Guild Awards|Screen Actors Guild Awards]].
title: Michael J. Fox

abstract: Of [[Puerto Rican|Puerto Rico]] descent, Morales was born in [[Brooklyn|Brooklyn]], New York, to Esai Morales, Sr., a welder, and Iris Margarita ([[née|married and maiden names]] Declet), a union activist involved with the [[International Ladies' Garment Workers' Union|International Ladies' Garment Workers' Union]]. Morales began his pursuit of an acting career by attending the [[School of Performing Arts|School of Performing Arts]] in [[Manhattan|Manhattan]].
title: Esai Morales

abstract: Erik Balling (29 November 1924   – 19 November 2005) was a [[Danish|Denmark]] TV and [[film director|film director]]. He created two of Denmark's most popular TV-series, [[Matador|Matador (Danish TV series)]] and [[Huset på Christianshavn|Huset på Christianshavn]].
title: Erik Balling

abstract: Alicia Silverstone (; born October 4, 1976) is an American actress. She made her film debut in [[The Crush|The Crush (1993 film)]] (1993), earning the 1994 [[MTV Movie Award for Best Breakthrough Performance|MTV Movie Award for Best Breakthrough Performance]], and gained further prominence as a [[teen idol|teen idol]] when she appeared at the age of 16 in the music video for [[Aerosmith's|Aerosmith]] "[[Cryin'|Cryin']]". She starred in the comedy hit [[Clueless|Clueless (film)]] (1995), which earned her a multimillion-dollar deal with [[Columbia Pictures|Columbia Pictures]], and in the big-budget film [[Batman & Robin|Batman & Robin (film)]] (1997), playing Barbara/[[Batgirl|Batgirl]].
title: Alicia Silverstone

abstract: She starred in [[How the West Was Won|How the West Was Won (film)]] (1962), and [[The Unsinkable Molly Brown|The Unsinkable Molly Brown (film)]] (1964), a biographical film about the famously boisterous [[Molly Brown|Margaret Brown]]. Her performance as Brown earned her a nomination for the [[Academy Award for Best Actress|Academy Award for Best Actress]]. Her other films include [[The Singing Nun|The Singing Nun (film)]] (1966), [[Divorce American Style|Divorce American Style]] (1967), [[What's the Matter with Helen?|What's the Matter with Helen?]] (1971), [[Charlotte's Web|Charlotte's Web (1973 film)]] (1973), [[Mother|Mother (1996 film)]] (1996) ([[Golden Globe nomination|Golden Globe Award]]), and [[In & Out|In & Out (film)]] (1997). Reynolds was also a [[cabaret|cabaret]] performer. In 1979, she founded the Debbie Reynolds Dance Studio in North [[Hollywood|Hollywood]], which still operates today.
title: Debbie Reynolds

abstract: Sir Patrick Stewart (born 13 July 1940) is an English actor whose work has included roles on stage, television, and film in a career spanning almost six decades. He has been nominated for [[Olivier|Laurence Olivier Award]], [[Golden Globe|Golden Globe Award]], [[Emmy|Emmy Award]], [[Screen Actors Guild|Screen Actors Guild Award]], and [[Saturn|Saturn Award]] Awards throughout his career.
title: Patrick Stewart

abstract: Michelle Marie Pfeiffer (; born April 29, 1958) is an American actress and producer. One of the most popular actresses of the 1980s and 1990s, she has received international acclaim and [[many accolades|List of awards and nominations received by Michelle Pfeiffer]] for her work in both comedic and dramatic films. Noted for her versatility as a [[character actress|character actress]], Pfeiffer has become particularly known for portraying nuanced and unglamorous, [[emotionally distant|Emotional detachment]] women as well as strong female characters with intense sex appeal. Pfeiffer is widely considered to be among the most talented actresses of her generation.
title: Michelle Pfeiffer

abstract: Walter Matthau (; born Walter John Matthow; October 1, 1920 – July 1, 2000) was an American actor and comedian, best known for his film roles, including as [[Oscar Madison|The Odd Couple (film)]] in [[The Odd Couple|The Odd Couple (film)]], [[based on the play of the same title|The Odd Couple (play)]] by playwright [[Neil Simon|Neil Simon]], in which he also appeared on [[broadway theatre|broadway theatre]], and notably, opposite Audrey Hepburn in [[Charade|Charade (1963 film)]]. He also appeared in the less successful Odd Couple film sequel some 30 years later, [[The Odd Couple II|The Odd Couple II]]. Matthau was known for his frequent collaborations with Odd Couple co-star [[Jack Lemmon|Jack Lemmon]], particularly in the 1990s with [[Grumpy Old Men|Grumpy Old Men (film)]] and its sequel [[Grumpier Old Men|Grumpier Old Men]]. He won the [[Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor|Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor]] for his performance in the 1966 [[Billy Wilder|Billy Wilder]] film [[The Fortune Cookie|The Fortune Cookie]]. Besides the Oscar, he was the winner of [[BAFTA|British Academy of Film and Television Arts]], [[Golden Globe|Golden Globe Award]] and [[Tony|Tony Award]] awards.
title: Walter Matthau

abstract: John Francis Bongiovi Jr. (born March 2, 1962), known professionally as Jon Bon Jovi, is an American singer-songwriter, record producer, philanthropist, and actor. Bon Jovi is best known as the founder and frontman of the [[rock|Rock music]] band [[Bon Jovi|Bon Jovi]], which was formed in 1983.
title: Jon Bon Jovi

abstract: Mary Elizabeth "Sissy" Spacek (; born December 25, 1949) is an American actress and singer.
