She is the recipient of [[various accolades|List of awards and nominations received by Sissy Spacek]] including an [[Academy Award|Academy Award]], three [[Golden Globe Awards|Golden Globe Awards]], two [[Critics' Choice Movie Awards|Critics' Choice Movie Awards]], a [[Screen Actors Guild Award|Screen Actors Guild Award]] and nominations for four [[BAFTA Awards|BAFTA Awards]], three [[Primetime Emmy Awards|Primetime Emmy Awards]], a [[Grammy Award|Grammy Award]].
title: Sissy Spacek

abstract: Eileen Evelyn Greer Garson, (29 September 1904 – 6 April 1996) was a British-American actress popular during the [[Second World War|Second World War]], being listed by the [[Motion Picture Herald|Motion Picture Herald]] as one of America's top-ten box office draws from 1942 to 1946.
title: Greer Garson

abstract: Edith Norma Shearer (August 11, 1902 – June 12, 1983) was a Canadian-American actress and Hollywood star from 1925 through 1942. Shearer often played spunky, sexually liberated ingenues. She appeared in adaptations of [[Noël Coward|Noël Coward]], [[Eugene O'Neill|Eugene O'Neill]], and [[William Shakespeare|William Shakespeare]], and was the first person to be nominated five times for an [[Academy Award|Academy Awards]] for acting, winning [[Best Actress|Academy Award for Best Actress]] for her performance in the 1930 film [[The Divorcee|The Divorcee]].
title: Norma Shearer

abstract: Michael McKean (born October 17, 1947) is an American actor, comedian, and musician, known for a variety of roles played since the 1970s.
title: Michael McKean

abstract: Charlotte Lucy Gainsbourg (born 21 July 1971) is a British-French actress and singer. She is the daughter of English actress [[Jane Birkin|Jane Birkin]] and French singer and songwriter [[Serge Gainsbourg|Serge Gainsbourg]]. After making her musical debut with her father on the song "[[Lemon Incest|Lemon Incest]]" at the age of 12, she released an album with her father at the age of 15. More than 20 years passed before she released the first of four albums as an adult ([[5:55|5:55]], [[IRM|IRM (album)]], [[Stage Whisper|Stage Whisper]] and [[Rest|Rest (Charlotte Gainsbourg album)]]) to commercial and critical success. Gainsbourg has also appeared in many films, including several directed by [[Lars von Trier|Lars von Trier]], and has received both a [[César Award|César Award]] and the [[Cannes Film Festival Best Actress Award|Best Actress Award (Cannes Film Festival)]].
title: Charlotte Gainsbourg

abstract: Spears became the subject of significant media attention and controversy in 2007, when she announced she was pregnant at age 16, effectively sending her career into hiatus. In 2013, Spears launched a career in [[country music|country music]]. She released her debut single, "[[How Could I Want More|How Could I Want More]]", along with her debut [[EP|extended play]], [[The Journey|The Journey (Jamie Lynn Spears album)]].
title: Jamie Lynn Spears

abstract: Laraine Newman (born March 2, 1952) is an American comedian, actress, voice artist, and writer who was part of the original cast of NBC's [[Saturday Night Live|Saturday Night Live]].
title: Laraine Newman

abstract: Soleil Moon Frye (; born August 6, 1976) is an American actress, director and screenwriter. She began her career as a child actor at the age of two. When she was seven years old, Frye won the role of Penelope "Punky" Brewster in the sitcom [[Punky Brewster|Punky Brewster]]. The series, which debuted on [[NBC|NBC]] in September 1984, earned consistently low ratings but the Punky character was a hit with young children. After NBC canceled the series, it was picked up for the [[syndication|Broadcast]] market where it aired for an additional two seasons ending in 1988.
title: Soleil Moon Frye

abstract: Roland Stephen "Steve" Taylor (born December 9, 1957), is an American singer, songwriter, record producer, music executive, film maker, and actor. A figure in what has come to be known as [[Christian alternative rock|Christian alternative rock]], Taylor enjoyed a successful solo career during the 1980s, and also served in the short-lived group [[Chagall Guevara|Chagall Guevara]]. In contrast to many Christian musical artists, his songs have often taken aim at other Christians with the use of satirical, sardonic lyrics. In 1997, he founded the record label [[Squint Entertainment|Squint Entertainment]], which fueled the careers of artists such as [[Sixpence None the Richer|Sixpence None the Richer]], [[Chevelle|Chevelle (band)]], and [[Burlap to Cashmere|Burlap to Cashmere]]. Despite this success, Taylor was ousted from the label by its parent, [[Word Entertainment|Word Entertainment]], in 2001. He has produced and written for numerous musical acts, one of the most consistent being [[Newsboys|Newsboys]]. As a film-maker, Taylor co-wrote, directed, and produced the feature films [[Down Under the Big Top|Down Under the Big Top]], [[The Second Chance|The Second Chance]], and [[Blue Like Jazz|Blue Like Jazz (film)]]. After a decade and a half of hiatus, Taylor returned to performing music in 2010 as the front-man for [[Steve Taylor & The Perfect Foil|Steve Taylor & The Perfect Foil]], a [[supergroup|Supergroup (music)]] he founded with [[Peter Furler|Peter Furler]], [[Jimmy Abegg|Jimmy Abegg]], and [[John Mark Painter|John Mark Painter]].
title: Steve Taylor

abstract: Evelyn Renee O'Connor (born February 15, 1971) is an American actress, producer, and director, known for the role of [[Gabrielle|Gabrielle (Xena: Warrior Princess)]] on the television series [[Xena: Warrior Princess|Xena: Warrior Princess]].
title: Renee O'Connor

abstract: Christina Cox was born in a town on the outskirts of [[Toronto|Toronto]], the youngest of three daughters. She is Canadian of Caribbean (Jamaican) descent. She has two older sisters, named Tracey and Melissa. Her father is an automotive executive.
title: Christina Cox

abstract: Mia Kirshner (born January 25, 1975 or 1976) is a Canadian actress, writer and social activist who works in movies and television series. She is known for her role as [[Jenny Schecter|Jenny Schecter]] on the cable TV series [[The L Word|The L Word]] (2004–2009), and for her recurring guest role as the terrorist [[Mandy|Mandy (24 character)]] on the TV series [[24|24 (TV series)]] (2001–2005).
title: Mia Kirshner

abstract: Dinah Shore (born Fannye Rose Shore; February 29, 1916 – February 24, 1994) was an American singer, actress, and television personality, and the top-charting female vocalist of the 1940s. She rose to prominence as a recording artist during the [[Big Band|Big Band]] era, but achieved even greater success a decade later, in television, mainly as hostess of a series of variety programs for [[Chevrolet|Chevrolet]].
title: Dinah Shore

abstract: Asia Argento (; born Aria Maria Vittoria Rossa Argento, 20 September 1975) is an Italian actress and director. The daughter of filmmaker [[Dario Argento|Dario Argento]], she had roles in the films [[XXX|XXX (2002 film)]] (2002), [[Land of the Dead|Land of the Dead]] (2005) and [[Marie Antoinette|Marie Antoinette (2006 film)]] (2006). She has won two [[David di Donatello|David di Donatello]] awards for [[Best Actress|David di Donatello for Best Actress]] for [[Let's Not Keep in Touch|Let's Not Keep in Touch]] (1994) and [[Traveling Companion|Traveling Companion]] (1996).
title: Asia Argento

abstract: Keith Hamilton Cobb (born January 28, 1962) is an [[American|United States]] actor.
title: Keith Hamilton Cobb

abstract: Michael Angelis (born 18 January 1952) is an [[English|England]] actor and voice actor. He is the younger brother of fellow actor [[Paul Angelis|Paul Angelis]]. He is best known for his work on [[Thomas and Friends|Thomas and Friends]].
title: Michael Angelis

abstract: Satoshi Kon was born on October 12, 1963. Due to his father's job transfer, Kon's education from the fourth elementary grade up to the second middle school grade was based in [[Sapporo|Sapporo]]. Kon was a classmate and close friend of manga artist Seihō Takizawa. While attending [[Hokkaido Kushiro Koryo High School|Hokkaido Prefectural Board of Education]], Kon aspired to become an animator. His favorite works were [[Space Battleship Yamato|Space Battleship Yamato]] (1974), [[Heidi, Girl of the Alps|Heidi, Girl of the Alps]] (1974), [[Future Boy Conan|Future Boy Conan]] (1978) and [[Mobile Suit Gundam|Mobile Suit Gundam]] (1979), as well as [[Katsuhiro Otomo|Katsuhiro Otomo]]'s [[Domu: A Child's Dream|Domu: A Child's Dream]]. [[Yasutaka Tsutsui|Yasutaka Tsutsui]] served as an influence on Kon's drawings. Kon graduated from the Graphic Design course of the [[Musashino Art University|Musashino Art University]] in 1982. During that time, Kon viewed numerous foreign films and enthusiastically read Yasutaka Tsutsui's books.
title: Satoshi Kon

abstract: Carole Penny Marshall (October 15, 1943   – December 17, 2018) was an American actress, director and producer. She came to notice in the 1970s for her role as Laverne DeFazio on the television sitcom [[Laverne & Shirley|Laverne & Shirley]] (1976–1983), receiving three nominations for the [[Golden Globe Award for Best Actress – Television Series Musical or Comedy|Golden Globe Award for Best Actress – Television Series Musical or Comedy]] for her portrayal.
title: Penny Marshall

abstract: Simon Baker (born 30 July 1969) is an Australian actor and director. In his television acting career, he is known for his lead roles in the [[CBS|CBS]] television series [[The Mentalist|The Mentalist]] (as [[Patrick Jane|Patrick Jane]]) and [[The Guardian|The Guardian (TV series)]] (as Nicholas Fallin). In his film acting career, he is best known for his roles as Max Rourke in the remake of the Japanese horror film [[The Ring Two|The Ring Two]], Riley Denbo in [[Land of the Dead|Land of the Dead]] and Christian Thompson in the film adaptation of [[The Devil Wears Prada|The Devil Wears Prada (film)]].
title: Simon Baker

abstract: Philippa Boyens, [[MNZM|New Zealand Order of Merit]], is a [[New Zealand|New Zealand]] [[screenwriter|screenwriter]] and [[producer|Film producer]] who co-wrote the [[screenplay|screenplay]] for [[Peter Jackson|Peter Jackson]]'s films [[The Lord of the Rings series|The Lord of the Rings (film series)]], [[King Kong|King Kong (2005 film)]], [[The Lovely Bones|The Lovely Bones (film)]], and the three-part film [[The Hobbit|The Hobbit (film series)]], all with Jackson and [[Fran Walsh|Fran Walsh]].
title: Philippa Boyens

abstract: Allison Brooks Janney (born November 19, 1959) is an American actress. A prolific [[character actress|character actress]], Janney has received [[numerous accolades|List of awards and nominations received by Allison Janney]], including an [[Academy Award|Academy Award]], seven [[Primetime Emmy Award|Primetime Emmy Awards]], a [[BAFTA Award|British Academy Film Awards]], a [[Golden Globe Award|Golden Globe Award]], and seven [[Screen Actors Guild Awards|Screen Actors Guild Awards]].
title: Allison Janney

abstract: Roxann Dawson (née Caballero, also credited as Roxann Biggs and Roxann Biggs-Dawson) is an American actress, producer, and director and writer, best known as [[B'Elanna Torres|B'Elanna Torres]] on the television series [[Star Trek: Voyager|Star Trek: Voyager]].
title: Roxann Dawson

abstract: Ron Gilbert is an American [[video-game designer|video game designer]], [[programmer|video game programmer]], and [[producer|video game producer]]. His games are generally focused on interactive story-telling, and he is arguably best known for his work on several classic [[LucasArts|LucasArts]] [[adventure game|adventure games]], including [[Maniac Mansion|Maniac Mansion]] and the first two [[Monkey Island|Monkey Island (series)]] games.
title: Ron Gilbert

abstract: Rita Moreno (born December 11, 1931) is a [[Puerto Rican|Puerto Rico]] actress, dancer and singer. Her career has spanned over 70 years; among her notable acting work are supporting roles in the musical films [[The King and I|The King and I (1956 film)]] and [[West Side Story|West Side Story (film)]], as well as a 1971–77 stint on the children's television series [[The Electric Company|The Electric Company]], and a supporting role on the 1997–2003 TV drama [[Oz|Oz (TV series)]].
title: Rita Moreno

abstract: Holly Marie Combs (born December 3, 1973) is an American actress and television producer. She is known for her roles as Kimberly Brock in the [[CBS|CBS]] series [[Picket Fences|Picket Fences]] (1992–1996), [[Piper Halliwell|Piper Halliwell]] in [[The WB|The WB]] series [[Charmed|Charmed]] (1998–2006) and [[Ella Montgomery|Ella Montgomery]] in the [[Freeform|Freeform (TV channel)]] series [[Pretty Little Liars|Pretty Little Liars]] (2010–2017).
title: Holly Marie Combs

abstract: Kim Coates (born February 21, 1958) is a [[Canadian-American|Canadian Americans]] actor who has worked in both Canadian and American films and television series. He has worked on [[Broadway|Broadway theatre]] portraying [[Stanley Kowalski|Stanley Kowalski]] in [[A Streetcar Named Desire|A Streetcar Named Desire (play)]] and in the lead role of [[Macbeth|Macbeth]] performed at the [[Stratford Shakespeare Festival|Stratford Shakespeare Festival]]. He is best known for his role as [[Alexander "Tig" Trager|Tig Trager]] in the [[FX|FX (TV channel)]] series [[Sons of Anarchy|Sons of Anarchy]].
title: Kim Coates

abstract: Victoria Ruffo (born Maria Victoria Eugenia Guadalupe Martínez del Río Moreno-Ruffo on May 31, 1962 in [[Mexico City|Mexico City]]) is a [[Mexican|Mexican people]] [[actress|actress]] notable for her roles in [[telenovela|telenovelas]].
title: Victoria Ruffo

abstract: Christopher Daniel Barnes (born November 7, 1972), also known professionally as C. D. Barnes and C. B. Barnes, is an American actor and voice actor. He is best known for his voice role as the [[title superhero|Spider-Man]] of the 1994 animated series [[Spider-Man|Spider-Man (1994 TV series)]], [[Prince Eric|Prince Eric]] from [[The Little Mermaid|The Little Mermaid (1989 film)]], as well as his on-screen portrayal of [[Greg Brady|List of The Brady Bunch characters#Greg Brady]] in the films [[The Brady Bunch Movie|The Brady Bunch Movie]] and [[A Very Brady Sequel|A Very Brady Sequel]].
title: Christopher Daniel Barnes

abstract: John Noble (born 20 August 1948) is an Australian actor and theatre director of more than 80 plays. He is best known for his roles as [[Dr. Walter Bishop|Walter Bishop (Fringe)]] in the US [[Fox|Fox Broadcasting Company]] science fiction television series [[Fringe|Fringe (TV series)]], and Henry Parrish in the Fox action-horror series [[Sleepy Hollow|Sleepy Hollow (TV series)]]. His most high-profile film role was as [[Denethor|Denethor]] in [[Peter Jackson|Peter Jackson]]'s [[The Lord of the Rings|The Lord of the Rings (film series)]] trilogy. He also provided the voice of the [[DC Comics|DC Comics]] [[supervillain|supervillain]] [[Scarecrow|Scarecrow (DC Comics)]] in the 2015 video game [[Batman: Arkham Knight|Batman: Arkham Knight]], where his character served as the main [[antagonist|antagonist]]. In 2015, he joined the main cast of the television series [[Elementary|Elementary (TV series)]] as [[Sherlock Holmes|Sherlock Holmes]]'s father. He was also cast as a doctor in the Australian TV series [[All Saints|All Saints (TV series)]]. In 2012, Noble was diagnosed with [[osteoporosis|osteoporosis]]. His charity, Noble Bones, helps to raise awareness for the disease.
title: John Noble

abstract: Chanakya assisted the first [[Mauryan|Maurya Empire]] emperor [[Chandragupta|Chandragupta Maurya]] in his rise to power. He is widely credited for having played an important role in the establishment of the [[Maurya Empire|Maurya Empire]]. Chanakya served as the chief advisor to both emperors Chandragupta and his son [[Bindusara|Bindusara]].
title: Chanakya

abstract: Cillian Murphy (; born 25 May 1976) is an Irish actor. He began his career performing as a rock musician. After turning down a record deal, he began his acting career in theatre, and in [[short|short films]] and [[independent|independent films]] films in the late 1990s.
title: Cillian Murphy

abstract: David Barsamian (born 1945) is an [[Armenian-American|Armenian-American]] radio broadcaster, writer, and the founder and director of [[Alternative Radio|Alternative Radio]], a [[Boulder, Colorado|Boulder, Colorado]]-based syndicated weekly public affairs program heard on some 250 radio stations worldwide.
title: David Barsamian

abstract: Margaret Nixon McEathron (February 22, 1930   – July 24, 2016), known professionally as Marni Nixon, was an American [[soprano|soprano]] and [[ghost singer|ghost singer]] for featured actresses in [[movie musicals|Musical film]]. She is now well known as the real singing voices of the leading actresses in films, including [[The King and I|The King and I (1956 film)]], [[West Side Story|West Side Story (film)]], and [[My Fair Lady|My Fair Lady (film)]], although this was concealed at the time from audiences.
title: Marni Nixon

abstract: Goran Višnjić ( ; ; born September 9, 1972) is a [[Croatian|Croatia]]-[[American|America]] actor who has appeared in American and British films and television productions. He is best known in the [[United States|United States]] for his roles as [[Dr. Luka Kovač|Luka Kovač]] on the [[NBC|NBC]] television series [[ER|ER (TV series)]] and Garcia Flynn on [[Timeless|Timeless (TV series)]]. He is the son-in-law of Croatian film director and former head of [[Croatian Radiotelevision|Croatian Radiotelevision]] (1991–95), [[Antun Vrdoljak|Antun Vrdoljak]]. He moved to the United States in the late 1990s.
title: Goran Višnjić

abstract: Ida Lupino (4 February 1918 – 3 August 1995) was an English-American actress and singer, who became a pioneering director and producer—the only woman working within the 1950s Hollywood studio system to do so. With her independent production company, she co-wrote and co-produced several of her own social-message films, and was the first woman to direct a [[film noir|film noir]], [[The Hitch-Hiker|The Hitch-Hiker]], in 1953.
title: Ida Lupino

abstract: Alexander Martin Clunes, [[OBE|Order of the British Empire]] (born 28 November 1961) is an English actor, television presenter, film director and comedian. He is best known for portraying Martin Ellingham in the [[ITV|ITV (TV network)]] drama series [[Doc Martin|Doc Martin]] and Gary Strang in [[Men Behaving Badly|Men Behaving Badly]]. Clunes has narrated a number of documentaries for [[ITV|ITV (TV network)]], the first of which was [[Islands of Britain|Islands of Britain (TV series)]] in 2009. He has since presented a number of documentaries centred on animals. He has also voiced [[Kipper the Dog|Kipper the Dog]] in the animated series, [[Kipper|Kipper (TV series)]].
title: Martin Clunes

abstract: Carole Landis (born Frances Lillian Mary Ridste; January 1, 1919 – July 5, 1948) was an American actress and singer. She worked as a contract-player for [[Twentieth Century-Fox|Twentieth Century-Fox]] in the 1940s. Her breakthrough role was as the female lead in the 1940 film [[One Million B.C.|One Million B.C.]], with [[United Artists|United Artists]]. Landis was known as "The Ping Girl" and "The Chest" because of her curvy figure.
title: Carole Landis

abstract: Bharathan (14 November 1946 – 30 July 1998) was an Indian film director, artist, and art director. Bharathan is noted for being the founder of a new school of film making in [[Malayalam cinema|Malayalam cinema]], along with [[Padmarajan|Padmarajan]] and [[K. G. George|K. G. George]], in the 1980s, which created films that were widely received while also being critically acclaimed. A train of directors, and screenwriters followed this school onto the 1990s including [[Sibi Malayil|Sibi Malayil]], [[Kamal|Kamaluddin Mohammed]], [[Lohithadas|Lohithadas]] and [[Jayaraj|Jayaraj]]. He was born at Engakkadu near [[Wadakkancherry|Wadakkancherry]], in present-day [[Thrissur|Thrissur]] district of [[Kerala|Kerala]], India.
title: Bharathan

abstract: Thilakan started his full-time career in acting after leaving college in the year 1956. During this period he and several friends formed a drama troupe called the Mundakayam Nataka Samithy in [[Mundakayam|Mundakayam]], where his father was working as an estate supervisor. He worked with the [[Kerala People's Arts Club|Kerala People's Arts Club]] till 1966, followed by stints in Kalidasa Kala Kendra, Changanacherry Geetha, and [[P. J. Antony|P. J. Antony]]'s troupe. He also performed in several radio plays presented by [[All India Radio|All India Radio]].
title: Thilakan

abstract: Kesavan Venugopal Nair (born 22 May 1948), known popularly by his stage name Nedumudi Venu, is an Indian film actor known for his works in [[Malayalam cinema|Malayalam cinema]], and [[Tamil cinema|Tamil cinema]]. He has received two [[National Film Awards|National Film Awards]] and six [[Kerala State Film Awards|Kerala State Film Awards]] for his various performances.
title: Nedumudi Venu

abstract: Walter Stacy Keach Jr. (born June 2, 1941) is an American [[actor|actor]]. Highly prolific, he has played mainly [[drama|dramatic]] roles throughout his career, often in law enforcement or as a private detective. His most prominent role was as [[Mickey Spillane|Mickey Spillane]]'s fictional detective [[Mike Hammer|Mike Hammer]], which he played in numerous stand-alone [[television film|television films]] and at least three different [[television series|television series]] throughout the 1980s and 1990s. The role earned him a [[Golden Globe Award|Golden Globe Award]] nomination in 1984.
title: Stacy Keach

abstract: Robert Picardo (born October 27, 1953) is an American actor. He is known for his portrayals of Dr. Dick Richards on [[ABC|American Broadcasting Company]]'s [[China Beach|China Beach]]; the Emergency Medical Hologram (EMH), also known as [[The Doctor|Doctor (Star Trek)]], on [[Star Trek: Voyager|Star Trek: Voyager]]; the Cowboy in [[Innerspace|Innerspace]], Coach Cutlip on [[The Wonder Years|The Wonder Years]] (where he received an [[Emmy nomination|Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Guest Actor in a Comedy Series]]); Ben Wheeler in [[Wagons East|Wagons East]]; and as [[Richard Woolsey|Richard Woolsey]] in the [[Stargate|Stargate]] television franchise. Picardo is also a member of the Board of Directors of [[The Planetary Society|The Planetary Society]].
title: Robert Picardo

abstract: Ali Kemal Sunal (10 November 1944 – 3 July 2000) was a Turkish actor. With [[Hababam Sınıfı|Hababam Sınıfı]], [[Kapıcılar Kralı|Kapıcılar Kralı]] and [[Davaro|Davaro]], Sunal gained large popularity amongst [[Turkish cinema|Turkish cinema]] goers and was famed for his character "Şaban", a role he frequently played. His characters in films often reflected the problems common Turkish people faced in their country.
title: Kemal Sunal

abstract: Sherrill Milnes (born January 10, 1935) is an [[American|United States]] operatic [[baritone|baritone]] most famous for his [[Verdi|Giuseppe Verdi]] roles. From 1965 until 1997 he was associated with the [[Metropolitan Opera|Metropolitan Opera]]. His voice is a high dramatic baritone, combining good legato with an incisive rhythmic style. By 1965 he had made his debut at the Metropolitan Opera. His international debuts followed soon thereafter, and Milnes became one of the world's prominent Verdi baritones of the 1970s and 1980s.
title: Sherrill Milnes

abstract: Robin Curtis (born June 15, 1956) is an American real estate broker and actress. She is best known for replacing [[Kirstie Alley|Kirstie Alley]] in the role of [[Vulcan|Vulcan (Star Trek)]] Lieutenant [[Saavik|Saavik]] in the films [[Star Trek III: The Search for Spock|Star Trek III: The Search for Spock]] and [[Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home|Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home]].
title: Robin Curtis

abstract: Jamie-Lynn Sigler (born May 15, 1981) is an American actress and singer. She is best known for her role as [[Meadow Soprano|Meadow Soprano]] on the [[HBO|HBO]] series [[The Sopranos|The Sopranos]].
title: Jamie-Lynn Sigler

abstract: Jean Dudley, known professionally as Lynne Perrie (7 April 1931 – 24 March 2006), was an English actress, singer, comediene, presenter and author. Born in [[Rotherham|Rotherham]], [[West Riding of Yorkshire|West Riding of Yorkshire]], she was the older sister of comedian and actor [[Duggie Brown|Duggie Brown]]. She rose to prominence in the 1960s as a cabaret singer, but was to become best known for her acting. Perrie is most recognised as Mrs Casper in [[Ken Loach|Ken Loach]]'s 1969 film [[Kes|Kes (film)]], Mrs Petty in the television series [[Queenie's Castle|Queenie's Castle]], and as [[Ivy Tilsley|Ivy Tilsley]] in [[Coronation Street|Coronation Street]], a character she portrayed from 1971 until 1994.
title: Lynne Perrie

abstract: George Maharis (born September 1, 1928, [[Astoria, Queens|Astoria, Queens]], [[New York City|New York City]]) is an [[American|United States]] actor who portrayed [[Buz Murdock|Buz Murdock]] in the first three seasons of the TV series [[Route 66|Route 66 (TV series)]]. Maharis also recorded numerous pop music albums at the height of his fame, and later starred in the short-lived TV series [[The Most Deadly Game|The Most Deadly Game]].
title: George Maharis

abstract: Abby Brammell (born March 19, 1979) is an American [[television|television]] and [[stage|Stage (theatre)]] [[actress|actress]].
title: Abby Brammell

abstract: Rico Yan (; born Ricardo Carlos Castro Yan; March 14, 1975 – March 29, 2002) was a [[Filipino|Filipino people]] [[matinee idol|matinee idol]], [[model|model (person)]], film and television [[actor|actor]], [[host|Television presenter]], [[spokesperson|spokesperson]] and [[entrepreneur|entrepreneur]].
title: Rico Yan

abstract: Humayun Saeed (born Humayun Saeed Ansari: 27 July 1971) is a Pakistani actor and producer. Saeed is also a co-founder of the media production house Six Sigma Entertainment Plus which produces television drama serials and commercial movies. He has appeared in dozens of Pakistani television dramas and limited number of films, and earned numerous accolades, including [[Lux Style Awards|Lux Style Awards]] and [[ARY Film Awards|ARY Film Awards]] Saeed Enjoys substantial fan following in Pakistan since the beginning of his career and was often ranked amongst the highest paid TV actors of his time.
title: Humayun Saeed

abstract: Craig Lamar Traylor (born March 19, 1989 in [[San Bernardino County, California|San Bernardino County, California]]) is an American [[actor|actor]]. He made his debut in an episode of [[ER|ER (TV series)]] in 1996. He is best known for his role as Stevie Kenarban, the asthmatic boy in a wheelchair and the title character's friend in the [[Fox|Fox Network]] sitcom [[Malcolm in the Middle|Malcolm in the Middle]]. Traylor has also had small roles in the films [[Matilda|Matilda (1996 film)]] and [[Get a Clue|Get a Clue]].
title: Craig Lamar Traylor

abstract: Gülse Birsel was born on 11 March 1971 in [[Istanbul|Istanbul]] as the third child of Gültekin and Semiha Şener. Her father was a lawyer, while her mother was a housewife. Her name was chosen from the first syllables of the names of her mother and father. Her elder brother Bozkurt is five years her senior, while her elder sister Dilek is three years older than her. Her older brother is an ophthalmologist and a former national volleyball player. She finished her secondary education at Beyoğlu Anadolu High School. She was thinking of acting as a profession until the end of high school. However, with the wish of her family, she first studied at [[Boğaziçi University|Boğaziçi University]], Department of Economics. Between 1994 and 1996, she completed her [[MFA|Master of Fine Arts]] at [[Columbia University|Columbia University]].
title: Gülse Birsel

abstract: Catriona MacColl (born 3 October 1954) is an English actress who has worked extensively in both film and television across Europe.
title: Catriona MacColl

abstract: Pete DePaolo (April 6, 1898 – November 26, 1980) was the American race car driver who won the [[1925 Indianapolis 500|1925 Indianapolis 500]].
title: Pete DePaolo

abstract: Adrian R'Mante (born February 3, 1978) is an American [[actor|actor]] and acting coach best known for his role as [[Esteban Julió Ricardo Montoya de la Rosa Ramírez|List of recurring characters in The Suite Life of Zack & Cody#Esteban]] in the [[Disney Channel Original Series|Disney Channel Original Series]], [[The Suite Life of Zack & Cody|The Suite Life of Zack & Cody]]. He was born in [[Tampa, Florida|Tampa, Florida]], [[United States|United States]]. He is married to Mayara Reina and they have two children.
title: Adrian R'Mante

abstract: Zelda Harris (born February 17, 1985) is an [[American|United States]] [[actress|actress]].
title: Zelda Harris

abstract: Sara Maldonado (born Sara Maldonado Fuentes; 10 March 1980) is a Mexican actress.
title: Sara Maldonado

abstract: Jessica Ann Johnson (née Simpson; born July 10, 1980) is an American singer, actress, and fashion designer. Simpson signed a [[recording contract|recording contract]] with [[Columbia Records|Columbia Records]] when she was sixteen, and released her debut studio album [[Sweet Kisses|Sweet Kisses]] in 1999. It sold over four million copies worldwide, and spawned the top three song "[[I Wanna Love You Forever|I Wanna Love You Forever]]" (1999). Hoping to achieve further success with her second album, Simpson adopted a more mature image for the release of [[Irresistible|Irresistible (Jessica Simpson album)]] (2001). The album's [[title track|Irresistible (Jessica Simpson song)]], which served as the lead single, became her second top twenty entry on the [[Billboard Hot 100|Billboard Hot 100]]. The album itself earned a [[gold certification|gold certification]] from the [[Recording Industry Association of America|Recording Industry Association of America]] (RIAA). Simpson married singer [[Nick Lachey|Nick Lachey]] on October 26, 2002 after four years of dating. The couple starred in the reality television series [[Newlyweds: Nick and Jessica|Newlyweds: Nick and Jessica]] (2003–2005) on [[MTV|MTV]], chronicling their marriage and careers. The show became a [[pop culture|popular culture]] phenomenon and made Simpson and her husband household names. The marriage did not last, however, and by November 2005 Simpson and Lachey confirmed they were separating; Simpson filed for divorce the following month citing irreconcilable differences.
title: Jessica Simpson

abstract: Sibi Malayil (born 2 May 1956) is an [[Indian|Cinema of India]] film director who works in [[Malayalam cinema|Malayalam cinema]].
title: Sibi Malayil

abstract: Prabhu Deva (born 3 April 1973) is an Indian [[dance choreographer|Choreography (dance)]], film director, producer and actor, who has worked in [[Tamil|Tamil cinema]], [[Telugu|Telugu cinema]], [[Hindi|Bollywood]], [[Malayalam|Malayalam]] and [[Kannada film|Kannada films]]. In a career spanning 25 years, he has performed and designed a wide range of dancing styles and has garnered two [[National Film Awards|National Film Awards]] for [[Best Choreography|National Film Award for Best Choreography]]. He is often referred to as the Indian Michael Jackson.
title: Prabhu Deva

abstract: Fazira binti Wan Chek (born 9 February 1974), better known by her [[stage name|stage name]] Erra Fazira, is a [[Malaysian|Malaysians]] actress, singer, fashion model, TV Host, film producer, as well as former beauty queen.
title: Erra Fazira

abstract: Muthuraman Radhakrishnan, popularly known as R. Muthuraman (1929–1981) was an Indian film actor who predominantly appeared in [[Tamil language|Tamil language]] films. He was a leading actor during the 1960s and 1970s and was fondly called as Navarasa Thilagam. He had paired with all the leading heroines of his time and acted in over a hundred films. Muthuraman's son [[Karthik|Karthik (actor)]] is also a popular Tamil actor and politician, and his grandson [[Gautham Karthik|Gautham Karthik]] is also an actor who made his debut in [[Kadal|Kadal (2013 film)]] (2013).
title: R. Muthuraman

abstract: Keanna adopted the stage name Keanna Reeves as a feminine version of the Hollywood actor [[Keanu Reeves|Keanu Reeves]].
title: Keanna Reeves

abstract: Leslie Graves's father, Michael Graves, was a theatre actor and introduced her to the entertainment industry when she was about 10. She started her career with a small role in a Broadway play A Cry of Players (1968–1969) written by William Gibson, and then moved to acting for TV series: [[Sesame Street|Sesame Street]] (1969, first 13 episodes), [[The Mary Tyler Moore Show|The Mary Tyler Moore Show]] (1971, in the episode titled "Baby Sit-Com"), [[Here We Go Again|Here We Go Again (TV series)]] (1973), and some uncredited commercials.
title: Leslie Graves

abstract: Carol Gracias, [[India|Indian]] supermodel was born on 28 December 1978 in [[Mumbai|Mumbai]], India to a [[Goan Catholic|Goan Catholic]] family. Carol was brought up in [[Mumbai|Mumbai]].
title: Carol Gracias

abstract: Robert Clark Gregg (born April 2, 1962) is an American actor, director, screenwriter, and voice actor. He is best known for the role of [[Agent Phil Coulson|Phil Coulson]] in the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe|Marvel Cinematic Universe]]. He has appeared in [[Iron Man|Iron Man (2008 film)]] (2008), [[Iron Man 2|Iron Man 2]] (2010), [[Thor|Thor (film)]] (2011), [[The Avengers|The Avengers (2012 film)]] (2012), and the television series [[Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.|Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.]], making him the actor with the longest screen time in the MCU. He will also appear as the character in [[Captain Marvel|Captain Marvel (film)]] (2019). He also voices the character on the animated television series [[Ultimate Spider-Man|Ultimate Spider-Man (TV series)]] and in the video games [[Lego Marvel Super Heroes|Lego Marvel Super Heroes]], [[Lego Marvel Avengers|Lego Marvel Avengers]], and [[Marvel Heroes|Marvel Heroes (video game)]].
title: Clark Gregg

abstract: Jason Clarke (born 17 July 1969) is an Australian film and television actor. Clarke has appeared in many TV series, and is known for playing Tommy Caffee on the television series [[Brotherhood|Brotherhood (2006 TV series)]]. He has also appeared in many films, often as an antagonist. His film roles include [[Zero Dark Thirty|Zero Dark Thirty]] (2012), [[White House Down|White House Down]] (2013), [[Dawn of the Planet of the Apes|Dawn of the Planet of the Apes]] (2014), [[Terminator Genisys|Terminator Genisys]] (2015), [[Everest|Everest (2015 film)]] (2015), [[Mudbound|Mudbound (film)]] (2017), [[Chappaquiddick|Chappaquiddick (film)]] (2017), in which he portrayed [[Ted Kennedy|Ted Kennedy]], and [[First Man|First Man (film)]] (2018), in which he portrayed astronaut [[Ed White|Ed White (astronaut)]].
title: Jason Clarke

abstract: Liz Burch (born 18 October 1954 in [[Hornsby|Hornsby, New South Wales]], Sydney, Australia) is an Australian actress.
title: Liz Burch

abstract: Marion Aye (April 5, 1903 – July 21, 1951) was an [[American|Americans]] [[actress|actress]] of screen and stage who starred in several films during the 1920s, mostly comedies. She is sometimes credited as Maryon Aye.
title: Marion Aye

abstract: In some of his other works, he voiced DJ in the computer animated/motion capture film, [[Monster House|Monster House (film)]], and starred as Raymond Figg in the [[Disney Channel Original Movie|Disney Channel Original Movie]], [[Life Is Ruff|Life Is Ruff]], released in 2005. Musso's [[self-titled debut album|Mitchel Musso (album)]] was released on June 2, 2009 on [[Walt Disney Records|Walt Disney Records]]. The album debuted at number 19 on the [[Billboard 200|Billboard 200]].
title: Mitchel Musso

abstract: So Ji-sub (born November 4, 1977) is a South Korean actor. After making his entertainment debut as a jeans model, he became known for his leading roles in the television series [[I'm Sorry, I Love You|I'm Sorry, I Love You]] (2004), [[Cain and Abel|Cain and Abel (South Korean TV series)]] (2009), [[Phantom|Phantom (TV series)]] (2012), [[Master's Sun|Master's Sun]] (2013) and [[Oh My Venus|Oh My Venus]] (2015–16) as well as the film [[Rough Cut|Rough Cut (2008 film)]] (2008). So has also released several [[hip hop|hip hop (music)]] [[EPs|Extended play]].
title: So Ji-sub

abstract: Moreno Soeprapto (born 14 November 1982 in [[Jakarta|Jakarta]]) is an [[Indonesia|Indonesian]] [[racing|motorsport]] driver and politician. He is the younger brother of [[Ananda Mikola|Ananda Mikola]], another driver.
title: Moreno Soeprapto

abstract: Amar B Choudary (born 4 January 1984), known by his [[stage name|stage name]] Jiiva, is an Indian film actor, producer and philanthropist. He began his career as a child actor in 1991 in films produced by his father [[R. B. Choudary|R. B. Choudary]]. He made his debut as a lead actor in the film [[Aasai Aasaiyai|Aasai Aasaiyai]] (2003) and went on to receive praise for his performance in the film [[Raam|Raam (2005 film)]] (2005). After legendary actor [[Sivaji Ganeshan|Sivaji Ganeshan]], Jiiva is the only [[Tamil|Tamils]] actor who won an international award at the Cyprus international film festival for the film Raam.
title: Jiiva

abstract: Miranda Katherine Hart Dyke (born 14 December 1972), known professionally as Miranda Hart, is an English actress and comedian. Following drama training at the [[Academy of Live and Recorded Arts|Academy of Live and Recorded Arts]], Hart began writing material for the [[Edinburgh Fringe Festival|Edinburgh Fringe Festival]] and making appearances in various British sitcoms including [[Hyperdrive|Hyperdrive (TV series)]] and [[Not Going Out|Not Going Out]].
title: Miranda Hart

abstract: Lisa Olivia Munn (born July 3, 1980) is an American actress and model. She began her professional career in television journalism before becoming an actress. In 2006, Munn starred as Mily Acuna on the series [[Beyond the Break|Beyond the Break]]. She co-hosted [[Attack of the Show!|Attack of the Show!]] from 2006 to 2010 and was a correspondent on [[The Daily Show|The Daily Show]] from 2010 to 2011.
title: Olivia Munn

abstract: Jeff Lumby (born 1955) is a [[Canadian|Canadians]] [[actor|actor]] and [[voice actor|voice actor]]. He is a member of the Lumby family, who created and produced the 1980s Canadian children's television series, [[Size Small|Size Small]], where he appeared as "Tex". Lumby played "Winston Rothschild III", the [[septic tank|septic tank]] and sewer technician character on [[The Red Green Show|The Red Green Show]] and [[Duct Tape Forever|Duct Tape Forever]].
title: Jeff Lumby

abstract: Avtar Kishan Hangal (1 February 1914 – 26 August 2012), popularly known as A. K. Hangal, was an [[India|Indian]] freedom fighter from 1929–1947 and also stage actor from 1936–1965 and later became a [[character actor|character actor]] in [[Hindi language|Hindi language]] films from 1966 to 2005. His most notable roles are as Ram Shastri in [[Aaina|Aaina (1974 film)]] (1977), as the Inder Sen in [[Shaukeen|Shaukeen]], as Bipinlal Pandey in [[Namak Haraam|Namak Haraam]], as Imaam Saa'b in [[Sholay|Sholay]], as Anokhelal in [[Manzil|Manzil]] and the antagonist in [[Prem Bandhan|Prem Bandhan]] and the 16 films he did with [[Rajesh Khanna|Rajesh Khanna]]. He has acted in around 225 Hindi films in a career spanning from 1966 to 2005.
title: A. K. Hangal

abstract: John A. Alonzo, [[ASC|American Society of Cinematographers]] (June 12, 1934 – March 13, 2001) was an [[American|United States]] [[cinematographer|cinematographer]], [[television director|television director]], and [[actor|actor]] known for his incredibly diverse body of work in both [[film|film]] and [[television|television]].
title: John A. Alonzo

abstract: Dichen Lachman (བདེ་ཆེན།) (; born 22 February 1982) is an Australian actress, of Tibetan, Nepalese, German and Australian heritage. She appeared in the soap opera [[Neighbours|Neighbours]] as [[Katya Kinski|Katya Kinski]] and in [[Joss Whedon|Joss Whedon]]'s [[science fiction|science fiction]] [[drama|drama]] television series [[Dollhouse|Dollhouse (TV series)]] as [[Sierra|Sierra (Dollhouse)]]. Lachman portrayed Suren in the American remake of [[Being Human|Being Human (North American TV series)]] as a main character during the show's second season. Lachman starred in [[The 100|The 100 (TV series)]] as Anya Kom Trikru during the first and second season. Lachman has also starred in the 2014 film [[Lust for Love|Lust for Love (2014 film)]] and had a recurring role in [[Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.|Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.]] as Jiaying, [[Skye's|Daisy Johnson]] Inhuman, ageless mother. Lachman currently stars as Reileen Kawahara in [[Netflix|Netflix]]'s [[Altered Carbon|Altered Carbon (TV series)]].
title: Dichen Lachman

abstract: Keith Andes (born John Charles Andes, July 12, 1920 – November 11, 2005) was an American film, radio, musical theater, stage and television actor.
title: Keith Andes

abstract: Timothy Farrell (June 26, 1922 – May 9, 1989) was an American film actor, best known for his roles in the [[Ed Wood|Ed Wood]] films such as [[Jail Bait|Jail Bait (1954 film)]], [[The Violent Years|The Violent Years]] and [[Glen or Glenda|Glen or Glenda]]. He also was the County Marshal of Los Angeles, California.
title: Timothy Farrell

abstract: Malcolm Tierney (25 February 1938 – 18 February 2014) was an English actor who appeared in many film and television roles.
title: Malcolm Tierney

abstract: William Todd Field (born February 24, 1964) is an American actor and three-time [[Academy Award|Academy Award]] nominated filmmaker.
title: Todd Field

abstract: George O. Gore II (born December 15, 1982) is an [[American|United States]] [[actor|actor]]. He is best known for portraying Michael Kyle, Jr. ("Big Head Junior") on the [[ABC|American Broadcasting Company]] [[sitcom|Situation comedy]] [[My Wife and Kids|My Wife and Kids]], Gore's television credits include guest roles on [[Law & Order|Law & Order]] and [[Touched by an Angel|Touched by an Angel]]. He was also a main character in the cast of the comedy [[Second Generation Wayans|Second Generation Wayans]].
title: George O. Gore II

abstract: Karel Zeman (3 November 1910 – 5 April 1989) was a Czech [[film director|film director]], [[artist|artist]], [[production designer|production designer]] and [[animator|animator]], best known for directing fantasy films combining [[live-action|live-action]] footage with [[animation|animation]]. Because of his creative use of special effects and animation in his films, he has often been called the "Czech [[Méliès|Georges Méliès]]."
title: Karel Zeman

abstract: Pamela Susan Shoop (born June 7, 1948) is an American [[character actress|Character actor]] in films and on television. She often appeared on television series created by [[Glen A. Larson|Glen A. Larson]].
title: Pamela Susan Shoop

abstract: Abelardo Dennis Florencio Ho (born 12 May 1981), more widely known as Dennis Trillo, is a [[Filipino|Filipino people]] actor, model and recording artist. Trillo is currently a contract star of [[GMA Network|GMA Network]]. He was known for his role as Eric del Mundo in the first ever gay-themed series on Philippine TV, [[My Husband's Lover|My Husband's Lover]] aired on GMA Network in 2013.

abstract: Peter Billingsley (born April 16, 1971), also known as Peter Michaelsen and Peter Billingsley-Michaelsen, is an American actor, director, and producer, best known for his role as Ralphie in the 1983 movie [[A Christmas Story|A Christmas Story]] and as "Messy Marvin" in the Hershey's Chocolate Syrup commercials during the 1970s. He began his career as an infant in television commercials.
title: Peter Billingsley

abstract: Neelima Azeem (born 2 December 1958) is an Indian TV actress . Azeem is the mother of actors [[Shahid Kapoor|Shahid Kapoor]] and [[Ishaan Khatter|Ishaan Khatter]].
title: Neelima Azeem

abstract: Leila Hatami ( Leylā Hātamī; born October 1, 1972) is an [[Iranian|Iranian peoples]] actress and director. She is known for her work in [[Iranian cinema|Cinema of Iran]], including her performance in the [[Academy Award|Academy Awards]]-winning film [[A Separation|A Separation]], for which she won the [[Silver Bear Award for Best Actress|Berlin Film Festival Award for Best Actress]] at the [[Berlin Film Festival|Berlin Film Festival]].
title: Leila Hatami

abstract: Tony Curran (born 1969) is a [[Scottish|Scotland]] actor who has appeared in [[Underworld: Evolution|Underworld: Evolution]], [[Doctor Who|Doctor Who]], [[Roots|Roots (2016 miniseries)]] and the Netflix historical epic [[Outlaw King|Outlaw King]].
title: Tony Curran

abstract: Megalyn Echikunwoke ( ; born May 28, 1983) is an American [[actress|actress]]. She has appeared on television as [[Tara Price|Tara Price]] in [[CSI: Miami|CSI: Miami]], [[Isabelle Tyler|Isabelle Tyler]] in [[The 4400|The 4400]] and as [[Mari McCabe / Vixen|Vixen (comics)]] in the [[Arrowverse|Arrowverse]].

abstract: Patrick Bristow (born September 26, 1962) is an [[American|United States]] actor and comedian.
title: Patrick Bristow

abstract: Andrew McKaige (born, 1959) is an [[Australian|Australian]] actor, most prominent in television soap opera. As well as acting, McKaige is also a voice-artist and singer-songwriter, having played with the country rock band, The Fine Line. In 1994, he won second place for Best Song in the Country Category of the Australian Songwriter's Association.
title: Andrew McKaige

abstract: Kathryn Hahn (born July 23, 1973) is an American actress, fashion model and comedian. She began her career on television, playing Lily Lebowski in the NBC crime drama series [[Crossing Jordan|Crossing Jordan]] (2001–07). Hahn went on to appear as a supporting actress in a number of major comedy films, including roles in the films [[How to Lose a Guy in 10 Days|How to Lose a Guy in 10 Days]] (2003), [[Anchorman: The Legend of Ron Burgundy|Anchorman: The Legend of Ron Burgundy]] (2004), [[Step Brothers|Step Brothers (film)]] (2008), [[Our Idiot Brother|Our Idiot Brother]] (2011), [[We're the Millers|We're the Millers]] (2013), and [[The Secret Life of Walter Mitty|The Secret Life of Walter Mitty (2013 film)]] (2013).

abstract: Marc Guggenheim was born and raised to a [[Jewish|American Jews]] family on [[Long Island|Long Island]], New York. He attended the [[University at Albany, State University of New York|University at Albany, SUNY]]. His brothers are screenwriters [[Eric Guggenheim|Eric Guggenheim]] and [[David Guggenheim|David Guggenheim]].
title: Marc Guggenheim

abstract: John H. Young (born 1934, Liverpool), known professionally as Jeremy Young, is an English actor of Scottish descent.
title: Jeremy Young

abstract: Prabhas made his film debut with the 2002 drama film [[Eeswar|Eeswar (2002 film)]]. He has won the [[Nandi Award for Best Actor|Nandi Award for Best Actor]], for his role in [[Mirchi|Mirchi (film)]]. abstract: Candan Erçetin (; born 10 February 1963) is a [[Turkish|Turkish people]] singer-songwriter. Over the twenty years of her singing career, she has been recognized for preparing and singing songs about human life. Despite the fact that she made her albums without much publicity, she was still appreciated for her efforts and her work influenced other artists. She was praised for not bringing her private life into the spotlight, and for holding her music on the front. Erçetin has released many music videos with different themes. As her family originate from the Balkans, she has often used elements of [[Balkan music|Balkan music]] in her songs and works, and in addition to Turkish, she has made songs in French and Greek as well.
title: Candan Erçetin

abstract: Bhupen Hazarika (8 September 1926 - 5 November 2011) was an Indian playback singer, lyricist, musician, singer, poet and film-maker from [[Assam|Assam]], widely known as Sudhakantha. His songs, written and sung mainly in the [[Assamese language|Assamese language]] by himself, are marked by humanity and universal brotherhood and have been translated and sung in many languages, most notably in [[Bengali|Bengali language]] and [[Hindi|Hindi]]. His songs, based on the themes of communal amity, universal justice and empathy, have become popular among the people of Assam, besides [[West Bengal|West Bengal]] and Bangladesh. He is also acknowledged to have introduced the culture and folk music of Assam and [[Northeast India|Northeast India]] to Hindi cinema at the national level. He received the [[National Film Award for Best Music Direction|National Film Award for Best Music Direction]] in 1975. Recipient of [[Sangeet Natak Akademi Award|Sangeet Natak Akademi Award]] (1987), [[Padmashri|Padmashri]] (1977), and [[Padmabhushan|Padmabhushan]] (2001), Hazarika was awarded with [[Dada Saheb Phalke Award|Dada Saheb Phalke Award]] (1992), India's highest award in cinema, by the Government of India and [[Sangeet Natak Akademi Fellowship|List of Sangeet Natak Akademi fellows]] (2008), the highest award of the [[Sangeet Natak Akademi|Sangeet Natak Akademi]], India's [[The National Academy for Music, Dance and Drama|The National Academy for Music, Dance and Drama]]. He was posthumously awarded the [[Padma Vibhushan|Padma Vibhushan]], India's second-highest civilian award, in 2012. Hazarika also held the position of the Chairman of the [[Sangeet Natak Akademi|Sangeet Natak Akademi]] from December 1998 to December 2003.
title: Bhupen Hazarika

abstract: Alison Newman was born in [[Bournemouth|Bournemouth]], Hampshire (now [[Dorset|Dorset]]) to David and Jenny Newman. She has one sister called Sarah. Both her parents were school teachers who encouraged her to take up acting as a hobby, but discouraged her from attending stage school when she was younger, a decision she subsequently agreed was probably sensible. Instead she joined the [[National Youth Theatre|National Youth Theatre]] when she was 16. Her father died in October 2002, while she was filming the second series of [[Footballers' Wives|Footballers' Wives]]. The producers allowed her to take time off from filming some of her last scenes in the series finale so she could be with her family.
title: Alison Newman

abstract: Victor Webster was born in [[Calgary|Calgary]], [[Alberta|Alberta]], the son of Roswitha, a hair stylist, and John ("Jack") Webster, a police officer. As a teenager, his behavior often got him into trouble. To find a more productive outlet, he started studying [[martial arts|martial arts]] and eventually became a teacher of this, earning an undefeated record as an amateur [[kickboxer|Kickboxing]] and a heavyweight [[black belt|Black belt (martial arts)]]. Meanwhile, his early interest in acting was demonstrated in his involvement with numerous school plays and [[theater|theater]] classes.
title: Victor Webster

abstract: Darío Grandinetti was born in the city of [[Rosario, Santa Fe|Rosario, Santa Fe]], [[Argentina|Argentina]]. In Rosario he played in the inferior teams of [[Newells Old Boys|Newells Old Boys]] football club. He began to work in the Junta Nacional de Granos as auxiliary and began studying theater. abstract: Anika Noni Rose (born September 6, 1972) is an American actress and singer known for her [[Tony Award|Tony Award]]-winning performance in the [[Broadway|Broadway theatre]] production of [[Caroline, or Change|Caroline, or Change]] and her starring role as Lorrell Robinson in the 2006 film [[Dreamgirls|Dreamgirls (film)]]. She also voiced [[Tiana|Tiana (Disney)]], Disney's first African-American princess in [[Walt Disney Pictures|Walt Disney Pictures]]' 2009 animated film [[The Princess and the Frog|The Princess and the Frog]]. In 2014, Rose played the role of Beneatha Younger in the Broadway revival of [[A Raisin in the Sun|A Raisin in the Sun]], for which she was nominated for the [[Tony Award for Best Featured Actress in a Play|Tony Award for Best Featured Actress in a Play]]. She was named a [[Disney Legend|Disney Legends]] in 2011.

abstract: Luiz Fernando Carvalho (born July 28, 1960 in [[Rio de Janeiro|Rio de Janeiro]]) is a [[Brazil|Brazilian]] filmmaker and television director, known for works closely linked to literature that constitute a renovation in Brazilian audiovisual aesthetics. abstract: Olivia Barash (born January 11, 1965) is an American actress. She also had a lead role in the [[Walt Disney|The Walt Disney Company]] television film [[Child of Glass|Child of Glass]] (1978).
