abstract: Barbara Crampton (born December 27, 1958) is an American actress. She made her screen debut on the daytime drama [[Days of Our Lives|Days of Our Lives]] (1983), and her film debut in 1984's [[Body Double|Body Double]] before starring in the horror comedy [[Re-Animator|Re-Animator]] (1985). Crampton has since starred in a variety of films including [[Chopping Mall|Chopping Mall]] (1986), [[From Beyond|From Beyond (film)]] (1986), [[Castle Freak|Castle Freak]] (1995), [[You're Next|You're Next]] (2011), [[We Are Still Here|We Are Still Here]] (2015), and [[Little Sister|Little Sister (2016 film)]] (2016). She is also known for playing [[Leanna Love|Leanna Love]] on the television series [[The Young and the Restless|The Young and the Restless]] (1987–93; 1998–2002; 2006–07) for which she was nominated for a [[Soap Opera Digest Award for Outstanding Villainess in a Drama Series – Daytime|Soap Opera Digest Award for Outstanding Villainess in a Drama Series – Daytime]] in 1990.
title: Barbara Crampton

abstract: Adriana Fonseca (; born Adriana Fonseca Castellanos March 16, 1977) is a [[Mexican|Mexico]] [[actress|actress]] and dancer. She is best known for her several roles in [[Televisa|Televisa]]'s telenovelas like [[La usurpadora|La usurpadora]] as Veronica Soriano (1998), [[Rosalinda|Rosalinda (telenovela)]] as Lucy Pérez Romero (1999), [[Mariana de la Noche|Mariana de la Noche]] as Caridad "Chachi" Montenegro (2003), [[Contra viento y marea|Contra viento y marea]] as Sandra Serrano Rudell (2005), [[Bajo las riendas del amor|Bajo las riendas del amor]] as Montserrat Linares (2007) and recently for her role as the protagonist in [[Telemundo|Telemundo]]'s successful telenovela [[Corazón Valiente|Corazón Valiente]] as Angela Valdez (2012).
title: Adriana Fonseca

abstract: Heather Menzies-Urich (born Heather Margaret Brotherston Menzies; December 3, 1949   – December 24, 2017) was a Canadian-American model and actress, known for her roles as [[Louisa von Trapp|Maria Franziska von Trapp]] in the 1965 film [[The Sound of Music|The Sound of Music (film)]] and Jessica 6 in the TV series [[Logan's Run|Logan's Run (TV series)]].
title: Heather Menzies

abstract: In 1998, Chris Eyre worked on two film projects. His first release was [[Things We Do|Things We Do (film)]] (1998). His debut film, [[Smoke Signals|Smoke Signals (film)]] (1998), won the [[Sundance Film Festival|Sundance Film Festival]] Filmmakers Trophy and the Audience Award. It also won "Best Film" honors at the 1998 [[American Indian Film Festival|American Indian Film Festival]].
title: Chris Eyre

abstract: Colin Higgins (28 July 1941 – 5 August 1988) was an Australian-American screenwriter, actor, director, and producer. He was best known for writing the screenplay for the 1971 film [[Harold and Maude|Harold and Maude]], and for directing the films [[Foul Play|Foul Play (1978 film)]] (1978) and [[9 to 5|9 to 5 (film)]] (1980).
title: Colin Higgins

abstract: Michèle Mercier (born 1 January 1939 as Jocelyne Yvonne Renée Mercier) is a French actress. In the course of her career she has worked with leading directors like [[François Truffaut|François Truffaut]], [[Jean-Pierre Melville|Jean-Pierre Melville]], [[Jacques Deray|Jacques Deray]], [[Dino Risi|Dino Risi]], [[Mario Monicelli|Mario Monicelli]], [[Mario Bava|Mario Bava]], [[Peter Collinson|Peter Collinson (film director)]] and [[Ken Annakin|Ken Annakin]]. Her leading men have included [[Marcello Mastroianni|Marcello Mastroianni]], [[Vittorio Gassman|Vittorio Gassman]], [[Jean-Paul Belmondo|Jean-Paul Belmondo]], [[Jean Gabin|Jean Gabin]], [[Charles Aznavour|Charles Aznavour]], [[Robert Hossein|Robert Hossein]], [[Charles Bronson|Charles Bronson]], [[Tony Curtis|Tony Curtis]] and [[Charlton Heston|Charlton Heston]]. She has appeared in over fifty films, and is best known for her starring role in [[Angelique, Marquise des Anges|Angélique, Marquise des Anges]].
title: Michèle Mercier

abstract: Park Eun-hye (born February 21, 1978) is a South Korean actress. She is best known for starring in [[Dae Jang Geum|Dae Jang Geum]], which led to her popularity in China. She also played the lead role in the Taiwanese drama, [[Silence|Silence (TV series)]], starring [[Vic Zhou|Vic Zhou]], and directed by Zhang Zhong.
title: Park Eun-hye

abstract: Anny Duperey (born Annie Legras; 28 June 1947 in [[Rouen|Rouen]], [[Seine-Maritime|Seine-Maritime]], France) is a French [[stage|Stage (theatre)]], film and television actress and best-selling author. She is a Chevalier of the [[Légion d'honneur|Légion d'honneur]].
title: Anny Duperey

abstract: Julián Rebolledo (born 1972), also known as Julian Dean, is an American [[actor|actor]] and [[voice talent|voice talent]], best known for his role as the voice of the neurotic father [[Jake Morgendorffer|Jake Morgendorffer]] on the MTV animated series [[Daria|Daria]] and as Raul Passos in the 2012 video game, [[Max Payne 3|Max Payne 3]].
title: Julián Rebolledo

abstract: Suhasini Maniratnam (born 15 August 1961) known commonly as Suhasini, is an Indian actress known for her works in [[Telugu|Telugu language]], [[Tamil|Tamil language]], [[Malayalam|Malayalam]] and [[Kannada|Kannada]] films. She made her film debut in 1980 with the [[Tamil|Tamil language]] film [[Nenjathai Killathe|Nenjathai Killathe]], for which she won the [[Tamil Nadu State Film Award for Best Actress|Tamil Nadu State Film Award for Best Actress]]. Suhasini won the [[National Film Award for Best Actress|National Film Award for Best Actress]] for [[Sindhu Bhairavi|Sindhu Bhairavi (film)]] in 1986. Suhasini is considered as one of the greatest actresses in South Indian Cinema.
title: Suhasini Maniratnam

abstract: Zoya Akhtar (born 14 October 1972) is an Indian film director and screenwriter. After completing a diploma in filmmaking from NYU, she assisted directors such as [[Mira Nair|Mira Nair]], [[Tony Gerber|Tony Gerber]] and [[Dev Benegal|Dev Benegal]], before turning writer-director in her own right.
title: Zoya Akhtar

abstract: Gabriel Soto Díaz (born April 17, 1975) is a [[Mexican|Mexico]] [[actor|actor]] and [[model|model (person)]]. He won the national male pageant [[El Modelo Mexico|El Modelo Mexico]], and placed first runner-up in [[Mister World|Mister World]] 1996. He was also a member of the former Mexican [[boy band|boy band]] [[Kairo|Kairo (band)]], and acts in [[telenovelas|telenovelas]].
title: Gabriel Soto

abstract: Jamie Rose (born November 26, 1959) is an American actress who played Vickie Gioberti on the prime time 1980s [[soap opera|soap opera]] [[Falcon Crest|Falcon Crest]]. Rose played the role from 1981 to 1983, leaving at the beginning of the series' third season. The role was subsequently recast some years later with Dana Sparks.
title: Jamie Rose

abstract: Wendy Phillips (born January 2, 1952) is an American actress, noted for playing [[David Selby|David Selby]]'s character's last wife, [[Lauren Daniels|Lauren Daniels]], during the final season of [[Falcon Crest|Falcon Crest]] and for playing [[Gerald McRaney|Gerald McRaney]]'s wife, Claire Greene, on both [[Touched by an Angel|Touched by an Angel]] and [[Promised Land|Promised Land (TV series)]]. Other television series in which she has been a featured player have included [[A Year in the Life|A Year in the Life]], [[The Robert Guillaume Show|The Robert Guillaume Show]], [[Homefront|Homefront (American TV show)]] and [[Studio 60 on the Sunset Strip|Studio 60 on the Sunset Strip]]. Among her film works, there is a role in [[Airplane II: The Sequel|Airplane II: The Sequel]] and also on [[Bugsy|Bugsy]].
title: Wendy Phillips

abstract: Richard Epcar is an American [[actor|actor]], director, and writer who voices in a number of English-language localizations of [[Japanese animation|Anime]], cartoons, and video games. Some of his major roles include [[Raiden|Raiden (Mortal Kombat)]] in [[Mortal Kombat|Mortal Kombat]] franchise, the [[Joker|Joker (comics)]] in [[Injustice: Gods Among Us|Injustice: Gods Among Us]], [[Zangetsu|List of Bleach characters#Zangetsu]] in [[Bleach|Bleach (anime)]], [[Bobobo-bo Bo-bobo|Bobobo-bo Bo-bobo (character)]] in [[Bobobo-bo Bo-bobo|Bobobo-bo Bo-bobo]], [[Etemon|Etemon]] and Myotismon in [[Digimon|Digimon]], Batou in [[Ghost in the Shell|Ghost in the Shell]], Ansem in [[Kingdom Hearts|Kingdom Hearts]], Joseph Joestar in [[JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Stardust Crusaders|JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Stardust Crusaders]] and [[JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Diamond is Unbreakable|JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Diamond is Unbreakable]], Black Ghost/Skull in [[Cyborg 009|Cyborg 009]], [[Akuma|Akuma (Street Fighter)]] in [[Street Fighter V|Street Fighter V]], and [[Daisuke Jigen|Daisuke Jigen]] in [[Lupin the Third|Lupin the Third]]. He and fellow voice actress [[Ellyn Stern|Ellyn Stern]] own and operate Epcar Entertainment, a voiceover production service company based in [[Los Angeles|Los Angeles]]. On September 28, 2011, Epcar appeared on the [[podcast|podcast]] Disasterpiece Theatre to discuss his ideas for a live-action version of [[Ghost in the Shell|Ghost in the Shell]].
title: Richard Epcar

abstract: Alfonso Brescia (6 January 1930 – 6 June 2001) was an Italian [[film director|film director]]. Brescia began working in film against his fathers wishes, and eventually directed his first film Revolt of the Praetorians. Brescia worked in several genres in the Italian film industry, including five science fiction films following the release of Star Wars. Brescia work slowed down towards the late 1980s, and directed his last film Club Vacanze which could not get distribution.
title: Alfonso Brescia

abstract: Edurne García Almagro (; born 22 December 1985) is a [[Spanish|Spain]] singer, actress, and TV presenter. She rose to fame in late 2005 when she took part in the [[Spanish|Spain]] casting show [[Operación Triunfo|Operación Triunfo (Spain)]] on [[Telecinco|Telecinco]] and finished in sixth place in 2006. She represented [[Spain|Spain in the Eurovision Song Contest]] in the [[Eurovision Song Contest 2015|Eurovision Song Contest 2015]] with the song "[[Amanecer|Amanecer (song)]]" where she finished in 21st place.
title: Edurne

abstract: Paul Nicholas (born Paul Oscar Beuselinck; 3 December 1944) is an English actor and singer. He started out with a [[pop|pop music]] career, but soon changed to musical theatre. Later, in the 1970s, he returned to the pop charts, and he began an acting career – starring in the 1983 [[BBC|BBC]] sitcom [[Just Good Friends|Just Good Friends]], for which he is best known. The show won a [[BAFTA|BAFTA]] and Nicholas was also nominated for best comedy performance. After the show ended, he returned to musical theatre and various other entertainment roles, including producing and directing.
title: Paul Nicholas

abstract: Vincenzo Colosimo (born 11 November 1966) known professionally as Vince Colosimo is an Australian [[AFI Award|AACTA Awards]] winning stage, television and screen actor. He has worked in both Australia and the United States. He is of [[Italian|Italians]] descent and currently resides in the United States of America.
title: Vince Colosimo

abstract: Michael Cudlitz (born December 29, 1964) is an American actor, known for portraying [[John Cooper|John Cooper (Southland)]] on the [[TNT|TNT (U.S. TV network)]] [[drama|drama]] series [[Southland|Southland (TV series)]] for which he won the [[Critics' Choice Television Award for Best Supporting Actor in a Drama Series|Critics' Choice Television Award for Best Supporting Actor in a Drama Series]] in 2013, Sergeant Denver "Bull" Randleman on the [[HBO|HBO]] miniseries [[Band of Brothers|Band of Brothers (miniseries)]], and Sergeant [[Abraham Ford|Abraham Ford]] on the [[AMC|AMC (TV channel)]] horror series [[The Walking Dead|The Walking Dead (TV series)]].
title: Michael Cudlitz

abstract: Melissa Sagemiller (born June 1, 1974) is an American television and film actress. She is known for her performances in films [[Get Over It|Get Over It (film)]] (2001), [[Soul Survivors|Soul Survivors]] (2001), [[Sorority Boys|Sorority Boys]] (2002), [[The Clearing|The Clearing (film)]] (2004), [[The Guardian|The Guardian (2006 film)]] (2006) and [[Mr. Woodcock|Mr. Woodcock]] (2007). Sagemiller also starred in television dramas [[Sleeper Cell|Sleeper Cell (TV series)]] (2005–06), and [[Raising the Bar|Raising the Bar (2008 TV series)]] (2008–09), and from 2010 to 2011 had the recurring role as A.D.A. Gillian Hardwicke in the [[Law & Order: Special Victims Unit|Law & Order: Special Victims Unit]].
title: Melissa Sagemiller

abstract: Karina Smirnoff (; January 2, 1978) is an American professional [[ballroom dancer|ballroom dancer]] of [[Russian|Russians]] and [[Greek|Greeks]] origins. She is known as a professional dancer on [[Dancing with the Stars|Dancing with the Stars (U.S. TV series)]], winning the [[thirteenth season|Dancing with the Stars (U.S. season 13)]] with army veteran and soap opera star [[J. R. Martinez|J. R. Martinez]]. She's also won two runner-up titles, a semifinal title, and several quarterfinal titles.
title: Karina Smirnoff

abstract: Indraneil Sengupta is an Indian film and television actor, and a model living in Kolkata since 2004.
title: Indraneil Sengupta

abstract: Jennifer Decker (born 28 December 1982) is a French actress. She is best known for the role of Lucienne in the 2006 American film [[Flyboys|Flyboys (film)]].
title: Jennifer Decker

abstract: Sonam Kapoor Ahuja (; born 9 June 1985) is an Indian actress who appears in [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] films. Kapoor is one of the highest-paid actresses in the industry and is the recipient of several awards, including a [[Filmfare|Filmfare Awards]] and a [[National Film Award|National Film Awards]].
title: Sonam Kapoor

abstract: Dana Davis (born October 4, 1978) is an [[American|Americans]] [[actress|actress]], known for playing [[Monica Dawson|Monica Dawson]] on the [[NBC|NBC]] series [[Heroes|Heroes (U.S. TV series)]] (2007), Chastity Church on the [[ABC Family|ABC Family]] television series [[10 Things I Hate About You|10 Things I Hate About You (TV series)]] (2009–10) and Carmen Phillips on the [[TNT|TNT (U.S. TV network)]] series [[Franklin & Bash|Franklin & Bash]] (2011-2013).
title: Dana Davis

abstract: Paolo Sorrentino (; born 31 May 1970) is an [[Italian|Italy]] film director and screenwriter.
title: Paolo Sorrentino

abstract: Kim Jung-eun (born March 4, 1976) is a South Korean actress best known for her roles in the film [[Marrying the Mafia|Marrying the Mafia]] (2002) and the television series [[Lovers in Paris|Lovers in Paris]] (2004), [[I Am Legend|I Am Legend (TV series)]] (2010) and [[Make a Woman Cry|Make a Woman Cry]]. In 2008, Kim hosted her own music talk show [[Kim Jung-eun's Chocolate|Kim Jung-eun's Chocolate]] on [[SBS|Seoul Broadcasting System]].
title: Kim Jung-eun

abstract: Hayes MacArthur (born April 16, 1977) is an American stand-up [[comedian|comedian]], [[actor|actor]] and [[writer|writer]]. He starred in the [[TBS|TBS (U.S. TV channel)]] comedy series [[Angie Tribeca|Angie Tribeca]].
title: Hayes MacArthur

abstract: Vijay Arora (27 December 1946   – 2 February 2007) was an Indian actor in [[Hindi|Hindi]] films and television serials, most famous for his roles in [[Yaadon Ki Baaraat|Yaadon Ki Baaraat]] and as [[Indrajit|Indrajit]] in the television serial [[Ramayan|Ramayan (TV series)]].
title: Vijay Arora

abstract: Vidya Malvade is an Indian actress, mainly working in the [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] film industry.
title: Vidya Malvade

abstract: Joanne Campbell (8 February 1964 – 20 December 2002) was a British actress and drama therapist best known for playing Liz in the 1980s sitcom [[Me and My Girl|Me and My Girl (TV series)]] and [[Josephine Baker|Josephine Baker]] on stage in This Is My Dream.
title: Joanne Campbell

abstract: Elizabeth Sabina Franklyn (born 15 September 1954) is an English actress, and the daughter of [[William Franklyn|William Franklyn]] and [[Margo Johns|Margo Johns]].
title: Sabina Franklyn

abstract: Prosenjit Chatterjee (born 30 September 1962) is an Indian film actor and producer who works predominantly in [[Bengali|Cinema of West Bengal]] and [[Hindi cinema|Hindi cinema]]. The son of [[actor|actor]] [[Biswajit Chatterjee|Biswajit Chatterjee]], he is a well-known actor himself. He began his acting career as a child actor in [[Hrishikesh Mukherjee|Hrishikesh Mukherjee]]'s [[Chotto Jigyasa|Chotto Jigyasa]], for which he won the [[Bengal Film Journalists' Association – Most Outstanding Work of the Year Award|Bengal Film Journalists' Association – Most Outstanding Work of the Year Award]]. Following this he had appeared in some other films as a [[child actor|child actor]]. Prosenjit's first leading role came through [[Bimal Roy|Bimal Roy]]'s [[Duti Pata|Duti Pata]], which couldn't take off his career.
title: Prosenjit Chatterjee

abstract: Srividya, also known as Sreevidya, was an Indian [[film actress|film actress]] who appeared in films in the [[Malayalam|Malayalam]], [[Tamil|Tamil language]], [[Telugu|Telugu language]], [[Kannada|Kannada]] and [[Hindi|Hindi]] film industries for 40 years. In the latter part of her career, she concentrated on [[Malayalam films|Malayalam films]]. Her portrayals as a mother in many films were highly acclaimed. In addition to acting, she occasionally worked as a [[playback singer|playback singer]] as well. Srividya's personal life was full of tragedies. In 2006, she died of [[spine cancer|spine cancer]], aged 53.
title: Srividya

abstract: Sarah Gadon (born April 4, 1987) is a Canadian actress. She first gained recognition for her performances in [[David Cronenberg|David Cronenberg]]'s films [[A Dangerous Method|A Dangerous Method]] (2011) and [[Cosmopolis|Cosmopolis (film)]] (2012). She has guest starred in a number of television series, including [[Are You Afraid of the Dark?|Are You Afraid of the Dark?]] (1999), [[In a Heartbeat|In a Heartbeat (TV series)]] (2000), [[Mutant X|Mutant X (TV series)]] (2002), and [[Dark Oracle|Dark Oracle]] (2004). She has also worked as a [[voice actress|Voice acting]] on various productions.
title: Sarah Gadon

abstract: Charles de Lauzirika (born August 17, 1967 in [[Los Angeles, California|Los Angeles, California]]) is an American DVD and Blu-ray producer and filmmaker.
title: Charles de Lauzirika

abstract: Han Hyo-joo was born in [[Cheongju|Cheongju]], [[North Chungcheong Province|North Chungcheong Province]]. Her mother was an elementary school teacher before becoming an inspector for public schools, and her father was an air force officer. As a child, she was good in sports, particularly [[track and field|track and field]]. In her sophomore year of high school, she moved to [[Seoul|Seoul]] and attended Bulgok High School, despite the objections of her strict and conservative father. She then entered [[Dongguk University|Dongguk University]], where she joined the theater and film department.
title: Han Hyo-joo

abstract: Richard Speight Jr. (born September 4, 1970) is an American actor, director, screenwriter and producer who is known for a variety of roles including [[CBS|CBS]] TV series [[Jericho|Jericho (2006 TV series)]], [[The Agency|The Agency (2001 TV series)]], and the [[HBO|HBO]] miniseries [[Band of Brothers|Band of Brothers (miniseries)]]. Speight plays a recurring role, the Archangel [[Gabriel|Gabriel]], originally thought to be a "Trickster" or [[Loki|Loki]], in the [[WB|The WB]]/[[CW|The CW]] series [[Supernatural|Supernatural (U.S. TV series)]].
title: Richard Speight Jr.

abstract: Jeon Hye-bin (; ; born September 27, 1983), also known as BIN, is a South Korean actress, singer and model. In 2002, she began her career as singer of the short-lived three members girl group [[LUV|LUV (South Korean band)]], however the group disbanded the following year due to individual goals.
title: Jeon Hye-bin

abstract: Kristopher Turner (born September 27, 1980) is a Canadian actor. He is best known for his role as Dr. Gavin Murphy on the medical drama series [[Saving Hope|Saving Hope]], and as Jamie Andrews on the [[CTV|CTV Television Network]] teen drama [[Instant Star|Instant Star]].
title: Kristopher Turner

abstract: Mukesh Rishi is an Indian film actor who worked primarily in [[Hindi|Bollywood]] films and since then primarily in [[Telugu|Cinema of Andhra Pradesh]] cinema. He has also appeared in [[Malayalam|Malayalam]], [[Punjabi|Punjabi language]] and [[Tamil|Tamil cinema]] films. He got his first break in Hindi in 1988 and has since, established himself as a leading character actor. Although he started his career in films as a villain, he has diversified into positive roles. He joins a list of non-Telugu speaking actors, such as [[Amrish Puri|Amrish Puri]], [[Puneet Issar|Puneet Issar]], [[Sharat Saxena|Sharat Saxena]], and [[Pradeep Rawat|Pradeep Rawat (actor)]], who have played the role of the villain in Telugu movies.
title: Mukesh Rishi

abstract: Sean Curley (born 1995) is an [[American|United States]] actor. He is the singing voice of Pablo on [[The Backyardigans|The Backyardigans]] and Spencer on Whoopi's Littleburg. He also played Josh Learner in [[Reservation Road|Reservation Road]]. On [[Broadway|Broadway theatre]], he has been in [[Fiddler on the Roof|Fiddler on the Roof]] and [[Beauty and the Beast|Beauty and the Beast (musical)]]. He is also a member of [[The Broadway Kids|The Broadway Kids]] and the Nautical Stars Theater Company.
title: Sean Curley

abstract: [[Hiro Suzuhira|Hiro Suzuhira]] and Aoi Nishimata have known each other from high school; their first work, Ritual, was introduced in 1996. In 2003, she joined [[Navel|Navel (company)]] along with Hiro Suzuhira, illustrating [[Shuffle!|Shuffle!]]. She then went on to make [[Really? Really!|Really? Really!]] and [[We Without Wings|We Without Wings]] (Oretachi ni Tsubasa wa Nai).
title: Aoi Nishimata

abstract: Frank John Hughes (born November 11, 1967) is an [[American|United States]] [[film|film]] and [[television|television]] [[actor|actor]], and [[screenwriter|screenwriter]]. Hughes is best known for his portrayals of [["Wild Bill" Guarnere|William Guarnere]] in the [[HBO|HBO]] miniseries [[Band of Brothers|Band of Brothers (miniseries)]], Tom Fox in [[Catch Me If You Can|Catch Me If You Can]], [[Tim Woods|List of minor characters in 24#Tim Woods]] in [[24|24 (TV series)]], and [[Walden Belfiore|Walden Belfiore#Walden Belfiore]] in [[The Sopranos|The Sopranos]].
title: Frank John Hughes

abstract: Juliana Kanyomozi, popularly known by the mononym Juliana, is a multiple award-winning Ugandan pop musician, actress, and entertainer.
title: Juliana Kanyomozi

abstract: Sunkrish Bala ([[Tamil|Tamil language]]: சுன்க்ரிஷ் பாலசுப்ரமணியன்; born Sunkrish Balasubramanian on May 21, 1984) is an [[American|United States]] [[actor|actor]] best known for his role as Dr. Caleb Subramanian on [[The Walking Dead|The Walking Dead (TV series)]].
title: Sunkrish Bala

abstract: Nagathihalli Chandrashekhar is an Indian director, actor, screenwriter and a lyricist who predominantly works in [[Kannada Cinema|Kannada film industry]]. He made his film debut as a screenplay writer in Kadina Benki (1986) which won the [[National Film Award for Best Feature Film|National Film Award for Best Feature Film]] and the [[Karnataka State Award|Karnataka State Film Awards]]. His directorial debut was [[Undu Hoda Kondu Hoda|Undu Hoda Kondu Hoda]] (1991) for which he won the [[Karnataka State Film Award for Best Story|Karnataka State Film Award for Best Story]].
title: Nagathihalli Chandrashekhar

abstract: Ashish Vidyarthi (born 19 June 1962) is an Indian film actor and [[motivational speaker|motivational speaker]], known for his work in 11 different languages, predominantly in [[Hindi|Hindi]], [[Tamil|Tamil language]], [[Kannada|Kannada]], [[Malayalam|Malayalam]], [[Telugu|Telugu language]], [[Bengali|Bengali language]], [[English|English language]], [[Odia|Odia language]] and [[Marathi|Marathi language]] cinema. He is noted for his antagonist and character roles. He also acted in TV serial Ham Panchi Ek Chal Ke. In 1995, he received the [[National Film Award for Best Supporting Actor|National Film Award for Best Supporting Actor]] for [[Drohkaal|Drohkaal]].
title: Ashish Vidyarthi

abstract: Jaya Ahsan is a Bangladeshi actress, model and producer. She works in [[Bangladeshi|Cinema of Bangladesh]] and [[Indian Bengali|Cinema of West Bengal]] films. She won [[Bangladesh National Film Award for Best Actress|Bangladesh National Film Award for Best Actress]] three times for her performance in the films [[Guerrilla|Guerrilla (2011 film)]] (2011), [[Chorabali|Chorabali]] (2012) and [[Zero Degree|Zero Degree (film)]] (2015) and many other local and international awards for her other films.
title: Jaya Ahsan

abstract: Jackie Beat is the lead singer of the [[Electroclash|Electroclash]] band [[Dirty Sanchez|Dirty Sanchez (band)]]. Beat is also a columnist for IN:LA magazine.
title: Jackie Beat

abstract: Kevin Sussman is one of four brothers, born to [[Jewish|Jewish]] parents. He grew up in Staten Island. He attended the [[College of Staten Island|College of Staten Island]] for one year and went on to graduate from the [[American Academy of Dramatic Arts|American Academy of Dramatic Arts]] in [[Manhattan|Manhattan]]. He later studied with acting teacher [[Uta Hagen|Uta Hagen]] for four years.
title: Kevin Sussman

abstract: Irene Tedrow (August 3, 1907 – March 10, 1995) was an American character actress in stage, film, television and radio.
title: Irene Tedrow

abstract: Anu Aggarwal (born 11 January 1969) is a former Indian model and actress. She is best known for her works in [[Aashiqui|Aashiqui]], [[The Cloud Door|The Cloud Door]] and [[Thiruda Thiruda|Thiruda Thiruda]].
title: Anu Aggarwal

abstract: Tom Ward was born in [[Swansea|Swansea]], [[Wales|Wales]], the son of poet and academic [[John Powell Ward|John Powell Ward]], and Sarah Ward OBE, a farmer.
title: Tom Ward

abstract: Varsha Usgaonkar (born 28 February 1968) is an [[India|Indian]] film actress from [[Goa|Goa]], who has worked in various [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] and [[Marathi|Marathi cinema]] movies as the leading lady. During the 1990s, she was the most popular actress in [[Marathi cinema|Marathi cinema]].
title: Varsha Usgaonkar

abstract: Shelley Blond (born 25 March 1970) is an English actress, voice actress, television presenter, and author.
title: Shelley Blond

abstract: Jin Goo made his television debut in the 2003 gambling [[drama|Korean drama]] [[All In|All In (TV series)]], as the younger version of the protagonist character played by [[Lee Byung-hun|Lee Byung-hun]]. They reunited onscreen in [[Kim Jee-woon|Kim Jee-woon]]'s [[film noir|film noir]] [[A Bittersweet Life|A Bittersweet Life]], and Jin would later join Lee when he established his own management agency, BH Entertainment.
title: Jin Goo

abstract: Alyssa Alano (born Geramie Daud; 11 August 1987) is a [[Filipina|Philippines]]-[[Australian|Australian people]] [[film|film]] and [[TV|television]] actress. She was a former member of the popular [[Viva|VIVA Entertainment]] Hotbabes franchise.
title: Alyssa Alano

abstract: Sukumari (6 October 1940 – 26 March 2013) was an Indian [[film actress|film actress]] best known for her work in [[Malayalam|Malayalam cinema]] and [[Tamil|Tamil cinema]] films.
title: Sukumari

abstract: Michel Blanc has also shown his versatility by appearing in more serious roles, such as the title role in the [[Patrice Leconte|Patrice Leconte]] film [[Monsieur Hire|Monsieur Hire]].
title: Michel Blanc

abstract: Halit Refiğ graduated from Şişli Terakki High School in 1951 and studied engineering at [[Robert College|Robert College]] in [[Istanbul|Istanbul]].
title: Halit Refiğ

abstract: Renu Saluja ([[Punjabi|Punjabi Language]]:ਰੇਣੁ ਸਲੂਜਾ, [[Hindi|Hindi Language]]: रेणु सलुजा) (5 July 1952 – 16 August 2000) was an Indian film editor. Entertainment|Bang Zoom! Entertainment]], [[Viz Media|Viz Media]], [[Funimation|Funimation]], [[New Generation Pictures|New Generation Pictures]], [[Studiopolis|Studiopolis]], [[Disney|Disney]]/[[Pixar|Pixar]], [[Riot Games|Riot Games]] and [[NYAV Post|NYAV Post]]. abstract: Charles Herbert Saperstein (December 23, 1948 – October 31, 2015), known as Charles Herbert, was an American [[child actor|child actor]] of the 1950s and 1960s. Before reaching his teens, Herbert was renowned by a generation of moviegoers for an on-screen broody, mature style and wit that enabled him to go one-on-one with some of the biggest names in the industry, and his appearances in a handful of films in the sci-fi/horror genre garnered him an immortality there. In six years he appeared in twenty Hollywood features.
title: Charles Herbert

abstract: Renuka Shahane was born in [[Maharashtra|Maharashtra]]. She studied Arts (Psychology major) from St. Xavier's College and then Post graduation in Clinical Psychology from Mumbai University. She is married to [[Ashutosh Rana|Ashutosh Rana]], also a [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] actor. They have two sons; Shauryaman and Satyendra. She was earlier married to Marathi theater writer-director Vijay Kenkare and later divorced. Her first marriage was short-lived. Her brother Girish Shahane is a scholar on contemporary art and serves as Artistic Director for Art fairs and a columnist for [[Scroll.in|Scroll.in]].

abstract: Mirosław Maciej Maleńczuk (born August 14, 1961 in [[Wojcieszów|Wojcieszów]], [[Lower Silesian Voivodeship|Lower Silesian Voivodeship]]), also known as Vladimir is a [[Polish|Poland]] [[vocalist|singer]], [[guitarist|guitarist]], [[poet|poet]], former leader of music groups [[Püdelsi|Püdelsi]] and [[Homo Twist|Homo Twist]]. abstract: Charles Baillairgé (29 September 1826 – 10 May 1906) was an architect, land surveyor, civil engineer, and an author.He was from a long line of sculptors, painters, and architects that began with his great grandfather, [[Jean Baillairgé|Jean Baillairgé]]. He was involved in designing many projects that were under the supervision of his brother, [[Frédéric|George-Frédéric-Théophile Baillairgé]], who held a senior position with public works. He completed the neoclassical stone building for the Academy of Music (Music Hall) on rue Saint-Louis in Quebec city in 1853.
title: Charles Baillairgé

abstract: Kal Naga (also credited as Khaled Naga or Khaled Abol Naga) is an award-winning [[actor|actor]], producer (feature films and stage), and director (stage) from [[Egypt|Egypt]]. He is recognized primarily for his work in [[Egypt|Egypt]] and the [[Middle East|Middle East]], but has increasingly ventured into American and British film and television roles. He started acting and directing English and Arabic plays and musicals in [[Egypt|Egypt]] in 1989 while studying theatre at [[The American University in Cairo|The American University in Cairo]]. Beginning his professional acting career in 2000, Naga starred in several movies through the next decade with roles encompassing several genres, from musicals [None but that! (2007)], action [Agamista (2007), Eyes Of A Thief (2014)], thrillers [Kashf Hesab (2007)], art-house [[[Heliopolis|Heliopolis (film)]] (2009), Villa 69 (2013), Decor (2014)] and slapstick comedy [Habibi Naeman (Sleeping Habibi) (2008)]. Additionally, he has participated in several European film festivals, where he received a range of awards as an [[actor|actor]] and producer. Since 2016, he has acted in several English-speaking roles, such as Tyrant on FX, History Channel's Vikings, and the BBC's TV mini series The Last Post. In a film festival in 2016 that celebrated Arab film submissions to the "Oscars," he was noted as being the most submitted actor in Arabic films submissions to the [[Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film|Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film]] (The Oscars). He is often tagged in western media as "Egypt's "Brad Pitt", and he has also been described as "the next Omar Sharif" especially after his American debut movie [[Civic Duty|Civic Duty (film)]] in 2007. Chosen as a Goodwill Ambassador for the UN in 2007, Naga has participated in several international causes, including advocating for democracy in his home country [[Egypt|Egypt]]. He is one of the most recognizable celebrity faces of the [[2011 Egyptian Revolution|2011 Egyptian Revolution]], taking part in mass demonstrations in [[Cairo|Cairo]] that led to the removal of President [[Mubarak|Mubarak]]. He faced defamation campaigns against him by the state-owned media during the [[Mubarak|Mubarak]] era before the [[January 25th, 2011 revolution|25 January Revolution]] in [[Egypt|Egypt]], and once again from the [[2013 "coup d'etat" General Sisi government in Egypt|2013 coup in Egypt]]. He has also been successful across many Arab TV networks as a host for prime-time shows from 1997 until 2005.
title: Kal Naga

abstract: Mark Indelicato (born July 16, 1994) is an American [[actor|actor]], singer, [[fashion|fashion]] [[blogger|blogger]], and photographer best known for his role in the [[ABC|American Broadcasting Company]] [[comedy|comedy]] series [[Ugly Betty|Ugly Betty]], as [[Justin Suarez|Justin Suarez]], the fashion-obsessed nephew of series protagonist [[Betty Suarez|Betty Suarez]].
title: Mark Indelicato

abstract: Joshua Toulmin (   – 23 July 1815) of [[Taunton|Taunton]], [[England|England]] was a noted [[theologian|Christian theology]] and a serial [[Dissenting minister|English Dissenters]] of [[Presbyterian|Presbyterianism]] (1761–1764), [[Baptist|Baptist]] (1765–1803), and then [[Unitarian|Unitarianism]] (1804–1815) congregations. Toulmin's sympathy for both the [[American|American Revolutionary War]] (1775–1783) and [[French|French Revolution]] (1787–1799) revolutions led the Englishman to be associated with the [[United States|United States]] and gained the prolific [[historian|historian]] the reputation of a religious radical.
title: Joshua Toulmin

abstract: Tadepalli Lakshmi Kanta Rao () (16 November 1923 – 22 March 2009), more popularly known as Kanta Rao, was an [[Indian film|Indian film]] actor and producer known for his works predominantly in [[Telugu cinema|Telugu cinema]]. Regarded as one of the finest [[method actor|method actors]], Rao starred in more than four hundred feature films in a variety of genres including mythological, social and folklore. He has also acted in a few [[Hindi|Hindi]], [[Kannada|Kannada]] and [[Tamil|Tamil language]] movies. He has produced about five films under the Hyma Films banner. In the 1960s, he was one of the primary actors in Telugu cinema, along with [[N. T. Rama Rao|N. T. Rama Rao]] and [[Akkineni Nageswara Rao|Akkineni Nageswara Rao]]. Kanta Rao was known for portraying the roles of [[Narada|Narada]], [[Lord Krishna|Lord Krishna]] and [[Arjuna|Arjuna]]. He played [[Lakshmana|Lakshmana]] in the blockbuster film [[Lava Kusha|Lava Kusha]], for which he has won the [[Rashtrapati Award|Rashtrapati Award]] for best actor in 1963.
title: Kanta Rao

abstract: Ita Rina was born on 7 July 1907 in the small town of [[Divača|Divača]] (then [[Austro-Hungarian Empire|Austro-Hungarian Empire]], later [[Yugoslavia|Yugoslavia]], now [[Slovenia|Slovenia]]) as Italina Lida Kravanja. She was called Ida Kravanja for short. The first daughter of Jožef and Marija Kravanja, Rina had a younger sister Danica. Shortly after the outbreak of the [[World War I|World War I]], the family moved to [[Ljubljana|Ljubljana]], where Rina matriculated in 1923. She was not a good student; she repeated the third grade of [[elementary school|elementary school]]. However, her dream was to be an actress.
title: Ita Rina

In addition, he formed one-half of the band [[Zip Code Rapists|Zip Code Rapists]] and has collaborated on numerous projects with musicians including [[Trey Spruance|Trey Spruance]] ([[Mr. Bungle|Mr. Bungle]], [[Secret Chiefs 3|Secret Chiefs 3]]).

abstract: Patrick Fabian (born December 7, 1964) is an American actor of film, stage and television. He is best known for his role on [[Better Call Saul|Better Call Saul]] as the cocky, arrogant lawyer [[Howard Hamlin|Howard Hamlin]]. His film roles include [[End Game|End Game (2006 film)]] (2006), [[The Last Exorcism|The Last Exorcism]] (2010), [[Pig|Pig (2011 film)]] (2011) and [[Jimmy|Jimmy (2013 film)]] (2013).
title: Patrick Fabian

abstract: Maria Katrina Iren Pe Halili (born January 4, 1986) in [[Quezon City|Quezon City]], [[El Nido Palawan|El Nido Palawan]], [[Philippines|Philippines]] known professionally as Katrina Halili is a Filipina [[actress|actress]], [[commercial model|commercial model]] and [[businesswoman|businesswoman]]. She made her screen debut via [[StarStruck|StarStruck (Philippine TV series)]], and became more popular until playing the main [[villainous|villainous]] roles in [[Darna|Darna (2005 TV series)]], [[Majika|Majika]], [[MariMar|Marimar (2007 TV series)]], [[Sa Piling ni Nanay|Sa Piling ni Nanay]], [[D' Originals|D' Originals]], [[Destiny Rose|Destiny Rose]], [[The Stepdaughters|The Stepdaughters]] and [[Pamilya Roces|Pamilya Roces]] and becoming the protagonist in [[One Night Only|One Night Only (2008 film)]], [[Gagambino|Gagambino]], [[Magdusa Ka|Magdusa Ka]], [[Niño|Niño (TV series)]], and her roles in [[Magpakailanman|Magpakailanman]]. She was tagged as "Primera Kontrabida of the Philippines" last 2017.
title: Katrina Halili

abstract: Joseph Cali (born March 30, 1950) is an [[American|United States]] actor known for playing the role of Joey in the 1977 film, [[Saturday Night Fever|Saturday Night Fever]]. Post Saturday Night Fever, he appeared on television and in films such as 1979's [[Voices|Voices (1979 film)]], [[The Competition|The Competition (1980 film)]], and [[Suicide Kings|Suicide Kings]].
title: Joseph Cali

abstract: Paul Tan is a [[Malaysia|Malaysian]] [[motoring journalist|journalist]]. He is best known for his website, paultan.org or Paul Tan's Automotive News, a popular news portal which covers the Malaysian & [[ASEAN|Association of Southeast Asian Nations]] automotive scenes. Paultan.org is managed by Driven Communications Sdn. Bhd., a company in which Paul Tan assumes the role as a managing director. The website also offers reviews, previews, test drives and covers various other topics that are automotive-related.
title: Paul Tan

abstract: Katherine Bailess (born April 24, 1980) is an American actress, singer, and dancer best known for playing the role of Erica Marsh on the [[CW|CW Network]]'s hit show [[One Tree Hill|One Tree Hill (TV series)]], Life and Death Brigade member Stephanie on [[Gilmore Girls|Gilmore Girls]], and [[Kyle Hart|Kyle Hart]] on the [[VH1|VH1]] series [[Hit the Floor|Hit the Floor (TV series)]].
title: Katherine Bailess

abstract: Brian Van Holt (born July 6, 1969) is an American actor. He is best known for playing Bo Sinclair in the [[ABC|American Broadcasting Company]] movie [[House Of Wax|House of Wax (2005 film)]] and [[Bobby Cobb|Bobby Cobb]] on the TV series [[Cougar Town|Cougar Town]].
title: Brian Van Holt

abstract: Ruth Negga (; born 7 January 1982) is an [[Ethiopia|Ethiopian]]-[[Irish|Ireland]] actress who has appeared in the films Capital Letters (2004) (also released as Trafficked in some countries), [[Isolation|Isolation (2005 film)]] (2005), [[Breakfast on Pluto|Breakfast on Pluto (film)]] (2005) and [[Warcraft|Warcraft (film)]] (2016). She has also played roles in television, such as in the [[BBC|BBC]] [[mini-series|mini-series]] [[Criminal Justice|Criminal Justice (TV series)]], [[RTÉ|RTÉ]]'s [[Love/Hate|Love/Hate (TV series)]], [[E4|E4 (channel)]]'s [[Misfits|Misfits (TV series)]], and [[ABC|American Broadcasting Company]]'s [[Marvel's Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.|Marvel's Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.]] In 2016, she began a starring role as Tulip O'Hare in [[AMC|AMC (TV channel)]]'s [[Preacher|Preacher (TV series)]].
title: Ruth Negga

abstract: Chunky Pandey worked as an instructor in acting school in 1986. He used to be senior to many junior budding artists such as [[Akshay Kumar|Akshay Kumar]].
title: Chunky Pandey

abstract: Miyano began his career as a musician in 2007. He released his debut single, , in May on the [[King Records|King Records (Japan)]] label. In March 2009, his debut album [[Break|Break (Mamoru Miyano album)]] was released.
title: Mamoru Miyano

abstract: Lee Reherman (July 4, 1966 – March 1, 2016) was an American actor, appearing in television and film and hosting television reality shows.
title: Lee Reherman

abstract: Lance Kinsey (born June 13, 1954) is a [[Canadian|Canadians]] actor and screenwriter, best known for his role as [[Lt. Proctor|List of Police Academy characters#Sgt..2FLt..2FCapt..2FActing Capt. Carl Proctor]] in the [[Police Academy|Police Academy (film series)]] film series. He also played the male lead in [[Club Fed|Club Fed (film)]].
title: Lance Kinsey

abstract: Sun Park (born 3 January 1981) is a Korean-born Australian singer, actress, entertainer and former member of the children's entertainment group [[Hi-5|Hi-5 (Australian band)]] as well as the [[television series of the same name|Hi-5 (Australian TV series)]].
title: Sun Park

abstract: John C. Allen (May 21, 1907 – August 17, 1979) was a [[roller coaster|roller coaster]] designer who was responsible for the revival of [[wooden roller coaster|wooden roller coasters]] which began in the 1960s. He attended [[Drexel University|Drexel University]]. He started working for the [[Philadelphia Toboggan Company|Philadelphia Toboggan Company]] in 1934 as a coaster operator and rose to become president of the company by 1954. He has designed more than 25 coasters and made significant contributions to roller coaster technology. He once said, "You don't need a degree in engineering to design roller coasters, you need a degree in psychology."
title: John C. Allen

abstract: Belinda Teal Marchande (born January 11, 1963) is a former American actress, best known for her role as Sheryl Rockmore on the [[Nickelodeon|Nickelodeon]] sitcom [[Kenan & Kel|Kenan & Kel]]. She has also guest-starred on [[Martin|Martin (TV series)]] and the [[UPN|UPN]] sitcom [[Good News|Good News (TV series)]]. She has not acted professionally since Kenan & Kel ended in 2000.
title: Teal Marchande

abstract: Kate Harbour (born 15 April 1971) is an English [[voice actress|Voice acting]] who provides many voices for the [[television series|television series]] [[Bob the Builder|Bob the Builder]] including [[Wendy|List of Bob the Builder characters]], [[Dizzy|List of Bob the Builder characters]], [[Mrs. Potts|List of Bob the Builder characters]], [[Mrs. Broadbent|List of Bob the Builder characters]], [[Mrs. Percival|List of Bob the Builder characters]], and Pilchard.
title: Kate Harbour

abstract: Haseena Moin is a Pakistani dramatist, playwright and [[scriptwriter|scriptwriter]]. She has written several plays for stage, [[radio|radio programming]] and [[television|television programming]], some of which have even gained international repute. She is the recipient of the [[Pride of Performance|Pride of Performance]] award for her services to the [[performing arts|performing arts]] in Pakistan. She wrote Pakistan's first original script 'Kiran Kahani' aired in the early-1970s. Before this [[PTV|Pakistan Television Corporation]] relied on novel-based scripts for dramas. She is considered to be the best playwright and dramatist Pakistan has ever witnessed.
title: Haseena Moin

abstract: Madolyn Smith is an American former actress. She is known for her roles in the films [[Urban Cowboy|Urban Cowboy]] (1980), [[2010: The Year We Make Contact|2010: The Year We Make Contact]] (1984), and [[Funny Farm|Funny Farm (film)]] (1988).
title: Madolyn Smith

abstract: S. Ravi Varman, [[ISC|Indian Society of Cinematographers]] is an Indian cinematographer, filmmaker, producer and writer. He has predominantly worked in films of Indian languages Tamil, Malayalam and Hindi language films. Known for his realistic picturization and poetic framing sense, Ravi Varman began his career in Malayalam films. He has directed a romantic film in Tamil titled [[Moscowin Kavery|Moscowin Kavery]] and also filmed the music video for the song "[[Bird Flu|Bird Flu (song)]]" by British Tamil songwriter [[M.I.A.|M.I.A. (artist)]].
title: Ravi Varman

abstract: Marie Mireille Enos (; born September 22, 1975) is an American actress. Drawn to acting from a young age, she graduated in performing arts from [[Brigham Young University|Brigham Young University]], where she was awarded the [[Irene Ryan Acting Scholarship|Irene Ryan#Legacy and charitable causes]]. Having made her acting debut in the 1994 television film [[Without Consent|Without Consent]], she has since received nominations for a [[Tony Award|Tony Award]], a [[Golden Globe Award|Golden Globe Award]], and an [[Emmy Award|Emmy Award]].
title: Mireille Enos

abstract: Christian Byers (born 31 July 1993, [[Sydney|Sydney]], New South Wales, Australia) is an [[Australia|Australian]] actor. In 2006, he made his film debut in [[Opal Dream|Opal Dream]], before featuring in [[December Boys|December Boys]] alongside [[Daniel Radcliffe|Daniel Radcliffe]]. In 2007, he portrayed Jacob in [[Hey, Hey, It's Esther Blueburger|Hey, Hey, It's Esther Blueburger]]. He is also the lead vocalist, second guitarist and organist of the band [[The Slippers|The Slippers]]. He is also participating in a Sydney-based television show,[1], as [2]. He currently attends [[University of Technology, Sydney|University of Technology, Sydney]]
title: Christian Byers

abstract: Vivienne Johnson, is an English actress, who is known for playing the supporting character of personal nurse to Young Mr. Grace in three seasons (1978-1981) of the [[British sitcom|British sitcom]] [[Are You Being Served?|Are You Being Served?]]. She also appeared as Freda in [[Carry On England|Carry On England]] in 1976, and Marilyn in [[Odd Man Out|Odd Man Out (UK TV series)]] opposite [[John Inman|John Inman]].
title: Vivienne Johnson

abstract: Rajit Kapur played the role of the famous [[Bengali|Bengalis]] detective [[Byomkesh Bakshi|Byomkesh Bakshi]] in the eponymously named TV series, [[Byomkesh Bakshi|Byomkesh Bakshi (1993 TV series)]] (1993). Byomkesh Bakshi is a fictitious character created by the popular Bengali writer [[Sharadindu Bandyopadhyay|Sharadindu Bandyopadhyay]]. [[Basu Chatterjee|Basu Chatterjee]] directed a TV show based on the stories of Bandyopadhyay, and Rajit Kapur played the lead role. The show was very popular and Rajit Kapur achieved his first media recognition through this show.
title: Rajit Kapur

abstract: Hirani was born on 20 November 1962 in [[Nagpur|Nagpur]] to a [[Sindhi|Sindhi people]] family. His ancestors originally belong to [[Mehrabpur|Mehrabpur]], a city in the [[Naushahro Firoz District|Naushahro Feroze District]], [[Sindh|Sindh]], of modern-day [[Pakistan|Pakistan]]. His father Suresh Hirani ran a typing institute in [[Nagpur|Nagpur]]. Rajkumar Hirani studied at [[St. Francis De'Sales High School, Nagpur, Maharashtra|St. Francis De'Sales High School, Nagpur, Maharashtra]]. He did his graduation in commerce. His parents wanted him to be a chartered accountant, but he was more keen on theatre and film.
title: Rajkumar Hirani

abstract: Jorge Lavat Bayona (3 August 1933 − 14 September 2011) was a Mexican film and television actor.
title: Jorge Lavat

abstract: Mikael Salomon (born 24 February 1945) is a [[Danish|Danes]]-born [[cinematographer|cinematographer]], [[director|Film director]] and [[producer|Film producer]] of [[film|film]] and [[television|television]]. After a long cinematography career in [[Danish cinema|Cinema of Denmark]], he transitioned to the [[Hollywood|Hollywood]] [[film industry|film industry]] in the late 1980s earning two [[Academy Award|Academy Awards]] nominations. He is also a [[television director|television director]] whose credits include dozens of [[series|Television series]], [[films|Television film]] and [[miniseries|miniseries]] including [[Band of Brothers|Band of Brothers (miniseries)]], [[Salem's Lot|Salem's Lot (2004 miniseries)]], [[Rome|Rome (TV series)]], and [[The Andromeda Strain|The Andromeda Strain (miniseries)]]. His awards and nominations include a [[Primetime Emmy Award|Primetime Emmy Award]] and a [[Directors Guild of America Award|Directors Guild of America Award]].
title: Mikael Salomon

abstract: Vanessa Taylor is an American screenwriter and television producer. She is known for writing [[Hope Springs|Hope Springs (2012 film)]], [[Divergent|Divergent (film)]], and [[The Shape of Water|The Shape of Water]], as well as for her work as a writer and co-executive producer on seasons two and three of [[Game of Thrones|Game of Thrones]]. Taylor is writing Disney's upcoming live-action remake of [[Aladdin|Aladdin (2019 film)]]. For The Shape of Water, she was nominated for the [[Academy Award for Best Original Screenplay|Academy Award for Best Original Screenplay]].
title: Vanessa Taylor

abstract: Kym Herjavec (née Johnson; born 4 August 1976) is an Australian professional [[ballroom|ballroom]] dancer and [[television|television]] performer who appeared in the first three seasons of the [[Australian version|Dancing with the Stars (Australian TV series)]] of [[Dancing with the Stars|Dancing with the Stars]] as a professional dancer, before moving to the [[U.S. version|Dancing with the Stars (U.S. TV series)]] of the franchise from 2006 to 2015. Johnson returned as a professional to the U.S. series in 2017 for its 24th season. She has since served as a judge on the Australian version of the show since 2013.
title: Kym Herjavec

abstract: Christopher Chace Crawford (born July 18, 1985) is an American actor, known for his portrayal of [[Nate Archibald|Nate Archibald (Gossip Girl)]] on [[The CW|The CW]]'s teen drama series [[Gossip Girl|Gossip Girl]] (2007–12). He is also known for starring in the films [[The Covenant|The Covenant (film)]] (2006), [[The Haunting of Molly Hartley|The Haunting of Molly Hartley]] (2008), [[Twelve|Twelve (2010 film)]] (2010), and [[What to Expect When You're Expecting|What to Expect When You're Expecting (film)]] (2012). In 2015, he portrayed Billy LeFever in [[ABC|American Broadcasting Company]]'s short-lived drama series [[Blood & Oil|Blood & Oil]].
title: Chace Crawford

abstract: Shauneille Perry was born on July 26, 1929, in [[Chicago, Illinois|Chicago, Illinois]], to a prominent African-American family. She is the daughter of [[Graham T. Perry|Graham T. Perry]] (1894–1960), one of the first African-American assistant attorneys-general for the State of Illinois and his wife, the former (Laura) Pearl Gant (1903–1957), one of the first African-American court reporters in Chicago. She is the niece by marriage of real-estate broker and political activist [[Carl Augustus Hansberry|Carl Augustus Hansberry]] (who married her father's sister, Nannie Louise Perry) and his brother, Africanist scholar [[William Leo Hansberry|William Leo Hansberry]]. She is also the first cousin of playwright [[Lorraine Hansberry|Lorraine Hansberry]], Carl Hansberry's daughter.
title: Shauneille Perry

abstract: Chelsea Hobbs (born February 18, 1985) is a Canadian actress. She is known for roles such as Gerda in the 2002 television film [[Snow Queen|Snow Queen (2002 film)]], and as Emily Kmetko the [[ABC Family|ABC Family]] teen drama [[Make It or Break It|Make It or Break It]].
title: Chelsea Hobbs

abstract: John Carlo de Vera, better known by his [[screen name|Stage name]] J. C. de Vera (born March 10, 1986 in [[Manila|Manila]], [[Philippines|Philippines]]), is a [[Filipino|Filipino people]] [[actor|actor]], host and model.
title: J. C. de Vera

abstract: Jake Burbage (born September 27, 1992 in [[Willingboro Township, New Jersey|Willingboro Township, New Jersey]]) is an [[American|United States]] [[actor|actor]] who is best known for his role on [[Grounded for Life|Grounded for Life]] as Henry Finnerty. Burbage attended [[Moorestown Friends School|Moorestown Friends School]] and graduated in 2011.
title: Jake Burbage

abstract: Gareth David Lloyd (born 28 March 1981), known professionally as Gareth David-Lloyd, is a Welsh actor best known for his role as [[Ianto Jones|Ianto Jones]] in the British [[science fiction|science fiction]] series [[Torchwood|Torchwood]].
title: Gareth David-Lloyd

abstract: Arthur Gonzales Solinap, known as Arthur Solinap, (born January 19, 1980) is a [[Filipino|Philippines]] actor and model. Solinap's career began as a member of Abztract Dancers together with his cousin [[Dingdong Dantes|Dingdong Dantes]]. He made his first TV appearance in 2005 as Muros in [[Encantadia|Encantadia]] and later played Diego in the 2007 series of [[MariMar|MariMar (Philippine TV Series)]].
title: Arthur Solinap

abstract: Patrick Heusinger (born February 14, 1981) is an American actor, known for his roles on the television series [[Girlfriends' Guide to Divorce|Girlfriends' Guide to Divorce]], [[Gossip Girl|Gossip Girl]], [[Royal Pains|Royal Pains]] and [[Absentia|Absentia (TV series)]].
title: Patrick Heusinger

abstract: Evin Crowley (born 5 December 1945) is a [[Northern Irish|Northern Ireland]] actress. She was born in [[Bangor, County Down|Bangor, County Down]]. She started acting as an amateur at a small theatre, later to become the [[Lyric Theatre|Lyric Players' Theatre]], in [[Belfast|Belfast]], before later being chosen to play the role of Moureen in [[David Lean|David Lean]]'s [[Ryan's Daughter|Ryan's Daughter]] (1970).
title: Evin Crowley

abstract: Vijaya Nirmala was born in [[Tamil Nadu|Tamil Nadu]] to a [[Telugu|Telugu people]] family from [[Andhra Pradesh|Andhra Pradesh]]. Her father had worked in film production. She has a son [[Naresh|Naresh (actor)]], who is also an actor, from her first marriage to Krishna Murthy. After divorcing her first husband, she married actor [[Krishna|Krishna (Telugu actor)]].
title: Vijaya Nirmala

abstract: Vincent Simone (born 15 March 1979) is a professional dancer born in [[Italy|Italy]], who has appeared as a professional dancer on [[Strictly Come Dancing|Strictly Come Dancing]] from 2006 until 2012. He moved to [[Guildford|Guildford]], [[Surrey|Surrey]], [[United Kingdom|United Kingdom]] when he was 17. Simone and professional partner [[Flavia Cacace|Flavia Cacace]] perform under the brand name Vincent and Flavia.
title: Vincent Simone

abstract: Abhay Deol (also known as Abhay Singh Deol, born 15 March 1976) is an Indian actor and producer, who works predominantly in [[Hindi language films|Bollywood]]. Born in the influential [[Deol family|List of Hindi film clans#Deol family]] of the [[Hindi cinema|Hindi cinema]], he began acting at a young age in theater productions at his school. Deol made his on-screen debut in 2005 with [[Imtiaz Ali|Imtiaz Ali (director)]]'s romantic comedy [[Socha Na Tha|Socha Na Tha]].
title: Abhay Deol

abstract: Saurabh Shukla (born 5 March 1963) is an Indian film, theatre and television actor and director. He is famous for his roles in [[Satya|Satya (1998 film)]] (1998), [[Barfi!|Barfi!]] (2012), [[Jolly LLB|Jolly LLB]] (2013), [[Kick|Kick (2014 film)]] (2014), [[PK|PK (film)]] (2014), [[Jolly LLB 2|Jolly LLB 2]](2017) and [[Raid|Raid (2018 film)]] (2018).
title: Saurabh Shukla

abstract: Bill Kopp (born April 17, 1962 in [[Rockford, Illinois|Rockford, Illinois]]) is an American actor, director, animator, voice actor, and writer.
title: Bill Kopp

abstract: Devon Werkheiser (born March 8, 1991) is an American actor, voice actor, singer-songwriter and musician. As an actor, Werkheiser is known for his starring role as [[Ned Bigby|List of Ned's Declassified School Survival Guide characters#Ned Bigby]] on the [[Nickelodeon|Nickelodeon]] sitcom [[Ned's Declassified School Survival Guide|Ned's Declassified School Survival Guide]], and for his role as the lead character Nolan Byrd in the 2007 Nickelodeon television movie [[Shredderman Rules|Shredderman Rules]]. Werkheiser also played Peter Parkes in the fourth and final season of the [[ABC Family|ABC Family]] series [[Greek|Greek (TV series)]].
title: Devon Werkheiser

abstract: Tania Saulnier (born March 5, 1982) is a [[Canadian|Canadians]] [[actress|Actor]], perhaps best known for her role in the film [[Slither|Slither (2006 film)]]. Saulnier was born in [[Vancouver|Vancouver]], [[British Columbia|British Columbia]], [[Canada|Canada]]. Once a competitive dancer, and motor-sport enthusiast Tania's first notable acting role came in 1998 with a small part as Marcey Bennett, in one episode of [[Cold Squad|Cold Squad]]. From there she moved on to various projects, one of which was playing Taylor Langford in the short-lived [[Nickelodeon|Nickelodeon]] series [[Caitlin's Way|Caitlin's Way]], for which she was nominated for a 2001 [[Leo Award|Leo Awards]] as Best Performance in a Youth or Children's Program or Series. She went on to act in small roles on various television shows, such as [[Smallville|Smallville]], and in the [[Supernatural|Supernatural (U.S. TV series)]] episode "[[Scarecrow|Scarecrow (Supernatural)]]". This was followed by her supporting role in [[James Gunn|James Gunn (filmmaker)]]'s horror film [[Slither|Slither (2006 film)]] as Kylie Strutemyer. Saulnier appeared in two films, [[The Invisible|The Invisible (film)]] and [[In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale|In the Name of the King]].
title: Tania Saulnier

abstract: Bruce Mahler (born September 12, 1950) is an American actor, producer, and writer. He is known for his role as Sgt. Fackler in the comedy films [[Police Academy|Police Academy (franchise)]], and as Rabbi Kirschbaum on the sitcom [[Seinfeld|Seinfeld]].
title: Bruce Mahler

abstract: John Benjamin Hickey (born June 25, 1963) is an American actor with a career in stage, film and television. He won the 2011 [[Tony Award for Best Performance by a Featured Actor in a Play|Tony Award for Best Performance by a Featured Actor in a Play]] for his performance as Felix Turner in [[The Normal Heart|The Normal Heart]].
title: John Benjamin Hickey

abstract: Mylène Demongeot (born Marie-Hélène Demongeot; 29 September 1935) is a French actress with a career spanning six decades. She has appeared in 72 films since 1953.
title: Mylène Demongeot

abstract: Al Ruscio (June 2, 1924 – November 12, 2013) was an American [[character actor|character actor]] who appeared in numerous television shows and films.
title: Al Ruscio

abstract: Scott Spiegel (born December 24, 1957) is an [[American|United States]] screenwriter, film director, producer and actor. He is best known for co-writing the screenplay for the movie [[Evil Dead II|Evil Dead II]] with longtime friend, film director [[Sam Raimi|Sam Raimi]], with whom he attended [[Wylie E. Groves High School|Wylie E. Groves High School]] in [[Birmingham, Michigan|Birmingham, Michigan]]. Spiegel played the role of Scotty in Raimi's [[Within the Woods|Within the Woods]], which served as a precursor to [[The Evil Dead|The Evil Dead]].
title: Scott Spiegel

abstract: Katerina Moutsatsou or Moutsatsos (), is a Los Angeles-based Greek actress, producer, writer, and activist. She is the author and producer of experimental films, videos, and animation series, which focus mainly on subjects related to her country of origin, [[Greece|Greece]]. She is vocal on the area of politics, and cultural identity. Her political animation series Sara and Mara was published by the Greek newspaper [[Eleftherotypia|Eleftherotypia]].
title: Katerina Moutsatsou

abstract: Darlene Cates (born Rita Darlene Guthrie; December 13, 1947 – March 26, 2017) was an American actress. She was best known for her role in the 1993 film [[What's Eating Gilbert Grape|What's Eating Gilbert Grape]], in which she played the title character's housebound mother.
title: Darlene Cates

abstract: Rohit Shetty (born 14 March 1974) is an Indian film director and producer. His work as a filmmaker includes the [[Golmaal film series|Golmaal (film series)]], the [[Singham film series|Singham (franchise)]], [[Bol Bachchan|Bol Bachchan]], [[Chennai Express|Chennai Express]] (for which he was nominated for [[Filmfare Award for Best Director|Filmfare Award for Best Director]]), and [[Dilwale|Dilwale (2015 film)]].
title: Rohit Shetty

abstract: John Lutz (born April 23, 1973) is an American actor, comedian, and screenwriter. He is best known for playing [[J. D. Lutz|J. D. Lutz]] on the [[NBC|NBC]] sitcom [[30 Rock|30 Rock]], and for his work as a writer on the NBC series [[Saturday Night Live|Saturday Night Live]] for seven seasons. In 2014, he joined the writing staff of the NBC late-night talk show [[Late Night with Seth Meyers|Late Night with Seth Meyers]].
title: John Lutz

abstract: [[Datuk|Malay titles]] Aznil bin Nawawi (born 6 November 1962), better known as Aznil Nawawi (sometimes he credited as Aznil Haji Nawawi, Aznil or Pak Nil), is a TV host in Malaysia.
title: Aznil Nawawi

abstract: Imogen Poots (born 3 June 1989) is an English actress. She played Tammy in the post-apocalyptic science fiction horror film [[28 Weeks Later|28 Weeks Later]] (2007), [[Linda Keith|Linda Keith]] in the [[Jimi Hendrix|Jimi Hendrix]] biopic [[Jimi: All Is by My Side|Jimi: All Is by My Side]] (2013), Debbie Raymond in the [[Paul Raymond|Paul Raymond (publisher)]] biopic [[The Look of Love|The Look of Love (film)]] (2013), and Julia Maddon in the American action movie [[Need for Speed|Need for Speed (film)]] (2014). In 2016 she starred as Kelly Ann in the [[Showtime|Showtime (TV network)]] series [[Roadies|Roadies (TV series)]].

abstract: Sandra Hess (born March 27, 1968) is a [[Swiss|Swiss people]] actress and fashion model. She is best known for her role as [[Sonya Blade|Sonya Blade]] in the film [[Mortal Kombat: Annihilation|Mortal Kombat: Annihilation]], and Lieutenant Alexandra 'Ice' Jensen in the television series [[Pensacola: Wings of Gold|Pensacola: Wings of Gold]].

abstract: Ayesha Dharker (born 16 March 1977) is a [[British|United Kingdom]]-[[India|Indian]] actress. She is known for her performance in the [[Tamil|Cinema of Tamil Nadu]] film [[The Terrorist|The Terrorist (1997 film)]] (1997), for which she was awarded Best Artistic Contribution by an Actress at the [[Cairo International Film Festival|Cairo International Film Festival]] and nominated for a [[National Film Award for Best Actress|National Film Award for Best Actress]]. She has also appeared in [[Hollywood|Hollywood]] films such as [[Star Wars: Episode II – Attack of the Clones|Star Wars: Episode II – Attack of the Clones]], [[Outsourced|Outsourced (film)]] and [[The Mistress of Spices|The Mistress of Spices (film)]], television series such as [[Arabian Nights|Arabian Nights (TV miniseries)]], the [[West End|West End theatre]] and [[Broadway|Broadway theatre]] musical [[Bombay Dreams|Bombay Dreams]].
title: Ayesha Dharker

abstract: Mary Beth Hurt (born September 26, 1946) is an American actress of stage and screen. She is a three-time [[Tony Award|Tony Award]]-nominated actress.
title: Mary Beth Hurt

abstract: Lori Alan is an American [[actress|actress]] and [[voice actress|voice acting]]. She has played a long-running role as [[Pearl Krabs|Pearl Krabs]] on the animated television series [[SpongeBob SquarePants|SpongeBob SquarePants]]. She also voiced [[Diane Simmons|List of Family Guy characters#Diane Simmons]] on [[Family Guy|Family Guy]], the [[Invisible Woman|Invisible Woman]] on [[The Fantastic Four|Fantastic Four (1994 TV series)]], and [[The Boss|The Boss (Metal Gear)]] in the [[Metal Gear|Metal Gear]] video game series.
title: Lori Alan

abstract: Émilie Dequenne (born 29 August 1981) is a [[Belgian|Belgians]] actress. She received a [[Cannes Film Festival Award for Best Actress|Cannes Film Festival Award for Best Actress]] for her debut role in [[Rosetta|Rosetta (film)]] (1999). Dequenne's other notable film roles were in [[Brotherhood of the Wolf|Brotherhood of the Wolf]] (2001), [[The Very Merry Widows|The Very Merry Widows]] (2003), [[The Light|The Light (film)]] (2004), [[Our Children|Our Children]] (2012), and [[Not My Type|Not My Type]] (2014).
title: Émilie Dequenne

abstract: He is currently the owner and CEO of [[Chip Ganassi Racing|Chip Ganassi Racing]] which operates teams in the [[IndyCar Series|IndyCar Series]], [[Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series|Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series]], [[WeatherTech SportsCar Championship|WeatherTech SportsCar Championship]], and in the World Endurance Championship. Overall, he runs 14 cars with 18 drivers across six different touring series.
title: Chip Ganassi

abstract: Daniel John Dyer (born 24 July 1977) is an English actor who has worked in television, film and theatre. Dyer's breakthrough role was as Moff in [[Human Traffic|Human Traffic]], with other notable roles as Billy the Limpet in [[Mean Machine|Mean Machine (film)]], and as Tommy Johnson in [[The Football Factory|The Football Factory (film)]]. Following the success of The Football Factory, Dyer was often typecast in "hard-man" roles, although it was this image that allowed him to present [[The Real Football Factories|The Real Football Factories]], its spin-off, [[The Real Football Factories International|The Real Football Factories International]] and [[Danny Dyer's Deadliest Men|Danny Dyer's Deadliest Men]]. Dyer has also worked in theatre, having appeared in three plays written by [[Harold Pinter|Harold Pinter]], with whom he had a close friendship.
title: Danny Dyer

abstract: Edie McClurg (born July 23, 1951) is an American stand-up comedian, actress, singer and voice actress. She has performed in nearly 90 films and 55 television episodes, often portraying characters with a cheery Midwestern accent.
title: Edie McClurg

abstract: Michael Nouri (born December 9, 1945) is an American television and film actor. His father was born in [[Iraq|Iraq]].
title: Michael Nouri

abstract: Kelli Giddish (born April 13, 1980) is an American television, stage, and film actress. She is best known for her role as [[NYPD|NYPD]] Detective [[Amanda Rollins|Amanda Rollins]] in the [[NBC|NBC]] television legal crime drama series [[Law & Order: Special Victims Unit|Law & Order: Special Victims Unit]] (2011–present). Previously, she portrayed [[Di Henry|Di Henry]] on the [[ABC|American Broadcasting Company]] soap opera [[All My Children|All My Children]] (2005–07), as well as starring in short-lived [[Fox|Fox Broadcasting Company]] crime drama series [[Past Life|Past Life (TV series)]] (2010); and the NBC crime drama series [[Chase|Chase (2010 TV series)]] (2010–11).
title: Kelli Giddish

abstract: Perla Haney-Jardine (born July 17, 1997) is a [[Brazilian-American|Brazilian-American]] actress, best known for her role as B.B. in the 2004 movie [[Kill Bill: Volume 2|Kill Bill: Volume 2]].
title: Perla Haney-Jardine

abstract: Stephanie Beacham (born 28 February 1947) is an English television, radio, film and theatre actress. She is known for her television roles in the [[BBC|BBC]] drama [[Tenko|Tenko (TV series)]] (1981–82), the [[ITV|ITV (TV network)]] drama [[Connie|Connie (TV series)]] (1985), and for playing [[Sable Colby|Sable Colby]] in the [[ABC|American Broadcasting Company]] [[soap opera|soap operas]] [[The Colbys|The Colbys]] (1985–87) and [[Dynasty|Dynasty (1981 TV series)]] (1988–89). Her film appearances include [[Dracula A.D. 1972|Dracula A.D. 1972]] (1972), [[Schizo|Schizo (1976 film)]] (1976) and [[Troop Beverly Hills|Troop Beverly Hills]] (1989).
title: Stephanie Beacham

abstract: June Vincent (born Dorothy June Smith, July 17, 1920 – November 20, 2008) was an [[American|United States]] actress.
title: June Vincent

abstract: Randolph Mantooth (born Randy DeRoy Mantooth, September 19, 1945), is an [[American|United States]] [[actor|actor]] who has worked in television, documentaries, theater, and film for more than 40 years. A graduate of the [[American Academy of Dramatic Arts|American Academy of Dramatic Arts]], he was discovered in New York by a [[Universal Studios|Universal Studios]] talent agent while performing the lead in the play [[Philadelphia, Here I Come|Philadelphia, Here I Come]]. After signing with Universal and moving to California, he slowly built up his resume with work on such dramatic series as [[Adam-12|Adam-12]] (1968), [[Marcus Welby, M.D.|Marcus Welby, M.D.]] (1969), [[McCloud|McCloud (TV series)]] (1970) and [[Alias Smith and Jones|Alias Smith and Jones]] (1971).
title: Randolph Mantooth

abstract: Peter Berg (born March 11, 1964) is an [[American|United States]] director, producer, writer, and actor. His directorial film works include the black comedy [[Very Bad Things|Very Bad Things]] (1998), the action comedy [[The Rundown|The Rundown]] (2003), the sports drama [[Friday Night Lights|Friday Night Lights (film)]] (2004), the action thriller [[The Kingdom|The Kingdom (film)]] (2007), the superhero comedy-drama [[Hancock|Hancock (film)]] (2008), the military science fiction war film [[Battleship|Battleship (film)]] (2012), the war film [[Lone Survivor|Lone Survivor]] (2013), the disaster drama [[Deepwater Horizon|Deepwater Horizon (film)]] (2016), the [[Boston Marathon bombing|Boston Marathon bombing]] drama [[Patriots Day|Patriots Day (film)]] (2016) and the action thriller [[Mile 22|Mile 22]] (2018), the latter four all starring [[Mark Wahlberg|Mark Wahlberg]]. In addition to cameo appearances in the last six of these titles, he has had prominent acting roles in films including [[The Great White Hype|The Great White Hype]] (1996), [[Cop Land|Cop Land]] (1997), [[Corky Romano|Corky Romano]] (2001), [[Collateral|Collateral (film)]] (2004), [[Smokin' Aces|Smokin' Aces]] (2006), and [[Lions for Lambs|Lions for Lambs]] (2007).
title: Peter Berg

abstract: Scott Caminetti (born 24 November 1962) is a [[Gold Logie|Gold Logie]] award-winning [[Australian|Australian]] television personality, appearing on several [[lifestyle|lifestyle (sociology)]] programmes on the [[Nine Network|Nine Network]]. He is best well known as the host of the hit reality TV renovation show [[The Block|The Block (Australian TV series)]].
title: Scott Cam

abstract: Paul Stojanovich (February 13, 1956 – March 15, 2003) was an [[American|United States]] [[television producer|television producer]] whose notable creations include [[American Detective|American Detective]] (1991–1993) and [[World's Wildest Police Videos|World's Wildest Police Videos]] (1998–2001).
title: Paul Stojanovich

abstract: Simi Garewal was born in [[mukatsar|mukatsar]], [[Punjab, India|Punjab, India]], in a [[Jat Sikh|Jat Sikh]] family. Her father, Brigadier J. S. Garewal served in the [[Indian Army|Indian Army]]. Simi is a cousin of [[Pamela Chopra|Pamela Chopra]], wife of film-maker [[Yash Chopra|Yash Chopra]]. Simi's mother Darshi and Pamela's father Mohinder Singh were siblings. Simi grew up in England and studied at [[Newland House School|Newland House School]] with her sister Amrita.
title: Simi Garewal

abstract: Nora-Jane Noone (born 8 March 1984) is an Irish film and television actress best known for her role as Bernadette in [[The Magdalene Sisters|The Magdalene Sisters]].
title: Nora-Jane Noone

abstract: Jane Turner (born 1 December 1960) is an Australian actress, comedian and [[Logie Award|Logie Award]]-winning comedy writer.
title: Jane Turner

abstract: Sally Thomsett (born 3 April 1950) is an [[English|English people]] [[actress|actress]] who was born in [[Sussex|Sussex]], [[England|England]]. She appeared in the film [[The Railway Children|The Railway Children (1970 film)]] (1970) and played Jo in the TV sitcom [[Man About the House|Man About the House]] (1973–76). She also appeared in the film [[Straw Dogs|Straw Dogs (1971 film)]] (1971).
title: Sally Thomsett

abstract: Donna Murphy (born March 7, 1959) is an American [[actress|actor]] and [[singer|singing]], known for her work in [[musical theater|musical theater]]. A five-time [[Tony Award|Tony Award]] nominee, she has twice won the Tony for [[Best Actress in a Musical|Tony Award for Best Performance by a Leading Actress in a Musical]]: for her role as Fosca in [[Passion|Passion (musical)]] (1994–95) and as [[Anna Leonowens|Anna Leonowens]] in [[The King and I|The King and I]] (1996–97). She was also nominated for her roles as Ruth Sherwood in [[Wonderful Town|Wonderful Town]] (2003), [[Lotte Lenya|Lotte Lenya]] in [[LoveMusik|LoveMusik]] (2007) and Bubbie/Raisel in [[The People in the Picture|The People in the Picture]] (2011).
title: Donna Murphy

abstract: Tricia Leigh Fisher (born December 26, 1968) is an American actress and singer.
title: Tricia Leigh Fisher

abstract: Michael O'Keefe (born Raymond Peter O'Keefe, Jr.; April 24, 1955) is an [[American|United States]] [[film|film]] and [[television|television]] [[actor|actor]], known for his roles as Danny Noonan in [[Caddyshack|Caddyshack]] and Ben Meechum in [[The Great Santini|The Great Santini]] — for which he received a nomination for the [[Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor|Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor]].
title: Michael O'Keefe

abstract: Cerina Vincent (born February 7, 1979) is an American actress and writer best known for playing [[Maya|Maya (Power Rangers)]] the Yellow Galaxy Ranger in the television series [[Power Rangers Lost Galaxy|Power Rangers Lost Galaxy]] and Suzy Diaz in [[Stuck in the Middle|Stuck in the Middle (TV series)]], as well as her film appearances in [[Not Another Teen Movie|Not Another Teen Movie]], [[Cabin Fever|Cabin Fever (2002 film)]], [[It Waits|It Waits]], and [[Everybody Wants to Be Italian|Everybody Wants to Be Italian]]. She has written three books with Jodi Lipper, and writes a regular column for [[The Huffington Post|The Huffington Post]].
title: Cerina Vincent

abstract: Bonnie Bartlett (born June 20, 1929) is an American television and film actress. Her career spans over 60 years, with her first major role being on a 1950s daytime drama, [[Love of Life|Love of Life]]. She is best known for her role as Ellen Craig on the medical drama series [[St. Elsewhere|St. Elsewhere]]. She and her husband, actor [[William Daniels|William Daniels]], who played her fictional husband Dr. Mark Craig, won the 1986 Emmy Awards on the same night, becoming the first married couple to accomplish the feat since [[Alfred Lunt|Alfred Lunt]] and [[Lynn Fontanne|Lynn Fontanne]] in 1965.
title: Bonnie Bartlett

abstract: Theresa Saldana (August 20, 1954 – June 6, 2016) was an American [[actress|actress]] and author. She is known for her role as Rachel Scali, the wife of Police Commissioner Tony Scali, in the 1990s television series [[The Commish|The Commish]], for which she received a [[Golden Globe|Golden Globe]] nomination for Best Performance by an Actress in a Supporting Role, in 1994. Major film roles include the part of 'Lenore La Motta', the wife of [[Joe Pesci|Joe Pesci]]'s character, in the 1980 feature film [[Raging Bull|Raging Bull]] and [[Robert Zemeckis|Robert Zemeckis]]'s [[Beatlemania|Beatlemania]] ensemble [[I Wanna Hold Your Hand|I Wanna Hold Your Hand (film)]]. She was also known for raising public awareness of the crime of stalking, after surviving a murder attempt by an obsessed fan in 1982.
title: Theresa Saldana

abstract: Patricia Charbonneau (born April 19, 1959) is an American actress, perhaps best known for playing the part of Cay Rivvers in [[Desert Hearts|Desert Hearts]], her first film role.
title: Patricia Charbonneau

abstract: Aarón Díaz Spencer (born March 7, 1982) is a [[Mexican|Mexico]] [[actor|actor]], [[singer|singer]], and [[model|model (person)]].
title: Aarón Díaz

abstract: He has co-presented the prime-time [[BBC One|BBC One]] game show [[Prized Apart|Prized Apart]], alongside [[Emma Willis|Emma Willis]]. He is also the presenter of the [[BBC Three|BBC Three]] show Reggie Yates' Extreme Russia, Extreme South Africa and Extreme UK.
title: Reggie Yates

abstract: Daniel Jason Sudeikis ( ; born September 18, 1975) is an American comedian, actor, screenwriter and producer. In the 1990s, he began his career in [[improv comedy|improv comedy]]. He has also performed with [[ComedySportz|ComedySportz]] and [[The Second City|The Second City]]. In 2003, Sudeikis was hired as a sketch writer for [[Saturday Night Live|Saturday Night Live]] and was a cast member from 2005 to 2013.
title: Jason Sudeikis

abstract: Constance Vera Browne, Baroness Oranmore and Browne (née Stevens; 14 February 1915 – 24 September 2006), commonly known as Sally Gray, was an English film actress of the 1930s and 1940s. Her obituary in [[The Irish Times|The Irish Times]] described her as "once seen as a British rival to [[Ginger Rogers|Ginger Rogers]]."
title: Sally Gray

abstract: Sophie Okonedo (born 11 August 1968) is an English film, theatre and television actress. She began her film career in the British coming-of-age drama [[Young Soul Rebels|Young Soul Rebels]] (1991) before appearing in [[Ace Ventura: When Nature Calls|Ace Ventura: When Nature Calls]] (1995) and [[Stephen Frears|Stephen Frears]]'s [[Dirty Pretty Things|Dirty Pretty Things (film)]] (2002).
title: Sophie Okonedo

abstract: Balachandra Menon (born 11 January 1954) is an Indian film actor, director and script writer. He made a number of films in the [[1980s|Malayalam films of the 1980s]] and [[1990s|Malayalam films of the 1990s]]. He has directed 40 movies and acted in over 100 movies. He won the National Film Award for Best Actor in the 1998 film [[Samaantharangal|Samaantharangal]], which was also directed by him. He has also worked as distributor, editor, composer, singer and producer in the [[Malayalam film industry|Malayalam film industry]]. He has found space in the limca book of records for the maximum number of films directed, scripted and acted in.
title: Balachandra Menon

abstract: Kelly Jones (born 3 June 1974) is a [[Welsh|Welsh people]] [[singer-songwriter|singer-songwriter]], [[lead guitar|lead guitarist]] and [[director|Film director]] and the lead singer of the band [[Stereophonics|Stereophonics]]. Influenced by classic rock bands such as [[Pink Floyd|Pink Floyd]], [[The Who|The Who]], [[Led Zeppelin|Led Zeppelin]], [[AC/DC|AC/DC]] and [[Sex Pistols|Sex Pistols]], Jones is noted for his raspy voice, which has been described as "[[whiskey|Whisky]]" and has drawn criticism as well as acclaim. As a lyricist, Jones is influenced by [[Neil Young|Neil Young]], [[Bob Catley|Bob Catley]], [[Bob Dylan|Bob Dylan]] and [[Otis Redding|Otis Redding]].
title: Kelly Jones

abstract: Ponce was born Carlos Ponce Freyre in [[Santurce, Puerto Rico|Santurce, Puerto Rico]]. His parents, Carlos Ponce, Sr. and Esther Freyre, emigrated from [[Cuba|Cuba]] after the [[Cuban Revolution|Cuban Revolution]] led by [[Fidel Castro|Fidel Castro]]. After his birth, the family moved to [[Humacao|Humacao, Puerto Rico]], where Ponce was raised. As a child, he actively participated in his school's plays and at home he would often put on a show for the family where he would sing the latest tunes. "Carlitos", as he is known in Puerto Rico, started to appear in television commercials at the age of six. He attended high school in Humacao and was a member of the school's drama club.
title: Carlos Ponce

abstract: Stacey Farber (born August 25, 1987) is a Canadian actress. She is known for playing [[Ellie Nash|Ellie Nash]] in [[seasons 2|Degrassi: The Next Generation (season 2)]] through [[7|Degrassi: The Next Generation (season 7)]] of the [[television series|television series]] [[Degrassi: The Next Generation|Degrassi: The Next Generation]]. From 2010–2011, she starred in the [[CBC|CBC Television]] series [[18 to Life|18 to Life]] with fellow Canadian [[Michael Seater|Michael Seater]] of [[Life with Derek|Life with Derek]].
