From 2014 to 2017, Farber played Sydney Katz on the Canadian medical drama [[Saving Hope|Saving Hope]].
title: Stacey Farber

abstract: Dhanya Veena, better known by her stage name Navya Nair, is an Indian film actress who has starred in [[Malayalam|Malayalam cinema]], [[Tamil|Tamil cinema]], and [[Kannada film|Kannada films]]. She is a recipient of 2 [[Kerala State Film Award for Best Actress|Kerala State Film Award for Best Actress]] and the [[Kalaimamani|Kalaimamani]] award.
title: Navya Nair

abstract: Brendan Gleeson (born 29 March 1955) is an Irish actor and film director. He is the recipient of three [[IFTA Awards|IFTA Awards]], two [[BIFA Awards|British Independent Film Awards]], and an [[Emmy Award|Emmy Award]] and has been nominated twice for a [[BAFTA Award|BAFTA Award]] and thrice for a [[Golden Globe Award|Golden Globe Award]].
title: Brendan Gleeson

abstract: Mary Kay Place (born September 23, 1947) is an American actress, singer, director, and screenwriter. She is known for portraying Loretta Haggers on the television series [[Mary Hartman, Mary Hartman|Mary Hartman, Mary Hartman]], a role that won her the 1977 [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actress - Comedy Series|Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actress - Comedy Series]]. Her numerous film appearances include [[Private Benjamin|Private Benjamin (1980 film)]] (1980), [[The Big Chill|The Big Chill (film)]] (1983), [[Captain Ron|Captain Ron]] (1992) and [[Francis Ford Coppola|Francis Ford Coppola]]'s 1997 drama, [[The Rainmaker|The Rainmaker (1997 film)]]. Place also recorded three studio albums for [[Columbia Records|Columbia Records]], one in the Haggers persona, which included the Top Ten [[country music|country music]] hit "Baby Boy."
title: Mary Kay Place

abstract: Earl Boen (; born August 8, 1941) is an American actor and voice actor, perhaps best known as criminal psychologist Dr. Peter Silberman in [[The Terminator|The Terminator]] (1984), [[Terminator 2: Judgment Day|Terminator 2: Judgment Day]] (1991) and [[Terminator 3: Rise of the Machines|Terminator 3: Rise of the Machines]] (2003). He is the only actor besides [[Arnold Schwarzenegger|Arnold Schwarzenegger]] to appear in each of the first three Terminator films.
title: Earl Boen

abstract: Robert Edward Knievel III (born May 7, 1962) is an American [[daredevil|Stunt performer]] and son of [[stunt performer|stunt performer]] [[Evel Knievel|Evel Knievel]]. He has also used the [[moniker|moniker]] "Kaptain Robbie Knievel."
title: Robbie Knievel

abstract: Navin Nischol studied in [[Bangalore Military School|Bangalore Military School]], [[Bangalore|Bangalore]], erstwhile King George Royal India Military College, [[Bangalore|Bangalore]]. He was the first gold medalist from the [[Film and Television Institute of India|Film and Television Institute of India]] to make it big. He starred in several superhits, such as [[Victoria No. 203|Victoria No. 203]] (1972) and [[Dhund|Dhund (1973 film)]] (1973) [[Aashiq Banaya Aapne|Aashiq Banaya Aapne]] (2005), [[Hanste Zakhm|Hanste Zakhm]] was the great breakthrough of his career. Later on, [[Nischol|Nischol]] switched to character roles and carved out a successful career for himself on television. One of his most successful serials on television was [[Dekh Bhai Dekh|Dekh Bhai Dekh]], co-starring [[Sushma Seth|Sushma Seth]], [[Shekhar Suman|Shekhar Suman]] and [[Farida Jalal|Farida Jalal]]. He also starred in the [[Punjabi|Punjabi language]] films [[Aasra Pyar Da|Aasra Pyar Da]] (1983) and [[Mahaul Theek Hai|Mahaul Theek Hai]] (1999).
title: Navin Nischol

abstract: In 2002, Robinson released her first solo album [[Dawn|Dawn (Dawn Robinson album)]], which produced the single "[[Envious|Envious (song)]]". In 2005, Robinson rejoined [[En Vogue|En Vogue]] for a tour, but departed from the group before they could record another album. In 2009, Robinson briefly returned to [[En Vogue|En Vogue]] again for their 20th Anniversary Tour. In 2010, she left [[En Vogue|En Vogue]] once again due to poor management and compensation of work. In 2013, she joined the cast of [[R&B Divas: Los Angeles|R&B Divas: Los Angeles]] for the first season of the series. Throughout her career, Robinson has sold a combined total of over 11 million records as a solo artist as well as with [[En Vogue|En Vogue]] and [[Lucy Pearl|Lucy Pearl]]. Her work has earned her several awards and nominations, including two [[American Music Awards|American Music Awards]], a [[Billboard Music Award|Billboard Music Award]], seven [[MTV Video Music Awards|MTV Video Music Awards]], four [[Soul Train Music Awards|Soul Train Music Awards]] and eight [[Grammy|Grammy]] nominations.
title: Dawn Robinson

abstract: Sheryl Rose Anna Marie Sonora Cruz (born April 5, 1974 in [[Makati City|Makati City]], [[Philippines|Philippines]]), better known simply as Sheryl Cruz, is a [[Filipina|Filipino people]] [[actress|actress]] and [[singer|singer]]. She is known for her role as [[Divina Ferrer|Divina Ferrer]] in 2007's television drama series [[Sinasamba Kita|Sinasamba Kita]], and as Valeria on [[Bakekang|Bakekang]] and the Philippine remake of [[Rosalinda|Rosalinda (Philippines TV series)]].
title: Sheryl Cruz

abstract: Sam Rockwell (born November 5, 1968) is an American actor. Rockwell became known for his leading roles in [[Lawn Dogs|Lawn Dogs]] (1997), [[Confessions of a Dangerous Mind|Confessions of a Dangerous Mind]] (2002), [[Matchstick Men|Matchstick Men]] (2003), [[The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy|The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy (film)]] (2005), [[Moon|Moon (film)]] (2009), [[G-Force|G-Force (film)]] (2009) and [[Seven Psychopaths|Seven Psychopaths]] (2012). He has received accolades for his supporting roles in [[The Green Mile|The Green Mile (film)]] (1999), [[Galaxy Quest|Galaxy Quest]] (1999), [[The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford|The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford]] (2007), [[Frost/Nixon|Frost/Nixon (film)]] (2008), [[Iron Man 2|Iron Man 2]] (2010), [[Conviction|Conviction (2010 film)]] (2010) and [[The Way, Way Back|The Way, Way Back]] (2013).
title: Sam Rockwell

abstract: Ai Takahashi joined Japanese idol group Morning Musume in 2001 as part of the group's fifth generation, along with [[Makoto Ogawa|Makoto Ogawa]], [[Asami Konno|Asami Konno]], and [[Risa Niigaki|Risa Niigaki]].
title: Ai Takahashi

abstract: Aparna Sen (, Ôporna Shen; born 25 October 1945) is an Indian filmmaker, screenwriter and actress who is known for her work in [[Bengali cinema|Cinema of West Bengal]]. A leading actress of the late 1960s and 1970s she has received eight [[BFJA Award|BFJA Awards]], five for best actress, two for best supporting actress and one for lifetime achievement. She is the winner of nine [[National Film Awards|National Film Awards]] and nine international film festival awards for her direction in films. She was awarded the [[Padma Shri|Padma Shri]], the fourth highest civilian award, by the government of India in 1987.
title: Aparna Sen

abstract: Fraser was born in [[Southwark|Southwark]], London. Her year of birth was usually cited as 1933, which she gave when auditioning for her role in [[I'm All Right Jack|I'm All Right Jack]], because the [[Boulting Brothers|Boulting Brothers]] wanted someone younger for the part. In fact she was three years older, as she confirmed in her autobiography, Liz Fraser ... and Other Characters, published by Signum Books in 2012. Her father was a travelling salesman for a brewery and her mother owned a shop just off the [[New Kent Road|New Kent Road]]. Their family life was disrupted by the [[Second World War|Second World War]], when she was evacuated, initially to [[Westerham|Westerham]] in [[Kent|Kent]] and then, when that was deemed still too vulnerable to bombing, to [[Chudleigh|Chudleigh]], a village in [[Devon|Devon]]. Her father died in May 1942, aged 40, when she was 11.
title: Liz Fraser

abstract: Farah Khan was born on 9 January 1965. Her father, Kamran Khan, is a stuntman-turned-filmmaker. Her mother, Menaka Irani, is the sister of former child actors [[Honey Irani|Honey Irani]] and [[Daisy Irani|Daisy Irani (actress)]]. Farah is thus a first cousin of film personalities [[Farhan Akhtar|Farhan Akhtar]] and [[Zoya Akhtar|Zoya Akhtar]] (children of Honey Irani). She has one brother, [[Sajid Khan|Sajid Khan (director)]], who is a comedian, actor and film director.
title: Farah Khan

abstract: Edie Adams (born Edith Elizabeth Enke, April 16, 1927   – October 15, 2008) was an American comedienne, actress, singer and businesswoman. She was an [[Emmy Award|Emmy Award]] and [[Tony Award|Tony Award]] winner.
title: Edie Adams

abstract: He was born Frederick Liedtke (several sources give "Frederico Nobile", apparently erroneously) in [[York|York, Nebraska]], Nebraska, to a [[French|French people]] mother and a father who had served as a [[captain|Captain (armed forces)]] in the [[American Civil War|American Civil War]] and was wounded at the [[Battle of Gettysburg|Battle of Gettysburg]]. Using the [[stage name|stage name]], Fred Niblo, Liedtke began his [[show business|show business]] career performing in [[vaudeville|vaudeville]] and in [[live theater|Theatre]]. After more than twenty years doing live performing as a [[monologist|monologist]], during which he traveled extensively around the globe, he worked in [[Australia|Australia]] from 1912 through 1915, where he turned to the burgeoning [[motion picture industry|Film industry]] and made his first two films.
title: Fred Niblo

abstract: Barbara Barrie (born Barbara Ann Berman, May 23, 1931) is an American actress of film, stage and television. She is also an accomplished author.
title: Barbara Barrie

abstract: Jennifer Hetrick (born May 12, 1958) is an American [[actress|actress]]. She is known for playing [[Vash|Vash (Star Trek)]] in [[Star Trek: The Next Generation|Star Trek: The Next Generation]] and [[Star Trek: Deep Space Nine|Star Trek: Deep Space Nine]], and Corrinne Becker (the ex-wife of Arnie Becker) on [[L.A. Law|L.A. Law]].
title: Jennifer Hetrick

abstract: Freddie Starr (born Frederick Leslie Fowell, 9 January 1943) is an English comedian, impressionist, singer and actor. Starr was the lead singer of [[Merseybeat|Beat music]] pop group the Midniters during the early 1960s, and came to prominence in the early 1970s after appearing on [[Opportunity Knocks|Opportunity Knocks (UK TV series)]] and the [[Royal Variety Performance|Royal Variety Performance]].
title: Freddie Starr

abstract: Alan Fudge (February 27, 1944 – October 10, 2011) was an American [[actor|actor]] known for being part of the cast of four [[television program|television programs]]: [[Man from Atlantis|Man from Atlantis]], [[Eischied|Eischied]], [[Paper Dolls|Paper Dolls]] and Bodies of Evidence, along with a recurring role (eighteen appearances over eight years, as of 2005) on [[7th Heaven|7th Heaven (TV series)]].
title: Alan Fudge

abstract: Jason Behr (born December 30, 1973) is an [[American|United States]] [[film|film]] and [[television|television]] [[actor|actor]]. He first starred in the American television series [[Roswell|Roswell (TV series)]], for which he was twice nominated for a [[Saturn Award|Saturn Award]], followed by roles in the films [[The Shipping News|The Shipping News (film)]] and the American remake of the Japanese horror film [[The Grudge|The Grudge]]. Behr has also had a series of guest appearances in various television shows like [[Step by Step|Step by Step (TV series)]], [[The Profiler|Profiler (TV series)]], [[7th Heaven|7th Heaven (TV series)]], [[Buffy the Vampire Slayer|Buffy the Vampire Slayer (TV series)]], [[JAG|JAG (TV series)]] and had a recurring role in the American television series [[Dawson's Creek|Dawson's Creek]].
title: Jason Behr

abstract: Julie Dreyfus (born January 24, 1966) is a [[French|French people]] actress. Dreyfus is well known in Japan where she made her TV debut on a French-language lesson program on [[NHK|NHK]]'s educational channel in the late 1980s. She has appeared on the [[TV|TV]] show Ryōri no Tetsujin ([[Iron Chef|Iron Chef]]) as a guest and judge. She is best known to western audiences for her appearances in the [[Quentin Tarantino|Quentin Tarantino]] films [[Kill Bill|Kill Bill]] and [[Inglourious Basterds|Inglourious Basterds]], in which she played [[Sofie Fatale|Sofie Fatale]] and Francesca Mondino respectively. Aside from her native [[French|French language]] she is fluent in [[Japanese|Japanese language]] and [[English|English language]].
title: Julie Dreyfus

abstract: Greg Cipes was born in [[Coral Springs, Florida|Coral Springs, Florida]], the son of Robin Mrasek and Geoff Cipes. He was ranked the number 3 Junior Professional Surfer in the U.S. in 1998, the year he began his career in cinema.
title: Greg Cipes

abstract: John Banner (born Johann Banner, 28 January 1910   – 28 January 1973) was an [[Austrian|Austrians]]-born American film and television actor. He is best known for his role as [[Master Sergeant Schultz|Hogan's Heroes#Sergeant Schultz]] in the [[situation comedy|situation comedy]] [[Hogan's Heroes|Hogan's Heroes]] (1965–1971). Schultz, constantly encountering evidence that the inmates of his [[stalag|stalag]] were planning mayhem, frequently feigned ignorance with the [[catchphrase|catchphrase]], "I see nothing! I hear nothing! I know nothing!" (or, more commonly as the series went on, "I know nothing, nothing!").
title: John Banner

abstract: Robert Lopez was born in [[Manhattan|Manhattan]], to Katherine (Lowe) and Frank Lopez. His father was director of publications for [[NYU Langone Medical Center|NYU Langone Medical Center]].
title: Robert Lopez

abstract: Daniel Dominik Kaiser-Küblböck (born 27 August 1985; [[disappeared 9 September 2018|Daniel Küblböck#2018 disappearance]]) was a German pop singer and actor who achieved celebrity status in 2002 as a participant in the first season of talent show [[Deutschland sucht den Superstar|Deutschland sucht den Superstar]] (DSDS), the German version of [[Pop Idol|Pop Idol]], in which he came third. He was briefly promoted as Daniel K, but relinquished this name as it had already been trademarked. In September 2018 he went missing while travelling on a cruise ship and is presumed deceased.
title: Daniel Küblböck

abstract: Mark Alexander Knox (born April 15, 1970), better known as Flex Alexander or Flex, is an American [[actor|actor]], [[comedian|comedian]] and [[dancer|dancer]].
title: Flex Alexander

abstract: Richard Jude Ciccolella (born November 30, 1947), is an American [[character actor|character actor]], perhaps best known for his role as [[Mike Novick|Mike Novick]] on [[24|24 (TV series)]].
title: Jude Ciccolella

abstract: Adrienne Eliza Houghton ([[née|Name at birth]] Bailon; born October 24, 1983) is an American [[singer|singer]], actress and TV personality. Adrienne Bailon first became publicly known when she rose to fame as one of the founding members and singer of both [[3LW|3LW]] (1999–2007) and [[The Cheetah Girls|The Cheetah Girls (group)]] (2003–2008).
title: Adrienne Bailon

abstract: Marisol Nichols (born November 2, 1973) is an American actress. She is best known for her role in the sixth season of [[24|24 (TV series)]] as Special Agent [[Nadia Yassir|Nadia Yassir]] and as [[Hermione Lodge|Hermione Lodge]] in the 2017 thriller series [[Riverdale|Riverdale (2017 TV series)]].
title: Marisol Nichols

abstract: Sue Johnston, [[OBE|Order of the British Empire]] (née Wright; born 7 December 1943) is an English actress known for playing [[Sheila Grant|Sheila Grant]] in the [[Channel 4|Channel 4]] [[soap opera|soap opera]] [[Brookside|Brookside]] (1982–1990), Barbara Royle in the BBC comedy [[The Royle Family|The Royle Family]] (1998–2012), Grace Foley in the BBC drama [[Waking the Dead|Waking the Dead (TV series)]] (2000–2011), [[Gloria Price|Gloria Price]] in the [[ITV|ITV Network]] soap opera [[Coronation Street|Coronation Street]] (2012–2014) and Miss Denker in the ITV drama [[Downton Abbey|Downton Abbey]] (2014–2015). She won the 2000 [[British Comedy Award|British Comedy Award]] for Best TV Comedy Actress and was nominated for the 2000 [[BAFTA TV Award for Best Comedy Performance|British Academy Television Award for Best Comedy Performance]] for The Royle Family.
title: Sue Johnston

abstract: Benoît Jacquot (; born 5 February 1947) is a French [[film director|film director]] and screenwriter who has had a varied career in [[European cinema|European cinema]].
title: Benoît Jacquot

abstract: Ona Grauer is a Mexican-Canadian actress, best known for her portrayal of the [[Ancient|Ancient (Stargate)]] [[Ayiana|Ayiana]] and later [[Emily Young|Emily Young (Stargate)]] in the science fiction television program [[Stargate Universe|Stargate Universe]], part of the [[Stargate|Stargate]] franchise. Most recently, she has been a voice actress on the FX hit show [[Archer|Archer (2009 TV series)]], where she voices the recurring character Katya Kazanova, as well as a woman impersonating Veronica Deane.
title: Ona Grauer

abstract: Ellie Cornell (born December 15, 1963) is an American actress and producer. She made her film debut in the 1988 film [[Married to the Mob|Married to the Mob]] before becoming known for her role as [[Rachel Carruthers|List of Halloween characters#Rachel Carruthers]] in [[Halloween 4: The Return of Michael Myers|Halloween 4: The Return of Michael Myers]] (1988) and [[Halloween 5: The Revenge of Michael Myers|Halloween 5: The Revenge of Michael Myers]] (1989).
title: Ellie Cornell

abstract: Mikhail Vartanov (, , b. February 21, 1937, RSFSR, [[Soviet Union|Soviet Union]], now Russian Federation, d. December 31, 2009, Hollywood, California) was a film director, cinematographer, documentarian, essayist, photographer and artist who developed a style of documentary filmmaking termed the “[[direction of undirected action|direction of undirected action]].”
title: Mikhail Vartanov

abstract: Cherry Jones (born November 21, 1956) is an American actress. A five-time [[Tony Award|Tony Award]] nominee for her work on [[Broadway|Broadway (theatre)]], she won the [[Tony Award for Best Actress in a Play|Tony Award for Best Actress in a Play]] for the 1995 revival of [[The Heiress|The Heiress (1947 play)]] and for the 2005 original production of [[Doubt|Doubt (play)]]. She won the 2009 [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Drama Series|Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Drama Series]] for her role as [[Allison Taylor|Allison Taylor]] on the [[FOX|Fox Broadcasting Company]] television series [[24|24 (TV series)]]. She has also won three [[Drama Desk Awards|Drama Desk Awards]].
title: Cherry Jones

abstract: Coleen Gray (born Doris Bernice Jensen; October 23, 1922 – August 3, 2015) was an American actress. She was best known for her roles in the films [[Nightmare Alley|Nightmare Alley (1947 film)]] (1947), [[Red River|Red River (1948 film)]] (1948), and [[Stanley Kubrick|Stanley Kubrick]]'s [[The Killing|The Killing (film)]] (1956).
title: Coleen Gray

abstract: Robert Ellenstein (June 18, 1923 – October 28, 2010) was an American actor.
title: Robert Ellenstein

abstract: Adrian Grenier (born July 10, 1976) is an American actor, producer, director, musician and environmentalist. He is best known for playing [[Vincent Chase|Vincent Chase]] in the TV series [[Entourage|Entourage (U.S. TV series)]] (2004–2011). He starred in the films [[Drive Me Crazy|Drive Me Crazy]], [[The Devil Wears Prada|The Devil Wears Prada (film)]], and [[Entourage|Entourage (film)]].
title: Adrian Grenier

abstract: Ali Azmat (born 20 April 1970) is a Pakistani singer-songwriter, musician and actor. He is best known as the lead singer for the influential [[Sufi Rock|Sufi Rock]] band [[Junoon|Junoon (band)]] and for his subsequent solo career. In 2001, he became part of the first Pakistani band (Junoon) ever to perform at the United Nations General Assembly.
title: Ali Azmat

abstract: Claude Comair (born February 3, 1958) is the founder of [[DigiPen Institute of Technology|DigiPen Institute of Technology]] and co-founder of the [[Nintendo Software Technology|Nintendo Software Technology]] Corporation. While at [[Nintendo Software Technology|Nintendo Software Technology]], a subsidiary of Nintendo Co. Ltd. of [[Kyoto|Kyoto]], Comair held the title of [[Chairman|Chairman]] and [[CTO|Chief technology officer]], and later, Chairman of the Board. Comair continues to be the President and CEO of [[DigiPen Institute of Technology|DigiPen Institute of Technology]] to the present day.
title: Claude Comair

abstract: Nicole Ari Parker-Kodjoe (born October 7, 1970) is an American actress and model. She made her screen debut with a leading role in the critically acclaimed independent film [[The Incredibly True Adventure of Two Girls in Love|The Incredibly True Adventure of Two Girls in Love]] (1995), and later went to appear in [[Boogie Nights|Boogie Nights]] (1997) directed by [[Paul Thomas Anderson|Paul Thomas Anderson]].
title: Nicole Ari Parker

abstract: Patricia Quinn, Lady Stephens (born 28 May 1944) is a [[Northern Irish|Northern Irish people]] actress, voice artist and singer best known for her role as Magenta in the film [[The Rocky Horror Picture Show|The Rocky Horror Picture Show]] (1975), and the [[original stage play|The Rocky Horror Show]] from which it was adapted.
title: Patricia Quinn

abstract: Jay Karnes (born June 27, 1963) is an American actor, best known for his role as LAPD detective [[Holland "Dutch" Wagenbach|Holland "Dutch" Wagenbach]] on the [[FX|FX Networks]] television series [[The Shield|The Shield]].
title: Jay Karnes

abstract: Gina Philips (née Consolo; born May 10, 1970) is an American actress. She had recurring roles on [[David E. Kelley|David E. Kelley]]'s [[Ally McBeal|Ally McBeal]], as Sandy Hingle, and [[Boston Public|Boston Public]], as Jenna Miller. She starred as Patricia "Trish" Jenner in the 2001 horror film [[Jeepers Creepers|Jeepers Creepers (2001 film)]], and reprised her role in a cameo in [[Jeepers Creepers 3|Jeepers Creepers 3]], released in 2017.
title: Gina Philips

abstract: Arielle Dombasle (born April 27, 1953) is an American-born French singer, actress, director and model. Her breakthrough roles were in [[Éric Rohmer|Éric Rohmer]]'s [[Pauline at the Beach|Pauline à la plage]] (1983) and [[Alain Robbe-Grillet|Alain Robbe-Grillet]]'s [[The Blue Villa|The Blue Villa]] (1995). She is best known to American audiences for her appearances on [[Miami Vice|Miami Vice]] where she played Kelly in Season 2, episode 12. The episode was entitled "Definitely Miami". She was also one of the main characters in the 1984 miniseries [[Lace|Lace (TV series)]]. Since 1978 she has released twenty-one singles and ten albums and has directed four movies.
title: Arielle Dombasle

abstract: Philippe Ramos (born 1966) is a [[French|France]] [[film director|film director]], screenwriter and film editor. He directed an adaptation of [[Moby-Dick|Moby-Dick]]: [[Capitaine Achab|Capitaine Achab]] with [[Valérie Crunchant|Valérie Crunchant]] and Frédéric Bonpart in 2004.
title: Philippe Ramos

abstract: Hana Makhmalbaf () (born September 3, 1988 in [[Tehran|Tehran]]) is an [[Iranian|Iranian peoples]] filmmaker. She is the younger sister of filmmaker [[Samira Makhmalbaf|Samira Makhmalbaf]] and daughter of filmmakers [[Mohsen Makhmalbaf|Mohsen Makhmalbaf]] and [[Marzieh Makhmalbaf|Marzieh Meshkini]]. She is known for her films, [[Joy of Madness (2003)|Joy of Madness]], [[Buddha Collapsed Out of Shame (2007)|Buddha Collapsed out of Shame]] and [[Green Days (2009)|Green Days (2009)]]. Makhmalbaf won the Lina Mangiacapre Award at the [[Venice Film Festival|Venice Film Festival]] in 2003 for [[Joy of Madness (2003)|At Five in the Afternoon]] . Joy of Madness also won the Special Jury Prize at [[Tokyo Filmex|Tokyo Filmex]]. Makhmalbaf's film Buddha Collapsed Out of Shame won various awards as well, such as the Paolo Ungari UNICEF Prize from the [[Rome Film Festival|Rome Film Festival]] and the Peace Film Award at the [[Berlin International Film Festival|Berlin International Film Festival]].
title: Hana Makhmalbaf

abstract: Timothy Busfield (born June 12, 1957) is an American [[actor|actor]] and [[director|Television director]]. He has played Elliot Weston on the television series [[thirtysomething|Thirtysomething (TV series)]]; Mark, [[Kevin Costner|Kevin Costner]]'s brother-in-law in [[Field of Dreams|Field of Dreams]]; and [[Danny Concannon|Danny Concannon]] on the television series [[The West Wing|The West Wing (television)]]. In 1991 he received a [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Drama Series|Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Drama Series]] for [[thirtysomething|thirtysomething]]. He is also the founder of the 501(c)(3) non-profit children's theatre Fantasy Theatre for Children and [[B Street Theatre|B street theatre]].
title: Timothy Busfield

abstract: Charles Dance was born in [[Rednal|Rednal]], [[West Midlands|West Midlands (county)]], the son of Eleanor Marion ([[née|married and maiden names]] Perks, 1911-1984), a cook, and Walter Dance (1874–1949), an electrical engineer who had previously served during the [[Boer War|Boer War]] in South Africa. Growing up in [[Plymouth|Plymouth]], he attended Widey Technical School for Boys (it closed when known as Widey High School in 1988) in [[Crownhill|Crownhill]]. Dance later attended The Leicester College of Arts (now known as [[De Montfort University|De Montfort University]]), where he studied Graphic Design and Photography.
title: Charles Dance

abstract: Alana de la Garza (born June 18, 1976) is an American actress. She is best known for her roles as [[Connie Rubirosa|Connie Rubirosa]] on the NBC television series [[Law & Order|Law & Order]], [[Law & Order: LA|Law & Order: LA]], and [[Law & Order: Special Victims Unit|Law & Order: Special Victims Unit]], and as Marisol Delko-Caine on [[CSI: Miami|CSI: Miami]]. In 2014 and 2015, she starred as Detective Jo Martinez in the ABC series [[Forever|Forever (2014 TV series)]]. From 2016 to 2017, she starred in [[Criminal Minds: Beyond Borders|Criminal Minds: Beyond Borders]] as [[Special Agent Clara Seger|Clara Seger]].
title: Alana de la Garza

abstract: Diane Farr was born on September 7, 1969, in [[New York City, New York|New York City, New York]]. She is of Irish and Italian descent. Farr studied drama at [[New York's|New York (state)]] [[Stony Brook University|State University of New York at Stony Brook]] and [[Loughborough University|Loughborough University]] in England and graduated with a joint B.A. from these two universities.
title: Diane Farr

abstract: Justin Chatwin (born October 31, 1982) is a Canadian actor, known for his roles in films like [[War of the Worlds|War of the Worlds (2005 film)]] (2005), [[The Invisible|The Invisible (film)]] (2007), and [[Dragonball Evolution|Dragonball Evolution]] (2009).
title: Justin Chatwin

abstract: Lenny Venito (born May 10, 1969 in [[Brooklyn, New York|Brooklyn, New York]]) is an American [[actor|actor]], who has made appearances in movies such as [[Gigli|Gigli (film)]], [[Men in Black 3|Men in Black 3]], and [[War of the Worlds|War of the Worlds (2005 film)]]. He also starred as Marty Weaver in the [[ABC|American Broadcasting Company]] comedy [[The Neighbors|The Neighbors (2012 TV series)]].
title: Lenny Venito

abstract: Paula Wilcox (born 13 December 1949) is an English actress. She is best known for roles in TV shows such as [[Girlfriends|Girlfriends (2018 TV series)]], [[Upstart Crow|Upstart Crow]], [[Mount Pleasant|Mount Pleasant (TV series)]], [[Boomers|Boomers (TV series)]], [[Emmerdale|Emmerdale]], [[The Smoking Room|The Smoking Room]], [[The Queen’s Nose|The Queen's Nose (TV series)]] and [[Man About The House|Man About the House]].
title: Paula Wilcox

abstract: Lisa Edelstein (; born May 21, 1966) is an American actress and playwright. Edelstein is known for playing Dr. [[Lisa Cuddy|Lisa Cuddy]] on the [[Fox|Fox Broadcasting Company]] medical drama series [[House|House (TV series)]]. Between 2014 and 2018, she starred as Abby McCarthy in the [[Bravo|Bravo (U.S. TV channel)]] series [[Girlfriends' Guide to Divorce|Girlfriends' Guide to Divorce]].
title: Lisa Edelstein

abstract: Isabella Hofmann (born December 11, 1958) is an American actress.
title: Isabella Hofmann

abstract: Miguel Arteta (born 1965) is a Puerto Rican director of film and television, known for his [[independent film|independent film]] [[Chuck & Buck|Chuck & Buck]] (2000), for which he received the [[Independent Spirit John Cassavetes Award|Independent Spirit John Cassavetes Award]], and for the films [[The Good Girl|The Good Girl]] (2002) and [[Cedar Rapids|Cedar Rapids (film)]] (2011).
title: Miguel Arteta

abstract: Reminisce Mackie ([[née|née]] Smith; May 30, 1980), known professionally as Remy Ma, is an American rapper. She was initially discovered by [[Big Pun|Big Pun]], and came to prominence for her work as a member of [[Fat Joe|Fat Joe]]’s group, [[Terror Squad|Terror Squad (group)]]. In 2006, she released her debut studio album [[There's Something About Remy: Based on a True Story|There's Something About Remy: Based on a True Story]], which was a modest success, peaking at number 33 on the [[Billboard 200|Billboard 200]] chart. She is one of only five female rappers to ever top the [[Billboard Hot 100|Billboard Hot 100]] chart (as a member of Terror Squad on "Lean Back"), and one of only three multiple winners of the [[BET Award for Best Female Hip-Hop Artist|BET Award for Best Female Hip-Hop Artist]], which she won in 2005 and 2017.
title: Remy Ma

abstract: Yee Jee Tso (born March 10, 1975 in China) is a [[Canadian|Canadians]] actor.
title: Yee Jee Tso

abstract: Dennis Spooner (1 December 1932 – 20 September 1986) was an [[English|English people]] television writer and [[script editor|script editor]], known primarily for his [[programmes about fictional spies|spy fiction]] and his work in [[children's television|children's television]] in the 1960s. He had long-lasting professional working relationships with a number of other British screenwriters and producers, notably [[Brian Clemens|Brian Clemens]], [[Terry Nation|Terry Nation]], [[Monty Berman|Monty Berman]] and [[Richard Harris|Richard Harris (television writer)]], with whom he developed several programmes. Though he was a contributor to [[BBC|BBC]] programmes, his work made him one of the most prolific writers of televised output from [[ITC Entertainment|ITC Entertainment]].
title: Dennis Spooner

abstract: Fiona Phillips (born 1 January 1961) is an English journalist, broadcaster and television presenter. She is best known for her presenting roles with the [[ITV Breakfast|ITV Breakfast]] programme [[GMTV Today|GMTV Today]].
title: Fiona Phillips

abstract: Vaitiare Hirshon-Asars (born Vaitiare Eugenia Hirshon; August 15, 1964), previously known as Vaitiare Bandera, is an actress based in the [[United States|United States]].
title: Vaitiare Bandera

abstract: Ta-Tanisha (born Shirley Cummings on January 15, 1953 in [[the Bronx, New York|the Bronx, New York]]) is an [[African American|African American]] [[character actress|character actress]], best known for her role as Pam Simpson on the television series [[Room 222|Room 222]], which she played from 1970 to 1972.
title: Ta-Tanisha

abstract: Steve McCurry is an American photographer, [[freelancer|freelancer]] and photojournalist. His most famous photo is of the "[[Afghan Girl|Afghan Girl]]", the girl with the piercing green eyes that periodically appears on the cover of [[National Geographic|National Geographic]]. McCurry has photographed many assignments for National Geographic and has been a member of [[Magnum|Magnum Photos]] since 1986.
title: Steve McCurry

abstract: Sharni Vinson (born 22 July 1983) is an Australian model, dancer and actress best known for her roles in [[Home and Away|Home and Away]], [[Bait 3D|Bait 3D]], [[Step Up 3D|Step Up 3D]] and [[You're Next|You're Next]].
title: Sharni Vinson

abstract: Benito Alfonso Bedoya y Díaz de Guzmán (April 16, 1904 – December 15, 1957) was a [[Mexican|Mexico]] actor who frequently appeared in U.S. films.
title: Alfonso Bedoya

abstract: Jane Badler (born December 31, 1953, in [[Brooklyn, New York|Brooklyn, New York]]) is an [[American|Americans]] actress and singer. She is best known for her role as [[Diana|Diana (V TV series)]], the main antagonist in [[NBC|NBC]]'s [[science fiction|science fiction]] series, [[V|V (1983 miniseries)]], between 1983 and 1985. Badler also appeared in [[ABC|American Broadcasting Company]]'s "reimagined" version of [[V|V (2009 TV series)]] in 2011, again playing an alien named Diana, who this time is the mother of the series' chief antagonist, Anna. In recent years, Badler has also become an established [[nightclub singer|nightclub act]] in [[Australia|Australia]], where she now lives, and has released three albums.
title: Jane Badler

abstract: Jamie Bamber holds dual citizenship in Britain, Ireland, and the United States through his American father and Irish mother.
title: Jamie Bamber

abstract: Tia Texada (born December 14, 1971) is an American actress. She is best known for her role as Cruz on the NBC series [[Third Watch|Third Watch]], and her recurring role as an undercover agent Ribera on [[The Unit|The Unit]] for CBS. Other roles include, [[In Plain Sight|In Plain Sight]], [[Saving Grace|Saving Grace (TV series)]], Chuck for NBC, HBO's [[Mind of the Married Man|The Mind of the Married Man]], [[Everybody Hates Chris|Everybody Hates Chris]], [[The Amazing Spider-Man|The Amazing Spider-Man (2012 film)]] [[feature film|feature film]], [[Batman Beyond|Batman Beyond]], [[Static Shock|Static Shock]], [[Firebreather|Firebreather (film)]], and [[Handy Manny|Handy Manny]]. She was the voice of Maybelline New York for 15 years, the number-one selling cosmetic brand in the world, and during her campaign of "Maybe Shes Born With it... Maybe It's Maybelline...", it was named Brand of the Year and Launch of the Year for Lash Sensational. She was first female live announcer for the Espy Awards, where she worked alongside [[Justin Timberlake|Justin Timberlake]], [[Jamie Foxx|Jamie Foxx]], [[LeBron James|LeBron James]], and [[Samuel L. Jackson|Samuel L. Jackson]] for seven years. She was the voice of the winning Golden Trailer award for RoboCop feature film. Tia was the voice for launching [[Super Bowl 50|Super Bowl 50]] for The NFL Today on CBS, Flesh and Bone for Starz, Lindt Gold Bunny, Zales, Unstoppable Collection, JC Penney World Cup Soccer IS for Girls, World Series of Poker Lady Luck for ESPN, and Skittles 'Taste the Rainbow'. Tia was born with severe [[strabismus|strabismus]] and after surgery to correct this and wearing an eye patch, she took an acting class to help with her shyness, which led to her career as an actress.
title: Tia Texada

abstract: Leslie Hendrix (born June 5, 1960) is an [[American|United States]] actress. She is best known for playing the role of [[medical examiner|medical examiner]] Elizabeth Rodgers on four Law & Order series ([[Law & Order|Law & Order]], [[Law & Order: Special Victims Unit|Law & Order: Special Victims Unit]], [[Law & Order: Criminal Intent|Law & Order: Criminal Intent]] and [[Law & Order: Trial by Jury|Law & Order: Trial by Jury]]). She also played Judge Hannah Lampert on the soap opera [[All My Children|All My Children]]. In the third season of [[Gotham|Gotham (TV series)]] she plays Kathryn Monroe, the mysterious leader of the [[Court of Owls|Court of Owls]].
title: Leslie Hendrix

abstract: Ralph Waite (June 22, 1928 – February 13, 2014) was an American actor and political activist, best known for his role as [[John Walton, Sr.|List of The Waltons characters]] on [[The Waltons|The Waltons]] (1972–1981), which he occasionally directed. He also had a recurring role in [[NCIS|NCIS (TV series)]] as [[Jackson Gibbs|List of NCIS characters#Jackson Gibbs]], the father of [[Leroy Jethro Gibbs|Leroy Jethro Gibbs]]. Waite had supporting roles in movies like [[Five Easy Pieces|Five Easy Pieces]] (1970), [[The Grissom Gang|The Grissom Gang]] (1971), [[The Bodyguard|The Bodyguard (1992 film)]] (1992), and [[Cliffhanger|Cliffhanger (film)]] (1993).
title: Ralph Waite

abstract: Veronica Hamel (born November 20, 1943, in [[Philadelphia|Philadelphia]]) is an [[American|United States]] [[actress|actress]] and model.
title: Veronica Hamel

abstract: Darlene Vogel (born October 25, 1962) is an [[American|United States]] actress who was a [[model|Model (person)]] and did commercials before getting into acting.
title: Darlene Vogel

abstract: Irene Hervey (born Beulah Irene Herwick; July 11, 1909December 20, 1998) was an American film, stage, and television actress who appeared in over fifty films and numerous television series spanning her five-decade career.
title: Irene Hervey

abstract: Macchio was born in [[Huntington, New York|Huntington, New York]]. He is the son of Rosalie (née DeSantis) and Ralph Macchio, Sr., who owned a ranch. His father is of half Greek and half Italian descent, and his mother is of [[Italian|Italian American]] ancestry. In a 1980 screen test, Macchio stated his family is from [[Naples|Naples]].
title: Ralph Macchio

abstract: James William Ercolani (born June 8, 1936), known by his stage name James Darren, is an American television and film actor, television director, and singer.
title: James Darren

abstract: Michael York, [[OBE|Order of the British Empire]] (born Michael Hugh Johnson; 27 March 1942) is an [[English|England]] actor. A two-time [[Emmy Award|Emmy Award]] nominee, for [[ABC Afterschool Special|ABC Afterschool Special]]: [[Are You My Mother?|Are You My Mother?]] (1986) and the [[AMC|AMC (TV channel)]] series [[The Lot|The Lot]] (2001), he has appeared in more than 70 films, including [[Romeo and Juliet|Romeo and Juliet (1968 film)]] (1968), [[Cabaret|Cabaret (1972 film)]] (1972), [[The Three Musketeers|The Three Musketeers (1973 film)]] (1973), [[Logan's Run|Logan's Run (film)]] (1976), and the [[Austin Powers|Austin Powers (film series)]] film series (1997–2002).
title: Michael York

abstract: Savitri Devi Mukherji (30 September 1905 – 22 October 1982) was the pseudonym of the [[Greek|Greeks]]-[[French|France]]-[[Italian|Italy]] writer Maximiani Portas (; also spelled Maximine Portaz), a prominent proponent of [[deep ecology|deep ecology]] and [[Nazism|Nazism]], who served the [[Axis|Axis powers]] cause during [[World War II|World War II]] by [[spying|espionage]] on [[Allied|Allies of World War II]] forces in [[India|India]]. She wrote about [[animal rights|animal rights]] movements and was a leading member of the Nazi underground during the 1960s.
title: Savitri Devi

abstract: Denis Villeneuve (; born October 3, 1967) is a [[French Canadian|French Canadians]] film director and writer. He is a four-time recipient of the [[Canadian Screen Award|Canadian Screen Award]] (formerly [[Genie Award|Genie Awards]]) for [[Best Direction|Academy of Canadian Cinema and Television Award for Best Achievement in Direction]], for [[Maelström|Maelström (film)]] in 2001, [[Polytechnique|Polytechnique (film)]] in 2009, [[Incendies|Incendies]] in 2011, and [[Enemy|Enemy (2013 film)]] in 2014. The first three of these films also won the [[Academy of Canadian Cinema and Television Award for Best Motion Picture|Academy of Canadian Cinema and Television Award for Best Motion Picture]].
title: Denis Villeneuve

abstract: Eva Ulrika Jonsson (born 16 August 1967) is a Swedish television presenter and model living and working in the UK. She became known as a [[TV-am|TV-am]] weather presenter and moved on to present [[Gladiators|Gladiators (1992 UK TV series)]] and became a team captain of the show [[Shooting Stars|Shooting Stars (TV series)]].
title: Ulrika Jonsson

abstract: Betty Field (February 8, 1913 – September 13, 1973) was an American film and stage actress.
title: Betty Field

abstract: Ann Sothern (born Harriette Arlene Lake; January 22, 1909   – March 15, 2001) was an American actress who worked on stage, radio, film, and television, in a career that spanned nearly six decades. Sothern began her career in the late 1920s in bit parts in films. In 1930, she made her Broadway stage debut and soon worked her way up to starring roles. In 1939, [[MGM|MGM]] cast her as [[Maisie Ravier|Maisie]], a brash yet lovable Brooklyn showgirl. The character, based on the Maisie short stories by [[Nell Martin|Nell Martin]], proved to be popular and spawned a successful [[film series|Maisie#Movies]] ([[Congo Maisie|Congo Maisie]], [[Gold Rush Maisie|Gold Rush Maisie]], [[Up Goes Maisie|Up Goes Maisie]], etc.) and a network radio series ([[The Adventures of Maisie|The Adventures of Maisie]]).
title: Ann Sothern

abstract: Alan Hale Jr. (born Alan Hale MacKahan, March 8, 1921 – January 2, 1990) was an American actor and restaurateur. Hale Jr. was the son of major movie character actor [[Alan Hale Sr.|Alan Hale Sr.]] Hale Jr.'s television career, which spanned four decades, was most noted for his co-starring role on the 1960s series [[Gilligan's Island|Gilligan's Island]]. He also appeared on several talk and variety shows.
title: Alan Hale Jr.

abstract: Born to [[Jewish|Jews]] parents in [[London|London]] in 1930, Henry Woolf was educated at [[Hackney Downs School|Hackney Downs School]], where he met [[Harold Pinter|Harold Pinter]]; he and Pinter were friends and collaborators for over 60 years. He earned a [[Bachelor of Arts|Bachelor of Arts]] degree from the [[University of London|University of London]] and then pursued a postgraduate course in directing at the [[University of Bristol|University of Bristol]], before going to the [[United States|United States]], to earn a postgraduate diploma from the [[College of William and Mary|College of William and Mary]], in [[Williamsburg, Virginia|Williamsburg, Virginia]]. While doing his directing course at Bristol, he commissioned and directed Harold Pinter's first play, [[The Room|The Room (play)]] (1957), in which he also originated the role of Mr Kidd.
title: Henry Woolf

abstract: He became a member of [[NITRO MICROPHONE UNDERGROUND|NITRO MICROPHONE UNDERGROUND]] in 1997. In 1999 he released his first single, Mr. Fudatzkee. In 2001, he was the first Japanese artist to be signed by [[Def Jam Japan|Def Jam]]. That same year, he made his major debut as a solo artist releasing Platinum Tongue which reached number fifteen on the Japanese (Oricon) music charts. In addition to his solo works, Dabo racked up numerous credits collaborating with various artists.In addition to his solo works, he has amassed more than 60 credits working with various artists.
title: Dabo

abstract: Diane Cilento (5 October 19336 October 2011) was an [[Australian|Australians]] actress and author. She was nominated for an [[Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress|Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress]] for her role in the 1963 film [[Tom Jones|Tom Jones (1963 film)]].
title: Diane Cilento

abstract: Conrad Vernon (born July 11, 1968) is an [[American|Americans]] [[voice actor|voice acting]], [[director|film director]], writer and storyboard artist best known for his work on the [[DreamWorks|DreamWorks Animation]] animated film series [[Shrek|Shrek (franchise)]] as well as other films such as [[Monsters vs. Aliens|Monsters vs. Aliens]], [[Madagascar 3: Europe's Most Wanted|Madagascar 3: Europe's Most Wanted]] and [[Penguins of Madagascar|Penguins of Madagascar]]. He also co directed the [[adult animated film|adult animation]], [[Sausage Party|Sausage Party]], which is a spoof of his notable works in DreamWorks.
title: Conrad Vernon

abstract: Generally going by the name "Aziz Nesin", the name "Aziz" was originally his father's nickname, used by Nesin for the [[pseudonym|pseudonym]] under which he started publishing. He wrote under more than fifty noms de plume, such as the pseudonym "Vedia Nesin", his first wife's name, which he used for love poems published in the magazine Yedigün.
title: Aziz Nesin

abstract: Anthony Wilford Brimley (born September 27, 1934) is an [[American|United States]] actor who has appeared in films and television series. After serving in the Marines and doing a variety of jobs including ranch hand and wrangler, Brimley became an extra for Westerns, and in little more than a decade he had established himself as a character actor in films such as [[The China Syndrome|The China Syndrome]], and [[The Natural|The Natural (film)]] (1984). His trademark mustache, accent and brusque delivery made Brimley recognizable, but forthrightness on screen was on occasion matched by bluntness on set when his interpretation of a character was being faulted. Brimley's weather beaten appearance enabled him to be convincing as someone decades older in the film [[Cocoon|Cocoon (film)]] (1985).
title: Wilford Brimley

abstract: Edmond O'Brien (September 10, 1915 – May 9, 1985) was an American actor who appeared in more than 100 films from the 1940s to the 1970s, often playing [[character parts|character actor]]. He received the [[Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor|Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor]] and the [[corresponding Golden Globe|Golden Globe Award for Best Supporting Actor - Motion Picture]] for his supporting role in [[The Barefoot Contessa|The Barefoot Contessa]] (1954), as well as a second Golden Globe and another Academy Award nomination for [[Seven Days in May|Seven Days in May]] (1964). His other notable films include [[The Hunchback of Notre Dame|The Hunchback of Notre Dame (1939 film)]] (1939), [[The Killers|The Killers (1946 film)]] (1946), [[A Double Life|A Double Life (1947 film)]] (1947), [[White Heat|White Heat]] (1949), [[D.O.A.|D.O.A. (1949 film)]] (1949), [[Julius Caesar|Julius Caesar (1953 film)]] (1953), [[1984|1984 (1956 film)]] (1956), [[The Girl Can't Help It|The Girl Can't Help It]] (1956), [[The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance|The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance]] (1961), [[Fantastic Voyage|Fantastic Voyage]] (1966), [[The Wild Bunch|The Wild Bunch]] (1969) and [[The Other Side of the Wind|The Other Side of the Wind]] (2018).
title: Edmond O'Brien

abstract: Lori Petty (born October 14, 1963) is an American actress and director. Her roles include playing Tyler Endicott in the 1991 film [[Point Break|Point Break]], Kit Keller in [[A League of Their Own|A League of Their Own]] (1992), and the title role in [[Tank Girl|Tank Girl (film)]] in 1995.
title: Lori Petty

abstract: Adam Baldwin (born February 27, 1962) is an American actor and voice actor. He starred in [[Full Metal Jacket|Full Metal Jacket]] (1987) as Animal Mother, as well as in the television series [[Firefly|Firefly (TV Series)]] and its continuation film [[Serenity|Serenity (2005 film)]] as [[Jayne Cobb|Jayne Cobb]]. His roles include Stillman in [[Ordinary People|Ordinary People]] (1980), Colonel [[John Casey|John Casey (Chuck)]] in [[Chuck|Chuck (TV series)]], and Mike Slattery in [[The Last Ship|The Last Ship (TV series)]].
title: Adam Baldwin

abstract: Kathryn Hays (born Kay Piper, July 26, 1933) is an American actress, best known for her role as [[Kim Hughes|Kim Sullivan Hughes]] on the CBS soap opera, [[As the World Turns|As the World Turns]] from 1972 to 2010.
title: Kathryn Hays

abstract: Maurice Benard (born March 1, 1963) is an [[American|United States]] [[actor|actor]]. He is known primarily for his portrayal of [[Michael "Sonny" Corinthos Jr.|Sonny Corinthos]] on [[ABC|American Broadcasting Company]] [[soap opera|soap opera]], [[General Hospital|General Hospital]], a role he has portrayed since 1993.
title: Maurice Benard

abstract: Amanda Blake (February 20, 1929 – August 16, 1989) was an American [[actress|actress]] best known for the role of the red-haired saloon proprietress "Miss Kitty Russell" on the [[western|Western (genre)]] [[television series|television series]] [[Gunsmoke|Gunsmoke]]. Along with her third husband, Frank Gilbert, she ran one of the first successful programs for breeding [[cheetah|cheetahs]] in captivity.
title: Amanda Blake

abstract: Nancy Lee Grahn (born April 28, 1956) is an American actress known primarily for her work in daytime [[soap opera|soap operas]], portraying [[Julia Wainwright Capwell|Julia Wainwright Capwell]] on [[Santa Barbara|Santa Barbara (TV series)]] from 1985–93 and [[Alexis Davis|Alexis Davis]] on [[General Hospital|General Hospital]] since 1996.
title: Nancy Lee Grahn

abstract: Luciano Tesi (born 10 December 1931) is an [[Italian|Italy]] veterinarian, amateur [[astronomer|astronomer]], discoverer of a large number of [[minor planet|minor planets]], and director of the [[San Marcello Pistoiese Observatory|San Marcello Pistoiese Observatory]].
title: Luciano Tesi

abstract: Frank B. Zoltowski (born 1957) is an [[Australian|Australian]] amateur [[astronomer|astronomer]] and prolific discoverer of [[minor planet|minor planets]] who lives in [[Woomera|Woomera, South Australia]], South Australia. In 1998, he was awarded a "[[Gene Shoemaker|Gene Shoemaker]] NEO Grant" for improved [[near-Earth object|near-Earth object]] searches.
title: Frank B. Zoltowski

abstract: Charles Richard Moll (born January 13, 1943) is an American actor and voice artist, best known for playing Aristotle Nostradamus "Bull" Shannon, the [[bailiff|bailiff]] on the [[NBC|NBC]] [[sitcom|situation comedy]] [[Night Court|Night Court]] from 1984 to 1992. Moll has also done extensive work as a [[voice actor|voice actor]], typically using his deep voice to portray [[villain|villainous]] characters in animation and video games.
title: Richard Moll

abstract: Frank Bonner (born Frank Woodrow Boers Jr., February 28, 1942) is an American actor and television director best known for playing sales manager [[Herb Tarlek|Herb Tarlek]] on the television [[sitcom|sitcom]] [[WKRP in Cincinnati|WKRP in Cincinnati]].
title: Frank Bonner

abstract: Camille Coduri (born 18 April 1965 in [[Wandsworth|Wandsworth]], [[London|London]]) is an English actress. She is best known for playing [[Jackie Tyler|Jackie Tyler]], the mother of [[Rose Tyler|Rose Tyler]], in [[Doctor Who|Doctor Who]], and also for her roles as Faith in [[Nuns on the Run|Nuns on the Run]], Miranda in [[King Ralph|King Ralph]], and Dot Clapton, chambers secretary in [[Rumpole of the Bailey|Rumpole of the Bailey]].
title: Camille Coduri

abstract: Sidney Fox (born Sarah Leiffer or Liefer, also cited Sadie Fox; December 10, 1907– November 15, 1942) was an American stage and film actress in the late 1920s and 1930s. Fox's Hollywood film debut was in [[Universal Pictures|Universal Pictures]]' 1931 production [[Bad Sister|Bad Sister (1931 film)]], which is notable for also being the first film of legendary actress [[Bette Davis|Bette Davis]].
title: Sidney Fox

abstract: Terrance Dicks (born 14 April 1935) is an English author and former television screenwriter, script editor and producer.
title: Terrance Dicks

abstract: Torhi Harper (born December 18, 1979), better known by his [[stage name|stage name]] Murphy Lee, is an American [[rapper|rapping]], best known as a member of the [[hip hop|Hip hop music]] group [[St. Lunatics|St. Lunatics]]. Lee is also the [[chief executive|Chief Executive Officer]] of his own label, U C Me Entertainment.
title: Murphy Lee

abstract: Shyam Benegal was born on 14 December 1934 in [[Trimulgherry|Trimulgherry]], then a British [[Cantonment|Cantonment]], and now twin city of the state capital, as Shyam Sunder Benegal. It was here at age twelve, that he made his first film, on a camera given to him by his photographer father Sridhar B. Benegal. He received an [[M.A.|Master of Arts]] in Economics from [[Osmania University|Osmania University]], [[Hyderabad|Hyderabad, India]]. There he formed the Hyderabad Film Society.
title: Shyam Benegal

abstract: Alejandro González Iñárritu (; ; credited since 2014 as Alejandro G. Iñárritu; born August 15, 1963) is a Mexican film director, producer, and screenwriter. His feature films have garnered critical acclaim and numerous accolades, including five [[Academy Awards|Academy Awards]]. In 2006, he became the first Mexican director to be nominated for the [[Academy Award for Best Director|Academy Award for Best Director]] and the [[Directors Guild of America Award for Outstanding Directing|Directors Guild of America Award for Outstanding Directing – Feature Film]] for [[Babel|Babel (film)]]. In 2015, he won three Academy Awards for [[Best Picture|Academy Award for Best Picture]], Best Director, and [[Best Original Screenplay|Academy Award for Best Original Screenplay]] for [[Birdman or (The Unexpected Virtue of Ignorance)|Birdman (film)]] (2014). The following year, he won a second Academy Award for Best Director for [[The Revenant|The Revenant (2015 film)]] (2015), making him the third director to win back to back Academy Awards, and the first since [[1950|23rd Academy Awards]]. Iñárritu was awarded a [[Special Achievement Academy Award|Special Achievement Academy Award]] for his [[virtual reality|virtual reality]] project [[Flesh and Sand|Flesh and Sand]] in [[2017|90th Academy Awards]], the first time it had been awarded since [[1995|68th Academy Awards]].
title: Alejandro González Iñárritu

abstract: Patricia Claire Blume, (born 15 February 1931), better known by her [[stage name|stage name]] Claire Bloom, is an English film and stage actress whose career has spanned over six decades. She is known for leading roles in plays such as [[A Streetcar Named Desire|A Streetcar Named Desire (play)]], [[A Doll's House|A Doll's House]], and [[Long Day's Journey into Night|Long Day's Journey into Night]], and has starred in nearly sixty films.
title: Claire Bloom

abstract: Maxwell Atoms (born January 21, 1974) is an American animator, screenwriter, storyboard artist, and voice actor. Atoms is best known as the creator of the [[Cartoon Network|Cartoon Network]] series [[The Grim Adventures of Billy & Mandy|The Grim Adventures of Billy & Mandy]].
title: Maxwell Atoms

abstract: Harry Sinclair is a film director, writer, and actor. In his early career he was an actor and member of [[The Front Lawn|The Front Lawn]], a musical theater duo. He went on to write and direct several short films, a TV series and three feature films.
title: Harry Sinclair

abstract: John Paul Tremblay (born 1968) is a [[Canadian|Canadians]] [[actor|actor]] and [[comedian|comedian]] who stars in the hit Canadian TV show [[Trailer Park Boys|Trailer Park Boys]] playing Julian, a newly released ex-con returning to his home in a trailer park in [[Nova Scotia|Nova Scotia]]. Tremblay grew up in the [[Dartmouth|Dartmouth, Nova Scotia]] suburb of [[Cole Harbour|Cole Harbour, Nova Scotia]] where he lived on the same street and went to the same high school as [[Robb Wells|Robb Wells]], his future co-star of [[Trailer Park Boys|Trailer Park Boys]]. Before [[Trailer Park Boys|Trailer Park Boys]] he and Wells owned a chain of pizza restaurants called J.R. Capone's. The show is written by Tremblay along with co-stars [[Robb Wells|Robb Wells]] and [[Mike Smith|Mike Smith (actor)]]. The Trailer Park Boys released a [[film|Trailer Park Boys: The Movie]] in 2006, most of it being filmed in the [[municipality of Halifax|Halifax Regional Municipality]]. Tremblay and Wells also appeared in the 2002 family film Virginia's Run, though not as Ricky and Julian. John and his wife Andrea Tremblay (nee Hurley) have three children.
title: John Paul Tremblay

abstract: Donna Burke (born 12 December 1964 in [[Perth|Perth]], [[Australia|Australia]]) is an Australian singer, voice actress and businesswoman.
title: Donna Burke

abstract: Jun Ji-hyun (born Wang Ji-hyun on 30 October 1981), also known by her English name Gianna Jun, is a [[South Korea|South Korean]] actress. She rose to fame for her role as The Girl in the romantic comedy [[My Sassy Girl|My Sassy Girl]] (2001), one of the highest-grossing Korean comedies of all time. Other notable films include [[Il Mare|Il Mare]] (2000), [[Windstruck|Windstruck]] (2004), [[The Thieves|The Thieves]] (2012), [[The Berlin File|The Berlin File]] (2013) and [[Assassination|Assassination (2015 film)]] (2015).
title: Jun Ji-hyun

abstract: Daran Morrison Nordlund (born November 1, 1964), better known as Daran Norris, is an American comedic actor and voice artist. He has appeared or voiced characters in more than 400 [[film|films]], [[video game|video games]], and [[television program|television programs]], including: Gordy in [[Ned's Declassified School Survival Guide|Ned's Declassified School Survival Guide]]; [[Cliff McCormack|Woody Goodman]] in [[Veronica Mars|Veronica Mars]]; the voices of [[Cosmo|Cosmo and Wanda]], [[Jorgen Von Strangle|Jorgen Von Strangle]], and [[Mr. Turner|List of The Fairly OddParents characters#Mr. and Mrs. Turner]] in [[The Fairly OddParents|The Fairly OddParents]]; Buddha Bob in [[Big Time Rush|Big Time Rush]]; and [[Knock Out|Knock Out (Transformers: Prime)]] in [[Transformers Prime|Transformers Prime]].
title: Daran Norris

abstract: Christian Clavier (; born 6 May 1952 in [[Paris|Paris]]) is a [[French|France]] actor, screenwriter, film producer and film director. He became widely popular after starring in two hit comedy series: [[Patrice Leconte|Patrice Leconte]]'s [[Les Bronzés|Les Bronzés]] and [[Les Visiteurs|Les Visiteurs]] directed by [[Jean-Marie Poiré|Jean-Marie Poiré]]. He furthered his popularity by taking a role of [[Asterix|Asterix]] in the screen adaptations of the comic books by [[Albert Uderzo|Albert Uderzo]] and [[René Goscinny|René Goscinny]].
title: Christian Clavier

abstract: Logan Marshall-Green (born November 1, 1976) is an American actor. He is known for his roles in the television series [[24|24 (TV series)]], [[The O.C.|The O.C.]], [[Traveler|Traveler (TV series)]], [[Dark Blue|Dark Blue (TV series)]] and [[Quarry|Quarry (TV series)]], as well as his roles in the films [[Prometheus|Prometheus (2012 film)]], [[Spider-Man: Homecoming|Spider-Man: Homecoming]] and [[Upgrade|Upgrade (film)]].
title: Logan Marshall-Green

abstract: Kaylani Lei (born August 5, 1980) is an American [[pornographic actress|pornographic actress]].
title: Kaylani Lei

abstract: Greg Weisman (born September 28, 1963) is an American writer of [[comic books|comic books]], [[animation|animation]] and [[novels|novels]]. He is perhaps best known for the animated series [[Gargoyles|Gargoyles (TV series)]] (1994-96), [[The Spectacular Spider-Man|The Spectacular Spider-Man (TV series)]] (2008-09) and [[Young Justice|Young Justice (TV series)]] (2011-13, 2019).
title: Greg Weisman

abstract: Stuart Michael Sharrett (born July 18, 1965) is an American actor. Best known for his role in the 1978 classic family movie [[The Magic of Lassie|The Magic of Lassie]] with [[James Stewart|James Stewart]], Sharrett additionally co-starred in the 1985 action film [[Savage Dawn|Savage Dawn]] and in the 1986 [[Wes Craven|Wes Craven]] [[horror film|horror film]] [[Deadly Friend|Deadly Friend]], for which he received a [[Young Artist Award|Young Artist Award]] nomination as the "Best Young Actor in a Horror Motion Picture".
title: Michael Sharrett

abstract: Victoria Clark (born October 10, 1959) is an American [[actress|actress]], [[musical theatre|musical theatre]] [[singer|singing]] and [[director|Theatre director]]. Clark has performed in numerous [[Broadway|Broadway theatre]] musicals and in other theatre, film and television works. Her [[soprano|soprano]] voice can also be heard on innumerable cast albums and several animated films. In 2008, she released her first solo album titled Fifteen Seconds of Grace. In 2005, she won a [[Tony Award for Best Leading Actress in a Musical|Tony Award for Best Leading Actress in a Musical]] for her role in [[The Light in the Piazza|The Light in the Piazza (musical)]]. She also won the [[Drama Desk Award|Drama Desk Award]], [[Outer Critics Circle Award|Outer Critics Circle Award]], and the [[Joseph Jefferson Award|Joseph Jefferson Award]] for her performances in the same show.
title: Victoria Clark

abstract: Skye McCole Bartusiak (September 28, 1992 – July 19, 2014) was an American film and television actress. She appeared in [[The Patriot|The Patriot (2000 film)]] (2000), [[Don't Say a Word|Don't Say a Word]] (2001), as [[Rose Wilder|Rose Wilder Lane]] in [[Beyond the Prairie: The True Story of Laura Ingalls Wilder|Beyond the Prairie: The True Story of Laura Ingalls Wilder]] (2002), [[24|24 (TV series)]] (2002–03), [[Boogeyman|Boogeyman (film)]] (2005), and [[Kill Your Darlings|Kill Your Darlings (2006 film)]] (2006).
title: Skye McCole Bartusiak

abstract: Tuesday Lynn Knight (born Melody Lynn Knight; February 17, 1969) is an American actress, singer and designer. She is best known for her role as [[Kristen Parker|Kristen Parker(character)#Kristen Parker]] in the 1988 film [[A Nightmare on Elm Street 4: The Dream Master|A Nightmare on Elm Street 4: The Dream Master]], replacing [[Patricia Arquette|Patricia Arquette]] in the sequel to [[A Nightmare on Elm Street 3: Dream Warriors|A Nightmare on Elm Street 3: Dream Warriors]] (1987). Her other film roles include [[Mistress|Mistress (1992 film)]] (1992), [[The Fan|The Fan (1996 film)]] (1996), [[Daddy and Them|Daddy and Them]] (2001), and [[How to Be Single|How to Be Single]] (2016). Knight has had guest appearances on several television series, such as [[Profiler|Profiler (TV series)]] (1996) and [[The X-Files|The X-Files]] (1999), as well as a starring role on [[2000 Malibu Road|2000 Malibu Road]] (1992). Outside of acting, her [[self-titled debut album|Tuesday Knight (album)]] was released in 1987 and her jewelry line was launched in 2001.
title: Tuesday Knight

abstract: George Layton (born George Lowy on 2 March 1943 in [[Bradford|Bradford]], [[West Riding of Yorkshire|West Riding of Yorkshire]]) is an English actor, director, screenwriter and author. He was born to a family of [[Czechoslovak|Czechoslovakia]] and [[Jewish|Jews]] ancestry and educated at [[Belle Vue Boys' Grammar School|Belle Vue Boys' School]] in [[Bradford|Bradford]] and studied acting at the [[Royal Academy of Dramatic Art|Royal Academy of Dramatic Art]] where he won the Emile Littler award. He went on to leading parts at [[Coventry|Coventry]] and [[Nottingham|Nottingham]] and appeared on Broadway in [[Chips with Everything|Chips with Everything]]. He also appeared in an [[Australia|Australian]] production called Funny Peculiar.
title: George Layton

abstract: Martin Kove (born March 6, 1946) is an American film and television actor most recognized for his role as the psychopathic Cobra Kai [[sensei|sensei]] John Kreese in the [[Karate Kid film series|The Karate Kid (franchise)]]. He is also known for his work in films such as [[Rambo: First Blood Part II|Rambo: First Blood Part II]] (1985) and on television series such as [[Cagney & Lacey|Cagney & Lacey]] as Victor Isbecki.
title: Martin Kove

abstract: Faith Brown (born 28 May 1944) is an English actress, singer, [[comedian|comedian]] and [[impressionist|Impressionist (entertainment)]]. She was a star of the [[ITV|ITV (TV network)]] impressions show [[Who Do You Do?|Who Do You Do?]], and The Voice in the TV show [[Trapped|Trapped! (TV series)]].
title: Faith Brown

abstract: Michelle Visage (born September 20, 1968) as Michelle Lynn Shupack is an American singer, television host, radio DJ, and author.
title: Michelle Visage

abstract: Maria Flor Leite Calaça (born August 31, 1983), usually known as Maria Flor, is a [[Brazil|Brazilian]] actress.
title: Maria Flor

abstract: Niki Karimi was born and raised in [[Tehran|Tehran]], [[Iran.|Iran.]] She has been active in theater since elementary school, and has said that her early interest in film and literature inspired her to become an actress.
title: Niki Karimi

abstract: Satomi Ishihara was born 1986 on December 24. Her agency is HoriPro.
title: Satomi Ishihara

abstract: Matt Borlenghi (born Matteo Andrea Borlenghi on May 25, 1967) is an Italian-American actor, best known for his roles as Brian Bodine on [[All My Children|All My Children]] from 1991 to 1993 and 1996, as Russ on [[The Jeff Foxworthy Show|The Jeff Foxworthy Show]], and as Rich Casey on [[Police Academy: The Series|Police Academy: The Series]].
title: Matt Borlenghi

abstract: Natalia Cigliuti (born September 6, 1978) is an [[Uruguayan|Uruguayan]]-[[American|United States]] [[actress|Actor]], best known for her roles as Lindsay Warner on [[Saved by the Bell: The New Class|Saved by the Bell: The New Class]] and as [[Anita Santos Warner|List of All My Children characters#Anita Santos]] on [[All My Children|All My Children]].
title: Natalia Cigliuti

abstract: Rachel Melvin (born February 9, 1985) is an [[American|United States]] [[actress|actor]]. She is best known for her roles as [[Chelsea Brady|Chelsea Brady]] on [[Days of Our Lives|Days of Our Lives]] (2005–09) and as Penny in [[Dumb and Dumber To|Dumb and Dumber To]].
title: Rachel Melvin

abstract: Linton Muldoon Treacy (June 4, 1887 – March 13, 1929), better known as Pete Muldoon, was a Canadian [[ice hockey|ice hockey]] coach and pioneer in the [[western United States|western United States]], particularly known for bringing a [[Stanley Cup|Stanley Cup]] championship to [[Seattle|Seattle, Washington]], [[Washington|Washington (U.S. state)]]. He is best known for reportedly putting a [[curse|Curse of Muldoon]] on the [[Chicago Black Hawks|Chicago Blackhawks]], as well as team owner Major [[Frederic McLaughlin|Frederic McLaughlin]], after he was fired at the end of the [[1926-27 season|1926–27 Chicago Black Hawks season]]; however, it has been alleged that a [[Toronto|Toronto]] sportswriter had come up with the "curse" due to a bout of [[writer's block|writer's block]] in 1943. Muldoon was the Black Hawks' first head coach.
title: Pete Muldoon

abstract: John Rhys Coiro (born March 12, 1979) is an American [[film|film]], [[television|television]] and [[stage|Stage (theatre)]] actor who got his start on Broadway but is best known for his on-screen roles.
title: Rhys Coiro

abstract: Andrew Michael Milonakis (; born January 30, 1976) is an American actor, writer, rapper, streamer, and comedian. He is best known for creating and starring in [[The Andy Milonakis Show|The Andy Milonakis Show]] on [[MTV|MTV]] and [[MTV2|MTV2]]. In 2013, he began a recurring role as Roman Armond on the [[Comedy Central|Comedy Central]] sketch [[Kroll Show|Kroll Show]].
title: Andy Milonakis

abstract: Yoon So-yi made her entertainment debut as a [[model|model (profession)]] in Graffiti Magazine in 2001. After a few years of print and commercial modeling, she auditioned for [[Ryoo Seung-wan|Ryoo Seung-wan]]'s action comedy [[Arahan|Arahan]] in 2004. Based on a popular South Korean comic, [[Arahan|Arahan]] explored the consequences of unleashing an ancient evil spirit into a modern city, with Yoon's character part of a hidden school of ancient masters who train a naive young policeman to fight this evil force. Yoon underwent strict training for six months in a film action school, where she had to overcome her phobia of heights. The film was a relative commercial success, with one review describing her as "tall and attractive in an excellently non-cutesy way." She received a Best New Actress nomination at the 2004 [[Blue Dragon Film Awards|Blue Dragon Film Awards]].
title: Yoon So-yi

abstract: Gwen Welles was born in [[Chattanooga, Tennessee|Chattanooga, Tennessee]] as Gwen Goldberg. She was the daughter of actress [[Rebecca Weis Welles|Rebecca Welles (Weis)]] and Barton Goldberg; her sisters were Elizabeth (Betsy) Goldberg Welles and Lori Yarom. Gwen graduated from University High School in [[Los Angeles, California|Los Angeles, California]] and attended [[Vassar College|Vassar College]] in [[Poughkeepsie, New York|Poughkeepsie, New York]]. Welles was married to actor [[Harris Yulin|Harris Yulin]] in 1975.
title: Gwen Welles

abstract: Keri Lynn Pratt (born September 23, 1978) is an American actress of film and television. She is well known for her role of Missy Belknap on [[Jack & Bobby|Jack & Bobby]] and as Dee Vine in the film [[Drive Me Crazy|Drive Me Crazy]], which was her debut role.
title: Keri Lynn Pratt

abstract: Margo Jones (December 12, 1913 – July 24, 1955) was an [[American|United States]] [[stage director|Theatre director]] and [[producer|Theatrical producer]] best known for launching the American regional theater movement and for introducing the [[theater-in-the-round|theatre in the round]] concept in [[Dallas, Texas|Dallas, Texas]]. In 1947, she established the first regional professional company when she opened Theatre '47 in Dallas. Of the 85 plays Jones staged during her Dallas career, 57 were new, and one-third of those new plays had a continued life on stage, television and radio.
title: Margo Jones

abstract: Eric Fogel (born July 8, 1969) is an American director, writer, animator, producer, and voice actor who is best known as the creator of [[Celebrity Deathmatch|Celebrity Deathmatch]]. He also created cult shows [[The Head|The Head]], [[Starveillance|Starveillance]] and [[Glenn Martin, DDS|Glenn Martin, DDS]]. Fogel also directed several episodes of [[Daria|Daria]].
title: Eric Fogel

abstract: Kristoffer Tabori (also known as K.T. Donaldson, born Christopher Donald Siegel; August 4, 1952) is an American actor and television director.
title: Kristoffer Tabori

abstract: Erin Fitzgerald is a Canadian-American voice actress who provides voice-overs for a number of cartoons, video games and English language dubs of Japanese anime. In animation, she voices [[May Kanker|List of Ed, Edd n Eddy characters#Kanker Sisters]] and [[Nazz|List of Ed, Edd n Eddy characters#Nazz]] in [[Ed, Edd n Eddy|Ed, Edd n Eddy]], and voices major characters in [[The Jungle Bunch|The Jungle Bunch]], [[Batman: Year One|Batman: Year One]], [[Monster High|Monster High]] and [[Ever After High|Ever After High]]. In video games, she voices female leads Yrel in [[World of Warcraft: Warlords of Draenor|World of Warcraft: Warlords of Draenor]], [[Chie Satonaka|Chie Satonaka]] in the [[Persona 4|Persona 4]] series of games starting with [[Persona 4 Golden|Persona 4 Golden]] and [[Noire|List of Hyperdimension Neptunia characters#Noire]] in the [[Hyperdimension Neptunia|Hyperdimension Neptunia]] series. In anime shows, she has voiced in [[Sailor Moon|Sailor Moon]], [[Bleach|Bleach]], [[Naruto Shippuden|Naruto Shippuden]], [[Knights of Sidonia|Knights of Sidonia]] and [[Glitter Force|Glitter Force]].
title: Erin Fitzgerald

abstract: Lee Dong-wook (; born November 6, 1981) is a South Korean actor and model. He is best known for his leading roles in the [[television dramas|Korean drama]] [[My Girl|My Girl (2005 TV series)]] (2005), [[Scent of a Woman|Scent of a Woman (TV series)]] (2011), [[Hotel King|Hotel King]] (2014), [[Guardian: The Lonely and Great God|Guardian: The Lonely and Great God]] (2016–2017) and [[Life|Life (2018 TV series)]] (2018).
title: Lee Dong-wook

abstract: Bhanu Athaiya née Rajopadhye (; born 28 April 1929) is an Indian [[costume designer|costume designer]], having worked in over 100 films, since the 1950s, with noted filmmakers like [[Guru Dutt|Guru Dutt]], [[Yash Chopra|Yash Chopra]], [[Raj Kapoor|Raj Kapoor]], [[Ashutosh Gowariker|Ashutosh Gowariker]], and international directors like Conrad Rooks and [[Richard Attenborough|Richard Attenborough]].
title: Bhanu Athaiya

abstract: Yu Hyun-mok (July 2, 1925 – June 28, 2009) was a [[South Korea|South Korean]] film director. Born in [[Sariwon|Sariwon]], [[Hwanghae|Hwanghae Province]], [[Korea|Korea]] ([[North Korea|North Korea]] today), he made his film debut in 1956 with Gyocharo (Crossroads). According to the website koreanfilm.org, his 1961 film [[Obaltan|Obaltan]] "has repeatedly been voted the best Korean film of all time in local critics' polls." Yu attended the [[San Francisco International Film Festival|San Francisco International Film Festival]] in 1963, where [[Variety|Variety (magazine)]] called Obaltan a "remarkable film", and praised Yu's "[b]rilliantly detailed camera" and the film's "probing sympathy and rich characterizations."
title: Yu Hyun-mok

abstract: Ben Lawson (born 6 February 1980) is an [[Australia|Australian]] [[actor|actor]], known for his role as [[Frazer Yeats|Frazer Yeats]] in the Australian [[soap opera|soap opera]] [[Neighbours|Neighbours]] from 2006 to 2008. Lawson has since appeared in several American television series, including [[The Deep End|The Deep End (TV series)]], [[Covert Affairs|Covert Affairs]], and [[Don't Trust the B---- in Apartment 23|Don't Trust the B---- in Apartment 23]]. In 2011, he starred opposite [[Natalie Portman|Natalie Portman]] and [[Ashton Kutcher|Ashton Kutcher]] in the film [[No Strings Attached|No Strings Attached (film)]]. Recently, he starred as Damien Rennett on the [[ABC|American Broadcasting Company]] political drama [[Designated Survivor|Designated Survivor (TV series)]] and as Larry Hemsworth on [[The Good Place|The Good Place]].
title: Ben Lawson

abstract: Kelly Reno (born June 19, 1966 raised in Pueblo Colorado) is a former [[child actor|child actor]] who was cast at age 11 in the role of Alec Ramsey (after responding to an open casting call), the young boy who is marooned on a deserted island along with an Arabian horse, in [[The Black Stallion|The Black Stallion (film)]] (based on [[the novel|The Black Stallion]] by [[Walter Farley|Walter Farley]]). The film was made in 1977. Reno did nearly all of the action scenes in the movie.

abstract: Jean-Luc Bilodeau (born November 4, 1990) is a Canadian actor who has been acting since 2004. abstract: LightningCloud released their self-titled debut in 2012 to critical acclaim. Sam Slovik of the L.A. Weekly called the group, "a near-earth object inventing new realms of the Electro-House-Hip-Hop revolution on the planet. Urban futurist[s], MC RedCloud and Crystle Lightning are L.A.'s subterranean Bonnie and Clyde." The Aboriginal Peoples Choice Music Awards (APCMA) honored the group with recognition for Best Hip Hop Album in November 2012. In 2013, LightningCloud battled their way past the best MCs in Southern California to win the "Who's Next: Battle for the Best" contest on the number one hip hop station in the United States, [[Power 106|Power 106]]. As winners, LightningCloud received a cash prize, a performance with [[Kendrick Lamar|Kendrick Lamar]], and the honor of representing the best of west coast hip hop against [[Hot 97's|WQHT]] Brooklyn-based, east coast representative Radamiz in a freestyle battle in Austin, Texas on March 15, 2013. After winning that MC battle, LightningCloud received the opportunity to work with [[Timbaland|Timbaland]] in the recording studio.
title: Crystle Lightning

abstract: Perez Hilton (born Mario Armando Lavandeira Jr.; March 23, 1978) is an American [[blog|blogger]], columnist, and [[television personality|television presenter]]. He is also known for posting [[tabloid|Tabloid (newspaper format)]] [[photograph|photographs]] over which he has added his own [[captions|caption (comics convention)]] or "doodles". His blog has garnered controversy for its attitude, its former [[outing|outing]] of alleged closeted celebrities, and its role in the increasing coverage of celebrities in all forms of [[media|Mass media]].

abstract: John Irvin (born 7 May 1940) is an [[English|England]] film director. He made several Hollywood films in the 1980s including [[The Dogs of War|The Dogs of War (film)]] (1980), [[Ghost Story|Ghost Story (1981 film)]] (1981) and [[Hamburger Hill|Hamburger Hill]] (1987).

abstract: Rauf Lala ([[Urdu|Urdu]]: رؤف لالہ) (born 1970 in [[Larkana|Larkana]], [[Sindh|Sindh]], Pakistan) is a popular [[Pakistan|Pakistani]] [[comedian|comedian]], [[actor|actor]], [[writer|writer]], and producer. abstract: Salim Ahmed Ghoush (22 April 1951 – 2 February 2010), better known by his stage name Cochin Haneefa, was an Indian film actor, director, and screenwriter. abstract: Nariman Hussein Murad, more commonly known by her [[stage name|stage name]] Hind Rostom, (   ; November 12, 1931 – August 8, 2011) was an [[Egypt|Egyptian]] [[actress|actress]] and one of the greatest icons in the golden era of [[Egyptian cinema|Egyptian cinema]]. abstract: Raghava Lawrence is an Indian choreographer who has also appeared in films as an [[actor|film actor]], director, [[composer|film score]] and playback singer. After making his debut as a choreographer in 1993, he began looking for acting opportunities. He began his career as an actor in 1998, in a [[Telugu film|Telugu cinema]], aged 22. He adopted the name "Raghava" in 2001, and worked for many prominent actors and directors in Tamil cinema throughout his career. He got his breakthrough with [[Telugu film|Telugu film]] [[Style|Style (2006 film)]] and then [[Muni|Muni (film)]]. Lawrence is also known for his intricate [[hip-hop|hip-hop]] and westernised dance moves and has won four [[Filmfare Awards|Filmfare Awards South]] and three [[Nandi Awards|Nandi Awards]] for best choreography. In 2015, after the death of former Indian president [[A. P. J. Abdul Kalam|A. P. J. Abdul Kalam]], Lawrence set up a charity trust in his name and donated 1 crore to it.
title: Raghava Lawrence

abstract: Sonya Walger (born 6 June 1974) is an English actress. Walger later starred on [[Tell Me You Love Me|Tell Me You Love Me (TV series)]] (2007), [[FlashForward|FlashForward]] (2009–2010), and [[Common Law|Common Law (2012 TV series)]] (2012). In 2016, she began starring in the ABC series [[The Catch|The Catch (TV series)]].
title: Sonya Walger

abstract: Hong Seok-cheon (born February 3, 1971) is a [[South Korea|South Korean]] actor, television personality, restaurateur and member of the [[Democratic Labor Party|Democratic Labor Party (South Korea)]]. In 2018, he revealed to be third cousins with Taeyong of [[NCT|NCT (band)]].

abstract: Sam Hamm (born November 19, 1955) is an [[American|United States]] [[screenwriter|screenwriter]]. Hamm is known for co-writing the screenplay for [[Tim Burton|Tim Burton]]'s [[Batman|Batman (1989 film)]] and the story for [[Batman Returns|Batman Returns]]. As a result of his work, he was invited to write for [[Detective Comics|Detective Comics]]. The result was Batman: Blind Justice, which introduced Bruce Wayne's mentor, [[Henri Ducard|Henri Ducard]], who later appeared in [[Batman Begins|Batman Begins]]. Hamm's other screen credits include [[Never Cry Wolf|Never Cry Wolf (film)]] and [[Monkeybone|Monkeybone]]. Hamm also wrote unused drafts for [[Planet of the Apes|Planet of the Apes (2001 film)]] and [[Watchmen|Watchmen (film)]] adaptations.
title: Sam Hamm

abstract: Andrea Arnold, [[OBE|Order of the British Empire]] (born 5 April 1961) is an [[English|English people]] filmmaker and former actress.
