abstract: Gina Pareño (born Geraldine Acthley, October 20, 1949) is a Filipino actress born to a [[German|Germans]]-[[American|United States]] father and a [[Filipina|Filipina]] mother. She started her career in the 1960s as an extra in several films and then later on became one of the artists of [[Sampaguita Pictures|Sampaguita Pictures]]. In 2006, she gained international recognition for her role in [[Kubrador|Kubrador]] (The Bet Collector) wherein she won the Best Actress award at the [[Osian's Cinefan Festival of Asian and Arab Cinema|Osian's Cinefan Festival of Asian and Arab Cinema]] and at the [[Brussels International Independent Film Festival|Brussels International Independent Film Festival]]. Pareño also won the [[Metro Manila Film Festival Award for Best Supporting Actress|2006 Metro Manila Film Festival]] as an outspoken and brash mother in the movie [[Kasal, Kasali, Kasalo|Kasal, Kasali, Kasalo]] and then later on received accolades for the same film and category in the [[FAMAS Awards|Filipino Academy of Movie Arts and Sciences Award]] as well as the [[Film Academy of the Philippines Awards|Film Academy of the Philippines]] in that same year.

abstract: Manoj Kadampoothramadam Jayan, popularly known as Manoj K. Jayan, is an Indian actor who predominantly acts in [[Malayalam|Malayalam cinema]], [[Tamil|Tamil cinema]] and [[Telugu|Telugu cinema]] films. Manoj has won three [[Kerala State Film Award for Second Best Actor|Kerala State Film Award for Second Best Actor]], respectively for his portrayals of Hariharan's "Kuttan Thampuran" in [[Sargam|Sargam (1992 film)]] (1992), "Thalakkal Chandu" in [[Pazhassi Raja|Pazhassi Raja (2009 film)]] (2009) and "Kunjiraman" in Farook Abdul Rahiman's [[Kaliyachan|Kaliyachan]]. His most critically acclaimed characters are "Kuttan Thampuran" (Sargam), "Digambaran" ([[Anandabhadram|Anandabhadram]]) and "Thalakkal Chandu" (Pazhassi Raja).
title: Manoj K. Jayan

abstract: Mia Michaels (born February 23, 1966) is an American [[choreographer|choreographer]] best known as a judge and for her [[contemporary|contemporary dance]] choreography on the TV show [[So You Think You Can Dance|So You Think You Can Dance (US)]] (SYTYCD). She has worked with musical artists such as [[Celine Dion|Celine Dion]], [[Madonna|Madonna (entertainer)]], [[Tom Cruise|Tom Cruise]], [[Catherine Zeta-Jones|Catherine Zeta-Jones]], [[Ricky Martin|Ricky Martin]], [[Gloria Estefan|Gloria Estefan]], and [[Prince|Prince (musician)]]. In 2005 she choreographed [[Cirque du Soleil|Cirque du Soleil]]'s world tour, "[[Delirium|Delirium (Cirque du Soleil)]]" as well as [[Celine Dion|Celine Dion]]'s [[Las Vegas|Las Vegas, Nevada]] show "[[A New Day...|A New Day...]]" for which she was later nominated for Emmy. In 2007 she won an [[Emmy Award|Primetime Emmy Awards]] for Outstanding Choreography for her "[[Calling You|So You Think You Can Dance (U.S. TV series)#Emmy Awards]]" routine on [[season 2|So You Think You Can Dance (season 2)]] of So You Think You Can Dance; she won again in 2010 for her work on [[season 5|So You Think You Can Dance (season 5)]]. She was a main judge of So You Think You Can Dance together with [[Adam Shankman|Adam Shankman]] and [[Nigel Lythgoe|Nigel Lythgoe]] for [[season 7|So You Think You Can Dance (season 7)]]. She choreographed the dance sequence of "Get Happy" in Season 7 Episode 15 of the "House" episode "Bombshells".
title: Mia Michaels

abstract: Dominique Blanc (born 25 April 1956) is a [[French|French people]] actress. She is known for her roles in the films [[May Fools|May Fools]] (1990), [[Indochine|Indochine (film)]] (1992), [[La Reine Margot|La Reine Margot (1994 film)]] (1994), [[Those Who Love Me Can Take the Train|Those Who Love Me Can Take the Train]] (1998), and [[The Other One|The Other One (film)]] (2008). In a career spanned nearly four decades, Blanc has won four [[César Award|César Awards]] from nine nominations.
title: Dominique Blanc

abstract: Samvrutha Sunil (born 31 October 1986), known [[mononymously|Mononymous person]] as Samvrutha, is a former [[India|Indian]] film actress who mainly appeared in [[Malayalam film|Malayalam films]]. Having made her debut in 2004 through the film [[Rasikan|Rasikan]] directed by her mentor [[Lal Jose|Lal Jose]], she has starred in over 40 Malayalam films and one film each in [[Telugu|Telugu cinema]] and [[Tamil|Tamil cinema]] languages. abstract: Dick Warlock (born February 5, 1940) is an American actor, and [[stuntman|stunt double]]. He has two sons, [[Billy Warlock|Billy Warlock]] and Lance Warlock, and one daughter, Rhonda. He sold the screen used hockey masks used in Friday the 13th parts 3, 4 and 5 to a private collector and artist.

abstract: Dameon Clarke (born January 16, 1972) is a Canadian actor who has done work for anime, films, television shows and video games. abstract: Todd McKee (born November 7, 1963) is an [[American|Americans]] actor. He is best known for his roles as [[Ted Capwell|Ted Capwell]] on the [[NBC|NBC]] soap opera [[Santa Barbara|Santa Barbara (TV series)]] and as [[Jake Maclaine|The Bold and the Beautiful secondary characters#Jake Maclaine]] on the [[CBS|CBS]] soap opera [[The Bold and the Beautiful|The Bold and the Beautiful]]. In the late 1990s, McKee began a career as a financial adviser for [[Merrill Lynch|Merrill Lynch]].
title: Todd McKee

abstract: Nicole Arbour (born 1985) is a [[Canadian|Canadians]] comedian, recording artist, choreographer, actress, dancer, singer and [[YouTube personality|List of YouTubers]].
title: Nicole Arbour

abstract: Norman J. Grossfeld (born December 15, 1963 in New York) is an [[American|United States]] [[director|Television director]], [[television producer|television producer]], [[screenwriter|screenwriter]] and [[executive|executive (management)]]. From February 1994 to December 2009, he was the president of [[4Kids Productions|4K Media Inc.]], a former subsidiary of [[4Kids Entertainment|4Licensing Corporation]] and Leisure Concepts. He produced the English adaptations of the first eight seasons of the [[Pokémon TV series|Pokémon (anime)]] and six seasons of [[Yu-Gi-Oh!|Yu-Gi-Oh!]]. He produced five seasons of the new [[Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles|Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (2003 TV series)]], five Pokémon movies, one Yu-Gi-Oh! movie and he also produced the 3 Seasons of [[Winx Club|Winx Club]] on [[4KidsTV|4KidsTV]]. In addition to producing and executive producing, Grossfeld co-wrote most of the [[Pokémon|Pokémon]] films, which grossed over $600 million worldwide. Grossfeld is credited with writing the [[Pokémon|Pokémon]] franchise's tagline, "Gotta catch 'em all!"
title: Norman J. Grossfeld

abstract: Maricel Soriano (born Maria Cecilia Dador Soriano on February 25, 1965) is a [[Filipina|Filipino people]] [[film|film]] and [[television|television]] [[actress|actress]] and one of the Philippine Showbiz Icons like [[Gloria Romero|Gloria Romero (actress)]], [[Susan Roces|Susan Roces]], [[Amalia Fuentes|Amalia Fuentes]], [[Nora Aunor|Nora Aunor]], [[Vilma Santos|Vilma Santos]], [[Sharon Cuneta|Sharon Cuneta]], [[Judy Ann Santos|Judy Ann Santos]], [[Claudine Barretto|Claudine Barretto]] and few to mention. She has starred in films covering different genres including comedy, fantasy (Inday series), horror, suspense, action, romance and drama. She has appeared in hundreds of films and has appeared in various blockbuster hits.
title: Maricel Soriano

abstract: Choi Si-won (born 10 February, 1987) is a South Korean singer, songwriter, model, and actor. He is a member of the South Korean [[boy band|boy band]] [[Super Junior|Super Junior]] and its [[Mandopop|Mandopop]] subgroup, [[Super Junior-M|Super Junior-M]].
title: Choi Si-won

abstract: Tim Choate (October 11, 1954 – September 24, 2004) was an American [[actor|actor]] who starred in a number of film and television roles on series such as [[Dragnet|Dragnet (series)]] and [[Babylon 5|Babylon 5]].
title: Tim Choate

abstract: John Patrick Lowrie (born June 28, 1952 in [[Honolulu|Honolulu]], [[Hawaii|Hawaii]]) is an American voice actor, actor, musician and author best known for voicing the Sniper in [[Team Fortress 2|Team Fortress 2]] and various characters in [[Dota 2|Dota 2]].
title: John Patrick Lowrie

abstract: Fleur Saville (born 14 July 1984, in [[Auckland|Auckland]]) is a [[New Zealand|New Zealand]] television actress best known for her roles in the television sitcoms [[Being Eve|Being Eve]] and [[The Tribe|The Tribe (1999 TV series)]] in which she became known to international audiences for her portrayal of Ruby. Saville previously acted on New Zealand soap opera [[Shortland Street|Shortland Street]], playing the personal assistant [[Libby Jeffries|Libby Jeffries]] for the CEO of Shortland Street Hospital.
title: Fleur Saville

abstract: Margo Martindale (born July 18, 1951) is an American actress who has appeared on television, in film, and onstage. In 2011, she won a [[Primetime Emmy Award|Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Drama Series]] and a [[Critics' Choice Television Award|Critics' Choice Television Award for Best Drama Supporting Actress]] for her recurring role as Mags Bennett on [[Justified|Justified (TV series)]]. Martindale was nominated for an [[Emmy Award|Emmy Award]] four times for her recurring role as Claudia on [[The Americans|The Americans (2013 TV series)]], winning the award in 2015 and 2016. She has played supporting roles in several films, including [[The Hours|The Hours (film)]], [[Million Dollar Baby|Million Dollar Baby]], [[Dead Man Walking|Dead Man Walking (film)]], [[The Firm|The Firm (1993 film)]], [[Lorenzo's Oil|Lorenzo's Oil]], [[...First Do No Harm|...First Do No Harm]], [[Eye of God|Eye of God (film)]], [[Win Win|Win Win (film)]], [[Marvin's Room|Marvin's Room (film)]], [[Forged|Forged (film)]], [[Orphan|Orphan (2009 film)]], [[The Savages|The Savages (film)]], [[Hannah Montana: The Movie|Hannah Montana: The Movie]], [[August: Osage County|August: Osage County (film)]], and [[Paris, je t'aime|Paris, je t'aime]].
title: Margo Martindale

abstract: Darren Ockert was born in [[Lincoln|Lincoln, England]], England. After graduating from [[The London School of Musical Theatre|London School of Musical Theatre]] he established a theatre production company called Darren Ockert Productions in London at the [[Young Vic Theatre|Young Vic]]. In 1999, Ockert became one of the youngest producers to win a prestigious [[TMA Award|TMA Awards]] for his co-production with the [[Young Vic Theatre Company|Young Vic]] of Arabian Nights. On 29 September 2000, this production of Arabian Nights played a limited run [[Off-Broadway|Off-Broadway]] on [[42nd Street|42nd Street (Manhattan)]] in New York City at the [[New Victory Theater|New Victory Theater]].
title: Darren Ockert

abstract: Funda Arar spent her early childhood in Ankara, where she was born, and later in [[Muğla|Muğla]] and [[Adapazarı|Adapazarı]]. She studied at [[Istanbul Technical University|Istanbul Technical University]]'s music conservatory, specialicizing in the [[mandolin|mandolin]]. Her first album Sevgilerde came out in 1999, became a big hit, especially the song "Aysel". Sevgiliye was released a year later and included hits like "Seni Düşünürüm" and "Cesminaz" in collaboration with [[Kıraç|Kıraç]]. Alagül and Sevda Yanığı, her third and fourth albums came out in 2002 and 2003, which had the songs "Haberin Var mı?", "Aşksız Kal".
title: Funda Arar

abstract: Jérémie Renier (born 6 January 1981) is a [[Belgian|Belgium]] [[actor|actor]]. His film debut was in the critically praised [[La Promesse|La Promesse]] (1996), directed by Luc and Jean-Pierre Dardenne. He became better known to worldwide audiences in [[Brotherhood of the Wolf|Brotherhood of the Wolf]] (2001) and [[L'Enfant|L'Enfant (film)]] (2005). The latter was also directed by the Dardenne brothers. He portrayed singer [[Claude François|Claude François]] in the 2012 film [[My Way|My Way (2012 film)]].
title: Jérémie Renier

abstract: Cheon Soo-yeon (born Cheon Seong-im on 15 August 1981), professionally known by her stage name Song Ji-hyo, is a South Korean actress and model. Song was a cover model for Kiki Magazine before she made her acting debut in the feature film [[Wishing Stairs|Wishing Stairs]] (2003), the third installment in the [[Whispering Corridors film series|Whispering Corridors (film series)]]. She made her television debut in the romantic comedy [[Princess Hours|Princess Hours]] (2006) and the historical [[Jumong|Jumong (TV series)]] (2006). Song then received wider recognition for her roles in the film [[A Frozen Flower|A Frozen Flower]] (2008), [[New World|New World (2013 film)]] (2013), and the TV series [[Emergency Couple|Emergency Couple]] (2014).
title: Song Ji-hyo

abstract: Norman Rossington (24 December 1928 – 21 May 1999) was an [[English|England]] [[actor|actor]] best remembered for his roles in [[The Army Game|The Army Game]], the [[Carry On films|Carry On films]] and [[the Beatles|the Beatles]]' film [[A Hard Day's Night|A Hard Day's Night (film)]].
title: Norman Rossington

abstract: Sonu Sood (born 30 July 1973) is an Indian film actor, model, and producer who acts predominantly in [[Hindi|Bollywood]], [[Telugu|Telugu cinema]], [[Tamil|Tamil film]], [[Kannada|Kannada cinema]] and [[Punjabi|Cinema of the Punjab]] films.
title: Sonu Sood

abstract: Nicolas Winding Refn (; ; born 29 September 1970) is a Danish film director, screenwriter and producer. He is known for directing the crime dramas [[Bleeder|Bleeder (film)]] (1999) and the [[Pusher films|Pusher (film series)]] (1996–2005), the fictionalised biographical film [[Bronson|Bronson (film)]] (2008), the dramatic adventure film [[Valhalla Rising|Valhalla Rising (film)]] (2009), the neo-noir crime film [[Drive|Drive (2011 film)]] (2011), the thriller [[Only God Forgives|Only God Forgives]] (2013), and the psychological horror film [[The Neon Demon|The Neon Demon]] (2016). In 2008, Refn co-founded the [[Copenhagen|Copenhagen]]-based production company [[Space Rocket Nation|Space Rocket Nation]].
title: Nicolas Winding Refn

abstract: Michèle Girardon (9 August 1938 – 25 March 1975), sometimes credited as Michele Girardon, was a French actress.
title: Michèle Girardon

abstract: Jon Wiener (born May 16, 1944) is an [[American|United States]] [[historian|historian]] and journalist based in [[Los Angeles|Los Angeles, California]]. He successfully waged a 25-year legal battle to win the release of the [[FBI|FBI]]'s files on [[John Lennon|John Lennon]]. Wiener played a key role in efforts to expose the surveillance as well as the behind-the-scenes battling between the government and the former [[Beatle|The Beatles]], and is a recognized expert on the FBI-versus-Lennon controversy. A professor emeritus of [[United States history|History of the United States]] at the [[University of California, Irvine|University of California, Irvine]], he is also a contributing editor to the [[left-leaning|American Left]] political weekly magazine [[The Nation|The Nation]] and host of The Nations weekly [[podcast|political podcast]], [[Start Making Sense|Start Making Sense (podcast)]]. He also hosts a weekly radio program in Los Angeles.In addition to being an advocate for [[liberal|Modern liberalism in the United States]] causes and transparency in government, he wrote two books about Lennon, and has described Lennon's song "[[Imagine|Imagine (John Lennon song)]]" as being a "hymn to idealism" with relevance today. He has been criticized by reporters for having a left-oriented bias in his books, sometimes leading to a revisionism regarding Lennon's political orientation. Wiener interviewed [[Gore Vidal|Gore Vidal]] many times, and recently published a book of interviews with the late celebrity which spanned many years.
title: Jon Wiener

abstract: Ayesha Kapur (born 13 September 1994) is an Indian film child actress who is best known in the [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] movie [[Black|Black (2005 film)]]. Kapur became the recipient of many Awards in the "Best Supporting Actress" category. In doing so, she became the second youngest (behind [[Darsheel Safary|Darsheel Safary]]) person to be both nominated and win a [[Filmfare Award|Filmfare Award]] and is currently the youngest person ever to win a [[Zee Cine Award|Zee Cine Award]] and an [[IIFA Award|IIFA Award]].
title: Ayesha Kapur

abstract: Isabelle Fuhrman (born February 25, 1997) is an American actress. She portrayed Esther in the 2009 horror film [[Orphan|Orphan (2009 film)]] and [[Clove|List of The Hunger Games characters#Clove]] in [[The Hunger Games|The Hunger Games (film)]].
title: Isabelle Fuhrman

abstract: Ana Martín (born Ana Beatriz Martínez Solórzano on May 14, 1946 in [[Mexico City|Mexico City]], [[D.F.|D.F.]], [[Mexico|Mexico]]) is a [[Mexican|Mexican people]] actress, singer producer and former model, best known for her work in [[telenovelas|telenovelas]], movies and the stage. She won the [[Miss Mexico|Miss Mexico Organization]] title in 1963, which took her to compete in [[Miss World 1963|Miss World 1963]] in London, where she was disqualified for being underage. Since 1965 she has appeared in numerous telenovelas and films.
title: Ana Martín

abstract: Mela Lee is an American actress based in the Los Angeles area who voices characters on a number of animated series, films, television shows and video games. In anime, she voices lead characters [[Rin Tosaka|List of Fate/stay night characters#Rin Tohsaka]], in [[Fate/stay night|Fate/stay night]] as well as its reboot [[Fate/stay night: Unlimited Blade Works|Fate/stay night: Unlimited Blade Works]] and current film trilogy opener Heaven's Feel; [[Yuki Cross|Yuki Cross]] in [[Vampire Knight|Vampire Knight]]; Shinku the fifth Rozen Maiden doll in [[Rozen Maiden|Rozen Maiden]]; and [[Erica Karisawa|List of Durarara!! characters#Erica Karisawa]] in the [[Durarara!!|Durarara!!]] series, which was broadcast on [[Adult Swim|Adult Swim]]. In animation, she is the voice of Tikki in [[Miraculous: Tales of Ladybug & Cat Noir|Miraculous: Tales of Ladybug & Cat Noir]], which airs on [[Nickelodeon|Nickelodeon]] and [[Netflix|Netflix]]. In video games, she voices Rachel Alucard in the [[BlazBlue|BlazBlue]] series, Tiki in the [[Fire Emblem|Fire Emblem]] series, Sharon Krueger and Scarlet in [[The Legend of Heroes: Trails of Cold Steel|The Legend of Heroes: Trails of Cold Steel]] series, and Pallegina in the [[Pillars of Eternity|Pillars of Eternity]] series .
title: Mela Lee

abstract: Ulrich Thomsen (born 6 December 1963) is a Danish [[actor|actor]] and filmmaker.
title: Ulrich Thomsen

abstract: Sarah-Jane Potts (born 30 August 1976) is an English actress, best known for her roles as Saint (Sarah) in [[Sugar Rush|Sugar Rush (UK TV series)]], as Ellie, Abs' on/off girlfriend on [[Casualty|Casualty (TV series)]] and as [[Jo Lipsett|Jo Lipsett]] in [[Waterloo Road|Waterloo Road (TV series)]]. Potts is the sister of actor [[Andrew-Lee Potts|Andrew-Lee Potts]]. From 2011, she appeared in [[Holby City|Holby City]] as Senior Nurse [[Eddi McKee|Eddi McKee]] on [[AAU|Acute Assessment Unit]], playing a different character to the one she played in Casualty. Potts left Holby City in the second episode of Series 15; her departure was kept a secret by the production team and was not reported at all by the media, resulting in a shock exit for her character.
title: Sarah-Jane Potts

abstract: California Governor [[James Rolph, Jr.|James Rolph, Jr.]] said at the time of his death, "Robert Dollar has done more in his lifetime to spread the American flag on the high seas than any man in this country." He made the cover of Time magazine on 19 March 1928, with several writings concerning his business', and was given a long obituary in the 23 May 1932, issue.
title: Robert Dollar

abstract: Norma Miller was born in [[Harlem, New York|Harlem, New York]], in 1919 to mother Alma and father Norman, a soldier, both from Bridgetown, Barbados. Norma was named after her father, who died from pneumonia a month before her birth. She had an older sister, Dot. Miller took dance lessons from a young age. When the [[Great Depression|Great Depression]] began in 1929, Miller and her family moved to a new apartment near the [[Savoy Ballroom|Savoy Ballroom]].
title: Norma Miller

abstract: Gayatri Asokan is a [[playback singer|playback singer]] who works mainly in [[Malayalam cinema|Malayalam cinema]]. Apart from singing, she also composes music for albums and jingles. She is well trained in [[Bhajan|Bhajans]] and [[Hindustani|Hindustani classical music]] and [[ghazals|ghazals]]. She started her playback career with the song "Deena Dayalo Rama" for the film Arayannagalude Veedu under music director [[Raveendran|Raveendran]]. "Enthe Nee Kanna" for Sasneham Sumitra won her the [[Kerala State Film Award for Best Singer|Kerala State Film Award for Best Singer]] in 2003. Her memorable hits include "Chanjadi Adi" from [[Makalkku|Makalkku]], "Thumbikkinnaram" from [[Naran|Naran (film)]] and "Pularumo" from [[Ritu|Ritu (2009 film)]].
title: Gayatri Asokan

abstract: Renu Desai is a former [[model|Model (person)]] and [[actress|actress]].
title: Renu Desai

abstract: Scott Coffey (born Thomas Scott Coffey; May 1, 1967) is an American actor, director, producer and screenwriter. His film credits include [[Shag|Shag (film)]], [[Some Kind of Wonderful|Some Kind of Wonderful (film)]], [[Dream Lover|Dream Lover (1994 film)]], and [[Mulholland Drive|Mulholland Drive (film)]]. He directed [[Ellie Parker|Ellie Parker]] in 2005.
title: Scott Coffey

abstract: Sonia Couling (also spelled Sonia Cooling, Sonya Couling or Sonya Cooling), (; June 18, 1974 in [[Bangkok|Bangkok]], [[Thailand|Thailand]]) nickname Pim (; ), is an international supermodel, actress, TV personality and [[cover girl|cover girl]]. She has appeared in many Thai TV shows and films, been a [[VJ|VJ (media personality)]] for [[MTV Asia|MTV Asia]], been a host for [[HBO Asia|HBO (Asia)]] and has produced and hosted [[Thailand's Next Top Model|Thailand's Next Top Model]] in 2005. Couling also acts in Hollywood and French productions.
title: Sonia Couling

abstract: Celestine Cruz Gonzaga-Soriano (born January 20, 1984), better known as Toni Gonzaga, is a [[Filipino|Filipino people]] [[singer|singer]], [[television host|television host]] and [[actress|actor]].
title: Toni Gonzaga

abstract: S. Justin Selvaraj, known by his [[stage name|stage name]] S. J. Surya is an Indian film director, screenwriter, actor, music composer and producer who has worked in the [[Tamil|Tamil language]], Telugu and Hindi film industries. He sought to become an actor but ended up directing, assisting [[Vasanth|Vasanth]] and Sabapathy.
title: S. J. Surya

abstract: Hansika Motwani is an Indian actress who mainly appears in [[Tamil|Tamil language]] films. She also acts in [[Telugu|Telugu cinema]], [[Malayalam|Malayalam]] and [[Hindi|Hindi]] films. She made her film debut in the Telugu film [[Desamuduru|Desamuduru]] (2007), winning the [[Filmfare Award for Best Female Debut – South|Filmfare Award for Best Female Debut – South]]. She then appeared in a couple of high-budget Telugu films, including [[Kantri|Kantri]] (2008) and [[Maska|Maska (film)]] (2009) . She started her career in [[Tamil cinema|Tamil cinema]] with [[Mappillai|Mappillai (2011 film)]] (2011) and then appeared in several commercially successful Tamil films including [[Engeyum Kadhal|Engeyum Kadhal]] (2011), [[Velayudham|Velayudham]] (2011), [[Oru Kal Oru Kannadi|Oru Kal Oru Kannadi]] (2012), [[Theeya Velai Seiyyanum Kumaru|Theeya Velai Seiyyanum Kumaru]] (2013), [[Maan Karate|Maan Karate]] (2014), [[Aranmanai|Aranmanai]] (2014), [[Manithan|Manithan (2016 film)]] (2016), [[Bogan|Bogan (film)]] (2017). She made her [[Malayalam|Malayalam]] debut with [[Villain|Villain (2017 film)]] (2017).
title: Hansika Motwani

abstract: Elodie Keene (born April 10, 1949 in [[Berkeley|Berkeley, California]], [[California|California]]) is an American film/television director, producer and editor. As a television director her credits include [[ER|ER (TV series)]], [[NYPD Blue|NYPD Blue]], [[The Practice|The Practice]], [[Ally McBeal|Ally McBeal]], [[Charmed|Charmed]], [[Felicity|Felicity (TV series)]], [[The Wire|The Wire]], [[House, M.D.|House (TV series)]], [[The Closer|The Closer]], [[Nip/Tuck|Nip/Tuck]] and among other series.
title: Elodie Keene

abstract: Samir Mehanović is a [[Bosnia|Bosnian]] and [[British|United Kingdom]] BAFTA and IDFA awards winning film director, producer, and screenwriter who lives in [[Scotland|Scotland]] since 1995. He is also nominated for [[UK BAFTA 2017|UK BAFTA 2017]] and received the Grand Prix Award 22nd International Short Film Festival in Drama, Greece 2016 for the short film Mouth of Hell, [[IDFA|International Documentary Film Festival Amsterdam]] Special Jury Award for Documentary The Fog of Srebrenica and the [[BAFTA SCOTLAND|BAFTA SCOTLAND]] award for the short film The Way We Played.
title: Samir Mehanović

abstract: A native of [[Shehong County|Shehong County]] in modern [[Sichuan|Sichuan]] province, Chen Zi'ang was the son of a rich man, and did not travel to the capital to take his exams until he was in his twenties. He completed the [[Jinshi|Jinshi (imperial examination)]] level of the [[Imperial Examination|Imperial Examination]] at age twenty-four.
title: Chen Zi'ang

abstract: Linda Perry (born April 15, 1965) is an American singer-songwriter, musician, and record producer. She first became known as the lead singer and primary songwriter of [[4 Non Blondes|4 Non Blondes]] and has since founded two record labels and composed and produced hit songs for several other artists. They include: "[[Beautiful|Beautiful (Christina Aguilera song)]]" by [[Christina Aguilera|Christina Aguilera]]; "[[What You Waiting For?|What You Waiting For?]]" by [[Gwen Stefani|Gwen Stefani]]; and "[[Get the Party Started|Get the Party Started]]" by [[P!nk|P!nk]]. Perry has also contributed to albums by [[Adele|Adele]], [[Alicia Keys|Alicia Keys]], and [[Courtney Love|Courtney Love]], as well as signing and distributing [[James Blunt|James Blunt]] in the United States. Perry was also inducted into the [[Songwriters Hall of Fame|Songwriters Hall of Fame]] in 2015.
title: Linda Perry

abstract: Dan Deublein (born November 22, 1972 in [[Show Low|Show Low]], [[Arizona|Arizona]]) is an American former actor. In 2005, he left the entertainment industry to pursue a career in medicine.
title: Dan Deublein

abstract: Cass Daley (born Catherine Dailey; July 17, 1915 – March 22, 1975) was an American radio, television and film actress, singer, and comedian. The daughter of an Irish streetcar conductor, Daley started to perform at [[night club|night clubs]] and on the radio as a band vocalist in the 1940s.
title: Cass Daley

abstract: Joey Miyashima (born November 18, 1957) is a [[Japanese American|Japanese American]] television and film actor. Miyashima played [[Pee-wee Herman|Pee-wee Herman]]'s Japanese pen pal, Oki Doki, in "Accidental Playhouse", an episode of [[Pee-Wee's Playhouse|Pee-Wee's Playhouse]]. He had a role in an episode ("9 Minutes and 52 Seconds Over Tokyo") of [[The Tracey Ullman Show|The Tracey Ullman Show]], and another in its spin-off, [[The Simpsons|The Simpsons]], as the voice of Toshiro, the apprentice chef, in the episode called "[[One Fish, Two Fish, Blowfish, Blue Fish|One Fish, Two Fish, Blowfish, Blue Fish]]". In 2006, he played the role of Principal Dave Matsui in the [[Disney Channel Original Movie|List of Disney Channel movies]] [[High School Musical|High School Musical]], and reprised it in [[High School Musical 3: Senior Year|High School Musical 3: Senior Year]] (2008). In 2009 he had a cameo as a police officer in the new [[DCOM|List of Disney Channel Original Movies]] [[Dadnapped|Dadnapped]].
title: Joey Miyashima

abstract: Erin Chambers (born September 24, 1979) is an American actress, best known for her role as [[Siobhan McKenna Spencer|Siobhan McKenna (General Hospital)]] on ABC soap opera [[General Hospital|General Hospital]]. She has made guest appearances in a number of television shows.
title: Erin Chambers

abstract: Victoria Thaine (born 4 January 1984) is an Australian television and film actress and former playwright.
title: Victoria Thaine

abstract: Marshall Lancaster (born 5 October 1974) is an English actor. He has appeared in television dramas including [[Coronation Street|Coronation Street]], [[Holby City|Holby City]], [[The Lakes|The Lakes (TV series)]] and [[Family Affairs|Family Affairs]]. He is best known for playing DC [[Chris Skelton|Chris Skelton]] in the [[BBC|BBC]] time-travel police dramas, [[Life on Mars|Life on Mars (UK TV series)]] and [[Ashes to Ashes|Ashes to Ashes (TV series)]], the former set in 1973, and the latter set between 1981 and 1983.
title: Marshall Lancaster

abstract: Sumanth was born in Hyderabad, India, on 9 February 1975. He is the only son of Surendra Yarlagadda and the late Satyavathi Akkineni, the eldest child of [[Akkineni Nageswara Rao|Akkineni Nageswara Rao]]. A few months after his birth, Sumanth's parents returned to the US where they were then residing. Sumanth however remained in India on the request of his late maternal grandfather [[Akkineni Nageswara Rao|Akkineni Nageswara Rao]], who was on a hiatus from films after a major heart surgery. The latter had often said that his busy acting career prevented him from fully experiencing fatherhood with his own children, so he wished to raise his first grandchild himself. Hence Sumanth was adopted by his maternal grandparents.
title: Sumanth

abstract: Louise Brealey, also credited as Loo Brealey, is an English actress, writer and journalist. She is best known for playing [[Molly Hooper|Molly Hooper]] in [[Sherlock|Sherlock (TV series)]]. .
title: Louise Brealey

abstract: André Dussollier (born 17 February 1946) is a French [[actor|actor]].
title: André Dussollier

abstract: Following the ending of Un paso adelante, Luengo launched a solo career and released her debut studio album Mi generación in 2005, followed by BL (2006), Carrousel (2008) and Bela y sus moskitas muertas (2011). She also co–wrote the song "Más fuerte" for Cucu Diamantes and earned a [[Latin Grammy Award|Latin Grammy Award]] nomination for [[Best Alternative Song|Latin Grammy Award for Best Alternative Song]] in [[2009|Latin Grammy Awards of 2009]]. In 2007 Beatriz Luengo won an [[EBBA Award|EBBA Awards]].
title: Beatriz Luengo

abstract: Vhong Navarro is a [[Filipino|Filipino people]] [[comedian|comedian]], [[actor|actor]], [[dancer|dancer]], [[singer|singer]], [[judge|judge]] and [[TV host|TV host]] of [[ABS-CBN|ABS-CBN]]. He is part of the dance group [[Streetboys|Streetboys]] in the Philippines.
title: Vhong Navarro

abstract: Sayaji Shinde (born 1 February 1959) is an Indian film actor who has acted in [[Marathi|Marathi cinema]], [[Telugu|Telugu cinema]], [[Tamil|Tamil cinema]], [[Kannada|Kannada cinema]], [[Malayalam|Malayalam cinema]] and [[Hindi|Bollywood]] films. Sayaji started his acting career in 1978 with acting in Marathi one-act plays. His acting in a 1987 Marathi play titled Hijada (Eunuch) was very well received, and since then he started gaining popularity among the circle of stalwarts. Later, he moved on to [[Marathi cinema|Marathi cinema]] and later started acting in other languages.
title: Sayaji Shinde

abstract: Mangal Singh Dhillon, better known as Mangal Dhillon is an [[India|Indian]] actor and film producer. He was born in Wander Jatana near [[Kotkapura|Kotkapura]] in [[Faridkot district|Faridkot district]], [[Punjab|Punjab (India)]].
title: Mangal Dhillon

abstract: Evan Olav Næss (born August 26, 1988), known professionally as Evan Ross, is an American actor and musician. He made his acting debut in the comedy-drama film [[ATL|ATL (film)]] (2006), and has since starred in the films [[Pride|Pride (2007 film)]] (2007), [[According to Greta|According to Greta]] (2009), [[Mooz-lum|Mooz-lum]] (2010), [[96 Minutes|96 Minutes]] (2011), [[Supremacy|Supremacy (film)]] (2014), [[The Hunger Games: Mockingjay – Part 1|The Hunger Games: Mockingjay – Part 1]] (2014) and [[Part 2|The Hunger Games: Mockingjay – Part 2]] (2015).
title: Evan Ross

abstract: Kunnisseri Veettil Raman Mani (1 January 1971 – 6 March 2016), better known by his stage name Kalabhavan Mani, was an Indian film actor and singer. Mani started his career as a [[mimicry|Impersonator]] artist with the [[Kalabhavan|Kalabhavan]] troupe. He has starred in over 200 films, including [[Malayalam|Malayalam film]], [[Tamil|Tamil film]], [[Kannada|Kannada film]] and [[Telugu film|Telugu films]], and is renowned for his humorous characters and villain roles. He received the [[National Film Award – Special Jury Award|National Film Awards]] and [[Kerala State Film Award|Kerala State Film Award]] for his performance as Ramu in [[Vasanthiyum Lakshmiyum Pinne Njaanum|Vasanthiyum Lakshmiyum Pinne Njaanum]] (1999).
title: Kalabhavan Mani

abstract: Kate Reinders (born December 10, 1980) is an American [[musical theatre|musical theatre]] actress, who has performed as lead and [[understudy|understudy]] in several [[Broadway|Broadway theatre]] shows. Reinders was born in [[Seattle, Washington|Seattle, Washington]], but raised in [[Spring Lake, Michigan|Spring Lake, Michigan]]. She attended [[Western Michigan Christian High School|Western Michigan Christian High School]], graduating in 1998.
title: Kate Reinders

abstract: Nam Sang-mi was working in a [[Lotteria|Lotteria]] restaurant near [[Hanyang University|Hanyang University]] in the fall of 2001 when someone posted her personal photos on the internet. Her popularity as an [[ulzzang|ulzzang]] led to her discovery as an actress. She made her debut in the 2003 melodrama series [[Love Letter|Love Letter (TV series)]], and began her acting career by taking small roles in films, [[TV drama|Korean dramas]], and commercials. Her first leading role came with [[Sweet Spy|Sweet Spy]] in 2005. This was followed by leading roles in comedy drama [[Bad Family|Bad Family (TV series)]] (2006) and action romance drama [[Time Between Dog and Wolf|Time Between Dog and Wolf]] (2007).
title: Nam Sang-mi

abstract: Shakira Isabel Mebarak Ripoll (, ; born 2 February 1977) is a Colombian singer, songwriter, dancer, businesswoman, and philanthropist. Born and raised in [[Barranquilla|Barranquilla]], her first [[studio album|studio albums]], [[Magia|Magia (Shakira album)]] and [[Peligro|Peligro (Shakira album)]], failed to attain commercial success in the 1990s; however, she rose to prominence in Latin America with her major-label debut, [[Pies Descalzos|Pies Descalzos]] (1996), and her fourth album, [[Dónde Están los Ladrones?|Dónde Están los Ladrones?]] (1998).
title: Shakira

abstract: Mamta Mohandas was born on 14 November 1984 to Ambalappat Mohandas and Ganga into a Malayali family which originally hails from [[Kannur|Kannur]] (Kerala). She attended the [[Indian School, Bahrain|Indian School, Bahrain]] until 2002 and is an alumna of the School. She pursued a [[Bachelor's degree|Bachelor's degree]] at [[Mount Carmel College Bangalore|Mount Carmel College Bangalore]]. She modeled for print ads for companies such as [[IBM|IBM]] and Kalyan Kendra and modeled on the ramp for the Mysore Maharajah and Raymonds. Mamta is trained in [[Karnatic|Carnatic music]] and [[Hindustani music|Hindustani music]].
title: Mamta Mohandas

abstract: Shahkrit Yamnam (; , born 25 June 1978 in [[Bangkok|Bangkok]], Thailand) is a [[Thai|Thai people]] film and television actor. He has acted in numerous popular [[lakorn|lakorns]], [[sitcoms|situation comedy]] and commercials. He is also credited under the stage names Shahkrit Yamnarm, Charkrit Ngamengarm and Krit.
title: Shahkrit Yamnam

abstract: Danitza Kingsley (born Danica Bujic) is an American [[photographer|photographer]] and [[actress|Actor]]. She is known for doing films such as [[Amazons|Amazons (1986 film)]], [[No Man's Land|No Man's Land (1987 film)]], [[Jack's Back|Jack's Back]] and South of Reno. As Danica Perez, she published a collection of her photographic work, The Glow: A Journey to Motherhood in 2001.
title: Danitza Kingsley

abstract: Lucrecia Martel (born December 14, 1966) is an [[Argentine|Argentina]] film director, screenwriter and producer whose feature films have frequented [[Cannes|Cannes Film Festival]], [[Venice|Venice Film Festival]], [[Berlin|Berlin International Film Festival]], [[Toronto|Toronto International Film Festival]], and many other international film festivals. Film scholar Paul Julian Smith wrote in 2015 that she is “arguably the most critically acclaimed [[auteur|auteur]] in Spanish-language [[art cinema|art cinema]] outside Latin America” and that her “[[transnational|transnational cinema]] auteurism and demanding features have earned her a hard-won reputation in the [[world art cinema|world cinema]] [[festival circuit|film festival#Notable festivals]].”. Similarly, film scholar Haden Guest has called her “one of the most prodigiously talented filmmakers in contemporary world cinema,” and film scholar [[David Oubiña|:es:David Oubiña]] has called her body of work a “rare perfection.” In April 2018, [[Vogue|Vogue (magazine)]] called her "one of the greatest directors in the world right now".
title: Lucrecia Martel

abstract: Kirsten Nelson (born October 3, 1970) is an [[American|Americans]] actress and director.
title: Kirsten Nelson

abstract: David Zepeda (; born as David Anastasio Zepeda Quintero on September 19, 1973 in [[Nogales, Sonora|Nogales, Sonora]], [[Mexico|Mexico]]) is a Mexican actor, model and singer.
title: David Zepeda

abstract: Luciana Carro (born March 23, 1981) is a Canadian [[actress|actress]] best known for her appearances on the television series [[Battlestar Galactica|Battlestar Galactica (2004 TV series)]], [[Caprica|Caprica (TV series)]], and [[Falling Skies|Falling Skies]] and in movies such as [[Two for the Money|Two for the Money (2005 film)]] and [[Dr. Dolittle 3|Dr. Dolittle 3]].
title: Luciana Carro

abstract: Nicholas D'Agosto (born April 17, 1980) is an American actor. He is known for being the lead of [[Final Destination 5|Final Destination 5]] and his recurring roles in [[Heroes|Heroes (U.S. TV series)]] and [[The Office|The Office (U.S. TV series)]]. He starred in the [[Showtime|Showtime (TV network)]] series [[Masters of Sex|Masters of Sex]] and the [[Fox|Fox Broadcasting Company]] series [[Gotham|Gotham (TV series)]]. D'Agosto also stars in the series [[Trial & Error|Trial & Error (TV series) ]] which finished airing its second season in October 2018.
title: Nicholas D'Agosto

abstract: Cleopatra Coleman (born 29 October 1987) is an Australian actress who lives in [[Los Angeles, California|Los Angeles, California]]. She is known for playing Erica on the American comedy series [[The Last Man on Earth|The Last Man on Earth (TV series)]].
title: Cleopatra Coleman

abstract: Anthony Starke (born June 6, 1963) is an [[American|United States]] [[actor|actor]]. He is well known for his one episode role in [[Seinfeld|Seinfeld]], playing the 3rd-person-speaking character Jimmy in "[[The Jimmy|The Jimmy]]", as well as playing Jack on [[The George Carlin Show|The George Carlin Show]], on [[Fox|Fox Broadcasting Company]].
title: Anthony Starke

abstract: Clovis Cornillac (born 16 August 1968) is a [[French|France]] actor, film director and screenwriter.
title: Clovis Cornillac

abstract: Orlando Martins (8 December 1899 – 25 September 1985) was a pioneering Nigerian film and stage actor. In the late 1940s, he was one of England's most prominent and leading [[black|Black people]] actors, and in a poll conducted in 1947, he was listed among England's top 15 favourite actors.
title: Orlando Martins

abstract: Brandon Baker (born April 28, 1985) is an [[American|United States]] [[actor|actor]]. He is known for the [[made-for-TV|Television film]] movies, such as [[Disney|The Walt Disney Company]] movies [[Johnny Tsunami|Johnny Tsunami]] and its sequel [[Johnny Kapahala: Back on Board|Johnny Kapahala: Back on Board]] as well as for his role on the [[NBC|NBC]] sitcom [[One World|One World (TV series)]]. In 2002, he appeared in episodes of the Disney Channel original series [[Even Stevens|Even Stevens]].
title: Brandon Baker

abstract: Born Viola Lynn Collins, reported variously in May or June 1977, Collins is from [[Houston|Houston]], [[Texas|Texas]], and has [[English|English people]], [[Scottish|Scottish people]], and [[Irish|Irish people]] ancestry. She has also claimed to have [[Cherokee|Cherokee]] ancestry, referring to herself as "Irish and Cherokee". She spent her formative years in [[Singapore|Singapore]], with "summers in [[Japan|Japan]] where her parents were getting their fourth and fifth and sixth [[dan|Dan (rank)]] in [[Shitō-ryū|Shito-ryu]] ... [[Okinawa|Okinawa]]-style [[karate|karate]]". During a childhood Christmas pageant in which she played Mrs. Claus, Collins discovered her love for acting.
title: Lynn Collins

abstract: Shantanu Moitra (born 22 January 1968) is an Indian [[music director|music director]] and background [[score composer|score composer]] who has composed & sung songs for the [[Hindi film industry|Hindi film industry]], and is most known for his scores in the films [[Parineeta|Parineeta (2005 film)]] (2005), [[Hazaaron Khwaishein Aisi|Hazaaron Khwaishein Aisi]] (2005), [[Lage Raho Munnabhai|Lage Raho Munnabhai]] (2006) and [[3 Idiots|3 Idiots]] (2009), and private albums, Mann ke Manjeere and Ab ke Saawan sung by [[Shubha Mudgal|Shubha Mudgal]]. In 2014, he received the [[National Film Award for Best Music Direction|National Film Award for Best Music Direction]] (Background Score) for [[Na Bangaaru Talli|Na Bangaaru Talli]].
title: Shantanu Moitra

abstract: Park Ye-jin (born April 1, 1981) is a South Korean actress.
title: Park Ye-jin

abstract: Apani N. Smith (born September 17, 1974) known professionally as Apani B. Fly, is an American [[hip hop emcee|Rapping]].
title: Apani B

abstract: Annu Kapoor (born as Anil Kapoor on 20 February 1956) is an [[Indian|Indian people]] film actor and television presenter best-remembered for hosting the vocal reality show [[Antakshari|Titan Antakshari]] from 1993 to 2006 and his roles in [[Mr. India (1987 film)|Mr. India (1987 film)]], [[Vicky Donor|Vicky Donor]] (2012) and [[Jolly LLB 2|Jolly LLB 2]] (2017). He received [[Filmfare award|Filmfare award]] as well as [[National Film Award|National Film Award (India)]] for Best Supporting Actor for Vicky Donor.
title: Annu Kapoor

abstract: Robert Tinkler (born May 12, 1973) is a Canadian voice actor who provides voices for a number of cartoons and anime shows. He voiced Max in [[The Adventures of Sam & Max: Freelance Police|The Adventures of Sam & Max: Freelance Police]], Delete in the children's animated series [[Cyberchase|Cyberchase]] and Howie in [[Almost Naked Animals|Almost Naked Animals]]. In anime, he provides the voice of [[Gingka Hagane|List of Beyblade characters#Gingka Hagane]], the main protagonist in [[Beyblade Metal Fusion|Beyblade Metal Fusion]] and Brooklyn Masefield in [[Beyblade G Revolution|Beyblade G Revolution]]. In feature films, he voiced Buddy in [[The Nut Job|The Nut Job]].
title: Robert Tinkler

abstract: Anna Trebunskaya was born December 28, 1980 in [[Chelyabinsk, Russia|Chelyabinsk, Russia]]. Her parents, Oleg Trebunski and Irina Trebunskaya, owned a dance studio and were professional ballroom dancers. Having begun dancing at the age of six, their daughter entered and won her first competition when she was seven. She moved to the United States with her parents when she was 17 years old to pursue her career as a professional dancer. She won her first US title of Amateur Standard Youth Championship in 1997 later becoming a professional competitor in the year 2000. Trebunskaya resides in California. She and her mother own a dance studio in [[Hermosa Beach, California|Hermosa Beach, California]].
title: Anna Trebunskaya

abstract: Jean-François Le Sueur (more commonly Lesueur; ) (15 February 17606 October 1837) was a French [[composer|composer]], best known for his [[oratorio|oratorios]] and [[opera|operas]].
title: Jean-François Le Sueur

abstract: Oh Man-seok (born January 30, 1975) is a South Korean actor. Best known for playing the titular transgender singer in rock musical [[Hedwig and the Angry Inch|Hedwig and the Angry Inch (musical)]], Oh's acting career spans theater, television and film.
title: Oh Man-seok

abstract: Anna Biller is an independent American filmmaker who has directed two feature films. Biller considers herself a feminist filmmaker, and consciously explores feminist themes throughout her work, including an attempt to insert the female gaze into cinema.
title: Anna Biller

abstract: Salma Agha (born 25 October 1956) is a [[British-Pakistani|British-Pakistani]] singer and actress who sang as well as acted in [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] films of India in the 1980s and the early 1990s. She was born in [[Karachi|Karachi]] and raised in London, where she received several film offers from Indian directors. Her first film was [[Nikaah|Nikaah]], in which she starred as heroine and also sang her songs herself. She was nominated for the [[Filmfare|Filmfare]] awards that year in both the [[Best Actress|Filmfare Award for Best Actress]] category and the [[Best Female Playback Singer|Filmfare Best Female Playback Award]] category. It was for her singing that she won the [[Filmfare Best Female Playback Award|Filmfare Best Female Playback Award]]. She is also known for her role in [[Kasam Paida Karne Wale Ki|Kasam Paida Karne Wale Ki]] (1984) opposite [[Mithun Chakraborty|Mithun Chakraborty]], and for her song "Come Closer" from the same film.
title: Salma Agha

abstract: Andrew Whipp is an [[English|England]] [[actor|actor]]. Whipp has received critical acclaim for many of his stage performances; most recently playing Gordon in F*ck the Polar Bears at the [[Bush Theatre|Bush Theatre]]. He was named in the Best Performances of 2010 list in the Sunday Times Irish Edition for his performance as Bernard Nightingale in [[Arcadia (play)|Arcadia (play)]] by [[Tom Stoppard|Tom Stoppard]] at the [[Gate Theatre|Gate Theatre]], [[Dublin|Dublin]], directed by [[Patrick Mason|Patrick Mason]].
title: Andrew Whipp

abstract: Celso Antunes (born November 12, 1959) is a [[Brazil|Brazilian]] [[conductor|conductor (music)]] located in [[Germany|Germany]].
title: Celso Antunes

abstract: Jeon Do-yeon (born February 11, 1973) is a [[South Korea|South Korean]] actress. She has won many awards in her career, including [[Best Actress|Cannes Film Festival Award for Best Actress]] at the [[60th Cannes Film Festival|2007 Cannes Film Festival]] and the 1st [[Asia Pacific Screen Awards|Asia Pacific Screen Awards]] for her portrayal of a broken woman who has lost everything in [[Lee Chang-dong|Lee Chang-dong]]'s 2007 film [[Secret Sunshine|Secret Sunshine]].
title: Jeon Do-yeon

abstract: Apurva Agnihotri (born 2 December 1972) is an Indian actor known for his role of Armaan Suri in [[Jassi Jaissi Koi Nahin|Jassi Jaissi Koi Nahin]].
title: Apurva Agnihotri

abstract: Adoor Pankajam (1929 – 26 June 2010) was an [[India|Indian]] actress, in [[Malayalam movies|Malayalam cinema]]. She hailed from [[Adoor|Adoor]] in [[Pathanamthitta|Pathanamthitta]] district of [[Kerala|Kerala]] state. Mainly, she was a [[supporting actress|supporting actress]], and a [[comedian|comedian]]. Her sister [[Adoor Bhavani|Adoor Bhavani]] was also a Malayalam cinema actress.
title: Adoor Pankajam

abstract: Babi Xavier (born Anna Bárbara Xavier; 6 July 1974, [[Niterói|Niterói]], Rio de Janeiro) is a Brazilian television actress, singer and TV hostess.
title: Babi Xavier

abstract: Jake Austin Szymanski (born December 3, 1994), known professionally as Jake T. Austin, is an American [[actor|actor]]. Beginning a career as a [[child actor|child actor]] at the age of seven, Austin is a five-time [[Young Artist Award|Young Artist Award]] nominee, two-time [[Teen Choice Award|Teen Choice Award]] nominee and [[Nickelodeon Kid's Choice Awards|Nickelodeon Kid's Choice Awards]] nominee. Best known for his role as [[Max Russo|Max Russo]] on the [[Disney Channel|Disney Channel]] series [[Wizards of Waverly Place|Wizards of Waverly Place]], and as the voice of Diego on the [[Nickelodeon|Nickelodeon (TV channel)]] animated series [[Go, Diego, Go!|Go, Diego, Go!]]. Austin was also the original actor who portrayed [[Jesus Foster|Jesus Foster]] on the [[ABC Family|ABC Family]] family/teen drama series [[The Fosters|The Fosters (2013 TV series)]]. He also co-starred in [[Hotel For Dogs|Hotel For Dogs]], [[New Year's Eve|New Year's Eve (film)]], [[The Emoji Movie|The Emoji Movie]] and the upcoming Adverse, releasing in 2019.
title: Jake T. Austin

abstract: Baldev Upadhyaya (10 October 1899 – 10 August 1999) was a [[Hindi|Hindi]], [[Sanskrit|Sanskrit]] scholar, literary [[historian|historian]], [[essayist|essayist]] and [[critic|critic]]. He wrote numerous books, collections of essays and a historical outline of [[Sanskrit literature|Sanskrit literature]]. He is noted for discussing Sanskrit literature in the Hindi language. Earlier books related to Sanskrit literature were often written either in Sanskrit or in English.
title: Baldev Upadhyaya

abstract: Terence Yin Chi-wai (), born May 19, 1975, is a [[Chinese|Han Chinese]] [[film|film]] [[actor|actor]], singer, [[producer|Film producer]], and media relations specialist. Yin has starred in over 30 movies, released one solo album and resides in [[Hong Kong|Hong Kong]].
title: Terence Yin

abstract: Ryan Jay Jimenez (born September 17, 1983), better known as RJ Jimenez, is a Filipino singer and guitarist and former scholar of [[Pinoy Dream Academy|Pinoy Dream Academy]].
title: RJ Jimenez

abstract: Zachary Bennett (born February 17, 1980) is a [[Canadian|Canadians]] [[actor|actor]] and musician in [[Toronto, Ontario|Toronto]], who is known for playing Felix King in [[Road to Avonlea|Road to Avonlea]]. He also co-starred in the 2006 TV film [[Jekyll + Hyde|Jekyll + Hyde]].
title: Zachary Bennett

abstract: Octavia Lenora Spencer (born May 25, 1972) is an American actress, author, and film producer. She is the recipient of [[several accolades|List of awards and nominations received by Octavia Spencer]], including an [[Academy Award|Academy Awards]], a [[British Academy Film Award|British Academy Film Award]], and a [[Golden Globe Award|Golden Globe Award]]. She is one of two black actresses to have received three Academy Award nominations.
title: Octavia Spencer

abstract: Elizabeth Herbert, Countess of Pembroke and Montgomery (January/March 1737 – 30 April 1831) was the daughter of [[Charles Spencer|Charles Spencer, 3rd Duke of Marlborough]] and [[Elizabeth Trevor|Elizabeth Spencer, Duchess of Marlborough]].
title: Elizabeth Herbert, Countess of Pembroke and Montgomery

abstract: Iliana Fox (born Iliana Jan Fox Gaitan on 3 January 1977 in [[Leeds|Leeds]], [[England|England]]) is a [[Mexican|Mexico]] [[actress|actress]] and [[voice actress|voice actress]].
title: Iliana Fox

abstract: Isadore Borsuk (November 4, 1927 – September 19, 2016), better known as Bobby Breen, was a Canadian-born American actor and singer. He was a popular male child singer during the 1930s and reached major popularity with film and radio appearances.
title: Bobby Breen

abstract: Lee Yoo-ri (; born January 28, 1980) is a South Korean actress and businesswoman. Lee first became known for her role in teen drama series School 4, and subsequently gained popularity with her role in family drama [[Precious Family|Precious Family]] (2005). In the recent years, she became known for her role as the [[antagonist|antagonist]] in [[television drama|television drama]] series [[Twinkle Twinkle|Twinkle Twinkle (TV series)]] (2011) and [[Jang Bo-ri is Here!|Jang Bo-ri is Here!]] (2014). She most recently starred in [[My Father is Strange|My Father is Strange]] (2017).
title: Lee Yoo-ri

abstract: Denise Darcel (8 September 1924   – 23 December 2011) was a French actress who also made films in [[Hollywood|Cinema of the United States]].
title: Denise Darcel

abstract: Matthew Scott Porter (born July 14, 1979) is an American actor and occasional singer known for his role as [[Jason Street|Jason Street]] in the [[NBC|NBC]] television drama [[Friday Night Lights|Friday Night Lights (TV series)]]. His character was injured during a football game in the pilot episode and became disabled. The character was inspired by high school football player [[David Edwards|David Edwards (football player and motivational speaker)]].
title: Scott Porter

abstract: Hubert August Piel (12 July 1892, [[Düsseldorf|Düsseldorf]] – 27 March 1963, [[Munich|Munich]]), known as Harry Piel, was a prolific German actor, film director, screenwriter and film producer who was involved in over 150 films.
title: Harry Piel

abstract: Jose Madrigal Ochoa, better known as Dominic Ochoa (born August 4, 1973) is a Filipino actor and member of [[ABS CBN|ABS CBN]]'s circle of homegrown talents named [[Star Magic|Star Magic]], as part of the batch 4. He is currently managed by [[Boy Abunda|Boy Abunda]].
title: Dominic Ochoa

abstract: Louise Latham (September 23, 1922 – February 12, 2018) was an American actress, perhaps best known for her portrayal of Bernice Edgar in [[Alfred Hitchcock|Alfred Hitchcock]]'s 1964 film [[Marnie|Marnie (film)]].
title: Louise Latham

abstract: Jeanette Loff (born Janette Clarinda Lov; October 9, 1906 – August 4, 1942) was an American actress and singer. Born to Danish and Norwegian immigrants, Loff was raised throughout the [[Pacific Northwest|Pacific Northwest]], and began singing professionally as a [[lyric soprano|lyric soprano]] and performing as an [[organist|organist]] while a teenager in [[Portland, Oregon|Portland, Oregon]].
title: Jeanette Loff

abstract: Antonio Casas (11 November 1911 in [[A Coruña|A Coruña]], [[Galicia|Galicia (Spain)]], [[Spain|Spain]] – 14 February 1982 in [[Madrid|Madrid]], [[Spain|Spain]]) was a [[Spanish|Spain]] footballer turned film actor who appeared in film between 1941 and his death in 1982.
title: Antonio Casas

abstract: Marília Pêra (22 January 1943 – 5 December 2015) was a Brazilian actress. Hailed as "one of the decade's [1980s] ten best actresses" by [[Pauline Kael|Pauline Kael]], Pêra won the [[National Society of Film Critics Award for Best Actress|National Society of Film Critics Award for Best Actress]] in 1982 for her role in [[Hector Babenco|Hector Babenco]]'s acclaimed [[Pixote|Pixote]], and received Best Actress awards at the [[Gramado Film Festival|Gramado Film Festival]] (Triple Award Winner) and at the Cartegena Film Festival for [[Carlos Diegues|Carlos Diegues]]' [[Better Days Ahead|Better Days Ahead (film)]]. Other films include [[Bar Esperança|Bar Esperança]], [[Angels of the Night|Angels of the Night]] and Diegues' [[Tieta do Agreste|Tieta do Agreste (film)]].
title: Marília Pêra

abstract: Aaron Norris (born November 23, 1951, in [[Gardena, California|Gardena, California]]) is an [[American|United States]] [[stunt performer|stunt performer]] ([[Good Guys Wear Black|Good Guys Wear Black]], [[Ant-Man|Ant-Man (film)]], [[I Love You Phillip Morris|I Love You Phillip Morris]]), [[director|Film director]] ([[Braddock: Missing in Action III|Braddock: Missing in Action III]], [[Platoon Leader|Platoon Leader (film)]], [[Delta Force 2: The Colombian Connection|Delta Force 2: The Colombian Connection]]), [[film|film producer]] and [[television producer|television producer]] ([[Walker, Texas Ranger|Walker, Texas Ranger]], [[Not Easily Broken|Not Easily Broken]], [[Logan's War: Bound by Honor|Logan's War: Bound by Honor]]). He is the younger brother of action film star [[Chuck Norris|Chuck Norris]].
title: Aaron Norris

abstract: Melissa Galianos (born September 26, 1979) is a Canadian actress known for her roles on various television shows on the Canadian network, [[YTV|YTV (TV channel)]].
title: Melissa Galianos

abstract: Imogen Holly Aird (born 18 May 1969) is an English television actress known for playing Forensic Pathologist Frankie Wharton in the [[BBC1|BBC1]] drama series [[Waking the Dead|Waking the Dead (TV series)]], having previously starred in productions such as [[Soldier Soldier|Soldier Soldier]] and the 1997 film [[Fever Pitch|Fever Pitch (1997 film)]] alongside [[Colin Firth|Colin Firth]].
title: Holly Aird

abstract: Navtej Singh Rehal (), popularly known as Naf, is the lead [[singer|singer]] of the [[Indo|India]]-[[Danish|Denmark]] [[music band|music band]] named [[Bombay Rockers|Bombay Rockers]]. His co-partner is [[Thomas Sardorf|Thomas Sardorf]].Rehal delivers the [[Punjabi|Punjabi language]] vocals and plays [[guitar|guitar]] and keyboards in the band. His debut [[album|album]] [[Introducing|Introducing (Bombay Rockers album)]] has gone five times [[platinum|platinum album]] with sales of over 100,000 [[album|albums]]. It was No.1 for 15 consecutive [[week|weeks]] on the [[India|Indian]] [[album|album]] charts.
title: Navtej Singh Rehal

abstract: Ivana Baquero Macías (born 11 June 1994) is a [[Spanish|Spaniards]] actress. At the age of 11, she was chosen by director [[Guillermo del Toro|Guillermo del Toro]] to star as Ofelia in [[Pan's Labyrinth|Pan's Labyrinth]], for which she won critical acclaim and the [[Goya Award for Best New Actress|Goya Award for Best New Actress]]. In 2015, she was cast as [[Eretria|Eretria (Shannara)]] in the television series [[The Shannara Chronicles|The Shannara Chronicles]].
title: Ivana Baquero

abstract: Ninad Kamat is an [[India|Indian]] [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] [[film|film]] [[actor|actor]]. Some of his movies are Zabardast, Kabhi Up Kabhi Down, Shiva, [[Lage Raho Munnabhai|Lage Raho Munnabhai]], 7½ Phere, Viruddh, Dus, [[Parineeta|Parineeta (2005 film)]], Zeher, Sangharsh, Doli Sajake Rakhna and [[Jai Gangaajal|Jai Gangaajal]]. He has also worked as a playback singer in Shiva and Darna Mana Hai. He is one of India's foremost voicing talents, having given his voice to thousands of commercials. He has dubbed for [[Amitabh Bachchan|Amitabh Bachchan]], [[Sachin Tendulkar|Sachin Tendulkar]], [[Will Smith|Will Smith]], [[Jim Carrey|Jim Carrey]] and more.
title: Ninad Kamat

abstract: Ted Sator played [[college hockey|College ice hockey]] for [[Bowling Green State University|Bowling Green Falcons men's ice hockey]]. During his senior year, the 1971–72 season, for the Falcons, Sator played 27 games, where he tallied 5 goals and assisted on 6 others; helping the Falcons finish the season with a record of 21-10-2. He was also selected to play with the U.S. World Team in [[Lake Placid, New York|Lake Placid, New York]]. Following his collegiate career, Sator joined the [[ Long Island Ducks|Long Island Ducks (ice hockey) ]] of the [[EHL|Eastern Hockey League]] in the following year. Sator's playing career came to an end due to a knee injury after only playing three games for the Ducks.
title: Ted Sator

abstract: Gail Patrick (born Margaret LaVelle Fitzpatrick, June 20, 1911 – July 6, 1980) was an American film actress and television producer. Often cast as the bad girl or the other woman, she appeared in more than 60 feature films between 1932 and 1948, notably [[My Man Godfrey|My Man Godfrey]] (1936), [[Stage Door|Stage Door]] (1937) and [[My Favorite Wife|My Favorite Wife]] (1940).
title: Gail Patrick

abstract: Sir John Morphett (4 May 1809 – 7 November 1892) was a South Australian [[pioneer|settler]], landowner and politician.
title: John Morphett

abstract: In 2009, Eita was cast in his first theatrical role playing a human in a romantic relationship with a female ghost. Not long after in August 2009, it was announced that Eita had been cast as the lead in the play Tokyo Gekko Makyoku, playing a mysterious character living in the early [[Shōwa era|Shōwa period]]. It was his first time playing the lead in a theatrical production.
title: Eita

abstract: Lily Mariye is an American television director, filmmaker and actress.
title: Lily Mariye

abstract: Elaine Kao is an [[Asian-American|Asian American]] theatre, television and film actress, best known for her roles in [[Bridesmaids|Bridesmaids]] (2011), [[Funny People|Funny People]] (2009) and [[Red Doors|Red Doors]] (2005).
title: Elaine Kao

abstract: Callan Pinckney (born as Barbara Biffinger Pfeiffer Pinckney September 26, 1939 – March 1, 2012) was an [[American|United States]] fitness professional known for her [[Callanetics|Callanetics]] exercises. Her nine books all became international best-sellers and the video series that followed sold over 6 million copies. Pinckney's first video release, "Callanetics: 10 Years Younger In 10 Hours", outsold every other fitness video in the US. Within three years it had pushed [[Jane Fonda|Jane Fonda]] into second place on the all-time individual best-selling fitness video chart and it remains the all-time fitness bestseller in both the US and UK.
title: Callan Pinckney

abstract: Lee Min-ki (born January 16, 1985) is a South Korean actor, singer and model. Lee played his first TV leading role in the 2005 sports drama Taereung National Village, followed by the romantic comedies [[Love Truly|Love Truly]] in 2006, [[Dal-ja's Spring|Dal-ja's Spring]] in 2007, [[Because This Is My First Life|Because This Is My First Life]] in 2017 and [[The Beauty Inside|The Beauty Inside (TV series)]] in 2018. The actor has also starred in [[feature film|feature films]], most notably in the box office hits [[Tidal Wave|Tidal Wave (2009 film)]], [[Quick|Quick (2011 film)]] and [[Very Ordinary Couple|Very Ordinary Couple]].
title: Lee Min-ki

abstract: Giselher Klebe was born in [[Mannheim|Mannheim]], Germany. He received musical tuition early in his life from his mother, the violinist Gertrud Klebe. The family relocated in 1932 to Munich, where his mother's sister, Melanie Michaelis, continued the training. His father's profession required a further relocation in 1936 to [[Rostock|Rostock]].
title: Giselher Klebe

abstract: Doug McGrath (born April 13, 1935) is a [[Canadian|Canadians]] actor whose most notable role was that of "Peter" in the acclaimed Canadian film [[Goin' Down the Road|Goin' Down the Road]] (1970) and its sequel [[Down the Road Again|Down the Road Again]] (2011). He also played in acclaimed Canadian films [[Wedding in White|Wedding in White]] (1972), [[The Hard Part Begins|The Hard Part Begins]] (1973), the original [[Black Christmas|Black Christmas (1974 film)]] (1974), [[Russian Roulette|Russian Roulette (film)]] (1975) and [[Coming Out Alive|Coming Out Alive]] (1980). He had a supporting role as a gym teacher in the cult comedy [[Porky's|Porky's]] (1981), and also played roles in [[The Escape Artist|The Escape Artist]] (1982), [[Twilight Zone: The Movie|Twilight Zone: The Movie]] (1983), the [[Australia|Australian]] comedy [[The Return of Captain Invincible|The Return of Captain Invincible]] (1983), [[Always|Always (1989 film)]] (1989) and [[Ghosts of Mars|Ghosts of Mars]] (2001).
title: Doug McGrath

abstract: Ram Kapoor (राम कपूर) (; born 1 September 1973) is an [[Indian|Indian people]] television and film [[actor|actor]]. He gained popularity portraying Jai Walia in the television series [[Kasamh Se|Kasamh Se]] and the character of Ram Kapoor in [[Bade Achhe Lagte Hain|Bade Achhe Lagte Hain]]. He played multiple characters Mamaji / Kunwar Amar Nath Singh (KANS) / Johnny / Balbir in the [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] film [[Humshakals|Humshakals]] and hosted the reality show [[Rakhi Ka Swayamwar|Rakhi Ka Swayamwar]], based loosely on [[The Bachelorette|The Bachelorette]].
title: Ram Kapoor

abstract: Tulsi Ghimire ([[Nepali|Nepali language]]: तुलसी घिमिरे) is a [[Nepali-Indian|Nepali-Indian]] [[film director|Film director]], [[screenwriter|screenwriter]], [[film editor|Film editing]], [[cameraman|Camera operator]], [[actor|actor]] and [[lyricist|lyricist]] in [[Cinema of Nepal|Cinema of Nepal]].
title: Tulsi Ghimire

abstract: Shelly Silver (born 1957 in [[Brooklyn, NY|Brooklyn, NY]]) is an American artist who works with film, video, and photography. Her art has been exhibited and broadcast throughout the U.S., Europe and Asia. She is Associate Professor of Visual Arts at [[Columbia University School of the Arts|Columbia University School of the Arts]].
title: Shelly Silver

abstract: Angus McLaren (born 3 November 1988) is an Australian actor who is best known for his roles in the television series [[Packed to the Rafters|Packed to the Rafters]] as Nathan Rafter and [[H2O: Just Add Water|H2O: Just Add Water]] as Lewis McCartney.
title: Angus McLaren

abstract: Dev Patel (born 23 April 1990) is a British actor. Born and raised in [[London|London]] to [[Gujarati|Gujarati people]] [[Indian|British Indian]] [[Hindu|Hindu people]] parents, Patel made his screen debut as [[Anwar Kharral|Anwar Kharral]] in the first two seasons of the British television [[teen drama|teen drama]] [[Skins|Skins (UK TV series)]] (2007–2008), landing the role with no prior professional acting experience. His breakthrough came in 2008 with the leading role of [[Jamal Malik|Jamal Malik (character)]] in [[Danny Boyle|Danny Boyle]]'s drama [[Slumdog Millionaire|Slumdog Millionaire]], which won the [[Academy Award for Best Picture|Academy Award for Best Picture]], and for which he was nominated for the [[BAFTA Award for Best Actor|BAFTA Award for Best Actor in a Leading Role]] and the [[SAG Award for Best Supporting Actor|Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by a Male Actor in a Supporting Role]].
title: Dev Patel

abstract: Alla Korot (born November 1, 1970) is an American [[actress|actress]] and [[dancer|dancer]] best known for her [[soap opera|soap opera]] roles of [[Allie Doyle Martin|List of All My Children characters#D]] on [[All My Children|All My Children]] and [[Stacey Sloan|List of General Hospital: Night Shift characters#Stacey Sloan]] on [[General Hospital: Night Shift|General Hospital: Night Shift]].
title: Alla Korot

abstract: Nadia Litz (born December 26, 1976) is a Canadian actress and director.
title: Nadia Litz

abstract: Stefan Valdobrev () (born 20 May 1970) is a [[Bulgarian|Bulgarians]] actor, film/theatre composer, singer-songwriter and filmmaker. He received classical training at the [[National Academy of Theatre and Film Arts|Krastyo Sarafov National Academy for Theatre and Film Arts]] in [[Sofia|Sofia]].
title: Stefan Valdobrev

abstract: Bailee Madison (born October 15, 1999) is an American actress. In film, she played [[May Belle Aarons|May Belle Aarons]] in [[Bridge to Terabithia|Bridge to Terabithia (2007 film)]] (2007), Isabelle in [[Brothers|Brothers (2009 film)]] (2009), Sally Hurst in [[Don't Be Afraid of the Dark|Don't Be Afraid of the Dark (2010 film)]] (2010), Maggie in [[Just Go with It|Just Go with It]] (2011), Harper Simmons in [[Parental Guidance|Parental Guidance (film)]] (2012), and Kinsey in [[The Strangers: Prey at Night|The Strangers: Prey at Night]] (2018).
title: Bailee Madison

abstract: Allen Leech (born 18 May 1981) is an Irish actor best known for his role as [[Tom Branson|List of Downton Abbey characters#Tom Branson]] on the [[historical drama|historical drama]] series [[Downton Abbey|Downton Abbey]]. He made his professional acting debut with a small part in a 1998 production of [[A Streetcar Named Desire|A Streetcar Named Desire (play)]], made his first major film appearance as Vincent Cusack in [[Cowboys & Angels|Cowboys & Angels]], and earned an [[Irish Film & Television Awards|Irish Film & Television Awards]] nomination in 2004 with his performance as Mo Chara in [[Man About Dog|Man About Dog]]. Leech played [[Marcus Agrippa|Marcus Agrippa (Rome character)]] on the [[HBO|HBO]] historical drama series [[Rome|Rome (TV series)]]. He also played Paul Prenter in the 2018 biopic [[Bohemian Rhapsody.|Bohemian Rhapsody (film)]]
title: Allen Leech

abstract: Jamie Hector (born October 7, 1975) is an American actor of [[Haiti|Haitian]] descent who is known for his portrayal of [[drug kingpin|drug kingpin]] [[Marlo Stanfield|Marlo Stanfield]] on the [[HBO|HBO]] drama series [[The Wire|The Wire (TV series)]] and as Detective Jerry Edgar in the drama series [[Bosch|Bosch (TV series)]].
title: Jamie Hector

abstract: Siena Goines (born March 28, 1969) is an [[American|United States]] film and television actress. She has guest-starred on the soap opera [[Passions|Passions]], the police drama [[The Division|The Division]] and the medical drama [[Private Practice|Private Practice (TV series)]].
title: Siena Goines

abstract: Capitello is of [[Sicilian|Sicily#People]] and [[German|Germans]] descent. Giovanni Capitello was born in [[Brooklyn|Brooklyn]], [[New York|New York (state)]] (1979) and grew up in [[East Patchogue|East Patchogue]], [[Long Island|Long Island]]. He attended [[Bellport|Bellport]] Senior High School (1994–1997).
title: Giovanni Capitello

abstract: Damon Herriman was born in [[Adelaide|Adelaide]], South Australia. He began acting in local television commercials at the age of eight, but it was not until he was cast as Frank Errol in [[The Sullivans|The Sullivans]] two years later that his career began to take off. He continued to work solidly as a child actor, with a return to The Sullivans a year later, as well as the Australian series The Patchwork Hero, Sara Dane, For the Term of His Natural Life and [[Taurus Rising|Taurus Rising]]. He received three [[Logie Award|Logie Award]] nominations for his performance in The Sullivans.
title: Damon Herriman

abstract: Mart Enrico Escudero, (born April 11, 1990) commonly known as Martin Escudero, is a Filipino actor, model and television personality. He rose to fame during his stint at [[the fourth season|StarStruck (Season 4)]] of [[StarStruck|StarStruck (Philippine TV series)]].
title: Martin Escudero

abstract: Monisha Unni (24 January 1971 – 5 December 1992) was an Indian film actress.
title: Monisha Unni

abstract: Lyndsey Marshal (born 16 June 1978) is an English actress best known for her performance in [[The Hours|The Hours (film)]], and as the recurring character [[Cleopatra|Cleopatra (character of Rome)]] on HBO's [[Rome|Rome (TV series)]], and as Lady Sarah Hill in BBC period drama [[Garrow's Law|Garrow's Law]].
title: Lyndsey Marshal

abstract: Jeramie Rain (born Susan Davis; August 23, 1948) is an American screenwriter, producer, [[philanthropist|philanthropist]] and former actress. Rain began her career with starring roles in several local stage productions in Charleston before moving to [[New York City|New York City]] in the early 1970s. After appearing in a string of commercials, she made her film debut in the crime film The Abductors (1972) before becoming known for roles as Sadie in [[Wes Craven|Wes Craven]]'s controversial horror film [[The Last House on the Left|The Last House on the Left (1972 film)]] (1972) and Willie Mae in Albert T. Viola's comedy film Preacherman Meets Widderwoman (1973).
title: Jeramie Rain

abstract: Linda Wagenmakers (born 30 November 1975, [[Arnhem|Arnhem]]) is a [[Dutch|Netherlands]] singer and voice actress. She started her Career at 21 playing Kim in the musical Miss Saigon for three years for Joop van den Ende Productions, working with [[Willem Nijholt|Willem Nijholt]] [[Tony Neef|Tony Neef]] and [[Ellen Evers|Ellen Evers]] [[Stanley Burlesson|Stanley Burlesson]] while shooting for RTL 4 drama series Westenwind, for which she also recorded the song "Laat me vrij om te gaan". During those three years she also voiced the dutch version of [[Mulan|Mulan]] in the [[Disney|Disney]] animation movie. And was part of many t.v.shows and events. She was part of the original cast of [[Rocky over the rainbow|Rocky over the rainbow]] playing Maggs and in later versions Dorothy. She was part of [[Musicals in Ahoy 2001|Musicals in Ahoy 2001]] singing the role of Kim from Miss Saigon as well as [[Eponine|Eponine]] from [Les Miserables]]. She also represented her country in the [[Eurovision Song Contest 2000|Eurovision Song Contest 2000]] in [[Stockholm|Stockholm]],with the song [[No Goodbyes|No Goodbyes (Linda song)]] involving a huge black and white dress designed by [[Jan Aarntzen|Jan Aarntzen]] [[Sweden|Sweden]], and finished the competition in 13th place with the song "[[No Goodbyes|No Goodbyes (Linda song)]]". Wagenmakers played the role of Kim in the Dutch version of the musical [[Miss Saigon|Miss Saigon]]. She also sang in the show "Musicals in Ahoy'".
title: Linda Wagenmakers

abstract: Joseph van Vicker (born 1 August 1977), better known as Van Vicker, is a [[Ghana|Ghanaian]] actor. He received two nominations for "Best Actor in a Leading Role" and "Best Upcoming Actor" at the [[Africa Movie Academy Awards|Africa Movie Academy Awards]] in 2008.
title: Van Vicker

abstract: Jason Gann was born in [[Toowoomba|Toowoomba]], [[Queensland|Queensland (Australia)]], Australia, the son of a military father and [[country singer|country music]] mother, and grew up in [[Brisbane|Brisbane]], Queensland. At 14, while attending an all-boys school, Gann discovered his love for comedy when he performed as Suzanne, leader of the can-can dancers in a high school production of [[Paint Your Wagon|Paint Your Wagon (musical)]]. After high school, he went on to study acting at the [[University of Southern Queensland|University of Southern Queensland]]. He earned a B.A. in Acting while also attending classes in humanities and the arts.
title: Jason Gann

abstract: Daisy Beaumont (born 5 May 1974) is an [[English|England]] [[actress|actress]].
title: Daisy Beaumont

abstract: Park Hae-il began appearing in theatre productions ever since childhood, and he first established himself on stage rather than on the screen. In 2000 he was awarded the Best New Actor award in the theatre category of the [[Baeksang Arts Awards|Baeksang Arts Awards]] for his role in the play Cheongchun-yechan ("Ode to Youth"). His film debut was in a minor role of [[Yim Soon-rye|Yim Soon-rye]]'s [[Waikiki Brothers|Waikiki Brothers]], however he left a major impression in his second film [[Jealousy Is My Middle Name|Jealousy Is My Middle Name]], in which he played a conflicted young man who develops a fascination/hatred for his boss, who has stolen two women from him. The film won the top prize at the [[Busan International Film Festival|Busan International Film Festival]] in 2002, and was released commercially the following spring.
title: Park Hae-il

abstract: Tamer Hassan (born 18 March 1968) is an English actor of [[Turkish Cypriot|Turkish Cypriot]] descent. He is best known for his role as the leader of the Millwall firm, opposite [[Danny Dyer|Danny Dyer]], in [[The Football Factory|The Football Factory (film)]].
title: Tamer Hassan

abstract: Gary Anthony Sturgis (born November 3, 1966) is an American actor and voice actor known for providing the voice of [[Ebon|Ebon (Static Shock)]] in the television series [[Static Shock|Static Shock]]. In addition to voice-overs, Sturgis appeared as an [[antagonist|antagonist]] in two of [[Tyler Perry|Tyler Perry]]'s movies, [[Diary of a Mad Black Woman|Diary of a Mad Black Woman]] (2005) and [[Daddy's Little Girls|Daddy's Little Girls]] (2007), as well as the movie [[Pride|Pride (2007 film)]] (2007), starring [[Terrence Howard|Terrence Howard]], and co-stars in the independent feature directed by [[Cedric the Entertainer|Cedric the Entertainer]], [[Chicago Pulaski Jones|Chicago Pulaski Jones]].
title: Gary Anthony Sturgis

abstract: Gertrude Jeannette was born on November 28, 1914 in [[Urbana, Arkansas|Urbana, Arkansas]]. Salley Getrude Crawford Hadley, her mother, was a homemaker. Willis Lawrence Hadley, her father, taught on a [[Native American reservation|Native American reservation]] near [[Spiro, Oklahoma|Spiro, Oklahoma]]. Gertrude Jeannette had five brothers and one sister, and grew up on a farm. The family moved to [[Little Rock, Arkansas|Little Rock, Arkansas]] during the [[Great Depression|Great Depression]], and she enrolled at the [[segregated|Jim Crow laws]] [[Dunbar High School|Dunbar Magnet Middle School]].
title: Gertrude Jeannette

abstract: Norm Lewis (born June 2, 1963) is an American actor and [[baritone|baritone]] singer. He has appeared in [[Europe|Europe]], on [[Broadway|Broadway theatre]], in film, television, recordings and regional theatre. Productions that he has been involved in include [[Dessa Rose|Dessa Rose (musical)]], [[Miss Saigon|Miss Saigon]], [[The Wild Party|The Wild Party (LaChiusa musical)]], and several others.
title: Norm Lewis

abstract: Jacqueline Fernandez (born 11 August 1985) is a Sri Lankan actress, former model, and the winner of the [[Miss Universe Sri Lanka|Miss Universe Sri Lanka]] pageant of 2006. In 2009 she started her career in [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] with the movie [[Aladin|Aladin (film)]] and since then has made a place in Bollywood. Jacqueline is also known as the Jacq of hearts in India. Born into a [[multiracial|multiracial]] family of Canadian, Sri Lankan, and Malaysian descent, Fernandez was raised in Bahrain. After graduating in [[mass communication|mass communication]] from the [[University of Sydney|University of Sydney]] and working as a television reporter in Sri Lanka, she joined the modeling industry. She was crowned Miss Universe Sri Lanka in 2006, and represented her country at [[Miss Universe 2006|Miss Universe 2006]].
title: Jacqueline Fernandez

abstract: He is the eldest son of [[businessman|businessman]], Brotin Bose Roy and Dolly Roy. His younger brother, [[Rohit Roy|Rohit Roy]] is also a TV actor. Ronit Roy spent his childhood in [[Ahmedabad|Ahmedabad]], Gujarat. This is where he did his schooling with the father of Ayush Sarkar, teenage actor. After his schooling, Roy pursued hotel management. After completion of his studies, he moved to Mumbai and stayed at the residence of filmmaker [[Subhash Ghai|Subhash Ghai]]. While Roy was keen to work in the film industry, Subhash Ghai persuaded him, not to pursue it due to the difficulties associated with it. Ronit worked as a management trainee at Mumbai's Sea Rock Hotel. To have experienced at all different levels, Ronit's work ranged from dish-washing and cleaning to serving tables and bar-tending. He played the lead role in Jaan Tere Naam (1992) which was a commercial success. He starred with [[Aditya Pancholi|Aditya Pancholi]] and [[Kishori Shahane|Kishori Shahane]] in Bomb Blast (1993).
title: Ronit Roy

abstract: Nathan Lopez (born Louie Nathanael Buado Lopez, August 19, 1991) is a [[Filipino|Philippines]] [[film actor|Actor]].
title: Nathan Lopez

abstract: Katherine Anne Alano (born 9 July 1985), better known as Kat Alano, is an [[English|England]]-[[Filipino|Philippines]] [[model|Model (person)]], [[actress|actress]] and [[television presenter|television presenter]]/[[VJ|VJ (media personality)]] in the [[Philippines|Philippines]].
title: Kat Alano

abstract: Lee Hyuk-jae (born April 4, 1986), better known by his stage name Eunhyuk, is a South Korean [[singer-songwriter|singer-songwriter]]. He is a member of the South Korean [[boy group|boy group]] [[Super Junior|Super Junior]] and their subgroups, [[Super Junior-T|Super Junior-T]] and [[Super Junior-H|Super Junior-H]]. In 2011, he joined Super Junior's [[Mandopop|Mandopop]] subgroup, [[Super Junior-M|Super Junior-M]] and the duo [[Donghae & Eunhyuk|Donghae & Eunhyuk]]; active in China and Japan respectively.
title: Eunhyuk

abstract: Carter MacIntyre (born 1979) is an American [[actor|actor]], best known for television roles on the series, [[Undercovers|Undercovers (TV series)]] and [[American Heiress|American Heiress]].
