His previous acting credits have included guest appearances on [[Smith|Smith (TV series)]] and [[ER|ER (TV series)]]. MacIntyre began appearing as [[CIA|CIA]] operative Leo Nash on the [[NBC|NBC]] series [[Undercovers|Undercovers (TV series)]] in the Fall 2010 season. MacIntyre was cast as the new guardian angel on [[Drop Dead Diva|Drop Dead Diva]] for Season 4.
title: Carter MacIntyre

abstract: Wisin met [[Yandel|Yandel]] in school. They began performing as a duo in the late '90s and made their album debut in 2000 with [[Los Reyes del Nuevo Milenio|Los Reyes del Nuevo Milenio]]. They later made the jump to a major label in 2003 with [[Mi Vida... My Life|Mi Vida... My Life]], their first for [[Universal|Universal Music Latin Entertainment]] subsidiary [[Machete Music|Machete Music]]. [[Pa'l Mundo|Pa'l Mundo]] then catapulted them to mainstream success in 2005. Subsequently, Wisin & Yandel established their own label, [[WY Records|WY Records]], and presented an affiliate group, Los Vaqueros. In November 2013, after the duo's Líderes tour, the duo went into hiatus, but although rumors saying their split was because of differences between them, Yandel denied those rumors and confirmed they're not disbanded. [[Wisin & Yandel|Wisin & Yandel]] reunited in 2018 and released their tenth studio album after spending 5 years apart. The new album is called "Los Campeones del Pueblo / "The Big Leagues."
title: Wisin

abstract: Veloor Krishnankutty, or Veloor Krishnan Kutty (, 5 July 1936 – 22 August 2003), was a popular satirist from [[Kerala|Kerala]] in southern [[India|India]]. He wrote more than 159 books in [[Malayalam|Malayalam language]]. The essence of his works is severe social criticism mixed up with humour. He was born in Velur in the state's south-central district of [[Kottayam|Kottayam]], son of N.N. Kunjunni and Parvathi Amma. He had completed his education at Kottayam M.D. Seminary and C.M.S. College.
title: Veloor Krishnankutty

abstract: Kishwar Naheed () (born 1940) is a [[feminist|feminist]] [[Urdu poet|Urdu poet]] from [[Pakistan|Pakistan]]. She has written several poetry books. She has also received awards including [[Sitara-e-Imtiaz|Sitara-e-Imtiaz]] for her literary contribution towards [[Urdu literature|Urdu literature]].
title: Kishwar Naheed

abstract: Marija Šerifović (, , born 14 November 1984) is a [[Serbia|Serbian peoplen]] singer. Initially rose to prominence as the talented daughter of Serbian folk singer [[Verica Šerifović|Verica Šerifović]], Marija is now recognised as one of the best [[vocal|vocals]] in Serbia of 21. century. She most knowably [[represented Serbia|Serbia in the Eurovision Song Contest]] on the [[Eurovision Song Contest 2007|Eurovision Song Contest 2007]] winning with the [[ballad|Balkan ballad]] "[[Molitva|Molitva]]" with 268 points, making her Serbia's only Eurovision winner to date. Šerifović has also released five studio albums and has numerous hit-singles such as 'Sama i nervozna', 'Pametna i luda' (2015) and 'Deo prošlosti' (2016). Since 2015 she has also been one of the judges on [[Zvezde Granda|Zvezde Granda]].
title: Marija Šerifović

abstract: Lee Yoon-ji (born March 15, 1984) is a South Korean actress. After making her acting debut in the sitcom [[Nonstop 4|Nonstop (TV series)]], Lee has starred in the television series [[Pure 19|Pure 19]] (2004), [[Princess Hours|Princess Hours]] (2006), [[Dream High|Dream High]] (2011), [[The King 2 Hearts|The King 2 Hearts]] (2012), and [[Wang's Family|Wang's Family]] (2013). She also appeared in [[season 1|We Got Married (Season 1)]] reality-variety show [[We Got Married|We Got Married]] (2008-2009), as well as the romantic comedy film Couples (2011).
title: Lee Yoon-ji

abstract: Rosshan Andrrews was born to Moolakuzhi Nedumparampil Andrews and Burney, who is an Indian [[film director|film director]] in [[Malayalam cinema|Malayalam cinema]]. He gained schooling from St. Aloysious Thrissur and college from Cochin College, Eranakulam. Rosshan Andrrews is a Roman catholic.
title: Rosshan Andrrews

abstract: Tanya Katherine Rosales Lyttle-Lapid, more popularly known by her [[screen name|Stage name]] Tanya Garcia (born August 5, 1981), is a [[Filipina|Filipinos]] [[telenovela|telenovela]] and [[film|film]] [[actress|actress]]. She became a household name after playing Cecilia in one of the longest running [[soap opera|soap operas]] of [[GMA Network|GMA Network]], [[Sana Ay Ikaw Na Nga|Sana ay Ikaw na Nga (2001 TV series)]], opposite [[Dingdong Dantes|Dingdong Dantes]]. In 2015 she moved back to her home network [[ABS-CBN|ABS-CBN]].
title: Tanya Garcia

abstract: Ridge Canipe (born July 13, 1994) is an [[American|United States]] actor. Ridge is best known for his roles in [[Walk the Line|Walk the Line]] (in which he played [[Johnny Cash|Johnny Cash]] as a boy), the thriller [[Baby Blues|Baby Blues (2008 film)]] in 2008 and the 2005 version of [[Bad News Bears|Bad News Bears]]. He also co-starred in the 231st presentation of the Hallmark Hall of Fame production [[Pictures of Hollis Woods|Pictures of Hollis Woods]] which aired on CBS in December 2007. He helped Walk the Line castmate and friend Hailey Anne Nelson, write and issue a [[vegan|vegan]] cookbook for children by [[PETA|PETA]].
title: Ridge Canipe

abstract: Katherine DeMille (born Katherine Paula Lester; June 29, 1911 – April 27, 1995) was a Canadian-born American [[film actress|actress]].
title: Katherine DeMille

abstract: Jeremy Callaghan (born 22 July 1967 in [[Papua New Guinea|Papua New Guinea]]) is an [[Australian|Australian]] actor whose portrayal of the cute and shy Constable Brian Morley on the popular TV drama [[Police Rescue|Police Rescue]] ensured international attention. Callaghan is also well known for his guest appearances on [[Xena: Warrior Princess|Xena: Warrior Princess]] (portraying Palaemon and Pompey) and [[Young Hercules|Young Hercules]] (portraying Pollux).
title: Jeremy Callaghan

abstract: Pranav Mohanlal (born 13 July 1990) is an Indian actor who appears in [[Malayalam films|Malayalam cinema]]. The son of actor [[Mohanlal|Mohanlal]], he began acting as a child with his screen debut in his father's film [[Onnaman|Onnaman]] (2002) in a minor role, followed by a leading role in [[Punarjani|Punarjani]] in the same year. He won the [[Kerala State Film Award for Best Child Artist|Kerala State Film Award for Best Child Artist]] for his role in Punarjani. He then decided to abandon films to focus on his studies. Since then, he has kept a distance from the film industry and was not keen on returning to pursue acting. He graduated with a [[bachelor's degree|bachelor's degree]] in [[Philosophy|Philosophy]] from the [[University of New South Wales|University of New South Wales]].
title: Pranav Mohanlal

abstract: Chandrachur Singh (born 11 October 1968) is an [[India|Indian]] actor, who works in [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] films. He won the [[Filmfare Award for Best Male Debut|Filmfare Award for Best Male Debut]] for his performance in [[Maachis|Maachis]]. He worked in daag the fire also
title: Chandrachur Singh

abstract: Paul Tonkinson (born 1 August 1969) is a British comedian, radio presenter and television personality, best known for his presenting work on [[The Big Breakfast|The Big Breakfast]] and [[The Sunday Show|The Sunday Show]].
title: Paul Tonkinson

abstract: Yaani King (born August 10, 1981) is an American actress, known for her role as Neely Lloyd in the TNT crime drama series [[Saving Grace|Saving Grace (TV series)]].
title: Yaani King

abstract: Sheena Halili (born Sheena Yvette Castro Halili on January 16, 1986 in [[San Fernando|City of San Fernando, Pampanga]], [[Pampanga|Pampanga]], [[Philippines|Philippines]]) is a [[Filipino|Filipino people]] [[actress|actress]]. She became popular when she played the role of Monica in the 2007 series, [[MariMar|MariMar (Philippine TV series)]]. She also became a Regal contract star because of Marimar.
title: Sheena Halili

abstract: Claire Keelan (born May 1975) is an English actress, perhaps best known for portraying Claire Ashcroft in [[Nathan Barley|Nathan Barley]] and Electroclash in [[No Heroics|No Heroics]].
title: Claire Keelan

abstract: Panchi Bora is an [[India|Indian]] television actress and model from [[Assam|Assam]]. She plays lead roles in the series [[Kayamath|Kayamath]] and [[Kitni Mast Hai Zindagi|Kitni Mast Hai Zindagi]], before working in the Telugu film industry.
title: Panchi Bora

abstract: Michael Stahl-David (born October 28, 1982) is an American actor, known for his role as Sean Donnelly on the [[NBC|NBC]] drama series [[The Black Donnellys|The Black Donnellys]] and his lead role as Robert Hawkins in the [[J. J. Abrams|J. J. Abrams]]-produced film [[Cloverfield|Cloverfield]].
title: Michael Stahl-David

abstract: Gérard Herter, also known as Gerhard Haerter, Gerard Haerther, Gerald Herter, Gerard Herter, and Gerhard Herter (born 12 April 1920 in Stuttgart, died 6 February 2007 in Munich) was a German actor of the 1950s and 1960 who played many villains, especially Prussian types, in [[spaghetti western|spaghetti westerns]]. He made his film debut in [[Caltiki - il mostro immortale|Caltiki - il mostro immortale]] in 1959. His last credited appearance was in [[Ludwig|Ludwig (film)]] in 1972.
title: Gérard Herter

abstract: Nadia Khan (born on 22 May 1979) is a Pakistani television [[actress|actress]], [[presenter|TV Presenter]] and Producer. She is best known for hosting [[The Nadia Khan Show|Nadia Khan Show]], a morning TV programme, and for OutStyle, her YouTube channel. Currently, she is hosting [[Croron Mein Khel|Croron Mein Khel]] on [[BOL Entertainment|BOL Entertainment]] and playing the role of Nigaar in [[Kam Zarf|Kam Zarf]] on [[Geo Entertainment|Geo Entertainment]].
title: Nadia Khan

abstract: R. N. Jayagopal (1935   – 19 May 2008) was an [[Indian film|Indian film]] director and lyricist in [[Kannada cinema|Cinema of Karnataka]]. He had written over 12,000 film songs.
title: R. N. Jayagopal

abstract: Laurie Walters Slade (born Laurie Jean Walters; January 8, 1947, [[San Francisco|San Francisco]], [[California|California]], United States) is an American retired actress, best known for playing Joanie Bradford on [[Eight Is Enough|Eight Is Enough]], which aired from 1977 until 1981 on [[ABC|American Broadcasting Company]].
title: Laurie Walters

abstract: Bentley Mitchum (born February 22, 1967) is an American actor who has appeared in about 40 films and TV series, including Sundance grand jury prize winner [[Ruby in Paradise|Ruby in Paradise]], [[The Man in the Moon|The Man in the Moon]], [[The Wonder Years|The Wonder Years]], [[Conviction|Conviction]], [[Susie Q|Susie Q (film)]], [[Meatballs 4|Meatballs 4]] and [[Demonic Toys|Demonic Toys]] and [[Shark Attack|Shark Attack]].
title: Bentley Mitchum

abstract: Mohammad Abul Kashem (known as Principal Abul Kashem, 28 June 1920 – 11 March 1991) is generally considered as a pioneer and the architect of the historic [[Language Movement|Bengali language movement]] of Bangladesh. He was also a politician, author and an eminent educationist. He founded the Islamic-oriented Bengali cultural organisation [[Tamaddun Majlish|Tamaddun Majlish]].
title: Abul Kashem

abstract: Sarika was born in New Delhi into a family of Marathi and Himachali descent. Her father left the family when she was very young. From then on, she became the head of the family and had to work. She did not attend school.
title: Sarika

abstract: Benoît Delépine (born 30 August 1958) is a [[French|France]] comedian and film director. He is known for his satirical activities on TV channel [[Canal+|Canal+]].
title: Benoît Delépine

abstract: Priya Vasudev Mani Iyer (born 4 June 1984), professionally credited as Priyamani, is an Indian multilingual film actress and former model, who works in [[Kannada|Kannada]], [[Malayalam|Malayalam]], [[Tamil|Tamil Cinema]], [[Telugu|Telugu Cinema]] and [[Hindi|Hindi Cinema]] language films. She has established a career in regional Indian films, and is the recipient of a [[National Film Award|National Film Award]] and three [[Filmfare Awards|Filmfare Awards]] in different-language films.

abstract: Ryan John Seacrest (born December 24, 1974) is an American radio personality, television host, and producer. abstract: Kim Jong-min (born September 24, 1979) is a South Korean entertainer. He is a member of the [[K-pop|K-pop]] group [[Koyote|Koyote]] and since 2007, has been a cast member of the variety show [[2 Days & 1 Night|2 Days & 1 Night]].
title: Kim Jong-min

abstract: Eva Mattes (born 14 December 1954, [[Tegernsee|Tegernsee]], [[Germany|West Germany]]) is an [[Austrian|Austria]]-[[German|Germany]] [[actress|actress]].

abstract: Shin Jung-hwan ([[Hangul|Hangul]]: 신정환; born 10 May 1975) is a [[South Korea|South Korean]] singer and entertainer. He debuted as a singer in 1994 as a member of the [[K-pop|K-pop]] group [[Roo'ra|Roo'ra]], and later became a frequent guest on South Korean [[variety show|variety shows]]. His career was put on hold for several years, and his popularity plummeted after he was found guilty of illegal gambling while visiting the Philippines in 2010.
title: Shin Jung-hwan

abstract: Norbert Locke, better known as Ned Locke (December 25, 1919 February 4, 1992), was an [[American|United States]] [[television|television]] personality and [[radio|radio]] announcer, best known for the role of "Ringmaster Ned" on [[WGN-TV's|WGN-TV]] [[Bozo's Circus|The Bozo Show]] from 1961 - 1976.
title: Ned Locke

abstract: Olivier Gruner (; born August 2, 1960), also named O.G, Оливье Грюнер in Russian, and 奥利弗·古鲁内尔 in Chinese, is a French former soldier, actor, director, producer, screenwriter, martial artist, and pilot. Born in Paris, France, he moved to the United States in 1988. His career began in 1987 at the Cannes Film Festival, France, where he was discovered.
title: Olivier Gruner

abstract: Terrence C. Carson (born November 19, 1958) is an [[American|United States]] singer and stage, [[voice|voice actor]], and [[television|television]] [[actor|actor]]. He is best known for portraying Kyle Barker on the [[FOX|Fox Broadcasting Company]] [[sitcom|situation comedy]] [[Living Single|Living Single]] and voicing [[Mace Windu|Mace Windu]] on [[Star Wars: The Clone Wars|Star Wars: The Clone Wars (2008 TV series)]]. He was also known for his long-running voice role as [[Kratos|Kratos (God of War)]] in the [[God of War|God of War (franchise)]] video-game series from 2005 until 2013.
title: Terrence C. Carson

abstract: Bodil Ipsen (30 August 1889 – 26 November 1964) was a [[Danish|Denmark]] actress and film director, and is considered one of the great stars of Danish cinematic history. Her acting career, which began in theater and [[silent films|silent films]], was marked by leading roles in large folk comedies and melodramas. However, it was as a director that she was most influential: directing the first Danish [[film noir|film noir]] and making several dark psychological thrillers during the 1940s and 1950s. Ipsen's name along with that of [[Bodil Kjer|Bodil Kjer]] is given to Denmark's most celebrated film prize, the [[Bodil Award|Bodil Award]].
title: Bodil Ipsen

abstract: Azita Ghanizada is an [[Afghan|Afghan]] [[American|United States]] [[actress|actress]].
title: Azita Ghanizada

abstract: John Joseph Feild (born 1978), known professionally as JJ Feild, is a British-American film, television and theatre actor. He started his television career in 1999. Feild played Fred Garland in [[Philip Pullman|Philip Pullman]]'s [[The Ruby in the Smoke|The Ruby in the Smoke]] and [[The Shadow in the North|The Shadow in the North]] television adaptations. In 2007, he starred as [[Henry Tilney|Henry Tilney]] in the television film [[Northanger Abbey|Northanger Abbey (2007 film)]]. The following year, he made his [[West End|West End theatre]] debut in a production of [[Ring Round the Moon|Ring Round the Moon]]. From 2014–2016, Feild portrayed Major [[John André|John André]] in [[Turn: Washington's Spies|Turn: Washington's Spies]]. Feild's film credits include [[Telstar|Telstar (film)]] (2009), [[Captain America: The First Avenger|Captain America: The First Avenger]] (2011), [[Austenland|Austenland (film)]] (2013), and [[Professor Marston and the Wonder Women|Professor Marston and the Wonder Women]] (2017).
title: JJ Feild

abstract: Vanessa Lee Chester (born July 2, 1984) is an American television and film actress. Chester rose to fame as a child actor for her roles in [[A Little Princess|A Little Princess (1995 film)]] (1995) and [[Harriet the Spy|Harriet the Spy (film)]] (1996), before gaining wide-scale recognition for her role in [[Steven Spielberg|Steven Spielberg]]'s [[The Lost World: Jurassic Park|The Lost World: Jurassic Park]] (1997).
title: Vanessa Lee Chester

abstract: Sibi Sathyaraj (also credited as Sibiraj) is an Indian actor working in the [[Tamil film industry|Tamil cinema]]. He is the son of Tamil film actor [[Sathyaraj|Sathyaraj]].

abstract: Joachim Rønning (born 30 May 1972) is a Norwegian [[film director|film director]] who previously worked in a team with [[Espen Sandberg|Espen Sandberg]]. abstract: [[Deshabandu|Deshabandu]] Gammana Patabendige Don John "Joe" Abeywickrama ([[Sinhala|Sinhala language]]:ජෝ අබේවික්‍රම) (22 June 1927 – 21 September 2011), known as Joe Abeywickrama, was a [[Sri Lanka|Sri Lankan]] actor. abstract: Liza Lapira (born December 3, 1981) is an American actress. abstract: Chris Renaud was born in 1966 in [[Baltimore, Maryland|Baltimore, Maryland]], and moved to [[Bethlehem, Pennsylvania|Bethlehem, Pennsylvania]], when he was 15, because his father worked for [[Bethlehem Steel|Bethlehem Steel]] and was transferred to their main office. Renaud has said he had mixed feelings with the move, saying it upset him but it was also one of the best things in his life because it showed him "that there was a great, big world out there". He was the artist for the high school yearbooks and newspaper and had aspirations of creating comic books. He graduated [[Parkland High School|Parkland High School (Allentown, Pennsylvania)]] in [[Allentown, Pennsylvania|Allentown, Pennsylvania]], in 1985 and attended [[Baum School of Art|Baum School of Art]] where he received a $1,000 scholarship.
title: Chris Renaud

abstract: Rasool Ellore Reddy (born 8 October 1964), also known as Rasool, is an Indian [[cinematographer|cinematographer]], screenwriter, and director known for his works in [[Telugu cinema|Telugu cinema]], and [[bollywood|bollywood]]. He is known for his works in films such as [[Gaayam|Gaayam]], [[Gulabi|Gulabi (film)]], [[Chitram|Chitram]], and others. abstract: Gabriel Porras (born Carlos Gabriel Porras Flores, February 13, 1968 in [[Mexico City|Mexico City]], [[Mexico|Mexico]]) is a Mexican actor. abstract: Byun In-chul was born in [[Jangseong County|Jangseong County]], [[South Jeolla Province|South Jeolla Province]], and attended [[Salesian High School|Salesian High School (South Korea)]] in [[Gwangju|Gwangju]]. He took up Law at [[Chosun University|Chosun University]] before dropping out to pursue acting. Byun entered the [[MBC|Munhwa Broadcasting Corporation]] actor's auditions in 1965, and made his acting debut in 1970. A year later in 1971, he became a regular on the landmark [[police procedural|police procedural]] Chief Inspector. He began using the [[stage name|stage name]] Byun Hee-bong in 1977. Throughout the 1970s, he became known on TV as a [[character actor|character actor]] who played eccentric men who didn't quite fit in with mainstream Korean society. He transitioned to the big screen in the 1980s, and earlier in his film career, starred in the classic [[Lee Doo-yong|Lee Doo-yong]] film [[Eunuch|Eunuch (film)]] (1986) and A Surrogate Father (1993).
title: Byun Hee-bong

abstract: Jimmy Weldon (born December 23, 1923) is an American voice actor, [[ventriloquist|ventriloquism]], and former television host. abstract: Jordan Metcalfe (born 24 May 1986) is an English actor best known for his role as Adil the Genie in the children's comedy [[Genie in the House|Genie in the House]], screened in the UK and the [[Netherlands|Netherlands]] on [[Nickelodeon|Nickelodeon UK]], in [[Germany|Germany]] on [[Nick Germany|Nick Germany]], in [[France|France]] on Canal J and [[Spain|Spain]] on Antena 3 (.NEOX). abstract: J. Livingston , commonly credited by his mononym Livingston, is an Indian actor, comedian and screenwriter who usually plays in supporting and comedy roles in Tamil films. abstract: Heather Doerksen (born February 12, 1980) is a Canadian actress who has appeared on stage and screen. She has also voiced many cartoons and advertising campaigns.

abstract: Monica Evans (born 7 June 1940) is an English actress known for her portrayal of Gwendolyn Pigeon in [[Neil Simon|Neil Simon]]'s [[The Odd Couple|The Odd Couple (play)]]. She was in the original [[Broadway|Broadway theatre]] cast for its entire run, then appeared in the [[film|The Odd Couple (film)]] version in [[1968|1968 in film]], and finally appeared in some episodes of the first season of the [[television|The Odd Couple (1970 TV series)]] series based on the play, all in the same role, alongside [[Carole Shelley|Carole Shelley]] as her sister Cecily Pigeon. She also provided voices for the [[Disney|Disney]] animated films [[The Aristocats|The Aristocats]], as Abigail Gabble (the Goose) (alongside Shelley as Amelia Gabble) and [[Robin Hood|Robin Hood (1973 film)]] (1973) as [[Maid Marian|Maid Marian]] (again alongside Shelley as her handmaiden, Lady Kluck).
title: Monica Evans

abstract: Lucy Brown was born in [[Crawley|Crawley]], Sussex, but grew up in [[Cambridgeshire|Cambridgeshire]]. She is the daughter of Christopher Brown and Helen Burleigh and has a younger brother named Mark. She went to [[King's College Prep School|King's College School, Cambridge]] in [[Cambridge|Cambridge]] and then on to [[Oundle School|Oundle School]] in Northamptonshire which she left to attend [[Hills Road Sixth Form College|Hills Road Sixth Form College]] in Cambridge. She then went on to graduate from the [[Guildhall School of Music and Drama|Guildhall School of Music and Drama]] London. In December 2007, she was declared "Most Beautiful English Actress of the Year" by a panel of 104 actors.
title: Lucy Brown

abstract: Randeep Hooda (; born 20 August 1976) is an Indian actor. Best known for is work in the [[Hindi film industry|Hindi film industry]] and theatre productions in India, he is the recipient of such accolades as two [[Stardust Awards|Stardust Awards]] and a nomination each for the [[Filmfare|Filmfare Awards]] and the [[International Indian Film Academy Awards|International Indian Film Academy Awards]].
title: Randeep Hooda

abstract: DeVeren Bookwalter (September 8, 1939   – July 23, 1987) was a theatre actor and director who became the first person to win three [[Los Angeles Drama Critics Circle Award|Los Angeles Drama Critics Circle Awards]] for his production, direction and performance in [[Cyrano de Bergerac|Cyrano de Bergerac (play)]] at the [[Globe Playhouse|Globe Playhouse]] in 1975.
title: DeVeren Bookwalter

abstract: Raymond Oliver Cruz Ilustre, better known by his [[screen name|Stage name]] Rayver Cruz (born July 20, 1989), is a [[Filipino|Filipino people]] [[actor|actor]], [[dancer|dancer]] and [[singer|singer]].
title: Rayver Cruz

abstract: Al Shearer (born August 14, 1977) is an American actor. He portrayed [[Nevil Shed|Nevil Shed]] in the 2006 [[Disney|Disney]] blockbuster [[Glory Road (film)|Glory Road (film)]], produced by [[Jerry Bruckheimer|Jerry Bruckheimer]]. Shearer might be best known for his role on the [[MTV|MTV]] series [[Punk'd|Punk'd]], or as "Hits" - host of the once-popular [[BET|Black Entertainment Television]] series Hits from the Street.

abstract: Haley Loraine Keeling (born January 7, 1988), known professionally as Haley Bennett, is an American actress and singer. She made her film debut as pop star Cora Corman in the romantic comedy [[Music and Lyrics|Music and Lyrics]] (2007) and has since appeared in the films [[The Haunting of Molly Hartley|The Haunting of Molly Hartley]] (2008), [[College|College (2008 film)]] (2008), [[The Hole|The Hole (2009 film)]] (2009), [[Kaboom|Kaboom (film)]] (2010), [[The Equalizer|The Equalizer (film)]] (2014), [[Kristy|Kristy (film)]] (2014), [[Hardcore Henry|Hardcore Henry]] (2015), [[The Magnificent Seven|The Magnificent Seven (2016 film)]] (2016), [[The Girl on the Train|The Girl on the Train (2016 film)]] (2016) and [[Thank You for Your Service|Thank You for Your Service (2017 film)]] (2017).

abstract: Glenda Hulita Elisabeth Batta (born 19 June 1978), better known by her stage name Glennis Grace, is a Dutch singer from [[Amsterdam|Amsterdam]]. In 2005 Grace [[represented the Netherlands|Netherlands in the Eurovision Song Contest 2005]] in the [[50th edition|Eurovision Song Contest 2005]] of the [[Eurovision Song Contest|Eurovision Song Contest]] and in 2018 she appeared on the [[13th season|America's Got Talent (season 13)]] of [[America's Got Talent|America's Got Talent]] and made it to the finals.
title: Glennis Grace

abstract: Shweta Menon (born 23 April 1974) is an Indian model, actress and [[television anchor|News presenter]]. She won [[Femina Miss India Asia Pacific 1994|Femina Miss India]]. She has predominantly acted in Malayalam and Hindi language films, besides appearing in a number of [[Tamil productions|Tamil cinema]].
title: Shweta Menon

abstract: In April 2009, [[Core Contents Media|Core Contents Media]], SeeYa's management company, announced that Nam Gyu-ri had violated the terms of her contract by refusing to perform her engagements as a member of SeeYa; the company also stated that it would potentially take legal action against Nam. Although the company later announced that she would return, it was eventually revealed that the issues could not be fully resolved, and Nam left again. In leaving the group permanently, Nam released a statement through her lawyers in which she said that she "could not possibly" return to SeeYa. In the statement, Nam announced that the reason for her departure was that she was more interested in pursuing an acting career than singing. Because it was impossible to pursue both paths, she had decided that she needed to give up working with the group. For this reason, she declined offers from all record companies that were interested in recruiting SeeYa, and would henceforth make a new beginning as an actor and not a singer.
title: Nam Gyu-ri

abstract: Han Ye-seul ([[Hangul|Hangul]]: 한예슬; born Leslie Kim on September 18, 1981) is an American-born South Korean actress. She made her acting debut in the [[sitcom|sitcom]] [[Nonstop 4|Nonstop (TV series)]] (2003), and has since played leading roles in [[television drama|Korean dramas]] such as [[Couple or Trouble|Couple or Trouble]] (2006), [[Tazza|Tazza (TV series)]] (2008), and [[Birth of a Beauty|Birth of a Beauty]] (2014), as well as the films [[Miss Gold Digger|Miss Gold Digger]] (2007) and [[Penny Pinchers|Penny Pinchers]] (2011).
title: Han Ye-seul

abstract: Archibald Williams Hall (December 21, 1908 – April 28, 1978), better known as Arch Hall Sr., was an American actor, screenwriter, and film producer, best known for making a series of [[B-movie|B-movies]] in the early 1960s which starred his son, [[Arch Hall Jr.|Arch Hall Jr.]] Hall used various names throughout his career including Nicholas Merriwether, William Waters, and Archie Hall.
title: Arch Hall Sr.

abstract: Tony Dalton studied acting at the Lee Strasberg Institute in New York. During this period he participated in small Off Broadway productions such as The Ballad of the Sad Café and A Streetcar Named Desire, among others. He acted as an extra in the movies Minotaur and Scriptfellas. Back in Mexico, Dalton gained notability for having produced and acted in the TV series No te Equivoques (2001), as well as in the soap operas Ramona (2000), [[Clase 406|Clase 406]] (2002), and [[Rebelde|Rebelde (Mexican telenovela)]] (2004–2006). His first successful film venture was [[Matando Cabos|Matando Cabos]] (2004), the first production of Lemon Films, where he enjoyed a starring role and also co-authored the screenplay. From there, he continued as an actor, appearing in Volver, Volver (2005), Mujer Alabastrina (2006), [[Efectos Secundarios|Efectos Secundarios]] (2006) and an episode of the TV series 13 Miedos (2007). He also landed roles in 2008's Love, Pain and Vice Versa and 2009's Amar. In 2010, he landed a part in the short film Mano a Mano, directed by Jose Barrera. Among the many roles he had during this time period, he places emphasis on [[Sultanes del Sur|Sultanes del Sur]] (2007), an action movie shot in Mexico City and Buenos Aires in Argentina, where besides playing the main character, Dalton also wrote the screenplay. A notable work on television was the hit series [[Los Simuladores|Los Simuladores]], where he played one of the protagonists — Mario Santos (logistics and planning) — along with Alejandro Calva, Arath de la Torre and Ruben Zamora. In theater, his most recent work was the play El Año Próximo a la Misma Hora, where he worked with Alejandra Barros. The play was a great success and reached over 200 performances in Mexico City (2011). Dalton was the antagonist of the telenovela [[Flor Salvaje|Flor Salvaje]] alongside Mónica Spear, Roberto Manrique, José Luis Reséndez, Norkys Batista, and Gregorio Pernía. The telenovela was recorded at Colombia. In 2015 he was the co-protagonist of Telemundo's series Dueños Del Paraiso.
title: Tony Dalton

abstract: Bernard Palanca, Jr. (born December 3, 1976) is a [[Filipino|Filipino people]] host, film/television [[character actor|character actor]], and product endorser.
title: Bernard Palanca

abstract: David Marc Worden (commonly known as Marc), attended Churchill Heights Public School in Scarborough, Ontario from grades 4 through 8. He was a student in the gifted program. He made his first known stage appearance as Sandy the dog in the school's musical production of Annie in 1986.
title: Marc Worden

abstract: Lauren Cohan (born January 7, 1982) is an [[American|Americans]] actress and model. She is known for her role as [[Maggie Rhee|Maggie Rhee]] on the [[horror drama|horror fiction]] series [[The Walking Dead|The Walking Dead (TV series)]]. She is also known for her roles as [[Bela Talbot|Bela Talbot]] on the [[fantasy|fantasy]] [[horror|horror fiction]] series [[Supernatural|Supernatural (U.S. TV series)]] (2007–2008), [[Rose|List of The Vampire Diaries characters#Rose]] on the [[supernatural|supernatural]] [[drama|drama]] series [[The Vampire Diaries|The Vampire Diaries]] (2010–2012), and [[Vivian McArthur Volkoff|Volkoff Industries#Vivian McArthur]] on the [[action comedy|action comedy]] series [[Chuck|Chuck (TV series)]] (2011). In addition to her television career, Cohan has also appeared in several films, such as the [[comedy|comedy]] [[Van Wilder: The Rise of Taj|Van Wilder: The Rise of Taj]] (2006), the [[psychological thriller|psychological thriller]] [[horror film|horror film]] [[The Boy|The Boy (2016 film)]], the [[superhero|superhero]] film [[Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice|Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice]] (2016), and the [[biographical drama|biographical drama]] [[All Eyez on Me|All Eyez on Me (film)]] (2017).
title: Lauren Cohan

abstract: Trine Dyrholm (born 15 April 1972) is a [[Danish|Danish language]] actress, singer and songwriter. Dyrholm received national attention when she placed third in the Danish, [[Dansk Melodi Grand Prix|Dansk Melodi Grand Prix]] as a 14-year-old singer. Four years later, she again achieved national recognition when she won the [[Bodil Award|Bodil Award]] for Best Actress in her debut film: the teenage romance Springflod. Dyrholm has won the [[Bodil Award|Bodil Award]] for Best Actress four times and a Bodil award for Best Supporting Actress once as well as four [[Robert Award|Robert Awards]] in her acting career.
title: Trine Dyrholm

abstract: Shenaz Treasurywala is an [[India|Indian]] [[actress|actress]], [[TV host|TV host]], [[writer|writer]], and [[travel vlogger|travel literature]].
title: Shenaz Treasury

abstract: Lisa Waltz is an American actress who has had roles in many television shows and who played Nora in the film adaptation of [[Brighton Beach Memoirs|Brighton Beach Memoirs]].
title: Lisa Waltz

abstract: Aarya Babbar (born 24 May 1982) is an Indian actor who appears in [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] and [[Punjabi|Punjabi language]] films. In 2014, Aarya participated in the eighth season of [[Bigg Boss|Bigg Boss]].
title: Aarya Babbar

abstract: Hans Warren Christie (born 4 November 1975) is a Canadian television and film actor known for his roles as [[Ray Cataldo|Ray Cataldo]] on the [[ABC|American Broadcasting Company]] [[drama|drama]] [[October Road|October Road (TV series)]] and as Aidan "Greggy" Stiviletto on the [[ABC|American Broadcasting Company]] series [[Happy Town|Happy Town (TV series)]]. More recently, Christie starred as Cameron Hicks in the [[SyFy|SyFy]] series [[Alphas|Alphas]].

abstract: Jennifer Elise Cox (born November 29, 1969) is an American actress known for her satirical portrayal of [[Jan Brady|Jan Brady]] in [[The Brady Bunch Movie|The Brady Bunch Movie]].

abstract: Masiela Lusha (; born October 23, 1985) is an Albanian-American actress, author, producer and humanitarian. Lusha gained recognition for playing [[Carmen Lopez|List of George Lopez characters#Carmen Lopez]] on the globally syndicated [[ABC|American Broadcasting Company]] sitcom [[George Lopez|George Lopez (TV series)]], a role which earned her two consecutive [[Young Artist Awards|Young Artist Awards]] for Leading Young Actress in a Comedy or Drama. After transitioning into film, she starred in Sony Picture's [[Blood: The Last Vampire|Blood: The Last Vampire (2009 film)]]. Lusha also starred alongside [[David Hasselhoff|David Hasselhoff]] and [[Ian Ziering|Ian Ziering]] in SyFy's television movie [[Sharknado: The 4th Awakens|Sharknado: The 4th Awakens]].
title: Masiela Lusha

abstract: Dylan McDermott (born Mark Anthony McDermott; October 26, 1961) is an American actor. He is best known for his role as lawyer and law firm head [[Bobby Donnell|Bobby Donnell]] on the legal drama series [[The Practice|The Practice]], which earned him a [[Golden Globe Award for Best Performance by an Actor in a Television Series – Drama|Golden Globe Award for Best Actor – Television Series Drama]] and a nomination for the [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actor in a Drama Series|Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actor in a Drama Series]].
title: Dylan McDermott

abstract: LisaGay Hamilton (born March 25, 1964) is an American actress known for her role as [[attorney|lawyer]] Rebecca Washington on the [[ABC|American Broadcasting Company]]'s legal drama [[The Practice|The Practice]]. Her theater credits include [[Measure for Measure|Measure for Measure]] (Isabella), Henry IV Parts I & II (Lady Hotspur), [[Athol Fugard’s|Athol Fugard]], Valley Song and The Ohio State Murders. Hamilton was also an original cast member in the Broadway productions of [[August Wilson|August Wilson]]’s [[The Piano Lesson|The Piano Lesson]] and [[Gem of the Ocean|Gem of the Ocean]].
title: LisaGay Hamilton

abstract: Connor Trinneer (born March 19, 1969) is an American film, stage, and television actor. He is best known for his role as [[Charles "Trip" Tucker III|Charles Tucker III]] on [[Star Trek: Enterprise|Star Trek: Enterprise]], as [[Michael|Wraith characters in Stargate#Michael Kenmore]] on the series [[Stargate Atlantis|Stargate Atlantis]], and as Professor Moynihan on the web series [[Guilty Party|Guilty Party (2017 TV series)]].
title: Connor Trinneer

abstract: Ellen Tyne Daly (born February 21, 1946) is an American actress. She has won six [[Emmy Award|Emmy Awards]] for her television work and a [[Tony Award|Tony Award]], and is a 2011 [[American Theatre Hall of Fame|American Theatre Hall of Fame]] inductee.
title: Tyne Daly

abstract: Kim Delaney (born November 29, 1961) is an American actress known for her starring role as Detective [[Diane Russell|Diane Russell (NYPD Blue)]] on the [[ABC|American Broadcasting Company]] drama television series [[NYPD Blue|NYPD Blue]], for which she won an [[Emmy Award|Emmy Award]]. Early in her career, she played the role of [[Jenny Gardner|Jenny Gardner]] in the ABC daytime television drama [[All My Children|All My Children]]. She later had leading roles in the short lived TV drama [[Philly|Philly (TV series)]], part of the first season of [[CSI: Miami|CSI: Miami]], and the first six seasons of [[Army Wives|Army Wives]].
title: Kim Delaney

abstract: Christine Flores (born September 26, 1981), better known as Christina Milian (), is an American [[actress|actress]], singer and songwriter. Born in [[Jersey City, New Jersey|Jersey City, New Jersey]], and raised in [[Maryland|Maryland]], Milian signed a contract with [[Def Jam|Def Jam]] at the age of 19. In 2001, Milian released her self-titled [[debut album|Christina Milian (album)]], which featured the singles "[[AM to PM|AM to PM]]" and "[[When You Look at Me|When You Look at Me]]"; "AM to PM" charted within the Top 40 of the U.S. [[Billboard Hot 100|Billboard Hot 100]] and both peaked in the top three on the [[UK Singles Chart|UK Singles Chart]]. In 2004, Milian released her second studio album [[It's About Time|It's About Time (Christina Milian album)]], which provided her first major U.S. hit, "[[Dip It Low|Dip It Low]]", which reached number five on the U.S. Billboard chart. "[[Whatever U Want|Whatever U Want]]" was released as the album's second single. Both singles charted within the Top 10 of the UK chart.
title: Christina Milian

abstract: Mary-Louise Parker (born August 2, 1964) is an American actress and writer. After making her stage debut as Rita in a [[Broadway|Broadway theatre]] production of [[Craig Lucas|Craig Lucas]]'s [[Prelude to a Kiss|Prelude to a Kiss (play)]] in 1990 (for which she received a [[Tony Award|Tony Award]] nomination), Parker came to prominence for film roles in [[Grand Canyon|Grand Canyon (1991 film)]] (1991), [[Fried Green Tomatoes|Fried Green Tomatoes]] (1991), [[The Client|The Client (1994 film)]] (1994), [[Bullets over Broadway|Bullets over Broadway]] (1994), [[Boys on the Side|Boys on the Side]] (1995), [[The Portrait of a Lady|The Portrait of a Lady (film)]] (1996), and [[The Maker|The Maker (film)]] (1997). Among stage and independent film appearances thereafter, Parker received the [[Tony Award for Best Actress in a Play|Tony Award for Best Actress in a Play]] for her portrayal of Catherine Llewellyn in [[David Auburn|David Auburn]]'s [[Proof|Proof (play)]] in 2001, among other accolades. Between 2001 and 2006, she recurred as [[Amy Gardner|Amy Gardner]] on the [[NBC|NBC]] television series [[The West Wing|The West Wing]], for which she was nominated for the [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Drama Series|Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Drama Series]] in 2002.
title: Mary-Louise Parker

abstract: Anna Lee, [[MBE|Order of the British Empire]] (born Joan Boniface Winnifrith; 2 January 1913 – 14 May 2004) was a British-born American actress.
title: Anna Lee

abstract: Danitra Vance (July 13, 1954   – August 21, 1994) was an American comedian and actress best known as a [[cast member|Saturday Night Live cast]] on the [[NBC|NBC]] sketch show [[Saturday Night Live|Saturday Night Live]] during its [[eleventh season|Saturday Night Live (season 11)]] and for work in feature films like [[Sticky Fingers|Sticky Fingers (1988 film)]] (1988), [[Limit Up|Limit Up]] (1990) and [[Jumpin' at the Boneyard|Jumpin' at the Boneyard]] (1992).
title: Danitra Vance

abstract: Kenan Thompson ( born May 10, 1978) is an American actor and comedian. Thompson began his acting career in the early 1990s, and garnered fame as an original cast member of [[Nickelodeon|Nickelodeon]]'s sketch comedy series [[All That|All That]].
title: Kenan Thompson

abstract: Park Chan-wook ( ; born August 23, 1963) is a [[South Korean|Koreans]] [[film director|film director]], [[screenwriter|screenwriter]], [[producer|Film producer]], and former [[film critic|film critic]]. One of the most acclaimed and popular filmmakers in his native country, Park is best known for his films [[Joint Security Area|Joint Security Area (film)]] (2000), [[Thirst|Thirst (2009 film)]] (2009), [[The Handmaiden|The Handmaiden]] (2016) and what has become known as [[The Vengeance Trilogy|The Vengeance Trilogy]], consisting of [[Sympathy for Mr. Vengeance|Sympathy for Mr. Vengeance]] (2002), [[Oldboy|Oldboy (2003 film)]] (2003) and [[Lady Vengeance|Lady Vengeance]] (2005).
title: Park Chan-wook

abstract: Sanjeev Bhaskar, [[OBE|Order of the British Empire]] (born 31 October 1963) is a [[British|United Kingdom]] [[comedian|comedian]], [[actor|actor]] and [[broadcaster|Television presenter]], best known for his work in the [[BBC Two|BBC Two]] [[sketch comedy|sketch comedy]] series [[Goodness Gracious Me|Goodness Gracious Me (BBC)]] and star of the [[sitcom|sitcom]] [[The Kumars at No. 42|The Kumars at No. 42]]. He also presented and starred in a documentary series called [[India with Sanjeev Bhaskar|India with Sanjeev Bhaskar]] in which he travelled to [[India|India]] and visited his ancestral home in today's [[Pakistan|Pakistan]]. Bhaskar's more dramatic acting roles include the lead role of Dr. Prem Sharma in [[The Indian Doctor|The Indian Doctor]] and a main role as DI Sunny Khan in [[Unforgotten|Unforgotten]]. Bhaskar is currently the Chancellor of the [[University of Sussex|University of Sussex]].
title: Sanjeev Bhaskar

abstract: James Arnold Taylor (born July 22, 1969) is an American voice actor, known for portraying [[Ratchet|Ratchet (Ratchet & Clank)]] in the [[Ratchet & Clank|Ratchet & Clank]] franchise; the main character [[Tidus|Tidus]] in [[Final Fantasy X|Final Fantasy X]]; and [[Obi-Wan Kenobi|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] in the [[Star Wars|Star Wars]] animated features such as [[Star Wars: The Clone Wars|Star Wars: The Clone Wars (2008 TV series)]] and the franchise's video games.
title: James Arnold Taylor

abstract: Thorsten Kaye (born Thorsten Ernst Kieselbach on 22 February 1966 in [[Frankfurt|Frankfurt]], [[Federal Republic of Germany|Federal Republic of Germany]]) is a German-British actor.

abstract: Wendie Malick (born December 13, 1950) is an American actress and former fashion model, best known for her roles in television comedies. abstract: Jennifer Westfeldt (born February 2, 1970) is an American actress and screenwriter known for the 2001 [[independent film|independent film]] [[Kissing Jessica Stein|Kissing Jessica Stein]], her 2004 Tony nomination for [[Wonderful Town|Wonderful Town]], and her 2011 film [[Friends with Kids|Friends with Kids]].

abstract: Katherine Kelly Lang (born Katherine Kelly Wegeman; July 25, 1961) is an American actress. She is best known for playing [[Brooke Logan|Brooke Logan]] in the [[CBS|CBS]] soap opera [[The Bold and the Beautiful|The Bold and the Beautiful]].
title: Katherine Kelly Lang

abstract: Jason Scott Lee (, born November 19, 1966) is an American actor and [[martial artist|martial artist]]. Lee is perhaps best known for his roles as [[Bruce Lee|Bruce Lee]] (no relation) in the 1993 martial arts film [[Dragon: The Bruce Lee Story|Dragon: The Bruce Lee Story]], and [[Mowgli|Mowgli]] in Disney's 1994 live-action adaptation of [[The Jungle Book|The Jungle Book (1994 film)]].
title: Jason Scott Lee

abstract: Susan Ward (born April 15, 1976) is an American actress and model.
title: Susan Ward

abstract: Michael Buffer (born November 2, 1944) is an American [[ring announcer|ring announcer]] for [[boxing|boxing]] and [[professional wrestling|professional wrestling]] matches. He is known for his [[trademark|trademarked]] catchphrase, "Let's get ready to rumble!" and for pioneering a distinct announcing style in which he rolls certain letters and adds other inflections to a fighter's name. His half-brother is UFC announcer [[Bruce Buffer|Bruce Buffer]].
title: Michael Buffer

abstract: Beverlee McKinsey (August 9, 1935 – May 2, 2008) was an [[American|United States]] [[actress|actress]]. She is best known for her roles on two daytime serials. Her first known role was as [[Iris Cory Carrington|Iris Wheeler]] on the soap opera [[Another World|Another World (TV series)]] from 1972 to 1980. Subsequently, she portrayed the same role until November 1981 on the spin-off show Texas. Her other famous role was as the [[Baroness Alexandra Spaulding Von Halkein|Alexandra Spaulding]], on the soap opera [[Guiding Light|Guiding Light]], from 1984 to 1992. In 1994, she made a brief return to daytime, appearing in 6 episodes of [[General Hospital|General Hospital]] as Myrna Slaughter, a witness in Edward Quartermain's trial for the murder of Jack Boland.
title: Beverlee McKinsey

abstract: Sarah Chalke (; born August 27, 1976) is a Canadian-American actress and voice artist. She is known for portraying [[Dr. Elliot Reid|Elliot Reid]] on the [[NBC|NBC]]/[[ABC|American Broadcasting Company]] comedy series [[Scrubs|Scrubs (TV series)]], the second [[Becky Conner|List of Roseanne characters#Becky Conner]] and Andrea on the ABC sitcoms [[Roseanne|Roseanne]] and [[The Conners|The Conners]], [[Stella Zinman|List of How I Met Your Mother characters#Stella Zinman]] on the [[CBS|CBS]] sitcom [[How I Met Your Mother|How I Met Your Mother]], and [[Beth Smith|List of Rick and Morty characters#Beth Smith]] on [[Adult Swim's|Adult Swim]] adult animated science-fiction series [[Rick and Morty|Rick and Morty]]. She also had a recurring role on the third season of the ABC/[[TBS|TBS (U.S. TV channel)]] sitcom [[Cougar Town|Cougar Town]].
title: Sarah Chalke

abstract: Ned Sparks (born Edward Arthur Sparkman, November 19, 1883 – April 3, 1957) was a Canadian-born [[character actor|character actor]] of the American stage and screen. Sparks was known for his [[deadpan|deadpan]] expression and deep, gravelly voice.
title: Ned Sparks

abstract: Mary Sean Young (born November 20, 1959) is an American [[actress|actress]]. She is best known for her performances in the films [[Stripes|Stripes (film)]] (1981), [[Blade Runner|Blade Runner]] (1982), [[Dune|Dune (film)]] (1984), [[No Way Out|No Way Out (1987 film)]] (1987), [[Wall Street|Wall Street (1987 film)]] (1987), [[Cousins|Cousins (1989 film)]] (1989) and [[Ace Ventura: Pet Detective|Ace Ventura: Pet Detective]] (1994).

abstract: Kathryn Bridget Moynahan (born April 28, 1971) is an American actress and [[model|Model (people)]], best known for her role in the police drama [[Blue Bloods|Blue Bloods (TV series)]]. She graduated from [[Longmeadow High School|Longmeadow High School]] in Massachusetts in 1989, and began pursuing a career in modeling. She appeared in department-store catalogs and magazines, and after doing television commercials, she began taking acting lessons. Moynahan made her television debut in a guest appearance in the comedy series [[Sex and the City|Sex and the City]] in 1999, where she later had a recurring role as Natasha.
title: Bridget Moynahan

abstract: Amanda Peterson (born Phyllis Amanda Peterson, July 8, 1971 – July 3, 2015) was an American actress, most known for her role as Cindy Mancini in the 1987 comedy film [[Can't Buy Me Love|Can't Buy Me Love (film)]].
title: Amanda Peterson

abstract: Cady McClain (born Katie Jo McClain on October 13, 1969) is an American actress, singer, and author.

abstract: Finola Hughes (born 29 October 1959) is an English actress, television host, entrepreneur, author, and dancer, best known for role as [[Anna Devane|Anna Devane]] on the [[ABC|American Broadcasting Company]] [[soap operas|soap opera]] [[General Hospital|General Hospital]] and [[All My Children|All My Children]], and her portrayal of Laura in the 1983 film [[Staying Alive|Staying Alive (1983 film)]], the sequel to [[Saturday Night Fever|Saturday Night Fever]].
title: Finola Hughes

abstract: Anna Vissi ( (, ); born 20 December 1957), also known as Anna Vishy, is a [[Greek Cypriot|Greek Cypriot]] singer, songwriter, actress, television presenter, radio personality, and businesswoman. She studied music at conservatories and performed locally before moving to the professional scene in [[Athens|Athens]], in 1973, where she signed with [[Minos|Minos EMI#Merger with Minos Matsas & Son]] and simultaneously collaborated with other musical artists and released promotional singles of her own while studying at the [[University of Athens|University of Athens]].
title: Anna Vissi

abstract: James Wheaton (January 11, 1924   – June 9, 2002), was an [[American|United States]] [[motion picture|motion picture]], [[stage|Theatre]], and [[television|television]] actor. Wheaton's credits include [[THX 1138|THX 1138]], Trouble Comes to Town and [[Sanford and Son|Sanford and Son]].
title: James Wheaton

abstract: Diego Luna Alexander (; b. December 29, 1979) is a Mexican actor, director, and producer. He has appeared in many films, including [[Y tu mamá también|Y tu mamá también]], [[Milk|Milk (film)]], [[Rudo y Cursi|Rudo y Cursi]], and [[Rogue One: A Star Wars Story|Rogue One]]. He is one of the founders and owners of [[Canana Films|Canana Films]].
title: Diego Luna

abstract: Tim Matheson (born Timothy Lewis Matthieson; December 31, 1947) is an American actor and director. He is perhaps best known for his portrayals of the smooth-talking Eric "Otter" Stratton in the comedy film [[National Lampoon's Animal House|Animal House]] (1978) and of Vice President [[John Hoynes|John Hoynes]] in the [[NBC|National Broadcasting Company]] drama [[The West Wing|The West Wing]]. He has had a variety of other well-known roles, including providing the voice of the lead character in the animated series [[Jonny Quest|Jonny Quest (TV series)]] and for playing President [[Ronald Reagan|Ronald Reagan]] in a [[television film adaptation|Killing Reagan (film)]] of the 2015 novel [[Killing Reagan|Killing Reagan]] that premiered on October 16, 2016 on the National Geographic Channel.
title: Tim Matheson

abstract: Delloreese Patricia Early (July 6, 1931   – November 19, 2017), known professionally as Della Reese, was an American jazz and gospel singer, actress, and [[ordained minister|Minister (Christianity)]] whose career spanned seven decades. Reese's long career began as a singer, scoring a hit with her 1959 single "[[Don't You Know?|Don't You Know?]]". In the late–1960s, Reese hosted her own talk show, Della, which ran for 197 episodes. She also starred in films beginning in 1975, including playing opposite [[Redd Foxx|Redd Foxx]] in [[Harlem Nights|Harlem Nights]] (1989), [[Martin Lawrence|Martin Lawrence]] in [[A Thin Line Between Love and Hate|A Thin Line Between Love and Hate]] (1996) and [[Elliott Gould|Elliott Gould]] in [[Expecting Mary|Expecting Mary]] (2010). She achieved continuing success in the religious television [[drama|drama (film and television)]] [[Touched by an Angel|Touched by an Angel]] (1994–2003), in which Reese played the leading role of Tess.
title: Della Reese

abstract: Efrem Zimbalist Jr. (November 30, 1918   – May 2, 2014) was an American actor known for his starring roles in the television series [[77 Sunset Strip|77 Sunset Strip]] and [[The F.B.I.|The F.B.I. (TV series)]] He is also known as recurring character "Dandy Jim Buckley" in the series [[Maverick|Maverick (TV series)]] and as the voice behind the character [[Alfred Pennyworth|Alfred Pennyworth]] in [[Batman: The Animated Series|Batman: The Animated Series]] and associated spin-offs. He also voiced [[Doctor Octopus|Doctor Octopus]] in the [[1990s Spider-Man animated series|Spider-Man (1994 TV series)]] and the 2000 PC, Dreamcast and PlayStation [[Spider-Man|Spider-Man (2000 video game)]] action-adventure video game, and [[Justin Hammer|Justin Hammer]] from the second season of the [[1994 Iron Man animated series|Iron Man (TV series)]].
title: Efrem Zimbalist Jr.

abstract: Alexa PenaVega ( Vega; August 27, 1988) is an American actress and singer. She is known for her role as [[Carmen Cortez|Carmen Cortez]] in the [[Spy Kids|Spy Kids (franchise)]] film series and Shilo Wallace in the film [[Repo! The Genetic Opera|Repo! The Genetic Opera]] (2008). In 2009, she starred as the title character Ruby Gallagher in the [[ABC Family|Freeform (TV channel)]] series [[Ruby & The Rockits|Ruby & The Rockits]].
title: Alexa PenaVega

abstract: After the breakup of the Eagles in 1980, Frey embarked on a successful solo career. He released his debut album, [[No Fun Aloud|No Fun Aloud]], in 1982 and went on to record Top 40 hits "[[The One You Love|The One You Love (Glenn Frey song)]]", "[[Smuggler's Blues|Smuggler's Blues]]", "[[Sexy Girl|Sexy Girl (Glenn Frey song)]]", "[[The Heat Is On|The Heat Is On (Glenn Frey song)]]", "[[You Belong to the City|You Belong to the City]]", "[[True Love|True Love (Glenn Frey song)]]", "[[Soul Searchin'|Soul Searchin' (Glenn Frey song)]]" and "[[Livin' Right|Livin' Right (song)]]". As a member of the Eagles, Frey won six [[Grammy Award|Grammy Awards]], and five [[American Music Award|American Music Awards]]. The Eagles were inducted into the [[Rock and Roll Hall of Fame|Rock and Roll Hall of Fame]] in 1998, the first year they were nominated. Consolidating his solo recordings and those with the Eagles, Frey had 24 Top 40 singles on the [[Billboard Hot 100|Billboard Hot 100]].
title: Glenn Frey

abstract: Solomon Hersh Frees (June 22, 1920 – November 2, 1986), better known as Paul Frees, was an [[American|United States]] actor, voice actor, impressionist and screenwriter known for his work on [[MGM|Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer cartoon studio]], [[Walter Lantz|Walter Lantz Productions]], and [[Walt Disney|The Walt Disney Company]] theatrical cartoons during the [[Golden Age of Animation|Golden age of American animation]] and for providing the voice of [[Boris Badenov|Boris Badenov]] in [[The Rocky and Bullwinkle Show|The Rocky and Bullwinkle Show]]. Along with his contemporary [[Mel Blanc|Mel Blanc]], he became known as "The Man of a Thousand Voices."
title: Paul Frees

abstract: Alexander Louis Teixeira de Mattos San Payo y Mendes (April 9, 1865 – December 5, 1921), known as Alexander Teixeira de Mattos, was a Dutch-English journalist, literary critic and publisher, who gained his greatest fame as a translator.
title: Alexander Teixeira de Mattos

abstract: Tab Hunter (born Arthur Andrew Kelm; July 11, 1931   – July 8, 2018) was an American actor, singer, film producer and author. He appeared in over 40 films and was a well-known Hollywood star and heartthrob of the 1950s and 1960s, known for his blond, clean-cut good looks.
title: Tab Hunter

abstract: Jung Yun-ho (; born February 6, 1986), also known by his stage name U-Know Yunho () or simply U-Know, is a South Korean singer, actor, and a member of the pop duo [[TVXQ|TVXQ]]. Born and raised in [[Gwangju|Gwangju]], South Korea, Yunho started his musical training under the talent agency [[S.M. Entertainment|S.M. Entertainment]] in 2001 and joined TVXQ in 2003 as the band's leader. Fluent in Korean and Japanese, Yunho has released chart-topping albums throughout Asia as a member of TVXQ. He has made occasional acting appearances in television dramas.
title: Yunho

abstract: Wanda Sykes (born March 7, 1964) is an American actress, comedian, and writer. She was first recognized for her work as a writer on [[The Chris Rock Show|The Chris Rock Show]], for which she won a [[Primetime Emmy Award|Primetime Emmy Award]] in 1999. In 2004, [[Entertainment Weekly|Entertainment Weekly]] named Sykes as one of the 25 funniest people in America. She is also known for her role as Barb Baran on [[CBS|CBS]]' [[The New Adventures of Old Christine|The New Adventures of Old Christine]] (2006–10) and for appearances on [[HBO|HBO]]'s [[Curb Your Enthusiasm|Curb Your Enthusiasm]] (2001–11).
title: Wanda Sykes

abstract: Jack Warden (born John Warden Lebzelter Jr., September 18, 1920July 19, 2006) was an American [[character actor|character actor]] of film and television. He was twice nominated for an [[Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor|Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor]]—for [[Shampoo|Shampoo (film)]] (1975), and [[Heaven Can Wait|Heaven Can Wait (1978 film)]] (1978). He received a [[BAFTA|British Academy of Film and Television Arts]] nomination for the former movie, and won an [[Emmy|Primetime Emmy Award]] for his performance in [[Brian's Song|Brian's Song]] (1971).
title: Jack Warden

abstract: Maxwell Caulfield ([[né|Given name]] Newby; born 23 November 1959) is a [[British-American|British Americans]] film, stage, and television actor and [[singer|singer]]. He has appeared in films such as [[Grease 2|Grease 2]] (1982), [[Electric Dreams|Electric Dreams (film)]] (1984), [[The Boys Next Door|The Boys Next Door (1985 film)]] (1985), [[The Supernaturals|The Supernaturals (film)]] (1986), [[Sundown: The Vampire in Retreat|Sundown: The Vampire in Retreat]] (1989), [[Waxwork 2|Waxwork 2]] (1992), [[Gettysburg|Gettysburg (1993 film)]] (1993), [[Empire Records|Empire Records]] (1995), [[The Real Blonde|The Real Blonde]] (1997), and [[The Man Who Knew Too Little|The Man Who Knew Too Little]] (1997). A recent appearance is as the king in [[A Prince for Christmas|A Prince for Christmas]] (2015).
title: Maxwell Caulfield

abstract: Alexis Arquette (July 28, 1969 – September 11, 2016) was an American [[actress|actress]], [[cabaret|cabaret]] performer, underground [[cartoonist|cartoonist]], and [[activist|activist]].
title: Alexis Arquette

abstract: Thomas Brodie-Sangster (born 16 May 1990), also credited as Thomas Sangster, is an [[English|English people]] actor best known for playing Sam in [[Love Actually|Love Actually]] (2003), Simon in [[Nanny McPhee|Nanny McPhee]] (2005), [[Ferb|Ferb Fletcher]] in [[Phineas and Ferb|Phineas and Ferb]] (2007–15), [[Jojen Reed|Jojen Reed]] in [[Game of Thrones|Game of Thrones]] (2013–14) and Newt in the [[Maze Runner film series|Maze Runner (film series)]] (2014–18).
title: Thomas Brodie-Sangster

abstract: Denise van Outen (born Denise Kathleen Outen; 27 May 1974) is an English actress, singer, model, dancer and presenter. She presented [[The Big Breakfast|The Big Breakfast]], played Roxie Hart in the musical [[Chicago|Chicago (musical)]] both in [[the West End|West End theatre]] and [[on Broadway|Broadway theatre]] and finished as runner-up in the [[tenth series|Strictly Come Dancing (series 10)]] of the [[BBC One|BBC One]] dancing show [[Strictly Come Dancing|Strictly Come Dancing]].
title: Denise van Outen

abstract: Mantak Chia (Chinese: 謝明德, [[Pinyin|Pinyin]]: Xiè Míngdé, born April 24, 1944 in [[Bangkok|Bangkok]], [[Thailand|Thailand]]) is a [[Taoist|Taoist]] Master. He is best known for his teaching Taoist practices under the names of Healing Tao, [[Tao Yoga|Taoist yoga]], Universal Healing Tao System and [[Qi Gong|Qi Gong]]. He has run numerous workshops, written a series of books, and published a number of training videos. He views himself primarily as a teacher.
title: Mantak Chia

abstract: Michael Rooker (born April 6, 1955) is an American actor, best known for his breakout role as Henry in [[Henry: Portrait of a Serial Killer|Henry: Portrait of a Serial Killer]] (1986), as well as his roles as Terry Cruger in [[Sea of Love|Sea of Love (film)]] (1989), Rowdy Burns in [[Days of Thunder|Days of Thunder]] (1990), Bill Broussard in [[JFK|JFK (film)]] (1991), Hal Tucker in [[Cliffhanger|Cliffhanger (film)]] (1993), Jared Svenning in [[Mallrats|Mallrats]] (1995), [[Merle Dixon|Merle Dixon]] in [[The Walking Dead|The Walking Dead (TV series)]] (2010–2013), and [[Yondu Udonta|Yondu]] in [[Guardians of the Galaxy|Guardians of the Galaxy (film)]] (2014) and its sequel [[Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2|Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2]] (2017).
title: Michael Rooker

abstract: Aristide Massaccesi (15 December 1936 – 23 January 1999), known professionally as Joe D'Amato, was a highly prolific [[Italian|Italian people]] [[film producer|film producer]], [[director|film director]] and [[cinematographer|cinematographer]] who worked in many genres ([[westerns|western (genre)]], [[decamerotici|decamerotici]], [[peplum|peplum (film genre)]], [[war film|war films]], [[swashbuckler|swashbuckler film]], [[comedy|Comedy film]], [[fantasy|Fantasy film]], [[postapocalyptic film|postapocalyptic]], and [[erotic thriller|erotic thriller]]) but is best known for his [[horror|horror film]], [[erotic|erotic films]] and [[adult|adult films]] films.
title: Joe D'Amato

abstract: Isabel Sanford (born Eloise Gwendolyn Sanford; August 29, 1917 – July 9, 2004) was an American stage, film, and television [[actress|actress]] and [[comedian|comedian]] best known for her role as [[Louise "Weezy" Mills Jefferson|Louise Jefferson]] on the [[CBS|CBS]] [[sitcom|sitcoms]] [[All in the Family|All in the Family]] (1971–1975) and [[The Jeffersons|The Jeffersons]] (1975–1985). In 1981, she became the second black American actress to win a [[Primetime Emmy Award|Primetime Emmy Award]], and the first to win for [[Outstanding Lead Actress in a Comedy Series|Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actress in a Comedy Series]].
title: Isabel Sanford

abstract: Sean Kanan (born November 2, 1966) is an [[American|Americans]] actor and TV Host, best known for his portrayals of [[A. J. Quartermaine|A. J. Quartermaine]] on [[General Hospital|General Hospital]], [[Deacon Sharpe|Deacon Sharpe]] on [[The Bold and the Beautiful|The Bold and the Beautiful]] and [[The Young and the Restless|The Young and the Restless]], and Mike Barnes in [[The Karate Kid Part III|The Karate Kid Part III]].
title: Sean Kanan

abstract: Malcolm-Jamal Warner (born August 18, 1970) is an American actor, musician, director, producer, writer and consultant. He is best known for his roles as [[Theo Huxtable|Theo Huxtable]] on the [[NBC|NBC]] sitcom [[The Cosby Show|The Cosby Show]] and as Malcolm McGee on the [[UPN|UPN]] sitcom [[Malcolm & Eddie|Malcolm & Eddie]]. He also starred as Dr. Alex Reed in the sitcom [[Reed Between the Lines|Reed Between the Lines]]. He currently stars as Dr. AJ Austin on the [[FOX|Fox_Broadcasting_Company]] medical drama [[The Resident|The Resident (TV series)]].
title: Malcolm-Jamal Warner

abstract: Jon Whiteley (born 19 February 1945 in [[Monymusk|Monymusk]], [[Scotland|Scotland]]) is a former child actor and art historian.
title: Jon Whiteley

abstract: Meredith Ann Baxter (born June 21, 1947) is an [[American|United States]] actress and [[producer|Film producer]]. She is known for her roles on the [[ABC|American Broadcasting Company]] drama series [[Family|Family (1976 TV series)]] (1976–80) and the [[NBC|NBC]] [[sitcom|sitcom]] [[Family Ties|Family Ties]] (1982–89), credited as Meredith Baxter Birney. A five-time [[Emmy Award|Emmy Award]] nominee, one of her nominations was for playing the title role in the 1992 TV film A Woman Scorned: The [[Betty Broderick|Betty Broderick]] Story.
title: Meredith Baxter

abstract: Jennifer Gemma Jones (born 4 December 1942) is an English [[character actress|character actor]] on both stage and screen. Her film appearances include [[Sense and Sensibility|Sense and Sensibility (film)]] (1995), [[Bridget Jones's Diary|Bridget Jones' Diary (film)]] (2001) and [[Woody Allen|Woody Allen]]'s [[You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger|You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger]] (2010). For her role in the [[BBC|BBC]] TV film [[Marvellous|Marvellous]] (2014), she won the 2015 [[BAFTA TV Award for Best Supporting Actress|British Academy Television Award for Best Supporting Actress]].
title: Gemma Jones

abstract: Leon Russell (born Claude Russell Bridges; April 2, 1942 – November 13, 2016) was an American musician and songwriter who was involved with numerous bestselling [[pop music|pop music]] records during his 60-year career. His genres included [[pop|Pop music]], [[country|Country music]], [[rock|Rock music]], [[folk|Folk music]], [[gospel|gospel music]], [[bluegrass|bluegrass music]], [[rhythm and blues|rhythm and blues]], [[folk rock|folk rock]], [[blues rock|blues rock]], [[surf|surf music]], [[standards|traditional pop music]], and [[Tulsa Sound|Tulsa Sound]].
title: Leon Russell

abstract: Howard Ellsworth Rollins Jr. (October 17, 1950 – December 8, 1996) was an American stage, film and television [[actor|actor]]. Howard Rollins was best known for his role as Andrew Young in 1978's [[King|King (TV miniseries)]], George Haley in the 1979 miniseries [[Roots: The Next Generations|Roots: The Next Generations]], Coalhouse Walker Jr. in the 1981 film [[Ragtime|Ragtime (film)]], Captain Davenport in the 1984 film [[A Soldier's Story|A Soldier's Story]], and as [[Virgil Tibbs|Virgil Tibbs]] on the TV crime drama [[In the Heat of the Night|In the Heat of the Night (TV series)]].
title: Howard Rollins

abstract: Hunter Tylo (born Deborah Jo Hunter, July 3, 1962) is an American actress, author and former model. She is best known for her role as [[Taylor Hayes|Taylor Hayes (The Bold and the Beautiful)]] (1990–2002, 2004, 2005–13, 2014, 2018–) on [[The Bold and the Beautiful|The Bold and the Beautiful]].
title: Hunter Tylo

abstract: Enza Anderson (born 1964) is a Canadian journalist, media personality, Ontario politician, and [[transgender rights|transgender rights]] activist.
title: Enza Anderson

abstract: Esther Davis (born 7 January 1970), better known by the stage name Essie Davis, is an Australian actress. She is best known for her roles as Phryne Fisher in [[Miss Fisher's Murder Mysteries|Miss Fisher's Murder Mysteries]] and Amelia Vanek in [[The Babadook|The Babadook]]. Other major work has included a recurring role as actress Lady Crane in [[season six|Game of Thrones (season 6)]] of the television series [[Game of Thrones|Game of Thrones]], and the role of [[Elizabeth Woodville|Elizabeth Woodville]] in the television series [[The White Princess|The White Princess (TV series)]], an adaptation of [[Philippa Gregory|Philippa Gregory]]'s historical novel.
title: Essie Davis

abstract: Throughout her teenage years, Marta Wiśniewska took extensive dancing lessons and was part of several dancing groups. In 2000, she became the dancer and choreographer of [[Ich Troje|Ich Troje]], then highly popular Polish pop group. She would become the partner of its lead singer, [[Michał Wiśniewski|Michał Wiśniewski]], and the couple took part in controversial reality show [[Jestem, jaki jestem|Jestem, jaki jestem]], which became a television hit. During the show in 2003 she recorded two songs for Michał and began to prepare her musical career with professionals. She chose the artistic nickname "Mandaryna" deriving from her birth name.
title: Mandaryna

abstract: Mädchen Amick ( ; born December 12, 1970) is an American [[actress|Actor]]. She is best known for her starring role as [[Shelly Johnson|Shelly Johnson (Twin Peaks)]] on the [[cult|Cult following#Cult fans and media]] [[television series|Television program]] [[Twin Peaks|Twin Peaks]] (1990–1991), its [[prequel|prequel]] film [[Twin Peaks: Fire Walk with Me|Twin Peaks: Fire Walk with Me]] (1992) and its revival television series [[Twin Peaks: The Return|Twin Peaks (2017 TV series)]] (2017). She was also a series regular on [[Central Park West|Central Park West (TV series)]] (1995-1996), [[Freddie|Freddie (TV series)]] (2005-2006), and [[Witches of East End|Witches of East End (TV series)]] (2013-2014). On the big screen she had starring roles in [[Sleepwalkers|Sleepwalkers (film)]] (1992) and [[Dream Lover|Dream Lover (1993 film)]] (1993). She currently portrays [[Alice Cooper|Families of Archie's Gang#Alice_Cooper]], the mother of [[Betty Cooper|Betty Cooper]], on [[The CW|The CW]]'s drama television series [[Riverdale|Riverdale (2017 TV series)]] (2017–present).
title: Mädchen Amick

abstract: Yash Raj Chopra (27 September 1932 – 21 October 2012) was an Indian film director and film producer, predominantly working in [[Hindi cinema|Hindi cinema]]. Yash Chopra began his career as an assistant director to [[I. S. Johar|I. S. Johar]] and elder brother, [[B.R. Chopra|B.R. Chopra]]. He made his directorial debut with [[Dhool Ka Phool|Dhool Ka Phool]] in 1959, a melodrama about illegitimacy, and followed it with the social drama [[Dharmputra|Dharmputra]] (1961).
title: Yash Chopra

abstract: Sean Maher (born April 16, 1975) is an American [[actor|actor]]. He is known for his portrayal of [[Simon Tam|List of Firefly characters#Simon Tam]] in the [[science fiction|science fiction]] [[television|television]] series [[Firefly|Firefly (TV series)]] and follow-up movie [[Serenity|Serenity (2005 film)]].
title: Sean Maher

abstract: Mary Rose Byrne (born 24 July 1979) is an Australian actress. She made her screen debut in the film [[Dallas Doll|Dallas Doll]] (1994), and continued to act in Australian film and television throughout the 1990s. She obtained her first leading film role in [[The Goddess of 1967|The Goddess of 1967]] (2000), which brought her the [[Volpi Cup for Best Actress|Volpi Cup for Best Actress]], and made the transition to Hollywood in the small role of [[Dormé|List of Star Wars handmaidens#D]] in [[Star Wars: Episode II – Attack of the Clones|Star Wars: Episode II – Attack of the Clones]] (2002), followed by larger parts in [[Troy|Troy (film)]] (2004), [[Knowing|Knowing (film)]] (2007), and [[28 Weeks Later|28 Weeks Later]] (2007).
title: Rose Byrne

abstract: Mary Marg Helgenberger (born November 16, 1958) is an American actress. She began her career in the early 1980s and first came to attention for playing the role of [[Siobhan Ryan|Siobhan Ryan]] on the daytime soap opera [[Ryan's Hope|Ryan's Hope]] from 1982 to 1986. She is best known for her roles as [[Catherine Willows|Catherine Willows]] in the [[CBS|CBS]] police procedural drama [[CSI: Crime Scene Investigation|CSI: Crime Scene Investigation]] (2000–12, 2013) and the subsequent TV movie [[Immortality|Immortality (CSI)]] (2015) and as K.C. Koloski in the [[ABC|American Broadcasting Company]] drama [[China Beach|China Beach]] (1988–91), which earned her the 1990 [[Emmy Award|Emmy Award]] for [[Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Drama Series|Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actress – Drama Series]].
title: Marg Helgenberger

abstract: Jack Palance ( ; born Volodymyr Palahniuk (); February 18, 1919 – November 10, 2006) was an American actor and singer. He was nominated for three [[Academy Awards|Academy Awards]], all for [[Best Actor in a Supporting Role|Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor]], receiving nominations for his roles in [[Sudden Fear|Sudden Fear]] (1952) and [[Shane|Shane (film)]] (1953), and winning the Oscar almost 40 years later for his role in [[City Slickers|City Slickers]] (1991).
title: Jack Palance

abstract: Bruce Davison (born June 28, 1946) is an American actor and director of television, film, and theater. Davison is well known for his starring role in the cult horror film [[Willard|Willard (1971 film)]] (1971), as well as his [[Academy Award|Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor]]-nominated and [[Golden Globe|Golden Globe Award for Best Supporting Actor - Motion Picture]]-winning performance in [[Longtime Companion|Longtime Companion]] (1989), and as Thomas Semmes in the HBO original movie [[Vendetta|Vendetta (1999 film)]]. He featured prominently in the [[X-Men film franchise|X-Men (film series)]] – through [[X-Men|X-Men (film)]] (2000) and [[X2|X2 (film)]] (2003) – as antagonist [[Senator Robert Kelly|Senator Robert Kelly]].
title: Bruce Davison

abstract: Joel Grey (born Joel David Katz; April 11, 1932) is an American actor, singer, dancer, director, and photographer. He is best known for portraying the Master of Ceremonies in the [[Kander & Ebb|Kander & Ebb]] musical [[Cabaret|Cabaret (musical)]], as well as in the [[1972 film adaptation|Cabaret (1972 film)]]. He has won an [[Academy Award|Academy Awards]], [[Tony Award|Tony Award]], and [[Golden Globe Award|Golden Globe Award]].
title: Joel Grey

abstract: Pamela Bellwood (born Pamela Anne King on June 26, 1951) is an American actress best known for her role as [[Claudia Blaisdel Carrington|Claudia Blaisdel Carrington]] on the 1980s [[prime time|prime time]] [[soap opera|soap opera]], [[Dynasty|Dynasty (1981 TV series)]].
title: Pamela Bellwood

abstract: Pia Zadora (born Pia Alfreda Schipani, May 4, 1953) is an [[American|United States]] [[actress|actress]] and [[singer|singer]]. After working as a [[child actress|child actress]] on Broadway, in regional theater, and in the film [[Santa Claus Conquers the Martians|Santa Claus Conquers the Martians]] (1964), she came to national attention in 1981 when, following her starring role in the highly criticized [[Butterfly|Butterfly (1982 film)]], she won a [[Golden Globe Award|Golden Globe Award]] as New Star of the Year while simultaneously winning the [[Golden Raspberry Award for Worst Actress|Golden Raspberry Award for Worst Actress]] and the [["Worst New Star"|Golden Raspberry Award for Worst New Star]] for the same performance.
title: Pia Zadora

abstract: Morgan Fairchild (born Patsy Ann McClenny; February 3, 1950) is an American actress. She achieved prominence during the late 1970s and early 1980s with continuing roles in several television series, in which she usually conveyed a glamorous image.
title: Morgan Fairchild

abstract: Jason Patric (born June 17, 1966) is an American film, television and stage actor. He is known for his roles in the films [[The Lost Boys|The Lost Boys]], [[Rush|Rush (1991 film)]], [[Sleepers|Sleepers (film)]], [[Geronimo: An American Legend|Geronimo: An American Legend]], [[Your Friends & Neighbors|Your Friends & Neighbors]], [[Narc|Narc (film)]], [[The Losers|The Losers (film)]], [[The Alamo|The Alamo (2004 film)]], and [[Speed 2: Cruise Control|Speed 2: Cruise Control]]. His father was actor/playwright [[Jason Miller|Jason Miller (playwright)]] and his maternal grandfather was actor [[Jackie Gleason|Jackie Gleason]].
title: Jason Patric

abstract: Steven Bauer (born Esteban Ernesto Echevarría Samson; December 2, 1956) is a Cuban-American actor. He is known for his role as Manny Ribera in the 1983 film [[Scarface|Scarface (1983 film)]], as [[Don Eladio|List of Breaking Bad characters#Don Eladio Vuente]] in the [[AMC|AMC (TV channel)]] drama series [[Breaking Bad|Breaking Bad]], Avi in [[Ray Donovan|Ray Donovan]], and the [[bilingual|bilingual]] [[PBS|PBS]] show [[¿Qué Pasa, USA?|¿Qué Pasa, USA?]]
title: Steven Bauer

abstract: Alisen Down (born January 3, 1976) is a [[Canadian|Canadians]] [[film|film]] and [[television|television]] [[actress|actress]].
title: Alisen Down

abstract: Danielle Riley Keough ( ; born May 29, 1989) is an American actress, model, and producer. She is the daughter of [[Lisa Marie Presley|Lisa Marie Presley]] with Danny Keough, and the eldest grandchild of [[Elvis|Elvis Presley]] and [[Priscilla Presley|Priscilla Presley]].
title: Riley Keough

abstract: Thicke was born on March 1, 1947, in [[Kirkland Lake, Ontario|Kirkland Lake]], the son of Shirley "Joan" Isobel Marie (née Greer), a nurse, and William Jeffrey, a stockbroker. They divorced in 1953. His mother remarried to Brian Thicke, a physician, and they moved to [[Elliot Lake|Elliot Lake]]. Alan Thicke graduated from [[Elliot Lake Secondary School|Elliot Lake Secondary School]] in 1965, and was elected [[homecoming|homecoming]] king. He went on to attend the [[University of Western Ontario|University of Western Ontario]], where he joined the [[Delta Upsilon fraternity|Delta Upsilon]].
title: Alan Thicke

abstract: Senta Berger (; born 13 May 1941) is an [[Austria|Austrian]] film, stage and television actress, producer and author. She received many award nominations for her acting in theatre, film and television; her awards include three [[Bambi Awards|Bambi (prize)]], two [[Romys|Romy (TV award)]], an [[Adolf Grimme Award|Adolf Grimme Award]], both a [[Deutscher|Deutscher Fernsehpreis]] and a [[Bayerischer Fernsehpreis|Bayerischer Fernsehpreis]], and a [[Goldene Kamera|Goldene Kamera]].
title: Senta Berger

abstract: Sonali Bendre (born 1 January 1975) is an Indian film actress, model, television personality and author. Primarily recognised for her work in Hindi films, she has also appeared in Telugu, Tamil, Marathi and Kannada language films. She has established a career in [[Hindi Cinema|Hindi Cinema]] and is one of the most popular actresses. Bendre is the recipient of numerous accolades, including a [[Filmfare Award|Filmfare Award]].
title: Sonali Bendre

abstract: David Soul (born David Richard Solberg, August 28, 1943) is an [[American|Americans]]-[[British|British people]] actor and singer. He is known for his role as Detective Kenneth "Hutch" Hutchinson in the [[ABC|American Broadcasting Company]] television series [[Starsky & Hutch|Starsky & Hutch]] from 1975 to 1979. He became a British citizen in 2004.
title: David Soul

abstract: Born in [[Montreal|Montreal]], [[Quebec|Quebec]], Canada, Pascale Bussières first attracted attention as a suicidal teenager in [[Micheline Lanctôt|Micheline Lanctôt]]’s 1984 film [[Sonatine|Sonatine (1984 film)]]; however, it was Blanche, the 1993 [[Radio-Canada|Radio-Canada]] series directed by [[Charles Binamé|Charles Binamé]] that gave her star status in [[Quebec|Quebec]]. After Blanche, and then a lead in Binamé’s Generation-X picture [[Eldorado|Eldorado (1995 film)]], Bussières became the 1990s heir to [[Geneviève Bujold|Geneviève Bujold]] and [[Carole Laure|Carole Laure]] – the most charismatic actress of her generation. It’s a measure of Bussières’s range as an actress that her follow-up to Eldorado was the role of a prim-and-proper theology student who discovers her lesbian desires in [[Patricia Rozema|Patricia Rozema]]'s [[When Night Is Falling|When Night Is Falling]]. She also gives a standout performance as an alienated fashion model who wants to conceive a child in [[Denis Villeneuve|Denis Villeneuve]]'s debut feature, [[August 32nd on Earth|August 32nd on Earth]] (Un 32 août sur terre), and won both the 2004 Best Actress [[Prix Jutra|Prix Jutra]] and [[Genie Award|Genie Award]] for her dramatic impersonation of Quebec singing star [[Alys Robi|Alys Robi]] in [[Bittersweet Memories|Bittersweet Memories (film)]] (Ma vie en cinemascope).
title: Pascale Bussières

abstract: Douglas Christopher Judge (born October 13, 1964) is an [[American Canadian|American Canadian]] actor best known for playing [[Teal'c|Teal'c]] in the [[Canadian|Canadian science fiction television]]-[[American|U.S. television science fiction]] [[military science fiction|military science fiction]] television series [[Stargate SG-1|Stargate SG-1]]. He attended the [[University of Oregon|University of Oregon]] on a football scholarship and was a [[Pacific-10 Conference|Pacific-10 Conference]] player. Judge played [[Kratos|Kratos (God of War)]] in the 2018 video game [[God of War|God of War (2018 video game)]], replacing long-time voice actor [[Terrence C. Carson|Terrence C. Carson]].
title: Christopher Judge

abstract: Anita Page (August 4, 1910 – September 6, 2008) was an American film actress who reached stardom in the last years of the [[silent film|silent film]] era.Page became a highly popular young star, reportedly receiving the most fan mail of anyone on the [[MGM|Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer]] lot. She was referred to as "a blond, [[blue-eyed|eye color#Blue]] [[Latin|white Hispanic and Latino Americans]]" and "the girl with the most beautiful face in Hollywood" in the 1920s.
