She retired from acting in 1936. Page married her second husband the following year with whom she had two children.
title: Anita Page

abstract: Olivier Martinez (born 12 January 1966) is a French film actor. He became known after roles in several French films such as [[Un, deux, trois, soleil|1, 2, 3, Sun]] (1993), which garnered him the [[César Award|César Award]] for "Most Promising Actor", [[The Horseman on the Roof|The Horseman on the Roof]] (1995), and [[The Chambermaid on the Titanic|The Chambermaid on the Titanic]] (1997). He has also appeared in [[Hollywood|Hollywood]]-produced features, including the drama [[Before Night Falls|Before Night Falls (film)]] (2000), the erotic thriller [[Unfaithful|Unfaithful (2002 film)]] (2002) and playing the role of a French drug lord in the action-crime-thriller [[S.W.A.T.|S.W.A.T. (film)]] (2003).
title: Olivier Martinez

abstract: Dina Meyer (born December 22, 1968) is an American film and television actress. She began her career appearing in a recurring role on the Fox teen drama series [[Beverly Hills, 90210|Beverly Hills, 90210]] (1993–94), before landing a female leading role opposite [[Keanu Reeves|Keanu Reeves]] in the 1995 film [[Johnny Mnemonic|Johnny Mnemonic (film)]].
title: Dina Meyer

abstract: Bernd Weidung (born 1 March 1963 in [[Koblenz|Koblenz]], [[Rhineland-Palatinate|Rhineland-Palatinate]]), better known by his [[stage name|stage name]] Thomas Anders, is a [[German|German people]] [[singer|singer]], best known as the [[lead singer|lead singer]] of German duo [[Modern Talking|Modern Talking]].
title: Thomas Anders

abstract: Louis Jourdan (born Louis Robert Gendre; 19 June 1921 – 14 February 2015) was a French film and television actor. He was known for his suave roles in several Hollywood films, including [[Alfred Hitchcock|Alfred Hitchcock]]'s [[The Paradine Case|The Paradine Case]] (1947), [[Letter from an Unknown Woman|Letter from an Unknown Woman (1948 film)]] (1948), [[Gigi|Gigi (1958 film)]] (1958), [[The Best of Everything|The Best of Everything (1959 film)]] (1959), [[The V.I.P.s|The V.I.P.s (film)]] (1963) and [[Octopussy|Octopussy]] (1983). He played [[Dracula|Count Dracula]] in the 1977 BBC television production [[Count Dracula|Count Dracula (1977 film)]].
title: Louis Jourdan

abstract: Michael J. Anderson (born October 31, 1953) is an American [[actor|actor]] known for his roles as [[The Man from Another Place|The Man from Another Place]] in [[David Lynch|David Lynch]]'s television series [[Twin Peaks|Twin Peaks]], the [[prequel|prequel]] film for the series, [[Twin Peaks: Fire Walk with Me|Twin Peaks: Fire Walk with Me]], and as [[Samson Leonhart|Samson (Carnivàle)]] on the [[HBO|HBO]] series [[Carnivàle|Carnivàle]]. He has the genetic disorder [[osteogenesis imperfecta|osteogenesis imperfecta]], a disease that leads to frequent breaks in long bones and improper healing, leaving him with a shortened stature of tall.
title: Michael J. Anderson

abstract: Jeri Lynn Mooney (born January 28, 1944), better known as Susan Howard, is an American actress, writer, and [[political activist|activism]]. She is perhaps best known for portraying the character [[Donna Culver Krebbs|Donna Culver Krebbs]] on the primetime serial [[Dallas|Dallas (1978 TV series)]] (1979–87), and as a co-star of the series [[Petrocelli|Petrocelli]] (1974–76). She is also a screenwriter and member of the [[Writers Guild of America|Writers Guild of America]].
title: Susan Howard

abstract: David DeCoteau (born January 5, 1962) is an [[America|American]]-[[Canadian|Canadians]] [[film director|film director]] and [[producer|film producer]].
title: David DeCoteau

abstract: André Lauren Benjamin (born May 27, 1975), better known by his stage name André 3000 (formerly André), is an American rapper, singer, songwriter, record producer, actor, and dancer best known for being part of [[hip hop|hip hop music]] duo [[Outkast|Outkast]] alongside fellow rapper [[Big Boi|Big Boi]]. As an actor, Benjamin has made appearances in a number of TV series and films, including [[Families|Families (TV series)]], [[The Shield|The Shield]], [[Be Cool|Be Cool]], [[Revolver|Revolver (2005 film)]], [[Semi-Pro|Semi-Pro]], [[Four Brothers|Four Brothers (film)]], and the lead role of [[Jimi Hendrix|Jimi Hendrix]] in [[All Is by My Side|All Is by My Side]].
title: André 3000

abstract: Sushmita Sen (born 19 November 1975) is an Indian actress, model who was crowned [[Femina Miss India Universe|Femina Miss India#Miss Universe]] in 1994 and she later won the [[Miss Universe 1994|Miss Universe 1994]] contest at the age of 18. Sen is the first Indian woman to win the competition. Primarily known for her work in [[Hindi|Bollywood]] films, she has also appeared in [[Tamil |Tamil cinema]] and [[Bengali|Cinema of West Bengal]] language films. She has won several accolades including a [[Filmfare Award|Filmfare Awards]].
title: Sushmita Sen

abstract: Charlotte Rae Lubotsky (April 22, 1926 – August 5, 2018), known professionally as Charlotte Rae, was an American [[character actress|Character actor]], [[comedian|comedian]], and [[singer|singing]] whose career spanned six decades.
title: Charlotte Rae

abstract: Zachary Scott (February 21, 1914 – October 3, 1965) was an American actor, most notable for his roles as villains and "mystery men".
title: Zachary Scott

abstract: Nathan Fillion (; born March 27, 1971) is a Canadian-American actor and voice actor best known for the lead roles of Captain [[Malcolm "Mal" Reynolds|Malcolm Reynolds]] in the [[Fox|Fox Broadcasting Company]] series [[Firefly|Firefly (TV series)]] and its feature film continuation, [[Serenity|Serenity (2005 film)]], as well as [[Richard Castle|Richard Castle]] on the ABC series [[Castle|Castle (TV series)]] and John Nolan on [[The Rookie|The Rookie (TV series)]].
title: Nathan Fillion

abstract: Karl Wilhelm Reinmuth (April 4, 1892 in [[Heidelberg|Heidelberg]] – May 6, 1979 in Heidelberg) was a German [[astronomer|astronomer]] and a prolific discoverer of 395 [[minor planets|minor planets]].
title: Karl Wilhelm Reinmuth

abstract: Francesca Annis (born 14 May 1945) is an English actor. She is known for television roles in [[Reckless|Reckless (TV serial)]] (1998), [[Wives and Daughters|Wives and Daughters]] (1999), [[Deceit|Deceit (TV serial)]] (2000) and [[Cranford|Cranford (TV series)]] (2007). A six-time [[BAFTA TV Award|British Academy Television Award]] nominee, she won the 1979 [[BAFTA TV Award for Best Actress|British Academy Television Award for Best Actress]] for the [[ITV|ITV Network]] serial [[Lillie|Lillie (TV series)]]. Her film appearances include [[Krull|Krull (film)]] (1983), [[Dune|Dune (film)]] (1984), [[The Debt Collector|The Debt Collector]] (1999) and [[The Libertine|The Libertine (2004 film)]] (2004).
title: Francesca Annis

abstract: Janine Turner (born Janine Loraine Gauntt; December 6, 1962) is an American [[actress|actor]] best known for her roles as [[Maggie O'Connell|Maggie O'Connell]] in the television series [[Northern Exposure|Northern Exposure]], as Jessie Deighan in the feature film [[Cliffhanger|Cliffhanger (film)]], and as Katie McCoy in [[Friday Night Lights|Friday Night Lights (TV series)]]. She is an author, public speaker and founder and co-chair of Constituting America 2010.
title: Janine Turner

abstract: Natasha Lyonne (born April 4, 1979), is an American actress. She is best known for her role as [[Nicky Nichols|Nicky Nichols]] on the [[Netflix|Netflix]] series [[Orange Is the New Black|Orange Is the New Black]] (2013–present), for which she received an [[Emmy Award|Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Guest Actress in a Comedy Series]] nomination in 2014, and for her role as Jessica in the [[American Pie film series|American Pie (film series)]] (1999–2012).
title: Natasha Lyonne

abstract: Jennifer Grey was born on March 26, 1960 in Manhattan, the daughter of stage and [[Academy Award|Academy Award]]-winning screen actor [[Joel Grey|Joel Grey]] and former actress/singer Jo Wilder (née Brower). Her paternal grandfather was comedian and musician [[Mickey Katz|Mickey Katz]]. Grey's parents both came from [[Jewish|Jewish]] families.
title: Jennifer Grey

abstract: Carla Bonner (born 3 March 1973) is an Australian actress best known for playing the role of [[Stephanie Scully|Stephanie Scully]] in the soap opera [[Neighbours|Neighbours]], a role she played from 1999 to 2010. She was also a guest on [[Celebrity Big Brother Australia|Celebrity Big Brother Australia]] in 2002. Following her departure from Neighbours, Bonner wrote a book called Hook, Line and Sink Her and guest starred in an episode of [[Wentworth|Wentworth (TV series)]]. She briefly reprised the role of Steph in 2013, before returning to Neighbours as a permanent cast member from October 2015 until June 2018.
title: Carla Bonner

abstract: Renee Olstead (born June 18, 1989) is an [[American|American people]] actress and singer. Active since childhood as an actress, she is best known for her roles on the CBS sitcom [[Still Standing|Still Standing (TV series)]] and on the drama [[The Secret Life of the American Teenager|The Secret Life of the American Teenager]] as Madison Cooperstein. In addition, she has recorded four studio albums, primarily of jazz music.
title: Renee Olstead

abstract: Nazih Abdul-Hamed Nabih al-Ruqai'i, known by the alias Abu Anas al-Libi ( ;   [[Libyan|Libyan Arabic]] pronunciation: ; 30 March 1964 or 14 May 1964 – 2 January 2015), was a [[Libya|Libyan]] under indictment in the United States for his part in the [[1998 United States embassy bombings|1998 United States embassy bombings]]. He worked as a computer specialist for [[al-Qaeda|al-Qaeda]]. He was an ethnic Libyan, born in [[Tripoli|Tripoli]].
title: Abu Anas al-Libi

abstract: When Miho Komatsu was 3 years old, she was influenced by her brother to start playing the electone (electronic organ). In junior high school, she was interested in Western and Japanese music. She started making and writing songs on her own. She participated in a band called "Keyboard". From senior high school, she appeared as the vocalist of a band in a [[Keihanshin|Keihanshin]] live house. A demo tape fell into the hands of a producer.
title: Miho Komatsu

abstract: Jason Harris Katz (born July 25, 1969) is an American voice actor and a former television host. He was the host of the short-lived [[Double Dare 2000|Double Dare (Nickelodeon game show)]] on [[Nickelodeon|Nickelodeon (TV channel)]]. He also was a host of Nickelodeon's Big Help on the Road in the late 1990s. He has recently appeared on [[Codename: Kids Next Door|Codename: Kids Next Door]] voicing the character Chad Dickson/Numbuh 274 and in a commercial for [[Olive Garden|Olive Garden]]. In 2002, Harris voiced Bill Dickey in the failed [[Adult Swim|Adult Swim]] pilot, [[Welcome to Eltingville|Welcome to Eltingville]]. He also did several minor voices in the video game [[Destroy All Humans! 2|Destroy All Humans! 2]].
title: Jason Harris Katz

abstract: Ann Dvorak (born Anna McKim, August 2, 1911 – December 10, 1979) was an American stage and film actress.
title: Ann Dvorak

abstract: Eric Stoltz (born September 30, 1961) is an American actor, director and producer. He is known for playing the role of [[Rocky Dennis|Roy L. Dennis]] in the biographical drama film [[Mask|Mask (film)]], which earned him the nomination for a [[Golden Globe Award for Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture|Golden Globe Award for Best Supporting Actor – Motion Picture]], and has appeared in a wide variety of films from mainstream fare like [[Some Kind of Wonderful|Some Kind of Wonderful (film)]] to independent films like [[Pulp Fiction|Pulp Fiction]], [[Killing Zoe|Killing Zoe]], and [[Kicking and Screaming|Kicking and Screaming (1995 film)]].
title: Eric Stoltz

abstract: John Hodiak (April 16, 1914 – October 19, 1955) was an American actor who worked in radio, stage and film.
title: John Hodiak

abstract: David Hayter (born February 6, 1969) is a [[Canadian-American|Canadian-American]] actor, [[voice actor|voice acting]], [[screenwriter|screenwriter]], director and producer. He is well known as the English [[voice actor|voice actor]] for [[Solid Snake|Solid Snake]] and [[Naked Snake|Big Boss (Metal Gear)]] throughout many titles in the [[Metal Gear video game series|Metal Gear (series)]]. His works as a screenwriter include [[X-Men|X-Men (film)]], [[X2|X2 (film)]] and [[Watchmen|Watchmen (film)]].
title: David Hayter

abstract: Chyna first rose to prominence in the [[World Wrestling Federation|WWE]] (WWF, now WWE) in 1997, where she was billed as the "Ninth Wonder of the World" ([[André the Giant|André the Giant]] was already billed as the [[eighth|Eighth Wonder of the World]]). A founding member of the [[stable|Glossary of professional wrestling terms#S]] [[D-Generation X|D-Generation X]] as the promotion's first female [[enforcer|Glossary of professional wrestling terms#E]], she held the [[WWF Intercontinental Championship|WWE Intercontinental Championship]] (the only female performer to do so) twice and the [[WWF Women's Championship|WWE Women's Championship (1956–2010)]] once. She was also the first woman to participate in the [[Royal Rumble match|Royal Rumble match]] and [[King of the Ring|King of the Ring]] tournament, as well as to become number one contender to the [[WWF Championship|WWE World Heavyweight Championship]]. With singles victories over several prominent male wrestlers – including multiple-time world champions [[Triple H|Triple H]], [[Kurt Angle|Kurt Angle]], [[Chris Jericho|Chris Jericho]], and [[Jeff Jarrett|Jeff Jarrett]] – Chyna left what WWE called "a [[lasting legacy|#Legacy]] as the most dominant female competitor of all time". After leaving the WWF in 2001, Chyna wrestled sporadically, with [[New Japan Pro Wrestling|New Japan Pro Wrestling]] (NJPW) in 2002 and [[Total Nonstop Action Wrestling|Total Nonstop Action Wrestling]] (TNA) in 2011. This was her final appearance in a wrestling ring.
title: Chyna

abstract: Sarah Ophelia Colley Cannon (October 25, 1912 – March 4, 1996), known professionally as her stage character Minnie Pearl, was an American country [[comedian|comedian]] who appeared at the [[Grand Ole Opry|Grand Ole Opry]] for more than 50 years (from 1940 to 1991) and on the television show [[Hee Haw|Hee Haw]] from 1969 to 1991.
title: Minnie Pearl

abstract: Diane Kruger ([[née|Given name]] Heidkrüger; ; born 15 July 1976) is a [[German-American|German Americans]] [[actress|actor]] and former [[fashion model|model (person)]].
title: Diane Kruger

abstract: Dana Snyder (born November 14, 1973) is an American stand-up comedian, actor, producer and voice actor. He is known for voicing [[Master Shake|Master Shake]] on [[Aqua Teen Hunger Force|Aqua Teen Hunger Force]] and Granny Cuyler on [[Squidbillies|Squidbillies]]. He also voiced Dr. Colosso on [[Nickelodeon|Nickelodeon]]'s comedy series [[The Thundermans|The Thundermans]].
title: Dana Snyder

abstract: Jared Drake Bell (born June 27, 1986) is an American actor, voice actor, singer, songwriter, and musician. Born in [[Newport Beach, California|Newport Beach, California]], he began his career as an actor in the early 1990s at the age of five with his first televised appearance on [[Home Improvement|Home Improvement (TV series)]]. Bell also appeared in several commercials, such as one for [[Pokémon Red and Blue|Pokémon Red and Blue]], but is best known for his starring roles on [[Nickelodeon|Nickelodeon]]'s [[The Amanda Show|The Amanda Show]] and [[Drake & Josh|Drake & Josh]]. Bell starred in a trilogy of [[The Fairly OddParents|The Fairly OddParents]] movies on Nickelodeon. Bell was the voice of [[Peter Parker / Spider-Man|Spider-Man]] in the animated series [[Ultimate Spider-Man|Ultimate Spider-Man (TV series)]] on [[Disney XD|Disney XD]]. He appeared on ABC's reality TV series [[Splash|Splash (TV series)]].
title: Drake Bell

abstract: Michael Edward O'Malley (born October 31, 1966) is an American actor and writer who has appeared in many films and television series. Born in [[Boston|Boston]] and raised in [[New Hampshire|New Hampshire]], O'Malley hosted the early 1990s children's game show [[Nickelodeon Guts|Nickelodeon Guts]] before moving to Los Angeles later that decade to star in his own sitcom for [[NBC|NBC]] called [[The Mike O'Malley Show|The Mike O'Malley Show]]. He is probably best known for his role as Jimmy Hughes on [[Yes, Dear|Yes, Dear]], the [[CBS|CBS]] series which aired from 2000 to 2006. He was nominated for an [[Emmy Award|Emmy Award]] for his role as [[Burt Hummel|Burt Hummel]] on the [[Fox|Fox Broadcasting Company]] series [[Glee|Glee (TV series)]].
title: Mike O'Malley

abstract: Erick Elías Rabinovitz (born June 23, 1980) is a Mexican actor. Elías began acting as an actor with a screen debut in [[DKDA: Sueños de juventud|DKDA: Sueños de juventud]] (2000), followed by roles in [[Amigos x siempre|Amigos x siempre]] (2000). He became known in the reality show [[Protagonistas de Novela|Protagonistas de Novela]] (2003), where he was the winner. He participated in projects of the American network [[Telemundo|Telemundo]], such as; [[Gitanas|Gitanas]] (2004), [[El cuerpo del deseo|El cuerpo del deseo]] (2005) and [[El Zorro, la espada y la rosa|El Zorro, la espada y la rosa]] (2007). He got his first starring role in the telenovela [[Tormenta en el paraíso|Tormenta en el paraíso]], from there followed roles as protagonists in [[Niña de mi corazón|Niña de mi corazón]] (2010), [[Ni contigo ni sin ti|Ni contigo ni sin ti]] (2011), [[Porque el amor manda|Porque el amor manda]] (2013), [[El color de la pasión|El color de la pasión]] (2014) and [[El hotel de los secretos|El hotel de los secretos]] (2016), the first series that [[Televisa|Televisa]] produced for [[Blim|Blim]].
title: Erick Elías

abstract: Gaspar Noé (; ; born December 27, 1963) is an [[Argentine|Argentine]] filmmaker living in [[France|France]]. He is the son of Argentine painter, writer and intellectual [[Luis Felipe Noé|Luis Felipe Noé]]. He is mostly known for his five feature films: [[I Stand Alone|I Stand Alone (film)]] (1998), [[Irréversible|Irréversible]] (2002), [[Enter the Void|Enter the Void]] (2009), [[Love|Love (2015 film)]] (2015), and [[Climax|Climax (2018 film)]] (2018).
title: Gaspar Noé

abstract: Luis Guzmán (born August 28, 1956) is a [[Puerto Rican|Puerto Ricans]] actor, who is known for his [[character|Character actor]] work. For much of Guzmán's career, he has played character roles largely as sidekicks, thugs, and policemen.
title: Luis Guzmán

abstract: Victoria Camargo, known professionally as Victoria Wyndham (born May 22, 1945), is an [[American|United States]] actress best known for her role as [[Rachel Cory|Rachel Cory Hutchins]] on the [[soap opera|soap opera]] [[Another World|Another World (TV series)]].
title: Victoria Wyndham

abstract: Neil Patrick Harris (born June 15, 1973) is an American actor, writer, producer, comedian, magician, and singer. He is known primarily for his comedy roles on television and his dramatic and musical stage roles. On television, he is known for playing the title character on [[Doogie Howser, M.D.|Doogie Howser, M.D.]] (1989–1993), [[Barney Stinson|Barney Stinson]] on [[How I Met Your Mother|How I Met Your Mother]] (2005–2014, for which he was nominated for four [[Emmy Awards|Emmy Awards]]), and [[Count Olaf|Count Olaf]] in [[A Series of Unfortunate Events|A Series of Unfortunate Events (TV series)]] (2017–2019).
title: Neil Patrick Harris

abstract: Dennis Franz Schlachta (; born October 28, 1944), known professionally as Dennis Franz, is an American former actor best known for his role as [[NYPD|NYPD]] Detective [[Andy Sipowicz|Andy Sipowicz]] in the [[ABC|American Broadcasting Company]] television series [[NYPD Blue|NYPD Blue]] (1993–2005), a role that earned him a [[Golden Globe Award|Golden Globe Award]], three [[Screen Actors Guild Awards|Screen Actors Guild Awards]] and four [[Primetime Emmy Awards|Primetime Emmy Awards]]. He also portrayed Lt. Norman Buntz in the similar [[NBC|NBC]] series [[Hill Street Blues|Hill Street Blues]] (1985–1987) and its short-lived spinoff, [[Beverly Hills Buntz|Beverly Hills Buntz]] (1987–1988).
title: Dennis Franz

abstract: Pier Angeli (19 June 193210 September 1971), also credited under her birth name, Anna Maria Pierangeli, was an Italian-born television and film actress. Her American cinematographic debut was in the starring role of the 1951 film [[Teresa|Teresa (1951 film)]], for which she won a [[Golden Globe Award|Golden Globe Award]] for Young Star of the Year - Actress. She had one son with [[Vic Damone|Vic Damone]], her first husband, and another son with [[Armando Trovajoli|Armando Trovajoli]], her second husband.
title: Pier Angeli

abstract: Rory Cochrane (born February 28, 1972) is an American [[actor|actor]]. He is known for playing Ron Slater in [[Dazed and Confused|Dazed and Confused (film)]], Lucas in [[Empire Records|Empire Records]], Lee Schatz in [[Argo|Argo (2012 film)]], Freck in [[A Scanner Darkly|A Scanner Darkly (film)]] and [[Tim Speedle|Tim Speedle]] in [[CSI: Miami|CSI: Miami]].
title: Rory Cochrane

abstract: Robin Mattson (born June 1, 1956) is an American actress. She is best known for her roles on the daytime soap operas [[General Hospital|General Hospital]], [[Santa Barbara|Santa Barbara (TV series)]], and [[All My Children|All My Children]].
title: Robin Mattson

abstract: Jason Statham (; born 26 July 1967) is an English actor and film producer. Typecast as the [[antihero|antihero]], he is known for his [[action-thriller|action film]] roles and portraying tough, irredeemable, and [[machiavellian|Machiavellianism]] characters. Throughout [[his film career|Jason Statham#Filmography]], Statham has regularly performed his own [[stage combat|stage combat]] and [[stunt|stunts]].
title: Jason Statham

abstract: Lennie James (born 11 October 1965) is an English actor, screenwriter, and playwright. He is best known for playing [[Morgan Jones|Morgan Jones (The Walking Dead)]] on [[The Walking Dead|The Walking Dead (TV series)]] and [[Fear the Walking Dead|Fear the Walking Dead]], and has appeared in many films including [[Snatch|Snatch (film)]] (2000) and [[Blade Runner 2049|Blade Runner 2049]] (2017).
title: Lennie James

abstract: Heidi Hudson Leick (born May 9, 1969) is an American actress, known for her role as villainess [[Callisto|Callisto (Xena)]] in the television series [[Xena: Warrior Princess|Xena: Warrior Princess]]. She is a certified [[Yoga|Yoga]] instructor and [[intuitive counselor|intuitive counselor]] at the Healing Heart Yoga Center.
title: Hudson Leick

abstract: Mary Martha Byrne (born December 23, 1969) is an American actress, singer and television writer. She played the role of [[Lily Walsh Snyder|Lily Walsh]] on the [[soap opera|soap opera]] [[As the World Turns|As the World Turns]] from 1985 to 1989, then again from 1993 to 2008; as well as, from 2000 to 2003, Lily's twin sister, Rose D'Angelo. Byrne has also appeared in other stage, television and movie roles, including the title role in the 1983 film [[Anna to the Infinite Power|Anna to the Infinite Power]]. She is currently executive producer of the digital drama series [[Anacostia|Anacostia (web series)]], where she has played the role of Alexis Jordan since 2011. Byrne has won three [[Daytime Emmy Award|Daytime Emmy Awards]] for acting.
title: Martha Byrne

abstract: Barbara Hershey (born Barbara Lynn Herzstein; February 5, 1948), once known as Barbara Seagull, is an American actress. In a career spanning more than 50 years, she has played a variety of roles on television and in cinema in several genres, including westerns and comedies. She began acting at age 17 in 1965 but did not achieve much critical acclaim until the latter half of the 1980s. By that time, the [[Chicago Tribune|Chicago Tribune]] referred to her as "one of America's finest actresses."
title: Barbara Hershey

abstract: Roger Bowen (May 25, 1932 – February 16, 1996) was an American comedic actor and novelist, known for his portrayal of Lt. Col. [[Henry Blake|List of M*A*S*H characters#Henry Blake]] in the 1970 film [[MASH|MASH (film)]]. He often portrayed stuffy defenders of the upper class and had regular roles on a number of television series. Bowen considered himself a writer who only moonlighted as an actor. He wrote eleven novels (including Just Like a Movie) as well as sketches for Broadway and television. He was also one of the co-founders of Chicago's comedy and acting troupe [[The Second City|The Second City]].
title: Roger Bowen

abstract: Marcus Nispel is a feature [[film|film]] [[director|film director]] and [[producer|Film producer]], as well as a [[director|music video director]] of [[television commercial|television commercials]] and [[music videos|music videos]]. He started a production company with partner Anouk (Frankel) Nora Portfolio Artists Network which later merged with RSA (Ridley Scott Associates) Black Dog Films to form Portfolio/Black Dog. He also worked at RSA as a commercial director for several years.
title: Marcus Nispel

abstract: Paul David Graf (April 16, 1950 – April 7, 2001) was an American [[actor|actor]], known for his role as [[Sgt. Eugene Tackleberry|Sgt. Eugene Tackleberry]] in the [[Police Academy|Police Academy (franchise)]] series of films.
title: David Graf

abstract: Catherine Hickland (born February 11, 1956) is an American film, stage, and television actress, as well as a singer, author and cosmetics-company [[CEO|CEO]] and hypnotist. She began her career in television in 1978, appearing in guest roles on several series before being cast in a recurring role on [[Texas|Texas (TV series)]] from 1980 to 1981. She also had supporting roles in the comedy film [[The Last Married Couple in America|The Last Married Couple in America]] (1980), and the horror films [[Ghost Town|Ghost Town (1988 film)]] (1988) and [[Witchery|Witchery (film)]] (1988).
title: Catherine Hickland

abstract: Charlotte Ross (born January 21, 1968) is an American actress. She is best known for her roles as Eve Donovan on the [[NBC Daytime|NBC Daytime]] soap opera [[Days of Our Lives|Days of Our Lives]] from 1987 to 1991, and as [[Det. Connie McDowell|Connie McDowell]] on the [[ABC|American Broadcasting Company]] [[police procedural|police procedural]] drama series [[NYPD Blue|NYPD Blue]] from 2001 to 2004.
title: Charlotte Ross

abstract: LaTanya Richardson (born October 21, 1949), often listed as LaTanya Richardson Jackson, is an American actress and producer. She began her career appearing in off-Broadway, before playing supporting roles on television and film.
title: LaTanya Richardson

abstract: Waldo Brian Donlevy (February 9, 1901   – April 6, 1972) was an American actor, noted for playing dangerous tough guys from the 1930s to the 1960s. He usually appeared in supporting roles. Among his best-known films are [[Beau Geste|Beau Geste (1939 film)]] (1939) and [[The Great McGinty|The Great McGinty]] (1940). For his role as Sergeant Markoff in Beau Geste, he was nominated for the [[Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor|Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor]].
title: Brian Donlevy

abstract: Geoff Johns (born January 25, 1973) is an American [[comic book writer|comic book writer]], [[screenwriter|screenwriter]] and film and television producer. He served as the President and [[Chief Creative Officer|Chief Creative Officer]] (CCO) of [[DC Entertainment|DC Entertainment]] from 2016 to 2018, after his initial appointment as CCO in 2010. Some of his most notable work has used the [[DC Comics|DC Comics]] characters [[Green Lantern|Green Lantern]], [[Aquaman|Aquaman]], [[Flash|Flash (comics)]], and [[Superman|Superman]].
title: Geoff Johns

abstract: Wally Kurth (born July 31, 1958) is an American singer and [[television|television]] performer. He is best known for his work on the [[soap opera|soap opera]] [[General Hospital|General Hospital]] as the second [[Ned Ashton|List of past General Hospital characters#Ned Ashton]], which he has portrayed since 1993, and for his role as [[Justin Kiriakis|Justin Kiriakis]] on [[Days of Our Lives|Days of Our Lives]] a role he created in 1987 and played until he left the show in 1991, returning to reprise the role in August 2009. He also played the character of Sam Hutchins on [[As the World Turns|As the World Turns]] for several months in late 2007/early 2008.
title: Wally Kurth

abstract: Ada Nicodemou (born 14 May 1977) is an Australian-born [[Greek Cypriot|Greek Cypriot]] actress. She began her acting career in 1994 playing Katerina Ioannou in [[Heartbreak High|Heartbreak High]]. She also starred in [[Police Rescue|Police Rescue]] and [[Breakers|Breakers (TV series)]]. In 2000, Nicodemou began playing [[Leah Patterson-Baker|Leah Patterson-Baker]] in the soap opera [[Home and Away|Home and Away]]. She won the 3rd season of [[Dancing with the Stars|Dancing with the Stars (Australian TV series)]] and hosted reality series [[Please Marry My Boy|Please Marry My Boy]] in 2012.
title: Ada Nicodemou

abstract: Christa B. Allen (born November 11, 1991) is an American actress. She is known for playing the younger version of [[Jennifer Garner|Jennifer Garner]]'s characters in [[13 Going on 30|13 Going on 30]] (2004) and [[Ghosts of Girlfriends Past|Ghosts of Girlfriends Past]] (2009), as well as for her role as socialite Charlotte Grayson on the [[ABC|American Broadcasting Company]] drama series [[Revenge|Revenge (TV series)]].
title: Christa B. Allen

abstract: Maggie Roswell (born November 14, 1952) is an American actress, voice actress, comedian, writer and producer from [[Los Angeles, California|Los Angeles]]. She is well known for her voice work on the [[Fox network|Fox Broadcasting Company]]'s animated television series [[The Simpsons|The Simpsons]], in which she has played recurring characters such as [[Maude Flanders|List of recurring The Simpsons characters#Maude Flanders]], [[Helen Lovejoy|List of recurring The Simpsons characters#Helen Lovejoy]], [[Miss Hoover|List of recurring The Simpsons characters#Elizabeth Hoover]], and [[Luann Van Houten|Luann Van Houten]], as well as several minor characters. This work has earned her both an [[Emmy Award|Emmy Award]] nomination and an [[Annie Award|Annie Award]] nomination.
title: Maggie Roswell

abstract: David Edward Hughes (16 May 1831   – 22 January 1900), was a British-American inventor, practical experimenter, and professor of music known for his work on the printing telegraph and the [[microphone|microphone]]. He is generally considered to have been born in [[London|London]] but his family moved around that time so he may have been born in [[Corwen, Wales|Corwen]]. His family moved to the U.S. while he was a child and he became a professor of music in Kentucky. In 1855 he patented a printing telegraph. He moved back to London in 1857 and further pursued experimentation and invention, coming up with an improved carbon microphone in 1878. In 1879 he identified what seemed to be a new phenomenon during his experiments: sparking in one device could be heard in a separate portable microphone apparatus he had set up. It was most probably radio transmissions but this was nine years before [[electromagnetic radiation|electromagnetic radiation]] was a proven concept and Hughes was convinced by others that his discovery was simply [[electromagnetic induction|electromagnetic induction]].
title: David Edward Hughes

abstract: Trinidad Silva, Jr. (January 30, 1950 – July 31, 1988) was an American [[comedian|comedian]] and [[character actor|character actor]], who played small supporting roles in a number of films of the 1980s.
title: Trinidad Silva

abstract: Anant Nag was born on 4 September 1948 to Anandi and Sadanand Nagarkatte in the Chowpatty suburb of [[Bombay|Bombay]]. Born into a [[Konkani|Konkani language]]-speaking family, his family settled in [[Shirali|Shirali]], [[Bhatkal|Bhatkal]] in [[Uttara Kannada|Uttara Kannada]] of [[Karnataka|Karnataka]] State.
title: Anant Nag

abstract: Cynthia Sikes Yorkin (born January 2, 1954) is an American producer and [[actress|actress]] known for her work on [[St. Elsewhere|St. Elsewhere]] and [[Blade Runner 2049|Blade Runner 2049]].
title: Cynthia Sikes Yorkin

abstract: Kari Matchett (born March 25, 1970) is a Canadian actress. She has appeared in films such as [[Apartment Hunting|Apartment Hunting]] (2000), [[Angel Eyes|Angel Eyes (film)]] (2001), [[Men with Brooms|Men with Brooms]] (2002), [[Cypher|Cypher (film)]] (2002), [[Civic Duty|Civic Duty (film)]] (2006), [[The Tree of Life|The Tree of Life (film)]] (2011), and [[Maudie|Maudie (film)]] (2016). She is perhaps best known for her roles as Joan Campbell on [[Covert Affairs|Covert Affairs]] and as Kate Filmore in the science fiction movie [[Cube 2: Hypercube|Cube 2: Hypercube]].
title: Kari Matchett

abstract: Malcolm Gets (born December 28, 1964) is an American actor. He is best known for his role as Richard in the American television [[sitcom|sitcom]] [[Caroline in the City|Caroline in the City]]. Gets is also a dancer, singer, composer, classically trained pianist, vocal director, and choreographer. He played Gould in the 2009 film [[Grey Gardens|Grey Gardens (2009 film)]] opposite [[Jessica Lange|Jessica Lange]] and [[Drew Barrymore|Drew Barrymore]] and his first solo album came out in 2009 from [[PS Classics|PS Classics]].
title: Malcolm Gets

abstract: Eva Le Gallienne (January 11, 1899 – June 3, 1991) was a British-born American stage actress, producer, director, translator, and author. A Broadway star by age 21, Le Gallienne consciously ended her work on Broadway to devote herself to founding the [[Civic Repertory Theatre|Fourteenth Street Theatre]], in which she was both director, producer, and lead actress. Noted for her boldness and idealism, she became a pioneering figure in the American Repertory Movement, which enabled today's [[Off-Broadway|Off-Broadway]]. A versatile and eloquent actress herself (playing everything from [[Peter Pan|Peter Pan]] to [[Hamlet|Hamlet]]), Le Gallienne also became a respected stage coach, director, producer and manager.
title: Eva Le Gallienne

abstract: Waheeda Rehman was born in a [[Muslim|Muslim]] family in [[Chengalpattu|Chengalpattu]], Tamil Nadu, India. She and her sister learnt [[Bharatnatyam|Bharatnatyam]] in Chennai, where Guru Trichunder Meenakshi Sundaram Pillai and (in Bombay), Guru Jayalaxmi Alva, Doyen among nattuvanars taught and performed on stage together. Her father, who was a district commissioner, died while she was in her teens.
title: Waheeda Rehman

abstract: Erika Flores (born November 22, 1979 in [[Grass Valley, California|Grass Valley, California]]) is an American former child actress. She is known for her role as the first Colleen Cooper in the [[Dr. Quinn, Medicine Woman|Dr. Quinn, Medicine Woman]] TV series; Flores left the role in 1995 in the middle of the third season, and the role was then recast with [[Jessica Bowman|Jessica Bowman]] taking over as Colleen.
title: Erika Flores

abstract: Bryton Eric McClure (born August 17, 1986), also credited as Bryton James and Bryton, is an American actor, [[voice artist|voice artist]] and singer. As a child actor, he played [[Richie Crawford|List of Family Matters characters#Richie Crawford]] on the [[ABC|American Broadcasting Company]]/[[CBS|CBS]] [[sitcom|situation comedy]], [[Family Matters|Family Matters]]. He currently plays [[Devon Hamilton|Devon Hamilton]] on the [[CBS|CBS]] [[soap opera|soap opera]] [[The Young and the Restless|The Young and the Restless]].
title: Bryton James

abstract: Elena Anaya Gutiérrez (born 17 July 1975) is a Spanish actress whose career started in 1995. She starred alongside [[Antonio Banderas|Antonio Banderas]] in [[Pedro Almodóvar|Pedro Almodóvar]]'s [[The Skin I Live In|The Skin I Live In]], for which she won the [[Goya|26th Goya Awards]] award for [[Best Actress|Goya Award for Best Actress]]. She is also known for her roles in [[Van Helsing|Van Helsing (film)]], [[Habitación en Roma|Room in Rome]] (Room in Rome) and [[Wonder Woman|Wonder Woman (2017 film)]].
title: Elena Anaya

abstract: Tareque Masud (6 December 1956 – 13 August 2011) was a [[Bangladeshi independent film|Cinema of Bangladesh]] director, film producer, screenwriter and lyricist. He first found success with the films [[Muktir Gaan|Muktir Gaan]] (1995) and [[Matir Moina|Matir Moina]] (2002), for which he won three international awards, including the International Critics' [[FIPRESCI|FIPRESCI]] Prize, in the [[Directors' Fortnight|Directors' Fortnight]] section outside competition at the [[2002 Cannes Film Festival|2002 Cannes Film Festival]]. The film became [[Bangladesh's first film to compete|List of Bangladeshi submissions for the Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film]] for the [[Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film|Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film]].
title: Tareque Masud

abstract: Jayne Eastwood (born December 17, 1946), also credited as Jane Easton or Jane Eastwood, is a [[Canadian|Canadians]] film, voice, and television actress.
title: Jayne Eastwood

abstract: Isabel Lucas (born 29 January 1985) is an Australian actress and model. From 2003–2006 she played [[Tasha Andrews|Tasha Andrews]] in [[Home and Away|Home and Away]], and in 2009 she made her film debut with the role of "Alice" in the 2009 sequel [[Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen|Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen]], in which she won the award for Best Breakout Performance-Female in sci-fi and action at the [[2009 Scream Awards|2009 Scream Awards]]. She appeared in [[The Loft|The Loft (film)]] (2014) and the [[thriller film|Thriller (genre)]] [[Careful What You Wish For|Careful What You Wish For (film)]] (2015), beside [[Nick Jonas|Nick Jonas]]. Lucas also appeared in [[Chasing Comets|Chasing Comets]], in 2018, and [[That's Not Me|That's Not Me (film)]] in 2017.
title: Isabel Lucas

abstract: Adewale Akinnuoye-Agbaje (; born 22 August 1967) is an English actor and former fashion model best known for his roles as Nykwana Wombosi in [[The Bourne Identity|The Bourne Identity (2002 film)]], [[Kurse|Kurse]] in [[Thor: The Dark World|Thor: The Dark World]], [[Killer Croc|Killer Croc]] in [[Suicide Squad|Suicide Squad (film)]], [[Mr. Eko|Mr. Eko]] on [[Lost|Lost (TV series)]], Malko in the [[fifth season|Game of Thrones (season 5)]] of the [[HBO|HBO]] series [[Game of Thrones|Game of Thrones]] and [[Dave Duerson|Dave Duerson]] in the NFL biopic drama [[Concussion|Concussion (2015 film)]].
title: Adewale Akinnuoye-Agbaje

abstract: Amrita Singh (born 9 February 1958) is an Indian film and television actress. She was a popular actress in the 80's and 90's and still plays a few roles in film and TV today. Amrita keeps a low public profile and gives few interviews.
title: Amrita Singh

abstract: Victoria Smurfit (born 31 March 1974) is an Irish actress. She is known for playing Orla O'Connell in the [[BBC|BBC]] television series [[Ballykissangel|Ballykissangel]] and [[Detective Chief Inspector|Detective Chief Inspector]] Roisin Connor in the [[ITV|ITV (TV network)]] [[police procedural|police procedural]] [[Trial & Retribution|Trial & Retribution]].
title: Victoria Smurfit

abstract: Ivo Gregurević was born in [[Donja Mahala|Donja Mahala]] near [[Orašje|Orašje]], today Bosnia and Herzegovina, on 7 October 1952, to parents Marko and Jela Gregurević.
title: Ivo Gregurević

abstract: Ulla Agneta Jones (née Andersson; born 18 June 1946), known professionally as Ulla Andersson and Ulla Jones is a former high fashion model, actress, singer, songwriter and photographer. She appeared on numerous magazine covers during the 1960s, before she retired from the [[Ford Modelling Agency|Ford Modelling Agency]]. She was married to American music producer [[Quincy Jones|Quincy Jones]], with whom she had two children.
title: Ulla Jones

abstract: Madhoobala Raghunath was born into a [[Tamil|Tamil language]]-speaking family. She is a niece of actress [[Hema Malini|Hema Malini]] and therefore a maternal cousin of [[Esha Deol|Esha Deol]] through her mother. [[Juhi Chawla|Juhi Chawla]] is her sister-in-law. She did her schooling from St.Joseph's High School in Juhu, [[Mumbai|Mumbai]].
title: Madhoo

abstract: Mary Scheer is an American actress, comedian, screenwriter and producer. She is best known as one of the original cast members of the [[sketch comedy|sketch comedy]] series [[MADtv|MADtv]] and for playing Freddie's mother, [[Marissa Benson|Marissa Benson]], on [[iCarly|iCarly]]. She also played Alice the Zookeeper on [[The Penguins of Madagascar|The Penguins of Madagascar]]. She played Gladys on Disney Channel's TV series, [[Bunk'd|Bunk'd]].
title: Mary Scheer

abstract: Diane Delano (born January 29, 1957) is an [[American|United States]] [[character actress|character actress]]. She is known for her numerous roles in films and television, such as Sergeant Barbara Semanski on the [[CBS|CBS]] television series [[Northern Exposure|Northern Exposure]] and Roberta "Bobbi" Glass on [[The WB|The WB]] television series [[Popular|Popular (TV series)]].
title: Diane Delano

abstract: Iain Glen was born in [[Edinburgh|Edinburgh]], Scotland, and educated at the [[Edinburgh Academy|Edinburgh Academy]], an independent school for boys (now co-educational), followed by the [[University of Aberdeen|University of Aberdeen]]. He then trained at [[RADA|Royal Academy of Dramatic Art]] in London, where he won the Bancroft Gold Medal.
title: Iain Glen

abstract: Jesdaporn Pholdee (; ; born June 5, 1977 in [[Bangkok|Bangkok]], [[Thailand|Thailand]] or nickname Tik ()) is a [[Thai|Thailand]] [[actor|actor]], [[model|Model (person)]], and presenter.
title: Jesdaporn Pholdee

abstract: Monica Sjöö, (December 31, 1938 – August 8, 2005), was a [[Swedish|Sweden]] painter, writer and a [[radical|Radical feminism]] [[anarcho/|Anarcha-feminism]] [[eco-feminist|Ecofeminism]] who was an early exponent of the [[Goddess movement|Goddess movement]].
title: Monica Sjöö

abstract: Tarik Filipović (born 11 March 1972) is a [[Bosnia|Bosnian]] and [[Croatia|Croatian]] [[presenter|TV presenter]] and [[actor|actor]] who lives and works in [[Zagreb|Zagreb]]. He has appeared in over 800 theatre plays since his debut in 1985. He has also been in many films and TV dramas produced throughout the areas of [[former Yugoslavia|former Yugoslavia]].
title: Tarik Filipović

abstract: Peter Chernin (born May 29, 1951) is an American businessman and investor. He is the chairman and CEO of The Chernin Group (TCG), which he founded in 2010. TCG manages, operates and invests in businesses in the media, entertainment, and technology sectors. Specifically, the company focuses on three areas: developing premium content for film and television, making investments in technology and media companies in the U.S., and capitalizing on strategic business opportunities in [[emerging markets|emerging markets]], especially Asia. In April 2012, Chernin sold a minority stake of TCG to strategic investment partners Providence Equity Partners, a leading private equity firm, and other private investors.
title: Peter Chernin

abstract: Paul Dooley (born Paul Brown; February 22, 1928) is an American actor, writer and comedian.
title: Paul Dooley

abstract: Herschell Gordon Lewis (June 15, 1926 – September 26, 2016) was an American filmmaker, best known for creating the "[[splatter|splatter film]]" subgenre of [[horror|horror film]] films. He is often called the "Godfather of Gore" (a title also given to [[Lucio Fulci|Lucio Fulci]]), though his film career included works in a range of [[exploitation film|exploitation film]] genres including [[juvenile delinquent|juvenile delinquent]] films, [[nudie-cuties|nudie film#Nudie-cuties]], two children's films and at least one rural comedy. On Lewis' career, [[AllMovie|All Media Network#AllMovie]] wrote, "With his better-known gore films, Herschell Gordon Lewis was a pioneer, going farther than anyone else dared, probing the depths of disgust and discomfort onscreen with more bad taste and imagination than anyone of his era."
title: Herschell Gordon Lewis

abstract: Michael Lembeck (born June 25, 1948) is an American actor and television and film director.
title: Michael Lembeck

abstract: Kelly Vitz (born Kelly Vitzthum on June 10, 1988) is an American [[actress|actress]] and is best known for portraying Magenta in the 2005 film, [[Sky High|Sky High (2005 film)]].
title: Kelly Vitz

abstract: Paul O'Brien (born 14 April 1978) is a [[South African-Australian|South African Australians]] actor. He is best known for his role as [[Jack Holden|Jack Holden (Home and Away)]] in the television soap opera [[Home and Away|Home and Away]], for which he won the [[Logie Award for Most Popular New Male Talent|Logie Award for Most Popular New Male Talent]] in 2006.
title: Paul O'Brien

abstract: Ruggero Deodato (born 7 May 1939) is an Italian [[film director|film director]], and has also performed as both a [[screenwriter|screenwriter]], and an [[actor|actor]] in both his own and other projects.
title: Ruggero Deodato

abstract: Sasha Pieterse-Sheaffer (; born February 17, 1996) is a South African-born American actress and singer-songwriter. She is known for her role as [[Alison DiLaurentis|Alison DiLaurentis]] in the [[Freeform|Freeform (TV channel)]] series [[Pretty Little Liars|Pretty Little Liars]]. Upon the success of the series, Pieterse earned a supporting role as Amy Loubalu in the 2011 [[Disney Channel|Disney Channel]] film [[Geek Charming|Geek Charming]]. In 2013, she starred in the teen comedy film [[G.B.F.|G.B.F. (film)]]. In 2017, Pieterse participated in the [[25th season|Dancing with the Stars (U.S. season 25)]] of [[Dancing with the Stars|Dancing with the Stars]] and finished in 10th place.
title: Sasha Pieterse

abstract: Agustina Cherri (born February 15, 1983) is an [[Argentine|Argentine]] [[actress|Acting]], [[dancer|Dancing]] and [[model|Fashion model]]. She is perhaps best known for her participation as Milagros in [[Chiquititas|Chiquititas]], a popular [[children|children]]'s [[telenovela|telenovela]].
title: Agustina Cherri

abstract: Heather Burns (born April 7, 1975) is an American actress, known for her role as Miss Rhode Island in the 2000 film [[Miss Congeniality|Miss Congeniality (film)]]. Her other film appearances include [[You've Got Mail|You've Got Mail]] (1998), [[Two Weeks Notice|Two Weeks Notice]] (2002) and [[Bewitched|Bewitched (2005 film)]] (2005).
title: Heather Burns

abstract: Irene Bedard (born July 22, 1967) is an American actress who has played many [[Native American|Indigenous peoples of the United States]] characters in a variety of films. She is perhaps best known for the role of Suzy Song in the film adaptation of [[Sherman Alexie|Sherman Alexie]]'s [[Smoke Signals|Smoke Signals (film)]] as well as for providing the voice of the title character in the animated film [[Pocahontas|Pocahontas (1995 film)]].
title: Irene Bedard

abstract: Ellen Greene (born February 22, 1951) is an American singer and actress. Greene has had a long and varied career as a singer, particularly in cabaret, as an actress and singer in numerous stage productions, particularly musical theatre, as well as having performed in many films—notably [[Little Shop of Horrors|Little Shop of Horrors (film)]], and television series. From 2007 to 2009, she starred as [[Vivian Charles|Vivian Charles]] on the ABC series [[Pushing Daisies|Pushing Daisies]].
title: Ellen Greene

abstract: Sean Harris is an English actor and writer. He is known for his role as Solomon Lane in the films [[Mission: Impossible – Rogue Nation|Mission: Impossible – Rogue Nation]] (2015) and [[Mission: Impossible – Fallout|Mission: Impossible – Fallout]] (2018).
title: Sean Harris

abstract: Sara Paxton (born April 25, 1988) is an American actress and singer known for her role as [[Mari Collingwood|Mari Collingwood]] in the [[horror film|horror film]] [[The Last House on the Left|The Last House on the Left (2009 film)]] (2009). She grew up in California and began acting at an early age, appearing in many minor roles in both films and television shows, before rising to fame in 2004, after playing the title role in the television series [[Darcy's Wild Life|Darcy's Wild Life]] (2004-2006) and Sarah Borden in [[Summerland|Summerland (TV series)]] (2004).
title: Sara Paxton

abstract: Joan Lorring (April 17, 1926 – May 30, 2014) was an American actress and singer known for her work in film and theatre. For her role as Bessy Watty in [[The Corn Is Green|The Corn Is Green (1945 film)]] (1945), Lorring was nominated for the [[Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress|Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress]]. Lorring also originated the role of Marie Buckholder in [[Come Back, Little Sheba|Come Back, Little Sheba (play)]] on Broadway in 1950, for which she won a [[Donaldson Award|Donaldson Awards]] (an early version of the [[Tony Award|Tony Award]]).
title: Joan Lorring

abstract: Nicholas Campbell (born 24 March 1952) is a Canadian actor and filmmaker, who won three [[Gemini Award|Gemini Awards]] for acting. He is known for such films as [[Naked Lunch|Naked Lunch (film)]], [[Prozac Nation|Prozac Nation (film)]], [[New Waterford Girl|New Waterford Girl]] and the television series [[Da Vinci's Inquest|Da Vinci's Inquest]].
title: Nicholas Campbell

abstract: Nedra Volz (née Gordonier, June 18, 1908 – January 20, 2003) was an American actress.
title: Nedra Volz

abstract: Adela Amalia Noriega Méndez (; born October 24, 1969), better known as Adela Noriega, is a Mexican actress. Noriega came to prominence as a teenager, starring in teen-oriented [[coming-of-age|coming-of-age]] telenovelas in the late 1980s.
title: Adela Noriega

abstract: Kelli Maroney (born December 30, 1965) is an American film and television actress. She is best known for her early roles in the movies [[Fast Times at Ridgemont High|Fast Times at Ridgemont High]] (1982) and [[Night of the Comet|Night of the Comet]] (1984), and on television in the [[soap opera|soap operas]] [[Ryan's Hope|Ryan's Hope]] and [[One Life to Live|One Life to Live]].
title: Kelli Maroney

abstract: Edwige Fenech (, ; born Edwige Sfenek; 24 December 1948) is a [[French-born|France]] [[Italian|Italy]] [[actress|actress]] and [[film producer|film producer]] of [[Italian|Italians]] and [[Maltese|Maltese people]] descent. She is mostly known as the star of a series of [[commedia sexy all'italiana|commedia sexy all'italiana]] and [[giallo|giallo]] films released in the 1970s, which turned her into a [[sex symbol|sex symbol]].
title: Edwige Fenech

abstract: Isha Koppikar (born 19 September 1976) is an [[India|Indian]] [[actress|actress]] and [[model|model (person)]] who has appeared in [[Hindi|Bollywood]], [[Tamil|Tamil cinema]], [[Telugu|Telugu cinema]], [[Kannada|Kannada cinema]], and [[Marathi|Marathi cinema]] films. Isha is best known for playing protagonists in films that garner more critical appreciation than substantial box office figures. Her most critically acclaimed performances were in the films [[Girlfriend|Girlfriend (2004 film)]] (2004), [[D|D (film)]] (2006), [[Darling|Darling (2007 Hindi film)]] (2007) and [[Shabri|Shabri]] (2011). She has also played leading and supporting roles in several commercially successful films, including [[Fiza|Fiza]] (2000), [[Company|Company]] (2002), [[Kaante|Kaante]] (2002), [[Dil Ka Rishta|Dil Ka Rishta]] (2003), [[Qayamat: City Under Threat|Qayamat: City Under Threat]] (2003), [[Tujhe Meri Kasam|Tujhe Meri Kasam]] (2003), [[Hum Tum|Hum Tum]] (2004), [[Kyaa Kool Hai Hum|Kyaa Kool Hai Hum]] (2005), [[Maine Pyaar Kyun Kiya?|Maine Pyaar Kyun Kiya?]] (2005), [[36 China Town|36 China Town]] (2006) and [[Don: The Chase Begins Again|Don: The Chase Begins Again]] (2006), as well as item numbers in several films.
title: Isha Koppikar

abstract: Ben Feldman (born May 27, 1980) is an American [[actor|actor]]. He has done stage acting, including the [[Broadway|Broadway theatre]] play [[The Graduate|The Graduate]] along with [[Alicia Silverstone|Alicia Silverstone]] and [[Kathleen Turner|Kathleen Turner]]. He also played a leading character in [[The Perfect Man|The Perfect Man]] and portrayed [[Fran Drescher|Fran Drescher]]'s son on the television series [[Living with Fran|Living with Fran]]. He is also known for his role as Jonah in the NBC sitcom [[Superstore|Superstore (TV series)]].
title: Ben Feldman

abstract: Ivan Nathaniel Dixon III was born in [[Harlem|Harlem]], the son of a [[grocery store|grocery store]] owner. When he was young, Dixon lived in the [[brownstone|brownstone]] at 518 West 150th Street in Harlem, on the same block with [[Josh White|Josh White]], [[Ralph Ellison|Ralph Ellison]], and the Hines brothers, [[Gregory|Gregory Hines]] and [[Maurice|Maurice Hines]]. He graduated from the [[Lincoln Academy|Lincoln Academy (Kings Mountain, North Carolina)]] in [[Gaston County, North Carolina|Gaston County, North Carolina]], and went on to earn a drama degree from [[North Carolina Central University|North Carolina Central University]] (NCCU) in 1954, where the theater troupe is now known as the Ivan Dixon Players. While at NCCU, he joined the [[Omega Psi Phi|Omega Psi Phi]] Fraternity.
title: Ivan Dixon

abstract: Ciarán Hinds (; born 9 February 1953) is an Irish actor. A versatile character actor, he has featured in films such as [[Road to Perdition|Road to Perdition]], [[Munich|Munich (film)]], [[There Will Be Blood|There Will Be Blood]], [[Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows – Part 2|Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows – Part 2]], [[Tinker Tailor Soldier Spy|Tinker Tailor Soldier Spy (film)]], [[Frozen|Frozen (2013 film)]], [[Silence|Silence (2016 film)]], [[Red Sparrow|Red Sparrow]], and [[Justice League|Justice League (film)]], in which he portrayed the main antagonist [[Steppenwolf|Steppenwolf (comics)]].
title: Ciarán Hinds

abstract: Shekhar Suman (born 7 December 1962) is an Indian film actor, anchor, producer, director, and singer . He is currently a part of [[Saat Phero Ki Hera Pherie|Saat Phero Ki Hera Pherie]], playing the role of Bhupi Tandon on [[SAB TV|SAB TV]].
title: Shekhar Suman

abstract: Johnathon Schaech ( ; born September 10, 1969) is an [[American|Americans]] actor, writer, and producer.
title: Johnathon Schaech

abstract: Ashleigh Aston Moore (September 30, 1981 – December 10, 2007) was an [[American|United States]] [[child actress|Child actor]], who played Chrissy in the 1995 film [[Now and Then|Now and Then (film)]].
title: Ashleigh Aston Moore

abstract: Vanessa Lengies (born July 21, 1985) is a [[Canadian|Canadians]] actress, dancer and singer. She is known for starring in the drama [[American Dreams|American Dreams]] as [[Roxanne Bojarski|Roxanne Bojarski]]. She appeared as Charge Nurse Kelly Epson on the [[TNT|TNT (U.S. TV network)]] medical drama [[HawthoRNe|HawthoRNe]], and has appeared in the recurring role of [[Sugar Motta|Sugar Motta]] in the third, fourth, and sixth seasons of the [[Fox|Fox Broadcasting Company]] series [[Glee|Glee (TV series)]].
title: Vanessa Lengies

abstract: Betty Thomas (born Betty Lucille Nienhauser, July 27, 1947) is an American actress, director, and producer of [[television|Television director]] and [[motion pictures|Film director]]. She is known for her Emmy Award-winning role as Lucy Bates on the television series [[Hill Street Blues|Hill Street Blues]]. As of March 2018, Thomas is one of just two directors (and the only solo director) to have multiple films on the list of seventeen highest-US-grossing female-directed films. Additionally, all of her films are in the top twenty five highest-US-grossing female-directed films.
title: Betty Thomas

abstract: Ronnie Claire Edwards (February 9, 1933 – June 14, 2016) was an American actress, best known for playing Corabeth Walton Godsey on the TV series [[The Waltons|The Waltons]].
title: Ronnie Claire Edwards

abstract: Helen Kleeb (January 6, 1907 – December 28, 2003) was an American film and television actress. In a career covering nearly fifty years, she may be best known for her role from 1972 to 1981 as "Miss Mamie Baldwin" on [[CBS|Columbia Broadcasting System]]'s family drama, [[The Waltons|The Waltons]].
title: Helen Kleeb

abstract: Laura Regan (born 17 October 1977) is a Canadian actress. She has had leading and supporting roles in the films [[Saving Jessica Lynch|Saving Jessica Lynch]] (2003), [[My Little Eye|My Little Eye]] (2002), [[They|They (2002 film)]] (2002), [[Dead Silence|Dead Silence]] (2007), and [[Atlas Shrugged: Part III|Atlas Shrugged: Part III]] (2014). She had a recurring role as Jennifer Crane in the TV series [[Mad Men|Mad Men]] and starred as Agatha on [[Minority Report|Minority Report (TV series)]] (2015).
title: Laura Regan

abstract: Pooja Bedi was born in [[Mumbai|Mumbai]] to the late Indian classical dancer [[Protima|Protima Bedi]] and film star [[Kabir Bedi|Kabir Bedi]]. She was brought up in what she calls a bohemian progressive artistic environment. She received her basic education at Besant Montessori in Mumbai and then at [[Lawrence School, Sanawar|Lawrence School, Sanawar]].
title: Pooja Bedi

abstract: Erin Daniels (born October 9, 1973) is an [[American|United States]] [[actress|actress]]. She is best known for her role as [[Dana Fairbanks|Dana Fairbanks]] on [[The L Word|The L Word]] (2004–2007). Her feature film work includes [[A Single Man|A Single Man (film)]] and [[One Hour Photo|One Hour Photo]].
title: Erin Daniels

abstract: Keith Szarabajka (; ; born December 2, 1952) is an American [[actor|actor]] and [[voice actor|voice acting]] known as Mickey Kostmayer in [[The Equalizer|The Equalizer]], [[Daniel Holtz|Daniel Holtz]] in [[Angel|Angel (1999 TV series)]], Harlan Williams in [[Golden Years|Golden Years (TV series)]], [[Trigon|Trigon (comics)]] on [[Teen Titans|Teen Titans (TV series)]], and Gerard Stephens in [[The Dark Knight|The Dark Knight (film)]]. He is also known for portraying Detective Herschel Biggs in the 2011 crime thriller video game [[L.A. Noire|L.A. Noire]], which included his likeness.

abstract: Kenneth Joel Hotz (born May 3, 1967) is a comedy producer and entertainer. Hotz is a former [[South Park|South Park]] consultant and staff writer. He is an award-winning [[Vice|Vice (magazine)]] personality. "Kenny" of the Comedy Central television series [[Kenny vs. Spenny|Kenny vs. Spenny]], creator of the FX series [[Testees|Testees]], and [[Kenny Hotz's Triumph of the Will|Kenny Hotz's Triumph of the Will]]. He has received numerous awards for his television work— from the [[Academy of Canadian Cinema & Television|Academy of Canadian Cinema & Television]] the [[Gemini Awards|Gemini Awards]] and the [[Canadian Comedy Awards|Canadian Comedy Awards]]. Hotz is a multiple-time film festival award-winner and [[Gulf War|Gulf War]] [[photo-journalist|photo-journalist]].
title: Kenny Hotz

abstract: Lilyan Chauvin (; ; 6 August 192526 June 2008) was a [[French-American|French Americans]] actress, [[television host|Television presenter]], director, writer, and acting teacher. A native of [[Paris|Paris]], Chauvin began her career performing on French radio and onstage in England. She relocated to the United States in 1952 to pursue an acting career, and was initially cast in minor television parts before making her film debut in 1957.
title: Lilyan Chauvin

abstract: Maria Carmela Brosas, better known by her [[screen name|stage name]] K Brosas (born July 15, 1975), is an [[actress|actress]], [[comedian|comedian]], [[singer|singer]] and [[television host|Television presenter]] of dual [[Filipino|Filipino people]] and [[American|American people]] citizenship. She was born in the [[Philippines|Philippines]] to an [[American|United States]] father and a Filipina mother and was a band member of Gladys and The Boxers and was [[lead singer|lead singer]] when the group performed as K and The Boxers. In mid-2010, she became a co-host in the game show [[Pilipinas Win na Win|Pilipinas Win na Win]].

abstract: Kim So-yeon (born November 2, 1980) is a South Korean actress. She is best known for starring in a number of well-known [[television series|Korean drama]], notably [[All About Eve|All About Eve (TV series)]] (2000), [[Iris|Iris (TV series)]] (2009), [[Prosecutor Princess|Prosecutor Princess]] (2010), and [[Happy Home|Happy Home (TV series)]].
title: Kim So-yeon

abstract: Al Mukadam (born Ali Mukaddam; April 6, 1984) is a Canadian actor from [[Toronto|Toronto]]. He is known for his performance as Ray Brennan in the [[Family Channel|Family Channel (Canadian TV network)]] [[television series|Television show]] [[Radio Free Roscoe|Radio Free Roscoe]] (2003–2005).
title: Al Mukadam

abstract: T. J. Ramini (born 26 May 1975) is a British actor known for his role as DC [[Zain Nadir|Zain Nadir]] in [[The Bill|The Bill]] and Cross in [[Prison Break|Prison Break]]
title: T. J. Ramini

abstract: Kelly Sheridan is a Canadian voice actress best known for being the voice for Barbie in the [[Barbie film series|Barbie (film series)]] from 2001 to 2010 and from 2012 to 2015. She had also voiced in numerous cartoons and English-language dubs of Japanese anime, including as: [[Sango|Sango (InuYasha)]] in the English dub of the anime series [[InuYasha|InuYasha]], Diana Lombard in [[Martin Mystery|Martin Mystery]], Theresa in [[Class of the Titans|Class of the Titans]] and Starlight Glimmer in [[My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic|My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic]]. She had been a member of Genus Theatre Company since August 2005.

abstract: During his reign, Taher Saifuddin RA adapted the modernisation in Western and European ideas, and over the course of it, he established its benefits for the Bohra community. This sets him an ideal for the mixture of modern isation, education while being rooted in the traditions and the culture of the Fatimi Heritage and his son and successor Syedna Mohammad Burhanuddin and grandson and his successor Syedna Aaliqadr Mufaddal Saifuddin have continued in his path taking giant strides in the benefit of the community. ,
title: Taher Saifuddin

abstract: Rammellzee's graffiti and art work are based on his theory of Gothic Futurism, which describes the battle between letters and their symbolic warfare against any standardizations enforced by the rules of the [[alphabet|alphabet]]. His treatise, Ionic treatise Gothic Futurism assassin knowledges of the remanipulated square point's one to 720° to 1440°, details an [[anarchic|anarchic]] plan by which to revise the role and deployment of [[language|language]] in society.
title: Rammellzee

abstract: Eric Lawrence Lively Brown (born July 31, 1981), better known as Eric Lively, is an American actor. He played the role of Andy Evans in [[Speak|Speak (film)]].
title: Eric Lively

abstract: Aracely Arámbula Jacques (; born March 6, 1975 in [[Chihuahua|Chihuahua City]], [[Chihuahua|Chihuahua (state)]], [[Mexico|Mexico]]), known professionally as Aracely Arámbula, is a [[Mexican|Mexico]] [[actress|actress]], [[model|Model (person)]], [[singer|singer]], [[television personality|television personality]] and [[entrepreneur|entrepreneur]].
title: Aracely Arámbula

abstract: Haviland Morris (born September 14, 1959) is an American film, television, and [[Broadway|Broadway theatre]] actress, who currently works in [[real estate|real estate]].

abstract: Nina Badrić ( ; born 4 July 1972) is a [[Croatia|Croatian]] pop singer and songwriter. She began performing in early 1990s, and competed in "Dora" - the Croatian selection for Eurovision Song Contest 4 times. She won 7th place in 1993 with "Ostavljam te", 10th place in 1994 with "Godine nestvarne", 18th place in 1995 with "Odlaziš zauvijek", and second place in 2003 with "Čarobno jutro". Badrić eventually represented [[Croatia|Croatia in the Eurovision Song Contest 2012]] in the [[Eurovision Song Contest 2012|Eurovision Song Contest 2012]] in [[Baku|Baku]], [[Azerbaijan|Azerbaijan]] with the song "[[Nebo|Nebo (Nina Badrić song)]]". She finished 12th in the second semi-final and failed to qualify for the grand final.
title: Nina Badrić

abstract: Marjean Holden (born November 3, 1964) is an American actress, stuntwoman and martial artist.
title: Marjean Holden

abstract: Milton Johns (born 13 March 1938) is an [[English|England]] [[actor|actor]] whose thin features and talent for obsequious or oily characters has often influenced the many television parts he has received. He trained at the [[Bristol Old Vic Theatre School|Bristol Old Vic Theatre School]].
title: Milton Johns

abstract: Eamonn Holmes (born 3 December 1959) is a journalist and broadcaster from [[Northern Ireland|Northern Ireland]], best known for presenting [[Sky News Sunrise|Sky News Sunrise]] and [[This Morning|This Morning (TV programme)]]. Holmes currently presents drivetime (4–7pm) weekdays on [[Talkradio|Talkradio]], and is the lead relief anchor for [[Good Morning Britain|Good Morning Britain (2014 TV programme)]].
title: Eamonn Holmes

abstract: Roger Michael Hilary Minster (21 March 1944 – 24 November 1999) was an English character actor.

abstract: Betty Astell (23 May 1912 – 26 July 2005) was an [[English|England]] [[actress|actress]].

abstract: Arye Gross (born March 17, 1960) is an American actor, who has appeared on a variety of television shows in numerous roles, most notably Adam Greene in ABC Sitcom [[Ellen (TV series)|Ellen (TV series)]].
title: Arye Gross

abstract: Adrian Dunbar (born 1 August 1958) is an actor and director from [[Enniskillen|Enniskillen]], [[County Fermanagh|County Fermanagh]], [[Northern Ireland|Northern Ireland]], best known for his television and theatre work. Dunbar co-wrote and starred in the 1991 film, [[Hear My Song|Hear My Song]], nominated for Best Original Screenplay at the [[BAFTA|BAFTA]] awards.
title: Adrian Dunbar

abstract: Lani Billard (born 20 June 1979) is a [[Canadian|Canadians]] actress and singer, who played Elizabeth "Busy" Ramone on the [[television series|television series]] [[Ready or Not|Ready or Not (Canadian TV series)]] from 1993–1997. Before that she was on a show called [[F.R.O.G.|F.R.O.G.]] on [[TVO|TVOntario]]. Since then Billard has appeared in [[Owning Mahowny|Owning Mahowny]] where she played Tori the Teller, and most recently she was seen in Sarah Polley's award-winning film [[Stories We Tell|Stories We Tell]].

abstract: Donnelly Rhodes Henry (December 4, 1937 – January 8, 2018) was a Canadian [[character actor|character actor]] with many American television and film credits, probably best known to American audiences as the hapless escaped convict Dutch Leitner on the [[ABC|American Broadcasting Company]] soap opera spoof [[Soap|Soap (TV series)]] and as Phillip Chancellor II on [[The Young and the Restless|The Young and the Restless]]. Rhodes was well known to Canadian audiences as Sgt Nick Raitt in the CBC TV series [[Sidestreet|Sidestreet]] (1975–1978) and as Grant "Doc" Roberts in another CBC TV series called [[Danger Bay|Danger Bay]] (1985–1990). He also starred as [[Doctor Cottle|Sherman Cottle]] ("Doc") on the [[Sci Fi Channel|Sci Fi Channel (United States)]] television program [[Battlestar Galactica|Battlestar Galactica (re-imagining)]] (2004).
title: Donnelly Rhodes

abstract: Scotty Bloch (born Maybelle Scott, January 28, 1925 – September 15, 2018) was an [[American|United States]] [[East Coast|East Coast of the United States]]-based stage and television actress.
title: Scotty Bloch

abstract: Helene Costello (June 21, 1906 – January 26, 1957) was an American stage and film actress, most notably of the [[silent era|Silent film]].
title: Helene Costello

abstract: Orla Brady (born 28 March 1961) is an [[Irish|Irish people]] [[actress|actress]].
title: Orla Brady

abstract: Leonard Whiting (born 30 June 1950) is an English actor and singer who is best known for his role as [[Romeo|Romeo]] in the 1968 [[Zeffirelli|Franco Zeffirelli]] [[film version|Romeo and Juliet (1968 film)]] of [[Romeo and Juliet|Romeo and Juliet]] opposite [[Olivia Hussey|Olivia Hussey]]'s [[Juliet|Juliet]], a role which earned him the [[Golden Globe Award for New Star of the Year – Actor|Golden Globe Award for New Star of the Year – Actor]].

abstract: Cédric Klapisch ( ; born 4 September 1961) is a [[French|France]] [[film director|film director]], [[screenwriter|screenwriter]] and producer.
title: Cédric Klapisch

abstract: Nikolaj Coster-Waldau (; born 27 July 1970) is a Danish actor, producer and screenwriter. He graduated from the [[Danish National School of Theatre|Danish National School of Theatre and Contemporary Dance]] in [[Copenhagen|Copenhagen]] in 1993. Coster-Waldau's breakthrough performance in Denmark was his role in the film [[Nightwatch|Nightwatch (1994 film)]] (1994). Since then he has appeared in numerous films in his native Scandinavia and Europe in general, including [[Headhunters|Headhunters (film)]] (2011) and [[A Thousand Times Good Night|A Thousand Times Good Night]] (2013).
title: Nikolaj Coster-Waldau

abstract: Uttam Kumar (born as Arun Kumar Chatterjee; 3 September 1926 – 24 July 1980) was an Indian film actor, director, producer and singer who predominantly worked in [[Indian Cinema|Cinema of India]]. Kumar is widely regarded as one of the most popular and beloved actors ever in [[India|India]]. Through his career he earned commercial as well as critical success, and he remains as an Indian cultural icon.
title: Uttam Kumar

abstract: T'Keyah Crystal Keymáh (born Crystal Walker; October 13, 1962) is an American actress and singer. In addition to her status as an original cast member of the [[Fox|Fox Broadcasting Company]] sketch comedy series [[In Living Color|In Living Color]] (1990–1994), she is also known for her roles as Erica Lucas on the [[CBS|CBS]] sitcom [[Cosby|Cosby]] (1996–2000), and as Tanya Baxter on the [[Disney Channel|Disney Channel]] sitcom [[That's So Raven|That's So Raven]] (2003–2005).
title: T'Keyah Crystal Keymáh

abstract: David Dorfman (born February 7, 1993) is an [[American|United States]] actor. He portrayed Aidan Keller in the 2002 [[horror film|horror film]] remake [[The Ring|The Ring (2002 film)]], and its 2005 sequel [[The Ring Two|The Ring Two]]. His other film roles include Sammy in [[Panic|Panic (2000 film)]], Joey in [[Bounce|Bounce (film)]], and [[Jedidiah Hewitt|List of The Texas Chainsaw Massacre characters#Jedidiah]] in [[The Texas Chainsaw Massacre|The Texas Chainsaw Massacre (2003 film)]]. He has also portrayed the character "[[Charles Wallace Murry|Charles Wallace Murry]]" in the film version of [[A Wrinkle in Time|A Wrinkle in Time (2003 film)]]. In 2008, Dorfman appeared in the film [[Drillbit Taylor|Drillbit Taylor]]. He has been cast alongside [[Thomas Haden Church|Thomas Haden Church]] in [1].
