abstract: Afshan Azad (born 12 February 1989) is a British actress and model. She is best known for playing the role of [[Padma Patil|Padma Patil]] in the [[Harry Potter film series|Harry Potter (film series)]], beginning in 2005 with [[Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire|Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (film)]]. In [[Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban|Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (film)]], Padma was portrayed by Sharon Sandhu.
title: Afshan Azad

abstract: Richard Bremmer (born 27 January 1953) is an [[English|England]] [[actor|actor]].
title: Richard Bremmer

abstract: Sally Cahill is a Canadian actress, voice actress and painter. She provided the original voice of [[Ada Wong|Ada Wong]] in the video games [[Resident Evil 2|Resident Evil 2]] (1998), [[Resident Evil 4|Resident Evil 4]] (2005) and [[Resident Evil: The Darkside Chronicles|Resident Evil: The Darkside Chronicles]] (2009).
title: Sally Cahill

abstract: Vanessa Marshall (born October 19, 1969) is an American actress, voice actress and singer. She is most active in animation, films and video games. She is the only child of actress [[Joan Van Ark|Joan Van Ark]] and reporter John Marshall. She started voice acting after being discovered at a one-woman show.
title: Vanessa Marshall

abstract: Vincent Sherman (July 16, 1906 – June 18, 2006) was an [[American|People of the United States]] [[director|film director]] and [[actor|actor]] who worked in [[Hollywood|Hollywood]]. His movies include [[Mr. Skeffington|Mr. Skeffington]] (1944), [[Nora Prentiss|Nora Prentiss]] (1947), and [[The Young Philadelphians|The Young Philadelphians]] (1959).
title: Vincent Sherman

abstract: Christopher McDonald (born February 15, 1955) is an American actor. He is known for his roles as Darryl Dickinson in [[Thelma & Louise|Thelma & Louise]] (1991), Shooter McGavin in [[Happy Gilmore|Happy Gilmore]] (1996), [[Ward Cleaver|Ward Cleaver]] in the [[film adaptation|Leave It to Beaver (film)]] of [[Leave It to Beaver|Leave It to Beaver]] (1997), Kent Mansley in [[The Iron Giant|The Iron Giant]] (1999), Tappy Tibbons in [[Requiem for a Dream|Requiem for a Dream]] (2000), and [[Mel Allen|Mel Allen]] in the HBO film [[61*|61*]] (2001).
title: Christopher McDonald

abstract: Daniel James Callum Blue (born 19 August 1977),, known professionally as Callum Blue, is an English actor. Best known for his roles on the [[Showtime|Showtime (TV network)]] series [[Dead Like Me|Dead Like Me]] and [[The Tudors|The Tudors]], as well as his roles as [[Zod|General Zod#Smallville]] in the American television series [[Smallville|Smallville]], Alex in the British television series [[The Secret Diary of a Call Girl|The Secret Diary of a Call Girl]] alongside [[Billie Piper|Billie Piper]], and Andrew Jacoby in the film [[The Princess Diaries 2|The Princess Diaries 2]] alongside [[Anne Hathaway|Anne Hathaway]].
title: Callum Blue

abstract: Kira Vincent-Davis (born July 9, 1979) is an American [[voice actress|voice actress]] best known for her work in English-language versions of Japanese anime. She voices Lucy/Nyu in [[Elfen Lied|Elfen Lied]], Minagi Tono in [[Air|Air (visual novel)]], Ayumu Kasuga in [[Azumanga Daioh|Azumanga Daioh]], Mizuki Tachibana in [[Gravion|Gravion]], Rino Rando and Pucchan in [[Best Student Council|Best Student Council]], Chaika Trabant in [[Chaika - The Coffin Princess|Chaika - The Coffin Princess]], and Mio Sakamoto in the [[Strike Witches|Strike Witches]] series. She has worked with dubbing production companies [[ADV Films|ADV Films]], [[Sentai Filmworks|Sentai Filmworks]], and [[Funimation|Funimation]].
title: Kira Vincent-Davis

abstract: Johann Dzierzon, or Jan Dzierżon or Dzierżoń , also John Dzierzon (16 January 1811 – 26 October 1906), was a pioneering [[Polish|Poles]] [[apiarist|apiarist]] who discovered the phenomenon of [[parthenogenesis|parthenogenesis]] in [[bee|bees]] and designed the first successful movable-frame [[beehive|beehive (beekeeping)]].
title: Johann Dzierzon

abstract: Michelle Gomez (born 23 November 1966) is a Scottish actress. She is known for her comedy roles in [[The Book Group|The Book Group]] (2002–03), [[Green Wing|Green Wing]] (2004–07) and [[Bad Education|Bad Education (TV series)]] (2012–13), as well as playing [[Missy|The Master (Doctor Who)]] – a version of The Master in the long running British science-fiction programme [[Doctor Who|Doctor Who]] from 2014 to 2017, for which she was nominated for the 2016 [[BAFTA TV Award for Best Supporting Actress|British Academy Television Award for Best Supporting Actress]]. She is also known for playing [[Mary Wardwell / Madam Satan|Madam Satan (comics)]] in [[Netflix|Netflix]] supernatural horror series [[Chilling Adventures of Sabrina|Chilling Adventures of Sabrina (TV series)]] (2018–present), which is adapted from the [[comic book series with the same name|Chilling Adventures of Sabrina]].
title: Michelle Gomez

abstract: Tanvir Mokammel (born 8 March 1955) is a Bangladeshi filmmaker and author of books. He is the recipient of the prestigious Ekushey Podok given by the state of Bangladesh for his contribution in cinema. He won Bangladesh National Film Awards in total for nine times for his films Nodir Naam Modhumoti (1995), Chitra Nodir Pare (1999) and Lalsalu (2001). He is the current director of Bangladesh Film Institute.
title: Tanvir Mokammel

abstract: Devon Murray was born in [[County Kildare|County Kildare]], Ireland on 28 October 1988. When he was six, his parents Michael and Fidelma Murray sent him to the Billie Barry and within two weeks he landed a Tesco television ad. Within six months he was in his first movie, acting alongside [[Aidan Quinn|Aidan Quinn]] in [[This Is My Father|This Is My Father]] (1998). He then joined the [[National Performing Arts School|National Performing Arts School]] and made his breakthrough role in [[Angela's Ashes|Angela's Ashes (film)]] (1999). He also acted with [[Jane Seymour|Jane Seymour (actress)]] in Yesterday's Children (2000).
title: Devon Murray

abstract: Joan Davis (born Josephine Davis, June 29, 1912 – May 22, 1961) was an American [[comedic|Comedy]] actress whose career spanned [[vaudeville|vaudeville]], [[film|film]], [[radio|radio]], and [[television|television]]. Remembered best for the 1950s television comedy [[I Married Joan|I Married Joan]], Davis had a successful earlier career as a [[B-movie|B-movie]] actress and a leading star of 1940s radio comedy.
title: Joan Davis

abstract: Lorraine Gary (born August 16, 1937) is a retired [[American|United States]] actress, best known for her role as Ellen Brody in [[Jaws|Jaws (film)]], [[Jaws 2|Jaws 2]], and [[Jaws: The Revenge|Jaws: The Revenge]]. She also appeared in [[1941|1941 (film)]] and [[Car Wash|Car Wash (film)]].
title: Lorraine Gary

abstract: In 2012, Songz released his first number one album, [[Chapter V|Chapter V (Trey Songz album)]], which debuted atop the [[Billboard 200|Billboard 200]]. The album's lead single titled "[[Heart Attack|Heart Attack (Trey Songz song)]]" was nominated for Best R&B Song at the 2013 Grammy Awards. Following that Songz released his sixth studio album, [[Trigga|Trigga (album)]] in 2014, promoted by the top 40 songs, "[[Na Na|Na Na (song)]]" and "[[Slow Motion|Slow Motion (Trey Songz song)]]". He has sold over 25 million records worldwide in singles and albums.
title: Trey Songz

abstract: Lara Jill Miller (born April 20, 1967) is an American actress, known for her role as Samantha "Sam" Kanisky on the 1980s sitcom [[Gimme a Break!|Gimme a Break!]] and as Kathy on [[The Amanda Show|The Amanda Show]].
title: Lara Jill Miller

abstract: Florence Halop (January 23, 1923 – July 15, 1986) was an American actress. Best known for her roles as surly patient [[Mrs. Hufnagel|List of St. Elsewhere characters#Mrs. Hufnagel]] on the drama [[St. Elsewhere|St. Elsewhere]] and the raspy-voiced bailiff Florence Kleiner on the sitcom [[Night Court|Night Court]], Halop was the sister of [[Billy Halop|Billy Halop]], one of the original Dead End/[[East Side Kids|East Side Kids]].
title: Florence Halop

abstract: Marcia Mitzman Gaven (born February 28, 1959) is an American actress from New York. Since studying at the [[High School of Performing Arts|High School of Performing Arts]] and the [[State University of New York at Purchase|State University of New York at Purchase]], she has appeared in many musicals during her career singing in both [[mezzo-soprano|mezzo-soprano]] and [[soprano|soprano]] roles. Her [[Broadway|Broadway theatre]] debut came in 1979 when she played Betty Rizzo in [[Grease|Grease (musical)]], serving as the replacement for the original actress of the role. In the 1980s she appeared in the musicals [[The Rocky Horror Show|The Rocky Horror Show]], [[Oliver!|Oliver!]], [[Zorba|Zorba (musical)]], [[Nine|Nine (musical)]], [[Anything Goes|Anything Goes]], [[Chess|Chess (musical)]], and [[Welcome to the Club|Welcome to the Club (musical)]], and in the operas [[Brigadoon|Brigadoon]], [[South Pacific|South Pacific (musical)]], and [[Sweeney Todd|Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street]].
title: Marcia Mitzman Gaven

abstract: Derren Nesbitt (born Derren Michael Horwitz; 19 June 1935) is an English [[actor|actor]].
title: Derren Nesbitt

abstract: Rahul Bose (born 27 July 1967) is an Indian film actor, director, screenwriter, social activist, and rugby player. Bose has appeared in [[Bengali|Bengali language]] films such as [[Mr. and Mrs. Iyer|Mr. and Mrs. Iyer]], [[Kalpurush|Kalpurush]], [[Anuranan|Anuranan]], [[Antaheen|Antaheen]], [[Laptop|Laptop (2012 film)]] and [[The Japanese Wife|The Japanese Wife]]. He has also appeared in [[Hindi|Bollywood]] films such as [[Pyaar Ke Side Effects|Pyaar Ke Side Effects]], [[Maan Gaye Mughal-e-Azam|Maan Gaye Mughal-e-Azam]], [[Jhankaar Beats|Jhankaar Beats]], [[Kucch Luv Jaisaa|Kucch Luv Jaisaa]], [[Chameli|Chameli (film)]] and [[Shaurya|Shaurya]]. He also played the [[antagonist|antagonist]] in the Tamil thriller [[Vishwaroopam|Vishwaroopam]] (2013) and [[its sequel|Vishwaroopam II]]. [[Time|Time (magazine)]] magazine named him "the superstar of [[Indian arthouse cinema|Cinema of India#Art cinema in India]]" while [[Maxim|Maxim (magazine)]] named him "the [[Sean Penn|Sean Penn]] of [[Oriental cinema|Oriental cinema]]". for his work in [[parallel cinema|parallel cinema]] films like [[English, August|English, August (film)]] and [[Mr. and Mrs. Iyer|Mr. and Mrs. Iyer]]. He is also notable for his social activism: he participated in the relief efforts that followed the 2004 [[Boxing Day tsunami|2004 Indian Ocean earthquake and tsunami]] and is also the founder of the anti-[[discrimination|discrimination]] [[NGO|NGO]], The Foundation.
title: Rahul Bose

abstract: Ronald Bass (born March 26, 1942) sometimes [[credited|WGA screenwriting credit system]] as Ron Bass, is an American [[screenwriter|screenwriter]] and [[film producer|film producer]]. Bass's work is characterized as being highly in demand, and he is thought to be among the most highly paid writers in [[Hollywood|Hollywood]]. He is often called the "King of the Pitches". In 1988, he received the [[Academy Award|Academy Awards]] for [[Best Original Screenplay|Academy Award for Best Original Screenplay]] for [[Rain Man|Rain Man]], and [[film|films]] that Bass is associated with are regularly nominated for multiple motion picture awards. His films have grossed over $2 billion dollars.
title: Ronald Bass

abstract: Sana Saeed (born 22 September 1988) is an Indian actress and model, who appears in [[Bollywood|Bollywood]] films. She first appeared as a child artist in [[Kuch Kuch Hota Hai|Kuch Kuch Hota Hai]] (1998) and continued to do so in films [[Har Dil Jo Pyar Karega|Har Dil Jo Pyar Karega]] (2000) and [[Badal|Badal]] (2000). She also appeared in television shows such as [[Babul Ka Aangann Chootey Na|Babul Ka Aangann Chootey Na]] (2008) and [[Lo Ho Gayi Pooja Iss Ghar Ki|Lo Ho Gayi Pooja Iss Ghar Ki]] (2008). In 2012, Saeed made her screen debut as an adult in a supporting role in [[Karan Johar|Karan Johar]]'s [[Student Of The Year|Student of the Year (film)]], which emerged as a box-office commercial success. She has appeared in many reality shows including [[Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa|Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa]] (2013), [[Nach Baliye|Nach Baliye]] (2015) and [[Fear Factor: Khatron Ke Khiladi|Fear Factor: Khatron Ke Khiladi]] (2016).
title: Sana Saeed

abstract: Cal Dodd (born Cathal J. Dodd) is an Irish-Canadian voice actor and singer, who is best known for his portrayal of the [[Marvel Comics|Marvel Comics]] character [[Wolverine|Wolverine (character)]] in [[X-Men: The Animated Series|X-Men (TV series)]] and the [[Marvel vs. Capcom|Marvel vs. Capcom (series)]] series of video games. Cathal also provided the voice of the hero/villain Random Virus in the BBC series [[Ace Lightning|Ace Lightning]]. He recorded with producer Bob Hahn in Canada, which consisted of demos and material to be submitted to major labels. His recordings ended up on the RCA label, with a full-length album release New Horizons on Hahn's own Rising Records label in 1975. He co-hosted the Canadian TV series Circus on [[CTV|CTV Television Network]] with [[Sherisse Laurence|Sherisse Stevens]] from 1978 to 1983.
title: Cal Dodd

abstract: Christine was born Virginia Christine Ricketts in [[Stanton|Stanton, Iowa]] in [[Montgomery County|Montgomery County, Iowa]] in southwestern [[Iowa|Iowa]]. She was of [[Swedish|Sweden]] descent. Upon her mother's remarriage, she changed her last name to "Kraft". The family later moved to [[Des Moines|Des Moines, Iowa]] in [[Polk County|Polk County, Iowa]], where Virginia attended Elmwood Elementary School. The family relocated again to [[Des Moines County|Des Moines County, Iowa]] in southeastern Iowa, not to be confused with the state capital in central Iowa. There Christine attended Mediapolis High School, where she aspired to be a concert pianist. Her family later moved to [[California|California]], where she enrolled at [[UCLA|University of California, Los Angeles]].
title: Virginia Christine

abstract: Juan Pablo Di Pace is an Argentinian actor, singer and director. Di Pace began his career in the [[United Kingdom|United Kingdom]], performing in a number of musicals and appearing in films like [[Survival Island|Survival Island]] (2005) and [[Mamma Mia!|Mamma Mia! (film)]] (2008). He later moved to Spain, starring in several television series from 2009 to 2013. In 2014, Di Pace began starring as [[Nicolas Treviño|Nicolas Treviño]] in the [[TNT|TNT (U.S. TV network)]] drama series [[Dallas|Dallas (2012 TV series)]]. Starting in 2016, he played the role of [[Kimmy Gibbler|Kimmy Gibbler]]'s estranged husband, Fernando, on [[Fuller House|Fuller House (TV series)]], a [[spin–off|Spin-off (media)]] series of [[Full House|Full House]].
title: Juan Pablo Di Pace

abstract: Derviş Zaim (born Derviş Zaimağaoğlu in 1964 in [[Famagusta|Famagusta]], [[Cyprus|Cyprus]]) is a [[Turkish Cypriot|Turkish Cypriot]] filmmaker and novelist, who has twice won the Golden Orange for Best Director for [[Elephants and Grass|Elephants and Grass]] (2000) and Dot (2008); Golden Oranges for Best Film and Best Screenplay for [[Somersault in a Coffin|Somersault in a Coffin]] (1996); and the Yunus Nadi literary prize for his [[debut novel|debut novel]] Ares in Wonderland (1995).
title: Derviş Zaim

abstract: Barbi Benton (born Barbara Lynn Klein; January 28, 1950) is an [[American|United States]] model, actress and singer. She is known for appearing in [[Playboy|Playboy]] magazine, as a four-season regular on the comedy series [[Hee Haw|Hee Haw]], and for recording several modestly successful albums in the 1970s. Since the 1980s, she has been semi-retired from show business to raise her children.
title: Barbi Benton

abstract: Liam Cunningham (born 2 June 1961) is an Irish stage and screen actor. He is known for playing [[Davos Seaworth|Davos Seaworth]] in the [[HBO|HBO]] epic-fantasy series [[Game of Thrones|Game of Thrones]]. He has been nominated for the [[London Film Critics' Circle Award|London Film Critics' Circle]], the [[British Independent Film Award|British Independent Film Awards]], has won two [[Irish Film & Television Awards|Irish Film & Television Awards]], and shared a [[BAFTA|British Academy Television Awards]] with [[Michael Fassbender|Michael Fassbender]], for their crime-drama short film Pitch Black Heist.
title: Liam Cunningham

abstract: Aboul-Qacem Echebbi ( ) (24 February 1909 - 9 October 1934) was a [[Tunisia|Tunisian]] poet. He is probably best known for writing the final two verses of the current National Anthem of Tunisia, [[Humat al-Hima|Humat al-Hima]] (Defenders of the Homeland), that was written originally by the [[Egypt|Egyptian]] poet [[Mustafa Sadik el-Rafii|Mostafa Saadeq Al-Rafe'ie]].
title: Aboul-Qacem Echebbi

abstract: Julia Duffy (born Julia Margaret Hinds; June 27, 1951) is an [[American|United States]] [[actress|actress]] best known for playing Stephanie Vanderkellen on the sitcom [[Newhart|Newhart]] (1983–90). For this role, she received seven [[Emmy Award|Emmy Award]] nominations and a 1988 [[Golden Globe Award|Golden Globe Award]] nomination. The role also won three [[Viewers for Quality Television|Viewers for Quality Television]] awards for her, as well as five American Comedy Awards nominations. She is also notable for playing the original Maggie Campbell on [[Baby Talk|Baby Talk (TV series)]] (1991) and Allison Sugarbaker on [[Designing Women|Designing Women]] (1991–92).
title: Julia Duffy

abstract: Azura Dawn Storozynski (born November 8, 1981), known professionally as Azura Skye, is an American actress who first gained recognition for her role as Jane on [[The WB|The WB]] television sitcom [[Zoe, Duncan, Jack and Jane|Zoe, Duncan, Jack and Jane]]. She also had a 2-episode role as [[Cassie Newton|Cassie Newton]] in the seventh season of [[Buffy the Vampire Slayer|Buffy the Vampire Slayer (TV series)]].
title: Azura Skye

abstract: María Luisa Paredes Bartolomé, (born 3 April 1946 in [[Madrid|Madrid]]), better known in show business as Marisa Paredes, is a [[Spanish|Spain]] actress.
title: Marisa Paredes

abstract: Alan Armstrong (born 17 July 1946), known professionally as Alun Armstrong, is an English actor. Armstrong grew up in [[County Durham|County Durham]] in [[North East England|North East England]]. He first became interested in acting through Shakespeare productions at his [[grammar school|grammar school]]. Since his career began in the early 1970s, he has played, in his words, "the full spectrum of characters from the grotesque to musicals... I always play very colourful characters, often a bit crazy, despotic, psychotic".
title: Alun Armstrong

abstract: Soha Ali Khan Pataudi (born 4 October 1978) is an Indian film actress, known primarily for her work in the [[Hindi film industry|Hindi film industry]], although she has also acted in [[Bengali|Cinema of West Bengal]] and English-language films
title: Soha Ali Khan

abstract: Samuel Vincent Khouth (born October 5, 1971), professionally known as Samuel "Sam" Vincent, is a Canadian voice actor, based in [[Vancouver|Vancouver]] who specializes for voicing characters in animated series, anime dubs and video games. His best-known roles are [[Edd Double D|List of Ed, Edd n Eddy characters#Edd (Double D)]] from [[Ed, Edd n Eddy|Ed, Edd n Eddy]], Guy Hamdon and Shezap from Shezow, and [[Krypto|Krypto]] in the [[Cartoon Network|Cartoon Network]] TV series [[Krypto the Superdog|Krypto the Superdog]]. He also voiced [[Athrun Zala|Athrun Zala]] from [[Mobile Suit Gundam SEED|Mobile Suit Gundam SEED]], Hikaru Shindo from [[Hikaru no Go|Hikaru no Go]], Julian Star from [[Cardcaptors|Cardcaptor Sakura]], and [[Tieria Erde|Tieria Erde]] from [[Mobile Suit Gundam 00|Mobile Suit Gundam 00]]. Other roles include [[Forge|Forge (comics)]] from [[X-Men Evolution|X-Men Evolution]] and [[Baby Bugs|Bugs Bunny]], [[Baby Tweety|Tweety]] and [[Baby Daffy|Daffy Duck]] from [[Baby Looney Tunes|Baby Looney Tunes]], Sideswipe from [[Transformers: Armada|Transformers: Armada]] and the voices of [[Aerrow and Dark Ace|List of characters in Storm Hawks]] from [[Storm Hawks|Storm Hawks]]. He is also known for [[Sonic|Sonic the Hedgehog (character)]]'s singing voice in [[Sonic Underground|Sonic Underground]], and the title character and the alien Billy of [[Martin Mystery|Martin Mystery]] and from 2018 onwards is the voice of [[Lloyd Garmadon|Lloyd Garmadon]] in [[LEGO Ninjago: Masters of Spinjitzu|LEGO Ninjago: Masters of Spinjitzu]].
title: Samuel Vincent

abstract: Tina Bursill (born 1951) is an [[Australian|Australian people]] actress. She is notable for her roles on television series [[Skyways|Skyways (TV series)]] as Louise Carter (1979–1981), and [[Prisoner|Prisoner (TV series)]] as [[Sonia Stevens|List of Prisoner characters – inmates]] (1983–1984). She won the [[AFI (AACTA) Award for Best Supporting Actress|AACTA Award for Best Actress in a Supporting Role]] for the 1987 film [[Jilted|Jilted (film)]].
title: Tina Bursill

abstract: Maggie Dence (born 1 February 1942) is an Australian stage, film and television actress. She is best known on television for her early comedy work and soap opera roles, including Rose Sullivan in [[The Sullivans|The Sullivans]] (1976–78), Bev "The Beast" Baker in [[Prisoner|Prisoner (TV series)]] (1984) and [[Dorothy Burke|Dorothy Burke]] in [[Neighbours|Neighbours]] (1990–93)
title: Maggie Dence

abstract: Sandahl Bergman (born November 14, 1951) is an [[American|United States]] [[dancer|dancer]], [[stuntwoman|stunt performer]], and [[actress|actress]].
title: Sandahl Bergman

abstract: Marina Sirtis (; born 29 March 1955) is a British-American actress. She is best known for her role as Counselor [[Deanna Troi|Deanna Troi]] on the television series [[Star Trek: The Next Generation|Star Trek: The Next Generation]] and the four feature films that followed, as well as other appearances in the [[Star Trek|Star Trek]] franchise.
title: Marina Sirtis

abstract: Fiona Spence (born 10 October 1948) is an [[English Australian|English Australian]] [[stage|Stage (theatre)]] and [[television|television]] actress and [[drama|drama]] [[teacher|teacher]]. She is known for her [[television|television in Australia]] roles as [[Gestapo|Gestapo]]-like prison officer [[Vera Bennett|Vera Bennett]] in [[Prisoner|Prisoner (TV series)]] (1979–81) and the unlucky in love spinster [[Celia Stewart|Celia Stewart]] in [[Home and Away|Home and Away]] (1988–90). She has made numerous returns to Home and Away reprising her role of Celia. Her other television roles include Eleanor McCormick in [[Packed to the Rafters|Packed to the Rafters]] (2013).
title: Fiona Spence

abstract: Christopher George was born in [[Royal Oak, Michigan|Royal Oak, Michigan]], on February 25, 1931, the son of [[Greek|Greeks]] immigrants John and Vaseleke George. John was born in [[Thebes, Greece|Thebes, Greece]], and was a veteran of [[World War I|World War I]], and Vaseleke was born in [[Athens|Athens]].
title: Christopher George

abstract: Richard Ridings (born 19 September 1958) is a British actor, and is best known for his portrayal of Alan Ashburn in the [[ITV|ITV Network]] television drama [[Fat Friends|Fat Friends]], and for playing Bernard Green in the [[BBC1|BBC1]] comedy-drama [[Common as Muck|Common as Muck]]. He trained as an actor at the Bristol Old Vic Theatre School. He is the father of singer-songwriter [[Freya Ridings|Freya Ridings]].
title: Richard Ridings

abstract: Rhys Wakefield (born 20 November 1988) is an Australian actor and director. He first started out as a regular on the Australian TV series [[Home and Away|Home and Away]] where he starred in 363 episodes. He played the lead in James Cameron's thriller [[Sanctum|Sanctum (film)]], the Polite Leader in [[The Purge|The Purge]] franchise and was nominated for Best Actor in a Feature Film by the Australian Film Institute and the Australian Film Critics Circle for his role in [[The Black Balloon|The Black Balloon (film)]]. Wakefield is now set to star in season 3 of HBO's [[True Detective|True Detective]] as a series regular, which airs in January 2019 .
title: Rhys Wakefield

abstract: Lynsey Baxter is an English actress. Born in London, she began as a child actress in 1974 and later trained at [[Royal Academy of Dramatic Art|Royal Academy of Dramatic Art]] (RADA). She has worked in theatre, television, film, radio and [[voiceover|voiceover]].
title: Lynsey Baxter

abstract: Matthew Rhys Evans (born 4 November 1974), known professionally as Matthew Rhys (), is a [[Welsh|Welsh people]] actor. He is known for playing [[Philip Jennings|Philip Jennings (The Americans)]] in the acclaimed television series [[The Americans|The Americans (2013 TV series)]] (2013–2018), for which he received two [[Golden Globe Award|Golden Globe Award for Best Actor – Television Series Drama]] nominations and a [[Primetime Emmy Award|Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actor in a Drama Series]]. He has also played [[Kevin Walker|Kevin Walker (Brothers & Sisters)]] in the television series [[Brothers & Sisters|Brothers & Sisters (2006 TV series)]] (2006–2011), [[Dylan Thomas|Dylan Thomas]] in the film [[The Edge of Love|The Edge of Love]] (2008) and [[Daniel Ellsberg|Daniel Ellsberg]] in the film [[The Post|The Post (film)]] (2017).
title: Matthew Rhys

abstract: Melody Anderson (born December 3, 1955) is a [[Canadian|Canadians]] social worker and public speaker specializing in the impact of [[addiction|Substance dependence]] on families. She is a retired actress, whose most high-profile role was playing [[Dale Arden|Dale Arden]] in the [[1980 adaptation|1980 in film]] of [[Flash Gordon|Flash Gordon (film)]]. She later starred in the 1986 film [[Firewalker|Firewalker (film)]], with Chuck Norris. While doing singing, she also trained as an actress, leading to roles in films and television during the 1970s and 1980s.
title: Melody Anderson

abstract: Michael Graziadei (born September 22, 1979) is an American actor, known for his role as [[Daniel Romalotti|Daniel Romalotti]] on the [[CBS|CBS]] daytime soap opera [[The Young and the Restless|The Young and the Restless]].
title: Michael Graziadei

abstract: Adoor Gopalakrishnan is an [[India|Indian]] [[film director|film director]], [[script writer|screenwriter]], and [[producer|film producer]]. Adoor Gopalakrishnan had a major role in revolutioning [[Malayalam cinema|Malayalam cinema]] during the 1970s and is regarded as one of the most notable filmmakers of India. Adoor's first film [[Swayamvaram|Swayamvaram (1972 film)]] (1972) is credited for pioneering the new wave cinema movement in Kerala along with [[Olavum Theeravum|Olavum Theeravum]] (1970) and [[Athidhi|Athidhi (1975 film)]] (1974). Most of his films go to festivals around the world, and are released in [[Kerala|Kerala]]. Eleven films he directed, from Swayamvaram to [[Oru Pennum Randaanum|Oru Pennum Randaanum]] (2008), were screened at several international film festivals and won him several national and international awards. He won [[National Film Awards|National Film Awards]] 16 times, [[Kerala State Film Awards|Kerala State Film Awards]] 17 times and also won several international film awards. He won the prestigious [[British Film Institute|British Film Institute]] Award for [[Elippathayam|Elippathayam]] (1981). Adoor received the [[Padma Shri|Padma Shri]] in 1984 and the [[Padma Vibhushan|Padma Vibhushan]] in 2006. The Nation honoured Adoor for his valuable contributions to Indian cinema by awarding him the highest cinema award of India, the [[Dadasaheb Phalke Award|Dadasaheb Phalke Award]] for the year 2004. Adoor has made only 12 feature films in his career.
title: Adoor Gopalakrishnan

abstract: Zienia Merton (11 December 1945 – 14 September 2018) was a [[British|United Kingdom]] actress born in [[Burma|Burma]]. She was best known for playing [[Sandra Benes|Sandra Benes]] in [[Space: 1999|Space: 1999]].
title: Zienia Merton

abstract: Simon Gipps-Kent (born Simon Trevor Kent; 25 October 1958 – 16 September 1987) was a prolific 20th-century [[English|English people]] [[theatre|theatre]] and [[film|film]] [[actor|actor]] in the 1970s-80s, noted for his teenage portrayals of British [[royalty|Royal family]] and [[nobility|nobility]]. He was born into a show business family in [[Kensington|Kensington]], [[London|London]]. His television debut was on the [[BBC|BBC]] in 1971 followed with a London [[West End theatre|West End theatre]] debut in 1972. A 16-year career in both venues continued until his unexplained death in 1987.
title: Simon Gipps-Kent

abstract: Jess Walton (born February 18, 1949) is an American actress, best known for her role as [[Jill Abbott|Jill Abbott]] on the CBS soap opera, [[The Young and the Restless|The Young and the Restless]]. Also she starred in the 2018 movie "Christmas with a View"
title: Jess Walton

abstract: Kang Hye-jung (Korean: 강혜정, born on January 4, 1982) is a South Korean actress, who first achieved recognition for her role in the [[arthouse film|arthouse film]] [[Nabi|Nabi (film)]] (2001), and two years later, she rose to stardom in 2003 through [[Park Chan-wook|Park Chan-wook]]'s revenge thriller [[Oldboy|Oldboy (2003 film)]]. For the next few years, she continued to appear in a diverse range of roles which drew her further critical acclaim, notably in [[Han Jae-rim|Han Jae-rim]]'s relationship drama [[Rules of Dating|Rules of Dating]] (2005), and [[Park Kwang-hyun|Park Kwang-hyun]]'s [[Korean War|Korean War]] comedy [[Welcome to Dongmakgol|Welcome to Dongmakgol]] (2005). In recent years, Kang has starred in more conventional melodramas such as [[Herb|Herb (film)]] (2007) and [[Girlfriends|Girlfriends (2009 film)]] (2009).
title: Kang Hye-jung

abstract: April Stewart (born February 8, 1968) is an American voice actress.
title: April Stewart

abstract: Daniel von Bargen (June 5, 1950 – March 1, 2015) was an [[American|United States]] [[film|film]], stage and [[television|television]] [[actor|actor]]. He was known for his roles as Mr. Kruger on [[Seinfeld|Seinfeld]], Commandant Edwin Spangler on [[Malcolm in the Middle|Malcolm in the Middle]], and Chief Grady in [[Super Troopers|Super Troopers]].
title: Daniel von Bargen

abstract: Patrick Pinney (born June 30, 1952) is an American actor and voice actor.
title: Patrick Pinney

abstract: Barbara Alyn Woods (born ) is an American actress. She is best known for her roles in television series [[One Tree Hill|One Tree Hill (TV series)]] and [[Honey, I Shrunk the Kids|Honey, I Shrunk the Kids: The TV Show]].
title: Barbara Alyn Woods

abstract: Lee Dong-gun (, ; born 26 July 1980) is a [[South Korea|South Korean]] actor and singer.
title: Lee Dong-gun

abstract: Lee Chamberlin (born Alverta LaPallo; February 14, 1938 – May 25, 2014) was an [[American|United States]] theatrical, film and television [[actress|actress]].
title: Lee Chamberlin

abstract: Koji Igarashi was born in the [[Fukushima Prefecture|Fukushima Prefecture]] on 17 March 1968. His father was a [[lumberjack|lumberjack]]. Igarashi had an interest in becoming a carpenter and later to be an artist. As a teenager, he would explore the nearby [[Komine Castle|Komine Castle]] with a camcorder. His first experience with video games was [[Atari|Atari, Inc.]]'s tennis game [[Pong|Pong]] at age 10, and an arcade game [[Crazy Climber|Crazy Climber]] two years later led him to want to design games. He taught himself the computer program languages [[BASIC|BASIC]] and [[assembly language|assembly language]], and designed amateur games. While attending university, he received a job offer from the company Grafika, which he had to turn down as he did not wish to work there. He accepted the next job offer, which was at Konami.
title: Koji Igarashi

abstract: Imogen Bailey (born 7 July 1977, [[Canberra|Canberra]]) is an [[Australian|Australian people]] model, actress and singer. As a model she has been featured on the cover of [[men's magazine|men's magazines]], including [[Ralph|Ralph (magazine)]], [[FHM Australia|FHM Australia]], [[Black+White|Black+White]]. On TV Bailey has appeared in various reality shows, [[Celebrity Big Brother|Celebrity Big Brother Australia]] (July–August 2002), [[Skating on Thin Ice|Skating on Thin Ice]] (2005), and [[Celebrity Survivor|Celebrity Survivor]] (2006), which was set in [[Vanuatu|Vanuatu]]. In 2008 she portrayed [[Nicola West|Nicola West]] on Australian TV soap opera, [[Neighbours|Neighbours]] for six months. As a singer her vocals were featured on the 2003 single "If U Want Me" by United Kingdom dance musician, [[Michael Woods|Michael Woods (producer)]]. It peaked at No.   46 on the [[UK Singles Chart|UK Singles Chart]] and No.   1 on the component, UK dance chart; No.   62 on the [[ARIA Singles Chart|ARIA Charts]] and No.   5 on its Dance Charts. In August 2012 Bailey participated in the second season of the [[Special Broadcasting Service|Special Broadcasting Service]] (SBS) TV documentary series, [[Go Back to Where You Came From|Go Back to Where You Came From]]. She is an advocate for [[animal rights|animal rights]] and has worked on many [[People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals|People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals]] (PETA) campaigns. Bailey also supports efforts to dispel myths about [[asylum seekers|Refugee#Asylum seekers]] in Australia. She shares her home base between Sydney and Los Angeles.
title: Imogen Bailey

abstract: Byron Mann () is a [[Hong Kong|Hong Kong]]-born American actor in film and television. His roles include Wing Chau in [[The Big Short|The Big Short (film)]], Chang in [[Hell on Wheels|Hell on Wheels (TV series)]], [[Ryu|Ryu (Street Fighter)]] in [[Street Fighter|Street Fighter (1994 film)]], Silver Lion in [[The Man with the Iron Fists|The Man with the Iron Fists]], Admiral Nguyen in [[The Expanse|The Expanse (TV series)]], and [[Yao Fei|Great Ten#Accomplished Perfect Physician]] in the first season of [[Arrow|Arrow (TV series)]].
title: Byron Mann

abstract: Elizabeth Garvie (born 1957 in [[Bristol|Bristol]]) is an [[English|England]] [[actress|actress]] best known for her role as [[Elizabeth Bennet|Elizabeth Bennet]] in the 1980 [[BBC|BBC]] dramatisation of [[Pride and Prejudice|Pride and Prejudice (1980 TV series)]].
title: Elizabeth Garvie

abstract: Ian James Corlett (born August 29, 1962) is a Canadian voice actor, producer, and author. He is the creator of [[Studio B Productions|Studio B Productions]]' animated series [[Being Ian|Being Ian]] and [[Yvon of the Yukon|Yvon of the Yukon]]. One of his best-known animation roles was the voice of [[Goku|Goku]] in the [[Saban|Saban Entertainment]] dub of [[Dragon Ball Z|Dragon Ball Z]] in the 1990s.
title: Ian James Corlett

abstract: John Keegan de Lancie (born October 31, 1984) is an [[American|Americans]] [[actor|actor]] and son of actor [[John de Lancie|John de Lancie]] and [[Marnie Mosiman|Marnie Mosiman]]. He is known for his role as Q, or [[Q Junior|Q (Junior)]], on [[Star Trek: Voyager|Star Trek: Voyager]], where he played the son of [[Q|Q (Star Trek)]], a longstanding character in the [[Star Trek franchise|Star Trek franchise]] portrayed by his father, John de Lancie, in the episode "[[Q2|Q2 (Voyager episode)]]". He has also appeared in several other popular [[television show|television shows]] such as [[Ally McBeal|Ally McBeal]] and [[The Drew Carey Show|The Drew Carey Show]]. Keegan has one brother, Owen de Lancie (born 1987).
title: Keegan de Lancie

abstract: Manolo Cardona (born Manuel Julián Cardona Molano April 25, 1977) is a [[Colombia|Colombian]] actor.
title: Manolo Cardona

abstract: Linda Larkin (born March 20, 1970) is an American actress and voice actress. She is best known for voicing [[Princess Jasmine|Princess Jasmine]] in Disney's 1992 animated feature film, [[Aladdin|Aladdin (1992 Disney film)]]. She later reprised her role in the sequels, [[The Return of Jafar|The Return of Jafar]] and [[Aladdin and the King of Thieves|Aladdin and the King of Thieves]], as well as in the [[Kingdom Hearts|Kingdom Hearts]] and [[Disney Infinity|Disney Infinity (series)]] video game series.
title: Linda Larkin

abstract: Douglas Seale (28 October 1913 – 13 June 1999) was an [[English|English people]] actor, producer and director.
title: Douglas Seale

abstract: Joaquim Pedro de Andrade (May 25, 1932 – September 10, 1988) was a Brazilian film director and screenwriter. He was a member of the [[Cinema Novo|Cinema Novo]] movement in Brazil. Andrade is best known for his 1969 film [[Macunaíma|Macunaíma (film)]], based loosely on the novel of the same title by [[Mário de Andrade|Mário de Andrade]]. His 1962 documentary film [[Garrincha: Hero of the Jungle|Garrincha: Hero of the Jungle]] was entered into the [[13th Berlin International Film Festival|13th Berlin International Film Festival]]. Garrincha is the hero football player, with Pele lead the victory World Football Cup in 1958 (Sweden) and 1962 (Chile). Macunaíma is a tale written by Mario de Andrade, published in 1928. Is an allegoric fable, tells the birth of Brazilian's national ethos.
title: Joaquim Pedro de Andrade

abstract: Mel Novak (born June 16, 1934) is an American [[actor|actor]] who is best known for villainous roles in [[Black Belt Jones|Black Belt Jones]], [[Game of Death|Game of Death]], and [[An Eye for an Eye|An Eye for an Eye (1981 film)]]. He is also known for doing all of his own [[stunts|stunts]] and fighting scenes.
title: Mel Novak

abstract: Mark Snow (born Martin Fulterman; August 26, 1946) is an American composer for film and television. Not to be confused with Mark Snow AKA The Yeti an EDM producer. Among his most famous compositions is the theme music for sci-fi television series [[The X-Files|The X-Files]]. The theme reached no. 2 on the [[UK Singles Chart|UK Singles Chart]]. Snow also wrote the music for another [[Chris Carter|Chris Carter (screenwriter)]] series, [[Millennium|Millennium (TV series)]], and the background music [[scores|film score]] for both shows, a total of 12 seasons.
title: Mark Snow

abstract: Shauna MacDonald (born October 6, 1970) is a [[Canadian|Canadians]] television and film [[actress|actress]], director, and [[radio|radio]] announcer.
title: Shauna MacDonald

abstract: María Belén Rueda García-Porrero (born 16 March 1965) is a [[Spanish|Spain]] [[actress|actress]]. She is best known for her roles as Lucía in the TV series [[Los Serrano|Los Serrano]]; as Julia in [[The Sea Inside|The Sea Inside]], for which she won a [[Goya Award|Goya Award]]; and as Laura in [[The Orphanage|The Orphanage (2007 film)]], for which she received another [[Goya Award|Goya Award]] nomination. Most recently she played the lead role in the movie [[Julia's Eyes|Julia's Eyes]].
title: Belén Rueda

abstract: Clyde Kusatsu (born September 13, 1948) is an American [[actor|actor]] of Japanese descent.
title: Clyde Kusatsu

abstract: Tobin Bell (born Joseph Henry Tobin Jr.; August 7, 1942) is an American actor. He is best known for his portrayal of [[John Kramer / Jigsaw|Jigsaw (Saw character)]] in the eight films of the [[Saw franchise|Saw (franchise)]]. After years of work doing stand-ins and [[background work|Extra (acting)]] on films, he got his first major acting job in [[Mississippi Burning|Mississippi Burning]] (1988) and went on to star in made-for-television films and guest star in television shows throughout the 1990s.
title: Tobin Bell

abstract: Canada Lee (born Leonard Lionel Cornelius Canegata, March 3, 1907 – May 9, 1952) was an [[American|United States]] [[actor|actor]] who pioneered roles for [[African American|African Americans]]. After careers as a [[jockey|jockey]], [[boxer|Boxing]] and musician, he became an actor in the [[Federal Theatre Project|Federal Theatre Project]], most notably in a [[1936 production of Macbeth|Voodoo Macbeth]] adapted and directed by [[Orson Welles|Orson Welles]]. Lee later starred in Welles's original Broadway production of [[Native Son|Native Son (play)]] (1941). A champion of [[civil rights|civil rights]] in the 1930s and 1940s, Lee was [[blacklisted|Hollywood blacklist]] and died shortly before he was scheduled to appear before the [[House Un-American Activities Committee|House Un-American Activities Committee]]. He furthered the African-American tradition in theatre pioneered by such actors as [[Paul Robeson|Paul Robeson]]. Lee was the father of actor [[Carl Lee|Carl Lee (actor)]].
title: Canada Lee

abstract: Melanie Kinnaman (born December 18, 1953) is an American dancer, film and stage actress. She is best known for her role as Pam in the 1985 horror film [[Friday the 13th Part V: A New Beginning|Friday the 13th: A New Beginning]]. She later co-starred with [[Eric Roberts|Eric Roberts]] in [[Best of the Best|Best of the Best (1989 film)]].
title: Melanie Kinnaman

abstract: Jsu Garcia, also credited as Nick Corri (born October 6, 1963), is an American film and television actor and producer. Together with author [[John-Roger|John-Roger]], he runs the production company Scott J-R Productions.
title: Jsu Garcia

abstract: Frank Harper (born 12 December 1962) is an English actor and film producer. He is best known for his "hard man" roles, such as "Billy Bright" in [[The Football Factory|The Football Factory (film)]] (2004) and "Dog" in [[Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels|Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels]] (1998).
title: Frank Harper

abstract: Megyn Price (born March 24, 1971) is an American actress, best known for her roles on television as Claudia Finnerty in the [[FOX Network|Fox Broadcasting Company]]/[[WB|The WB]] sitcom [[Grounded for Life|Grounded for Life]] (2001–05), Audrey Bingham on the [[CBS|CBS]] sitcom [[Rules of Engagement|Rules of Engagement (TV series)]] (2007–13), and Mary Roth on the [[Netflix|Netflix]] sitcom [[The Ranch|The Ranch (TV series)]] (2016–present).
title: Megyn Price

abstract: Armughan Shahid (; born 27 April 1969), better known by his stage names Shaan Shahid () and Shaan, is a [[Pakistani|Pakistanis]] actor, model, writer and film director. With his career spanning more than two decades with over 500 films, Shaan has established himself as one of the most popular leading actors of [[Pakistan|Pakistan]]. Shaan started his acting career in 1990 by making debut in Javed Fazli's film [[Bulandi|Bulandi (1990 film)]] opposite to [[Reema Khan|Reema Khan]]. He has won many awards in [[Pakistan|Pakistan]] including one [[Pride of Performance|Pride of Performance]], four [[National Film Awards|National Film Awards]], fifteen [[Nigar Awards|Nigar Awards]], five [[Lux Style Awards|Lux Style Awards]], one [[Pakistan Media Award|Pakistan Media Award]], [[ARY Film Award|ARY Film Awards]]. He is considered as the highest-paid film star in Pakistan.
title: Shaan Shahid

abstract: Amy Steel Pulitzer ([[née|Name at birth]] Steel; born May 3, 1960) is an American actress and psychologist. She began her career with guest appearances on a variety of television [[soap opera|soap operas]]. Transitioning into feature films, Steel rose to prominence when she was chosen to play the role of the heroine [[Ginny Field|Ginny (Friday the 13th)]] in [[Steve Miner|Steve Miner]]'s [[slasher|slasher film]]-[[horror film|horror film]] [[Friday the 13th Part 2|Friday the 13th Part 2]] (1981). A commercial hit, Steel was asked by Miner to reprise her role as Ginny in the 1983 [[3D film|3D film]] [[Friday the 13th Part III|Friday the 13th Part III]] but declined the offer as she feared being typecast.
title: Amy Steel

abstract: Cathy Silvers (born May 27, 1961 in [[New York City|New York City]], [[New York|New York (state)]]) is an [[American|American people]] actress and author, and the daughter of actress Evelyn Patrick and actor/comedian [[Phil Silvers|Phil Silvers]].
title: Cathy Silvers

abstract: Desirée Lois del Valle Dunham (born May 28, 1981), better known by her [[screen name|stage name]] Desiree del Valle, is a [[Filipino|Filipino people]] [[actress|actress]] born from an [[American|United States]] father and a Filipino mother.
title: Desiree del Valle

abstract: Helen Gibson (August 27, 1892 – October 10, 1977) was an American film actress, [[vaudeville|vaudeville]] performer, radio performer, [[film producer|film producer]], [[trick rider|Horse riding stunts]] and [[rodeo|rodeo]] performer; and is considered to be the first American professional [[stunt woman|Stunt performer]].

He was born into a Pashtun Syed family in 1956 in [[Quetta|Quetta]], [[Balochistan|Balochistan (Pakistan)]], [[Pakistan|Pakistan]]. In 1992 Jamal made his acting debut in [[K2|K2 (film)]], directed by [[Franc Roddam|Franc Roddam]] and since than in many other movies and dramas.

abstract: Marguerite Clark (born Helen Marguerite Clark, February 22, 1883 – September 25, 1940) was an [[American|United States]] [[stage|theatre]] and [[silent film|silent film]] [[actress|actress]]. As a movie actress, at one time, Clark was second only to [[Mary Pickford|Mary Pickford]] in popularity. Today, most of her films are lost.

abstract: Peg Phillips (September 20, 1918 – November 7, 2002) was an American actress best known for playing storekeeper [[Ruth-Anne Miller|Ruth-Anne Miller]] on the television series [[Northern Exposure|Northern Exposure]].

abstract: Terry Kinney (born January 29, 1954) is an American actor and [[theatre director|theatre director]], and is a founding member of the [[Steppenwolf Theatre Company|Steppenwolf Theatre Company]], with [[Laurie Metcalf|Laurie Metcalf]], [[Gary Sinise|Gary Sinise]], and [[Jeff Perry|Jeff Perry (American actor)]]. Kinney is best known for his role as Emerald City creator [[Tim McManus|Tim McManus]] on [[HBO|HBO]]'s prison drama [[Oz|Oz (TV series)]].
title: Terry Kinney

abstract: Bridget Marquardt, born Bridget Christina Sandmeier, was born in [[Tillamook, Oregon|Tillamook, Oregon]]. Shortly after her birth, Marquardt's mother moved the family back to [[California|California]], where Marquardt was raised. Her parents divorced when Marquardt was in the fifth grade. Her mother remarried, and Marquardt and her younger brother Edward moved to their stepfather's [[ranch|ranch]], where they later gained a half-sister, Anastasia. Marquardt attended Galt High School for her freshman and sophomore years and then transferred to [[Lodi High School|Lodi High School (California)]], from which she graduated in 1990.
title: Bridget Marquardt

abstract: Travis Schuldt (born September 18, 1974) is an American actor. He originated the role of [[Ethan Winthrop|Ethan Winthrop]] on [[Passions|Passions]], and played the recurring roles of [[Keith Dudemeister|Keith Dudemeister]] on [[Scrubs|Scrubs (TV series)]], Rick/Subway on [[Community|Community (TV series)]], and [[Ben Smith|List of It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia characters#Ben Smith]] on [[It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia|It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia]].

abstract: Lisa Jane Persky (born May 5, 1955) is an American actress, journalist, author, artist, and photographer. She is best known for her supporting roles in the films [[The Great Santini|The Great Santini]] (1979) and [[Peggy Sue Got Married|Peggy Sue Got Married]] (1986), and her work in the late 1970s as a writer and [[photojournalist|Photojournalism]] for [[New York Rocker|New York Rocker]] magazine.
title: Lisa Jane Persky

abstract: Brooke Vincent (born 4 June 1992) is an English actress. She is known for her portrayal of [[Sophie Webster|Sophie Webster]] in the [[ITV|ITV (TV network)]] soap-opera [[Coronation Street|Coronation Street]] since 2004 where she took over the role from Emma Woodward.
title: Brooke Vincent

abstract: Erik Knudsen (born March 25, 1988) is a Canadian actor. He is perhaps best known for portraying [[Daniel Matthews|List of Saw characters#Daniel Matthews]] in [[Saw II|Saw II]], Alec Sadler in [[Continuum|Continuum (TV series)]], and [[Dale Turner|List of Jericho characters#Dale Turner]] in the CBS series [[Jericho|Jericho (2006 TV series)]].
title: Erik Knudsen

abstract: Edwina Booth (born Josephine Constance Woodruff; September 13, 1904 – May 18, 1991) was an [[American|United States]] [[actress|actress]]. She is best known for the 1931 film [[Trader Horn|Trader Horn (1931 film)]], during the filming of which she contracted an illness which effectively ended her movie career.
title: Edwina Booth

abstract: Maxine Peake (born 14 July 1974) is an English actress. She is best known for her roles as Twinkle in [[Dinnerladies|Dinnerladies (TV series)]] and [[Veronica Ball|List of Shameless characters#Veronica Ball]] in [[Shameless|Shameless (UK TV series)]], barrister Martha Costello in the BBC legal drama [[Silk|Silk (TV series)]], and Grace Middleton in the BBC drama series [[The Village|The Village (2013 TV series)]], as well as starring in Black Mirror episode "[[Metalhead|Metalhead (Black Mirror)]]". She is also an accomplished stage actress, having played the title role in [[Hamlet|Hamlet]].

abstract: Seneca was born Joel McGhee, Jr. in [[Cleveland|Cleveland]], [[Ohio|Ohio]]. Prior to his acting career, he belonged to the R&B singing group The Three Riffs, which was active from the late 1940s and performed at upscale supper clubs in [[New York City|New York City]]. He was also a [[songwriter|songwriter]] and had big hits with "[[Talk to Me|Talk to Me (Joe Seneca song)]]" which was sung by [[Little Willie John|Little Willie John]], and "[[Break It to Me Gently|Break It to Me Gently]]," which was a smash hit twice, once by [[Brenda Lee|Brenda Lee]] in 1962 and once by [[Juice Newton|Juice Newton]] in 1982.
title: Joe Seneca

abstract: Stuart Gordon (born August 11, 1947) is an American [[filmmaker|Filmmaking]], [[theatre director|theatre director]], [[screenwriter|screenwriter]], and [[playwright|playwright]]. Initially recognized for his provocative and frequently controversial work in [[experimental theatre|experimental theatre]], Gordon is perhaps more widely known for work in film. Most of Gordon's cinematic work is in the [[horror|Horror film]] genre, though he has also ventured into [[science fiction|science fiction film]] and [[film noir|film noir]]. Like his friend and fellow filmmaker [[Brian Yuzna|Brian Yuzna]], Gordon is a fan of [[H. P. Lovecraft|H. P. Lovecraft]] and has adapted several of the author's stories for the screen, including [[Re-Animator|Re-Animator]], [[From Beyond|From Beyond (film)]], and [[Dagon|Dagon (2001 movie)]], as well as the [[Masters of Horror|Masters of Horror]] episode [[Dreams in the Witch-House|H. P. Lovecraft's Dreams in the Witch-House]].
title: Stuart Gordon

abstract: Manoj Bajpayee (born 23 April 1969), also credited as Manoj Bajpai, is an Indian film actor who predominantly works in Hindi cinema and has also done [[Telugu|Telugu cinema]] and [[Tamil|Tamil cinema]] language films. He is the recipient of two [[National Film Awards|National Film Awards]] and four [[Filmfare Awards|Filmfare Awards]].
title: Manoj Bajpayee

abstract: Nikkhil Advani (born 28 April 1971) is an [[India|Indian]] film producer, director and screenwriter. He is one of the co-founders of [[Emmay Entertainment|Emmay Entertainment]], a motion picture production company. Nikkhil has worked with famed ecologist Bittu Sehgal and he serves on the advisory board of Save The Tiger’s cause.
title: Nikkhil Advani

abstract: María del Pilar Peña Sánchez (born 14 July 1973), better known as Candela Peña, is a [[Spanish|Spain]] [[actress|actress]].
title: Candela Peña

abstract: Kim Tae-hee was born on 29 March 1980 in [[Ulsan|Ulsan]], [[South Korea|South Korea]]. Her father is Kim Yoo Moon, who established and is chairman of Hankook Union Transportation Company in 1984. She is often involved in various charities to help out underserved youths and broken families in the Ulsan area. She has an older sister, Kim Hee-won, and a younger brother, [[Lee Wan|Lee Wan]]; the latter is also an actor and appeared in her television series [[Stairway to Heaven|Stairway to Heaven (TV series)]]. She attended Samshin Elementary School, Daehyun Middle School (대현중학교) and then enrolled at Ulsan Girls' High School.
title: Kim Tae-hee

abstract: Lil' JJ was born in Little Rock, Arkansas. He won [[BET|Black Entertainment Television]]'s comedy talent search Comin' to the Stage.
title: Lil' JJ

abstract: Michael Emerson (born September 7, 1954) is an American film and television actor who is best known for his roles as [[serial killer|serial killer]] William Hinks on [[The Practice|The Practice]], [[Benjamin Linus|Benjamin Linus]] on [[Lost|Lost (TV series)]], [[Zep Hindle|Zep Hindle]] in the first [[Saw|Saw (2004 film)]] film, and [[Harold Finch|Harold Finch (Person of Interest)]] on the [[CBS|CBS]] series [[Person of Interest|Person of Interest (TV series)]]. Emerson has also worked extensively in theater and narration. He has won two [[Primetime Emmy Award|Primetime Emmy Awards]] and been nominated for three others, as well as receiving other awards and nominations.

abstract: Jonah Bobo (born January 24, 1997) is an American actor and voice actor. He is best known for his role as Danny Budwing in the 2005 film [[Zathura: A Space Adventure|Zathura: A Space Adventure]], and the voice of Austin on [[Nickelodeon|Nickelodeon]]'s [[The Backyardigans|The Backyardigans]].
title: Jonah Bobo

abstract: Ahn Ji-hwan (; born July 24, 1969) is a [[South Korea|South Korean]] [[voice actor|Voice acting in South Korea]], [[actor|actor]] and [[television|television presenter]] and [[radio presenter|radio personality]] who joined [[Munhwa Broadcasting Corporation|Munhwa Broadcasting Corporation]]'s [[Voice Acting Division|MBC Voice Acting Division]] in 1993 and debuted with his role as Prince Dandarn (known as Prince Omar in South Korea) on the Korean dub of [[Time Travel Tondekeman|Time Travel Tondekeman]].
title: Ahn Ji-hwan

abstract: Brenda Bruce [[OBE|Officer of the Order of the British Empire]] (7 July 1919   – 19 February 1996) was a British actress. She had a long and successful career in the theatre, radio, film and television.
title: Brenda Bruce

abstract: Elizabeth Melise Jow (born February 18, 1991), best known as Malese Jow and recently Melise, is an American actress and singer. She is known for her roles as Geena Fabiano on the [[Nickelodeon|Nickelodeon]] sitcom [[Unfabulous|Unfabulous]], Lucy Stone on the Nickelodeon musical sitcom [[Big Time Rush|Big Time Rush]] and as Anna, a teenage vampire on [[The CW|The CW]]'s fantasy drama [[The Vampire Diaries|The Vampire Diaries]]. She starred as Julia Yeung in the short-lived CW science fiction romantic drama [[Star-Crossed|Star-Crossed (TV series)]]. Jow starred as Mareth Ravenlock in season two of [[The Shannara Chronicles|The Shannara Chronicles]].
title: Malese Jow

abstract: Born in [[Sabinas|Sabinas]], [[Coahuila|Coahuila]], on March 26, 1904, Emilio Fernández Romo was the son of a revolutionary general, while his mother was a descendant of [[Kickapoo|Kickapoo people]] Indians. He was the older brother of the Mexican actor [[Jaime Fernández|Jaime Fernández (actor)]]. From his parents he inherited a deep feeling and love for his country, as well as its customs and indigenous beliefs, that led him to build his personality as a man of impetuous character. From his earliest years and throughout his life, he was characterized by a strong personality, brash character and pride in his indigenous roots, traits forged by the great influence exercised on him by his family.
title: Emilio Fernández

abstract: Sudhir Dalvi is an [[India|Indian]] actor. He first came to prominence for portraying [[Guru|Guru]] [[Vashishta|Vashishta]] in [[Ramanand Sagar|Ramanand Sagar]]'s TV series [[Ramayan|Ramayan (TV series)]] and is well known for his role as [[Sai Baba|Sai Baba of Shirdi]].He has acted as Sai Baba in Manoj Kumar's feature film [[Shirdi Ke Sai Baba|Shirdi Ke Sai Baba]] which is a milestone role in Bollywood.
title: Sudhir Dalvi

abstract: Cecilia Edith Rotenberg Gutkin better known as Cecilia Roth (; born August 8, 1956) is an [[Argentine|Argentine]] [[actress|actress]]. She is the winner of two [[Goya Awards|Goya Awards]] and a [[European Film Award|European Film Awards]]. She is known for being an "[[Almodóvar|Pedro Almodóvar]] girl" and the "muse" of [[Fito Páez|Fito Páez]] during the 1990s.
title: Cecilia Roth

abstract: Jussie Smollett (born June 21, 1982) is an American actor, singer, director and photographer. He began his career as a [[child actor|child actor]] in 1987 starring in commercials and films, including [[The Mighty Ducks|The Mighty Ducks]] (1992) and Rob Reiner's [[North|North (1994 film)]] (1994). In 2015, Smollett attracted international attention and received rave reviews for his portrayal of musician [[Jamal Lyon|Jamal Lyon]] in the [[Fox|Fox Broadcasting Company]] drama series [[Empire|Empire (2015 TV series)]]. Smollett has also appeared in [[Ridley Scott|Ridley Scott]]'s science fiction film [[Alien: Covenant|Alien: Covenant]] as Ricks and in [[Marshall|Marshall (film)]] as Langston Hughes.
title: Jussie Smollett

abstract: Dean Devlin (born August 27, 1962) is an [[America|United Statesn]] screenwriter, producer, television director and former actor. He is the founder of the [[production company|production company]] [[Electric Entertainment|Electric Entertainment]].
title: Dean Devlin

abstract: Zoe Carides (born 19 February 1962) is an [[Australian|Australian]] actress of film and television, who is best known for her roles in Death in Brunswick as Sophie, [[G. P.|G. P.]] as Dr. Sonia Kapek and [[Grass Roots|Grass Roots (TV series)]] as Liz Murray. Carides was born in Sydney,.

abstract: Richard Kristian Rama Gutiérrez (born January 21, 1984), popularly known as Richard Gutierrez, is an American-born [[Filipino|Filipino people]] actor and model. He is one of the sons of actor [[Eddie Gutierrez|Eddie Gutierrez (actor)]].
title: Richard Gutierrez

abstract: Ella Guevara (born Janella Denise Yuson Guevara; August 19, 1998, [[Quezon City|Quezon City]]) is a [[Filipina|Filipino people]] [[child actress|child actress]]. She rose to fame through her appearance on a talent search on [[television|television]] called [[StarStruck Kids|StarStruck Kids]] that aired on the Filipino television channel [[GMA 7|GMA Network]]. Although she did not go on to win the said competition, she has since gone on to make several television and [[film|film]] appearances, mostly on [[the same network|GMA Network]] and has proven her worth as a child actress when she won as best child actress 5 times in a row, making her one of the most popular child actresses in the Philippines.
title: Ella Guevara

abstract: Isabel Coixet (Sant Adrià del Besós, Barcelona, April, 9 of 1960) started filming when she was given an 8mm camera on the occasion of her First Communion. After obtaining a BA degree in History at Barcelona University, where she majored in Eighteenth and Nineteenth Century History, she worked in advertising and spot writing with a magazine called Fotogramas. She continued working in the world of advertising, gaining a brillian curriculum in that field, standing out as creative director of the agency JWT.
title: Isabel Coixet

abstract: Rodney Eastman (born July 20, 1967) is a [[Canadian|Canadians]] [[actor|actor]]. He is also a musician in a band called [[King Straggler|King Straggler]] with fellow actors [[John Hawkes|John Hawkes (actor)]] and [[Brent Gore|Brent Gore]]. The band resides in [[Los Angeles|Los Angeles]], [[California|California]].
title: Rodney Eastman

abstract: Yolande Moreau (born 27 February 1953) is a Belgian comedian, actress, [[film director|film director]] and [[screenwriter|screenwriter]]. She has won three [[César Awards|César Awards]] from four nominations.
title: Yolande Moreau

abstract: Anna Jullienne Kermode (born 7 November 1982) is a [[New Zealand|New Zealand]] actress, best known for her role as [[Nurse Maia Jeffries|Maia Jeffries]] in the television series [[Shortland Street|Shortland Street]].
title: Anna Jullienne

abstract: Gwen Taylor (born 19 February 1939) is an English actress who has appeared in many [[British television|British television]] programmes. She is known for her roles as Amy Pearce in the sitcom [[Duty Free|Duty Free (TV series)]] (1984–86); Barbara Liversidge in the sitcom [[Barbara|Barbara (TV series)]] (1999–2003); Peggy Armstrong in the drama series [[Heartbeat|Heartbeat (UK TV series)]] (2005–09), and [[Anne Foster|Anne Foster]] in the soap opera [[Coronation Street|Coronation Street]] (2011–12). She was nominated for the 1990 [[BAFTA TV Award for Best Actress|British Academy Television Award for Best Actress]] for her role as Rita Simcock in the comedy series [[A Bit of a Do|A Bit of a Do]] (1989). Her film appearances include [[Monty Python's Life of Brian|Monty Python's Life of Brian]] (1979) and [[The Lady in the Van|The Lady in the Van]] (2015).
title: Gwen Taylor

abstract: Gia Carides (born 7 June 1964) is an [[Australian|Australian]] actress. She is best known for her portrayals of Liz Holt in [[Strictly Ballroom|Strictly Ballroom]], Susy Connor in [[Brilliant Lies|Brilliant Lies]], and Cousin Nikki in [[My Big Fat Greek Wedding|My Big Fat Greek Wedding]].
title: Gia Carides

abstract: Susanne Aartun Sundfør (; born 19 March 1986) is a Norwegian singer-songwriter and record producer. Born and raised in [[Haugesund|Haugesund]], Sundfør embarked on her musical career two years prior to the release of her [[eponymous debut album|Susanne Sundfør (album)]] (2007), which reached number three on the Norwegian album chart. It was followed by [[Take One|Take One (Susanne Sundfør album)]], a live album consisting of songs from her debut. Her second studio album, [[The Brothel|The Brothel]], was released in 2010 to commercial success in Norway, peaking at number one and becoming the best-selling album of that year. The album saw a shift from the piano-driven pop of previous releases towards a more ambitious and [[electronic|electronic music]] direction. In 2011, she released a live instrumental album composed solely of synthesizers, [[A Night at Salle Pleyel|A Night at Salle Pleyel]], serving as a commission piece.
title: Susanne Sundfør

abstract: Gregory Widen is an American [[screenwriter|screenwriter]] and [[film director|film director]]. He is the creator of the [[Highlander|Highlander (franchise)]] film and television franchise, and the writer-director of the [[cult|Cult film]] [[horror film|horror film]] [[The Prophecy|The Prophecy]].
title: Gregory Widen

abstract: Jeremy Ratchford (born August 6, 1965) is a [[Canadian|Canadians]] [[actor|actor]]. He starred as Nick Vera on the [[TV series|TV series]] [[Cold Case|Cold Case]].
title: Jeremy Ratchford

abstract: Choi Min-sik (born May 30, 1962) is a [[South Korea|South Korean]] actor. He is best known for his critically acclaimed roles in [[Oldboy|Oldboy (2003 film)]] (2003), [[I Saw the Devil|I Saw the Devil]] (2010), and [[The Admiral: Roaring Currents|The Admiral: Roaring Currents]] (2014). He also starred alongside [[Scarlett Johansson|Scarlett Johansson]] in the 2014 French film [[Lucy|Lucy (2014 film)]].
title: Choi Min-sik

abstract: Emily Williams was born on 8 October 1984 in [[South Auckland|South Auckland]], New Zealand, to a [[Samoan|Samoans]] family. Williams' has an older sister — [[Lavina Williams|Lavina Williams]], who was a contestant on [[Australian Idol|Australian Idol]] in 2006 and also a younger brother — [[J.Williams|J.Williams (singer)]], a singer/dancer in New Zealand. During Willams' early years, her father was very strict when it came to devoting yourself to religion and music. Before appearing on Idol, she worked as a forklift operator from [[Inala, Queensland|Inala, Queensland]].
title: Emily Williams

abstract: Alona Tal (, ; born October 20, 1983) is an [[Israeli|Israelis]] singer and actress. She is known for her roles in [[Veronica Mars|Veronica Mars]] as cheerleader [[Meg Manning|List of Veronica Mars characters#Meg Manning]] and [[Supernatural|Supernatural (U.S. TV series)]] as [[Jo Harvelle|Jo Harvelle]].
title: Alona Tal

abstract: Freddie Davies was born in [[Brixton|Brixton]], [[London|London]] in 1937, the grandson of [[music hall|music hall]] comedian Jack Herbert. At the start of the [[Second World War|Second World War]], Davies was evacuated to [[Seend|Seend]] in [[Wiltshire|Wiltshire]], subsequently to [[Torquay|Torquay]] in [[Devon|Devon]] and then to [[Salford|County Borough of Salford]], [[Lancashire|Lancashire]] in 1941.
title: Freddie Davies

abstract: Lita Grey (born Lillita Louise MacMurray, April 15, 1908 – December 29, 1995), who was known for most of her life as Lita Grey Chaplin, was an American actress and the second wife of [[Charlie Chaplin|Charlie Chaplin]].
title: Lita Grey

abstract: Nina Foch (; born Nina Consuelo Maud Fock; April 20, 1924 – December 5, 2008) was a [[Dutch American|Dutch American]] actress. After signing a contract with [[Columbia Pictures|Columbia Pictures]] at age 19, Foch became a regular in the studio's [[horror pictures|horror film]] and [[films noir|films noir]] before establishing herself as a leading lady in the mid-1940s through the 1950s, often playing roles as cool, aloof sophisticates. Her career spanned six decades, consisting of over 50 feature films and over 100 television appearances.
title: Nina Foch

abstract: Currie Graham (born February 26, 1967) is a [[Canadian|Canadians]] [[stage|Theatre]], [[film|film]] and [[television|television]] [[actor|actor]].
title: Currie Graham

abstract: The Rajshahi Cadet College is 25   km away from Rajshahi city. The college, the foundation of which was laid by the then President of Pakistan, Field Marshal Ayub Khan, on 6 November 1964, was formally inaugurated on 11 February 1966 as Ayub Cadet college, which was renamed soon after the independence of Bangladesh.
title: Rajshahi Cadet College

abstract: Maize High School is a fully accredited public high school located in [[Maize, Kansas|Maize, Kansas]], United States, serving students in grades 9-12. The current principal is Dr. Chris Botts. Maize High School is one of two high schools located within the city limits of Maize, Kansas. The school colors are red and white, although black is considered an unofficial third color. The average annual enrollment is approximately 2,000 students.
title: Maize High School

abstract: Ohr HaTorah Day School was an [[Orthodox|Orthodox Judaism]] [[Jewish day school|Jewish day school]], located in the [[River Heights|River Heights, Manitoba]] neighbourhood of [[Winnipeg|Winnipeg]], [[Manitoba|Manitoba]], [[Canada|Canada]]. It existed between 1998 - 2011, when it closed due to declining enrollment.
title: Ohr HaTorah Day School

abstract: Ross Sheppard High School or École Ross Sheppard (SHEP or Ross Shep) is a [[high school|secondary school]] located in a northwest neighbourhood of Coronation Park, in [[Edmonton|Edmonton]], [[Alberta|Alberta]], [[Canada|Canada]]. The school colours are Colombia blue and navy blue. It is represented by a [[Thunderbird|Thunderbird (mythology)]], also known as a T-Bird. Outside the school is a totem pole with a T-Bird on top, representing the school mascot. The school serves the needs of over 2,000 students attending grades 10-12, including approximately 35 international students annually. Ross Sheppard School's philosophy is based on four pillars - Academics, Arts, Athletics and Service.
title: Ross Sheppard High School

abstract: Wichita North High School, known locally as North, is a fully accredited high school located in [[Wichita, Kansas|Wichita, Kansas]], United States, serving students in grades 9-12. The school was founded in 1929 on the site where the United States government sent Company 'A' of the 10th Division to the forks of the [[Arkansas River|Arkansas River]] to protect the incoming cattle drivers from the Indians.
title: Wichita North High School

abstract: The Affiliated High School of Peking University (), abbreviated as Běi Dà Fù Zhōng (北大附中) or BDFZ, is a major public high school in Beijing that offers 7th-12th grade education. It is regarded as one of the most prestigious high schools in China. In a 2016 ranking of Chinese high schools that send students to study in American universities, BDFZ ranked number 12 in mainland China in terms of the number of students entering top American universities.
title: Affiliated High School of Peking University

abstract: International School Brunei (ISB) is an [[international school|international school]] split over two sites, one located in the Sungai Akar area of [[Bandar Seri Begawan|Bandar Seri Begawan]], Brunei and the other located in [[Kuala Belait|Kuala Belait]] in the Belait district. It is the first international school to be set up in Brunei. The current executive principal, as of 2014, is Steven Paul Geraghty. The school has four sections: [[pre-kindergarten|pre-kindergarten]], [[kindergarten|kindergarten]], primary, and secondary.
title: International School Brunei

abstract: Drummond High School is a public school serving grades 9 through 12 in [[Drummond|Drummond, Wisconsin]], [[Bayfield County|Bayfield County]], [[Wisconsin|Wisconsin]], [[United States|United States]]. It is a fairly small school that holds about 120 students. Drummond High School is the only high school in the Drummond Area School District, which serves 720 square miles. The district contains the towns of Barnes, Cable, Delta, Drummond, Grand View, Kelly, Lincoln, Mason, Namakagon, Highland and the Village of Mason.
title: Drummond High School

abstract: Benowa State High School (BSHS) is an Independent, Co-Educational school located on the Gold Coast, Australia, which was founded in 1980. It is part of the [[Council of International Schools|Council of International Schools]] (CIS) and hosts [[exchange student|exchange students]] from Asia, America, Africa and Europe. It commenced a French Immersion program in 1985 and was the first school to offer Marine Biology as a subject in the Queensland curriculum. In 2015, they commenced their Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) based educational program.
title: Benowa State High School

abstract: Lourdes Public School and Junior College was established in 1996 by Lourdes Educational Trust on behalf of Lourdes Forane Church which belongs to the Archdiocese of [[Changanacherry|Changanacherry]]. The Archbishop of Changanacherry is its patron and the vicar of Lourdes Forane Church is the Manager. It is an English medium co-educational institution recognized by [[Central Board of Secondary Education|Central Board of Secondary Education]]. The school is located in the heart of [[Kottayam|Kottayam]] town, opposite the District Headquarters in the state of [[Kerala|Kerala]], India. The school was awarded minority status by the [[National Minorities Commission|National Minorities Commission]] in 2012. Lourdes Public School was ranked 1st among the Co-ed Day Schools in Kottayam, 2nd in Kerala and 99th in India in the Indian Day Schools League Table by Education World for 2013.
title: Lourdes Public School and Junior College

abstract: Cocalico Senior High School is a [[public secondary school|public secondary school]] in [[Denver|Denver, Pennsylvania]], [[Pennsylvania|Pennsylvania]], United States, whose enrollment consists of students in grades 9–12. The school is part of the [[Cocalico School District|Cocalico School District]], serving [[East Cocalico Township|East Cocalico Township, Pennsylvania]], [[West Cocalico Township|West Cocalico Township, Pennsylvania]], Denver, and [[Adamstown|Adamstown, Pennsylvania]] in northern [[Lancaster County|Lancaster County, PA]].
title: Cocalico Senior High School

abstract: École L'Odyssée (, English: "Odyssey School") is a [[public|Public school (government funded)]] [[francophone|francophone]] high school in [[Moncton|Moncton]], [[New Brunswick|New Brunswick]], Canada. It is part of the province's [[Francophone Sud School District|Francophone Sud School District]], offering education to students from grade nine to twelve. The school opened on September 30, 2005 as part of a $24.2 million project, alongside the adjoining [[middle school|Middle school#Canada and the United States]], [[École Le Mascaret|École Le Mascaret]]. École L'Odyssée was conceived as a way to alleviate the overcrowding problem at [[École Mathieu-Martin|École Mathieu-Martin]] in nearby [[Dieppe|Dieppe, New Brunswick]], a problem the district has had in the past. The Odyssée-Mascaret project, as well as the future [[Carrefour de l'Acadie|École Carrefour de l'Acadie]] middle school, replaced the former École Beauséjour and École Vanier complexes. This move allowed the [[Moncton Hospital|Moncton Hospital]] to expand, while the Vanier establishment made way for medical offices. On September 9, 2009, the school was given permission to begin an $884,000 expansion for its far side, allowing for a larger space to be reserved for its infirmary and orientation center.
title: École L'Odyssée

abstract: Lawrence Free State High School (FSHS or LFS) is a [[public|Public high school]] [[secondary school|secondary school]] in [[Lawrence, Kansas|Lawrence, Kansas]], USA operated by [[Unified School District|Unified school district]] 497, and serves students of grades [[9|Ninth grade]] to [[12|Twelfth grade]]. It is one of two public high schools within the city limits of Lawrence. The current enrollment is approximately 1,825 students. The school colors are hunter green and silver. The current principal is Myron Graber.
title: Lawrence Free State High School

abstract: Kooringal High School (KHS) is a secondary, partially selective, [[co-educational|co-educational]], [[public|Public school (government funded)]] [[high school|high school]], located in the [[Wagga Wagga|Wagga Wagga, New South Wales]] suburb of [[Kooringal|Kooringal, New South Wales]], [[New South Wales|New South Wales]], [[Australia|Australia]].
title: Kooringal High School

abstract: Holcomb High School (HHS) is a [[public high school|Secondary education in the United States]] in [[Holcomb|Holcomb, Kansas]], [[Kansas|Kansas]], United States operated by Holcomb USD 363, and serves students of grades [[9|Ninth grade]] to [[12|Twelfth grade]]. The school colors are black and orange; the enrollment for the 2009-2010 school year was approximately 269 students.
title: Holcomb High School

abstract: Mapulang Lupa National High School is a public secondary school located in [[Valenzuela City|Valenzuela City]]. Formerly known as Valenzuela National High School - Mapulang Lupa Annex, it was established in 2003 and gain its independent status on September 13, 2006 through House Bill #5776 (3RS-13 C) sponsored by the late [[Congressman Antonio M. Serapio|Antonio Serapio]] together with then Albay representative [[Joey S. Salceda|Joey Salceda]] and Negros Occidental representative Jose Carlos V. Lacson during the [[13th Congress|13th Congress of the Philippines]]. The current school principal is Mrs. Edelina I. Golloso.
title: Mapulang Lupa National High School

abstract: Parry Sound High School (PSHS) is a [[public|state school]] [[high school|High school#Canada]] in the town of [[Parry Sound|Parry Sound, Ontario]], [[Ontario|Ontario]], [[Canada|Canada]]. The school is one of the largest in the [[Near North District School Board|Near North District School Board]], with 842 students , and serves as the only high school in Parry Sound.
title: Parry Sound High School

abstract: Berlin Brothersvalley High School is a small Public High School, located in the central [[Somerset County|Somerset County, Pennsylvania]] town of Berlin. The High School is connected to the Middle School and Elementary School.
title: Berlin Brothersvalley High School

abstract: Chestnut Ridge Senior High School is a small, rural public, comprehensive [[high school|high school]] located in the Chestnut Ridge region of Bedford County, Pennsylvania. In 2015, enrollment was 639 pupils in grades 8th through 12th, with 42% of pupils eligible for a free lunch due to family poverty. Additionally, 15.9% of pupils received special education services, while 4.22% of pupils were identified as [[gifted|Intellectual giftedness]]. In 2014, the student body makeup was 56 percent male and 44 percent female. The total minority enrollment was 3 percent. Chestnut Ridge Senior High School is the only high school in the [[Chestnut Ridge School District|Chestnut Ridge School District]]. The school employed 33 teachers. Per the PA Department of Education, 100% of the teachers were rated "Highly Qualified" under the federal [[No Child Left Behind|No Child Left Behind]] Act.
title: Chestnut Ridge Senior High School

abstract: Hays High School is a coeducational [[public|Public high school]] [[secondary school|secondary school]] located in [[Hays, Kansas|Hays, Kansas]] operated by [[Unified School District|Unified school district]] [[489|Hays Unified School District 489]].
title: Hays High School

abstract: Pathways Schools is a group of International K12 and Pre-Primary schools located in Gurgaon and Noida (Delhi NCR), India. The curriculum includes the [[Primary Years Programme (PYP)|IB Primary Years Programme]], [[Middle Years Programme (MYP)|IB Middle Years Programme]] and [[Diploma Programme|IB Diploma Programme]] (DP) of the [[International Baccalaureate Organisation|International Baccalaureate Organisation]] of Geneva. Pathways World School, Aravali was the first IB Continuum School in North India and the first residential school in the region to follow the IB curriculum. The K12 schools in Gurgaon and Noida are day schools, whereas the K12 school at Aravali is a day cum residential school offering day, week and term boarding options.
title: Pathways Schools

abstract: Jean Vanier Catholic Secondary School (JVCSS), simply Jean Vanier or Vanier is a Roman Catholic [[high school|high school]], part of the [[Toronto Catholic District School Board|Toronto Catholic District School Board]] (TCDSB), in the [[Eglinton East|Eglinton East]] neighbourhood of [[Scarborough|Scarborough, Toronto]] in [[Toronto|Toronto]], [[Ontario|Ontario]], Canada. The school was opened as [[Tabor Park Vocational School|Tabor Park Vocational School]] (1964-1986) by the [[Scarborough Board of Education|Scarborough Board of Education]] and later owned by the [[Toronto District School Board|Toronto District School Board]], after which the building was leased to the TCDSB in 1989.
title: Jean Vanier Catholic Secondary School

abstract: Rotorua Lakes High School, commonly known as Lakes High, or simply Lakes, is a state school educating boys and girls from Year 9 to Year 13. It is situated in Owhata, in the eastern suburbs of [[Rotorua|Rotorua]], [[New Zealand|New Zealand]], and draws many of its students from the eastern Rotorua urban area, and the semi-rural lakes communities to the south and east of Rotorua; this giving rise to the name Rotorua Lakes.
title: Rotorua Lakes High School

abstract: Destrehan High School is a public high school located in [[Destrehan, Louisiana|Destrehan, Louisiana]]. The [[St. Charles Parish Public School System|St. Charles Parish Public School System]] school serves all students on the East bank of the [[Mississippi River|Mississippi River]] in grades 9 through 12.
title: Destrehan High School

abstract: HKFEW Wong Cho Bau Secondary School is an aided [[secondary school|secondary school]] in [[Hong Kong|Hong Kong]]. Founded in September 2003, the school is fully subsidized by [[Government of Hong Kong|Government of Hong Kong]]. Most subjects of the school are taught in Chinese.
