Situated in [[Fu Tung Estate|Fu Tung Estate]], [[Tung Chung|Tung Chung]], [[New Territories|New Territories]], the [[grammar school|grammar school]] had 65 teachers, as of 2016. Established by [[Hong Kong Federation of Education Workers|Hong Kong Federation of Education Workers]], the school is the only secondary school governed by the teachers union.
title: HKFEW Wong Cho Bau Secondary School

abstract: Homewood High School (HHS) is a [[public|State school]] [[high school|high school]], serving grades 9-12, in the [[Birmingham, Alabama|Birmingham, Alabama]] suburb of [[Homewood|Homewood, Alabama]]. It is the only high school in the [[Homewood City School System|Homewood City School District]]. The student enrollment for the 2014-15 academic year was 988. The principal is Zachary Barnes. In the summer of 2007, the front of the school was remodeled, and a new building, Pathways Alternative School, was constructed in the upper level of the student parking lot. The front office and lobby were also remodeled in the summer of 2008.
title: Homewood High School

abstract: Sekolah Kebangsaan Sungai Binjai ([[Jawi|Jawi script]]:سكوله كبڠسأن سوڠاي بينجاي), commonly known as SK Sungai Binjai or short, SKSB (or sometimes, [[Binjai|Mangifera caesia]]), is a primary National School type situated at Batu 6, [[Pekan Meru|Meru, Malaysia]], at the city of [[Klang|Klang (city)]] and the state of [[Selangor|Selangor]]. The name of the school, Sungai Binjai, literally translated in English as The [[River (Sungai)|River]] of the [[Malaysian Mango|Mangifera caesia]], taken from a river flowing nearby the school.
title: Sekolah Kebangsaan Sungai Binjai

abstract: Ramakrishna Mission Shilpayatana is a Private [[Industrial Training Institute|Industrial Training Institute]] with four [[I.T.I.|Industrial training institute]] Trade courses - [[Electrician|Electrician]], [[Fitter|Fitter (occupation)]], [[Turner|Turning]] and [[Welder|Welder]](Gas & Electric) - under Craftsman Training Scheme (C.T.S.) affiliated to National Council for Vocational Training (N.C.V.T), New Delhi. It was established in 1963 as a Government Sponsored Junior Technical School, during the birth centenary celebrations of [[Swami Vivekananda|Swami Vivekananda]]. Swamiji is the greatest and most remarkable philosopher sage and karma yogi one comes across in Modern India, who sailed to the United States of America in 1893 to find means for the material development of the masses of India. He represented [[Hinduism|Hinduism]] at the [[Chicago Parliament of Religions|Parliament of the World's Religions]]. This institution has been nurtured with [[Swami Vivekananda|Swami Vivekananda]]'s ideas to help build a bridge for the masses, especially in rural India, to connect to modern industry. Hundreds of youth who would otherwise have had no scope to go in for higher education have been trained by us in skills and are gainfully employed in various well-known industries. It is located in [[Belur Math|Belur Math]], P.O. Belur Math, Dt. [[Howrah|Howrah]], Pin- 711202, [[Belur, West Bengal|Belur, West Bengal]].
title: Ramakrishna Mission Shilpayatana

abstract: Avalon Heights International School is a coeducational secondary school located in [[Vashi|Vashi]], [[Navi Mumbai|Navi Mumbai]]. It is affiliated to the [[Indian Certificate of Secondary Education|Indian Certificate of Secondary Education]] (ICSE) and was established in 1998. The school has over 1200 students and is located near APMC Market in Navi Mumbai.
title: Avalon Heights International School

abstract: Ubay National Science High School (Filipino: Mataas na Pambansang Paaralang Pang-Agham ng Ubay), commonly called USci or SciHigh is a special public high school in the Philippines. The campus is located in the southern tip of Barangay [[Fatima|Fatima, Ubay]] in the municipality of [[Ubay|Ubay, Bohol]] in the province of [[Bohol|Bohol]]. The school is duly administered by the [[Department of Education|Department of Education (Philippines)]]. It is the second science high school in Bohol, next to [[Tagbilaran City|Tagbilaran City Science High School]].
title: Ubay National Science High School

abstract: La Purisima Concepcion Elementary School is located in Hda. La Purisima Concepcion, Brgy. E Lopez [[Silay City|Silay City]], [[Negros Occidental|Negros Occidental]] five kilometers away from the city proper. Agriculture is the primary means of income of the community. Almost 70% engage in agriculture 30% in non- agricultural works.
title: La Purisima Concepcion Elementary School

abstract: The Maine Girls' Academy (MGA) was an [[independent|Independent school]] [[high school|Secondary school]] for girls located in [[Portland|Portland, Maine]], [[Maine|Maine]]. Founded in 2016 as the successor to [[Catherine McAuley High School|Catherine McAuley High School]], the school was [[nonsectarian|nonsectarian]] and not sponsored by the [[Sisters of Mercy|Sisters of Mercy]], which previously sponsored Catherine McAuley High School.
title: The Maine Girls' Academy

abstract: Rio Vista High School is a public high school located in the city of [[Rio Vista, California|Rio Vista, California]]. The school is in the [[River Delta Unified School District|River Delta Unified School District]].
title: Rio Vista High School

abstract: Suncoast Community High School is a [[public|Public school (government funded)]] [[magnet|magnet school]] [[high school|high school]] (grades 9-12) in [[Riviera Beach, Florida|Riviera Beach, Florida]]. The school's campus was built in 1955 as Riviera Beach High School. It was desegregated in the 1960s and renamed in 1970. It became a [[magnet school|magnet school]] in 1989 and has selective admissions.
title: Suncoast Community High School

abstract: The Baltimore City College, known colloquially as City, City College, B.C.C. and nicknamed "The Castle on the Hill" is a [[public magnet|Magnet school]] [[high school|Secondary education in the United States#High school]] in [[Baltimore, Maryland|Baltimore, Maryland]], United States. Established and authorized by resolution in March 1839 by the [[Baltimore City Council|Baltimore City Council]], signed / approved by the 10th [[Mayor|List of mayors of Baltimore]], [[Sheppard C. Leakin|Sheppard C. Leakin]] (1838-1840), and opened in October 1839 as "The High School", "City" is the third oldest active public high school in the US. A citywide [[college preparatory school|college preparatory school]] with a [[liberal arts|liberal arts]] focus, The Baltimore City College has [[selective admissions criteria|selective school]] based on entrance exams and middle school grades. The four-year City College curriculum includes the [[IB Middle Years Programme|IB Middle Years Programme]] and the [[IB Diploma Programme|IB Diploma Programme]] of the [[International Baccalaureate|International Baccalaureate]] curriculums since the mid 1980s.
title: Baltimore City College

abstract: Baylor School, commonly called Baylor, is a [[private|private school]], [[coeducational|Mixed-sex education]] [[prep school|University-preparatory school]] in [[Chattanooga|Chattanooga, Tennessee]], [[Tennessee|Tennessee]]. Founded in 1893, the school currently sits atop a [[campus|campus]] and enrolls students in grades 6-12, including boarding students in grades 9-12. These students are served by Baylor's 148 members of faculty, over two-thirds of whom hold advanced degrees, including nearly 40 adults who live on campus and serve as dorm parents. Baylor has had a student win the [[Siemens Award for Advanced Placement in math and science|Siemens Competition]] and a teacher receive the National Siemens Award for Exemplary Teaching. The school is also an athletic powerhouse, having the best high school sports program in Tennessee and in the top 25 nationwide according to [[Sports Illustrated|Sports Illustrated]]. In the past 21 years, Baylor has won a remarkable 157 state championships, including a national record of 16 consecutive victories in women's golf from 1995-2012. They have also repeatedly been named national champions in both men's and women's swimming by Swimming World Magazine. For the 2011-12 school year, Baylor enrolled 1070 young men and women, 20% of whom lived on campus as representatives of 25 states and 30 countries.
title: Baylor School

abstract: The Doon School (informally Doon) is a boys-only [[independent|independent school]] [[boarding school|boarding school]] in [[Dehradun|Dehradun]], [[Uttarakhand|Uttarakhand]], [[India|India]]. .It was founded in 1935 by [[Satish Ranjan Das|Satish Ranjan Das]], a [[Kolkata|Kolkata]] lawyer, who prevised a school modelled on the [[British|United Kingdom]] [[public school|public school (United Kingdom)]], but conscious of Indian ambitions and desires. The school's first [[headmaster|Head teacher]] was an Englishman, [[Arthur E. Foot|Arthur Foot]], who had spent nine years as a science master at [[Eton College|Eton College]], England before coming to Doon, and returned to [[England|England]] right after India's independence. The current headmaster is [[Matthew Raggett|Matthew Raggett]], who succeeded [[Peter McLaughlin|Peter McLaughlin]] in 2016, and is the fourth British headmaster in Doon's history. He is a member of [[Headmasters' and Headmistresses' Conference|Headmasters' and Headmistresses' Conference]], [[UK|UK]].
title: The Doon School

abstract: The Maggie L. Walker Governor's School for Government and International Studies (MLWGSGIS) is a public regional [[magnet high school|magnet school]] in [[Richmond|Richmond, Virginia]], [[Virginia|Virginia]].
title: Maggie L. Walker Governor's School for Government and International Studies

abstract: Robert Service High School is a public [[high school|high school]] in [[Anchorage|Anchorage]], [[Alaska|Alaska]]. It had an enrollment of 1,779 students as of August 2, 2016. Serving grades 9 through 12, the school was named for the poet [[Robert W. Service|Robert W. Service]]. Part of the [[Anchorage School District|Anchorage School District]], the school opened in 1971 and was the last of four high schools built by the district (its lineal predecessor, the Anchorage Independent School District) within a decade. Service High originally operated as Service-Hanshew; as was the case common within Anchorage during that time, [[junior|middle school]] and senior [[high school|high schools]] shared a single building. Included in the case with other junior-senior high schools in Anchorage, a separate structure was built to educate the junior student body and referred as [[Hanshew Middle School|Hanshew Middle School]] in the period of the [[1980s oil glut|1980s oil glut]]. This is located approximately two miles west of Service along the Lake Otis Parkway. The school completed a partial renovation in 2005. The official school colors are green and gold, and its [[mascot|mascot]] is the [[cougar|cougar]]. Service High School's current principal is Frank Hauser.
title: Service High School

abstract: Nan Chiau High School (NCHS) () is a premier [[co-educational|co-educational]] institution in [[Singapore|Singapore]] affiliated to [[Singapore Hokkien Huay Kuan|Singapore Hokkien Huay Kuan]]. It offers the four-year Express (Special) course for [[secondary education|Secondary education in Singapore]].
title: Nan Chiau High School

abstract: The Zemun Gymnasium ([[Serbian|Serbian language]]: Земунска гимназија / Zemunska gimnazija) is the most prominent [[gymnasium|Gymnasium (school)]] in [[Belgrade|Belgrade]], [[Serbia|Serbia]]. It is located in [[Belgrade|Belgrade]]’s [[Zemun|Zemun]] municipality. Founded in 1858, it's Belgrade second oldest, after the [[First Belgrade Gymnasium|First Belgrade Gymnasium]] (founded in 1839), and Serbia's sixth oldest gymnasium, after those in [[Sremski Karlovci|Sremski Karlovci]] (founded in 1791), [[Novi Sad|Novi Sad]] (founded in 1810), [[Kragujevac|Kragujevac]] (founded in 1833) and [[Šabac|Šabac]] (founded in 1837). By the number of students, it is the largest gymnasium in Serbia today.
title: Zemun Gymnasium

abstract: Mills High School is a [[public|Public school (government funded)]] [[high school|high school]] in [[Millbrae|Millbrae, California]], [[California|California]], one of seven in the [[San Mateo Union High School District|San Mateo Union High School District]].
title: Mills High School

abstract: Richmond Secondary School has the distinction of being the City of Richmond’s first high school. Originally established in 1927 on Cambie and Sexsmith street as Richmond High School, it would undergo numerous location, name and organizational structure changes throughout its history.
title: Richmond Secondary School

abstract: Cadet College Kohat is a highly prestigious military based boarding school for boys of grades 8th through 12th. The high school is located on the outskirts of [[Kohat|Kohat]], [[Pakistan|Pakistan]].
title: Cadet College Kohat

abstract: Bellarine Secondary College is a multi-campus school on the [[Bellarine Peninsula|Bellarine Peninsula]], Australia. The college consists of 2 campuses, one in [[Ocean Grove|Ocean Grove, Victoria]], and the main campus in [[Drysdale|Drysdale, Victoria]]. The larger and main campus in Drysdale holds the students in years 9, 10, 11 and 12, while the smaller Ocean Grove campus holds the students in Years 7 and 8. The Drysdale campus holds around 1000 approx. students, and the Ocean Grove campus accommodates around 400 students. It has a SEAL ([[Select Entry Accelerated Learning|Select Entry Accelerated Learning]]) class, which means the students are able to do years 7-10 in 3, not 4 years. This also means that students have 3 years to do VCE, not 2.
title: Bellarine Secondary College

abstract: Wichita Northwest High School, known locally as Northwest High, is a fully accredited public [[high school|high school]] located in [[Wichita, Kansas|Wichita, Kansas]], [[USA|United States]] that serves over 1,500 students in grades 9-12.
title: Wichita Northwest High School

abstract: New Indian Model School was started in 1988 and is located in [[Al Garhoud|Al Garhoud]], [[Dubai|Dubai]], [[United Arab Emirates|United Arab Emirates]]. They started the school by renting apartments. The onset of the heavy migration of workers and labourers from [[Indian subcontinent|Indian subcontinent]] to Dubai, during the oil boom, was particularly good for the school. The school provided concessions for families sending multiple children. The student population mainly come from [[India|India]].
title: New Indian Model School

abstract: Campus High School is a public high school in [[Wichita, Kansas|Wichita, Kansas]] serving students in grades 9-12. Despite being located within the Wichita city limits, Campus is part of [[USD 261|Haysville USD 261]], which is the school district for the Wichita suburb of [[Haysville|Haysville, Kansas]]. The current principal is David Morford. The school colors are black and white with an accent of gold. The current enrollment is 1,742 students.
title: Campus High School

abstract: Nelson McIntyre Collegiate (NMC) is a grade 9-12 high school in [[Winnipeg|Winnipeg]], [[Manitoba|Manitoba]]. It is part of the [[Louis Riel School Division|Louis Riel School Division]] and has an enrollment of approximately 280 students.
title: Nelson McIntyre Collegiate

abstract: SOS Hermann Gmeiner College located in the Mirpur-13 of the capital was established in 1986 by the SOS-Kinderdorf International, headquartered in Innsbruck, Austria, a [[Non-Government Organization|Non-Government Organization]]. The foundation stone was laid by the former President [[Hussain Muhammad Ershad|Hussain Muhammad Ershad]]. In 2010, the college was ranked among the top ten institutions of the country for its academic performance in Secondary School Certificate examination.
title: SOS Hermann Gmeiner College

abstract: William R. Boone High School is a [[public|Public school (government funded)]] [[high school|high school]] in [[Orlando, Florida|Orlando, Florida]], United States. Built in 1952, the school is one of twenty high schools in the [[Orange County Public Schools|Orange County Public Schools]] system, created to accommodate the growing number of students at Orlando High School. The plan involved building two high schools, Orlando North and Orlando South, to take the place of Orlando High School and convert the old high school facilities into what is now Howard Middle School. The last principal of Orlando High School, William R. Boone, died of a heart condition before the two new schools were opened, so the school board dedicated one of the high schools in his memory, then christened Orlando North as [[Edgewater High School|Edgewater High School]] after its surrounding community.
title: William R. Boone High School

abstract: Robert Bateman High School (also known as Robert Bateman, or Bateman) is located in [[Burlington, Ontario|Burlington, Ontario]], [[Canada|Canada]]. The school is under the jurisdiction of the [[Halton District School Board|Halton District School Board]], and was established in 1970 as Lord Elgin High School. After a merger with General Brock High School in 2004 it was renamed Robert Bateman High School.
title: Robert Bateman High School

abstract: Shawnee Mission East High School is a [[public|Public high school]] [[secondary school|secondary school]] in [[Prairie Village, Kansas|Prairie Village, Kansas]], US, for grades [[9|Ninth grade]] through [[12|Twelfth grade]]. It is one of five high schools operated by the [[Shawnee Mission School District|Shawnee Mission School District]] ([[Unified School District|Unified school district]] 512).
title: Shawnee Mission East High School

abstract: Sherando High School is a [[public secondary school|public secondary school]] within [[Frederick County|Frederick County, Virginia]], [[Virginia|Virginia]], United States, and is part of [[Frederick County Public Schools|Frederick County Public Schools (Virginia)]]. The school is located east of the town of [[Stephens City|Stephens City, Virginia]].
title: Sherando High School

abstract: Capuchino High School is a [[public|Public school (government funded)]] [[high school|high school]] in [[San Bruno|San Bruno, California]], [[California|California]], United States. The school is surrounded by the city of [[Millbrae|Millbrae, California]] on all but one corner. It is one of seven high schools in the [[San Mateo Union High School District|San Mateo Union High School District]], a division of the [[San Mateo County|San Mateo County, California]] Office of Education.
title: Capuchino High School

abstract: Howick College is a [[state|state school]] co-educational [[secondary school|secondary school]] located in the eastern [[Auckland|Auckland]], [[New Zealand|New Zealand]] suburb of [[Cockle Bay|Cockle Bay, New Zealand]]. Serving Years 9 to 13, the school has a roll of students as of
title: Howick College

abstract: Sir Allan MacNab Secondary School is located at 145 Magnolia Drive in [[Hamilton|Hamilton, Ontario]], [[Ontario|Ontario]], Canada, and is a member of the [[Hamilton-Wentworth District School Board|Hamilton-Wentworth District School Board]]. Sir Allan MacNab Secondary School opened in 1969 and has 873 students. The school was founded in 1969 and is named for Sir [[Allan MacNab|Allan MacNab]], the last [[Premier of Upper Canada|Joint Premiers of the Province of Canada]] before [[Confederation|Canadian Confederation]] and a resident, lawyer and politician in Hamilton from 1826 until his death in 1826 at his home, [[Dundurn Castle|Dundurn Castle]]. Located on the west mountain of Hamilton, the school catchment area extends into [[Glanbrook|Glanbrook Township, Ontario]] and [[Ancaster|Ancaster, Ontario]].
title: Sir Allan MacNab Secondary School

abstract: Walkerville Collegiate Institute (W.C.I) is a secondary school (grades 9 through 12) located in the olde [[Walkerville|Walkerville, Ontario]] area of [[Windsor, Ontario|Windsor, Ontario]], and managed by the [[Greater Essex County District School Board|Greater Essex County District School Board]]. It is the home of the Walkerville Centre for the Creative Arts, which has arts programs in Drama, Dance, Visual Arts, Media, and Vocal. All of the WCCA courses require students to audition to get into the program. Walkerville hosts one of three Community Living (STEPS Programs) in the district, which serves more than 30 developmentally challenged students. Walkerville also has sports teams which include basketball, soccer, volleyball, tennis, and badminton.
title: Walkerville Collegiate Institute

abstract: Olathe North High School is a fully accredited public high school located in [[Olathe, Kansas|Olathe, Kansas]], United States, serving students in grades 9-12. The school is one of five public high schools in the [[Olathe School District|Olathe School District]]. The school colors are red and royal blue and the mascot is the Eagle.
title: Olathe North High School

abstract: Salina High School South is a fully accredited public school located in [[Salina, Kansas|Salina, Kansas]], serving students in grades 9-12. The school serves approximately 1,162 students each year, and about 90% of the staff employed at the school are certified, including principal Curtis Stevens. The school colors are green, gold, and white, and the school mascot is the Cougar. The athletic teams offered at Salina South are varied and compete in the 5A division according to the [[KSHSAA|Kansas State High School Activities Association]].
title: Salina High School South

abstract: Grand Prairie High School relocated to its current site at 101 Gopher Boulevard in January 1953, following the 1952 Christmas holidays.
title: Grand Prairie High School

abstract: Taos High School, founded in 1917, is the public [[high school|high school]] in [[Taos|Taos, New Mexico]], [[New Mexico|New Mexico]], [[United States|United States]]. It is located outside of [[Taos Pueblo|Taos Pueblo]], at the base of the [[Sangre de Cristo Mountains|Sangre de Cristo Mountains]].
title: Taos High School

abstract: Wellington College Belfast (better known as Wellington College or WCB) is a [[co-educational|coeducation]] [[grammar school|grammar school]] located in [[Belfast|Belfast]], [[Northern Ireland|Northern Ireland]]. The most recent [[principal|Principal (school)]] was Nicola Connery. The school was formed when, in 1989, the [[all-boys'|Single-sex school]] [[Annadale Grammar School|Annadale Grammar School]] and the all-girls' [[Carolan Grammar School|Carolan Grammar School]] merged to become a single co-educational school.
title: Wellington College Belfast

abstract: Salina High School Central, often referred to as Salina Central, is a fully accredited public high school located in [[Salina|Salina, Kansas]], [[Kansas|Kansas]], serving students in grades 9-12. The school was known as Salina High School before the opening of [[Salina High School South|Salina High School South]] in 1971. Located at 650 East Crawford in the city of Salina, the school is attended by [[USD305|Unified school district]] students living north of Republic Avenue. The athletic programs compete in the Ark Valley Chisholm Trail League of the 5A division according to the [[KSHSAA|Kansas State High School Activities Association]]. The Salina High School Central campus is home of the Salina Stadium.
title: Salina High School Central

abstract: Imaduddin School is one of the youngest schools in the Republic of [[Maldives|Maldives]].
title: Imaduddin School

abstract: The [[Knowledge and Human Development Authority|Knowledge and Human Development Authority]] of Dubai has rated Greenfield Community School as follows
title: Greenfield Community School

abstract: Founded in 1976 by Madhu Verma, Dubai Scholars Private School was a villa-based school, located in the [[Deira|Deira, Dubai]] area of [[Dubai|Dubai]]. Eventually, the school relocated to 2 villas, later expanding to 7.
title: Dubai Scholars Private School

abstract: The National Band Council of Australia (NBCA) is the national association representing the interests of brass and concert bands in [[Australia|Australia]]. The NBCA is dedicated to promoting and developing the banding movement throughout Australia. The Council is also responsible for the operation of national band contests, marching contests and solo and party competitions.
title: National Band Council of Australia

abstract: Laurel Highlands High School was created in 1967 by merging rival high schools, North Union and South Union. Students attended high school in their respective buildings until completion of the current campus in 1972. Minor upgrades were performed to the school in 1994. The most recent structural update was completed in 2015 with a $43 million renovation.
title: Laurel Highlands High School

abstract: Bhavans Vidya Mandir, Elamakkara is a private [[K–12|K–12]], [[CBSE|Central Board of Secondary Education]]-affiliated school run by the [[Bharatiya Vidya Bhavan Educational Trust|Bharatiya Vidya Bhavan Educational Trust]] in Elamakkara, [[Kochi|Kochi]], [[Kerala|Kerala]]. Founded in 1972, it is the first Bhavan's school to be set up in Kerala.
title: Bhavans Vidya Mandir, Elamakkara

abstract: Frazier High School is a diminutive, rural, public [[high school|high school]]. It is the sole high school in the [[Frazier School District|Frazier School District]]. It is in the northern [[Fayette County, Pennsylvania|Fayette County, Pennsylvania]], in the town of [[Perryopolis|Perryopolis, Pennsylvania]]. In 2015, enrollment was reported as 350 pupils in 9th through 12th grades, with 43% of pupils eligible for a free lunch due to the family meeting the [[federal poverty level|Poverty in the United States]]. Additionally, 12% of pupils received special education services, while 3.7% of pupils were identified as [[gifted|Intellectual giftedness]]. The school employed 24 teachers. Per the [[Pennsylvania Department of Education|Pennsylvania Department of Education]], 100% of the teachers were rated "Highly Qualified" under the federal [[No Child Left Behind|No Child Left Behind]] Act.According to the [[National Center for Education Statistics|National Center for Education Statistics]], in 2013, the school reported an enrollment of 342 pupils in grades 9th through 12th, with 110 pupils eligible for a federal free or reduced price lunch due to the family meeting the [[federal poverty level|Poverty in the United States]]. In 2013, the school employed 24 teachers yielding a student-teacher ratio of 14:1. According to a report by the Pennsylvania Department of Education, 1 teacher was rated "Non‐Highly Qualified" under No Child Left Behind.
title: Frazier High School

abstract: The Glynn County School District is a public school district in [[Glynn County|Glynn County, Georgia]], [[Georgia|Georgia (U.S. state)]], United States, based in [[Brunswick|Brunswick, Georgia]], [[Georgia|Georgia (U.S. state)]]. It serves the communities of [[Brunswick|Brunswick, Georgia]], [[Country Club Estates|Country Club Estates, Georgia]], [[Dock Junction|Dock Junction, Georgia]], and [[St. Simons Island|St. Simons, Georgia]], [[Georgia|Georgia (U.S. state)]].
title: Glynn County School District

abstract: Atchison County Community High School is a fully accredited public high school located in [[Effingham, Kansas|Effingham, Kansas]], serving students in grades 7-12. The school colors are orange and black. The average annual enrollment is approximately 325 students.
title: Atchison County Community High School

abstract: Hodgeville School is a public K-12 school in [[Hodgeville, Saskatchewan|Hodgeville, Saskatchewan]] in Canada.
title: Hodgeville School

abstract: St. Matthias Anglo Indian Higher Secondary School is one of the oldest schools in [[Chennai|Chennai]], India, located in Vepery, Chennai. It has around 1,000 students on roll drawn mainly from the [[Anglo-Indian|Anglo-Indian]] community.
title: St. Matthias Anglo Indian Higher Secondary School

abstract: Alamosa High School (AHS) is the [[public|state school]] [[senior high school|senior high school]] of the city of [[Alamosa|Alamosa, Colorado]], [[Colorado|Colorado]], United States. The school colors are [[maroon|Maroon (color)]], [[white|white]] and [[black|black]], and its mascot is a Mean [[Moose|Moose]].
title: Alamosa High School

abstract: College Park Academy (commonly CPA) is a [[charter school|charter schools in the United States]] middle and high school located in [[Riverdale Park, Maryland|Riverdale Park, Maryland]]. The school is a joint collaboration project with the [[University of Maryland, College Park|University of Maryland, College Park]]. This will provide benefits such as interaction with college students and allow students to take [[college prep|college preparatory]] classes.
title: College Park Academy

abstract: Fort Frances High School is the only high school serving [[Fort Frances, Ontario|Fort Frances, Ontario]]. The school is administered by the [[Rainy River District School Board|Rainy River District School Board]] and serves roughly 700 students.
title: Fort Frances High School

abstract: Etna High School was founded in 1891 in Etna, a community founded as a result of the [[California Gold Rush|California Gold Rush]].
title: Etna High School

abstract: Howard Lake-Waverly-Winsted High School (HLWW HS) is located in [[Howard Lake, Minnesota|Howard Lake, Minnesota]]. The Public School enrolls 9th-12th Graders in the Howard Lake-Waverly-Winsted Public School District. As of 2017, the school had 314 students enrolled. The campus consists of the High School, complete with a Gymnasium, the [1]; the Middle School, with a three court gymnasium featuring a walking track, a weight room; a Football Field; the Track; Several Baseball Fields; a School Garden; and the District's Bus Garage.
title: Howard Lake-Waverly-Winsted High School

abstract: Peirce Secondary School (PSS) (Chinese: 培雅中学; pinyin: Péiyǎ Zhōngxué) is a government-aided secondary school located in [[Bishan, Singapore|Bishan, Singapore]]. Founded in 1994, Peirce Secondary School is known for its niche in Uniformed Group Co-Curricular Activity (CCA).
title: Peirce Secondary School

abstract: Le Grand High School is a public high school located in [[Le Grand|Le Grand, California]], [[California|California]].
title: Le Grand High School

abstract: Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalaya, Bohani (JNV Bohani) is a [[boarding school|boarding school]] in [[Bohani|Bohani]], [[Narsinghpur|Narsinghpur]], [[India|India]]. JNV Bohani is funded by the Indian Ministry of [[Human Resources Development|Human Resources Development]].
title: Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalaya, Bohani

abstract: The campus of Cadet College Skardu is located in the center of Skardu valley next to the Skardu airport in Hotto town. Skardu is linked to Islamabad International Airport by a daily flight. It takes about forty five to sixty minutes to fly from Islamabad to Skardu. The college is approximately above sea level.
title: Cadet College Skardu

abstract: Cadet College Sanghar was founded in 1990. It was built in Jam Nawaz Ali. Cadet College Sanghar is the fourth [[cadet college|Cadet Colleges in Pakistan]] in the province of [[Sindh|Sindh]].
title: Cadet College Sanghar

abstract: New Hope-Solebury High School is a [[high school|high school]] located at 182 West Bridge Street in [[New Hope, Pennsylvania|New Hope, Pennsylvania]]. The school's [[mascot|mascot]] is the [[Lion|Lion]], and its colors are royal blue and gold. It is located in the [[New Hope-Solebury School District|New Hope-Solebury School District]]. The school houses grades 9 through 12. The school has approximately 500 students. They are ranked number two in the state by the U.S. News & World Report, and 320th nationally. Stephen Seier is the current principal of New Hope-Solebury High School.
title: New Hope-Solebury High School

abstract: A cadet college is an institution following the model of English public schools. In 1979, Rangpur Cadet College was established as the sixth cadet college of Bangladesh. The former Rangpur Residential Model High School was converted into a cadet college with some infrastructural modification. The land now owned by the college is partially taken from the [[Carmichael College|Carmichael College]], an educational college which stands beside it. The college started with its first three batches (called the intake) in 7th, 8th and 9th grade in 1979. Commander Habibur Rahman was the first principal of this institution.Cadet Hossain Sohel Shahnewaz was the first College Prefect of the CCR (who was assassinated on the February 25, 2009 in the BDR mutiny). From 2003, English was introduced as the medium of education as per a government decision to convert the cadet colleges into English medium. The 28th intake was the first batch in English medium.
title: Rangpur Cadet College

abstract: Emporia High School is a fully accredited public [[high school|high school]] located in [[Emporia, Kansas|Emporia, Kansas]], serving students in grades 9–12. Emporia has an enrollment of approximately 1,400 students and a teaching staff of 130. It is the only [[public high school|public high school]] within the city of Emporia. The principal is Britton Hart. The school mascot is the Spartan and the school colors are red and black.
title: Emporia High School

abstract: Cadet College Mastung is a residential high school, for boys grades seven through twelve.
title: Cadet College Mastung

abstract: American International School, Abu Dhabi is an international school offering an American curriculum.The IB Diploma Program (IBDP) and IB Primary Years Program (IBPYP) are offered. The school is coeducational in elementary and gender-segregated in secondary.
title: American International School, Abu Dhabi

abstract: Halstead High School is a public high school located in [[Halstead, Kansas|Halstead, Kansas]], United States, serving students in grades 9-12. The school is part of the Unified School District 440. The school primarily serves the towns of Halstead and [[Bentley, Kansas|Bentley, Kansas]]. The school colors are royal blue and white with black commonly used as a [[complementary color|complementary color]].
title: Halstead High School

abstract: Wichita South High School, known locally as South, is a fully accredited [[high school|high school]], serving students in grades 9-12, located in [[Wichita, Kansas|Wichita, Kansas]]. It is also known as Wichita High School South. The school colors are blue and red. The school's enrollment was 1,922 during the 2016–2017 school year, making it the 9th largest high school in Kansas.
title: Wichita South High School

abstract: Wath Comprehensive School: A Language College is a [[mixed|mixed-sex education]] [[comprehensive|comprehensive school]] [[secondary school|secondary school]] on Sandygate in [[Wath-upon-Dearne|Wath-upon-Dearne]], in the [[Metropolitan Borough of Rotherham|Metropolitan Borough of Rotherham]], [[South Yorkshire|South Yorkshire]], England.
title: Wath Comprehensive School

abstract: Before the establishment of Steveston-London Secondary School, [[Steveston Secondary School|Steveston Secondary School]] and [[Charles E. London Secondary School|Charles E. London Secondary School]] were two high schools close together. However, both schools were merged into one because of declining enrollment. The name "Steveston-London Secondary School" was chosen on June 14, 2006 as decided in a student vote from both schools.
title: Steveston-London Secondary School

abstract: Clounagh Junior High School is a controlled school on the Brownstown Road, [[Portadown|Portadown]], [[Northern Ireland|Northern Ireland]]. It accepts male and female pupils following primary education. Generally, children attend for three years (from ages 11–14) however, those with special educational needs stay for an extra two years. After the children leave they are ordinarily transferred to either [[Portadown College|Portadown College]] or [[Craigavon Senior High School|Craigavon Senior High School]].
title: Clounagh Junior High School

abstract: Washburn Rural High School is a public high school located in southwest [[Topeka, Kansas|Topeka, Kansas]], serving students in grades 9–12. The school is adjacent to [[Washburn Rural Middle School|Washburn Rural Middle School]]. Edward Raines became the [[principal|Principal (school)]] in 2007, replacing former principal Bill Edwards. The school colors are blue and white and the school mascot is the "Junior Blue". The average annual enrollment is approximately 1,900 students.
title: Washburn Rural High School

abstract: Milliken Mills High School is a [[high school|high school]] in the city of [[Markham|Markham, Ontario]], [[Ontario|Ontario]], [[Canada|Canada]]. It is one of 29 high schools in the [[York Region District School Board|York Region District School Board]].
title: Milliken Mills High School

abstract: Dr. Samuel L. Banks High School is a [[public|Public school (government funded)]] [[secondary school|Secondary education in the United States]] in [[Baltimore|Baltimore]], [[Maryland|Maryland]]. It is part of the small schools initiative in order to consolidate larger schools into smaller learning environments.
title: Dr. Samuel L. Banks High School

abstract: Walbrook High School formerly known as Walbrook Senior High School (1971–1996) and Walbrook Uniform Services Academy (1996–2005), is a [[public|Public school (government funded)]] [[high school|High school#United States]] located in [[Baltimore, Maryland|Baltimore, Maryland]].
title: Walbrook High School

abstract: The Boulder Valley School District No. Re2 is a school district in [[Colorado|Colorado]], headquartered in the BVSD Education Center in [[unincorporated|unincorporated area]] [[Boulder County|Boulder County, Colorado]], near [[Boulder|Boulder, Colorado]]. The district serves Boulder, [[Gold Hill|Gold Hill, Colorado]], [[Jamestown|Jamestown, Colorado]], [[Lafayette|Lafayette, Colorado]], [[Louisville|Louisville, Colorado]], [[Nederland|Nederland, Colorado]], [[Superior|Superior, Colorado]], and [[Ward|Ward, Colorado]]. Its area also includes portions of [[Broomfield|Broomfield, Colorado]] and [[Erie|Erie, Colorado]].
title: Boulder Valley School District

abstract: Kapaun Mt. Carmel Catholic High School, sometimes called Kapaun, is a private, four year, [[co-educational|co-educational]], [[secondary school|secondary school]] operated by the [[Roman Catholic Diocese of Wichita|Roman Catholic Diocese of Wichita]]. It is located in the east side of [[Wichita, Kansas|Wichita, Kansas]]. The school colors are blue and white. The average annual enrollment is approximately 850 students.
title: Kapaun Mt. Carmel Catholic High School

abstract: The Tasmanian Bands League (TBL) is the governing body of community banding in [[Tasmania|Tasmania]]. It is also an affiliated banding association of the [[National Band Council of Australia (NBCA)|National Band Council of Australia]]. The Tasmanian Bands League's operations include the running of music camps and workshops within the state, as well as the organisation of local band-related competitions.
title: Tasmanian Bands League

abstract: Raoul Wallenberg Traditional High School is a [[high school|high school]] in [[San Francisco, California|San Francisco, California]], USA. It was founded in 1981 in honor of the Swedish diplomat [[Raoul Wallenberg|Raoul Wallenberg]].
title: Raoul Wallenberg Traditional High School

abstract: Mountain Brook High School (MBHS) is a three-year [[public|State school]] [[high school|high school]] in the [[Birmingham|Birmingham, Alabama]], [[Alabama|Alabama]], suburb of [[Mountain Brook|Mountain Brook, Alabama]]. It is the only high school in the [[Mountain Brook City School System|Mountain Brook School System]]. School colors are green and gold, and the athletic teams are called the [[Sparta|Spartans]]. MBHS competes in [[AHSAA|Alabama High School Athletic Association]] Class 7A athletics.
title: Mountain Brook High School

abstract: Cadet College Petaro is a boarding school from grade 7 to grade 12 in [[Jamshoro District|Jamshoro District]] of the southern province of [[Sindh|Sindh]] in [[Pakistan|Pakistan]]; about 20 miles (32   km) from [[Hyderabad|Hyderabad, Pakistan]]. Its campus occupies over 700 acres (2.8   km²) on the west bank of the [[Indus River|Indus River]] on the road from Hyderabad to [[Dadu|Dadu, Pakistan]], [[Larkana|Larkana]] and [[Quetta|Quetta]]. The college has also started Cambridge O-Level System.
title: Cadet College Petaro

abstract: Mudgee High School is a New South Wales government high school in the regional town of [[Mudgee|Mudgee]]. It is part of the Cudgegong Learning Community (CLC). It provides comprehensive education for students in years 7 to 12 including a support unit for special education. The current enrollment is close to 1000 students.
title: Mudgee High School

abstract: St. Clement's School (SCS) is an [[Anglican|Anglican]] independent school for girls in [[Toronto, Ontario|Toronto, Ontario]], [[Canada|Canada]]. The school was founded in 1901 by Canon Thomas Wesley Powell and was originally [[co-ed|co-ed]]. Students at SCS are often referred to as Clementines.
title: St. Clement's School

abstract: Hinsdale Central High School, or HCHS (locally referred to as simply "Central") is a public four-year [[high school|high school]] located at the corner of W. 55th St. and S. Grant St. in [[Hinsdale, Illinois|Hinsdale, Illinois]], a western suburb of [[Chicago, Illinois|Chicago, Illinois]], in the [[United States|United States]]. Founded in 1879, the school is well known for its large spending per student, academic excellence, and athletic programs. It is part of [[Hinsdale Township High School District No. 86|Hinsdale Township High School District No. 86]], which also includes [[Hinsdale South High School|Hinsdale South High School]]. The school is 17 miles west of Chicago and serves a suburban residential area of approximately 35,000 people. The Central campus draws its students from all of the village of [[Hinsdale|Hinsdale, Illinois]], majority of [[Clarendon Hills|Clarendon Hills]] and [[Oak Brook|Oak Brook, Illinois]], and small parts of [[Burr Ridge|Burr Ridge]], [[Darien|Darien, Illinois]], [[Willowbrook|Willowbrook, DuPage County, Illinois]] and [[Westmont|Westmont, Illinois]].
title: Hinsdale Central High School

abstract: Since its formation in 1917, Warren Township High School District 121 has grown and evolved with its residents. From a one-story building on O'Plaine Road to two campuses located about 4.5 miles apart, Warren has seen graduating classes grow from about 25 students in the beginning to more than 1000 today. There are more than 4,500 students divided between two campuses, representing one comprehensive high school program for more than 61,000 residents from Gurnee, Beach Park, Gages Lake, Grandwood Park, Grayslake, Millburn, Old Mill Creek, Park City, Third Lake, Wadsworth, Waukegan, Wildwood and Lake Villa.
title: Warren Township High School

abstract: Andover Central High School is a [[public|Public high school]] [[secondary school|secondary school]] in [[Andover|Andover, Kansas]], [[Kansas|Kansas]], United States, operated by [[Unified School District|Unified school district]] 385, and serves students of grades [[9|Ninth grade]] to [[12|Twelfth grade]]. It is located southeast of Central and Andover Road.
title: Andover Central High School

abstract: Kambrya College is a state government funded coeducational secondary school located in [[Berwick, Victoria|Berwick, Victoria]], Australia. Opening in 2002 with 97 Year 7 students, the school quickly grew to over 1600 students by 2007. The school has facilities for visual and performing arts, information technology, science, hospitality, wood and metal workshops, dedicated automotive workshop as well as a fitness centre. The school also had over 20 portable classrooms, largely due to its rapid growth in its early years, however since 2014 at least 10 of the older portables have been relinquished. In 2018 a building project will see a new block of general purpose classrooms constructed.
title: Kambrya College

abstract: Cawthra Park Secondary School, also known as CP, is a public [[high school|high school]] built in 1972 located in Southeast [[Mississauga, Ontario|Mississauga, Ontario]], Canada.
title: Cawthra Park Secondary School

abstract: The school is named after [[Jeffery Amherst|Jeffery Amherst, 1st Baron Amherst]], who was commander of the [[British|Kingdom of Great Britain]] armed forces in North America during the [[Seven Years' War|Seven Years' War]]. The school's construction began in 1921, and completed in 1922. Previously, students in the Amherstburg area who wanted to continue their education past elementary school had to go to the town of Essex, where they were required to pay room and board during the school term.The following have been Principals of General Amherst High School since 1922, the year it opened:
title: General Amherst High School

abstract: Wichita Collegiate School, known locally as Collegiate, is a private, co-educational, non-denominational, and non-profit [[college preparatory|college preparatory]] day school founded in 1963 currently enrolling 966 students from [[preschool|preschool]] through 12th grade located in [[Wichita|Wichita, Kansas]], [[Kansas|Kansas]], United States. The Headmaster is Tom Davis. The school motto is: "Proba te Dignum" (Latin for "Prove Yourself Worthy")
title: Wichita Collegiate School

abstract: South Callaway R-II High School, most commonly known as South Callaway High School, South Callaway, SoCal, or SCHS, is a public [[high school|high school]] located in [[Mokane, Missouri|Mokane, Missouri]]. It provides education for students in grades 9-12. The school is part of the South Callaway R-II School District, all located on the same campus in Mokane, and is the only high school in the district. School colors are blue and white. The school was opened in 1959.
title: South Callaway High School

abstract: The Queensland Academies - Health Sciences Campus (QAHS) is a Queensland State Government selective entry [[high school|high school]] located on the [[Gold Coast|Gold Coast, Queensland]] in [[Queensland|Queensland]], [[Australia|Australia]]. QAHS offers the [[International Baccalaureate Diploma Program|IB Diploma Programme]] to students in years 11 and 12, and is also open to year 10 students, who study a preparation program for the IBDP. The school aims to attract students wanting to enter the scientific, medical and health-related industries, and is only open to the state's 'best and brightest high school students'. In 2017, Better Education ranked Queensland Academy for Health Sciences as the #1 school in the state of Queensland based on OP/IBD results.
title: Queensland Academy for Health Sciences

abstract: Cadet College Kallar Kahar is a residential institution near [[Kallar Kahar|Kallar Kahar]], [[Chakwal District|Chakwal District]], [[Punjab|Punjab (Pakistan)]].It was founded by Lt. General Nazar Hussain HI(M). 16 entries have been passed out from college till now.
title: Cadet College Kallar Kahar

abstract: St. John Brebeuf Regional Secondary is a [[Catholic|Catholic]] school, under the administration of the [[Catholic Independent Schools Vancouver Archdiocese|Catholic Independent Schools Vancouver Archdiocese]] school board.
title: St. John Brebeuf Regional Secondary

abstract: Royal Oak Middle School opened in 1985 on the site of the former Royal Oak High School, which opened in 1965. Originally, the middle school served students in sixth through eighth grades. In 2007, the mission of the school changed to serve only seventh- and eighth-grade students.
title: Royal Oak Middle School

abstract: Hueytown High School is a four-year [[public|State school]] [[high school|high school]] in the [[Birmingham|Birmingham, Alabama]], [[Alabama|Alabama]] suburb of [[Hueytown|Hueytown, Alabama]]. It is one of fourteen high schools in the [[Jefferson County School System|Jefferson County Schools (Alabama)]]. School colors are purple and gold, and the athletic teams are called the Golden Gophers. Hueytown competes in [[AHSAA|Alabama High School Athletic Association]] Class 6A athletics.
title: Hueytown High School

abstract: Shanghai Shixi High School or "Shanghai Shixi Middle School " (), founded in 1870, is a public high school located in the [[Jing'an District|Jing'an District]] of Shanghai, China.
title: Shanghai Shixi High School

abstract: Juniata High School is a small, [[rural|rural]], public high school which is one of two high school operated by the [[Juniata County School District|Juniata County School District]]. The students reside in the central and western portions of [[Juniata County|Juniata County, Pennsylvania]] in central [[Pennsylvania|Pennsylvania]]. The campus is located centrally in the county in Milford Township and is shared with the school's sole feeder school, Tuscarora Junior High School. Juniata High School provides grades 9th through 12th. By 2013, pupil enrollment had declined to 563 pupils, with 36.7% of pupils coming from low income homes. According to a report by the Pennsylvania Department of Education, 100% of the teachers were rated "Highly Qualified" under the federal [[No Child Left Behind|No Child Left Behind]] Act. In 2013, the school reported that 10% of the pupils received special education services while 3.7% of pupils were identified as gifted. The Pennsylvania Department of Education reported that 6 teachers were rated Non-Highly qualified by NCLB. They had failed to maintain their teacher certifications.
title: Juniata High School

abstract: Brownsville Area High School is a small, rural public [[high school|high school]] serving students in southwestern Pennsylvania, near the [[Monongahela River|Monongahela River]]. It serves students living in the Borough of [[Brownsville|Brownsville, Pennsylvania]] and [[Brownsville Township|Brownsville Township, Fayette County, Pennsylvania]], [[Luzerne Township|Luzerne Township, Fayette County, Pennsylvania]] and [[Redstone Township|Redstone Township, Fayette County, Pennsylvania]] in [[Fayette County|Fayette County, Pennsylvania]]. In [[Washington County, Pennsylvania|Washington County, Pennsylvania]] it serves the Borough of [[West Brownsville|West Brownsville, Pennsylvania]]. In 2015, enrollment was reported as 510 pupils in 9th through 12th grades, with 59.8% of pupils eligible for a free lunch, due to the family meeting the [[federal poverty level|Poverty in the United States]]. Additionally, 17.25% of pupils received [[special education|special education]] services, while 4% of pupils were identified as [[gifted|Intellectual giftedness]]. Brownsville Area HIgh School employed 39 teachers in 2013. Per the [[Pennsylvania Department of Education|Pennsylvania Department of Education]], 100% of the teachers were rated "Highly Qualified" under the federal [[No Child Left Behind|No Child Left Behind]] Act.
title: Brownsville Area High School

abstract: The South Slave Divisional Education Council (SSDEC) was created in 1991 alongside five local District Education Authorities (DEAs) in each of the major communities of the South Slave Region. These five DEAs are responsible for setting Council goals and priorities, while the SSDEC is responsible for implementing their decisions within the schools. Both the SSDEC and the five community DEAs are granted power by the [[Government of the Northwest Territories|GNWT#Government]] through the Education Act.
title: South Slave Divisional Education Council

abstract: OPF Boys College Islamabad is an educational institution located in the centre of [[Islamabad|Islamabad]], Pakistan. The college is run as a project of Overseas Pakistanis Foundation (OPF). The college started functioning on 12 September 2001.
title: OPF Boys College Islamabad

abstract: Dodge County High School is a SACS ([[Southern Association of Colleges and Schools|Southern Association of Colleges and Schools]]) and GAC ([[Georgia Accrediting Commission|Georgia Accrediting Commission]]) accredited school, where students can work towards a College Prep, College Prep Plus, Tech Prep, Tech Prep Plus, or Community Achievement Program diploma. Course work within these areas may include programs such as EMAC (Educational Media Academic Courses), which consists of foreign language offerings in Latin, German, and Japanese, and often involves video or phone lessons.
title: Dodge County High School

abstract: York County School District 3 (also known as Rock Hill Schools) is the largest of the four public school districts in [[York County, South Carolina|York County, South Carolina]], USA. The district serves students in and around the city of [[Rock Hill|Rock Hill, South Carolina]], approximately 20 miles south of [[Charlotte, North Carolina|Charlotte, North Carolina]].
title: Rock Hill Schools

abstract: Although the school's official history dates only to the formation of Las Cruces Public Schools in 1954, Las Cruces High School (LCHS) is considered the successor to the former Las Cruces Union High School (1918), which was located at the corner of Alameda and Picacho Avenues near downtown Las Cruces. LCHS inherited the Bulldog mascot and school colors from the former school, which served as a unified high school for the several smaller school districts that existed in the area before being consolidated to form LCPS. The present campus on El Paseo Road opened in 1956, at which point the old LCHS building was converted to house Alameda Junior High School. AJHS itself closed its doors in the early 1980s and the old building sat vacant for several years before being extensively renovated to house the Third Judicial District Court. The [[New Mexico Activities Association|New Mexico Activities Association]] considers LCUHS and LCHS to be the same school and credits LCHS with all state titles won by the previous school.
title: Las Cruces High School

abstract: GEMS World Academy is an international, [[private school|private school]], located in [[Dubai|Dubai]], [[UAE|United Arab Emirates]]. The school is managed by [[GEMS Education|GEMS Education]]. Founded in 2007, GEMS World Academy follows the [[International Baccalaureate|International Baccalaureate]] Curriculum, and offers education to students ranging from KG1 to Grade 12. As of October 2017, the school has capacity for 1910 students.
title: GEMS World Academy

abstract: Tamakoshi English Boarding School (TEBS) is a Secondary [[English|English language]] medium school. It was established in 2059 [[BS|Vikram Samvat]] (2002-2003 A.D) and is named after the River Tamakoshi. Mr. Deepak Kumar Khadka is the Principal of this school and Mr. Govinda Prasad Ghimire is the chairperson currently.
title: Tamakoshi English Boarding School (TEBS)

abstract: It offers courses from Playgroup to Class V in the "Ibtedayi' section (Pre-primary) though Class VI to Class X in the Dakhil ([[Secondary|Secondary school]]) section and "Hifz" section. Faridpur Jamia Islamia Madrasah offers Madrasha Education the [[Ministry of Education|Ministry of Education]] in Bangladesh. Students taking the following Public Examinations via (i) Ibtedai'e Final Completion Examination at the end of Class V (ii) Junior Dakhil Certification (JDC) examination at the end of class VIII (iii) Dakhil examination ([[S.S.C|S.S.C]]) at the end of Class X accredited by the [[Bangladesh Madrasah Education Board|Bangladesh Madrasah Education Board]]. It has hostel and bus facilities. Current enrolment is 500 with well capacity to accommodate 450 students & nearly 30 qualified teachers mostly with graduate and postgraduate qualifications.
title: Faridpur Jamia Islamia Madrasah

abstract: North Gaston High School is a public [[high school|high school]] in the [[Gaston County Schools|Gaston County Schools]] school district located in [[Dallas|Dallas, North Carolina]], [[North Carolina|North Carolina]], [[United States|United States]]. Its attendance range covers the central portion of northern Gaston County and it also serves the communities of [[Hardins|Hardins, North Carolina]], [[High Shoals|High Shoals, North Carolina]], [[Ashebrook Park|Ashebrook Park, North Carolina]], [[Spencer Mountain|Spencer Mountain, North Carolina]], and parts of North [[Gastonia|Gastonia, North Carolina]], as well as the surrounding rural areas. George Conner serves as principal. Assistant principals are Mary Beth Edwards, Marsha Michael and Jon Stauffer. Mike Patton serves as athletic director. Feeder [[middle school|middle schools]] are W.C. Friday and Holbrook.
title: North Gaston High School

abstract: Calexico High School is a [[public|State school]] [[high school|Secondary school]] located in [[Calexico|Calexico, California]], [[California|California]].
title: Calexico High School

abstract: The Victorian School of Forestry (VSF) was established in October 1910 at [[Creswick|Creswick, Victoria]], in the Australian state of [[Victoria|Victoria (Australia)]]. It was located at the former Creswick Hospital, built in 1863 during the [[gold rush|Victorian gold rush]]. The creation of VSF was one of the many recommendations of a Royal Commission held between 1897 and 1901 into forest degradation. The first tertiary forestry school in Australia, VSF was administered by the [[Forests Commission Victoria (FCV)|Forests Commission Victoria]] until 1980, when VSF amalgamated with the [[University of Melbourne|University of Melbourne]] to become that institution's School of Ecosystem and Forest Sciences. From 1910 to 1980, 522 students completed the Diploma of Forestry at VSF.
title: Victorian School of Forestry

abstract: Mariposa County High School is a public [[high school|Secondary school]] located in [[Mariposa, CA|Mariposa, California]]. The school is part of the [[Mariposa County Unified School District|Mariposa County Unified School District]].
title: Mariposa County High School

abstract: T. C. Williams High School is a [[public|Public school (government funded)]] [[high school|high school]] in [[Alexandria|Alexandria, Virginia]], [[Virginia|Virginia]], near [[Washington, D.C.|Washington, D.C.]] The school has an enrollment of about 3,800 students.
title: T. C. Williams High School

abstract: Anatolia College (Greek: Κολλέγιο Ανατόλια, , or sometimes the American College (Greek: Αμερικάνικο Κολλέγιο, ), is a private, non-profit, educational institution located in [[Pylaia|Pylaia]], a suburb of [[Thessaloniki|Thessaloniki]], [[Greece|Greece]]. The school has three subdivisions: [[Anatolia Elementary School|#Elementary School]], [[Anatolia High School|#Secondary School]] (which includes an International Baccalaureate Diploma Program, [[IBDP|International Baccalaureate]]) and ACT (the [[American College of Thessaloniki|#American College of Thessaloniki]]), the tertiary division of the institution.
title: Anatolia College

abstract: St Andrews Christian College is an independent, co-educational school situated in the Eastern Melbourne, Australia suburb of [[Wantirna South|Wantirna South, Victoria]]. The school was founded in 1983 by the [[Presbyterian Church|Presbyterianism]], and takes students from [[Prep to Year 12|K-12 School]].
title: St Andrews Christian College

abstract: Fairmont Senior High School (FSHS) is a historic secondary school located in [[Fairmont, West Virginia|Fairmont, West Virginia]], and is listed on the [[National Register of Historic Places|National Register of Historic Places]]. The school serves grades nine through twelve and is part of the [[Marion County|Marion County, West Virginia]] School District. The athletic teams are referred to as the Polar Bears, giving rise to the term "Polar Bear Pride".
title: Fairmont Senior High School

abstract: Sydney Academy (often abbreviated as SA and once often referred to as "The Academy") is one of two main secondary schools, along with [[Riverview Rural High School|Riverview Rural High School]], that service the city of [[Sydney|Sydney, Nova Scotia]], [[Nova Scotia|Nova Scotia]]. Its current building, at 49 Terrace Street, is an educational facility opened in 1959, and is the sixth building to house the school. It is the oldest school in the Sydney area, and once was a private school near the end of the 19th century. The Academy is the [[Cape Breton Regional Municipality|Cape Breton Regional Municipality]]'s (CBRM) only school to offer the [[International Baccalaureate|International Baccalaureate]] (IB) program, which began in the summer of 1987.
title: Sydney Academy

abstract: Cross Creek High School opened in 1999, for convenience and to relieve overcrowding at nearby [[Hephzibah High School|Hephzibah High School]] and [[Butler High School|Butler High School (Augusta, Georgia)]].
title: Cross Creek High School

abstract: Kirtland Central High School (KCHS) is located in the town of [[Kirtland|Kirtland, New Mexico]], [[New Mexico|New Mexico]] ([[USA|United States]]) its colors are [[Purple|Purple]] & [[Gold|Gold (color)]] and their mascot is the [[Bronco|Bronco]]. KCHS is a part of the [[Central Consolidated School District|Central Consolidated School District]] along with [[Newcomb High School|Newcomb High School]] and [[Shiprock High School|Shiprock High School]].
title: Kirtland Central High School

abstract: Our Lady of Mercy College, Burraneer (also OLMC or OLMC Burraneer) is an all-girls 7–10 school situated on [[Burraneer Bay|Burraneer Bay]], in Sydney's southern suburbs, [[Australia|Australia]]. Our Lady of Mercy College, Burraneer is a Newman Selective [[Roman Catholic|Roman Catholic]] School. It was founded by in 1932 by the [[Sisters of Mercy|Sisters of Mercy]]. In 1960, the college moved to its current location in Burraneer Bay. The current enrolment is ~550.
title: Our Lady of Mercy College, Burraneer

abstract: Rongotai College is a state single-sex boys' [[secondary school|secondary school]] in the southeastern suburb of [[Rongotai|Rongotai]], [[Wellington|Wellington]], [[New Zealand|New Zealand]]. Serving Years 9 to 13 (ages 12 to 18), the school has 622 students as of July 2015.
title: Rongotai College

abstract: South Milwaukee High School, "Home of the Rockets," is a high school located in the city of [[South Milwaukee|South Milwaukee, Wisconsin]], [[Wisconsin|Wisconsin]], U.S.A., a suburb of [[Milwaukee|Milwaukee]]. Approximately 1,300 students attend the high school. The school is operated by the School District of South Milwaukee.
title: South Milwaukee High School

abstract: Lake Braddock Secondary School (LBSS) in [[Burke, Virginia|Burke, Virginia]], United States, administered by [[Fairfax County Public Schools|Fairfax County Public Schools]] (FCPS), is one of three 7-12 secondary schools in [[Fairfax County|Fairfax County, Virginia]]; the other two are [[Hayfield SS|Hayfield Secondary School]] and [[Robinson SS|Robinson Secondary School]]. Lake Braddock opened in 1973. Its mascot is the [[bruin|Brown bear]], and the school colors are purple and gold.
title: Lake Braddock Secondary School

abstract: Lethbridge Collegiate Institute (LCI) is a [[public high school|public high school]] in [[Lethbridge|Lethbridge]], [[Alberta|Alberta]], Canada, operated by [[Lethbridge School District No. 51|Lethbridge School District No. 51]] that serves grades nine through twelve. LCI was the first school in Lethbridge designated only for secondary students. It opened at its current location in 1950, but was founded in a smaller, adjacent building in 1928. Since its 1950 opening, several additions and layout changes have been made at the school. In August 2010, [[Chinook High School|Chinook High School (Alberta)]] opened in [[West Lethbridge|West Lethbridge]] with over 700 students enrolled. Those that entered grade 11 in 2009 at LCI were permitted to complete their graduating year at LCI, but west Lethbridge students are now encouraged to attend the new high school, which was being built in conjunction with a western campus of Catholic Central High School, recreational facilities, and a public library.
title: Lethbridge Collegiate Institute

abstract: Greengates School () is a British-style [[international school|international school]] located in the Balcones de San Mateo neighbourhood in [[Naucalpan|Naucalpan]], located north-west of [[Mexico City|Mexico City]] metropolitan area, in the [[State of Mexico|State of Mexico]]. As of 2015, it has approximately 1,150 students of some 60 nationalities, derived mainly from the diplomatic and international business communities. During forms 4 and 5 (grades 9 and 10 in the American System), students study for the IGCSE ([[International General Certificate of Secondary Education|International General Certificate of Secondary Education]]) examinations, while in their last two years of high school ([[Sixth form|Sixth form]]), students prepare for the [[International Baccalaureate Diploma|International Baccalaureate Diploma]].
title: Greengates School

abstract: Baptist Lui Ming Choi Secondary School (BLMCSS) is a [[secondary school|secondary school]] in [[Sha Tin|Sha Tin]], [[Hong Kong|Hong Kong]], near [[Lek Yuen Estate|Lek Yuen Estate#Lek Yuen Estate]]. It was established in 1978 by the [[Hong Kong Baptist Convention|Hong Kong Baptist Convention]]. Situated in the [[new town of Sha Tin|Sha Tin New Town]], the school is a [[co-educational|co-educational]] [[grammar school|grammar school]] offering education at the first to sixth form levels education in [[Hong Kong|Hong Kong]]. English is the major [[medium of instruction|medium of instruction]] whereas [[Cantonese|Cantonese]] are used for subjects like Chinese Language, Chinese History, Chinese Literature, Liberal Studies, Visual Arts, Physical Education. In junior forms, [[Mandarin Chinese|Mandarin Chinese]] is also taught. The school has mission in providing an all-round education based on Christian values by nurturing their moral, intellectual, physical, social, aesthetic and spiritual skills, knowledge and attitude.
title: Baptist Lui Ming Choi Secondary School

abstract: Columbia International College is a [[private|private school]] [[boarding|boarding school]] [[preparatory school|university-preparatory]] in the [[Ainslie Wood|Ainslie Wood, Ontario]] neighbourhood of [[Hamilton, Ontario|Hamilton, Ontario]], Canada. As of 2014, the school has students from over 70 countries.
title: Columbia International College

abstract: Hills Road Sixth Form College (commonly referred to as HRSFC, Hills Road or just Hills) is a [[public sector|State school]] [[co-educational|co-educational]] [[sixth form college|sixth form college]] in [[Cambridge|Cambridge]], [[England|England]], providing full-time [[A-level|Advanced Level (UK)]] courses for approximately 2,400 sixth form [[student|students]] from the surrounding area and a wide variety of courses to around 4,000 part-time students of all ages in the [[adult education|adult education]] programme, held as daytime and evening classes.
title: Hills Road Sixth Form College

abstract: Central Cabarrus High School was formed in 1966 by joining three area high schools: Bethel, Harrisburg, and Hartsell. In its beginning, Central was home to 850 students and 45 teachers. The focal point of the new school was the C.A. Furr Planetarium, the only school planetarium in the state of North Carolina. Central boasted a space age classroom during a space enthralled time. Central was a direct result of desegregation in the education system of North Carolina.
title: Central Cabarrus High School

abstract: The school, founded in 1915 as Agincourt Continuation School to provide part of the then secondary schooling in the area (final years or [[junior/senior matriculation|Matriculation#Canada]] were done in [[Markham High School|Markham District High School]] until 1930). school was renamed Agincourt High School in 1954, and Agincourt Collegiate Institute in 1957. A.C.I is the oldest school in the former [[Scarborough|Scarborough, Toronto]]. From 1915 to 1929 it was housed on the second floor in what is now [[Agincourt Junior Public School|Agincourt Junior Public School]] building on the west side of Midland Avenue north of Sheppard Avenue. Agincourt's first permanent home opened on the east side of Midland Avenue in 1929, a three floor brick building. The second and current building replaced the second school in 1952.
title: Agincourt Collegiate Institute

abstract: Spokane Public Schools (District No. 81) is a public [[school district|school district]] in [[Spokane County, Washington|Spokane County, Washington]], and serves the city of [[Spokane|Spokane, Washington]]. The district includes oversight and administration of seven high schools, six middle schools, and 34 elementary schools. Specialized programming focuses on alternative learning opportunities for intelligently gifted children, as well as those that experience moderate to severe emotional and/or physical disabilities, are homeless, or experiencing the Spokane Public Schools system through the foreign exchange program.
title: Spokane Public Schools

abstract: Marymount Secondary School ([[Chinese:|Chinese language]] 瑪利曼中學) is a Band 1 all-girls EMI Roman Catholic Secondary School located in [[Happy Valley|Happy Valley, Hong Kong]], [[Hong Kong Island|Hong Kong Island]], Hong Kong. The Primary School is [[Marymount Primary School|Marymount Primary School]]. Marymount is also well known for its school choir which receives a lot of prizes in the [[Hong Kong Schools Music Festival|Hong Kong Schools Music Festival]] as well as International Competitions.
title: Marymount Secondary School

abstract: The Tipton Community School District is a [[public|Public school (government funded)]] [[school district|school district]] located in [[Tipton, Iowa|Tipton, Iowa]]. It serves 834 students and comprises one elementary school (K-5), one middle school (6-8), and one high school(9-12). Its stated focus is on developing the total student in a full range of academic and extra curricular offerings. The school has a staff of over fifty professional educators whose stated values are [[education|education]], [[student achievement|student achievement]], and student growth. Tipton’s educational program is anchored by the basics and [[music|music]], [[art|art]], and [[physical education|physical education]] which are all considered essential at every educational level. [[K-12|K-12]] [[special education|special education]] and [[Talented and Gifted program|Talented and Gifted programs]] are also available. Media centers and computer labs exist in each attendance center to assist in [[curriculum|curriculum]] delivery. All classrooms are computer and telephone networked with every other school within the district.
title: Tipton Community School District

abstract: Viewbank College is an Australian public secondary school located in the north eastern suburb of [[Viewbank|Viewbank, Victoria]], in [[Melbourne|Melbourne]], Australia.
title: Viewbank College

abstract: Shawnee Mission Northwest High School is a fully accredited public high school located in [[Shawnee, Kansas|Shawnee, Kansas]], United States, serving students in grades 9-12. The current principal is Lisa Grumann. Shawnee Mission Northwest is one of many schools located within Shawnee, Kansas and surrounding areas. The school colors are orange, black, and white. The school population is approximately 1,850 students.
title: Shawnee Mission Northwest High School

abstract: Sylhet Cadet College () is a [[military high school|military high school]] for boys (Grade VII - XII) situated 7   km north to Sylhet divisional City, east to the Osmani Air Port Road, beside Parjatan hotel of Sylhet.
title: Sylhet Cadet College

abstract: Feni Girls' Cadet College is a [[military high school|military high school]] for girls, located in [[Feni Sadar Upazila|Feni Sadar Upazila]], Bangladesh. Cadet colleges are autonomous residential institutions that impart an all round education to the young learners at the secondary and higher secondary level. The colleges are under the auspices of the Ministry of Defence and function under the direct supervision of the [[Adjutant General|Adjutant General]] of the [[Bangladesh Army|Bangladesh Army]].
title: Feni Girls' Cadet College

abstract: Cole Harbour District High School was founded in 1982 by the amalgamation of Cole Harbour High School, founded in 1979, and Gordon Bell High School. The newer building for Cole Harbour High was used as the new location for Cole Harbour District High, and Gordon Bell High was repurposed as the Gordon Bell Building, a general-purpose [[adult education|adult education]] centre, which was also used as a temporary location for the students of [[Halifax West High School|Halifax West High School]] during the 2001-2002 school year, when its own building was unusable due to health concerns. As of January 2015 the Gorden Bell building has been demolished.
title: Cole Harbour District High School

abstract: Kloof High School is a [[public|state school]], co-educational high school located in [[Kloof|Kloof]], near [[Durban|Durban]] in KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa.
title: Kloof High School

abstract: Parsons Senior High School is a [[public|Public high school]] [[secondary school|secondary school]] in [[Parsons|Parsons, Kansas]], [[Kansas|Kansas]], USA operated by [[Unified School District|Unified school district]] 503, and serves students of grades [[9|Ninth grade]] to [[12|Twelfth grade]]. It is the sole high school in the school district.
title: Parsons Senior High School

abstract: Blue Valley Northwest High School (BVNW) is a [[high school|high school]] in [[Overland Park, Kansas|Overland Park, Kansas]], United States. It is part of the [[Blue Valley Unified School District|Blue Valley Unified School District]]. Blue Valley Northwest is one of several schools located within the city limits of Overland Park.
title: Blue Valley Northwest High School

abstract: Kenner Collegiate Vocational Institute (Kenner CVI) is the oldest operating public high school in [[Peterborough|Peterborough, Ontario]], [[Ontario|Ontario]], [[Canada|Canada]]. It opened in 1952 and is now an accredited [[International Baccalaureate|International Baccalaureate]] School. It is named after [[ Peterborough Collegiate Institute's|Peterborough Collegiate]] quinquagenary teacher and principal Dr. [[H.R.H. Kenner|Henry Rowe Hocking Kenner]], father of literary scholar [[Hugh Kenner|Hugh Kenner]].
title: Kenner Collegiate Vocational Institute

abstract: Havergal College is an independent boarding and day school for girls from Junior Kindergarten to Grade 12 in [[Toronto|Toronto]], Ontario, Canada. The school was established in 1894 and named for [[Frances Ridley Havergal|Frances Ridley Havergal]], a composer, author, and humanitarian.
title: Havergal College

abstract: Manhattan High School is a public [[high school|high school]] in [[Manhattan|Manhattan, Kansas]], [[Kansas|Kansas]], United States, serving students in grades 9-12. It is part of the Unified School District 383. For the 2013–2014 school year, Manhattan High had an enrollment of 1,920 students.
title: Manhattan High School

abstract: Robert Cecil Palmer Secondary School, (commonly, R.C. Palmer Secondary School, RCPSS, RCP, and Palmer Secondary School) is a [[public|state school]], [[co-educational|Mixed-sex education]] [[secondary school|secondary school]] situated in [[Richmond|Richmond, British Columbia]], [[British Columbia|British Columbia]], [[Canada|Canada]] which educates students in grades 8-12. Palmer Secondary School is one of the many schools under the [[Richmond School District|Richmond School District]]. It is the only school in Richmond to offer the Pre-AP Incentive Program, the ACE-IT plumbing program and, previously, the Palmer Hockey Academy. The Richmond Virtual School is also hosted in the Palmer building.
title: Robert Cecil Palmer Secondary School

abstract: Blue Valley Southwest High School is a fully accredited public high school located in [[Overland Park, Kansas|Overland Park, Kansas]], United States, and one of five currently operated high schools in the [[Blue Valley School District|Blue Valley School District]]. The school opened in August 2010. The principal is Scott Roberts. Its feeder school is Aubry Bend Middle School. In total, Blue Valley Southwest is a facility. The school mascot is the Timberwolf and the school colors are forest green, black, and silver.
title: Blue Valley Southwest High School

abstract: Shawnee Heights High School is a fully accredited public [[high school|high school]] located in [[Tecumseh, Kansas|Tecumseh, Kansas]], east of [[Topeka, Kansas|Topeka, Kansas]]. The school colors are red, white, and turquoise and the school mascot is the [[Thunderbird|Thunderbird (mythology)]]. The average annual enrollment is approximately 1,200 students.
title: Shawnee Heights High School

abstract: On November 2, 2007, Vancouver College officially opened the Holler Family Science Centre and the new South Gym. The facilities were blessed by The Most Rev. [[Raymond Roussin|Raymond Roussin]], SM, the former Archbishop of Vancouver. They consist of four brand-new science classrooms, a "super" laboratory, a greenhouse, a new gymnasium, and several offices and classrooms serving the school's curricular and extra-curricular interests.On January 30, 2008, construction had finished on the school's High Performance Fitness Centre. The Centre consists of two floors, the first being a cardiovascular training area containing [[Indoor Rower|Indoor Rowers]], stationary bicycles, treadmills, and a stair climber. The upper floor functions as a weight-training facility where the athletics teams get weight training. The facility is known to be one of the best gyms in the lower mainland. The Fitness Centre is attached directly to the new South Gym, serving as an athletic complex for its students and staff. Following this, the Kucher Centre for the Performing Arts opened in December 2008. The centre is a large underground theatre with complete audio visual systems
title: Vancouver College

abstract: Olathe South High School is a fully accredited public high school located in [[Olathe, Kansas|Olathe, Kansas]], [[USA|United States]], serving students in grades 9-12. The school is one of five high schools in the [[Olathe Unified School District|Olathe Unified School District]] (USD 233). Olathe South High School was recognized as a National School of Excellence for the 1990-91 school year by the [[U.S. Department of Education|U.S. Department of Education]], becoming the first high school in Olathe to do so. Olathe South's official colors are blue and gold, and the official mascot is the [[Falcon|Falcon]]. The average annual enrollment at Olathe South is approximately 2,100 students.
title: Olathe South High School

abstract: Grassfield High School is a public high school located in [[Chesapeake, Virginia|Chesapeake, Virginia]], [[USA|United States]], and is administered by [[Chesapeake City Public Schools|Chesapeake City Public Schools]]. It was built to ease overcrowding at Deep Creek High School, Great Bridge High School, and Hickory High School. Grassfield, along with [[Western Branch High School|Western Branch High School]] and [[Oscar Smith High School|Oscar F. Smith High School]], features the latest technology available in the school district. Grassfield is also the City of Chesapeake's location for the STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics) school as various high school students around the city can apply for admission into the program.
title: Grassfield High School
