Other repairs and building work took place over several months and just in time for the 1957/8 season and the club have remained there ever since.
title: Brewery Field

abstract: Baylor Ballpark is the [[baseball|baseball]] stadium at [[Baylor University|Baylor University]] in [[Waco, Texas|Waco, Texas]]. The stadium was built on the site of Ferrell Field, Baylor's home from 1977 to 1998, by mid-February in 1999. The Bears have hosted three [[NCAA|National Collegiate Athletic Association]] regional and two super regional tournaments at Baylor Ballpark, including one of each in their [[College World Series|College World Series]] season of 2005.
title: Baylor Ballpark

abstract: Friends Arena (), also known as Nationalarenan, is a [[retractable roof|retractable roof]] [[multi-purpose stadium|multi-purpose stadium]] in [[Stockholm|Stockholm]], [[Sweden|Sweden]]. Located next to the lake [[Råstasjön|Råstasjön]] in [[Solna|Solna Municipality]], just north of the [[City Centre|Stockholm City Centre]], it is the biggest stadium in [[Scandinavia|Scandinavia]]. Since its opening, the venue has served as Sweden's [[national stadium|List of national stadiums]] for men's football, hence its name. The main tenants of the stadium are Sweden's men's [[national football team|Sweden national football team]] and [[Allsvenskan|Allsvenskan]] football club [[AIK|AIK Fotboll]]; both relocated from their previous home at the [[Råsunda Stadium|Råsunda Stadium]]. The venue has a total capacity of 65,000 at concerts and 50,000 seated at football matches, but the stadium can be scaled down to provide for smaller events with approximately 20,000 guests. If the city of Stockholm's bid with [[Åre|Åre]], [[Falun|Falun]] and [[Sigulda|Sigulda]], [[Latvia|Latvia]] for the [[2026 Winter Olympics|2026 Winter Olympics]] is successful, this arena would host the opening and closing ceremonies, being the largest stadium to do this, narrowly beating [[Beijing National Stadium|Beijing National Stadium]] if 2022 ceremonies aren't fully sold-out events.
title: Friends Arena

abstract: The Stade de la Meinau (), commonly known as "La Meinau", is a [[football|football (soccer)]] [[stadium|stadium]] in [[Strasbourg|Strasbourg]], [[France|France]]. It is the home ground of [[RC Strasbourg|Racing Club de Strasbourg Alsace]] and has also hosted international matches, including one game of the [[1938 World Cup|1938 FIFA World Cup]], two games of [[Euro 1984|Euro 1984]] and the [[final of the Cup Winners' Cup in 1988|1988 UEFA Cup Winners' Cup Final]]. La Meinau has also been used as a venue for concerts and a mass by [[John Paul II|John Paul II]] in 1988. The stadium is owned by the Strasbourg municipality and is rented by the RC Strasbourg.
title: Stade de la Meinau

abstract: Stade de la Mosson () is a [[football|association football]] stadium in [[Montpellier|Montpellier]], France. It is the home of [[Montpellier HSC|Montpellier HSC]] ([[Ligue 1|Ligue 1]]) and has a capacity of 32,900. Formerly a 16,000-seater stadium, it was entirely rebuilt in 1998 to host 6 games of the [[1998 FIFA World Cup|1998 FIFA World Cup]]. It was also used as a venue for group stage matches in the [[2007 Rugby World Cup|2007 Rugby World Cup]].
title: Stade de la Mosson

abstract: State Farm Stadium, formerly known as University of Phoenix Stadium, is a multi-purpose [[football|American football]] [[stadium|stadium]] located in [[Glendale, Arizona|Glendale, Arizona]], west of [[Phoenix|Phoenix, Arizona]]. It is the home of the [[Arizona Cardinals|Arizona Cardinals]] of the [[National Football League|National Football League]] (NFL) and the annual [[Fiesta Bowl|Fiesta Bowl]]. It replaced [[Tempe|Tempe, Arizona]]'s [[Sun Devil Stadium|Sun Devil Stadium]] as the [[Valley of the Sun|Phoenix metropolitan area]]'s main stadium. The stadium is adjacent to the [[Gila River Arena|Gila River Arena]] and it features the first fully retractable natural grass playing surface built in the United States on top of an AirField Systems drainage system. An opening on one side of the stadium allows the playing field to move to the exterior of the building, allowing the entire natural turf playing surface to be exposed to daylight and also allowing the floor of the stadium to be used for any other purpose (such as seating for concerts or to accommodate motorsports events) without damaging the turf.
title: State Farm Stadium

abstract: Estadio Agustín Tovar, also known as Estadio La Carolina, is a [[multi-purpose stadium|multi-purpose stadium]] in [[Barinas|Barinas, Barinas]], [[Venezuela|Venezuela]]. It is currently used mostly for [[football|football (soccer)]] matches and it is the home stadium of [[Zamora FC|Zamora Fútbol Club]]. The stadium holds 30,000 people and was completed in 2007.
title: Estadio Agustín Tovar

abstract: Buffalo City Stadium (also known as the BCM Stadium) is a multi-use [[stadium|stadium]] in [[East London|East London, Eastern Cape]], [[South Africa|South Africa]]. It is currently used mostly for [[Rugby Union|Rugby Union]] matches and is the home stadium of [[Border Bulldogs|Border Bulldogs]]. The stadium holds 16,000 people.
title: Buffalo City Stadium

abstract: Mackenzie Stadium is a [[baseball|baseball]] venue located in [[Holyoke, Massachusetts|Holyoke, Massachusetts]]. It was home to the [[Holyoke Millers|Holyoke Millers]] and today is used by both the [[Valley Blue Sox|Valley Blue Sox]] of the [[New England Collegiate Baseball League|New England Collegiate Baseball League]] (since [[2008|2008 NECBL season]]) and the [[Elms College Blazers|Elms College]] of the [[New England Collegiate Conference|New England Collegiate Conference]] (since 2005). It was built in 1933 and has a capacity of 4,100 people.
title: Mackenzie Stadium
